3.description: What the heck just happened?!?!I just left this place 30 minutes ago and I'm laying comatose trying to figure out how to move after eating this whole bowl!! For starters the ordering process was a bit different but the owner was there and super friendly and gave me some terrific recommendations. I got 3 bowls and tried their soda that was like the best cherry ginger ale I've ever had... Their Coxicha (I know I'm spelling it wrong) was out of this world! When I get out of this food coma I will be back with some buddies! Do yourself a favor and get a bowl when you're in the area!!! Great prices, great people, great portions see ya never chipotle :)

1.description: You gotta check this place out!!The Fejoida...really delicious and a complete meal.The staff are super nice and the atmosphere/ layout/ design is modern, clean and because the storefront wraps the corner - lots of natural light.  Satya

0.description: The bowl with chicken, black beans, and mango sauce is great. The mango steak salad is fantastic, but portions are a bit small. The kibe was outstanding, and the amazon smoothie with acai is a winner. Looking forward to coming back. I hope they offer larger portion size on the mango steak salad.A tigela com frango, feijão preto e molho de manga é legal. A salada de manga bife é fantástico, mas as porções são um pouco pequeno . O kibe foi otimo, e o batido amazon com açaí é legal tambem. Espero que eles ofereçam tamanho da porção maior sobre a salada de manga e bife.

2.description: I LOVE EVERYTHING BRAZILIAN! Samba, Carnaval, Capoeira, Caipirinhas, just to name a few. This place is even better than their original place on Broadway!!!! Omg!!! Love, love everything they serve! Must try the Pao de Queijo, hot mini bread stuffed with mozzarella...I call them, little hot pillows of heaven! The traditional dish of Brazil, Feijoada, an amazing sausage and black bean stew served over white rice. Just go and tell Tony, the owner I sent ya! He'll take good care of you and teach you about his wonderful Brazilian culture! Gostoso! Delicioso!

5.description: Really tasty food. The feijoada is really authentic. Looking forward to returning.The decor is inviting and it seems like it will be a nice place to hang out and drink coffee.They do need to sort out their make up air and hood exhaust!

6.description: Ordered the pork loin Brazilian bowl, with guacamole and black beans. DELICIOUS. Generous amounts of pork loin (more like a ton of pork loin), and everything mixed together very well (snap pea pods, red onions, kale, cucumber, lettuce, tomatoes, corn, rice). Yum. Ordered the Ipanema and Copacabana smoothies. Also very tasty. Beef empanada tasted good, but there is hardly any filling, so be wary. The interior is clean and modern, a small space towards the back which houses a couple of TVs, a small couch and a couple of seats around a coffee table with a mini chess board. There's also a little grocery area at the front. Hopefully, this restaurant sticks around in this spot. Good start!

7.description: I am so happy they've opened up near me ! This place does everything well, especially the acai bowl and empanadas. Been told by my Brazilian friends it's quite authentic. Just need to open up in the Loop where I work.

8.description: The shrimp bobo was awesome, and my hubby got the Brazilian national dish plate, which he said was really good. The Brazilian limeade is spectacularly tangy just enough to be good but not overwhelming. The restaurant space is clean amd the staff is very friendly.  Since it is a new place, they are still training, but we had no issues. And they have a cute grocery section, too.

9.description: This is only a review for take out: The food was very good, fast service, nice staff. We got a mix of things to share. Happy to have something new in the AP. Especially something on the healthier side of things.

10.description: Excited to see this new restaurant open in our neighborhood, just a short walk away, and that it is BYOB.  Went over for dinner on a cold, snowy evening and were surprised to find that they charge a $3.00 BYOB fee FOR EACH PERSON in the party.  We raised objection to this, but were still charged for each person.  On this basis, a larger party (of which there were several that evening) with, say, eight people, would pay a fee for $24.00!!  A nominal fee would have been OK, but this seems ridiculous and excessive for just opening a bottle and providing glasses.  We joked that if we come again we will bring an already opened bottle of wine and our own plastic glasses.Had the beef stroganoff which was really good, especially the rice base.  It comes topped with unusual crispy little potato strips which add flavor and a nice crunchy texture to the dish.  Had the chocolate coconut cake for dessert.  It was really flavorful, moist, not too sweet, and was a generous portion for two to share.  The staff was friendly but a bit bumbling (understandable as they just opened) but could definitely use more training.  They use paper plates and plastic forks which is not great, but acceptable at this price point.Will probably go back, but they definitely need to reconsider their BYOB policy.

4.description: Ordered an empanada which was frozen inside. When I brought it up to the counter I was not greeted with an apology but more of a quizzical look. Had to ask 15 minutes later where was the replacement? To which I was told it's coming.It's an improvement for what was previously here but food is only a C+ for the price and don't care for the service.I am not so experienced with Brazilian food and this is not an upscale place but didn't have a level of bang that I could get from other not too upscale restaurants, unfortunately.My daughter described her dining experience here as "I'd say my dish tasted like something that was prepared sometime ago that was reheated."

12.description: First of all, what are the 3 R's of this place?Just your typical hole in the wall Filipino store.  I guess I'm just used to the bigger Filipino supermarkets that you find out here in California.  But I felt that the grocery part of this place was pretty dirty, unorganized, and unappealing.  The lady who was working there had curlers in her hair which my cousin and I found unappetizing (maybe she was going to a party).  The restaurant part was more clean and the food looked somewhat appetizing.  But the mood in the place was pretty somber.  There was about 15 people in the place (about 81% of the folks were wearing nurses scrubs, which made it more stereotypical Filipino) and it was dead quiet.  Everyone at the place just ate and didn't say a word to each other.  Plus everyone was staring at us (maybe it was our California aura..I don't know).  But we just felt a cold reception here so we decided to go down the street to another Filipino joint called Rubys (and that was complete opposite and very lively and awesome food).  They should change the name to 3 C's for Cold, Comatose, and Curlers in the hair of lady who works there."

3.description: To Ronald M.(the son of the owner) It doesn't let me respond back to my review, so unfortunately I have to start a new one. Yes, this is Bernadette, I am writing from my daughter's email. First off THANK YOU, if I would of spoken to you and you replied back to me on the phone the way you replied back on here. Believe me, I would've NEVER even took the time out of my day to write anything on here. Yes we were talking a different dialect, which I think, you do not understand, because if you did, you would know that I Am not lying about ANYTHING I said. I have known your mother for a very long time, I have been going to Three R for years.I know that Is her business and that is exactly why I asked to speak with her personally when I found a hair in my food. But the outcome obviously wasn't what I(or any random customer) would've expected. She did question me to make sure it was a hair in my food, did NOT apologize nor offered anything if I returned. She Hung up on me. That is the TRUTH. Very rude and unprofessional. I would NOT be wasting my time on this page, if it were a lie. BUT I do want to thank you for the offer. I appreciate the apology. Like I said, I was just trying to inform, I didn't want ANYTHING back from it.

1.description: As a Grocery store for Asian/Filipino goods in a pinch, this place is OK. It's generally overpriced but that's what you get for not wanting to haul your ass to Argyle. As a turn-turo (literally point-point in Tagalog) their ready to eat foods are very disappointing. The pork adobo is so greasy and the pinapaiitan and the diniguan was icky. Both had no real meat, just the organ meats which just seems cheap. Also it's super vinegary. I don't know who's cooking but seriously, chill with the suka already. Once, I got some rice there and there was a hair in it. So some hairnets would be good too. The fried fish is Ok, but make sure to check that it's fresh because sometimes it's just dry and sitting there for awhile. The empanada is alright but it has raisins which I'm not crazy about so depends if you're pro or con sweet/savory. They do have some good homemade desserts here too but pricy like the food. It is mostly Mexicans here so that's kind of weird for a Filipino store. There is one Filipino lady, older, I think she's the owner. Not very friendly and has that sour milk face you never want to see before you're going to eat something.  Lately, I've just skipped this place and kept driving down Montrose to Rubys (call first! to make sure they are open). The people are nicer there and the food is much better and more affordable. If I need groceries, I haul it to Uptown by the Argyle grocery marts or Unimart if I don't want to drive that far.

2.description: I've been buying lunch here for the past 2-3 years and I always get the FRESH LUMPIA together with the combo. I just noticed that through the years the ingredients has become less and less. All it has inside is carrots and this white vegetable plus one lettuce. It's a really SAD version of fresh lumpia that I grew up eating. No peanuts, no chickpeas, no shrimp or any protein. And last week I decided to give it a try again and I noticed the brown SAUCE no longer has GARLIC that helps give flavor to it. So I'm just plain disappointed. It might be little things to them but if I don't see any improvement I will never come back will never recommend this place

9.description: A tad untidy and they re-sell Aldi products at a higher price (cooking oil, et al and there's an Aldi down the street where you can buy it for $2 less).  Simply amazing.  They did put new shelving in so that helps a little.  Food is really fatty at times and I don't mean the 5g kind.  There can be lobs of fat on the meat that you need to manually dismantle.  Typically, and unfortunately, this is how a lot of Filipinos eat (I am one).  There are times too though when it's pretty good so it's a gamble.  I don't eat there in the summer because of all the flies that enter the place and end up regurgitating on everything.  If you want Filipino food in a clean environment sans flies, go to La Isla Pilipina nearby on Lawrence.

10.description: 3 R Filipino Grocery and Restaurant is a great place for authentic Filipino food. There are 2 sections of the store.  One side is a grocery and the other is a restaurant. Some of the dishes they have are kare-kare, beef steak, lumpia,  and my all time favorite chicken adobe! Everything is sooo good here! The food is priced just right (only $6.00 for 2 sides and rice). In addition, they are very generous with their portion.Anyone alike Filipino or non-Filipino that had a chance to eat here know that they will never be disappointed. I found that Saturday has the most variety and food is freshly made.In the grocery area I shop for fresh mango nectar, snacks such as wasabi peas (Get these in your Jewel Osco and you will be priced doubled!), shrimp chips, dried mangos, and you will love the Pan de Sal (filipino slightly sweet bread) made fresh daily. Thank god for a little culture in Chicago. I hope this place will never go out of business. I would be really disappointed!

13.description: 3 R is a Filipino grocery store with an attached restaurant.  I used to go here often for Filipino staples like dried noodles for pancit, fish sauce, frozen lumpia, ube & macapuno ice cream, baked goods, milk candies, and much more.  The restaurant is turo-turo style (a.k.a. the Filipino cafeteria).  There are no menus, so you just point to the food on the buffet table and the woman behind the counter will package it for you.  I usually order the lumpia, palabok, fried milkfish, mungo, and turon.  The last time I went, the owners had changed (they weren't Filipino), and the vibe seemed different in there.  I would still go back, though, if I were in the neighborhood.

16.description: Echo the rude lady behind the counter....I thought I was gonna be the first to comment about that....A while ago there was an Ecuadorian dude trying to tell me what ingredients belong in sinigang? -giving me a serious 'tude. Come on now! I am a Chicago native and I grew up around the corner from this place. I recently got back from So Cal and must say that the majority of Filipino restaurants out in Cali are heavenly, clean, delicious and VERY polite.  We need more options out here in the city. This place is REAL Filipino home cooking. It's just not good though.I remember when it was easy to get good Filipino food.If you are new to our cuisine, perhaps you should eat at someones Lola's house to get your first impression.It didnt used to suck over there until the employees got rude and their grocery in-stock position was so hit or miss.Go look at their meat and fish counter...thats where they get the ingredients for the cafeteria. Yikes.

6.description: Tried the longanisa pizza which was like a Lou Malnati's deep dish butter crust with longanisa instead of sausage. It was also very filling. The Turon and empanadas weren't too bad either. Once again, The pizza alone will have me coming back for more. It's also byob so you could have a beer or two while watching the Bears. It's a cute restaurant and adjacent store.They should create a tocino pizza since they are doing the fushion thing.Fyi, the pizza's are only available at night which is not too convenient for me.

15.description: liss and i stopped in to buy some ingredients to make lumpia for a dinner party.  3 r's is a small store, but we were able to find everything that we were looking for, including at least three different kinds of lumpia wrappers (which is desirable).  ...but there was no garlic!  how am i supposed to make delicious lumpia w/o garlic?  (fyi, they carry pre-prepared lumpia that's ready to fry in case you don't have enough time to make them from scratch.)also, i've had much better ensaymada.  the ensaymada that they carry is too doughy, and as a result, the sugar to bread ratio is uneven.  - - the bread could be a lot more light and fluffy.

0.description: Once again went to this little hidden Gem I forget this place is here I found it a couple years ago by accident and recently the better half is working on Montrose so I keep driving by here Had to stop in yesterday and get some Chicken Adobo, I also got the Fresh Lumpia which is kinda a Filipino version of a spring roll and it comes with a Garlic dipping sauce oh it was good, and the Abodo here is perfection, the staff here are great and will help you to understand what they have and make some choices if you don't the food too well, the Perk with Green Peppers and Pineapple (sweet and Sour) was very good to I have not had a single thing here that I didn't like so far and I have eaten most things they offer

5.description: HIT OR MISS. The question is, are you feeling lucky? With all that money you're spending here? My family and I have frequented Three R's mostly during my childhood, then stopped when it was taken over by non-Filipinos, and now it's Filipino run again. Just when we thought it was A-OK, the restaurant serves me a NASTY batch of pork barbeque in sauce. Sauced Filipino barbeque is one of the best foods on the planet, but it's supposed to be sweet and a little tangy. This stuff was spicy, the meat was kind of hard as if it was old, and we actually had to throw it away. Compared to other Filipino establishments, the food here is also more expensive.Regardless, their turon (plaintain eggroll) is not half bad. I also like their laing (Filipino style cream spinach with fish or pork). They have a lot of other offerings too in addition to their convenience store.

11.description: These guys now park a "bahn mi" food truck downtown during the week, so I thought I would give them a try. Specifically I tried their vegetarian sandwich, which only had cucumber, carrot and radish (and mayo). Compared to the superior bahn mi sandwiches at Nhu Lan (which come in several vegetarian varieties that include some form of protein), the Three R's sandwich was a big disappointment. From now on I'll just brind Nhu Lan sandwiches to work.

8.description: I think some of you Yelpers have been a tad overly critical of this joint...ME TOO! LOL Two sections of this place. Store with all the Philippine Delicacies you can ever imagine. Along with your standard needs: Chicarons(pork skin with suka packets), pandesal (bread), ensymada (sweet bread), tocino (sweet pork), longanisa, bangus, Yan Yan, Need I go on? Its a lil dirty but considering the amounts of people who go in there on a daily basis, I don't blame them. Maybe they should hire another dude where his sole job is to clean the store and greet people. 'Cuz apparently the chick in the restaurant part doesn't like to be friendly (read below).The restaurant part is where I have the issue. First of all what the bloody hell is wrong with the sour faced hispanic chick serving up our food? Why does she give me attitude and never...NEVER...smiles. She gets a little snippy with the custies too. I saw her snapping on the sweetest little lady about pricing. Last I remember, she was in a customer service environment. Good thing the food was good. Its cool, they have all these ready made dishes. You pick 'em. Pay. Sit down and eat.

4.description: OK, life threw me a curve ball today and once again I found myself in this area and the restaurant I intended on eating at was closed.  So rather than ride 2 busses home on an empty stomach I decided to give this restaurant another try to see if my oninion of this restaurant would change or not.If Yelp would allow me I'd rate this restaurant 3 1/2 stars, but unfortunately that's not possible so I feel that at least for me it's closer to a 3 than a 4 star experience so that's how I come up with the 3 star rating.  Although I'm rating it a 3 star kind of place I will probably stop in again and try some other items on their menu.  Go ahead and give it a try, hopefully you're taste buds will disagree with mine and you will be blown away.My meal today started out with poncit.  This time I found the poncit to be more flavorful and good.  To be truthful I can't say it was the best poncit I've ever eaten, but I did find it to be good and I can see where others might disagree with me and feel it is better than my assessment of it.For dessert I had 4 large longanisa (sp?) sausages that I dipped in their vinegar dip.   I know eating that as a dessert probably qualifies me as certifiably weird, but hey I love the stuff and to me it's a great dessert.  It was very good!After all that I was pretty stuffed, but I tried a bite of the adobo pork I'm saving for supper tonight so I'd know how it was before writing this review.  I found it to be very good and I'm looking forward to chowing down on it for supper tonight.  It was a little greasey and my preference would have been that it have a stronger adobo flavor, but of course others may find it to be great for their preferences.  Overall though like I said it was very good and I wouldn't mind ordering it again.Once again I found the service to be quite friendly.  Friendly service is always appreciated and they seem to be consistently friendly so kudos to them!Overall this was a real good experience and I will return at some point in the future.

14.description: I've been coming here before but eversince i moved,it was simply out of the way.finally had to come by for a quick breakfast,i had the beef tapa tocino and longganisa,it was the combo so it came with garlic fried rice.then they asked me if i wanted the egg,ofcourse i like to have the fried egg how on earth would it be tapsilog! Went home sick vomited and had trips to the bathroom it was the only meal i ate the whole day.

7.description: Hit or miss, I agree with Lesley A.  But the 5 stars are solely for when I discovered the empanadas on a "hit" day.  I never really cared much for empanadas before.  If you go on a "miss" day sorry (there are such days) but  hopefully there will be more "hit" days for me.  Don't go here for the incredible, plump, tasty, sweet empanadas so I never run out when I get the craving for them.

1.description: Very convenient wholesale store, just steps from my house.  They are a little more expensive than lynami, the store I usually go to, but price wise it's not that bad.  I say three stars because when you first go in, you show them your student ID from whichever nail/cosmotology school or you show your valid nail technician/cosmotologist licence, fine.  But all of the times I've gone,  I purposely call a friend or family member on the phone because I always feel uncomfortable when the guy, whoever it may be,  starts following me....  I understand people steal and things but every time I go, I have no pockets and a tiny wristlette just to avoid the stereotype and any problems but that's the only discomfort I have.  Another thing is they don't have a variety of hard gel products or odorless acrylic.  It's not a huge deal to me but it would be a plus if they had that in stock.

2.description: I'll start off by saying I absolutely love this place! Cheap Opi Nail polishes. They even have china glaze crackle polish. it was sold out almost everywhere but I knew they'd have it! . They have  a Lots of nail art supplies &samples, nail salon equipment &furniture, nail polish and lots more.

0.description: Good local spot for nail supplies which is pretty difficult in the Northwest side of the city near Albany/Jefferson Park areas. Good prices, large stock of quality brand nail supply item: CND, ESSIE, Gelish, Entity and more. Nice spa furniture as well. Staff is super friendly and helpful. They have even stayed open a couple of minutes later once to accommodate me which I appreciate!This is a newer location, so their inventory is always growing. They may not have everything you need because they are semi-newer but they are growing fast.Their hours are a little difficult for me personally but if you plan ahead this may work for you. The only complaint I have is I tend to find products I like there and purchase and when I come back for refills they are sold out. When I ask if they are reordering they say yes, I come in time and time again and its not restocked. When I follow up they say they are reordering or placed an order but honestly it never comes. I think they may just confirm its ordered to please me in the time being but it just causes more frustration.I still think this is the best and most organized nail supply on the North Side of Chicago.

1.description: This is the worst place I have been to. My son's hair was cut completely crooked! I was specific in explaining we DO NOT want short hair. Showed him how much to cut and he still cut it wrong. Had the nerve to tell me what he thought my child needed. To make the whole situation worse it that the owner has yet to return my call. I have left 2 messages for her. She relayed a message through another employee telling me to return for a free hair cut. Are you crazy???Horrible customer service. DO NOT CUT YOUR HAIR HERE!!!

9.description: This place would have once received 5 stars from me. I regretfully give it two. I used to get my brows done by Sara. She was like an artist with that thread. I have seen her turn beasts into beauties. Then since let her go. The owner left the place. Bilal has since left the place. The brows have now all been jacked and the good fades have faded away. Since the new management change. Everything has changed. The quality of hair cuts and brow artists. It also smells like some serious body odor up in there. They really need to take care of that because i almost gagged. I love this place for its convenience but I hate it for everything else. I would like to formally resign from being a customer, effective immediately. Goodbye Mario's.... you were once the place to get lined up and brows done nice. I now will travel further to see my girl Sara again.In Summary:The place is small.The chairs are flimsy.It smells like frito-lays and hot garbage in thereThe customer service is badManagement is bad

23.description: This is my neighborhood place to get a haircut. Though I know there are a lot of $5 places in the area, I pay my $10 here and get a nice close cut. This is also a popular place for an eyebrow threading (ouch).

12.description: Stopped in for threading tonight. No wait. Noor was very sweet. The look is clean, but not the arch I usually like. Could be worse though. Had lip threaded as well - great job. $12 TOTAL which is an amazing price. I'll be back and will be more specific in the look I want.

21.description: Nor keeps me coming back.  I've tried cheating on her and going to different places, but I keep getting disappointed.  She's precise and fast.  And when she threads, she definitely has a lighter hand so it doesn't hurt as much.  My only qualm, you get your eyebrows threaded in the same space as guys are getting their haircuts.  You gotta be brave enough to not care as they stare at you while you are getting threaded.  As if they think we women have perfect eyebrows naturally!!

16.description: This USED to be the place for men to get their haircut and men/women to get their brows done for cheap but at a good job but the place has gone downhill since Mario, his brothers, and other originals have left...note, they are NOT on vacation if you ask for them.     My boyfriend went to same people to get his cut and brows done and I went to the same girl.     Mario never did his hair but knew we were regulars.   Since the ownership has changed, you get asked by several "stylists" or "threaders" if you want to go with them after it is obvious that you are waiting for someone in particular.   I agree with a previous review that it is almost like you are walking into an auto dealership and not a hair salon.       A lot of the good and original stylists have left.    Thankfully, we found out where several of the stylists have moved and continue to see them for our hair and brows.

17.description: This is my neighborhood place to get a haircut. Though I know there are a lot of $5 places in the area, I pay my $10 here and get a nice close cut. This is also a popular place for an eyebrow threading (ouch).

10.description: My original place for eyebrows and upper lip threading.  The things we girls go through...Go see Noor - she rocks!  She's quick, efficient and knows her brows.  She makes it almost painless.  Almost.  Be warned -  she also has a fan club.  More times than not, I'd be waiting for her with 5 people in front of me and a poor "other threader" asking if she could do my brows instead.  Yep, Noor is awesome.Because of this, I try to go at off times or right before they close - i HATE waiting.  :)

5.description: My wax place with Klara she is the best! Have brought friends that leave happy with her work. :)

11.description: No body does eyebrows like clara! That's why I don't mind driving 20 minutes back and forth because I know I'll be happy with the results each and every time.

22.description: I get my eyebrows threaded here. Why? Because it's fast, good and relatively painless.Ask for Noor -- she rocks -- she's there from Tuesday-Saturday.It's only $6 and takes about 5 minutes. I've tried to duplicate the results by plucking, but it never looks quite as clean!I hear the haircuts are good, too. Maybe I shoulda gone there instead of Segovia. Oh, well. I'll try it next time! Parking is plentiful... with other conveniences around like Chase, CVS and Little Caesar's haha!

0.description: I only get my eyebrows threaded here and Noor is amazing. I cannot tell you how many times she has saved my eyebrows!I cannot express how wonderful she is, you have to see for yourself, its well worth it!Unfortunately I moved, so I now go to Deeba, they too are wonderful!

20.description: This place would have once received 5 stars from me. I regretfully give it two. I used to get my brows done by Sara. She was like an artist with that thread. I have seen her turn beasts into beauties. Then since let her go. The owner left the place. Bilal has since left the place. The brows have now all been jacked and the good fades have faded away. Since the new management change. Everything has changed. The quality of hair cuts and brow artists. It also smells like some serious body odor up in there. They really need to take care of that because i almost gagged. I love this place for its convenience but I hate it for everything else. I would like to formally resign from being a customer, effective immediately. Goodbye Mario's.... you were once the place to get lined up and brows done nice. I now will travel further to see my girl Sara again.In Summary:The place is small.The chairs are flimsy.It smells like frito-lays and hot garbage in thereThe customer service is badManagement is bad

19.description: This place USED to be the best place to get your hair did but once Mario sold it, the place has gone south. One thing that I miss greatly is how Mario knew who you were and who you were there to see. Now, you're just asked and harassed by numerous stylists for a cut, like walking into an auto dealership. And the quality of stylists has really gone down. Mario had some great people cutting hair, including himself and his brother. Again, once the place was sold, the good ones just up and left. Haven't been there in a long time...and don't plan on it.

2.description: To add to my previous comment I had stated they can work on eyebrows well. I take it back as I came in to get my money back on a chopped up so called layered hair cut the same woman messed up on another customer with her eyebrows, as we both complained to Noor (the owner) about the messed up jobs this women had done, she defends her about both horrible jobs both my hair and this lady's eyebrows. Please do yourself a favor and find another salon, it's clear if for any reason they mess up on anything you will NOT get your money back and Noor will try to deny everything.

18.description: Well I only go here to get my eyebrows and upper lip threaded and I think Clara does an amazing job. She's usually pretty busy and has quite a wait most of the time. I have tried going to other places and every time I do, I regret it because only Clara can do an excellent job threading my eyebrows. The pet peeves that I have about this place are that they do not accept credit cards/debit cards and that they are constantly on their phones either texting or talking. The second pet peeve bothers me the most because it's really unprofessional especially when they have a customer. These are the reasons why I only give this place 4 stars.

13.description: Very nice work for $12.00 bucks on  eyebrow/upper lip threading!!! I usually go to Noora.  She very sweet and not afraid to start a conversation with anyone.  They just recently raised the eyebrow thread to $8.00 bucks but I think it's because they are trying to keep up with the Joneses!!! and price services like every one else. But if you are in a hurry and need a quick 'clean-up' this is the place!! Usually no waiting and your are done in about 15 minutes:)

4.description: my go to for eyebrow threading.  I always ask for Noor.  She is AMAZING, quick  and the service is only $8

6.description: I have been coming here for years to get my eyebrows done. Just this week, they sent out coupons for a buy one eyebrow thread get one lip service free. However, when I went in today and gave them the coupon, they wouldn't honor it. She said it was a mistake and she wouldn't take it. It wasn't my mistake. I had an email specifically stating the offer. Yet, she still wouldn't honor it. It's bad business in my opinion and unfortunately for them, they lost a customer because of it.

15.description: I get my eyebrows threaded here. Why? Because it's fast, good and relatively painless.Ask for Noor -- she rocks -- she's there from Tuesday-Saturday.It's only $6 and takes about 5 minutes. I've tried to duplicate the results by plucking, but it never looks quite as clean!I hear the haircuts are good, too. Maybe I shoulda gone there instead of Segovia. Oh, well. I'll try it next time! Parking is plentiful... with other conveniences around like Chase, CVS and Little Caesar's haha!

7.description: The reason why i always return to this salon is because the only asian lady in the salon always does a great job on my hair cut. I live in lincoln park and im always willing to come this far just for her to cut my hair :)

8.description: I love Klara! I have been going to her for years for my eyebrows. I only go to her even for my wedding she did my eyebrows. She won't disappoint you at all. Believe me!

3.description: Highly recommended if you want your eyebrows to be on "FLEEK" that's known to mean be ON POINT!!! Noor has been doing my eyebrows for many many years. Everyone in there is great. It's inexpensive and you barely wait for a chair. Great place to get in fast and continue on with your day. I'm a guy whom gets eyebrows threaded preferred over waxing. They make the shape so manly and masculine for me I can't resist but to keep going back! Trust me you won't be disappointed!

14.description: Nor keeps me coming back.  I've tried cheating on her and going to different places, but I keep getting disappointed.  She's precise and fast.  And when she threads, she definitely has a lighter hand so it doesn't hurt as much.  My only qualm, you get your eyebrows threaded in the same space as guys are getting their haircuts.  You gotta be brave enough to not care as they stare at you while you are getting threaded.  As if they think we women have perfect eyebrows naturally!!

12.description: My favorite pupuseria is back with extended hours! Hands down the best pupusas and Guatemalan food in Chicago.

7.description: I came here with a friend recently for papusas and the food was great. Multinational staff and food; best papusas I've had in Chicago. Very affordable as well.

3.description: This place is delicious and affordable.  I had a  loroco with cheese and beans with cheese pupusa; both great. The curtido is very authentic and chips are amazing as well.  This is a BYOB place, and has a nice ambiance to it, specially for dinner.

1.description: Las Delicias has good food and service, and i'd definitely return. Ever since El Tinajon closed i've been looking for a replacement, and their menu has all the Guatemalan specialities that El Tinajon had and more, namely Saladorean pupusas. Chips were fresh and warm, the green salsa was very tasty. Guacamole was ok, not much seasoning. For an entree, I tried the hilachas, which is a type of stewed beef in sauce. The sauce was tasty, but the beef was a little tough and stringy. I'd try something different next time, the menu is very extensive and I hesitate to review based on one visit. The dining room is modest but comfortable with bright decor and a mom & pop restaurant atmosphere. I'll definitely return for more specialty dishes.

2.description: I wandered into Las Delicias on New Years Day, looking for something different for dinner takeout.    The menu is loaded with traditional Central American foods (mainly Guatemalan and Salvadorian) that are quite intriguing, though there are also Mexican standards and even a kids breakfast menu.  The interior of the sizeable restaurant looks pleasant enough, and I may have to dine in next time.  There is a counter with some artisan trinkets on sale.  I ordered a vegetarian combo platter, as well as a tamal guatemalteco.  Most people are familiar with the Mexican-style tamales, but this Guatemalan-style corn tamale with pork is larger and has a more gelatinous density.  Now for the sprawling combo platter - starting with the pupusa, a cornmeal patty that is a Salvadorian standard I have enjoyed in other restaurants.  I chose the pupusa with loroco filling.  Loroco is a vine with edible flowers, though the generous amount of cheese filling makes it the dominant ingredient of the pupusa.  There is also a cup of slaw which is traditionally used as a topping for the pupusa.  The cheese chilaquil is sort of a quesadilla, with the tortilla smothered with a red salsa and paired with a generous plop of guacamole.  The massive platter also comes with sides of a very dense pile of refried beans, a scoop of rice sprinkled with carrots and peas, a cup of spicy green sauce, and fried sweet plantains.  The wedges of sweet plantains have a slightly charred exterior that created a delicious caramelized effect.  All in all, I was very satisfied with trying out a new (to me) restaurant on the first day of the New Year.

9.description: This place is a new favorite of mine. The pupusas are delicious. Service is prompt and friendly. My favorite was the sweet corn tamales. The building had an odd smell, but there's always take out! I will re-order from here.

18.description: Food and price is great but owner's/waiter's attitude is grumpy! For the taste and price - it balances his attitude.

10.description: Their food is great but ive gone three mondays in a row and theyve been closed. Even though the hours on their door say they're open Monday through Sunday at 10am. Sadly we have to find another spot to call a favorite for jibaritos.

13.description: It is very hard to find a great Place to eat Pupusas, Well Chicago stop looking.  Delicias is the best in the city.  I cannot speak for any of the other dishes but the pupusass are well worth the trip.

16.description: By far, the best Guatemalan and Salvadoran food in Chicago.  I most definitely recommend the Pupusas, but everything on the menu is outstanding.  Great, very friendly service.  Family friendly.

17.description: Great pupusas,  EXCELLENT curtido (a cabbage-y vinegary coleslaw to put on your pupusas), lovely spicy green sauce for the chips, lovely service and a nice setting for a meal. Also, it is BYOB but we didn't see a liquor store handy (gas station kitty corner?). They have virgin margaritas on the menu so bring your own tequila?

15.description: I finally got the chance to try this place out, and I am so glad I did! Las Delicias is the perfect name for this restaurant because the food is definitely delicious. My husband is Guatemalan and I am Salvadoran, By birth  we have pretty high expectations for all things pupusas and longaniza related. Las pupusas de loroco  y las de revuelta (had to bust out the Spanish here!) were perfect and not greasy at all.  Loroco is a Salvadoran flower bud that tastes kind of like spinach when cooked. Revuelta is a mixture of minced pork, beans and cheese- the trifecta of tastiness. As I said, both were excellent and reminded me a lot of how my grandma and aunts make them.In addition to the pupusas, we orderd yuca frita (fried yucca root) and sweet plantains. The yuca frita came with fried pork chunks that were killer! The only thing I would add is perhaps a side of mojo for dipping. Instead, I used the complimentary salsas and was perfectly happy. Not everyone likes to dip their yuca, I happen to be a dipper. The sweet plantains (platanos maduros) were just how I like them- lightly fried and not soaking in oil. You also get a healthy portion for the price. At the end of the night, my husband and I ate like kings and still had food left over to take home. This feast cost us the hefty price of.... $27. Yep, just $27 total for the BOTH of us for six pupusas, yuca frita, platanos, and soft drinks. You can't beat the price! Need I mention that this place is BYOB? Yes. Hell yes. So not only is the food tasty and cheap, but you can also bring your own booze which makes the deal even better. Looking over the menu I noticed they had virgin margaritas. Perhaps they will let you bring your own tequila? I know most BYOB places only allow beer and wine, but it couldn't hurt to ask next time! They also have michelada mixers- all you have to do is bring your own beer!In summary, this place is great. The food is tasty and on point with what Salvadoran and Guatemalan cuisine should be- delicious, inexpensive, soul satisfying  food.

0.description: Really good. Our other Guatemalan restaurant closed down and we found this place by accident. My kids were so excited to see their favorite dishes on the menu they jumped up and down. We spend time in Guatemala each summer so I think we know good food and this place delights. The servers are also very sweet to my kids. It's a weekly stop for us.

5.description: Not really sure if I would give the pupusas five stars as the other reviewers have. I didn't find them to be special. I've had much much better. The masa is kind of dry, almost tasted like cardboard, the cheese is very good, it's good quality. The cabbage slaw is great!The decor is not special either. Even though it's not an old restaurant it gives the appearance of being so by their outdated tables and chair, and "decorations". One side has unified tables and chairs, while the other side is completely mismatched. The service is nice, it's very homey. Perhaps I'll give it another try for other dishes, but I won't go out of my way to eat the pupusas that I was so looking forward to tasting after reading all of the reviews. The prices are good, very affordable, the service is fast, but then again I tried it on a slow night. The inside is definitely a place where you can relax, and not feel rushed about having to vacate your table quickly.

11.description: My Mom fell in love with this place and she is finicky! Platanos con crema are to die for as a side order!. I got the lunch special: 2 Pupusas (filled with beans cheese chicken or pork grinds in a delicious home made corn tortilla) with rice and black beans and a cabbage salad for the Pupusas. The staff is always courteous, the atmosphere is nice, you can BOB, and it's a homemade meal.....

8.description: realy good service if you love pupuzas this is the best place to eat good music and really good service and the food keep it up guys

4.description: Enjoying Guatemalan and Salvadorian food at this restaurant.  Have been friend with owners for years and they are really nice and supportive of community  organizations. Yummy food and cultural dishes.

14.description: finally created a yelp acct and this is the first place i want to review. PAPUSAS HERE ARE MOUTH-WATERING.

6.description: Great experience!  Wonderful service - friendly and quick.  Excellent food and music, and we had a great time singing karaoke!

3.description: great seafood.  Make sure you ask for texas supreme

1.description: This fish store recently opened by our house and it is great! The fish is very fresh and the prices are really low (especially compared to the fish market just down the street from this store). Definitely check it out and support this new small business!

2.description: My family has purchased seafood from Chitown since it moved to the northwest side of Chicago. and before that, on the east side.  The new location is easy to get to and plenty of street parking is available. Everyone there is welcoming and helpful.  The shop is clean and neat. The fish we bought was fresh and fairly priced. We appreciated the variety available. At Christmas time shopping, we had so much to choose from for our "Feast of Seven Fish"! Needless to say, there were a lot more than 7 types of fish on our table on Christmas Eve. Thank you, Chitown!

0.description: I'm so glad we stopped by to check it out. Very fresh and very affordable prices for scallops and gulf shrimp (things we normally don't splurge on). There is more than what is on display and the friendly staff are helpful. Many, many options for frozen choices (great if you like breaded things!). Double check their website for hours of operation.

3.description: Great atmosphere, excellent customer service, friendly patrons and great            inexpensive (awesome portions) food!

1.description: What joke bar. Must of been the owner or someone close to him who reported me for telling the truth about this sorry bar. People this bar ain't no good period

2.description: I go to this bar several times after work on Friday evenings and have always had great service and a good time. But the past few times that I've stopped in on a Wednesday or Thursday evenings, it has been a completely different experience. The woman that worked these nights I can hardly understand when talking to her, I had to ask her name 3 times and I still am not sure if it's Salina or Sameena. Also,  I have noticed that she charges different (higher and lower) prices for the same drinks for certain people. When I ordered a vodka and cranberry I was charged for the vodka and then extra for the juice (6.00) and the lady 2 people down from me ordered the same exact drink and only paid 4.00! And I watched, it was the same vodka, not a more expensive one. And then the man next to me she was talking to a lot and every time he ordered a beer she gave him a shot for free!!! (She says its on me) I really enjoy coming here but I just think you should know people are being taken advantage of. Instead of coming 2 or 3 nights a week I will only come on Friday nights for now on since that's the only time I've ever had good service and been treated fairly.

9.description: I too was here recently and saw Expo 76.  First of all, that band rocked, but the bar prices were very reasonable, the staff was attentive, and the food was outstanding - A burger and fries for $5.00 with all the trimmings.  I even asked if we could split a burger between my wife and I, and the cook made two separate plates with a half burger on each!  Kudos for going the extra mile.  This was the second time I have been to the bar and both times have been a treat.  Great crowd and it seems like a lot of music, events and activites going on here.  I think I found our new weekend haunt.

10.description: Not sure where the other people were at on their reviews but. There are no pictures on the walls.  So no war criminals....  But Ive had lots fun in sunnyday. Friendly people,  now they have entertainment. Almost every weekend.  Serbian food great. And American food was great too.  Hot wings are excellent.  And cant beat price.   Domestic beers. Are 3 bucks. Unless ur drinking draft. SD. Pretty much in price.   Id. Say come see for yourselves.  I m a.regular i guess!

4.description: Another solid, dive-y bar in a neighborhood chock-a-block with them. Came here with a friend, and while we paid a bit more for beer than standard around the area, they made up for it by giving us each two shots of whiskey for free while we were there, so it more than evened out. The menu and other reviews mention the Serbian food, but I was more in the mood for a burger, which was quite good and only $5. Several times the place erupted Cheers-style into applause when someone came in, which suggests this place has a solid cast of regulars who frequent it on the weekends (or more). There's also a little dining area in the back, which was almost completely vacant while I was there.Only downsides are that there is no tap (at least I didn't see one), and I can see where it would be slightly on the intimidating side for newcomers. But it's a nice option for the area.

6.description: A great Serbian bar and cheap lunch. I discovered this place not too long ago and was surprised by how good and economical the food was. It is a small charming resteraunt with seating in the back and a dive bar in front. they serve both American and Serbian food and I am sure the Serbian food was as good as the American staples I had. This is a small business that is a pleasent alternative to large chains and bars that we find ourselved inudated in this day and age.

11.description: Fantastic serbian food. Amazing portions. Ethnic music and feel mixed with traditional american bar setting. Friendly staff.

5.description: definitely a welcoming place unlike some other ethnic joints around hereit is indeed serbian. the menu on the wall is the american menu. if you want to see the serbian menu you have to ask for itit would be a whole lot cooler if they didnt have any tvs. tvs ruin a place like this. they had three tvs on and the volume was really loud. that was distractingi don't think i would come backexcept maybe on a saturday from 8-3 when they have a live serbian band

7.description: I went here for the first time on Friday as one of my favorite bands, Expo 76 was playing. It's a great little neighborhood bar in an easy to park area. The main bar in the front has reasonably priced drinks and super friendly bar staff. The middle part is a Serbian restaurant, I'd like to go back to try the food as I have heard it is delicious and made to order. The back area is where the band was playing. It's a bit of a strange set up but, it works. I really enjoyed my visit and will definitely be back to see what other acts they have here. Dina was great and let me know that they also have karaoke twice a month! Yes!!!

8.description: Only one word; disturbing!!! Maybe one more? Creepy!!!This place have every war criminal's picture on its walls. What!!!??? enough to lose your appetite, and leave...

0.description: Awesome dive atmosphere and fair prices. This place is within stumbling distance from my house. The decor is divey yet modernized. The bar goers are all very friendly and seem much less sketchy than Laurel Tap. The bartenders are attentive and nice. There's not much of a liquor selection but for a dive bar I wouldn't expect "artisanal" whiskies or craft liquor selections.. I'll definitely return!

3.description: I tried out this place after getting a deal from youswoop.com for an hour long massage and optional stress management evaluation for $35!  It is an odd location, but it wasn't too far so I took advantage of the deal.  I arrived early to complete the paperwork.  It was a small building with more of a doctor's office feel than a spa, but as they provide a variety of services it did not seem like a big deal.  The receptionist checked me in and then said we could get started.  I was a little surprised that this turned out to be the massage therapist, but as it was a Saturday it did not send me running for the door.  The massage room was not huge, though welcoming and the therapist was friendly.  She reviewed my information and inquired as to the type of massage that was wanted.  I didn't get any questions or further discussion about the stress evaluation, unless the review of the paperwork was what that meant.  She played the obligatory relaxing music and gave me an opportunity to change.  She was very thorough for the full body massage, but I have to admit that I was very distracted by the noise level.  Maybe it is because it is on a busy street or we were in the first room, but I could hear every noise while I was trying to relax and enjoy the massage!  I tried to block out the traffic as that was not the fault of the business, but then when I could hear the radio playing in the waiting room, the phone ringing (followed by the answering machine), and people talking/laughing in the waiting room, I became annoyed.  I tried placing my arms by my ears, paying more attention to the relaxation music, and just thinking of other things.  Maybe I should have asked her to turn up the music, but as I did not want that blaring in my ear and I was not sure if it would make a difference, I did not bother.  I did not understand how the staff could not realize it though as it continued throughout the appointment.  So, the business really needs a white noise machine, to move the massage beds to the back, or some more insulation to better sound-proof the area to improve business and increase repeat customers.  I thought I was going to have the same issue with the lighting (as when I flipped over it was right in my eyes--one of those overhead ceiling fan types), instead the massage therapist noticed I placed my arm over my eyes and offered to utilize a cloth to cover my eyes as she noted even with the dimmer that it was bright.  For the massage itself, it was the full time allotted, she used the right amount of pressure to get the job done, and used a cream that made my skin feel silky soft on the way out.  I received the obligatory sales pitch afterwards for the "recommended" monthly massages (don't we all wish we had the time and the money for that!), but thankfully she let me leave with the sheet and did not push for my credit card number.  It was okay for what it was and the massage therapist should get props for her efforts.

1.description: Incredible YouSwoop deal - $35 for a one hour massage, I'm there. Even if it's a mere backrub, it's an incredible deal.I went, and the backrub was fine. They have a monthly massage arrangement, and an arrangement for chiropractic. Very good deals!The location FOR ME is not convenient. However, if you live in this neighborhood, GO HERE!

2.description: When I happened upon this place, I was looking for a chiropractor in my neighborhood that also offer massage. The office is small and efficient with ample street parking. I have received great chiropractic care from Dr. Alissa and massage from both therapist for the last 2 years. In terms of chiropractic care, Dr Alissa is very thorough in both her treatments and explanations. She remembers your history (unlike some other specialist I have been to) and is incredibly personable. The massage therapists are both very competent, aren't afraid to apply pressure when necessary. (and trust me, I need a lot of pressure). They are also very thorough with their assessments and treatment. I have had many experience with massages throughout the city, and nothing can beat the service and the price of this place. I want to make this clear, I wasn't looking for a "spa" treatment place, I was looking for a place that can consistently and thoroughly help with my chronic back pain without having to spend a bundle. Advance Physician Pain Management more than fits that bill.

0.description: This is a review of the massage only.I, too, had a YouSwoop coupon for the massage, and am very grateful that, occasionally, there is a "deal" that isn't downtown or Lincoln Park. When I called to make the appointment, I was offered the optional free stress assessment as well. Since it was free, I figured, why not? Even though I already felt pretty sure what my stress level was . . . like, maybe, off the charts?Anyway, the office is located just west of Pulaski on Lawrence. I found free street parking a block away on Leland, near the police station on Pulaski. There is metered parking available on the main streets, of course, but I'm a long-time Chicagoan, and that means - you don't pay to park!The office looks like a medical clinic. Which it is. It's a chiropracty office with massage. A very nice young lady was the receptionist. She did the optional stress test in a back room.The decor is pretty sparse. But frankly, I'm not Oprah's favorite designer, I want good services in a clean space, and that's what this place offers.The stress assessment consisted of blood pressure checks, while seated and while standing. Depending on the difference between the two readings, you can apparently tell if the adrenal glands are working overtime. The young lady also did an eyeball test - she briefly flashed a penlight's beam into each eye, checking to see the rate of the eyeball's contraction. Because I actually eat very healthy and exercise, I was deemed to be on the very low end of stressed.The massage was in the front room, which was pretty chilly and small. However, there was a blanket on the table, so I was not cold after disrobing or during the massage. The massage therapist, Jen, took a moment to ask me about my concerns, and what I wanted from the hour-long massage. And God love her, she actually did what I wanted. Jen's technique was excellent - thorough, good pace, and deep enough so that I really felt like I had good bodywork. She checked in with me about the pressure occasionally. And I totally zoned out - I looked at the clock in the room, before and after, and she did a full hour. But, from la-la land, where I was, it seemed like it was a lot less time. It's Einstein's example of relativity: when you sit on a hot stove, a minute seems like an hour. When you spend an hour kissing your significant other, an hour seems like a minute.Jen did take a moment to go over the Wellness Club membership for massage, and gave me a description to take home. No hard-sell, though, just an informational statement.A really excellent massage session. I highly recommend Jen. Cannot speak to other services offered by this business, since I did not experience them.

4.description: My hour long massage was awesome! I would for sure see Jen again!

58.description: I loved the baba ghanoush! I could've eaten that alone and been satisfied. I had the chicken schwarma sandwich with fries. The fries are steak cut fries seasoned with sumac and served with this tasty garlic sauce. Yum. The sandwich was delicious, but I could live off that baba ghanoush.

56.description: Great food, great service. I've been to this place a few time, and I really like it. They have great food. Pretty much everything they serve is freshly made there, unlike other restaurants that serve you canned food eg canned hummus, grape leaves.

29.description: Mediocre food - nice ambience - prices on the high side.  Both the Lamb and the Kefta kebabs were on the dry side - falafels too.  Go across the street to Salaam if you care for the food and less about the ambience.

42.description: Found this gem in Albany Park in 2007 and have been going back ever since.  Authentic, incredibly fresh, amazing flavors and the atmosphere is terrific.

23.description: One of the top spots in Albany Park. We often get the same, sweet gal for a server and she always makes me smile. BYOB, which is wallet-friendly, so that's a nice perk.Falafel has the perfect texture, which is a falafel game-changer for me. There's more than enough sauce, the lack of which is sometimes a concern for me at Middle Eastern places. I've kind of fallen in love with the pickled veggies they bring as an "appetizer". All the meat main dishes have been juicy and flavorful in my half-dozen experiences so far. Lebanese food as good as I've ever had it in the states. Yum.

47.description: The best falafel, atmosphere and service in any middle eastern restaurant in the city, THEY NEVER DISAPPOINT.

8.description: EntréesLamb and beef kafta: 5Lamb and beef Sharma: 4.5Hummus: 5Baklava: 5Tea (with mint leaves in): 5Service: 5Ambiance: 5It was very busy and animated on a Sunday afternoon, and all was enjoyable.

31.description: I FINALLY tried Semiramis. Finally. What took me so long? I have no idea. It's within walking distance. I pass by it all the time. It's BYOB... but I must admit I was at a friend's house and we wound up ordering it via GrubHub. Wha?GrubHub. I love you and I hate you at the same time or rather, my waistline hates you. On to bigger and better things like how much I loved the falafel pita special with it's red cabbage, pickle and tahini sauce. What I loved even more? THE FRIES! Now, I've made it known that my favorite fries come from another Middle Eastern joint which also resides on Kedzie. But, I think that Semiramis has taken that title with their thick cut steak fries seasoned with sumac. Now, I hate to be a buzz kill amidst all this Semiramis love but as much as I loved the fries... I did not love the garlic "mousse" that accompanied it. I love garlic. I loved the flavor of the garlic "mousse" but I did not like its consistency. I hear the word "mousse" and I think...creamy and light. That is not what you are going to get at Semiramis. The "mousse" is like the consistency of mashed potatoes. Yes, I dipped my french fries in garlic mashed potatoes. Ok, not really...but that's what I felt like I was doing. Yes, I am going to keep going on the garlic mousse thing...I know, I know. This "mousse" should probably be called by it's traditional name; toum. Ya know, so a gringo like me doesn't get their hopes up expecting an aioli type sauce. You are thinking: is she done talking about this damn garlic mousse? Why yes, yes I am. The sandwich is also served with a Lebanese potato salad. At first glance, you might think it's smashed sweet potato...but it's not. I am not sure how I feel about this side dish. I'd rather just stick to the fries. Overall, a tasty experience. I will definitely have to stroll on in and try the roasted chicken that I hear people raving about... with a side of fries, of course.

34.description: This was for a delivery order. I ordered the mixed grill entree, hummus, and fries. Delicious! Everything was in huge portions, so I was able to get 3 meals out of it. The mixed grill entree was especially my favorite. The only negative was the pita bread, which was bland and flavorless. No matter, all the other items made up for it.

16.description: I have been dining at Semiramis for the last 10 years or so.  Love the food.  My wife and I typically start with a couple of appetizers such as the Dolmas, Falafel and hummus.  My wife loves the Fattoush as well.  Always fresh and refreshing. I am addicted to the lamb and beef chawarma with the baba ghannouj.  Joesph makes the best baba in the city.  Love this dish.  My wife is a bit more open than I am and loves the lentils and rice dish and the roasted chicken as well.  Our son is partial to the charwarma and baba (takes after me, i guess). We travel up north for our Semiramis fix 2-3 times a year.  I wish it was closer to home.  We would visit Semiramis more often if it were in walking distance.And, BYOB.  Most excellent.  The baklava, which i believe is purchased from the store across the street, is just perfect for an after dinner dessert.  Not too sweet and not too large.  Just right.  As a side note, you need to walk through part of the kitchen area to use the bathroom.  Some people may dislike this.  I like restaurants that have this layout as it allows me to view the cleanliness of the restaurant.  Semiramis is always sparkling clean.  I am a super big fan of clean restaurants.

13.description: Great food and BYOB. This place always has delicious and fresh food, I've never had a bad meal here.Parking is real easy on the street, just don't forget to pay the meter.I'd like to recommend a specific dish but i've had just about everything here and would recommend it all!

11.description: One of the top spots in Albany Park. We often get the same, sweet gal for a server and she always makes me smile. BYOB, which is wallet-friendly, so that's a nice perk.Falafel has the perfect texture, which is a falafel game-changer for me. There's more than enough sauce, the lack of which is sometimes a concern for me at Middle Eastern places. I've kind of fallen in love with the pickled veggies they bring as an "appetizer". All the meat main dishes have been juicy and flavorful in my half-dozen experiences so far. Lebanese food as good as I've ever had it in the states. Yum.

39.description: A super place to enjoy Middle Eastern food a couple giant steps up from the carryout-oriented joints in the neighborhood (though their handling of carryout orders is excellent, too!). Great place to eat and enjoy conversation. Surprisingly, don't miss the fries. Bonus: you can order a whole roasted chicken to-go for a really low price.

37.description: Been here twice and have never been disappointed. Today, I had the falafel special sandwich and I'm pretty sure it was the best falafel I've had in the city! I love the pickled radishes and olives that they serve too! Friendly service in a cute part of Albany Park!

0.description: This is one of our favorite date night spots in the neighborhood. We always order the same things and enjoy it every time. They have the best hummus (yum!) and my husband loves the French fries with garlic dip. We split the mixed grill for our entree which is basically like a combo platter, and it is delicious. Don't forget to bring a bottle of wine since its BYOB. Our meal with tip is less than $40, which I think is extremely reasonable compared to other date night spots in the city. I definitely recommend Semiramis to anyone visiting Albany Park. Nice ambiance, too:)

38.description: Semiramis is probably my favorite middle eastern restaurant in Chicago.  I'm not sure what it is, but they've gotta be putting something in their chicken because it is delicious.  The hummus is some of the best you'll get in Chicago.  Don't forget to try the different baklavas and Arabic coffee when you're done.

51.description: We had our rehearsal dinner here; we had about 21 people and a few kids. I called and spoke to Joseph the owner the day before and ordered appetizers so they would be ready when we arrived. My family wasn't familiar with the type of food and the servers did a good job of explaining what everything was. Everyone seemed to really enjoy the food and it was reasonably priced. And BYOB always helps!

27.description: This neighborhood spot is by far our favorite! Tonight's meal was especially delicious- and perhaps it's that new cook in the kitchen.  Things to recommend: the "special" sandwiches, the nightly special, the salads-seasoned and dressed perfectly! If you love in the neighborhood, make this place a regular. If not, make this restaurant your destination of choice! Awesome!

32.description: I want to eat here everyday for the rest of time. Awesome food. Good prices. Even better service. Great place.

54.description: My bff introduced me to this place.  The fact that he's from Lebanon and a Middle Eastern food snob, pretty much guaranteed it to be good.  Been here twice and loved it both times! I suggest to get the vegetarian plate to sample all the yummy apps! The mixed grill is delish. Entrees are pretty hefty...you will be stuffed! BYOB to boot!

48.description: Great takeout!!! Falafel and lentil soup were amazing! This is one of few lebanese places in my area that I actually really like and the prices are very reasonable with great portion sizes! Everything was very fresh! I would definitely go/order from here again!

44.description: Semiramis is great. My only issue with them is that they keep offering delivery....and then taking it away again. If they could only stop dashing my dreams of someone delivering delicious chawarma to me as I wear comfortable pants in front of the television, I would give them five stars.

24.description: Delivery service was AWFUL! Driver left before I could answer the door (I live in a high rise and the elevator is slow). Called and explained the situation, and they said it would be an ADDITIONAL DELIVERY CHARGE! I told them that was absolutely unacceptable. The driver came back and the food was ICE COLD! Terrible. Don't waste your delivery budget money with this place.

7.description: Roast Chicken was excellent and their rice is delicious! Hummus also hit the spot. We spent about the same we do when we order pizza, but the meal was better tasting, healthier, and more filling.The best thing though? Delivery was super fast! I do live less than a mile a way, but still we got our food nearly an hour before the GrubHub estimated delivery time.

49.description: If I had to judge the restaurant from my most recent experience, I'd likely give this place only three stars, but every restaurant is entitled to have a bad night. I came in on a weekday evening, there weren't many people there. I ordered a chicken fatoush salad. The presentation was nice, the flavor was so-so. Did the job. Next time I'll stick with the grilled meats, it is probably what they do best. The server was nice, but not the most competent. I will come back--I like this place--but it has its flaws.

40.description: horrible food I could of made a better fatoush salad at home and chicken sharwma was chicken breast cut up and cooked in a frying pan chicken and beef sharwma both where sweet and needed more flavor I will not be ordering from here again sorry the delivery was quick the food was disgusting and the garlic sauce was garlic mashed I'm so angry I spent 30$ for food that I could of made better at home sorry but I do not recommend this place there sharwma sucks I ordered a plate and didn't receive any bread

53.description: what can you say about semiramis that other people haven't probably already said:i just had some leftover lentil soup cold right out of the fridge, didn't re-heat it, and it was profound.  not even in the summer, and it's pretty cold in my apt.  that's a good measuring stick/real talk.

30.description: Checked this place out tonight with my boyfriend and we were both thoroughly impressed.  My boyfriend says the baba ghanoush is the best he's had (it was delish, prob in my top 3) and the super garlicky "mousse" was awesome with the fries (we mixed it with yogurt sauce).  The mixed grill that he got was great, with the kafta being his favorite part.  My veggie plate was yummy, with enough leftover for lunch tomorrow.  I don't usually like dolmas (something about them being cold is weird to me) but I tried these and they were actually decent, just not my "thing."  The best part of the meal by far was the falafel.. it had a bright green center from the herbs and absolutely amazing flavor.  Combine that with BYOB, friendly and attentive service and some baklava to go and we will definitely be back.

46.description: Very nice atmosphere at this Lebanese restaurant. Our waitress was nice and the grilled plate was fantastic! However, chicken shawerma sandwich is made with cold ingredients, except the chicken (even pita bread was chilled) and so it's cold to the touch. I did not like that. Secondly, their garlic toum sauce was not right.Overall, decent place for grilled meats and nice ambience. I do recommend u try it at least once:)

1.description: Cracked olives and picked turnip amuse bouche is a nice touch when you sit down.  I ordered the chicken kafta sandwich.  While almost every middle eastern country has their own version of chicken kafta, for me it's all about the texture.  Many Lebanese places make it with ground chicken breast. I'm guessing Semiaramis' version was mostly white meat.  Although the flavor of the kafta was outstanding, the texture was rather firm & dry.    I find that I prefer the texture of a chicken kafta made with ground thigh & leg meat  ( a few breadcrumbs never hurt either) The minced chicken sandwich was wrapped in a fresh pita with tomatoes, lettuce, cucumber pickles and yogurt sauce .My server was extremely friendly, efficient, and very helpful.  She directed me to hit up Nazareth Bakery to buy sweets and to Sanabel Bakery for the pita.  I will try Semiarmis again to see if I can be "overwhelmed" by the food (like so many other Yelpers).

55.description: A review based on delivery quality and speed. First of all, they made me beef schwarma, chicken kabob sandwiches, hummus, and kibbe with drinks and delivery in 40 minutes from 3 miles away. That's pretty incredible.The packaging was excellent with extra foil around the leakier sauces and the sandwich. The bag everything came in was very neatly organized, intelligently so, order stapled to the outside. The hummus: a giant serving, came with 3 pitas complimentary. Quality of both was excellent and hummus was nicely garnished. The kibbe: a mincemeat fried thing with sauce made mostly from lamb: this was good but not amazing. Perhaps I expected more flavor. I'd probably salt it next time because the quality of the meat was good and it was delicately fried not super heavy. Came on a bed of lettuce with an interesting tahini sauce.Beef Schwarma: a healthy large cup portion with tomato based sauce and a tahini-like sauce (may have had yogurt in it). Different than the tahini for the kibbe. Quality excellent, size, excellent.The chicken kabob sandwich was the highlight of the meal. Perfectly marinated with just the right amount of sauce to make it smooth, but fresh crisp vegetables in a light pita wrap, this was like butter but with more taste contrasts and highlights.I have 2 meals left over from this and it all cost $30. Definitely recommended for delivery.

9.description: Good food....been there a few time, and always very consistent.  BYOB is nice as well.

26.description: Best Lebanese food in Chicago.  I was a huge fan of Joseph's food when he had his place on Belmont, and lost track of him.  I was delighted to find this spot in my new neighborhood-and at my first taste (lentil soup) I asked the waitress if this was ZouZou's restaurant, because I recognized his distinct flavors.  The place is charming, the staff excellent, and the food superb as always.

25.description: Live in a high rise, order delivery all the time. Twice now their delivery man has asked me to come down and pick up the food from the front door. I asked him to come up and he said "don't give me attitude". Avoid this place if you want your food delivered on time and to your door.

12.description: Is tried this restaurant after going to noon-o-kabob and Saleem for years. The whole roast chicken was excellent. The ful and tabbouleh salad were very good also. I will be coming back to try the kabobs.

59.description: we tried this place after having it recommended to us by a random stranger. She had overheard us discussing another mediterranean  restaurant and had a similar opinion of it so I trusted her opinion of this place.my husband had never had schwarma so we ordered some schwarma and kibbe.I have to say I was less than impressed with both. The kibbe were larger than previous kibbe I had tried and a little dry. The schwarma was just disappointing.However, I will definitely give them a 2nd chance.

21.description: I have been dining at Semiramis for the last 10 years or so.  Love the food.  My wife and I typically start with a couple of appetizers such as the Dolmas, Falafel and hummus.  My wife loves the Fattoush as well.  Always fresh and refreshing. I am addicted to the lamb and beef chawarma with the baba ghannouj.  Joesph makes the best baba in the city.  Love this dish.  My wife is a bit more open than I am and loves the lentils and rice dish and the roasted chicken as well.  Our son is partial to the charwarma and baba (takes after me, i guess). We travel up north for our Semiramis fix 2-3 times a year.  I wish it was closer to home.  We would visit Semiramis more often if it were in walking distance.And, BYOB.  Most excellent.  The baklava, which i believe is purchased from the store across the street, is just perfect for an after dinner dessert.  Not too sweet and not too large.  Just right.  As a side note, you need to walk through part of the kitchen area to use the bathroom.  Some people may dislike this.  I like restaurants that have this layout as it allows me to view the cleanliness of the restaurant.  Semiramis is always sparkling clean.  I am a super big fan of clean restaurants.

17.description: So yesterday, Mothers Day, we stopped in for our dinner around 5pm. It was a group of 9 of us and we had my 1 year old nephew with us as well.First let me just say, THANK YOU to the waitress who was patient and so helpful during on whole time there. With my nephew not wanting to sit in his seat (what 1 year old does) and all of us changing our minds and being a pain, she stood their with a smile and always said it was not a problem. This place is tucked on the street filled with so many amazing hole in the wall places, and it does compete very well so! The food was fresh and very good, the only thing im sad about is not ordering the Shrimp salad special which my aunt did because it was OUT OF THIS WORLD amazing! Between all 9 of us we tried almost most the menu. Its not too large but that okay, because was is there is amazing! Helpful Tips:-They take reservations! -Its located right by the metra track. -BYOB! You can't beat that!

10.description: This is a review of their catering/carryout.  I planned a party for an indeterminate number of people (I guessed 30-40 would arrive over a long period of time).  Joseph helped me select a simple combo of foods that would cost around my budget.  The food was freshly made, on time for pick-up and...delicious!   I wish I could make Baba Ganoush or cucumber salad that was even half as good.  Even though the guests loved the food, we had a few left-overs, which was A-OK with us.

5.description: Ful is awesome - super fresh fava beans, garlic, mint...delicious. Pita and cardamom coffee were super tasty as well. Our waitress was really friendly (but not in that overbearing way) and told us all about how the food was prepared. Only complaint was that the kibbe and borak were a little dry.

3.description: I have a bad habit of letting Groupons expire. I wish I actually used the deal at this place, but at least I used my credit. And we ate like queens!Complimentary olives- score!Hummus with warm, soft pitas- so good, I nearly filled up on it.Tabbouleh- I don't know where this has been all my life. This is a must-have.Roast chicken with garlic mousse on the side (a bit like garlic mashed potatoes but with more garlic than potatoes)- pretty good, and a lot of food for a little $.Chicken shawarma wrap with hummus, eggplant, pickles. Delicious, but not quite as good as my fave chicken wrap from Noon-o-Kabab next door. The service was friendly, atmosphere pleasant. Overall very satisfying.

35.description: I eat a lot of Middle Eastern food and after reading the reviews thought this place would be great! The ambience is really nice, but the food is really subpar. They use store bought pita bread (and to me the best part about eating out for this type if food is fresh bubbly house made pita) and the hummus was pasty and flavorless. The entrees were ok but nothing fabulous. I think it was overpriced for the food quality. Not to mention a $6 corking fee for a BYOB place :/The one thing I did really like was the olives and pickled beets they serve upon arrival!

19.description: Fabulous prices and delicious food! Very authentic. Highly recommend the lentil soup and anything with chicken. Their fries with sumac are absolutely the best and that garlic mousse is WOW! Love the Arabic coffee with cardamon and it pairs perfectly with the baklava trio- honey, melts in your mouth.

28.description: The first place we ordered takeout after moving to Chicago. Fatoosh salad and the baba ganush were my fave, and everyone else loved the dolmas and the hummus.

45.description: I was told that this place has the best falafel in Chicago and that if I were to ever go there, that I should get the Falafel Special. I was not steered in the wrong direction.
