It tasted amazing and wouldn't surprise me if it was in fact the best falafel in Chicago. The place was relatively empty but it gave it a nice charm. It's also decorated really well and my girlfriend and I loved our server.  My girlfriend got a ground lamb and beef sandwich which was also delicious.  I'm definitely going back and taking friends from out of town here.

33.description: Our large group happened upon this place and couldn't have been happier. Great middle eastern food. Just go and eat here, you'll be happy.

43.description: Four of us dined at Semiramis last night for the first time.  What friendly, warm atmosphere!  The service was exceptional, only out done by the food!  Can't wait to go back!

2.description: I've been here a few times and I can't believe I haven't received it yet! The first few times was years ago. I don't know if they've changed, if I've changed, or a little bit of both. The prices are ok although I think a lot of the dishes are pre-made. This time we ordered hummus, baba ganoush, and some falafel to start. Everything came out almost immediately. The pita was warm which is a very good thing. The baba ganoush was ok. I think it needed a little something. We love the hummus, and my friend said the falafel was great. I didn't partake because I had ordered the special falafel sandwich. We waited a really long time for our mains. There's one lady running around on her own so maybe she was jammed. My sandwich was all wrapped up in waxed paper and the falafel was cold. I'm pretty sure this sandwich was made earlier in the day, or maybe yesterday. My friend got the mixed meats plate. He said the chicken was his least favorite of the three. It looked really dry. I also think this was prepared either earlier in the day or the day before. He loved the beef and lamb.We shared the baklava trio. I couldn't tell the difference from any of them. The pastry tasted a little stale.

18.description: I FINALLY tried Semiramis. Finally. What took me so long? I have no idea. It's within walking distance. I pass by it all the time. It's BYOB... but I must admit I was at a friend's house and we wound up ordering it via GrubHub. Wha?GrubHub. I love you and I hate you at the same time or rather, my waistline hates you. On to bigger and better things like how much I loved the falafel pita special with it's red cabbage, pickle and tahini sauce. What I loved even more? THE FRIES! Now, I've made it known that my favorite fries come from another Middle Eastern joint which also resides on Kedzie. But, I think that Semiramis has taken that title with their thick cut steak fries seasoned with sumac. Now, I hate to be a buzz kill amidst all this Semiramis love but as much as I loved the fries... I did not love the garlic "mousse" that accompanied it. I love garlic. I loved the flavor of the garlic "mousse" but I did not like its consistency. I hear the word "mousse" and I think...creamy and light. That is not what you are going to get at Semiramis. The "mousse" is like the consistency of mashed potatoes. Yes, I dipped my french fries in garlic mashed potatoes. Ok, not really...but that's what I felt like I was doing. Yes, I am going to keep going on the garlic mousse thing...I know, I know. This "mousse" should probably be called by it's traditional name; toum. Ya know, so a gringo like me doesn't get their hopes up expecting an aioli type sauce. You are thinking: is she done talking about this damn garlic mousse? Why yes, yes I am. The sandwich is also served with a Lebanese potato salad. At first glance, you might think it's smashed sweet potato...but it's not. I am not sure how I feel about this side dish. I'd rather just stick to the fries. Overall, a tasty experience. I will definitely have to stroll on in and try the roasted chicken that I hear people raving about... with a side of fries, of course.

41.description: Love me some Semiramis.  Everything I've eaten has been delicious.  The garlic sauce for dipping...well, I could just drink it.  My friends all love it.  It's affordable, byob, and offers GREAT customer service.  Going there again tonight!

52.description: Semiramis is one of those gems you can keep coming back to again and again (which I do!). Anything on the menu is delicious, the prices are very reasonable, it is BYOB, and you won't have to wait hours for a table on the weekends. What more can you ask for??If you live in the area and hate to cook-- they are a great option for amazing and relatively "healthy" takeout. This is a perfect spot for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. Try Semiramis out, you will not be disappointed!

50.description: Good Lebanese food is hard to come by, even in a big city like Chicago. I have Lebanese roots and have lived here for more than six years. In that time, I've visited most of the prominent Middle Eastern restaurants in the area. In my opinion, Semiramis belongs near the very top of the list. They execute all of the essential elements of a Middle Eastern feast perfectly -- especially the hummus, baba ghannouj, tabbouli, fattoush, and falafel, all of which are consistently prepared the way I'd expect on a trip back to Beirut. You really can't go wrong with a visit to this Albany Park gem. I've been a fan of Semiramis for a while, so when my fiancee and I decided to serve Lebanese food at our wedding, we entrusted Semiramis with the task.  In June 2013, they provided the entrees we served to our 150 guests. Given my family background, I had high standards, but Joseph and his staff were more than up to the task and exceeded our expectations in every respect. Throughout the process, Joseph was easy to work with and available to discuss our menu planning and coordinate logistical issues with our planner and catering staff. On the day of, Joseph made sure that all of the food arrived in perfect, "restaurant-quality" condition - especially the lamb and chicken kebabs, which were cooked perfectly. My extended family - including some who flew in from Lebanon and have very discerning taste when it comes to Mediterranean cuisine - were uniformly impressed, which I can assure you is no small accomplishment!I would recommend Semiramis to anyone who is looking for an authentic, affordable Middle Eastern feast. After our fantastic experience with our wedding, I wouldn't hesitate to suggest them to anyone looking for a family restaurant to cater a wedding or other major event. Thanks again to Joseph and everyone else at Semiramis for your consistently great work - can't wait to stop by again soon!

4.description: I think this place is really underrated. It is like having a big brother that everyone compares you to. You could be doing a good job but still you dont get all the credit you deserve becuase you are living under his shadow. The big brother is noon-o-kabob in this case. Which I love but I still feel takes all the credit from Semiramis. Anyway, Semiramis! The place is small and clean, nothing special but its full of culture. The food is really good and the portions are not bad. For 40 bucks we had 3 appetizers, 1 sandwich and 1 entree. Cant beat that. The hummus and their falafel appetizer are to die for. The great news is that the place is BYOB which I did not know when I came but plan on taking full advantage of it next time.

6.description: By far the best Lebanese restaurant in Chicago.  Their hummus is the creamiest I've ever had and has the perfect balance of texture and seasoning.  Parking is on the streets so if you are going on a weekend be prepared to look around for a bit but I promise you, the hummus and and almost everything else they serve is worth the drive and the wait.

22.description: This place is awesome. I definitely enjoyed this quaint little place.Our waitrees  was great. Try the vegetarian platter,light and fresh.

15.description: Food was great but a little too pricy for what it is. There are more economical options that serve the same style meals. I had the Mixed Grill, all the meats were tender, flavorful, and not over cooked. This in my opinion is not the type of food you want delivered. Eating it fresh off the grill is ideal since it may dry out by the time it arrives to your door. Just an FYI to all the delivery reviews that knocked them. If you don't live within a mile don't even bother asking for delivery.

57.description: Sometimes I get on a Middle Eastern food kick so I try out a bunch of places. We met the owner yesterday afternoon at the restaurant. Super nice, laid back guy. The ambience was just ok. Could use some updating. Service was great! Our server knew the menu well and even pronounced the dishes properly. Food was ok. I ordered the lamb and beef kabob dinner plate. Comes with plenty of rice. It tasted like old rice. I don't want to call it stale but on the drier side. Very minimal grilled veggies. One quarter of an onion, one quarter of a tomato, and one-fourth of a green pepper. That was ok. Two skewers of meat (one lamb and one beef). They were seasoned perfectly and cooked perfectly. No complaints about the meat. Overall experience wasn't bad. I would come back to try the lunch menu/smaller portions.

20.description: One star for quick delivery. The rest is dismal. Mediocre to bad food. Mediocre falafel sandwich but bad babaghanoush. Decent lentil soup and domas, but still not very good. The worse is that I ended up getting sick from it. After talking with my dinner partners about who had what, it came down to the domas with yogurt sauce. I got sick from this food and it makes me unhappy.

36.description: So yesterday, Mothers Day, we stopped in for our dinner around 5pm. It was a group of 9 of us and we had my 1 year old nephew with us as well.First let me just say, THANK YOU to the waitress who was patient and so helpful during on whole time there. With my nephew not wanting to sit in his seat (what 1 year old does) and all of us changing our minds and being a pain, she stood their with a smile and always said it was not a problem. This place is tucked on the street filled with so many amazing hole in the wall places, and it does compete very well so! The food was fresh and very good, the only thing im sad about is not ordering the Shrimp salad special which my aunt did because it was OUT OF THIS WORLD amazing! Between all 9 of us we tried almost most the menu. Its not too large but that okay, because was is there is amazing! Helpful Tips:-They take reservations! -Its located right by the metra track. -BYOB! You can't beat that!

14.description: Meh--average food, average prices.  Beef/Lamb Kefta were a little dry, the waiter told us it would have grilled vegetables.  To me, a charred /raw 1/2 onion, 1/2 a tomato and a couple of green pepper slices don't constitute grilled veg.  BYOB to boot.

58.description: Again another place that when you drive by, you wouldn't give this place a second look! in fact it looks so bad you'd wonder why it even got approved from the health department. We'll you'd be wrong here! its excellent! Great sushi at great prices with excellent service. its take out only. great to order ahead if your entertaining for a large group!

56.description: Nothing like Fresh Sushi! Love the Wasabi!

29.description: My first review was three years ago, so we've been ordering from here a long time.  Got our faves tonight and while it was fine, it just wasn't near as good as it usually is.  I actually didn't eat the tuna roll, it just didn't look fresh, my husband said it tasted okay.  Sadly, I think this was our last take out order here.  While I love the price, I'm willing to pay more for the good stuff.  Such a shame.

42.description: (Korean lady owner): Hello, Lawrence Fish Market(Customer on the phone): Yes, I want two (2) tamago, (2) ebi, (2) salmon sushi, (2) hamachi sushi, and (2) taro sushi.(Korean lady owner): Ok, (repeat the order back to the customer), can I your name and phone number, please?(Customer on the phone): Sure, my name is Lollipop, like a snack.  My number is (123) 345-7890.  (Korean lady owner): Thank you, twenty (20) minutes.  Please note that the phone here rings non-stop because it's how popular, affordable, fresh this place is.  It may appear atypical, but there's nothing shady about it!  Write down LFM # and you will be set and sail!  CASH ONLY

23.description: Amazing! Totally worth the hike form Hyde Park and the trip to the bank (they are cash only). Does not look like a typical sushi restaurant but extremely delicious!

47.description: Deliciousssssss! So cheap and so delicious, I will probably order from here (I mean, make my husband order and go pick up) at least 3 times a week.

8.description: Sashimi explosion! It's so fresh. It's so cheap. It's so delicious. Lawrence Fish Market hands down has the best deal on sashimi platters. $50 cash and even will get you a huge display of fresh fish blobs of all types for the devouring. Check out my pic to see exactly what you'll get for this deal of a deal. It's not a fancy place - place your order, pick up and go. But man is it delicious and cheap! Seriously nothing else like this in the city for all your guppie needs!Ca$h only.Takeout only.Prices can't be beat.Freshness is on point.

31.description: Best sushi in Chicago with prices you can't beat. I come here all the time and they never leave me unsatisfied. The place can look kinda sketchy compared to other sushi restaurants, and it's carry out only but aside from that it's worth every penny.

34.description: As everyone else has said, this place is the best bang for your buck when it comes to sushi/sashimi. There is strictly take out, I really wish they would deliver. The fish comes in fresh, as they supply to other restaurants. My favorite is the giant party tray of sashimi.

16.description: This is the best sushi place in Chicago. I've been to a lot of fancy sushi places, but Lawrence Fish Market is by far my favorite. You can see their base product which is frozen, but if you know anything about sushi, you know that all sushi fish in the US is frozen because of FDA rules. Their fish is some of the best and most importantly, it is affordable. It is cash only and there isn't really seating, but it's definitely one of those hidden gems. Typically, we order over the phone. $80 will get enough to stuff 6 grown men. We then pick it up in the anti-odor device (trash bag lol) and then bring it back to eat at the apartment, or if it's a nice day, we go to a park. Don't be put off by the hole-in-the-wall appearance or the fact that it's not really near anything. Lawrence Fish Market is awesome.

13.description: Still great for cheap, quality sushi. old van seat has been replaced with a decent couch. one spicy tuna maki, one ebi tempura maki with added avocado, 2 super white tuna nigiri, one tuna nigiri and one salmon nigiri ran $12. It was ready in 5 minutes. Salmon was decently marbled. everything was tasty. Staff was friendly. The owner was resting her eyes when I walked in. Cash only.

11.description: I got a couple recs for this divey sushi joint up north, and after a first-hand experience, I can safely put in my own two cents of approval. Lawrence Fish Market is truly a hole-in-the-wall, middle of nowhere place doling out outstanding fish. The Korean owners could not be more friendly. They hand you a paper with the offerings, and you check next to what you fancy. Pay cash only, wait 15 minutes or so, and get a heaping of delicious fish.The standard sushi pieces run a buck or buck and a quarter, making it real easy to load up. The good stuff (here's looking at you, uni) run you a litlte more. Rolls are also very cost-friendly, with even standard fare like spicy salmon made with fish that's better than your average bear. The sushi is remarkably fresh, and if you come away with a large platter and a belly ready to overeat, you shant dine disappointed. As another reminder, the place is cash only, but you're not spending that much dinero so I don't mind the owners saving on the points.

39.description: This is the best sushi place in Chicago. I've been to a lot of fancy sushi places, but Lawrence Fish Market is by far my favorite. You can see their base product which is frozen, but if you know anything about sushi, you know that all sushi fish in the US is frozen because of FDA rules. Their fish is some of the best and most importantly, it is affordable. It is cash only and there isn't really seating, but it's definitely one of those hidden gems. Typically, we order over the phone. $80 will get enough to stuff 6 grown men. We then pick it up in the anti-odor device (trash bag lol) and then bring it back to eat at the apartment, or if it's a nice day, we go to a park. Don't be put off by the hole-in-the-wall appearance or the fact that it's not really near anything. Lawrence Fish Market is awesome.

37.description: When I saw the prices for the sushi here my first thought was that they seemed too good to be true. I was disappointed to find out that's exactly what they are. Any of the rolls with cucumber were just loaded to the gills and I had trouble seeing and trading the fish. The fish itself was good quality, and the non-specialty roles were good and cheap, but any sushi restaurant that tries to inundate me with cucumber to save a little money will lose favor quickly.

0.description: This is now my favorite place for sushi.  Super cheap, the sashimi is HUGE (not kidding, a $1 piece of tuna sashimi was like a brick), and it tastes fresh.  I just hope they never change!Remember cash only

38.description: We regularly attend this establishment for sushi takeout. Their food is always amazing. Fresh and consistent. They are quite a drive for me but always worth it. Great prices too! Would recommend to everyone!

51.description: The Lawrence Fish Market family thanks you for 27 years of loyalty, love, and patronage. Even though the store is still there, our team no longer is. After years of joyfully and faithfully serving the Chicagoland community, it is with heavy hearts that our family says goodbye.

27.description: Best and the most freshest sushi ever. I use to be a sushi chef so I'm not lying when I say the quality here is astounding. The staff is very friendly, and once when I short a dollar they let it slide. If that's not customer service I'm not sure what is. Great pricing to!

32.description: This place is the business if you want cheap, fresh sushi! The place is a hole-in-the-wall like others have said and a bit of a drive depending where you live in the city, so my friends and I have to drive there when we really want to indulge. They don't have any seating, but that's okay since eating sushi in your sweats in front of the TV is the best. Their prices also can't be beat (~$6 for a rainbow roll vs. $12 at any other sushi restaurant) and they have a wide variety of maki rolls and nigiri that will satisfy anyone. Highly recommend their rainbow rolls, hamachi nigiri, and toro and uni nigiri if you really want to treat yoself. This is the place to satisfy your sushi craving without breaking the bank and beats any AYCE sushi joint!

54.description: Me and friends ate everything and it was delicious: Crunch, Boston, Philadelphia, Tempura, Spider it was all good. Service was quick and friendly! I will be back really soon there was no seating, so we ate in the McDonalds down the street.

48.description: This place is really cheap for really good sushi.  It is really fresh and the pieces of fish for the nigiri sushi are larger than most places.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  The only cons are it is an all cash business, and take-out only,but a small price to pay for such reasonably-priced sushi with such large portions.

44.description: Delicious fresh sushi platter for a reasonable price. It's a small store, with no seating. The wait was about 20min, during which we walked around outside for a bit (not much to see around there though). 4 stars because of the more remote location.

24.description: This is my go to place if I ever want good and cheap sushi to carry out.  Its not the most appealing looking place but it doesn't really matter since you are taking it togo anyway.  Make sure to bring cash and call in early to keep you from waiting when picking it up.  **If you are in Skokie, another comparable place would be Dempster fish market.

7.description: This is my go to place if I ever want good and cheap sushi to carry out.  Its not the most appealing looking place but it doesn't really matter since you are taking it togo anyway.  Make sure to bring cash and call in early to keep you from waiting when picking it up.  **If you are in Skokie, another comparable place would be Dempster fish market.

49.description: Like the other reviewers mentioned, this place is NOT meant to be a sit down restaurant. Word of advice: call at least half an hour to an hour in advance to place your order as they may get swamped (especially on weekends). The rolls with raw fish are much better than some of the other ones (i.e. the spider roll is passable). The rainbow roll is my absolute fave and they aren't stingy on the fish! The only big downside is that it is cash only.

40.description: My favorite food is sushi and for many years I have picked up sushi from Lawrence Fish Market a couple of times a month.  It is carry out only and cash only.  The prices were and still are the best in the Chicago area.  The fish used to be, but no longer is, as fresh and pretty much as high quality as you will find in most decent sushi places around Chicago.  Though, not surprisingly, I have never found sushi in Chicago as high grade as on the East and West coasts where I ate sushi a couple of times a week when I lived there.A couple of months ago Lawrence Fish Market changed management, and probably ownership, and it has been very disappointing since.  The 3 times I picked up from Lawrence since the management change they tried to overcharge me twice (e.g. $43 for $31 worth of sushi), the quality of some of the fish was not good at all, twice the girl answering the phone and taking orders had no clue what was on their menu so it took forever to place the order and twice they had my order wrong.Hate to say this, but I won't be going back to Lawrence Fish Market anytime soon.

53.description: The fish is very fresh and cheap. The place is not fancy but they are clean. If you want sushi at a good price, this is out. It is take out only but for this price does it matter?

30.description: I decided to try this place based on the reviews, and overall was pretty pleased. The sushi was fresh, and a great vie for the price. The only criticism is that the spicy salmon roll was not spicy at all. I don't live in the neighborhood, so it's a hike to get out here. Be prepared to take out, as there's only one table to sit. Overall, a really good place for take out if you live in the area.

46.description: I love this place. Call ahead to avoid having to wait there because the place is tiny, but oh so good. Their menu is so cheap and great. Any time friends visit from out of town we put in a order. :) Can't recommend it enough.

1.description: I still LOVE this place! (I literally just finished eating from here) They're still as awesome as ever and at an unbeatable price. Sad news...  the "famous van seat" is gone... but hey, things change. Seriously, skip all the other sushi places and get some amazing take out here! I also recommend doing a combination tray. Just tell them an amount over $30 and let them do the rest. Oh, and there are other yummy little add-on's like seaweed salad!

55.description: Cheap and good, not much else to say

9.description: So glad I stumbled upon this place. Legit be ready for some cheap fresh Sushi. I ordered 7 rolls, for 3 people, and they were ready in 20mins. Small place that looks sketchy from the outside, but the Sushi did not dissapoint. I will be coming back for all my to go sushi needs.

26.description: The sushi here is probably one of the best I've had, it's carry out and cash only but so worth it! And the prices make things even better!

25.description: A very good fresh place for fresh fish market. They also make really fresh sushi here as well. The fish is so fresh and good. Also it's very cheap as well. Parking was a little hard to find since its on the side streets and it is pay to park

12.description: $4 Philly roll? Phuck yes.. all the sushi here is so cost effective I am thinking of starting a sushi delivery restaurant that jacks up the price of this sushi by 20-30% and delivering that. Nobody knows about this place, which is good and bad. Good because there is not much of a wait, bad because if they go out of business I will cry. I dropped $60 and had enough for lunch and dinner for 4. Sat on the couch with a yoga mat on it like I owned the joint. The inside is reminiscent of where the joker got his reconstructive surgery in the original Batman movie, look it up you goddamn millenials, with your gluten free snapchat. JACK WAS THE ORIGINAL JOKER! HE WAS THAT ROLE!The owner/ head chef / guy with monogrammed white outfit is so crazy nice and polite, I love it. His waifu is all smiley but seems like she is trying REEEAAALLLLY hard not to stick a chopstick in my forehead. Find this place steps from the admiral theater, on a strangely unfamiliar strip of Lawrence far from your gentrified yupsterville a few miles east. Here you will see glimpses of the old country manifested in shops that sell everything from weirdly fashioned soccer equipment, electronics, cologne, jeans etc. All made by the cousins of those running the shops here in Chicago. Its like walking through a museum of closed sweatshops. I still got 4 knit hats for $20 next door. Also if your in this hood, check out the 240 lounge nearby.

59.description: Sashimi explosion! It's so fresh. It's so cheap. It's so delicious. Lawrence Fish Market hands down has the best deal on sashimi platters. $50 cash and even will get you a huge display of fresh fish blobs of all types for the devouring. Check out my pic to see exactly what you'll get for this deal of a deal. It's not a fancy place - place your order, pick up and go. But man is it delicious and cheap! Seriously nothing else like this in the city for all your guppie needs!Ca$h only.Takeout only.Prices can't be beat.Freshness is on point.

21.description: My partner and I went there last Friday. Ordered,  on our way there and still have to wait for almost an hour, as expected. We ordered the combination platter for $50, 1/2 sashimi, 1/2 sushi plus 2 unagi. 2 uni and 2 amaebi. Total $78. Took them back to our room at the SilverSmith hotel on Wabash and devoured the entire platter...burrrrp( excuse us). OMG they were oh so so good, fresh and very reasonably priced. Rest assured we were very very satisfied. That was our 2nd time there and today may be our third before heading back to Atlanta tomorrow. We have been to sushi restaurents in Atlanta, San Francisco, New York. Portland, DC, Tokyo, Kuala Lumur, Bangkok, LA but this would be our top 3 sushi place. Its an unassuming, hole in the wall sushi joint but boy, will u be please with the sushi...

17.description: These guys are always so good. I can't believe this is the first review I'm writing for them, I order probably bi-monthly. Everything from there is so yummy and is super inexpensive. The only different thing that they do is put lettuce in the spider roll, so I usually order without. The people there are always super friendly and work super hard. They are cash only, so don't let that trip you up, but there is a chase bank within a few blocks.

10.description: Decor/cleanliness/environment: just a reminder: THIS IS A MARKET, not a restaurant. Look at the pictures to have an idea how the inside looks like.  (Not applicable)Service: they make fresh sushi right in front of you and they are quick making it.  Good service!!! FYI: you can call to order so that once you go inside, it's ready for you to pick up. (1.5/1.5)Food: FRESH!!!! GOOD QUALITY!!!! No complains!!!! (2/2)Cost: Price is very decent! Cheaper than other sushi places I have been to in Chicago. (1.5/1.5)

5.description: Went here for the first time after the change in ownership.  I was a bit skeptical but the sushi here is better than ever.  On the nigiri the fish was cut thicker than before (in a good way) and the presentation of the platters was genuinely beautiful.  So beautiful, in fact, that the family started devouring the sushi before I could snap a pic (oops).Crazy good value and damned tasty too.  I'm a fan.

3.description: I almost considered not writing this because I want to keep this gem to myself. You've read the other reviews, yes the outside is shady, but you're prepared now, you got this. So u pull up, your eyebrows burrow & you are hesitate to come in. But you're craving sushi & you want it now. Pick up the paper menu on the counter, 6 rolls ordered, 15 min wait, & $35 cash...you are visually in awe. The sushi looks great, so great that I forgot to take a pic. You start with the ginger & then Wow! Delicious sushi and so affordable! Tips: cash only, order by phone, metered parking.Must try!

35.description: No frills, yet fresh and made to order.  Affordable prices too! The presentation is great for party trays!

19.description: Extremely busy location but worth the wait! Don't let the  appearance fool you, sushi is fresh and generous portions. Worth the wait

28.description: We happened to be sailing down Pulaski, in need of some tilapia for dinner, when C told me to "turn right!" She had Yelped "fish market" and Lawrence Fish Market popped up. I asked for one pound of tilapia and was told it would be 15-20 minutes. I was somewhat surprised, but another patron leaned over and said, "They really busy. They're always busy." Good sign, I thought. Meanwhile I watched as they prepared are variety of sushi and sashimi; customers came and went. Soon my fish was ready. I hadn't anticipated that they cut up the tilapia into little, bite-size pieces, but it didn't matter for my purposes. Next time I'll be clear that I wanted fillets. The fish had excellent texture. In fact, I tried it raw and it was perfectly okay. But I'm not a fan of raw tilapia.

45.description: Fresh and cheap sushi! Probably some of the best I've had in a while. Definitely just a take out place so call for pick-up first! I went in and placed my order and it took about 15 minutes which wasn't bad. They have a pretty comfy blue couch too if you're waiting on your food. The spider roll was amazing! And they're pretty generous with the fish. I'm so glad I found this place, will definitely be coming back regularly!

33.description: Ordered for the first time and asked for the suggestions of the person answering the phone. They accommodated and did not make me feel one bit like I was asking too many questions when I was asking about the dishes. To our delight, the food was great and the servings were more than expected. It's a little far for us but will definitely order again.

43.description: Warning!! Due to excellent quality and dirt cheap sushi prices, you are likely to over eat and fall into a food coma for several hours.Love this place!!

2.description: This place is a hidden treasure!!Best sushi carry out place! Not only its FRESH, got delicious sushi, its very very reasonable priced!Pros:Great selection of FRESH fish!Offer party trays at very very affordable rateTips:ONLY take cash!Place your order early and by phone!No dine-in, carry out onlyMetered parking

18.description: The fish is so fresh !! It's my new favorite place to get take out sushi. They are really nice, and their prices are awesome !! Lots of sushi does not equal $$$$ here. Try it out! Just to go, though.

41.description: An awesome place to go for cheap, fresh, sushi.With the quality of sushi that you get and the price you pay, Lawrence Fish Market really can't be beat. The rolls are a few bucks and sashimi ranges from $1-3/piece depending on what you get (and $4 for toro). Like others have stated, the fish here is probably some of the freshest there is in Chicago. The workers are all extremely nice, too, which is always a huge plus.Tips:-It's a small little market and it can be easy to miss when you walk by, so keep an eye out for it-It's cash only, so be sure to have some bills on hand when you come pick up your order-It's not really a dine-in place (although I guess you COULD eat at the one table they have...but whenever I go someone is sitting there working, and I've yet to see anyone eat their food there), so basically you're placing a to-go order-I suggest calling in your order ahead of time to avoid having to wait in the small store (check the Yelp pics for the menu)Definitely will be back!

52.description: Sashimi explosion heaven!!  If you're looking for inexpensive, fresh, sushi, Sashimi or a sushi - sashimi party platter, that won't break the bank, go to Lawrence Fish Market soon!!!I've eaten sushi at Lawrence Fish Market for years.  This place is a hidden Chicago gem.I have family and friends driving from the suburbs just to buy fresh fish and sushi from  this restaurant.  This is a very small fish market, that just so happen to sell fresh sushi.  The prices are unbelievably inexpensive!!!  This is not a fancy dine in restaurant, it's a order and take out restaurant.  The sushi, sashimi, party platters, etc are made fresh, they are not pre-packaged, call in your order or order in person, be prepared to wait about 20 minutes or so depending on how much food you order.  The short wait is worth it, because the food is fresh!!!Please go to Lawrence Fish Market ASAP,,, pick up some Soju and/or sake and enjoy dinner, with family, friends, have a party, or just a quite romantic sushi & Sashimi at home.  The only downside; they don't have brown rice or black rice sushi.The BEST KEPT secret in Chicago for FRESH seafood, sushi rolls, sashimi, etc... everything seafood :)   The party platters are beautiful & delicious!!! :)

50.description: Tip: call ahead of time to place your order and then pick up in store. It is more like a take out place, if you order when you get there, you might need to wait a while as there are a few party tray orders in front of you.This place is offers very good value. The sushi is fresh and the price is cheap. For the spicy salmon/tuna/scallop (yes, scallop!!!) rolls, it is only $3.25 each. Of course it would not be like the top of the class freshness, but given its price, i think it is great value. It is definitely fresher than a lot of the sushi bars at 3 times the price in the loop.You would wonder how they make money at such low margin, but when you see their volume of business and how hectic they are preparing all sorts of party trays, the answer is obvious.

4.description: Ok, after more than 8 visits, we've never gotten sick, the sushi is super fresh and reasonably priced - so I've increased my rating from 3 to 4 stars. They have a great following now so why not remodel the entire store and charge a little bit more. Because I'm willing to pay more for a better experience.

6.description: (Korean lady owner): Hello, Lawrence Fish Market(Customer on the phone): Yes, I want two (2) tamago, (2) ebi, (2) salmon sushi, (2) hamachi sushi, and (2) taro sushi.(Korean lady owner): Ok, (repeat the order back to the customer), can I your name and phone number, please?(Customer on the phone): Sure, my name is Lollipop, like a snack.  My number is (123) 345-7890.  (Korean lady owner): Thank you, twenty (20) minutes.  Please note that the phone here rings non-stop because it's how popular, affordable, fresh this place is.  It may appear atypical, but there's nothing shady about it!  Write down LFM # and you will be set and sail!  CASH ONLY

22.description: This place looks a bit creepy from the outside...even inside lol. But their fish is super fresh and the sushi is really good and very reasonably priced! I live in the neighborhood and have order a lot of their rolls...very yummy! Don't judge a book by its cover. Try it out!

15.description: An awesome place to go for cheap, fresh, sushi.With the quality of sushi that you get and the price you pay, Lawrence Fish Market really can't be beat. The rolls are a few bucks and sashimi ranges from $1-3/piece depending on what you get (and $4 for toro). Like others have stated, the fish here is probably some of the freshest there is in Chicago. The workers are all extremely nice, too, which is always a huge plus.Tips:-It's a small little market and it can be easy to miss when you walk by, so keep an eye out for it-It's cash only, so be sure to have some bills on hand when you come pick up your order-It's not really a dine-in place (although I guess you COULD eat at the one table they have...but whenever I go someone is sitting there working, and I've yet to see anyone eat their food there), so basically you're placing a to-go order-I suggest calling in your order ahead of time to avoid having to wait in the small store (check the Yelp pics for the menu)Definitely will be back!

57.description: I'm so glad I found this place on yelp. This is not a restaurant. It's mostly just a take out counter in a little place that you'll walk right past if you didn't know better. I ordered there and waited about 10 minutes for my order. The prices are unreal. Rolls are like 3 or 4 bucks mostly and sashimi as cheap as a dollar a piece. Everything was delicious. They make it well and present it nicely for take out.

20.description: $4 Philly roll? Phuck yes.. all the sushi here is so cost effective I am thinking of starting a sushi delivery restaurant that jacks up the price of this sushi by 20-30% and delivering that. Nobody knows about this place, which is good and bad. Good because there is not much of a wait, bad because if they go out of business I will cry. I dropped $60 and had enough for lunch and dinner for 4. Sat on the couch with a yoga mat on it like I owned the joint. The inside is reminiscent of where the joker got his reconstructive surgery in the original Batman movie, look it up you goddamn millenials, with your gluten free snapchat. JACK WAS THE ORIGINAL JOKER! HE WAS THAT ROLE!The owner/ head chef / guy with monogrammed white outfit is so crazy nice and polite, I love it. His waifu is all smiley but seems like she is trying REEEAAALLLLY hard not to stick a chopstick in my forehead. Find this place steps from the admiral theater, on a strangely unfamiliar strip of Lawrence far from your gentrified yupsterville a few miles east. Here you will see glimpses of the old country manifested in shops that sell everything from weirdly fashioned soccer equipment, electronics, cologne, jeans etc. All made by the cousins of those running the shops here in Chicago. Its like walking through a museum of closed sweatshops. I still got 4 knit hats for $20 next door. Also if your in this hood, check out the 240 lounge nearby.

36.description: Fave upon fave upon fave. My normal order: - crunch - spicy tuna - ET - california - spider $20 of goodness.

14.description: How disappointing. Our family's been going to this place for over a decade, and it's gone down hill. The owners recently changed, quality has gone down significantly and the prices have sky rocketed. Ordered a modified rainbow roll (shrimp tempura instead of the artificial crab) 1 toro, 1 uni and 1 hirami sashimi. The sashimi size is half of what it used to be. And the fish was not fresh, horrible fishy taste. And it cost $17.50. This USED TO BE a place that had a fun and witty jokester for an owner and served the best sushi in town for an amazing price that I used to tell my friends about. I don't think I'll be recommending this place to anyone anymore. Definitely not worth the money, the time traveled or quality.

1.description: I've been to several tattoo/piercing shops around Chicago and I have to say, this is the cleanest and most friendly shop I've been to. Its fairly new so you might not have heard much about it until now, but definitely go in and check it out, you will be pleasantly surprised. I went in to get a cover-up of a messed up tattoo I got from a different shop in the city (which I have chosen not to name). My artist at Tattoo Boulevard, Barry, did an amazing job and I am so proud to show off my new art! I went this past Wednesday for the consultation and Barry had something drawn up for me by Thursday evening. When I went in today to get poked we spent a few hours longer than we anticipated, but it was a good sized, detailed piece and Barry was really taking his time to do his best work on me. The time didn't matter to me, Barry set up his personal computer and we watched a few episodes of Game of Thrones while he worked. Not to mention that the other artists were coming around to check out our progress and help give suggestions for the cover-up as well. I am so grateful for his patience and precision, his art looks fantastic on my arm and I plan to return in the future for more artwork!

2.description: This place is amazing! Super clean and beautiful! Each artist's artwork is displayed to exhibit their talent. Everyone there is super nice and accommodating. They make you feel at ease and is very helpful. This is definitely the place to get inked! I have gotten all of my work done by angel who is super talented! Love this place!

0.description: The shop just opened up and I have to say I'm very impressed. It is super clean and spacious. Everyone is super friendly. They have 2 piercers and 7 artists.My artist is Angel who is also the owner of the shop. He is very professional and his work is exceptional. This coming from a girl with 29 tattoos. There is a lot of parking around. Also a parking lot that is pay on weekdays but free on the weekends.

1.description: We attempted to try it out; unfortunately, they happened to close early on a Saturday night.  That was ok with us. As we were about to turn around to find somewhere else to eat, the man (assuming who was the owner) came running after us and asked if we wanted whatever was left for the day.  I used to work at food service as my very first job in my teenage years.  With that being said, if they were to have any leftover, by law they need to discard the food.  Rosa J. hates to be wasteful and accepted his invitation to come in.  He was SUPER kind to us, same with the young lady who rang us up at the register.  The food was fantastic.  I would say it's a Mexican take-on American comfort food.  We had lots of chicken, pita bread, pasta salad, mashed potatoes, and rice (courtesy of them...gratis).  For a little more than $15, there was so much food.  Stupid Rosa J.!  I've been living in Albany Park for a year and half and never walked in to Nick's Pit Shop.  Did those yummy grilled chicken ever appear tempting to me?  I must have been lying to myself that I didn't want any chicken.  From now on, No More Lies!

9.description: This location is so much better than the Bucktown one.The staff is incredibly friendly, and even recognizes me though I only head out there once every couple of months. The chicken and sides are all exactly as they should be - fresh, flavorful and warm.On Saturdays and Sundays, they have a lady making tortillas in the front of the restaurant. They are without a doubt the best tortillas I've had in my entire life. It's worth it for those alone.

23.description: If you like bad customer service and spoiled rice then dine here. The young lady taking orders was rude, the chicken dry and the rice was spoiled. I will never dine here again. This place does not deserve the one star I had to give it to post this review.

12.description: Love Nick's Pit Stop. Best chicken in the city, that and Chicken Planet but that is way down in the Loop.

21.description: I haven't eatin here but we always order a whole chicken to take home. Their whole chicken is the best, I would say it's better than Boston market....

16.description: I consider myself a food snob. I have traveled and lived in many places across the world. Hong Kong, London, Charlotte, Monterrey, etc. I can, confidently say without a doubt, this is the best chicken i've ever tasted in my life. The chicken with the spicy green salsa... Amazing.

17.description: The first time I ordered from Nick's Pit Stop in Albany Park was through delivery and  the chicken was great. The first time I stepped into the restaurant, I was impressed. The  person who took my order provided great service, great recommendations, and were fast. However, I ordered by delivery again yesterday and sad to say, I was very disappointed. First of all, the delivery guy could've been a little more friendly. He  demanded that I give him a tip not knowing that I already included it with the bill and his body language was just unfriendly, and the woman who took my order through the phone did not tell me how much I had to pay after I asked her 3 times, the chicken was burnt and dry as if I got the worst of the bunch (usually their chicken is moist,  tender, and flavorful, but this was just terrible), and the only thing from me not tearing this place apart is because of past service. I know for sure that I will not order delivery from them again if it's going to be that ass who will be bringing me the food! On the plus side, if you decide to order their sides, their refried black beans and mashed potatoes are good. Hope I didn't sound too mean...

10.description: The chicken were very very well cooked. The skin got nice crisp and the meat is moist and delicious. The sauce they provide were very lack luster. The BBQ sauce tasted like it has a lot of ketchup in it. The spicy green sauce was good but didn't quite go with the chicken. The sides were okay, not bad but nothing spectacular either.Despite the lackluster sides I'm still giving them 4 stars because the chicken, which is the main attraction of the shop, is done very well. Would definitely go back again and again when I'm in the mood for grilled chicken!

5.description: Great food love the chix special eat here daily

11.description: We stopped here for lunch because I saw a woman making tortillas in the window and that seemed like a good sign. The name sounds like barbeque to me but it's all chicken on the menu. The very friendly servers speak both Spanish and English but this isn't exactly a taco place. Or a barbeque place.  It's mostly chicken with sides . I ordered a Regular Half which comes with two sides - I chose macaroni and cheese which was good and mashed potato and gravy which was okay. It came with four pieces of chicken so I took a lot of it home. And it came with tortillas! Which were not as good as I thought they would be but that's me - I've only ever eaten factory made tortillas.My husband got a Chicken Pita sandwich with beans and rice. He said they were good not great.   Horchata was good, a little sweet but I told myself the cinnamon cancelled out the sugar. The nice man behind the counter said that he had taken some things off the menu to simplify it.  That and the fact that I am first to review makes me think they are new here.  The decor is a little dingy but that lovely mango color that you see everywhere in places like this is nice here. I won't make a special trip back but I'd definitely go back if I was in the area again.

22.description: I have gotten delivery to work from here a few times and they have been all excellent experiences.  Tons of food, moist and tender chicken, all at a great price.  The chicken is really, really, good. You taste the natural taste of the chicken with the great char taste supplied by the pit.  The combo is the way to go. Comes with a side (which are all fan-freakin-tastic, pita/tortillas, and choice of BBQ sauce (spicy and tangy) or salsa (rich and spicy).  And all huge portions.  This is a great little hole-in-the-wall on Lawrence.  Worth a look if you are a big fan of char-grilled Chicken like this reviewer is!

0.description: Me encanta el pollo al carbon a Nicks Pit Stop.  (I love the grilled chicken at Nicks Pit Stop).  The staff are friendly, the food is fresh and comfort.  Homemade horchata and homemade hot sauces make it even better.  Gracias Nick's.

20.description: A review of this place is long overdue, as I'm there almost every week.  The staff is super sweet, and has your order ready in seconds.  Their delivery is also really fast.There's really not much to say.  It's perfectly done grilled chicken.  Moist and flavorful and soooooo satisfying.  They leave the skin on, and it's crispy and a delicious and just the right texture.  But it's great without the skin too.I barely even need to bother buying and making chicken myself - I can go to Nick's and get one that's perfectly prepared for the same price of uncooked chicken in a grocery store.I'd give it five stars - I mean hell, I seriously haven't found better grilled skin-on chicken, but I'm afraid Nick's isn't a full meal.  It's the star of a meal I'm making myself at home.  They serve a bunch of unspecial sides ie corn that tastes like it's from a can, beans, etc.  You can either get  tortillas or pitas with your chicken (and the tortillas are lovingly handmade by a lady in the window each week), but they don't really have the fixings to either go middle eastern or mexican - no tomatoes, cucumber, parsley, cilantro - in fact, nothing fresh.   I head to Nick's on the way home from the grocery store.So really, they only do one thing, and they do it perfectly.  Flavorful, delicious  chicken.

19.description: We walked into this place because it was too hot to cook and we wanted to try something we hadn't before. Everyone was sticky and crabby so if the place was a bust it was going to be a bad day.  The baseball game was on, perfect for a sunny day and the folks behind the line greeted us warmly. As we sat down my husband ordered whole chickens (that's the thing at this place) and a few sides. The food was delivered promptly, and the chicken was really juicy and flavorful. We had tortillas, corn, beans and mashed potatoes and while nothing was a revelation, everything was hot, reasonably tasty and a good value. We fed a family of five for about $25 and had much more substantial food than we might at a typical fast food joint. The bathrooms were comfortably clean, the decor is a little awful - bright yellow from floor to ceiling and  a ton of classic Americana artifacts splashed all over the place - but it's got some kind of personality, and the staff was very pleasant. Overall, a pretty good experience for a shot in the dark.

2.description: Tried the chicken with the mac and cheese and mashed potatoes and it was pretty decent and environment was pretty clean and the service was very good also.

18.description: I haven't eatin here but we always order a whole chicken to take home. Their whole chicken is the best, I would say it's better than Boston market....

13.description: I'll admit it.  I don't get it.  Why do I get pita bread and salsa with my BBQ chicken?A friend who's a regular brought this over one night and it was...alright.  The chicken and the sides were fine...but it wasn't anything to write home about. Certainly not with Brasa Roja so close to me (and half the price!)!  And then...I found myself staring...what do I use this pita bread for? To eat my green beans? Or my mashed potatoes? Do I put the salsa on it? What am I MISSING?!

4.description: Chicken was thoroughly cooked and well seasoned. Very reasonably priced. The spanish rice was just ok. Friend had green beans and mac and cheese and that looked like a better option. Very friendly staff and plenty of seating.

6.description: Grilled quarter white meat chicken...mmmm moist and perfectly cooked. Accompanied by warm tortillas and black beans and a soda. Fast, hot and fresh!

15.description: I finally stopped on the way in from the highway and was surprised to enjoy very nice chicken and sides (black beans and green beans). I would say I prefer their chicken to Chicken Planet downtown. Everything tasted homemade. Service was good - there seemed to be a husband/wife team running the joint.

7.description: A review of this place is long overdue, as I'm there almost every week.  The staff is super sweet, and has your order ready in seconds.  Their delivery is also really fast.There's really not much to say.  It's perfectly done grilled chicken.  Moist and flavorful and soooooo satisfying.  They leave the skin on, and it's crispy and a delicious and just the right texture.  But it's great without the skin too.I barely even need to bother buying and making chicken myself - I can go to Nick's and get one that's perfectly prepared for the same price of uncooked chicken in a grocery store.I'd give it five stars - I mean hell, I seriously haven't found better grilled skin-on chicken, but I'm afraid Nick's isn't a full meal.  It's the star of a meal I'm making myself at home.  They serve a bunch of unspecial sides ie corn that tastes like it's from a can, beans, etc.  You can either get  tortillas or pitas with your chicken (and the tortillas are lovingly handmade by a lady in the window each week), but they don't really have the fixings to either go middle eastern or mexican - no tomatoes, cucumber, parsley, cilantro - in fact, nothing fresh.   I head to Nick's on the way home from the grocery store.So really, they only do one thing, and they do it perfectly.  Flavorful, delicious  chicken.

8.description: Best Chicken in town! Two people can easily finish one chicken. The red salsa is perfect, while the green one is SPICY has heck! For sides bf and I had cold pasta and rice and they were both pretty darn amazeballs!

3.description: This is some of the best food I've had in a while! And the people working here are the nicest people I've come across in a service setting in a loooong time. Nice, clean place. Amazing food. Great people. Highly recommended.

14.description: I have gotten delivery to work from here a few times and they have been all excellent experiences.  Tons of food, moist and tender chicken, all at a great price.  The chicken is really, really, good. You taste the natural taste of the chicken with the great char taste supplied by the pit.  The combo is the way to go. Comes with a side (which are all fan-freakin-tastic, pita/tortillas, and choice of BBQ sauce (spicy and tangy) or salsa (rich and spicy).  And all huge portions.  This is a great little hole-in-the-wall on Lawrence.  Worth a look if you are a big fan of char-grilled Chicken like this reviewer is!

56.description: THE BEST PHO EVER! LD Pho used to be located on California and Lawrence (my local spot until they changed ownership). They have now relocated to Kedzie near Lawrence, and the food is better than ever. The pho is definitely the highlight, but really all of the dishes are so good! My husband and I are frequent diners - and each and every time, we are treated with amazing service and wonderful food. Our usual is the egg banh-mi and pho. The flavors are wonderful and it's filled with lots of noodles and chicken/beef. The best part of our whole meal is always the hospitality we receive. Every diner becomes a part of LD's family, and you feel like you're at home with your family when eating there. The chef, Liu, is not only extremely talented but he has an incredible passion for food and creating wonderful dishes.Hands down, our #1 restaurant to get some great good and top notch pho!

29.description: The chef seemed so passionate in the food he cooks It was perfect!!! He actually came out and made great recommendations for me. For appetizers we ordered pork spring rolls and the first bite I took was a shocking surprise of a yummy crunch! They make their spring rolls with a piece of fried egg roll paper wrapped inside and it was so good!!!  I ordered the the Vietnamese pork chops and O. M. F. G. BEST. MARINATED. PORK CHOPS. EVER!!! My mom got the traditional Vietnamese pho and it was the perfect seasoning! It had so much flavor! Other places I've been are either plan blah or filled with msg sugars. You can taste the healthiest of the broth! My mom is a chef herself so for her to even like anything is great! I'll definitely be coming back for seconds, thirds, infinity.

42.description: Amazing food!! Out of all the Vietnamese restaurants in Chicago, LD Pho is out all time favorite. The pho is delicious, as well as everything else on the menu. The owner, Liu, has a love and passion for cooking and it shows through his amazing creations. A must!

23.description: Great phó! I love the coconut shrimp and firecracker shrimp and fried egg rolls. I'll definitely be frequenting LD phó!

47.description: Some of their prices may look extreme so I just stick to the basics. Bah Mi's are yummy. Pho is pholicious and I'm certain they have other decent items that I can't wait to try. I frequented his old location and am happy that he's closer.  Very close to the Kedzie Brown line so if you travelers who don't want to walk from Kimball and Lawrence to this place just hop on the brown line and get off on Kedzie. You will be happy that you did.

8.description: Went here on a whim a few days ago- the entrees were good but the service was great. I got the pho ga and the broth was just wonderful for this weather. We tried the deep fried Oreos after dinner- they came with apples which was a nice touch. Delicious.

31.description: Ld pho is the best pho I ever had! It's a great family business. The service is wonderful,  the food is amazing... try the porkchop. ..it's my favorite! We will be back ! Again and again

34.description: This place is great! Lu is a great host, and the food is excellent. The grilled pork spring rolls are probably the best spring rolls in the city. The #16 special pho with everything is fantastic!

16.description: I can't say enough good things about this place. Everything is delicious. My favorite is the pho, No.25 and 37. The deep fried Oreo is also heavenly. Thank you for putting in your souls and making delicious food!

13.description: Okay, so I don't often give out five stars (although another welll deserved 5 star review for Supino's in "the D" is coming soon), unless a place truly deserves it. Considering this place is new, I would have expected some growing pains, but if this place isn't up to it's full potential, then damn! They might need 6 stars to be fair. The service is friendly and very helpful, the atmosphere is simple, but clean, the aromas from the kitchen get you salivating the moment you walk in and of course- the Pho is brilliantly executed. I am excited to come back again (and again), to try more of the menu. LD is certainly worth coming back to again and again.

11.description: Excellent restaurant! The prices are higher than Argyle, but the quality is very good. It's nice to have a lot of veggie options. The veggie pho is spectacular! Nice to see some variety in the hood! Highly recommend!

39.description: I so glad to find this place. I can honestly say that this was my best dinner ever.  The restaurant very clean, nice and friendly service , the food was so fresh and tasty( also come with amazing sauce). My family got 16 different order from the menu then we don't have to wait long for our dishes ,beautifully quick and delicious. My mom&dad never happy like that, they really enjoy the foods so we kept talk about that for 50minutes driving Lol. I strongly recomment everyone coming in and try it, i also hope this place closer to my house cause i wish i can come here everyday. Thank you !

37.description: Love this spot!  This has quickly become my newest go-to for Vietnamese comfort food.  The firecracker shrimp is to die for! (Thanks to my bro Matt, who allowed me some from his plate).  I took one of friends there who apparently has a thing for fried oreos which is something they offer on the menu.  Definitely not something you see at a Vietnamese joint but it works!  The pho is great (especially because they offer it in different sizes including the "baby size" lol)

0.description: I love this place.  Clean small, authentic, Vietnamese, casual storefront restaurant.  The service is amazing- the staff is warm, welcoming, and inviting.  Server and owner were very sweet and attentive.  The food was great.  We got the baby beef pho (the smaller portion, but way more than enough for 2, love their broth) , the shaking beef rice dish (amazing- stir fried beef with onion and peppers and side of white rice), and the spicy udon noodles (more Japanese, but great, as well).  I also had an iced Vietnamese French coffee with condensed milk.  It was my version of a perfect Vietnamese coffee blend: not overly creamy or too sweet like some places.  I love the food and service, but one thing to note that it is a super casual mom-n-pop-shop storefront restaurant.  So please be aware that if you come in winter, it is pretty cold with the door swinging open when people come in.  I am okay with that as I am always warm, but my husband and other patrons left their coat on while they ate.  So if you can't take the cold, wait to come and eat their delicious food in warmer months.  I am coming back.  They have a huge menu.  I need to try out other dishes, and their banh mi.

38.description: Didn't know LD relocated until I found it here on yelp. I love this place and glad I'm back!

51.description: Okay, so I don't often give out five stars (although another welll deserved 5 star review for Supino's in "the D" is coming soon), unless a place truly deserves it. Considering this place is new, I would have expected some growing pains, but if this place isn't up to it's full potential, then damn! They might need 6 stars to be fair. The service is friendly and very helpful, the atmosphere is simple, but clean, the aromas from the kitchen get you salivating the moment you walk in and of course- the Pho is brilliantly executed. I am excited to come back again (and again), to try more of the menu. LD is certainly worth coming back to again and again.

27.description: LD Pho is awesome! I have had 5 different types of Pho and a variety of appetizers and nothing I have had has been any less than amazing. The family who owns this place is very friendly and welcoming and remember me everytime I come in. I have been on a search for the best Pho in the city for a while now and LD takes the crown.

32.description: One of the finest Vietnamese restaurants around!  Everything on the menu is delicious along with some very interesting dishes such as alligator and frog legs.  Try the chicken wings too! The pho is the real deal, best broth I have ever had.  The owner Lu is awesome, very friendly and accommodating too.  He prides himself on his open kitchen, which is spotless!  Menu has a wide range of choices and trust me it is all delicious!

54.description: Best pho broth in Chicago. I've been to tank noodle and wasn't impressed with their average tasting msg -filled broth. I can honestly say that this was the first time that I've wanted to lick the bowl clean. The menu is pretty versatile. He's got the standard Vietnamese pho and com tam menu plus a little extra. The adventurous chef has had experience in almost all Asian cuisines and provides some specialty dishes that you wouldn't expect to find in a pho restaurant, from pad Thai to Korean kimchi soup, not to mention plenty of vegetarian options. This is a small family owned and operated business and it deserves the support of the community. I strongly recommend coming in and trying it for yourself and if you enjoy the food please write a review and tell your friends about it. I would like to see this restaurant succeed because I don't want to get pho anywhere else.

48.description: Wondering what happened to LD Pho?  They've moved from Lawrence to 4722 N. Kedzie. SO happy that Chef  Liu Dang was able to regroup and reopen!  But it's not only about the Pho! I was acutely missing his deftly seasoned chicken lettuce wrap (to which I had become addicted), his amazingly textured tasty spring rolls, (and their accompanying sauces) ...and his Pho! -- oh those soups!  Liu is also a master at dipping sauces...  and will explain how to use them.  We've been going thru his menu now that he's back and everything is as delicious as before. The salt/pepper shrimp is delectable, with a wonderfully spicy sauce - it's on the white board, not on the menu. But don't let Liu catch you pouring any of those sauces into one of his delicately seasoned fragrant Pho bowls!  When he rushed over, heartbroken, as I had sullied his perfectly balanced broth, I was convinced that he's truly a great chef.  There are lots of choices and unusual things on the menu, including alligator and frog legs prepared in multiple ways...  and mmmm...wondrous dumplings... sort of the love child of a gyoza and a pot sticker!  He's open Mondays, and also for lunch, a good thing, and he even has a whole section devoted to vegetarian dishes on the menu, including Pho -- quite unusual!  The decor features scenes from VietNam... walls are bright green and black toward the bottom...  there's a convenient hand-washing sink at the end of a hall on the way to the facilities...  all very nicely laid out. I have yet to try his special salads, Banh Mi sandwiches, the hot pot, or the desserts, which make me giggle:  deep fried oreos, snickers, or twinkies (and more)!  ha!

44.description: I was surprised to find a new Vietnamese restaurant open in the neighborhood. Wanted to give it a try and so happy I did! Got multiple entrees and apps and all were fresh and delicious. I don't paying the $1-$2 more to have a real authentic meal - saves me the drive into Argyle street.

24.description: Best place on the northside for pho. Make sure to call ahead for pickup, as i've come to find out, this place can get packed at anytime of the day.

7.description: The owner talks funny but the Pho is great! I would definitely come back for another bowl of Pho.

49.description: I am a big time Asian food eater. I dont think I have tasted better dishes than theirs. Best hands down ramen stir fry and pork rolls! Always tasteful and fresh!

40.description: A lot of vegetarian and vegan options such as vegan bun (vermicelli rice noodle salad) and a large menu of traditional authentic dishes as well. This appears to be a family run restaurant and the chef prepares dishes with the flavors that I love about Vietnamese cuisine - fresh herbs and light but complex flavors. Boyfriend has tried several of the specials such as shaking beef and loved them. I have tried the vegetarian and vegan options and thought the were very flavorful. For the vegetarian protein he has two choices of tofu-a regular tofu and an egg tofu which is an interesting custard like tofu that I have never had before. Very happy that I have a Vietnamese option closer than Argyle.

53.description: Great to see them back open on Kedzie.  Spring rolls are a must here.  Just a textural delight.  Fresh with a nice crisp in them, the peanut sauce brings it all together.  Lots of options for fans of veg and meat alike.  I haven't made my way around all of the menu, but I love the pork and noodles.  My daughter has dreams of the chicken pho and my son is disappointed with every fried rice he gets except here.  Great place for the family for lunch or dinner.  Prices totally reasonable and the food is fresh and delicious.  GO!

30.description: the pho was s big disappointment with a lot of fat attached to the chickenAnd gristle. The environment was a very noisy(child screaming) with a footballGame on the TV playing during lunch. ...the service was marginal and theStaff in general were not very friendly and hospitable. We had several otherDishes that would not warrant the 5 star ratings that the other customersGave....Maybe because we have travelled to Viet. Nam on several occasions,We have truly high standards....the owner forgot to,bring us,our beverage,Which was also shocking, and did,not even bring my dinner partner his,beverage or even offer him a beverage other than the water...?..stillPretty disgusting.....the owner needs to stop,having his friends posting 5 Star reviews....the latest review of 2.stars is the most honest and accurate!

46.description: What an amazing dinner I just had.  Food was so fresh and tasty.  The server Jenny was so helpful and made us feel at home.  The cook/owner came out from behind the grill and talked to people after the rush was over.  The deep fried oreos were amazing and we almost ordered another order of them. .. we definitely will be back.  So refreshing to be made felt at home.

1.description: The shredded chicken pho tasted really weird... honestly like apple juice? What?The beef pho was alright, but just alright...Service was good though, can't complain there.I will stick with other pho!

55.description: The best Pho in the city? In my book, hell yes.They do vegan pho (which is apparently hard for other places to understand).After devouring my Pho, I always order a round of deep fried oreos.I always leave feeling completely stuffed and happy.They recently moved, which has made them even closer to my apartment. Win win win!

9.description: This is a great place that exemplifies the best aspects of a typical Vietnamese restaurant here in Chicago. It's run by a young immigrant family. The owner is the cook and therefore always in the place, so you can count on it being consistent and attentive. His wife helps supervise and organize, and their children are helpful, buzzing around the dining room, serving water, helping translate, taking orders too, learning the business and being cute.The manager/major domo/head waiter (whom I originally thought was the owner) is a very friendly and helpful man. He is quick to suggest dishes if need be and has a good memory for returning customers (even if it's only their second visit). He is welcoming and sets a great tone for new visitors. All of the staff are eager to please and very nice. If they appear shy, it is probably due to the fact some have a limited command of English.This restaurant's environment is very basic: colorful walls and some decorations and a large TV for watching American football or other shows (with no sound so not annoying). Most important: it's clean. Very clean. Each table is already well stocked with utensils, napkins and sauces, so it's well organized too. It has an open air kitchen so you can see everything that happens in the "back of the house" which promotes honesty, cleanliness, and cooperation among staff. They're busy, working to make our food, and you can tell that they are doing a good job.LD Pho's menu is lengthy but not exhausting. It has plenty of appetizers, multiple variations of pho, plus many other Vietnamese dishes, and a little to my surprise, it also has a few other cuisines' dishes such as pad thai and udon noodles -- both of which are excellent. Everything I've ordered from this restaurant has come out hot, fresh, and delicious. Prices are right for the type and location of restaurant. There is also a daily specials board that changes regularly. A bonus is the fact that you can order a "baby pho" (like a baby cone at an ice cream store) so that if you want pho but not as your only food (because their regular sized pho is enormous like most Pho restuarants), you can pay $5 for a smaller portion. Now, let's realize that this would be a very large bowl of soup at any other style cuisine, and you realize you're getting a bargain.I would recommend this place to both the new-to-Vietnamese-cuisine eater as well as someone looking for a neighborhood spot that serves Vietnamese food. Patrons are fortunately a mix of all ethnicities including Vietnamese, so it's evident that all are welcome and that the food is appreciated by not just the newly introduced, but also those who want and know authentic Vietnamese cooking. For example my friend who is quite knowledgeable about Vietnamese cooking mentioned that this place serves bun mam (a spicy seafood soup) not often found in our Chicago Vietnamese restaurants.

26.description: Finally made it back here after they moved from the old location. Even better than I remember it! The pho and spring rolls were solid as always. Also got the fried chicken wings, which were absolutely phenomenal - seriously the best wings I've ever had. This place is twice as far as Argyle for me but I'll still travel here to satisfy my Vietnamese cravings.

25.description: One of the best pho places i the state. Way better than argyle. The quality of the food is good and the broth is very well done. I recommend people to give it a try. Maybe youll like it and it willturn out to be your new spot to get your pho craze on! I love the pho dac biet (special). Though i may come back and try the vegetarian pho. I wonder what it taste like with tofu!!

12.description: I literally just ordered lunch from LD Pho for delivery, and it was exactly what I was hoping for.   I ordered the ribeye house specialty dish, egg rolls and a baby beef pho to share with my husband.Considering it was delivery the food was everything I want in Vietnamese cooking.  I loved the freshness and quality of the food.  I only wish I had ordered the full size beef pho.I definitely will be ordering from LD Pho again very soon or paying them a visit in person to have some more tasty Vietnamese cooking.

21.description: On our trip to Chicago, my family and I were so lucky to find this place. Let's get started with the fact that my dad is a huge fan of boiled chicken and we ordered a take home from LD Pho. At first we were never think to go back for another meal until we get to our hotel and taste their dipping sauce. It was so amazing that the pickiest one - my dad - have to give compliments about! The next day we went back to LD Pho for our dinner and we were not disappointed. Since we are a big family, we ordered many dishes to try and all of them were beyond what we expected! Each of every dish has it own unique dipping sauce, the flavor was well balanced. My combination plate of rice was so good it made me miss my country. The flavor was exactly the same as what I've had back home, the meat was well cooked yet still moist. My parents was never been that happy eating at a Vietnamese place before so it warm my heart to see them talk and laugh. The owner who is also the executive chef was so nice we felt like family talking to him. We went their for a last time before we get home and promised him to be back whenever we have a chance. My family and I never had such an experience for the past five years living in the U.S. so LD Pho sure be a place to go anytime we're at Chicago. I don't know what else to say about this place but I am now home and we miss it a lot!

17.description: Very good food at low pricesI was looking for a good time without blowing my wallet.  LD PHO is the best place to get great food at low places.  I especially enjoyed the spicy seafood PHO.  I would tell all my friends to come here.  The staff are very friendly

10.description: I've been suffering from food fatigue for the last few months.  Nothing sounds good to me, and part of that is that I've been having some bad luck with the stuff I've been ordering.  Today I was craving a chili-cheese dog and onion rings, but to be honest, I was not prepared to pay over $20 to have Door Dash bring me one.  So I checked out the new listings on GrubHub and found LD Pho, saw that the prices were good, and figured that I hadn't had Vietnamese food in a while, so why not give it a shot?I am SO happy I did.  I ordered the vegetarian pho, vegetable spring rolls, and the French iced coffee with condensed milk, and it was absolutely the best meal I've had since our home-cooked Thanksgiving dinner.  The pho was so flavorful that I forgot it was supposed to be vegetarian.  They pile on the add-ins.  I got a bag filled with mint and bean sprouts, two cartons filled with rice noodles, veggies, and a hoisin-sriracha (I think) mixture that was amazing!  I ordered it with the egg tofu, which I think is deep-fried silken tofu, and absolutely delicious even on its own.The spring rolls were nearly as good as the ones I used to get from the late, lamented Saigon Grill, and honestly?  The pho was better, at least in part because it was vegetarian. (Really, I'm not ALL about the chili-cheese dogs.  Not absolutely.)  The iced coffee had a wonderful richness;  I wish I'd ordered two.  I also wish I hadn't decided to be good and taken the deep-fried Oreos off the order because if anyone is going to do deep-fried Oreos right, it's going to be these folks.  Next time for sure.And there will be a next time.  For less than I'd have paid for that dog and onion rings, I got enough food for two generous meals.  You can't beat that for value, and it's a nice change to want to finish my leftovers instead of staring at them until they're too old to eat and need to be thrown out.Food fatigue takes one on the chin today, thanks to LD Pho.

5.description: Rosa J. and family are soon leaving Albany Park for another Chi-town neighborhood.  What she will miss the most is many quality restaurants on Kedzie near the Brown Line station.  It was my first time at LD pho, but surely it won't be my last visit.Hubby, Daddy J., and Mama J. spoke positively on LD pho based on their experience.  The season change has been in favor of the consumption of pho.  A large bowl of Pho tai no vien (beef slice and meat ball soup) sounded like a plan.  We began our meal with the Vietnamese iced coffee with milk ($4.00, as of 10/06/2015).  I had to say they were pretty fantastic!  I tasted a hint of nutmeg, and the sugar level was executed appropriately.  Although the price of a large pho was on a higher side ($9.00), I was delighted with the flavor of broth here.  I don't claim to be a connoisseur of Vietnamese pho, but I have started to develop a standard on a bowl of good pho.  The "pho tai no vien" at LD pho this evening was yet the best one I've had so far.  Hubby, on the other hand, ordered the sweet & sour tofu.  He said he preferred the vegetarian pho he had last time.  Our taste of Vietnam tonight came to $28 and some change.  The service was friendly.  It might be a minute detail and I happened to notice it.  The owner stepped "aside" to refill our water without interrupting our conversations.  After he was done with refilling, he politely "re-set" our glasses to the original positions.  Even though we didn't really have any question on the menu, I overheard that he enthusiastically answered other patrons' questions.  I could tell that he took pride for his work.  LD Pho is located one (1) north from the CTA Kedzie Brown Line station.  Miss the Red Line to Argyle where the "Little Vietnam" is?  I believe LD pho is just as competitive as the ones one can find in Uptown.

3.description: I'm Vietnamese and grew up near San Jose, CA - viet central.  I've been up and down Argyle and after about 2 years of attempting vietnamese food in Chicago I've more or less given up on finding something that'll satiate my occasional cravings. However, I heard this place is good so I decided to put my skepticism aside and try it.I ordered the bun bo hue and my friends had the pho.  Hm.. I would say.. it'll do.  The bun bo hue broth was good but the noodles were pretty hard and there was so much of it that I had to take out the excess and put it on a separate plate.  The beef slices were okay. There was also no chunks of gelatin blood which is the norm for this dish..
