My friend's pho didn't really taste very clean and their bowl seemed to be very sparse of noodles and meat... total opposite of mine!  This is ideal for the broth lover but not pho lover.Maybe I'll come back if I'm ever craving broth or need to replenish my hungover body but I'll never go out of my way to come back.  The owner was nice.. he asked me if I was vietnamese.. I asked him if he was too... nope, malaysian.  Go figure.

35.description: I spent a month in Vietnam and eat a lot of pho in the city, and this could the best pho I've ever had. Healthy and fresh. Super nice staff.

19.description: What an amazing dinner I just had.  Food was so fresh and tasty.  The server Jenny was so helpful and made us feel at home.  The cook/owner came out from behind the grill and talked to people after the rush was over.  The deep fried oreos were amazing and we almost ordered another order of them. .. we definitely will be back.  So refreshing to be made felt at home.

28.description: This place rocks! The owner is really cool and the food is awesome. The place is small and cozy. I really enjoy their beef Pho and the yangchow fried rice.

45.description: The best has gotten even better!!!! The new location is nnnnnnniiiiiiiiicccccceeeee!!!! LD is a genius!!! Anything he recommends....is GRRRREEEAAATT!!!! I had the chicken lettuce wraps....unfreaking believable!!! This has got to be the top Vietnamese in the country!!! I'd give him 10 stars if I could!

33.description: Rosa J. and family are soon leaving Albany Park for another Chi-town neighborhood.  What she will miss the most is many quality restaurants on Kedzie near the Brown Line station.  It was my first time at LD pho, but surely it won't be my last visit.Hubby, Daddy J., and Mama J. spoke positively on LD pho based on their experience.  The season change has been in favor of the consumption of pho.  A large bowl of Pho tai no vien (beef slice and meat ball soup) sounded like a plan.  We began our meal with the Vietnamese iced coffee with milk ($4.00, as of 10/06/2015).  I had to say they were pretty fantastic!  I tasted a hint of nutmeg, and the sugar level was executed appropriately.  Although the price of a large pho was on a higher side ($9.00), I was delighted with the flavor of broth here.  I don't claim to be a connoisseur of Vietnamese pho, but I have started to develop a standard on a bowl of good pho.  The "pho tai no vien" at LD pho this evening was yet the best one I've had so far.  Hubby, on the other hand, ordered the sweet & sour tofu.  He said he preferred the vegetarian pho he had last time.  Our taste of Vietnam tonight came to $28 and some change.  The service was friendly.  It might be a minute detail and I happened to notice it.  The owner stepped "aside" to refill our water without interrupting our conversations.  After he was done with refilling, he politely "re-set" our glasses to the original positions.  Even though we didn't really have any question on the menu, I overheard that he enthusiastically answered other patrons' questions.  I could tell that he took pride for his work.  LD Pho is located one (1) north from the CTA Kedzie Brown Line station.  Miss the Red Line to Argyle where the "Little Vietnam" is?  I believe LD pho is just as competitive as the ones one can find in Uptown.

43.description: Best pho in the city for my money right now. Order #17 (and a bubble tea/smoothie, if you so desire).

2.description: Great pho, great service, and a nice extensive menu.  I previously had been getting my pho fix from LC Pho.  The partnership that originally owned the LC Pho location split and one owner now runs LC Pho and the other opened LD Pho, less than half a mile away.  While LD has a somewhat more extensive menu with more Vietnamese and some other Asian options (ramen noodle stir fries, pad thai, etc.) the two restaurants are very similar.  My go-to is veggie pho with beef broth.  LD, just like LC, uses amazing egg tofu in their veggie pho rather than regular tofu and this makes all the difference.  The veggie pho is filled to the brim with fresh veggies (onions, carrots, broccoli, mushrooms) and the beef broth adds an amazing flavor.  If comparing LC and LD, the pho items are basically the same, with a slight difference in broth.  I find LC's broth to be a little more flavorful, but also more salty.  The LD broth is a more muted flavor but not as salty.  So it's really all about your preference.  The nice thing about LD is they have so many other non-pho options too and I look forward to returning to try many of them.  Service is very warm and friendly and they are happy to make modifications or substitutions at your request.  The restaurant is a simple hole in the wall (that is the ambiance you hope for when you're eating pho) but everything is very clean and organized.  Parking is easy to find right on the street outside.

18.description: I so glad to find this place. I can honestly say that this was my best dinner ever.  The restaurant very clean, nice and friendly service , the food was so fresh and tasty( also come with amazing sauce). My family got 16 different order from the menu then we don't have to wait long for our dishes ,beautifully quick and delicious. My mom&dad never happy like that, they really enjoy the foods so we kept talk about that for 50minutes driving Lol. I strongly recomment everyone coming in and try it, i also hope this place closer to my house cause i wish i can come here everyday. Thank you !

41.description: I was a huge fan when they were off of Lawrence and didn't care for who had replaced them. When I found out they were now down the street, I was excited.Still great Pho, they do it vegan style, the tofu (which I usually don't care for anywhere) is pretty good, and you can make it as spicy as you want at your table. I got comments on it twice and although its rated $$, I think its pretty cheap comparing the amount portions and the quality combined. I'm a huge fan, my girlfriend is as well, and we just took our friend whose now a fan. We couldn't even knock it all out. I'm so happy they've moved down the street.Also, the first time I ever had a deep fried food (I'm west coast, we don't do it crazy like ya'll) was the deep fried oreos at the prior LD Pho. I hear they still do it here, but we didn't get it this time, and I RECOMMEND IT. It makes the food that much easier to settle with the deep fried oreos to absorb it though!

52.description: This place is outstanding.  I am beyond excited that it moved into my neighborhood.  The food is really something special, and it's great for vegetarians.  The chef came out to ask us about our food, and it was obvious that he takes great care to make the menu varied and appealing.  LD Pho will likely become my most frequently visited restaurant in the city.  Everything we tried was amazing, and the preparation of tofu was unlike anything we've had before.

50.description: I had the Beef Lettuce Wrap. So good! I used to go to the restaurant on Lawrence and loved it. He's finally open again with even more menu items! Excellent pho! I can't wait to come back. Lu is the nicest person too.

4.description: Always great food and great service. Delivery, dine-in, or pick-up. They can get busy but they tend to their costumers very well.

6.description: This place has a bowl of pho with all of the things I like (sliced beef, soft tendon, flank, meatballs) but not the one that I don't (tripe), which would be enough to win my undying love.  But there's more!  Fantastically rich broth and actual rare sliced beef, make this a hands down fave.  Add fresh, homemade eggrolls to die for, super friendly service, and a very pleasant atmosphere, and LD Pho is my go-to pho spot for sure!

22.description: I've been looking for a new Pho spot since I moved. This is the third one I've tried since I've been in Chicago and it is likely the best. It's a small location but the food portions are large and full of flavor. I started with the chicken dumplings which were some of the best I've had with the sauce that comes with. Then they brought out my big, steaming bowl of hot pho. The smell hit me as soon as it hit the table and I knew it was going to be delicious. I, of course, added my accompaniments of sriracha and hoisin with bean sprouts and a squirt of lime. I couldn't believe how good it was. I've been to the more well known pho restaurants and this one definitely has them beat. Definitely going to be making more stops here as this weather goes further down hill.

15.description: The pho is amazing! I can't say enough how great it is. The broth was delicious. Just one thing to keep in mind: there are two chicken pho options (with mean & shredded chicken). Even the vegetarian pho was delicious, the egg tofu were bomb.

57.description: I love this place they used to be on California. I can even take my kids to eat the pho and they love it. The fried rice is also good.

20.description: The broth is incredible.  And that's what makes it.  Many get baby beef pho with the rolls appetizer for a great lunch for about $10.   Easier access than argyle and on par if not a step up from many of them there.   Deep fried Oreos? How can you have room?

36.description: All the pad thais I've tasted, this one with no meat just the sweet tofu on it is so deliciously spicy! I would love to try other menu soon with my family from NY.

14.description: Warm, friendly, family-run Vietnamese. Great staff. Visible cooking area. Generous portions. They feature some items on the menu that are less common than at other places, which is a bonus.Everything I've ordered here has been tops. Enormous sized pho. Great pot stickers (veg, pork or chicken). Good spicing. An enjoyable dining experience. Typical Vietnamese family restaurant décor.

3.description: they do a nice job with my hair and the price is right but they are never happy to see me. maybe because I am white..... also I am ALWAYS waiting for my appointment . ALWAYS. I'll see how my hair turns out this time and update my review.

1.description: I've never experienced anything better than great here. Everett has been cutting my hair for 2 years now.He always makes sure that It always looks perfect.The place is clean and always busy. Check them out for yourself, you'll see.

2.description: Of all the things that I've been here I've never been disappointed with my hair. They take their time and I think their services are great! They wash your hair, take their time cutting and then style your hair however you'd like. I always make my appointment with Camille. She's brilliant!

9.description: I don't normally trust hair salons that use Zs instead of Ss, or Ks instead of Cs in their name so I was a bit nervous going in today after reading some of the reviews but I figured most of the less favourable reviews were for manicures and not haircuts and I was frustrated with my hair and this place is just around the corner for me, so I took a chance.I had a photo of the hair style I wanted which helped A LOT because the girl who cut my hair didn't speak much (if any) English and the guy next to us had to translate at the beginning. But she worked quickly and quietly and did a great job! The only thing I was iffy about was that she parted my hair to match the photo which is the opposite side to how I wear it, but that's a fairly easy home fix.It was a very Hispanic heavy salon with Telemundo on the TV and no other English speaking customers so I felt a little out of my element, but the atmosphere was friendly and the price was right for me so I might go back if my regular girl at my usual salon is booked up or out of town.

10.description: When I go to a salon I expect to see name brand products. I want to see Matrix, and Biologe and Paul Mitchell on the stations. I saw Herbal Essence, really? You shop for your customers at CVS? I had a pedicure and the girls are obviously straight out of beauty school. She was nice and friendly, but the pedicure looked like a child did it. The polish is clumpy. First some girl started the pedicure, and didn't speak much. Then mid pedicure got up and left. The girl who finished used a razor on my feet, which I love but she did it in 12 directions and now my feet feel uneven. The place is a joke that needs some professionals to come in and teach them how to run a business. I'm disappointed.

4.description: I went here a week ago with my friend for henna, it was reasonably priced, and I had been there for it a few years ago. The owners are new, and the lady who does the henna is different. The previous artist was awesome. The current artist does great designs, but I think the tip of the bag was cut off too much, it was very thick. While I was waiting for the first half to dry, I sent a photo to my girlfriends, they thought it was cool and asked what color it was. I was expecting brown, as it should be, but I asked the artist, and she said it was black. I'm very white and was a little concerned at that point. I also recalled hearing before that some black henna was bad. So before bed, I went online to see when I could wash my skin. I found a few pages saying no black henna is good. Natural henna is brown, and the only way it can be black, is if it has a bunch of chemicals in it. I saw photos of people's skin scarring and breaking out from it. I went into panic mode and scrubbed for about 20 mins in the shower. Luckily, I haven't had a reaction. The black is terrible though, it was put on so thick, that it looks like somebody drew on me with a sharpie. The only way I would return, is if it was natural brown, and was able to be applied much thinner. If you are going to risk it and go for black henna, I would suggest shaving the area. My hair on my arm was died black, so I shaved it. There's little white stripes now where my hairs laid.

6.description: It's good that this place is next to a high-school, as that will probably be the main clientele. 3 hours and 45 minutes for a mani-pedi.  I would have expected some sort of exfoliation, and a much better end result for this long of a procedure.  I did have the no-chip manicure, but still, that was about 45 minutes, so the time was uncalled for.Since they had just opened, I decided to give them another try, thinking they had the opening month jitters.  I had called and made an appointment, and let the girl who answered know I would be coming in on my lunch break, and just needed a manicure with removal of no-chip manicure - I had one hour to work with.  She said that was fine.When I got there, they had one person working, and she had just started a manicure on another client.  I was right on time, and told her I had made an appointment, and was on my lunch break.  She said, well, I just started so it will be a half hour.  After I told her that was unacceptable, and I would be leaving - the client getting her nails done stood up, said she'd go get something to eat, and I could stay.  Thank you very much nice wonderful customer!  However, after the client left, and I sat down, the technician thought she would use the SAME TOOLS ON MY HANDS that were just used on the other girl.  GROSS.  I really should have left then and there, but wanted to get this horrible no-chip stuff off my nails, and it wouldn't come off for me.  So, after she got new tools, she proceeded to take off the shellac polish (By the way, save yourself and never get this done!  They talked me into it the first time). That alone took 45 minutes.  Once it was off, and she started shaping my nails, she was really not doing a good job, I was out of time, and told her I was done, and had to leave.   She wanted to charge me for a full manicure and the shellac removal, but after I told her she didn't do anything for my manicure, agreed to only charge me $15.I will not be back.

12.description: So this place is pretty new, and I personally think they're working hard at amping up their services! I took my mom here last month for a mani/pedi, and both she and I were very satisfied! The Vietnamese gentleman, has years of experience doing mani/pedis, he's very professional, and def.  knows what he's doing. I haven't tried any of their other services yet, but I will! the owners are quite young, but very nice. Def. check it out!

5.description: This is from a visit in July 2011. I'll spare names or details of any the employees that I interacted with, since they seemed nice. However, nice doesn't necessarily cut it when you would like a pedicure to standards.Ignoring the fact that my pedicure took forever as the girl who did it was being very social with her coworkers and a friend who was visiting her.... there are two big things that bothered me.1. All tools and towels used on me were DIRTY. I can't say I felt comfortable seeing a towel with brown stuff on it, and I'm not sure they even know what an autoclave is. Other nail salons I've been to at least have their tools fresh for each client.2. The girl who did my pedi was extremely rough. I'm pretty sure she buffed my nails to the point where they hurt! I have damaged nails underneath the polish. I wonder if it might have anything to do with the dirty tools too.My lesson learned? Do NOT go here for nails.

13.description: This has become my sister and I go-to place for all things hair. I absolutely love the way I both look and feel once these guys are finished with my locks.  I have had cut and color services done by both of the owners Ever and Jaime. Each are extremely talented and really work with you to understand your needs. It bothers me to see that so many spot on reviews have been filtered for this salon, I implore you to read the "hidden reviews" to get a feel for the overall service. I find Cutz and Nailz to be affordable, accommodating, quick and professional.  From the minute you sit down, you feel like a part of the salon. Why go to some ritzy overpriced salon when you can support an incredible local salon with better service and affordability. There is ample parking in front and their hours 9am-9pm are extremely helpful (for when you're last minute setting up appointments that is).  I am beyond happy that I found Cutz and Nailz and will keep going back.

11.description: I was excited for a nice new salon to open in my neighborhood. The girls were very nice there and did a good job on my nails. However, I do agree with the first review that it did take longer than expected. The free henna was nice as well, but the girl didn't seem to understand that I didn't want it so big. Also, you need to make your own mix at home (lemon & sugar) to blot on the henna, or it's only very light and last 3 days. Overall, my nails look fine and she took her time.

8.description: the staff is very funny and friendly. I had a good mani and pedi. Wasn't the best I ever had but if I'm too lazy to do it for myself I'd be back since they're so close to home.

0.description: Maria does an amazing job with my eyebrows. She never fails to make them look precise and clean.

7.description: I was contacted by the owner of the salon and offered a free manicure or a discount on another service to give them another chance.  Being extremely busy, I hadn't had an opportunity to accept the offer.Recently, a lady friend and I stopped in for pedis.  I didn't tell anyone who I was, and I didn't ask for any free services or discounts.  I didn't end up getting any services, free or otherwise.  We were told that another staff member was supposed to have arrived already, but hadn't.  We were asked to come back in an hour.  We did.When we returned, the other staff member still hadn't arrived and frantic phone calls to this person's cell phone followed.  We left again, only to be chased out the door because the other person had just arrived.  We sat back down...and waited.  Finally, we just left.  I respect business owners to reach out to customers who had had sub-par experiences.  And, had I actually been able to get a pedicure, it might have been better this time.  But the whole place still seems horribly disorganized, and I just don't have the patience for it.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: I chose this restaurant to celebrate mothers day with my family after someone highly recommended it.  Needless to say, I had high expectations.  Unfortunately, the first impression was not very good.  Waiter and waitress were slow and distracted.  It also took a long time to get our food.  And finally, the food was OK but not what I was expecting.  The lobster didn't set well with my stomach to make matters worse. They are nice, but I also like getting good service when I go to a restaurant.  It makes a big difference when wait staff knows how to talk to customers.  This was not a language barrier issue, it was lack of training.

1.description: Like Rebekah, we walked in to an empty restaurant, which should have scared us off right then and there. How can you people say the food here is amazing? There are exactly four Ecuadorian dishes on the menu, and we decided to go with carne asada instead. Dry and chewy meat with a lump of rice, a lukewarm potato patty and bland beans arrived. The empanadas were nondescript with a strange sweet sauce. The spicy red sauce one reviewer raved about is simply Chinese red chili sauce. Won't go back!

2.description: Hubby and I decided to try this place after finding our favorite Korean place across the street was closed for good, R.I.P. San Chae Dol Sot, you will be missed!We walked into the empty restaurant expecting to be warmly welcomed instead we found 2 workers sitting with their back to the door watching t.v., after standing there awkwardly for a minute they slowly stood up and went behind the counter, not really acknowledging us besides glancing at us oddly.Our waiter slowly got 2 menus for us and slowly walked over to us, I felt like apologizing for interrupting their TV time, that is how unenthusiastic they were to see us. He then mumbled, where did we want to sit. We picked a table and sat down, he gave us our menus and walked away, returning shortly with 2 glasses of water. Let me say this place has a very odd decor, some classy touches such as a couple fresh carnations in a nice tall vase on the table are nice. The tables are roomy and the place was clean. Other than that there is an odd mish mosh of things that don't really go together or make sense.We had a hard time deciding what to eat since half the menu is sushi and the other half is Ecuadorian food and it is hard to wrap your mind around this flavor combination. We were very wary of the sushi side because with no customers, there was a good chance the fish was not terribly fresh. So we were left with the Ecuadorian side, after 10 minutes our waiter came back and we asked the waiter what he recommended. Apparently he didn't speak English so he had to get the cook to come take our order. I then asked the cook what he recommended, he pointed out the 2 most expensive items on the menu and mentioned a Lobster dish that wasn't even on the menu,,,,hmmm...I am noticing a pattern here. Hubby asked about the Broiled Chicken breast, he said he wouldn't recommend it but that he could get the grilled chicken...also not on the menu....ok.At this point we were ready to leave so I told him we needed more time. He walked away and went to the back and we decided to just leave, as we got up we signaled to him that we were going to go and he smiled and said ok. I think he was relieved, I don't really know what to say but the water was great!

5.description: Our visit to the Galapagos Cafe was kind of odd. Several of the food items I tried to order were not available (not a good sign). I ended up with a meat and mashed potato appetizer, whose name escapes me and a bowl of chicken soup. The appetizer was pretty good, but the chicken soup sucked canal water.Christopher had the carne asada and his meal was very good and nicely presented. We also enjoyed the plantain chips, but they were rather skimpy on the sauce they served with it.The decor is very stark. It was clean, but could use some pizazz. The long wall on the east side was decorated by two sword fish models that looked like they were intended to decorate Barbie's Dream House rather than a human sized store. They really need to decorate a bit.As we didn't try any sushi, I can't give too detailed a review.  We may come back sometime, but I can't  imagine why.

6.description: The food was great - my wife and I shared the Galapagos Maki, which was fantastic, not to mention very large.  I also had the breaded fried chicken with fries and a basic lettuce salad, which was very tasty.  My wife enjoyed her steamed vegetable plate.We had no problems with the service as some of the others seemed to have.  Our waiter was attentive enough, kept our waters full and we received what we ordered.  As some of the others mentioned, the interior decor is plain, but clean.  I definitely would go back and recommend others to try the sushi - it is worth it, and is sold at a very reasonable price for such a large portion.  It was of similar quality to the specialty Japanese sushi restaurants.

7.description: The food here is AMAZING.  My family and myself are all from Ecuador and I really appreciate this place is around to give us a little taste of home.  We visit often.  The food here is authentically home-made.  Hence, this translates to waiting longer than you might expect but it's completely worth it!!  I have recently ordered "Camarones a la plancha".  So far, it's my favorite dish.  If you love seafood, I recommend it.  In general, if you love sea food and food prepared with great care, I recommend this place.

8.description: I was very happy about this place!  The interior is clean and tidy and the service was just lovely.  I ordered the tilapia with coconut sauce and it was outstanding.  The fried plantain chips, empanadas and other appetizers were equally delicious.  This is a place just waiting to get discovered.  BYOB also!

0.description: We have gone numerous time to this restaurant. Food always takes a long time and the only server they have is always non social. So we had to decide how desperate we were for Ecuadorian food before we hauled over there. We now found a new place closer to home that recently opened called Sabor Avenida on the corner of Diversy and Mernard. Nice family owned business.

4.description: 6 of us for dinner on one of the snowiest, coldest nights of the year.  The place was almost empty when we came in for dinner as the weather was horrible, but we were greeted with a warm smile. I am now a huge fan of Ecuadorian food after our meal last night. Some of the dishes we tried: Fish(tilapia) with a coconut milk/tomato sauce, chicken fried rice, a fish stew, combo (beef, pork, chicken, shrimp) fried rice, a cooked vegetable plate with an amazing sauce and a beef stew with vegetables and tripe. We also had the plantain and cheese appetizer and the fries and franks appetizer (french fries and a grilled frank). Both were fine.  Complimentary plantain chips with a nice salsa as well. Everything was great, our waiter was polite and always had a smile on his face.  The place is very clean, the women's bathroom is very nice and clean. No complaints and we will for sure be back. BYOB.

3.description: Ok, first off, I'd like to start off that I came here on the hunt for last minute Halloween gear.  I needed a cheap wife beater to cut up for my Pretty Woman outfit, which I found for $1.99.  Woot.  And my costume rocked, if I can say so myself. :)But, what I forgot was that they have loads of budget clothing that is good to stock up on w/o paying a hefty amount.  I got a few more beaters, some yoga pants and plain white (and some colored) tees for all under $5 bucks each.  Not bad.So, while this is not quality clothing really, it's a pretty good deal when getting those everyday items and such for a good price that def won't break the piggy bank.  It's kind of like a forever 21 - I mean just cuz you're not on a high school budget anymore doesn't mean you have to pay triple the price for undershirts and stuff, right?!  And I even found cute scarves that I can rock this winter - rather than spending $30 for a Juicy tee with no logo, get one here and save those dollars for some Louboutins...or whatever high fashion nonsense you're into...hahah.  And you can find trendy stuff that's good for a few wears...dare I say, I shall be back.

1.description: This place is literally two (2) blocks away from my apartment.  Nevertheless, I seldom go there to check it what they have.  Tonight, I passed by and decided to stop by to refresh my knowledge in junior fashion.  You really get what you pay for.  If you don't mind the quality of clothing you're purchasing, you should be pretty content shopping at the Discovery Clothing.  They appeared to have enough number of sales associates working on the floor.  Please understand that they don't offer dressing rooms for customers.  Don't complain about this; watching shoplifters is a difficult task and a store like this needs to pay attention on the issues in loss prevention so they can stay in business.  I used to manage a competitor store, and boy, I was SO exhausted everyday.  I now have lots of appreciation to those who work in the junior-fashion industry.  There were some fashionable and cute items that didn't "look" cheap (unless you touch the fabrics and the truth would be revealed).  If I needed clothes, shoes, and accessories, I would probably pick out some items and happily take them home.  However, with four (4) plus year working in the fashion retail, I'm eagerly getting rid of what I have in my closet because I've had a lot.  For those who have some stereotypes about the Discovery Clothing store, there shouldn't be any concerns.  They have clientele with different diversities and ethnicities.  With that being said, anyone should be comfortable walking into one of these stores.

2.description: If you are a woman don't go in this store wearing a skirt or dress. Most of the clothing racks are mirrored on the bottom, so they can catch you shoplifting by stuffing things up your clothes...I guess? The only other reason I can think of for that, is that the person who designed them is a pervert of some sort...They have men working there who are probably not straight men, but still, who wants anyone looking up their skirt for any reason.Adding to the problem is that they tail you and make you feel like a criminal. I finally left today in frustration because they were following me, and as soon as I put something on a bench they would run off with it. I was going to buy some shoes, although I was hesitant because they are made of really cheap materials and are definitely not even worth the price of $30. I thought of using them as part of some costuming, so I figured it didn't matter so much if they weren't meant to last long.They don't have dressing rooms, but have a real liberal return policy so I am giving them an extra star for that.

5.description: I shop here quite often.  You can always find something in style for cheap prices.  Albeit, the quality isn't as good but you get for what you pay.  They especially have really cute 'clubbing' clothes and several locations in the city.  There is a 14 days return policy and the tag must still be on the item.

6.description: Oh no no no no no. Can't recommend this place at all! Th eprices are affordable, but there are so many other places to go to in this city that are comparable price-wise. You will not leave this place with any quality whatsoever! The clothes are sometime kinda cute, but when I bought home those three items, I knew I would instantly regret it! Plus there's no return policy. Bummer.

7.description: I've been a Discovery shopper throughout the past few years.  The prices are what have me returning.  They typically carry the latest fashion trends at a fraction of what you would pay at the department stores or local mall.However, at times, the quality of the clothes isn't the best.  Some tend to shrink and at times you wonder, why in the world would anybody consider buying that?  But, there are some great deals.  They have a huge selection of jeans, with most being no more than $20.  The same brands you would find in your typical juniors' store.  I also like scoping out the accessories.  This past fall, I picked up some strands of beaded necklaces to see how I could incorporate them into my wardrobe.The other big downside to this store is that they don't have fitting rooms.  At times, you can get away with trying on a jacket or what not over your shirt, however be weary, some employees try to enforce the no trying on rule strictly.  Their return policy is decent.  I buy things that appeal to me, go home and try them on.  If I don't like it, I just make sure to come back within two weeks to return it for a full refund.This store is definitely worth a visit if you want to update your closet with the newest trends but without making a huge dent in your wallet!

8.description: I used to be a huge fan of discovery Clothing when I lived back in the suburbs. Now I feel like their clothing line has become very trashy. I rarely find tops that I like to wear. The disappointing fact of this clothing store is they don't have any fitting rooms. They are very sneaky because obviously you like something and you will buy it without trying it on. But once you take that tag off, you can't exchange/return it. So be careful! Their accessories are nice. I've gotten a bunch of things from here. Can't beat their prices for sure!

9.description: I love, love, love Discovery.  I swear by it.  Being a bartender and having to wear all black, it is so much easier to buy a whole bunch of different tops for under $50.  That way, if you ruin one, you just go on to the next one!

0.description: Cute cheap merch ..it's like a Rue 21 for Albany Park. It's in walking distance of other shops, doesn't have a dressing room but has 20 days return policy. I always walk out with bags. +shoes for little people feet (size6 fits like 5). Bonus.

4.description: I am not a fan of any of the Discovery stores or most of its clothing. When I do happen to make a bad call and buy something I'm only going to complain and whine about, they are very happy to welcome my exchange/return, even I misplaced some tags to the shoes I bought. Friendly staff too.

0.description: Pharmacy One is a great little neighborhood pharmacy in Albany Park!Located on the busy intersection of Kedzie and Lawrence, Pharmacy One is definitely a "Mom and Pop" kind of Pharmacy. With disheveled shelves containing cough syrup, ointments and bandages this place makes up for their unorganized facade with their awesome customer service. They seem to accept every Insurance Plan, HRA or Medicare Plan that exists and all served up quickly with a smile. Pharmacy One truly is a great little neighborhood pharmacy. Need cough syrup, ointment or a prescription filled? Pharmacy One is your place. Local, friendly and served with a smile!

Worst company.  They refused to run my card because if I didn't have the money that it would make her ratings go down. I told her I was sure I I had at least 64$  to which she replied why would I run your card and make my ratings go down if you don't know. Call back when you know. I asked for a supervisor which I never got. She got back on the phone and told me her supervisor advised her to tell me what she already said.  Her name was Diane. They also refused to assist me in anyway when my phone was stolen.

1.description: I hate buying shoes. Big time. The people that run the store were very cool and quite helpful. They have all kinds of styles, American and imports - and a strong selection of dress/work shoes.  Evidentally the same family has been operating this store from the same location for 37 years now, now being run by a guy named Bill and his brother, and taken over from their father. Perhaps more of note are the prices. I went to DSW recently to buy a few pairs of dress shoes, found nothing that I could walk comfortably in - and everything was pretty pricey. If the average decent shoe I tried on at DSW was 90-135$ - it is of note that at Athenian the prices for the same styles and designers were averaging 49-89$. Hugeness. So, a chronically pissed off shoe customer like myself walked out 20 minutes after I walked in with sweet pairs of Giorgio Brutini and Stacy Adams for about 130$ total. Giggity. The place is a hidden treasure. Go with immediacy.

0.description: love this store, so helpful, pleasent, and wonderful to support a local business.  check it out!

58.description: I can't even explain how HORRIBLE this food was.  You would think these four food items you could not screw up BUT they definitely succeeded! I ordered a steak sandwich, wings, nachos, and mozzarella sticks and I wish I had just went to bed hungry.  The steak sandwich tasted like it came out of the dumpster out back.  The wings were undercooked and looked like they just slaughtered a chicken, slapped some breading on it, and called them the most delicious wings in the city.  The chicken super nachos were a pile of slop and you couldn't tell what you were even eating let alone TASTE anything.  The mozzarella sticks were just plain awful and I guarantee they stopped at Jewel in the freezer section and bought some sticks and stuck them in the microwave for 3 seconds.  Do NOT ever go here! I called to let them know how I felt and wanted a refund and it turned into just a shouting match on how I can't afford this meal and just want my money back! STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!

56.description: Free six pack of beer (with coupon) and a superbowl pizza big enough to feed a ravinous army of vikings delivered to my door in 45 minutes for 27 dollars, including a 5 dollar tip.... 'Nuff said.

29.description: Good thin-crust and surprisingly good deep dish.  Their prices are very fair.  This has been our go to pizza place for 3 years and I've only gotten one bad/burnt pizza.  The rib dinner, Italian beef, wings, and salads are good too.  The staff is very friendly and I've always had good service.  Really looking forward to their remodeled interior!

42.description: Pizza is good. Havent had anything else. Fast delivery. Free liter of rc with a large pizza. Good in my book.

23.description: Great fresh vegetables, lovely staff, great drink selection. Cozy and comfortable and they treated us like royalty. Will definitely come back.

47.description: Well let's see the slices to go taste like raw dough I ordered chicken nuggets one night an they were so dry sauce couldn't help so I gave it two stars cause when you order delivery you'll get a six pack of beer for free with the football pizza

8.description: My Family has been ordering for delivery from Angelo's for over 35 years.I'm not sure if it is still under the same ownership these days....But I just Love That Pizza!I just ordered a 16" Thin Sausage Pizza with Extra Sauce and it was Awesome. And they don't even charge for Extra Sauce. Delivery was Hot and Fast. Other Joints in Competition such as Marie's, La Villa, Martino's are not even in the same ball park. They are all High Priced and Skimmpy on the Ingredients. You get a Free Liter of Pop with your order. I must get in to the Newly Renovated Dinning Space...I Hear Great thing about it. They are supposed to have a great Selection of Beers and also serve Mexican Fare! Yum!Plus they are open to 2am on Fri/Sat... So if you have not tried Angelo's Pizza you must do so! I will Remain a Loyal Customer for 30 more years! Bravo Angelo's!

31.description: order wrong on this salty over priced pizza.

34.description: Great burgers, great taco salad in a shell, and amazing coconut milkshakes. Fast service and high quality (for a fast food place)!

16.description: Angelo's is an amazing place to be. I love the way they remodeled the place. The food is absolutely amazing, the cocktails are phenomenal, the whole staff is great and very knowledgable. I will definitely be back here.

13.description: I've lived in the neighborhood all my life grow up on Angelos pizza !! Parents have been going there for almost 30 yrs ..Use to be the spot to go to for good eats  unfortunately that has all changed since they  remodeled the place food sucks..recently order a  horrible Philly cheese steak  deluxe half the size it used to be for 17 dollars wow!! They changed there steak fries as well . I guess there charging  more for the black containers there using now no more  Angelos for us !!!

11.description: I really enjoy the pizza, only thing is the cheese comes off when you bite into it- so its a bit chewy and thick. It does taste wonderful though and the toppings seem really fresh. I got zucchini and garlic- YUM! Unfortunately. They have a long delivery time. No matter if its pizza or soup its 45 minutes to 1 hour- and the last 2 times I ordered from them it was 1 hour and 10 minutes which is really disgusting, especially since the fact that the times I ordered were NOT peak times.So for now I will stop ordering from Angelo's since they can't even keep a a BAD promise. Oh- and I have to call them each time to find out status.

39.description: Food is extremely overcooked.  My pasta container was almost an inch thick full of grease.  But that's not why I'm displeased.  The delivery driver had given us the wrong order.  Basically as well as receiving our own food we received someone elses as well.  About a half hour later my phone rings and its the Angelo's manager.  He argued with me that he needed the food back the driver gave us.  Which included items the driver did not even give us.  I'm not a complete jerk, so I had no problem giving the food back.  I just think its disgusting that they wanted the food back to redeliver to the original purchaser.TLDR;  Gave a new local place a shot, staff sucked, food sucked

37.description: Just happened to be over a friends house watching a Hawks game when i came across Angelo's Pizza menu and thought why not. The Pizza and jumbo wings were amazing!!! Definitely a new spot for a late night bite.........

0.description: Angelo's has had a massive remodel this summer and changed its image completely. It is not an order and pick up place anymore. It is an extremely classy, nice, and modern sit down restaurant with a wrap around bar. They have a pretty decent beer selection and the pizza is much better. This place is great when the weather is warm, as they have collapsible walls that open all around the front of the restaurant.This place is a great hang out, great drinks, and pretty good food. The place is going to wow you but it certainly will not disappoint you.

38.description: Good solid food. Lasagna dinner special on Sunday nights is well worth it. Two huge pieces of lasagna swimming in cheese and sauce. Delicious.\The "tub" of briled chicken with a vesuvio style sauce was moist, tender and tasty.Always reliable spot for food.

51.description: good place good food , great delivery .

27.description: Boarded up windows and they've raised the price of the only edible thing I've eaten there.  I'm done with this place.

32.description: I ordered through GrubHub two times. The first time, they forgot my dessert. The second time, they delivered my food to the wrong place even though I specified I was at work (provided address online) instead of at home. My food was cold and took an extra 45 minutes. Never ordering from them again.

54.description: I opted for Mi Ranchos tonight. I am so surprised. This is garbage. I have never ordered from here before but I am not pleased. One the delivery driver did not have a pen for me to sign for with. I just wasted 10 minutes looking for a pen in the apartment I just moved into. Two, the rice and beans that came with the flauta dinner were not even half way full. I've never seen such skimpy portions before. Three, NO FORKS! How can I eat my rice and beans with no fork. Plain and simple if your food is just delivered and instead of chowing it down like my fat self usually does I go ranting on Yelp, your food sucks! The flauta was too dry and flavorless and the beans were just no bueno. The beef nachos are okay. Never again.

48.description: it's all about the barbecue wings, baby,,,Literally. This review is all about the wings.  I used to pass this place off as any old neighborhood fried whatever shack.  My wife told me she used to walk 2 city blocks to this place just for these wings.  So we finally made it over here one day and I got to see these so-called "wings"  They sell them for a buck a piece.  A rip-off you say?  "Yeah, you can get wings at BW3 for like 45 cents on tuesdays!"  Well, first of all, the wings Angelo(or Angelo's?) sells are the flap and the drum TOGETHER.  For a DOLLAR.  Beat that b*tch with a bat.  I bet you can't!  The sauce is sort of like barbecue/ketchup, and the outside is a bit crispy/crusty.  The wings sit in one of those pizza by the slice warmers on the counter top, and if you get there before me, there might be some chicken in that case.  Arrive after me, and you will have to wait 900-1200 seconds.BTW - My wife hates 99.9% of foods with sauce on it.  But she loves these wings, so that should tell you something.

44.description: My wife and I go to Angelo's because it is the closest pizza place to our house.  Go in there once in a while to get a slice and the quality is never consistent.  Some days are just Ok, others are down right bad.  We have gone into there restaurant and have never had good service.  Always had to wait way too long.  The young punk manager who always acts like he is doing you a favor when you deal with him has made our last couple visits memorable in a negative way.  Angelo's has to remember that there are at least two other pizza places within walking distance.  Both are better and have menus that focus on doing a few things good, not dozens of things just so so.

24.description: I really enjoy the pizza, only thing is the cheese comes off when you bite into it- so its a bit chewy and thick. It does taste wonderful though and the toppings seem really fresh. I got zucchini and garlic- YUM! Unfortunately. They have a long delivery time. No matter if its pizza or soup its 45 minutes to 1 hour- and the last 2 times I ordered from them it was 1 hour and 10 minutes which is really disgusting, especially since the fact that the times I ordered were NOT peak times.So for now I will stop ordering from Angelo's since they can't even keep a a BAD promise. Oh- and I have to call them each time to find out status.

7.description: Last night, I attempted to place an order with Angelo's Pizza for delivery. We have ordered from Angelo's on a regular basis (at least a couple of time each month) for about 10 years until they changed their buy 2 get 1 free meals special. It is now buy 3 get 1 free. I have not ordered from then since the summer of 2014. Looking to try them again after some 10 months, we attempted to order an 18" Angelo's Special. According to the home page of their website which we had just clicked on, there was a coupon for either free 6 pack of pop or domestic beer. After providing all my information and completing the order, I asked for the free 6 pack of beer. The lady who took the order told me that the promotion was no longer in effect. I mentioned to her that their website which I had in front of me on the computer had the coupon live on it's website and there were no expiration dates. She repeated that they reserve the right to change pricing without notice. I repeated that this coupon was live on their website and that this was phony advertising. If it is on your website which is the official website of your business, you should either honor it or take it off. It did not matter. You would think the business as a courtesy would honor it for a customer that had ordered from them countless times over 10 years  and then inform me the promotion had ended. I cancelled my order and informed her that I will never do business with them again and hung up. Now some other area restaurants will gain more of my business.5/6/2015: Update. As of today at 7:20 pm, this offer still appears on their home page.7/1/2015: Update. As of today at 4:20 pm, this offer still appears on their home page.

49.description: I found this place while walking around the neighborhood. I sat down just for a pizza slice and drink. The waitress was very attentive and helpful about the menu, I had a few questions. The food was reasonably priced, I don't think I spent more than 5 dollars. They had plenty of other stuff on the menu in which I plan on trying cuz I thoroughly liked this place and will return.

40.description: Used my $10 credit from my previously screwed up order. It. Took. Over. An. Hour. And. Twenty five. Minutes. Albany park to Avondale. Pizza. C'mon. I'm over this place.

53.description: Ok this is exclusively a rating for Angelos (not mi rancho) and more specifically, their smoothies.Try their smoothies, now.-They are made with real ice cream!- Flavors are kinda limited but theyre all deliciousI have had their mozarella sticks and pizza, nothing to cause a foodgasm but not horrible either. Theyre also open late so pretty good for that midnight craving, and if youre feeling lazy you can order delivery. But yea, you have to have a purpose for passing by bc its not really in between anything major. And that purpose is smoothies. Yum.

30.description: Decent pizza. Nice people. They are re doing the inside and have a new sign. Bang for buck pizza, and you get a decent amount of fried mushrooms for a half order. Not acidic either which is always good! I'll definitely get their pie again. I did pick up, so I have no thoughts about delivery.

46.description: LOVE Angelo's!!! Every time my friends and I order, the food is delivered on time, hot, and delicious!!! They have so much to chose from... Pizza pasta chicken steaks shrimp fish salads burritos tacos and so much more!!!! Their BBQ wings are ahhhhmazing!! I would highly recommend the drive to try a taste of Angelo's!!! The ladies working there are so polite, always smiling, and not to mention those hottt sisters that work there ;-)  Love, your favorite customer, Eric Sanchez

1.description: I had never been to the old place, but the new place is great. Great beer selection on tap, and they have a secretly awesome beer in bottles that I won't disclose here. The in-house menu is fantastic, great beet salad. I get it every time. The pizzas are dynamite - truly artisan creations. I highly recommend the Quattro Formaggi.Great whiskey menu as well, from a distillery in Park City. Haven't dove into it yet but I plan to. Friendly ownership, friendly staff, local, what else does one need?

55.description: this place is awesome, free WiFi, cheap beer, and if you don't want to leave your place the deliver until 1:00AM

9.description: I've been to Angelo's three times since it re-opened in July and it is excellent!   I loved hearing from the owner and managers about the care that went into picking every detail of the new space including some beautiful reclaimed barn wood on the walls throughout the restaurant.  While the atmosphere is great, Angelo's really shines when it comes to their food and beverage.  They have great list of craft beer and global wines (affordably priced) and also make a mean cocktail.  I learned on my last visit they even have special ice cubes (crystal clear perfect squares) made specifically for their rocks glasses which just adds to the experience of being there.  Lance, the sommelier, is incredibly helpful with pairings and has a great sense of humor as well.And the food...  The Burrata Margherita pizza is my absolute favorite item on the menu, but one can do no wrong.  The meatballs are incredible, the smoked tomato risotto is among the best I've had anywhere in the city, and I also love the grilled octopus.  I've tried other pizzas and menu items too and all have been great.  While I'm not typically a dessert person, they treated our table to the lemon tiramisu during a friend's birthday dinner, and it was incredible.  I don't remember the name, but it was paired with a dessert wine and the combination was out of this world.  The servers also work well as a team and are very attentive and friendly.  All in all, Angelo's combines a comfortable neighborhood vibe with incredible food and service.  Highly recommend.

26.description: Last night, I attempted to place an order with Angelo's Pizza for delivery. We have ordered from Angelo's on a regular basis (at least a couple of time each month) for about 10 years until they changed their buy 2 get 1 free meals special. It is now buy 3 get 1 free. I have not ordered from then since the summer of 2014. Looking to try them again after some 10 months, we attempted to order an 18" Angelo's Special. According to the home page of their website which we had just clicked on, there was a coupon for either free 6 pack of pop or domestic beer. After providing all my information and completing the order, I asked for the free 6 pack of beer. The lady who took the order told me that the promotion was no longer in effect. I mentioned to her that their website which I had in front of me on the computer had the coupon live on it's website and there were no expiration dates. She repeated that they reserve the right to change pricing without notice. I repeated that this coupon was live on their website and that this was phony advertising. If it is on your website which is the official website of your business, you should either honor it or take it off. It did not matter. You would think the business as a courtesy would honor it for a customer that had ordered from them countless times over 10 years  and then inform me the promotion had ended. I cancelled my order and informed her that I will never do business with them again and hung up. Now some other area restaurants will gain more of my business.5/6/2015: Update. As of today at 7:20 pm, this offer still appears on their home page.7/1/2015: Update. As of today at 4:20 pm, this offer still appears on their home page.

25.description: I ordred my food at 6;30.. did not come until 8:30 and I am only about 10 min away. The delivery guy didnt speak english, called me from his cell instead of my intercom... I just had surgery on my leg which is why I ordered and he couldnt figure out my doorbell. I saw him walk down the block, I call him back, Angelo calls me on the other line and is now trying to tell him how to use my doorbell... I finally give up and slowly make my way down the stairs .. he hands me my bill and n ow has no pen ... I have to wait while he now runs down the block to go to his car to get a pen ... I finally get upstairs only to find they forgot part of my order.. I call them and the guy does not even seem to care .. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.. DON'T BUY FROM THEM! I will never order from them again... PS.. the food was not good either.. my taco was like 3 shells and a lot of lettuce ....

12.description: I drove past this place yesterday and made a point to stop in today to try it out. Boy, I'm sure glad I did because this place is a hidden gem for sure! From the beautiful decor to the amazing menu, you will not be disappointed. The host and server were quite friendly and made us feel so welcome upon entering. We tried the spinach caesar salad first. It came with just the right amount of dressing and the tomatoes and red onions added a nice kick. The Angelo pizza came next and it was cooked just right - all the ingredients made a perfect combination with the wonderfully crispy crust. I cannot wait to go back - this place is fantastic!

59.description: great pizza! great people! great prices!!

21.description: Friendly and knowledgeable wait staff; excellent food; great environment!

17.description: I'll never order from this place again! I just placed an order for Italian beef sandwich with fries on a Wednesday afternoon at 1:25 pm and it finally arrived an hour and a half later COLD with mushy fries, hard as a rock cheese and meat! I called after waiting an hour and fifteen minutes and the girl that answered the phone was useless, very matter of fact and unapologetic. I used to order from them all the time and couldn't remember why I stopped, this is probably why. Just threw the food out and wasted $15! Do yourself a favor and order you food from somewhere else.

10.description: Never again... Food came in almost 1/2 an hour late from what was promised. Containers came in all cracked up and squished. (Not gonna even give any praises regarding the food) Worst of all, after giving card info over the phone, delivery guy arrives(very apologetic btw, and the only satisfactory part of the experience) asking for cash payment. He gets the supervisor on the phone, who rudely asked for my card # like it was my fault that the card info was no where to be found while I were trying to investigate how that even happened in the first place. Manager suddenly steps in the conversation and explains what happened while I tell him the delivery guys phone is about to die. So I called him back and after giving card info, he delivers a very dry apology and gets me off the phone. No attempt was even made to show any sincerity at all. I am normally a brush-my-shoulders,eh.. shit happens kinda guy, but this was just so unsatisfactory that I am taking my time to write this review to give me at least a little satisfaction after being on the receiving end of the kind of shitty service you wouldn't wish upon anyone else. I strongly believe I'm not alone and there are others yet to come. Therefore, never again...

5.description: Check out the new revamped Angelo's Pizza, Pasta, Wine!! The new remodeled space is beautiful and a great addition to the neighborhood.  The food is fantastic, great salads, creative pizzas, awesome pasta dishes, etc.  they have wine cooled and on tap, with a great beer and cocktail list.  I love having this place in the neighborhood!!

3.description: Angelo's did an amazing job renovating and reinventing the restaurant concept. They still have their normal delivery menu; but if you dine in its small plate Italian and gourmet pizzas. Everything I've tried is fantastic, but I can't go without having the bruschetta. The space has great ambiance and the staff is really attentive with good knowledge of the food, craft cocktails and extensive wine and beer options.  They definitely have created a more upscale lounge setting. Good for date night or a night out with friends.

35.description: This place sucks! I would give them a -5! They don't know how to answer phones, place people on hold, or even get an order right. And their food isn't even good. Good luck placing an order & getting the right food. Talk about being inexperienced!!!

19.description: My otherwise healthy son ordered taco salad (delivered) and within a hour after eating it developed profuse vomiting and diarrhea which resulted in an ER visit, IV's and two antibiotics. Avoid this place! ~ they may not list food poisoning on the menu, but they sure are serving it,

28.description: My otherwise healthy son ordered taco salad (delivered) and within a hour after eating it developed profuse vomiting and diarrhea which resulted in an ER visit, IV's and two antibiotics. Avoid this place! ~ they may not list food poisoning on the menu, but they sure are serving it,

45.description: Worst customer service ever.. They forgot a lunch special... Brought it back after an hour!!! Food was cold... And on top of that driver had an attitude problem...

33.description: Me and friends go to this place once and awhile and the pizza is good but the BBQ wings are great. They are big and tasty. I will definitely be back.

43.description: Delivery was fast. Steak burrito was very good and the highlight was the spicy green sauce. It is spicy, and I like that! Salad comes loaded with fresh veggies. The guac was ok.

2.description: What the hell happened, Angelo's? Where is the baked potato option in lieu of the (cold) french fries with entrees? Where is the cole slaw? What happened to the soup or salad choice? Where is the "cajun" flavor in your (literally) tasteless cajun-battered chicken? Why didn't you actually cook the jumbo shrimp? If this was the first time we ordered from Angelo's, I'd brush it off as just another in a long line of poorly-run restaurants on the North Side. But fuck, man, Angelo's has been our go-to delivery option on Sunday for years. The sting comes more from knowing that this place used to be so much better than from biting into a raw fried shrimp. Seeing the new menu stuffed in our gate should have been the indicator that changes are afoot there. (Why the need for such unnecessary promotion?) Whereas specials were a big part of the menu before, they are clearly being phased out as some sort of cost-cutting measure, I'm sure.I hate throwing food away, but I'm physically ill at the thought of heating that shit up for lunch tomorrow. Get your act together, Angelo's. You had a high-quality product (with terrific specials) once so you can do it again.

18.description: Friendly and knowledgeable wait staff; excellent food; great environment!

41.description: Just ordered dinner delivery. Taco dinner, veggie burrito, nachos and fried veggies. Order was incorrect. Food was cold. Called and all the manager would do is give me a $10 credit to use next time. Ironic.

52.description: We have become a big fan of Angelo's My girlfriend and I have come and eat here a few times and So far everything we had has been good here.Our favorite is the wings with the hot sauce, great size wings but they are amazing with the hot sauce, in fact the only complain is that i wish the hot sauce came in a bigger portion.I haven't had the opportunity to order from Mi Rancho nor eat in (since we always order to go) but i definitely recommend eating at Angelo's.

50.description: We ordered lunch from Angelo's today. The day after Thanksgiving, we were all feeling lazy and were busy watching hockey, so ordering in was an easy choice.They offer 18 different lunch specials, for $4.95 each. Mom and Christopher both had the Italian Beef sandwiches. They came with fries, slaw and a can of pop. I had the spaghetti with meatballs. It came with slaw, Italian bread, Parmesan cheese,  and a can of pop as well.The sandwiches were decent, the fries ok, the slaw really good and the spaghetti was pretty dang good, including the meatball. The portions were big and heck, with a can of soda thrown in it was really a deal.We will definitely be ordering lunch again someday soon. Good inexpensive food and quick friendly delivery.  We are happy. Now, if only the Blackhawks can score a few more goals!!!

4.description: The thrill is gone. Since reincarnating as an eat-in wine bar, the old delivery menu service has taken a downturn. Things change - I've heard the wine bar is pretty good, but the "old school" Italian/Mexican kooky-but-it-worked huge delivery menu just isn't what it used to be. Sigh...

6.description: I have been ording from Angelo's  since 1996 the BBQ Chicken WAS to die for! Simply amazing best by far. I also frequently  order the pizza which is also amazing! My husband wanted to bring me and my coworkers lunch and went to get outlr favorite BBQ Chicken last week, it was very disappointing firt the chicken was cut all wrong the the recope was completely  different down to the breading they used, Bbq sauce is awful this made me really sad, why mess with perfection? I called Al the owner right away to find out what happened? He told me the changed the menu and got a new chef ugh. I ordered pizza today it tasted a little different, but is still really good. I would highly  recommend  bringing old Bbq chicken recipe back asap.

22.description: Angelo's just re-opened after a lengthy remodel and now has an updated, almost swanky, dining room and a completely overhauled and more upscale menu. On my first visit, I only had a drink at the bar. The beer selection was great, and the old fashioned was pretty well executed. Staff and management were attentive and clearly trying to make a good impression. They did, and I'll be back to try the food.

15.description: Love the new atmosphere. Soooo cozy. Food is still terrific. Went their for brunch. My personal favorites were the sangria, Bloody Mary, breakfast pizza, biscuits and gravy. Everything is really good. Loving the upgrade. Very chic. Highly recommend!

57.description: I ordered a few things from this place a week or two back and am just now getting around to writing a review.First up - Buffalo Wings, These are basically the same wings you get at a quick chinese take out place. The same breading, the same gross chicken. Not to mention, they dont but hot wing sauce on them (isnt that the point of BUFFALO wings?) they give you a shot glass of tabasco sauce on the side! What?!2nd - Pizza - The pizza was cooked completely uneven, half was nearly raw, the other half was nearly burnt. The sausage was fatty and hard to chew. I will say the sauce on the pizza was quite good, but the rest of the ingredients really were sub par.3rd - Mozzarella Sticks - They were blanch fried and extremely undercooked. Almost a white-ish color breading on them and tasted like the same kind you get at walgreens in the frozen food section for 99 cents.I thought I would be nice and give a NICE complaint to the store and let them know about my issues and that I DID NOT want a refund, but the manager was extremely rude told me the food was fresh and hung up on me. Really? This is how you do business? No thanks!

20.description: Some friends and I showed up at this place last night expecting to get some cheap greasy food and some generic beer.  However, when we got there, we were surprised to see that the place has been totally made over into a kinda fancy Italian restaurant, and is no longer the Pizza plus Mexican Food plus Fried Food spot we were expecting. (Side note - I can't find an updated website for this place, and the current one does not reflect AT ALL what the restaurant is now).  We realized we were kinda under dressed but went in anyways.  From the moment we walked in (a manager opened the door for us and said "WELCOME!" even though my husband was wearing his sweaty tshirt and shorts from biking there from the Loop), I was impressed.  We were seated and attended to right away.  Our server was a French guy named Georges who knew everything about the menu and was SPOT ON with several food and drink recommendations.  The food is "small plate sharing" as I feel like every other restaurant is these days.  Between the four of us we got two pizzas, grilled octopus, meatballs, and steak dish.  Every single thing was delicious. At the end of the night we were on the fence about dessert and Georges recommended we have a glass of limoncello instead.  It was refreshing, just sweet enough, and had some dairy mixed into it which created a velvety  smooth texture.  Yum!  In a nutshell, I showed up expecting generic greasy food, and was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere, service, food, and drink options.  The four of us ended up spending almost $300 (that includes tip) when all was said and done, but it was worth it, and we'll be back soon!  A great neighborhood find.  Well done, Angelo's!!

36.description: I will not return.   First, I must say that the waitress was friendly and attentive, but the  pitcher of margaritas - forget that item.   After a  few first tasting  sips, you could figure out that there was no flavor, very very little tequila, and the same for the lime.  What are they trying to serve?  Slightly-flavored ice water.   This is the first Mexican-oriented restaurant that I have tried or patronized that does NOT offer salsa and chips to its guests.    My partner and I were so disappointed.  We both had slightly different versions of the Combination Plate.   Every condiment is $$ extra. Bottom line, very disappointing.   One Star for the waitress.

14.description: Good thin-crust and surprisingly good deep dish.  Their prices are very fair.  This has been our go to pizza place for 3 years and I've only gotten one bad/burnt pizza.  The rib dinner, Italian beef, wings, and salads are good too.  The staff is very friendly and I've always had good service.  Really looking forward to their remodeled interior!

12.description: Maybe the air in Carbondale is getting to me, or just maybe finally getting back to civilization is nothing but pure ecstasy to me.....add in the cute smile one of the servers greeted me with, mix in razor sharp humor of a friends' reunion, and the amaaaaazing curves of the............sheeshas, get ur mind out of the gutter! :Dfinally some good sheesha, except I can surpass that on a regular basis! the cappuccino was extraordinary, or maybe it was just the way the server gave it to me :)I liked the decor, maybe not the most chic, but blends the east and west together! plus the pic of the owner with "The Greatest" adds another star!what I wanna know is how come theres so many high schoolers there? whatever floats their boat! lol....I haven't checked out the back room yet, but the BYOB sounds tempting!Overall the visit was not only satisfying, its how i describe it "it hit the spot" :D2 Thumbs up!

7.description: Ugh...where to begin?! First off, the hookah quality is terrible. Second, a GIANT cockroach crawled into the bathroom while I was in there. And worst of all the falafel appetizer I ordered immediately made me sick...as in I had to run back into the cockroach bathroom to vomit. And somehow my bill was $29 when all I had was a regular hookah, tea and falafel app...the math seems a bit off. If I hadn't been so sick I'd have stayed to ask about that...but I just needed OUT of that place.I used to like this place and hadn't been in a couple of years. Quality has definitely plummeted. I will be steering clear of here from now on, and I would highly suggest you do the same!!  Praying I don't officially have food poisoning Added note: Just realized the tip was automatically included...strange practice for a party of one. That would explain the higher than expected bill. I still tipped my waitress 20% on top of that because her service was the only good thing about this experience. Had I known tip was included though... Ugh, I'm done! #MovingOn

3.description: Haven't tried the food but the service there does not match the ambiance.  Well ventilated area with ample leg room, but of the 3 times I've been here, the hookah has been ridiculously expensive ($13+$4 auto gratuity=$17 for a single hookah).  Wouldn't have been as bad with some friends to share the bill, but solitary-- service provided is not worth the value.Great place for late night activities as it is open till at least 4am.  Of the 3 times of been there, the female servers were extremely rude and dismissive.  However, the male attendant during today's session allowed me to stay a bit after hours to finish up some work-- for that I give this place an extra star.  Another good point is WiFi-- I experienced stable connection with adequate speeds for my activities.  There is also a section with outlets on the wall which make it convenient to plug in items for power.  In retrospect, I think I would probably gotten a better bang for the buck if I went for the food instead of the hookah.  Oh well; you live and learn.

1.description: The 2 stars are for the hookah.  It's pretty ok.  Everything else, doesn't even deserve 1star. The place is dirty, I felt like i had cockroaches crawling on me.  The table was all sticky, the food was undercooked and really salty. The waitresses are clumsy and tend to forget what people ordered.   I had to remind her 4 times to get our table an ashtray. A lot of underaged kids there smoking and drinking, i felt like i was at some teen party.  They need to start checking IDs.  Horrible  experience. I do not recommend this place.

2.description: The food is the star in this case, they have the best grilled chicken in town, the rice is the best I've encountered in the city. Rice with small noodles, making it authentically Arab. The service is ok, the hookah selection not bad, the volume can eventually be an issue, but drinks are great here!

9.description: I went there on a Saturday night, it was almost full, we ordered hooaks and turkish coffee, the service was terrible i blame the management for that, i mean few waitresses and one guy who took care of the hookah for the whole cafe.I have been smoking hookah for more than 10 years, The hookah in this cafe was not good at all, when i told the guy responsible he just start smoking a bit and told it's ok he said this exactly " it's good, i think it's great" after a while i stopped smoking because it was bad, when i told d him the second time he was rude almost ignoring after telling that he is busy ???!!! Seriously i pay money for a good service and stuff not for that kind of attitude.  It was not only our table, the one next toe had 7 people, and they were also complaining that the hooakah was bad, and they had to inform the waitress several time until someone came to fix it.  Last but not least 20% gratitude was included in the bill. Bad experience, never going there again.

18.description: Don't bother going here.  The service here is extremely lame, they charged us $3 per person to drink the wine we brought - out of plastic, cracked cups... lame.   Let me repeat, the service at this restaurant is horrible the worst part is they put 15% gratuity automatically on the bill and we were a party of 4.  Go here to smoke a hookah maybe, but forget about ordering any food only because of the service, the kaftah kabob is good but does not make up for the service.  Go to Noon-O Kabob instead.

10.description: Never ever going back again.I went there as a last minute resort with some friends.They sat us down, and then it took about 10 minutes, until my friend stopped one of the waitress' and asked for some service. We gave her our order, and then 10 minutes later, another employee came by and with attitude asked to see our ID's after like 20 minutes of already being there. Then they brought us our hookah and food and when it came time to pay, we saw they added the gratuity to our bill, we asked why it was included if it isn't mentioned anywhere on the menu, and their was only 4 of us, the waitress didn't know and the other girl came by and said no ones ever complained, they always charge people that, theres nothing she can do. So we ended up paying it, even they didn't deserve it for horrible service!

13.description: Ugh I am so over this place, crappy hookah the last few times I have been there, so I refusing to go back!  I don't think they have cleaned their hookahs since I wrote my original review.  And I am tired of their high prices, no refills or even water....if you want a better place nearby go to Hubble HookaH!

16.description: Food is great, ambience is nice...Service was GREAT!!!!!!!! We had a hookah that was not working properly....The coal person realized it and said we will get you a better hookah....It was nice of them to do....LOVE THE FOOD AS WELL.....Must try the FATOOUSH SALAD AND ROLLS!!!!!!!!

17.description: Went there to eat and the place was a dump!!! We were right by the kitchen area which only had two tables and about 10+ chairs everywhere, the TV was very loud and after we sat down the owner made it even louder so he can hear what ever program he was watching, which made it pretty clear to us that we were not welcomed....the only thing i liked was their lentil soup-that's the only star for the place........

15.description: the service is sometimes slow, but the fatoush salad is ahhhhhhmazing!! and i know one of the servers the one married to the owner and the one coal guy ahmed..so they're what really keep me commin back! :)

0.description: When I started to smoke hookah this was one of the original spots I used to go to. This was around 10 years ago, when I was under 18 and they didn't card  you. This along with Neffertitis, were the spots. Nefertitis is now closed, but this spots still around and seems like its doing well for itself. The place has changed in appearance over the years. They upgraded the chairs, have granite tables, nicely painted walls that's perfect for the environment. When you come in here you really do feel a Mediterranean vibe, this is what I think a hookah bar should look like. They serve more food now, heard its ok but I don't really eat at hookah places. But the hookah is usually on point. They use the cubed coals with seem to have less of a char taste. The hookah usually hits well, and is pretty strong. To go along with the dozens of cigarette smokers in the place, this place gets pretty smoky. Almost too smoky. Which is my biggest issue. Ventilation has always been a problem here, and I have even had some friends feel very uncomfortable due to it, to the extent of almost passing out. Casual smokers will prob have to step out for fresh air if  you stay for a long time. But other then that, this is as authentic of a hookah place you can get, and that may be a reason why its continues to do so well. Its not gimmicky flashy, or tries to be something it isn't like all the new hookah spots, its a legit hookah spot for real hookah smokers!

5.description: I went there with a friend , we didn't  feel for hookah but we order food, I was surprised  how the hack this people has hookah and food menu in the same time. We order small hummus and 6 pc falafel and falafel sandwich and chicken  sandwich.  Our bill was $47 , they charge us $6 for the 6 piece  Falafel. I told the waitress this is the only place on earth  that charges $1 for  one Piece  of falafel. Advice :  I wouldn't  go there at all.  Service  is no good not happy at all.  Total a rip off.  On addition  to the $47  we added $8 tip for the service .  So basically  we spent $55  on this.  I felt like What the hack... that's too expensive.

11.description: A great place to go with friends for a night of hookah. The flavors of hookah are plentiful and they also have some good food options. I would not recommend taking a seat in the back room unless you are an avid cigarette smoker or you are invited to a party. The music back there is really loud and the waiters seem to only stop by once in a while.

8.description: This was my first time at a hookah place and I am hooked!!! I initially went there for the food, I mean come on who doesn't appreciate some good Mediterranean food right? The ambiance is very calm and cool. You have the option to sit in a well lit room or in a more intimately lit side room. We chose the latter.Upon entering you can lightly smell the sweetness of the tobacco. I can't stand the overbearing smell of cigarette smoke and so I was a bit nervous that this would be like that, but the ventilation system takes care of that. In fact there were some cigarette smokers there and had I not seen them I would've never realized they there there. We got a combo platter, some baba ganoush, and humus. Everything was amazing! The steak was a little tough but it was so nicely flavored that I didn't mind. (FYI I'm not really a steak chick so I'm super picky about that. Lol)Now for the fun part. I know I said I don't like cigarette smoke but I was a cigarette smoker. I know weird right? Anywho I was a little intimidated by the hookah so I made my hubby try first.
