I saw he was having fun so I just dove in. We didn't pick our flavor, our amazing waitress did. Funny enough she didn't tell us what we were getting so we guessed. Turns out we received a nice watermelon mint blend. I don't personally like watermelon, (I know I'm weird) but the taste was like chewing bubble yum. It was so cool.The place got packed really fast so get there early. One thing to note there is a $10 minimum per person on the busy weekends, but that's not hard to do. :)

4.description: Based on ordering carryout:I ordered baba ghanouj but wanted taste it first. the server refused to have me try it. I figured the reason behind that when i got home. Went straight to the garbage. Pouring babaghanouj straight from the can is not the way to go! Poor food and poor customer service=Horrible establishment

14.description: I'm giving this place 3 stars only because I'm a huuuuge fan of their super-smooth (yet not overbearing) Sweet Melon hookah.  Come here on a weekend evening during prime-time and its $10 PER PERSON on one hookah!!!  Insanity!I went last night, a Saturday, and the back room was chock-full of drunk high schoolers.  I don't think the staff cares much if minors drink on the BYOB policy, because I KNOW I saw a kid (maybe 15, if that) chugging Coronas.The front room is mostly older men in a more lavishly furnished sitting room.  It has, for some reason, always given me a creepy vibe.  I always prefer the back room with the disco ball, strobe lights, TVs, and loud music.  It can get very "Excalibur" in here, be warned.The female manager is WAAAAY overbearing, pushy, and tries too hard to get tipped.  The service is effing slow.3 stars for great Melon hookah smoke, being allowed to smoke cigarettes, and the extraordinary tea.

6.description: I use to go here a lot and I recently went there. I forgot how comfortable the seating is, or I just finally realized how uncomfortable it was after getting some very bad hookah. We ordered Blue Mist and Orange and the hookah was not hitting. We asked for them to check it out, the guy came, ashes the charcoal put them back on and smoke a few times, barely for anything and just gave it back to us like it was fine. Either he has never had a good bowl in his life or he was just trying to insult us. We immediately just paid and left and went to another hookah bar. Really bad experience.

1.description: No one could fix my eyebrows. I've tried almost every Salon on Devon and Beauty Spot in Lincoln Park. The Assiriyan lady at this salon is AMAZING. After threading she tweezes the small in grown hair and for atleast 2 weeks you don't have to retouch them. No1 has ever taken 20 mins for just my eyebrows and all for $6. now thats a dealIt is out of the way but I'll always go to her.

0.description: Anita is an experienced hair stylist. She knows her craft very well. I found her through my cousin who has been her customer for 15 years now.  Anita is very pleasant and accomodating.  She also does eyebrow threading very well.The best thing about this salon, the price is very good. I get the same result for when i get a 60$ haircut.  She only charges 28$ (cut and style).  It doesn't have that upscale ambiance but that's ok with me. I'm there to get a haircut not to get a spa.  This is the place for you if you don't care about those extra upscale perks other salon gives you.I highly recommend her.

12.description: Wanted to make authentic tamales. We went to Lindo and asked one of the check girls for help. The owner came out with one of his nephews. He help us pick out all we would need to make the tamales. The laid out the process for us. The came out great, but that is another story. The kicker is the food counter in the back. The array of prepared foods, carnitas, barbacoa, the roasted chicken especially had great flavor. The sides of beans, rice and salsas, also excellent taste. We packed up lunch for 4. So much food for so little money. If you want a mexican feast for your home this one stop shop will make your gathering a memorable occasion.

3.description: I've had a couple bad experiences here dealing with the management when trying to get some food catered, and I know for a fact they were trying to jip me.  But, it's a solid grocery store. The produce and bakery areas are good, but the butchers have been pretty consistently rude to me. The pre-made food is fine, predictable, and pretty cheap.It's fine, but Andy's fruit ranch down the street is just a much better option every time.

1.description: I don't usually review grocery stores but this store was awful. The parking lot was so full that I had to park on the street and pay $2.35 to meter park.The aisles are a joke, you can only fit one cart down the aisle at a time. The wait for meat from the butcher department was over 45 min long, not to mention the horrible stench of what smells like rotting milk while you wait your turn. Everything was overpriced from the milk to the meat and I had to lug 10 heavy bags to my car because you can't take the shopping cart out of the stores enclosed entry way. My 1st time here, was also my last.

2.description: I bought cow head for $33 and they only gave me bones and more bones it  had little meat very disappointed

9.description: Wow... boycott this place, right now!The lighting is dim and depressing. The isles and the place in general doesn't seem very clean (at least for a place that sells food items). The prices are kinda high for basic items and more so for specialty items.Those are not, however, the reasons you should boycott this place. The reason is quite simply this: whoever owns or manages this store has NO SOUL! Why, you ask? Well, on your way out, turn your head to your right and you will see a wall of shame. It has several polaroids of people that have been caught shoplifting. Let me make it clear that the wall of shame, as I called it, is indicative of the shame the management should feel for displaying this parade of misery for all to see! These are clearly hungry people! Half the photos are of crying mothers with babies in their arms and small children at their side (and the food items they tried to take laid out in front of them). It is sickening that they would treat people like that. I'm not saying those people had a right to walk in at take what they want, but they don't deserve that kind of treatment. You got your items back. Ban them from the store if you want. Even, have them arrested... if you feel it's necessary (which I don't), but this is out of line. And don't get me wrong. I'm the farthest thing from someone soft on crime. I believe rapist, murders, terrorist, and child abusers should all have public (and painful) executions. They deserve no less. But, the people in those photos on the wall are just hungry people. They didn't hurt anyone. Have a soul, for the love of god.I'm never stepping foot inside this place again, and I'm going to tell everyone I know to stay away, also.

10.description: Simply put, this is your typical neighborhood supermercado.  And if you've never been to a supermercado (seriously?), this is a good place to start.  The first thing you see when you walk in is the produce section.  Fairly priced, fresh produce with an emphasis on Mexican staples.  I happen to love cooking with these ingredients, so yay for me!  It also helps to be a little creative in the kitchen (translation: just because it's a supermercado doesn't mean you have to make Mexican food every night, duh).They have a bakery section with an array of pan dulce (like conchas) and bolillos.  By the way, bolillos are fantastic for breakfast egg sandwiches.  They're even better with chorizo, which you can also purchase here.  I noticed that most of the customers had gravitated towards the prepared food section, which had several dishes already made and ready to eat.  I noticed a couple stew-like dishes, Mexican rice, carnitas, and chicken.  I'll make sure to try their prepared food next time, because everything looked very tasty.Other random notes on the place - they have an impressive glass-bottled soda selection.  $1 Mexican Cokes, Fresca, Sidral Mundet (apple soda), Jarritos, Senorial (non-alcoholic sangria), and several other glass-bottled sodas.  They also have 2 liter Coco Rico (coconut soda) and Inca Kola (Peruvian soda).  I also loved their huge selection of fruit juices and nectars.  I purchased a few cans of passion fruit juice, which is excellent in cocktails (passion fruit margaritas, anyone?)Yes, there are several other grocery stores in the area, but the more the merrier.  And don't forget about their sister restaurant (aptly named Lindo Michoacan, of course) right next door.

13.description: This place depresses me. the lighting is awful. the product is stocked as if it was done in a hurry. the meat is ok but the shrimp I bought was awful. It seems almost everything has corn syrup in it. I really am gonna try to avoid this place as much as possible. counter service is ok though.

16.description: There are so many supermercados in this area that it's hard to choose.  I only go here for their homemade white corn tortillas - YUMMY!  At less then a $1 for 20+ quality tortillas, you really can't go wrong!

6.description: I love this supermarket because it has food similar from back home, Argentina. The food is fresh, and the meat as well. I love that they have a Carniceria and that the delivery is free! can you believe it!The people is super nice, I had a lot of stuff and I was calling my husband to pick me up,and one of the cashier heard me and she said hey we have free delivery, they call immediatly to Carlos and the truck was already up front. A gentleman help me with my stuff and they delliver my food and myself

15.description: This supermarket is a hidden gem. I had my daughters baptism food catered here . The food was absolutely phenomenal . Everyone raved about the food. I ordered carnitas,fajitas de carne asada y chicken,frijoles charraos and rice. I recommend this  place and so do my 80 guest.

0.description: I hate to say "it's alright" on my review.  Why would you yelpers read my review if I didn't have anything else to say, or provide any insight on the things I saw?  Well, this grocery store really is "alright" to the bone.  In my opinion, there are too many Hispanic grocery stores in Albany Park, so the competition is definitively ON!  The freshness of the produce items, from what I observed, wasn't nearly as superior as what Cermak Produce offers.  On the other hand, the prices weren't fantastic, but they were within the average and acceptable to my purchasing standard.  I usually don't purchase any butchered meat and poultry items, but their meat department looked clean and had more extensive selections than Chicago Produce located on two (2) blocks west.  The same phenomenon applied on the seafood and hot-food departments.  If I want fresh seafood, I would prefer to shop at Lindo Michoacan than at Chicago Produce or at Mayfair because that department has more visual appeal.  Since I fix mostly vegetarian dishes at home, Chicago Produce is my preferred grocery store for veggies and fruit.  In other words, traveling further in order to shop at Lindo Michoacan doesn't seem so necessary.  Anyways, I wasn't too impressed overall.

5.description: I live right across the street so in terms of convenience they are great.  Since I don't eat the traditional Mexican diet though I give it two stars.The only time I find this place useful is when I am getting ready to make salsa or want Coke that is product de Mexico and HFCS (High Fructose Corn Syrup) free.Other than the occasional thing I need in a hurry I would rather go to Andy's Fruit Ranch or Harvestime Foods.  Also, on the weekends this place is mega packed and the traffic on Lawrence doesn't help make this parking lot any less of a nightmare so if you are thinking about driving here don't, it is always hell.

11.description: I -love- this place! Everyone is super friendly, the produce is fantastic, the meat is great, and the hot food in the deli is always a treat! I speak no spanish, so sometimes it is a bit awkward communicating, but they always sort it out with a smile. The chipotle cheese is my new crack addiction!The bakery is amazing - I had never been in a mexican grocery store/bakery prior to this one.. so the first time I go up to the baked goods I wait patiently for someone to help me, the woman from behind the counter comes out and is all smiles with the tray and helps me with my selection (with pointing and holding up fingers to indicate quanitity).To my embarassment, I tell my friend and landlord this story and she almost wets her pants laughing at me, apparently the bakery is self-service in getting your baked goods. So now whenever I see the woman who helped me I get embarassed, but she is always smiling (in fact all the ladies are smiling at me).It's a great place, check it out! Some stuff could be cheaper, but you will be hard pressed to find their prices at Jewel or Dominicks!

8.description: I'm no fan. I've gone to this place several times for the sake of convenience, since it's the closest grocery store to my apartment, but I think it's time to start taking a longer walk. Put aside the fact that the prices aren't always clearly marked, and some of the prices just make no sense (why is a quart of milk twice as much as a half gallon?), and you're still left with the fact that the whole store has a certain dingey, overcrowded feel to it. Half the signs written in English are misspelled, and the cashiers may or may not make eye contact. Two stars, instead of just one, because they do sometimes have some good deals on fresh fruit.ETA: I went in there today because I was all out of cat food. A small box of dry cat food was $9.99! I went down the street to Joony Mart, and they had the same thing for $3.09. I'm willing to accept that many items in a small, local shop will be priced higher than they might be at a large chain, but that's just crazy.

4.description: This is a bit better than 18th St. I promise.I wish I could write something cool, like -"I wanna hop onto the steam table and bang the carnitas tray dude!"But, I have already done that and don't care to comment. 5 stars for possibly the best carnitas possible outside of Mexico, if you peer through the swinging doors you will see workers churning stainless pots of this pork confit over blazing fires...kinda looked like the hell scene in the Constantine movie.If you haven't done this yet, and aren't squeamish...pick the parts you want.I usually get a pound or two mixed, a little stomach, skin, ribs, and lean meat. Grab a pack of the homemade tortillas and find some green sauce. Go to the crib and chop everything up. Use tortillas to shovel both lbs. of meat into your face, drink the green sauce. Wake up from your coma,repeat.

14.description: Jo quiero Supermercado Lindo Michoacan! And not just because it's down the block from my apartment. It's a smallish place that's kept very clean and orderly. Because many regulars here buy in bulk, their fish, meats and produce are fresh and very reasonably priced. There's also a little baked goods section at the back. I've never developed a love for Mexican pastries but their raised doughnuts are definitely tasty. Don't forget to take a number at the meat counter, especially when it's busy! As Tom M. mentions, the guys working the meat & fish section will grind/fillet/slice what you're buying, if you ask.The deli offers carnitas and roast chickens every day, with a few other hot items on a rotating basis. I once had some delicious pork meatballs simmered in a poblano sauce but haven't seen those on offer since. Just two days ago I bought some amazingly sweet peaches and bunches of mint to make a sorbet (it's doubtful the peaches will make it to that stage, num-num-num).The clerks give me funny looks whenever I tell them, 'No plastic bags, thanks. I brought my own.' Maybe they're seeing more crazies like me coming in and wondering when their rents and property taxes will start going through the roof. Or maybe I'm just uglier than I think.In any case, this place is great. Go in with respect. Leave with nice ingredients for dinner AND some spare change in your wallet. Then do a little dance.

7.description: The day before thanksgiving this store booted my husband (charging him $200) despite the fact that he was 10 feet from his car (helping a person who car had died) and I had shopped there minutes before. We live three blocks from this store and use to visit there very often - the owner did nothing when we explained our situation. To make matter worse, today on my walk to the next nearest grocery store, I had to pass Lindo Michoacan - THEY DID NOT SHOVEL THEIR SIDEWALKS!! So they can charge us, and we have to comply with the city ordinance but they are free to possess our property and not follow city rules!!! Seriously - go the extra distance to Andy's or Harvest time where they value their customers.

58.description: My husband and I have been coming to this establishment every Sunday since we moved to the Albany Park neighborhood 5 years ago. Which is about the time the establishment first opened it doors.  Obviously, we like the food. The 2 waitresses and owners, one of which are always on premise and very polite. They will also help you make a discussion if you can't decide between two dishes. Their breakfast/lunch menu is extensive:Breakfast:  I would recommend a skillet or one of their daily specials write on the wipe board by the door. Lunch: The gyro platter is delicious and comes loaded with fries.  The Greek Chicken is yummy but you need to ask if they have it sometimes it not ready or they have sold out. It's a roasted chicken with a Greek blend of spices. And if you're in the mood for a huge, loaded salad go for the Cobb salad. Loaded with chicken, bacon, avocado and served in a bowl as big as your head.  If you eat it all....congratulations. Over the years we have seen this Cafe popularity grow substantial and of course with that comes the line of people. Yes, this establishment is small about 7-8 booths and 6 tables.  If you go during the week there will be no wait however like most Chicagoans we like our Sunday breakfast/brunch so yes there will be a little wait. Typical wait time now is about 10-15 minutes. There is no hostess, however someone a waitress or owner will ask you if you want a table or booth and then give you an est. wait time. You can take in the quint atmosphere by the door until your seating is ready. If you decide to stop by go early (before 10am) or after 1pm on a Sunday your wait time will be very minimal or non- existence as we have discovered over the years. While writing this post will only cause more people to flood one of my favorite Chicago cafes, I cannot let this establishment go unrecognized for their great service and food we have received over the last five years.

56.description: Service amazing the plates are a nice size and food is the best.  I love to take my family and they always have two high chits when I go it hard to dine with twins but they make it easy. If you live in Albany park must go.

29.description: West River Cafe is a nice little spot right off Kedzie.I came here with a larger group with younger kids and they pushed together tables very quickly and were very cheerful. They even made little strawberry shakes for the younger kids in the group, just because and on the house. That was really nice of them.Everyone ordered the breakfast items and seemed to be very happy with their orders. I happened to order a chicken caesar salad and it was HUGE. Very good quality chicken and tasted very good.This is an inexpensive spot to grab brunch. Stop by if you want to be full and still have money left in your pocket.

42.description: In a restaurant. In a west end town......a dead end world.The east end boys and west end girls.West River Cafe... (dun dun dun dun)Too many shadows, whispering voices.Mundane menu with too many choices.If, When, Why, What.A boring diner - anything interesting you got?West River Cafe...(dun dun dun dun)

23.description: This corner cafe is super low key. They have prompt service and the food comes out before you can blink. Their gyros omelette with feta cheese is terrific. We will be back!

47.description: I have been to handful of diners, but this one hits home.  Service is great, food is fresh, but the only thing they lack is consistency. The place gets packed on the weekends so service and wait time are a little longer than if go during the weekday. If you go there Sunday morning, make sure you go before the Church down the block lets out. If not, yer gonna be waiting.  Overall, I can't complain, the staff is friendly, the food is great for what you pay and the ambiance is very comfy.   I'll pick this place over iHop, Dennys, or Golden Nugget any day.  Breakfast rules here, lunch isn't bad.  They always have daily specials for breakfast and lunch. All I have to say is MONTROSE SPECIAL!!!

8.description: I may have gone on an off day, but....sub-par service, corned beef hash from a can, and mediocre bacon.

31.description: I've been coming here for years. My office is in the vicinity. I've always enjoyed the eggs benedict and daily specials. The other day I discovered their home made potato soup. I couldn't believe my taste buds... just exquisite. Yesterday we picked up 2 bowls of mushroom soup. We took it back to the office and were delighted with the wonderful home made soup, and delighted to find french bread in the bag. Together a wonderful lunch. Thanks West River cafe.

34.description: Great neighborhood spot with fast and friendly wait staff, 80s rock on the radio and tasty and filling skillets.  Pretty much the only sit down breakfast spot in Albany Park.  I wish they'd add a location further west (hint, hint!).

16.description: Great service and nice staff.Kind of dirty atmosphere, the back of the restaurant wreaked of cigarette smoke.Food was super average for a vegetarian but my bf loved his chicken dish.

13.description: We went on a Saturday, at a morning-ish hour, for brunch.  The food was fine, and I came away full, but it took a very long time to order, get our food and get out of there.  I know brunchy weekends are busy, but an hour wait for food is a bit much.

11.description: In a restaurant. In a west end town......a dead end world.The east end boys and west end girls.West River Cafe... (dun dun dun dun)Too many shadows, whispering voices.Mundane menu with too many choices.If, When, Why, What.A boring diner - anything interesting you got?West River Cafe...(dun dun dun dun)

39.description: Sweat pants on! Hair a mess! Cross the street with dumb look on face! I did it all for West River Cafe! Everything here is perfection personified for diner fare.  Portions on your plate will usually not be finished because there's so much for you to take home across the street to your hobbit hole! Grumble grumble go the voices in your head. Eat the rest of your Gyro skillet ya ding dong!  I'm so happy to come here though and the staff are friendly and know the meaning of re-fill!  Oi. Now to lose some weight!

37.description: I've been hear a few more times than I have actually checked in. I have to say the food is good diner food. When I think of diner I automatically think breakfast, but I've tried other menu items and it's just those breakfast sausage links that are horrible to me. Nice staff, fast service. Closed by 3pm but good to stop in if you're up early wanting good food.

0.description: I came in on a Tuesday morning around 11am.  The place was still 1/2 full which is a good sign.  It is a small cover location with 7 booths, 4 tables and a lunch counter.  My table was a little wobbly, which I hate.  It was easily fixed with a sweetener.I wish the stools at the counters had backs but they were more of the classic look.  The Decore was that faux country kitchen look.  I really am not a big fan of it but it is what you find in new places in chicago.  There were two waitress working and they were running around diligently.  The coffee was average although pleantiful.  I like that they had the old fashioned full suger container.  Joanie, the older of the servers was waiting on me and she was friendly and very attentive.  I am 90 % sure the other waitress was also the owner.  A Greek lady I would guess.I ordered the steak and eggs which were cooked to order!  This is a big plus.  The kitchen is open and in the back of the Resturant.  This defiantly has a local feel and is a much better option than say the Chian comparisons.  The biscuit was fresh and fluffy.  The gravy was a light color and tasty, however it was sparse.  I had to ask for an extra side to cover my biscuit.  While it did have chuncks of sausage it still needed to be seasoned for taste.  The eggs were prepared over easy and were perfect, as were the hash browns.  The steak was good as well but nothing too special.  Overall everthing was good and this was a place I would stop by again.  I do not think that I would ever wait for a table in a crowd how ever.

38.description: My family and I have gone here over the past several years. We used to like it more, but the prices have gradually gone up and are just too high for the quality of the food. Service is fine and the decor is fun (mostly chicken-themed). Sometimes the music is turned up a bit high.

51.description: This is our ultimate Sunday brunch spot. This diner is filled with character and wonderful, super nice people that work there. The experience here is very personable and the food is super delicious. I always order the florentine Benedict. Also the Alaskan Waffles are delicious and are served with ice cream - yum!

27.description: West River is a cute little Breakfast/Lunch corner diner. I had a Steak skillet and it was good. I was seated at the counter and service was good without being intrusive. I live very close so this is a good low key spot I can grab some good brunch and write.

32.description: West River Cafe was our third choice and after my experience there today, I don't feel so bad saying that.  We walked in and was greeted my no one for about 3 minutes. Finally one of the busy servers nodded to us, asked us how many in our party and then mumbled while pointing to a table that was being cleaned for us.  We sit down and another server comes to our table with water and silverware.  He does not bring menus and he does not greet us.  Finally, we asked a third server for menus and she promptly brings them. The entire time we are barely getting through the greeting process there is another gentleman behind the cash register.  He seems to be an owner or a manager, and he is not participating in the chaos that is brunch service, in any other way but quickly taking people's money when they are leaving or leaning against the wall that divides the small, bustling kitchen and the tiny chaotic dining room. We order our food from server number one. She is apologetic for our wait and seems a bit disheveled as I have watched her multitask through the dining room as her manager watches calmly behind the register. Not doing anything to assist her or any of the servers during this busy time.  Our food comes out within a matter of about 10 minutes and was good I guess, but I was just happy to be eating at this point because I was starving.  The server brings our check more than half way through our brunch.   We quickly finish eating and prepare to leave. Now that I am about to pay my bill, the manager is now sitting in the back of the restaurant, drinking soda and checking his cell phone. I wait for him to return (as you can imagine he was in no hurry).  As he is taking my payment he never asks how my meal was and he doesn't thank me for coming In.  Needless to say i will not be back. Having worked in the service industry, you learn to "follow the bubble".  Help seat, help bring menus, drinks, condiments and take payment. As a manager, you are ALWAYS suppose to assist your staff. I was disgusted with my experience. If it wasn't for the okay food and my bustling server who did the best she could in the weeds, I would give this place one star because it was easy to find. Good luck.

54.description: I am always a fan of a place that serves breakfast all day. They have so many choices, it's ridiculous! I had the gypsy skillet, and my boyfriend had the biscuits and gravy. Both dishes were delicious! The portion size is out of this world. My skillet was huge and it was under 5 dollars. My boyfriend had the option to do a full or half plate. He went with the full plate and got 6 biscuits. Again, his dish was about 5 or 6 bucks. It's a small place, and it's not very crowded. We didn't have trouble finding a seat. It's kinda like an old school diner. The service was great, and our waitress was very nice. The atmosphere is very relaxed, and I didn't feel rushed. I would def go there again! It was awesome.

48.description: Descent food. Excellent service.

44.description: Breakfast special $4.99! This is a great little neighborhood breakfast/lunch place. Ask for their wonderful multi-grain bread. It is cozy, clean, the food is great, prices are good, and service is fast. Most entrees are about $9 but they do have that amazing special. Love it! Sundays of course are very busy.

24.description: Good chilaquiles, the waitress was a bit distracted being that she was waiting her friends but it's ok because the food good although we also had a gyro and it was like the saltiest thing ever bah but it was good lol fresh coffee nice little chill spot.

7.description: I love this little cozy diner! They have a little bit of everything on the menu,plus a wall of hot tea choices which I love:)they also have daily specials.

49.description: Came here once, will not be back again. Which is a shame, as I'd love a diner just a few blocks from our house. The food is..well..meh. Which to me is a crime - a diner that can't make good breakfast food? Cramped and divey. Hilltop on California & Foster is better & worth the walk.

40.description: I just moved to the neighborhood a few days ago, and I've already eaten twice at West River Cafe. It's the ideal diner. They serve breakfast all day, and the food and coffee are aces! I had the avocado skillet with bacon and coffee the first time. The skillet was very tasty and the portion was substantial. My boyfriend had the breakfast tacos with chorizo. We kept stealing bites of each other's food--SO GOOD! The next day, I was still unpacking and didn't want to make food, so I got a bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich and a coffee to go. The sandwich was also excellent. I'm so happy to have such a rock-solid diner just around the corner from me. It's right up there with Cozy Corner in terms of diner awesomeness.

53.description: This review is long overdue! My roommate and I have been going to this diner almost every Sunday afternoon since I've moved to Albany Park a year and a half ago. I really like the small town feel to this place. Living in the city, it's quite difficult to break away from the hustle & bustle of everything so this is a great place to come sit down & enjoy a cup of coffee and a stellar breakfast. (Get the California Omelette. It is FANTASTIC) Service is great. Everybody is really friendly and welcoming.  It is certainly always one of the highlights of my weekend! I'm always stoked to go out & party on a Saturday night but I must say, I always look forward to my Sunday afternoons a little bit more!

30.description: 2 words, Monte Cristo..It's probably the best I've had..The portions are huge and the quality is more than you'd expect from a diner. The wait staff is super nice and they're always nice to my kids..Can't ask for more..No gripes about this place at all..

46.description: Had to check out this place before I moved out of the hood. The food was pretty good. Oddly enough I decided to order an oatmeal and I really enjoyed it. I was a little wary ordering from a dinner, but I wanted to eat light. Definitely decorated in a country decor against the backdrop of the bustle of Kedzie and with a diner feel. The wait staff was friendly enough. We got a wobbly table and the busboy went out of his way to stick stuff under the foot of the table to keep it from rocking back and forth. Worth a stop if you happen to be getting out from church or walking the 'hood.

1.description: Big question. Does an egg dish listed in the menu under the subheading of "skillets", need to be served in a skillet ?  Answer, hell no. Serve it on a plate or whatever, just make sure it tastes good .Skillets at West River Cafe are served  on a plate . Cool with me. However,  I requested that the hashbrowns be crispy. That didn't happen . My " Gypsy Skillet " /(plate) was delivered as soft "unseasoned" hashbrowns topped with  sautéed small cubes of ham & onions , and a slice of "American " cheese ( not cheddar  as listed in the menu) melted on top .  This was topped with 3 good size eggs prepared any style . Ample potion size , but lacking flavor.On the positive side, this is a very clean little neighborhood diner. Bottomless cup of coffee, daily specials , good service. Was really hoping this might be one of my weekend diner hangouts, ( where there were no waiting lines) but I'm thinking that despite no lines , it's not  on par with "Over Easy", "M. Henry" or "Bongo Room".  Granted, this is your typical Greek diner , but prices are equal to any of the aforementioned .  Guess I'm doomed to wait in line for an awesome weekend breakfast/brunch!

55.description: This is a delicious hidden gem in Albany Park on the corner of Montrose and Kedzie.  It is so diner-y, with its wood paneled walls and rooster decor.  It only serves breakfast and lunch (and breakfast all day, I do believe).  And breakfast there is so good.  This place is always full of locals.  I'm kind of protective of this place.  I want it to do well but I don't want all of Chicago traipsing into my hood to experience the deliciousness.  The staff is friendly and pleasant, the food is so darn good.  My favorite is the sausage gravy and biscuits.  The portion is plentiful - six biscuits!! -  the biscuits are home made and a decent meal here won't set you back very much at all.

9.description: This has been my go-to breakfast and brunch spot since moving to Albany Park.The servers are super nice, the food is super good and plentiful for the price.I rotate between the benedicts, skillets and the biscuits and gravy. Beware, however, the B&G is big enough to keep you full all day, so maybe go lighter if you have late lunch or dinner plans.

26.description: Great place if you are hungry for some eggs. It's a diner with a variety of plates and specials. Service is fast and food comes out fast too. I've tried the Huevos rancheros which were just ok. Rice and sauce tasted like it was from a can but eggs and tortilla were good. My son had the chocolate chip pancakes and he really did like those. Place is a little divvy but kid friendly for sure. Plus, while packed, it was fairly easy to find a seat on a late Sunday morning. Prices were a little higher than I would expect but again...if you're in the area, this will do.

25.description: I think yelpers get this one wrong. No one thing was worth four stars let alone the whole experience. The coffee was water and the waitress was indifferent. Won't be returning.

12.description: Eggs, eggs, eggs in everything! When I ordered an array of sides, but no eggs, the waitress seemed genuinely startled. The hashbrowns and bacon were, well, hashbrowns and bacon. The coffee was coffee. Nothing spectacular, but nothing wrong, either. The food was served on mismatched plastic plates and bowls. Any kitschiness in the cute, worn-down decor is purely unironic. The price is definitely right. If you just want some solid, no-frills food for a decent price, in a clean neighborhood place, go here. If you want a cutesy, upscale brunch place, go somewhere else.

59.description: Good food, clean, reasonably priced.This is a decent diner through and through.  However, what kicks it up a few notches in my estimation?  FOUR KINDS OF OATMEAL.  Well, okay, four different ways oatmeal is served.  I love oatmeal.  I order it for brunch whenever I can, and usually it's just a big heaping bowl with some brown sugar, milk, and maybe a few dessicated raisins.  Not so at West River.  I got myself a heaping bowl with strawberries, blue berries, and granola.I also got some eggs and bacon, both of which were tasty.  I'm definitely hitting this place up again.

21.description: This is a fantastic small family neighborhood diner!! The staff are friendly, attentive and quick. We like to have a quick brunch here and there's seldom a long wait. Food always arrives very quickly and made to order. Classic breakfast favorites are accompanied by some Latin and Greek options for greater variety. Love the gyro omlette, the feta cheese is delicious!! Prices are very reasonable as well. Definitely a place to check out and support in the neighborhood.

17.description: This place is wonderful and reasonably priced! Service was great! A little bit of a wait but I didn't mind because it was super busy! Staff and service were excellent.

10.description: Great place if you are hungry for some eggs. It's a diner with a variety of plates and specials. Service is fast and food comes out fast too. I've tried the Huevos rancheros which were just ok. Rice and sauce tasted like it was from a can but eggs and tortilla were good. My son had the chocolate chip pancakes and he really did like those. Place is a little divvy but kid friendly for sure. Plus, while packed, it was fairly easy to find a seat on a late Sunday morning. Prices were a little higher than I would expect but again...if you're in the area, this will do.

5.description: Ate there a while back and ordered a breakfast special. It was a pretty good value and it was quite tasty.   I read a newspaper and I was given a refill of water. I felt it was a better deal than an egg mcmuffin any day of the week. Waitress was cordial.

3.description: This was a snowy morning in late February, but Rosa J. and her hubby were still energetic and wanted breakfast.  Since traffic everywhere was congested due to the harsh weather condition, we took it slow and headed to West River Cafe.  Like many other joints in Albany Park, I passed through this establishment many times while riding the CTA 78 (Montrose) bus.  Again, what a discovery!  It's located on the corner of Montrose and Kedzie, diagonally across from the Walgreens.  The waitress was cool and attentive.  We received our coffee immediately upon sitting down.  There are many vegetarian-friendly items on the menu.  Hubby LOVES avocados, so he picked the avocado Benedict.  I'm a "Benedict" junkie, too (the food, not the former Pope), so I had the Florentine Benedict.  The items on the menu are priced reasonably, comparable to the "semi-nearby" popular competitions (The Kronor and Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club...even though I would say "The Kronor" is slightly more expensive).  However, West River Cafe is one of the a few quality breakfast joints in Albany Park.  Both avocado Benedict and florentine Benedict were super on point!  The eggs were poached perfectly, and the hollandaise sauce was delicious.  Our hash browns had good texture and were cut into a good "bite-size."  There's also a TV there, so we could pay attention to the local traffic since it appeared to be ultra-dysfunctional this morning.  They do accept credit cards; paid street parking is available on Kedzie.  If utilizing public transportation, the CTA 78 (Montrose) drops you off at Montrose and Kedzie; CTA Kedzie Brown line station is a couple of blocks north of West River Cafe.  With that being said, I will be certainly be back!

35.description: West River Cafe is the closest diner to my place so I've been there a few times for breakfast despite the fact that it is pretty lackluster overall. The prices are mid-range and the food is okay, for the most part. The hash browns are tasteless and rubbery, and asking for them extra crispy is usually ignored, or possibly the cook doesn't know how to do it.The service, though, is why I won't be returning. When I go to a diner, I like to have breakfast, read my paper, and drink coffee. This means I might not jump up and leave as soon as I've eaten my last bite of omelet (unless there's a line at the door - I'm not a monster).However, the older waitress with short hair (who I suspect might be one of the owners) is in the habit of dropping your check on the table after 2 coffee refills and then completely ignoring you in order to make you leave. Even when she is pouring coffee at the tables on either side of you, and you are flagging her down, cup in hand, she will straight up refuse to serve you. Again, if the place were busy, or if I'd been there over an hour or something, I'd understand her wanting me to leave. As it is, this is just super passive aggressive nonsense and I'm not going to reward it with more of my money. Any recommendations for other breakfast places near Montrose/Kimball/Kedzie?

19.description: This corner cafe is super low key. They have prompt service and the food comes out before you can blink. Their gyros omelette with feta cheese is terrific. We will be back!

28.description: Great diner place that you can easily walk in on a Saturday or Sunday morning for a table with no wait. This is just a few blocks from where my boyfriend lives and he's a frequent visitor, and I've tagged along quite a few times. I can always count on a good meal, fast service, and a good price!Only had breakfast food here but it's all been great!

45.description: Great place! Good food and very friendly service all wrapped in an unassuming package.  The ultimate diner experience.

33.description: You can't go wrong with large portion size and reasonable pricing.  What makes this a 5 star breakfast joint, in my opinion, is the customer service and true diner experience.  No frills, just consistent coffee refills and fluffy short stacks.  Me and FeFe will be back!

43.description: I'm glad this diner is in my neighborhood.  I typically come here for their breakfast. The food is good and not expensive at all. My parents love going here when they visit me. The staff is always friendly. Good recommends: Avocado Benedict(my fav), when offered their 4.99 bone in ham is solid. Pancakes and French toast are also tasty.

2.description: Came at Saturday for breakfast  order skillet and egg Benedict , well skillet was served  warm , and on plate, and Benedict was kind of watery, give this place 3 stars , it's ok go there if you  are  really  hungry )

18.description: Love the food, great atmosphere but felt kind of ignored my waitress was usually very attentive and nice to me and my child but recently she has been not as great as when I first moved in the neighborhood. Only tip: improve your customer service .

41.description: Small cozy diner. Staff was exceptionally friendly and very courteous.  portions are big but the prices are very reasonable.  Food was really good. Had the Montrose breakfast special. Delicious! Will definitely be returning to try some of the other breakfast items and lunch specials.

52.description: this is our favorite place for weekend breakfast/brunch! Menu is consistent with typical diners but there always has specials that often inspired by Latin American cuisine. The service is super fast and very friendly. We never had any problems with food or service.

50.description: Decent eggs benedict, good  hollandaise, my sons eggs were cold and I had to ask them warm them up, my wife eggs and bacon and they were good, but just not that spectacular. Nice small environment, you get your money's worth.

4.description: I'm a firm believer in adding avocado to just about anything and one of my favorite breakfast items is eggs Benedict. You add avocado to that and I'm in heaven. I no longer needed to glance over the menu once I spotted my avocado eggs benedict. It was served with a good portion of hash browns. Definitely left feeling stuffed. My friends had the manager's special: two eggs, two pancakes, two sausage links served with hash browns, and an order of french toast. They both enjoyed their food and it was decided we'd come back again. The cafe isn't huge but you have your choice of seating from booths, tables and a stool at the counter. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. Was't very busy when we there at 9 this morning but I'm guessing this place fills up after 10. Reasonable prices, quick service, clean, and good food, can't really ask for anything more in a place.

6.description: I got the Italian sausage skillet and half the sausage was super well done and looked like it was leftover from 2 days ago. And all of the old sausage was neatly hidden inside the skillet's potatoes while the fresh sausage surrounded the plate. I told the cashier about it and tried to show her the offending sausage, but instead of looking at it, she said I should have sent it back. I'm probably not going back there because I am not going to waste my time picking through the potatoes to see if the cook gave me fresh sausage or yesterday's sausage. I appreciate his frugal-ness but he should give the old dried out sausage to his dog.

22.description: A wonderful little diner with a  traditional feel to it.  Great for low key breakfast/lunch in the local area.  Service was spot on...not too bothersome but not lacking. Food was the best part. A little pricy but well worth every penny. The Manager's special is highly recommended!!

15.description: When I moved from Lincoln Square from Albany Park, I wasn't sure if I'd find a good go-to brunch/breakfast place. I won the jackpot by landing just a few minutes' walking distance from West River Cafe. Phew! West River is your classic neighborhood diner. Warm, welcoming, tasty, and not pretentious at all. You will not find bloody mary bars, or bottomless mimosas (or any alcohol for that matter) here. Nor will you find maple bacon doughnut holes or trendy gourmet breakfast items. But what you WILL find is hearty breakfast and brunch options, a comfortable environment, always friendly service, and reasonable prices. Full disclosure, I've only eaten here for breakfast. I would like to try it for lunch as I suspect it would be a hearty lunch too. Full disclosure #2, I do not eat eggs or cheese, so I can't comment on the omelets or burritos though when I take visiting family here, they are very complimentary about those menu options. So, based on what I've ordered, you cannot go wrong with the pancakes, waffles, french toast, or sausage here. They have a large breakfast menu but also specials and neither disappoints. Tasty every time. But the charm of West River is not *just* the food. It's also the experience. The service is friendly and I think we've had the same 2 waitresses each time. Both treat you like a regular. I usually only go out for breakfast when people are visiting but think I'd feel equally comfortable pulling up a stool to their counter and enjoying breakfast solo. West River Cafe is the real-deal, and much more comfy than some of the places in Lincoln Square.

57.description: Awesome diner for those that love that kind of thing.

20.description: This place is great! I use to live in lake view and loved salt and pepper. Needed a place to go to and finally found a great local joint. The food is decent and came to the table fast. The owner was standing by the cash register the whole time making sure biz ran smooth. His name is Jim. Say hi!

36.description: My husband and I go here everyone in awhile because it is cheap, close and cute. And of course yummy. Especially the corn flake french toast which I have never heard of anywhere else.

14.description: Defiantly not a place for a crowd nor if you have a few little ones, as I experienced on my visit; waitress was getting annoyed. Waitress was in such a rush to take our order which she could easily see that none of us had actually taken a glance at our menus. Food had a great taste ( egg tacos) beans were defiantly a bit stale. Kids pancakes were defiantly a hit with the kids. Food overall was good but service was in need of improvement but maybe it was just one of them days for that particular waitress. Some children also picked up on the waitress disturbance. I would definitely try them again & this time try some coffee ( another negative on the waitress part, didn't bother to ask what we wanted to drink )

12.description: I'm surprised for a heavily Yelped neighborhood like Albany Park, this place had only 1 review before mine. Two guys I work with joined me here for lunch on a Friday. Located in a small storefront half-block east of Pulaski, this is a real Mexican's Mexican restaurant.Remarkably affordable with plentiful servings of great food sums it up best. The walls, painted red in swirly, stucco-like fashion, display Mexican art. Since the dining area is pretty small, it almost feels like coming over to eat at someone's home. When we arrived, there was a large family with children eating lunch. Spanish country music from WOJO FM played in the background. For the duration of my 45-minute stay at the restaurant, I think I was the only non-Hispanic customer in the place but I felt right at home anyway.The waitress didn't speak much English, so both of my co-workers ordered in Spanish. I said "Carne asada burrito" instead of steak burrito to do my benchmark burrito test on the place. I also got a side of rice and beans and a tall glass of horchata. Despite her limited English, she got my order correct.The guys ordered their favorite, as this is the home of the $3 tortas. Not a lame torta served on a hamburger bun, but a massive sammich loaded with meat, thick slices of avocado and other toppings, covering the entire plate! The bread looked home-baked, not mass produced. My steak burrito was excellent too. So big, in fact, that it was cut in half. We also shared a bowl of chips and 2 dishes of salsa: red and green. The red was the hotter of the two but a bit too oily for my liking. The green salsa was perfect: just the right amount of kick balanced with the perfect flavor enhancement for the burrito.In the end, I paid less than $8 for a massive burrito, 2 sides and the horchata drink. You can't easily top that at any nearby places I know.Besides your lunch & dinner items, they also have an extensive breakfast menu with eggs, Mexican sausage or omelette. I think this can become my new favorite Mexican place near my workplace. For all you late-nighters living in the area, it's open till 1 AM but keep in mind it's cash only - no credit/debit cards.

7.description: This place can be hit and miss at times, but I'd give them a five star rating if their good chef didn't have a day off. Four it is. I'm just now attempting to eat a burrito dinner that was bought three hours ago...work got in the way, oops...and it's great! Seriously. I'd pay them the $13 I give to asadero and drive the extra three miles if it was consistent. I paid $8. P.S. No Code Violations. Good luck finding that anywhere.

3.description: Typical sunday night, everything is closed.. So we stumbled into this place.The food is great and cheap. I had a chicken huarache (5.99), which was a decent sized and flavorful. The boy got a cubana torta. (9.99)Lets talk about this cubana.. It was massive and two men could share one and be stuffed. I have never seen a Cubana torta this big.  The boy couldn't finish it and he can eat a lot.

1.description: I'm going to be nice here; it's actually 2.5 stars.  Hubby and I wanted to try a different place in our neighborhood, so this was our choice for tonight.I was pretty disappointed.  The caldo de Cameron was blend, even though they included extra chili peppers.  The intrinsic kick a soup should possess; in other words, wasn't present.  The tragic story occurred at the end of my soup consumption: one of the shrimps wasn't, at all, de-shelled.  That particular shrimp shouldn't be in my soup, or in anyone else's.  Owner(s): please take a note.  Hubby's pork gordita was just ok.  He definitely prefers the gordita by the joint diagonally across the McDonald's on Lawrence.  If you want to know what that joint is, please take a look at my other review on that joint.  Their menu is more extensive.  Perhaps I just ordered the wrong items.  if that's the case, I will come back, if there's absolutely no other options for me to eat at 2100 hour.  I have to honestly say: living in Albany Park, There's always something better than this that opens late.

2.description: Love this place, haven't had a bad meal here so far. Literally eat there so much they know my face by now!!! Only thing that's open later at night in the neighborhood which is a plus for me. Only downside is sometimes I don't have cash on me and it seems that a lot of places in the areas cc machine is inop and only take cash. Still love this place either way!!!

9.description: Get the pastor.  Asada tacos were pretty meh.  Tough, impressively little flavor.  From the looks of the other reviews here, some of their other meat options aren't spectacular either.  But the al pastor... holy crap.  Best al pastor I've had to date...  and I sample taquerias like it's my job.  You're cheating yourself if you don't try at least one pastor taco here.   Horchata, service, and prices were all a bit above average as well, but not worth raving about.

18.description: seriously cheap food. my roommate got a sandwich or torta that i took a few bites of that tasted strangely like chicken pot pie. mmm, i would get that if i was you.  standard mexican fare other than that. if you are lucky after your meal you can catch the ice cream man walking past to grab an ice cream (coconut).

10.description: Friendly neighborhood taqueria - all the food was tasty, and they accommodated our large group, no problem.I wouldn't say it's any more spectacular than any other taqueria in the area, but you know, cheap and good.

13.description: This place is the izzo!I'm sure good and cheap hardly go together... but the food is fantastic and the prices make it seem like a steal. The waiters/waitresses are courteous and polite. Eat there or take it to go!  The tortas and carne asada dinner are awesome!

16.description: Three words, Al Pastor Huarache.  This is some serious authentic Mexican fare. The huarache is a HUGE sandal shaped corn disc, filled with beans, then fried to golden crisp perfection. Topped with your choice of meat, cheese, cream, and veggies. A good huarache is tough to come by and this place nails it. Love the Al Pastor, but other people i've been here with rave about the Carne Asada as well. From the exterior it looks like your typical off the beaten path Mexican dive but don't be fooled, they serve up some tasty treats here.

17.description: This authentico Mexican eatery is in my neighborhood. Unfortunately I was very disappointed with my order of chicken enchiladas suiza, generally one of my favorite typical Mexican dishes. The shredded chicken filling was tender but virtually flavorless. The cheese smothered the trio of enchiladas, but again with no flavorful effect. Perhaps I should have added the hot sauce to create some sort of sensation. The guy selling tamales from a cart in front of the nearby Mexican grocery store is a better bet, although I have not seen him since the recent heat wave.

15.description: I stopped by for a quick lunch, straying away from my typical order of tacos for a gordita instead.  For those who have never tried one, a gordita is a fresh masa dough disc that's griddled or fried, split,  and filled with your choice of ingredients.  Although it wasn't on their menu, I asked for a chicharron gordita and fortunately they did offer it.The chicharron was simmered in tomatillo salsa, soaking it up like a sponge.  This may be off-putting for those who prefer crunchy chicharron, but I really enjoyed it.  The rest of the gordita was filled with onion, cilantro, and a smear of refried beans.  Simple, delicious, and inexpensive.  The gordita plus horchata was less than $5.The place itself is small, but clean.  Service was friendly.  And it's directly across the Admiral Theater, so I'm sure they get plenty of customers late night.  I'll stick to lunch, though  :)

0.description: Great food great chef I love these little whole in the wall joints  greats torta I have ever ate and cheap

5.description: Amazing food! I had the Huarachote and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD! Warning!!!! Be ready to eat due to the HUARACHOTE is just gigantic. The tortas de huevo are incredible but please make sure to mentioned to the waitress to get the TORTA de huevo and not the breakfast torta due to the breakfast one is with out the bread (or pan).Again, this place was outstanding.Smile!

11.description: carne asado taco was kind of tough meatchicken taco was not very flavorfulLomo beef taco was the winneroverall just average, but we might be back since it is convenient.place was full with spanish speakers at 2pm on a saturday

8.description: This place has amazing tacos. That's all I have tried because I'm not that brave. It's a little hole in the wall place..only has about 6 tables. One server. She is super nice tho. It's nothing special but I love a place with a good taco and this place does it! Very reasonable prices also. Love these kinda of joints that are plain Janes but get the job done. Stop in and try it. I can only vouch for the tacos but I'm sure you won't be disappointed!

4.description: It might be a little small, but this is a great "Mami y Papi" restaurant that you should definitely try if your a fan of real Mexican food in Chicago. The prices are reasonable and the portions are great. The service is also good and friendly. The restaurant was also clean and they remodeled a few years ago so it looks nice too.I recommend the Torta and Huaracha de Carne Asada and the Chilaquiles Verdes, but I've tried the Tacos and Burritos and they were great too! Really the only bad thing is that it is a relatively small place, but that gives it a little bit of charm to some people. This place proves that sometimes the best places are the small mom and pop places!

14.description: The food here is awesome! Staff is friendly too.  Try the burrito!

6.description: Steak tacos have more fat then meat.They use ripe plantains and lettuce as fillers for their guacamole dip.The place was shut down by the city several times for not meeting city code and compliance.. In other words, it's dirrrrttty!!

3.description: I've been taking my son here for years now, before it became a barber shop lol We like it here  Johnny is a very nice guy! And even though he already has appointments and friends, if I ask him to do my kid's cut, he will

1.description: Have been coming here for years.  I live in the city about 2 miles away but I make drive every time because it's the best place to get a quality hair cut.....they line me up, trim my beard and eye brows for under $10....I walk out feeling like a million bucks every time no exceptions.

2.description: Who ever gave this this place a bad review. Your an idiot. I found this place by accident on November 3 2012. It was 845pm at night and I needed a haircut and the owner johnny and his team were the only ones willing to give me a haircut and took their time on me and didn't rush me at all. From that date, I was sold and I come from the suburbs. When I get a chance to make it that way I come out and get a good fade and shave for $15 while the suburbs charges like 30. Love these guys and Johnny one time I was short on a haircut and he said to pay next time and he hooked me up nice guy and trustful man.

0.description: When I moved to the Windy City, I couldn't find a consistent barber. I was cutting my own hair until my friend introduced me to Johnny Blades. I've been coming here for over 2 years now. I've never had to tell John how to cut my hair. I simply sit down and he works the blades. I've also sat down at all the other chairs for a cut and all of the barbers know their skills. All on point! I assure you if you come to Johnny Blades it's worth every minute of your time and money. I'll be coming for life. If you plan on getting a cut, make sure you give yourself time. Either call ahead or come early. They close 830 on weekdays through Saturday and 5 on Sunday.

4.description: I would not recommend this barbershop to anyone! The inconsiderate owner in the front chair picks and chooses his clients. If you are  not his friend or close client you will be pushed off to the other barbers that are terrible at cutting hair. The wait time is extremely long and the owners friends get first priority if they come in after you! Do NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE.

3.description: Happy to have this little Filipino store open so early on Sunday morning.... Thank you

1.description: Thank you for being the only Pinoy store in Albany park. Its nice to known you're only blocks away if I ever need a sinigang packet.

2.description: Love this place!!! They have all the essentials (except for Happy peanuts!! Bring in Happy peanuts!!!) and they even have balikbayan boxes!! Right next to a filipino restaurant too! It's a conspiracy I tell ya!!  Lol

0.description: I was happy to find this small Filipino grocery store on Lawrence while walking home from the Brown Line.  The store is organized and well stocked on basic Filipino staples.  Items you'll find here are:-Dried noodles (bihon, sotanghon, canton, luglug, misua, etc.)-Rice (duh)-Jarred sauces (Jufran, lechon sauce, alamang, bagoong, patis, etc.)-Frozen goods (lumpia, siopao, suman, longaniza, banana leaves, etc.)-Jarred sweets (ube, macapuno, langka, coco jam, nata de coco, etc.)-Snacks (shrimp chips, Boy Bawang, otap, barquillos, sampalok, etc.)-Canned goods (coconut milk, Ligo sardines, corned beef, Spam, etc.)-Dried mixes (bibinka, puto, Mama Sita's mixes, instant soups, etc.)-Drinks (coconut water, calamansi juice, tamarind juice, nectars, etc.)and more...For a small store, they have a good variety of staples to choose from.  I will definitely be back to purchase goods so that I can hone my Filipino cooking skills!4/21: I noticed that they carry bottled Taba ng Talangka in the cooler, which is crab roe paste.  OMG!

4.description: This tiny Pinoy (Filipino) grocery store has a decent selection of packaged food, big bags of rice, some frozen items, and a few fresh items.  Usually they have freshly-made ready to eat food such as lumpia for sale as well.  Proprietors are very friendly.

58.description: Just go there have the korean spicy wings and have your life changed simply put. Everything is great but the wings are some of the best I've ever had I would put them against any wings out there wow!!

56.description: Cafe Orient 33 proves that it is possible to offer high-quality Korean food at low prices (I have often wondered most Korean restaurants are really expensive when the ingredients don't really cost that much and the preparation time doesn't seem like it should be that long.).  The Korean Fried Chicken was really inexpensive and was crispy and the meat was still moist.  The tofu stew was flavorful, and the fried rice was a big hit too.I also liked the fact that hot tea was offered complimentary too and that tea seemed pretty decent to me.

29.description: I come here about once a month (I used to come here twice a month when I was lazy to cook, haha). I am addicted to their wings, particularly the Sweet Garlic flavor. It's not overwhelmingly garlicky and balanced out with a sweet (obviously) and peppery flavor. I've tried nearly everything on their appetizer and entree menu, and each dish has a Korean/Asian fusion theme to it while still feeling like it's homey, comforting food.I also like that the menu sometimes changes and has new additions. I recall last summer was when the Pork Bulgogi Sandwich first came out--it was a very flavorful and unique twist to the Korean dish. Their BBQ fries were also added a few months ago, if I recall correctly. I highly recommend ordering them! They're sweet and smokey, and the portion is large.Service is wonderful here. Kelly and her husband (the owners) are genuinely nice and make you feel welcomed. You really can't go wrong with this place, especially for the price. I highly recommend eating here!Also, don't forget to places your dishes on the left by the register when you're done :)

42.description: Nice, affordable place for Korean food, especially spicy wings.  At other Korean restaurants, the minimum order for wings can run close to $20.  With Cafe Orient 33, you have the option of ordering as little as 5 pieces for only $6.50!  Most of all, their wings are perhaps better than at more expensive eateries.  Also, service has always been great at this super clean, order-at-the-counter, mom and pop shop.Their ramen (Korean shin-style) was also good. Spicy pork dish wasn't bad, but not great.  Their wings definitely are the star of the show.

23.description: Love the wings. I usually don't notice/care in restaraunts or life in general, but this place is sparkly clean. I would likely eat off the bathroom floor if necessary. The owners are friendly as well.

47.description: I went here on a whim and never lived to regret it. The food and price were stellar. Delicious eats for cheap ! For such a small place they have quite a selection, plenty to choose from on drinks as well.

8.description: This is based SOLELY on the food alone. But if it was about service, I'd rate it a 4 because the people behind the counter were oh-so friendly and really cute! The guy behind the counter told me not to get the Louisiana sauce on the wings. Really appreciated the honesty haha even when it's against their own food.That said, I was very underwhelmed by the wings... I mean it has NOTHING on Crisp... The wings seemed too soggy and lost its crunch, which I'd expect from my Korean fried chicken! The sauce was also lacking in a kick... the garlic sauce was not garlicky or sweet enough nor did the korean sauce have enough of that chili paste flavor. I think the biggest problem is the texture of the chicken though ... just not crispy enough!I also ordered this octopus cooked with onions and hot peppers just out of curiosity. I must say though, I was disappointed but it's probably because I just don't like the tough texture of octopus. I really loved the milk tea. Get it hot and without the bubbles! They also have complimentary tea on the counter -- it's barley flavored and really pleasantly nice.

31.description: I come here all the time. Great food, low prices make this place good. What makes it great are the staff. They treat you like family! Thanks to Kelly and Ed for always making every experience outstanding. Love your Bulgogi, pork broth soup, and bim bim bop!

34.description: Menu seemed confusing at first glance because it was so diverse! I ordered the bulgogi for take out during dinner time. Staff is friendly. Space is quiet and located in a plaza. Bulgogi was delicious. Rice was yummy - soft and slightly sticky. Kimchi had string radish and cabbage in it and tasted good, not that fermented, a bit salty... It was good but then again, I was super hungry when I ate it.It's a short walk from the Kimball brown line subway station. I would come back for food next time I'm in the area and want Korean food.

16.description: The couple who runs this place is so sweet, and the food they make is just amazing. We really haven't had anything we didn't like, but the wings, bulgogi, bibimbop, and dumplings are our favorites. If you eat in, order a ton of stuff and share it.

13.description: Went here on a Saturday afternoon with Nae L.  I was very happy to see a Korean place with chicken wings and high ratings on Yelp!!!I was a little surprised to find this place in the strip mall and the set up was more like fast food than casual dining and there were loads of college kids there being loud and very loud.  We grabbed and perused the menu and I ordered some popcorn chicken along with Korean and Sweet Garlic wings and we went up to the counter to pay.  For water you get a very small plastic cup to fill from an urn. The food took awhile to come out but the spicy Korean wings had a nice crisp to them and were probably double fried.  The sauces did not impress me much since the spicy Korean sauce seemed too concentrated in the sauce making it a little rough.  Sweet Garlic had very large chunks of raw garlic in it so the flavor was a bit overpowering.  The popcorn chicken was crunchy and came with Louisiana sauce which was spicy but not like Louisiana sauce.The real pro of this price is that the food is very affordable and very flavorful.  The cons are that it is very loud and will take a very long time to get food.  Overall I am a fan and would come back when I have a craving for Korean Chicken Wings.

11.description: Menu seemed confusing at first glance because it was so diverse! I ordered the bulgogi for take out during dinner time. Staff is friendly. Space is quiet and located in a plaza. Bulgogi was delicious. Rice was yummy - soft and slightly sticky. Kimchi had string radish and cabbage in it and tasted good, not that fermented, a bit salty... It was good but then again, I was super hungry when I ate it.It's a short walk from the Kimball brown line subway station. I would come back for food next time I'm in the area and want Korean food.

39.description: This is a place I can bring my asian family!  It's simple and inexpensive with a parking lot and lets you eat casually like a fast food joint. No weird interaction with the server constantly checking on you. Come and go as you please.As many have mentioned, the lady, whom I presume is the wife and husband team of the restaurant, were soft spoken and sweet. She pointed to me all the most ordered dishes and asked if I needed WiFi to study. I'm a little too old to be a student, granted, I had a backpack on, but to study? well, there are alot of students that roam around here I guess.Anyway, there are stacks of newspapers and magazines by the door and it's actually a pretty good size place with high ceilings and a soft sunny yellow interior. It's homey, warm and airy, which is such a contrast to the up and coming neighborhood. I've been to Korea before and there are definitely Korean elements with decor, plants and use of light wood.I got the Bibim noodles and Korean wings. I wasn't expecting much of the noodle dish, but the beef was really good. It's sweet, but has other savory flavors. The wings are pretty awesome too. It's a bit different, like there's a crunchy nutty coating, either it's deep fried garlic and the sauce is a bit spicier than I had at other places. I can only eat two, but probably the whole thing if I had some rice to go with,

37.description: My husband and i ate here today and we really enjoyed the food.. We ordered bibimbap, bulgogi and korean wings.. Everything was so yummy.. This will be our go to place if we want our korean food fix.. The owner.. I think he is the owner is super nice.. And the restaurant is really clean.. Definitely coming back here again

0.description: We found our go-to place for Korean food!! The dishes were delicious! Right before we stepped in to eat, we have just finished eating Korean fried chicken and stir fry noodle at another place. While waiting for our to-go order there, I read the Yelp reviews for Cafe Orient 33 and that was how we met. I shared the BiBimBap with rice and beef mixed order with my daughter, enough for two with flavors that left us wanting more. My husband ordered the spicy octopus with rice and that was also good. The rice is not the usual dry Chinese rice; it's soft with almost a mix of sticky rice. My two other little ones ordered the dumpling with rice cake soup. My son accidentally dropped one of his rice cake, picked it up, and said, "It's too bad that I can't clean this." While my husband encouraged him to just plop the piece into his tea and call it clean, it says a lot when my little one enjoy the food so much that he's lamenting over the loss. The service, food and overall ambiance rave us this immerses feeling of longing--missing home, even if I'm not Korean. We felt as though we paid a visit to our old village and are being spoiled with authentic homemade food.

38.description: I love lunch at this place.  Its low key, easy, the woman behind the counter is adorable and sweet.  The food is fantastic.  I always get the bibimbop.  Lunch for 2 is usually about 15 bucks with free tea and kimchi.  I've eaten at almost all lunch spots within walking distance and this is my favorite.  Enjoy

51.description: Cafe33 Great food, especially the Korean Spicy Wings.  The staff is very friendly and the prices are reasonable.

27.description: We come here every month and we love it. It's a very relaxed environment and great food.

32.description: It was ok.Not as great as I expected from the reviews.They were friendly. It was clean.

54.description: This place is great! We had called for takeout and ordered two bibimbap. But on our way over, we figured we had more time than we originally thought for dinner so decided to dine in. They were very accommodating and transferred our dishes from to-go boxes to the bowls and we ended up ordering the dried pork maki, potato balls, and spicy ramen soup as well. Everything was very tasty. The spicy noodle had the perfect amount of spiciness. And the price was cheap! $27 for our whole order. We will definitely go here again. And soon!

48.description: I love this place for so many reasons.  THE FOOD:Delicious and tastes like they make it from scratch each time.  It does take a little while for orders to come out, but totally worth the wait.  The chicken wings are very meaty and they are generous with the sauce.  Their dumpling soup is so comforting and pretty filling.  I tried their waffle with ice cream recently out of curiosity.  I expected a diner-style waffle with soft serve ice cream, but it was better than that...the waffle was gooey (in a good way) yet crispy and they used real ice cream with chocolate sauce!  Oh and the potato balls - I can eat 30 of those, they're so good!  Plus everything is affordable.  And they don't require tip??  I still tip anyway b/c they're incredibly nice and the service is always amazing.THE SERVICE:As I just mentioned, the service is great.  I always feel so welcome, and they make you feel at home.THE ATMOSPHERE:I like the whimsical decor and the place is very clean.  It's also spacious and bright.  I love that there's a parking lot too!

44.description: Great food and service. I didn't eat my side of rice so the lady gave me my money back. Such a nice staff and very happy to be working there

24.description: 3 stars for service, location, and value. I'm no expert in Korean food. I think this is my 2nd time ever eating Korean food so I'm really not a very good judge. I ordered something that looked popular -- bibimbap with beef. It came with noodles in the bottom, beef and veggies on top. I think this is an acquired taste to which I'm not accustomed to. And I really don't have anything to compare it to since I've never really eaten Korean food except for bulgogi. This dish is just ok to me. It was fresh and I liked the veggies. The meat was tender and was tasty but the veggies were plain and so were the noodles. It's kind of like eating pho for the first time, if you don't know to add the sauces, you won't enjoy it. The bbq French fries were tasty but definitely not an authentic dish to brag about. I'm just a fat girl looking for something familiar in an unfamiliar place. The place was clean and the service was good. Also the meal was uber cheap. So that's always awesome. I guess for newbies like me, you won't know til you try again. And I may, in the future.

7.description: First of all, the lady who owns this place was really nice! We got a bibimbap and some wings for dinner. the bibimbap was good, and the wings were very saucy! The wings had good flavor and properly cook, but it had too much sauce on it. Keep in mind, this is not the double fried Korean fried chicken. Korean fried chicken is much crisper.I would come back again for the food and great service!

49.description: Met two of my friends out for dinner here with my wife. The place is a mom and pop place. You order at the counter and bus your own table. They have hot tea and water sitting out for the taking.The food: I believe I got A4 (beef and rice) and A5 (6 different vegetables with an egg) and 10 Korean spicy chicken wings. My friends got the BBQ pork sandwich and the lettuce wrap with bbq short ribs i think. Everything was delicious. Absolutely delicious.The wings: crispy, slightly sweet, slightly tangy, with a spicy heat that was pleasant (it was noticeable, but not overpowering where you stopped being able to taste the food).The beef and rice dish: well spiced and seasoned, flavorful. And very fun sticky rice and a side of spicy kim-chi.Wife's vegetable dish: must have been good because I didn't get a bite...Friends lettuce wrap: also delicious, one bite of meat was slightly tough, but the flavor was nicely complemented by the red sauce and rice that went with it.Didn't get to try the bbq pork sandwich, but it looked delicious.Downside: I probably gained a lb or two from the 10 chicken wings...BYOB, and they supplied nice wine glasses so you didn't have to drink out of plastic cups.Good for easy, casual, good food dinner.

40.description: Had a craving for chicken wings and based on the many Yelp reviews decided to check this place out. Ordered the spicy Korean and sweet garlic and boy was it tasty. My new go to place for wings as it is close to my home. Will have to try the other dishes and update this review.

53.description: Love this place for the food and friendly service. Everything is delicious and the prices are not too bad either. I especially liked the garlic wings (super crispy, flavorful,  and tender), dumplings, bulgogi, and octopus appetizer. There is a parking lot which is also a plus.

30.description: We love coming to this place. It's like being in the home of a Korean family and they're making you fresh delicious food in their kitchen. And the price is unbeatable!  The place is always meticulously clean and welcoming. We adore all the decoration details too. As well as the great periodical selections. We enjoy our relaxing meals here so much that we drive from Logan Square to eat here every chance we get. Love it!!! Can't find a place like this anywhere else in Chicago.

46.description: I came here based off of the reviews, and let me tell you I was not disappointed. They have hands down the BEST chicken wings in Chicago. The service is amazing as well and the people behind the counter are super down to earth and very cordial. The one downside is $1 a wing.. I mean thats kind of expensive.

1.description: Stumbled upon this place accidentally, as I live around the corner...but let me tell you!Chicken wings are absolutely delicious! I am not a big fan o chicken wings, but these are amazing. Kimchi is nice and crunchy; octopus appetizer is very good. Peanut butter smoothie is yammy.I highly recommend this place, and it has easily become my local neighborhood favorite.People behind the counter are always nice and welcoming. Definitely go back there once every couple of weeks.
