55.description: Chicken is what you come for. The garlic chicken was nice and crispy when it came out. I recommend eating there for maximum freshness. Dining area is large and can accommodate larger parties. The owners are nice and friendly and very inviting. Chicken is da bomb!

9.description: Hands down one of the best dollar per taste bud value to be had. Btw, also BYOB so basically you make money by eating here!Get your wings on. Get your bibimbap on. The side dishes including kimchi are wonderful and the service is excellent. Simple place with very good food. Enjoy you beverage of your choice BYOB!

26.description: Super disappointing!  I got the wings in two flavors - Louisiana and Korean spicy.  The Louisiana is just nonsense - the sauce was terrible, and the chicken was mushy.The Korean spicy seemed a little better, at first.  But once you got through the crisp outer layer of what is passable sauce, you got to slimy, wet, and slightly spongy chicken meat that lacked flavor or edible texture.  The wings do seem gigantic, but I'd guess they are regular small wings that have retained water and sodium.  The whole thing just reeked of that really low quality spongy chicken that you'd get from cheap Chinese American lunch specials in suburban strip malls.I love fried chicken and I really love wings, but these are wings I couldn't even eat.  I'm just glad I had a side of kimchi to eat with some leftover rice.

25.description: Fantastic wings, great bimbimbop

12.description: I come here about once a month (I used to come here twice a month when I was lazy to cook, haha). I am addicted to their wings, particularly the Sweet Garlic flavor. It's not overwhelmingly garlicky and balanced out with a sweet (obviously) and peppery flavor. I've tried nearly everything on their appetizer and entree menu, and each dish has a Korean/Asian fusion theme to it while still feeling like it's homey, comforting food.I also like that the menu sometimes changes and has new additions. I recall last summer was when the Pork Bulgogi Sandwich first came out--it was a very flavorful and unique twist to the Korean dish. Their BBQ fries were also added a few months ago, if I recall correctly. I highly recommend ordering them! They're sweet and smokey, and the portion is large.Service is wonderful here. Kelly and her husband (the owners) are genuinely nice and make you feel welcomed. You really can't go wrong with this place, especially for the price. I highly recommend eating here!Also, don't forget to places your dishes on the left by the register when you're done :)

59.description: Great place. Taste is actually better than a high priced restaurant. Our family is tired of eating out for Korean food because of taste , cost and poor service. Always wondered why can't there be a burger and hot dog type of joint for Korean food? Well here it is! The cleanest Korean restaurant and super friendly two older gentlemen behind the counter. My kids love it. We will be eating here for awhile...

21.description: Very highly recommended for a quick lunch or dinner. Service is great (owner is very friendly). Complimentary  tea, food is very tasty (bulgolgi with rice and chicken wings is always my favorite), and place is very clean.

17.description: Came here for the first time last month with a friend and it is definitely one of my favorite spots near campus! I got the chicken teriyaki with fried rice and it was so good! The portion size is pretty big. I came here last week and just got the fried rice and it was just as good! I had to take my fried rice home because I couldn't finish it. The service here is great! They are so friendly and always asking if we need anything else. They have a great variety on their menu. I have yet to get their wings but I've heard they are so good!

10.description: After having seen the famous Cafe Orient 33 on Yelp with nearly a 5 star rating, I decided to come in to see what all the hype is about. One bite later and I must confess that Heaven on Earth exists. This place was and is amazing. The chicken wings were freshly made to order. They were roughly $1 a piece but they are large and extremely flavorful. The sweet garlic and the spicy Korean sauce are a must try. In addition to this, I also had the opportunity to try the bibimbap and gyoza which were also phenomenal. Food is enough of a reason to give this place a try. Another outstanding quality that this place possesses lies within its customer service. The lady at the front was offering so much guidance in choosing what to order and she even gave us a few extra wings. She had a smile on the entire time and really valued her customers. She even thanked us when we left - so generous. Her efforts to keep us satisfied don't go unnoticed. I love this place and will definitely be back!

5.description: Got garlic & spicy chicken wings (This review based on the wings only). They were so delish. I've been around and tried Dek & Crisp but this place is a champ. Keep up the good work.

3.description: 3 stars for service, location, and value. I'm no expert in Korean food. I think this is my 2nd time ever eating Korean food so I'm really not a very good judge. I ordered something that looked popular -- bibimbap with beef. It came with noodles in the bottom, beef and veggies on top. I think this is an acquired taste to which I'm not accustomed to. And I really don't have anything to compare it to since I've never really eaten Korean food except for bulgogi. This dish is just ok to me. It was fresh and I liked the veggies. The meat was tender and was tasty but the veggies were plain and so were the noodles. It's kind of like eating pho for the first time, if you don't know to add the sauces, you won't enjoy it. The bbq French fries were tasty but definitely not an authentic dish to brag about. I'm just a fat girl looking for something familiar in an unfamiliar place. The place was clean and the service was good. Also the meal was uber cheap. So that's always awesome. I guess for newbies like me, you won't know til you try again. And I may, in the future.

35.description: Went here on a Saturday afternoon with Nae L.  I was very happy to see a Korean place with chicken wings and high ratings on Yelp!!!I was a little surprised to find this place in the strip mall and the set up was more like fast food than casual dining and there were loads of college kids there being loud and very loud.  We grabbed and perused the menu and I ordered some popcorn chicken along with Korean and Sweet Garlic wings and we went up to the counter to pay.  For water you get a very small plastic cup to fill from an urn. The food took awhile to come out but the spicy Korean wings had a nice crisp to them and were probably double fried.  The sauces did not impress me much since the spicy Korean sauce seemed too concentrated in the sauce making it a little rough.  Sweet Garlic had very large chunks of raw garlic in it so the flavor was a bit overpowering.  The popcorn chicken was crunchy and came with Louisiana sauce which was spicy but not like Louisiana sauce.The real pro of this price is that the food is very affordable and very flavorful.  The cons are that it is very loud and will take a very long time to get food.  Overall I am a fan and would come back when I have a craving for Korean Chicken Wings.

19.description: Cafe Orient 33 proves that it is possible to offer high-quality Korean food at low prices (I have often wondered most Korean restaurants are really expensive when the ingredients don't really cost that much and the preparation time doesn't seem like it should be that long.).  The Korean Fried Chicken was really inexpensive and was crispy and the meat was still moist.  The tofu stew was flavorful, and the fried rice was a big hit too.I also liked the fact that hot tea was offered complimentary too and that tea seemed pretty decent to me.

28.description: They have 4 wing sauces available and many other entree dinner choices. The service was extremely fast and all the dishes were piping hot when they hit the table. Lots of flavor and a little spicy but even a weakling on the spice barometer can handle it.

45.description: My family and I went here for our Valentines dinner on Sunday 2/15/15. I decided from reading the other Yelp reviews that we need to try this place. We were not disappointed one bit. We had the Korean spicy and garlic chicken wings- they were cooked to perfection and doused in delicious sauces. A must have when you visit this lovely establishment. If you do not you are missing out. We tried several other dishes that were all terrific - my boys liked the fried rice and my bibimbap with beef was tasty and served with a spicy hot sauce that was just perfect! It is a small little joint that packs the flavor and goodness in each dish. You should give it a try - you will not be disappointed.

33.description: Hands down one of the best dollar per taste bud value to be had. Btw, also BYOB so basically you make money by eating here!Get your wings on. Get your bibimbap on. The side dishes including kimchi are wonderful and the service is excellent. Simple place with very good food. Enjoy you beverage of your choice BYOB!

43.description: I've dined here a few times so far.  I believe it's owned & run by an older Korean couple, who are very friendly, sweet, kind, respectful, and always smiling!  You can typically expect terrible customer service from most chinese/korean restaurants... so you'll be taken aback by the welcoming & inviting hospitality of this place!The place is a storefront in a little strip mall.  Extremely clean... tables, floors, washrooms.  Although they serve & bring the food to you at your table when it's ready... they refuse to take any tip money.  I've tried, and they won't let you.  They do have a designated table in the restaurant, to  help yourself to cold water / hot tea / condiments.  Also, after you're done eating, you clean your own table (not necessarily clean & wipe down the table... but bring your empty dishes to a bin & throw paper cups in the garbage).The food is very good & has a home-cooked feel to it.  If you're a soup lover... they have ramen noodles (spicy & mild versions).  But I'd recommend their dumpling soup (chicken broth with small gyoza/pot-sticker dumplings & eggs) if you haven't tried it... amazing!  For appetizers... I've tried the fried calamari, deep fried shrimps, bean sprouts sauteed in garlic, house salad.  Entrees... I've tried the bibimbap, chicken teriyaki, egg beef noodle, ny strip steak & onions w/ fried rice.  All food are decent portions... tasty & satisfying.  Kalbi is always good, so haven't bothered to order that yet.  Still have yet to try their salmon teriyaki... looks delicious!Overall.. always a good dining experience when you go here.  It's not exactly "to die for" food... but if you're looking to grab a convenient, very good-tasting meal in a clean storefront restaurant w/ a casual setting, this is definitely a nice stop!

2.description: After seeing a picture of Cafe Orient's wings on Instagram, I immediately put it on my list of places to try! This review is based solely on the wings and the calamari, as those were the only things we tried. 1.) Get the wings! We ordered 15 wings, and when they came out we were surprised at how big they were. I thought the wings were cooked very well. The outside skin was extremely crispy, while the inside was juicy and tender. The two flavors we got were spicy Korean, and sweet garlic. I enjoyed the sweet garlic, it tasted like a mixture of honey and garlic. I wasn't a huge fan of the spicy Korean. The sauce isn't very spicy, and it tasted a little weird. I wasn't sure if it was made from soy sauce, or something else. It was unique, and I just couldn't figure out if I liked it or not. There are other sauces, but we just didn't order them. 2.) I wouldn't recommend the calamari. It's squid tempura, and it's just nothing special. The tempura batter and quality of the squid weren't memorable.3.) The service is good, the woman taking our order was very friendly. The food took longer than normal to come out, but the food was very fresh so we didn't mind.

18.description: Yup, still amazed at this place. Their new items that they added are great. I love going there and speaking with the owner. She's very warm, welcoming and turns out great product consistently. It's restaurants like this one that set the bar high and I thank them for putting 110% into making their customers happy.

41.description: You can read descriptions of the good food, outstanding value, and the kind and generous service in the other 4 and 5 star reviews.  I agree with them.  I just wanted to voice my appreciation--and also commend the place for making a box in a strip mall so tastefully odd and lovely.  The décor and the ambiance are beyond charming

52.description: This is a no frills restaurant with simple, homestyle cooking. We will definitely return for the phenomenal Korean spicy wings, the great price, and the friendly service!

50.description: Service was very slow.  Loud atmosphere.  Looked like a donut shop without decor of any kind.  Food was below average and not served with traditional spread of various Korean veggies.  Don't drive a long distance for this very mediocre food.  Stay in Chinatown.

4.description: We had 5 of the wings with spicy sauce. Loved the balance of sweet to spicy! Excellent food - just wish we lived closer.

6.description: This is a place I can bring my asian family!  It's simple and inexpensive with a parking lot and lets you eat casually like a fast food joint. No weird interaction with the server constantly checking on you. Come and go as you please.As many have mentioned, the lady, whom I presume is the wife and husband team of the restaurant, were soft spoken and sweet. She pointed to me all the most ordered dishes and asked if I needed WiFi to study. I'm a little too old to be a student, granted, I had a backpack on, but to study? well, there are alot of students that roam around here I guess.Anyway, there are stacks of newspapers and magazines by the door and it's actually a pretty good size place with high ceilings and a soft sunny yellow interior. It's homey, warm and airy, which is such a contrast to the up and coming neighborhood. I've been to Korea before and there are definitely Korean elements with decor, plants and use of light wood.I got the Bibim noodles and Korean wings. I wasn't expecting much of the noodle dish, but the beef was really good. It's sweet, but has other savory flavors. The wings are pretty awesome too. It's a bit different, like there's a crunchy nutty coating, either it's deep fried garlic and the sauce is a bit spicier than I had at other places. I can only eat two, but probably the whole thing if I had some rice to go with,

22.description: First of all, the lady who owns this place was really nice! We got a bibimbap and some wings for dinner. the bibimbap was good, and the wings were very saucy! The wings had good flavor and properly cook, but it had too much sauce on it. Keep in mind, this is not the double fried Korean fried chicken. Korean fried chicken is much crisper.I would come back again for the food and great service!

15.description: Nice, affordable place for Korean food, especially spicy wings.  At other Korean restaurants, the minimum order for wings can run close to $20.  With Cafe Orient 33, you have the option of ordering as little as 5 pieces for only $6.50!  Most of all, their wings are perhaps better than at more expensive eateries.  Also, service has always been great at this super clean, order-at-the-counter, mom and pop shop.Their ramen (Korean shin-style) was also good. Spicy pork dish wasn't bad, but not great.  Their wings definitely are the star of the show.

57.description: This is based SOLELY on the food alone. But if it was about service, I'd rate it a 4 because the people behind the counter were oh-so friendly and really cute! The guy behind the counter told me not to get the Louisiana sauce on the wings. Really appreciated the honesty haha even when it's against their own food.That said, I was very underwhelmed by the wings... I mean it has NOTHING on Crisp... The wings seemed too soggy and lost its crunch, which I'd expect from my Korean fried chicken! The sauce was also lacking in a kick... the garlic sauce was not garlicky or sweet enough nor did the korean sauce have enough of that chili paste flavor. I think the biggest problem is the texture of the chicken though ... just not crispy enough!I also ordered this octopus cooked with onions and hot peppers just out of curiosity. I must say though, I was disappointed but it's probably because I just don't like the tough texture of octopus. I really loved the milk tea. Get it hot and without the bubbles! They also have complimentary tea on the counter -- it's barley flavored and really pleasantly nice.

20.description: I was really in the mood for some good korean food, searched, and based on the reviews here,  how could I go wrong? I was in for a big surprise and my socks were blown right off!  Ordered the spicy korean chicken wings and they where ahhhhmazing! love em', best in Chicago!

36.description: I'm so hooked. Lately I have been addicted to their bibimbap as it's just so delicious!  I rarely eat fried food but I've tried their popcorn chicken and it's really good, not to mention their dipping sauces are unique and full of flavor.Have to try their chicken wings and peanut butter smoothie as other Yelpers have said such amazing things about them. Will post an update as soon as I am able to venture away from the bibimbap!

14.description: I love this place. The wings here are so crispy and tasty, especially with the Korean Spicy sauce. Even if you're not a fan of Korean food but like good wings, I think you'll enjoy this place. Other perks: VERY clean establishment, friendly staff, fast service, strip mall parking if you need to drive (but not too far from the brown line). And oddly enough, it's never too busy. Five stars.

58.description: Excellent Persian food! Kabobs are cooked perfectly and the staff is attentive. This place never disappoints. Go here instead of Reza's!!!!Of note, they now have two parking lots, which helps tremendously

56.description: Always a wonderful meal. Enough to bring home for another meal. Try the appetizer Tahig- crispy saffron rice and beef. Absolutely incredible! Finish off the meal with fig ice cream, both sweet and savoury.

29.description: Noon O Kebab is one of my new favorite restaurants in the city. As an LA native, I never, ever thought I'd find good Persian food in Chicago. It was beyond my wildest dreams to think that the best Persian food I would ever eat would be in Chicago! But yes--Noon O Kebab consistently delivers on this promise. The Joujeh is tasty and succulent, the Koubideh is perfectly seasoned, and of course they serve some of the homestyle dishes like my beloved Fesenjan, Borani, and Tadig stews that are just decadent. The Kashke Bademjan is hands down the best I've ever had, too. The real miracle, though, is the baklava. Honestly--when I tasted this baklava, I realized I had never really had baklava in my entire life. It was that good. I've never tasted anything that wasn't extraordinarily delicious and perfectly executed from this place. Thank you Noon O Kebab for making one of my favorite cuisines so stellar in Chicago!

42.description: Great taste. Great service. A bit short staffed. Good parking space. Good serving size.

23.description: Got what I'm fairly sure was the best kabab I've ever had here, and it wasn't even particularly expensive -- like $10 or so.  They also have my Karoun yogurt drinks, which are hard to find around Chicago for some reason.  It's way out of my way to get up here, but I'll definitely be back.

47.description: The whole three stars goes to food that was pretty good, I liked the Barg Kabab the most and Im not going to suggest their koobideh! Anyway, I enjoyed my meal... But service was awful, when we sat nobody helped us and got ordered for almost 30-45 mins, even though we told them we are ready, and I can't say they were nice and friendly with us and asking if we need something, it was Labor day and I kinda understand that they shouldnt be happy of helping people and working till midnight.

8.description: The meal started off right with a bakery of warm, fresh pita with homemade cheese. We got a roasted eggplant dish for appetizer and it was very good, very hearty.  For my entree I ordered the salmon kebabs with grilled vegetables and dill rice. The salmon was incredible, so tender and flavorful. The rice was seasoned perfectly. The grilled vegetables were charred outside but still raw.The service was excellent. The decor is lovely,  i enjoyed seeing the mosaic scenes along the walls. I would definitely return, and recommend this place to others.

31.description: Delicious food with a decent price. I recommend this place for people love authentic Mediterranean food. I love the food. I had grilled lamb and kebab cooked well.

34.description: Try "Kashk e Bademjan" as an appetizer and "Barg" and "Chicken with bone" as main dishes.

16.description: I've never had a server go through a creative, elaborate ruse to provoke me to ask if she was free. Until tonight.Elena, 0.00 Are you free?; wonderful appetizer with the crisp rice; 5 stars if she had been free...

13.description: Delicious! Everything is so good I wish I could keep eating! The meat is so juicy, the rice is so tasty, the bread fresh and warm, and the tea is high quality herbs. You can just tell that the food was cooked with love. The service is so friendly, Parvin is just amazing. If your looking for a good healthy, hearty meal this is the place to be! Everything is high end even some stuff is imported :) very very unique. Even the decor is authentic down to the rugs and art tiles. The venue has a cozy feel to it but doesn't take from it's elegance. If your new to Persian cuisine or live by it, this place is definitely worth a visit. You won't be disappointed. P.s you must try the bakleva!

11.description: Trying to find a good Iranian restaurant here has been too difficult, was more than unimpressed with Rezas but heard great things about noon o kabob. Being Persian I have high standards for Persian food. Ordered: Tadig with ghormeh sabzi- the order of tadig was HUGE. Very delicious. The ghormeh sabzi tasted weird and i obviously just prefer my grandmothers. Not the best ghormeh sabzi. I had a confusing conversation with the waiter wanting eggplant with tadig but he didn't understandMast O khiar-YUM! Yogurt with mint and cucumber Shirazi-YUMHummus-delicious and creamy SOLTANI-the barg was really good, juicy and tender. Barg is my favorite so I was happy to find good barg in chicago. The koobideh was decent but not the best I've ever had. Rice was also great Overall good would reccomend the barg kabob and to skip the ghormeh sabzi will definitely be back to try other favorites.

39.description: Really don't know what the hype is about this place. We tried the the kabobs and they were very drying and had no flavor at all.

37.description: Love this place! I always get the chicken joujeh kebabs and its my favorite. The meat is so flavorful and tender and the portions are HUGE. Atmosphere is great and they recently expanded their parking area which helps because the place is always packed during lunch/dinner time especially on the weekends. Probably my favorite Iranian place in Chicago (so far). Prices are also reasonable for the amount you get.

0.description: This is actually my first check in here, but I've been a customer for years.  Noon o kabob is my favorite Persian restaurant. Their dishes are authentic Persian food. The restaurant as well as the catering section are always packed. Mary (the manager) is the most kind and fun person to talk to, she goes out of her way to make  us feel special. Their service is absolutely amazing!  Most of the time their Persian tea and ghand (sugar cubes) are on the house. Persians don't stir the sugar cubes in the tea. "Instead, they place it in their mouth and hold on it as they take each sip" fine with me, I love it !I highly recommend their Maust O'Musier yogurt.Looking forward to the next time!

38.description: Had dinner at noon o kabob last night. Ordered the combination of Chicken & Ground Beef kabob with a combination of Dill and White rice. I ordered two combination dinners for my companion and myself. When the food was served however, only one large plate of food was presented.  I was shocked at the size of the entree however and realized that there was enough food on the large plate to feed the two of us. The server was confused and thought that we only ordered one dinner to share between the two of us.  As it turned out, the sever was correct. One large plate of kabobs and rice was more than enough.  A small plate of onions , radishes , feta cheese and pita was also served with the meal. Extra feta cheese was requested and promptly served.  The dinner was not only delicious , but the price was very affordable.  Dinner for two, $ 21.00 ... Plus a tip.Oh, and FREE PARKING in their lot.

51.description: Went with a group of 21 yesterday.  Everyone raved about the food, and I agree: it was the best Persian cuisine I have eaten.  I've had Fessenjan (chicken in a walnut pomegranate sauce) at a few other places and have always liked it, but the sauce at Noon O Kabab had a richness I had not encountered before.  It was exquisite.  I sampled five different appetizers, including 3 variations on eggplant.  All were delicious. The service was very good, too.  Our waitress brought out some complimentary side dishes, including a yogurt sauce, and was great about having leftovers boxed up and splitting the check. I wish we'd had room to try some of the desserts as well -- that will have to wait until next time, and there definitely will be a next time!

27.description: I liked the food they served. Especially, their appetizers were really good but the service was below average. Our waitress brought us our dish in half and wrong. It took way long to figure out and fix the issue.

32.description: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in the city. This Persian gem has the right ingredients. Lamb shank with a sultan I combination plate with saffron, yogurt and hummus. Throw some grilled jalapeños on the side and....ok that's enough. Don't be like those folks in the movie 300, they never tried real Persian food.

54.description: Great service and great food. The Kashke Bademjun is to die for. The owner herself came down and understood my vegetarian requirements.

48.description: Partial Halal Menu. The Chicken and the Lamb is Halal here, per verbal assurance from staff.  I ordered the pomegranate chicken wings, which had a good sauce, but the wings were slightly under cooked (but still edible).  Also had the chicken & lamb kebab combo plate with rice (ordered the half dill rice and half regular rice) which comes with two grilled tomatoes.  The kebabs were good.  Wish they had some butter for the rice.  For appetizer had pita bread with fresh cilantro and feta cheese (great) and also had the hummus which was also very good.  This is a fancier sit down place and get's busy on the weekends so you may have to wait 20 - 30 minutes for a table.  Very friendly staff and service was great.

44.description: Trying to find a good Iranian restaurant here has been too difficult, was more than unimpressed with Rezas but heard great things about noon o kabob. Being Persian I have high standards for Persian food. Ordered: Tadig with ghormeh sabzi- the order of tadig was HUGE. Very delicious. The ghormeh sabzi tasted weird and i obviously just prefer my grandmothers. Not the best ghormeh sabzi. I had a confusing conversation with the waiter wanting eggplant with tadig but he didn't understandMast O khiar-YUM! Yogurt with mint and cucumber Shirazi-YUMHummus-delicious and creamy SOLTANI-the barg was really good, juicy and tender. Barg is my favorite so I was happy to find good barg in chicago. The koobideh was decent but not the best I've ever had. Rice was also great Overall good would reccomend the barg kabob and to skip the ghormeh sabzi will definitely be back to try other favorites.

24.description: Disgusting! Had hair in my rice. Two long mexican hairs. I almost puked. Do not take anyone important here. Absolutely disgusted right now with this incident.

7.description: Best lentil soup EVER!  Tons of flavor.  When it's cold out - do yourself a favor and get yourself some.  It is reasonably priced.  The hummus and pita is delicious too.  I'll have to further explore the menu, for real this is all I ever get there because it is so yummy.

49.description: I tried the salmon, it was cooked perfectly and the dill rice was delicious!  Staff was very helpful.

40.description: It's really good food something different . Desert is just to sweet .... But grate food! Obviously going back !

53.description: Greeeeeeat food and amazing service! Gonna come back for sure!Don't leave without getting a baklava at the end!

30.description: Kashk o bademjan is a must have. All your kebabs are good.  I usually get chenghe but tried the lamb shanks this time.  I wish you had more lamb dishes.Next time..ghormeh sabzi

46.description: koubedih koubedih koubedih!  Delicious.

1.description: Authentic Persian food! And delightful customer service. Ordered 10 Soltani plates sorted, Barg Kabab Plate, Shish Chenjeh, Salmon and Shrimp, Chicken lentil soup and Domieh for desert which was complimentary. When we come here we ORDER BIG. Always leave satisfiedOh and the Domeih Oh my God the taste is too over powering will not order that again, thank god I didn't pay for it

55.description: Very friendly staff, nice decor and the food is delicious. The lunch specials are a great deal!

9.description: Charming restaurant with lots of unique dishes. The lamb koubideh was flavorful and delicious. Joujeh was flavorful and juicy. Combo platters are a good call for the more curious or indecisive. They offer a nice variety of interesting drinks, including a fig mead that is like a sweeter, less nutty honey wine. For our free appetizer, we tried the tadiq, which was crunchy and interested (although I wish they had defined the topping options somewhere!). Service was a little slow but they were admittedly quite busy. Overall, I would definitely return but feel no need to immediately schedule my next trip.

26.description: I'm Persian, so have tried a lot of Persian food, and this place is as it good as it gets.  I remember this place when it first started up.   Everything I've tried is delicious, from the appetizers to the meats, to the tea, the bread.  It certainly the best Persian food in Chicago-land, most likely the state, and one of the top Persian restaurants in the whole country.  What's more is that I am not speaking on behalf of only myself, but literally, everyone I've known (Persian or not), and referred to this place, says the food is amazing.  With the newer renovations, the place provides for a wonderful ambiance, too.

25.description: My favorite place to get Persian cuisine. Authentic, fresh, flavorful. Don't be a fool and go anywhere else.

12.description: I've been here three times and everything is so good. Every time I've been here it's been busy, but the wait has never been too long.Baba ganoush, humus, and falafel are all good.The dill rice is everything. Grilled shrimp and vegetables is my go to. It's a big portion, but I have no troubles finishing it because everything is delicious. The pomegranate shrimp is also amazing.

59.description: Great food, atmosphere, and service! We had to wait for about 15 minutes before being seated, but it was a Saturday night so 15 minutes is nothing and the place was crowded. We tried the family platter and it was more than enough. We also tried the dulamah (stuffed grape leaves) which was super delicious. The grilled meat that came with the family platter was tinder and juicy and coked to perfection. The service was great; our waiter was so attentive.   You cannot go wrong with this place, I would definitely recommend it to others.

21.description: Recently started eating at the restaurant, I always ordered or take out for years. The food is fantastic I absolutely love the food. But I definitely do not recommend going in and eating at the restaurant. Sad to say the amazing food does not match its service. The service is horrible. Unless you're extremely patient, I don't recommend anyone to come here to eat. Just take out. I would give this place all the stars for its food, but I think service is everything and very important for a restaurant and I hope they improve someday.

17.description: Disgusting! Had hair in my rice. Two long mexican hairs. I almost puked. Do not take anyone important here. Absolutely disgusted right now with this incident.

10.description: Came here awhile ago, not sure why I haven't been back. Some of the most authentic Persian food I've had. I had the lamb, and it was perfect. The waiter was very friendly and gave us recommendations on what to get. Did not disappoint.

5.description: This place is not overrated!Came here right at open as a party of two. I checked in on yelp and got the free appetizer.  Unfortunately they were out of the dolmeh, so we got the dolmeh falafel instead. It good, but the spices and herbs were overpowering. We mistakenly order a two-skewer lamb kabob. It was HUGE. it could easily last two meals for us. With the free appetizer we were not able to finish. The lamb was some of the most tender lamb I've had in my life.Definitely recommeded

3.description: For my birthday, my son took me to Noon O Kabab for lunch. We had not been here before, but he had heard great things about it. We were immediately seated by a friendly and welcoming server. She brought us cups of hot tea while we reviewed their extensive menu.We ordered a small hummus which was fantastic. The menu had so many options that looked good, it took a while to make a choice. I finally selected Chenjeh and Joujeh (Rib Eye and marinated chicken) which was fabulous. It is served with jasmine rice, pita and grilled tomatoes. The chicken was well flavored but the steak was excellent. It was cooked to perfection (medium rare), juicy and tender.The portions are enormous so I finished less than half of my meal. They boxed what was left, which gave me dinner that night and lunch the next day. I really enjoy Middle Eastern food and this now ranks as one of my favorites.The only downside is it is a little hard to get to without a car. Fortunately I was driving, but the train is not nearby and I didn't see any busses. It is, however, worth going out of your way for.

35.description: By far, my favorite Persian restaurant. Food always comes fresh and prices are very reasonable. Love their lunch special menu! Prices range from $6.95-10.95, can't beat that! I highly recommend this place!

19.description: Noon o Kabab is a white cloth Persian/Iranian restaurant near the Kedzie brown line stop. Having seen episodes of the Shahs of Sunset and reading Persepolis sparked my interest in trying this cuisine for the first time. To be honest, I've never come across an Iranian restaurant until now. Noon o Kabab has two establishments located side-by-side-the delivery-pick up establishment and the finer dining establishment next door. We arrived and were seated promptly. We were given complimentary pita bread and an accouterment of onions and feta cheese. We also ordered the dolmeh (vegetarian) appetizer. The dolmeh (stuffed grape leaves) came in a tomato-based sauce. This wasn't very appetizing-lukewarm and rice-based, the dolmeh needed a heartier stuffing. For the main course, we shared an order of joujeh and koubideh (one large skewer of boneless chicken breast and one skewer of ground beef). The meat is accompanied by a choice of white or dill rice (Get the dill rice). The food looks exactly like the pictures on the menu/Yelp. Its a beautiful presentation, and with the exception of the dolmeh, the food was well-prepared and pleased everyone at the table. The service needs to be picked up a notch-We waited ten minutes for our order to be taken, asked for butter when the food was brought over and never received it, and to prevent further delay, handed our credit card to the server as soon as she brought the bill. The food is good, and given the number of people waiting, we didn't want to be stared down by hangry patrons any longer.

28.description: This place is not overrated!Came here right at open as a party of two. I checked in on yelp and got the free appetizer.  Unfortunately they were out of the dolmeh, so we got the dolmeh falafel instead. It good, but the spices and herbs were overpowering. We mistakenly order a two-skewer lamb kabob. It was HUGE. it could easily last two meals for us. With the free appetizer we were not able to finish. The lamb was some of the most tender lamb I've had in my life.Definitely recommeded

45.description: Food is beyond excellent. Ash-e-resteh is like my grandma's. The barg (meat) and whitefish is out of this world. Succulent well chosen meats, seasoned well and presented in larger portion sizes. I'm a multiple visit reviewer and am pleased every time with selection, service and food. Highly recommended.

33.description: The best lamb kabob ever and great Fesenjoon! Good size of portions and good quality food in addition to a cozy traditional atmosphere! Must stop in!

43.description: This place is simply amazing. You can taste how fresh and good (non greasy) the food is.

2.description: Excellent Persian food.For appetizer the Baba Ghanoush was good and served with nice warm pita. My entree was Lamb and the kabobs with the roasted tomoatoes and dill rice was amazing. The servings are very generous and I was too stuffed to order dessert.I'd highly recommend and will go back to try some of their other offerings.

18.description: 2nd time at this restaurant .... Once again they delivered a 4 meal experience... Food was on point, fresh and oh so good ... It's a must try .... The Persian mojito was good but too small for the $9 they charge ... Later I noticed not too many tables had cocktails on their tables ... Hmmm

41.description: Charming restaurant with lots of unique dishes. The lamb koubideh was flavorful and delicious. Joujeh was flavorful and juicy. Combo platters are a good call for the more curious or indecisive. They offer a nice variety of interesting drinks, including a fig mead that is like a sweeter, less nutty honey wine. For our free appetizer, we tried the tadiq, which was crunchy and interested (although I wish they had defined the topping options somewhere!). Service was a little slow but they were admittedly quite busy. Overall, I would definitely return but feel no need to immediately schedule my next trip.

52.description: Their Persian dishes were or of the best we have ever had. We wee a party of eight and we all tried different variations of beef And chicken kabobs as well as an eggplant-based appetizer called Kashk-e Badenjan. All of was exceptionally good with generous portions, juicy kabobs and perfectly cooked rice. We also tried a couple yogurt based sides: Mast-o Moosir  (with shallots) and Mast-o Khiar (cucumber) plus Olivier Salad which is a kind of Persian potato salad. Everything was good,There were a few negatives! On the top of the list was our server who happened to be one of the owners. While we were fortunate to have her as a server, she came across a bit pushy with her suggestions. I really did appreciate the suggestions but what I didn't appreciate was how forcefully she made them. Another problem was the long delay between appetizers and main dishes. That was most probably due to how busy they were. We were there at around 3pm on a Sunday afternoon, which ordinarily is not a busy time. But on this particular day they were dealing with a large Persian conference in town. Still they should have been more prepared.Given the size of their portions and the quality of their food, prices are reasonable.

50.description: Noon o Kabab is a white cloth Persian/Iranian restaurant near the Kedzie brown line stop. Having seen episodes of the Shahs of Sunset and reading Persepolis sparked my interest in trying this cuisine for the first time. To be honest, I've never come across an Iranian restaurant until now. Noon o Kabab has two establishments located side-by-side-the delivery-pick up establishment and the finer dining establishment next door. We arrived and were seated promptly. We were given complimentary pita bread and an accouterment of onions and feta cheese. We also ordered the dolmeh (vegetarian) appetizer. The dolmeh (stuffed grape leaves) came in a tomato-based sauce. This wasn't very appetizing-lukewarm and rice-based, the dolmeh needed a heartier stuffing. For the main course, we shared an order of joujeh and koubideh (one large skewer of boneless chicken breast and one skewer of ground beef). The meat is accompanied by a choice of white or dill rice (Get the dill rice). The food looks exactly like the pictures on the menu/Yelp. Its a beautiful presentation, and with the exception of the dolmeh, the food was well-prepared and pleased everyone at the table. The service needs to be picked up a notch-We waited ten minutes for our order to be taken, asked for butter when the food was brought over and never received it, and to prevent further delay, handed our credit card to the server as soon as she brought the bill. The food is good, and given the number of people waiting, we didn't want to be stared down by hangry patrons any longer.

4.description: We were traveling last weekend and did a search on Persian food and found this place.  I'm so glad that we did.  I got a very large to-go order to take back home.  It was a three hour car ride but the temps were super cold being January plus we put it in a cooler.  We ordered a couple of different styles of kabob (Sultani and Kubideh) and they were some of the best I have ever tasted.  We also ordered Ghormeh Sabzi that was made with Lamb and outrageously wonderful, Pomegranate Chicken wings which I was told were good, Caspian Eggplant and a couple of Persian Salads.  Don't miss out on this place.  It is worth it and I thought the prices were extremely reasonable too.

6.description: Been looking for a new Mediterranean place to replace my last favorite Ameer Kebob. They didn't disappoint. Which the rice had a little more flavor but that's my only complaint.

22.description: Their skewered chicken (joujeh) is amazingly good. It's so juicy and soft that you wouldn't  believe it's a chicken breast. The food is simply delicious if you've never been here before pls try first then you will get addictive like me lol

15.description: One of my few Middle Eastern food experiences, and my first Persian one. I went in having no idea what to expect, but I was already interested just looking around- There are beautiful tile mosaics and other art decorations invoking the spirit of Persia, or at least what someone can easily imagine was. There's nothing modern, no common minimalist mood like what you'd find in a lot of Chicago restaurants these days, and my dish of grilled seafood with dill rice was simple but amazing. The dill really balanced the grilled shrimp nicely, and the grilled vegatables that came with it- tomatoes, peppers and onion- tasted fresh and good. I'll definitely go again.

57.description: It is a good place to go. If you would like to try some Persian Food ！！！Chicken and Shrimp  is very teasty , but the rice is kind of dry to me.

20.description: 2nd time at this restaurant .... Once again they delivered a 4 meal experience... Food was on point, fresh and oh so good ... It's a must try .... The Persian mojito was good but too small for the $9 they charge ... Later I noticed not too many tables had cocktails on their tables ... Hmmm

36.description: If you're looking for a restaurant with quality ingredients, decent prices, and professionalism from employees, look no further. I recently wrote a less than complimentary review and was contacted buy the business owner. He apologized for a delivery incident that occurred and was very gracious to address those involved and correct the problem. The food is always of highest quality. Seriously, delicious - I've even converted my friends from their usual "pizza and beer" routine. I would have come back regardless, but now I have a wide respect for this restaurant.

14.description: Went here at 1:50 on a Saturday afternoon (based on yelp rating) and there was a wait. We soon found out why.  The waiter brought out feta cheese, onions and cucumbers. The  feta cheese was among the best I have ever tasted. The pita bread could have used a little salt, but that is a minor issue.I ordered the shrimp curry stew, which came with dill rice. It was excellent.  The wife ordered chicken in walnut/pomegranate sauce. I don't know what it is called in the menu. The sauce is good, but it is rich.  The sauce works with the chicken, but not on its own. The service is good.

1.description: This pharmacy is maddening...long hold times no matter what time of day you call...On the few occasions I have had to call.. they put me on hold and then after ten minutes on hold the call drops. Not sure if its an incompetent person not paying attention or their phone system sucks. the store is always with only one cashier and this makes for very long lines...most of the time though they are pretty pleasant despite the rush but the fact that its always crowded and the pharmacy dept seems to always be short staffed makes me avoid this store even though its the closest.

9.description: Another great pharmacy tech at this Walgreens at Lawrence and Pulaski..After having such a great experience with Carmelo this is the only Walgreens I go to for my meds.  Again the most helpful pharmacy people today was Moe and Missy I have an old fashion doctor that they have to call for refills and Missy jumped right on it.  Then when I spoke with Moe he explained clearly the issues that I am dealing with..Cant Thank Them Enough....

23.description: This review is specifically about the photo department. So, I bring my film into the store at about 11:30P on a Saturday night. It's quiet and the girl at the main check out counter is flirting with a customer while he chats her up. I proceed to the photo counter, where there isn't a soul around, and wait. And wait, and. . . . wait "Excuse me, is anyone working in the photo department?" PA "Customer need assistance in photo." Enter, stage left, Mr. Assist-er. A giant specimen of a man, old and new food stains intermingling on his shirt as he continues to suck the food from between his teeth and look at me with a mildly interested look. Sparing most of the rest of the details, I wanted a double set of both rolls of film and a CD with one of them. Not freaking brain surgery. He was simply daft. I figured I had gotten through to him when he told me he'd been developing my pictures himself and I said to make the CD to go along with the roll of film with baby pictures on it. I picked up the film this morning and the ass had made a CD for the wrong film. There was no point talking to a manager because that would not have solved the timing problem. Don't take your pictures here. Argh.

5.description: You can't expect five stars from any Walgreens. But I would say out of all the locations I've been to I enjoy this one the most. Staff are friendly, shelves are stocked I'm in and out. I can't say there was ever really a time I walked into that specific location and didn't come out with a bag. Conveniently located and plenty of parking. Hookah bar, strip club, buffet and bank literally down the street. Also Lawrence Fish Market. Must try if you haven't already.

25.description: Bigger and better than its predecessor, good thing they moved the location and got a bigger space.  When it's after hours and you are in a bind and flowers could save the day.....  They carry a few bouquets and single roses.  $4-$10, not bad.  I wonder if dudes buy flowers here and take them to their favorite entertainer at the Admiral ??

12.description: Slow or busy pharmacy. Three cars in drive thru. 8 on line. One sitting waiting. Carmello is fantastic.

21.description: Nice and quiet. It has all the bits and pieces I need.

16.description: I got the day off... I got a day off... I got a day off! I can pretend like it isn't bragging, but that wouldn't be terribly convincing, would it?Chores? Psssh... What chores?  NATO protests? Who cares! I'm on a mission to enjoy this glorious, bright, warm, gorgeous spring day off by sunbathing in my back yard with the Baby Beagle, a paperback Edith Wharton novel (The Buccaneers), a chilly pitcher of homemade mojitos and the only thing to make it better? A cheap mani-pedi. A girl who had the cutest herringbone print nails ever told me the Sally Hansen nail strips were everlasting. I had a crush on her manicure, but didn't want to play twinsies so I bought the sexy black lace print- OMG- less than $10 for all tools included, screw-up-proof mani-pedi? Not a myth. It is supposed to last up to 10 days. Fun to apply, no dry time, has survived the daily rigors (heavy-duty cleaning products, hand washing and hand sanitizer applications) of a doctor's office. Can't say that about gels or standard polish, which will get chipped, faded, stripped or peeled within the first day of wear at work. I might go back and buy more... because so many people keep stopping me to tell me how cool it looks! You should try it. While you are at it, if you don't grow your own mint, Make a juice spritzer with equal parts seltzer water and white grape juice (or you can use cranberry, cherry, pineapple, orange, whatever you like), rock your favorite summer bikini, relax, read, soak up the sun and play ball in the yard with the puppy! Perfect day off!

17.description: Bigger and better than its predecessor, good thing they moved the location and got a bigger space.  When it's after hours and you are in a bind and flowers could save the day.....  They carry a few bouquets and single roses.  $4-$10, not bad.  I wonder if dudes buy flowers here and take them to their favorite entertainer at the Admiral ??

10.description: Worst pharmacy ever! They messed up my Mom's cancer medications three times!!!! 1st time: gave it to another person with similar name. 2nd-  they forgot to order her medicine. 3rd: medication ordered came two days late. It's my fault for going back there after the second time they messed up, that's why I'm giving two stars. Otherwise I would give it 1.

11.description: The WORST pharmacy location that is  always super slow but today managed to be even worst of the worst.Guilty in your prescription somewhere else!!!!

26.description: This is a brand new Walgreen's that's open 24 hours!  It's bigger and has better parking than the old Walgreen's a block away.  It's also good to see new construction in Albany Park.  Did I mention it's open 24 hours?

27.description: This Walgreens is not bad, though the checkout lines can pinch up during busy times. My grandma likes to buy a few things here, though I prefer the nearby Osco. They have a pharmacy here, and my grandma enjoyed getting her flu shot here in the fall.

0.description: If you ever thinking about getting a flu shot, this is the place! I think his name was Marcus and this Asian pharmacist gave me a shot and it didn't even sting. The best shot ever lol I  also like this place because it opens 24 hours.

20.description: This is our local walgreens.  Open 24hours, next to starbucks, chase and staples.   Always has what I'm looking for, from a coffee filter, to a toaster.   Love my walgreens.

19.description: This is our local walgreens.  Open 24hours, next to starbucks, chase and staples.   Always has what I'm looking for, from a coffee filter, to a toaster.   Love my walgreens.

2.description: This Walgreens is crazy if moms and children use this place as their playground.  I went at 1115 hour on a non-festive Saturday morning, and it was quiet and everything was in order.  My mission was to get charmin toilet papers since we were out of them.  I was able to find them.  There were items in the past that were out by the end of the week and they could care less on re-stocking them.  However, today's trip was smooth.  The cashier was nice and actually greeting you like a human being.  You usually have to take the initiatives asking them to punch in the phone number if you don't have the balance rewards card with you or to redeem points.  I used a manufacturer's coupon like I always do (I'm a couponer).  The check-out experience was speedy.  This Walgreens is usually a hit-or-miss, depending on what time of the day.  They usually mark the items with the right signs, unlike the CVS on Pulaski (they are freakin' bad about putting the marketing underneath the items.  Sometimes they just didn't care).  This truly helps when I'm trying to match the right coupons with the correct items.

18.description: This is your typical Walgreens. Nothing special, nothing bland. Every department has an extensive stock with a variety of many products to choose from. I love the sales that are always going on. It's definitely my go to place when I'm on a road trip or getting a birthday card before a party or whatever life's events might require.

13.description: Slowest pharmacy I've ever been to. I needed a refill and it took me 45 mins and there was nobody in line.....nobody even asked if I needed help until I had to ring the doorbell 3 times. Turrible (in my Charles Barkley voice). Seriously the worst

4.description: I can always find what I want at this Walgreens. Its very organized and there is always a cashier up front. The only thing is the times I have been here at night I have been cat called, people like to hang out at the parking lot.During the day it seems just fine.

24.description: This is a very clean, new space with a pretty solid selection.  About what you'd expect from a Walgreens.  Be warned, getting in and out of the shopping center can be a mess since the Lawrence/Pulaski intersection is basically a circus.  Don't plan on exiting East on Lawrence or North on Pulaski without some drama, including but not limited to horn blowing, obscene gestures, dirty looks and overly aggressive driving directed your way.  I've also noticed that though there is a good sized parking lot, it is almost always full in the evening, I suspect a lot of people park there illegally.  Still, it's usually reasonably easy to squeeze into a space assuming you don't mind door dings.

6.description: 24 hour pharmacy rocks. They're always on top of their work. Even though it's rare I see the same face, every tech & pharmacist has always been more than helpful and happy.

22.description: The location of this Walgreens is just right.  The new location is so much better then a couple years back.  There are always customers coming and going, whether its 4pm or 4am.  There is a customer walking in every minute.  The staff is friendly and helpful.

15.description: This Walgreens is conveniently located and open 24 hours, which is why I am visit so often.  It's clean, cashiers are helpful, and the store is well stocked.  What more can you want from a pharmacy really?  The lines do bunch up once in a while and what really bugs me is that the cashiers don't speed up to get the line moving.  Don't get me wrong, once in a while is fine but this happens all the time.  But like I mentioned, it's ok for a Walgreens.  They stock what I need and I avoid the busy times.

7.description: I came here looking for tweezers and and Xacto knife. This place had both of the items I needed. I am quite pleased.

8.description: Overall, employees are friendly. There are a few cashiers that probably shouldn't be in this line of work, but the other employees are very friendly. Close and convenient. Love the pharmacy.

3.description: THEY TOW YOUR CAR IF YOURE IN THE STORE!!!!!I literally had my vehicle towed while I was in the store. I have receipts from the pharmacy to prove it. The manager Aman is the most incompetent individual I've had the misfortune of coming across. He told me he would call me back and straighten the issue out and it hasn't been straightened. I had to pay $216 for shopping at Walgreens. I will never again be shopping at this Walgreens, and it's their loss since I was previously a frequent flyer. I will be telling my family to go to the 24 hour jewel also. Anyone why doesn't want their car towed while shopping should do the same.

14.description: This Walgreens sucks. They don't have enough of the advertised items in stock, SIMPLE items like chewing gum and chocolate. The workers are lazy, was waiting at the pharmacy and saw one of the workers just push one of the carts towards the wall and knocked a bunch of packages of who-knows-what, didn't care to see what he knocked, off the shelf and just walked away. He didn't even bother cleaning up his own mess. I basically travel to the Walgreens on Peterson and Lincoln, WAY better than this one.

58.description: The food quality was not very good.  The chicken had a weird smell to it and the kabobs were not cooked well.  Additionally, the chicken skewer was also not smelling good.  Rice was very wet.  All in all not a pleasant experience.

56.description: Easy place to get to for quick, cheap, healthy eats. I had some of the most tender and flavorful chicken shawerma here. Service is quick and friendly, and they let us use the free hummus coupon attached to the menu. They also offer a student discount!

29.description: Came here for the Groupon deal. It was a 3-course dinner for two. There was a little mix-up with our order. Upon letting them know we were using a Groupon, they brought us special menus that said to select 2 appetizers, 1 entree, and baklava for dessert. My husband and I chose 2 appetizers(falafel and baba ganoush), and thought we'd need to split the 1 entree, which was no big deal. We split entree's all the time. We ordered the chicken shawarma. A little bit later, I think the owner or manager came over and said we could choose 2 entree's, not just 1, so my husband ordered the chicken kabob. So, we were expecting to get 2 appetizers, 2 entree's and baklava for 2. Our baba ganoush never came. We really didn't care because we had enough food for the both of us and that was plenty. I think there was just some confusion and we got an extra entree instead of the baba ganoush. That aside, the food was great! The falafal and hummus were delicious and the chicken shawarma and yellow rice were cooked perfect. The baklava wasn't as sweet as I've had before at other places, which I liked. The servers were very polite and we both loved the food. I will definitely come back here to eat again and try other things on the menu, like the baba ganoush. I'm really happy to have found this place!

42.description: I know the owner, he's a great guy. Clean place and nice servers. I would recommend it to everyone who enjoys Mediterranean food.

23.description: Yum! Loved it. The Hummus was excellent.

47.description: The food is good, but what is not good is the portion. I've been ordering from this place for a while and the portions are getting smaller and smaller, but the price of the exact same dish I order every time has been increasing. It's a shame. I've referred many people to try this place, but I definitely won't be anymore. It's obvious this restaurant is trying to milk every penny from every dish it sells. The shawerma portions in the combo plates are a joke. They've made the kifta even narrower and the shish kabob pieces are the size of a quarter, if you're even lucky enough for them not to forget them in your order! The dish isn't even worth $10, let alone the ridiculous $19.99 price tag they've attached to it. Treat your customers and your restaurant better before people stop ordering from you.Response to Tareq: did you really just ask me do I care to share why I would get that impression? Did you not read my review? You are skimming on the portions and have increased the price. And the quality hasn't improved to explain the increase in cost either. Twice you have also forgot to include my 4th combinations selection and both times you told grubhub that it was in the bag. I don't know what type of service you're used to getting, but practically calling your customers liars doesn't help. I didn't want to include all of that in my original review, but your response seemed very cynical. So everyone, if you're looking for good Middle eastern food, drive down Lawrence, east, there are plenty of better and much cheaper places.

8.description: There are things in Rosa J's life that she regrets.  When she numerously passed by Hala In because she was making excuses for having a difficult day at work or just being tired, she made a conscious decision on skipping this wonderful place.  From now on, there's no more going home...directly...Hala In has officially hooked her up!  I don't know how many times I've passed back and forth while riding on the CTA 81 (Lawrence) bus.  I'm now very mad at myself and keeping asking myself why I didn't try this place when I was given a plenty of opportunities.  Being an avid yelper receives a number of benefits, including a small order of hummus on the house.  It may sound very cliche, but their hummus is one of the best I've ever had.  If you think many of those middle eastern eateries in downtown and in other Chicago neighborhoods have the best hummus, think twice.  I challenge you!  I also had the grilled tilapia.  Wow, what a well-seasoned piece of fish!  It also came with salad, rice, and grilled veggies on the side.  Everything was delicious.  Hubby's falafel platter, on the other hand, had fifteen (15) pieces of falafel!  Yes, he counted for me in case I wanted to share this piece of information with you all.  For $8.99, that wasn't bad at all.  We also shared the Arabic coffee since neither of us tried it before. What a discovery!  I'm now in love with this and can't get enough of it.  The saffron and clovers in the coffee were unique, yet harmonious without giving you too much "buzz."  I had an awesome experience at Hala In tonight.  I need to come back, ASAP!

31.description: Excellent find. Good portions. Hummus was better than several restaurants in the city. Chicken dishes were well prepared and served with rice. We will be back!

34.description: hi hala in! i love you again.  stopped by for chicken shwarma dinner take out the other day and i am so glad you brought back the original containers with the nice portions and separate salad container.  thank you for listening to your patrons. we are very impressed that you are one of the few restaurants that respect our opinions. we will be back more often now.

16.description: I never post on Yelp anymore,  but am making an exception for Hala. I was very shocked to come on here and see that that Hala has worse reviews than several restaurants that I've found to be seriously inferior.  Hala's food is simply amazing.  It takes serious restraint to not order it multiple times per week. My favorites are the shawarma, baba ganoush, and the grape leaves.  It's always all cooked to perfection.Living in Albany Park, I've made a point to try all the other middle eastern restaurants that are in walking distance. Every single time, I bemoan the fact that their food just isn't Hala quality.   Other grape leaves tend to be cold and mushy and other baba ganoush just seems bland.  Even the rice from Hala is significantly better.If I get married, I'll seriously considering having this place cater my wedding.

13.description: We found this place through groupon and I'm glad I made the purchase. The food sampler was amazing and tasted amazing for he minimal price we paid. I highly recommend the chicken Kebabs. If you're looking for a quick bite and craving Mediterranean food check this place out.

11.description: We came here with a groupon for a 3 course tasting. Apparently, this was a separate menu with limited choices. Annoying, but understandable.I ordered falafel and chicken shawerma. It came with a ton of rice too. The food was good. Chicken was tender and the falafel was flavorful. Service was a bit slow, which was surprising since we were there at an off time and there was only one other person eating there. For dessert, we had baklava. There was so much food. I was stuffed!I get the feeling this isn't really an eat in place. There are plenty of tables, but it seemed like most customers were for carry out. There isn't really much in terms of decor either.I would order take out from this place again. Lots of tasty food for a reasonable price.

39.description: Since my last review, I have to agree with many of the people that gave this place less than stellar reviews and primarily it is also related to the smaller portions/price increases and the lack of customer service from at least one of the waitresses that took care of my group (older woman with long hair) she was not very friendly and it was as though we were inconveniencing her when we asked for extra utensils.. she scoffed over but gave a fake smile when she laid them down on our table...although I still found the food to be rather good the service at least on that day was not very welcoming not to mention that I also noticed less meat on my dish but the prices did go up a bit. I had double the rice on my plate than the actual beef shawarma I had ordered. I understand everything has gone up nowadays but it does not justify getting cheated out of a meal....

37.description: My fiance and I order from here regularly on busy week nights when we just do not have enough time in the day to cook.  Their chicken shawerma is delicious, the hummus is so creamy and tasty.  Hala even makes plain old rice special - I could eat their rice everyday.  Falafel, lamb.. i think we've had the entire menu at this point.  Its is a neighborhood favorite of ours.

0.description: This place is amazing.I wish i could visit this guys more often, because they offer the best middle eastern food  I have ever tried. The portions are huge and always fresh.Katerina Barsukova

38.description: The worst, most dry falafel we've ever eaten. And sealed like a panini (?). Lentil soup was really not good either. Didn't get our pop either from our combo on delivery. Very disappointed for $40.

51.description: Bad experience :( cold food unprofessional service and never ever use Groupon they will ripped you off at the end

27.description: Went on a Saturday afternoon with a Groupon deal.  For some reason, we did not get served anything for over 30 minutes when all the other tables were getting complimentary pita.  Waitress did not come back once to assure us that the food was coming out..they were working on it.. didn't offer us anything actually.  Horrible service..food was mediocre after all that waiting.  Air conditioning broke too...so it was hotter than Hades in there.  Terrible.  Never coming back.

32.description: You can tell there's a lot of love going into the cooking here. Fresh ingredients, elegant presentation, amazing lentil soup. I'll be back for more!

54.description: This has become our stand-by for Middle Eastern takeout. Generous combo plate with chicken shawarma, chicken and beef kabob and kafta. The meat is nicely prepared, especially the shawarma. The tahini sauce and hot sauce are great (we always get extra). The salad it comes with is a little skimpy, but acceptable. The falafel are great, the hummus is great and the baba gannoush is fantastic. The pita are fresh and warm. We haven't yet eaten there, but it is simple and clean, with plenty of tables. Highly recommended!

48.description: I am very disappointed today with the lunch special. When I came in, I ordered a small hummus. The lunch special used to include falafel, but they have now substituted hummus for the falafel. How much hummus can one person eat and why was I not informed of this change? Very small portions on the lunch special and I certainly will not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The prices have not gone down but the portions sure have. I will not return. The two small pieces of chicken were burnt. The beef roll looks like a sausage link.  I told the waitress this lunch was unacceptable and she told me that she would add one piece of falafel.  I told her I did not want it.  I waited for the check and after waiting a long time, she returned to the table with a piece of falafel. I specifically told her I was not happy with this meal.  She got very indignant and was raising her voice. I do not want to be forced by anyone to eat something that is not acceptable.  It is very hard to believe that this woman was so very insistent and then presented me with a bill.  Are you kidding????  I did not come here to be insulted or to be treated like a child and then insulted. Awful. Waitress extremely rude. Really not the way to run a business. I definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT.

44.description: Though my first time,  food was meager at best. Ordered Chicken shawarma plate the meat was so dry I could barely swallow.  I usually give places a second go to make a fair assessment, but this time I don't think I will be back. N.O.K. blows the socks off this place.

24.description: While Hala In is a bit pricier than other restaurants serving the same food, I must say that their food is delicous and fresh!Ordered from them using grub hub, and my experience was a good one. The food arrived in less than an hour, nothing was missing, and everything was yummy.

7.description: My go to since they deliver and Pita Inn does not and is a little too far to drive.  They are reasonably priced, consistent and delicious!  I frequently get 3 meals out of my shwarma dish I order.

49.description: Came in for dine-in. Food was delicious but unfortunately we had to wait about 45 min for it to be brought out to us even though it was pretty slow  in terms of number of diners.  Carry out/delivery seemed very busy.

40.description: The felafel is excellent.  We did the "free humus with Yelp  check-in" and they didn't seem to know what we were talking about, but honored it anyway,  so all is well that ends well. Great pita too.

53.description: I was not impressed with the food. Being Palestinian myself, I was really expecting something better. The portions are EXTREMELY small. The amount of food you get is minuscule compared to other restaurants in the area (ie. Salam). And why is it $5 for a side of rice?! That's ridiculous. Totally overpriced. Lentil soup was good, but the hummus was seriously lacking in flavor. Mediterranean salad was sub par. Won't come back. Save your money and travel farther on Lawrence for a bigger bang for your buck.

30.description: This a great restaurant in my neighborhood. We prefer to order takeout. It is (or was BYOB). However last time we were there the owner warned us that Ramadan was approaching and we should not bring alcohol to his establishment. I was thinking - when in Rome! So have not gone back. Still love the food despite the lack of assimilation into the good old USA.

46.description: I've ordered from here before through Grub Hub and decided to come in with my girlfriend and try the dining in experience. The restaurant is very clean and the service is excellent! The food is very very very delicious and tastes very fresh. I had the falafel and it came out really good and I did the build your own combination with lamb, chicken, and kifka kabobs and beef shawarma, which came with rice and a salad. I was very impressed with the taste of the food. I highly recommend Hala In!!!

1.description: I've been to this place several times. I've got them delivered, I've sat there and ate and I'm also picked up the food. The food is good, but I've had better. There is really nothing to complain about regarding the food.The service is good, they servers are nice and friendly. I've had a problem with communication sometimes, but other than that, nothing else. Place is small, but it's nice. Nothing to great or amazing about the place, but they are a good place to grab food for and eat at.

55.description: Best kabobs in town, I've been searching for the best authentic kabobs, and have found them. Hala In is owned by an Arab family and the service is amazing. The kabobs are grilled and YOU CAN TASTE IT. The rice alone will have me coming back.

9.description: This place is great! We live a couple blocks away and have ordered to go a couple times, food is always fresh, portion sizes are large and the service is always great. We get the combo kabobs...kefta,chicken and steak. Great grilled flavor...the hummus is creamy. All for a great price too! Give this place a go!

26.description: Very tasty!! It's slightly expensive for delivery.  However, there is an affordable Groupon option.  I highly recommend you check this out. I was impressed with the falafel.

25.description: I was blown away. Only ate here because I was in the neighborhood. Will probably go out of my way to come back. The babaganouj is the best I've ever had. So is the falafel.

12.description: one of the best places to eat in the neighborhood.  Food was fantastic.  Service was a little awkward.  This seems to be more of a take out place than a dine in place, but the quality food makes this place worthy of 5 stars. My Beef Kabab was one of the best I've ever had.

59.description: Just okay. Nice place, good service, good food. Just not exactly what we've come to expect from a middle eastern restaurant. The hummus was pretty good, but the pita they serve with it seems to be just store bought pita pockets. They ended up coming in handy when my boyfriend got his falafel platter, which was just a plate with maybe 16 falafel balls and a tiny bowl of salad in the middle. He made his own falafel pita things and ended up getting way too full. I got the salmon kabob platter which came with some grilled veggies and a side of rice. I had to ask for a side of tahini as neither of our dishes came with any sauces. Thought that was kind of weird. All the food was good, just not great. I wouldn't call it a 4 star restaurant overall.

21.description: Love the chicken salad there. Generous amount of the most delicious chicken. Never left disappointed. Hummus and baba ganoush very delicious.

17.description: My bro found this place and asked me if I wanted to go. After looking at the Yelp reviews, prices, and pictures; I agreed to go. I also invited my sister and cousins to come along for the ride. We were very excited because the food in the pics looked amazing and the prices were relatively generous. We walked into this little gem at the corner off Lawrence. The lady greeted us with a genuine smile and seated us immediately. Water and the menus followed right after. I told her about the free small hummus with a check-in and she acknowledged it and brought it out. Something else she did was allow my sister to also get another free hummus with her check-in too! We were very thankful for her kindness. Not only was the hummus free, it was probably the best hummus I've ever had. It was so nicely blended and seasoned and served with pita bread. This hummus also had some lemon and olive oil mixed into it - nicely and perfectly executed. I ordered the combo platter which had chicken kebab, chicken shawarma, beef, and yellow rice with it. Delicious! Wow, I almost ordered one to go. It was seasoned so brilliantly. The meats were so tender and flavorful. My bro ordered the stuffed grapes leaves too. I've never had that so it was nice to try it for the first time. Very simple yet yummy! Also, best falafel I've ever had! Service was excellent here! She was so nice and did a great job. She kept getting us more water, bringing out pita bread, asked us if we needed anything else, etc. She even went back and gave us separate checks when we asked. It was very convenient for us and we are thankful for how nice she was. We will be back and I highly recommend!

10.description: I have to say, living in this neighborhood you have plenty of options for Mediterranean.   But being the good local home owner I wanted to support my local economy. But it is disappointing to order from a place, feel like you're being overcharged and realizing that you are.  The lamb kabob entree consisted of 6 pieces of lamb and a tray full of rice all for $15.  You're expecting a delicious meat plate and ending up with rice with meat scraps.   Ridiculous and upsetting.  I live a few houses down, will not be ordering from here again. Disappointing because it actually tastes great, but they rip off customers.

5.description: Food is so good that when I moved away, I craved it. Always nice staff and very fair prices. Free small hummus when you check in. Can't go wrong.

3.description: While Hala In is a bit pricier than other restaurants serving the same food, I must say that their food is delicous and fresh!Ordered from them using grub hub, and my experience was a good one. The food arrived in less than an hour, nothing was missing, and everything was yummy.

35.description: We came here with a groupon for a 3 course tasting. Apparently, this was a separate menu with limited choices. Annoying, but understandable.I ordered falafel and chicken shawerma. It came with a ton of rice too. The food was good. Chicken was tender and the falafel was flavorful. Service was a bit slow, which was surprising since we were there at an off time and there was only one other person eating there. For dessert, we had baklava. There was so much food. I was stuffed!I get the feeling this isn't really an eat in place. There are plenty of tables, but it seemed like most customers were for carry out. There isn't really much in terms of decor either.I would order take out from this place again. Lots of tasty food for a reasonable price.

19.description: It's good, a little bit on the pricey side, but good. Should get on the lunch special train.

28.description: Love the shawerma sandwiches- well seasoned and perfectly cooked chicken and beef in a yummy wrap! Wasn't a huge fan of the falafel, but the baklava is delish! We have been ordering from here a lot lately- want to try the grape leaves next!!!

45.description: The food is good but it's so expensive just order a beef kebab with no rice but hummus and to add one side of chicken so (basically like 3 small pieces) and asked for delivery came out to be $25 dollars geez and I still tip the delivery person so wasting more money!! I rather go to a nicer restaurant and pay a good amount for food for $25!! Over priced!! the serving is too small to pay for this much!! Just saying! Charge me 4.99 for 3 small pieces of chicken are you serious wow it's not even organic, never again!!!

33.description: I never post on Yelp anymore,  but am making an exception for Hala. I was very shocked to come on here and see that that Hala has worse reviews than several restaurants that I've found to be seriously inferior.  Hala's food is simply amazing.  It takes serious restraint to not order it multiple times per week. My favorites are the shawarma, baba ganoush, and the grape leaves.  It's always all cooked to perfection.Living in Albany Park, I've made a point to try all the other middle eastern restaurants that are in walking distance.
