Every single time, I bemoan the fact that their food just isn't Hala quality.   Other grape leaves tend to be cold and mushy and other baba ganoush just seems bland.  Even the rice from Hala is significantly better.If I get married, I'll seriously considering having this place cater my wedding.

43.description: I have to say, living in this neighborhood you have plenty of options for Mediterranean.   But being the good local home owner I wanted to support my local economy. But it is disappointing to order from a place, feel like you're being overcharged and realizing that you are.  The lamb kabob entree consisted of 6 pieces of lamb and a tray full of rice all for $15.  You're expecting a delicious meat plate and ending up with rice with meat scraps.   Ridiculous and upsetting.  I live a few houses down, will not be ordering from here again. Disappointing because it actually tastes great, but they rip off customers.

2.description: I've found a replacement for PIta Inn, and they deliver! We just moved and had to order in the first night at our new place. Together, we ordered baba, hummus, the combo plate and chicken shawarma plate. First off, the portions were so big we ate the leftovers for two days! The hummus and baba are simply divine. The shawarma and combo plates were huge and delicious. We shared the combo plate that night and heated up the shawarma for dinner the second night. It reheated very well.They also don't skimp on pita. They sent more than enough for everything we ordered (unlike some other places I've been to). Overall, it was so good we reordered it once we ran out! Also, I need to mention the delivery was way shorter than the times we were given. Very good experience.

18.description: You can tell there's a lot of love going into the cooking here. Fresh ingredients, elegant presentation, amazing lentil soup. I'll be back for more!

41.description: The food here is great! I love the yellow rice with chicken shawarma.  Highly recommend it.  The place is a little small though.

52.description: Food is delicious and great affordable lunch special ($7.99)!! It comes with chicken kababs, kifta, chicken shawarma and falafel (in my case never received), yellow rice, side of salad, and a can of pop. Very decent amount! However in my plate I didn't get a falafel and really lacking the sauce, but I did get a small amount of hummus. Regardless it was a good lunch. The downfall for this visit which I gave it four stars is because The waitress and the lady by register were not quite nice. I came in for table of 1 and took awhile for waitress to greet me. I just helped myself and found a table. As oppose to the people behind me was table of 3 and waitress immediately went to them and served them water and I on the other hand didn't. Finally went to me, I ordered lunch special. She gave me a Coke. I didn't ask for Coke. Heck, she didn't even ask me what kind of pop I wanted. I had to call her back to ask for another type of Pop. Got my food and IT WAS DELICIOUS! I realized than my lunch didn't have falafel as its stated on the menu. I just let it go. At this point, she didn't even ask me how my food was or even checked on me, not even refilled my water at all. Unlike the table of 3, she cleaned there table, gave them extra napkins, filled there water and checked them. Upon checking out, I realized there was a discount for students. I gave her my nursing college ID and she gave me the wrong amount. I had to recalculate it for her and inform her it was a wrong price. She got an attitude and corrected it again. She rung me up. Didn't even say good bye nor thank you for coming. Owner is really nice and greets you, but if the owner keeps continuing to have a front staff and waitress that gives bad service people will not come back. In my case, I will try again and come back since the food is toooooo good! People have bad days and maybe his staff was having one. Makes sure u check in via Yelp so you can get a small hummus and pita bread (which comes out hot and very good!)

50.description: Fresh, tasty Arabic food. The vegetarian combo is really good! I've been here several times and the food is always consistent. Love the tabouli, hummus, falafel and dolma. Being from the Detroit area and having Middle Eastern parents, I know a thing or two about Mediterranean food. You'll love it.

4.description: A five star rating made up the hard way, by a combination of things. First things first, we were greeted quickly and menus brought to us right away. Pleasantries were made and our order taken done quickly.There was a wait for our food, however it arrived freshly prepared, hot, and with very ample servings. My husband had the tilapia and I the chicken kabobs, he cleaned his plate, so I'll just take that as evidence that it was good, I don't eat fish anyway. I only could eat half of mine, I wanted to do better because the chicken was very moist, with a nice char on it and the spices just right. We also had hummus, falafel and pita bread. All good.My only disappointment was the offerings for soda was either can or bottle, I prefer fountain Coke, and the availability of refills (no Bloomberg lectures please) even through I know it's bad for you. This place is like visiting a friends house for a meal, friendly, homey, relaxed and they know how to cook. There wasn't one thing over the other, it just all came together very well.

6.description: Excellent chicken shawarma and salad. Ever since Dawali closed down on Lawrence/Kedzie, we've been trying to find a place with chicken shawarma that matched their quality. These guys do, and they might even be better at it. Will be ordering again and again.

22.description: The food was tasty but i cant understand why you are charging for sauces.  That is kind of ridiculous. Do i not deserve a small cup of yogurt sauce/hot sauce with my meal?  I think so.

15.description: The food here is so good! The baba ghanouj is, in my opinion, the best in the city. The falafel are awesome, very flavorful and always just the right balance of crunchy outside and soft inside. I've ordered a lot of things on the menu, and brought both vegetarians and avid meat eaters, and everyone is impressed. I'm so lucky to have this place in walking distance from my house.

57.description: They are 7 for 7 with delivery screw ups.  I keep coming back because the food is good and they've comped the last two times they f'd up.

20.description: WOW this place is good. I can honestly say that this is the best place in my entire life growing up in Chicago to get a falafel ANY thing. The have the best falafels ever made, amazing flavor. As if God came down and made these falafel's themselves. The yellow rice here is amazing as well, and the hummus is oh so fresh and delicious. I can't wait to order from here again!

36.description: Service was good. Our waitress told us it was her third day working and she was very sweet and attentive. They honored the free small hummus offer from yelp after the waitress checked with the manager. I ordered the shwarma combo. It came with salad and rice. All of the food was delicious and tasted fresh. I'd definitely go there again for dinner. It was a Friday night but there was no wait to get seated.

14.description: Their HUMMUS! Like non other in the area. I LOVED the babaganush and falafels. Everything was very good and fresh. We order for pick up and they were very fast. The owner even threw some desserts in for my kids. Very good service and very good food.

1.description: Con: This WAS my primary produce market. At first, the prices were great and the quality was, too. However, as of recent, the quality has declined significantly. For instance, my last two tomato purchases had been red and firm on the outside, sour, green and slime on the inside. Same with the cucumbers - firm and green on the outside but squishy and watery when cut. Very disappointing! Pro: The meat is fairly priced. They offer marinated meats at the Butchers, as well.Con: Other products like dry goods and dairy are priced ~$2 above average. Pro: Excellent place to find eclectic seasonings for many typea of dishes.

9.description: Mayfair Market opened TODAY in the former Walgreen's (which itself had moved into a new building a block north quite awhile ago). It's a bit weird walking into a brand-new grocery with fully stocked shelves, perfectly displayed piles of fruits and vegetables, and immaculate floors thanks to its workers mopping the aisles non-stop (hey - it's NEW!). This grocery should give the nearby Fiesta Market some stiff competition (only a block away), with a variety of Mexican products. It's bigger than Fiesta, so I was combing the aisles and also found quite a few Indian and Mediterranean products too. I bought green beans, broccoli, ginger, grapes, along with interesting items like a bag of plantain chips, a 6-pack of mini dulce-de-leche cups, and a box of spicy frozen mini-samosas. A free parking lot is south of the store. I will definitely be back to shop here!

23.description: I am not impressed. I was so excited waiting for this place to open. I am a fresh fruit and veggies junkie. While the quality was comparable to other such markets in the area, the prices we about 20% higher on average. I realize the place just opened and they may be marking up now to re coop losses, but with so many other sh-options, I literally decided to take it elsewhere and left. I'll go back in late spring and see it things have come down a bit. I was bummed.Update:7-31-09Way better experience as of late.  Great meat section, fresh produce.  I like-y!

25.description: Mayfair Market opened TODAY in the former Walgreen's (which itself had moved into a new building a block north quite awhile ago). It's a bit weird walking into a brand-new grocery with fully stocked shelves, perfectly displayed piles of fruits and vegetables, and immaculate floors thanks to its workers mopping the aisles non-stop (hey - it's NEW!). This grocery should give the nearby Fiesta Market some stiff competition (only a block away), with a variety of Mexican products. It's bigger than Fiesta, so I was combing the aisles and also found quite a few Indian and Mediterranean products too. I bought green beans, broccoli, ginger, grapes, along with interesting items like a bag of plantain chips, a 6-pack of mini dulce-de-leche cups, and a box of spicy frozen mini-samosas. A free parking lot is south of the store. I will definitely be back to shop here!

12.description: They're grocery items aren't the best and pretty average, but their produce and its variety is amazing.  They also have a wide range of tortillas that are brought in fresh usually daily.  I am moving back to the suburbs and I am going to miss this store so much.  I haven't found anything like it in the NW suburbs yet.

21.description: wow this place is clean! its lovely to have a local market with a produce section that doesn't look like its been ravaged by savages (see tony's on elston). the meat counter smells like.... wait for it... NOTHING! i point this out because, once again, tony's on elston has a meat counter that smells like a combination of rot and bleach. the prices are low and the produce i've gotten has been quite good so far.the selection of shelf stable items is not extensive but you've pretty much got all your staples. they also have some interesting ethnic foods, some pre-packaged indian/middle eastern stuffs and of course your standard mexican fare.hopefully mayfair keeps up with the cleanliness and organization of their market; its appreciated.

16.description: I am not impressed. I was so excited waiting for this place to open. I am a fresh fruit and veggies junkie. While the quality was comparable to other such markets in the area, the prices we about 20% higher on average. I realize the place just opened and they may be marking up now to re coop losses, but with so many other sh-options, I literally decided to take it elsewhere and left. I'll go back in late spring and see it things have come down a bit. I was bummed.Update:7-31-09Way better experience as of late.  Great meat section, fresh produce.  I like-y!

17.description: This cute little grocery store is right down the street from my house.  Its nice to go there when I want some inexpensive produce or something and I don't want to trek all the way up to the Jewel.  The produce is very affordable and really fresh.The store does cater to Mexican tastes though, so there are some things in there that I as a Midwestern gal originally from Indiana didn't quite understand.  It doesn't have everything, but if I need to pick something up for dinner, its an easy 5 minute walk and very convenient.  I can't beat that!

10.description: Great produce market!  The produce is always fresh and inexpensive.  You never see a wrinkled pepper or a bruised tomato at Mayfair, unlike some of the other nearby produce marts.Yes, the pre-packaged foods are pricey and limited, but produce and meats are what you should be coming to Mayfair for.  Go to Jewel for your Frosted Mini-Wheats.I got the most amazing chorizo here once for next to nothing.  Mmmm...chorizo...

5.description: Very clean store, decent prices and I love the fact you can pick your own carnitas for 3.99lb

11.description: Strange vibe. Produce is great but the product is expensive compared to other markets. Im always shocked to see how far the cashierwill go to completely ignore every nice thing I say. Clean, well stocked but I might just have to avoid this place in leiu of other, more affordable markets.

22.description: I appreciate having a new grocery store within walking distance of my home.  Not only for the convenience factor, but for the array of produce (and more) that's unique to a neighborhood like this.The first thing you notice is how clean, organized, and well-stocked everything is.  Can I get an Amen on that?!  The produce section has all my favorites - plantains, 2 kinds of avocados, fresh okra, upo, bitter melon, yuca, and more than I can remember right now.  Plus they have a few items that I haven't tried yet - tindora and fresh curry leaves to name a few.  Heads of garlic and limes were on sale for 10 cents each.  What's not to love?I headed over to the butcher section and noticed all kinds of cuts that I love to cook with, like oxtail and shanks.  The deli section has paneer, feta, Mexican cheeses, and various deli meats.  And the seafood section had langoustines, which I was very tempted to buy.  But I'll save that for another time.The shelves were stocked with goodies from India, the Middle East, Peru, Mexico, and Europe.  We're talking about spices, jams, pickled vegetables, pate, a large variety of dried legumes, candies (they sell my favorite - La Cubanita's dulce de leche fudge), marinades, pita from Al Khayyam Bakery, European bread from Val's Bakery, etc.  The freezer section has frozen Indian vegetables, Malaysian paratha, empanada wrappers, sofrito, arepas, samosas, Peruvian corn, and more.Basically, if you like to cook with these ingredients, this store is for you.  This isn't a "one stop shopping" place, but there are other stores nearby where you can purchase everything else.  Happy cooking.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------7/23:  I made tilapia ceviche and found all the ingredients here.  They carry Rocoto pepper paste, which is a Peruvian pepper used in traditional ceviche.  Score!  I also purchased garlic plantain chips, which were perfect with the ceviche.On a side note for vegetarians in the neighborhood, they do carry TVP (textured vegetable protein).  They have "beef" and "chicken" strips and crumbles, and "chorizo" crumbles.

0.description: I'm glad that Mayfair Market was salvaged by the new ownership who took over approximately one (1) month ago.  The fresh produce was fully-stocked; the categories of meat in the meat department was neatly presented; the seafood department wasn't so shabby, either.  The entire venue was clean and easy to navigate.  Although I don't consider Mayfair Market was a "one-stop" place for grocery shopping, the prices for produce, for the most part, are competitive.  We got 2 and 1/4 lb worth of apples, two (2) cucumbers, one (1) bundle of Mexican green onions, one (1) head of iceberg lettuce, one (1) bag of red grapes, one (1) tray of skirt steak, two (2) pieces of Mexican sweet bread, one (1) bag of carrots, and two (2) lb worth of bananas for under  $14!!  I don't think that's bad at all.  I also like the itemized monitor at checkout.  The cashier accidentally double-charged the skirt steak, but since it was itemized with a large font, this mistake was quickly identified and corrected immediately.  I'm happy that Mayfair Market has made a comeback.P.S. They do have a private parking lot for your convenience.

20.description: Incredibly affordable produce and deli meats. I purchased two HUGE bags of food for under $20 - something I could never achieve at the Jewel. Definitely not a place to get everything you need (no yogurt, dry goods are scant) but I am only buying my meat, cheese, and produce here from now on. Thank you, Mayfair!!

19.description: This place has the best prices on fruits and veggies in the area. I always go to this store to buy them. They make fresh pico de gallo and guacamole that I love - I highly recommend trying both of them!! I also really like the premade beef or chicken fajita mix at the deli counter - just cook and serve (so easy)! The one thing I wouldn't recommend buying there is name brand products. They tend to be a bit more expensive (convenience store type pricing).

2.description: I wouldn't even give them one star if that was an option... Humiliating experience at this place. Their cashier didn't even bother double bagging our heavy items with their flimsy bags. She was doing it all in a hurry (probably since she was going home soon)and put all our heavy stuff in one bag so of course it broke! We come back in, asking if we can get the items replaced and after the employee stopped to finish gossiping with some costumer then she got back to us, and refused because "it didn't happen in their property" They had a store policy sign displaying "no exchanges or refunds without a receipt", we had our receipt(and the transaction had happened like seconds beforehand) so I guess that sign is just there for show. The manager/owner went to the lowest of low by accusing my boyfriend of purposely dropping the stuff and that's why they wouldn't refund. So yeah if you are looking for good costumer service, fluent  English speaking staff that won't twist your words, and to get treated like a decent human being overall then this is not the place to go! Hopefully they don't treat everyone like that as I don't imagine it being any good for business. We basically paid for something we didn't even get. This business runs on stealing from their costumers...

18.description: Not a one stop shop, but very high quality produce and cheap prices. Wish they took Amex though.

13.description: A somewhat nearby alternative to Harvestime Foods! It's conveniently located at the intersection of Lawrence and Pulaski, where there are two major bus routes. In fact, there's a bus stop right in front of the store. There is a Walgreens, Chase, and whatnot a block or two away for "one-stop" errands.The volume of produce is great. It's not like freakin' Jewel in which there are 4 ugly and old zucchinis left. Mayfair is well-stocked and organized. The produce prices are very reasonable. I can't remember exact prices, but it was like 49¢ for a pound of onions and Idaho potatoes, less than 70¢ for an avocado, and whatnot.Although, the store looks much larger from the outside, it is actually not that big. Just like at Harvestime and other ethnic grocery stores, the pre-packaged and dry goods are a little pricier than big name stores. I shop at Aldi for such things.I dig it.

4.description: Ehhhhh, here's the thing:They used to keep this place well-stocked.  I don't mean like you can find "mainstream" products like you could find at jewel, but you could certainly find any "hispanic" food item you could ever possibly need.  The last four times I've come here though, it's like they've neglected to restock on anything except the produce.  There have been multiple times now where I've had to leave this store only to go to the grocery store on Lawrence and Drake just to get a common item.  Also it seems that as of late, they've risen a lot of their prices.  Milk is $1.50 - $2.00 more expensive here than just about any other grocery store.  As far as the produce goes, they have a good selection, and good quality.  The store is clean.  I just wish they didn't raise their prices, and they kept the store fully stocked.  I shouldn't have to go to a different fruteria to get enchilada sauce, y'know?I guess if I were to assess my mood after leaving this place most recently, I'd label the mood as "mad."  I was a little mad.

24.description: Finally a great neighborhood supermarket in Mayfair! Produce and meat/deli are the highlights. Quality and variety of these departments are outstanding.  I spoke to the manager and this is his 6th store in the Chicagoland area.  He explained that he wanted to cater to the variety of people we have in the neighborhood (Korean, Polish, Hispanic, Middle Eastern, etc.) therefore their is a great variety of foods in the store.  Opening day was Feb 18, 2009.

6.description: Terrible, terrible, terrible. That's the only way I can describe this store. They continue to display the Mexican flag upside down, even after I brought it to the managers attention. Terrible, insulting and disrespectfull. For shame.  22 days and counting.

15.description: I appreciate having a new grocery store within walking distance of my home.  Not only for the convenience factor, but for the array of produce (and more) that's unique to a neighborhood like this.The first thing you notice is how clean, organized, and well-stocked everything is.  Can I get an Amen on that?!  The produce section has all my favorites - plantains, 2 kinds of avocados, fresh okra, upo, bitter melon, yuca, and more than I can remember right now.  Plus they have a few items that I haven't tried yet - tindora and fresh curry leaves to name a few.  Heads of garlic and limes were on sale for 10 cents each.  What's not to love?I headed over to the butcher section and noticed all kinds of cuts that I love to cook with, like oxtail and shanks.  The deli section has paneer, feta, Mexican cheeses, and various deli meats.  And the seafood section had langoustines, which I was very tempted to buy.  But I'll save that for another time.The shelves were stocked with goodies from India, the Middle East, Peru, Mexico, and Europe.  We're talking about spices, jams, pickled vegetables, pate, a large variety of dried legumes, candies (they sell my favorite - La Cubanita's dulce de leche fudge), marinades, pita from Al Khayyam Bakery, European bread from Val's Bakery, etc.  The freezer section has frozen Indian vegetables, Malaysian paratha, empanada wrappers, sofrito, arepas, samosas, Peruvian corn, and more.Basically, if you like to cook with these ingredients, this store is for you.  This isn't a "one stop shopping" place, but there are other stores nearby where you can purchase everything else.  Happy cooking.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------7/23:  I made tilapia ceviche and found all the ingredients here.  They carry Rocoto pepper paste, which is a Peruvian pepper used in traditional ceviche.  Score!  I also purchased garlic plantain chips, which were perfect with the ceviche.On a side note for vegetarians in the neighborhood, they do carry TVP (textured vegetable protein).  They have "beef" and "chicken" strips and crumbles, and "chorizo" crumbles.

7.description: I find myself shopping here less often.  The main reason is that they are lax regarding pulling products according to the expired date.  I've accidentally purchased bread here that was moldy.  Since then I've been paying closer attention and have found other items with expired dates for sale.  The other reason I've stopped coming here is that I can't find basic products like beans! Their shelves have become bare in areas.  I understand that it's a grocery catering to the neighborhood demographics but take a walk down their bean aisle.  I've stopped in three times in the last 3 weeks and could not find a single can of chick peas.  A display case that used to hold Mexican Coke was completely empty on my last visit.  I've asked about stocking a few products here and there, but I've never seen them carried.  The physical condition of the store has deteriorated as well.  The dirty floors and broken glass make you think twice about buying their products.Produce is okay for the most part.  Their meat counter seems to do a lot of business and I occasionally buy chicken breasts there.  Their guacamole is excellent and recommended.A few years ago, they sold deli meats by Dietz & Watson but it's now Sara Lee and the like.  I used to be able to do most of my shopping here since it was only a few blocks away but now I only stop in for a few items on occasion.

8.description: (Mostly) Good produce at a good price.  There were some berries on super sale and I was all excited, until I saw that over half of each package was moldy :(  other then that, they had a pretty good selection and the prices for the produce was great.  I took a walk around the rest of the store, prices seemed to be good and they had a pretty good variety of products.  Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but if I was near by again and needed some produce, would definitely stop in.

3.description: UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP!!!!Dennis who owned Fiesta Fruit Market for years.. Later opening and running Mayfair Market from 2009-2011..   Has come back and taken over the store!! Motivated as always to provide the quality service the neighborhood remembers and deserves!!           Officially re-opening it's doors....        Wednesday SEPTEMBER 10th 2014

14.description: AWESOME produce selection!  Everything is always stocked and fresh and the prices are hard to beat.  They also have a very good butcher/deli section.  While their shelves aren't stocked with your usual big box grocery store products, they do have tons of great ethnic finds-Indian, Mexican, European, Middle Eastern, Chinese/Korean, etc.  Not really a one stop shop for me, but definitely worth the extra trip.

1.description: My experience here was satisfactory. Great food variety, including vegetarian options. I am in LOVE with their Green Juice. I had the Celery, Nopal, Pineapple, and Green Apples. You HAVE to give it a try. I recommend you come and check them out. ;)

0.description: It you want to a phenomenal Mexican restaurant that has an incredible favor and amazing food, well do not look any further, El Golocito is the right place to be and to enjoy everything they offer.Their tortas, tacos de pulpo o de camaron are just OUT OF THIS WORLD!The owner (Ramon) is an amazing support of the Albany Park community by donating his products to support undocumented students and their dreams to go to college. His ice cream creations are DELICIOSOS!El golocito is a very worth place to try, once you try it you'll never go back to another Mexican restaurant.El golocito also has green juices if you want to be healthy and another thing regarding the way they prepare their food is that they use butter or olive oil. Ramon is conscious of being healthy and having that on mind his food is always fresh and healthy.I am a native from Mexico and believe I know about food. EL GOLOCITO is the best!

3.description: The guys who work there are awesome. Great, helpful customer service. I walked in to ask if they had any dairy-free cookies (I'm fasting so it's all about being vegan for me right now) and they looked at all their pastries and found one. Success. I took five, and as he rang me up I handed over my debit card but I guess he didn't want to charge it because it was only a dollar and I had no cash, so he gave me the cookies and said I could pay him back next time. Wow. Granted, I felt like crap, but boy was that nice of him. I'm definitely coming back next week to pay back that dollar. Oh, and the pastries I had were delicious. One of my new favorite bakeries for sure!

1.description: Been going here for years. Still the best tasting baklawa in Chicago. Pick your favorite nut. Cashew for me. Also you must try the canned French feta cheese. Guaranteed you'll never buy any other feta again. I can't stop eating it even plain on crackers. For me also make outstanding hummus. If available, the cheese, filo triangles are incredible too. Must eat the same day. Much more great stuff.

2.description: Some of the best falafel on Kedzie in an unassuming storefront.  The sweets and bakery are excellent and prices are really good.  They also have a pretty good selection of middle eastern groceries in a second storefront.  Owner was very helpful and friendly.

5.description: I walked into this place because I had about 20 minutes to blow before my appointment. If you venture through the whole store, you'll find that they have a vast variety of Middle Eastern foods. The owner makes you feel at home.  I was asking lots of questions because as we all know, we don't want to be confused for one ethnicity by a total stranger. You know, asking if you're Mexican if you are from a South American country or asking an Asian if they're Chinese. I went off on a tangent, just as you can in this place full of food and desserts. The Falafel sandwiches are so delish (I don't tend to say delish, brings out the girlie in me) and $2.05. The Baklava and other sweets are tremendous and I'm not a dessert guy either. I usually forgo the dessert for extra food during the actual meal.Btw, this is not a sit down cafe or a little bistro. Nope, just grab and go. You can even buy the Falafel balls by the pound.Enjoy!

6.description: i love this place. the dudes who run the place are super friendly. every time i go in there with my kid, he gets a free sesame cookie or falafel. i usually stop in here for some pickled turnips, harrissa, canned stuff, spices, tahini, or any other shit I'm looking for. everything is super cheap and authentic. they have amazing pastry selection and you can get a big tasty falafel sandwich for $2.50! where the fuck do you get such a deal like that? if you wanna make you're own falafels sandwiches at home, buy a dozen falafels for $3 and get a bag of pitas and homemade Jerusalem salad too! spinach pies or zattar bread is off the chain too. defiantly a little gem in albany park!

7.description: This small store disguises a pretty big selection.  I'm not a huge sweets person, so I can't really speak for the pastries.  But everything else is great and the prices are definitely cheap - $.99 pita bread, pre-cooked falafel ($2/doz), and a nice selection of canned foods.

8.description: Great Arab grocery - this one is good for baked goods and cookies! Has the usual array of semi-disorganized stuff jumbled together. Friendly and helpful owner.

0.description: I went to Feyrous today because we are cooking Molukhia tonight!  It is kind of like a stewed spinach dish but in English it's called Jews Mallow.  Still the BEST FALAFEL in the City, Bulgarian feta, Labna (yogurt), Olives, Apricot and fig jam, Spinach pies, pita bread, orange blossom honey, and the pink bag of tea.

4.description: Friendly Palestinian Bakery with that small bakery feel.  Wonderful selection of middle eastern sweets.I was looking for incense but actually needed the charcoal and found it here.I will be back to pick up more baklava.

12.description: Tina and Dollie were the florists for my wedding.  They did an amazing job on my flowers and my centerpieces were even better than I imagined. I think people were getting sick of me saying how much I loved my flowers throughout the night.  =)Both Tina and Dollie are wonderful to work with and made everything stress free. They are incredibly talented, and you can tell they truly love what they do. I would recommend anyone to use them for their event!

3.description: Tina and Dollie are brilliant, sweet, and wonderful women to work with.  They were the florist for my wedding and they did an absolutely amazing job.They did the personal flowers (brides bouquet, bridesmaids bouquets, corsages, flower girl pomander, and boutinerres). I showed them a picture of what I wanted the bouquet to look like and they copied it to a tee, well they actually made it look more amazing than the picture. I received compliments all day long and days after on my bouquet, the bridesmaids bouquets and pretty much all of the work. They are the super sweetest people to work with.  They are very patient, will listen to your ideas, offer great suggestions, and are just overall wonderful people you want to be working with when you are planning a wedding.  There prices are very reasonable compared to other florist in the city (I was a budget bride).  I will recommend them to any bride I talk to. They are fantastic!!

1.description: When people see my wedding pictures, "I love your flowers!" comes before "Oh you look so beautiful!"  I don't even mind :)  I am a flower-lover, and Tina and Dollie created what I wanted with my wedding flowers perfectly - a seriously eye-catching and gorgeous bouquet.I wanted texture, and maroon, and gerbera daisy, and touches of white - a nontraditional bride bouquet - and they pulled it off, adding in sweet pea which I didn't even know I liked.  Totally worth it and stunning in the pictures.Our table decorations (other than the flowers) were on the simple side - white linens, small favors, and your normal place settings, so I was depending on Tina and Dollie for the splashes of color and excitement in the center - and OH they came through.  I had classy square vases, loosely arranged flowers as I requested, with lots of texture, color, and most of all the daisies were there.We also had flowers on our cake, and I don't even know what was involved to make it happen but somehow they coordinated with our venue, cake baker and event planner to make a gorgeous arrangement of flowers on the cake.  Useful info about Tina and Dollie - if I remember correctly they're a pair of friends who do only weddings, and have done for years.  So, they don't have a "flower shop" but instead an office where they meet clients for appointments - Worked for me.  This was nice because with a May wedding, the flower shops I called were all preoccupied with Mother's Day, and were hemming and hawing about whether they could do a wedding so close.  The office is a bit hard to see from the road so just google the address and park - look for the big flower sign.    I worked mostly with Tina, and she was available by text, email or phone for confirmation and last minute details, which was really helpful.  Finally, on the quote they give they're very transparent about what each thing costs, so if you're trying to cut back you can ask about specifics instead of dealing with a "package deal" where you don't know where the money is going.  And, if you're trying to add something a few weeks beforehand you know how much it's going to add to the contract.

2.description: Tina and Dollie arranged the flowers for my wedding in September.  They were easy to work with, took the time to understand what I wanted, and delivered a perfect finished product.  I highly recommend their service to any bride looking for gorgeous flowers!

9.description: Tina & Dollie did the flowers for my wedding in November.  I can't remember where I initially found them, but probably on The Knot or WeddingWire.  I had seen a photo of a bouquet they did that was so vibrant and had such great texture, that I knew I wanted to consider them for my flowers, but was surprised that there weren't many reviews written about them.  I went out on a whim and met with Dollie one day at their new space on Kimball.  Dollie was so great and had tons of ideas, which was so helpful, because I needed guidance on what I really wanted.  I knew I wanted bright red and lots of texture.  Communication was good throughout, mostly e-mail contact, with my updated contract e-mailed to me every time I changed the number of flowers, or types of flowers I wanted.  They were so flexible.  The price quote was soo much cheaper than the other flower shop in Chicago I checked out too.  My budget was less than $1500.On the day of the wedding, Tina & Dollie showed up very early to the reception and set up everything, then hand delivered the personal flowers to my hotel room.   My bouquet was gorgeous & exactly what I'd imagined.  I got tons of compliments on my flowers & love looking at the pictures of them.  They were truly beautiful and I could have wanted nothing more.  I highly recommend Tina & Dollie to all brides looking for fabulous wedding flowers & don't want to spend a fortune!!

10.description: We worked with Tina for our wedding flowers, and she was fantastic. She worked around our budget and found ways to give us the look we wanted, without grabbing every last cent out of our pockets. The photograph we showed Tina of the centerpiece we wanted had some very interesting flowers that she hadn't heard of. She did her research and found a way to have them shipped in from New Zealand without adding extra cost to our total. Tina is soft spoken, calm, and easy to talk to. She listens to your ideas and takes them to a new level with her creative talent. Our flowers turned out beautifully, and I'll enjoy looking at them in photographs for years to come!

13.description: I LOVE Tina and Dollie.  I met them years back when they were fairly new.  I was a wedding planner and recommended many brides to them.  They are very accommodating when trying to work within your budget.  They are very sweet and pleasant to work with and very professional.  I even recommended them to my brother and his wife when they were looking for a florist.  The flowers for their wedding were beautiful.  I'm so happy to see how Tina and Dollie have grown through the years and now have a storefront location.  Way to go ladies!

16.description: I was referred to Tina & Dollie from a family friend who used basil and mint in their wedding flowers.  Tina & Dollie work and communicate together clearly and have unending energy.   It is obvious how dedicated they are to their craft and making each event unique.  I came with a portfolio of pictures of everything I wanted; Tina and Dollie took every idea and made it better, making every aspect of the of our wedding flowers unique.  At one point, I used the restroom, and by the time I came back, they had thrown together a mock boquet of what I'd have the day of the wedding!  It was a spectacular piece, just imagine the one the big day!  On the wedding day, when I walked into the venue I was stunned with what I saw, every arrangement, boquet and  centerpiece was just as we'd discussed, they were vibrant, well put together, and I still have a few centerpieces decorating the house: the flowers they use live so much longer than what I've experienced in the past.I highly recommend working with these efficient, professional and warm ladies.  They are the pros of the flower industry and its craft.

6.description: Tina and Dollie did the flowers for my wedding! Tina did an amazing job!  I told her I wanted elegant and simple spring-like! She out did herself. I gave her the color scheme and the one restriction of not using the Starburst lily and everything was gorgeous! I had the centerpiece pots that I wanted her to use and they created a beautiful display of flowers in each one.  They used different flower arrangements in each one and each were uniquely beautiful! I continue to receive compliments from people who attend the wedding! Just wonderful!

15.description: Tina and Dollie were one of the florist our wedding planner had recommended to us.  We met with two florists and loved Tina's energy.  We were the difficult clients that had very little idea of what we wanted.  Over a couple meetings she put two centerpieces together for us, one of which we loved and ended up using as the church flowers.  We liked the second one but didn't think it would work with the venue space (the piece she put together was exactly what we had described to her).  I called Tina and told her my concerns and asked for a fourth meeting.  When I arrived I found out Tina (without being asked) drove out to the suburbs to look at our venue space so she could help put together a centerpiece that would compliment the room.  She agreed that the last centerpiece would not work and we went back to the drawing board.  By this time our wedding was less than two weeks away and we had changed the entire color scheme.  There was no more time for sample centerpieces.  The first flowers I saw were the bouquets.  There are no words to describe how perfect they were.  My bouquet was exactly what I had pictured in my head.  We then arrived to the venue and my husband and I got to see the room before our guests arrived.  All the stress and time we spent looking at flowers and meeting with Tina had paid off.  The flowers were absolutely gorgeous and made the room come together.  I would highly recommend Tina and Dollie to anyone.  They will deliver!!!  Thank you so much for helping to make our wedding perfect!

0.description: Tina a Dollie were our wedding day flower saviors. I am so grateful to them for the beautiful work that they did & for their absolute professionalism, patience and compassion.A few weeks before our wedding, the person who was going to do our flowers proved that she was not up to the job.  Everything happens for a reason; A friend who is a caterer and event planner swooped in before panic could ensue and  recommended Tina and Dollie. We were on a tight budget and even tighter time frame, but Tina and Dollie came through in spades. Dollie listened closely, quickly understood our taste, made suggestions completely in line with what we had in mind but were only able to vaguely describe. That in itself is an art.Dollie was able to tailor the order to our budget without sacrificing quality. The price we paid was more than reasonable.When the flowers were delivered, they actually took my breath away. They even upgraded my bouquet. as a surprise.  For the reception, they didn't just design the centerpieces, but took in to account how they would look across the entire venue, varying the height to create an entire picture. The effect was stunning.The only sad thing that happened is that my bouquet got left in the limo after the ceremony on the way to the venue. But at least I have the pictures and the many compliments we have gotten for the work Tina and Dollie did.Dollie & Tina, thank you again for your stunning work. It was a serious pleasure to work with you.*I meant to give them 5 stars the first time I did this review - the 4 stars was a mistake on my part.

5.description: Out of all of our wedding vendors, I think I was most impressed with the work Tina and Dollie did for our wedding in July.  Throughout the entire process, Dollie was very professional, helpful and very sweet!Dollie's suggestions throughout the process were extremely helpful - given I am a clueless tomboy and don't know the first thing about flowers. :)  I gave her an idea of what colors I wanted incorporated and that I wanted to include the cattleya orchid in my bouquet since my mom named me after that flower.  This orchid was not the easiest to work with but my bouquet and all of the flowers were absolutely gorgeous.  I let Dollie know that we would be taking photos before the ceremony so she provided a couple extra boutonnieres in case the flowers wilted during our long photo session outdoors - they all lasted but it was great to have the extras as a backup.  I would recommend Tina and Dollie's services to anyone - the flowers were so beautiful and the service they provided was top notch!

11.description: I can't even begin to explain how wonderful these women are!  Beautiful work.  Fantastic patience with clients.  Punctual.  Smart.  They will bend over backwards to get the job and do it well.  As a person who is in a position to refer brides and corporate clients to florists, Tina and Dollie have never let me down.  They take the time to listen and do a presentation that pleases the eye as much as the clients and their guests.

8.description: Tina and Dollie did our wedding two weeks ago (September 1st), and the flowers were absolutely beautiful.  At the last minute we decided to add on two large bouquets to put on top of pillars at our outdoor ceremony, and I was shocked by how beautiful they were when they were delivered!  I hadn't really given many details, I just had said I wanted two large bouquets to sit on top of two plastic pillars from Hobby Lobby - and Tina did a great job at creating my very vague vision!Tina was our go-to for our floral needs, and she put together some pretty amazing arrangements.  The only issue was that she was not always timely with her responses to some of my questions through email, some questions never got answered, and I was very concerned a few days before the wedding because we hadn't confirmed delivery times or details at that point, and I was worried that the flowers wouldn't show up!  Luckily she got back to us and confirmed time of delivery, and the flowers were there when we arrived, fresh and beautiful as she promised.  Her flowers were stunning and she has great artistic skill at putting arrangements together (something I know nothing about!), but I would have liked more promptness in replies to emails and phone calls - that would have helped to lessen my worry and stress as the wedding day approached!

4.description: This review is long overdue!  Tina and Dollie were AMAZING.  I planned my wedding long distance last year and did most of my communication over email before actually meeting them in person.  Basically I sent email upon email of photos or dos and don'ts.  I probably sent a good 20 emails.  I don't know how they did it.  But when I went into their shop they had set up such beautiful samples of exactly what I was thinking but couldn't put into words.  I had wanted limes incorporated into the arrangements and they made these beautiful flowers with limes - so amazing!  The best part that the costs - very reasonable was a good bang for your buck!  They worked with my budget.On the day of they were on time and really so sweet.  I went up and hugged them when they arrived.  My bouquet was more beautiful than I could imagine.  I was so happy!  I would recommend anyone to use them (and I have btw).

14.description: I used Tina and Dollie for my wedding in September.  I worked primarily with Dollie and her work exceeded my expectations.   She instilled a confidence in me so that I didn't need to worry about anything the day of our wedding.  The flowers were amazing, unique and perfect for us.  Dollie was able to work with our budget and covered every detail.   I would definitely recommend them again.  Thanks so much, Tina and Dollie!

7.description: I micro-managed every single detail of my daughter's quinceanera except the flowers, and here's why: I had Tina and Dollie. Every time someone asked me what I was doing for tablescapes or flowers or decor I just said 'Tina and Dollie are handling that.' I know for damn certain I didn't pay enough for how absolutely stunning that room looked when they were done, and even my kitschy little idea of using empty Patron bottles as centerpieces was handled with grace and good taste - such that I had people asking me if they'd mind if I mimicked that setting! Tina, I'm usually pretty good with words but I know none of the words I've got can thank you and Dollie enough for putting into effect the vision I had for a room filled with light, delicate color, the sweetness of summer and the refined elegance that I dreamed about all those years. When my daughters hid the surprise flowers we were supposed to receive in the morning - and then forgot about them - I could not believe that Dollie went back to the shop and prepared a whole new set so that none of us would be without that special touch. You understood what that dream space looked like in my head from the very beginning and made our daughter's once-in-a-lifetime night magical. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart. ~ C.

1.description: Thanks a lot for my beautiful haircut . It's was a great experience.  Love the place .Christina owner super sweet , professional.  I have to be back soon for highlights. Can't wait. Personally very highly recommend.

9.description: I'll write a 5-star review, because I feel like it's the rating it deserves, however, don't clog up all the openings!

12.description: Cristina is a goddess. She's the only stylist I've ever stuck with. She's relaxed, fun, and will take awesome care of you. She really takes time to develop a relationship with you, and treats her customers like friends. I love her so. Get your hair cut here. Give her all your money.

21.description: I absolutely adore this salon. Supreme Beauty Parlor is a hidden gem right off the Francisco Brown Line stop. From the train station you can see the salon front and the pop of  turquoise on the wall one of the first things to catch my attention. Inside the salon it has a 60s flare which caters to my love of anything vintage and retro. I had my hair colored and styled by the owner and stylist, Cristina, and I love it! Cristina is a great stylist. She takes the time to ask questions about what you would like done to your hair. In the past, I've had stylists be rather curt on questions asking at most 2 questions which would result in me being rather upset or disappointed in my style because I didn't get what I wanted. With Cristina, that is not the case. As I stated before, she takes the time to get to know you and hair. These are definitely traits that I would I want to find in a stylist. A perfect example of this was when I went from mid-back length hair to a pixie because I needed a dramatic change so, I contacted Cristina showing interest. Upon consultation, she asked many questions to make sure that this is what I wanted and gave recommendations of what short styles would suit my face and personal flare. Been rocking the pixie cut ever since.Additionally, the salon carries a local beauty supply line, Bomber Betty Custom Cosmetics. Being a fan of the retro look, winged eye liner and the red lip, I was curious of the quality of the line. I was able to test/swatch a number of the lipsticks and I had to buy one. The texture is smooth and moisturizing as well as natural, paraben-free and cruelty-free. One random bonus of this salon that I haven't seen in any other in the city was while I waited I was asked if I would like a cup of coffee. Usually in salons, I sit awkwardly silent with the other clients and offered nothing or, in the off chance, I would be offered the rare cup of water. So, being a coffee drinker, my ears perked.If you want to get your hair styled by a considerate, talented stylist then definitely book an appointment at Supreme Beauty Parlor with Cristina.

16.description: I absolutely adore this salon. Supreme Beauty Parlor is a hidden gem right off the Francisco Brown Line stop. From the train station you can see the salon front and the pop of  turquoise on the wall one of the first things to catch my attention. Inside the salon it has a 60s flare which caters to my love of anything vintage and retro. I had my hair colored and styled by the owner and stylist, Cristina, and I love it! Cristina is a great stylist. She takes the time to ask questions about what you would like done to your hair. In the past, I've had stylists be rather curt on questions asking at most 2 questions which would result in me being rather upset or disappointed in my style because I didn't get what I wanted. With Cristina, that is not the case. As I stated before, she takes the time to get to know you and hair. These are definitely traits that I would I want to find in a stylist. A perfect example of this was when I went from mid-back length hair to a pixie because I needed a dramatic change so, I contacted Cristina showing interest. Upon consultation, she asked many questions to make sure that this is what I wanted and gave recommendations of what short styles would suit my face and personal flare. Been rocking the pixie cut ever since.Additionally, the salon carries a local beauty supply line, Bomber Betty Custom Cosmetics. Being a fan of the retro look, winged eye liner and the red lip, I was curious of the quality of the line. I was able to test/swatch a number of the lipsticks and I had to buy one. The texture is smooth and moisturizing as well as natural, paraben-free and cruelty-free. One random bonus of this salon that I haven't seen in any other in the city was while I waited I was asked if I would like a cup of coffee. Usually in salons, I sit awkwardly silent with the other clients and offered nothing or, in the off chance, I would be offered the rare cup of water. So, being a coffee drinker, my ears perked.If you want to get your hair styled by a considerate, talented stylist then definitely book an appointment at Supreme Beauty Parlor with Cristina.

17.description: I am thrilled to have a cool salon in the area.  Cristina is an artist and hair  is her medium.  I just got one of the best hair cuts and it did not cost me an arm and leg.  Salon is cute and I can't wait to go back.  Definitely worth checking out.

10.description: I have a very simple criterion for whether I will return to a hair-cutter joint: whether or not they give me a good haircut.  And Christina always does, so I'm a regular now.You know how some places have a haircut that they give all the guys?  You tell them what you want, they nod, then do what they do to everyone?  Well, not this place.  They listen and do a good job achieving your coiffure vision.  I make it harder than it probably needs to be on Christina and she always accommodates my narcissism.  Her recent hire, Nicole, did my last one, and she did a great job, too.Now, if you're into all the "other" stuff, this place has that, too.  Like I said, Christina is super cool and easy to joke with.  Her fella, Ross, is always around, and he's cool, too.  And big dogs.  And beer!  And she usually has good music playing too.If you're a dude who needs a regular place to get your hair cut, and if you're in the general area, you'd be a fool not to try this place.

5.description: such a cool, chill place. staff was super friendly and so welcoming. they fit me in at the last minute during a bit of a hair disaster and i am grateful. sonya did an amazing job saving my 'do. love this shop!!!

11.description: Supreme Beauty Parlor is my happy place!  I'm a dog and cat groomer, and they don't care what I look like.  At first I thought this was a blessing, until I looked in the mirror and realized I looked like I just escaped from a women's correctional facility.  I needed some serious HELP!Thankfully, I heard about Supreme Beauty Parlor through the grape vine, and booked an appointment.  Christina was AMAZING!!!!  My tired, dried out locks are now perfectly trimmed and colored.  Not only that, but my locks are also soft and shiny.  Words can't describe the transformation.  If you're looking for fabulous hair in a swank 60's setting, go to Supreme Beauty Parlor and ask for Christina.  She will make all your hair dreams come true!

22.description: Supreme Beauty Parlor is my happy place!  I'm a dog and cat groomer, and they don't care what I look like.  At first I thought this was a blessing, until I looked in the mirror and realized I looked like I just escaped from a women's correctional facility.  I needed some serious HELP!Thankfully, I heard about Supreme Beauty Parlor through the grape vine, and booked an appointment.  Christina was AMAZING!!!!  My tired, dried out locks are now perfectly trimmed and colored.  Not only that, but my locks are also soft and shiny.  Words can't describe the transformation.  If you're looking for fabulous hair in a swank 60's setting, go to Supreme Beauty Parlor and ask for Christina.  She will make all your hair dreams come true!

0.description: I've been stressed. The kind of miserably stressed where I'm not taking time for myself, not taking care of myself because everything is  "Now, now, right now, NOW!"I look like the walking dead- need a haircut, a manipedi, a nap and the ultimate luxury of time for all of this. I literally had a near-sexual dream of completely uninterrupted hair washing and drying. Because that is impossible at home. And Boyfriend said "Baby, I bought you salon time" and I cried.Christina cut my hair, styled it beautifully and made me feel gorgeous. I have a lot of dark hair. It grows crazy-fast. It is simultaneously baby-fine and really greasy if not washed daily. Many times, telling a stylist layers will only look stringy or frazzled get ignored and I wind up hacking it myself with kitchen scissors to some ridicule. Or the layers break off and look a constant ponytailed mess. Also, heavily styled processes are never going to happen. I do not own a curling iron, a straightening iron resided years in unopened packaging under the sink and rarely have the time to even plug in the hair dryer I own. I trust Christina and did not feel rushed or like any requests were unreasonable- which is great. So often told "we are going to do what you don't want anyway and then apply 40 super-greasifying products..." Not here! To have that confidence is rewarding- Thank you so much for listening to me. The space is comfortable and the vintage decor is charming and fun. Feels like the set of Mad Men making for escapism. My hair looks clean, smooth, sleek and soft. I really enjoyed it, hope you get to go soon, be pretty for the holidays and enjoy it too!

20.description: im not surprised to hear  how  good she is doing , Cristine has been cutting  my hair   for  a long  time and has  always  done  a great  job..i just can't  wait  to get a hair cut  in her new  place... hearing the new place  is awesome.....

19.description: I went there after reading all the positive reviews. Christina is friendly and offered me tea indeed. Very nice. I brought the photo of what I want and she told me she could "certainly" do it. The haircut on the photo was a challenging one, I was surprised she did not say something like "I will try". But she said "certainly". She cut my hair way too short than what was on the photo  and I left $45 and with a nice short, pretty simple haircut. I was given a bunch of explanations in the end of how my hair is different (too thick, too wavy). Ah, yes. She actually thought that she replicated the haircut on the picture.Chances are, she actually did NOT see the difference between what she did and what was on the picture I brought. So, nice place. Very relaxing. Benefits the neighborhood. Normally I would break into tears after being cut much shorter. My hair grows very slowly. But i wanted to be nice, since Christina is such a kind woman.So, go ahead and give it a try. Just do not expect too much in terms of actual haircut and ask for something simple. She will do what she can.

2.description: Great place! So glad I found it!!

18.description: Supreme is literally a few steps from the Brown line and in a great location.  But, it's Cristina that's the reason to go.  She can make anyone look good!  She's helped me grow my hair out and then cut it when I got tired of it.  She'll listen to what you want and works with what you got.  She'll show you how to maintain the look at home (which is always the hardest part of a new hair cut).  The salon is super cute and retro.  You can't go wrong with her super reasonable prices and welcoming atmosphere.

13.description: I've been getting my hair done by Christina, the owner, for about 2 years now. I will not have anyone else near my locks. She is absolutely amazing and takes so much pride in her work. I have VERY thick hair and when she first started working on it was an unruly, damaged colored mess. Now it's healthy, I'm always complimented on it and asked where to go. The salon is super cute and retro and you get to sit and enjoy a drink while getting your hair did for a very reasonable price. Love love love. Also, this is weird to mention, but as someone who has spent a lot of time in uncomfortable hair washing stations, the sink is really nice. I can't explain it, it just is.

4.description: I got an adorable haircut from Christina. Cute shop right near the brown line station. very affordable and Nice to support local small businesses!

6.description: I went here for a haircut a while ago and it was fabulous!! Though it was a little difficult to get an appointment, it was definitely worth it!!

15.description: Supreme Beauty Parlor is as charming as it gets. The space is lovely and filled with fun vintage items. But the best part is how you will look once you walk out the door! Christina and Kate are incredibly talented- not to mention witty and fun. The salon is right across the street from the Francisco el stop AND a pie shop. How awesome is that??!?

7.description: Quite place on Saturday afternoons, but good hair cut, good price, good service.

8.description: I bring my 2 year old here for haircuts, and we love it!  The place is afordable, easy to access, and super cute!

3.description: Found this place on yelp ...I'm always hesitant to go to a new salon in fear of a horrible cut. However, I trusted the reviews and fortunately was able to book with Christina that same day. She did a great job, she offered her opinion and convinced me completely. I always appreciate a hair stylist that knows what works for each client. She's the professional..not me. Looking forward to my next appointment with her.

14.description: Cristina is amazing, I took my 7 year that hates hair cuts to see her.  My daughter was so comfortable with Cristina, she did an amazing job and now my other two girls have appointments for next week.  Super excited about our new awesome salon!

1.description: This well-supplied independent family-run pharmacy is notable for the wide selection of Korean gift and household items stocked in the attached "Modern Gift" shop and its large Shishido cosmetics sales area.  They also have a good selection of Zojirushi products, including "Mr. Bento" insulated lunchboxes, rice cookers, and instant hot water dispensers.

0.description: Modern Pharmacy is neither modern, nor a pharmacy.  Discuss amongst yourselves.This is my go-to for Shiseido supplies.  I feel like they have a different selection than the department stores, but it's been so long since I have bought Shiseido stuff elsewhere that I can't even compare.  At Modern Pharmacy, they give bigger and better samples.  They also sell many Korean food items and tea, sake sets and other pottery wares, hula hoops with magnetic roller balls implanted in them for some reason, luggage, rice cookers, nail polish, shirts, hats, cactus honey powder, and a few other make-up lines such as IOPE and The Amore.  Oh, and some antique furniture.Best non-modern non-pharmacy in town.

1.description: This Serbian store is somewhat hidden amidst the many restaurants and stores on Lawrence Ave.  It's easy to walk by and not notice it.  But I was curious to see what they offered and checked the place out recently.They have everything Serbian - Serbian CDs, DVDs, books, flasks, t-shirts, souvenirs, religious paintings, traditional clothes, and more.  Definitely a must see place for those of you who are of Serbian descent, and non-Serbian people like me who are just plain curious.  I honestly don't know of any other Serbian stores in Chicago (there are a few Serbian restaurants and churches, though), so this place is a unique sight.

0.description: Drive west on Lawrence Ave. to the once predominantly Jewish neighborhood of Albany Park and now find a real melting pot of many cultures working and doing business together.  It's really a paradise of adventure for those that are seeking and hunting for the unusual, the imported and the unique.Discover Srpska Tradicijia (Serbian Tradition) and if you're a collector of icons, this is like discovering oil in your backyard.  There are countless religious icons here, mainly of Serbian style, that are just magnificent. All sizes and varieties and pricing from $6.00 on up.  All Byzantine or Orthodox icons are quite similar in what is being depicted however, a sharp eye can tell them apart from the Greek, Russian, Serbian and Ukrainian styles, as well as that of many other countries too numerous to mention.Srpska Tradicija also has many videos, CD's, books, folk art, ethnic dolls, clothing and pottery but, it's tremendous display of icons are certainly the lure for any iconic connoisseur.This is a Serbian Store of heritage and pride but, you would be amazed at how wonderful, a fun item from this select store would enhance your living space.  Street parking is difficult and congested but, don't let that deter your curiosity.  You just might find a store around the corner, that has something just  as marvelous, that nobody else knows about, yet that is!

When compared to the soccer store inside the Mitchell Mall; Only Sport Soccer blows it out of the water. Much larger selection nestled inside an actual store allows them to stock a much larger amount of stuff; including a very large selection of cleats and jerseys. Also available are athletic bags, team bags, playing socks, shin guards, zip ups, scarves, other supporters gear like wristbands, posters, t-shirts, etc. Jersey's are Mostly Mexican League and national team stuff, with a large selection of premier league jerseys, and other big name teams (mostly top teams from Italian Serie A, French Ligue 1, La Liga [Espana], some Brazilian and other South American clubs). They also have a smattering of club-correct shorts to match jersey's. Definitely a great selection here.It's local, so it's the way to go. They do take credit cards, but it was all screwed up when I went. Ca$h is king. Prices are typical for jersey's, anywhere from 60-80. If you're well liked and not obnoxious you'll probably get a few bucks knocked off. I'll definitely be returning here.

3.description: Good food, horrendous service, and highly incompetent delivery. Only order if you plan on picking up. If you call to request something, or to resolve an issue, you better speak fluent Spanish (like I do), or you're out of luck.  With service so Indifferent and unsympathetic, it does not matter how good the food is.

1.description: This place has potential if it wasn't for the horrible service you get from the waitresses.  I'll start with the good:Excellent foodGood PricesNow the bad:ServiceWait time for foodThe Extremly Loud musicThe food was excellent and it was decently priced.  However, after taking our order we did not see our waitress for another 25 mins.  She came to say that the kitchen is really busy because there was a lot of orders.  However, the restaurant was not even half full.  When the Dj stopped playing the ridiculously loud music I could hear other tables complain that they should just get up and leave since they had not received their food either, and they were there before we were.  We finally got our food after 40 mins of waiting, and while most of the food was delicious some of it was cold.  The main issue with this place is the wait staff, just simply horrible.  Some waitresses were even watching their own kids by the bar while waiting on tables.  I would only go back if they changed some of those issues there.

2.description: The service here was bad for my first visit, which was yesterday. I went with a guy friend, the waitress totally put her back on me and talked to him. I didnt even hear a word she said, i asked my friend what did she say? Because obviously i didnt hear anything. He just said that what we wanted to order. I felt like that was a total disrespect, i was recomended there for the food. But if their service is this bad and disrespectful then never again! By the way we just left, didnt order anything and never came back nor are we. This place was just terrible and it was on my firsr visit. Smh... i dont recomend this place if youre young and if you go with friends or a couple because i herd rhe waitress ignores the ladies and keeps her eye on the males... smh disrespect.

5.description: I have been to E lVelero de Nayarit twice since last summer (2014). At the time I saw one review on yelp & it was negative. The person particularly complained about the service. I'm not sure if that person & I had dinner in the same place. My girlfriend & I were served  by two teenagers who couldn't have been more solicitous, attentive, and charming - a couple of really nice kids. The food was terrific. We had the charolada velero. It was incredibly flavorful. Subsequent to that visit I had the fish Veracruz. I can't remember, maybe it was snapper, some kind of white fish. What ever the case, this was likewise spectacular. This style is a particular favorite of mine & this was the best I've ever had.  My advice is to enjoy this restaurant while you can, before it's "discovered".

6.description: Love the food here.  No frills decor and it can get noisy, but that's all part of the charm.  If you can put up with 3 TVs that often blast 3 different shows as a jukebox cranks ranchero music simultaneously, you'll be rewarded with excellent Mexican style seafood.

7.description: Had I searched Yelp and found no entry for this restaurant prior to my visit, I should perhaps have had second thoughts about bringing my wife and kids here. But I actually took my chances and went to the restaurant once on a weekday when not one other customer was seated.  The service was attentive and friendly. I promised them I would bring my family to sample their food...what a mistake I made.This time unfortunately our experience was unforgivable.  After seating ourselves, we waited approximately 10 minutes before the server approached our table.  She attempted to hand us menus but I had to ask her (in Spanish) to please clean the table. (The waitress would be best described as a beauty school dropout who must have begged the owner for a second chance.)  After clearing the table, she gave us the menus and disappeared for another 10 minutes.She took an order that included two appetizers as well as their Sunday special of the day, a shrimp cocktail. In addition to the appetizers, we ordered a $40.00 tray of langostinos (prawns) , their specialty of the house as our main course.  While we were waiting for our appetizers, she brought out a tostada of ceviche (on the house) with a single plastic fork  for four of us to share.When our appetizers appeared, she first tried to tell an adjacent table that they had ordered the food she placed before them. After looking at us, she sheepishly relocated the plates to our table even though we still hadn't been provided with any setups (knife, fork & spoon) and she just left the food and walked into the back. I got up and found where the silverware was stored and proceeded to give myself the McDonald's experience at 20 times the price.  I could not find any plates so I asked her to bring them when she caught me red handed.Two minutes later she tried to serve up the main course.  We told the waitress to bring it back until we had completed our appetizers.  Unfortunately, my wife had a bad gut feeling about what they might do to our food in the kitchen, so I went back up to the bar and asked for our check (and also told her that my wife was afraid to eat the food.)  The waitress blamed the kitchen staff for all of the problems but I would say she deserved 80% of the culpability. (The other 20% can go to whoever made the hiring decision as well as the training or the lack thereof that was provided.)It pains me to write this review because I really wanted to support this local business. Sadly, I cannot see myself ever bringing another person to this restaurant.

8.description: Prior to visiting El Velero de Nayarit I read the previous review posted. Living in the neighborhood, I always wanted to stop by. El Velero is the only sea food restaurant in the area, if not for this restaurant I would have to travel far to another sea food restaurant. The previous review made me wonder whether or not I should stop by. In the end however, I decided to give it a shot. I was EXTREMELY happy with my choice. I feared I would be greeted with bad service but in reality I was welcomed warmly and offered wonderful service. I asked the waitresses (whom were very beautiful if I may add from the shortest to the tallest!) if they had new employees or a new chef. Her response was that there was new waitresses and cooks. The food was EXQUISITE, the waitresses were BEAUTIFUL and HELPFUL, and the owners were very FRIENDLY I was even offered a free drink. I felt silly thinking I was not going to stop by because of the review I had read earlier on. Since I live in the area I plan on coming more often and bringing family and friends.I believe previous bad service was due to former workers. The owners informed me of trouble they were experiencing because of them. In the end, I felt the owners and workers were truly genuine. W/ this new service I am sure the business will prosper!!GIVE IT A CHANCE & STOP BY!!!!

0.description: Okay, admittedly the front end of this place is a mess, but they clearly know what they are doing in the kitchen, AND the have some really good seafood to do it with.  First of all, let me say, I have only been once, but if I lived in Chicago, I would definitely go again.  My wife agrees.Bad stuff first, yes it is a noisy place with TV's going and blasting music and vinyl flooring, which doesn't help.  What we put up with for good seafood!  At a reasonable price! But yes,  the wait staff (one young lady) was kinda clueless, but nice.   And they do seem to pay more attention to the to go orders. Also, the restaurant does seem to be having some other issues. Cash only and no alcohol!  Not a real problem.  The grocery store across the street has a cash machine and the liquor store one block west has cold wine and beer. Cheaper that way, anyway.The food.  Ah, the food!  We had the shrimp ceviche. Simple. Nicely done.  My wife ordered the seafood mocajete and I had the shrimp (camarones) diabla.   The shrimp were nicely prepared (e.g. not over cooked) with a simple spicy sour sauce.  Not overly complex, but good.  The mocejete was another matter. Lots of seafood with the best, most complex sauce of any mocajete we have ever had.  I got to have some too.  Delicious!Back to the diabla.  I really wanted to order the zarandeado, but it is for more than one and not cheap.  I love this dish when it is done right, but even in Mexico, I have had it  wonderfully prepared and awfully prepared.  So at the last minute I changed my order and got something I did not really want.  On reflection, I probably would have ordered oysters.  Did I mention that they have fresh oysters on the half shell, And oysters cooked in a variety of ways.If you live within 10 miles of the restaurant be sure to go, put up with the defficiencies to get great seafood at a reasonable price.

4.description: Wow, where do I start? Oh I know, Mexican Mexican Mexican delicious cuisine that is focused on seafood! I came in yesterday for a take out, about 12 pm. The atmosphere in this place is not the greatest. It looks spacious but they haven't used this great space for their advantage. The walls are covered in mirrors and they have lights of a different color.Any who, concentrating on the food.. ITS DELICIOUS!!  This is not your typical place where you eat cold boiled shrimps, cocktail sauce and a wedge of lemon on the side. This food is phenomenal and affordable.I had the caldo de camaron (picoso) which is a spicy shrimp broth. Well guys they don't play around with the heat! I think the broth was made of habanero peppers! lol than I had coctel de camaron, really flavorful! They added octopus too! And last but not least I order charolada velero it was a combination of prawns, crab legs and lots of shrimps swimming in their huichol sauce!  Oh god as I am writing this I want to go running and eat there again!  I walked out with food enough for 5 people on a bill of $67.54. Yes it may sound scary but in other seafood restaurants a bill for 5 people will leave you broke! Yikes I am coming back Velero, I am!

1.description: Yow how does Crafty Beaver stay in business?  I am trying to build a custom table for a very small area in my kitchen using materials from my on going kitchen remodeling.  I went to one of the stores close to where I live and there were no cars in the lot except me.  I had a specific item I was looking for that Dan was able to help me with.  He was very helpful, but in terms of what products the store carries its very small and very limited.  I suppose they do serve a purpose, but it seems to be a dying breed with all the large home improvement stores like Home Depot, Menards & Lowes

9.description: Home Depot sucks. You can never find anyone, and when you do, they know two things about hardware: jack and sh*t, and they're pretty weak on jack. Sure this store is smaller -- but how big would Home Depot be without the garden center, appliances, jillion light fixtures, and attempts to sell you a kitchen? All the weird little bits you can never find at Home Depot, you can find here. And if you can't, help is always available. They've even custom ordered garden tools for me that they don't stock. Their prices are good, and they carry lines of products that Home Depot doesn't.If nothing else, I'd bet that your tax dollars weren't swept away in a TIF to build and maintain Crafty Beaver -- google the Home Depot on Kimball to see how we all got robbed on that deal.Why not the 5th star? Well, they're not open as late or as early as the other guys. But think of how much time you waste wandering around Home Depot hoping you'll find the one person in the store who isn't there on a work release program.

12.description: I use to live 5 mins from this location, but that has not stopped me from frequenting them now. This is a great little hardware store and as others have mentioned, they have a pretty good selection considering their size. I have gone there to get anything from keys made for my boss to a toilet seat to a 2x4 to seal up my back door. Don't ask, crazy ex...But each visit, they have always been accommodating and never make me feel out of place just because I am female. This type of un-bias is appreciated!

21.description: This is one of their older stores. They have all your hardware needs covered.  The deals here are amazing. I check their sales flyer from time to time also. If you are building a patio or deck you may want to stop by here and check this store out.

16.description: This neighborhood hardware store is part of the Crafty Beaver/Do It Best chain. It is not a bad place to pick up supplies, although nowadays it is dwarfed by the Home Depots of the world. The prices are not too bad at this store.
