17.description: Having grown up in a small town where customer service is king and everyone at any given store knows you and what you need firsthand, one can imagine how big box stores can turn me off.  Crafty Beaver on Montrose in Chicago is the antithesis of all of those big box stores.  Not only is their selection still good (and they have things that the big boxes just ignore), they continue to excel at serving their customers.  I frequent this location for a lot of my little projects, but after my experience today, I had to sign up on Yelp to create this review.  I had mis-measured and purchased a relatively small amount of fir flooring in the wrong length.  The worst part was that I had had already had them cut existing stock to length.  I knew the policy was that they would not take this merchandise back, but I brought it anyway when I went to purchase the correct lengths.  They made a decision to take it back even though it had been cut.These guys have always taken care of me even though I am not a contractor or even someone who might be considered a "regular."  After today's awesome experience, I will make it a point to try them first for all of my home improvement and project needs.Thanks, Rick, and all the folks working at the Montrose location!

10.description: I have been a fan of Crafty Beaver for some time now. The hardware store ain't bad either.

5.description: Glad we found this alternative to the Home Despot.  While the selection is obviously not as wide, they have most of the common things a homeowner needs for regular repair and maintenance.  Their staff is very helpful and friendly, although there was one occasion in which I got a well-intended but incorrect piece of information.The prices here are great, and there is ample parking.  Check it out!

11.description: WOW!!!  This place makes me feel so at home!!  Okay, so I am not the sabbiest  when it comes to hardware, plumbing, and such.. Yet, this place makes me feel so comfortable to ask all kinds of questions!It always seems that the sweetest people answer the phone.I just spoke to Katie who has to be the sweetest customer rep. I have ever spoken to in a Hardware Store.  She was extremely kind.. calling me back a few times to get me a promo code discount.  I am so happy they are just around the corner from me!!  A great pleasure to do business with!!This beats going to Home Depot.. in fact, it doesn't even compare.  For this kind of service, I wouldn't even mind paying a little more.  Yet, they actually charge LESS and carry items home depot doesn't even have.The best part is that they actually KNOW what you're talking about.. and really work to give you the best options.I must remind myself to look here first whenever I need a "crafty" supply...  :)

3.description: Friendly, knowledgable, helpful, and just plain pleasant service. Always a breath of fresh air after having to go to Home Depot. I wish CB had a bigger store, because I would never go to Home Depot, except for when CB doesn't have what I need. All in all though, I love these guys! Selection may be limited in some respects, but they do all the services you expect from a hardware store-including some HD doesn't (hellooooo lawn mower rental!). Support local businesses!

0.description: I just moved into the neighborhood and dread heading over to Home Depot. It's no Home Depot, way smaller, but they have most everything you could need for most projects. To me it's the perfect neighborhood hardware store. I've had keys made here, propane exchange, bought random tools and hardware so far it's been a great experience.

20.description: This neighborhood hardware store is part of the Crafty Beaver/Do It Best chain. It is not a bad place to pick up supplies, although nowadays it is dwarfed by the Home Depots of the world. The prices are not too bad at this store.

19.description: I love this hardware store. It is big enough to have everything you need but not to big that you feel lost in the store. The prices are very reasonable & the staff is very knowledgable. I will continue to shop there.

2.description: I own a small flooring company and I go here often. The customer service here is great . The employees are very friendly and helpful . They are always willing to order something for me if it isn't there. It's a nice change of pace from the big chain stores that hire people that know nothing about the business. I highly recommend stopping in if you haven't yet.

18.description: My favorite hardware store. Small and organized, with friendly helpful people. I like the fact they have individual screws to buy so I can mix and match what I need or sometimes want to try.

13.description: Can definitely save some cash here if you check on their specials. Not a one stop shop, but great to have in the neighborhood especially when disaster strikes at home and need supplies quick! Sales people are really knowledgable and nice as well.  Oh, and sign up for their loyalty program - they send coupons in the mail!

4.description: Not as much personal assistance that you get from the Big Box over at  Menard's, but depending on what you need...it will suffice.  I saw that they had cedar mulch on sale this week for $2.89 per bag, and decided to get some (or four) in celebration of Polish Constitution Day.  If you ask the guy working there, who has "just a tiny bit of Polish blood in him", to help you find what you are looking for, you will get ignored completely.  But, once you show him your receipt for what you purchased, the mulch plus one lemonade, he will gladly throw the four heavy bags of red cedar mulch (aka Sunrise Blend) in your car for you and you will be on your happy, Polish Princess way.  Jinkewya.

6.description: Need tools?? Need "Materials"?? Well you can get it all from your local Beaver, Crafty Beaver that is. Why a Beaver you ask, well aren't Beavers crafty?? I mean if you called it the Crafty Goose, (which could mean something completely different to you) it wouldn't have that same spark. Besides I like Beavers and I would hope that they're crafty or they wouldn't be as much fun. Clearly I have no idea what I'm talking about anymore and I'm just rambling to this review some depth.It's a hardware store, like Ace but with a better name. Prices are reasonable and the staff is helpful for the most part. Overall, it makes me smile every time I pass by, but that's for a different reason then most... well, probably not the silly people I know. HeheSkip the depot and make your way down to the beaver...

15.description: This place is just a joy. The staff are always so helpful, and they always have what I need, without long waits or having to traverse vast acres of store to get it.  Went to get some keys cut one evening and the service was amazingly swift, friendly and the keys worked beautifully. There's a handy parking lot and prices are very fair. Plus I love the retro vibe. Long may you run, Crafty Beaver.

7.description: I am biased towards adorable animals, including anthropomorphic ones. Crafty Beaver is seriously the cutest business name and logo. It's not at all cheesy, but "whimsical". In need of studio supplies, I headed to Crafty Beaver after some price research. I was on a tight budget, and to my delightful surprise, I managed to spend little here. Upon entrance and throughout my shopping, I was helped by several people. I know nothing about tools or anything, so I get lost very easily in hardware stores. While obviously Crafty Beaver (ugh, so cute) has a smaller selection than Home Depot, there are sweet deals. The employees informed me of a major sale, which saved me money in the end. ALWAYS, always a plus.Don't judge Crafty Beaver on its appearance. Sure, the building is old and dull-looking, but it is bigger than Ace Hardware, and the helpful employees are easier to find than Home Depot. Their deals are comparable, if not better than other stores. TOTAL awesomeness.(FYI: Crafty Beaver is in Albany Park. Irving Park is literally across the street on the south side. Psh, learn your Chicago neighborhoods.)

8.description: Leave Home Depot behind and go to the Crafty Beaver.  This is my neighborhood hardware store and I don't like to shop anywhere else.  There are always people ready to help and show you where things are.  As a woman you might feel intimidated in a hardware store, but not here.  These folks are pro's and only want to help you get the stuff you need.  Seasonal specials are great and you can rent equipment cheap and easy.  Oh, and get a t-shirt.  Your friends will be jealous.

14.description: Excuse me- wht ihdbkieohg; ksdporjteoriha oghepgogajpokr eparpangpj mepak HUH?? WHAT?? Wait, what are you saying? That is pretty much what it sounds like to me when people are talking in "hardware" language.  Hubby and I  SUCK at all things hardware related, so you can imagine our devastation when the central air went out this summer in the midst of a week of 90 degree days. After two days of us trying to figure it out (totally stupid I know) my dad came to the rescue, probably because he was sick of hearing me complain about not having air (dad's are good like that). All we needed was a new thermostat he said. Ok, great let's go to Crafty Beaver! I called them first, the guy asked me all these questions and when I explained to him that he needed to describe these questions in detail kind of like he was talking to an 8 year old HE ACTUALLY DID! lol. After the call we drove to the Crafty Beaver and got exactly what we needed with some pointers on installing it and were on our way. That evening just because we could, we froze ourselves out! NICE!Great Service and great location with parking! We will return (hopefully not soon)!!

1.description: Chicago's premier custom bag maker, WIG is a steadily growing business.  I own a WIG bad and use it daily to carry my work clothes, groceries and other purchases on my back when commuting around the city on my bike.WIG will make any bag to your specs, taking into account your size, gender, color and pattern preference and about anything else you can imagine.  The outfit (no pun intended) is run by Isaac and his partner Wendy.  Isaac a professional tailor who has experience sewing things such as kevlar bullet-proof vests for police, work wear and uniforms for all sorts of professional.  He also makes knickers, frame pads (for your bikes top tube to protect it from dings), hip packs and about anything else you can imagine.  He's made bags for not only bikers, but also for numerous professionals around the world such as photographers, professional chefs, musicians and martial arts enthusiasts.  Plus the WIG team  are about the nicest and most courteous people that you will ever meet, especially in Chicago.Need a custom bag to carry just about anything on your back or on your bike?  Get in touch with WIG and he'll hook you up.

0.description: So because the highly custom nature of this bag I had some input on it after using it for a while. I sent an email to Issac and Wendy asking if I could hire some "hours" to make a few modifications to my bag. I did not want it to seem like I could design it better, but I had some ideas. I had no idea how this would go over!Get back into town, set up a time and ride up there to meet with Issac. We replaced a buckle, moved a strap and designed a couple of ways to hold some items in place while you're riding. Amazing.I have no idea were else you could even begin to look for this level of service. And it's so rad that they, themselves, ride bicycles and understand the ins and outs of hauling stuff on two wheels. When it came to payment, they refused, but I threw some money on the table and left before they could say much more.Sweet!Truly Amazing!

Great prices, lots of sheets, comforters, blankets, rugs curtains household items and so much more..... I found them on the "LEVEL UP" app, then went to the store. Free parking on Lawrence on Sunday. Otherwise "Pay To Park", thank you Rahm....
Great placeMiddle eastern grocery storeEgyptian Gifts Have All Tobacco Brands All FlavorsAll Hookah Brands And Accessories

3.description: Surprsing location. Huge store. Super helpful salesman. Some knock-offs, some real designers. Not ultra-cheesy, like some "modern" spots. Custom orders can take 6 weeks, though, so buy off the floor if you want it now.

1.description: I am very disappointed that I came here for my bed. I received a call 25 minutes into my delivery time informing me that my item could not be delivered as scheduled. The attempt was to redeliver at another day. I rearrange my schedule for the current date and shouldn't have to take off from work for a redelivery. Buyer beware.

2.description: We went to Modern Home to look for furniture for our new place.  We went in Sunday clothes, and do look a bit younger than we are, and were treated like we were not qualified enough to buy anything.  As a high end salesperson myself, that was strike one in my book.  Strike two was the ridiculously rude and pushy lady that attempted to speak to us.  She did not listen to any of our needs, and kept talking over us.  Then she kept leaving us everytime she thought she saw someone that looked wealthier walk by.  We loved some counter stools there, but needed to measure our counter in our new home first.  She went so far as to say that she had a guy who could saw off the bottom if they ended up being too tall.  Um, why couldn't we just go home and measure first?  She said they might not be available in the future.  Ok, well we were moving in two weeks, not two years.  Strike 2.AND the prices were extremely inflated for bargaining.  I'd rather just get a great bottom price rather than having to guess how much lower they can go.  Everytime we tried to object or walk out the door another $50 came off the price, even after she'd already given us her "best price." Strike 3.I don't typically write reviews unless I've bought something, but I was pretty disgusted with this experience.  Not recommended.

0.description: We recently bought a Mobican king bedroom set ($3000) and sectional ($3000) from here. I think we got a good deal on the bedroom set considering what was quoted us at Design Studio for a similar style. We were able to negotiate the price of both purchases, and received about $500 (maybe a little more) off each. We also negotiated for free delivery and setup so that saved us a little bit more. Our salesman (Deprece) was very helpful and answered all our inquiries. Also, we didnt pay in full until we received our bedroom set. We paid 70% of the total at the time we placed the order; I've heard horror stories about furniture stores so I was weary about paying in full and they obliged. We've received our bedroom set but are still waiting on our sectional, which was a custom order. Once we receive our sectional, I'll update this review. For the time being, I'm going to give this four stars. If everything goes smoothly with our sectional, I'll give this place 5 stars. After shopping around, we learned that we would have to wait a couple of months for the pieces of furniture we wanted so we did place our order a few months before moving into our new place. If you want it "now" then I'm sure you can negotiate a good price for floor models.Update: Got our couch and are very happy with it. Would definitely go back there.

4.description: Want to give your house a complete make-over with the latest home furnishings? Then this is the place to go. Cheap prices, great stuff, and next day delivery, what could be better than that?!?!?!

0.description: Baladna which the English Arabic word for "Our Country" and meaningful and wonderful place to buy or sell jewelry.Customer service is very helpful and informative to its customers and quick to work as fast as possible regardless how busy it is. The staff gives excellent prices on all sorts of jewelry. Regardless whether you like to come in to buy or sell, Baladna takes care of you as one of their own kin.Compared to most jewelry stores, you feel much right at home. You get the proper clarification of the right prices and the right offer compared to most companies that give you the 'bull' rather the real deal. I will say I have came to this place more often in a year than any other places only because I get treated as a friend, as a customer, & or even as a proper individual.They buy & sell between 14k-18k-21k-22k. They do not buy precious stones.

28.description: Love this place. The food is consistent and never disappoints. Monster wraps are large and filling. If you walk in and make your order be prepared to wait-- The kitchen makes everything to order.

1.description: I can't believe they just told me there closed at 8:45 and won't deliver. Last order he said is 8:45 . Exactly I called at 8:45. That's lame. I won't call again.  Already before they sold me uncooked meat. That's two times now they messed up, I won't be calling again.

9.description: Great Persian cuisine. Chicken kabab is out of this world so is dill rice. You can bring your own bottle of wine but corking fee is quite pricey. Definitely recommend this place

29.description: Three Words. Listen to me. Three Words. Spicy Pomegranate Wings! These spicy, sweet, tart, savory wings are delicious. It is a Persian party in your mouth. These wings are slow roasted and then slathered in a savory pomegranate glaze. I destroyed this wings and they were only the appetizer. Ok, listen to me again. Four Words...Joujeh-on-the-Bone. You would think I was sick of poultry after devouring all the wings, but this Cornish Hen was a great entree. Marinated, skewered and then char-boiled to absolute perfection. Juicy, savory, a little smokey and everything I ever wanted to do to a Cornish Hen. This was served over perfectly cooked Dill Rice, grilled onions and tomatoes and lemons to squeeze over for a tangy complement.This meal was absolutely delicious and it was all delivered to my apartment in about a half an hour. I would suggest Noon O Kabab to anyone who loves succulent, savory, smokey and scrumptious poultry.

23.description: Dear Kibbideh kabob and dill rice,          Kibbideh, it's been too long since the last time I ate you for lunch.  I once missed your company and attempted to make a reasonable facsimile with ground lamb and ground beef, green onions and parsley...It didn't go too well, in fact, it just made me miss you more.  Dill rice, if I even had an idea as to how to capture your delicious essence and create something similar in taste, I would trade all my goats for that nugget of knowledge.  But alas, it is a secret that will never be spoken.  And I suppose the only way to get this most excellent joining of herbs, carbs and protein are to visit noon o kabob.  Until we meet again....                                                                                        Keith

5.description: Great food. Huge portions.Friend Joanne W has been raving about this place and even though I hate raisins in anything other than oatmeal raisin cookies, she persuaded me to try the Shirin Polo. Persian white rice topped with finely shredded pistachio, orange peel jam, shredded carrots, golden raisins and Persian barberry. Along with the rice I wanted to try the pomegranate mushroom--another suggestion by JW and suggested by the online menu.  I also wanted to try the lamb kebab and got a chicken kebab for the kid. I ordered at the location and was quoted 15 minutes and my order was ready in more like 10 minutes. The Shirin Polo and mushrooms was just delicious.  It's on the sweet side and I'm one that doesn't care for anything sweet in a savory dish but somehow, I didn't mind the sweetness in this.  The rice was cooked perfectly and all the flavors complemented/blended well.  Between lamb and chicken at a Persian restaurant, I always lean toward lamb. But here, the chicken won out. Juicy and flavorful, just so well-made.  The lamb, meh. dry and bland. Like I said earlier, huge portions. Leftovers well into the next day. Friendly service. 'Easy on the wallet. Small parking lot (yay!). Can't wait to try some other dishes!

31.description: im giving this place a 3 for a few reasons..first let me give the positives..the staff is unbelievable..they are soooo nice and friendly..i was welcomed with a warm greeting from a lady who i thought was persian..she was soo friendly..i loved her..she offered me great advice on places to see, places to live, and helped me with the menu..while i ordered the kabab sandwich..it was OK..the price was good..but, not what i had expected..i was super hungry, there was another patron who was chit chatting away with me, and honestly would not let me eat..which pissed me off..but, that is no fault as to why im giving a 3..the take out area, is small..of course it is for take out..i didnt know that..i ordered their ghormeh sabzi becuase i wanted to compare it with the dish i had at masouleh's and took that order to go..when i ate it at home, it sucked!!! Bigtime..it is made by the owners sister, and honestly, when compared to the one at Masouleh..no comparison..Masoulehs 7 starrs..this one, 1 and that isbeing nice about it..i guess i am picky..but it didnt taste anything like how it should..dont order the ghormeh sabzi..the sandwich is ok..i would order it if you are starving, and need something to fill your stomach..but even then, i would think twice about it, and maybe opt for eating at the resturant at a sit in enviornment..i was told that they have great kababs..maybe ill stop by the resturant area and try it..as far as the take out is concerned..ill pass..the staff on the other hand, loved them..the food, it was blah..

25.description: I had the Lamb Wrap for lunch and it quite tasty. I recommend it as the portion is great by itself. I couldn't finish it as i was curious as to how much or big this wrap was going to be. The wait wasn't too long and it's definitely a place for carry out.

12.description: The food is very good but to me, a bit overpriced? This is just the takeout side of the restaurant. What was curious to me today was while I was overlooking the takeout menu, two different guys went out of their way to ask me if I was looking for the restaurant. No, I got it, thanks! I don't know if they were being helpful or they just didn't have a clue I was already there for several minutes perusing the menu.....hmmm.

37.description: There was a month when I was working long days along with a vegan. Due to his choosen diet, we could only order from two places for lunches and dinners.... Noon-O-Kabab and a vegetarian Thai place.... so basically I ate Noon-O-Kabab meals at least once a day if not twice a day for about 30 days.... and I stand here today telling you I would do it again in a heart beat! With some places one might get tired of their food so many times in a row... but with Noon-O-Kabab the more I had it the  more I craved it. So flipping good! The feta wraps were amazing! The hummus and pita bread and skewered meat (yes, I ate it right in front of my vegan friend... all sorts of meats too... he was nice about it...)... he got some sort of spicy veggie plate that he ordered and ordered and ordered day after day. The delivery guy got to know us very very well after a few days... recognized my voice from whatever phone I called him on.  Why oh why are they not open 24 hours a day?!!!

21.description: I will make this quick. When I walked in, a customer was placing a large catering order with the only available cashier. All of a sudden Jose came to the rescue. He must have saw my fustration - I was waiting a long time. Jose stepped up, took my order and never stopped smiling or maintaining eye contact. When I went back to pick it up, he greeted me at the door, handed me my order and said "Thank you so much for your patience, I put something extra in your bag" WOW! Sadly, two hours passed before I could even open my bag, but when I did, everything was SO FRESH, and delicious. Thank you Jose, your little treat made my day, and because of you, I will be back.

16.description: Delicious!   Adass Polo......"Wonderful mix of lentils, raisins, caramelized onions, saffron and Persian barberry served with Persian white rice.(You don't want to miss this one)"  From their menu.  They do not lie.   This dish was fantastic.   Add the Caspian Eggplant and you will have no desire to ever cook for yourself again.   YUM-O.    I will be doing take out again + I want to try their restaurant soon.

17.description: I'm giving this place 5 stars because upon my first visit the owner greeted me and proceeded to show such incredible generosity, that I was absolutely blown away. I told him that I had just moved into the area, and my gas wasn't turned on yet. So, I ordered my food....then he told me that he was going to give me some extra things to try. Well, that was an understatement!He gave me so much food to take home and try it was enough for 2 people, or a few days. The dill rice, which was excellent, and some other delicious stews and things.His gesture of kindness and generosity made such an impression on me that I vowed to let everyone know what an incredible person the owner is.Aside from that, I always get the salmon plate and it is always fresh and delicious....I love to sprinkle the feta cheese that they serve with it onto my dill rice. The people that work there always show great hospitality. Fast, healthy and delicious.... I love spending my money at places like this because I know the people "behind" the food are inherently good.

10.description: Husband and I love the food here!  We have never had an issue with the staff, they are helpful and wonderful.   It's hard to find quality fresh product for an affordable price.  Highly suggest this place! They have great lunch deals as well! :)

11.description: I love meditterean food and had high hopes for this place, but they were not met. Having not that much time I went to the carry out location which right next door to the dinning spot. The carry out building is pretty small and practically on train tracks but that didn't bother me . I saw that they had a lunch special for $5.95 that looked really good I asked for that but the guy at the counter told me that was for the dine inn and this was the carry out but its the same, what meat do u want? Thinking it was I ordered the lamb. The total came out to $9.67. I don't know if he scammed to pay more or if it was a misunderstanding either way he was not clear. I just paid thinking maybe it would be worth it, nope! I got a pretty decent kabob of lamb it was juicy and all, but that's about it. The meal was pretty much buried in plain boring rice and also some pretty good dill rice that salvaged the meal. In a hurry I forgot to ask for extra tahini or hot sauce, but I hoped they would include atleast one, wrong. I had to eat the flavorless rice stale pita with no sauce.they did include feta cheese and onions but for $10 I expect some flavors  not just couple pieces of meat and a pound of rice! I will give this place another shot at the dinning location but trust me if u want better flavors go to naf naf or olive or best yet pita inn!

26.description: Stopped in after reading some Yelp reviews and was really satisfied! The food was delicious, the service was fast, and the people were very nice. I would recommend this to any friends who find themselves in the area.

27.description: I order from Noon O Kabab a few times a month.  The staff is beyond nice, and the food is amazing.  I've never had a bad meal from them, but my go to dishes are the salmon and the joujeh on the bone.  Their dill rice is fabulous, and the hummus is the best in the city.  The prices are higher than standard takeout, but totally worth it - fantastic food in very generous portions.

35.description: We got our food extremely fast.  However, the food seemed a bit bland.  They are very helpful with picking out food.  They do need to work on the taste of the food.  We got the combination chicken kabob and the chicken and steak kabob.  Food was hot, just not up to par with the price, more rice than anything.

8.description: same great food in the restaurant but a lot quicker and in a much more casual environment. Marie and Elias are awesome!

0.description: I already love Noon o Kabab for their sit down meals, so it's no surprise that I love their pick up. A casual housewarming party was delayed by friends being kept late at work. Overworked and not wanting to cook, there were talks of going out to eat or pizza. Since they lived close to here, I offered to grab a family platter from here!I ordered the family platter with some additional appetizers. While they forgot to check for my extra parsley, there was still plenty of parsley in the container and food all around. Six hungry people couldn't even finish the family platter with additional orders of Must o Khiar and Hummus!My friends aren't as picky of eaters as me, much less as picky about Persian food. I was thrilled, ecstatic, overjoyed, when I sampled the Ghormeh Sabzi! Almost as good as how my mom makes it! HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE?When I told my mom of the sorcery of the delicious Persian food, she relayed some Persian Guilt onto me about how I don't need her to cook for me anymore.

20.description: A bit pricey, but worth it for an occasional treat.  Everything I've had at Noon O Kabab is as tasty and fresh as can be.  I am a huge fan of their dill rice.  All the kababs are delicious, but particularly the filet mignon.  With my last order I decided to try the Persian potato salad, and I'm sure glad I did as it was one of the best things I've ever eaten.

19.description: Three Words. Listen to me. Three Words. Spicy Pomegranate Wings! These spicy, sweet, tart, savory wings are delicious. It is a Persian party in your mouth. These wings are slow roasted and then slathered in a savory pomegranate glaze. I destroyed this wings and they were only the appetizer. Ok, listen to me again. Four Words...Joujeh-on-the-Bone. You would think I was sick of poultry after devouring all the wings, but this Cornish Hen was a great entree. Marinated, skewered and then char-boiled to absolute perfection. Juicy, savory, a little smokey and everything I ever wanted to do to a Cornish Hen. This was served over perfectly cooked Dill Rice, grilled onions and tomatoes and lemons to squeeze over for a tangy complement.This meal was absolutely delicious and it was all delivered to my apartment in about a half an hour. I would suggest Noon O Kabab to anyone who loves succulent, savory, smokey and scrumptious poultry.

33.description: One of my favorite restaurants has always been Noon-O-Kabob, so when I recently moved to Albany Park, I decided to share their amazing cuisine with my friends by having Noon-O-Kabob cater my housewarming party.  The experience exceeded my expectations.  I've never catered an event before, and I was a little nervous about ordering the right stuff and getting it delivered on time so I had a good discussion with Noon-O-Kabob's staff before placing my order.  I told them how many people I expected, the type of food I was interested in, and when I would need it delivered.  They provided me with everything I needed to know to be able to make an informed order.  You can order by phone or at the catering location.One of the best things about Noon-O-Kabob's catering is that you can order practically anything off of their normal restaurant menu al-a-carte, or can choose a pre-set menu priced per person.  I found the al-a-carte options a better (and less expensive) fit for my simple (around 35 people), while the pre-set menus would be ideal for larger event.The food was hot and fresh when it arrived, and a big hit with my guests.  Even my vegetarian friends had enough options.  Although I ended up with more food than I needed, this was more due to over-ordering because of my paranoia about running out of food - Noon-O-Kabob had provided me with relatively accurate quantity expectations.   And I didn't mind ordering too much because prices didn't break the bank!  Even delivery was only a few bucks.If you want inexpensive catering that is a little more unique than sandwiches or Mexican, try Noon-O-Kabob.

2.description: Noon o Kabob is a staple in our home for take out! It for your looking for a great cooked Persian meal this is the place to go!!!! The khoubdeh and chenjeh are mind blowing! The portions are generous! I can't wait to try their salmon!!!

34.description: They give you soooo much food, what a value! i had the shrimp curry and  we really enjoyed it. Yum yum yum!

32.description: iI tried this place again 3 years later and I am still not impressed. Semarmis is down the street and much better!

18.description: I love the take out! Grace and Marie are amazing!! Very thoughtful and kind!! Had the salmon and rib eye for a friend and they were more than accommodating to explain the menu!! Keep up the fantastic work ladies!!! I'll be back all the time

13.description: This review for the Take out storeThe best :-)I really enjoyed the food Finally I found the place I was looking for. I like their chicken and shrimp and the Hummus and "yoghourt cucumber mint salad " I wished if they offered the persian bread..!  ...don't forget to bring thermo bag with you.

4.description: The food in general is okay, but not great for the price that is on the menu. The rice is too plain, and the meat (kabob) can use a little more taste.

24.description: Fancy yourself as an Amir Talai or a Bijan Pakzad!? Think you got more PERSIANLITY then they DO!?!? You prolly dont! But, the wraps at Noon O Kabab can you help you with that! (by the way, Amir Talai and Bijan Pakzad are famous Iranians, thanks Googlez).Noon O's catering and to-go location is just that. No seats, no servers, no foolin' around. Just grab that food and go, but call ahead because you'll have to wait a little otherwise. The food is just as good as the other, however here they have added their WRAPS WITH PERSIANLITY!! Feels you gotta bellow that out like you are yelling from the top of a mountain... Mount Azad Kuh perhaps? On to the food. The wraps are huge, and for $6-7 bucks a pop a great deal. The Joujeh Kabab (marinated chicken breast) is excellent. The meat is super juicy, and the has a slight ting of citrus. Very well cooked, and rolled into rice with the trimmings. The preparation for the falafel is very similar, but here... dare I say it... may be the best falafel I've ever had. Semaramis was always my favorite, but now I find my self picking Noon O's over it. Either way, you can't lose with Noon O' To Go!

6.description: Some days are so long and grueling that even the idea of grocery shopping renders my exhaustion insurmountable.You know those days? Where you are ready to be done with it but don't want to raid the fridge, eat cookies for dinner or pick up a crap burger at a drive thru? Maybe you still have work to do, contracts to negotiate, reports to draft, calls to make, a dog to walk and a dose of chores such as laundry besides. Take a minute. Place an order and give yourself and loved ones a break. It'll only take a minute. Try this. It is as healthy as you want to make it! Hummus with veggies? Look at the pictures of lamb- yum-yummy! You want a lamb kabob, you really need one and you will look like a gourmet hero bringing this home!

22.description: Delicious!   Adass Polo......"Wonderful mix of lentils, raisins, caramelized onions, saffron and Persian barberry served with Persian white rice.(You don't want to miss this one)"  From their menu.  They do not lie.   This dish was fantastic.   Add the Caspian Eggplant and you will have no desire to ever cook for yourself again.   YUM-O.    I will be doing take out again + I want to try their restaurant soon.

15.description: By far the best Persian restaurant in Chicago.  The Salmon Kabab, and Fillet (Barg) Kabob are absolutely delicious.  The Saffron infused rice (White & Dill) are the best.Don't forget the "Kashke-Bademjan' (Eggplant appetizer) with warm freshly baked bread...  Succulent.

7.description: Well, after multiple apologies from the managers, we were offered to give them a second chance, on the house, and they said that that would never happen again.  We eat there a lot cause it's one of the finest in the city.... So we ordered a delivery, as we expected, it was spot on..... Very juicy, tender , cooked perfect rib eye and ground beef...they made sure to keep in contact w/ me to see how everything was which is great service..... Keep up the good cooking...

36.description: great food, great prices. I love this place

30.description: My husband and I had Noon O Kabab cater our wedding on June 25, 2011 and the food was terrific.  Our guests kept asking us who catered the food because they said it was the best food they've ever had at a wedding.  Even my hard-to-please parents loved the food and lots of people went up for seconds. Our guests raved about the steak, chicken, and salmon kabab! Marie worked with us through the whole process and she was unbelievably supportive, helpful, and warm.  I enjoyed working with her because she knew how much food I needed for 200 people and didn't rush me to make decisions. Marie took all my calls and promptly returned calls too.  She was there from the beginning until the end, and she went above and beyond to ensure that the food at our reception was of the highest quality and the process super easy.  I would not hesitate to use Noon O Kabab for another big event.  They truly deserve the five stars!

3.description: I came in here late night on short notice. All I have to say Is Marie is the best I came in they got my order wrong. I called and spoke with a man who got my initial order wrong. All the boys started playing the blame game... I don't care who made the mistake and Maria took the initiative and fixed the mistake. She is such a sweetheart and is so friendly.  She even went as far as to see if it was OK for my pregnant fiance to eat salmon. (apparently the verdict is still out) . Great customer service skills and great food to make this place a deadly combo. Way better then Reeza by my book. With no shortage of compition of middle eastern fare along the street. Noon has made a name for itself quickly. Ps try the family platter it's the best bang for your buck !

14.description: Dear Kibbideh kabob and dill rice,          Kibbideh, it's been too long since the last time I ate you for lunch.  I once missed your company and attempted to make a reasonable facsimile with ground lamb and ground beef, green onions and parsley...It didn't go too well, in fact, it just made me miss you more.  Dill rice, if I even had an idea as to how to capture your delicious essence and create something similar in taste, I would trade all my goats for that nugget of knowledge.  But alas, it is a secret that will never be spoken.  And I suppose the only way to get this most excellent joining of herbs, carbs and protein are to visit noon o kabob.  Until we meet again....                                                                                        Keith

3.description: I've been coming to La Piramide since I graduated from 8th grade (I had my graduation dinner here). I have lots of memories stored here. (Mostly dinner with my mom) and every time I come here I feel good. The food is good. I used to order Camarones a la diabla all the time (before I began getting allergic reactions to shrimps) now I order Enchiladas Suisas..! Delicioso!!!

1.description: I was very suspicious as we were walking into this place.  It was extremely dark; there were no other customers at approximately 2100 hour; the hostess didn't seem to be happy to be there.  Ok, all those ominous signs were present.  We, however, have committed to trying this place for dinner tonight.  There was point of no return.  Thus, We took a courage pill and placed our order.  I stick with my normal routine item: caldo de Cameron (shrimp soup), and hubby ordered the chicken mole combo.  We were informed that the waiting was about fifteen (15) minutes for the order to be ready.  That was no problem.  I know the Univision soap opera would keep us company.  There was one other guy, too...introducing...miss fly!  That fly was with us for entire duration of the wait.  She was annoying, but at least she wasn't hungry for human skin.  She was just loitering around us.  Well, that was cool...I guess.The plastic bags to hold our order were from Jewel-Osco.  Umm...another ominous sign, but the taste of food was all that mattered.  How did the food taste?  Surprising, it was quite good! My caldo de Cameron wasn't too spicy, even though the hostess did ask me if I wanted spicy, which I responded positively to her inquiry.  Despite the lack of spiciness, the flavor was pleasant.  I wish there were more shrimps in the soup, but overall, it was satisfying.  Whoever cooked the soup also de-tailed the shrimps.  Thank you.  That was a four-star worth of praise for the work he or she performed.  My hubby's chicken mole was actually interesting.  I didn't think I had mole before.  With an abundant amount of tortilla they provided as part of the meal, that was an excellent medium to scoop that yummy mole.  Oh by the way, the total came to $25 after tax.  Though I wouldn't say the prices of items were competitive enough comparing to other similar establishments in Albany Park.  This hole-in-the-wall place is a keeper.  Perhaps after I spread good words about it, they will turn on more lights to attract more customers into the door.  As of now, the lighting is just horrible.

2.description: Hmm... another taqueria.  Do you see a trend here?  I went here for lunch today and yes, we have a winner!  But I must warn you.  If you're scared of the words "cabeza" and "lengua", you may want to stop reading.  For those who aren't scared, will you marry me?  The cabeza (head) tacos are my favorite.  Tender pieces of meat - a bit of this and that, if you know what I mean - with cilantro, onions, and smokey red chili salsa on the side.  I'm already addicted to it.  The lengua (tongue) tacos were also delicious.  Thinly sliced lengua, topped with cilantro and onions.  I prefer braised, shredded lengua, but their version is quite good.  The only item I didn't care for was the carne asada taco.  I've had better carne asada elsewhere, plus for some reason they added lettuce, tomato, and cheese to it.  Tacos were inexpensive (under $2 each) and they were pretty generous with the meat.  The rest of the menu is typical taqueria fare: tostadas, sopes, gorditas, huaraches, quesadillas, etc.  I want to try their guacamole next time.  Honestly, other than the guac, I'm happy with just ordering the cabeza tacos.

0.description: One of the best mexican restaurants in Albany Park! It's family owned and operated, so you know you're definitely receiving the best service. The food is great! My favorites are "Flautas de Pollo". Their "Tortas" and "Enchiladas" are tasty as well.  Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to try a different mexican joint. Yay Piramide!

58.description: The quality of the meat is great. The only thing that's a downfall is the price and the small servings. Overall, it's a great experience for anyone who has never tried Korean BBQ.

56.description: I went there the other evening with my girlfriend.  Both of us were looking forward to some good food.   My first impression of the place was that they loved baseball.  My second impression was that the place was Japanese owned.   This was amusing to me,  since many Korean restaurants try their hand at making sushi.   I'd never seen a Japanese restaurant try their hand at banchan.  And that's where the disappointment started.  Most Korean restaurants will give many little plates filled with vegetables and kimchi (banchan).  It is part of the experience and is expected at ANY Korean restaurant.   This place charges $2 per person for the meal and you only get four small plates,  which are refillable only if you pay another $2.  No way were we even given a two person portion.  In addition,  we ordered a stew, and rice was not included.   Some of you may be wondering,  Chicago Kalbi has stew?  Yes they do!  But, it seems like you have to beg them for the secret menu.  And, you have to beg them to cook the eggs in your dolsot bibimbap fully for people with special dietary restrictions.   All in all, the food was not bad, but it was definitely not worth the price or aggravation.   However, if you want to see a miniature museum of Ichiro Suzuki and an enormous collage of restaurant personnel with famous athletes,  this is your place.

29.description: By far my favorite Korean restaurant , been going there for years, the food is all ways top shelf and the staff is great. If you like Korean food you have to try Chicago Kalbi.

42.description: We love the Korean BBQ here. It's delicious. Highly recommend the Korean style kolbi and the bulkogi. Make sure to use the Korean BBQ sauce! The banchan (little salads) they serve are very good as well. My husband loves the bean sprouts and my favorite is the potato salad. The best part of the meal may be the soup! It's made with tofu and vegetables with an amazing flavor. And to top it off, the service is wonderful. We came in late on a Saturday night and all of the staff left helped us. I highly recommend this restaurant whether you love Korean BBQ or have never tried it (the staff will help!).

23.description: My favorite kalbi place! Meat is good quality! Love both the Korean and Japanese style kalbi! That beef tartar AMAZING! :D

47.description: Get the yukke, raw beef, quail egg, slivered pear, sesame oil, outstanding.  The meats are also very high quality.  This is no all you can eat junk joint serving the lowest possible grade of meat legally allowed.You may pay a bit more, but if quality over quantity is whats important to you, then your in the right place.

8.description: Excellent KBBQ, nice space, great ventilation...and attentive wait staff! Unlike most KBBQ restaurants, this place actually treats its customers well.Bonus: they use charcoal as opposed to a gas grill like many other places.There are a lot of options in the city for KBBQ, but this place is the right choice.

31.description: This place is truly amazing! The taste of the food is beyond describable! The marinade of the meat is so incredible and succulent, it makes you want more and more! Definitely a good restaurant to go on a date with someone, due to it's charm, tasty food, fun preparation and grilling of food, and the caring staff.Only negative is that there is usually a long wait. Came around 6:30 on a Saturday and waited around 45 mins. BUT it is worth the wait.

34.description: Best Japanese Yakiniku in Chicago and maybe the US.

16.description: Best Korean BBQ. The service is awesome. You'll be seated and eating delicious food in no time.  Seating is much more private than your typical place, which makes it great for date night and groups.  Tons of traditional sides. We usually do the shrimp, bulgogl, sliced ribeye and sometimes the spare ribs.  They have the Japanese style of cooking (more like a BBQ than a hot griddle), which I prefer.  Can't love this place any more. Five stars.

13.description: Portions were tiny compared to San Soo Gab San but the meats were tasty and lean.  Not tempted to come back as there are other BBQ places I would rather try. Next!

11.description: Came here for dinner after a long day of work, and upon entering, I was greeted by literally everyone that worked there. And it was a vey warm, genuine, friendly greeting by all. The food and prices were good, the atmosphere was totally cool, especially if you're a sports fan. Our waitress came with kid friendly plate, utensils, cup for my daughter (which she loved), and when the waitress saw that I was splitting my rice with my daughter, without asking, left and came back with a bowl of rice in a cute, kid friendly bowl for her. Most places are too cheap to even consider giving away a bowl of rice, but it was very thoughtful of her. I would definitely go back!

39.description: Horible, horible, and horible. The place is extremely dirty, everyone is rude and the food sucks. I got sick after I eat there. Don't waste your time there. I have never been to a place like that. Ewww

37.description: So we get here and the place is completely filled with smoke of burned BBQ  to the point that we could not stand the smell.  We left. So it's hard to rate the  food when you don't have it.   please get it together I want to try !!!!  For now: LOST MY BUSINESS!!

0.description: Good old "Japanese" style Korean BBQ place.This place brings me back memories from years ago when my parents used to take us kids to Korean BBQ places in Japan. Excellent food & service! The owner couple is so friendly, they are always there working hard and greeting guests.

38.description: super dirty place !!!horrible service !!!rude staff !!!will never go back !!!Smells really Bad Too !!!

51.description: The owner or manager was so nice and it's always good when you can genuinely tell that they care about how the food tastes and the service the customer is receiving. One thing I really liked was the setup of the dining areas; where the grills and tables are set up there's wall partitions around you so it feels really cozy and secluded so it's great for a date or if you have a lot of talking to do  or catching up with friends. The meat is of great quality which is obvious with your first bite, the sides are actually tasty and fairly proportioned, unlike some other Korean BBQ restaurants. Overall this is one of my preferred restaurants for Korean BBQ in the city. Definitely recommend it.

27.description: LOVEEE this Korean BBQ place.  I love the segregated private rooms and cooking your own meat on the grill at your table.  The fans work well so you don't leave there smelling as bad as you would if you went to Ron of Japan.  All the sides are really yum too: kimchee rocks, dikon (spicy radish) rocks, the Shrimp, Kalbi Beef, Cucumber thingy....so good!  It's not very romantic, but definitely fun with a group.  I would make a reservation just to be safe (make sure you ask for a table with a grill if you want it, some tables don't have it so they cook the meat for you--but that's half the fun).  There is always street parking.  Can't wait to go back!

32.description: Went here years ago and loved it and back recently with the wife and daughter. Well go back and we like it's walking distance.

54.description: Ok for those of you ( familiar with/or who love) "all you can east" Korean BBQ and/or the "24hr type" Korean BBQ that serves huge portions of very cheap meat (so highly marinated to make it taste good that it's sodium sugar content reaches super saturated realms) ..... Well this ain't that type of place. Rather, this is a place with very high quality meat, whose prices and portions reflect it. The chicken is all free range chicken the meat is subtlety marinated and clearly fresh and well prepared. The peen is a Korean woman raised in japan and the staff to my surprise all Japanese - so when I said thank you in Korean I was met with confused looks. The appetizer fried dumplings where wonderful perfectly cooked and not greasy. The beef tartar was better then I have eaten in fine French resturants. The main dishes were also perfect.Now - the best part was ....... The place is only the second Korean BBQ I have found in chicago with REAL coals. Only this one has great polite service and does not leave you at the end of the night smelling like you were sitting IN the BBQ yourself.

48.description: I absolutely loved this place - wanted to come on a Tuesday night but realized it was closed on Tuesdays.  We did not give up and came in on a Wednesday night.  The food was wonderful and the service was quick (and good).  So far I have had lots of luck with Korean BBQ places in the Chicago area.  Definitely recommend this place!

44.description: Great Korean BBQ.  Staff is very attentive, felt a little rushed but not a big deal.  Price is on the higher side but fresh seafood and meat will create a higher price point.  Great for groups (4 to 8).  Would go again.

24.description: Finally got the chance to check this place out on Valentine's Day as I always drive by the place. Ordered the combination plate for two which included chicken, bulgogi, short ribs, miso soup, and the standard assortment of Korean side dishes. The meats were very tasty but a little on the skimpy side for the price. But the excitement of barbecuing your own food in a restaurant might have been worth it. Will go back again but maybe only on a special occasion.

7.description: So some friends from work, the wife, and I decide to give this place a go for a double date. It has pretty high reviews and we like Korean BBQ so it seemed like an obvious choice.So my first issue is that the TV was playing 'Biggest Loser'. And if that wasn't bad enough it was the part with the weigh-ins. There is no way that looking at people pushing 300lbs weighing in without shirts is appetizing before dinner. I asked if we can turn the tv off or change the channel, and after a minute or confusion they turned it off.So we started our meal with the karage wings and the cow tongue appetizers. They were both okay, nothing too special. However for the price of the cow tongue I would have expected something a little more substantial. I wasn't too disappointed as I'm not the offal fan in the group.For the mains we ordered four meats to put on the bbq.  They were bulgogi, shrimp, pork belly, and kalbi.  All were good, all the kim chis were good.  However I personally didn't find this place to be worth the drive into the city.So the spread also had some lettuce to make wraps with the meat and some sauce.  At I ate the wrap normally. Then the lady told me to grill the lettuce.... I was confused but said okay and gave it a try. She corrected herself and told us  grill the meat not the lettuce (which I already knew!) to make the wrap. She kept on trying to show us how to eat and use the grill...... It was a little weird because none of us were asking for help and were doing fine before she showed upI honestly can find just as good or better Korean in Niles, Glenview, or Buffalo Grove.

49.description: Easter celebration !Chicago kalbi was a great idea. The food was scrumptious! My family and I got the Kalbi (Korean style) and the bulgogi which comes with this delicious dipping sauce. The service was great. It's a little pricey but it was a great experience. They do not have unlimited bbq for a set price fyi.

40.description: Awesome bbq, yummy!

53.description: Really thought this place would be better due to the reviews but was I wrong. My roommate and I came in an hour before they closed and we decided to get the (Pork) which is basically a thinly stir fried pork marinated with spices but it ended up being maybe 7 slices of meat on a big plate that we thought possibly the cook split up for us to share and was anticipating on when the other plate would come. But boy was I wrong. I was so disappointed in the portion size, especially after it cost $15. We then ordered the kimchi jigae soup and that also came in a small pot. Normally the portion of a soup especially kimchi one is more generous but this also was very very small in size. That too was over priced. So then we were really disappointed with the serving size and decided we needed some hot sake. The price was reasonable for that so we ordered two more rounds. We wanted to get one more small plate of the side of kimchi that usually comes before the entree arrives but the server said "is it okay if we charge $1.50" I mean come on, most places give them out for free when you ask. I understand every little thing is money but what's four small slices of a tiny kimchi going to hurt? I really think the owner should reevaluate the pricing if not they should consider a bigger portion for the amount they are charging per item. The food itself is decent taste wise, but it's not all that different from other Korean restaurants. Food wise this place isn't all that it's hyped up to be but I guess the only good thing I could say was that the staff was friendly.

30.description: I thought the place would be good given the overall score on here, but nope. Went in with my friend and we ordered two "meals". Meals come with side dishes, tea, and the food. A La Carte is just the dish. Well we got out "side dishes" for our meal and there were only 3 for both of us. Not even 3 for each of us. Then we asked for more when they ran out and nope! Extra charge. I have eaten Korean food from at least 6 different places and this has been the worst experience and food I have had. I didn't have the BBQ, so I guess I can't judge that, but the Yukgaejang was horrible. Not even in a stone bowl and was almost cold when it was brought out to me. Never coming here again.

46.description: The food was wonderful and the service was even better! We decided to eat here on a whim and loved the experience! Our 10 month old loved the short ribs! They were incredibly accommodating with our baby and quickly had a high chair for him and his own water cup. We will certainly be back!

1.description: This place is like a fusion between Korean and Japanese food offerings. Kalbi, is a Korean word for marinated ribs strips, but this restaurant carries an really authentic spread of Japanese or Japanese inspired foods, at least what you can grill over an open flame.My sister and I, both being Korean, came here and got the Korean BBQ meats. The meat was tender and it came with a smattering of the usual side dishes. Restaurant has been around for awhile, so the interior may feel a little dated, but you'll see a TON of celebrity pictures, and autographed baseballs, many of them Japanese, scattered all over the walls. It's a classic stop with good food, and very pleasant service.

55.description: I already decided that i would like this place when i walked in, why? due to past experiences, it is kinda intimidating for me to walk into a korean place without any of my korean friends, but the host wore this big smile on her face! so welcoming, super friendly. same with the chef who happened to walk out from the back as well...the food is good! the side dishes were delightful! i esp love the kimchi and the spicy pickled daikon. i was a bit surprised by the price at first since i was expecting the typical korean bbq joint prices, but when the food came, it's def a higher quality of meat! it reminded me a gyu-kaku. i am all about quality of quantity, esp when it comes to food. we ordered the japanese kalbi and the short rib with sesame sauce! the meat was marinated just enough to bring out the flavour.  it is so tender and flavourful, which is different from the other typical korean places where you know the meat was just soaked in the marination for days, and the greasy feeling in the stomach afterward.Def coming back for to try other dishes!

9.description: I've been here over many years. The service is great and food is terrific. The cheaper set menus are not a bad option for novices but if you want some tasty high quality steak, save your money on your beer and spend it on the Kobe beef!!! It's so awesome, you don't know what you're missing until you have it. All the side dishes are so tasty and fresh, clean. One of my favorite joints!!

26.description: I'm a huge fan of Korean bbq and I definitely was not disappointed by this place. The restaurant itself says it's a fusion of Korean and Japanese, but it's actually not: it has both types of cuisines but they aren't mixed and they both definitely have their own unique flavors. The service here is amazing-- extremely friendly and helpful. My friend and I tried the Japanese and Korean style of sliced short ribs and both was excellent. A lot of fat marbled in both which keeps it juicy, but unlike other places if not cooked more crispy becomes a little chewer. My favorite dish, surprisingly, was one I didn't want but my friend did, was the intestine appetizer. It was so tender and the sauce was amazing. Forget the other times you've had-- try it here!

25.description: We've been wanting to try this place from all the great reviews. We came in on a Wednesday night when they opened so there was absolutely no wait! We were hungry so we ordered a Combo with kalbi, chicken, and shrimp for $44. We thought there would be a lot of meat because it says on the menu "for two people". When they brought out the meats it looked like meat enough for one person, we thought they would bring more. They even charge for side dishes. Needless to say, my fiancé left hungry. The service was good though and the chicken and kalbi were marinated well. But overall I'd say it was expensive for the amount of food we got. I don't think we'll be coming back.

12.description: I am writing this as a sit in post Korean BBQ bliss...First off, this place is open super late. We are late eaters so this is a major plus (especially on a Sunday night). We were happily greeted at the door and seated immediately.We started with pan fried dumplings which were homemade (very clearly homemade by taste!!!!), our server was great, he even made me iced Korean tea (barley tea)We got the Bulgogi (beef) and chicken to grill at the table. The meat was fresh and seasoned nicely. The wood chip grill was brought out and the vent fan turned on. We each got rice and miso soup (both were on point) and the banchan (side dishes) were out of this world (also homemade).At the end of the meal, we were presented with a hot towel to clean our hands off which was a super nice touch.We are here on an empty, slow Sunday night and everything was served and cooked with care and attention.Looks like a great place for a group and definitely worth the money. I am a super picky eater in regards to Korean food and I am one happy (stuffed) camper.YUMMMMMM!

59.description: Three reasons why I'm not coming back:1: over price2: little food 3: taste of food: not as good as other review said. Though not sure why others think it was so great! Very disappointed! Never going to come back!

21.description: Great food, great service, great evening. Party of 6 came in at 8 pm on a Saturday night without reservations. They were busy but were able to seat us after a short wait. Very authentic and lots of fun! We will definitely be back.

17.description: Love this atmosphere, the food, and the experience!The staff is soooo friendly and willing to help!!!! GO HERE!

10.description: You walk in and bam, the smell is awesome, I began salivating immediately and couldn't wait to get the food on the table. Then wait I have to cook this myself!  Really? Yes! They prepare the food, bring it to your table and you cook it at your own pace.  I really enjoyed the experience, the food, and the atmosphere!

5.description: Took a date here and was definitely a good place to go [pats self on back]. Staff was very attentive and amicable and were very quick about preparing the grill that is built into the table. We ordered about four meats and were astonished at how easy it was to cook them (we flunked out of Le Cordon Bleu, don't judge). Meats were accompanied by sauces and marinades, as well as rice and some small vegetable dishes. Everything was delicious. Nothing else to add that hasn't been expressed in the other reviews. Would definitely recommend to anyone attempting to get to 2nd base with a date.

3.description: Meat is better than gyukaku！3 levels Beef tongue is fantastic, choose the best one. Kalbi is ok. Porks are also great.

35.description: Love the rib and beef here. Really taste good. However, the price might be a little expensive compared with the food. Good service and ice cream served after the dinner.

19.description: LOVEEE this Korean BBQ place.  I love the segregated private rooms and cooking your own meat on the grill at your table.  The fans work well so you don't leave there smelling as bad as you would if you went to Ron of Japan.  All the sides are really yum too: kimchee rocks, dikon (spicy radish) rocks, the Shrimp, Kalbi Beef, Cucumber thingy....so good!  It's not very romantic, but definitely fun with a group.  I would make a reservation just to be safe (make sure you ask for a table with a grill if you want it, some tables don't have it so they cook the meat for you--but that's half the fun).  There is always street parking.  Can't wait to go back!

28.description: This place was terrific!  I went there on Feb 7, with a group of 12 to celebrate my bday...be forewarned: you won't be seated until your entire party is present. The 10-15 min wait was worth it, however. The owner, a cute lil Korean lady was great!  We ordered different dining options for BBQ, such as their A, B, C, options which come with a combo of chicken, kalbi beef, bulgogi, shrimp, squid....all was delicious. The steak tar, tar is a MUST! The restaurant was pretty busy, but that's expected on a Saturday night, therefore the service was a bit slow, but we understood. It gave us time to talk and laugh, and enjoy ourselves with sake and beer.  Overall,  the dining experience was positive,  the food was delish. ...I will definitely be back!

45.description: Best Korean restaurant in the country, hands down.  And I've eaten at a lot of Korean places in NY, LA, DC, etc.  The kalbi here is simply amazing!  Looks very nondescript from the outside.  Be sure to finish off the meal with the green tea ice cream!

33.description: Loved this place. The quality of the meat is phenomenal. Service was very attentive and fast. Do not be afraid to try any of the sides or the beef tongue! Great place to go on a date or with small group of friends. A little expensive but very worth it.

43.description: The service is wonderful BUT if you're looking for authentic Korean food, this is NOT the place for it. All of the different meat options to grill are marinated in a Japanese style and flavour. Even some of the appetisers are Japanese items such as Curry croquettes, gyoza, etc.The  food is delicious, but the portions are smaller and the price is expensive. This is not authentic Korean food. It is "korean food" made in a japanese style.

2.description: This is one of the more upscale quality and presentation orientated kalbi houses in the city. I've been coming here since I was a little girl and not much has changed except the dessert menu. (I still want that plum wine ice cream recipe by the way.) They stand apart from their competition by offering wood chips instead of gas for their tables, offer privacy rooms and open seating, Japanese appetizers and Korean entrees. The owners are a Japanese/Korean couple that being both their cultures toward into what simply tastes like the best quality beef, sliced pork, and seafood pancakes. There's always a familiar greeting at the door met with warm smiles, a glass that's never in danger of drying up and a great smoky smell that fills the air and permeates your clothes. Street parking can be a little nuts so sometimes it's better to drop off your passenger to secure a table and wood while you're looking for a spot.

18.description: We decided  to try , Chicago  kalby, and was impressed, it's so good!  Everything  is  fresh delisios , fish  sup seafood pancake and noodles  , fall in love with  this  place )

41.description: One very important preface to this "Korean BBQ" is that it is actually Korean food prepared in a Japanese style. What that means is that you are not attending an authentic Korean BBQ when visiting Chicago Kalbi but an amazing Japanese fusion instead.Upon entering the restaurant a flood of delightfully pungent smoke billows into the vestibule. You hear the sizzling of grills all around the restaurant; plenty of laughter and a great deal of Japanese. If you were wondering, yes, this is in fact heaven. The restaurant is always staffed by an older Japanese couple (owners), two young Japanese servers (one male and one female), and several Hispanic men who bus. Each one of these individuals is very good at their job and has a certain level of enthusiasm about their fare that is nothing short of adorable and endearing.The tables in the restaurant are all separated by partitions, giving you a very private experience in a typically bustling restaurant. Sometimes you might have to wait 30 minutes but DO IT! You will regret it if you do not. The tables are wood constructed with a covered, hollow metal core. You can choose to have BBQ where they will fill the interior with a charcoal filled dutch oven with a grill rack atop or simply order menu items. The latter is inexcusable - because I said so.Every time I go, I go with one other person. I recommend no more than four, otherwise you might have to wait much longer than I stated, particularly on a Friday or Saturday. I see larger parties though so please don't let this deter you.The combo set is the way to go. It comes in three different options with varying meats. I always opt for the kalbi, bulgogi and chicken. The set comes with those meats, many delicious small salads, miso soup and green tea ice cream for dessert. In addition to that I get the veggies, one other a la carte meat and an occasional appetizer. This is the ideal amount of food for two people. You will feel so pleasantly full at the end of the experience but not heavy or lethargic in the least. Other meats I've tried and enjoyed are: the squid; shrimp; short rib; kobe beef (wagyu); heart; and tongue. I've also tried the yukke which is delicious though I strongly advise against ordering it. The only reason being I do not know the source of the meat and if it comes from one of the 13 large meat processing facilities in the US the likelihood of it containing e coli is significant. I have never been sick from it but if you have children they should not be eating raw, ground beef. The impact of the e coli on their systems is completely different from adults and cases of those infections are beyond tragic. If you are concerned about the meat, ask them if they know the source. If the meat comes from a small packaging facility that adheres to sanitation requirements the likelihood of that pathogen is significantly reduced. Regardless, eat that one dish with caution, though if you do get it I will say it's one of my favorite items. It's so silky with a great balance of sweet, salty and savory flavors.In addition to my meal, I also order a large Sapporo, and a small bottle of jumai ginjo sake. While one person cooks the meat, the other prepares a shot of sake for us to toast in appreciation of the bountiful fare and excellent service we receive. The sake washes down the well marinated and perfectly cooked (I'm a master!) meat with nostalgic delight. You feel the light of Amaterasu shine upon your gleaning smile as you realize it's just all that booze and laughter you've been enraptured in for the last hour.

52.description: Found this restaurant by watching the Vice munchies video with Paul Kahan, who thinks very highly of Chicago Kalbi. It's a unique place where the owning family clearly cares about the quality of food they bring to your table.Word of advice: Don't let the wait staff dissuade you from ordering the more interesting things on the menu (e.g. beef tartar with mountain yam) - I think they're looking out for picky Americans.

50.description: My favorite Korean BBQ spot in Chicago! I've tried many other Korean BBQ places before, but when I was introduced to this place, I became instantly hooked!  Their food is great (I recommend jumulok, Korean style kalbi & bulgogi) along with the sides that come with our order.  My favorite side would have to be their potato salad and the seaweed.  The staff is very friendly & hospitable.  Portions can be a little small, but I think it's worth it.It can get very busy so I would recommend going in a little early than you'd want to. I wouldn't skip out on this place--love the food & love the staff!

4.description: I have no word to describe it. just too good. especially kobe beef. tender and juicy. and the best restaurant service I have ever enjoyed. But the price is a little high.

6.description: Food is always good here.  I would probably say we are regulars but others might say otherwise. We usually will get the gyoza and paejun as appetizers.  Also will get the Japanese and Korean style kalbi.  Their squid at cooked at the table is very tasty too.  I usually get the green tea ice cream for dessert.  The staff is always friendly and will check in to see how people are doing I would recommend that you call ahead during Friday, Saturday and Sunday so that you'll have a booth.

22.description: Love this atmosphere, the food, and the experience!The staff is soooo friendly and willing to help!!!! GO HERE!

15.description: I'm a huge fan of Korean bbq and I definitely was not disappointed by this place. The restaurant itself says it's a fusion of Korean and Japanese, but it's actually not: it has both types of cuisines but they aren't mixed and they both definitely have their own unique flavors. The service here is amazing-- extremely friendly and helpful. My friend and I tried the Japanese and Korean style of sliced short ribs and both was excellent. A lot of fat marbled in both which keeps it juicy, but unlike other places if not cooked more crispy becomes a little chewer. My favorite dish, surprisingly, was one I didn't want but my friend did, was the intestine appetizer. It was so tender and the sauce was amazing. Forget the other times you've had-- try it here!

57.description: love absolutely love Korean BBQ and this place is my top 5 for sure there are nice and hospitable and the meets are lean with little fat. its a little expensive for the portions but I love me some kalbi.

20.description: Came here for dinner after a long day of work, and upon entering, I was greeted by literally everyone that worked there. And it was a vey warm, genuine, friendly greeting by all. The food and prices were good, the atmosphere was totally cool, especially if you're a sports fan. Our waitress came with kid friendly plate, utensils, cup for my daughter (which she loved), and when the waitress saw that I was splitting my rice with my daughter, without asking, left and came back with a bowl of rice in a cute, kid friendly bowl for her. Most places are too cheap to even consider giving away a bowl of rice, but it was very thoughtful of her. I would definitely go back!

36.description: So some friends from work, the wife, and I decide to give this place a go for a double date. It has pretty high reviews and we like Korean BBQ so it seemed like an obvious choice.So my first issue is that the TV was playing 'Biggest Loser'. And if that wasn't bad enough it was the part with the weigh-ins. There is no way that looking at people pushing 300lbs weighing in without shirts is appetizing before dinner. I asked if we can turn the tv off or change the channel, and after a minute or confusion they turned it off.So we started our meal with the karage wings and the cow tongue appetizers. They were both okay, nothing too special. However for the price of the cow tongue I would have expected something a little more substantial. I wasn't too disappointed as I'm not the offal fan in the group.For the mains we ordered four meats to put on the bbq.  They were bulgogi, shrimp, pork belly, and kalbi.  All were good, all the kim chis were good.  However I personally didn't find this place to be worth the drive into the city.So the spread also had some lettuce to make wraps with the meat and some sauce.  At I ate the wrap normally. Then the lady told me to grill the lettuce.... I was confused but said okay and gave it a try. She corrected herself and told us  grill the meat not the lettuce (which I already knew!) to make the wrap. She kept on trying to show us how to eat and use the grill...... It was a little weird because none of us were asking for help and were doing fine before she showed upI honestly can find just as good or better Korean in Niles, Glenview, or Buffalo Grove.

14.description: This place was terrific!  I went there on Feb 7, with a group of 12 to celebrate my bday...be forewarned: you won't be seated until your entire party is present. The 10-15 min wait was worth it, however. The owner, a cute lil Korean lady was great!  We ordered different dining options for BBQ, such as their A, B, C, options which come with a combo of chicken, kalbi beef, bulgogi, shrimp, squid....all was delicious. The steak tar, tar is a MUST! The restaurant was pretty busy, but that's expected on a Saturday night, therefore the service was a bit slow, but we understood. It gave us time to talk and laugh, and enjoy ourselves with sake and beer.  Overall,  the dining experience was positive,  the food was delish. ...I will definitely be back!

1.description: THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE! DO NOT ENTER UNLESS YOU WANT TO COME OUT LOOKING BAD & WITH NO CASH.I called prior to coming here and asked how much it would be to color my hair and the man said $35. I thought it was a decent price so I went. When I entered the man and the lady were fooling around in the back and smoking hookah. They were very rude, and the man told me the lady would do my hair. I showed her a picture of what I wanted and she said she could do it. So I sat in the chair and she began to brush my hair very harshly, I have curly hair so you're supposed to be careful but she was puling on it and talking on the phone. She then proceeded to tell me she would do highlights cause that's what the girl had in the picture (not really) but since she was a hair stylist I thought she knew better. When she put on the highlighting cap, she was pulling out my hairs hard, then she put on the dye. I have dark brown hair so she had to put in the bleach to make it light. The bleach got on my hands and it stung soooo bad. When she washed my hair my highlights were BLONDE! I asked her if it would stay like that and she said yes. I NEVER TOLD HER NOR DID THE WOMAN IN THE PICTURE I SHOWED HER HAVE BLONDE HIGHLIGHTS. She told me that's the color I wanted and she couldn't do anything about it. She ended up charging me $65 for something not even close to what I wanted. I was crying because a girl's hair is precious, and mine wasn't. I was in tears, literally. I was not happy and I spent all that money to top it all off. I wore a hat until I could re-color it, that's how embarrassing it was. Don't go there please. I would give this place zero stars, but I can't.

0.description: Great place! Affordable. Caters to all hair styles. Ask them for a recommendation on a haircut.

58.description: We went to Golden Crust just because it was close to our house but had pretty low expectations. We love thin crust pizza and were prepared to be disappointed. But we were pleasantly surprised by the tasty pizza and extensive beer list. Service was very friendly too. The pizzas are more pricey than take out joints, but we had several lunches from the leftovers. We will be back!

56.description: If your itching for some pizza and beer this is your place. It's pretty average but still a good place to have in your back pocket. The beer selection was pretty good last time I went. But it is expensive. When they first opened, it was $3 for a good beer. THAT'S AMAZING when your in college....which are most of their clients. I would give it more stars if the prices were better. PS Make sure there are no cubs, sox, blackhawks or bears games if your planning on having a conversation. It gets loud!!
