29.description: If you like thicker crust and sweeter sauce, order from G.C.K that's all bye.

42.description: Decent craft  beer selection, pizza is pretty good too. Customer service needs to be addressed however. A couple of months ago ordered a half sausage and half cheese pizza for pick up. Got the pizza and brought it home but the pizza was way overdone with burnt edges. Don't they check these things? When I called to discuss I talked to the cashier, she told me I could have "like" 6 bucks off. When I told her I wasn't happy with that someone else gets on the phone and tells me to bring in the pizza back for a full refund. I'm not walking all the way back there with hungry kids waiting. All I want is a refund or pizza credit or something. The guy lo balls me and offers me 5 bucks over the phone. He obviously thinks I'm running a pizza scam or like to fleece food places in my spare time. I then talk to the manager and she offers me half off for my next pizza order, to which I accept  to be fair. Sooo I call tonight to try to redeem my offer and they have erased/didn't save my credit. Ok then...

23.description: My husband and I just moved to the neighborhood and this place is walking distance. We went a few times while we were stocking our fridge, and every time was better than the last. The pizzas are great, the beer list is awesome-they have gumball head on draft-and the staff is friendly. Good food and good service, and that's all you need for a good night out.

47.description: The people who answer the phone clearly do not know how to comprehend the English language. I've ordered for delivery from Golden Crust about three (3) times now and every time I've ordered they deliver the wrong food. Such b.s. go out of business already, so ghetto.

8.description: It was a cold, rainy day, and my fiance and myself were starving.  We did not want to cook but had a craving for pizza.  Instead of going to the local Pizza Hut, we decided to try someplace local and have it delivered.The ordering process was straight forward, but you could tell they were busy.  The person on the phone was a bit short with me but nothing rude.  She did not give an estimated delivery time, but I used my typical 1 hour time window for delivery.One thing I do have to say is that Golden Crust is somewhat pricey.  Their base price is very reasonable but toppings are very expensive.  For a salad, garlic bread, and 16-in. pizza, we paid around $30 before delivery.  The food was delivered in about a hour fresh and hot.  In my opinion, the pizza needed a bit more sauce, but my fiance loved it.  The crust was absolutely perfect - golden and crisp.  The toppings were also plentiful and fresh.  We will definitely keep Golden Crust in our roster.

31.description: We live right down the street so we visit often. The stuffed cheese pizza is amazing. Ludicrous amounts of cheese, good crust and sauce. Friendly and pleasant atmosphere if you dine in. Can't comment on anything else personally as I've only ever had the stuffed cheese pizza, but my roommates seem fond of the regular style pizza. Super lucky to have it so close by.

34.description: love their pizza since i was in highschool!

16.description: I will not give this place any stars. I have been a loyal customer for years. This pizza place would give coupons for a free medium sized pizza when you collect 20. Being a loyal customer for so many years I was able to collect many of them. When I tried to use them, a very unprofessional so called manager began to swear at me. What is the point of collecting these coupons when all they are going to do is swear at customers and refuse service. I used to love this pizza place but I don't anymore. The management there has no class. When I tried to get the owners contact information to report their unprofessional demeaner, they kept hanging up the phone on me. I do not recommend this place unless you want to be cussed out and refused service.

13.description: I visited here because my friend was having a going-away party. The pizzas are good. She ordered a buffalo chicken pizza and a deluxe pizza. I loved the buffalo chicken pizza, while everyone liked the deluxe better. I loved the tangy sauce and thought it wasn't too salty. It was also very cheesy. When it was brought out of the oven, it was steaming and stretchy. The service was also great. They always made sure we had water and enough plates and napkins. I really enjoyed that place. Also, parking was very easy around that area. I found a spot across the street right away.

11.description: This bar was completely empty on Sunday's for football. Lol. Completely. It's a nice place for a beer and a game but the food is not good. The safest thing on the menu are the pretzels and they're alright, but the calamari tasted like freezer burn and nothing else we ordered was memorable.

39.description: I have had this pizza on several occasions and normally, this place is 4 stars or above.  The pizza is really pretty good, the beer selection is fantastic.  The location can't be beat.  The service is the worst part of this place.  Our most recent experience (2 nights ago) involved my husband ordering two takeout pizzas.  The server said that it would be 20-30 minutes.  Well, 45 minutes goes by before my husband inquires about it.  To which the server said, "Oh yeah, I think that its ready." He brings the pizza home (we're a 10 minute drive) and the pizza is cold and the cheese is downright rubbery.  I don't know if it was a combination of the pizza being cold or of there being too much cheese on the pizza, but the toppings (including the cheese) came apart from the crust.  FOR. BOTH. PIZZAS.  Now, I know two things.  1).  This is a first world problem.   I get it.  Its pizza, not the cure for AIDS.  2).  I am not a pizza maker.  I don't know what exactly happened, but this is first time this has ever happened with a pizza.   And it was quite embarrassing because I kept going on and on to our guests about how amazing this pizza was.  Moral of the story, if you are ordering takeout, nag your server to make sure the pizza comes to your table when it is done.

37.description: I'm not sure what the heck happened to this place but, meh. Over-priced beers, food is meh (not a drop of love), service...they did a good job with what training they were given. I used to get the thin crust pizza but stopped as it was making me sick. I've tried maybe a dozen other things on the menu and nothing I took the time to remember. The new space is cool and if they had better beer specials I'd probably go there for the games. To be fair they did some improvements to the menu but with their food I had 3 bad experiences in a row. Something happened to the kitchen. And I was going to give you a 2 but that's not fair.

0.description: i eat a lot of pizza here in Chicago and i most say wow this place is so so so good really nice ppl a most go to. The chicken tenders and wings were tasty with the right amount of hot and mild seasonings but the thick crust pizza was too doughy and hardly could taste cheese and toppings.

38.description: It was a cold, rainy day, and my fiance and myself were starving.  We did not want to cook but had a craving for pizza.  Instead of going to the local Pizza Hut, we decided to try someplace local and have it delivered.The ordering process was straight forward, but you could tell they were busy.  The person on the phone was a bit short with me but nothing rude.  She did not give an estimated delivery time, but I used my typical 1 hour time window for delivery.One thing I do have to say is that Golden Crust is somewhat pricey.  Their base price is very reasonable but toppings are very expensive.  For a salad, garlic bread, and 16-in. pizza, we paid around $30 before delivery.  The food was delivered in about a hour fresh and hot.  In my opinion, the pizza needed a bit more sauce, but my fiance loved it.  The crust was absolutely perfect - golden and crisp.  The toppings were also plentiful and fresh.  We will definitely keep Golden Crust in our roster.

51.description: I have been a fan of this local neighborhood spot, but tonight was frustrating. I wanted to take my pregnant cousin out for a nonalcoholic beer, called GC and they have one option... So that's the place we decided to go. As I'm making my beer choice, I mention to her that the beer menu is difficult to read because of the spacing, and I finally order a Steigl from the imports section. I am served a Steigl Radler. I was expecting a Pilsner. They are not the same, and technically, neither should be listed as simply a Steigl, especially at a bar that boasts 40 beers on tap. So I sent it back and got a Stella. We were only staying for one beer anyway, but when the bill came we were charged $5 for what the menu clearly stated should have been a $3.50 nonalcoholic domestic beer. I pointed this out to the waitress who said "that's how the system rang it up." She inquired with the bartender who also disagreed with us and they were not willing to adjust the price. "Sorry about that," she said, but I leave the place with this bad taste in my mouth and no desire to return, so now "I'm sorry" that I'll be taking my business elsewhere.

27.description: Probably the worst thick crust pizza I've ever had.  Something smells like burning tires.  I hope it is not from my pizza.  Surely they must realize an error of some sort has occurred.  Perhaps the owner is present on a Friday night to uphold the quality of what could only be described as a disaster if he/she wasn't here to save the day.  Gotta love corporate America's audacity to serve this rubbish as fit for human consumption.Someone here is getting rich at the expense of society's palette.The staff is approachable.  She refills  your water without having to pant of thirst.  Unfortunately, I was not greeted by the manager after displaying my distaste for their pizza.He/she must be preoccupied with more urgent matters.

32.description: The pizza was nothing special. The service was good but I think we will go to another pizza place.

54.description: Finally, a place in Albany Park to go after a long train ride and longer day!  We had the calamari which was perfectly cooked and lightly breaded, wings, and a small deluxe thin crust pizza and we loved every bite.Let's be clear (hey, Yelp!) this is a bar, not a restaurant. And as a bar it gets five stars for great bar food and a VERY good beer selection. At least twenty on tap and probably twice that in bottles.  And sitting outside enjoying it all in their covered beer garden while watching the Cubs lose (or rain delay) makes it all the better!Friendly bar service (Pete) tops this place off. So if you're like me as someone living in these parts looking for a great bar near home, or just in the mood for pizza and a beer, you may have found your spot.

48.description: Food is pretty good. Full bar which I love. Good veggie burger! I will say that whenever I am there I always get service that is pretty lacking in the education department. They never seem to know what salad dressing, cheese and alcohol they have. So they could step it up in that department but overall good place!

44.description: Placed an order over the phone for a 16" pizza and 8 piece of fried chicken and was told it would be an hour and a half. Two hours later, called the location as food had not yet arrived and was told the driver had already left and would be here any minute. 20 min later called again as food had still not arrived and by this time had looked up that the location was only 4 min away by car. The second call the lady on the phone was so incredibly rude and condescending. The food arrived 10 min later and was cold but didn't taste too bad (why they got 2 stars instead of 1). If I were to give them another chance it would certainly be dining in and not delivery as the food would have been much better even if it was hot.

24.description: Take out and delivery not good. Too bad. Food really bad

7.description: Found this place randomly, was starving and just moved to the area. Super cheesy pizza and very quick delivery. Also got the breaded veggies, unfortunately all the breading kinda fell off which is my only complaint.

49.description: I've been ordering here for years and the thin crust is always consistently good. Stay away from the think crust. Just extra dough for no reason.

40.description: I recently moved to the Albany Park area and this is one of my favorite places.  It  has never been crowded when I've gone. I think they have 40 beers on tap. The pizza is good but it is not Chicago style.  The salads and pretzels are yummy. They seem to have a neat outdoor area which I'll be excited to try.  Very relaxed atmosphere.  The service is decent.  Good place to watch sports.

53.description: Great value, and decent pizza. I will tell you that they have a fantastic tap list, the problem is merely that their pizza is nothing to "ride home to mom about." Here is where they deserve credit, they are doing a much needed accessible restaurant in an incredibly diverse neighborhood (Albany Park). It's a huge risk for them to have this type of establishment, but they're tapping into North Park Universities student body with reasonable prices. Great place if you're looking for a good brew, and a cheap meal.

30.description: Great service and the staff members were very nice as well. At Golden Crust, they had a nice set up of all different games going on for different sports which was great and enjoyed the atmosphere

46.description: I have been twice and wasn't disappointed either time!  The pizza is not Chicago style, so if that's what you are looking for its not your place.  However, if you LOVE fresh cheese and a lot of it,  this is a great place to head to. They cover the pizza in cheese (you may need a fork to eat it as it's quite heavy! ) The beer selection is good.  Not great, as it seemed each time we tried to order a beer the one we wanted was out of stock! Still, plenty to select from....The waitresses are very friendly, too!

1.description: The pizza is good. The service is awful.We first got pizza from this place when we moved into the neighborhood. Actually, a guy who sold us a mattress recommended it, as he lives nearby, too. So we got a couple pies to go for out helpful friends who did a lot of heavy lifting with us on moving day. They were ready on time, hot, and delicious.Then we went to watch a Cubs game, as our TV was not hooked up yet. The pizza was hot and delicious, the beer was cold, and the TVs were on. The waitstaff was ok.Last night we went for another cubs game, and while it was crowded, there was no line out the door, there was no reason for anyone to be panicking, but we could tell that some of the staff were losing their sh*t.First, we walked in. The bartender (who had been our server the other night) grabbed a couple of menus and pointed to a teeny table against a wall. I said "Can we sit on the patio?" She put the menus away and said, "Sure, go ahead." She Put.The Menus. Away.We figured that someone would bring us a  couple, and that it would be fewer than 20 minutes before that happened. WRONG.Several innings later, we were brought menus, several innings later, we were asked if we wanted to order. In the meantime, one waiter was asking people to move tables in anticipation of needing the bigger table for bigger groups. Gee whiz, if you had someone greeting and seating (and handing out menus) you wouldn't have to be so rude as to ask someone to move where they were sitting. Customers were sharing menus because no one was coming around with any. Two waiters seemed to be panicking while our waitress was playing clean-up to their screw-ups. One guy (maybe a bus boy? he wasn't dressed like a waiter, that's for sure.) was carrying orders out and not knowing who they went to. "Did you order this pizza? Did you order this beer?" Seriously? We got our pizza, and it was hot and delicious. I was lucky to get the second beer that I ordered...several innings before. Too bad.

55.description: Love this place! Pizza is always great and have a nice selection of brews. The service is always great! Super friendly, I hate that I moved from the Albany Park area.

9.description: We have been coming to this place for years. Food is decent.  An hour for delivery. Nice dining-in since they remodeled.  Family friendly and fun for sporting events. We went there on a BEAUTIFUL Sunday afternoon at 1pm and wanted to sit outside, but the patio was closed! Why??? Terrible. Went elsewhere.

26.description: FOOD: I love this place. I have tried a few different things--pretzels and garlic bread apps (nothing special)--but my partner and I are creatures of habit. I adore their stuffed pizza, we almost always get pepperoni and pineapple. I don't have a snooty palette, and I think poor pizza is still, at least, pizza. This pizza is my favorite. I love the gooeyness of the massive amounts of cheese and the sometimes flimsy, sometimes crispy crust. (More often, the crust is flimsy under the weigh of the pizza's innards; the softness complements the gooey cheese, IMO. The crispier crust made the pizza easier to hold. Although there was a variety, this place is still pretty consistent. Plus, consistency is boring and bespeaks of taking the humanity out of food production.)SERVICE: The servers and bartenders are always friendly, and there tends to be only one server, sometimes that server is also the bartender (at least at the early evening weekday hour I go). Sure, sometimes that means the service isn't Johnny-on-the-spot, but they are always super nice and very eager to serve you (and they keep a good watch on my emptying cup of beer). Since I'm not an asshole who thinks the world and every customer service worker should revolve around my whims, the sort of service I find at Golden Crust means a lot to me. I don't know his name, but the bartender there most Monday nights is an incredibly friendly guy with some great tatts--I always love it when he is there.ATMOSPHERE: I generally go early Monday evenings to dine in, otherwise I'll do take out. I don't like crowded and loud places. Since Golden Crust is a bar, you would expect it to be both of those things. In the summer, the place tends to be more crowded, because their patio is nearly the same size as their dining area. Sometimes the music is a bit loud; it's a bar, they get a pass on that. However, they sometimes don't turn the music on until the evening progresses. This past week, they had no music on, but I could hear just enough of Con Air on the TVs that I could follow the movie. Like most bars, the TVs show people sportsing in various manners. I actively dislike sports, so I appreciate the times I've been able to cover lulls in conversation at the table by watching Con Air and Good Fellas.

25.description: Used to come here more often when I lived in the neighborhood.  Really solid pizza, and an amazing beer selection.  The owner always would come over and come ask how everything was and would buy a round.  Great spot, in an up and coming neighborhood.  I strongly suggest giving this place a shot.  Pizza is darn good, however venture away from pizza and you will definitely find out pretty quickly that they have really great high quality food all over this menu.  I will always come back, unfortunately not as often as I would like!

12.description: Their stuffed pizza was a hot mess. Aside from them giving our pizza to the wrong person and making us wait an hour 45 minutes when we live two blocks away, it was a huge sour disappointment to taste this heavy doughy brick of what they called stuffed pizza. It was bland, dry and just plain doughy. I had to slice off half the dough just to eat it and i didn't even enjoy what I was eating. I will stick with the thin crust.Thin crust is still  A okay in my books. I'm still giving them a 4 since they accommodated us for their mistake and I still love their thin crust. I think Giordanos stuffed is way better.

59.description: Have lived in the neighborhood 10 years, this place is always our go-to for pick up or delivery.  They did a nice job on the remodel and have a great beer selection.One request - please 86 the promotional/advertising pizza boxes...if and when I travel alone for work, I'll typically order in a pizza.  The box I picked up last night looked like something I'd get from ordering a pizza from Pappa John's in a city like Des Moines.  I know "it's what's on the inside that counts", and the pizza was great, but I'm having a tough time getting over the tacky take out box it came in....

21.description: Their stuffed pizza was a hot mess. Aside from them giving our pizza to the wrong person and making us wait an hour 45 minutes when we live two blocks away, it was a huge sour disappointment to taste this heavy doughy brick of what they called stuffed pizza. It was bland, dry and just plain doughy. I had to slice off half the dough just to eat it and i didn't even enjoy what I was eating. I will stick with the thin crust.Thin crust is still  A okay in my books. I'm still giving them a 4 since they accommodated us for their mistake and I still love their thin crust. I think Giordanos stuffed is way better.

17.description: Probably the worst thick crust pizza I've ever had.  Something smells like burning tires.  I hope it is not from my pizza.  Surely they must realize an error of some sort has occurred.  Perhaps the owner is present on a Friday night to uphold the quality of what could only be described as a disaster if he/she wasn't here to save the day.  Gotta love corporate America's audacity to serve this rubbish as fit for human consumption.Someone here is getting rich at the expense of society's palette.The staff is approachable.  She refills  your water without having to pant of thirst.  Unfortunately, I was not greeted by the manager after displaying my distaste for their pizza.He/she must be preoccupied with more urgent matters.

10.description: I always said a lot of good things about this place. I just tried ordering a pizza over the phone and whoever answered was a complete a******. I am just surprised at the customer service from this place. I wanted to have a pizza ready so when I got there I would not have to wait 30 minutes. This person did not care at all. I let them know that I was very hungry and I just wanted to have my food ready. I asked what kind of pizzas they had and all he wanted to tell me was thin and thick pizza. I told him ok I guess I won't eat there and he said ok and hung up they don't care that they lose customers apprently.

5.description: I like for the most part the employees. The food on the other hand is really bad. I ordered twice now the caprice salad (sorry if misspelled) and its come out with dried balsamic vinegar and the tomatoes are a little dried out. So it's definately not freshly made. The mozzarella sticks are horrible and the pizza always comes out either undercooked or over. I ve tried most of the other food and it's also not very good. The beer selection is good. Maybe though if the didn't scimp their food would be better.

3.description: Went in on a Thursday to catch the second half of the football game and the place was at quarter capacity; not busy at all. No one greeted me at the door so I sat down. After a few minutes all no service. Walked up and grabbed my own menus and said hello to the waitress. She comes by and takes the order of the table next to me. No service. She comes by and drops off the check for the table opposite me. Still no service. So I left.And every friggin table is wobbly.As for the food I'm sure it's alright. Who knows?

35.description: My sis and I were starving and decided to check out this place. It was a great atmosphere and our waitress (Kasia) was amazing and attentive. However, there was a misunderstanding in our order and I honestly think it was because the volume to the TV's was sooooooooooooo loud poor waitress probably couldnt hear our order. On my pizza there was hot peppers on the wrong half and I took a bite of a jalapeño. I am allergic to spicy food and in seconds I let the waitress know I cannot eat the pizza and ask if they dont mind correcting the order. Unfortunately we got penalized by that when the manager decided to let us wait 30-45 mins for a new pizza. We thought it was an honest mistake and he could of put our order first then making us wait. My sister insisted in talking to the manager because we both did not want Kasia to get in trouble and we just wanted to tell him how we enjoyed Kasia's service and how he should probably consider decreasing the volume but unfortunately he never showed up after asking for him twice.... how rude!

19.description: If you like thicker crust and sweeter sauce, order from G.C.K that's all bye.

28.description: Love this place with a passion. The owner Jimmy is a very involved owner that always comes around and talks about the local life and knows his beer like no one else.I have now tried their stuffed pizza, and its flat out amazing. I bring all my friends to this location when they're in town.

45.description: So I live in the neighborhood and was thrilled when they remodeled because my husband and I would only do takeout, never once stepped foot in the place beforehand. I was like FINALLY a bar I can go to, that is walking distance from my house. This isn't LP, Lakeview, WP etc where there is a "cool" bar every 30 feet, so its great to have a neighborhood place to watch a Hawks game, eat some pizza and hang out.The pizza is tasty, the fried veggies are delicious, and 40 beers with daily specials? Perfect.Sometimes the service is slow because they get slammed -but hey, it happens.  I don't need a server in my face every 5 minutes. The one downside is that their takeout menu is HUGE - but their in house menu doesn't have everything you find on the takeout.  I would love to try some of their sandwiches and other dishes, while inside the restaurant!

33.description: Pretty good pizza. Try the stuffed crust, although might be a little expensive.Great interior with plenty of tvs to watch the games.

43.description: The Greek french fries totally hit the spot, and my bartender made one of the best Whiskey Bloody Mary's I've ever had. Good draft selection too!!

2.description: I think I'm finally done with this place..As you can see from my previous review our family has been loyal GC fans for ever!!!easily 23 plus years..Unfortunately the last couple years the service has seriously gotten out of control. I am not sure but seems like the new staff or manager after the upgrade to GC pizza "and TAP" is def the problem..Our family has given GC so much business over the years and to be treated the way I have on 3 previous orders is just a downright slap in the face..1. and the most important here.. Aprox yr ago Order pizza for 7 kids. Pretty simple. XL Thin Crust Cheese and Sausage only. Pizza arrives with all kinds of veggies and call GC asap. The girl at the time (which is the same girl that has given me trouble last 4 orders) proceeds to tell me that the best she could do is give me $10 off on my next order wtf?? Manager explains the same.  "There is a $37 order in front of me that 7 kids will not eat because you guys screwed up and now you want me to spend another $26+ to correct the problem?" both said yes. Unacceptable. Run to Little caesars pick up a couple to feed the kids asap!! This also happened during a bears game last year. 2 XL THIN CRUST and sides we're talking $70+ order.. pizzas were screwed up somehow and all they could do at the time was give us a measly credit of $10 towards our next order. What kind of policy is this? If I order A and you give me B, why should I pay extra to correct this?? on that order we tried so hard to get the manager to understand how wrong this was that he just hung up on us. 2. About 4 yrs ago a buddy suggested we have them bake the Crushed pepper into our pizza. Wow was that a good Idea. GC has done this on many occasions for us ever since. It's only when this girl answers that THIS is not possible. "It's not how we make our pizza's sir" "It's not an ingredient sir" "The cooks wont do it sir" BS this has been done many times before. Charge me extra if you want just make this happen please. "Sorry sir, I can't" ok Thanks!!3. This has now happened 3 times but most recent last Sunday, XL thin crust deluxe please BUT can you ask the guys i the back to add no toppings to 1/4 the pizza? It's 4 adults and a 6yo  that freaks out if there's anything else on his cheese pizza. "Sorry sir that's not possible" She tells me that they can do 1/3 cheese and how that will be cheaper for me. I tell her that I don't care what it costs, charge me DELUXE for the whole pizza and just make 1/4 or few end slices JUST CHEESE. "Sorry sir our system doesn't work that way" It got me thinking that maybe there is only the option of 1/3 in the computer so I ask her If she could kindly go ask the guys in the back, as they are loading pizza with toppings, to not add toppings to the end of it, aprox 3 slices. "Sorry sir that isn't possible" HOW THE HELL IS THAT NOT POSSIBLE? once again this has been done in the past but getting her to understand that is not happening. This girl can not think outside the box to help a loyal customer of over 20 years now. She had no answer for me. So once again In my usual fear of servers/cooks spitting in my food, I declined to escalate this. Besides my previous run ins with managers there has gotten me no where.. This sucks so much because the truth is, we love the pizza. The problem for GC (although it seems they don't care) is that my extended family has also had couple similar issues. We  spend $thousands$ a year at this place!! One month alone we did the math and added up over $700 worth of orders! From the worst policy of correcting or compensating customers for incorrect orders to that Robot on the phone that can't handle a simple request WE ARE DONE.

18.description: This place is disgusting. We walked out. I read lots of reviews saying they had horrible customer service but good pizza so I decided to risk it. We walked in when the place was empty and neither of the two servers working would acknowledge my friend or I even after we both said hello to the server walking past us as we entered. The hostess brought us two waters and my friend looked down and noticed a piece of a FRENCH FRY floating in her water! My friend brought the water up to the two women working who were giggling together behind the bar and told them what had happened. BOTH servers were eating French fries!!! If they can't even bother to keep food from their mouths landing in the water, who knows how careless they are with the pizza. So disgusted.

41.description: Since moving to Albany Park, Golden Crust has become one of my mainstay pizza places for both dine-in and delivery. It is conveniently located just off the Kedzie brown line stop, and for those in the neighborhood, the delivery option is great too. First, let's talk about the pizza. I have only had the thin crust but have found it exceptional both via delivery and dine-in. The crust is truly golden--perfectly crispy and capable of holding voluminous toppings. In fact, it is surprisingly filling for a thin crust and each time I take visitors there, we remark about how our eyes seem to be bigger than our stomachs. However, the leftovers are great and reheat very well. I will say that the crust remains deliciously crispy even with delivery, which is not always the case. I can't comment on many other items on the menu, although the fried veggie appetizer is always good (and also filling)! I've only had this dine-in though so can't comment on it from delivery. Delivery service has always been prompt (early!) and spot on quality. Dine-in experience has been good as well. There is a nice patio that is weatherized so allowed for some nice fall patio meals. Also, they have a FANTASTIC selection of craft beers. The decor is warm and welcoming, particularly the lighting and Blackhawks wall. It does double as a sports bar though, so during big games gets a bit loud (just in case that's NOT what you're looking for during big games). Golden Crust is another nice go-to in the Albany Park neighborhood and worth the trip up the Brown Line for those outside the neighborhood.

52.description: This place has good Pizza. A nice place to chill with friends. I LIKE their variety of different beers. I have only gone here at night. Not a lot of people. Very quiet but also near the train, which is a plus.

50.description: Great pizza ,love the special for dining in specially on game days ^.^ the best pizza around all ways good , love getting the free wings and liter soda that comes with a stadium pizza specially since I get wings and pizza all the the time they come with a ticket that when I get my 20 tickets in no time I get a free pizza as a bonus I recommend this pizzeria to anyone the only bad side is living a block away on game night for teams you don't support since it can get really loud and are able to hear the screaming from a block away still tho the food its what's important and they have the good stuff

4.description: Golden Crust is so hit-or-miss. First, loved them. Then they got every order wrong, so we parted ways for a while. We mended our relationship and we were chomping on Stadiums again...until tonight. What started as a crispy, saucy delight turned into a soapy, nasty mess as I made my way to the edge pieces. Whoever is doing the pans needs to do a better job rinsing.

6.description: Disclosure: It helps If you know the paul Vitti calls Primo scene in the movie Analyze this.Oh damn! Im having lots of feelings about this...Im feeling very mad, very angry, in fact im feeling outraged. I need to get some closure on this.Golden Crust (GC) was a very trusted go to place for me when I lived in Albany Park. I am usually quite picky about my pizza but this place had rock solid food. In fact I ordered pizza here so many times they knew me by name. Unfortunately I moved out of the neighborhood and had not been there for quite some time. So with a couple of friends we decide to pay GC a visit to watch the Bears game, you know that game we allow 50 something points to Green Bay. This might be a couple months behind but I remember It vividly!  What an aweful night! The Pizza was horrendous, the cheese tasted old and rubbery and was falling off the Pizza. The Cheese Sticks we had for for appetizers were terribly overcooked or overheated, I had one and didnt want any more, when did that ever happen?! Did fricken Primo cook this food? For a drink I ordered a Cider and they brought me a beer and to top it all off the Bears allowed 50 plus points and got their ass handed to them. Now the Bears disaster was not their fault but I couldnt even take comfort in the knowing the food was there for me...Everything that night was a disaster... I was really angry and wanted to chop their balls off and shove it up their f*#%in asses, i wanted to bury them, wanted to stick ice picks in their eyeballs and send it to them for desert! How was that?After writing this review and imagining shooting their pizza about a dozen times i just want to say "there's your f*#%in pizza! Now that I have closure they get 2 stars because I know they can do better...

22.description: I visited here because my friend was having a going-away party. The pizzas are good. She ordered a buffalo chicken pizza and a deluxe pizza. I loved the buffalo chicken pizza, while everyone liked the deluxe better. I loved the tangy sauce and thought it wasn't too salty. It was also very cheesy. When it was brought out of the oven, it was steaming and stretchy. The service was also great. They always made sure we had water and enough plates and napkins. I really enjoyed that place. Also, parking was very easy around that area. I found a spot across the street right away.

15.description: Love this place with a passion. The owner Jimmy is a very involved owner that always comes around and talks about the local life and knows his beer like no one else.I have now tried their stuffed pizza, and its flat out amazing. I bring all my friends to this location when they're in town.

57.description: This place has definitely taken a step back since my original post. The wait staff turned over and is now very average. Pizza is still good, but the taps seem like they aren't cared for. I've had beers that taste weird because, presumably, the taps aren't cleaned properly. Hopefully it will shape up.

20.description: First time Still not decided. I ordered thick large 1 topping with coupon they say free but fries and 1 litter soda charged $.50 delivery is $3. The pizza was good at first but then after a while of bites I started tasting a flavor from sewer water (tart). It says Italian pizza but the tomato sauce is from a can, sausage needs flavor , fries were not fresh because some of the fries were re cooked that it cause it to have the burn taste and have a different texture . So far I recommend you to try villa pizza 3632 n. Pulaski road. They have messed some of my orders but it does taste more Italian. P.s. I have worked at a fast food restaurant with season fries and regular and I do know how fries are supposed to taste.

36.description: Disclosure: It helps If you know the paul Vitti calls Primo scene in the movie Analyze this.Oh damn! Im having lots of feelings about this...Im feeling very mad, very angry, in fact im feeling outraged. I need to get some closure on this.Golden Crust (GC) was a very trusted go to place for me when I lived in Albany Park. I am usually quite picky about my pizza but this place had rock solid food. In fact I ordered pizza here so many times they knew me by name. Unfortunately I moved out of the neighborhood and had not been there for quite some time. So with a couple of friends we decide to pay GC a visit to watch the Bears game, you know that game we allow 50 something points to Green Bay. This might be a couple months behind but I remember It vividly!  What an aweful night! The Pizza was horrendous, the cheese tasted old and rubbery and was falling off the Pizza. The Cheese Sticks we had for for appetizers were terribly overcooked or overheated, I had one and didnt want any more, when did that ever happen?! Did fricken Primo cook this food? For a drink I ordered a Cider and they brought me a beer and to top it all off the Bears allowed 50 plus points and got their ass handed to them. Now the Bears disaster was not their fault but I couldnt even take comfort in the knowing the food was there for me...Everything that night was a disaster... I was really angry and wanted to chop their balls off and shove it up their f*#%in asses, i wanted to bury them, wanted to stick ice picks in their eyeballs and send it to them for desert! How was that?After writing this review and imagining shooting their pizza about a dozen times i just want to say "there's your f*#%in pizza! Now that I have closure they get 2 stars because I know they can do better...

14.description: I came here to watch a Blackhawks' championship game 5 with a group of people on a Saturday night. We took a long table at the patio area and it was perfect area to watch a sport game close to TVs with the right amount of volume on. We ordered one thin crust meat pizza and one thick crust veggie pizza and two appetizers from the menu. The chicken tenders and wings were tasty with the right amount of hot and mild seasonings but the thick crust pizza was too doughy and hardly could taste cheese and toppings.  I like their a pretty big list of craft beers and its detailed description of beers on the menu. I will definitely come back to watch a sport game and try their another craft beer and another kind of thin crust pizza.

3.description: I love Nick's Billiards! This is such a fun place to relax and shoot some pool. Or they also have ping pong and snooker tables, which are hard to find in Chicago.The place is BYOB, which makes hanging out at Nick's an economical night out. I usually like to pick up a case of beer at the CVS across the street, and Nick's provides a bucket of ice. Nick's also has a concession stand. Their chicken sandwich is excellent, and I usually order it with french fries. Staff is friendly and accommodating, and there is plenty of parking in the lot out front.If you're looking for a great place to chill, hang out and have a fun time, visit Nick's Billiards.

1.description: This is what you call a pool hall. Even though I have been here before and it was cool back then. With the new renovations and new pool tables. This place has become pretty awesome. So I walk into this place on a saturday night and it was packed. I asked the owner if it was like this all time and he said most of the time. The owner was friendly and we talked for a bit afterwards. I could not help but notice how new everything looked and how clean this place was. The crowd at nicks is very diverse and It was a good sign to see everyone enjoying themselves and laughing. There was music playing that gave this place a cool atmosphere. It ranged from EDM to billboards top 50. Which was okay by me. The tables played great. I Guess because they were new. No dead rails and weird rolls. But what made my night was when I notice some tables had buckets of beer. I WAS LIKE " Wait, What? This place is BYOB. AWESOME SAUCE!" LOL. So my night was instantly made better. SO, got some 312s and chilled out. Then like most people. I got hungry. So I checked the menu and ordered the  chicken wings and cheese fries. While I was ordering I had a chance to get to know some of the regulars that hang out there and they were cracking jokes and friendly. Which gave this place a very hangout neighborhood vibe. Which is nice. When I got my food. It was surprisingly good. I had to order more wings...LOL...But with everything being said. My experience at nicks was very enjoyable. If your looking for a nice place to shoot some pool. Go to nicks. You wont go wrong.

2.description: So they just reopened a month ago.  I was there just last night and was expecting the old and moldy Nick's.  But this is Not the old Nick's.  Everything in this place is brand spanking  new.  Multiple tournament size Brunswick pool tables with brand new cloth.  My favorite is the Diamond table imported from Belgium.  Brand new carpet and fixtures.  They even clean the pool balls!  A friendly guy named John runs the place.  He had house music playing when I came in.  I rarely review anything unless it impresses me one way or the other.  If you are a pool player in the Albany, Irving Park, or Logan Square area you should check this place out.  The place is top notch and rates are like half of what Gcue or Lucky Strike charge.  Its also BYOB so whats not to like?!  The place gets 5 stars from me based on the brand new equipment, seting, and price.  The only thing this place needs is you so check it out.

5.description: WOW! How could I forget to write a review on my favorite hangout spot where you can find me 4 days out of the week! I enjoy watching sports games here as I am trying to unwind from a busy. FREE WI-FI too! You get a sort of "Cheers" feeling to the place. Table time is inexpensive and even cheaper before 5. Food choices including hot dogs, chicken nuggets/tenders, sandwiches, fries, chicken dinners, nachos, etc. They also have a snooker and ping-pong-table if you don't want to do traditional table. All skill levels play here.They have great cues and tables. Plenty of seats and tables to sit and chat between your shots.The staff is friendly and make you feel at home. The music makes things so much funner while you are dancung to your favorite tune. Go there grab a bite, bring friends, bring some brew (YEP, its BYOB), shoot some stick, and maybe you will meet some new ones.

6.description: What is with the other 2 reviews?This place is a hole. And not the charming hole in the wall you stumble upon once in a while kinda place. I used to come here all the time when ditching hs and shooting pool for hours on end. There used to be a "feature table" where the big dogs would gamble and do trick shots. The rest of the place was spacious but always packed with people ready to play and make some bets. Flash forward to the present. This place just let itself go. There is no "old school charm" or even any friendliness. They also recently raised their prices so shooters do not even get the same value out of it. The food is horrible and I would never dare to eat from there. It is worse than eating at a gas station, cause at least the gas station has turnover on its food. I have no idea how long some of the food has been rotating at Nicks, probably since my hs days. The tables are ok but this place which once was about 9 tables bigger, and had seen a lot more action during its heyday. Now it is sad and run down. It is a bit depressing to be there. The other patrons are cold and the service is bad. No action. No fun. Thumbs down. Dislike!

0.description: I might as well be one of the regulars. I live in Wicker Park so there are plenty of tables around, but none of them are anywhere near as nice as these ones... Especially the 9ft. Diamond table up front. I am here at least once a weekend. This place is BYOB and there's a 7/11 just behind it so you can walk over and get more beer if you didn't bring enough (I do that a lot.) This is an awesome place to meet OR make friends and get some solid billiards in. They even have a snooker table. not many places around can say that. No jukebox, but there is always music on and it's not so loud that you have to yell to say something. Food menu is small, but everything was Hand Picked by the owner and I will say it's all good. Last Weekend I noticed that the owner had replaced some of the house cues with new Dufferin ones which is always good. I wouldn't want to go to a pool hall and have to use an awful cue that's more beat up than the streets of Chicago are. It's Friday today and I already know where I'm going after work.See you on table 1 at NICK'S Billiards.

4.description: This place looks run down and neglected.  It looks and feels dirty and falling apart. From the patchy carpeting to the panel walls.  The tables and sticks seemed in ok condition, but tables were super close to each other. So much that, when shooting, the end of my pool stick goes past the edge of the neighbor's table.  That becomes a real problem when the place gets busy, which it did this Saturday night. The price is reasonable ($10/hr for two players). Unless they clean and fix this place up anytime soon and maybe space out the tables better, I would rather look for somewhere else to play before coming here again.

29.description: Hubby was super hungry one late night and randomly stopped here on his way home from night prayer. He wasn't sure what to get (indecisive as usual) so the guy behind the counter offered him a sample of the fried cod. He loved it so much he ordered a pound of it and headed home contemplating waking the Grouch (me) up from her beauty rest. That's some risky business right there. We all lived to tell about this place because it just so happens I will still awake... haha.Man oh man. We dogged that cod fish. The batter was perfectly flavored and super crunchy. Just a pinch of spiciness. Fish was cooked to perfection also. He was so excited he forgot to bring sauce. I let him slide this time. So today we decided to head in to have the fresh shrimp. The people who work there are super cool. We changed what we wanted like 10 times and the guy was super patient about it. We ordered a pound of shrimp and a 1/2 pound of the cod. The guy rang us up and told us to give him 12 minutes. No problemo with all the magazines laying around the place we kept ourselves busy.While we were waiting I read the signage which said they weigh the fish BEFORE they batter and cook it. I find that extremely fair considering the great prices they have in there. I wanted the crab cakes but they were out. He said that they make 8 or 9 of them every day so that they are always fresh.We got our food and yessss oh yessss it was delicious. I will say I enjoyed the cod more than the shrimp, but it was delicious. I am NOT a fan of tartar sauce but their sauce here is great. Went perfect with the cod. Hubby and I slammed it all.This is not a fancy schmancy spot by any means. It's a hole in the wall people so don't come in here expecting 5 star restaurant ambiance.There is limited seating, but if you want some fresh tasty fried fish stop in and enjoy!I will update them after we go back a few more times... let's see if that crab cake earns them the 5th star! Just stop in and give em a shot!!!

42.description: I really enjoyed their shrimp. Just the right amount of crispness and batter. My husband and I both agreed it's actually better than Hagens and Goose Islands shrimp. Will definitely be going back!

23.description: This place is great! Super fresh and delicious shrimp. We also liked the onion rings and mushrooms. The chipotle mayo is definitely one of their best sauces. This is not really a sit down place and the only downside is that THEY DO NOT TAKE CREDIT CARDS. Other than that, if you are in the neighborhood and looking for some tasty fried seafood--check this place out!

47.description: I tried the white fish, shrimp, catfish, and the chicken strips, as well as macoroni and potatoe salad, all were great. What I really liked was that the fish actually had meat on it!! what bothers me most is when u order fish somewhere and all u get is the breading and a sliver of actual fish meat, this place did deliver! really great prices try them out

8.description: Very good after hours food. If you're craving fried seafood, and you live in the area, this is a great alternative to some of the other spots like Goose Island Shrimp House.I have the jumbo shrimp, calamari, and cod with lemon pepper seasoning.They were all seasoned well and tasty!

31.description: So. Let me tell you about Fish N' Go, my guiltiest pleasure of all. This place is really good. The food is deep-fried, and the prices are great. The thing I like about it is that its not over-cooked. It's deep-fried to an appropriate extent. It's basically a fast food seafood joint and basically a hole-in-the-wall. Seating is basically limited to a few stools. The employees are courteous and helpful in helping you decide. My recommendations are the shrimp, nuggets, fries, & calamari.My only 2 complaints are they don't take credit cards and they charge for the sauces. But don't let the 30cent charge deter you from getting their cocktail sauce.

34.description: My guiltiest pleasure is an order from Fish N Go consisting of the following:1.  3/4 pound of chicken "nuggets" with a side of their BBQ sauce2.  Large potato salad (I savor each bite, incredible flavor)3.  Order of hushpuppiesIf you live in the hood, call in your order, then drop by for a pickup.  Everything is made fresh to order.  Seriously, you can watch them prepare your fried goodness.  Nothing is warmed up, or sitting around.  Bring cash - it's very reasonably priced - and then take your order home.

16.description: This place is a hidden jem. I don't come here as much as I should, but this place can't get any better. I always get the jumbo shrimp, calamari, and the catfish in the lemon pepper seasoning. I can't wait to try their crab cakes and hush puppies. This seafood tastes so fresh and of good quality and made to order. Don't let this place fool you, you have to try this place. The food is fresh, the prices are decent, and the cook is always friendly.

13.description: I was in the area and thought I try it out based on the positive reviews. It is a small little place and I wouldn't consider it a sit down restaurant but the food taste really good and fresh! I had the tilapia and shrimp. I enjoyed them both but will favor the shrimp more. I also had it with a small fries. The fries were  good in taste and portion.  The guy running the place was very nice and explained the different seasonings to me. I would recommend! And will be back next time I'm in the area.

11.description: I'm always looking for a good fish place. I'm picky. I've lived a few miles away for the last four years, but had not tired this place. Everything was good. I'll be back. I recommend.

39.description: I had the fried shrimp. They had good flavor and the breading was very crunchy. They could have used just a bit of seasoning, but that's my personal taste.The fries were fresh-cut and very good.The prices were very reasonable.The people were friendly and the place was clean. There are a few places to sit along the wall and window, but this place is mostly carry-out. There is all kinds of street parking along Pulaski.I would return!

37.description: I never see anyone inside when I go by, but they are still in business. I picked up some fish chips (cod) on my way home today. I was lucky enough to score a parking spot right in front, so it was fate.The fish was very good, as was the slaw and potato salad. The man behind the counter is friendly. I'd love to see this place do enough business to stick around for a long time. They have quite a variety of fish and a decent amount of sides. Mom really loved the fish, so I guess I will be visiting more often, because what momma wants, momma gets! (Of course)

0.description: I live right around the corner from Fish N Go and am so happy I do! Seriously the best deep fried everything I've ever had. I usually get the chicken nuggets, salmon, and hush puppies. Everything is fresh and prepared right in front of you. Super friendly cashier and the prices are dirt cheap for such awesome quality. Cash only*

38.description: The food is good.  The owner is really cool. Once they start taking credit it'll be even better.  I love everything.

27.description: This is the greatest deep fried seafood joint I have ever been too in Chicago! I say it's under rated and needs to become more well known in the neighborhood. I just can't believe I have lived in the area most of my life and I just found it a year ago :/. The owners are cool dudes too!

32.description: The floor is dirty and matches the employees hands. I cannot put food in my body handled by people who don't care about cleanliness. Where's the City Inspectors when you need them?

48.description: Really good yummy freshly made, fried shrimp! N mushrooms. Will be back. Great prices too!

44.description: I had seen this place for a while and decided to give it a try. I ordered 1/4 of chicken nuggets and 1/4 shrimp to test things out. The nuggets were great made from real chicken breast unlike the processed ones from fast food places. The shrimp were awesome to good size and breading taste good. I will definitely be a return customer to this place.

24.description: Went here after my GF recommended it and finally got us some food from here. The wait was about 20 minutes but was worth it because it was all freshly made to order. The food wasn't that expensive and was great. Both my gf and I are rubbing our stomachs and satisfied with the meal. RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. Owner was Very Nice.  Oh btw, While waiting they have Avengers on the flag screen TV.

7.description: Nice variety, decent prices, top notch quality. You should be getting your fried seafood here. A+And they're nice folks too.

40.description: Delicious food, great prices!!! Enough said, definitely going back many more times to come! Already found my favorites (shrimp & fish chips YUM!) but can't wait to try everything they have to offer.

30.description: Cash only... Limited seating.. Excellent service and great food! Freshly battered and fried upon ordering.

46.description: Perfectly cooked fish.  I tried the walleye and scallops. Great homemade tartar sauce. Just a counter and a few stools if you want to eat in.

1.description: This is an overdue review... I went in here about a year ago after a family member said they heard it was good. I went in with three other family members and bought food for everyone. The cool thing about that is I was able to try all their food choices in addition to mine. Everything we bought that night was really good and the prices were about average. We usually go to The Fish Keg in Rogers Park and Fish N Go was definitely cheaper than the Fish Keg! I would say a little newer/cleaner as well. Parking was a pain and so was their cash only policy. I had to walk down the street to go get cash and come back to pick up the food.I will definitely be back!

9.description: Delicious. Nice and juicy shrimp and fish chips awesome service. Probably one of the best in the neighborhood. Stopped by after reading the reviews here. !

26.description: We have visited this small place a number of times.  It is really a diamond in the rough and can be easily overlooked.  The fried jumbo shrimp are delicious!  The breading is crispy without being greasy.  The fried scallops are also good.  We visit whenever we need a quick fried food fix.

25.description: I have been wanting to try this little hole in the wall place for months after driving by and then seeing the amazing Yelp reviews. I finally got to try it Friday night. Just to cover all our sea creatures-crustaceans, mollusks, and fish-we ordered some shrimp, calamari and cod. Ho-ly. Mo-ly. Everything was so fresh and fried to perfection. The cod just melted in my mouth, calamari neither rubbery nor soggy, and shrimp perfect-no tails and very large. The staff was friendly and threw in some free sauce since we were first timers. Tartar sauce was the bomb! As another reviewer said get the lemon pepper seasoning- you won't be disappointed.

12.description: Not sure how this flew under the radar. But the food here is excellent. I had the shrimp and they were plump and very tasty. Was pleasantly surprised at how good the food tasted. Plus it's a good value. VERY nice family owned business as well. They offer quite a variety of fish. Next time, I'll try the wall-eye.

21.description: We tried Fish N' Go for the first time today. Excellent food. The menu changes a bit from day to day, because everything is always daily fresh. Although they're laid back, the owners take great pride in how they prepare food.For years I've enjoyed Snappy's and Hagen's for fried seafood. I think Fish N' Go edges both places out.

17.description: It's fried fish and it's fresh. But it's fried, and it ain't the best in the city like for example snappys down on Irving.

10.description: The best fish and chips in the city. Super fresh and made to order!! Such a small place you would never guess but I highly recommend your next lunch or dinner be here!

5.description: Quality seafood. Cod & shrimp are amazing, potato salad was delicious . Breaded mushroom.. Eh was okay, too much breading for my taste. It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside. It's actually pretty clean. It does take time to get your order but that's because they use fresh batter. It's cash only but for $20 we got a large order of potato salad. Cod, shrimp, and two orders of mushrooms. We were so full after. Well worth the money spent .

3.description: I read about this fast food place here in yelp and it sounded delicious. As I was walking near Lawrence and Pulaski, I decided to try it out and boy was I not disappointed. I was greeted by a lonesome elderly Latino. He told me to come in and was super friendly, always with a smile on his face as he explained the menu. I ordered 3/4 pounds fried fish and a coleslaw and he told me to wait for 10 minutes as he was frying the fish. Ten minutes earlier I got my food and returned home where I tasted one of the best fried fish I have ever had. Kudos to this old man he knows what he is doing. With a friendly demeanor and godlike food, he gained a customer.

35.description: You can't go wrong with cheap, fried, and delicious food. And when you can buy it by the .25, .5, and 1lb... Awesome! Try the scallops and calamari... mmm

19.description: Great place!  The cod and shrimp are fantastic. So fresh and delicious. The service was fantastic.Ric was so nice and friendly. We have been there 3 times in 10 days. He was very polite and easy to talk to. Can't wait to try the walleye when available.  Check it out, u will not be disappointed.

28.description: order the fried shrimp and the cod.  the cod has a different flavored breading but they are all so good.  the mushrooms are good and for less than $2 it's a steal!  they have tastly homemade cole slaw. this is mainly a take out place and they only take cash. service is outstanding and extremely courteous.

45.description: After a night of darts me and a friend needed late night snacky snacks and walked down the street to grab a bite to eat. The first thing you'll notice at Fish N Go is the blazing heat that emanates from the kitchen behind the count. The sweltering heat is likely to knock you out and the wait for food can be a test of endurance against the heat.  Fish N Go's menu includes chicken, various fried fish, fried shrimp, and lots of deep fried eats. the price was not too bad $8.99 for 3/4 lb shrimp and $1.75 for small fries or something like it. It is kind of annoying to pay 30 cents for cocktail and tartar sauce but whatevs. The food took ten minutes and the shrimp was crunchy but not tooooo overcooked. I wish they had given me a slice of lemon and that probably would have rounded out everything. A late night deep fried greasy spoon that is what you'll find over at Fish N Go. Maybe I go back, maybe I don't - it all depends on the intersection of opportunity and time and on the corner of Pulaski and Lawrence.

33.description: Real straightforward fried fish and chicken place.  They have a large selection of fish and also offer chicken.  The servings come in .25, .5, .75  or 1 pound and they offer cocktail, tartar, barbecue and hot sauce.  The food is cooked when ordered, so it is moist and fresh.  Despite being deep fried, it is not particularly greasy and the breading is just right.My son had the shrimp and I had the chicken.  Everything was bite sized and both were delicious.  The cost is fairly low.It is definitely take out and it is not high end cuisine.  However, it is well done fried food and the cost is hard to beat.

43.description: Better than I expected, not quite the same menu as Hagen'.   Fried fish and chicken.  First time today, 7/15/11 and I had Fish Chips, Clam Strips and Smelt.  All very good, as good as Hagen's  So were the French Fries - made fresh from unpeeled potatoes.     It took about 10 minutes to make the order.  I'm pretty sure the 1/4 pound serving was a little more than 1/4 pound.   Mostly for pickup, not dining in.  Street Parking on Pulaski on the east side of the street.  Call in advance with your order, leave the flashing lights on as you park to run in and pick up.

2.description: Quality seafood, fried to perfection, and reasonable prices?  Yes, you can find it at Fish N Go.  I'm glad that I reside in Albany Park and there's fried seafood available for my indulgence after work.  The owner is always friendly and tells you what they have in their shipment today.  We ordered the 1/2 cod, white fish, and shrimp...for under $20.  They also included the sauces for no extra costs (if you want extra, it's 30 cents).  The wait is usually ten (10) to fifteen (15) minutes, but it's what you would expect for made-to-order food.  Their breading is very crispy, which works great on "fish" items.  I prefer a bit less crispy breading on shrimps, but with their prices, I still think they are one of the best deals you can find in Chicago.  The place is considered hole-in-the-wall, to my opinion, yet it's clean.  There's no tables; there are some high chairs and wall tables if you want to dine in there.  I would say that you should take it to the park diagonally across the road, next to the Mayfair Market, if weather permits.Please note that this establishment is CASH ONLY.  While there's no ATM on site, Walgreens and Chase bank are nearby (Walgreens uses the Chase bank ATM).  CVS isn't far away featuring the PNC Bank ATM.  All you need is $20 for two (2) people, and I think you can handle it, right?

18.description: Great food i love there shrimp and hush puppies everything is amazing here great hangover food!!

41.description: Tried this for the first time today and was very happy with my lunch! This is definitely a carryout place and that is ok with me, I called ahead and my food was ready when I got there 12 mins later just like they said it would be! I skipped breakfast so everything on the menu looked interesting to me but I knew that my eyes were bigger than my stomach so had to resist the urge to order everything! So I settled for a 1/2lb of shrimp, 1/4 lb fish chips, small fry and hushpuppies.This was an enormous amount of food, I was expecting small portions but got a ton (8-10) of large shrimp (I forgot to count), 6 hushpuppies, a good amount of fries for a small and 5-6 or so fish chips, maybe more but I didn't really count.The fish and shrimp had a nice crunchy coating but were still nice and meaty and cooked perfectly. Hushpuppies were excellent had that wonderful crunchy exterior but a nice soft interior with a nice onion flavor. Fries were good as well and all in all this was an excellent first time experience and I will definitely be back.I gotta say unless something changes I won't be venturing back to Hagen's with this place right down the street!

4.description: I am Craving Seafood!Giving this place a try!Wow!Yes, I am starting off this Review with a Wow, I needed a word that pulleda lot of punch because honestly, that's what this place delivered to meyesterday afternoon.Now, I love Seafood, and I love the Healthier Options of Seafood suchas the grilled and baked varieties, however, yesterday I chose to try aplace in Albany Park where they serve the deep fried variety, becauseonce a year or so I just get the craving, what can I say?Guilty, I have no defense!Now, this place doesn't look like much from the outside, and it's a smallstorefront on Pulaski Road off the corner of Lawrence, but man, what thisplace is serving up on the inside is Killer!Well. not literally, cause I'm still here and it's the day after!The great guy who runs this place, his name is Rick, was so welcomingand friendly as I entered and he explained to me that they had a smallershipment than normal this week and that he might not have a few certaintypes of fish available at the moment.But, what I was craving was some Shrimp and some Cod Strips andsome Hush Puppies which I had heard through the grapevine werepretty great, and for the record, great they were!Not only were the Hush Puppies great but the Cod Strips were the flakiest,crispiest and freshest tasting, fried to perfection, not overly greasy either.Ditto on the Shrimp!So, great deep fried Seafood which is sold at various weights, menu pricesthat are more than fair according to the weight you purchase.And, a great guy named Rick who runs this place and delivered meprobably the best Deep Fried Seafood I've found yet.Well. I'm sold, give them a try, you will be too...Also, this place is strictly Cash Only, so Plastic won't do you any good here!So bring some Greenbacks, your stomach and wallet will Thank You later..

6.description: Yelp says this place is supposed to be open. I am currently sitting outside the restaurant, and it is closed. I'm kind of upset as I was looking forward to fish and calamari for my cheat day. Nowhere on the front door does it list hours of operation. Not impressed!

22.description: I was in the area and thought I try it out based on the positive reviews. It is a small little place and I wouldn't consider it a sit down restaurant but the food taste really good and fresh! I had the tilapia and shrimp. I enjoyed them both but will favor the shrimp more. I also had it with a small fries. The fries were  good in taste and portion.  The guy running the place was very nice and explained the different seasonings to me. I would recommend! And will be back next time I'm in the area.

15.description: Wanted seafood on a Friday night and finally decided to check this place out since it's within walking distance from home. It's a small place with no tables; just stools and counters you where you can eat. Ordered the mushrooms, jumbo shrimp, calamari, clam strips, fish chips, and French fries. Everything was delicious! They do take a bit of time to prepare the food but that's because everything is breaded to order. Definitely worth the wait though. Just disappointed in myself for not checking it out sooner. Oh just an fyi, it's cash only so bring lots of it.

20.description: Wow!  The seafood comes in fresh daily.  The breading is just right.  Homemade sauces.  Excellent fresh cut fries.  This place is fantastic.  The owner is very helpful and they have specials that veer towards the exotic (baby shark anyone?).  The shrimp were perhaps the freshest I have had at a fry joint.  Don't judge this book by its cover.

36.description: I've been coming here for awhile now and every time i come i just can't help but love this place more and more!! I love the fact that they now offer JUMBO shrimp and they have some of the best fries and onion rings that i have ever tasted!!! Most importantly though.......the staff is wonderful and always so nice! will always keep on coming back! If you haven't already tried this place than what are you waiting for!? GO CHECK IT OUT!!!

14.description: I have went by this place a million times & never stopped in. The place doesn't scream come on in....I wanted some fish and I was sick of Goose Island. Went here based off of the yelp reviews. Friendly guy who knows his stuff & takes pride in what he does! I told him it was my 1st time & he took his time & explained to me the menu & why they were out of certain items. EVERYTHING here is fresh....and EVERYTHING is breaded to order!!Yes, you have to wait a little bit longer but nothing beats freshness!! So glad I stopped in......I will definitely be a repeat customer!

28.description: Every time I go in here, I question whether or not I love myself.Or if I have selective amnesia and forget what the experience before was like. It's a thrift store, you try your luck, you cross your fingers. You get bombarded by smelly dudes and screaming kids. But alas I shall return again soon: crazy awesome blue dining tables, you shall be mine.

1.description: Last time, hubby "attempted" to go in to check it out, but he smelled the piss and spurred out of the entrance.  This time, Rosa J. was courageous enough to go through this adventure, but she detected no release of human bodily fluid upon entering.  Thus, she stayed.  I have to say that thrift stores are inspiring places to be if you try to reminisce the good times we used to have.  Even though I am no longer in my early 20s, some merchandize there certainly shared some common history with me.  I didn't purchase anything, though I normally would.  Since the PA announcement indicated that there would be a half-price sale coming on January 1st., I will stop by again to score some stuff that I saw in the store.Like other thrift stores in town, the quality of merchandize varies.  You can find a genuine-leather jacket for $35, or you can get a not-so-shabby sweater from a department-store brand for under $4, as long as you're willing to take time to dig in.  As a blazer junkie, there's a ton of blazers I'm interested.  Do you remember the red-velvet blazer that your awesome idol would wear on TV in 1994?  Yeah, I saw it, not to mention the 90s styles are totally coming back with a vengeance.  I took some photos, just for your entertainment.  To everyone on Yelp: wish you have a very successful 2015!  May the force of Yelp be with you.

39.description: My friend told me we were going to a second-hand store. I didn't expect something quite so close to Goodwill.My ADD is too finely tuned for this place.

9.description: Since I love thrift stores, I frequent this location every once in a while if I'm in the neighborhood.  But there really isn't anything that I've found here that's ever been extremely spectacular.  Plus, you will have to hold your nose upon walking inside, as this one seems to funnel yucky thrift store smell from their ventilation system.One more than one occasion, I've gotten run over by one of the workers rolling a clothing rack by me.  She only sheepishly apologized after I let out a loud wail from the pain!  Also, the staff here don't even care or acknowledge your presence, as they will place items on racks and rudely scoot a section of clothing into where you are shopping, as if you're in their way!And the all-time most hilarious thing I've ever seen here?  While filing through some T-shirts on a rack one day, I saw one with the biggest blob of dried and chunky puke on it, as if it were fake...but it wasn't!  It was priced and hanging up to sell!  Can you say "EWWWWWWW!" ?  Wait, was that the most hilarious thing?  I totally forgot about the cranky cashier that everyone here always snickers about.  She gets 5 stars for being the most entertaining experience of coming here.

29.description: My friends and have always made an outing of going to the Village because it is The.Place.To.Be. I can't begin to tell you how many gems I've walked off with there... like a Fendi shirt for $3.00, a brand new polo dress with the $120 price tag still stuck to it for $1.50. I kid you not. If you have the patience (and well, ehem, the taste) then you will make out like a bandit over and over.

23.description: This place is HUUGEEE. Two floors. You can find ANYTHING. However, it is very messy and barely organized. Slightly smelly, but I've learned to endure thrift-store smells (It ain't that bad.)Cheap prices. There are discounts on items with tags of a certain color.Look hard, be determined, sift through the crap, and you may find some worthwhile items. For example, I went into the store determined to find a sweatshirt with my college emblazoned on it. I FOUND IT. Next-to brand new, as well! I've also found quite a few name-brand items, like Abercrombie and Fitch and Victoria's Secret PINK. Girls my age: try the little girls and boys sections. Some junior's clothes end up there.If you're patient, you may be rewarded here. Don't give up too quickly. If your arms get tired easily, then go do some push-ups. Then you can push the heavy hangers back and forth with no pain.

5.description: There are moments you seriously say something and while you mean it, you want to be proved wrong. You hope the establishment cleans up or does something to resolve the compalaints and prove you wrong: abclocal.go.com/wls/stor…Honestly wish I was wrong, but like others too have said- there are seriously creepy and disgusting perverts. Be safe, Don't leave your kids unattended.

31.description: I grew up in this neighborhood and yes... I used to shop here often.  I couldn't afford those fancy Girbaud jeans my classmates were flaunting.  But on occasion, I'd find something "cool" here.  I shopped here long before the hipsters started wearing their ironic vintage t-shirts.  Long before it was "cool" to look poor, that is.  Now, enough of my bitterness.  Back to my review...You can find anything here.  Old cookbooks? Check. Acid-washed jeans? Check.  Nachos?  Check.  I remember going to the nacho stand (at the entrance to the store) as a kid.  You know, the kind with the round tortilla chips, melted cheese on the side, with pickled jalapenos on top?  Boy, back then... that was a treat!  I'm not ashamed to say it, either.

25.description: It smells like someone hid dirty diapers Easter egg style throughout this place. I go through these periods once in a while, let's call it...broke! And I think, "hey, I should try thrift shopping!" It only took me about 10 minutes to figure out that I am physically unable to purchase used clothing from this place...and yes, I realize I sound like a priss, feel free to throw hate in my direction v_vBut! They do have a good size book selection and they're like $0.40 each! Lot's of high school required reading and romance novels, but I found some older popular paperbacks in good shape.

12.description: It's right near the Kimball brown line, so I go here real often. I would say the chances of finding really cool stuff every time is slim, but once in awhile you can find something really cool. I recently found a Bob Mackie "wearable art" suit jacket, and I used to find an occasional piece of acceptable original wall art, but I haven't lately.The clothes sure do get disarrayed in there, falling all over the floor, but I don't see how that is the fault of employees since customers in there throw stuff around. I do think they could arrange the furniture a whole lot better, so you can actually walk past it, and I am glad they let you use the bathroom. Even though it doesn't have a lock on the door, it's nice they let you use it.As far as employees go, I love Kathy, one of the cashiers. Some people think she's mean, but I think she's really amusing, and always love listening to her joke around. When I go in, I'm disappointed if she isn't working. There is, however, a middle aged Indian lady in there who is a real grump.She used to scowl at me, and one day she told me I was trying on too many clothes, so I had to go complain. I also find it irritating to see so many people get the boot on their cars in the parking lot. There is a guy who stays in the lot all day long just to catch people walking off to someplace else. He then boots their vehicle and you hear them screaming, "Oh, my God!!!, Oh, my God!!," or something similar.

37.description: I love buying clothes here. Sure, it takes a while to sort through their messy racks and lots of the stuff is pretty hideous and you need to wash everything before you can wear it, but I've found some great things here.I went there today and I found 5 shirts and 4 pairs of pants and my total was less than $17. Since they don't have a dressing room...two of the things didn't fit me, but hey...I still got good deals.The store is messy, and lots of the stuff is junk, but at least this thrift store has some good stuff...and when it's good, they don't jack the price up on that item.Anyway, go hear and you'll probably be pretty pleased if you're willing to take the time to actually look.

21.description: This was the final stop and ended up being the one were the booty was scored! It was a little crazy because they were having a half off everything day and it was the last Saturday before the holiday. The clothes were well organized and there appeared to be a large selection. Prices were cheap ( especially at half off). Parking would be adequate on a normal day. They do accept credit cards. Overall a good store with lots of special finds!

16.description: This is truly the mecca for all things tacky! As you can see from my other review, this is the store that kicked off me and SJ's resale madness. On my last trip, ironically about this time last year, I had found one of my favorite Lady Gaga dresses here for $8. So, after two other stores with nary a tacky Christmas sweater, I had to stop here. You see, I am hosting a bad Christmas sweater contest at work and since I'm the resale queen, I need to BRING IT! This is also the place, during that fateful visit last year, where I witnessed a brave chap buying what had to be the funniest tacky sweater EVER!
