a word he said to me other than when he showed me the pan and said, "$9.99."  Despite the language barrier, he was very nice to us and patient while we decided.There is only one table with two chairs in here, but we were lucky that other customers took their orders to go.  I'd sort of intended for us to split a few pastries, but aside from the Knafeh, most of the cookies were 1-2 bites big and not ideal for sharing.  The cookies all looked really good and would make a great treat for your office, holiday party, or birthday.They also sell vegan and sugar-free baklava.  I would go back for the baklava for sure.  I would have liked for the menus to be more descriptive, including the random labels on the glass, because I probably would have purchased a sack of cookies.

57.description: My friend and I were craving for something sweet after having dinner at a nearby restaurant, but the dining experience there was pretty dismal so we looked for an alternative and happened upon this place through my Yelp phone app.I was not to be disappointed! In fact, Jaafer made my day by having an awesome Yelp deal, which made our visit even sweeter. (Sorry, couldn't stop myself with the play on words). First off, their display of sweet offerings is amazing and made you want to try everything. The service was very welcoming and friendly. He was very helpful in giving us advice on what to choose and even threw in a few extra tasty treats b/c he didn't want us to miss out.  We ended up w/ a container of various goodies.  Their baklavas are sooo GOOD, especially the chocolate baklava. It is heavenly at the first taste. Also, do not miss out on the pistachio-filled birds nest. You really can't choose anything bad at this place. I look forward to coming back to get my fill of sweets again.

20.description: I will never buy from this place again! I went couple weeks ago and there was a girl who I ask her what the price of bamia which is kind of arabic sweet she told me 1.5$ I told her I want 6 she ask me do you want to put it in the plate? I answered yes, and when I paid in the end I surprised she took more than 10$!! In the first I did not noticed because I bought several sweet , but when I checked the receipt I noticed , I try to ask her and it was very silly when she told me the price of the plate is 10 $ !! I told her I ask you first what the price of one piece , she told me but you put it in the plate , next time hold it with your hand ! So I advise everyone ask about the prices carefully before you buy anything and do not let them make fun of you!!

36.description: Came here for a sweet fix after I found the baklava I had with dinner at Noon O Kebab was less than awesome. The store is bright, clean, and cheerful and smells great. They sell over a dozen different baklava as well as several other Middle Eastern sweets. The owners are very friendly and enthusiastic that you try their different products. They have a long (20+) year history selling sweets and apparently you can get their baklava in many places including Whole Foods. You can mix and match most varieties of sweets for $9.99 a pound with 1 or 2 types being a little more expensive. After buying a good size box for less than $10, the owner offered us free drinks to go with the dessert. The only downside is that there is not really any seating so you have to take your desserts to go.I'm interested to compare this place to Nazareth Sweets across the street, which also has very good ratings.

14.description: YUM! Ran in here on Easter to pick up some yummy treats. Love that they have sugar free options (who knew!) that tasted as incredible as the full sugar treats. Will definitely be back.

28.description: Where do I start? Finchs brewery was great.  Beau knew a ton about making beer.  He was super attentive to the group and not to mention patient.  Most the guys in my group are not hop heads but they were able to find a beer they enjoyed.   This was an excellent experience as a whole.  Every single person on the tour wanted to return later in the future.  We were even able to order in some pizza.  I recommend this place to everyone.  If you want a place that allows you the taste their beers for the price of the tour not to mention the pint glass, this is it.  This is a great value for your money.

1.description: I miss Beau.  He annoyed me, but he was at least funny with his cornball jokes that I refused to laugh at.  We've done this tour 3 times now as our friends who backed out the 2nd time had us come with this last time.  Never again.  "You've done one tour, you've done them all."For the most part, this is true.  Unless you have some awesome history (like Argus) or have some insanely huge brewery (like Lagunitas), you know what to expect going on these tours.  The first time we came, they filled up our glasses from their tap and we actually got to walk around on the "tour".  The second time, they poured from cans and you could walk around a little, though the amount of people had greatly increased.  The guide the second time was knowledgeable, but quiet and therefore pretty boring if you were in the back and couldn't hear.  This last time, they poured about a half inch of beer and we walked down one side for the entire "tour".  You couldn't hear the guide as this group was even bigger than the last time, he didn't seem to actually have answers to a fair amount of questions being asked and as people started to walk back for more beer, he said something like "yeah, go ahead and drink the rest of the time, whatever."Is being on Groupon consistently actually working out?  They mentioned that the northeast accounts for a large part of their sales and I believe it, since they have a fondness for mediocre beer out that way.If you want people to buy your beer (and enjoy the "tour") you need to have entertaining people talking about your product and to give out more than a half inch pour, because it really isn't indicative of the quality.  I don't need to get drunk, but at least give a decent pour to make me want to go out and buy your beer.  The only guide who did that was Beau.

9.description: Went on a brewery tour here a couple of months ago thanks to the bestie. We had an awesome day!!! We learned a Lil about beer brewing. We drank A LOT. We ate some hops. In case your wondering it tasted like garlic.  I personally think the best part was the unlimited amount of beer we got to drink. I was not planning on getting drunk it just happened :/ not that I'm complaining. These beers aren't what I usually lean towards bc they're IPA's. They mostly have that skunky bitter taste to them. They had this one in a blue can I think it was a wheat beer it was definitely my fave. I also got adventurous and mixed two of the lighter beers. It was a winning combination in my book!! Even if one of the employees looked at me a Lil funny. If you're looking for a chill activity to partake in on a Saturday with your friends hitting up a brewery is definitely a good idea!!One of the employees was super cute n cool too. He was even telling us about another brewery that offered a gluten free beer.

29.description: Okay.  Ben responded to both myself and my friend to apologize for the oversight, explaining that the tour leader thought our appointment was at 2PM (still no call though?  To see where we were?  He just left?).  They are considering ways to make up for the misstep.Oh, and friend will be refunded promptly.

23.description: Boy was this $10 tour a blast! We were able to have a group tour and everyone could buy tickets online. Bottomless beer was great! Our tour guide was awesome...hysterical and really informative. Favorite brewery tour thus far in Chicago.

5.description: Super small brewery tour... They have a lot crammed into a little space, but it's legit!  They give ya a rundown of how beer is made and that's about it.  But, it's essentially an all you can drink event!  Sign. Me. Up!   We got half pours from cans, six choices... Threadless was my favorite!  Get the groupon!  Have a good time!

25.description: this tour is a must. we had the groupon for $12. 10 beers for 12 bucks can't be beat. u can get there 1/2 an hour before your tour starts and they let u use your own judgment for when u should leave. our tour was at 1pm and there were still people from the noon tour there when we left at 230. very informative on the brew making process if u haven't been on one before.  if u have, it's still worth it for the generous amount of beer u receive.

12.description: So like many other I picked up a Groupon to this place and was super excited to check it out. To start lets chat prices shall we? I've done Goose Island and MANY of MI wine/beer tours and I must say so far, Finch's you have taken the cake as far as price to amount of alcohol! They have some beers on tap and the rest are served from cans. Its nothing like the Goose Island one where you sit around after the tour and get your little samples of beer that are about 2 sips worth. Here you mingle in the production area and can try all the beers and go back for a seconds of some. You get about a good 30 mins or so to mingle and try the beers.Tour time. So The tour is about 20 minutes or so. Finches can not sell you any alcohol nor can they offer you some chips and a bar stool. They are just a production facility so its like if you or I decide, "HEY I want to make BEER in my garage!" but on a much larger scale of course. The tour guide was a super nice and funny guy.All in all, I would highly recommend the tour/tastings. Because of the tour my group of four fell in love with the stout beer they had our to taste and I even fell more in love with the Wheat beer. So thank you Finch's and the staff for growing my vice problems. Helpful Tips:-Bring singles! No no there is no stripper... but there is two different tasting stations and the people pouring your beers are serving you, so drop a couple singles in! -Bring cash as well if your like to pick up a hat or shirt. They will take credit card but they prefer cash they said. -Most of all: BE OPEN! I usually wont go for an IPA but Finch's was really good and I would actually pick it up for a night of pizza and beer.

21.description: Delivered as expected! Its very local to me so I went for the tour with a few friends. We arrived early and enjoyed Unlimited Pours of their beers. Nothing that knocks me out, but I dig their Stout(I am a bit snobby)Small place but they really packed the tanks in there. Fairly short tour with the usual run-down of the process. Pretty cool if you haven't seen a brewery before or didn't know how beer was made. Well worth the money! Free Pint Glass and about 45min of beer! :-) Give the tour a try! Support Local Brews!

16.description: Let's be upfront.  This is not a brewery tour.  Yeah, they say it's a tour.  Yeah, the Groupon you may or may not purchase says it's a tour.  But it's not a tour.  It's a marketing event.Finch has sort of a weird reputation in the craft brew scene, and this "tour" all but confirms the rumors.  Now, it's not a bad facility.  And I bet a lot of the folks that work here love what they do.  But calling what they let you come in for a tour is a bit misleading.  You come in, you check in and get your wristband and glass.  Then you're directed to go drink.  Cool! Unlimited half pours!  Who cares that they're opening room temperature cans, and the ladies pouring the beers aren't affiliated with them in any way and are expecting tips (don't forget to bring singles!), the beer is FREE.So you're kinda left to freely roam as you drink your beer until the beginning of the so-called tour.  Eventually their tour guide rustles you and the rest of the ridiculously large group up for what quickly becomes obvious to be anything but a tour. It's five minutes of talking about how beer is made (I guess a little more specifically how they make beer, but it's just barely personalized), although I mostly just head the conversations about all things not-beer happening around you.   At this point, you realize it's not really the tour that this brewery is interested in sharing with you.  Especially when the tour guide specifically asks you to please buy their beer.   Then it's back to the drinking!If you're cool with paying $6 a person (Groupon prices, who knows what they charge for a regular tour) to drink a bunch of mediocre beer they wrote off as a marketing expense, then this is the tour for you!

17.description: In the summer, I worked at Andersonville's City Made Fest and met a lot of local brewers, which is how I discovered Finch's.  We initially had plans to tour Half Acre, but we didn't arrive early enough and decided to call Finch's.  We were able to make reservations on a smartphone on the way over.  The tour is only $10 and for what you get, it's a steal!We were the second group to arrive, and I immediately recognized the gentleman who would be leading our tour.  My memory is a little foggy this morning, and I unfortunately can't remember his name. :(  Anyway, he was awesome as our tour guide, and you can tell he is super passionate about beer!  They announced that you could drink unlimited beer on the tour and had four on tap.  I started off with the Facist Pig, which next to the Threadless IPA is my favorite.  All you can drink beer for $10 is awesome!I would definitely do this tour again, especially over some of the other larger breweries in Chicago.  If you haven't been yet and are thinking about it, visit Finch's the next Saturday you can!

10.description: I purchased a groupon and a group of 4 headed here for a tour and tasting.Making a reservation for the tour was easy. There's a statement on their website that tells you if you have a groupon, you have to email them for your reservation. I emailed in my name, my preferred tour date/time, and groupon code and got a response back within a couple hours that we were all set for the tour.A couple days before the tour, I got an email reminding me of the upcoming tour date and giving instructions on how to find the place. There's no sign, but it's a black brick building with a red door. It wasn't too difficult to find, but there was no address.Cut forward to the day of the tour. We arrived, and were told we were not listed on the tour list. Strange. I had printed out my confirmation emails and showed the employee, and they admit they made a mistake - they had us down for the next Saturday's tour. No worries though, they gave us our choice of souvenir glasses (mason jars, traditional logo style glasses, or a more rounded beer glass) and we got to tasting.The tour starts with about 20-30 minutes of mingling and drinking. For this reason, I recommend going with a friend or two. There are bartenders giving out sample size tastes of their beer on tap and from cans. I truly liked each beer, but my favorite was the Secret Stache Stout. Chocolate-y, coffee-y, and just plain delicious.The tour itself was informative, but it was a bit startling to see how small their operation was. It honestly reminded me of a large-sized home brewer set up. Our tour guide was really nice and quite knowledgeable, and he made the experience fun.After the tour, there's a bit more time for tasting before the next tour starts. Don't look to linger too long though - there's no tap room to sit with a pint, nor is there food to purchase. Also, they can only sell to distributors, so you can't take any home with you that day.We got there around 2:50 and concluded around 4:30.Oh yeah, and parking was a breeze. There's pay to park spots a bit south of the brewery on Elston, but if you head north, parking is free on Elston as well as on the side streets (no permit needed).I would recommend this tour.

11.description: I've been on a few brew tours before and this one was just really disappointing. The staff is very nice and warm upon checking in and registering for your scheduled tour group. After checking in, we could immediately begin bending the elbow, which is pretty sweet; however, all the beer was served from cans. I would only expect that the brewery would have their beer on a tap of some kind. Despite that down fall, you can drink all you want (or can?) during your scheduled tour time. So while on the very, very brief tour, you can pop by the little table and get a refill. The tour itself was the most disappointing part. Our tour guide wasn't that knowledgeable about to the brew process or the types of ingredients the company uses. For example, I asked where their grains come from, and they said they will find out and let me know. I can only imagine this is more common question and they should already know. Perhaps they should think about assigning two guides per tour group to ensure all "basic" questions can answered. I gave our tour guide a benefit of the doubt and thought maybe their newer, so I asked the individual refilling our beers, but they didn't know either. He instructed me to look at the bags of grain in the brew room to see the origins printed on those bags. Overall, it was just a poor quality brew tour. For a smaller company that has been around since 2011, I would have hoped they hold higher standards for their company and their brew tour experience.

26.description: Sometimes, moms need a day out.  Enter, Finch's Brewery Groupon.  I got together my mommy friends and ventured out to an unmarked building on Elston.  We walk in and after checking in they give you a pint glass and ask what kind of beer you'd like (3 on tap - we had Threadless, Awesome Cabeza and Fascist Pig).  As we waited for people to arrive, we milled about in their storage room and drank (there were probably about 25 people total on our tour).  They announce at the beginning of the tour where the bathrooms are and that you are welcome to get a refill at any time during the tour.  Score!  The tour began and we started to get a little tipsy (hey, we are new moms and our tolerance is awful after abstaining for a year).  Our tour guide was good - knowledgeable and patient and able to talk over our drunken babbling (sorry about that!)  It was the run of the mill brewery tour information - but I love seeing how each place does it a little differently.  And it's great to see how excited the employees are to share their product.  The tour lasted about an hour.  It's a small place - you won't get lost inside if you have to take a bathroom break or get a refill - I'm amazed they could fit an entire brewing operation in there!  All of their beers were very tasty.  It's a great deal (even without the groupon) and I highly suggest checking it out.  It gives you a new appreciation for what you're drinking and puts a great personal connection to your beer!  All in all, a great way to spend a Saturday afternoon.  And again, sorry for our drunken revelry (and the glass I broke :( ).    Thanks for helping a few new moms unwind.

27.description: Great tour, super informative, fun and a significant amount to drink. Love I and would absolutely do it again.

0.description: Came here with a Groupon for a brewery tour. It was simple to sign up, I just had to email them what days and times I was interested in visiting and they emailed me back a confirmation. One of the best parts of the whole experience was that we got unlimited tastings throughout the tour. When we first arrived we got to sample beers, and got to sip as we went through the process of how the beer is made and manufactured. After the tour ended we got to continue to drink until our hour was over. At the end we also got to take home our Finch pint glass! I enjoyed all of their beer, but would say I was partial to their ales. If you are a beer lover, check it out! Worth the money!For more pics and details check out: stellasout.com/touring-a…

20.description: So like many other I picked up a Groupon to this place and was super excited to check it out. To start lets chat prices shall we? I've done Goose Island and MANY of MI wine/beer tours and I must say so far, Finch's you have taken the cake as far as price to amount of alcohol! They have some beers on tap and the rest are served from cans. Its nothing like the Goose Island one where you sit around after the tour and get your little samples of beer that are about 2 sips worth. Here you mingle in the production area and can try all the beers and go back for a seconds of some. You get about a good 30 mins or so to mingle and try the beers.Tour time. So The tour is about 20 minutes or so. Finches can not sell you any alcohol nor can they offer you some chips and a bar stool. They are just a production facility so its like if you or I decide, "HEY I want to make BEER in my garage!" but on a much larger scale of course. The tour guide was a super nice and funny guy.All in all, I would highly recommend the tour/tastings. Because of the tour my group of four fell in love with the stout beer they had our to taste and I even fell more in love with the Wheat beer. So thank you Finch's and the staff for growing my vice problems. Helpful Tips:-Bring singles! No no there is no stripper... but there is two different tasting stations and the people pouring your beers are serving you, so drop a couple singles in! -Bring cash as well if your like to pick up a hat or shirt. They will take credit card but they prefer cash they said. -Most of all: BE OPEN! I usually wont go for an IPA but Finch's was really good and I would actually pick it up for a night of pizza and beer.

19.description: Tour was great, as were the suds before during and after; but this place is in the middle of nowhere.

2.description: I need to lay the lumber to these clowns once and for all, because they're now on my local brewery sh*t list along with Two Brothers.Beer snobs rag on this place constantly, and I actually found myself irrationally making excuses for them by trying to hone in on their positives (I.e. making maybe two above average beers). But after my latest experience at their facility, I've realized they deserve all the ridicule. This is a company that always made mediocre beer, and in a surging and highly competitive market, have stubbornly remained stagnant. That's their prerogative. What irks me is that all they have to offer people, besides weak-ass beer, is a boring and highly regulated tour. If their cheap asses continue lessening their pours, they'll have to serve beer to people with a medicine dropper. This comes off as me being mad for not getting more free beer, but I'm mostly mad I couldn't get buzzed enough to forget how boring the tour, and the guy conducting it was. They need to accept the fact that the only incentive to coming here is for people to get their day drink on. Not to listen to them drone on about boring beer making blather you hear at every other brewerys' tour, or their uninspiring backstory. Much of that is their own fault for being too stubborn to change. Look, Finch's, there's a reason you're never NOT on Groupon. You can't lure people in otherwise. So the least you could do is not be incredulous to the people that do come in, and accommodate them. I know they're "too craft beer" to listen to suggestions and not do whatever they want to do, but it would behoove them to visit Argus' brewery, take the tour and take notes. If you're not going to make stellar beer, or have a taproom for people to hang, at least make your tour fun. I've endured way too much bitchassness from the people at this company, and the beer isn't worthwhile. There's no reason to come here unless you enjoy punishment.

18.description: We decided this year that instead of getting my uncle a weird gift related to beer, that we would start a new tradition: Christmas brewery tours. a $10 tour that includes all you care to drink and a cup to bring home = Christmas tradition hit. The space is cool, the beer is great, the only bummer was that the "tour" guide did not project loud enough to reach over people that were way more interested in the beer drinking than the beer making process - at times we were standing right in front of him and could barely make out what he was saying because it was so loud but I think that is more the fault of the other people that came than of his.

13.description: Read several of the other reviews. I really don't understand them. We had a group of 4 who went on a tour yesterday. Our tour guide, Frank, was great. He was fun, witty, and made the entire tour and process of brewing understandable to people who don't normally brew beer on a daily basis. I've been on many brewery tours and this one was my favorite. 1) The advertise unlimited samples. They really do give you unlimited samples. I believe the expression they used was: "We aren't in school." If you wanted to stand at the table the whole time and drink, they really wouldn't care. 2) They specifically tell you why they don't have signage. They can't sell beer from that location. I read a few reviews that were all jazzed up about that point. Look up the address and go to that address. Not that hard. 3) I will say that our tour guide, specifically, was awesome and extremely knowledgeable. I understand that this can vary, so for those who didn't have Frank, I'm so so sorry for you.4) Some of the other complaints I saw were that of "there's no seating" or "the tour is too short", etc etc. I mean, you're paying $10 for unlimited beer, (generous samples too), a free pint glass, and a little info. I think if you're paying more, you can complain about things, but this is clearly not going to be anything more than a $10 operation, and it was an awesome one! Have some more beer and chill out. 5) Hopefully they open up a tap room where you can just hang out and actually buy merch, because while it wasn't a huge deal not to be able to buy their product after the tour, that certainly is a fun part of many brewery tours. Overall - the tour and tour guide were great. For $10/person it was a great way to spend part of a Saturday afternoon. Don't have too high of expectations, this is not a huge brewery. It is a smaller, awesome place.

4.description: I was wondering when this would start happening. I've been on so many beer tours now, the information is of course repetitive and unless a tour does something exciting to spice it up (a la Argus Brewery), it gets monotonous. Prior to the tour starting, you can immediately start getting samples of their brews. Generous samples. I'm talking they basically fill up your entire pint glass sample. If you haven't been on a brewery tour before, you will find it very informative. They take you around their brewery while going through the brew process. I picked up some bits and pieces as I do with each brewery tour but I didn't find anything overly unique about the Finch tour. Once the tour finishes, they give you a completely reasonable time limit to hang out and have more 'samples' (ie their really full pint pours). They had all their signature brews on tap (Threadless IPA, Facist Pig & Cut Throat Pale Ale) + one cool new one (Wet Hot American Wheat) + some bottled brews to try. If your goal is to drink on a tour, they will go above & beyond your goal. The downside is there isn't a single chair in sight so you have to stand the entire time you're drinking. Personally I'm not a fan of standing & drinking and could have stayed longer to sip more drinks, but jetted after the tour due to this. Maybe that's their goal though!The guys working at the brewery are all great - really friendly, knowledgeable about Finch & the whole brewing process plus seem to have that passion I love seeing in beer guys.They said perhaps one day they will open a tap room, talons crossed!

24.description: In the summer, I worked at Andersonville's City Made Fest and met a lot of local brewers, which is how I discovered Finch's.  We initially had plans to tour Half Acre, but we didn't arrive early enough and decided to call Finch's.  We were able to make reservations on a smartphone on the way over.  The tour is only $10 and for what you get, it's a steal!We were the second group to arrive, and I immediately recognized the gentleman who would be leading our tour.  My memory is a little foggy this morning, and I unfortunately can't remember his name. :(  Anyway, he was awesome as our tour guide, and you can tell he is super passionate about beer!  They announced that you could drink unlimited beer on the tour and had four on tap.  I started off with the Facist Pig, which next to the Threadless IPA is my favorite.  All you can drink beer for $10 is awesome!I would definitely do this tour again, especially over some of the other larger breweries in Chicago.  If you haven't been yet and are thinking about it, visit Finch's the next Saturday you can!

6.description: I got a groupon for a beer tour here. I came with a friend and had a good time. they allowed us to try all of the beer and learned about their process. The staff was all very friendly and the beers were great! We also got to keep the beer glass we had for our tasting. One thing they could do to make the beer tour better, is to offer the beer for sale so you take it home right away. I'm just a business minded person, and since is hard to find their beers in all stores,  I think that is one place they can easily make money.

22.description: I was wondering when this would start happening. I've been on so many beer tours now, the information is of course repetitive and unless a tour does something exciting to spice it up (a la Argus Brewery), it gets monotonous. Prior to the tour starting, you can immediately start getting samples of their brews. Generous samples. I'm talking they basically fill up your entire pint glass sample. If you haven't been on a brewery tour before, you will find it very informative. They take you around their brewery while going through the brew process. I picked up some bits and pieces as I do with each brewery tour but I didn't find anything overly unique about the Finch tour. Once the tour finishes, they give you a completely reasonable time limit to hang out and have more 'samples' (ie their really full pint pours). They had all their signature brews on tap (Threadless IPA, Facist Pig & Cut Throat Pale Ale) + one cool new one (Wet Hot American Wheat) + some bottled brews to try. If your goal is to drink on a tour, they will go above & beyond your goal. The downside is there isn't a single chair in sight so you have to stand the entire time you're drinking. Personally I'm not a fan of standing & drinking and could have stayed longer to sip more drinks, but jetted after the tour due to this. Maybe that's their goal though!The guys working at the brewery are all great - really friendly, knowledgeable about Finch & the whole brewing process plus seem to have that passion I love seeing in beer guys.They said perhaps one day they will open a tap room, talons crossed!

15.description: Delivered as expected! Its very local to me so I went for the tour with a few friends. We arrived early and enjoyed Unlimited Pours of their beers. Nothing that knocks me out, but I dig their Stout(I am a bit snobby)Small place but they really packed the tanks in there. Fairly short tour with the usual run-down of the process. Pretty cool if you haven't seen a brewery before or didn't know how beer was made. Well worth the money! Free Pint Glass and about 45min of beer! :-) Give the tour a try! Support Local Brews!

7.description: Mike bought a brewery tour on Groupon, of course. We decided, why should our lives stop just because we had a baby?? So we packed up our little and headed on over. We had signed up for the 1:00 tour and showed up at about 12:40. When we checked in they told us we couldn't get in until 12:45...and asked us to come back. Hmmmm...weird?? I thought so. That is until I got in there. There's nowhere to sit, or even a waiting area. It's literally the factory that they make the beer in, with two tables set up with the cans of beer waiting to be poured into your glass, the glass was the best part. It was a little warm and humid out so the beer was only cold if you got it right when they brought it out and were lucky enough to notice them opening a new can...so there was a lot of staring at the pourers haha. Growing up in WI, I've been to lot's of brewery tours, this was definitely different. Chicago, stick to pizza. Let WI handle the beer.

8.description: Got the groupon for the tour and tasting. Chill place.We got to sample 6 different beers, an unlimited quantity. After sampling for a bit we did a tour and the brew master went over the process and how their operation works. After the tour we had til the end of the hour to continue sampling and ask any questions and mingle.Everyone gets a Finch's brew glass. For the money i paid, it was most definitely worth it.As far as their beer is concerned, I am a fan of their Blonde ale the most. I also enjoyed the pale ale and it was interesting to try the black ipa which i have never heard of.I say check it out and yelp it. Support your local businesses!

3.description: I used to live not too far from this place and had no idea this place even existed!!! You wouldn't even know as this building has ZERO signage outside, thankfully it was easy to find the address!I came here with some friends for a brewery tour...I have PLENTY of winery and brewery tour reviews on my page.  I've said it before, I'll say it again... if you've been through one, you've been through them all!  But, it's always a different experience of course, along with different beer.  The staff were super friendly the day we visited with our groupon.  We booked the tour in advance online with no problem.  Upon arriving we got our pint glasses and got to sample some beer ... they had them light to dark which was super helpful.  I'm not a fan of dark beer but I seemed to like one of them the best.They do not sell beer here, and their warehouse is located in the area of North Ave & Cicero.The space isn't huge but the tour takes you through the entire process with some information about what they do there and how they make beer and concludes with the bottling process.  At the end of the tour we were able to hang out and drink more beer.  It's something to pass the time on an afternoon during the chilly months.  It's worth checking out... just look for the address to the place, you won't see a "Finch's Brewery" sign out front :)

14.description: Really enjoyed the tour, staff was knowledgable and friendly. The beer was very good, especially liked fascist pig. Also met a lot of cool people on the tour, I highly recommend checking it out.

3.description: Everything we order from here comes fast and is just delicious Mexican. I have not physically been here, but delivery has been on point!

1.description: It's the first time we ordered from this place and the reviews were pretty good, so my family wanted to try and see if we found our next favorite Mexican resto. We ordered from Yelp through the app and ordering from their menu was pretty easy no complaints on that.The food came almost an hour placing the order which is pretty fast considering the amount of food we placed. We had the 2 steak burrito dinner, 3 taco dinner, 2 nachos con carne, 2 chicken quesadilla and 6 tamarind drinks. The food was superb it taste really good and it's not as salty as the other Mexican resto we've been through. The also hook you up with a ton of lime and salsa verde. The only complaints we had was my sisters taco dinner, two of tacos didn't have any meat on it and we were missing 3 of our tamarind drinks. We tried calling the number to get the rest of our order but there were no answer. When I checked the plastic, there were two individually packed tacos with the meat on them so that one was solved but for the drinks we never got to contact them to get it or get a refund on it. The drinks were pretty cheap so I didn't much complain on it for not getting it. Price wise they have one of the cheapest price I've seen so far for a Mexican resto. Not bad though.Overall pretty good food and drinks, but they need to make sure to get the orders right before making any delivers to their customers.

2.description: It's a pretty good place. They are fairly new and we randomly picked this place walking down the street. They have their al pastor on a spit which is delicious. The tostada was kind of okay. I'm a bit picky when it comes to tostadas though . They do start you with chips and salsa and with soup to begin with. It's nice and clean.

9.description: Their burritos is on point. Great meat to trimmings ratio. And their green sauce - Game over.

10.description: never got our order, they claimed grub hub never sent it over- we got confirmation from grub hub that they did get the order. they lied, were rude on the phone as we were handed to three different people without aknowledgement of the issue until the last one realized how mad we were - then totally lied and said, "Oh! weird we just got the order now!" that was an hour after it was supposed to be delivered. He said he'd send us our food in 40 mins. NO thanks, not going to wait three hours to eat, cancelled the order- their customer service skills are severely lacking that is for sure.

4.description: This establishment hasn't been opening for that long and it's less than one-block away from our apartment.  My husband and I decided to give it a try and we were impressed by how clean the restaurant was.  The cooks were friendly and provided good service.  The portions were generous for the values.  They do accept credit cards but the minimum purchase has to be $10.  I ordered from the Mexican breakfast menu (two over-easy eggs with green sauce) and my husband ordered the tortas.  Not to mention that the chips and salsa were fantastic.  There were three choices of salsa for the chips and all of them were full of flavors and not blend.  We also received complementary chicken soup for dining in which was good, too.  Overall, we definitely recommend this place when we want Mexican anytime (open 24 hours)!

6.description: Was looking for a late night taco/burrito place close by and found this place. I have had the steak and al pastor tacos and both are really good. Have also ordered the steak burrito dinner with the rice and beans and that too was excellent. I have eaten in many Mexican eateries and this place is better than many out there. Dining in offers a clean and no frills experience with good service. I have been a repeat customer several times over.

12.description: I give them average because nothing really stood out that "wow'd" us. The service was good and the place was clean. We ordered steak, chorizo, and Al pastor tacos. Wish the Al pastor had more flavoring but it's better than I've had at other locations. The horchata (rice water) was good. Overall average place I say. I would go back because i liked the service.

5.description: This place is awesome. Best burrito I've had in the area, open 24 hours, great horchata and amazing salsa/chips on the house. Great people.....They deliver! whaaaaa. 2 good, true love.

13.description: This place is legit, not to be judged by the numerous places that have preceded it in the same location. The food is great, prices are fair,and the owners are really nice. Plenty of seating inside!

11.description: Love this place. If I feel like tacos when I wake up in the morning? Los Flacos. Yo, just came from work and need a quick Guac and Chips fix, Los Flacos. Late night after-party burrito munchies? You guessed right-- Los Flacos.Very affordable, friendly service, open 24 hours, and chips & salsa while you wait for your take out order.

8.description: 2nd time delivery: called at 4:40 for 2 burritos. It's now 5:52 and still nothing. I'm only a mile away.

0.description: Grubhub delivery. I have ordered here twice. The carne asada burrito is great. The pico can be hot and spicy yet it's really fresh. The asada quesadilla is very good. The gauc was great once and just ok the 2nd time. The tacos were all very flavorful yet I'm lame and not a fan of soft corn tacos. I like flour tortillas so the tacos are out for me. This is becoming our goto Mexican place.

7.description: In a continuing quest to find good food delivery to Sauganash, we gave Los Flacos a GrubHub try one Taco Tuesday when we had just returned from vacation and were too exhausted to even cook tacos. Since the food was so affordable, we went a little crazy choosing an assortment and unknowingly ordered enough food for about 5 people between the two of us. One of my main criteria for a good Mexican restaurant is quality guac, and theirs was really great. I even painstakingly preserved what was left so I could use it for avocado toast the next morning(there was some left even though we pigged out because the order was huge). We tried the al pastor, chicken, chorizo, and carne asada tacos, expecting them to be small, like 3 per person sized, but they were pretty huge. I ate two and couldn't go on. I had bites of all and they were really good. Now any time Taco Tuesday rolls around and I'm too lazy to cook, I won't hesitate to call these guys.

29.description: My friend raved about this place when I visited Chicago. Having lived in NYC, I have trouble finding places where the look, style, and range of desirable clothing I want gets close to what SOHO or Brooklyn can offer, so I was very skeptical to say the least, but sometimes, your expectations are blown out of the water. In short...this place really really thoroughly impressed me for the following reasons:1) The range of selection is incredible..any size, a wide price range, any type of dye, any style of denim...you name it, this place has got it.2) Whoever merchandises has got a great eye. No...not everything in there will fancy your interest, but it'll be absurd for any store to be that way. But every item I picked up was reasonably priced relative to its quality and design. Someone here clearly hand picks each item and thinks about not just the style but the fit, quality, and value of an item...very impressed overall. This is such a hard thing to do right...finding an agreeable point of value and quality/design that offers maximum value for the customer and store.3) Service...yes, the service is fantastic. Having worked very closely with a lot of retail clients, service is soooooo tough in a retail environment. It's not just that the service is very knowledgeable and genuinely helpful, but the it's consistently very excellent. That's hard to accomplish in any retail environment (clothing, food, cafes, etc.). Rain or shine, there's always someone knowledgeable, friendly, and willing to help you out. And if you don't want to be bothered, they give you your space too. But if you're serious about picking up the perfect pair of jeans, listen to these folks. They know their stuff in and out.4) I know this place is known for their denim...but everything else is pretty fantastic too. Mildblend doesn't have quite the range of tops relative to their expansive collection of denim, but it's still a very solid offering. And guess what, they know their strength and specialty is denim, and they are hands down the best in that department. With regards to tops, footwear, accessories, etc., perhaps not the biggest selection, but as stated earlier, someone's got a great eye for style, quality, and value.Truth of the matter is...if you're the type that goes to the store, tries everything on, and then goes online to find the same thing at the cheapest place possible, I'm confident that these guys will still provide incredible service and expose you to new brands, styles, fits, etc. to make sure you find what you're looking for or didn't know worked well for you. But I value everything these guys offer outside of just the product. I will walk out with not just exactly what I had in mind but something better, because of the experience and knowledge of the people who work here. They don't care about selling you what's most expensive or in stock or hip...they genuinely care about what works for you. That is the biggest hallmark of an excellent store. If that means paying a little extra...and I mean very very little, I'm totally fine. Their pricing is very competitive for the stuff they offer. Not only that, they take really good care of you after the sale and also hem your jeans...try doing that with an online place. Truth of the matter is, the pricing for most of these goods are controlled anyway, so you wouldn't even find a better deal online.I'm thoroughly impressed. Everyone raves about how small businesses are gems...but truth of the matter is, few actually are. This place on the other hand is the pinnacle of a good small business to me. I have to concur with all of the other rating too.

42.description: Fantastic experience at Mildblend yesterday.  Smart, honed aesthetic, with a fantastic selection in Men's clothing.  What a nice change.  As it was my first time, Chris helped me shop the store, and was INCREDIBLY patient with me, as I easily tried on twenty items.  On top of that, he picked out two items that I would not have even considered that were perfect for me.  I'll be coming back often!

23.description: I just want to reiterate what Travis B. had to say: This is the only place in Chicago that has a chain stitch machine (Union Special).  So when your jeans are hemmed, they will look exactly like there are supposed to.  Chain stitch hem for jeans not purchased at their store is $25, they will hem on the spot in ten minutes.  Great service.With respect to jeans selection, large selection of Nudies and Naked and Famous.  Medium selection of smaller US makers, like Left Field and Rogue Territory.For Japanese denimheads, there were three stacks of Flat Heads, a stack of Iron Hearts (the 21 ounce denim), and a stack of Japan Blue / Momotaros.

8.description: Had a great experience buying denim here. Mildblend really knows how to take care of their customers! I was promised a free hemming service with a pair of denim I bought on 3/29/14 and they honored that promise almost a year later, no questions asked. Awesome customer service. Justin was extremely knowledgeable and approachable - he was a huge reason for my good experience today. Ps my first experience at this store was great as well, they really took their time to explain everything and help me try on several pairs to ensure a perfect fit.

31.description: I don't know of you have ever purchased raw selveged denim.. It is a process..with ao many brands, fits and wear characteristics.... then you have  the break in period! But the great guys at Mildblend in Chicago where a great help in all ways! Plus the huge selection was a treat and overwhelming  at the same time.. Better selection than anywhere in Los Angeles.  Highly recommended!!

34.description: Awesome staff, great selection. Staff took over an hour bringing me stuff and were very knowledgeable about the brands. Most of the things I ended up getting were things that the staff picked out for me and I'm extremely happy with all of them.

16.description: Visiting from California, we were looking for an authentic shopping experience with a hip local feel. Mildblend exceeded our expectations! Quality, cool men & women's wear with fantastic service! Luce & his team are superb!

13.description: The guys are SUPER helpful!! Really like the jogger pants

11.description: By far one of the best places in Chicago to shop if you truly care about the clothing on your back. The knowledgeable staff has always been a huge help when I've been in the shop. The past two times that I have purchased jeans from them, they were diligent to make sure I had the fit I wanted and needed. Even while helping the other patrons in the shop, they made sure that my time there was respected. I have had denim repaired there four times, and the quality of the repairs are always top notch. You can barely tell that there was a hole on the back pocket of my favorite pair of Naked & Famous. These guys are the real deal. Knowledgeable and friendly staff really make this one of the best shopping experiences you can have

39.description: Absolutely wonderful experience.Was on a mission for new denim. Had walked by here before and noticed the "free alterations after purchase" sign, so I figured I'd go in and check it out.Sales associate was incredibly nice, cute (always helps...Lee/Leigh, if you read this, you have my number in your store directory - call me), and super attentive. Knew her denim. Described kind of what I was looking for in style and fit, and she immediately had recommendations of fits and styles from different designers.Must have tried on 15 pair of jeans until I wavered between two pair; had to have been there for 90 minutes, including 30 minutes after closing time. Between Lee/Leigh and the owner (presumably), I found a pair of denim. Presumable owner really knew his denim; was able to tell me how different styles would wear, stretch, etc. Also, they were incredibly patient with me and my indecisiveness. As a major plus, when I paid for my jeans, they were hemmed on the spot.Will be going back again, without a doubt.

37.description: I don't typically leave positive reviews but there's a lot to like about this store. Not only do they have a great selection of men's clothing, but the hipster backpack collection is unparalleled. In addition to possessing great merchandise, they also are in possession of the best salesperson in Chicago. Leigh is extremely good at her job. She was able to dress my squat frame so well that now I no longer have to be ashamed of my hulking muscles and uncommonly short torso. I will definitely be back and hope to see her again.

0.description: First time in, staff was super patient and not at all pushy in helping me find my first pair of raw denim.  Bought and they hemmed in store for free (included with all denim).  Lots of great shoes/boots and jackets too, including heavy hitters like Schott NYC.  Props to these guys for not making me feel unhip in Wicker Park.  I will return...

38.description: I've been waiting a while for Chicago's answer to Self Edge or Blue in Green and it looks like this is it. If you're a denim head or into heritage brands this is the place for you. Luke may be one of the nicest, most knowledgeable people I've ever met in regards to denim, repairs and garment construction - he's genuinely passionate about the brands he has in the store. (For the record my first time in the store was today - I'm not a friend or marketer here to write a glowing review).It sounds like they'll be branching out into Japanese denim in the near future which is really exciting if you're in the Midwest and have had to buy denim sight-unseen to get the really interesting stuff. If you want clothes that aren't disposable and you intend to get years of really heavy wear out of them, then this is the place for you. His repair service is incredibly reasonable too especially if you've ever priced Denim Therapy or other similar places. He did a great job on my jeans with one-day turnaround.

27.description: Recently got three pairs of blown out jeans repaired here.  The job was totally pro.  At $25 a pair it was a little on the pricey side, but I am not sure where else I could have this done at the same quality.

32.description: Based on a walkthrough alone, I cannot wait to go back and actually try stuff on. It looked like they had an awesome selection and things were reasonably priced. Yep... can't wait to return!

44.description: Very knowledgable and laid-back customer service. Found some cool things and a great deal on a bag.Wil definitely be back.

24.description: Awesome store, the best denim store I have found anywhere. The staff took the time to find me a perfect fit - plan to try on a handful so they can explain the advantages and disadvantages. On-site hemming and ready to go.

7.description: This place rocks. I've gotten several pairs of jeans here, all custom-hemmed. And everyone who works here knows their stuff and really cares about the products they're trying to sell. You never feel pushed into a purchase - the salespeople will give you an honest opinion of what works for you and what doesn't. Also, they're totally chill about girls buying raw. Can't say the same of most places! If the prices are off-putting, hit up the sale racks - you can usually snag a pretty good deal. But also know that if you spend $250 on jeans there, you probably won't regret it.

40.description: I bought a Filson laptop bag here a couple of weeks ago and i am very happy with it so far. This place has a nice warm atmosphere and the staff was super knowledgeable and friendly.. They will even hem your jeans for free if you buy them there!

30.description: Best selection of raw denim in the city and the staff is awesome. They really know the designers and brands they carry along with how they will fit on certain body types. I had a positive experience here, brought my friend a few weeks later and it might have been better. If you are looking for good quality jeans and an overall good experience, this is the one and only place you need to go.

1.description: On line purchase was one of the best ever! An item was listed as in stock but then was gone before I hit the purchase button. Someone got the last one at their store before I could check out, soo.....Mildblend dug deep and found 1 in stock at the original manufacturer! Awesome customer service! Thank you!

9.description: This place is absolutely top notch. Especially if you are looking for denim. A ton of options of the best quality, employees are super attentive and know everything their is to know on the brands and fits. Know that you are buying premium denim, not for the designer name on them, but the quality. ($100-$250) I have no issue with the price points, some might.It took 10 minutes to get my pants hemmed (no charge) after getting them fitted and marked. I've never seen that before. The owner is usually doing the hemming and denim repair, he rocks.The only little downside for me is that some of their tops (button downs, sweaters, etc.) are really trendy and 'out there' design wise. To each their own in terms of style, though.No complaints, will be back for sure. All denim & pants will be purchased here.

26.description: exactly the kind of stuff i like, really high quality materials, and the staff is wonderful; even helped me pick out a few things for my gf which of course can be tricky if she's not there to try them on. but she loves them and they fit perfectly! props to mildblend

25.description: A totally unexpected gem! My husband and I were killing time pre-dinner with friends and never expected to do anything but walk in and out of Mildblend. The girls working there were friendly right off the bat, and couldn't have been cooler-not always the case in high end retail these days. After conversing about our mutual love for tattoos, Lee helped me find and try on some of the best jeans I've ever put on my body. I'm a terrible shopper for myself, and often order jeans online. I like what I like and stick with it, and she got me totally out of my comfort zone...and into two phenomenal pairs of salvage denim gems!They were so fantastic that we raced there after dinner so my husband could try some on...and he bought a great pair, and took advantage of the incredibly easy and talented on-site tailor for hemming. No one does a perfect raw hem that fast in store in the Midwest. It is such a great treat. I cannot say enough about this store. It's an incredible find and we will be back again and again. Knowing they also repair old denim is a lifesaver as well..,go see these guys and keep good people like this in business!!

12.description: Proof that big name department stores simply cannot compete with boutiques in terms of customer experience. For years I always wanted a quality pair of raw denim with the goal to achieve a pair of jeans that not only provide a custom fit over time but also breaks in naturally. I've heard nothing but good reviews about Mildblend Supply Co and my shopping experience proves why. The staff was extremely helpful and because they are passionate about denim, they make sure you walk away with the best fitting pair of jeans possible. Finding the perfect pair is process of trail and error. The staff helped me try on about 10-12 different pairs of raw jeans from several brands before we finally came that perfect pair. At the price point for a pair of jeans I expected great service but the staff went above and beyond.An added bonus is they will hem your jeans for FREE, which is a $25 service if you bought your jeans from anywhere besides Mildblend. Overall with their large selection of jeans and outstanding customer service, Mildblend Supply Co is the best there is in Chicago. I will no longer be purchasing my jeans from big department stores.

21.description: Proof that big name department stores simply cannot compete with boutiques in terms of customer experience. For years I always wanted a quality pair of raw denim with the goal to achieve a pair of jeans that not only provide a custom fit over time but also breaks in naturally. I've heard nothing but good reviews about Mildblend Supply Co and my shopping experience proves why. The staff was extremely helpful and because they are passionate about denim, they make sure you walk away with the best fitting pair of jeans possible. Finding the perfect pair is process of trail and error. The staff helped me try on about 10-12 different pairs of raw jeans from several brands before we finally came that perfect pair. At the price point for a pair of jeans I expected great service but the staff went above and beyond.An added bonus is they will hem your jeans for FREE, which is a $25 service if you bought your jeans from anywhere besides Mildblend. Overall with their large selection of jeans and outstanding customer service, Mildblend Supply Co is the best there is in Chicago. I will no longer be purchasing my jeans from big department stores.

17.description: I ordered a bag off the website & got tangled up in an unfortunate situation outside of Luke's control. But, he went above and beyond to make the situation right and for that I am extremely grateful.I never got the chance to shop at MildBlend when I lived in Chicago and apparently I missed out. As the four stars say, Yay! I'm a fan.

10.description: Went in just to browse. Did not expect to come in and buy anything, but once I walked in I saw that they carried Canada Goose I knew my bank account was in trouble. They guy that helped us was really attentive and brought me a couple choices to choose from. After deciding on the style I had to decide between two colors and the guys there were honest about which color looked best. I did not get the coat I wanted last winter but this winter I am fully equipped.

5.description: It's not cheap, but then what you get is quality backed by a man that believes in every product he sells.  That man is Luke.  I cannot say enough good things about him.  He's very down to earth and wonderful to speak with.  I've gotten my raws hemmed by him and it's a marvel to see him do his magic.  But he's more than just a magician behind a machine.  If only I had more money, I'd definitely patronize his location just on the fact that he sells quality items that he himself would wear.  He's one of Chicago's best local clothing shops hands down.

35.description: To put it simply, I'm incredibly picky with jeans. Having never purchased denim from anywhere other than the chain mall type stores, I was pretty nervous to buy high end jeans. The staff took at LEAST an hour of their time to bring me every possible jean they though would work for me. I'm pretty sure I was there a little past the actual store close when I finally figured out what worked for me, the owner (Luke?) even tailored them on the spot so I could wear them out. Would highly  recommend Mildblend, great store, great staff, great products. Thanks Justin, Luke, and one of the gals (can't remember her name).

19.description: Absolutely wonderful experience.Was on a mission for new denim. Had walked by here before and noticed the "free alterations after purchase" sign, so I figured I'd go in and check it out.Sales associate was incredibly nice, cute (always helps...Lee/Leigh, if you read this, you have my number in your store directory - call me), and super attentive. Knew her denim. Described kind of what I was looking for in style and fit, and she immediately had recommendations of fits and styles from different designers.Must have tried on 15 pair of jeans until I wavered between two pair; had to have been there for 90 minutes, including 30 minutes after closing time. Between Lee/Leigh and the owner (presumably), I found a pair of denim. Presumable owner really knew his denim; was able to tell me how different styles would wear, stretch, etc. Also, they were incredibly patient with me and my indecisiveness. As a major plus, when I paid for my jeans, they were hemmed on the spot.Will be going back again, without a doubt.

28.description: I ordered a bag off the website & got tangled up in an unfortunate situation outside of Luke's control. But, he went above and beyond to make the situation right and for that I am extremely grateful.I never got the chance to shop at MildBlend when I lived in Chicago and apparently I missed out. As the four stars say, Yay! I'm a fan.

3.description: Great denim selection and free hemming with purchase. They do killer repair work and always have a fresh selection of goods (Jeans, Hats, Packs, Boots, Shirts, etc,).

33.description: This is THE place for denim.I always have a difficult time finding men's pants with a good fit, but not once have I not been able to find something spectacular.The staff are extremely knowledgable and friendly. I got introduced to my first pair of Nudie Jeans by the sales associate Leigh. She knew exactly what size and fit would look good, and sure enough the first pair of pants I tried on was the winner. That takes a special amount of retail skill, and I was quite pleased with my experience.I highly recommend Mildblend for your denim needs.Make the world your runway!

43.description: Went here for the first time ever, they were so nice and helpful! Lots of sweet clothes and good sales.

2.description: I LOVE this store.They carry great,in demand brands.Stellar tailor in the shop.I always get parking so they are also great on the location column.of the ledger book.My son Max only buys jeans at this store.

18.description: Best selection of raw denim in the city and the staff is awesome. They really know the designers and brands they carry along with how they will fit on certain body types. I had a positive experience here, brought my friend a few weeks later and it might have been better. If you are looking for good quality jeans and an overall good experience, this is the one and only place you need to go.

41.description: This place is great. They have an incredible selection of the best brands. I bought my pair of nuddie jeans there and when they ripped in 5 months the owner did a professional job patching the denim. He rocks and the store is great.

4.description: Great store. Friendly staff. As soon as I walked in I was helped. They have lots of high quality items besides jeans. I really like their leather goods and coats. I had a pair of my favorite jeans repaired in the crotch, and the stitch work was top notch and reasonably priced. He even reinforced the opposite side to prevent another hole from forming. I'll be bringing back another pair in the future.

6.description: Great selection of higher end men's clothing. Very knowledgeable and helpful staff. Tons of selection you can't find anywhere else in Chicago.

22.description: Best denim experience!  When I wandered in I wasn't looking for a new pair of jeans-but raw denim had been intriguing to me.  Tulip was incredible and the entire staff was warm, friendly and truly excited about denim and helping me find the perfect pair.  After I tried on the styles that originally caught my eye, Tulip started bringing me other options which all fit much better than the original pairs.  Through the whole process she helped me understand what would happen to the jeans, what to expect and look forward to!  And at the end, they did a great quick hem job on the bottom (for free) to make the jeans perfect.  If you want associates that care and know their product go here!!  I live in MN and will now be going back the next time I need jeans!

15.description: I just want to reiterate what Travis B. had to say: This is the only place in Chicago that has a chain stitch machine (Union Special).  So when your jeans are hemmed, they will look exactly like there are supposed to.  Chain stitch hem for jeans not purchased at their store is $25, they will hem on the spot in ten minutes.  Great service.With respect to jeans selection, large selection of Nudies and Naked and Famous.  Medium selection of smaller US makers, like Left Field and Rogue Territory.For Japanese denimheads, there were three stacks of Flat Heads, a stack of Iron Hearts (the 21 ounce denim), and a stack of Japan Blue / Momotaros.

20.description: Staff was extremely helpful. Mad the process of finding the perfect pair of jeans very easy. Also, getting the chain-stitch hem for free is an added bonus

36.description: Great Denim shop. They have a really good selection here of jeans and carry some really good brands. The owner was giving me a great deal on an item I was looking for, but unfortunately it did not fit.Seriously, if you want a pair of good jeans, this is the place to come first. They even have a sale rack. I'd say this is the best place to look for raw denim in all of Chicago. The employees I met there were really cool and helpful and are even personal fans of the brands that are sold in the store. Mildblend is also the only location in Chicago that offers chainstitching for jeans. We need small businesses like this one in our city.

14.description: Great store. A huge selection of stuff, very knowledgable and friendly staff. They're at the high-end of the denim/heritage clothing market, and they make sure that you find the exact right pair of jeans that fit properly. They also hem without charge if you purchase at their store... as it should be at this price point.

12.description: Went here for contacts and glasses. They were very friendly and knowledgeable. They were great on helping me pick out frames from their big selection. Prices where good and they work with all kinds of insurance plans on top of that. Very satisfied customer here! :-)

3.description: I wish I could give this place ZERO star. The worst quality frames,the worst business ethics, the worst customer service....The hispanic lady is a liar. She lie to her teeth. The business charge you co-payment when actually there should not be any co-payment. I complained to my insurance and the insurance dropped this business. My insurance paid them money, a lot of money for Eye Glasses. But  both the lenses came loose with in one week. The frame doesn't balance correctly.Here it gets more interesting... My insurance representative told me the insurance actually pay them if they fix or repair the pair. They wanted to charge me extra $5 for a screw. Screw them don't give them your business.My insurance approved me for another pair from a different store.Please go somewhere else there are good alternatives out there.

1.description: I have been a loyal customer since 2007! I love everyone there. It is shocking to hear the reviews of poor customer service, since they have always been so pleasant. Dr. Hellen is so knowledgable! I was having trouble with my contacts and I was about ready to give up on them. However, Dr. Hellen suggested the daily contacts, and I went back to using contacts. Eye care is very pricey in general. My insurance is pretty good when it comes to eye care, and even sometimes I feel that everything is pricey, but realistically no matter where you go, you will be paying quite a bit for your eye care needs. I would highly recommend them to anyone! I love supporting local businesses, and I will continue supporting them, hopefully in the years to come!

2.description: Very friendly and accommodating as we tried to get our son's eyes checked before school starts. (Procrastinating parents - that's us). My 5-year-old was just enamored with Dr. Hellen and all her 'cool stuff' - and she was excellent, able to keep his attention and guide him through what she needed from him, without him feeling overly imposed upon. Parents of young children, you know what I mean. She was VERY good with him.All in all, an excellent experience. Everyone we had contact with was friendly and efficient. I will have no hesitations taking him back for next year's check-up.

9.description: I like this place and actually come here for all my eye wear and eye exams even though I'm 25 minutes away. The selection is great with a lot of name brand selections. The best part about this place is their service - they truly take their time with you and make sure you are happy with your eye glasses. I will continue coming here regardless of my distance....and that is rare for me.

10.description: Beware of this place!  Went to this place looking to buy a one years' supply of  Bausch  & Lomb toric lenses.  The staff up sold me to another make that was more expensive than the B&Ls but would be better on my eyes.  That brand that did not work for me.  When I asked to get the B&L after the trial period was over, the staff tells me that the B&Ls were the same price as the more expensive brand- so no refund of any difference!!  Ended up paying $40/box - on the internet, the price for B&Ls toric is $20/box!! They charged me double! And when I showed them proof, the staff tells me that I was paying for excellent service!!

4.description: Excellent Customer Service.  I have been in need of new contacts and glasses.  I needed an updated prescription and was given an appointment that fit my schedule.  My examination was done by a very professional and knowledgable Optometrist.  She was efficient and courteous.  Good Parking and quick service.  I love this local business and am happy to do business with them again.

6.description: I just walked away from one of the worst customer service experiences of my life. I have been going to lawrence eye care with my family for a few years now. It is actually not convenient at all in terms of location for my family but we have had such great service over the years, it was just easier to be loyal. I went in for a normal eye exam, asked for them to readjust my glasses that they had actually over-bent during my last visit (so the glasses were falling off of my face pretty consistently). The lady argued with me, told me it was my fault.. I then said, "it's ok.. I will take it somewhere else to be fixed then." and she then proceeded to get extremely upset with me, called me weird to my face, walked away muttering about how weird I was out loud, and called me weird/crazy to another co-worker there in front of me. I was so shocked.. and confused.. and could not believe they could treat a customer like this! Another lady came up to her and had her go into the back of the store. She threw a fit! and came back to me and said an exasperated sorry.. I then said to her I just don't think it is okay to call a customer weird, to which she responded "but you being weird is the truth!" - and this is when I decided I will no longer be bringing myself or my family back here again. She was then shooed to the back of the store. The older lady came up to me and apologized and said that the original lady is not normally like this and that she didn't know what was going on. That there may be something else going on with the lady.. Either way, I couldn't believe the experience I had.. It just had me floored.. all because I had asked them to readjust my glasses for me. I would NEVER recommend this business to anyone, ever again.

15.description: Lawrence Vision Center is a locally owned optical store with reasonable prices and a lab on site. The on site lab is one of the best things about this place, when I went in there and ordered my glasses they said that they would be available the next day! I think they will also do glasses in an hour but I was there near closing. One of the people working there told me they get their frames from a wholesaler (across the street). They have a large selection of frames, including ones they sell for $99. I didn't get my exam here, so I can't comment on that. There is another website with a review that says they will replace glasses with no charge. This was not my experience. My glass got split in half with a break where the left part of the nose bridge meets the frame. They were going to charge me "half price" from the normal price of the frame for new ones. Unfortunately that was about the same price I paid for the glasses because of the discount I got from my insurance. This is why they lose one star. All and all, they are very nice and have extremely fast service.

0.description: In reference to the high prices on eyewear...It is a fact that one Italian company, Luxottica, owns more than 80% of the eyewear industry and prices are dictated by them. They own all designer brands like Prada, BVLGARI, Dolce & Gabbana, Ray-Ban, and even Oakley. They own Lens Crafters and Sunglass Hut as well.Even with that in mind, I have always received competitive prices at Lawrence Eye Care. They have even specially ordered sunglasses for me at that competitive price straight from Luxottica. They have a friendly staff and great service. They repaired my glasses numerous times for free. This place is really out of the way for my family, but we still come back every time we need new glasses.

5.description: My last two pairs of eyeglasses were from here, and I've always gotten a competitive price. Maybe it's the fact I can haggle in Korean...

13.description: I've had nothing but good experiences here. Dr. Yun is super sweet and cute and extremely professional. The staff barely speaks English but they are happy and friendly and go out of their way to accommodate you.They accept all kinds of Ins and what is not covered is not too pricey anyway.

11.description: Maybe they are good for optometry, but steer clear if you have opthalmology concerns...We came in one Saturday when our dog accidentally clawed my boyfriend in the eye and scratched his cornea. We figured an eye doctor would be better than the emergency room, and were pleased when Lawrence Vision Center, which is only blocks from our apartment, could get us in in a few hours.After a brief exam, we were shocked when the optometrist gravely told us that the prognosis for my boyfriend's eye was "not so good" and that he would mostly likely lose some or all of his vision in his right eye. Her bedside manner was nonexistant and she really made no effort to impart any sense of hope to us.The optometrist said that she was not comfortable treating his eye because the prognosis was so poor, so she would prefer to refer us to a cornea specialist, an actual M.D. with a concentration in opthalmology. Unfortunately, since it was Saturday, there was no specialist available to come and we were given the options of going to the emergency room at Northwestern Memorial, who has an opthalmologist available, or for the optometrist at Lawrence Vision Center to perform "the procedure" (what exactly she planned to do was still a mystery). Terrified but definitely sure we wanted a second opinion, we opted to go to Northwestern Memorial, where we were stunned that our confident and articulate doctors told us that my boyfriend's prognosis was great! Aside from being painful and light sensitive, the cornea should heal within 48-72 hours with the antibiotic drops given. After doing the exact same basic tests that the optometrist at Lawrence Vision Center did, they confirmed that the scratch was not in his field of vision and his vision would not be affected at all. We were stunned that we received such drastic diagnoses and prognoses at the two different clinics, but it seemed that the Northwestern Memorial doctors were not necessarily surprised, considering optometrists do not receive significan opthalmology training. Bottom line: DO NOT go here if you need opthalmological care! If you need glasses or contacts, this might be your place -- their selection is good. But *do not* trust them with the health of your eye.

8.description: Gamsa Hamida!I knew which frames I wanted, and got a quote from Visionworks of almost $500 !!!  Ouch!  The people at Lawrence Eye Care were able to special order the exact frames, and had them made to order to fit my big nose in less than 3 business days, for almost half the price.  They just earned a valued customer, since I have worn glasses since I was 9 yrs old, and love to get new glasses, sunglasses, and contacts.  I am a very Happy Happy Happy Happy Customer.

14.description: I wore gas perms for almost 15 years and wanted to switch back to soft contacts.  First I went to a doctor in the burbs (where I was living at the time) and every week, my prescription seemed wrong.  He would check and check and tell me everything was ok, even tho I had blurry vision with the new contacts.  So I gave up and went back to gas perms after about 6 weeks.  OW!!  It was really painful to make the switch again.Fast forward to a year later.  My mom recommended Lawrence Vision to me (I had gone there as a kid) and I now lived in the city (although not very close, so I trekked up there).  When I explained my situation to the doctor, she told me that gas perms and soft contacts are totally different and that my eyes would go thru a period of adjustment, lasting up to 6 mos, and that my prescription would change continuously during this time!  But after I got thru that period, I should be ok.  She was very confident and explained everything thoroughly, so I felt comfortable trusting her opinion.For the next six months, I had eye appointments every 2 weeks where she monitored my progress.  Finally my eyes "settled down" and I'm now wearing soft contacts comfortably.  The only mistake I made was to order my glasses prior to the "settle down" period, so I had to have my lenses replaced (ugh) and pay for it again (don't make my mistake!).The customer service here is very good.  Make sure you are very clear on whether you are going to call them if your stuff is in or if you want them to call you.  Also, they have a great selection of designer frames, and I'm pretty sure their prices rival any "For Eyes" type place.  Also, great hours, and very flexible.  I highly recommend them.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 (which is kind of out of their control) is that it's a bit far from my house, and they charge $8 to send the contacts to your house if you don't want to come in.  Other than that, I'm very happy with their staff, prices and service.

7.description: I have been going to Lawrence Eye Care for glasses and contacts on and off since I was a kid. When I was 8, I got my first pair of glasses here. The neighborhood has changed quite a bit since then-- it used to be dominated by Korean restaurants and businesses, but now many have left the area. Lawrence is one business that has remained because it is an excellent place operated by warm, competent people. They grind their own lenses on site (you can see them in the lab behind a big plate glass window- very cool!), which means that you don't have to wait a week to get your glasses, like at most places.
