In many cases they only take about an hour! They have an excellent selection of frames, as well. The next time you need a pair of glasses, I would definitely recommend you give this place a chance.

28.description: Great place for late night. Especially since I live so close to the restaurant, haha.The steak and chicken tacos are great, had it once with just cilantro and onions, and another time with everything else. Both were great.

1.description: I want to start out by saying I was treated to amazing service from the moment I walked into El Gallo Bravo #6. I almost skipped out on this place for boxed mac 'n cheese with hamburger. Definitely made the better call for Mexican deliciousness. My order was taken immediately and I chose a vacant table next to the drafty windows to wait for my takeout. The waitress was sweet to offer me chips and salsa while I waited for my order. The salsa is infused with cilantro, which didn't disappear underneath the hair-raising heat of this sassy little sauce. I busted out my bottled water I had in my purse to help cool things down a little!I tore into 3 tacos. To switch it up, I got one chicken, steak, and fish. The chicken tacos here are the best and the most authentic tasting. I say that meaning that I feel the chicken taco had the most dimensional layers of everything family-owned little Mexican restaurants bring to the table in the way of flavor and spices. The aroma of the warm corn tortilla fused beautifully with the marinated chicken, cilantro, and onions. I expected some kind of sauce sobre the fish tacos (like what you come across in gorditas), but the meat was still moist and not over cooked. I just found the fish bland like it needed more spices or something to jazz it up. The steak taco was definitely dry, and I wouldn't come back for these a second time. I was definitely taken with the creamier side salsas they offer to pour over the tacos. The green was my favorite, but it still wasn't enough for the fish tacos.You don't come here for the atmosphere, but I definitely feel like the restaurant is too bright inside. I'd try to make the place look a little more inviting by using candles on the table or just dimmer lights. Otherwise I feel like El Gallo Bravo is par for the Mexican genre of 24-hour restaurants. They don't have to be fancy. All they need to do is keep on delivering the same quality of amazing service I received while I was there and that takes you far in the restaurant industry. Now that I know they are always open, I'll keep that in mind for late-night munchies.

9.description: Love this place it's 24hrs.and the al pastor is the best I've had on this side of the border!  They put the pineapple on it! Worth a visit anytime of the day!

29.description: Really good place here for take out food. Good seasonings on the meat and a unique, tangy sauce is offered here. The staff is friendly. Its the only place I have ordered take out food and I was given free chips and sauce while I wait for the order to be cooked. Occasionally they throw in extras as well.

23.description: As always, get the special. The "Fortachon" is steak, pork, ham, bacon, sausage, cheese, avocado, and sometimes onions with a side of refried beans and rice.This meat-a-lanche is well prepared and filling enough for two, plus leftovers.The green sauce has a nice kick (although it's thick in a creepy way).The orange sauce seems like someone mixed the green sauce with Roller Skating Rink Nacho Cheese.Otherwise a spartan Taqueria with strip-slot machines. Terrible service, but really, who cares?

5.description: The food is great and authentic. They are open 24 hours which is awesome!! They have four parking spots on the side of the building which is SO convenient. The waitresses are always really polite and friendly. They can get really packed with a late night crowd but everything still comes out promptly. I accidentally locked my keys in the car and they were so nice and let me keep my car in one of their parking spots overnight. Overall, customer service is on point with the food trailing very close.

25.description: I have been in desperate search for a good place to grab some Mexican food around the neighborhood and-FINALLY I have found it! I am picky with my meat n how its cooked and they nailed it on the head the first time around...I have gone on more than one occasion and they have not disappointed! The waitstaff is courteous and the prices decent. The Salsa options that comes with the chips definitely have a lil spice n I like it. Also, its 24 hours and I recommend going there at any hour. You don't have to be intoxicated to enjoy the food!

12.description: This place is open 24hrs and has a separate parking lot so parking isn't difficult (esp. Since it's located on Lawrence).Food is alright for quick bites. Nice sized plates of food. Takes CASH ONLY. Home made salsa is alright. Good service.

21.description: I've been there twice, like a month ago was fantastic, tbut the second time (sunday the 8th- Ocotober) was a little bad, I don't blame them because  a waiter and a cook dind't show up,  and they were really busy.It took 30 minutes to get our food, it was exquiste tough, the waiter was friendly and she apoligized 3 o 4 times for getting our food late.I really like this place , I  will give it  another chance, who knows, maybe this coming sunday ,:).

16.description: i walked by here last night and it smelled so good, i had to drop in and get some chicken tacos to go.  HUGE portions of chicken, literally busting out of the tortilla and inexpensive too.  might be the least chincy taco ive ever gotten in chicago.  that orange sauce they give you is different from your standard green or red salsa, but it is awesome.  i will definitely be going back here.  plus, 24 hours?  sheeeiit.

17.description: I come here more often than I care to admit because it is such an excellent place for an inexpensive, fast, and fulfilling meal. I usually get takeout because I live in the neighborhood, but it is actually a nice, clean, cheerful place to dine in too. It is almost never empty, and the crowd actually seems to pick up after midnight on the weekends.I am obsessed with their chips and salsa - both the green and orange salsas are incredibly spicy, but I often crave it and can't stop eating it once it's in front of me. You get this complimentary when you eat in, and they usually also give me some to much on while I wait for my carry out order. I also usually order this to go - just beware that because it isn't on the menu, the price they charge sometime varies depending on who is ringing you up. They aren't trying to pull one over on you - I just don't think anyone knows for sure how much they are suppose to charge for it.Ok - enough about chips and salsa (because I'm getting hungry now). I also like their refried beans and steak tostada, while my husband prefers thier chicken tacos. I'm not a big fan of their rice, largely because I don't like peas (there are enough peas in the rice that it is difficult to pick them all out). They also give you grilled onions and peppers with your meal, but we never eat these. Our out of town friends love this place - much more authentic and flavorful than what they can get in Indiana.

10.description: Great burritos tonight! We need more hot sauce though...one tiny little serving is not enough!

11.description: Their carne de asada tacos here are so good! I LOVE how they're 24/7. Also the place inside looks very clean. Salsa & chips are great as well. I wish they delivered. I will definately be coming back here.

26.description: This place was good for some non fast food Mexican. I had the chicken burrito and it was pretty big! They gill it nicely, so it has a nice crunch. I went with my other, and we ended up spending 17 bucks. Not sure really what happened, maybe it was those two soda's that we grabbed. I would go again.

27.description: The carne asada here is the standard griddle-cooked stuff, so nothing special. (I have a strong preference for broiled carne asada, which unfortunately you'll find in maybe 10% of the taquerias around here.) But their al pastor is the genuine stuff, cut off a shwarma-style spit and with just the right dose of pineapple slivers. I couldn't decide between 3 stars or 4, then I remembered their awesome salsas (you get three styles). The creamy green salsa is my fave. As is a common complaint of mine, I wish they'd take credit card. They'd get a lot more of my business if they did, especially since its 24/7 status makes it a would-be favorite for this insomniac.

0.description: I ordered a couple of tacos for takeaway lunch at El Gallo Bravo (the full title is Su Nueva Casa Del Gallo Bravo, if you are keeping score).  This taco joint on Lawrence is open 24 hours, and is BYOB.  I don't know what the atmosphere is at 3AM, but around noontime there is efficient bilingual service from the staff.Typical me - I ordered single tacos with three different fillings.  I was wondering if I needed to break open a bag of chips at home to fill me up.  No needs for chips on this day, as each of the tacos have a generous amount of filling.  My favorite of the three was the chorizo, which seemed to have enough flavorful chorizo meat for two tacos.  The al pastor and the chicken tacos were fine, though I admit I was concentrating the sides (lime wedges, two kinds of sauces) on these two and not the chorizo.  Never had radish slices with tacos before (also on the side), but I ate them all up.  If this place were just a teeny bit closer to my house, I might come here more often

20.description: I come here more often than I care to admit because it is such an excellent place for an inexpensive, fast, and fulfilling meal. I usually get takeout because I live in the neighborhood, but it is actually a nice, clean, cheerful place to dine in too. It is almost never empty, and the crowd actually seems to pick up after midnight on the weekends.I am obsessed with their chips and salsa - both the green and orange salsas are incredibly spicy, but I often crave it and can't stop eating it once it's in front of me. You get this complimentary when you eat in, and they usually also give me some to much on while I wait for my carry out order. I also usually order this to go - just beware that because it isn't on the menu, the price they charge sometime varies depending on who is ringing you up. They aren't trying to pull one over on you - I just don't think anyone knows for sure how much they are suppose to charge for it.Ok - enough about chips and salsa (because I'm getting hungry now). I also like their refried beans and steak tostada, while my husband prefers thier chicken tacos. I'm not a big fan of their rice, largely because I don't like peas (there are enough peas in the rice that it is difficult to pick them all out). They also give you grilled onions and peppers with your meal, but we never eat these. Our out of town friends love this place - much more authentic and flavorful than what they can get in Indiana.

19.description: I went here for a late Saturday lunch at 2pm today with my family.  The place wasn't busy, which was to be expected.  There were maybe 3 tables occupied.Right away, we were given homemade chips and 3 types of salsa: a smooth creamy orange sauce with a kick, salsa fresca, and a smooth creamy avocado sauce with a little punch of its own.  My favorite salsa was the avocado, but all of them were pretty tasty.I ordered 3 tacos with just onions and cilantro: 2 carne asada and 1 chile relleno.  Everyone else ordered carne asada tacos as well, but with different toppings.  You can have just onions and cilantro, or you can go all out and add lettuce, tomato, sour cream, and cheese.  I prefer simplicity when it comes to my tacos.After we ordered, they brought out cups of chicken noodle soup with limes on the side.  Delicious!  I added a squeeze of lime to mine, but it wasn't really necessary.  The soup was good all on its own.Now, for the tacos... The chile relleno taco was not very flavorful.  It was improved by a squeeze of lime and some salsa, but I probably won't order it again.  The carne asada tacos were good, but not great.  The meat was cut a bit on the thinner side, and the meat was cooked a bit more than I'd like.  They were pretty tasty again with a squeeze of lime and some salsa.El Gallo Bravo, you were good, but my heart still belongs to La Pasadita.

2.description: I was really excited to eat here after seeing the reviews but unfortunately, I never got the chance to actually try anything.My fiancee and I waited about five minutes to have someone come bring us a menu last night, despite it being rather empty, the young woman who ended up bringing us menu made a point of bussing empty plates from a few tables before bothering to drop them off.  Didn't bother asking us if we wanted anything to drink.About five minutes later she came back and took our food and drink order, but neglected to ever come back.  After seeing at least four more tables come in and be seen and brought drinks promptly after they sat down, I told my fiancee I wanted to leave.  15+ minutes with nothing to drink, but every other patron who came in after got their's within three minutes? Idk, I guess my skin isn't the right color for them.

18.description: I've been here many times at different hours of the day and they consistently make good food.  They have large portions for their entrees so I suggest sharing with a friend (or two). Thanks Mark G. for suggesting this place.

13.description: I am only giving 3 stars because of communication. Otherwise their tacos are soooo good!!! But it's a hassle bc I don't speak Spanish and they do not understand any English. It's so frustrating bc I love this place but they need to hire someone who at least understands the basics.

4.description: The food is great! But the service is horrible! They have no social skills what so ever.i stopped dining in! So I started pick up! things were going good for 2 months up until today the gave the wrong order, I called in and told them the issue and the server (if you want to call them that) never even tried to rectify the problem, I asked to talk to a manager.Guess what no manager came to the phone. They even tried to charge me for a delivery fee to bring me the correct order.

24.description: I love the tacos from El Gallo Bravo. I would always go to the spot off of Montrose, The best part is that they are open 24 hours. Except one time when I went late night on Christmas. This place is good to eat tacos at any time, but  these really hit the spot when you are drunk going home real late night. The red sauce is amazing. I was excited when I saw this spot open off of Lawrence. Get the Tacos de Bistec with jalapenos and grilled onions use the red sauce and prepare for your nose to run wild.

6.description: Food is amazing, probably best steak tacos and tortas in the area, but customer service is very hard to judge if you don't speak Spanish. I speak just barely enough to order (sin frijoles!) but the communication is just off. You'd think they'd have at least one English speaking person on staff. Meh. Food is still worth it, good prices, and 24 hours!

22.description: I've been here many times at different hours of the day and they consistently make good food.  They have large portions for their entrees so I suggest sharing with a friend (or two). Thanks Mark G. for suggesting this place.

15.description: If you know a better place, please let me know. Until then, this is the place for al pastor. Open until 5am for your fix.

7.description: This place has very good food the cooks truly take their time in cooking their food so delicious. The waitresses are also nice and attentive to everyone. Best part is that it's opened 24 hours!

8.description: Great carne asada burrito. I got it without the rice and it's still humongous. I knocked two stars off because their sauces weren't that great. Sauce is very important!

30.description: My friend and I went here after a late night concert.  We were both starving and I needed to find a place open late and near my home.  Fortunately, this El Gallo Bravo is open 24 hours.  YES!!!I learned my lesson from my previous visits and ordered tacos without all the "extras" (sour cream, cheese, lettuce, and tomato).  No need for that.  I had 2 chile relleno tacos and 1 ribeye taco, with cilantro and onions ONLY.  Delicious.  I tried some of my friend's carne asada taco, as well.  The carne asada was ok, not the best but it was fine with a squeeze of lime and a bit of salsa.Again, this place is a gem for me because it's so close to my home and open late.  If you happen to be in the neighborhood at some odd hour (I'm not going to ask why...*cough*Admiral Theatre*cough*), check this place out.

3.description: El Gallo Bravo on Lawrence is the closest Mexican restaurant to our apartment.  Even though it's advertised as a "24/7" joint, it opens and closes as they wish.  So, why weren't Rosa J. and hubby regulars to this place?  The "older" El Gallo Bravo failed the city sanitation inspection and had a mandatory shut-down for quite some time last year.  Nevertheless, it resurrected and has been in business since that fatal temporary closure.Anyhow, we came this evening after Rosa J.'s long day of work.  Rosa J. did her usual weekend routine: menudo, while hubby had the enchilada de queso.  After we found a table and have got ourselves situated, the server delivered for chips and salsa.  They weren't particularly spicy, yet we felt the need to order the drinks.  Therefore, a large horchata and a large jamaica helped set the tone for our dinner.  Here are my reflections on each item we had at El Gallo Bravo on a cool, non-festive Sunday evening:- horchata: hubby commented that it was too sweet for his palate.  - jamaica: it was actually strong and the amount of sugar was adequate.  - enchilada de queso: it was filling because of the copious amount of cheese.    The lettuce was decently fresh, and the arroz appeared appetizing.  - menudo: it was awfully bland.  I added all the peppers, diced onions, cilantro, and lime that were given to me to the broth.  All these add-on ingredients still didn't boost the flavor.  Once again, my quest to find a perfect bowl of menudo in the north-side Chicago hasn't yet succeeded.  We gave away another hard-earned $24 to this mediocre establishment.

14.description: Is this place still open? Called them 5 times tonight and got the operator message telling me the number has been disconnected! One star for teasing me with these amazing looking tacos and then not having a working phone :( guess I'll have to give my business to Cardona's

0.description: I've been going to Tomas for 20 years. He does a wonderful job cutting and coloring my hair. I always get tons of compliments after I see him. His prices are reasonable. He is an extremely nice man who always fits me in when I need him.I recommended him to several of my co-workers who now use him on a regular basis and are very pleased. My husband uses him also. Highly recommended neighborhood salon.

3.description: Nasty Nasty Nasty fooddisgusting guys behind the countera dead bug in the hot saucenot cheap and the owner keeps on staring "not freindly"food went to the garbage and i was still charged full pricei will never come back

1.description: There are better places to go down the street for some good middle eastern food.The rice was bland, the hummus was bland, the falafel was ok.  You can do better than go to this place.  I liked the chicken shawerma and the chicken and steak on the combination plate and everything else was just average.We were the only people in the place, but still had some trouble waiving down the server.  The cook was kind enough to make a fresh batch of a sauce that they did not have already made, which was really nice.I am not sure I would go back again, just because there are other places that are much better down the street.

2.description: This restaurant is tucked away in strip mall. Probably not a place to take a date to, but if you want a generous portion of middle eastern goodies then this is the place. I stopped by for lunch and ordered the meat combination platter. The kifta was tender and juicy and the shish kabob was also quite tasty. The schwerma - perfectly spiced lamb shaved right of the rotating grill thingy- is the best I have had in Chicago. A generous portion of tasty olives, pickled radish, pita bread , rice and creamy hummus comes with the order. All of this for about $10.  I ordered a couple of falafel, which were also tasty but not as memorable as the meat. My waitress was an approachable and accomodating Bulgarian woman who offered me a minty tea on the house.

5.description: absolutely without question the best hummus in the city.... their daily specials are also pretty delicious for only $8.99.. enjoy

0.description: We order the Fata and combination plate. They brought complimentary falafel ball which were wonderful with the tahini sauce, a small hummus plate and our dishes. The meat was spiced right and moist. the rice was flavorful and plentiful.  The fata which has cripsy pita bits in a warm hummus sauce is very yummy.  We are planning on going back.

4.description: Food was just okay, but I have tasted much better at other spots in this neighborhood, like George's and Al-Amira across the street.  I only ended  up here because they have free parking.  The waitress had very dirty fingernails.

58.description: Beagle found this place with his little puppy nose  and brought us here. No, really... I have pictures to prove it! Some weekend mornings, I am too burnt out to cook. On those days my handsome Boyfriend will suggest a walk and a coffee. Here, our Beagle wanted pie, or maybe quiche, or maybe baked treats... They were all good but what I really, really adored was the duck and mozzarella sandwich- delicious, wonderful textures and I seriously debated getting another. Yes, two sandwiches, all for me. Shut up, it was that delectable.I got a slice of pie and shared it with Boyfriend and Beagle. Boyfriend had the mediterranean quiche with salad and there were no leftovers- which means it was scrumptious.The guy at the counter was cute and sweet- which I appreciate tremendously. Coffee was decent and the outside benches in the sun are wonderful on a bright Spring morning. We will be back. You can't beat the cause- feeding the hungry!

56.description: Great Slice to enjoy!

29.description: This place has quickly become my go-to spot for lunch when I don't want to eat anything heavy. They have a wide variety of salads including a chicken curry, which is my personal favorite. They also offer organic eggs and burgers which I have yet to try. Coffee is always fresh and flavorful and the pies of course are really good. I'm not big on the sweets, but I highly recommend the blueberry and peach pie. Atmosphere is pretty chill and they have some outdoor seating as well.

42.description: I love this place and my 2 1/2 year old loves this place. The food is delicious and the pie is out of this world. Cherry pie is the best. The staff is always friendly. If you're in the area stop by, you won't be disappointed. I also love that its near a park so after lunch or dinner we can walk over to the park and play for a bit.

23.description: This cafe has everything I could want. Amazing pie with a variety of types, affordable at around 3.50 a slice, and a great location. I love that they do a non-profit for the homeless and feed 600 people a week! I don't live anywhere near it but I am wiling to take the brown line up any day for some yummy pie here!!

47.description: Every person who has ever stared in dismay at their stove at the end of a long day wishing they did not have to cook to achieve a healthy meal without spending a fortune needs to know about the subscriber program at First Slice. It's seriously the most awesome thing ever, and in being a subscriber you're actually contributing to a program that helps the community.Even when i'm not sure what certain items are on the weekly selections, I've come to realize that it's almost always unimportant, because regardless of what it is it's going to be delicious (chicken tinga? wth is that? guess what, doesn't matter! delicious!). Now when it's time to make dinner I have no stress of having to deal with it and no guilt brought on by succumbing to dialing for over-priced take out.And they even accommodate our low-carb needs. Thank you! I feel a little guilty because we've been on the subscriber program for several months and I haven't written a review- tbh I was avoiding it because I didn't want to have to subtract a star for the morose staff I've interacted with. I'm very pleased to note that has changed with the new management- I've definitely seen a huge upswing in the positivity levels at the counter- yay!Oh and to the person who wrote that the salads in the counter creep them out- bummer for you because they're friggin delicious. In particular, curry chicken salad and cucumber chicken salad are utterly delectable. Also, pie. YUM.

8.description: Delicious food and great service. The tuna salad sandwich is excellent and I highly recommend the cherry sour pie. Honestly, it's hard to go wrong with anything on their menu.

31.description: This location is always well kept and has a variety of choices. Their coffee is good; if you are like me and do not like the taste of hot milk, they do have soy and almond. They also have specials up on their wall everyday. The staff has a lot of positive energy and they make your stay feel like you are in their home. The location is small, cozy and everything a little cafe should be, in my opinion. I have enjoyed myself every time I have stopped by. The Francisco Brown line is right next-door and it does make noise, but nothing to make a big deal about. If you are looking for a small quiet place to eat, drink and use your computer to get work done like me First Slice is your spot. I suggest that you visit before you actually listen to the bad reviewers. Some people are too spoiled. Learn how to appreciate the little things in life. ;)[CPaynes]

34.description: Great community Cafe! I love this place. We went for the Sunday brunch and we weren't disappointed. I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo and it came out more like a grilled wrap. Very affordable. We ended the meal with a couple slices of pie. Best I have had in a long time. Will be recommending to all my neighborhood friends.

16.description: This coffee shop is rad, and so are the people who work here.  Nice location, and nice crowd inside.

13.description: I've been here quite a few times and surprisingly, I've only had pies twice! I do recommend, like the others, the blueberry cheesecake pie. It's decadent and delicious. I also enjoyed the chicken guacamole sandwich and their coffee-braised pork burrito. The side salad paired with sandwiches has a light citrus vinaigrette with a kick of chili pepper, which is yummy. The coffee and lattes are good, but nothing out of the ordinary. I come here often because it is in between school and home, and it's a cute little place to get some work done that is just steps away from Manor brown line. The staff is always very friendly, which I appreciate. One downside is that the menu is a little overpriced. The atmosphere of this location is definitely relaxing, even during my study power hours, and I feel at ease just being in this homey environment. It might just be the friendly faces behind the counter with awesome customer service :)

11.description: First Slice catered our wedding - and it was incredible!!! We hosted a 150 person wedding in the suburbs of Chicago - we were set on using First Slice as our caterer because of their delicious food, their important mission and their reasonable prices. As they have not catered many large weddings in the past, we were a tad apprehensive but..........THEY WERE INCREDIBLE. Sarah Beth was our point of contact, she was SO professional and on top of her game throughout the process.  She went out of her way to coordinate with the venue and our wedding planner to ensure everything went smoothly. On the day of, the food service was smooth, the food was hot, plentiful, and DELICIOUS.  We had rave reviews from our guests - this is not your average, boring wedding food.  And let's not forget about the pie!  Who needs wedding cake, when you can have fresh, wonderful pie??Not only that, but on our wedding day we did not really get a chance to eat much (read: anything).  Sarah Beth made sure to pack us leftovers - so appreciated and needed the few days following the wedding!  ALSO, we learned after the wedding, that one of the First Slice servers ended up helping out behind the bar because one of our bartenders (not through First Slice) did not show up - instead of a disaster, First Slice made it all work.  We are SO thankful to First Slice, and especially Sarah Beth - our wedding would NOT have been the same without you!  If you are getting married, seriously consider using First Slice as your caterer, you will not be disappointed!!

39.description: I came here specifically for the pie, and I was not terribly impressed. The French Silk Pie was still frozen when I bit into it. Pies are clearly not made fresh here.

37.description: Cute little place, clean environment, small but not crowded. Coffee is solid and reasonably priced. Hot chocolate is good. The only gluten-free baked good is a peanut-butter cookie. which is just okay (doesn't hold together well- eat it with a fork). Nice addition to the neighborhood, and perfectly located for commuters.Fair warning: the CTA brown line rumbles by, and creates a bit of noise. It can also get pretty stuffy inside in the summer. There is outdoor seating, though.There is a bathroom in back, through the kitchen.

0.description: Good pie, good coffee, tasty sandwiches, and wonderful customer service. I've been here three times. Once to pick up coffee and pie as a treat. Another time to feed my son and grab some lunch myself and a third time to have lunch with a friend and her baby. The customer service got better and better each time and the guy working really catered to us as moms with newborns offering refills on coffee as he came around to us versus us going to the counter. He also remembered me from my second visit which felt good seeing as it had been a couple weeks and that never happens in the city. It wish I lived closer and could visit more.

38.description: Great atmosphere and friendly service.  What they lack in speed they make up for in a great attitude.    Very relaxed.  Not incredibly private as you may end up sharing a long table with other customers but it's very cool.  Love the salad combos.

51.description: Great little neighborhood place! Unique menu items, friendly, knowledgable, helpful staff. My fav from here is the black bean and mushroom tamales! Tasty, comes with a side salad of mixed greens. Give it a try!

27.description: If you love quirky and convenient locations, coffee selections, artisan sandwiches, quiche, salad, soup, pie, juice and friendly interactions, this place is such a treat. I just moved to the neighborhood and was looking for some local coffee and found this! Off the Francisco stop, just walk down the ramp from the platform and it's patio is right at the edge of the ramp. Amazing! Fun for kids who like trains, dog walkers, families, college kids, teens, food bloggers and people looking for some r&r inspiration. Yummy vegetarian food too (:

32.description: A neighborhood gem right off the L stop and across the street from a park. Great coffee, sandwiches and pies.  I need to try their specials on Friday and their Sunday brunch.

54.description: Where to go?  The area is mostly residential...sounds like a dilemma, tis.  It hath been the untimely emptying of the happy throne and fall of many kings.  Alas, I found the perfect place for my pretentious ass.  They use all the right key words, organic, sustainable, responsible business practices etc.  Most importantly, the food is solid, unspectacular yet exciting.  It is a solid four star establishment, perfect place that compliments not only the neighborhood but also your inner hipster.

48.description: First I want to say that if I was giving a rating just on the food it would probably be a 5 star. We have been getting their subscriber service for about a year and a half so we have tried a lot of their offerings and have generally been very happy with the food.The reason for the lost two stars is because of management. Every time that I have had to interact with anyone beyond just picking up our food I have felt very uncomfortable and more like an imposition than a customer. I understand that management has recently changed, but my recent interactions with them have not been any better.The people who work the counter are usually friendly, but there are certain people that I would rather turn around than to go in and speak to. I consider that an extension of grumpy management though. If your manager acts like your customers are a burden then you are probably going to act that way too.I hope they find a way to bring more joy and friendliness into the business because they have a great product.

44.description: The best pie ever. Period. Will make you stop your conversation. I have the Key lime and Blueberry cheesecake. They will change your life!!!

24.description: I love this place. Great food! The place is very cute and the people that work there they are all very nice. On Sunday they have brunch, their French toast is one of the best ones I ever had.

7.description: Great employees, great people, great vibe! People here are extremely helpful and they have great food. I would totally recommend the chicken and guacamole sandwich! Also, the place has free WiFi, so its a pretty good place to chill and relax, or even do some quick homework.oh! Of course the pies are GREAT!

49.description: LOVE First Slice! A true hidden neighborhood gem. Favorite pies are the Polka Dot and seasonal Pumpkin Cheesecake. Blueberry Cheesecake is just as tasty! The paninis are all amazing--especially LOVE the Duck & Mozzarella. They have no air conditioning in the summer and it's extra chilly in the winter, but definitely worth it. Just dress appropriately and you'll be fine :)

40.description: This is hands down one of the best places in chicago. And my family and I, luckily!!!, live next door. This is the real deal local coffee/ food stop place. With some very unique surprises, like their weekly food subscriptions and charity giving.

53.description: Good coffee.Tasty tea.Delicious pie.Friendly people.Cozy atmosphere.What's not to love?The coffee at First Slice is pretty good, and they have a nice selection of teas. I do sometimes stop in just to get a cup of coffee or glass of lemonade, but then I see the pies beckoning to me, so I have to get a slice to go. I mean really, how can you not get a slice of pie when a case of them are just there, staring at you, looking delicious? The cherry pie is kind of amazing, with a lattice crust and juicy, tart cherries. They also make a good pecan pie, which is one of my favorite types of pie. The red wine poached pear pie is scrumptious. But the blueberry pie...oh, the blueberry pie is the stuff that dreams are made of. That is, of course, if you are lucky enough to stop by on the rare occasions that they have blueberry pie. There are a few tried and true classic pies that are always available, but then there are a few rotating flavors in their repertoire, as well.Everything that I have had to eat, not just the pie, has been delicious. The duck and mozzarella sandwich is a personal favorite, with mounds of duck meat piled high on crusty bread and topped with mozzarella, spinach, and sauteed mushrooms. I also crave the curry chicken salad, which is super flavorful. The bacon quiche fills my heart with joy with each bite of fluffy egg/bacon goodness.I am seriously in love with this location of First Slice. It is closer to me than the one on Ravenswood, but it still serves the same delicious food and desserts. And, more importantly, like their sister locations, they are part of a not for profit organization that works to feed the hungry in Chicago. So go ahead and get a second piece of pie. It is for a good cause.

30.description: Very relaxing, homey environment,  good cafe, wide array of food optiins that I haven't tried yet. Will be back. Oh come here at the beginning or end of your North Shore Channel trail bike ride!

46.description: The coffee and food here are great. You can find healthy, quality meals/bites to accompany great Alterra coffee. The prices are very reasonable. The atmosphere is cozy with enough space to spread out and study, or to simply meet a friend(s). There's always an amiable, mellow crowd.

1.description: Great pie & coffee. Reasonably priced compared to other pie places and you get a delicious huge slice of pie. I had the french silk pie and it was delicious. Not overly sweet like most french silk pies, the chocolate was made with cocoa, you can tell by the taste. Paired it with a cafe au lait which was fresh and delicious. The staff was warm and welcoming. I will be back to try other pies!

55.description: Love this little joint right off the Francisco brown line.  They have delicious tea - not that McDonald's, no flavor or overly sweet style tea.  Legit iced tea.  And amazing cookies.  The decor is super cute and it would probably be the perfect spot for a writer to churn out some glorious pages.

9.description: This First Slice Pie Café location is really close to the Francisco stop on the Brown Line.  I have been here twice and it is a good spot to meet friends if you are in the area.  I have had the chocolate peanut butter pie and the hot chocolate here, and both are fine if not crave-worthy.  Service is quick and pleasant enough, although one time I did see a line forming around lunchtime.  Whether you come solo or with family, you should feel cozy here.

26.description: I love this place. It's got great food and the staff are super friendly. I highly recommend it.

25.description: A stellar weekend brunch spot for 1-2 people - staff was a bit slammed on a monday but the food came out great.  Really amazing pie.  Coffee was solid carafe black. Cool little seating area outside, literally 10 feet from the train crossing.  Great neighborhood spot!

12.description: This location is always well kept and has a variety of choices. Their coffee is good; if you are like me and do not like the taste of hot milk, they do have soy and almond. They also have specials up on their wall everyday. The staff has a lot of positive energy and they make your stay feel like you are in their home. The location is small, cozy and everything a little cafe should be, in my opinion. I have enjoyed myself every time I have stopped by. The Francisco Brown line is right next-door and it does make noise, but nothing to make a big deal about. If you are looking for a small quiet place to eat, drink and use your computer to get work done like me First Slice is your spot. I suggest that you visit before you actually listen to the bad reviewers. Some people are too spoiled. Learn how to appreciate the little things in life. ;)[CPaynes]

59.description: The First Slice Pie Café on Manor, near the Francisco Brown Line el stop, is an additional location, that joins the one at the Montrose Brown Line el stop.Like, the latter store, the Manor location is part of the non-profit organization that supports food donation and distribution. The web site is worthy of reading. However, you won't find a menu there. The site is all business, the First Slice Pie's business of serving the community.The café has good coffee. It offers some baked goods, and, apparently, it has a pizza night (?). This is the type of space that is ideal for a book club get-together, or for working on your iPad or tablet. There are several tables outdoors. The effect of the patio area is lovely, but the ambiance is marred somewhat by the surprisingly noisy traffic on the street outside. It is not busy, just noisy. The First Slice Pie Café is a great addition to the neighborhood. I plan to visit it more often now that summer is on the horizon.

21.description: This First Slice Pie Café location is really close to the Francisco stop on the Brown Line.  I have been here twice and it is a good spot to meet friends if you are in the area.  I have had the chocolate peanut butter pie and the hot chocolate here, and both are fine if not crave-worthy.  Service is quick and pleasant enough, although one time I did see a line forming around lunchtime.  Whether you come solo or with family, you should feel cozy here.

17.description: I found myself in unfamiliar territory in pursuit of a good haircut across the street at Supreme, and stopped by First Slice after for a quick bite. I only got the turkey chili, but my word it was to die for! Possibly the best chili I've ever had when paired with the little toast triangles. Though I only tried one thing, I can tell the whole menu is quality from the ingredients I tasted. Can't wait to go back! It's totally worth the trek up north for me.

10.description: My daughter is planning on using First Slice as the caterer for her wedding so we stopped by to check on the food before the tasting. We were very impressed - we both have allergies and our server knew what was safe for each of us. He also knew how to work around our allergies to give us a great meal.. (Between the 2 of us we are gluten free, nut free, and lactose free) We had great service, good food, and a fun conversation with Dana. And First Slice has a cause we can support.

5.description: First almost 70 degree day of the year, so of course I find myself outside (duh!).  Took my little Maltese, Kai, to the dog park.  Which was awesome, but I found myself very hungry.  And since Pi Day (3.14) just passed and I didn't have any, I look for the closest pie place around.Got the food to go, so I could sit outside with Kai.  I tried the turkey chili and the chicken/guacamole sandwich.  The sandwich was okay, but I really enjoyed the turkey chili!  The peanut butter and chocolate pie was to die forrrrrrr.  I'm pretty sure it had oreo crust, and that made it even more amazing.The only reason I don't give the place 4 stars is because the guy behind the counter was kind of rude to me.  I didn't understand his question, and he got snippy with me.  But...like I said, the pie was amazing!  And who doesn't want a slice of pie sometimes.

3.description: Rosa J.'s weekend may be involved with "crowd controlling," "baby-sitting," and "sanctioning"...and yes, those are some of my responsibilities as a retail professional.  However, no matter what she does for living by day, she will always be a Chicago foodie.  This morning I took a walk, with hubby, to the east end of Albany Park on Manor Ave. by CTA Francisco Brown Line station.  I've been a resident of Albany Park for two (2) years and have never visited "First Slice."  First Slice is a cafe that serves classic western-style quick bites for breakfast and lunch, quality-brew coffee, and of course, gourmet pies.  I've been to many cafes in Chicago that are more hipsters-friendly or catered to workers who would only hang out with their PC or Mac.  "First Slice" is totally welcoming for the entire family.  In fact, I saw many little neighborhood kids patronizing.  One (1) of the sweet boys, surprisingly, picked out a bottle of grapefruit juice and helped mama with the door.  What a gentleman at such tender age!  And he's going to be a foodie in the next generation since he knows his "fruit."  Ok, look forward to seeing you at the Yelp Elite event in the year of...2035 (when I turn 50)!  Anyways, sorry for digressing.  I now have to talk about the Mediterranean quiche and the Chicago veggie sandwich we ordered.  The young lady was very personable and helpful for suggesting items on the menu, since their menu was pretty extensive.  All the ingredients they used were very fresh. They quiche was seasoned nicely; it had a good texture and wasn't "crusty" because it was made-to-order.  On the other hand, the choice of cheese for their Chicago veggie sandwich was brilliant!  They used the medium-aged cheddar, which complemented the spinach and onion very well.  I almost wanted to order another kind of sandwich, but I knew I would have a plenty of opportunities since I live nearby and I enjoy taking a walk meandering "MY" neighborhood.  There was one that would tickle your fancy: "Duck & Mozzarella" sandwich!  What would that taste like?  I hope it would taste "crack-lissimo."Well, if that wasn't funny, I apologized for trying too hard.  Unfortunately, I no longer take the brown line to commute to work.  Otherwise, I would pop in here more frequently.  I'm not a huge "pie" person, but they complete my equation with other items that are wholesome and healthy.  Overall, "First Slice" has left me a great first impression, so I will be back when I can.

35.description: Came in to try the pie and was not impressed at all. I notice most people probably go for the wifi. I didn't get a chance to try the other menu items so I'll probably be back and see how it goes.

19.description: This was my second visit to first slice and I will be back again soon. The pie is to die for (if you like gooey peanut butter pie you must try theirs!).  The staff is super friendly and I love their social mission. My wife has fallen in love with with their polka dot pie that has a cheesecake texture and a light almond flavor as well.

28.description: Train fans, WHAT A LOCATION!  Sit and watch the gates of the brown line at street level from this adorable cafe!  We had a grilled cheese we liked so much we ordered another to go.  Very friendly service.

45.description: Super cool little pie and sandwich place in Albany Park.  Sure it's even better in the summer with their outdoor patio right next the Brown Linen train. Cozy and esp fun for the kiddos. All sandwiches look good but we tried the Mediterranean quiche and coffee braised beef burrito.  Both exceptional. Plus the salad is so simple yet flavorful (anything with arugula is a winner in my book).  Then had a slice of the key-lime pie and was tasty as heck too.  Also have a nice cup of freshly brewed coffee with soy milk. This is a chain of cafes that are passionate about cooking good food but also help busy families serve good meals at home (they offer a meal plan for purchase) and help fight hunger for those in need.  You can learn more at any of their locations and on their website - firstslice.org.If you're in the neighborhood for breakfast lunch or dinner, this is a good pick.

33.description: I love to go here on a sunny spring or summer day to get a cup of iced coffee and a slice of pie!  They also have a lentil salad there that's fantastic, perfect for a light lunch.  The service is friendly and it's right next to the park that I take me son to so it's super convenient!

43.description: got a sandwich and pie.  the sandwich was really chincy for the price.  pie was good but seemed overly sweet.

2.description: After a few more visits, I still like the place, but have had better pie.  Still a nice spot.

18.description: A stellar weekend brunch spot for 1-2 people - staff was a bit slammed on a monday but the food came out great.  Really amazing pie.  Coffee was solid carafe black. Cool little seating area outside, literally 10 feet from the train crossing.  Great neighborhood spot!

41.description: I love this place! Super friendly staff! You've got to try the apricot bran muffins!

52.description: FANTASTIC PIE!!!  Prior to yesterday I had only stopped in occasionally to get a coffee when I take my little guy to the park across the way, but yesterday I was tempted by their peanut butter chocolate pie!  Amazingly good!   Today (because I guess I felt no need to stay on my diet), I stopped in today.  This time I tried the Coffee Toffee pie. CRAZY GOOD!  The staff is extra nice too.  I cant wait to go back and try another kind of pie!

50.description: I love having this little pie shoppe just down the street. It's a cute bright little space steps from the Francisco stop. But First Slice is offering up more than just pie. There are a variety of baked goods to be had - scones, cookies, muffins, biscotti. There is also a case with heat & eat items for those nights when you just don't feel like cooking. Finally there is a menu with a little something for everyone - sandwiches, pizza, quiche, salads.. and of course pie! Pie, glorious pie. Chocolate pie. French Silk pie. Fruit pie. Coffee Toffee pie and my favorite - Peanut Butter pie! I've sat outside on a beautiful fall day with a Sprecher soda and a delicious slice of quiche and I've run in, grabbed a sandwich with a slice of pie to enjoy in the comfort of my own home. An enjoyable experience either way. And perhaps the best thing about First Slice is that it's a non for profit devoted to  serving the community via youth groups, churches and various other outreach programs. That's right, First Slice is a self funded charity that serves thousands of meals to the needy and homeless. Support this local business who not only serve up some tasty fare but give back to the community. First Slice, First Rate.

4.description: Food, everywhere. This is an establishment focused on providing food stuffs. No surprises here.

6.description: My friends and I stopped by on the last day of our road trip. We rented an air bnb down the street and happened upon First Slice when walking to catch the brown line. The staff is super friendly plus the decor & dinnerware are charming. I had the Mediterranean quiche and raspberry cheesecake pie. Both were ridiculously delicious and well worth the price! I'll be back next time I'm in Chicago!!

22.description: The pie is good.  Love the lemon bar.  The ham and cheese sandwich is a guilty pleasure. They taught me to like salads (lots of good things in them). The food subscription is fabulous!

15.description: This place really is more 4 1/2 stars. Be forewarned that the space really is quite small. It steps from the Brown Line Francisco stop. Truly a little café that offers everything from soups, sandwiches, wraps, and best of all pie.Of course we decided to go on Pi Day so it couldn't possibly accommodate all the foot traffic this place would bring in because they sell pie. So glad we tried this new pie place out because it is definitely a hidden gem and a cute local spot for those that live in the neighborhood. We weren't too turned off about the small space because they are so close to a park and it happened to be a nice day. My husband and I opted to share a sandwich (which comes with a side salad and some chips), tried their lemonade, and each had a slice of pie of course! Everything was delicious! We got a ham sandwich with cheddar cheese. This was no run of the mill regular sandwich. It was cut into halves and was the perfect cross of Panini with oooey gooey melted cheddar. It expertly hid some tasty mustard and red onion as well. Their lemonade was just the right combo of drink and wasn't too tart. My husband got a chocolate peanut butter slice and I opted for my favorite, key lime pie. How can you go wrong with key lime that has an inch of whipped cream with the perfect amount of tart custard? The graham crust was heavenly, decadent, but not too rich. Now, the chocolate peanut butter on the other hand is a knockout. I snagged a couple of bites and they were outstanding. Creamy and rich with a chocolate graham crust and a thin layer of what looks like chocolate ganache. It is the ratio of chocolate to peanut butter. Can't wait to go back! Couldn't think of a better way to celebrate Pi Day!

57.description: Scrumptious blueberry lemonade! I wandered over to this small, charming cafe after visiting a possible new apartment down the street. If a good-hearted shop like this doesn't make one want to move nearby, I don't know what will.

20.description: My husband, son, and I do the subscription program and every weekend we pick up our delicious fresh frozen meals for the week. We've been doing this for about 7 months so far and it has changed our lives. We don't live nearby but it's worth the drive. I love to cook, but when we both come home from work during the week we want to enjoy a delicious healthy family meal together without much prep, and this program is perfect for us. Look up the menus and details on their website!

36.description: While there are multiple locations of this quaint cafe, this is by far my favorite one. Every employee I've met is welcoming, helpful and sweet. Their pies are to die for. They have classics, such as apple, French silk and chocolate peanut butter as well as seasonal flavored like strawberry rhubarb, pumpkin and blueberry. My two favorite pies are Key Lime (a regular flavor) and pumpkin cheesecake (a fall flavor). The pies are well priced, at about $3.50. I usually also get a large tea (tip: all the tea sizes cost the same, so get the large for the best deal). Their tea list is extensive and I have yet to try one I don't like. Their coffees and other drinks are good but slightly on the pricey side. As far as food goes, I haven't had much there. The quiches are delicious as well as the salads. Most people rave about the Mac & cheese but it's too much for me. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a yummy, reasonably priced and cozy-feeling cafe in the busy city. (Sometimes I don't just recommend, but I drag my friends here. No one has ever complained once they try something!)

14.description: Cute little cafe. Stopped in with a friend, orders the sweet onion quiche and chicken cucumber wrap. Both were super delish. The quiche was to die for, hot and cheesy.. Great selection of teas and coffee as well. The pies looked amazing but I had to pass..

3.description: I was pretty excited when this bakery opened, as it has a very appealing and inviting atmosphere, compared to some of the bakeries in the area. Everything is clean, and the woman who works there is VERY friendly. She answered my questions, and was very patient with my requests. While they don't have a HUGE selection, what they do have is high quality.Here's what I sampled:Cheese Pie - actually cheese melted onto a pita. It was surprisingly amazing, especially after being warmed up in the oven.Meat Pie - a pita with meat and spices baked on top. The meat has a nice nutmegy flavor, but needs a bit more zing. I suggest finding a sauce you like to eat it with, or maybe heating it up with some cheese on top.Pita Bread - a HUGE stack of fresh, tasty pitas for just a few dollars. Just like what they would give you at a restaurant with some hummus.Oregano & Sesame spiced pita - Definitely different, but also quite good.Pistachio Baklava/Cookie- They actually have pistachio only treats, which is great for me since I'm allergic to walnuts and can't usually enjoy baklava. It is crispy and has the distinct flavor of honey and nuts. The texture and taste is just perfect.Overall, I think Tannourine is a great new place in the Albany Park hood, especially since they have great, friendly staff as well as really low prices. I look forward to trying more of their items.

1.description: This bakery is very, very close to my condo. I was walking down my alley on New Years Day and I smelled cinnamon. I remembered that Tannourine just opened and I wanted to check it out! The man working the counter was very friendly and wanted to give me as many free samples as I wanted. So nice of him!I ended up purchasing a dozen of baklava and some pistachio cookies. The sweet treats were delicious and the baklava was nice and flaky. I will definitely be back but it will have to be once in a while because this place will ruin my diet! If you are in the area, check out this new bakery!

2.description: Tannourine has yummy stuff. I know: I have a genetically sweet tooth inherited from my father. The bakers are genuinely nice people. I know: I am Jewish and they are Arabs and they call me "brother". Eating there is not against my beliefs but against my diet. Yet, I cannot stop myself and I go weekly. Their baklava is irresistible and so are those people. Try them both, but I warn you: Tannourine Bakery is contagious and addictive... And if it's too cold, they have a web site and they deliver their goodies all over USA: tannourinebakery.com

0.description: A.) The old man who owns this place is the sweetest person on earth. Every time I came in he would remember me and chat with me, and offer me some amazing middle eastern coffee. Once he even invited me in back to sit and eat some dinner with he and his friend who run the bakery, it was delightful. B.) The spinach pies, and pita breads (especially the kind with cheese on top) are delicious, as well as extremely reasonably priced!C.) Baklava... so many kinds, and all tasty. They also sell little boxes of a variety of baklava or cookies, that make really wonderful gifts.    If you are ever in the area, you must try it. If you live in the area and haven't tried it yet, you are missing out!

3.description: Nicest small bar in Albany Park. Great atmosphere, diamond pool table and TouchTunes jukebox. Thumbs up!!!! A+ service.

1.description: Fun drink specials and a very cool dive bar for relaxing evenings! Highly recommended for a quick and easy drink

2.description: Bartender is hot, pool table is a Diamond and nice. They do comedy here sometimes also. Good little find. Will return.

9.description: "Sitting in the waiting room..." There are plenty of written rules when it comes to a strip club. But, to the best of my knowledge, there are only two unwritten rules: The first rule is that you never wear jeans to a strip club. Always slacks or (if you're a lady or a gentlemen who doesn't care) a skirt or dress. This has nothing to do with being classy. Once you've been to one, you know the reason why so I won't discuss it here. The second rule, imparted to me by a wise bro is "no dude wants to roll into a strip club alone." This just looks kind of creepy. "Sitting in the waiting room..." Well the 240 Lounge has solved this problem for the Admiral Theater. Located a few doors down, the 240 literally serves as that particular strip club's waiting room. It's a low key bar where patrons of the other establishment can meet up, pre-lube, and, well, if you've been to the Admiral, sometimes decide not to leave. I mean, this bar plays the same kind of songs as you'd hear at the strip club and there are photos of the Admiral's strippers on the wall.  So it's almost the same.Since the Admiral is a dry strip club, this is also the place to get sauced using the in/out privileges at the Theater. Though drinks, for how divey this bar is, are a bit pricey - especially considering this is Albany Park. There are some good specials, though, including $3 redheaded sluts! I'm not much of a shot drinker, but I do love a good redheaded slut. They also serve a blue balls shot for the same price, but I didn't want to try that. It didn't seem enjoyable. "Sitting in the waiting room..." Maybe needless to say, the one and only time I've been here, the group of guys next to me as I was waiting for my two peeps (maybe I shouldn't use that word for a bar next to a strip club) were downing jagerbombs (yeah, it's that sort of clientele). But the bartenders are chill and friendly no matter what drink you get. "Because they can't get up!" They also have karaoke, just in case you're looking for an "excuse" to be here that doesn't involve the building next door (or does and you're just looking for a reason to lie about your whereabouts).  Maybe that's the unwritten third rule of a strip club...plausible deniability.

10.description: Blacked out windows greet you from outside, I could tell why once I stepped inside.Having been summoned to this bar for an old friend's birthday, I got to this bar before my friends had finished Korean BBQ down the street at Chicago Kalbi. I was amused to see autographed adult film star posters on the wall, but considering where I was at, it was to be expected. What was unexpected was entering an empty bar minus one guy on the opposite end of the bar and the bartender.If I represent 50% of the potential revenue and tips that could come in, you would figure that I would require immediate attention on entering a bar. Nope, I had to look around to see a texting bartender while I waited for no response. Eventually she woke up from her much more interesting virtual world and served me a drink and sank back into the other side of the bar to continue her virtual adventures.Slowly in came my friends one by one and eventually we had 20 people in the bar and everyone in here was complaining about how damn slow it was to get a drink. We are the only people in the bar, how does it make any sense that we have to wait super long to get a damn drink! And it's not like we are ordering the cheapest beer in the house, it's our friend's birthday so shots go flying left and right and replenisher rounds but nope the service kept interrupting our flow of chi to a higher plane called drunkeness.We were displeased and felt animosity for the poor service on a friend's birthday. We left.Nope, not you.

4.description: One of my favorite places in Albany park,genial stuff, good atmosphere, nice people and jukebox! What else you need:) The owner is always kind and greets me every time.

6.description: Thank you,Baby Jeebuz! The place has been remodeled and it is still a dive bar,but,in a good way! I am no longer in fear of my life to use the restroom!

12.description: If I could give this place zero stars would.  The only draw to this place is that its next to the Admiral (which also deserves zero stars) which doesn't serve alcohol.  I still don't think that's a good enough reason to charge $9 for a Makers rocks.  The most I've paid for a Makers rocks was $8 in New York.  This place is a whole in the wall.  The bartender tried justifying the price to me.  "Oh its 2 and half shots and worth the money." Bullshit.  Then I inquired about a sign in the window that said Karaoke Wednesdays and $6 pitchers.  The bartender replied that their tap was broken and they no longer had karaoke but they were trying to bring it back.  False advertising.  My advise to you...walk the extra block around the corner to Gamblers.  Good prices and really nice people at Gamblers.

5.description: The remodel of this place looks amazing. Such a huge difference. Its a great local bar with a friendly staff. They have a comedy showcase every 2nd and 4th Thursday. Its a really fun show. The hosts are great and so handsome!

11.description: So say you're out celebrating your friend's bachelor's party.  You're all drinking and having a grand old time as guys are apt to do at a bachelor's party.  Just when the group reaches that happy, everything-is-absolutely-hilarious! buzz, someone decides to throw out the ingenious idea of going to the Admiral for some good, clean fun with a bunch of naked women.  Given the collective inebriation of the group, everyone thinks this is the greatest idea since sliced bread and proceeds to pile into cabs, all the while picturing the ample T&A they will soon be enjoying.During the cab ride out to the Admiral, you realize that the place is located far far away from downtown Chicago.  So far that, uh oh, you're starting to lose your happy giddy buzz.  You try to crack a joke about pirates to get the group going again but everyone else is starting come down too, as evident by the blank stares out the windows of the cab.  By the time the cab drops you off at the Admiral, you realize that your buzz is practically gone for some strange, inexplicable, annoying-as-all-get-out reason.  You start to panic at the thought of going into a strip club while ... *gasp* ... sober.  You look around Lawrence Ave and realize there is zero nightlife on the block save for the Admiral.  You fear for the worse and resign to defeat until one of your friends decides to ask the surprisingly friendly doormen if there was any place nearby where you can get a drink."Sure.  Three doors down that way.  There's a bar.  Can't miss it."You look up in the sky and are suddenly thankful for this blessing of a bar out in the middle of nowhere.  It's called the 240 Lounge and it took care of our pre-Admiral needs for the evening.  Total dive bar with lots of cheap booze (Hoegaarden for $4!).  The bartender was extremely friendly and gave the bachelor a free shot on the house.  We only stayed in there for maybe 15 minutes but we were not only able to get our buzz back, but had such a good time that we almost decided to stay at the bar instead of going to the Admiral.  I don't think I'll ever go back to the Admiral again (overrated rip off -- I'll save that for another review) but I am happy to have discovered the 240 Lounge.

8.description: This is a weird and sometimes creepy bar.  It attracts all kinds of yahoos.  It's only other use is that it's open a few feet away from the Admiral.  The Admiral is a dry club.  That means no booze and all of their other drinks are $8 dollars each.  Yep, $8 dollars for a fucking bottle of water.  The next time you happen to visit the Admiral and say your friends have stepped out for a smoke, you can step in here for a couple drinks.  Admiral's security is cool about customers doing this and promote you to visit other local businesses.  Often times Admiral viewers will come and go between the two spots.I wasn't going to share this recent incidence but I will.  I think it goes to show, well, weird.  So I was at the Admiral recently with a couple guys.  I was still inside while a couple guys stepped out for a drink.  Approaching the bar a patron hopped up out of his seat and offered to buy them a drink.  Cool, they thought.  One got "Jamo on the rocks" and the other a beer.  One of my friends is a very BIG guy.  Due to his short height, most would dub him as obese.  I guess the guy that bought them a beer had some "thing" for fat guys.  Since this patron bought, they hung out and had a conversation with him.  The whole while the patron had his eyes on my buddy's belly.  He kept telling him how he like to beat up his belly.  My bro has a huge belly, it's that which makes him such a jolly guy.  So, dude was looking at his belly and talking to it like he wanted to fight with it.  Realizing the predicament a free drink posed, they gulped their drinks and we took a bit of extra time before returning for another round.

0.description: Top of the bottom shelf.Nice little dive bar.Pool table. Comedy on thursdays.I can somersault here from my apartment. Sometimes if I have to take a dumper and the roomies already stretching his colon. I'll stop in here for a beer and a blintz. Nah mean norma jean?

7.description: This bar waters down their liquor. Plain and simple. I'm an Asian girl and I took 4 Patron shots. I didn't even turn typical-Asian-drinking  red. Very disappointed. Thursday is open mic night for stand up comedians. Be careful... You could end up at the receiving end of bad jokes.However, the Asian bartender was delightful. I hope she wasn't the one watering down my shots. You've been warned.

0.description: I had a wonderful experience here, Jesse is extremely helpful and answered all my questions. He helped me change my account and his customer service was outstanding, unlike my previous experience at another location.

1.description: This place sucks now. Only 1, maybe 2, guys cutting hair in the morning. Was waiting for an hour so my boyfriend could get a haircut. the barber decides to say he's going home real quick instead of cutting my boyfriends hair after we've been there for over an hour.RIDICULOUS.

0.description: The place is real laid back and not expensive at all. Their always have at least 3 barber's. Another thing this is one of the few places that cuts black men hair very well on the northside that is not owned by African Americans. I say that because a lot of places up north either can't cut brothers hair or don't do it very well. Although all the barber's here are either Hispanic or middle eastern, their clients are extremely diverse.A clean cut in a real clean and friendly spot is rare without being a chain. Go to Lil' Zees and you won't be disappointed.

29.description: Los mogotes I can describe this place with one word: DELICIOUS. Los Mogotes has new owner and I have to say that it has being an amazing improvement. I tried Huarache al Pastor and it was out of this world MMMMM.... I was told by the owner's son that they are working on introducing new dishes such as for those who love hamburgers "Hawaiian Hamburger" they will add pineapple and some extra New Mexican condiments that I'm sure it will be an amazing success. Ladies and gentlemen you will not be disappointed at all.

42.description: Deliciosos tacos and salsa! I love this place! The Guacamole is tasty!Very fast service. The staff is friendly.  I also recommend the veggie Guarache.  gracias!

23.description: Great little Taqueria. Tiny, intimate, and has that great tortilla smell you hope for when you enter a legitimate Taqueria. Basic menu of burritos, tacos, tortas, and tostadas. And the more dinner friendly stuff like carne asada, chile relleno, and fajitas. Everything I have tried has been excellent. And for starters they give you fresh fried tortilla chips and some great homemade spicy salsa.  Friendly people and waitstaff and the food always tastes fresh.I like the tortas there a lot. Great bread and well marinated meat. The pastor and asada are my favorites. They give you two different sauces to go with it as well. A spicy red (different from the salsa) and a tomatillo that is just plain fantastic.  Great little spot in Albany Park.

47.description: The BEST Taco Place in the Neighborhood ! Unfortunately, that still doesn't mean it's so great. For some unfathomable reason, although the neighborhood is packed with Mexican people, there are no particularly good Mexican restaurants here - just a few that are cheap-ish and not too terrible.  CASH ONLY too, so be prepared. OK, the food - The meat is flavorful (you never find chicken-skin in the tacos, unlike so many places) the coffee is tasty when it's good, but too often obviously stale, sometimes it's brewed too weak. Spotty quality of something not-too-difficult to get right like coffee kind of makes me wonder if the effort spent on sanitation is similarly uneven or lackadaisical. OTOH, the tomatoes are always RED and plump, not those pointless translucent little cubes of wet nothing you get so many other places. Cilantro is always well washed and onions always chopped neatly and tiny. They know how to make vegetarian items, unlike some places that don't seem to know what the word "vegetarian" means. Avocado torta & an order of veg. quesidillas (with savory grilled peppers & onion) make a nice & affordable veg meal big enough for 2 to share. Maybe unsurprisingly the quality of the avocados is sometimes good sometimes less than good. It's understandable that sometimes an item of produce is just not great, but if avocados suck this week, I'd rather have them off the menu than be served a brown stringy avocado like it's no big deal. To me it's a big-ish deal enough deal that I don't want to pay for an only semi-edible avocado. Food made to order generally comes the WAY you ordered it, especially if you can order in Spanish. In English it's hit-or-miss. (I've lived here 10 years now, some of the waitresses have been working here the whole time and their English - even just food on their own menu related English - has not improved one iota in that decade, so I'm assuming it's not any kind of priority, which is kind of lame.) The tables and bathroom do always seem clean, and the sink is low enough that my 3 year old can reach it wash her own hands, which makes her very happy. The staff are generally friendly and basically competent. (As mentioned, their English isn't anywhere near 100%, or even 50% so be prepared to be patient. If you get frozen salsa as one reviewer claimed to, by all means send it back. They are nice enough people, if they make a mistake they will fix it, I'm sure. Also FYI the cheese is a burrito isn't supposed to be melted, if you order a burrito, expect the cheese inside to be cold and unmelted, if it was hot enough to melt cheese in there, the veg. ingredients would be wilted, and the sour cream would be nasty.)Don't waste your time looking for cheap tacos anywhere else, you won't find better in the immediate neighborhood. You can definitely find some better ones in Andersonville & Lincoln Square, maybe Ravenswood, but not in Albany Park. These are the ONLY tacos in the neighborhood half as good as the ones I make at home.  :)Stop by on your way to Ronan & River Park, watch the geese swim in the river, and feel happy you live in wonderful Albany Park. I've lowered my rating although the food is generally decent, and the staff is nice, if unskilled in English speaking, I am super tired of the TVs playing loud, violent soap operas & loud, sadistic, sexist Mexican westerns, and the plastic everything, and in the last 6 months I've gotten nothing but weak stale coffee. Wish I could give it 2.5 stars, half way between A-OK & meh sounds about right.

8.description: Don't deny yourself a treat just because they're off your regular beat. Forget about heading to Andersonville, Lakeview, or wherever you think you need to be. Honestly, if you live somewhere near or far it's worth the trip to Kedzie on the Brown line (3 blocks north) or the Foster and Lawrence buses (2 blocks south or north). This quaint family-owned joint in Albany Park is best-in-class. They've recently remodeled and reworked their menu, which includes a new Sunday brunch. This is a great little spot for a clean take on classic and contemporary Mexican food that satisfies with both familiar and unique flavors. Because, it's really about the food. Right?

31.description: I'm a big fan of chicken tortas, so I went here to order a chicken torta to go ($4.50). The torta was huge but lacked flavor for me. I hope to try their other stuff and update this review when I do.

34.description: Albany Park is fairly crowded with these little storefront Taquerias, and I can't say that I've been to more than a few.  But I'm never unhappy with Los Magotes.  Expect the usual tacos, tortas, burritos here.  I find their asada to be quite good.  Pretty cheap, more than decent Mexican food.  Service is always fine, Telemundo is always blasting on the TV.Cash only.

16.description: So the bf has come home with dinner from here and I've been impressed with the selection he chooses for us.  He's gotten a few of their steak dinners and been pretty happy with them and I'm absolutely smitten with the avocado burrito.  The salsa is still amazing, hot or not (seems like a different recipe every day).Eating in, the server is really friendly.  The salsa bowl is cute and I'm tempted to steal it and its accompanying wooden spoon.  Dinner comes with two sauces in a modern white dish: chipotle and green sauce. It's a good place for lunch or quick dinner.  I still wish they were open later.  I'd probably LOVE all the food then.  ;)

13.description: This is a nice taqueria. It is clean and the food is good. Chris had the steak tacos and I had the Huaraches de Nopales. I also had the guacamole. We enjoyed everything we tried and will be back again as it is close to home.Taqueria Los Mogotes is one of those places we drove by for a very long time before we thought to stop in. I am glad we did!!!

11.description: Small, clean establishment with friendly service. Being close to where I work, I come here regularly. What keeps me coming back is the freshness of the food and careful preparation/presentation of everything I've tried, which is only about five items from their menu. What I get most are the burritos. And I almost always get one of their fruit flavored lemonades.

39.description: All North Park students know to get really good Mexican food here. I'm a huge fan of the chicken tostadas and horchata - and the salsa is always on point. The food is cheap but it's really good so you're sure to leave really pleased (and possibly with a doggie bag). Unfortunately, they only accept cash so don't stroll in with a card. They always have the television on, so test your spanish-speaking abilities by trying to translate the sitcoms (or have even more fun and write your own script).

37.description: Fresh, yummy food at an affordable price.  The guacamole was made when we ordered it and tasted of fresh cilantro and ripe avocados!  Every time my boyfriend and I go there we have a delicious experience. The  ambiance is not so great because they have two t.v.'s blasting all the time with Spanish soap operas.  Don't get me wrong, I love Spanish soap operas (my mom loves them!) but I don't really like t.v.'s in restaurants (I hate sports bars!)  But the food is worth it!  Try the burrito al pastor (spicy pork) or the skirt steak dinner!  YUM!

0.description: love this place! Great food, reasonable prices and great staff!

38.description: I must be fair here. I love this place for their food. It's cheap and delicious. Typically, I get the cecina tacos (squeeze some lime juice over the meat, it's fantastic), but I have tried a nice portion of the menu. I'm also a fan of most of the breakfast items. Unfortunately, they only take cash, but their is an ATM in the Juny Mart next door. I think their greatest downfall is that their hot sauces aren't very spicey. Don't come in with a sweet tooth, only their horchata can sastisfy it (which is very tasty and goes great with any meal). If you like small mexican diners that serve good mexican food this is the place for you.

27.description: HOLY SH*T!  Why did I not know about this place sooner?!When it popped up on Grub Hub one night while I was cruisin' for a place to order some burritos, I thought why not venture away from my usual places - I'm always in search of better Mexican food, having never quite found the perfect taco place.As soon as I saw that this place offers vegetarian versions of standard taqueria fare, I was in love.  I've never been able to eat sopes, huaraches, etc., because they almost ALWAYS come exclusively with meat.  Not only are there vegetarian versions of these dishes, but there are SEVERAL vegetarian options!  Good lord...I tried the Rajas con queso sope - delicious, fully loaded with peppers, cheese, beans, lettuce and tomato, and not at all greasy.  The peppers had just the perfect hint of spiciness.  The quesadilla de harina - vegetariana came with grilled onions, peppers and tomatoes that were still piping hot on a bed of cheese when they arrived.  The vegetarian burrito was good and stuffed full of the extra avocado I requested.  The crown jewel of what I tried was definitely the Huaraches de Nopales.  Nopales grilled up with onions, topped with cheese, laid lovingly on a bed of refried beans on a huarache.  SO good, perfect amount of saltiness.  The red and green salsas were both perfect topping our dishes, and everything was really reasonably priced.  Needless to say I had plenty left over for lunch the next day.  I will be ordering from this place often...probably too often.Oh, and free delivery on grubhub with a $20 order.  ESTOY ENAMORADO! :D

32.description: Im on a quest to find a local replacement for my favourtie tacos al pastor in logan square.
