So far, this place comes the closest!  I always get chicken tacos, al pastor  style, so just meat, cilantro and onions, lime on the side. (even though i ask for cheese on the side too) - Get two supertacos... never more. I stupidly always want three- and theres NO. WAY. i can do it. Its just too much damn food.  The supertacos are what... 2$ each? and somehow seem twice as big? If you are getting regular tacos and put on cheese and cream anyways, you might as well get the upgrade, cause extras cost extra.  Its not everything i want from a taco- I think id like the meat to be a little more flavorful- but for somewhere within walking distance, and so inexpensive, with endless chips and salsa- what can i say?  Oh yes, cash only!

48.description: I am so happy to discover this place in my new neighborhood!They have some of the best guacamole I've ever had, and its pretty cheap, but unfortunately, you get what you pay for, so the chip to guac ratio is way off.  Their sopes are also wonderful. The staff is very friendly, and made sure to ask if crema & queso were okay since I ordered my food sans meat.  Very fast service too.  Tasty food at cheap prices is sure to become a regular with me.

44.description: Not good. Half a dish of frozen salsa to go with the meager handful of cold chips.  Wet chicken in the tasteless burrito with cold cheese that never melted. Plastic silverware, no water. No ambiance: just loud TVs and a view of the  kitchen.

24.description: Fantastic taqueria. Quick, clean, good and cheap Mexican food. This place has the best salsa for your chips. - I strongly recommend the carne asada and their tacos al pastor are to die for.Also, i believe they give North Park and Von Steuben students 10% off.

7.description: This place is great chips and salsa when you walk in its. Byob and we just left there and they let us put the hawks game on.. GO HAWKS!!!!

40.description: You know, we eat here every once in a while and it has always been great, yummy, bordering on wonderful. Tonight...not so much.My husbands flautas had parmesan cheese sprinkled on top and they were almost burnt. My super tacos were awful and my absolute favorite beef soup was unsalted and not even a little bit spicy. Lie they got a new chef. Really...if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

30.description: I have this to be my favorite Mexican restaurant for the price. Amazing burritos and quesadillas.

46.description: If you're looking for someplace really nice and not a high school hang out, then don't go here, because you'll only be unhappy, but if you don't mind and you're looking for just good food, here's your place.You can't go into this place in the middle of the school year during hours, and expect it not to be packed with Von kids.  I was a Von kid, and I gotta say, Los Mogotes did a damn fine job of stuffing me stupid for my next class, and left me with bus fare.  Oh nostalgia.It;s a small little hole in the wall, but help was usually friendly, and prices were pretty cheap.  No complaints.  I'm sure in the summer or in the evenings it's not as packed with high schoolers, so if that's a turn off, school lunch hours are usually between 9:30a-2:30p.  Anytime after that should be kiddie free.

1.description: Remember Simon Cowell from the earlier seasons of American Idol?  He was known for the fact that he was always honest.  Oh excuse me. I should use the modifier: "brutally" honest.  I enjoyed my time at Taqueria Los Mogotes this evening.  The service was very attentive and on-point, yet I couldn't get over the fact that the food was lackluster.  Well, I should specify that the entrees were bland, but their aguas frescas stole the entire show.  We started the meal with the strawberry and mango aguas frescas.  They were yummy and refreshing.  I would certainly go back for those.  While the ESPN Sport Center kept me entertained, the entrees came with pretty magnificent presentations.  I had the pastor (spicy pork) torta.  The pastor slices weren't that spicy, but I was given the green and red salsa on the side.  Guess what?  It didn't make any difference in terms of the flavor.  I've had tortas in various neighborhoods in Chicago.  I had to say I prefer the torta in the taqueria inside a neighborhood supermercado.  How about hubby's veggie burrito suizo?  I sampled a little bit, but I was somewhat disappointed.  You would think with cheese, sour cream, and other ingredients the entire burrito would taste "sexy" like a salsa dancer.  I didn't feel such sensation.  The young man who ran the show was charismatic, good-looking, and easy-going, but the food was the weakest link.  I was torn if I should give them another opportunity and try something else on the menu.  This was a nice neighborhood place for dine-in or carry-out on the northeast end of Albany Park.  I must say I've had much better experience at their competitors not only in Albany Park, but also in other neighborhoods in Chicago.

9.description: Wow! I hadn't been here before the remodel / new menu but someone told me I should check it out, and boy was she right!  Unique dishes/ingredients, very fresh, very clean, very friendly.  Best tacos in the area, which is saying a lot when there's a taqueria every couple of blocks, but it is TRUE!  Try the cochinita tacos and esquites appetizer - yum!  Also the homemade lemonades are great AND it's BYOB AND they will make margarita mix to go with your booze too.  This place is awesome, and run by really nice people (a husband and wife team).  Oh, and did I mention they deliver?

26.description: I love El Mogote~! I've been a patron for 6 years...and this is one of the best authentic mexican restaurants in town! The staff is very very friendly, and always gets your orders right...and their torta de carne asada.....oh yum!!!! Get some horchata with your order :D

25.description: This is a nice taqueria. It is clean and the food is good. Chris had the steak tacos and I had the Huaraches de Nopales. I also had the guacamole. We enjoyed everything we tried and will be back again as it is close to home.Taqueria Los Mogotes is one of those places we drove by for a very long time before we thought to stop in. I am glad we did!!!

12.description: Taqueria Los Mogotes burritos are the bomb.com! I really don't eat here much, but when I do, I get the burritos. I love the chicken ones, but have also enjoyed the steak as well. They are highly big and one can be shared by two people, easy. I usually get one for lunch, cut it in half, and save a part of dinner later.  Service has always been good to me, which setting up a order for catering can be a little ice age. I would highly recommend trying this place out for their chicken burritos.

21.description: I ordered a combo plate- veggie taco, enchilada and chil relleno with rice and beans, with a large Horchata. Everything on the plate was too spicy for my taste; does not taste like authentic Mexican food to me, I've had much better.  Aside from the friendly waiter and service, I wouldn't go back.

17.description: Yummy! I have only had their tacos, guacamole, salsa and chips but I have had them often and I have LOVED them every time. No exaggeration. I usually carry out but occasionally have dined in - I recommend dining in for the benefit of savoring the fresh off the grill deliciousness of their cuisine, however, the decor and size of the place is nothing to write home about. This place is short on ambiance, long on good food. Warning: Bring cash!! This place recently (as in this summer) picked up credit card transaction capability but their card reader often and randomly does not work for days at a time:( My one complaint and the reason for no 5th star.

10.description: Great Mexican food. Authentic & very friendly service. Their salsa is bar none. Check em out. Their pork & beef is just like my grandmother use to cook & the head chef is always in & ready to talk.I'm from LA & this is one of my favorite spots in Chicago.

5.description: Newly renovated interior, good brunch, very friendly service. Try the Sunday morning sandwich. It's awesome. Can't go wrong with this place!

3.description: My buddy Dan drug me hear after telling me how great this place was post renovation.  I tried 6 of the tacos (yes I shared) and they were pretty solid.  They hand make their own tortillas and each of the tacos had a different flavor.  Pretty bold and tasty flavors I might add, and different from your average basic "carne asada" taco.  Not too pricey, and worth the extra .50 per taco to get better quality.  Will go back for sure.

35.description: This is a nice place for a quick bite. Their chicken burrito is very decent, and tacos are good too. The ambiance is not the best, to say the most,  but who cares if it's good and cheap!We usually take food from them to go, and at such a low  price, we always get a filling dinner for almost nothing.

19.description: I used to eat here ALL of the time. Their taco dinner was my thing. Alas, as they say, all good things must come to an end. They must have been bought out by new owners or something because ever since: price=increase and food portion and quality=NOSEDIVE. Save your money, go to Garcia's.

28.description: Yummy! I have only had their tacos, guacamole, salsa and chips but I have had them often and I have LOVED them every time. No exaggeration. I usually carry out but occasionally have dined in - I recommend dining in for the benefit of savoring the fresh off the grill deliciousness of their cuisine, however, the decor and size of the place is nothing to write home about. This place is short on ambiance, long on good food. Warning: Bring cash!! This place recently (as in this summer) picked up credit card transaction capability but their card reader often and randomly does not work for days at a time:( My one complaint and the reason for no 5th star.

45.description: This is my favorite Mexican place in Albany Park, hands down.The staff is very friendly and fast, the food has never failed to be extremely fresh and GOOD, the chips and salsa are great, I have never had to wait for a table and can't really see that happening anytime soon, and the food is super cheap (except for those entrees, but you don't need those, the regular burritos and the fabulous super tacos are very filling on their own).My roommates know how much I love this place, as I always ask everyone to go with me - I recently have been going once a day.I'm currently addicted to the Chorizo Super Taco.  When I first came, I got a chicken taco, and it was super good.  I kept getting it for about 2 weeks after that first visit.  Then I decided to venture elsewhere, and I got a burrito.  Great, but I'm still kind of missing something - probably the taco's cilantro and lime.  Soon I switched to the Super Taco, which adds sour cream and cheese, and a different (and to die for) grilled tortilla.I'm seriously going to go eat there right now.  I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

33.description: Some of the best asada in the city, no joke.  The decor is nothing to write home about, but the service is friendly and the prices are low.  And the food is consistently delicious.  Best taqueria in Albany Park, one of the best in the city.

43.description: This place has delicous food. I remember when it opened, nad burnt up, lol. Before it was some fast food place with no seats or tables, just a counter.Memories.

2.description: Renovated, both in decor and menu. The atmosphere is a little smaller and darker, but has the look more of a restaurant than a taco joint. The menu has been Americanized a bit, and now includes hamburgers. The old vegetarian burrito is gone, replaced by something with portobello mushrooms but no rice or avocado. The chorizo taco is good. The esquites is (are?) not the mayonnaise kind, but made with lots of peppers and lime juice. I can't say it's really better or worse than before, but it is different. Worth checking out if you are tired of the Lawrence Avenue taco places.

18.description: Fantastic taqueria. Quick, clean, good and cheap Mexican food. This place has the best salsa for your chips. - I strongly recommend the carne asada and their tacos al pastor are to die for.Also, i believe they give North Park and Von Steuben students 10% off.

41.description: Since I need to add more spots to my best guacamole list, I schlepped to Taqueria Los Mogotes to check theirs out. But the best laid plans sometimes never come to fruition....especially when I see an avocado burrito listed on the menu. I've never seen such a thing, and had to have it!. It was muy delicioso, and cut in half so I could take the balance home for dinner.Good crowd in here at 2 PM on a Saturday afternoon, and that may be why the service was so incredibly slow. I'll come back for the guac at a different time.

4.description: Love this place! Besides the fact that they are conveniently located by me, their food is pretty great. They've recently renovated and changed their menu. Still worth trying. Their steak quesadilla is my favorite! It's pretty big as they make their own tortillas so one is usually enough for me. They also added cochinita tacos that are awesome! Try it!

6.description: This place got a makeover! The decor is modern but cozy. Same friendly staff and amazing food. The Albany Park Burger had the perfect amount of spice with the chorizo sauce and the ketchup with Chile flakes with crispy fresh french fries. We had the chicken nachos to start which comes with sour cream and fresh guacamole. No skimping here, there were plenty of toppings down to the last delicious chip. Aside from the amazing food this place is also a BYOB and they have 6 different flavors of Margarita mixers! Next time I will definitely bring a bottle of Blanco. Can't wait to go back!

22.description: The tortas are great, can't beat em!  The guacamole is also good, very limey.  Everything is as cheap as can be and the service is unbelievely fast.  I used to go here for lunch with people back in high school.  The mexican soaps on the tv in the morning add to the ambience.

15.description: Great little Taqueria. Tiny, intimate, and has that great tortilla smell you hope for when you enter a legitimate Taqueria. Basic menu of burritos, tacos, tortas, and tostadas. And the more dinner friendly stuff like carne asada, chile relleno, and fajitas. Everything I have tried has been excellent. And for starters they give you fresh fried tortilla chips and some great homemade spicy salsa.  Friendly people and waitstaff and the food always tastes fresh.I like the tortas there a lot. Great bread and well marinated meat. The pastor and asada are my favorites. They give you two different sauces to go with it as well. A spicy red (different from the salsa) and a tomatillo that is just plain fantastic.  Great little spot in Albany Park.

20.description: Love the al pastor tacos!! Prices are incredibly reasonable, service is good, and environment is really chill. A great place. We go here 2x a week

36.description: A friend of mine stopped over the other night and we ordered from Taqueria Los Mogotes. We ordered the steak tacos, chicken torta and guacamole. We walked up here and placed our order and took it to go. The service was fast and friendly. My torta was huge and had plenty of chicken. I could not finish the whole thing! The one thing it was lacking was some flavor. The guacamole was good and it had little to no cilantro.I will probably go back but the other Mexican restaurant that is closer to my house is slightly better. If you are craving authentic Mexican fare, give this place a try. Just make sure you bring some cash, they don't accept debit or credit.

14.description: Cheap prices is what I likeAl pastor tacos here are soo good.Sometimes though, they seem to undercook the meat leaving me with a stomach ache. or maybe it's the quality of it but pretty sure it's from undercooking the meat. I usually just request that they cook it till it's a bit crispy.Tried all the other meats. al pastor is the best. then chicken, then groundbeef/carne asada.

58.description: The place deserves one star but the extra star goes for the good food. The service is horrible. I have been this place twice, both of the times I was disappointed. Second time when me and my friend visited this place, we ordered the same food that was supposed to come with salad for each person. The server decides to bring my side with some yogurt mix instead of salad. This was really rude, making changes to my order without asking me. I told him that I don't want this, then he brought me my salad. I think they had to much yogurt mix and they needed to get ready them. Just be careful what you order and what you get.

56.description: I have been searching for the perfect hummus since high school 15 years ago. I think I found it.Not only is their hummus delicious, but the portions! MY GOD, THE PORTIONS! A small will feed you for a few days.Falafel is also great, as is the baba ganouj. Haven't tried any meat yet.

29.description: You can't go wrong if you want some really good Mediterranean food here.  Tons of stuff they offer in the menu, all made fresh to order.  The best plate of food your gonna get is their business lunch special that they offer ALL day!  You get to try a combination of different meats on a bed of rice and a side salad.  If your not too far away, make sure to visit and get an amazing experience!

42.description: Worse experience ever I have since the last 2years been here in Chicago ,the food absolutely cold and the stuff are unprofessional start from waitress ,Casher ,even the Owner  :( truly i don't recommend to anyone who's looking for good restaurant just avoid it ,and I wish if could give them NO star but will not allow me. Thanks YELP

23.description: I got some food for the family on the day of EID. The restaurant was packed and very busy, but still thats could not be an excuse for them to serve us low quilt y food. The shawerma chicken was so dry as well the chicken Kabob. The Humus I can tell it was not fresh at all which force me to throw them away at the end of the day. Most of us were very disappointed due to the low guilty of the order. The only good thing was the Kifta kabob.

47.description: Order a lunch special (beef kabob sandwich and falafel sandwich) waaayyy too much bread. There was barely any food within the wrap. I give them two stars only because the delivery was fast and the food wasn't cold.  You pretty much don't get what you pay for.

8.description: Salam serves up solid Middle Eastern food.  The meats are decent, they have been dry at times and other times moist and delicious.  The rice is great, the salad is tasty and the white garlic sauce is the perfect compliment to any meal, really.  Order extra!

31.description: Ordered pita and instead I got a wrap. (twice) Ordered sprite, got charged and didn't get my sprite.Refused to refund me and wanted to credit me the value but why would I want to return?!It has been a couple of weeks.I still haven't gotten refunded. I was basically robbed.

34.description: This place is so great that, when I landed from Boston on a weekend trip to Chicago, this was my first stop. I absolutely love the falafel here. And, everything else. Never had a bad meal. My favorite is their vegetarian plate! Love it!!!

16.description: I am a regular althouh I don't live in the hoodI eat here every time I drive byFood is always excellent, service is excellent and prices very affordableI love this place and this food5 strong statrBEST Mediterranean around. Excellent food and best waiter in Chicago, Mr. Alberto Shadi! This guy is an institution, hands down! He speaks more than 15 languages!!!!!I also buy their Nazareth Sweets, they are outstanding!!!

13.description: Their food is usually pretty good but I've been there twice in the last two weeks and the food has been below average, when we got our food it was cold and they forgot some of our order and we still got charged for it, they have one side closed off for construction and it's super crowded, horrible experience!

11.description: VERY disappointed.  Paid $5 delivery charge on a $10 meal, tipped another $3 and the food was ICE cold!!!!  When I called to request a refund on the delivery fee I was told "we don't refund for cold food."  Food was mediocre at best. Meat was gristly  and chewy.  Hummus was very watery with little flavor. Won't be ordering from here again.

39.description: Man, what has happened to this place? I used to bring people here all the time and the food would never fail to impress. Recently I've noticed a change in both the food quality and service. Bread has been forgotten on two take-out occasions, and once while we were sitting in. Another time, I was told I can only have tahini or garlic sauce with my order. And once my Kefta Kebab was undercooked inside.Previously the Salam staff were always very friendly and generous and made us feel welcome. There's definitely a different vibe in there now. I'm not sure what caused it and I don't really care to find out. I'm really sad to write this because Salam has been my favorite place to get middle eastern food, but after so many problems I can't return without feeling bad.

37.description: This review is just for DELIVERY.just started working in the area, dying for lunch.  so I scour yelp for cheap eats delivery.  reviews are great, i'm in!  so I go through the yelp delivery process.  eep, $13 minimum for delivery.  so i'm still famished, thus i continue.  eep, eep! the price now says $14 minimum for delivery.  what happened?so I call the resto, the lady says that it is $20 minimum delivery, cash only.  guess i'll have to visit instead, as I do want to try it eventually.

0.description: I will absolutely return here when I visit Chicago.They know meat and they know how to prepare it very well.  I am not sure I have had better.  The falafel is more perfect here, than any other place I've had it.  And I've visited many.  My mouth and stomach were very happy to eat here. If I had two more stomachs, I would have ordered one of everything on the menu.  I'll have to drag an unsuspecting soul or two here.  They will be content.I got the business lunch, and they most certainly gave me the business!  Thank you, Salam!

38.description: Price and food quality wise, this is the place hands down for your middle eastern food fix.  The shawarma and kabobs are mouth watering deliciously good.  The falafel is memorable as well as the hummus!  The hummus is a must order.  The rice served is also equally delicious.

51.description: Khallas .Try to order an economical business lunch special, like the chicken kofte sandwich, and you won't be able to.  They never have it.  So you order an eggplant sandwich.Try to sit in the back, facing away from other customers so you can eat in Peace/Salam  and focus on your work and you will be asked to move to a smaller table front and center even though the place is empty.Try to ask for no tahini, but garlic sauce instead; and you will be force fed the tahini and have to ask again for garlic sauce.  Try to wait for a glass of water while you are hungry and thirsty, only to have to ask just for a glass of water that other tables get right away.  Try, lastly, to use the Buy one Lunch , Get One free coupon when you check in on Yelp , only to be humiliated at the cash register when you inquire why you were charged for both your entree and a sandwich.  The coupon is for Entree only.  Try to order mint tea but never get it because they decide to boil the water after your lunch break is over.  Try to not come back, though, because the food is delicious.

27.description: These four stars are for the FOOD.  Be warned, the service here is terrible.  So, to avoid having the service outweigh the amazing food, just get take out and eat from the comfort of your own home.Hummus and babaganoush are very yummy, and the Kalayas are this delicious blend of savory spices and tomatoes, are HUGE portions, and a great bang for your buck.

32.description: This place has terrible customer service. They also serve low grade beef shwarma. I called a pick up order and asked them specifically to cook my steak well done. I like my steak charred because it adds so much more flavor. I specifically asked them grill it 10-15 min longer than they usually do and they of course didn't. When I picked it up still looking slimy and not a bit of char on the steak. It obviously wasn't grilled extra like I asked. Told them to throw it back on the grill till it's charred. I also told them I like it hard and crispy and don't mind it at all. They threw it back on the grill for a couple more minutes and packed it up and sent me on my way. I figured I told them three times already exactly how I wanted it so they would have some idea what charred means. Asking them to cook my meat well done is like pulling teeth with these guys. When I got home it still was slimy and oily meat and not very much char. I called them and they asked me to bring it back after I got home. No offer to credit or anything. What a waste of time and money.

54.description: The sweet and short....no where near the best falafel; just greasy and green. Service ok. Baklava old and gyro meet tasty a bit off. Good hummus and fast service, plus the Mr. Husband's first taste of Mediterranean chow..so, we go often and he enjoys.

48.description: Great food. Great people. I highly recommend this place. Reminds me of being back home

44.description: Authentic. From the rotisserie chicken to the manager's mustache this place is as authentic as it can get. Coming back from years in the West Bank I was looking for a restaurant that mirrored the street restaurants of my village, I found it. The food itself is amazing with the lemon scented rice to the meaty shawarma sandwiches, this place is awesome!

24.description: Once I ordered my carry out I realized I made a big mistake. I noticed a dirty smelly mop leaning up against the wall. The counter tops were nasty and full of clutter. The same guy who was mopping the floor was also the server and never stopped to wash his hands after washing the floor. Yuck!!!  My husband asked me if I was sure I still wanted to  eat there, But didn't want to be rude and cancel my order. I just couldn't get past the filth to eat my  carry out. I was totally disgusted. When I want Middle eastern food next time, I will go somewhere else.D. Preston

7.description: I got some kunafa for take out. I like it but the one i've tried in Dubai was more tasty. But the service was fast and pleasant. I made on order by the phone and picked up my sweets in 10 min, it was ready and packed.

49.description: Best. Damn. Hummus. In. Chicago. Period.  I used to live in the neighborhood, but now that I don't, I find my cravings for Salam just keep growing.  You must go there and try their Chicken Schwarma Plate and Falafel's, you can't beat the price and I have yet to find a place in the city that can even compete with their hummus.  It won't happen.

40.description: Food was amazing! they gave us so much I literally had leftovers for three days after.  We ordered the humus Fattah which was perfect.  my combination platter arrived steaming hot and the meat was tender and the spices were on point.  Even the rice was good to eat on its own. fluffy and seasoned just right.  I also ordered a slice of Knaffah which is my favorite dessert and it was to die for. The right combination of sweet and cheese. I will definitely drive back

53.description: This place is DA BOMB!  Excellent Mediterranean food.  The lunch specials are cheap, filling, and delicious.  The help is... Cheeky and kind.  Can't miss with this menu.  One of my favorite lunch options in Albany Park.  You won't regret it.  Got Hummus?

30.description: Salaam is my goto place to get my gyro fix. I usually order the lunch special gyro plate, which is a fantastic value. However , I am a bit puzzled with the lack of consistancy. Sometimes the meal comes with a pita, other times it does not. The service is decent, although, one of my visits, they forgot my order and told me to call next time. I think that is an unacceptable method of handling an issue that the restaurant is at fault for.

46.description: The food all tasted lovely. The falafel was really wonderful. I got the falafel sandwich, and I do wish they had more falafel in the sandwich. I felt like I was eating a cucumber and tomato sandwich instead of a falafel. However-it all tasted great. My boyfriend got chicken, and it was out of this world! I will definitely be back soon.

1.description: From a Middle Eastern-view, not good at all. Not a clean establishment, and the food is mediocre at best. Semiramis and Noon-O Kabob nearby are your best bets here! Semiramis has the best food and beautiful setting/people; Noon-OKabob is family-friendly/casual.

55.description: 5 stars seems generous for such a casual place, but their food beats the pants off other Middle Eastern restaurants!Their falafel recipe is perfect and has been since I started eating here 8 years ago. It is worth driving to eat here. I drove an hour & a 1/2!The meat is never over-seasoned and their hummus is creamy and dreamy and I drool with hunger when I think of it.Oh! They serve 5 different teas that are Middle eastern style and Arabic coffee with baklava. Love this!For the Middle Eastern diner, come eat food that will take you home. Everyone is welcome, the owner and servers are friendly, and it's fantastic food!

9.description: This place is consistently pleasant and reliably delicious. You always get more food than you'd expect and it's reasonably priced. If you haven't tried this spot, don't hesitate. Semiramis is across the street and that's a wonderful restaurant also, this one is much more bare bones but the food is delicious.

26.description: Salam serves up solid Middle Eastern food.  The meats are decent, they have been dry at times and other times moist and delicious.  The rice is great, the salad is tasty and the white garlic sauce is the perfect compliment to any meal, really.  Order extra!

25.description: I LOVE their food and they have good service too. I will travel all over the city for this place.

12.description: Khallas .Try to order an economical business lunch special, like the chicken kofte sandwich, and you won't be able to.  They never have it.  So you order an eggplant sandwich.Try to sit in the back, facing away from other customers so you can eat in Peace/Salam  and focus on your work and you will be asked to move to a smaller table front and center even though the place is empty.Try to ask for no tahini, but garlic sauce instead; and you will be force fed the tahini and have to ask again for garlic sauce.  Try to wait for a glass of water while you are hungry and thirsty, only to have to ask just for a glass of water that other tables get right away.  Try, lastly, to use the Buy one Lunch , Get One free coupon when you check in on Yelp , only to be humiliated at the cash register when you inquire why you were charged for both your entree and a sandwich.  The coupon is for Entree only.  Try to order mint tea but never get it because they decide to boil the water after your lunch break is over.  Try to not come back, though, because the food is delicious.

59.description: What is happening to this place?????? I've been coming here for 20 years, when this place was nothing but a hole in the wall with fluorescent lighting. Ordered here this past Thursday and got the combination plate with a small hummus for dinner. When I got home and opened up my carry out order, both the beef sharwarma and chicken sharwarma was cooked to a crisp, it was not edible. The chicken and beef kebab was burnt, so the only flavor was the burnt taste. Lastly, the kefta was still raw on the inside! As a Palestinian-American, I have boasted about this place to visitors and fellow friends to try this place if you're in town. Now, I'm embarrassed that I even make this place a recommendation! Stop having 18 year old kids pretend they are a cook and serve the quality that you guys are known for. After 20 years, I won't be returning. Nor will I ever recommend this place. You guys need to get it together.

21.description: I love this place this place has the best Mediterranean food I've ever tasted good food great people great service 5 stars gold rating

17.description: I truly do enjoy this food. I get the combination plate and almost always love it. The only problem I have is I always order the exact same thing and when I get home sometimes they will throw in a different meat that I never like and it ruins it. I love the food but if I order something I expect it to alway be the same not sometimes different it is frustrating.

10.description: Once I ordered my carry out I realized I made a big mistake. I noticed a dirty smelly mop leaning up against the wall. The counter tops were nasty and full of clutter. The same guy who was mopping the floor was also the server and never stopped to wash his hands after washing the floor. Yuck!!!  My husband asked me if I was sure I still wanted to  eat there, But didn't want to be rude and cancel my order. I just couldn't get past the filth to eat my  carry out. I was totally disgusted. When I want Middle eastern food next time, I will go somewhere else.D. Preston

5.description: Dropped in for lunch today and got the lunch combo instead of  the shish taouk by itself and it was a mistake.  The shawerma was OK as was the falafel and the taouk portion was outstanding as usual but the meat part (kufta and kebab) were really not good at all.  Super dry and not flavorful.  Kibbe was good but not as good as I remember.I still like this place a lot but will just focus on the shish taouk or maybe the chicken tikka which seems out of place but these guys hit it out of the park.

3.description: My aunt who has lived in Ravenswood for the majority of her life kept telling me that this is her favorite Middle Eastern joint in the city.  Well, I finally tried it and I fully understand why.  I actually purchased a Groupon they had available, $12 for two $10 coupons, great deal!  I ordered online through Yelp for pick up and it did take a little longer than I had expected.  Also they were off by their ETA by almost 10 minutes but hey sometimes people get busy and spit happens so I forgive them.They greeted me at the door and immediately helped me, big plus for me.  It is a little bit of organized chaos in there but it's charming in a way and hey if you get the food right I'm okay with that.  All the gentleman working were very polite and friendly.  I was extremely happy with the staff.  I ordered the chicken kebab sandwich, ala carte falafels, and their hummus because I heard so much about it.  The sandwich was probably my favorite- big pieces of juicy chicken, tomators, lettuce, some type of banana pepper? I don't know but I loved it.  And of course tahini sauce.  So good!  The falafels were pretty good not too special but the hummus lived up to it's hype.  They give you so much food too!  I had a whole other meal left when I was full.Looking forward to coming back and possibly dining in.  Thanks guys :)

35.description: The hummus is terrific.  The service is poor. The servers are friendly,but they forget to bring basics like drinks and utensils. It is inexpensive so perhaps it is better for a take out option.

19.description: 5 stars seems generous for such a casual place, but their food beats the pants off other Middle Eastern restaurants!Their falafel recipe is perfect and has been since I started eating here 8 years ago. It is worth driving to eat here. I drove an hour & a 1/2!The meat is never over-seasoned and their hummus is creamy and dreamy and I drool with hunger when I think of it.Oh! They serve 5 different teas that are Middle eastern style and Arabic coffee with baklava. Love this!For the Middle Eastern diner, come eat food that will take you home. Everyone is welcome, the owner and servers are friendly, and it's fantastic food!

28.description: The single worst place ever.They were out of everything.The server had a very bad attitude.Nobody came to check if we needed water or more food.They wouldn't even let us split a check.

45.description: Salam is one of the best middle easterns restaurants I have tried! There portions are huge so you get a lot for your money. The service is great and everyone is always friendly. Albert always takes care of me and he does a fanatastic job, he is extremely friendly and accommodating. The restaurant is very clean and spacious. This is very close to my school so they have earned a lifetime customer from me. I am so glad I have found this little gem in Albany Park. Thank you Salam!

33.description: The only thing better than the food was the service. Helpful and attentive. We had a veg plate that could have been enough for two and then a meat combo with the most delicious chicken. Must try.

43.description: Haven't been here in years, not because of the food,but I was living abroad. I was surprised to see they have expanded and congratulations on doing well.There was two of us for lunch and we for the most part, enjoyed everything. Fried cheese, spinach pie, kibbeh, mixed platter, moulikiha with chicken, and mint tea. The one thing I was taught in culinary school was season your food, season your food, season your food, and the second thing, taste your food. Years later, I tell my students the same thing.  Everything, with the exception of the cheese, needed salt. Moulikiha, is one of my favourite dishes but lacked salt, lemon, and garlic. Also, the rice seems to be of an inferior quality. Overall, we demolished everything, except all of the rice. With a few changes in the kitchen, I believe everyone would rate this place 5 stars in every review.

2.description: Lie. They always say one tahini is "on the house" but the next is 25cents. Their prices went up about 25% the food decreased about 10% but all that is irrelevant when it comes to cursing at a customer. The "owner" said, "this is my business, I can do what I want! What are you, Pakistani, indian? You cheap motherfu*kers!"All because we wanted to substitute one meat item for another in a combination. Is it really that serious? Taking your bad day out on the customer. If they deny this, they're lying.

18.description: Excellent place! My family and I went here for lunch the other day the food was perfect. Our server was a young tall guy forgot his name (sorry dude) but he was very informative and patient with us. We couldn't decide because everything on the menu looked good! I ended up getting a combo of beef and chicken sharmawa (I know I know I'll be more adventurous once I study the menu). My lunch/ dinner was nothing shy of perfect. You have to try the spinach pie it's delish! We'll be back. Oh and how could I forget the hummus?!! I don't even like hummus but theirs is out of this world good!

41.description: Wow. Very impressed. Great service, feels like a family restaurant. The falafel is great and the humus is perfection. Not a big meat eater, but the lamb was delicious. Highly recommended.

52.description: I was missing my country food testing and now finally found the great place which has many kinds of the Arabic food, I love it and I will come back for sure

50.description: I am a regular althouh I don't live in the hoodI eat here every time I drive byFood is always excellent, service is excellent and prices very affordableI love this place and this food5 strong statrBEST Mediterranean around. Excellent food and best waiter in Chicago, Mr. Alberto Shadi! This guy is an institution, hands down! He speaks more than 15 languages!!!!!I also buy their Nazareth Sweets, they are outstanding!!!

4.description: What can I say, this place is so amazingly good. This place is right off the brown line Kedzie stop, perfect location when you want something right after work. The food is cooked to perfection. I usually get the combination platter. Beef, chicken, rice, salad, falafel, sausage. What more can you for. The portions are enough to share....but I dont. Lol. Make sure you order the hummus and pita bread. The staff is a bunch of younger kids (i say kids as early 20s) but very respectful and kind. Great job!!! You have a customer for life.

6.description: As a local customer, I am humiliated to present this food to other people. However, the chicken and the falafel are good. Avoid the Kifta Lamb/Beef except chicken. I'm not ready to recommend this place some of my friends.

22.description: Dropped in for lunch today and got the lunch combo instead of  the shish taouk by itself and it was a mistake.  The shawerma was OK as was the falafel and the taouk portion was outstanding as usual but the meat part (kufta and kebab) were really not good at all.  Super dry and not flavorful.  Kibbe was good but not as good as I remember.I still like this place a lot but will just focus on the shish taouk or maybe the chicken tikka which seems out of place but these guys hit it out of the park.

15.description: My most favorite restaurant. I like the tilapia with fries. Taste verygood. Also chicken tikka. Love this place

57.description: Great food and exceptional service.  I would definitely go back.

20.description: My aunt who has lived in Ravenswood for the majority of her life kept telling me that this is her favorite Middle Eastern joint in the city.  Well, I finally tried it and I fully understand why.  I actually purchased a Groupon they had available, $12 for two $10 coupons, great deal!  I ordered online through Yelp for pick up and it did take a little longer than I had expected.  Also they were off by their ETA by almost 10 minutes but hey sometimes people get busy and spit happens so I forgive them.They greeted me at the door and immediately helped me, big plus for me.  It is a little bit of organized chaos in there but it's charming in a way and hey if you get the food right I'm okay with that.  All the gentleman working were very polite and friendly.  I was extremely happy with the staff.  I ordered the chicken kebab sandwich, ala carte falafels, and their hummus because I heard so much about it.  The sandwich was probably my favorite- big pieces of juicy chicken, tomators, lettuce, some type of banana pepper? I don't know but I loved it.  And of course tahini sauce.  So good!  The falafels were pretty good not too special but the hummus lived up to it's hype.  They give you so much food too!  I had a whole other meal left when I was full.Looking forward to coming back and possibly dining in.  Thanks guys :)

36.description: This place is great if you are looking for awesome food but shouldn't be your first pick for a fancy dinner. But for the prices food is very flavorful. And I have tried many Mediterranean restaurants. This has been one of the best ones. They can however improve on cleanliness and guest service that's my only critique.

14.description: Authentic. From the rotisserie chicken to the manager's mustache this place is as authentic as it can get. Coming back from years in the West Bank I was looking for a restaurant that mirrored the street restaurants of my village, I found it. The food itself is amazing with the lemon scented rice to the meaty shawarma sandwiches, this place is awesome!

1.description: My husband and boys both get there hair cut by Abraham for 13 years! If your looking for a great hair cut he's your man! His hair cuts are aways on point!!

0.description: Needing a late evening haircut, I came to Yelp to find a good barbershop to get a fade.  I was surprised to find Abraham's place as one of the only shops in the area that was open late.Super clean barbershop.  Friendly atmosphere.  I walked in without an appointment and there were three people ahead of me.  Those three haircuts (and mine) ended up looking great.  Highly recommend Abraham.  Super nice guy...and great barber skills.Will definitely repeat whenever I'm in the area!

12.description: These guys are RUDE.  I was looking for a hard-to-find replacement glass shade for a ceiling fixture, and the guys at both Menards and Home Depot recommended I go here.  I walked in, and there were several salespeople standing or sitting at computers near the front of the store.  It wasn't immediately obvious where I should look, so I asked one of them where I might find what I was looking for.  He glared at me, said "Uh, I'm helping a customer right now." and went back to his computer screen.OK, I'm not that touchy about customer service, but if all you're doing is sitting at a computer typing away, how am I supposed to know that you're helping someone and not waiting for someone to help?  I tried with him again, asking if he could at least point me to the correct section of the store so that I could find something on my own.  He glared at me, again, and said that they don't carry anything like that, and dove right back into his computer screen.  Thanks a lot buddy.  Since all of the other staff people were standing around watching this, I said to another one that I'd specifically been sent here by people at other stores, and asked if they could refer me anywhere.  They said that I was looking for a specialty part, and that it could be ordered.  So, I gave my name and phone number, along with a description of what I needed.  Three weeks later, no call back.  Big surprise.  I'll definitely never go near this place again.On the other hand, on the recommendation of a friend, I went to Clark Devon Hardware that same day. They didn't have what I needed in stock, but it was an item that they carry, so they took my information, actually called me when it was in, and were in general very helpful.   They're not a lighting store, but they are nice guys.

3.description: So first off, the layout and exterior advertising of the store are a little confusing.  I have driven by this place hundreds of times on my way to/from the Kennedy, and thought it was a light fixture store, but after being directed here (by a box store employee) to find a replacement part for an attic fan, I find that it is half high-end quirky light fixtures and vents/fans, and half electrical-related hardware store.  So that's a good thing.  They seem to have two counters, one with people seated at computers (lighting consultant/designer people maybe?) and one with people standing (the hardware section).  Seems like the negative reviews I've seen have to do with customer service and I can see that a bit.  For me walking in, I didn't know which direction to go for help and so I went to the standing counter.  There was no acknowledgment of my existence while the staff was helping other customers ("I'll be with you in a minute, sir"--no), but once the employee had finished with the other customer he called me over and was very helpful, took a lot of time with me, and gave me lots of options and advice.  I'll definitely be going here for electrical, fan-related, and lighting needs in the future.

1.description: I was looking for a small chandelier and they had exactly what I needed. Very friendly staff and very helpful.the fixture was reasonably priced too. I just started remodeling and I will definitely be purchading all of my fixtures here.

2.description: Great selection and we found a chandelier that we both loved -- FINALLY! It was my second visit and again had a great experience with Helen, our sales person. If you are the type to go into a small business and then buy it online -- I actually double checked online out of curiosity and found we got a great price in comparison. Great selection, great service and fair pricing. Dog friendly too.

9.description: Beware of their return policy. After purchasing an expensive fixture from their showroom I attempted to exchange it for another. But alas, I was informed that there are no returns or exchanges when the wire tips are crimped. Very unsatisfied, especially given the pricetag. I'll be going elsewhere.

10.description: Wonderful store.  Great selection, helpful staff, full service.  Shop local!

13.description: I came in to get a lighting fixture for my bathroom and everyone was really helpful. I knew nothing going in but EVERYTHING coming out!Thanks guys!!! xoxox

16.description: They are both RUDE and incompetent.  I was charged twice for the same order and they could / would not remove the charge so I had to rely on my credit card company to save the day.

6.description: Unfortunately, the only positive thing I have to say about this place is that they have very nice lighting.  Just as the other lighting place I ventured to, the results were very different.  I walked in not knowing too much about my track lighting.  However,  brought in a picture.  The sales rep was not able to assist at all.  He told me I need to get the name of the track lighting, bring in a pendant to see if he could figure it out and that it would just be better to replace the entire track.. The other place ventured to told me the opposite.  They told me I have a very universal track and that the majority of the existing pendants would work with it and I will be able to salvage the track and transformer if the color matches the rest of my kitchen design.Whether or not he was knowledgeable was the least of my concerns.  Just the level of customer service, unwillingness to be helpful, and lots of arrogance left me wanting to never go back there.  Very unfortunate.

15.description: They have a nice selection of lighting however, every time I've been there it seems like it is difficult to do business with them and the customer service people do not understand how to multi task. After my last frustrating experience with them, I will happily take my money else where; my advice is to do the same.

0.description: We recently purchased lighting fixtures here and would recommend Fox Lighting.  They have better quality & selection than Home Depot/Menards but are also more approachable & reasonable than higher-end boutiques we looked at.  Fox has a good-size showroom to select from, along with numerous catalogs to access hundreds of additional lighting fixtures.  We experienced good customer service in the store and knowledgeable sales associates.  They indicated it would take about one week to receive our products and met that deadline.  Helen J. was a big help to us and we appreciated her assistance.

5.description: My husband and I recently started renovating our new home and we had a list of things our electrician instructed us to buy, as well as a list of all the fun stuff we got to pick out like different fixtures for each room. We were helped by a big, bearded, tattooed guy named Damien who was AWESOME. He works in the electrical part of the store, not the lighting fixture side, but he was pretty knowledgeable about all of it and when he didn't know something, he found out for us. I can't speak for any of the other salespeople, as no one else tried to help us, so maybe that accounts for the other bad reviews this place gets. He helped us navigate the many (too many) options for track lighting to determine what will best suit our needs, and give us the best quality for our budget. I was really impressed with his all around knowledge and he seemed happy to share. We ended up buying more than we expected because we found a lot of things that we really liked and made sense for us after Damien showed us all of our options. When we brought it all back to our house, the electrician looked over everything and was really happy with our selection. I never got the feeling that he was being a pushy salesman, he seemed legitimately concerned with helping us out. The only thing I don't understand about this place is the display of "snack machines" and weird candy, like Sour Dots and Cherry Tinglers. But it gave me and my husband something to laugh about while our order was being filled!

11.description: We recently re-did our entire house, so we needed a *ton* of fixtures, from can lights to chandeliers, to ceiling fans.  I think we spent a total of over 30 hours in Active Electric over the course of 12 months (and a correspondingly large amount of money!), but since we spent so much, they cut us great deals.Since we went there often, we tended to be more patient when they had a lot of people on Saturday, and you could tell that they appreciated it--you can only spread 3-4 salespeople so far.  We went through dozens of catalogs, they called manufacturers to see if they could get certain configurations of glass shades and fixtures, and even wound up supplying us with dimmers and some networking stuff for the house.Overall, money well-spent, and having the help of Skip and crew over here really made life easier.Oh, and be sure to check out their Fox Lighting store in Glenview over by the Abt.  I'll post this review over there as well.

8.description: Thanks for the help! I talked to Brian over the phone and he was very knowledgeable with his advice, I would definitely recommend this store!

4.description: Great customer service is working at this store. They are extremely friendly and helpful. They helped me find the necessities that were required by electrician. I had a great experience when I was looking for some electrical supplies and new lighting for my apartment. They offer wide variety of beautiful lighting so I had really difficult time of deciding what I will buy. It's a great local business. I think that they even offer better quality lighting than Menards. Prices are also pretty fair for the quality they are offering.

14.description: I went here to buy a fan in May for my bedroom. I had done a little research and knew I wanted a casablanca. First, the wait was horrible. Second, when I finally got my turn, I was made to wait for people calling on the phone and other "regulars' that were browsing. Third, I found out quicly that Casablanca is a fortune and when I asked for something more reasonably priced, she made me feel stupid and poor (no joke -- and I have thick skin). Fourth, she was not helpful in putting together lighting, or coloring, or finding one with a remote, and so I was left to my own devices as she helped those on the phone. I walked out paying for a $200 fan with no lights because I was overwhelmed by the choices and she was NOT helpful. Fifth, the remote was supposed to arrive 2 weeks after I placed my order - but by MID-JUNE, I had heard nothing, so I called was given the run around and told it would be in soon. 2 more weeks, I call AGAIN, still not in - but should be in Friday and they will call. End of day Friday, I CALL them, yes it is in. I can pick it up. I go next day to get the fan, long story short, it doesn't come with a long downrod (not even a 6 inch option) and the remote does not have the part that goes in the fan to make it all work. REALLY??????!!!!!!!!You sell fans and you never thought to ask if I would need a downrod longer than 3 inches? ANd then I wait almost 2 months for damn remote and it is incomplete. I installed the fan w/o the remote, returned the remote and WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE! Pick -up counter is rude, prices are inflated, service is horrific - PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE.

7.description: Spent some time here in the showroom taking a look at lighting/electrical fixtures for my loft. I'll admit, I don't know much when it comes to either of those subjects...but that's where Active picks up the slack. The salesman I spoke with was highly knowledgeable and incredibly patient with all of my questions and requests. I left feeling that I had been given quality advice and quality products. I will definitely be coming back.

0.description: I wore Heejab and I liked it.  I went back for more, especially the cotton blend ones that keep all of my curls under wraps.  In various colors, like green, light green, dark green, turquoise green, mint green, pale green, and olive green.  Because Green matches my Big Eyes.  Wallahy Jamila Abayas fit for Bedouin Brides, and just regular girls from Michigan living in Exile over here on the North side of Chicago, too.  MASA ALLAH!

58.description: I love this place, great service, great meats and their Tabbouli is made with the best ingredients!

56.description: Food: 4/5 Excellent! Loved the juicy kebabs. The naan wasn't warm but there was a tasteful thickness to it. The rice was beautifully flavored. The lentil soup was good, a little more spice would have made it great.Service: 1/5 Terrible service. The waitress didn't get me extra napkins that I requested. I didn't get my desserts. I showed her my order receipt and requested for the dessert a second time she promptly took my receipt and the it in the trash. I had to go talk to the cashier just to get food that I ordered! The service ruined my experience. Ambience: 4/5. Pretty good. Reminded me of cafes and restaurants in the Middle East and North Africa.Overall: 3/5 stars. Can do much better if service is improved. Get a waitress that isn't rude.

29.description: Probably best Persian restaurant in Chicago area with great prices!

42.description: Ok I don't give 5 stars to many things unless they're 100% on point with everything or because the food is that amazing. Kabobi is absolutely amazing, their food is perfectly seasoned, perfect blend of spices and HUGE portions! The place itself is not the nicest and the neighborhood not the greatest but believe me the food makes up for where they lack. I highly recommend the shish kabob, Chicken shish kabob and the beef kabob, the half and half dill/white rice is the way to go cause they're both so soft, flavorful, buttery and perfect! The prices here are great. Very authentic food, huge portions, quality meats and very low prices. FYI: Each entree can be easily shared with 2 people.

23.description: A great place for lunch/dinner when we don't feel like cooking or just have craving for some kabab. They also have a super deal for lunch - a lot of food and reasonable prices. Delivery is fast and friendly. The only problem I have is - they NEVER get my order right when I ONLY order kabab (instead of combo - i.e. no rice, no bread). NEVER - I'd repeat my order clearing stating no rice no bread, they'd repeat my order, correctly, and when delivered - there's piece of bread or there's rice. Not a big deal, obviously, but I hate to waste food like that.

47.description: The food here is plentiful and awesome! I'm having the bone in chicken and koubideh, my wife loves the salmon. They give you plenty of rice and a thin lavash bread on the bottom of your dish that soaks up the juices very nicely. Prices are very reasonable. The owner is friendly and generous. The only problem I see is that this place was recently featured on a TV food program and I'm afraid it will become too crowded!

8.description: Great Persian/Mediterranean food. I ordered mix platter of chicken/beef koobideh with dil rice, it was perfectly done and tastes delicious. I had their baklava for dessert and Persian tea. I will definitely come here again!

31.description: What a great place! It was 3 of us tonight. We had the hummus, falafel, and 3 of their entrees. The food FAR exceeded any expectation - everything was phenomenal! And the service was on point. The owner was greeting everyone and ensuring that everyone's experience is going well. We will be back! 5 Stars!

34.description: I finally decided to try this after reading all the great reviews on Yelp. Food was not what I was expecting at all! I love Persian food and thought this would be similar to Noon o Kabob or Reza's, but it was no where near that. We ordered for delivery and our food came cold and not fresh. The lamb and koubideh were dry and tasteless. The chicken kabob was ok but nothing spectacular. I will not be ordering from here again.

16.description: Incredible meal!! I flew in from out of town to meet my friends. They surprised me with a visit here. This was amazing. Get the koobideh.

13.description: This place is awesome!! My new favorite Persian spot.  Delicious, authentic.  the portions are huge and at a great price. My wife and I share the kabob kubideh entree which is 2 skewers of your choice of ground beef chicken or lamb kabob. We got the beef and chicken. I would have loved the lamb but my wife is not a lamb eater. The entree comes on a Massive plate with a huge portion of delicious Persian style rice. We got half and half dill rice and regular white rice. Keep in mind the rice will be buttery. It's just how they roll. The entree is served on a big silver tray with a pita bread on the base and all the food is on the pita bread. This allows the flavors of the food and the juices from the kabob to soak into the pita bread and make it amazing.  It's also served with 2 delicious grilled tomatoes. The entree is 12.95 and can easily serve 2. My friend got the lunch special which was about the size of a regular entree and any other restaurant. Comes with rice Persian salad.  rice and 2 types of kabob. For dessert we grabbed a few pieces of the bomyes an authentic Persian pastry topped with honey. Definitely recommended you try those. I believe they are 2 for a dollar.  The atmosphere is very casual. You actually walk up and order but then your is brought to your table. They are also open very late. Definitely planning many more visits here in the future.

11.description: Fellow Persian here & if you are looking for really good Iranian food, this is the place to go. Quality is uhhhmazing! My go to dishes are Sultani or just koobideh, both cooked to a temperature of Medium. The doogh (yogurt drink) is really really good too. I don't like the carbonated doogh so I love that theirs isn't. Ooo the mast o muhseer (yogurt with garlic) is great too.Soooooo good! As a disclaimer I've only tried their meats here. I haven't tried their stews or the fish.

39.description: This review is for take-out only.  Daddy J. and Mama J. discovered Kabobi Grill since it's close to their church on Kedzie.  Although Rosa J.'s "foodie hours" don't begin after 7:30pm on Sundays since her day job keeps her busy, she was curious about this place that her parents have been raving about.  Daddy J. and Mama J. brought back these following dishes this morning for the Mediterranean version of Chinese full-moon evening (prices effective as of 09/27/2015) 1) vegetarian tomato lentil (small size for $2.95): I personally still prefer the regular lentil soup.  The soup appeared greasy; however, it was quite light and healthy-tasting.  2) Kashkeh bohemjan ($6.95): It featured mashed roasted eggplants, caramelized onion, win a hint of garlic and mint.  Honestly, it really didn't look too appetizing, but it was delicious once I had the first bite.  3) hummus ($4.95): it's A MUST TRY, enough said.  3) falafel ($5.95): six (6) pieces were included.  I missed the most optimal time for consuming, so I couldn't judge this appetizer accurately.  I bet they would taste much better, firmer, and crispier when they were fresh out of the kitchen.  4) lamb koubideh kabob ($12.95): the portion was huge!  Three (3) people with a normal appetite could have shared this entree and would be full.  The lamb was juicy but not oily.  If you're a fan of lamb, you should enjoy this because the ground lamb kabob was well-seasoned.  They were so much pita bread that was generously given to us.  Daddy J. and Mama J. always enjoy chatting with the owner and are treated like VIPs (exact words).  If you want a feast without spending a fortune, Kabobi caters and delivers, too if you reside in Albany Park.

37.description: Newer location to cool down my Persian food appetite.Walk in and order by cashier and you will get a number to put on your table,Within minutes your enormous delicious food will serve, From this point forward I let you enjoy your food.LOOLThank you Kabobi to bring authentic Persian food back to Chicago.

0.description: Kabobi is a Persian must try!!I love lamb or chicken koobideh & rice more than anything else out there! It's my ultimate favorite type of meal!I came here after I saw someone post an awesome photo of a chicken & lamb koobideh combo plate on Instagram. I said to myself, "I need to try this place ASAP!" & two days later I made it to Kabobi. Three of us went in on a Saturday afternoon and the place was packed. The guy at the front counter, who seemed like the owner, right away kindly greeted us and told us to grab the last table. We sat at the table and he advised us to look over the menus then go up to the front to order and pay. I loved the fact that you get to pay right after ordering because you get the paying part over with and do not have to linger around after eating your meal to try and get the waiter's attention for the check. We ended up ordering two large combo plates with chicken kabob, lamb fillet, lamb koobideh and chicken koobideh. The combos also came with largeeee portions of dill & regular rice, onions and a baked tomato. I loved all the meats. Everything was delicious! The rice was good, but if I had to choose, I would choose the regular rice over the dill rice. Also they put enough rice for 3-4 people on one combo plate. Their Hummus was amazing too!!! It was my cousin's first time trying Hummus and she thought it was delicious. The place itself is super casual, the service was quick and the food was really good. Also the staff and owner were all really kind people. In the front there was a whole display of dessert options too. Alsooo for those of you who have foreign guests in town and do not know where to take them.. skip the fancy places and take them here. It's casual, quick and the flavors are simple enough for them to enjoy and not have the chance to critique.

38.description: The food is delicious and if you're a foodie on any level you'll enjoy this! It is a bit of a "hot spot" with locals so is often crowded, so not always easy to get a table, but you'll quickly get a feel for the chatty atmosphere and communal feel to the Iranian culture. The staff are friendly and fairly quick. 1/2 a star off as almost everything includes tomato/is in a tomato-based sauce so having to really search for different flavors, and 1/2 a star off as it's not the cleanest and sometimes seemed a bit sloppy in their appearance - but that's not a big deal when you're eating delicious food. (Tip: Order dishes to split, huge portions!!)

51.description: Kabobi is my goto spot for Mediterranean Cuisine . The portions are huge , so far everything I've tried has been delicious. My favorite dishes are the combination plate with lamb koubideh and filet mignon or the lamb shank.

27.description: The BEST persian food around. The portion sizes are huge and the prices are GREAT!  Wonderful service and staff. If I could give it more than a 5 star, I would! You order your food at the counter, they give you a number, then they bring the food to you when it's ready. Thanks Joe (the owner) for making us feel right at home!

32.description: Top-notch.  The best restaurant I know of for excellent Persian kabobs.  No-frills.  Go for the food.

54.description: The lunch special is awesome. HUGE portions! I had the chicken kabobs ($6.99) and the shish kabobs ($11.99). Both were very flavorful and the grilled veggies were def a bonus. The lunch combos come with rice, bread, hummus  and side salad which are all great and very flavorful (one combo is enough for leftovers). One thing I didn't like is that the sauces are extra and the service wasn't too friendly. I had to ask for sauce 3 times before they brought it and they weren't nice about it. On that note, make sure to purchase the flavored tahini sauces and hot sauce. Without the sauce, the meal is not complete!

48.description: I like this place good place and the service is the best hear i had a lunch special with the combination of chicken and lamb that was really good i would recommend this place for the kabob lovers

44.description: if you wanna have a Persian food, definitely go here. Its a really good place and the price is not high.

24.description: Love this place. It's a family favorite. The chenjeh and chicken kabab are absolutely delightful. Would definitely recommend it to everyone. Portions are huge, and staff is nice :).

7.description: This review is for take-out only.  Daddy J. and Mama J. discovered Kabobi Grill since it's close to their church on Kedzie.  Although Rosa J.'s "foodie hours" don't begin after 7:30pm on Sundays since her day job keeps her busy, she was curious about this place that her parents have been raving about.  Daddy J. and Mama J. brought back these following dishes this morning for the Mediterranean version of Chinese full-moon evening (prices effective as of 09/27/2015) 1) vegetarian tomato lentil (small size for $2.95): I personally still prefer the regular lentil soup.  The soup appeared greasy; however, it was quite light and healthy-tasting.  2) Kashkeh bohemjan ($6.95): It featured mashed roasted eggplants, caramelized onion, win a hint of garlic and mint.  Honestly, it really didn't look too appetizing, but it was delicious once I had the first bite.  3) hummus ($4.95): it's A MUST TRY, enough said.  3) falafel ($5.95): six (6) pieces were included.  I missed the most optimal time for consuming, so I couldn't judge this appetizer accurately.  I bet they would taste much better, firmer, and crispier when they were fresh out of the kitchen.  4) lamb koubideh kabob ($12.95): the portion was huge!  Three (3) people with a normal appetite could have shared this entree and would be full.  The lamb was juicy but not oily.  If you're a fan of lamb, you should enjoy this because the ground lamb kabob was well-seasoned.  They were so much pita bread that was generously given to us.  Daddy J. and Mama J. always enjoy chatting with the owner and are treated like VIPs (exact words).  If you want a feast without spending a fortune, Kabobi caters and delivers, too if you reside in Albany Park.

49.description: Right off of Kedzie and Lawrence, theres a chance you might miss this spot driving by. If so just look for the place that's packed. Came here with a group of people trying to get our "Kabobi" grub on before we went to smoke hookah. Didn't know what to order so I went with a recommendation of the kabab Barg. When I say the portions are huge, that's an understatement. I can eat a lot but this is ridiculous. You get a big round plate with some type of bread with like 2 lbs of rice. Its like a carb overload. Ps go with Dill over regular rice. On top of that 2 skewers of meat and some fixings. The meat is pretty good. I was disappointed in the hot sauce though. From what I am told this a pretty legit/authentic kabob place much like some on the east coast.

40.description: I'm so disappointed with this place. If I could give 0 star I would. I wanted chicken kabob but the owner kept telling me to order the soltani so I did. The ground chicken was tasteless and wasn't good so I moved on to the boneless chicken. As I kept cutting off chunks with my spoon, I noticed that the chicken was not cooked so I tried the second piece and that wasn't cooked either. I told the waitress and she came back to the table with a spoon and plate. She shoved me to the side so she can take the chicken off my plate. So the cook put my chicken that I had touched with my silverware on the grill that they put everyone else's food. Yes so you might have ate my left over chicken friends. 10 minutes later I received my burnt boneless chickens with oil dripping from it. I was so disgusted I told the owner and he said that the heat kills everything so it was ok to put my food back on the grill. That is absolutely disgusting and I have never been to a restaurant that does that. So be aware the next time you eat there because you might be eating someone else's food too. And btw me and my friend were sick for 2 days after eating here. I will never ever eat here again and will never recommend it to anyone.

53.description: Yesterday evening, my friend picked up three orders of vegetarian samplers. Right off the bat, they forgot to include the pita bread, which is pretty essential. They did deliver it to us in a relatively timely manner, but just check your to go orders. It was an honest mistake and if the food had been edible, I would have given them a pass on that. Unfortunately, the food was hardly edible. Maybe I just have high standards living close enough to frequent Olive Mediterranean Grill, Naf Naf Grill, and Pita Inn. Or maybe this food was just gross. The dolmades were fine, nothing special. The falafel had the strangest texture. It was really spongey, dry, and lackluster in the flavor department. Honestly, it reminded me of a vaginal sea sponge. They were edible though. The hummus and Jerusalem salad were edible as well, but they're both pretty difficult to f*** up. The baba ganoush, however, was easily the most inedible food I've ever encountered. It was sour, tasted nothing like eggplant, and I couldn't stomach more than one bite. At this point the pita bread arrived and I was sure they couldn't f*** that up. How is it that Trader Joe's pitas taste better than this cardboard from a traditional Mediterranean restaurant?! Your guess is as good as mine. I felt pretty ripped off after spending $15 on complete garbage (literally I probably could have raided a dumpster and found better food) and I cannot fathom why anyone would give this place 5 stars, but I did enjoy a cold sprite and a good laugh with friends.

30.description: This was fantastic! 2 of us called in for delivery, we got the kabob combination with dill rice, lamb and beef, a vegetarian sampler, baklava and bemeih for dessert. The kabobs had awesome flavor, tender and not dry at all. The veggie sampler had amazing hummus and babagannouj, well worth a try. Excellent dill rice, grilled tomatoes and pita bread. All very very good! Had a small issue with delivery (forgot the drinks) but restaurant was very helpful and quickly sent someone back with our drinks.

46.description: My wife and I stopped in for lunch and we were thrilled with tasty lamb kabob plates (enormous portions) in a comfortable and casual atmosphere. Can't wait to return.

1.description: Omg!!! Hands down the best Persian food I've ever had!!Went here my entire pregnancy. Craved it every weekend. My baby is known as "The Kabobi Baby"

55.description: I'm really surprised to see such high reviews here... I had an extremely "meh" experienceI went here with two other people. Nice spot with the open windows and high ceilings, but weird tables that don't fit the space, leaving it to be very cramped and awkward.Poor service, as we had to ask a couple of times for water, napkins, and silverware, and eventually ended up just getting most of those items ourselves, which the waitress then seemed irritated by.One person ordered Maust Museer, a creamy dill yogurt with pita bread which was delicious. She also ordered a bowl of their vegetable soup, which was so oily (we all tried it), it was basically inedible. No flavor, just oil. We shared an order of falafel, which was different than any falafel I have ever had. It was fluffy, almost bread like. It's possible the chick peas were ground to a more fine flour, but I did not prefer these at all. They did not taste very fresh and had little flavor compared to the dozens of other times I've had falafel. Then they brought another order of falafel, and that's when the confusion began. One of the people with me said "You already brought us our falafel." The waitress panicked and said "That's ok- we'll give it to someone else" and took it away. I told her we were waiting for our entrees and she looked totally confused. I and the other person who had not already had the soup waited for our entrees, and the owner (?) came over to tell us that the orders had been duplicated in the system so we would simply get double our food. We didn't get double our food. They just brought us two of the same entree- not the one I had actually ordered, but doubles of what my dining partner had ordered. At this point, we were short on time and frustrated by the weirdness and lack of service, so I just ate a little of my entree and brought it home for later. The reason for two stars? The meats were delicious, especially the chicken kabob, and the dill rice was beautifully,perfectly cooked and seasoned. If you go, go for the entree and skip the apps/sides

9.description: I'm obsessed with this place. I've never actually been to the restaurant but I've ordered takeout multiple times and it is unreal. HUGE portions of dill rice with choice of two kinds of kabobs- I've tried the lamb, beef and chicken and I think the chicken is best. You could easily get three meals out of it there is so much food and it's just as good left over. I'm so happy they deliver to me considering how far I am from their location. This is easily the best Persian food in the city, 5 Stars!!!

26.description: Plain and simple, delicious kabobs and rice. Their signature sauce is phenomenal and I bought 5 jars to take to friends. That good! Owner and servers are nice and helpful. Go!!

25.description: The service was really great - a gentleman came out and chatted with us a bit. But we got a lot of food and I didn't like any of it. It was not only not seasoned well, it was just bland.

12.description: Not bad, food is great. Not as good as Nuno but better than rezas. Food is served on enormously large plates which I don't think is necessary considering the tables are not that large. Service is awkward, you get partially served. You get your own water and utensils but get your food served. You have to make the order at the front desk so I guess it's semi fast food?

59.description: Anyone who doesn't give this place a 5 is out their mind. Food was fast and unbelievably amazing. The staff is super friendly and they never say no to any reasonable request. The manager/owner comes right up to the table. Asks if everything is great and shares a quick laugh. I'll definitely come back again but this time with more of my family members.

21.description: Very good food, we ordered the gormeh sabzi which was delicious, and sultani grill which is a very large portion and very well cooked too. One of the appetizer was very good too something with eggplants

17.description: Great place to have some Persian food. The meat is flavorful and succulent. Portions are big and filling. Whenever I go there, I have to have their chicken koubideh and chicken breast kabob combo platter. If you prefer chicken, definitely give that a go. Other items like the Jujeh are also good, but I prefer the former two items since they are just easier to eat and more succulent.

10.description: I went to eat here for the first time the other day and i just ordered a small lentil soup because i wasn't that hungry but about 15 minutes of sitting down, a big plate of food is placed in front of me and i thought my friends ordered it but they said no, so my guess was the owner, out of the kindness out of his heart, gave me a free dinner. This sorta thing never happens so i was in shock..nobody does that. I'm really thankful for it. Earlier i felt really down and out and this definitely lifted my spirits and proved that their are some good, genuine people out there in the world that care. The food tasted GREAT! Thanks kabobi!

5.description: Very nice. We visited Kabobi's on a recommendation from our Airbnb host, and she did not lead us wrong. Kabobi's serves up delicious Mediterranean food with generous portions that are piping hot and fresh off the grill.
