We had a great lamb kebob, hummus, baba ganoush, rice, and huge portions of hot pita bread. The food was great and the prices were very reasonable.

3.description: Authentic  fresh delicious Persian food !! Da best !! Try the Chicken Sultani or the Filet Mignon. On point !!!

35.description: Incredible meal!! I flew in from out of town to meet my friends. They surprised me with a visit here. This was amazing. Get the koobideh.

19.description: Hummus is ON POINT. Maybe the best we ever had. Love the skewer combo of chicken thigh and filet mignon.  Delivery can take a bit long but that's mostly because kedzie Avenue is a nightmare.  The owner and staff are very friendly and accommodating.  We love this place and order at least once a week if not more.

28.description: This place is still amazing. I can't even tell you how many times I've been there and gotten it to go and I've never had anything I didn't like.

45.description: We went to Kabobi based on the recommendations on Yelp, but found the food to be mediocre. It is unseasoned and unexciting, and some of it did not seem fresh. The portions are large but the food is not lovingly, freshly, or creatively prepared. We were particularly disappointed in the falafel, which had a dense, bread-like consistency and did not taste freshly made. The exceptions were the baba gannoush and the shish tawook, both of which were very good. The restaurant seems to straddle wanting to be a nicer, sit-down place (the staff were all very attentive and friendly) and a fast-paced, casual, take-out joint. (For example, you order at a counter and get a number. We were particularly dumbfounded when an employee started his nightly vacuuming right next to our table while we were eating and while the restaurant was full of patrons). Al-Khaymeih, the previous restaurant in this spot, was significantly better and there are more delicious options down the street.

33.description: My boyfriend and I love this place! Their pita bread is to die for. So warm and fluffy! The meat is juicy and very flavorful. I believe it's the Kabob Sultani (?) that my boyfriend and I get every time we come in. It comes with buttery rice, tomato, and onion. We always eat all of it. The owner and servers are all really great. The owner came by once and gave us free dessert and Turkish tea! We are now hooked!

43.description: Visiting Chicago with friends and we're looking for a late dinner. This place does not disappoint. Locals eat here which is the first good sign, owners and staff very friendly and checked on us several times even advised us how to best enjoy our food. The lavash, hummus, falafel were excellent. My favorite was the chicken kabobs they were so well seasoned. I wish I lived in the area. Must try for anyone looking for good food. Be warned the serving sizes are large definitely enough to share.

2.description: Magical. Magic kabobs. I salivate every time I think about this place. Takes great self control not to gorge yourself. Get the kashke bademjan and chicken koobideh with dill rice. I love you, Kabobi.

18.description: What a great place! It was 3 of us tonight. We had the hummus, falafel, and 3 of their entrees. The food FAR exceeded any expectation - everything was phenomenal! And the service was on point. The owner was greeting everyone and ensuring that everyone's experience is going well. We will be back! 5 Stars!

41.description: One Of my Favorite places to eat in town! The service is fast, the atmosphere is casual and the food choices are great. Be careful ordering because I could barely finish my own plate. I like the chicken and steak in dill rice.

52.description: Fellow Persian here & if you are looking for really good Iranian food, this is the place to go. Quality is uhhhmazing! My go to dishes are Sultani or just koobideh, both cooked to a temperature of Medium. The doogh (yogurt drink) is really really good too. I don't like the carbonated doogh so I love that theirs isn't. Ooo the mast o muhseer (yogurt with garlic) is great too.Soooooo good! As a disclaimer I've only tried their meats here. I haven't tried their stews or the fish.

50.description: This review is for delivery only. I order using the Yelp app on my phone. I order, pay by credit card and even can include a tip. When the food arrives & there is nothing to sign. Just thank the delivery person, grab my bag, and eat. Great specials, including the chicken kabob and vegetarian plates. Huge portions, great fresh ingredients - some of the best hummus I've ever had.

4.description: Food is amazing. I have never had a bad meal here. The service can be a bit spotty at times, but it can mainly be attributed to how busy they get. When you do get service, it is friendly and genuine. My wife and I make an effort to go here at least once a month.

6.description: Awesome place, delicious fresh food. Excellent customer service. Reasonable prices. Yumm yum

22.description: Great Persian/Mediterranean food. I ordered mix platter of chicken/beef koobideh with dil rice, it was perfectly done and tastes delicious. I had their baklava for dessert and Persian tea. I will definitely come here again!

15.description: LOVE....in fact, ABSOLUTELY LOVE.Three days in a row....and cannot wait to go back tomorrow or the day after.I found out about this restaurant on Sunday. Lo and behold I had lunch there on Monday, and ordered plenty to go, I had delivery from there on Tuesday, and today, Wed. went back there to eat again.  LOVELY.Beef and lamb kebabs are great there. I did not care for the chicken at all. Love it that they give plenty of herbs (basil) and onions. Tomatoes are grilled so well. The kebabs are juicy like there is no tomorrow.Yogurt and Persian (damn it, it is Iranian not Persian -- unless you are talking about cats) were delicious. The dill rice, great with plenty of dill. I think they put a good amount of butter in everything.  Love their lavash bread versus the pita which you can find at any neighborhood McDonald's.The young lady with beautiful eyes at the cashier is from Lebanon but I think born or raised here.  Love her service. There is a lady who tends the tables. Personable and professional. The delivery champ, real nice.This is a no frill place, with delicious food, and great service. I go back to try some  of the more traditional Iranian dishes and report back.THANKS y'all!

57.description: High quality food. The house shish kabob was the best I've ever had. The tahini sauce was a little different in a good way. This place has a nice, clean atmosphere. I would have rated this 5 stars. The one thing I didn't like was I had to serve myself water and the water was coming out of a giant Gatorade dispenser. It felt really out of place.

20.description: After coming here two times I decided to hang my hat.The atmosphere is casual maybe too casual for there's nothing ambient like at Noon O kabob or Rezas.Chairs are squeaking and shaking as patrons try to squeeze for comfort.Service is a disappointment! First off the wait staff also clean the carpets go to the dishwasher in the backroom pour your water only one time and then grab the entrees and vread without washing their hands. After the food is served they just stand like museum expos while looking at you and won't even bother pouring more water or asking if you need anything.I find this very common in many middle eastern restaurants. Sad but true. Now for the food :AppetizersI didn't get any herbs or cheese as its common in Persian cuisine to get at least one type of veggie or cheese nibbler. Oh well.Their hummus is always fresh with special dark well done pita pockets. The kashke bademjan  (Persian eggplant dip) was very oily and didn't have enough eggplants or any yogurt on it which almost every Persian place I've been to did.Entrée :I like how the meals are served on big platters with plenty of rice and a thin buttered lavish bread underneath. I've ordered the three main meats:Chicken Joujeh  (kabob)Was bland , cold and tough ...Total disappointment. The Koubideh ground beef kabob was Good the 1st time... nice and flavorful and very fresh...however the 2nd time around, it was not only bland but Not fresh at all and again...cold.I know that this place is an alternative to the already crumbling Noon O kabob down the block, but when it comes to Persian cuisine with fresh consistency and good service, and a clean environment; it's Definitely Not at kabobi.

36.description: We always order there lunch specials for work! All I can say is AMAZING!!!! The meat is great and packed with flavor, but I was surprised to taste how  phenomenal there Persian salad is as well as their hummus! Kabobi grill had the best hummus in Chicago!!!

14.description: Right off of Kedzie and Lawrence, theres a chance you might miss this spot driving by. If so just look for the place that's packed. Came here with a group of people trying to get our "Kabobi" grub on before we went to smoke hookah. Didn't know what to order so I went with a recommendation of the kabab Barg. When I say the portions are huge, that's an understatement. I can eat a lot but this is ridiculous. You get a big round plate with some type of bread with like 2 lbs of rice. Its like a carb overload. Ps go with Dill over regular rice. On top of that 2 skewers of meat and some fixings. The meat is pretty good. I was disappointed in the hot sauce though. From what I am told this a pretty legit/authentic kabob place much like some on the east coast.

3.description: I ordered for delivery via Delivery.com. I had the combination plate and 6 additional falafel. Although the oder took **over 90** minutes, the food is great! the falafel has great flavor and the chicken and beef is nice and spicy. It case with a side of delicious hummus.Plan ahead if you're hungry. I think the food is well worth the wait.

1.description: We found this place through Restaurant.com. When we show the app to the cashier he didn't have idea what we were talking about. He called the manager and she didn't have idea either... How can this restaurant be in a app like Restaurant.com and even the manager doesn't have idea about it????????? So bad...

2.description: Just had great 4 way combo from in n out pita and I must say food was great and the price was reasonable. I will be coming back again

5.description: I ordered again. The Gyros was still pretty skimpy. Will not order again.

6.description: Just tried this Monday for lunch. The service was awesome. The guy at the countrr and the chef were incredibly nice and welcoming. Best falafel I have had in Chicago!! So yummy! Great prices!

7.description: Stopped in for a late night snack and was pleasantly surprised by this small counter service place ! Lentil soup was homemade and out of this world!!!! Falafels were made to order fresh ! Great service , Great food  ! I'm definitely going back !

8.description: Love the food the service was great and the restaurant seems very clean the staff was just amazing.

9.description: Very disappointing.  The gyro was dry and the fries were soggy.  The hummus and shawarma were bland and uninspired .  The shawarma was dry and flavorless.  Will not order from them again.

0.description: Well it was about dinner time and i thought hmmm i need to get my taste buds licking some pita. So i searched the city and this poped up like a spring. I took a slow drive and walked in and eat some most mouth watering pita oh what glory this was for a pita master.

4.description: Absolutely delicious! So glad to have this place in the neighborhood. Everything is great! Best hummus! Chicken kabob plate is my favorite so far.

3.description: Terrific tacos within the ambiguous sea of taquerias that is Chicago's North and West side. Very courteous staff, terrific pollo and churitzo tacos.  Very fair prices.  Parking is good for lunch.

1.description: Normally, before I write a review, I try a variety of things on the menu. We tried the steak tacos, the steak (fajitas) tacos and the pork tacos. Our favorite was the pork tacos. Which is unusual because we were usually prefer the steak of the park. The pork tacos had a great spice and flavor to them. Will def go back to try more.

2.description: They now have soup menu...very exciting!  I ordered the caldo de Camaron (shrimp soup).  It was spicy but flavorful.  They used medium-sized shrimps yet loaded the entire soup with them.  In addition, I had the tongue tacos.  They don't always have them available even though this is listed on the menu.  Their ingredients are fresh and prices are very reasonable.  In average, the same items you will typically find in their competitor restaurants will charge $1 or $1.50 more.  I've dined in other Mexican joints nearby, and I have to say Los 2 Michoacanos is one of the best in Albany Park.

5.description: Inside this unassuming storefront are some seriously delicious tacos!  We stopped on a whim and got (a) pastor (marinated pork) tacos, the best I have ever had, tender and flavorful; (b) carne asada (cubed beef) tacos, served with nicely seared meat; and (c) guacamole, freshly made with a good citrus tang.  Well priced, delicious!

6.description: I had steak and pork tacos. The meat was really good. They seemed very fresh.  The gal taking our order let us try the chicherones(sp). The price was really reasonable.  Overall really good experience.  We took it to go so didn't really experience the restaurant.

0.description: The best Mexican joint around!! I have tried many different Mexican places around albany park and nothing beats  Los 2.  The tacos are so good and always packed with tender, not at all dried out, meat. The cook needs all the props he can get cause he works so hard to get your food out. I recommend  huaraches which has 2 different sauces and comes with meat and onions and cheese. I usually get one cause they fill me up so quick and are pretty big.

4.description: After visiting La Cremeria Ordeña next door a few times, I was curious about the tacos here. After seeing the good reviews, I stopped in today and picked up an order to go. Al Pastor was very good, well marinated with some crispy bits, and not dried out like i've experienced at Taqueria San Juanito before. The lengua was also good, cubed not sliced, fairly moist and very hot from the griddle. One of the pleasant surprises were the large homemade tortillas used for quesadillas. Very hearty and tasty. The guacamole was pretty good. Service was friendly, it was midday so there weren't any other patrons at the time. The order came up promptly. Overall this was a nice little spot, and i'll definitely return soon to try other dishes.I'm not sure of their exact hours, but the door said open until 10pm most nights, and 11pm on Saturday.

3.description: This place is great. They have everything including some hard to find items.

1.description: a good hardware store with helpful staff.  You won't be allowed to wander aimlessly without someone helping you either with advice, or the location of the parts you came in there for.Bill's first to review logic is that cost is king, & the box stores are preferred. That leaves no room for these 2 questions.1 - What's your time worth?  usually it's possible to be in & out of a neighborhood shop before a trek from the parking lot at the Walmart of home repair.2 - In the box stores, you may find someone who can direct you to the correct isle, but that's usually the (upper) limit of help.  It's hard to find  any technical knowledge to help you through a 'how to fix it'  problem for your home.

2.description: I get all of my keys made here - a dollar less than home depot, they let me bring my dog in, and it has such a small town kind of feel... I also like that the owner is super friendly-- you just don't get this kind of service at bigger stores.

5.description: So I'm in a pinch for some pepper spray, and this place totally has it. The lady says it's her last one and she reserves it for me til I get there....no big whoop. Same lady at the counter when I show up......and I don't have to walk down 7 aisles to find it.....I'm looking at you Home Depot. Now if only my wife can figure out how to not spray herself in the face.

6.description: This morning I had the most helpful & wonderful experience at this store.I needed a few keys cut & the very helpful girl behind the counter greeted me warmly & even suggested that I could get designers keys made for not much more than the regular ones. She cut the keys to perfection & asked if I she could be of assistance with anything else I was in need of.....I had a list. So...she took me down each of the isles offering me several different types of each item that I was in need of, varying in price! PERFECT!....Also, a young man that was stocking when I walking in, stopped to help me as well. He was very knowledgeable as to all my paint needs, as well as parts for my broken grill. He really knew what I was talking about & needed.........In this day & age when BIG huge hardware stores have pushed the little guys out of business, it is refreshing to have a neighborhood store I could walk to, to get all my hardward needs & then some. I'd pay the extra few bucks just for the conveinience. Kudos to YOU Keysone Ace & YOUR wonderful staff. Don't ever change!Btw....this was a Wednesday morning at 8:30am!

7.description: I'm not a usual reviewer but I wanted to counteract the other review, I guess.This place is minutes from my house, but admittedly, I go to Home Depot more often, assuming they'll have more.  However, every time I go in here they are EXTREMELY helpful and they have always had what i'm looking for, no matter how obscure.  The place still has price stickers in everything and a cash register... its a dying breed.  But it had quality products and excellent service and you feel you're supporting the community rather than a giant corporation.

8.description: This place used to be an Ace Hardware, or at least I think so because all the "Ace" signage on the outside is gone. It looks like there are some things that still say "Ace" in the store so maybe they are in some penalty phase. It's a fairly small hardware store, and certainly no match to the humongous Home Depots of this world. What bugs me is that everything here seems very expensive, so I come here only when I am lazy or desperate for a spare part.

0.description: Not sure what all this negativity is about. This is a hardware store. The aisles are tiny and stocked high and might not make sense. That's kind of the nature of these independent Ace hardware stores. This is the first Yelp review I've ever written, mostly because the people who write Yelp reviews are, largely, entitled morons who are more interested in making a stink on a website where their fragile entitlement can remain intact than actually trying to DO SOMETHING in the situation. I've had the pleasure of responding to Yelp reviews for the past two years at the cafe I work at and you wouldn't believe the levels of stupidity I've experienced. ANYWAY this place is a local hardware store. The owner cut my keys with no trouble. Amazing what being polite and reasonable gets you, huh?

4.description: Amendment to my previous review: I love this place. Great neighborhood hardware store. I don't know why anyone would battle Home Depot when there are places like this. Helpful friendly staff. They let me  bring my dog in and are always happy to see him!  They generally have what I need. I did just find out they are not on the Ace Hardware delivery to store program which is disappointing. This is a good place. A little old and crowded feeling, but that's a hardware store. I have only been a few times but the staff is helpful. It feels family owned and operated which I like.

1.description: My husband and I came in to sell a gold Versace watch worth $1,995 and the man wanted to give us $100 for the watch worst experience not worth the trip at all don't waste your time.

0.description: I have a thing for watches and when I was in the neighborhood of Albany Park I stopped into this Pawn shop and saw the great selection that they have to offer. I was greeted with great respect unlike many other ones that I've been to in the past. After it was all said and done I walked out with a couple of watches that I like very much at a very reasonable price. The people there were more than accommodating to my liking and price range. Very happy and will be back many more times!!!
Pharmacy that also sells a few cosmetic items (including wigs) and lotto tickets.

58.description: Place was a sweet while cruising down Laurence, tacos are pretty darn good. Tried em all, fish taco takes the cake. Sweet sweet potato fries.

56.description: I have been an Albany Park resident for 3 days, 2 of those days in a row I ate here with my family after moving. I have already had all the tacos on the menu. This place is amazing! I highly recommend the truffle fries, and I know you're thinking 'oh truffle? cmon!' Well put those thoughts aside cause these aren't just normal truffle fries made with jewel brand "infused" truffle oil, the seasoning is complex and wonderful, even when paired with tacos. The T & B Special taco Is the best, their fish taco is also awesome. The 2nd night we went the chef sent out some type of blue potato fries, he couldn't have picked a better table to use as a guinea pig! The fries were amazing, a deep velvet blue with a texture smoother than normal potato. If those make the menu, ORDER THEM IMMEDIATELY!!! I live about 3 blocks away and will probably order from T & B at least three times a month!

29.description: I think it's awesome, my family thinks it's awesome. Even maproomsucks2015 thinks it's awesome which is really saying a lot. Food is very good and the service is attentive but unobtrusive. Eat here.

42.description: This place is fabulous!I had the shrimp taco and a couple of the mini burgers. EVERYTHING was very tasty. My friend had the turkey burger and I thought that was the best of the bunch. Sweet potato and their regular house fries are excellent as well.Friendly service as well.I'll be going back!

23.description: Best tacos everrrrrrrrr!!!! I don't write reviews but this place is amazing. From the attentive service to the food quality. Can't wait to go back with my family!

47.description: Forgot those frou frou taco joints in Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, Albany Park is legit! Just go the extra mile and eat here instead.Freshly made taco wrappers definitely gives it the soft texture that makes a good taco. Add some protein, sauce and slaw and you got yourself a gourmet taco. It is definitely up on the list of best not-so Mexican taco places in the city! Yes, I said it, in the CITY. I ordered a bunch of tacos from Duck Confit, T&B and fish. They were beautifully presented and good portion size. I ate the fish taco and there's a lot going on, it's a grilled piece of meat so it's healthier than the deep fried ones (though I like those too). Also ordered a round of mini T&B sliders. Each mini-burger comes with it's own side of fries. I tried all three and my favorite were the sweet potato - crunchy on the outside, creamy and sweet inside. Ask for aioli and you have 4 options to choose from at no additional cost. Burger cooked at medium was perfectly medium. Inside sits a piece of shrimp and guac, this tiny burger is incredibly quite filling.Tiramisu with blackberry sauce served on a chilled marble cutting board is excellent as well. At $4, can't go wrong.I forgot to mention we were here on a Sunday and they serve brunch too - a meat and veggie option, chilaquiles, chips and guac. It's not on the menu, but I think they're starting a brunch too. Space is great, high ceilings, cool giant mural of the "Bean" and large windows. Good staff and plenty of seating. If this place opened in Wicker, I am certain there would be a line out the door. The only unfortunate thing is the name, T&B Grill. Had I just saw the name alone, I think of those little shops that sell frozen patties, chicken nuggets and fries, quickly fried or griddled in a seedy neighborhood. Nothing wrong with that except T&B uses all fresh ingredients. Definitely coming back here to get my fill of tacos and sweet potato fries. What you wanna go now?!?!?! Let's go!!

8.description: So GOOD! You need to try this place. We've eaten here 4 times and hey have been consistent with the quality of food and service.

31.description: Handmade tortillas and fresh food, the duck and shrimp tacos are the bomb, burgers are really good too!!

34.description: Oh my lanta. Best tacos ever. I stumbled upon this little place while on my way to a meeting and am so happy I stopped in. The guacamole comes in a red cabbage bowl and the chips are freshly fried - yum! I'll definitely be back!

16.description: The shrimp taco is a must!!! All their aioli sauces that come with burgers and tacos are full of flavor. Their burgers are super delicious and you can get them in mini size with a side of fries. Their delicious  guacamole is made from scratch. The OJ is freshly squeezed at $3.50 a 16oz glass is a steal. Our tab for 3 tacos, guacamole, steak and eggs and mini burgers with fries $40.00!!! Come try! Your belly will be happy!!

13.description: I recently ordered a takeout meal from T & B Grill, a fairly new joint on Lawrence that serves "Mexican and American fusion."  The service was pleasant and relatively quick, and the dining area is decorated by a colorful mural of the "Bean" - the landmark Cloud Gate sculpture of Millennium Park.  I ordered a "T" (duck taco) and a "B" (turkey burger) to go.  The duck taco was tasty but not your average taco coming out of one of the many taquerias that line Lawrence Avenue.  This taco comes with duck leg confit and a cup of green salsa, though the meat was flavorful enough without the salsa.  The turkey burger was good, with a very thick patty of turkey meat.  The toppings included a blob of cooked spinach, which to me did not seem to mesh well with the burger as it seemed to just sit there.  The tomato slice and the swiss cheese worked out better (what happened to the onion rings??), and the pretzel bun was satisfying and for the most part withstood the soppiness of the spinach pile.  The burger is accompanied by fries, which I upgraded to sweet potato fries for a slight upcharge.  The spicy ketchup is good, but the fries were very good and did not need much enhancement.  They also offer mini versions of their gourmet burgers, so you might want to mix and match if you want to try several kinds of burgers in one shot.

11.description: Forgot those frou frou taco joints in Wicker Park, Lincoln Park, Albany Park is legit! Just go the extra mile and eat here instead.Freshly made taco wrappers definitely gives it the soft texture that makes a good taco. Add some protein, sauce and slaw and you got yourself a gourmet taco. It is definitely up on the list of best not-so Mexican taco places in the city! Yes, I said it, in the CITY. I ordered a bunch of tacos from Duck Confit, T&B and fish. They were beautifully presented and good portion size. I ate the fish taco and there's a lot going on, it's a grilled piece of meat so it's healthier than the deep fried ones (though I like those too). Also ordered a round of mini T&B sliders. Each mini-burger comes with it's own side of fries. I tried all three and my favorite were the sweet potato - crunchy on the outside, creamy and sweet inside. Ask for aioli and you have 4 options to choose from at no additional cost. Burger cooked at medium was perfectly medium. Inside sits a piece of shrimp and guac, this tiny burger is incredibly quite filling.Tiramisu with blackberry sauce served on a chilled marble cutting board is excellent as well. At $4, can't go wrong.I forgot to mention we were here on a Sunday and they serve brunch too - a meat and veggie option, chilaquiles, chips and guac. It's not on the menu, but I think they're starting a brunch too. Space is great, high ceilings, cool giant mural of the "Bean" and large windows. Good staff and plenty of seating. If this place opened in Wicker, I am certain there would be a line out the door. The only unfortunate thing is the name, T&B Grill. Had I just saw the name alone, I think of those little shops that sell frozen patties, chicken nuggets and fries, quickly fried or griddled in a seedy neighborhood. Nothing wrong with that except T&B uses all fresh ingredients. Definitely coming back here to get my fill of tacos and sweet potato fries. What you wanna go now?!?!?! Let's go!!

39.description: One thing, AMAZING!  Everything is so fresh.  The best chips (homemade with a little kick), and guacamole, quesadillas, and tacos.  Cannot wait to go back and introduce it to my friends. Service is very friendly, warm and attentive. BYOB.

37.description: The menu options at this place are great! I love how they offered all the burgers on their menu in mini sizes which were $4.50 each and comes with delicious fries! The burgers were delicious and so worth the price. I would come back for the burgers alone. The presentation was also very cute! See all the pictures!I did however think the tacos were a little overrated. Although the T&B and shrimp taco were good and the presentation was nice, I wasn't blown away by the taste.I also did not like the crab Mac and cheese. It tasted bland and the consistency was very watery :( The service here is really great. The waitress was so smile-y I couldn't stop smiling at her either :) :) :) What a lovely lady!The chefs and owners of this place seem to take very good care of the restaurant. The place was a lot bigger than I expected and very clean. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to those in the area.

0.description: So my lovely bride provided an excellent review of T&B Grill but they deserve a second 5-star rating.Friendly staff with big smiles on a crappy day (mostly due to being Hangry!) good simple food, flexibility in wanting half orders of fries so we could sample more.A great stop if you are nearby

38.description: The hard question isn't whether or not to eat here, it's trying to decide what to eat! Really great food for a really good price. Get the mini burgers.

51.description: Great location for the wife and I we walked here for a random date nightHostess was nice but server needs to be more friendly didn't have much of a personality she didn't say anything when she came to us just stood there lolFish tacos were SICK!Steak tacos need more meat but was very good!Green sauce must have crack in it I could've drank it lolT&B burger was small, I ordered medium but it came out well done it was decentFries were awesome!Will come back server just needs to talk more and seem like she's happy lolGreat place though!

27.description: Everything was pretty good, and I'm certainly glad to see some more approachable restaurants come to this area.  Aside: The corn mural is a little bit Georgia O'Keeffe-ish.

32.description: I was excited to see a new taco/burger joint in my hood...me and my hubby finally tried it out and it was really good. We started with the quesadilla appetizer...the server explained to us that everything was fresh which was nice to hear so I knew it would take a little longer to get our food but 25 min for an appetizer was a bit much...only 3 tables in the entire place. I got the t&b taco and shrimp taco, my husband got the fish and steak. We were impressed it was really yummy! For portion size I think they are very reasonably priced and our server was a super friendly girl. My only complaints were how long the food, 25 min for app and 45 for tacos...it was also very smoky in there...I'm giving four stars because over all it was a pretty decent experience and we will for sure go back to try the burgers!

54.description: I've been wanting to try T&B and finally made it there tonight for take-out.  Wow, the fish tacos and steak tacos were simply delicious!  Everything from the homemade tortillas, pickled onions, veggies, and sauces were outstanding!  The service was very friendly and the space was bright and clean, albeit, very simply decorated.  The Bean mural is quite cool too!I will be back again and again! Great job guys!

48.description: So good! I would definitely recommend T&B. We went for a Saturday lunch and the service was lovely, friendly, and attentive. I got the T&B burger with regular fries, which was super tasty. It's a bison burger with guac, chorizo, and shrimp. Whoever came up with that combo had the right idea!My boyfriend had two tacos and a mini burger, which ended up being just the right amount of food. The tacos were veggie and chipotle beef -- he preferred the beef but both were good. He requested the truffle fries for an additional $1 - these were tasty, but I really enjoyed the regular fries with the moderately spicy seasoning!The space has plenty of room for seating, is pleasantly sunny in the afternoon, and has a new-looking mural on one wall. Our meal was also a good value. We got a burger with fries, a mini burger with fries, and two tacos for about $22.

44.description: Service was incredible. The girl was so nice, friendly, and knew the menu very well so she made sure we knew what we were ordering. Basically saved me from ordering something I would not have been happy with which I'm extremely grateful for. The food was delicious and I will definitely be back.

24.description: Awesome place. Try the duck tacos  they are the bomb. Burgers are also super good. Quail egg on burger is great

7.description: I'm a proud Albany Park resident.  I personally have witnessed many establishments, at this very same address, failed to make it through.  However, I felt that T & B Grill is here to stay!  Their menu is simple, yet it's done with a creative twist.  Yes, the "T" stands for "tacos," and the "B" stands for "burgers."  I tried their T&B burger.  The burger patty is made out of bison, along with shrimps, avocado, and chorizo bits.  It was delicious and satisfying.  I haven't seen crispy chorizos on a burger before, but it really added some texture to the burger.  Hubby had the veggie burger.  I told him about this place that serves vegetarian entrees.  He said he would definitely go back for their veggie burger, or their tacos.  I saw the adjacent table order the Mac & Cheese, along with a mini burger.  Everything I saw coming from the kitchen was a work of art!  I really should have visited this place when they first opened.  What took me so long to realize that this BYOB corner joint was this awesome?  Fortunately, I live one (1) block away from T & B.  Often times a paid parking spot on Lawrence Ave. is difficult to find.  If you choose to drive, Argyle, two (2) blocks north, has free parking.

49.description: If you want good tacos, this is the place to go! The service was great, and I really enjoyed my time there! Next time I go I'd love to try their burgers.

40.description: I never write Yelp reviews, but this place is SO GOOD. Hands down, the best tacos I've ever had. And burgers/fries are fantastic.

53.description: Awesome tacos!!! Get the Mac n Cheese! You won't regret it! And don't forget you drinks!!! It's byob! Can't go wrong. Shrimp taco was my fave.

30.description: Great food and wonderful personal service. Family friendly, we won't miss it whenever we're in Chicago

46.description: Good burger and awesome fries. The tacos where just okay....They need more flavor and meat. The tortillas where good and fresh. I would go back just to have a burger and fries.

1.description: So glad I finally got to try this place. The Crab Mac n Cheese is a must try! Also tried the t&b (shrimp) and fish taco which were also very tasty. Friendly staff and good service, I will definitely come back. I want to try the rest of the taco selections as well as the mini burgers.

55.description: First off -- the service is amazing and our waitress is so sweet and friendly! super plus! For the food:T&B Taco and Fish Taco -- they look amazing but the flavor might be lacking just a little. However, each taco does have a good amount of shrimp/ fish -- so it's okay overall T&B burger (mini) with truffle fries -- the bison patty is juicy and very flavorful. I enjoyed this a lot more than the tacos. This has shrimp, chorizo and guac on top of the patty which were good additions. Yummy burger!  &not dry! The mini burger was good but it was $5 + $1 for the truffle fries -- it's good to try but I wouldn't come again if I was hungry and not looking to spend a lot of money on tacos and small burgers

9.description: A solid place for burgers, but I was a little underwhelmed. I got the T&B burger with a beef rather than bison patty and substituted sweet potato fries for the side. I wasn't a huge fan of how the burger came with chili, which overwhelmed the shrimp and avocado flavors; however, the patty itself was generously thick and juicy. The sweet potato fries, while also solidly executed, weren't anything out of the world. Friendly service and good food--I liked the variety of unique options the menu offered, but I wasn't as amazed by the food as the reviews seemed to suggest I would be.

26.description: This is our new Taco Tuesday place! Our kiddo just loves the mini T & B Burger. My husband enjoy their tacos very much and always looks forward to going there again. Prices are very reasonable! Don't forget the truffled fries too, they are amazing.

25.description: One word-AMAZING! My fiancé and I came here because we tried all of the places near us. The tacos and mini burgers were delicious. Everything was cooked perfectly and the flavor combinations were right on!

12.description: Great place for flavorful tacos with fresh ingredients. The TB taco and TB burger were both great. I need to come back and try the fish taco too. The presentation was also thoughtful and creative.

59.description: I recently ordered a takeout meal from T & B Grill, a fairly new joint on Lawrence that serves "Mexican and American fusion."  The service was pleasant and relatively quick, and the dining area is decorated by a colorful mural of the "Bean" - the landmark Cloud Gate sculpture of Millennium Park.  I ordered a "T" (duck taco) and a "B" (turkey burger) to go.  The duck taco was tasty but not your average taco coming out of one of the many taquerias that line Lawrence Avenue.  This taco comes with duck leg confit and a cup of green salsa, though the meat was flavorful enough without the salsa.  The turkey burger was good, with a very thick patty of turkey meat.  The toppings included a blob of cooked spinach, which to me did not seem to mesh well with the burger as it seemed to just sit there.  The tomato slice and the swiss cheese worked out better (what happened to the onion rings??), and the pretzel bun was satisfying and for the most part withstood the soppiness of the spinach pile.  The burger is accompanied by fries, which I upgraded to sweet potato fries for a slight upcharge.  The spicy ketchup is good, but the fries were very good and did not need much enhancement.  They also offer mini versions of their gourmet burgers, so you might want to mix and match if you want to try several kinds of burgers in one shot.

21.description: We've eaten here several times and have yet to be disappointed. The burgers are great, the tacos are delicious and if you pass up on the freshly made quac and chips, you're crazy! We have taken my parents who are notorious foodies and they were seriously impressed. They should be in the Loop charging three times the price, but lucky for us, they aren't!! Amazing food at seriously good prices!

17.description: Food was better then expected. I was thinking just regular burgers and tacos but they have a different selection. They have fish tacos, duck taco, etc. Their burgers seem to have a splash of excitement. Food was made with a twist that made it just better! Having something different rather then the same old regular stuff makes it boring. This place was a breathe of fresh air with the different style tacos.

10.description: Saw the reviews and thought we should try this place! Brought the kids and didn't think they had a kid friendly menu but u can definitely win them over with plain burgers, fries and their donuts! I believed we tried out almost everything...was excited to taste the duck taco but thought it tasted too smokey and didn't care for it as much...the fish taco was delicious and the t and b taco was amazing and perfectly put together! However I did think the shrimp was portioned too small! I was biting into more cabbage than shrimp and it was like two shrimps sliced in half placed on a taco! The steak taco...crab Mac and cheese...delicious!The workers were extremely sweet and helpful...I feel like some minor changes would make this place amazing! The food is good just needs something more to stand out and be great! Staff was extremely friendly however!

5.description: The menu options at this place are great! I love how they offered all the burgers on their menu in mini sizes which were $4.50 each and comes with delicious fries! The burgers were delicious and so worth the price. I would come back for the burgers alone. The presentation was also very cute! See all the pictures!I did however think the tacos were a little overrated. Although the T&B and shrimp taco were good and the presentation was nice, I wasn't blown away by the taste.I also did not like the crab Mac and cheese. It tasted bland and the consistency was very watery :( The service here is really great. The waitress was so smile-y I couldn't stop smiling at her either :) :) :) What a lovely lady!The chefs and owners of this place seem to take very good care of the restaurant. The place was a lot bigger than I expected and very clean. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to those in the area.

3.description: Dam I just got out of the hospital yesterday and after eating hospital food for 2 days I'm a cravin sum good vittles. I saw T & B about 3 weeks ago.  The food looks remarkable and I have been dying to get here and try their food.  Both their tacos and burgers look like works of art, but I chose the tacos this time.I love tacos and if you see what this place has I'm sure you will come here.  It's very nice little restaurant on the corner of Lawerence Ave & Lawndale tastefully decorated.  The presentation of every different taco is remarkable and a work of art every taco tastes & looks completely different.  They were all delicious a perfect blend of protein, seasoning and spice on each taco.  I ordered 5 tacos all of them on homemade cilantro and jalapeño tortillas.* Spicy Shrimp - Spicy shrimp, habanero, lime, aioli, garlic, cilantro & lime slaw* Fish Taco - ancho chili peppers, black sesame seeds, pickled red cabbage, pico de gallo, jalapeño & lime aioli * Chipotle Steak Taco - grill hanger steak, guacamole, chipotle adobo, pickle red onions & cabbage* Duck Taco - Duck leg confit w/ancho peppers* Grilled Vegetarian Taco - Free courtesy of Yelp with a Check in - Black Beans, sweet corn, yellow squash, red onions, zucchini & roasted tomatillo salsaAll the tacos were delicious.  The burgers also look great.  They come in regular size for $10 & mini's for $4.50.  I think I'll try the mini's next time

35.description: I've been here twice in a week and everything is amazing. Food is delicious and I recommend the chipotle steak taco, truffle fries, and tiramisu. The waitresses are friendly and cheerful. Both times I've been here there have been zero complaints and only talks of coming again. So glad it's about  a mile away from home. It'll  be an easy go-to place  for me!

19.description: Another top quality experience here tonight! We think consistency and quality are critical elements of a restaurant's success and we're delighted t & b grill is sustaining a great experience, and at a bargain price for the quality.

28.description: Yum! I really love T & B Grill! I was initially turned off by this place because I thought the name and awning made it sound like a greasy burger slinging joint. I was wrong and shame on me for the pre-judgement. T & B is nice and warm and cozy, and service is super friendly. BYOB! My partner had the chipotle burger (it has pulled pork on top) I didn't try it but it looked amazing, and I know he was quite happy with it. The FRIES! I don't know what they do to them but they are amazing. There is.. a seasoning on them, so delicious! I had the shrimp tacos and the fish tacos. T&B makes their own cilantro and jalapeno tortillas in house. The fish tacos were to die for, and the shrimp taco was perfectly spicy (and paired well with my Metropolitan Krankshaft). I will be back soon to try the crab mac and cheese and the roasted veggie tacos. So happy to have them in the neighborhood!

45.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  BYOB and delicious, affordable food.  I will go here again and again.

33.description: A solid place for burgers, but I was a little underwhelmed. I got the T&B burger with a beef rather than bison patty and substituted sweet potato fries for the side. I wasn't a huge fan of how the burger came with chili, which overwhelmed the shrimp and avocado flavors; however, the patty itself was generously thick and juicy. The sweet potato fries, while also solidly executed, weren't anything out of the world. Friendly service and good food--I liked the variety of unique options the menu offered, but I wasn't as amazed by the food as the reviews seemed to suggest I would be.

43.description: This place is the real deal. Delicious and creative dishes, excellent customer service, and a chill ambience (love the mural of Cloud Gate, aka the Bean). We had their classic cheddar cheeseburger with aioli on a pretzel roll and their truffle french fries--the food more than lived up to all of the amazing Yelp reviews out there! So good, and so happy that we have a favorite new neighborhood restaurant here in Albany Park. Looking forward to trying the tacos next time, and bringing our friends and family over, too. Thank you, T & B Grill!

2.description: Not bad duck, fish, and carne asada tacos. Awesome that they serve duck. Tasty, yes but really nothing special. Slightly overrated. Presented as a "higher-end" taco but many street taco counterparts are better. Seems as if care went into the preparation. Fat was trimmed off of the meat nicely (or meat was nicely chosen). Too much sauce. Barely any cabbage. Very, very, skimpy on the meat. Concept not very unique. Simple (although simple isn't bad). Would be worth it if portions were fair and sauce was not heavy. All protiens were cooked nicely. Food was seasoned well. Price compared to portion is shameful (especially in that neighborhood & in Illinois). Tortillas nice and fresh but small. Guacamole was good but overpriced. Fresh (like all other good taco spots). Creative but mimics an overdone food truck concept. Overall, should have more of a humble approach to what is offered. When it comes to tacos it just comes to freshness, great meat, and flavor... This being said, you can find great and "fairly" priced tacos in Chicago and T&b Grill is not that spot. There are many other places that offer tacos that are not skimpy, of quality meat, complimented by great salsas, and made with fresh ingredients. This place is not bad but definitely doesn't impress when it comes down to fulfilling hunger with some great tacos... This place will leave some realizing that they were better off going to a well worth it taco spot instead.Taco's were almost there but they missed the mark and the place seems more like a business concept.If changes are made than this pace would be worth another try, if not than search on if your looking for great tacos...

18.description: First off -- the service is amazing and our waitress is so sweet and friendly! super plus! For the food:T&B Taco and Fish Taco -- they look amazing but the flavor might be lacking just a little. However, each taco does have a good amount of shrimp/ fish -- so it's okay overall T&B burger (mini) with truffle fries -- the bison patty is juicy and very flavorful. I enjoyed this a lot more than the tacos. This has shrimp, chorizo and guac on top of the patty which were good additions. Yummy burger!  &not dry! The mini burger was good but it was $5 + $1 for the truffle fries -- it's good to try but I wouldn't come again if I was hungry and not looking to spend a lot of money on tacos and small burgers

41.description: I guess the Brunch menu is temporarily unavailable while they're updating it, so if you remember what you liked from the old menu, you can still get it.

52.description: Do yourself a favor and check out my new favorite neighborhodd spot. So happy T&B is in my neighborhood. Amazing food and service at a great price and it's a BYOB.  I really enjoy the burgers and tacos, especially the Classic burger and the fish tacos. I have tried several of the burgers and sampled most of the tacos. My recommendation is to get a mini burger along with a taco if you are hungry. I am hooked on the sweet potato fries. They have done a great job with their menu and a salad would be the perfect addition. I would love to be able to split a salad or have a full salad instead of a burger or tacos.  I know the chef would come up with a great signature salad that I would crave just as much as the classic burger. Please hear my request! Thanks for this great meeting spot in Albany Park.

50.description: Everything is soooo delicious and the service is very fast. The employees are all also extremely nice!!

4.description: The name doesn't say much.That's ok, because their food and service speak volumes. I could eat tacos here every day if I could. T&B isn't an old, greasy-spoon taqueira. It's upbeat and clean inside. The servers are really superb.The food is traditional yet modernized, with new flavors and dressings, but not minimalist junk you get in trendy neighborhoods, either.

6.description: Stumbled in after a rough beating from the snow, too many brunch offerings at previous restaurants, & way over hungry... Soon truffle fries graced our table & slowly my inner hulk faded as each bite solved life's problems. After a quick jaunt next door to the Liquor store (BYOB!) to further eradicate my lack of personally (if you've ever been hangry you'll understand) for a bottle of wine & why not?!? Shortly after my glass was full & numerous tacos graced our table. Thank you T&B for saving our family Valentine Day! Added bonus, the donuts drizzled in both chocolate & raspberry sauce didn't hurt either.

22.description: Dam I just got out of the hospital yesterday and after eating hospital food for 2 days I'm a cravin sum good vittles. I saw T & B about 3 weeks ago.  The food looks remarkable and I have been dying to get here and try their food.  Both their tacos and burgers look like works of art, but I chose the tacos this time.I love tacos and if you see what this place has I'm sure you will come here.  It's very nice little restaurant on the corner of Lawerence Ave & Lawndale tastefully decorated.  The presentation of every different taco is remarkable and a work of art every taco tastes & looks completely different.  They were all delicious a perfect blend of protein, seasoning and spice on each taco.  I ordered 5 tacos all of them on homemade cilantro and jalapeño tortillas.* Spicy Shrimp - Spicy shrimp, habanero, lime, aioli, garlic, cilantro & lime slaw* Fish Taco - ancho chili peppers, black sesame seeds, pickled red cabbage, pico de gallo, jalapeño & lime aioli * Chipotle Steak Taco - grill hanger steak, guacamole, chipotle adobo, pickle red onions & cabbage* Duck Taco - Duck leg confit w/ancho peppers* Grilled Vegetarian Taco - Free courtesy of Yelp with a Check in - Black Beans, sweet corn, yellow squash, red onions, zucchini & roasted tomatillo salsaAll the tacos were delicious.  The burgers also look great.  They come in regular size for $10 & mini's for $4.50.  I think I'll try the mini's next time

15.description: I was presently surprised by this restaurant. The food was absolutely AMAZING. Everything was excellent. Try the shrimp tacos, they were my favorite. The fish taco and steak taco were also fantastic. The classic burger was also really good. The service was excellent and very attentive. We will definitely be returning to this restaurant in the near future!!!

57.description: 5 girlfriends from the south side of Chicago ventured out to the north side for a birthday celebration. We all were pleasantly surprised. Great service, amazing food, great value! The burgers were awesome, everything from the veggie to cheddar jalapeño...tacos - very impressed, shrimp and steak were really great! Please check this restaurant out!

20.description: Great creative food. Different take on tacos and burgers. Great to see this type of creative food  in a neighborhood that could use something beyond the standard ethnic eateries.

36.description: Group of three went on a Sunday night. We tried the classic burger, crab mac'n cheese, and shrimp, fish, steak, duck tacos.The burger and normal fries were the best things. Being a Sunday night I don't think everything was as fresh as normal. Taco wise I liked the duck most. The steak was covered in so much mayo it was kind of gross and took away from the flavor of the steak. I understand mayo on a fish/shrimp taco to provide more fat, but steak is already enough on it's own. Really, all the tacos just had too much mayo and overpowered everything else. Solid place in the neighborhood as long as they focus on having fresh ingredients instead of trying to mask short falls with lot's of mayo/sauce.  If you go I'd recommend the Classic Burger over anything else.

14.description: T&B Grill has my admiration, they are trying creative things and doing them well. The service was friendly and fast, the hostess was super nice and personable.Tacos were delicious, we tried the duck and steak/chorizo mix, salsa verde was very tasty as well. Presentation was nice, the tacos came out on a wooden cutting board. House made green tortillas with cilantro and jalapeño were unique. I'd definitely return to try the daily specials and a burger. The menu seemed very ambitious with a good variety. Interesting concept, I'd encourage anyone to try them out. Glad they're in the neighborhood.

1.description: This place is awful.  And I'm not talking about regular awful.  I talking agonizing, creepy, mothball, b-movie, drizzling rain, back alley, cut rate, china town storage locker awful. I live near enough that the sign has intrigued me for years.  How could it not? Giant yellow letters shrieking "Socksco"!  Hello?  I mean the sign, and store, take up several storefronts.  I've always wanted to peak inside and learn what could be supporting that much real estate.  Well now I know and I'm more than underwhelmed.  They just sell extra low quality bulk socks, underwear towels and shockingly tacky outerwear. You might ask who buys enough of this crap to pay that kind of rent?  Well, ever seen the homeless guys who aggressively peddle crappy socks and dish towels outside convenience stores and at busy intersections? This is likely their textiles point of origin. You know the low quality undergarments hawked at flea markets and swap meets?  This is dusty crevice from which they spring.  You know the guy selling the DVDs and the t-shirts and won't leave you alone while you're drunkenly trying to enjoy a polish or pork chop sandwich from an outdoor stand at 3 in the morning?  Well this is where that tool got the worthless, translucent shirts he can't stop hassling you to buy.   Socksco apparently is in the business of selling flimsy garments to flimsy people.The interior is cluttered enough I wondered if they were closed for a remodel.  The prices aren't clearly marked, not that you'd buy anything.  And the whole space smells like mildew and formaldehyde.   The young girl slowly folding socks without making eye contact had the plaintive look of a human trafficking victim.  The strangely motionless older man sitting on a metal folding chair looked like he'd slice her lip if she tried to make a run for it.  There's a back area that we wandered into and couldn't be sure if it was storage or more retail space.  The whole experience was strange enough that my girlfriend stopped me from taking the folding chair sock pimp's picture because she was a little bit afraid we'd end up being killed and our socks harvested for resale.So if I haven't been clear enough I'll take care of that right now.  Socksco isn't worth the fifty cents I stuck in the demon parking box on Lawrence.  And if you're like me you occasionally read a review so terrible you've just got to see the place for yourself.  Well this ain't that kind of place.  This place just sucks.

0.description: I love this place.  My fave neighborhood clothing store / warehouse.  GREAT deals, and often unique items.  Although many items are packaged in bulk, they will sell them individually.  And if you're a regular they are flexible on the time frame of their return policy.

3.description: This CVS is nice,well organized and clean. As for the staff they are also very nice and friendly. If they don't have  something in stock they will gladly substitute it with a item close to it for the same sale price even or give you a rain check. All you have to do is ask. The checkout is normal checkout time believe me I've seen much worse. They usually open another register when they have more than 3 people in line.

1.description: I really want to like this CVS. I really do considering its walking distance from my house...so whenever I need an item or two from booze to tampons to medicine, this store is a quick, easy stop.Only problem is... it's never a quick and easy stop. Whether I'm buying one item or ten items... I spend AT LEAST 15-20 minutes a trip, and that's all thanks to the checkout lines. There is usually only one cashier and at least 4 people in line. No matter what time of day.The 2ft long receipt you get for your transaction, the long lines, and the poor customer service is definitely not worth the trip.

2.description: I can't believe no one has pointed out the excessively high cost of items at this CVS. Or maybe its all CVS's?! I don't know because I usually go to Walgreens for drug store related purchased, but this is so close to my house I sometimes stop there if I need something in a hurry. Recently my husband asked me to pick up tin foil on my way home and I stopped into CVS but they only had one option which was $5. I refused to pay that for tin foil and went to Walgreens where there were a few different options, all under $3 (I think I paid $1.50). Today after spending nearly $20 on infants Tylenol and Pedialite for my sick baby my husband and I both said we will NEVER go back to this CVS. I don't care how close it is to my house- the mark ups are outrageous. Not to mention this location is dirty, never fully stocked and the check out lines are always so long.

0.description: Wow, I can't believe this CVS location doesn't have any reviews yet!So, uh, yeah. My experience is mostly with the pharmacy here... but, given my recent experiences at area Walgreens locations, this CVS is blowing them all out of the water. Friendly, responsive pharmacy staff that are quick to check up on the status of your prescriptions, eager to offer advice, helpful enough to direct you to the correct aisle to find your OTC drugs, and talk you through all the little freak-outs that can often accompany being sick.This store is absolutely massive. Great selection of everything from salon hair care to odds and ends like Snuggies, headphones, and candy.Nice enough cashiers; tons of parking. Location appears fairly uncrowded on weeknights.

4.description: Long wait lines and surly staff.

1.description: Food was really good-4 starAfter we ordered was told they didn't have yuca, then when we asked for additional dressing when they couldn't fulfill our original order they charged us for extra dressing instead of accommodating us for not having what we wanted Overall a great place for Take out

9.description: Best peruvian chicken in chicago!Love the sauces too!this is no fancy restaurant and to be honest the only thing i recommend is the chicken and the ceviche but it sure is delicious! oh and its cheap! 17 dollars gets you a whole chicken, salad, and fries thats dinner for 4!

12.description: A late review here. I've been to this place a few times this past summer. Went for the "pollo a la brasa", came back for the ceviche. And the chicken too! The chicken was great, very savory (have to say the first time it was a bit undercooked for my taste - I think they were trying too hard to be "juicy" - but the rest of the times, it's been spot on), the fries, the salad and the yummie hot sauce, just great. Peruvian all around. The first time we ordered a fish ceviche, as an appetizer, and the pollo as an entree. The ceviche was so good, we came back the following day, just to have ceviche. Now, the ceviche dish is rather large, so it may be a lot for one person, but, if you're hungry, go for it!Pollo a la brasa, ceviche + Inca Kola, so good! Service is good, prices are okay, which leads to the following: this place is a hole in the wall, in Chicago, AND in Peru. I've been to restaurants in Peru too: this is your regular family-owned/run neighborhood joint. But the prices don't reflect that. But maybe I'm looking for a correlation between the establishment and the prices, when perhaps there is none (?) The chicken was inexpensive, the ceviche, not so much. But I really didn't care that much, as I was back several times. I haven't tried anything else, so I will be back.

21.description: This is a very small place, like a takeria type, i went there because the word in the street is that they had the best peruvian Chicken in town, and since is new i thought that it was a good idea to try it.We stop around 1 pm on a sunday, all the tables were already filled, lots of kids, and to be honest i didn't like the atmosphere, it really looks like a cheap taco place, there were food all over the floor because the kids were playing with the lettuce.My husband and I decided to ask for the chicken to go, and we went to the sushi reastaurant across the street, quiet a difference!We had a nice luch and went back to Fina stampa to pick up food.I don't think this is a place were people go for a romantic dinner (impossible), word in the street is that they have good dishes.My family loved the chicken, but Rosa de lima has a better flavor (according to them).As i said, is very small place, charming people, very polite on the phone, good english.

16.description: Oh, hell yes. This place is soooooo good. Excellent Peruvian chicken at a fantastic price. It's a small, family-owned restaurant that makes it when you order it. I have a craving now, just thinking about it. I think I'll head over. It would be in your best interest to do the same.

17.description: Excellent peruvian food!! specially the "Pollo a la brasa" broiled chicken crunchy but tender and since it isn't fried its not greasy and fatty. The chicken can be ordered by quarters, halves or a whole and it comes with a very simple but tasty salad (delicious green dressing) and homemade french fries which can be replaced by rice. The papa a la Huancaina is delicious as well and they also offer good ceviche and other Peruvian specialties. The restaurant is not very pretty, neither is the area where it is located, but the food is totally worth the adventure!!!

10.description: I love Peruvian food! I have been to many if not all of the local Peruvian spots and this was sadly a disappointment.  I ordered a very common Peruvian dish, aji de gallina, and it was HORRIBLE. First the dish didn't look like it and tasted nothing like it.  The white rice was hard and cold. I would give it zero stars but my son really enjoyed his meal, the pollo a la braza and anticuchos.His meal looked freshly made and he really enjoyed the chicken and fries.It seems that the only consistently good thing they make here is the chicken. Do not try any other dishes and take a quick drive to the two other Peruvian restaurants nearby. I won't name them because I don't want to lose credibility by giving names of other local competitors but they are easily found via yelp.I have been to them and  they have very good traditional dishes.Aji de gallina, lomo saltado, seviche.

5.description: Not what I remembered from the first time I came last year but still delish. Chicken was very moist and flavorful.-4/30/2014

11.description: Monday 10/17/2011 12:00pmThis is a truly " A Hole in the Wall" place. The parking lot could maybe hold 5 cars, so park your car on the street if you can. This restaurant is next to Charlie's Supermarket.The restaurant itself is very small. I thought the price was a bit high for the location. $10.00 for 1/2 chicken? Maybe it's just me.I ordered the Pollo a La Brasa 1/2 chicken. It came with salad and fries.Salad was nice. I liked the dressing.Chicken was moist and delicious. I would come back for this chicken.Yelpers this is not a Boston Market but a small mom and pop type of restaurant and they serve one very delicious chicken.Enjoy

22.description: This restaurant is for typical Peruvian.  Bien Taypa!!Ceviche and Jalea are the best dish.Pollo a la brasa definitely is a must.

0.description: Get the charbroiled rotisserie chicken.  It's juicy, flavorful, and tender.  The sauces that accompany the chicken are addicting.  Make sure you try the orange hot sauce.  My typical order consists of 1/2 of a chicken, rice and salad.Fina Estampa's prices are higher than it's competitor, which is just a few blocks down the street.  However, the quality of their food exceeds that of any other rotisserie chicken place in Chicago.

20.description: If you are looking for an authentic Peruvian dining experience, then this is your place.  This is exactly what I remember the restaurants being like in Peru.  This is not some sort of Disneyfied version of a Latin American restaurant.  For instance, do you think that there are any restaurants like Brazzas in Brazil?  Maybe in the Sao Paulo Marriott and that's it.  I have traveled throughout Brazil, Peru and Latin America.  Do you really think restaurants in Latin American serve food in those stupid Gaucho outfits at $50 a person?   Fin Estampa is the type of restaurant that you would find throughout Peru, very small, simple and modest.Fina Estampa (Pollos a la Brasa) is located in an ugly small strip mall next to the Montrose Saloon.  Upon walking in, you will usually see kids running around, Univision turned as loud as possible and a warm smile from the owners.  You know this is a family business!  There is nothing physically attractive about this place until the food comes out.  The food is exactly as I remember it in Peru.  The rotisserie chicken is juicy and served w/ a variety of sauces.  The ceviche is huge here.  The Peruvian style is much chunckier than the other styles so pieces of fish are much larger than you may be used to.  The serving is so large, it is more like a meal.  In fact, ceviche is served exclusively as a lunchtime meal in Peru and not an appetizer.  In Peru, if you ask for ceviche at dinner, you'll get a funny look from your server.  The sides that accompany your meal are great esp. the Peruvian style corn which is toasted.  The large kernals are puffed out like popcorn except the casing stays on the kernel.  I crave this stuff.  While the prices aren't as cheap as you would expect from a place that looks like this, the servings are huge and expect to be taking some food home with you.  After your meal, stop next door  for a beer at the Montrose Saloon and you've got yourself a nice evening.

19.description: Hmmm, pollo a la brasa.  It really is very much just like back home.  Fantastic value, and fantastic chicken.  If you like chicken, do yourself a favor and just  try it one time.  You will not regret it.  The only thing I regret, is not going back more often.

2.description: Horrible experience!  The chicken is great; however, their service is poor!  I will not cater from them again.  Since point one, they had the worst customer service on the phone.  Second, I needed to pick up the food at a specific time and they could not do it because they were "busy".  Therefore, to make this work, I had to rearrange someone else to pick up the food.  Unfortunately, the person that went pick up the food, was never given part of the order.  We wanted to speak with owner and he was busy on a picnic.  I am still waiting on a call back from him.  Horrible customer service!

18.description: This is a very small place, like a takeria type, i went there because the word in the street is that they had the best peruvian Chicken in town, and since is new i thought that it was a good idea to try it.We stop around 1 pm on a sunday, all the tables were already filled, lots of kids, and to be honest i didn't like the atmosphere, it really looks like a cheap taco place, there were food all over the floor because the kids were playing with the lettuce.My husband and I decided to ask for the chicken to go, and we went to the sushi reastaurant across the street, quiet a difference!We had a nice luch and went back to Fina stampa to pick up food.I don't think this is a place were people go for a romantic dinner (impossible), word in the street is that they have good dishes.My family loved the chicken, but Rosa de lima has a better flavor (according to them).As i said, is very small place, charming people, very polite on the phone, good english.

13.description: Those TVs are annoying! I used to go there for the ceviche until one time they asked if I wanted it spicy or not I said spicy and they served me a uneatable ceviche so ridiculous spicy and it seems like they did it on purpose cause the waitress seemed to make fun of it at the end when I couldn't finish it. Also they should hire better staff, people that are not going to be on their phone all day or watching tv but hopefully they already hired better and more professional waitress. After all this place has good pollo a la brasa and I would like to go back to see if there is better service.

4.description: This is my favorite place for Pollo a la Brasa Peruano, Peruvian Rotisserie, in Chicago. Each time we went to chicago, we stop by and eat one there and take one more for home. As a peruvian I can says this flavor is pretty well similar that the original. We also tried the Anticuchos, Great flavor!!! better than those at Tanta (which is a great place for Peruvian food too). I highly recommend The Fina Estampa for Pollo a la Brasa and Anticuchos.

6.description: Only order the polla a la brasa.  Order an Inca Kola for your drink.  Once you get your meal, only eat the polla a la brasa.  Do not eat anything else on your plate.Few notes:There are 2 cooks.  One cook makes only the polla a la brasa.  The other cook makes everything else.  The cook that makes everything else is a terrible cook.  If you eat anything that isn't polla a la brasa you will most likely dislike it.They moved across the street, so they have a larger lot and plenty of street parking.The atmosphere is weird with 2 large TV's turned up so the terrible cook can hear it in the back.If the owner is reading this don't change the polla a la brasa, fire your line cook, hire a sous chef, and get rid of the TV's.

15.description: This is the place to go for pollo a la brasa for sure! My Peruvian aunt and parents all agree. It tasted so much like the chicken in Lima.  It was perfectly seasoned and very moist. The fries were also really tasty. We ordered two other dishes: lomo saltado and tallarin saltado. The lomo saltado was under seasoned, there were hardly any onions or tomatoes and the pieces of meat were too big. But at least they weren't chewy or fatty pieces of meat. The  BEST lomo is at Macchu Picchu restaurant, but cooked by Sra. Violeta who is only there on certain days. She makes the juiciest, tastiest lomo saltado in the world! But I digress...The lomo was just meh, it was edible. The tallarin saltado wasn't bad. I just tasted a few noodles, since I was already full but my family seemed to think it was okay, nothing to rave about, though. So, in sum- go for the chicken!!!!Oh! I should add that it's a mom and pop little hole in the wall with loud salsa music playing that makes it difficult to have a conversation. But the music is good! They also have super fast service and are friendly. Go!

7.description: Ok let's start at the beginning.....small parking lot.. check...in a strip mall.. check...place looks tiny..check..So sounds like this hole in the wall wouldn't offer some good Peruvian polla a la brasa.... you would be totally wrong. The food here is great! It is very simple yet perfectly on point for spices and flavor.  I tried lomo saltado there and some ceviche - both were not so bad or spectacular. So why come here, you ask? You should come for the chicken - the "pollo a la brasa" is incredible. So I suggest a nice 1/4 pollo a la brasa meal with it's salad and fries and a can of Inca Cola and you are golden.

8.description: If you can get past the appearance, this is a great place to grab a quick Peruvian meal.It's a total hole in the wall - it's not really that clean but not like "ew, I'm going to get sick," more like "where is the little kid that was eating here before me"Great place for some Peruvian roast chicken and an Inca Kola

3.description: One of the best places to get roasted chicken from. Every time I order the Pollo a la Brasa it's always juicy and well seasoned! The salad came with a green salad dressing, the salad is simple but that sauce was amazing! The fries are crispy and thick. I love their white garlic sauce, goes well with the chicken. I recommend it!

14.description: Om Nom Nom Nom Nom!!!As an authentic Peruvian...well at least born there and maybe raised around Peruvian food in the States...but regardless... I have to say that this chicken is the most flavorful chicken I have ever had! I don't know what they put in the marinate but it's worth giving this hole in the wall a try. Not the prettiest of places, but what my parents tell me this is how Peruvian restaurants are back home. Very small place, nothing fancy just good food and great prices! I have a method of testing out good Peruvian food and that is ordering all of my favorite Peruvian appetizers all at once... luckily for me my metabolism allows me to do that. So here is what this glutton ordered..(besides the Pollo A La Brasa/Rotisserie Chicken..Tamal Peruano/Peruvian Tamale - stuffed with egg and chicken and marinated onions.Papa Rellena/Stuffed Mashed Potato - stuffed with seasoned steak, eggs, raisins and olives.Papa a la Huancaina -sliced boiled potatoes in a creamy sauce (cold dish) Ceviche - fresh fish marinated in lime juice served with sweet potatoes, corn, and cancha corn. Results of this test where GREAT SUCCESS!!  Try it you won't forget it! Don't be scared of the parking lot, just go in!. :)

29.description: This is my new favorite Thai restaurant!  I went for lunch on a Saturday.  I ordered the Basil and my wife ordered the Vietnamese sandwich.  Very nice flavors.  When the menu indicates spicy, it is spicy - but not over the top.  Service was attentive but not pushy.

42.description: Excellent Thai. Other Thai restaurants beware, once people discover this delicious  and affordable Thai food all bets are off. So happy to have a quality Thai place in this area! Had the Deluxe Platter and Fresh Summer Roll both really good. I didn't care for the taste of the Larb Moo, a pork croquette. For me, it had a pungent flavor but not awful. My husband loved it (but he's a pig). For my entree, I had the shrimp Pad Thai, the best I've ever had in the city. My husband had the Curry Duck. The curry sauce was complex and just delightful  with pieces of lychee. Yummy. I will be frequently visiting... Big place so finding a table not a problem.

23.description: This is our new go-to Thai place. The service has always been friendly and attentive. We go every few weeks. Everything we have tried over the last few months has been delicious but favorites include the Pad Woon Sen and Green Curry. Plus it's BYOB! What more can you want?

47.description: Ah wow. DELICIOUS full-bodied and creamy green curry, and the yum talay (spicy seafood salad) was a great starter. Fresh, flavorful and cooked excellently.We also had the River Prawn Tom Yum Noodle dish, which had the perfect balance of spicy and sour, along with a giant and super tasty prawn.Go here for the amazing Thai food, but most importantly understand the story and eventual legacy that Arun is trying to build here. This center (that the restaurant is housed in) is the anchor for what will eventually be Chicago's dedicated Thai town! I hope the community continues to support him in this awesome yet challenging endeavor. I know I most definitely will!!

8.description: This place aims really low, and still misses big time! Don't be fooled by the four star rating... Has to be from friends/family of ownership. Too much of the menu is deep fried and tastes of little more than dirty fryer oil. Still feels like a police station in a bad way, and I think the prisoners probably ate better food here. Soooo many better Thai options.

31.description: Really cool space in an old police station. Menu has a variety of standards mixed w. unique extras from Chef Arun. Many dishes inspired from his other well known restaurant but with much more affordable prices!

34.description: Party of 20???  What???  Family dinner for August birthdays.  Converted a police station into a very cute little BYOB Thai place!  I'd eat in this kind of jail anytime!!  Ordered almost everything off the menu but didn't get to taste as much as I wanted.  Def deserves another trip back into the city.  Next time maybe with less than 20 people Crispy pot stickers were a BIG hit with the kids.  To bad they were SO SMALL.  Size of a date.  Bite size, for my 4 yr old... Really small but def a big crunch n good flavor.  It lists only veggies as ingredients but couldn't really put my finger on what the binding agent was.  Thought chicken but didn't say on the menu.
