Crab ran goons were another big hit with the kids.  Bigger than the potstickers.  Must have been really good cuz my 4 yr old was basically French kissed it trying to get to all the filling.  He wouldn't even give me a bite to taste.  Chicken coconut curry was delish.  Chicken was a bit chewy but flavor was good!!  I had the broth over white rice n I could have eaten more of it!Minced basil chicken was flavorful but a bit salty for me.Tried so many/too many things that were good that I can't really pin point which was my fave but def think it would be worth another trip into the city.A few of us (the ones who were paying) were a bit turned off by the service...or should I say our server?  There was a main server, a trainee (who seemed as if he had NEVER waited tables before!  He prob shouldn't have been "training" with our crazy party of 20), a runner n a busser.  When someone asks you if you need anything u just order from them regardless of what color their shirt was (diff color shirts for servers, runners, bussers).  Well I guess we weren't suppose to order from anyone except the main server who was wearing yellow.  The main server was rude about it too saying we could only order from her.  Well then why was your staff asking us if we needed anything else??  FYI...there is a corkage fee starting next week I think.  They just received their license.  Thank goodness they didn't charge us today cuz they left the opener on the table n we had to open our own bottles n pour our own wine.  So they didn't really "serve" us I guess so they didn't charge us or didn't charge cuz they didn't want to "serve" us?  Dunno.

16.description: What a great and reasonably price Thai food restaurant!! 2nd time here and it's great. Portions are enough to fill me up! Recommended!!

13.description: Came here after finding it on Yelp with higher stars than the 2nd option, which we were initially  leaning toward.  Glad we took the leap!  Never would have known it was even a restaurant because the building used to be a police station.Great apps, especially the beef soup, which was flavorful, light, and wonderful tender beef.  Pad see ew was wonderful & the wife enjoyed her Penang curry.I found out halfway through lunch that this is the same chef of Arun's 4 star that I had eaten at 12 yrs ago for a special occasion.  That explains why the quality was so good.Definitely a thumbs up.  I'll be back again soon.

11.description: Not familiar with the neighborhood but it seems like a great place to dine. The decor inside is pretty hip and has good brightness. I love how they had a display of China and decor. I do have to say that I was happy to hear some Thai in the restaurant and a friendly boss who kept everyone accommodated. However I was not that excited about the food since the nest that was on the plate of wings were not fresh (lost its crisp). The wings were delectable and well accompanied by the sriracha sauce. I was baffled by the pad Thai that was also ordered since it was really wet and most of the strands of noodles are broken. The dish was made with ketchup and other seasonings. This was the least of my favorite due to the texture of the noodles and authenticity. My favorite dish was definitely the green curry sauce it has a delicious hint of coconut to it though lacks the melding of the flavor from the vegetables added (eggplant and green peppers). I do have to add that the menu really made me interested in coming back :). Aside from this, the statue (phra phrom) is worth a visit. Don't forget to pay your respects to the God~ Another perk that made this location worthwhile is the parking lot. :) good accommodation here and easily accessible for commuters via CTA

39.description: Delicious! Came here with a group and sampled many things on the menu, the highlights were definitely the Masaman curry & the Red Curry with roasted duck and lychee! The Tom Khar & Tom Yum soups were good but a bit too sweet for me. All in all, everything we tried were incredibly aromatic and jam-packed with flavor. Service was great and Chef Arun's take on Thai food is unique - loved the originality. Will definitely be coming back !!

37.description: Excellent dinner and service. Fresh ingredients and Delicious food. Can't wait till they deliver:)

0.description: The old police station lives!  Yes the little police station at the corner of Pulaski and Sunnyside (supplanted by a giant police station just down the street on Pulaski) has finally emerged as Taste of Thai Town - a restaurant!   This long-delayed and much anticipated restaurant is sort of a second cousin to the famous Arun's on Kedzie.   The exterior still has the stern look of a former police station - the tinted glass doors and windows of the front facade always look dark to the untrained eye.  The attractive shrine of Brahma (similar in style to the Erawan shrine in Bangkok that was the site of a bombing this summer) is located just south of the restaurant fronts a small parking lot.  The interior is also attractive, with the main dining room featuring murals on the walls.  Past the main room there are other dining spaces that are also nicely decorated.  Instead of being interrogated by cops, diners are served very well by pleasant and attentive staff members.I have tried the fried taro rolls, sort of like the crispy Chinese spring rolls with veggies and thin noodles inside, and they come with sweet and sour sauce.  The fresh summer roll is like the chewy Vietnamese spring roll with veggies and shrimp, accompanied by a yummy plum sauce on the side.My favorite dish that I have tried here (so far) is the masaman curry with beef chunks, peanuts, potato and onion, along with white rice (chicken is a meat option, though the server says the chicken is served with the bones).  The curry dish has a red chile designation on the menu, but it is really rather mild, so that is good news to me.  The beef and other ingredients swim in a rich and creamy Thai curry sauce with coconut milk, somehow creating a smooth and delicious "gravy" that reminded me of a peanut sauce.  Anyway I think I have found my "go to" dish here with the masaman curry.  I have also tried the curry fried rice, a mild rice dish with a colorful array of veggies.  The phad kee mao is a fairly spicy noodle dish, though curiously the red chile logo used to designate spicy dishes does not appear on the menu (though "hot peppers" are in the ingredients).  The rad nah mee grob is presented as a soup, with the crispy noodles served separately from a bowl of Asian broccoli and black beans swimming in a broth-like gravy.  The sweet mango with pandan sticky rice is outstanding, though when I went recently I was informed that the mango was "out of season" and therefore this dessert was unavailable.  The custard cake was good though the pasty triangles offered a rather subtle sweetness.  Ice cream flavors include coconut (thumbs up from my bud) and also green tea.  You can also go sweet beverage-wise with a Thai ice tea or Thai ice coffee.  There are supposedly some "secret" dishes that are true Thai delicacies, so perhaps when I'm feeling bold I will ask for them.  I have ordered once for takeout once, but for the full experience please dine in and you will really like it here.

38.description: Very tasty food, reasonably priced, great service and comfortable ambiance - this restaurant has it all.  The food here may be the best thai in Chicago.  Also big enough for parties.  Will definitely be back!

51.description: I am an active member in my community. This establishment is long overdue and will probably provide a great stimulus to our community. Where else can you get EXCELLENT Thai cuisine and have free off-street parking, and is BYOB (for now)? Be among the first. You will probably love it.

27.description: I have been waiting to check this place out and finally had lunch today. The food was very good, but I felt it was overpriced for Thai cuisine in Chicago.I started withe the appetizer platter, which is probably meant for two.The bites were small and I had no problem polishing it off. You will see the portion size in my picture. I had the Masaman Curry Beef. Great flavor, missing some heat.I took half of that home, it was a decent portion.All and all, $30 with tax and tip. I felt it was good, not worth the price tag.They do have a lunch special, but I wanted to try more things.

32.description: I saw an article written about this place and decided to try it out. I love Thai food and have been to Bangkok and had the authentic food. I knew  the chief was Arun and expected to be something really good. Started off with the deluxe platter as an appetitive. It's a little taste of everything, crab Rangoon, larb moo tord, pot stickers and crispy taro roll. All was excellent. Very fresh and tasty. I love basil beef so I decided to try theirs. I have to say their basil beef was excellent. The flavors were simple and not a lot of gravy that sometimes I think has too much salt. Very, very fresh. My husband had the chicken masamancurry. Very good. Sweet and hot at the same time. Service was good. We went for late lunch to avoid any crowds. Plenty of seats around and great for large groups too. There are several rooms that could accommodate small to large groups of people. Staff were friendly but some could be a little more knowledgable about the dishes on the menu, like hotness. I was told to try Arun's specials. He makes them daily but does change the specials out dependent on the season. Would highly recommend this place especially if you like Thai food. The price might be a little pricier than some Thai food restaurant but I think the food is fresher and the taste proves it.

48.description: Very good and very clean. Staff was super friendly. We both Pad See Ewe, it was very good.

44.description: I wasn't sure what to expect when I parked and walked in. There were no other cars in the lot, but I was glad to see a brightly lit, contemporary dining room with couple of large parties during the lunch hour. The front-of-house staff was immediately attentive and warm. I had the shumai and phad see-ewe. Both were delicious and incredibly fresh tasting. The noodles were a little toasted from the stir fry, well seasoned. I think they could've used a little more spice, so I'll ask next time. So glad to see this place finally opened up - it's my new favorite Thai.

24.description: Chicago magazine rated this restaurant in The Hot List, top 10 places people talking about and dining at. I decided to go there with my 4some after our golf game. We ordered their special in the menu called Shabu Shabu or Thai style Hot Pot where I ordered seafood and my friends tried Beef and Lamb. This is not your typical Thai restaurant. Tom yum soup based seafood Shabu Shabu is my recommendations. I remembered I only had it once in Thailand. The chef here is really very creative, you really need to know how to order and willing to try new things in order to experience this Hot place as recommended by Chicago magazine. The server seen not very family with the special menu yet because she did not tell us about it. The ambient is beautiful decorated. I loved the most is the White Brick Wall from the original Chicago Police Station. This beautiful place really changed the entired neighborhood. Well done, Ciy of Chicago on the street scape!

7.description: I have been waiting to check this place out and finally had lunch today. The food was very good, but I felt it was overpriced for Thai cuisine in Chicago.I started withe the appetizer platter, which is probably meant for two.The bites were small and I had no problem polishing it off. You will see the portion size in my picture. I had the Masaman Curry Beef. Great flavor, missing some heat.I took half of that home, it was a decent portion.All and all, $30 with tax and tip. I felt it was good, not worth the price tag.They do have a lunch special, but I wanted to try more things.

49.description: Wasn't sure what to expect. Got there 15 min before the kitchen was closing but we never felt rushed. Bright clean place. The menu has all of the faves of any neighborhood Thai restaurant (pad thai, curries, fried rice, etc) plus a few delicious sounding additions. Started with the beef salad - I typically enjoy beef salad at most places but this one was amazing! Just so fresh and the portion was a good size to share. We also got the green curry, which is also another favorite of mine in general. Again, it was excellent - i never had fish balls with egg in the middle but now I'll want it in all my green curries! And finally, we got a noodle soup with seafood which was also very flavorful - reminded me of tom yum soup but more delicate and elevated. That's basically what all of the dishes here were - familiar dishes elevated to the next level and more delicate (never had that greasy feeling at all) without losing any of the flavor. Will def be back!

40.description: Great spring rolls and basil beef.  Neighborhood is totally changing for the better with all of the street improvements along Montrose and Pulaski.  This is just one of the new restaurants in the area.  So exciting!

53.description: Food tastes great but if you're someone that couldn't eat spicy food you should let the workers know so they can accommodate you :)Also, outside the restaurant is a god statue where it is known as the Four-Faced Buddha where you can pray to it .

30.description: Found out this new Thai restaurant just opened recently so decided to check it out one evening after work. Ordered the crab Rangoon and fried taro rolls for appetizers. Both were very flavorful and delicious. For the main dish we ordered the phad kee Mao and the chicken phad Thai. These were also very good. The place was clean and service was good. Will come back again to try out other Thai dishes.

46.description: Tried this place out today with a few friends.  Had the Khao Ka Moo (pork knuckle with rice) and the Pandan Mango Sticky Rice.  The flavors for these two dishes were exactly as my mom and grandma used to make them.  The service is second to none and the food is also reasonably priced.  I will definitely go back there for another meal soon!

1.description: This place is in a former police station which is pretty cool in and of itself. Glad to know Emanuels closing of local police stations didn't just leave them vacant. The following was from a take out order. The people were all very nice. The wings have a good sauce with a little heat. The skin is soft though which isn't my preference. The tom yum river prawn broth is delicious. I ordered it extra spicy and it wasn't really but maybe that's because I'm white. There were two good sized prawns, two halves of a cherry tomato and plenty of mushrooms and onion. Finally the phad kee mao. I got it with pad thai noodles which I prefer and it peppery and delicious though the noodles stick together a bit making for unintended projectiles as a bite broke free from the mass. I'm looking forward to going back for others things. Going with four stars for now even though as I type this the wings are in the oven.

9.description: Heard this was one of the hot new places to try so I went lol. We started with the shrimp rolls and grilled scallop tapas style. Both were good. Shrimp rolls were also filled with crab meat for a different taste. Scallop was grilled nicely and the sauce had a nice sweet taste to it. We also ordered the fiery chicken wings. I was kind of disappointed in those since it was not as crispy and I thought they would be. We also had a beef salad which had a very nice dressing on it. Our entrees were Thai fried rice with a fried egg on top. Fried rice had good flavor. Also we ordered the garlic river prawns. That dish was a winner. Flavor was great. The only problem I can see is that they seem kind of confused with the hostess and wait staff. Service got better through the night but the start, like seating and order taking took a while. Other then that we enjoyed our dinner.

26.description: If I could go lower I would! I love Thai Food, I was hoping for a winner.... Arg :(Crab Rangoon left me spitting out the second bite. Fried rice was at best a hint of grease, a couple kernels of corn and some tough pork mixed into white rice. I specifically asked about the basil Thai and was given nothing even remotely what we discussed. Prices are way out of whack for the product delivered.Sorry Folks, not even a kudos for trying.

25.description: I love this place. Plain and simple. My mother, who is straight from Thailand, says that this place has some of the most authentic and best tasting food. The Phad Thai even tastes as if it was made in Thailand! And the for someone who has never enjoyed fried rice, this place has some of the best I've  ever had, and with a nice variety of styles as well Everything is of the best quality, and truly reflects the owner's, Arun's, cooking. And at an amazing price! I wish I could eat here every night!

12.description: Food tastes great but if you're someone that couldn't eat spicy food you should let the workers know so they can accommodate you :)Also, outside the restaurant is a god statue where it is known as the Four-Faced Buddha where you can pray to it .

and you will really like it here.

17.description: Order from her three times,a week....this,is,the best Thai,food in Chicago,hands down!  Tom the manager is very accommodating...the carryOut is exceptional.....everything on the menu is top notch! Trust me..I am a Thai foodie....The only place to.order your Thai,food..spotless too!

10.description: Party of 20???  What???  Family dinner for August birthdays.  Converted a police station into a very cute little BYOB Thai place!  I'd eat in this kind of jail anytime!!  Ordered almost everything off the menu but didn't get to taste as much as I wanted.  Def deserves another trip back into the city.  Next time maybe with less than 20 people Crispy pot stickers were a BIG hit with the kids.  To bad they were SO SMALL.  Size of a date.  Bite size, for my 4 yr old... 5.description: Delicious, very fresh food. Excellent service and pleasant ambiance. Loved the scallop appetizer.

3.description: Taste of Thai Town is a gem on Pulaski,  the crab rangoon is the best off all the places I have ever been . The soup here is even better than anything on Argyle, I have been here numerous times and every time I come here I try something different . The green curry is phenomenal so are the Vietnamese sandwiches which are the best anywhere .

35.description: I'm going to start with what was amazing:  the Tom Kha soup.  What was just ok was the Crab Rangoon.Less than desirable was the Pad Thai.I'll be back for the soup for sure, but will probably not dine in as I was one of 3 tables that had to ask for service!!  I hope they work this out because having another restaurant in our neighborhood is critical!

19.description: Every time I go here, I think: I want to live here. Everything is beyond amazing. Newsflash!! They are No longer BYOB. The Service, I really like. Portage Park is lucky for this gem.

28.description: Heard this was one of the hot new places to try so I went lol. We started with the shrimp rolls and grilled scallop tapas style. Both were good. Shrimp rolls were also filled with crab meat for a different taste. Scallop was grilled nicely and the sauce had a nice sweet taste to it. We also ordered the fiery chicken wings. I was kind of disappointed in those since it was not as crispy and I thought they would be. We also had a beef salad which had a very nice dressing on it. Our entrees were Thai fried rice with a fried egg on top. Fried rice had good flavor. Also we ordered the garlic river prawns. That dish was a winner. Flavor was great. The only problem I can see is that they seem kind of confused with the hostess and wait staff. Service got better through the night but the start, like seating and order taking took a while. Other then that we enjoyed our dinner.

45.description: In what was once the 17th District Police Station, this building has undergone a complete transformation. The inside was clean and cheerful. The waitstaff was attentive and friendly. I had Pad See Ew, and it had a lot of flavor without being spicy.The prices were affordable and there was plenty of off street and on street parking available.Overall, I highly recommend it!

33.description: Food is so good, very friendly service , I love  toed mon-pla very delicious and pad see-ewe thai style same as Thailand. Start from Monday 24, 2015 I got tell from Mgr that they have a Liqour license sorry about the people that drink you can not bring your wine no more, congratulations for their license.

43.description: Not familiar with the neighborhood but it seems like a great place to dine. The decor inside is pretty hip and has good brightness. I love how they had a display of China and decor. I do have to say that I was happy to hear some Thai in the restaurant and a friendly boss who kept everyone accommodated. However I was not that excited about the food since the nest that was on the plate of wings were not fresh (lost its crisp). The wings were delectable and well accompanied by the sriracha sauce. I was baffled by the pad Thai that was also ordered since it was really wet and most of the strands of noodles are broken. The dish was made with ketchup and other seasonings. This was the least of my favorite due to the texture of the noodles and authenticity. My favorite dish was definitely the green curry sauce it has a delicious hint of coconut to it though lacks the melding of the flavor from the vegetables added (eggplant and green peppers). I do have to add that the menu really made me interested in coming back :). Aside from this, the statue (phra phrom) is worth a visit. Don't forget to pay your respects to the God~ Another perk that made this location worthwhile is the parking lot. :) good accommodation here and easily accessible for commuters via CTA

2.description: Tastes very authentic Thai. The portions are generous, minus all the decorative accents. We ordered pad Thai is was delicious! Also, the green curry is good too! Lots of meat and the soup was good

18.description: Wasn't sure what to expect. Got there 15 min before the kitchen was closing but we never felt rushed. Bright clean place. The menu has all of the faves of any neighborhood Thai restaurant (pad thai, curries, fried rice, etc) plus a few delicious sounding additions. Started with the beef salad - I typically enjoy beef salad at most places but this one was amazing! Just so fresh and the portion was a good size to share. We also got the green curry, which is also another favorite of mine in general. Again, it was excellent - i never had fish balls with egg in the middle but now I'll want it in all my green curries! And finally, we got a noodle soup with seafood which was also very flavorful - reminded me of tom yum soup but more delicate and elevated. That's basically what all of the dishes here were - familiar dishes elevated to the next level and more delicate (never had that greasy feeling at all) without losing any of the flavor. Will def be back!

41.description: Way over rated for a restaraunt owned by Arun. Service was poor air conditioning was weak and the food was nothing great. There was something wrong with our tom yum soup and i told the server who took it away and said he would notify the kitchen. then later when the bill came it was still on and the manager came by and rudely said you should have told me about it and I said I told your staff about it. Overall for all the hype nothing out of the ordinary in terms of taste, portions, or service. Many other local thai restaraunts do better.

52.description: Amazing!!!  Two chicken pad Thai and crab Rangoon for $25.00.  Crab Rangoon was probably the best I've had and the Pad Thai was excellent.  Welcome to the neighborhood. Can't wait to go back.

50.description: Arun's has always been among the finest of chefs. This location makes it possible to experience his food at affordable prices. You should go to this new destination and let your kids experience the food and the Thai community. We will still go to Aruns for special occasions.... But this can be a weekly opportunity. So glad he did this... We should support it.

4.description: Very good Thai place with an affordable lunch menu. For only $6.95, you can get three courses. An appetizer, a super salad, and an entrée. Entrées vary by day of the week but offer a wide selection from Currys to noodles.  We tried the seaweed salad along with the basil fried rice with tofu and chicken pot see yu. We enjoyed both very much and the service was good.  Decour is also quite nice and can accommodate large groups. They even have outdoor seating. Will definitely come again for dinner.

6.description: My husband and I were so excited to try this restaurant that took forever to build. We finally went tonight. Apparently this restaurant was recently on Chicago's best. Well, far from it!  We started out by ordering 2 glasses of Pinot Grigio. The waiter said they were out of that wine.  Ok...?  We ordered Chardonnay instead. Next my husband ordered the seafood salad for an appetizer. Nope, they were out of that too.  Ok..? I got the summer roll and split that with him. It was very good. Next I ordered the massaman curry, he ordered the giant soup bowl- but the waiter said good thing we ordered when we did because we got the last ones of each. Seriously? Lastly we ordered the mango dessert, and guess what? They were out of that! So needless to say, we won't be back. The waiter explained they had a big party over the weekend so they ran out of things.  So the chef didn't think it might be a good idea to go shopping yesterday or today?  Too bad, lots of other places to try. They are fired.

22.description: I was wondering what had become of the police station that stood hear years ago. Much to my surprise a Thai restaurant now stood here. I decided to give it a try a couple of days ago. I was pleasantly surprised. The interior was beautiful, bright colors and stunning artwork adorned the walls. The staff was courteous. The lunch menu was full of choices, so after going back and forth with my choice, I settled on an entree I have not seen outside of Bangkok. First though came a nice seaweed soup and a great version of a fresh vegetable spring roll. The entree soon followed and I was transported back to the streets of Bangkok with every bite. I will be back again, next time with more people so we can try dining family style and share a wider range of dishes.

15.description: This is our new go-to Thai place. The service has always been friendly and attentive. We go every few weeks. Everything we have tried over the last few months has been delicious but favorites include the Pad Woon Sen and Green Curry. Plus it's BYOB! What more can you want?

20.description: This is the closest Thai joint to our house so great for a quick fix.  We've been there about 6-7 times and they just opened a couple of months ago.  We've only done take out so far but the place looks lovely inside, you'd never know it was a former police station.  It is a bit on the pricey side for the portion size, but the quality is very good and the people who work there are very very nice (they gave me a glass of ice water while I waited once when I had walked over on a hot day).

36.description: Every time I go here, I think: I want to live here. Everything is beyond amazing. Newsflash!! They are No longer BYOB. The Service, I really like. Portage Park is lucky for this gem.

14.description: What a great Thai place! Thanks to Chicago's Best for the recommendation. We started with the Fresh Summer Rolls which were tasty and fresh.  We tried the Yum Woon Sen salad which was delicious and had a kick to it.  Our main entrees were Phad See-Ewe and Green Curry Pla-Krai both did not disappoint.  We had dinner with another family and we all agreed we would return.  I was a little disappointed for I was told they were out of the seaweed salad on the specials list as well as the sweet mango with pandan sticky rice.  Maybe next time....

12.description: Great buying experience at Galaxy Furniture.    Reasonably priced and a great selection.  Mike, the Sales Manager, was very helpful.  No high pressure but very knowledgeable about the different choices.  Definitely recommend checking out Galaxy.

7.description: Had a perfectly OK experience with this place. Went in twice, once to scout and once to buy. Bought a couch, good price.However, the salespeople need some work on giving exact information. We were told that some pieces were easy to assemble by hand, which was not the case. Also, the delivery times, while not promised to us, were constantly moving forward. We still got it within a week or so, so it was annoying, but it still worked out.Fine place for new furniture when it's close-by, but I probably won't return.

3.description: If I could give a negative star I would. The furniture is poorly made and the customer service was awful and not to mention I'm still missing pieces from what I over paid for. Just avoid at all costs, and trust me it will cost you a lot. I wish I would have bought used furniture on Craigslist.

1.description: I was fortunate  to do some researching via Yelp & other sites & came across Galaxy Furniture , I seen great reviews &  several comments on Omar. Well I called & spoke directly to  him & I have to state this man is THE MAN, he is professional, Resourceful & overall the Essential Trusting Salesman. I dont know his title there but he should be the owner cause he is knowledgable and came through on everything he said he would do. He found me coupons, sales & better deals than were listed. All in all I am 110% completely  satisfied & will be back thanks to your very Personable OmarTY... NATALIE MARTINEZ

2.description: I had been looking everywhere for a matching lamp set that would go with my new house. I couldn't find it anywhere but I finally found it online from Galaxy Furniture. I called the store and the people there were very professional and nice. I bought the lamp set and it was shipped to me a few days later. Great selection, great prices and great customer service.

9.description: This place is so unprofessional. They lie and give you a run around and have absolutely no customer service etiquette. They suck!!! I am waiting on a credit for 2 months and a repair for new furniture I bough that they are refusing to take back. They are full of it and I am going to report all of this to the BBB.  Please look up this business thoroughly or just go to Mikes!!! That's what I should have done!!!!! Now I am stuck trying to get something from people who have no clue how to transact business or retain repeat business.  I had to give them a rating if not they get no stars!!!!!I am sure they posted their own reviews because they are grimy like that!!!!!

10.description: Great customer service and great selection. When it comes to furniture and appliance stores these guys are the best. Omar and mike are gonna take care of you at its best. I will definitely go back.

13.description: I had a great experience dealing with Galaxy Furniture on Montrose... I ordered online and received my furniture on time and in great condition. Everyone was extremely helpful and courteous, including the delivery crew that lugged my love seat, table, and chair up to my apartment on the top floor of my building. Maria helped me obtain the financing I needed to get the items I wanted--a true professional! She followed up to make sure I was completely satisfied , and I truly appreciated that. The entire staff is awesome at this place! The only issue I had was that they did not open on one day that I wanted to come in and pick out a rug, but it was during the recent blizzard, so it's completely understandable. I will definitely be shopping there again, they have a great collection of classic and contemporary designs, good prices and, as mentioned earlier, a great and professional staff. Five stars all day!

16.description: Hello!!! Drove by this furniture store that just open was just planning on taking a look, but ended up buying a bed frame and mattress set!! Felt so comfortable with the people there not aggressive at all and found something at a reasonable price!! Told them the date I wanted it deliver and the time and that's exactly what i got! As promise my bed was deliver on time and with a great service!!! Strongly recommend Galaxy Furniture!!!

17.description: I can't believe the prices!!!  AND...Ashley Furniture???  Wow!  They were so helpful with every annoying question I had.  I'm very picky about certain things, but they were extremely patient with me and really gave me the time.  I added the coffee table and end tables because it was truly a great deal.  I know at other furniture places, there's no way I would've received the same price.  I love bargains especially on great quality.

15.description: So, I just moved in to a newer/bigger apartment, so I figured I needed new furniture. I went to a well known furniture store in chicago, saw something I really liked but the price was just ridiculous. Luckily I brought my sister with me, because she talked me into going to Galaxy Furniture. At first I was a little skeptical because I've never heard of them, because I always thought if you needed furniture, you had to go to the big guys. NOT ANYMORE FELLOW YELPERS!!!! (Or is it yelpians?) I bought a sectional from Galaxy for a very small fraction of what I was going to pay elsewhere. And the funny thing was it was the exact same "Ashley" sectional I was looking at before. Put it this way, I bought a whole living room set, dining table, two area rugs, a runner rug for my hallway, and a very nice painting for the same price that I would've paid at the other place.       The staff was very helpful with choosing colors of rugs that would accommodate my taste and colors. They weren't pushy, they took their time with me and even helped me get the best financing deal available. Oh!!!!! And the coffee they had was DELISH. Delivery was on time and my place looks great. Definitely going to recommend Galaxy Furniture to all of my pals and gals.

0.description: I had a WONDERFUL shopping  experience at Galaxy Furniture in Chicago. Brittany and Omar were so helpful and polite as I searched for the perfect Couch. They provided all the specifics I needed to know about the merchandise. The showroom is filled with GORGEOUS pieces. I saw many sofas I liked and luckily the customer service reps helped me narrow down my search. Just a few things i want to mention that make this furniture store stand out. - first it's the credit and financing options they make available to EVERYONE. Yup, EVERYONE! I No credit, bad credit, they got you covered. - the owner is AWESOME!  Ask for Omar, he's great. - Super fast delivery -great service from the floor reps to the delivery guys. -GREAT PRICESI highly recommend Galaxy Furniture.

5.description: I  was visiting my boyfriends family and walked by Galaxy Furniture. I found a nice lamp set, that I've been looking for to go with my new home. Perfect lamps and nice service.

11.description: Really great quality furniture and good prices. It was difficult deciding on a couch since they are all so beautiful but Omar worked with my husband and I, going above and beyond to make sure we would get something we will love for years to come. He doesn't push customers into buying anything, no pressure that makes you feel comfortable. He even offers to let you go home, think about it and call him to order your furniture without having to go back into the store. Excellent service, will definitely come here again!

8.description: Maria and Omar saved me from an air mattress with several holes. I dreaded going to bed on that thing. I needed an inexpensive yet comfortable bed. These two fabulous folks made it happen and got it delivered quickly. I'm so happy I went in and spoke with Maria. They had a nice selection,  they really listened to me. They didn't try to sell me  anything. Yet they were complete professionals. I'm so excited about this bed.

4.description: I bought a sofa here and it is JUST PERFECT! I've been looking everywhere for a cushy leather sofa that doesn't look old and tacky for our game room. I saw it right away when I walked into Galaxy Furniture, the light tan color was exactly what I pictured. Maria was so nice and helped us sign all the documents and get the couch delivered, and we were out of there in under an hour. The couch fits so well into our home decor and I couldn't be happier with Galaxy's service and selection.

14.description: this place sucks! don't waste your time shopping here. they sell overpriced cheap furniture. i purchased a bedroom set (bed, headboard and dresser/mirror). my bed railings broke 1 week after delivery and my dresser drawer came apart. i called maria to let her know my bed broke and she sent out  the same cheap railings (on top of me having to pay for delivery). i truly regret purchasing from this store. stay away!!

6.description: Absolutely CRAZY for the couch I just bought from Galaxy Furn. My credit sucks and they were still able to give me great financing and a decent deal. Helpful guys and nice shopping atmosphere. Best part about it is the quality for the price, I visited a bunch of furniture stores but the prices here were by far the most reasonable.

3.description: I went to Woofer because it is in my neighborhood. I was looking to get my 1993 Acura Legend's radio replaced. I walked in and was served right away. The man helping me showed me all of the different models. I told him that I wasn't looking for something expensive. He showed me a model that was priced at $120 and immediately told me that he'd give it to me for $100 plus $50 installation. He installed it right away. It took less than an hour. It came with a 90 day guarantee and a one year manufactures warranty. Kmart is right across the street and there is a great Mexican restaurant next-door to kill time while you wait! I'm recommending this place to everyone.

1.description: I have been searching for a place to install my amp and sub so I called around and they were a little bit less than the competition so I decided to try them out since they are in the area and I didn't have to drive far especially through the rain and snow. I told them what I wanted done and they said they could get it done in about an hour which they did. I just wanted a little bass added to my truck and once they were done they adjusted the system and I was on my way. They told me if i had any concerns to call or comeback. If you are looking for a car stereo place that is not too busy that can do what you want the same day. Give them a call. When you call the number listed here, ask for the retail shop number because they do wholesale and provide for the shops in the area.

2.description: Super friendly staff..  Nice showroom.   Great installation team.  Edgar Is the best!!!

0.description: Really awesome place. I had purchased a car receiver online and searched around for a place to install it. After scouring the internet and calling around, I decided Woofer was worth a shot. Jay was more than accommodating throughout the process, and the installation was done quickly, cleanly, professionally, and (most importantly) with great care and customer service, all in about 45 minutes. I will be returning for any other car stereo needs in the future! Zero complaints.

29.description: I have been here three times since Rojo opened. The beachy renovations are a revelation for the neighborhood, classy without being super fancy. Delectable flavors at a great price point. I'm a vegetarian and have really enjoyed all the veg options. Like all the theme nights, too. Also, bathrooms are clean and cute!

42.description: This place was a refreshing surprise to our neighborhood. I'm not a big fan of brunch in general, but it really doesn't exist in our neighborhood, until now! My dad is in town, he had chilequellas, delicious! Steak was super tender (everything is organic!). I had squash tacos, steak tacos, and chicken - loved the squash, tortillas were homemade. My hubby had a huevo sandwich with eggs, bacon, pibil (pull pork) not sure what else, but he loved it! We will be back soon :)

23.description: I loved the tacos!  The tortillas were hand-made, the ingredients tasted fresh, and the flavors were delicious.  From the brunch menu I had the chicken verde taco, the arrachera (skirt steak) taco, and the charred butternut squash taco, each $2.50.  These were _good_ tacos, with flavors that remained on my palate and make me want to go back, as I write this now.  I'm picky about my tacos, having lived for some years in Mexico City, and would classify these as gourmet tacos.We were there Sunday at noon, and sat in the sun near another couple, who have already been multiple times.  Apparently the dinner menu is not available until  after 3, but the chef accommodated my request for a couple of portobello empanadas, with Argentine chumichurri sauce.I was hungry, so the 3 tacos and 2 empanadas were about the right quantity for a meal.  They've only been open a month, so seemingly some of the hours/pricing/specials are still in flux.  In a perfect world we would have had some chips at the table, as we often expect at Mexican restaurants.  See their menus on their web site at:  rojogusano.comWe look forward to going back, soon, with friends!  Outstanding!

47.description: They have a fantastic brunch menu, along with their delicious dinner menu - awesome to have them in the neighborhood!

8.description: Love this place ! Feel like I'm in a very trendy part of town here . The tacos are delicious . The guacamole is flavorful & buttery. The drinks are so very yummy & well made . The service is spectacular . I'll definitely be recommending it to all of my friends & coming back myself .

31.description: Margarita/tequila heaven! The previous restaurant here was mediocre. So when they started remodeling this place I was surprised to see how nice and modern the place was coming along.  When we went the staff was very friendly and attentive, we even got a guacamole on the house! To start off they had three different kinds of guacamole, all very tasty!! We had the empanadas and the mixture in it was to the say the least mouth watering and full of deliciousness. The tacos are great, good size and very tasty!! The cocktails they mix are good, however they are a little on the smaller size. They could use bigger glasses, but the price for them is A-ok!! Overall great service, delicious food, and drinks are well served.

34.description: Can't say enough about the great service and even better food!! My sister and I were greeted by Rafa and were made to feel at home. She had the pork shank rice bowl and I had 4 tacos..all very good. We ended the dinner with the chocolate tamal..delicious!! Our server, Amaris, was very attentive and knowledgable about the menu. Great staff!! We definitely will recommend to our friends!!

16.description: We tried out rojo Gusano on a Friday night. We live in the neighborhood and are excited to find all these new places popping up, went around 8 pm not a lot of tables maybe 4 or 5. They were offering a free guac so we tried out the Serrano one. It was pretty yummy. We then ordered the steak, chicken verde and shrimp tacos along with a side of the corn. I was impressed. The steak was really good. Next time I go back I will order just steak. It was so good. The chicken as well. Not a fan of the shrimp taco it was extremely bland. The corn was served elote style so you can't go wrong there. The decor was pretty cool. Kinda reminded me of a so cal taco shop. We also had the margaritas which were great. Give this place a try. They are just starting out...I really think there is potential here!

13.description: Along with (the also excellent) T&B Grill, this place is a great addition to the Lawrence Ave. stretch of the Albany Park eating scene, which currently boasts the most diverse concentration of restaurants in the city. Rojo Gusano is diverse in its own right -craft but unostentatious taqueria fare and chopsticks at each table for Asian-inspired rice bowl offerings, reflecting the demographic mix of the neighborhood.Full bar set up with a good beer/liquor/cocktail list (lots of small batch offerings, unusual if not unique in this mostly Budweiser or BYOB district), inventive chip/salsa/guacamole offerings and a functioning garage door for open air dining during the six or eight weeks that's possible in Chicago. Wednesday nights are being promoted as Cult Movie Night, with free popcorn and drink specials to go along with the selection of the week (we were told it was The Warriors this week, not an inappropriate choice for the area).  Very friendly staff and super affordable.

11.description: So happy to have these folks in the neighborhood!My roommate took me out for a birthday dinner tonight.  I was a bit too hungover to enjoy any of the cocktails or mezcals, but their list is wonderful.  We ordered an embarrassing amount of food, but I'm so glad we did.  The guacamole with habanero is so fresh and flavorful, and the perfect kind of heat.  The corn on the cob was so huge and piping hot, with so much tasty cotija cheese that I couldn't shovel it into my face fast enough.  The ceviche was also great - the octopus and shrimp were delicious.  And the tacos!  I had a short rib, steak, and green curry shrimp taco, all of them were total knockouts.  The short rib was cooked perfectly.  The green curry shrimp taco was strange, but in the best kind of way.  And I could eat 100 of those steak tacos.  Outstanding.  We also had all of their salsas, and the habanero one was again my favorite - such an awesome amount of spice and acid.  When our server found out it was my birthday, she brought out a chocolate tamale.  Oh man.  It was the perfect little bundle of moist, delicious chocolate cake inside the husk, with ice cream and raspberry sauce, peanuts, and fresh strawberries.  I couldn't eat it fast enough.The service at this place is A+.  Our server gave us her name, but I'm terrible at remembering things.  She was on top of her game, funny, and made sure we were totally taken care of.  We were also visited by someone I would assume is an owner or manager, and he was delightful!  He even brought me a sample cocktail, the Mezcalada, which he promised would help with the hangover (it was delicious, refreshing, and I'm still alive so that's good).  You can tell these are people that want to take care of their guests and they did just that for us.  The specials during the week look great, they have brunch, and the place is fun and very cute.  I can't wait to go back, eat more tacos, try one of the rice bowls, and drink lots of things.Thanks for making this hungover broad's birthday dinner a total success!

39.description: What a great new choice for dinner! Terrific vibe great music interesting drinks attentive staff and a unique menu.  Our group of 5 hit $2 taco night so we ordered margaritas, multiple guacamoles,  rice bowls, drunken beans, sopes, and all the tacos. Rafael dropped by with free shots of Mezcal and the chef checked in to ensure we were happy....which we definitely were!!! The servers need a little more experience explaining the menu but that will come. We all want to return and add this to our supper club rotation.  Easy online reservations make it easy. Check em out

37.description: Best option in Albany park! Best tacos and cocktails in town! The tequilas and mezcales are the most exquisite on the bar. If you haven't been here and you live in or close of Albany park what are you waiting for? Lol cool place to chill and the patio for the summer it's gonna be a boom!

0.description: this place is a nice addition to the neighborhood.been there twice, good experience both times.my very picky 3 y.o.  daughter ate almost a whole serving of rice and beans, and my wife who has high standards loves the beans. my 7 month old son was gnawing at the cornwe have tried around 5 different tacos and all were goodinteresting cocktail choices and mezcal / tequila selection.several specials with deep discounts throughout the week ($2 taco nights, 40% off nights, etc)looking forward to their open patio in summer

38.description: Trying my best to love this place bc it's close and they have good food but I've had problems since day one. Called and placed a order to only arrive and they were closed???!! Still wondering why my order was taken. Got lied on by one of the girls there about it also. Now this is the 4th time I've called to place a order, the line is busy (within a 2 week span) today I'm currently calling now and on my 7th call to see if the line gets free and it's not. like wtf!!!!!

27.description: Really love this place! My boyfriend lives a few blocks away so we've been here twice and enjoyed both times. The service is always perfect, the mojitos are great and so is the tequila. But I definitely love the guacamole the best. I've had 2 out of 3 and they were both delicious. We really liked the rice bowls and tacos, too. Tacos were small but they're $2 on Tuesdays so definitely worth it. We will be back often for sure!

32.description: Went here a few days ago followed by a recommendation from my neighbor who said they added tacos slightly similar to the ones from T&B Grill. I tried the chicken verde and steak tacos which were the best; however the butternut squash and shrimp  tacos were bland. A little bit more flavor would be recommended. The service is okay, but I know as time goes by, they'll hopefully improve. I would just recommend the chicken verde and steak tacos and give the brunch a menu a try!

48.description: They just opened this place and I think I love this place already. And it's so convenient because my apartment is a few buildings down! Amazing food, drinks, and specials- Not to mention, a very friendly and welcoming atmosphere.We went in and were told the Guacamole will be free and we got charged for it.. Which I ended up not disputing because it was delicious! I believe we got the Fiery Habanero which they recommended because we wanted something on the spicier side. Def. need to try the rest! (Bartender/Host were very attentive)They had a special of a shot+Corona beer+taco=$10 (Had that and added an extra taco)Their tacos are served on hand made AUTHENTIC tortillas! Which is awesome given the fact that nicer Mexican places don't do that anymore :(Only down side was that one of my tacos was a little cold.. And that was only mine. My sister's was perfect. I had the Chicken Verde & Arrachera.. SO YUMMY!Seriously recommend people to give this place a shot! So good & affordable. Can't wait to go back and try more. !!

44.description: We saw the write up in Chicago Mag and realized this place is right around the corner from us. And we happened to come on Taco Tuesday! That means every taco is $2. In short, the food is excellent. I have nothing to complain about (unlike the girls next to us whose order got mixed up and were so ungraceful about it). We were immediately greeted with 2 delicious shots of mezcal on the house. After that, we decided to start with 2 different kinds of guacamole, habanero/radish/mango and Serrano pico de gallo. They set the bar high with their guacamole, the best I've ever had. We got pretty much every taco available. They were all really good, the attention to detail was amazing. To make my point, they make their own tortillas. My boyfriend's favorite was the braised short rib while I couldn't decide on a favorite. We also got the butternut squash rice bowl, which (surprise) was also delicious. I really recommend ordering salsa right when sitting down to eat to put on everything. For dessert, I got the chocolate tamale with vanilla ice cream. That was a really fun take on warm chocolate cake with ice cream. We will definitely be coming back! It's clear that the chef has an exquisite palate.

24.description: As a taco fanatic, I was glad to see a new option in the neighborhood. Overall the experience was good here, though I'd probably try something different than tacos next time. While ambitious, the tacos are tiny, served on single 4-5" tortillas. Good for a bite, not really a meal. Precious taco syndrome is real, people... See also Big Star and Takito Kitchen. My preference for tacos are Dos Michoacanos and T&B Grill nearby.Rojo Gusano's vibe is friendly and welcoming, the staff was enthusiastic and willing to chat about chicken-infused mezcal, Mexican mixed meat specialties, among other things. The space is nicely done, with interesting art, exposed brick and a garage door that opens onto the street. There is a bar, though the bar stools were sort of uncomfortable. Food wise, the chorizo taco was 2/3 potato and crema sadly. Short rib taco was ok. Guacamole with pepitas was good. Interesting menu that I'd return to try different things. Excited they have a brunch option. Mezcalada cocktail was tasty. Glad they're in the neighborhood.

7.description: Amazing tacos. The steak tacos were intergalactic, way outside of the milky way...kind of like chef Dudley! Awesome restaurant

49.description: Wonderful new establishment in Albany Park. All meat is local organic. The signature drink was Mezcalada and it was delicious. Luis was great in explaining the menu and philosophy of restaurant. The decor was a natural welcoming west coast type of feel. The guacamole was amazing, several different ways they can make it, we chose ours with spicy pumpkin seeds. I'm so thrilled to have this type of restaurant in our neighborhood. During summer they will have outside seating.

40.description: We tried out rojo Gusano on a Friday night. We live in the neighborhood and are excited to find all these new places popping up, went around 8 pm not a lot of tables maybe 4 or 5. They were offering a free guac so we tried out the Serrano one. It was pretty yummy. We then ordered the steak, chicken verde and shrimp tacos along with a side of the corn. I was impressed. The steak was really good. Next time I go back I will order just steak. It was so good. The chicken as well. Not a fan of the shrimp taco it was extremely bland. The corn was served elote style so you can't go wrong there. The decor was pretty cool. Kinda reminded me of a so cal taco shop. We also had the margaritas which were great. Give this place a try. They are just starting out...I really think there is potential here!

30.description: Friendly, gracious service. Creative cocktails with some delicious twists on Mexican favorites. The michelada is undeniable. Food was very tasty. One dish was not prepared as expected. It was re-made with apologies and genuine concern. Prices are very fair. A great experience!!!

46.description: Tried the chorizo and arrachera tacos and they were pretty good!  Staff are extremely nice, which always makes a place even better.

1.description: went for $2 taco Tuesday. had the short rib taco, arracherra taco, and fish taco.pros: great tasting tacos with short rib as my favorite. corn tortillas that were fresh and held up. welcoming, open space that seems like it would be great in the summer. cons: smallish tacos. different info on the parking garage next door from two different employees. regular price of $3.50 each is a little expensive for the size of the tacos despite the deliciousness and quality ingredients. felt a little cramped despite all the open space. my jacket was brushed up against every time anyone walked by. I'll be back to explore the rest of the menu and brunch menu looked intriguing.

9.description: Amazing tacos the service is great ! Everyone is so friendly they make you feel so welcome ! The drinks are so good ! Luis and Ama need a raise you need to try the Mexican kiss shot taste like heaven

26.description: Great addition to the area. Food is spectacular. We had the empanadas, tamales, guacamole, chicken taco, steak taco, and chorizo taco. Everything was delish. Service was prompt and friendly. Will definitely make this a new regular in my rotation of restaurants. Inside atmosphere is laid back and cool. Highly recommend this place. Can't wait to try their brunch.The only thing keeping me from a 5 star is the situation with the chips. This place has great guacamole and salsas, however, they only serve a very limited amount of chips.  Between two we probably asked for refills 4 or 5 times. I recommend that they change their chip configuration and provide full bowls. This will make more sense when you go and see for yourself.

25.description: This place was great!  Happy to finally have a good Mexican restaurant in the area.  Drinks and food were good and staff was super attentive.

12.description: I haven't written a Yelp review in years, but I was so pleased with the brunch I had here recently that I had to post this. My wife and I stopped in after hearing good buzz about this place. We arrived early on a cold Sunday afternoon. One table was just getting up to leave and they were praising the staff effusively. We figured that was a good sign, even though we were the only people there when they left.We had a couple cocktails to start--a Mezcalada and a Bloody Gazpacho. Both were great. The Mezcalada was cool and refreshing. The Bloody Gazpacho was a bit on the sweet side, but had a nice spicy kick that saved it from being too sweet.We each ordered an egg sandwich and a taco. I had the Huevos Sandwich because it had cochinita pibil, and I also had a Chicken Verde taco. She had another type of egg sandwich (can't remember the name), and a Charred Butternut Squash taco.The egg sandwiches were both good--the cochinita pibil was rich and plentiful. But the tacos were what just blew us away. I didn't even get to look at my wife's taco because she devoured it so fast. I rarely order chicken tacos, but this was the best chicken taco I've ever had. The tacos are small, but my chicken verde was packed with chicken, and the crema and radish made it eat nice and light even though the flavors were vivid. And the tortillas were freshly made in house.After we finished our food, Chef Nieto came out of the kitchen and introduced himself and asked us about our meal. He took the time to get to know us and was incredibly friendly and personable. He offered us a coffee drink free of charge. It was delicious.I also want to mention how friendly the service was overall. From the moment we opened the door, we were greeted with smiling faces and friendly people. The restaurant is new and looks great. There's a garage door in the front that I suspect will open up in the summer. There are daily specials and they even have a movie night.We can't wait to go back for dinner. Or brunch. I can't remember the last time I left a restaurant wanting to stop people on the street and tell them to eat there, but that's how I felt leaving Rojo Gusano.

21.description: There's a reason why this restaurant had one person in it on a Friday night at 6:00. Me. I placed an order to go and when I brought it home I was livid. I ordered 4 cheese quesadillas, not one quesadilla divided into fourths. My pescado taco was the size of a thumb and extremely over fried. Tasteless. Bland. And best of luck to them because the only thing they have going for them is their nice interior.

17.description: As a taco fanatic, I was glad to see a new option in the neighborhood. Overall the experience was good here, though I'd probably try something different than tacos next time. While ambitious, the tacos are tiny, served on single 4-5" tortillas. Good for a bite, not really a meal. Precious taco syndrome is real, people... See also Big Star and Takito Kitchen. My preference for tacos are Dos Michoacanos and T&B Grill nearby.Rojo Gusano's vibe is friendly and welcoming, the staff was enthusiastic and willing to chat about chicken-infused mezcal, Mexican mixed meat specialties, among other things. The space is nicely done, with interesting art, exposed brick and a garage door that opens onto the street. There is a bar, though the bar stools were sort of uncomfortable. Food wise, the chorizo taco was 2/3 potato and crema sadly. Short rib taco was ok. Guacamole with pepitas was good. Interesting menu that I'd return to try different things. Excited they have a brunch option. Mezcalada cocktail was tasty. Glad they're in the neighborhood.

10.description: Amazing. Had their mezcalita, as well as a Valentine's prix fixe. Got two types of guacamole and salsa, a lobster ceviche, and  four tacos - arrachado, chorizo, pork, and pescado. The most incredible churros for dessert. Loved the ambiance and the service. Can't wait to go back for more mezcal drinks this summer to enjoy the patio space.

5.description: Food: 4.5Ambiance: 4Service: 2Took a group of 12 here to celebrate my cousin's birthday. We were able to get a reservation that night for 8:15 pm and were excited to try this new neighborhood spot. We got there and our table was ready, things looked good. We ordered our drinks, then placed our food orders. We then sat there and waited 30 mins. No drinks. Then our food came out in waves. And still no drinks. Half our table had food, while the other half sat watching. We flagged down numerous waitstaff and communicated the missing food numerous times. Finally the manager came out to assess the missing food items and tried to expedite the orders. We then finally got our drinks. And slowly everyone finally got their food, piecemeal and about 25 mins apart. Not acceptable for half the table to be eating while half sat starving. It seemed like they lost half our food tickets. After everyone had their food, the manager came back out to apologize and offer up complimentary desserts. That was a decent gesture. We ate our dinner, which was very good.Standouts:BeansSweet PlantainsCeviche Tacos: chicken; shrimp; fish; short rib; chorizo ($2.50-$3.50 each)Then we placed our orders for desserts. Chocolate tamals and churros with raspberry and chocolate sauce. Only to be told five minutes later they were all out of tamals except for 1. Churros it was. They brought out the one tamal and four orders of churros and we enjoyed the desserts. Desserts were $7 each and although decent not worth that price point. The manager apologized again for the poor dinner service and we explained how the food was excellent but the service/kitchen timing needed work. He agreed with me and promised to get things to a better place next time we come by. Overall a nice night: yummy food, nice ambiance, but lackluster service. They're very new so I can understand the kinks. I will be back for the food though, and hopefully service improves.

3.description: I had the mushroom taco, curry shrimp and battered fish taco. Tortillas were great! But shrimp and fish lacked flavor. I also had the ceviche which was amazing. The ceviche was My favorite out of everything. Guacamole was very good and fresh as well. I expected the habanero to be spicier but it was enough. The waiter who helped was had a bit of an attitude when explaining things. Service and food was ok. A friendlier staff would be nicer to see.

35.description: I haven't written a Yelp review in years, but I was so pleased with the brunch I had here recently that I had to post this. My wife and I stopped in after hearing good buzz about this place. We arrived early on a cold Sunday afternoon. One table was just getting up to leave and they were praising the staff effusively. We figured that was a good sign, even though we were the only people there when they left.We had a couple cocktails to start--a Mezcalada and a Bloody Gazpacho. Both were great. The Mezcalada was cool and refreshing. The Bloody Gazpacho was a bit on the sweet side, but had a nice spicy kick that saved it from being too sweet.We each ordered an egg sandwich and a taco. I had the Huevos Sandwich because it had cochinita pibil, and I also had a Chicken Verde taco. She had another type of egg sandwich (can't remember the name), and a Charred Butternut Squash taco.The egg sandwiches were both good--the cochinita pibil was rich and plentiful. But the tacos were what just blew us away. I didn't even get to look at my wife's taco because she devoured it so fast. I rarely order chicken tacos, but this was the best chicken taco I've ever had. The tacos are small, but my chicken verde was packed with chicken, and the crema and radish made it eat nice and light even though the flavors were vivid. And the tortillas were freshly made in house.After we finished our food, Chef Nieto came out of the kitchen and introduced himself and asked us about our meal. He took the time to get to know us and was incredibly friendly and personable. He offered us a coffee drink free of charge. It was delicious.I also want to mention how friendly the service was overall. From the moment we opened the door, we were greeted with smiling faces and friendly people. The restaurant is new and looks great. There's a garage door in the front that I suspect will open up in the summer. There are daily specials and they even have a movie night.We can't wait to go back for dinner. Or brunch. I can't remember the last time I left a restaurant wanting to stop people on the street and tell them to eat there, but that's how I felt leaving Rojo Gusano.

19.description: Tried the chorizo and arrachera tacos and they were pretty good!  Staff are extremely nice, which always makes a place even better.

28.description: Rojo Gusano is a top notch addition to Albany Park.  They are enthusiastic and friendly, and the food will keep you coming back.When we arrived the host promptly offered Kelly and I guacamole and a couple shots of mezcal, gratis.  Needless to say, we acquiesced.  I don't know how long such profligacy will last, or if you will be so lucky, but the sooner you get here, the better.The guac was great, fresh and creamy, and the mezcal was tasty and smooth, though I am no expert.  I am an expert on cocktails, however, and they are excellent.  We both had mezcal variants on classic cocktails, and they were delicious.  Sadly, the list of those is not online, so you'll have to visit to find out what they are!On to the food!  We started with the tortilla soup, which is some of the best I've ever had, if not the best.  It has an earthy, smoky, rich quality to it, and packs a lot of heat, but not too much - you have a low level fire in your mouth while eating it, but it is never unbearable.For dinner we had tacos - $2, all varieties, on Tuesday night.  They were all delicious.  Kelly loved the fish tacos and enjoyed the butternut squash, but thought it could have had a bit more seasoning to it.  I had the steak tacos, which were oozing with juices and piled high with sauteed onions.  They were delicious, with spices galore, tingling my tongue, but never pushing me into overload.  It was a heady, pleasurable experience.After the spices cooled off, we moved to dessert, where we split the churros y chocolate.  The churros were crisp and fresh, and the chocolate was smooth and creamy, and had a hint of tequila flavor to it.  I washed it down with some Walthens Single Barrel bourbon on the rocks, served in a fancy snifter glass.We will definitely be back.

45.description: Along with (the also excellent) T&B Grill, this place is a great addition to the Lawrence Ave. stretch of the Albany Park eating scene, which currently boasts the most diverse concentration of restaurants in the city. Rojo Gusano is diverse in its own right -craft but unostentatious taqueria fare and chopsticks at each table for Asian-inspired rice bowl offerings, reflecting the demographic mix of the neighborhood.Full bar set up with a good beer/liquor/cocktail list (lots of small batch offerings, unusual if not unique in this mostly Budweiser or BYOB district), inventive chip/salsa/guacamole offerings and a functioning garage door for open air dining during the six or eight weeks that's possible in Chicago. Wednesday nights are being promoted as Cult Movie Night, with free popcorn and drink specials to go along with the selection of the week (we were told it was The Warriors this week, not an inappropriate choice for the area).  Very friendly staff and super affordable.

33.description: Food: 4.5Ambiance: 4Service: 2Took a group of 12 here to celebrate my cousin's birthday. We were able to get a reservation that night for 8:15 pm and were excited to try this new neighborhood spot. We got there and our table was ready, things looked good. We ordered our drinks, then placed our food orders. We then sat there and waited 30 mins. No drinks. Then our food came out in waves. And still no drinks. Half our table had food, while the other half sat watching. We flagged down numerous waitstaff and communicated the missing food numerous times. Finally the manager came out to assess the missing food items and tried to expedite the orders. We then finally got our drinks. And slowly everyone finally got their food, piecemeal and about 25 mins apart. Not acceptable for half the table to be eating while half sat starving. It seemed like they lost half our food tickets. After everyone had their food, the manager came back out to apologize and offer up complimentary desserts. That was a decent gesture. We ate our dinner, which was very good.Standouts:BeansSweet PlantainsCeviche Tacos: chicken; shrimp; fish; short rib; chorizo ($2.50-$3.50 each)Then we placed our orders for desserts. Chocolate tamals and churros with raspberry and chocolate sauce. Only to be told five minutes later they were all out of tamals except for 1. Churros it was. They brought out the one tamal and four orders of churros and we enjoyed the desserts. Desserts were $7 each and although decent not worth that price point. The manager apologized again for the poor dinner service and we explained how the food was excellent but the service/kitchen timing needed work. He agreed with me and promised to get things to a better place next time we come by. Overall a nice night: yummy food, nice ambiance, but lackluster service. They're very new so I can understand the kinks. I will be back for the food though, and hopefully service improves.

43.description: Great food!  Great ambiance!  Amazing mexcalada!! Amaris is a wonderful server!  Try their variety of guacamole dishes. ....amazing! Menu is not only indicating mexican food but other Latin American delicacies. ...mmmm

2.description: Rojo Gusano is a great addition to the neighborhood! First of all, it's rare in this neighborhood to find a restaurant with a full bar. The menu, though not large, somehow felt a little confusing or weirdly organized and so it took my friends and I a long time to order. We picked a variety of cocktails, tacos, guacs, and a few other treats. Everything was good, and a few things are great. The tacos I had, including the chorizo and the short rib, tasted very homemade in the best way. They were heart and filling and had generous portions of meat even though at first glance they seemed a little small. Why four stars? Service was really lacking, but I'm sure it's just a growing pain. I'll be back again soon and hope to be able to move up to five stars!

18.description: I cannot adequately express how THRILLED I am to have this place in the neighborhood! I've visited Rojo Gusano twice now and will keep coming back as long as they keep churning out delicious tacos, tasty drinks, and hiring awesome servers.Food: I'm a creature of habit and have ordered the same tacos each of my visits. $2 Taco Tuesday is a heck of a deal! Green Curry Shrimp tacos are fire. The Baja tacos are on point, but the sleeper hit for me is the butternut squash and cotija cheese taco. Fantastic! The caramelized sweetness of the squash goes perfectly with the earthiness of the cheese. My husband raves about the chorizo tacos and pork shank, although I've never personally ordered them. The guacamole is tasty and comes with crispy tortillas that you break into pieces for dipping. I love the churros and chocolate dipping sauce. Honestly, I've never met a churro I didn't like, but these babies are freshly fried and almost melt in your mouth- really, really good. Drinks:I wasn't a huge fan of mezcal before, but this place has converted me. Their margaritas are the best I've had in the city. The mezcal's earthiness shines and is balanced by the sour sweetness of the lime, not drowned out by it. Many of the other places I've been to in Chicago that are known for their margaritas drown their drinks in syrup and go light on the tequila. Not here. I can have several of the Fulano Margaritas without getting sugar shock, plus you get a mini shot on the side. One drink and you can start to feel the effects of the mezcal- hooray for saving money! Atmosphere:I love the easy-breezy beach feel of the restaurant. Very chill and laid back. Come as you are- jeans and sneakers are just as fine as dressier attire.Highly recommend checking out this new Albany Park gem.

41.description: Rojas Gusano has a great food,  great drinks and a great space.  We tried a bit of everything and were not disappointed.  The Guacamole and salsas were perfectly seasoned.  We tried an assortment of tacos my favorite was the chicken verde,  my husbands was the chorizo. The drinks were yummy and strong.   The atmosphere is warm and welcoming.  There is exposed brick throughout and it is nicely decorated.  The ambiance is perfect for a date night.  We will be back!  What a great addition to the neighborhood!

4.description: New place in the neighborhood. Some good friends went on Sunday for brunch and they raved about it! By myself on a Thursday night bellied up to the bar, party of 1! The bartender was awesome very informative. Thursday night is Mezcalrita night so I had to have one, salted rim not to sour and the mezcal was smooth in flavor, my new favorite drink! Started with the Tortilla soup excellent rich creamy freshly made tortillas, loved it! Chicken Tamale wrapped in a banana leaf, great presentation moist full of flavor. Two taco's Chorizo and Chicken, the chef really knows his latin food the flavor coming out of the Chicken and Chorizo taco was off the chain! I'm stuffed, ate way to much. Can't wait to go back for brunch!

6.description: Rojo Gusano is a top notch addition to Albany Park.  They are enthusiastic and friendly, and the food will keep you coming back.When we arrived the host promptly offered Kelly and I guacamole and a couple shots of mezcal, gratis.  Needless to say, we acquiesced.  I don't know how long such profligacy will last, or if you will be so lucky, but the sooner you get here, the better.The guac was great, fresh and creamy, and the mezcal was tasty and smooth, though I am no expert.  I am an expert on cocktails, however, and they are excellent.  We both had mezcal variants on classic cocktails, and they were delicious.  Sadly, the list of those is not online, so you'll have to visit to find out what they are!On to the food!  We started with the tortilla soup, which is some of the best I've ever had, if not the best.  It has an earthy, smoky, rich quality to it, and packs a lot of heat, but not too much - you have a low level fire in your mouth while eating it, but it is never unbearable.For dinner we had tacos - $2, all varieties, on Tuesday night.  They were all delicious.  Kelly loved the fish tacos and enjoyed the butternut squash, but thought it could have had a bit more seasoning to it.  I had the steak tacos, which were oozing with juices and piled high with sauteed onions.  They were delicious, with spices galore, tingling my tongue, but never pushing me into overload.  It was a heady, pleasurable experience.After the spices cooled off, we moved to dessert, where we split the churros y chocolate.  The churros were crisp and fresh, and the chocolate was smooth and creamy, and had a hint of tequila flavor to it.  I washed it down with some Walthens Single Barrel bourbon on the rocks, served in a fancy snifter glass.We will definitely be back.

22.description: Wonderful atmosphere and caring, attentive staff. Food is amazing and has been consistently served warm and fresh. Menu is plentiful with options and offers an amazing new take on Mexican favorites with contemporary fusion. Salsas range from mild to hit/spicy and compliment all the food. Bring an appetite and room for dessert.

15.description: So impressed. This place is bringing amazing tastes farm-to-table to Albany Park at great prices. The tacos are loaded with flavor, with local and ethically sourced meat and are generous portions. The attention was wonderful, friendly staff brought us our food quickly and steaming. We loved Panchita Lopez, our hipster-Mexican plaid-clad most excellent and knowledgeable server. Stripped-brick industrial look. Candles on the table, happy music and a great bar. Will be coming back.

20.description: So happy to have these folks in the neighborhood!My roommate took me out for a birthday dinner tonight.  I was a bit too hungover to enjoy any of the cocktails or mezcals, but their list is wonderful.  We ordered an embarrassing amount of food, but I'm so glad we did.  The guacamole with habanero is so fresh and flavorful, and the perfect kind of heat.  The corn on the cob was so huge and piping hot, with so much tasty cotija cheese that I couldn't shovel it into my face fast enough.  The ceviche was also great - the octopus and shrimp were delicious.  And the tacos!  I had a short rib, steak, and green curry shrimp taco, all of them were total knockouts.  The short rib was cooked perfectly.  The green curry shrimp taco was strange, but in the best kind of way.  And I could eat 100 of those steak tacos.  Outstanding.  We also had all of their salsas, and the habanero one was again my favorite - such an awesome amount of spice and acid.  When our server found out it was my birthday, she brought out a chocolate tamale.  Oh man.  It was the perfect little bundle of moist, delicious chocolate cake inside the husk, with ice cream and raspberry sauce, peanuts, and fresh strawberries.  I couldn't eat it fast enough.The service at this place is A+.  Our server gave us her name, but I'm terrible at remembering things.  She was on top of her game, funny, and made sure we were totally taken care of.  We were also visited by someone I would assume is an owner or manager, and he was delightful!  He even brought me a sample cocktail, the Mezcalada, which he promised would help with the hangover (it was delicious, refreshing, and I'm still alive so that's good).  You can tell these are people that want to take care of their guests and they did just that for us.  The specials during the week look great, they have brunch, and the place is fun and very cute.  I can't wait to go back, eat more tacos, try one of the rice bowls, and drink lots of things.Thanks for making this hungover broad's birthday dinner a total success!

36.description: I've been here twice now (once on a Saturday night and for a Sunday brunch).  We ordered a variety of tacos for dinner and a couple cocktails.  Everything was delicious (especially the pulled pork taco, steak taco and fish taco).  Service was exceptional.  They gave us a complimentary guacamole and it was amazing!!  Spicy with sweet mango puree.  Brunch was great too.  Tacos are small but priced at $2.50 and $3.50 each, I'm good with that.  Looking forward to going back soon!
