14.description: Great addition to the area. Food is spectacular. We had the empanadas, tamales, guacamole, chicken taco, steak taco, and chorizo taco. Everything was delish. Service was prompt and friendly. Will definitely make this a new regular in my rotation of restaurants. Inside atmosphere is laid back and cool. Highly recommend this place. Can't wait to try their brunch.The only thing keeping me from a 5 star is the situation with the chips. This place has great guacamole and salsas, however, they only serve a very limited amount of chips.  Between two we probably asked for refills 4 or 5 times. I recommend that they change their chip configuration and provide full bowls. This will make more sense when you go and see for yourself.

28.description: I love the place!  I normally go there with my friend and we order  2 pupusas each ( I get cheese and my friend gets beans and chicarrones), 1 tamal with sour cream (this tamal is made of sweet corn and it's quite moist and delicious), and an order of empanadas de leche (little sweet plantain balls filled with a sweet white paste).  I consider them dessert :)I had the fried yuca.   I guess I don't have a taste for it.  I prefer yuca en escabeche (boiled with sauteed onions).  Honestly, I don't care much if there is an ambiance or not at this place, I just enjoy the food they serve!  I've been there many times and I will go back. It's good to know there's a place for good pupusas in my neighborhood.  I used to work in a Salvadorean restaurant a few years ago and I did miss the food!

1.description: I love this place! Pupusas are delicious and their side of cabbage served with it goes perfectly with it. I have tried the frijol y queso pupusa, and chicharron pupusa. I have also had their camarones a la diabla and it was soooooo delicious but very spicy too! You have to really be into spicy foods.The sauces they give with their food are very delicious.The gentleman who always takes our order is very kind and friendly. The place itself it a bit small but they do have high chairs available if you have a little one. They do carry out, I really recommend this spot!

9.description: I don't normally like refried beans, but theirs are great!  Love their breakfast.

29.description: My review is exclusively on the authenticity of the food. The place atmosphere is not the best, but hey..that is also authentic in a sense...anyway..down to the food. I'm Salvadorean, so my word means a lot, and I recently moved to the US and I travel a lot back home (is not like I've lost my taste for it). When I went, I started with an "atol de elote", which is Salvadoran corn beverage. Atol de elote is based on fresh corn (elote) and has a wonderfully fresh flavor, I really liked it. Then I order one cheese pupusa which was truly authentic. Then I had some "empanadas (or pastelitos) de leche", this is made out of fried plantains and it was really good...In addition I also tried the "yuca frita" (cassava fries) which was just good. I most definetely recommend this place, I talked to the owners of this place, the man is from Nicaragua but he acts Salvadorean...and the woman (the one who cooks) is salvadorean 100%. So, if you've heard of Salvadorean cuisine, this is it!.--- I've been there again and I think they've lost some of their flavor. I think the cook is different. So I'm giving them 4 stars now because I haven't found a better place to eat Salvadorean.

23.description: I'll echo Millie R. here.  The service is very good and the food is cheap and tasty.  The only knock being it is a bit of a hole in the wall.  Very small knock,  though.  We dug into the pupusa's and found ourselves piling on the tasty slaw.  My wife liked the horchata as well.  This worked perfect for weekend afternoon snack.

5.description: Pupuseria Restaurant "El Cuscatleco" is an unassuming Salvadorean spot located on Lawrence a bit east of Kedzie.  My buddy and I were the only gringos eating here, so that might be a good sign.  Since this is a pupuseria, I just had to order some pupusas, a specialty of El Salvador.  I had three different pupusas and they were good, though I could not really tell the three of them apart taste wise.  They come with some slaw and some hot sauces, and I gladly piled slaw atop the pupusas.  I also ate a "hen" tamale, and it tasted like a chicken tamale.  My friend was not feelin' the pupusas so he ordered a taco dinner, which looked like tacos you could get at any little Mexican restaurant.  I drank a sugary pop called Kolashanpan, and it is supposedly the genuine pop of choice for true Salvadoreans, though I'd say the flavor is more of a cream soda or tutti-frutti rather than "champagne".  For dessert we ordered a plate of these fried sweet plantain dumpling dessert balls, and they were delicious.  The service seems a bit pokey, so come hungry but not in a super hurry.

25.description: I hit this place up after looking for some Salvadoran places on Yelp. Nice place and good food. The horchata was great, not the rice based kind, but the real Salvadoran drink.  I ordered some huevos rancheros and the dish came out good. The people working there are cool, and the prices are very reasonable. Finding Salvadoran food in the middle of the country should be a bit more, but it wasn't.

12.description: I went here last week but unfortunately I was in and out.  Nevertheless, I wanted to give them a review since I felt the service was great and the food was worth mentioning.  I had a pupusa de loroco and It was pretty tasty.  I've had pupusas de pollo and beef before but this is my first time trying loroco and it caught my eye since they are very popular in El Salvador. I do intend on going back so that I can try more of the items.  Once I do, I will update this review.

21.description: Pupusas here are good but~ their "Tamal de elotes"? to die for!!!!I'm not much of a tamales person but Tamal de elotes, originally from Salvador/Guatemala are so much better than tamales you see at most Mexican restaurants.The service here sucks. You will wait very, very long for your pupusas but my friend told me that this is the norm. So call ahead and place your order way, way ahead of time. Why the three stars? 4 stars for the food, 2 for the service and the wait. So 3 to average the two.

16.description: I went to the pupuseria last night for the first time and i must say that I was very impressed by most of the food.  We had a burrito, pasteles de carne, pupusas de loroco, queso, and chicharon, as well as a guatemalan style tamale. The pupusas were fantastic, as was the burrito...the pasteles were a bit more greasy that i would've liked but the flavor was great. The tamale was the low point of the meal, the masa was pretty flavorless and mushy (waterlogged) and the pork within was equally bland. That being said in the land of averages this place really impressed me, and the staff were very friendly which is always a bonus to good food, i will be sure to come back. Finally the bill was only $22 for all that food, filled 2 of us up completely.

17.description: Pupusas here are good but~ their "Tamal de elotes"? to die for!!!!I'm not much of a tamales person but Tamal de elotes, originally from Salvador/Guatemala are so much better than tamales you see at most Mexican restaurants.The service here sucks. You will wait very, very long for your pupusas but my friend told me that this is the norm. So call ahead and place your order way, way ahead of time. Why the three stars? 4 stars for the food, 2 for the service and the wait. So 3 to average the two.

10.description: I am far from a snob, and pride myself in regularly frequenting shady-looking establishments. But this place was dingy, had unfriendly service, and unfriendlier pupusas. The girl taking my order had an attitude, as well as the cook behind her. They charge extra if you want salsa for your food ($1 for a tiny portion), I purchased 7 of them--just to make a point. I was not impressed at all by the food or the ambiance. I ordered carryout because there was no way that I would eat inside this place. If you enjoyed the marvelous pupusas at nearby Delicias Brianna (RIP), this place doesn't even come close. Not even the rice was good, and I love flavored rices--especially the Central American varieties. I will not be back. Gross.

11.description: Best pupusas and pan de quesadilla in the city! Salsa is homemade and deliciously spicy.  Very casual dining, but sooo yummy!

26.description: The family that runs the place was super duper friendly, but the food was a little flavorless. Maybe it was an off-day.

27.description: This place is definitely a hole in the wall but their pupusas are delicious. The pupusas filled with cheese / pork rind and cheese and beans were fresh and made to perfection.The slaw and hot sauce used to put on the pupusa were great. The service is good and the food is cheap. I highly recommend this place!

0.description: This place makes great Salvadorian pupusas! I think it is better to grab some takeout rather eat there. The waitstaff are really friendly but the layout of the restaurant is terrible. The tables are too close and the decorations are kind of tacky!

20.description: I came here not expecting to eat (I needed something from them) but they, the husband and wife that own the place, treated me so well and with so much warmth that I tried the pupusas. I had no idea what they would be like, but I am very partial to "corn pancakes" so I knew that I would at least enjoy that. I was not wrong, I was not disappointed. I cannot compare this food to any other Salvadoran food, but I had a great experience. The wife, Rina, is super friendly. The music is good, at a good volume (not too loud). The food is good (and I like that you have to wait - there is really something wrong with food that is ready in two minutes). As I waited, I chatted with Rina and enjoyed the sound of the pancakes being formed. I really don't understand the comments about it being a hole in the wall...it's Albany Park! And, what do people expect? I am puzzled by that, really. It's clean and friendly, easy to get to, and managed by people who know their food!

19.description: I love pupusas, and I'm so happy that Cuscatleco is within 10 minutes of my apartment. I've been there twice now and both times I've loved the pupusas (beans and cheese, loroco with cheese and ayote with cheese). They also give you a very generous amount of curtido and salsa, I love to pile it on. My boyfriend loves the pasteles, steak tortas and tamal del gallina. The family that owns the business is also very nice, welcoming and funny. We love this place, we're recent Southside transplants and have had a hard time finding nearby ($) restaurants that we really like (Ravenswood area). The majority of our favorite Northside places have been in Albany Park. The first time we went, it did take some time to get our food, but the second time was much faster. I think it depends on what you order, the pupusas and pasteles are made fresh to order, so you know that nothing has been sitting out.

2.description: My first time trying this cuisine... I was so happy that  I loved it so much. Place is no frills and waiter was also.. Got one of each flavor and got a heaping cabbage salad to go on top. Salsas are good and not too spicy... Can't wait to try them for the 2nd time

18.description: I was in the hood recently and decided to call my order in so I could pick up the pupusas.  Their pupusas are consistently good.  I love that.  I wish I could adopt the chef as my mother.  They gave me a 30 minute pick up time and they had just started cooking the pupusas when I got there 30 minutes later.  It's okay to wait if you have time.

13.description: I've been coming here for a few years. It's a basic family diner, sometimes with loud news blasting (yesterday when I went there were violent images, as that's what's on the news in Central America unfortunately.) But the food is really pretty good. It's as good as the stuff I used to have in Central America, where pupusas are being made on the street corners.Try the pupusa mixta with a big helping of cabbage and tomato sauce. BTW, Central American food isn't spicy, so the salsas are mild.To explore another flavor, try the pupusa de loroco,  (loroco is a vine flower bud from Central America.) Also, the plantains with beans and crema are delicious.  (The refried beans are so tasty, thicker and more flavorful than Mexican style... just like I tried abroad...)   There's also a very light and refreshing Guatemalan tostada with minced beef, minced radish, and mint. It was unique. I'd stay away from the Mexican items, just because...Well, its Central American - so you'd probably get the best Mexican in a Mexican place. Basic service has always been fine for me. The place is small, so if you need attention you can get it. They need the business. Please go here.

4.description: This place is so worth the try... I live in the suburbs, but when I drive to  Chicago, I make sure I stop by here!!! The place is small, but food is  delicious... You must try their pupusas. The cheese and salsa give their dishes a remarkable taste!!!

24.description: Nice guy runs this place, but it's a big letdown after Cuscatleco 2 (See PUPUSERIA LOS PLANES), which is way, way up on Clark.  The pupusas were OK, the soup was OK, they didn't have that super-freshness of the food up at Cuscatleco 2. To be honest, I've never had a bad pupusa, but these were the lamest pupusas I ever had. The salad or cole saw or whatever that they put on the pupusas was limp and not fresh.  The worst thing was: The most tasteless red sauce I have EVER come across.

6.description: I really like their food, in particular their soups which are meals in and of themselves.  Last week during the snow storm they had the beef knuckle soup with corn, yucca and other vegetables.  It was scrumptious and just right for stormy weather.

22.description: For months I've been wondering where I could hear the "slap-slap" sound of freshly made pupusas in Chicago.  After a bit of research I decided to have my first pupusa experience at Pupuseria Restaurant Cuscatleco.  After placing my take-out order with the friendly gentleman behind the counter, I sat down and quietly observed the families who were dining in, as well as the one dude who walked in selling bootleg DVDs.  I knew this was a nondescript, neighborhood type of place so the only "wow" factor I was looking for was from the food.  Unfortunately my friends, this is where the story heads south.  I ordered three pupusas (the Frijol Con Queso, the Chicharron, and the Loroco), and really wasn't impressed by any of them.  The Loroco definitely had the most promise at first, but after a few bites they all started to taste the same, even with the accompanying salsas.  Maybe these bad boys are best eaten fresh, so I can't really say if my 10 minute car ride home had that much of an effect since I'm a novice when it comes to the pupusa.  In addition, the side salad (best described as a vinegar slaw I suppose), was pretty much past its prime - the smell alone gave away that it wasn't very fresh.  Keep in mind, I came late on a Tuesday night so maybe it just wasn't the right time of week to go.  If there is one saving grace, prices are dirt cheap and the food is filling.  I haven't given up on you yet pupusa.  Next stop is Rogers Park...

15.description: This unassuming Salvadorian restaurant is just what every neighbourhood needs. They have no lofty goals for culinary dominion and yet the food they turn out satisfies every time.I usually go here for a quick snack of pupusas, which are like hollow flatbreads made from corn/rice flour and filled with cheese, meat or vegetables. Cuscatleco offers only a few varieties of pupusas: combinations or cheese, beans, chicharron and loroco (flowers from an edible herb). My favourites are the cornmeal pupusas filled with cheese and loroco, or cheese and chicharron. I find the rice flour pupusas a little dense, and the cornmeal ones have a wonderful warm, buttery aroma. The meal comes with a bowl of pleasantly vinegary cabbage slaw, mildly tinged with Mexican oregano. You will also get little containers each of a green cilantro sauce and a red chilli sauce. I'm partial to the green!The menu also includes other items from El Salvador and Mexico. The tacos and tortas are tasty and wholesome, but so far the pupusas are my favourites. I would recommend coming here for a snack, especially as an alternative to chain fast food. The people are also nicer!

7.description: The Bay Area's large Salvadorean community will spoil you on good pupusas, but this place was pretty decent overall.I got a huuuuge take out order para la familia cuando estaba en Chicago last year. Everything was really good. The nice hombre me dio un free soda because he misunderstood my order and I had to wait a few extra minutes.The fam was contento con todo as well.

8.description: Had new friends in town and before the headed home to Ohio they craved Salvadoran food.  This quaint, northside establishment appealed to their appetites as well as our wallets.  The friendly staff made sure we were comfortable and taken care of.  Parking? It's the northside so it's first-come-first-serve.  It hit the spot and we were all happy about it.

30.description: This unassuming Salvadorian restaurant is just what every neighbourhood needs. They have no lofty goals for culinary dominion and yet the food they turn out satisfies every time.I usually go here for a quick snack of pupusas, which are like hollow flatbreads made from corn/rice flour and filled with cheese, meat or vegetables. Cuscatleco offers only a few varieties of pupusas: combinations or cheese, beans, chicharron and loroco (flowers from an edible herb). My favourites are the cornmeal pupusas filled with cheese and loroco, or cheese and chicharron. I find the rice flour pupusas a little dense, and the cornmeal ones have a wonderful warm, buttery aroma. The meal comes with a bowl of pleasantly vinegary cabbage slaw, mildly tinged with Mexican oregano. You will also get little containers each of a green cilantro sauce and a red chilli sauce. I'm partial to the green!The menu also includes other items from El Salvador and Mexico. The tacos and tortas are tasty and wholesome, but so far the pupusas are my favourites. I would recommend coming here for a snack, especially as an alternative to chain fast food. The people are also nicer!

3.description: Eat the pupusas hot off the grill. The cheese  and loroco pupusa was my favorite by far. Just the recollection of it is mouth watering. The other mixed ones were also quite tasty. The chicken tamal was a bit watery. Perhaps they added water to keep it from tasting dried out, I'm not sure, but the flavor was good despite being watery. Focus on the pupusas. And maybe plantains too.

14.description: Where's the flavor? Steak meal wasn't all that. The pasteles aren't pasteles at all instead their Empanadas. Don't be mistaken like me. They call empanadas pastales. So if you want their Puerto Rican looking pastele you have to say TAMALES POR FAVOR! I'd hate to ask for an empanda there I'd probably get a cheeseburger. The crunch was cool but the flavor lacked. I've had way better Salvadorian food before.  Your left wanting to smack the chef for not adding flavor to anything. The papusas were okay but didn't amaze me.

28.description: For the price and the service, this place is a class act. The place is efficient and no frills as it gets, but for $5 dollars a cut you cannot beat it.

1.description: Table 21Rude lady spray the water in my face, pulling my hair like unhappy worker then doing eye brown w/wax she was fast like 5 dollar service haaaa then and the end said marry Christmas like don't forget mi tip..... I will not hey that's your job lady from table 21

39.description: I haven't got my haircut for this cheap since I was back in H.S. in WV, but a hair cut's a haircut. If you have pretty basic hair (I usually go #3 on the side and #4 on the top), nothing beats this place. However, if you have a faux hawk, they'll probably laugh you back to Enclave.The experience is worth it... there might have been 50 people in the shop when I went, plus 20+ stalls for haircuts, coloring, etc. You 'check-in', tell 'em what you want, and they tell you what # barber you go to. Feels very factory like, but I'm sure you can request a barber.I was in and out with in 15 mins; that included a straight razor and scissors on top that ended up not being short enough.. so on came the clippers. Tipped him $2. Check in guy called me 'buddy'. I love that. Total price: $7. As good or better than my $28 cut at State Street.

9.description: Best hair care in Chicago only $5 its been like that for decades family operated barber shop i have only best things to say about this place keep it up with great work !

29.description: So near to my house, and a $5 haircut that can't be beat.  Why spend $15 or more when I keep my hair pretty short anyway?  I really like Betty & Nick's!My first experience at Betty & Nick's, a year ago or so, was not a good one.  I got a mediocre haircut and the stylist was less than thorough.  But, because of convenience I went back, and since that first time, they have redeemed themselves.  I always get a good haircut.  And I never have to wait.  Service is quick and friendly.  I don't usually request a certain stylist, but after yesterday's visit I think I will - because Adem gave me a killer haircut.Also, the place is always entertaining - lively, busy, chaotic even, with a wide array of diverse characters - but great fun for people-watching.

23.description: My God. I reallllly did not want to go to this place. I'm very sensitive about my hair and I've left many salons crying because they fucked it up. Well it has been a while since I've cried over my hair, I still get nervous every time I get a cut. The guy at the front desk asked me what I needed and had me sit down in a chair. The place was pretty busy although i've seen it packed a lot deeper than it was this night. (It was a weeknight around 8). I noticed one barber TALKING ON THE PHONE while cutting dudes hair. I waited for about 10-15 minutes for a chair and this guy answered his phone 2 or 3 times. I would have snapped if that happened to me. When I was called the lady knew I needed my eyebrows threaded and a cut. My hair was super greasy and I was expecting her to wash it before she cut it. Nope. I guess they don't do that here. I asked for just a few inches off to get rid of the dead ends and I forget exactly what I said but I mentioned having it layered. She said I didn't have layers so she was just going to give me a trim. I was a little thrown off when she said that but I was just too tired to care at this point. She cut my hair in like 5 minutes and I wasn't really impressed. Then she did my eyebrows. I've had threading before but damn this shit was painful! I've never had anyone do it so hard before. I just kept telling myself this is what you get for paying five dollars. My eyebrows look good, although L and E Salon does do a little better of a job for only 8  dollars. I wasn't impressed by my cut until last night when I straightened it for the first time since I got it cut a few weeks ago. It looked awesome! It looks cut perfectly straight and although it's not layered my (drunk) friend kept saying how nice and layered it looked.  I'm poor and you're ten minutes away. I'll be back. It wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be.

5.description: I always go to Ahmed M at Station 17. He is really good and friendly. I highly recommend him. It's only a $5 haircut but I also tip him real well. He deserves it and my haircut would have cost $20 or more at some other places.

31.description: The fastest haircut I've ever gotten. Literally 10 min. I only got a 4 (top) and 2 (side) but super quick and just $5. I don't recommend here if you have a very picky (talent-required) cut, but if you just want to get a trim real quick hit this shack up!

25.description: i love getting threaded here!!! never any wait!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! no apt needed!

12.description: This place offers a great value for $5. Make sure you ask for Khalid in station #6. Hands down an amazing barber and all around great guy. I come all the way from the south side just to have him cut my hair. You'll look sharp guaranteed. Remember Khalid in station #6. He is typically off on Wednesdays.

37.description: For guys who want a simple haircut, go to Betty & Nick's.  It's the home of the $5 haircut!  It's popular with families in Albany Park, and you'll see long lines here on weekends.  I noticed that women are usually sent to the basement and the men on the main floor.  Not sure why, but it's been like that for as long as I can remember.Ladies, they do offer $5 eyebrow waxing and threading.  Eh.... I tried waxing once (don't do it) and threading a few times.  There was a lady who used to do my threading, who was very good and consistent, but she's no longer there.  I tried someone else after she left and it wasn't the same.  Overall, it's cheap, fast, and mainly for men and children who want simple haircuts.

21.description: I have coming here for years and although I have tried getting waxed at high-end salons, they don't do nearly a good job as VENO! This lady will wax me and thread any sparse hairs left behind! I call her up (because I'm her regular) and I am in and out in 15 minutes or less!!!! Only thing -  I don't get tweeze, I prefer to do that at home with my own. $5 - WHO CAN BEAT THAT???  NOTE - they have a small parking lot in the back!

16.description: I have coming here for years and although I have tried getting waxed at high-end salons, they don't do nearly a good job as VENO! This lady will wax me and thread any sparse hairs left behind! I call her up (because I'm her regular) and I am in and out in 15 minutes or less!!!! Only thing -  I don't get tweeze, I prefer to do that at home with my own. $5 - WHO CAN BEAT THAT???  NOTE - they have a small parking lot in the back!

17.description: I had previously written a bad review, but it was after something that I had overreacted about that wouldn't have normally bothered me as much during a stressful time. However, I've cooled off since then and am still a loyal customer. I don't trust my eyebrows to anyone else. My only complaint is that the wait can be long at times, but that's only because they are so good at their job that everyone comes here. I do recommend this place and have recommended this place to all my friends. My only suggestion is to try to come during the week so you won't have to wait as long.

10.description: The 5 stars is for Buffy. She knows my eyebrows and does them perfectly and I have pretty thick ones. She's always downstairs and is not there on Wednesdays. Just tell her how you like them and she'll do just that. Thanks Buffy!

11.description: The fastest & cheapest haircut I have ever received... and it was good! Unreal deal. $5 even, no tax. Amazing.

26.description: Let me just say that for a men's 5$ haircut, you get a $50 dollar treatment.  I have been getting almost all of my haircuts from here and they do a fantastic job cutting hair.  Not only that, but they include the "little things" that make a big difference.  Things like the straight razor treatment on the sideburns and back of neck are amazing and go a long way in my book.  Ladies prices are also very reasonable too.To make a long story short, if you want a great haircut and don't want to spend a lot of money then Betty and Nick's should be your destination.

27.description: Amazing! For 10$ plus tip I got a great haircut and my eyebrows threaded. It is a no bs type of place, but very efficient and the woman who cut my hair (station #7 right by the door) was professional and talented. I don't like to be babied or to make a big deal out of my trips to hair salons, so this is pretty much my ideal.  If you do prefer that sort of thing, this might not be the place for you. I will be returning, though.I was told sometimes there is a bit of a wait if you go during peak hours (assuming evenings and weekends) but I was immediatly seated upon arriving, and in&out within 35 minutes.Also, they do not take credit cards, but there is an atm inside.

35.description: Five dollar haircut is the new five dollar footlong.  I can't get in to see my hairdresser until Christmas, so I dropped in for a trim.  Five.  Five.  Five dollar hairrrrrcuuuut (ber ner na ner).There are no joke more than sixty hair cutting stations in here, roughly estimating six seats arranged around about ten poles.  I would say 95% of the people in there on that rainy Tuesday afternoon were men.  A woman from the back noticed me, my gender, and my long hair from waaaaay across the room and motioned me back.  It was just what I needed, a trim that evened out my layers until I can get the real deal in my favorite salon.  Five stars for the five dollar haircut.  One star for the five dollar eyebrow job.  I looked like my boss's jack-o-lantern -- two elongated triangles pointing downward in hastily awkward anger.  Sing it with me!  Five.... FIVE....

8.description: great place to have a quick man haircut. Though sometimes you have to make sure it's all done properly. Depending who cuts your hair, sometimes they hurry too much

0.description: When I go for a haircut I expect to get in fast, get out quick and be on my marry way. Well I have never known it any other way at this location.First of all this place is huge with ample hairdressers ready to showoff their artistic style. Even If they are busy like on a Saturday or Sunday they will send you downstairs where someone is immediately available without a drop in quality.In addition the price is only $5. Cant really beat that. So if you do not have "that" person that cuts your hair I would strongly suggest Betty &  Nicks on Kimble.

38.description: 11:00 - 11:01Me: I'd like a haircut please(guy looks around)Guy: Have a seat right there11:01-11:02Stylist: How do you want your hair cut?Me: Take it all of with a #111:02 - 11:11I receive my haircut11:11 - 11:13I put on my jacket, give the stylist a tip and pay $5 for my haircutLess than 15 minutes after I walk in I am leaving looking good! This is my new spot forever and ever. My message to you is don't shop around just go here again and again. Don't argue with me or give me any of your objections - Just do it!

20.description: This is how it works. Find a barber you like, it'll take some bad fades and a lot of trial and error if you're an unlucky scalp. Grab this person's cell number, call before you go to reserve a chair. Tip at least $5, and this will help ensure consistency. Figure out world cup soccer, or any NBA finals schedule prior to going, you don't want to get your cut during any meaningful games -lest you desire an asymmetrical look, or you have some sort of blood clotting agent to apply to a gash left when the entire shop leaps in the air after a goooooal. If you can do all of this, I guarantee you'll be a lifetime customer. Oh, park west of Bernard and walk -it's free.

19.description: Let me just say that for a men's 5$ haircut, you get a $50 dollar treatment.  I have been getting almost all of my haircuts from here and they do a fantastic job cutting hair.  Not only that, but they include the "little things" that make a big difference.  Things like the straight razor treatment on the sideburns and back of neck are amazing and go a long way in my book.  Ladies prices are also very reasonable too.To make a long story short, if you want a great haircut and don't want to spend a lot of money then Betty and Nick's should be your destination.

33.description: Home of the $5 haircut. Crowded, chaotic, crazy and awesome. I've been trimmed, threaded, waxed and colored (a fix-it for an at-home disaster that I created) here. If you go downstairs to the basement, it's less crowded down there, usually. When you have long, straight hair that just needs the ends trimmed, why pay more?

2.description: I realized that the place I trusted for many years has changed its business from serving any customer to empowering their barbers to selective pick individuals and either service or reject them without any discretion.  Example - if someone you prefer is not available the next time you go, other barbers refuse you and it has happened a couple of times, leaving a very bad experience and taste for me.  I find it rude, distasteful, and partly a bit of a rude awakening. Although it is at the end of the day a $5 dollar haircut, I used to come here because of growing up in the neighborhood but sadly it's not the same as it used to be.

34.description: This place is A-OK because of the price and the time it takes to get an electric cut. They pretty much take any walk-ins, that's if it's not crowded with homeys who are basically watching their friend getting a hair cut because it's only $5. The place looks more crowded than it really is because it's a "Family Hair Care" salon. So you may get an occasional bump in the back of your chair by little Felipe who is playing with his soccer ball in the salon. A word of advice for you guys, bring a photo of how you would like your hair cut if you are unsure. It really helps communicate what you want, since most of the staff have a language barrier. Sure, the green card holding staff understand the English words, "square, round, short, little bit," etc. My only complaint with Betty & Nick's is that if you get a good hair cut, chances are you may never see that hair stylist ever again. What stylist wants to work for $2.50 a head plus tip long term anyway?

32.description: Let me put it this way..You get what you pay for. A cheap price for a bad haircut.

18.description: I've always came here for threading of eyebrows. But today I needed a trim with a flat iron straighter. Who ever was at booth 24 at around noon to 1pm was very nice but straight butchered my hair! Severely and highly disappointed. Instead of a trim she cut 3 inches off my top front half! I will never go to this place again, not even for an "emergency" like I needed today. I wish I could undo the decision to even go there today!

41.description: it's a 5-dollar haircut for bhuddah's sake!! it's hard to beat the price of a haircut. i usually tip around 3 to 5 bux extra depending on how i like the cut. i like the cut i get from sam. i use to go w/ benny before he left the place (deported?).be sure not to park @ the 7-eleven across the street. they have signs posted in the barber shop to warn ya too.

13.description: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE SERVICE. I got a perm done here a couple days ago and they completely ruined my hair. All I wanted was some body to my hair and now I look like a damn poodle. I honestly am too embarrassed to even go outside. The lady who did the perm had absolutely NO idea what the hell she was doing. Too bad I didn't figure that out until after she had put the solution in my hair. I sat in that place for almost 3 hours as this lady stood there and ruined my hair. I also mentioned to them that I, in no way, wanted my hair cut and the lady cuts my hair very uneven to try to fix the mess she left of my hair. They're prices are cheap but the service is horrible. While I was in there, at least 12 other people were complaining about their haircuts. Hairdressers answer their phones while doing your hair, VERY UNPROFESSIONAL! Yeah, the prices here are great but everything else about this place sucks. Worst hair experience of my life. I will never go here, they obviously just hire anyone who says they know how to cut hair. Definitely wish I could just go back in time and never even walk into that place.

4.description: For those who actually care how their eyebrows look, the best person to go to is Buffy (downstairs station) for threading, she's the best at it also any waxing on the face. I trust her with my brows! Note: her off days are Wednesday's and is available after 1pm, typically she closes.

24.description: A four Star Hair cut for $5 buck's who could ask for a better deal. A great place for a fast snip and clip.

6.description: I used to like this places. I've got a couple of guys that cut my hair. I was a regular customer. Until they keep screwing up my hair. ...

22.description: I never ever had a bad haircut here and for 5 bucks a haircut that is saying something. This place is a virtual factory for hair styling. With over 30 stations I never waited to get a cut I always had somebody take me as soon as I walked in. It really reflects the neighborhood with stylist being from all nations. On one end the tv is blaring Mexican soaps and on the other European soccer. This place is always busy but be weary on coming during the weekend as they are packed to the rooftop with customers. This is also a great place to get neighborhood gossip as I always find interesting topics to talk to the person that's cutting my hair with. No your not going to get wine or beer, your not going to get a scalp or foot massage and yes maybe there isn't hot model types cutting your hair but they are polite, fast and no frills. This place IS Chicago. If you want a great cheap good old fashion haircut this is the place to visit.

15.description: I have personally went to this particular location 3 times, the previous 2 I had gotten my haircut from meitrthe (station 1) she gave me a low fade with an edge up and it was pretty much picture perfect as 5 bucks can possibly buy, So if you're in need or happen to be near, go and check them out, and make sure not to be a jerk and TIP.

40.description: Sammy can "hook it up!"  Been going to him for about 9 months (every two weeks!)  The price is right ($5.00) which is the reason it is usually very busy.  If you get hungry while you wait, there is a street vendor right outside, a 7-11 accross the street, and a bakery as well.

7.description: For just five dollars, I got an awesome haircut from Betty and Nicks. The salon is located in Albany Park, right off Montrose Ave. This is a no frills kind of place with old school barbers that do a fantastic job.  The same haircut would cost me $30 downtown. It gets really crowded here on Saturday and Sunday mornings, so my advice is to try and come during a weekday. They have over 30 chairs going at one time. Since the price is so affordable, I usually get a shave during my visit. I highly suggest this barbershop to anyone on a budget, as well as families. Super Deal. .

36.description: These guys are pro's and they will do you right, shave and haircut for $10? i always leave a 100% tip cuz its hard out here for a playa

30.description: I take my daughters there every 2 months for their haircuts. Also took my mom there recently. As long as you know who to go to, it's the best $5 haircut!!! We only go to Ofelia and Betta for their cuts. They are awesome, but usually super busy. Well worth the wait though. Give them a try!  :-)

3.description: Do not go here! I just took my three year old daughter with special needs there to get a haircut and we were refused service by 3 different stylist. At one point the lady at the front desk went up to one of the stylist who was doing absolutely nothing and explained to her my daughter with special needs needed a haircut and she outright said "no". For a business that's been doing this for over 20 years you should be ashamed of yourselves.

14.description: This place is damn impressive.I took my boyfriend here to get a haircut. It ran us $7 bucks. For $7, his hair looks great! In and out in about 15 minutes, quick, efficient, and well done.I'd give it 5 stars except it kind of ticked me off that they only take cash.  Be prepared fort hat! Had to try their atm, which didn't work, then make a mad dash across the street.  Kind of frustrating, but really, a haircut for 5 bucks plus tip is unbeatable.

1.description: Hooray, a Boost Mobile nearby! It is free to switch from Sprint, and their plans are far more affordable on my laughable budget. Nearby free parking. (Five stars).I poke my head around the store as a customer service rep is having a long discussion in Spanish with a large family. This could take a while. I start flipping through a Boost brochure. "Telefonos Celulares Prepagados." Shit, this one is in Spanish. Wait... they are all in Spanish. (Four stars). The family has completed their transaction-less transaction, and the customer service rep glaces to see if I am still busy attempting to deconstruct the Spanish language and takes a new customer ahead of me. (Three stars). Finally, I get the coveted attention of the rep, and explain how Sprint customer service had told me about the free switch. I asked him to walk me through their Android phones. He pulled out a Galaxy and said, "$300." "But it's $249 online, can you match that?" I asked. "No." He then pulled out another phone, junky looking with low quality feel. "$50." "What platform does it run on?" He told me the name of the phone. (Two stars). "No, what platform for Droid?" I asked, again. He looked at me, obviously confused."Ice Cream Sandwich? Jelly Bean? Gingerbread? What's the processor on this thing?" I asked, with the air of nerdy intellect (of which I have none)."....Oh," he said after a brain-wheel-turning long pause. "uh, jelly bean?" (One star). Most cell phone reps can talk circles around me. You would think I wouldn't be so irritated to be on the other side of it for once.

2.description: i really want to share it with everyone!!!!!!!and you make your choice if you want to deal with that type of service or not.i got a cover for my phone for 4$ on ebay it came with screen protector,i stopped by at the boost on Lawrence and Western and asked Asian guy who works there to help me out with screen protector...Response i got was unexpected... he judged my phone cover saying that it's very cheap and bad quality, said that i wear expensive eyeglasses  and charged me 5$ to stick screen protector...In my opinion it's unacceptable.. i had terrible experience..i was shocked by the behavior of that men...

0.description: Update:  On December 9th ( a month later) a store manager called me to try to offer a special incentive to me, for my unfortunate experience at their store.  I thought that was nice of them.  They still haven't done anything, but I did receive a follow up call.  and an apology.  I guess that's better than nothing huh.  I didn't post that review to stick it to the man...There are people out there like myself who work very hard to make ends meet for a living.  I HAVE no other choice but to put my trust in a vendor to supply an honest service.  I want to know the cell phone carrier I'm using is a reliable cell phone company that will meet my needs.  Stealing from me doesn't help build trust.  It just pisses me off and I never want to use them again.  I hope the management team is very sincere about making  this bad customer experience right.  In the meantime I'm looking for another carrier.  I hear T-Mobile may have a similar plan now.  I'm going to look into them today.So only time will tell... This entire experience has left an AWFUL taste in my mouth.

12.description: this grocery place has almost everything i need. they also have some international variety as well. check em out!

3.description: Great selection and prices on produce, and staff is always friendly and helpful.

1.description: We stopped by here to grab some fruit after eating at a nearby restaurant. We'd never been before but figured we'd check it out. For 24 dollars, we bought a papaya, pink lady apples, 2 pineapples, fuyu persimmons, swiss chard, and zucchini. The prices are great and they have a good selection of fruit. Some of the kale looked kinda of wilted so we didn't buy that, but they have a wide enough variety that you can see what looks fresh and buy that instead. I wouldn't seek this grocery store out, but if I were in the area, I would check out the fruit selection again.

2.description: I actually really like this super market. They offer fresh produce at reasonable prices; also this is a clean store.  Its very important to feel like a store is well maintained while shopping for groceries.

9.description: This grocery store is very good for certain kinds of produce, but today I bought three eats of corn for $2.39 and red peppers for about $2/lb.  In terms of hispanic food staples, this place has it all including orange Mexican pop.I find the meat cuts to be lacking, today went in for some porterhouse steaks and found $3.50 cuts that were way undersized.  Props for having ground sausage and selling fryer chicken, but no props for not selling deboned chicken thighs.I like the rotisserie chicken, spanish rice, and chicken wings sold every day.  The deli has most meats I am looking for but roast beef is never to be found and the deli workers never cut the meat thin to my specifications so the texture of the meat is not as good as it could be.Yes, they sell frozen pizza puff.  You'll even find frozen rabbit in their freezer - frozen rabbit?  You got me, man! All in all good enough for basic grocery needs, but lacking in some dimensions in snacks and deli meat.

10.description: Their produce isn't much cheaper than Jewel or Dominick's unless it's limes, mangoes, chilies or stuff that's advertised on their window.   They have a butcher shop where Spanish is preferred.    WIC and Link cards are always welcome.   If you order more than one item at the deli counter you may just get a sigh from the deli person.Their parking lot is a nightmare because it cannot accommodate the many junk trucks and custom mini vans that go in and out of there.  Check for dust on some of their products, then check the expiration date...you may be surprised.

4.description: One of the dirtiest grocery stores I've ever been to. Went to get ingredients for chilequiles... Tortillas were displayed in front of the deli and covered in mold.

6.description: Never been here before....it reminded me of some of the other ethnic supermarkets I been to, yet this one seemed more Spanish due to the area. (No big deal)  Coke in a bottle is always awesome.The selections here were good, didn't need too much but people were friendly and the deli section was small (not to say it isn't good because of this)I dont frequent the area as much but I may stop back by if I do.  A big plus is the parking as Lawrence usually is crap parking.  One thing I though was weird was when I paid with my card...it took longer than usual to run (like over a min) and the cashier tells me with all the cards it does that so it is normal.  Maybe they need to upgrade something?I a lso believe they take WICK cards in here for those that use it.

0.description: Recently, I've been seeing some improvements on Chicago Produce overall.Their presentations on fresh produce are full and organized.  Their prices are more competitive in comparison to the nearby Mayfair Market.  In addition, I feel that their meat and seafood departments are better than what I saw last year.  Especially the seafood department, I've been sensing a major change on offering better quality items.  Since I rarely come in during lunch hours, I cannot really comment on the hot food counter, but I've occasionally seen some leftovers and they look quite decent to me.  Hope one of these days I get a chance to try them.

5.description: Crazy Cheap prices, like $0.75 loaf of bread, $2.99 Peanut butter, $2.50 juice, $0.99 cheese and really great produce: I could smell the sweet apples as soon as I walked in! Really good quality onions, the garlic bulbs were tight, the greens still crisp. A ton of pinatas hanging from the ceiling to crack me up. I saw no expired product- but dude, are you buying boxed food like Hamburger Helper and Kraft? Why? That stuff is no good! Even broke you can make a decent grilled cheese! Make your own yummy Soup! (Which is what I did, using the aforementioned produce, having just moved close by.)They have fruit popsicles! Try the lime- so refreshing on a hot day!I even bought Goose Island Beer for Boyfriend. I do not understand the reviewers who were snubbed or are saying mean racist things- that is I suspect an outright lie and not right. I speak English and am trying to learn Spanish. Have Encountered nothing but extraordinarily kind employees who politely tolerate my embarrassingly broken Spanish and wind up patiently reverting to English just fine. A small space, friendly, cheap, clean and quiet. I'll be back!

13.description: I can't speak for anything but their produce, but my girlfriend brought some home yesterday, and it was incredibly cheap - she bought a TON of fruits and veggies, and the bill only came to $16. The prices can't compare to Jewel or Dominicks; and it's waaay better quality, more fresh than the crap that the aformentioned places carry..!

11.description: Has goods from different ethnic groups, including Asian, Middle Eastern, and Africa. Although most of the employees are native Latin Americans, I have never come across anyone who didn't speak English. The quality of their produce is comparable to Jewel and Dominick's, and the prices are economically friendly. Parking lot is shared with many other stored in the shopping center and finding a parking spot on a Sunday can be a nightmare. I live by the store and I shop here almost daily.

8.description: I recently stopped by here to purchase items for guacamole.  Avocados were 2 for $1, limes were 15 for $1, cilantro bundles 3 for $1...  I would have to disagree with the other reviewer about the produce prices.  I can't find prices like that at Jewel or Dominick's.  Just sayin'.  Along with fresh produce, they also carry Hispanic staples - dulce de leche, Adobo and Sazon seasoning (must-haves in my house), dried beans, spices, Goya brand empanada dough in the freezer, several brands of tortillas, and more.  They have $5 rotisserie chicken, carnitas, and Spanish rice at the prepared food counter, as well as fresh store-made salsa and guacamole by the produce section.  Grab some carnitas, tortillas, salsa, and guac here to make great tacos at home.  And they carry Mexican Coke in glass bottles!  Score!

14.description: Decent and inexpensive produce--much less expensive than Jewel or Dominicks. Today, I got a pineapple for $0.99, a 10 oz. container of fresh store-made guacamole for $1.80, and three limes for a quarter. They also have the best selection of Jarritos in town (I recommend the electric-green colored lime flavor).

7.description: Their produce is SO much cheaper than Jewel.  This grocery store and neighborhood is about FRESH produce. If you want to buy boxed food then just go to the Jewel and buy your extremely unnecessarily overpriced (and select unripe) produce. I rarely see rotten food there. Avacados spoil quickly when they're not refrigerated, so sometimes they will get spoil. Their prices can't be beat so I have been beat in the past when picking out avocados, but you usually can find good ones. I love Chicago Produce, and I love this one.

0.description: I've been coming here since I moved to the neighborhood in April. I've been wearing acrylic nails for years, but when I started coming here, I developed a severe nail fungus on three nails. This has never happened at any other place I've gone to. They must be using cheap acrylic; either that, or their tools are not properly sanitized. So I stopped coming here for nails & just came for eyebrow waxing. Well, today was it. They told me they'd be with me in 10 minutes. 25 minutes later, I up & left. Poor service, poor quality products. Avoid this place.

This little florist shop on the corner of Lawrence and Central Park doesn't look too fancy from the outside, but the flowers they sell are fresh and lovely, and the floral designer has an excellent eye for composition.  They also have party balloons, cards and gifts.

3.description: Please do yourself a favor and don't come here. It is dirty, they're slow, and there was a horror movie playing really loud while I was trying to relax while getting a mani/pedi, which was the complete opposite of relaxing (not to mention so unprofessional).

1.description: Awesome! I absolutely love this place it was my first time there and I am definitely coming back!

2.description: Before I headed over, I called to make sure they could take me.  I was told to come on over.When I got there, I was told simply "you wait," in a pretty unfriendly manner.  I was fine with that, because I figured it would be about 5 minutes since I was told on the phone that they could take me immediately (I was five minutes away).  I looked through all the colors while I waited, and was already disappointed: not a very good selection and all, and many colors had settled and separated so much that even a whole minute of shaking wasn't able to bring them together.I waited patiently in the waiting area.  At one point, the manicurist moved me to the chair and told me she would be with me soon.  And I waited, and waited.Total amount of time waited before I gave up and left?  A whopping 42 minutes.  Even though I had confirmed before coming and they told me they could take me immediately.  No one even bothered saying anything or looking up as I left.

5.description: The people were friendly... The salon was pretty empty. But I'm very disappointed in the outcome of the no-chip. I got a mint green and not enough layers were added so it doesn't look strong enough & you can kind of see through it... So for that reason I have to give only 2 stars.

6.description: Great place in the Albany Park neighborhood. $30 for a mani-pedi any day of the week is pretty unbeatable. Spent some quality time on the foot and leg massage, which was really nice and they didn't go overboard with cuticle trimming, which usually leaves me with hang nails for the weeks after.

7.description: Happened by this place quite on accident while they were closed and came back later in the afternoon for a pedicure. The people there are very nice, the pedicure was great, the massage chairs are the best I've ever experienced and the prices are good. I honestly thought about NOT reviewing this place simply because I didn't want it to get overcrowded but a place this good needs to be shared.

8.description: I've been coming here since last year and its about time I post a review for this place.  I absolutely love their work. They're very friendly ladies and always take their time with me. Pj and Kelly work very well together and love what they do. I have even gotten my haircut and colored by Linda who does great work for extremely affordable prices. This is my favorite nail salon hands down!

9.description: Best deal in town. I got a pedicure for $20 by Thuy (who I believe is also the owner). She was really sweet and very meticulous. She also gave me a pretty long foot massage which felt awesome! Overall she did a superb job. I was pleased with the quality and it was a comfortable and relaxing experience. The place is small and far from upscale (more like quaint neighborhood hole in the wall), but if you're comfortable with that I recommend it highly. I will definitely be back.

0.description: Have you ever looked down at your feet, and despite your do it yourself attitude, knew right away that tacking those dogs was a job for the pro's?  That's what happened to me today...I told the FeFe that we had to make this right! Jump on Yelp, see this nail spot as the closest and we walk over. No wait, so he says get your nails polished off to babe.  Nice friendly service and a nice and clean job, where you wont be shorted on the leg and foot massage. FeFe says all nail shops should offer a hand message to waiting men who bring their ladies. That didn't happen, but he was happy with the reasonable price and my feet are just plain happy :-)

4.description: I wish I had tried this place before. I walked by it all the time, yet never stopped in.  I am so glad I finally did! Despite the long wait, only two workers when I went, it was well worth it. I got a French manicure and pedicure with design and both were excellent. Friendly atmosphere and very sweet to kids- the woman next to me had a son who was losing patience and the owner put on a special movie for him and gave him candy. Amazing prices too. I highly recommend them.

12.description: Magdalena, the owner is so friendly and kind. Her shop is cozy and clean. My pinky finger is cut and I was getting a no  chip but she was very careful and accommodating. I made my appointment earlier today and I am grateful that she was able to take me! My nails look great!

3.description: I really did not want to leave a poor review because they are so nice, but a no chip manicure chipping on day day three is unacceptable. My no chips normally look a lot thicker so I thought the thinness of the nail polish was strange. I got it done Friday evening and Monday morning it started chipping. They let me know my toes should last a good amount of time also, but that starting chipping on Sunday! It took two hours total to do my nails and feet. I highly doubt I would go back here. I would rather pay a little more and get nails that at least last a week.

1.description: I cancelled my Groupon! I called the ONLY phone number that is listed for this place assuming I would get an automated response with their hours, like most businesses. To my surprise someone picked up the phone, I apologized because it was early and stated that I was trying to get their hours. She ever so rudely told me that she was booked solid and that it was too early for calls like this and then hung up on me! Maybe you should actually get a business phone, like every other self respecting business, instead of using your cell. Thank goodness for refunds!

2.description: I got a shellac manicure last week from Magdalena. She is a lovely lady, fun to talk to, and great at what she does! She was meticulous and took just the right amount of time. I work in healthcare so I am constantly washing/ scrubbing and essentially abusing my hands. So normally when I get a gel manicure I expect it to last no more than 7-10 days. They still look just the way I want them to! Very happy I took a chance on the groupon - which btw she will price match .

9.description: The owner was very kind, so I feel bad writing anything too negative. The first comment on the yelp page is from her, so that's a little misleading. I went here for a no-chip manicure and was really disappointed. The nail polish was runny and was all over my fingers, I had never seen that happen before. The towels she used were stained and looked dirty. She was also outside smoking when I got there, which made my hands smell after she did the manicure.She didn't have a huge selection to choose from, but I understand they're expensive and she said she just opened recently and had her laptop stolen as well :( The polish ended up chipping the very next day and was completely gone within a few days.She's really nice, but honestly I wouldn't go back.

10.description: Maggie is great! Perfect manicure & pedicure. I will definitely be back again and again. I highly recommend this great little salon.

13.description: Magdalena is an artist, a scientist, and a very kind person. She took the time to listen and understand my kooky nail vision before getting started. She was attentive to my comfort and was pleasant to talk to as she worked long and hard to make my nail art beautiful. She seriously spent all day with me. My nails are out of this world, and it was a great deal!

16.description: I bought a Groupon and it was well worth it!  She spent an hour and 20 minutes on my feet and legs, even though the Groupon specified 1 hour.  She was extremely friendly and did a wonderful job on my feet.  The salon is very cute and clean and the massage chairs look brand new.

6.description: I haven't even been there because I keep calling to make an appointment, and it goes straight to voicemail! Left 2 messages that haven't been returned.  WTF?

15.description: I love her!!! She is awesome. The black nails with gold glitter are my nails. First time I went to her, and she did an awesome job with my nails. I will definitely be back. She is such a great nail tech! :)

0.description: I absolutely LOVE my nails! I got them done more than two weeks ago and they're still perfect. Magdalena, the owner, only uses Shellac products which is the best no chip manicure line on the market. I'm definitely going back there! Just want to update my review. These are my nails now...going strong after 3 weeks!!

5.description: Magdalena is a Godsend. She's so sweet and talented. She takes her time and makes sure he customer is relaxed and comfortable with her services. I knew of this place because of a Groupon I purchased. Now it's where I go to every time I need to do my nails. I highly recommend this place!!

11.description: Had a groupon last year at this place and it was great!  Got another one this summer and called to make an appointment.  Never called me back.  Called a second time, no call back then too.  I contacted Groupon and requested my money back.  I did get refunded, but not calling me back was rude.  If they don't want previous customers back, maybe they should let them know as part of the Groupon conditions.  If there was a wait period, would of been nice to know.  Wish I could get another one!

8.description: M G. Is right. I too kept trying to make an appointment and it just goes straight to voicemail. I tried several times on different days and nothing...

4.description: Fabulous place! This is my regular place now and I come monthly. People are great, and my nails always look amazing. Last shellac manicure lasted 3 weeks!

14.description: Magdalena is a really nice person, and she does her job very well.  I'm definitely coming back for spa pedicure to this place.

7.description: I got a pedicure there 3 days ago and I'm still relaxed from that awesome massage chair I got to sit in while they worked on my feet. Maggie didn't do it- her co-worker did and she was great. Really took her time and paid attention to detail. My nails look perfect and it was more than worth the money.

28.description: I love it here. The hookah is good and well priced. 13 dollars for regular flavors and 16 for special flavors. I had the sweet melon and it was awesome. Hookah came and checked on us regularly. And they use the wood coals which is better for the argeelah ( hookah ) we sat in the front room cause the back room was filled with rowdy people. We also got the tiramisu which was good. Awesome authentic environment with your typical old arab men playing cards and backgammon. Always love coming here , staff is always super friendly too!

1.description: Not the best but not the worst. I am an avid hookah smoker and this place is not too bad. It's open early which is a plus. The food is also super delicious. Would recommend to people.

39.description: I have been to this place at least 4 times. I love their food . It's always fresh and yummy. Pretty authentic also.. My only problem with this place is the starbuzz  hookah brand that makes me nauseous every time I smoke it.  They should have more options for the Al-Fakher brand.. 2 other people have had the same experience and they are regular hookah people..Overall, it's a cool place. However, I have to share that the last time I was there.. there were 2 couples that brought in their 2 children. How can someone do that with smoke blowing around!? Oh well, not everyone is a responsible parent apparently...

9.description: The place is nice with a good environment. Good place to watch the basketball game too. I went with my friends. Both of them ordered their own hookah and since I don't do it and it was late at night I didn't want "anything". An hour later, the waitress asks again if I wanted anything and offers water, so I said sure. She didn't come back. It was about time anyway for me to leave.

29.description: I love this place. I've become a fan of hookah so I've probably been to this place about 7-8 times already. I always have a great time and the service is really good. If you sit in the back you get to listen to a variety of different music as well as play cards or bagamon etc. The prices are great and the hookahs are of great quality. Lets not forget the BYOB and the food is great. So far I'd recommend this place to everyone.

42.description: Update:  Apparently you can't get food in the lounge anymore (only the attached restaurant area) which makes me sad because that was one of the appeals to this place.  I used to love going to hookah lounges when I was at U of I and I think I found a great spot in the city now. The back area has a plasma tv and plays lots of good high energy music videos.  It's funny because that back room really reminds me of a VIP room, if you catch my drift...maybe it's the red leather couches...You can bring alcohol here but be warned that they're charge $5 a head for that.  Tried their hummus too and it was very tasty! Love hummus! You could really taste the chickpeas in them.  Can't wait to go back and try some of the other foods!

23.description: I've been in this place a few times on different occasions. This place knows nothing about making great hookah. Their hookahs are too old, usually overfilled with water or come with worn hoses. Their service is not too bad except for that they depend on "beautiful" eastern european girl who aren't well trained, unfriendly, and the only reason for them to be there is to attract customers. I think this place CAN be much better with some extra work.

5.description: BYOB and cheap hookah!  Love hanging out in the backroom where they always have music playing and videos on the 2 tvs they have. People bring their bottles of liquor and cards and just hang out and relax. The place reminds me of the middle east with the decorations and tables they have throughout.   Also, there is a $50 max that you can charge to a credit card so keep that in mind if your group is spending more. Pretty ridiculous and not something I've heard in the past but it is what it is! Im sure I will def be back here since I dont know many hookah joints in the area. There are always extra charges for everything so make sure you triple check your bill before you pay.

31.description: Alibaba as a hookah lounge is only worth 2 stars. The hookah towers are big and look like a steal for $12 but they probably need to be cleaned b/c they don't hit that well. Also, the establishment has no circulation or air filtration, the smog was so thick you could barely see to the other side of the room (ok exaggerating, but it was bad). It's because people smoke ciggs in their too. I'm only giving them an additional 1 star because the place is BYOB and has good customer service and is open pretty late.

25.description: Sometimes you just need some good sheesha in a grimey dive in the middle of the night.. that's when you head to Ali Baba's. As soon as you enter this joint you probably wonder if you needed to bring your passport with you. Arabic Pop music videos playing on the flat screens around, some old arab "uncles" sitting on their designated tables playing cards or backgammon drinking tea.. a bunch of other kids in another corner acting like they're too cool for school.. yeah.. you get it all here. The foods okay.. not sure if they cook their own food or get it from the kabab place next door.. but the sheesha is pretty good. They 'll mix whatever flavors you want together even if its not on the menu, serve the base with whatever drinks you want inside.. sure you pay a little extra but whatever.. the place is still ridunculously cheap. so why not.

12.description: Great hookah, delicious meddtrainian food and awesome atmosphere, good place for large groups before or after party.

37.description: I wont ever step foot in this establishment again due to the fact that sadly, i once was a young 17 year old girl who thought it wasn't a big deal to not be paid hourly. The food might be alright but, in my opinion, you are better off heading closer to kezie and lawrence. The portion sizes tend to be bigger and cheaper in those parts.. Either way no matter what you decide to do remember to tip the damn waitress.

21.description: Great ambiance! Good hookah, food is ok... Great place to relax, beware though. Mary get really crowded and loud on weekends..

16.description: Sometimes you just need some good sheesha in a grimey dive in the middle of the night.. that's when you head to Ali Baba's. As soon as you enter this joint you probably wonder if you needed to bring your passport with you. Arabic Pop music videos playing on the flat screens around, some old arab "uncles" sitting on their designated tables playing cards or backgammon drinking tea.. a bunch of other kids in another corner acting like they're too cool for school.. yeah.. you get it all here. The foods okay.. not sure if they cook their own food or get it from the kabab place next door.. but the sheesha is pretty good. They 'll mix whatever flavors you want together even if its not on the menu, serve the base with whatever drinks you want inside.. sure you pay a little extra but whatever.. the place is still ridunculously cheap. so why not.

17.description: I came here with a friend of mine not too long ago.  We liked the authentic Arab music and decor.  The lighting is much brighter than I've seen in other hookah lounges, but that didn't bother us.  We ordered a sweet berry mix, and we enjoyed it.  The only thing I didn't like were the many cigarette smokers.  I realize that lots of people smoke cigarettes in hookah lounges, but the smell kind of killed the atmosphere a little for me.  The staff is very friendly to the customers.Cash only!  Get money beforehand, or use the ATM in the lounge.  My friend told me that she paid $2 in fees.

10.description: Decent enough place... Nice staff , the ambience can be a little better and the lighting a little dim. Overall an ok place.

11.description: I went on a Saturday and it was very busy. Coconut charcoals yea! Service a bit slow but it was understandable. Hookah was excellent and the food's portions are huge. There was a 15% mandatory tip, but I would have left it anyway. Totally recommended.

26.description: This hookah bar has been my "2nd home" for the past 2 years. I love this place because it's not too noisy and the atmosphere is nice. I generally just like to chill with some friends and at times play cards and this place is definitely my favorite hookah lounge. The chairs are comfortable and the setting is perfect! I usually go to the back room because they have more modern songs (rap, hip-hop, pop, etc) and all. Since I go here often I basically have no problem with the waitresses here. The one thing that sucks is that you have to pay in cash but other than that I love this place! :)

27.description: Ended my birthday celebration here.The lack of ventilation was HEAVY. 99% of my accompanying party needed to take frequent breaks outside.Beyond that, the hookah attendant moved swiftly. The chicken tenders and fries were on point.BUT!That heavy smoke was a KILLERDecent time; crazy bill

35.description: I went here on a date. i'd def. go back, it was a saturday, more people came as the night wore on, the hookah guy working the rotation of the coals and hookahs was nonstop and great, and it's byob, something i didn't take advantage of but would be nice.  total for 2 for 1-2 hrs smoking, coffee, water and tip? 26expect people  under 21, but diverse crowd toward the night.

8.description: Hookah is okay. Service is slow and terrible. Very loud. No space... Not comfortable sitting next to other strangers.

0.description: Pretty cool spot, BYOB comes with a $5/person fee but totally worth it if you're going to be there for a while. They have a pretty nice food menu. The Pina colada hookah was fantastic! Plus they're open till 4am!

38.description: I love this place!...I am a regular...very diverse crowd...very cozy...byob...great food...good looking crowd...best part of all, the owner has pay per view shows all the time...I watch the UFC fights all the time.

20.description: Not bad hookahs, good kitchen. Cheap price. And this place works till 4 am so you easily can go there to afterparty)))

19.description: Too expensive and poor service and quality.  The service and hookah is almost bad as ugly hookah. But the atmosphere and that they serve food brings up to one more star. If you go with a group of people expect to pay at least $150.. The food is just ok but they serve it at least. And the hookah is not a clean fresh taste like Hookah joint or Havana hookah.  And the service sucks unless they see you spending alot of money but besides that they don't care about you.

33.description: We've been here about 4-5 times. The hookah is priced around $12 (which is decent) and we can only vouch for the double apple flavor, which was good. The food was alright, definitely not worth the price though. The cheesecake is typical store bought and the drinks are given in cans (no glass)They show sports on 1 tv, arabic music on another, and the way they're positioned, mostly everyone in the place can see. The hookah experience overall was good (according to SO, i don't smoke). They changed the coals consistentlyIt's a great atmosphere, but we didn't like it the times we sat at the tables. it's only comfy and relaxing when you get to lounge on the couches, but they're usually "reserved" (which tends to mean people who know the owner get first dibs, even if they aren't showing up until an hour after you leave. not the best business practices). The people love to stare at you if you're not what they're used to seeing, and it can get uncomfortable at times. We kinda got tired of the scene after our 5th visit and never really returned.

2.description: I am only giving this place 3 stars because of the decor.  I like the nice furniture and the hookah is better than average.  But I am taking 2 stars off for the staff that has no sense of customer service and the crowd that is mostly middle eastern people.  Their menu is alright but the food was not that great and took an hour to arrive.

34.description: Great place, the hookah is superb and the cappuccino is great.

32.description: I have beeen going to Alibaba for years now.  I LOVE this place.  Relaxed athmosphere.Food: I have tried hummus everywhere I go, but Alibaba's is the best.  As for the rest, I have eaten few other items and they are pretty good.Service: this will usually drive you crazy.  VERY slow.  The waitresses are nice, but I have never ever had a slower service in my life (this goes for all the million times I have visited).Regardless of service, you can't beat the ambient though.  I highly recommend for everyone that wants to hang with friends, even bring you laptop and get some work done (free wi-fi)

18.description: Really expensive hookah, and even more expensive, fixed tip. Especially if you and that old man who brings you your coal and bong does all the work.Wings and other dinner entrees really good.

41.description: So what does a chic who spits on people and yells after getting kicked out from an establishment "I'm from Yelp!" when drunk knows about middle eastern food? Let's not forget about making fun of someone dressing up as a girl while her boyfriend is dressed as a woman nun. You guessed it right! Correct answer is "nothing".A real authentic food is not something an American born or anyone outside the culture may like. Still, it doesn't make it non-authentic.I walk into this place and I see the owner who is suckin on hukkah (authentic). TV is always showing a crappy show (authentic). Meat is washed 100% out of blood and the raw cooked (authentic). People from native country (Saudi Arabia) hanging out there with their friends (authentic).Someone who doesn't belong to a certain culture thinks it's not authentic (non-so-authentic).For everything else, there is Mastercard.

13.description: This place deserves zero stars.  The hookah was horrible, wasn't even smokable...gave me a headache..drove an hour for a hookah and literally stayed for 15 minutes and left..Will never ever go back ...

4.description: Hanging out with one of my buddies about to have me a cocktail and a blue mist hookah. Very friendly and professional service. Flat screen tva with dim setting and comfortable seating. Definitely a nice place to blow some steam and smoke.

24.description: I came here with a friend of mine not too long ago.  We liked the authentic Arab music and decor.  The lighting is much brighter than I've seen in other hookah lounges, but that didn't bother us.  We ordered a sweet berry mix, and we enjoyed it.  The only thing I didn't like were the many cigarette smokers.  I realize that lots of people smoke cigarettes in hookah lounges, but the smell kind of killed the atmosphere a little for me.  The staff is very friendly to the customers.Cash only!  Get money beforehand, or use the ATM in the lounge.  My friend told me that she paid $2 in fees.

6.description: Awesome place to hangout with friends. The hookah serving is best and Mediterranean food is mind blowing.It was nice.....!

22.description: Really expensive hookah, and even more expensive, fixed tip. Especially if you and that old man who brings you your coal and bong does all the work.Wings and other dinner entrees really good.

15.description: Very bad hookah, 2 weeks ago, I asked the lady is the tobacco  Alfakher she said yes, then when I started smoking I felt that I want to throw  up then I asked the man who do the hookah about the tobacco he said nobody told me about your request and I gave you our tobacco, when I want to leave I asked the lady why she did that she said I don't know about the hookah , I paid $49 for 1 sprite , 1 arabic coffee, 2 bad hookah and falafel sandwich.very bad customer service and bad hookah

40.description: This was actually my first hookah bar I have ever been to and I had really good customer service.But then like a couple months pass and I come back and a woman over charged me, she never came to check up on how everything was going. It was hard to get her attention unless I actually got up. I use to tell friends to go here but that's all changed, after explaining my story. None of my friends will go now. Now we go to other locations instead.

7.description: This place used to be my go to for quality hookah for "real" smokers. It's environment is great, and is busy almost at all times of the day. But I think it's popularity became its downfall. They have become way understaffed. As soon as we got there a table next to us said they have been sitting there for 30 mins and no one has helped them! They left! But since I have came here for years I gave it a shot and went up to the girls in the front to order! Atleast if the hookah was good it would make up for it! But it wasn't. The hookah was weak and I got a headache, which I always do when I come here I think the air filter is broken. Pass go to uglys environment there sucks but hookahs on point!

36.description: This place isn't anything great and quite disappointing. When I think Hooka bar I think lots of couches or even pillows on the floor for congregation. This place had uncomfortable chairs which resemble that of a hospital waiting room. The couches, which we snagged immediately walking in, were at least comfortable, however, the cleanliness of them leaves a disturbing thought in my head.My friend and I got a hooka with apple tabaco which tasted more like licorice... odd, yes.
