The other oddity was that they only brought us a hooka with one hitter (I dunno the actual terminolgoy of it) instead of two. I had to keep placing and removing my mouth guard so as to not share germs with my friend. I would have loved a glass of wine or a beer to sip with the hooka but they didn't offer alcohol which was definately a bummer. I'm not sure if it's a BYOB establishment - if I find out that it is I will give this place a second chance. However, they did have cappacinos and other beverages like soda and I believe some foreign drinks. I"m not brave enough to try those so I'll have to wait to review that until a brave or familiar friend goes with me LOL. The other annoyance I had was with a group of 4 men who were playing rummy and getting so worked up that they sounded as if they'd get in a fist fight. Granted I laughed at the time but that was merely to not look annoyed and risk getting yelled at myself. The staff did nothing to settle the men down out of respect for the other patrons. I probably will never go back to this place - unless, again, I find out that it's BYOB. It didn't wow me and some aspects of the establishment simply disturbed me.

30.description: My first time at a Hookah bar and I liked it!! Great place to go on a date! The food was okay . Taste the same as bar food. So it suit the establishment. We were a little confused on what the flavors were and which ones where the favorite,we also did not get any help with our selection. I really do not see the purpose of blowing flavored smoke but it was something new. Now what I did like was they allow BYOB but then they charge you $10 I wish they would have stated that we when arrived but being in Chicago I expect to spend a decent amount. So I was prepared. The place is so CHILL....I also would reccommend to go in the back room the lights are dimmed and they have a mixture of all music videos playing.You can also play cards with your guest . So I would say If you wanna get out of the house but do not want to go the club just chill and listen to music ,socialize, and have a few drinks..This is the place to go! With  3 appetizers the hookah and the BYOB we only spent $46 alot cheaper than going to the club.

3.description: I've been here once long time ago, 10 years ago to be specific. I didn't like it then because it was too bright and way too open for customers.  It's 2 rooms, the front is well lit, while the backroom is a bit more dim.  I came here for a farewell party. I thought after 10 years it would be better.  Well the place is a bit better looking but still nowhere near good.After we ordered our hookah, the waitress kept coming back to take everyone else's order, which is fine, but she came back like 5 different times without our hookah.  You'd think after 15 minutes, our hookah would be ready. people kept showing up at different times, the people that came after us got their hookah before us.  that was the first thing I noticed, how the heck does that happen? I go "hello Miss, we ordered before them" she goes "let me go check on it" I bet you she didn't even put the order in.  That shows a very unorganized place. what happened to 'first come, first serve' moto?!Thankfully I ate before I went there because few of my friends did not enjoy their food there.  The hookah wasn't good either, I've had plenty of hookah in many different places, some are better than others, this one burned quickly and God forbid if you put the hookah on the table...apparently it's one of their rules.  Where I was sitting, in a corner with chairs and a huge table in front of me, there was no room to put hookah on the floor by me because of people's legs were in the way.  we literally had to move the table back to make room for the hookah. and it had to go right in front of me because everyone's legs were long and crossed.  I felt squished and uncomfortable the whole night.I don't like bashing business but yall need to get this place straightened up.  I don't care about the food since I never ate there, but the main thing is hookah and if you can't accommodate the customer, I don't know who your trying to please then.

14.description: It seems like there was an error and now there are 2 Ali baba hookah bars on yelp. Nevertheless, the gem of this place is the food they make and the juices they provide! Try both to be mesmerized by this little unique spot on Lawrence!

3.description: Delicious chilaquiles! Ordered some for delivery this mornimg and they definitely hit the spot. Service was quick too, got here in about 1/2 hour which was surprising because Grubhub orders usually take and hour at least.  Their horchata is also pretty amazing. Will be ordering from here again soon.

1.description: We've ordered delivery from there 4 times now and have loved it every time! We will definitely continue. The steak tacos are awesome! Rice and beans are amazing as well. Definitely recommend!

0.description: We ordered online from them (she used her yelp account to do so!). So, being from Cali, I'm always concerned with having good food from taquerias, they were a staple of my diet back home. I could just load up on tacos and enjoy life. Now, being a vegetarian, its typically a bit harder to enjoy tacos since understandably, if you're a small taqueria, you aren't thinking of catering to vegetarians in any special way beyond burritos. I accept this as my fate.Now, Salsa & Chips has some good vegetarian options for being so tiny. The enchilada was great, the taco was simple with avocado in it, and tostada. Great, wholesome taqueria food that I could enjoy with a decent side of beans and rice. Another part I pick on is the salsa and chips, and since it's the places namesake, I was hopeful. I'm the kind who likes things spicy as hell, which this salsa was not, but it was flavorful with a slight build up spice that was more than good enough. I know we'll be buying here again, it was easy on pick up, and they seemed like a nice local business which I take pride in enjoying.

2.description: Disgusting! The chicken tasted like fish and the beef like pork. Dry old cilantro and refrigerated soggy tomatoes complimented the taste of food that belonged in the garbage can (or diaper) perfectly.

5.description: Amazing carne asada! The salsas are great and the fact that they have Mexican coke is cool. I really loved the guacamole and the rice with my carne asada, check this place out!

6.description: There are many Mexican restaurants in Albany Park. Most are good but some stand out. Salsa and chips stands out for many reasons. You are greeted with a friendly smile. The delivery is fast and of course the food is very tasty. I tried the huge chicken burrito and ate the whole thing.  I suggest you check it out. I crawled out stuffed and the walk home helped my digestion. If you like authentic Mexican. I highly recommend Salsa and Chips.  Kimball and Montrose.

7.description: Stopped in to grab a quick taco before a party so I didn't show up starving. This definitely hit the spot. Love the brightly colored walls and great customer service. And I got to watch some soccer while I waited. Win.

8.description: Pleasantly surprised by this place! I went in on a Friday night and there were no other customers. The menu is pretty basic with tacos/burritos, etc. I ordered a taco dinner for myself and my wife, along with chips and guac. The guac was actually VERY fresh and homemade. The kitchen is right in front and you can see the cook making your food. I had a steak, chorizo and chicken. All tasted fresh and not greasy. Tortillas are not homemade, but also do not fall apart as soon as you take your first bite. My wife also really liked her three chicken tacos. Overall, great spot for a quick takeout. I imagine I'll be trying other Mexican restaurants in the Albany Park area, but this was a great start!

9.description: Get the chorizo! Awesome food and great service.

10.description: SUCH generous portions! I've ordered the veggie burrito multiple times, and it is huge. I love the option to add avocado; really makes it special. An order of guacamole is also much bigger than at other restaurants, and very fresh. Salsas are spicy and delicious! The service is VERY prompt and friendly, and the food is a great value. I can't wait to order from here again.

4.description: I carry out from Salsa & Chips at least once a week, and I have never been disappointed.  The staff is friendly, and the food is always fresh and consistently good.  Plus, you get a large quantity for the price.  I'd recommend it!

0.description: Natural Nails is a neighborhood gem that needs to be brought into the light. It's a full service nail salon that does manicures and pedicures. They have several full spa pedicure stations, complete with foot soak. They do gel nail colors and traditional polishes as well. There are male and female manicurists, and both genders are welcome and spotted in there. The talented staff at Natural Nails also do some of the fastest and most effective waxing I've ever experienced! They know how to actually shape eyebrows, instead of just removing all but an irritatingly thin pencil-line of hair like other places. Their facial waxing doesn't leave me sore for long and they always remove the residual wax completely, unlike other places.The staff doesn't look down on their clients, you can make appointments or just walk right in, but the best part? IT'S DIRT CHEAP. Please tip well if you go, because those guys and gals work HARD.Check it out for the full range of services!

3.description: F-him! Been going for several years. Keeps walking away to answer the phone, sit down, light a cigarette, b-s with his wife CONSTANTLY!! One time he went next door to look at security camera footage of his place broken into the day before and left me in the chair waiting for 20 damn minutes! 4 other customers waiting too! Now the last time I went instead of paying my usual 15 he rips me off and charges me 26 for a fade haircut that ANYBODY can do! Plus he only had $2 in his drawer, perhaps on purpose! DO NOT BEFRIEND HIM! DO NOT PATRON THIS SHADY PLACE!! Sure he's cheap if you aren't too nice and surr the haircut is decent but bad treatment goes a long way.

1.description: Went in for a haircut, it was a sloppy job. While washing my hair water got all over my face and down my back. I asked for it to be cut jus below my shoulders and it ended up getting cut just above. Once I go home I realized it was uneven. Granted I only paid $10 for it, so you get what you pay for.

2.description: Please note that I did not get a haircut here, I only got a pedicure. I came here in desperate need of a pedicure, having not had one in 10 months. I had blisters on the top of two of my toes from shoe irritation. I don't know whether the woman who gave me the pedicure thought it was dead skin or what, but she picked at both of them and made them bleed. She exacerbated one of the blisters so badly that my toe bled each of the next two days, when I had to wear shoes.I tried to pay with a card, and after running it through the machine twice, it didn't work. They called customer service for the machine, and I was told it would be a 17 minute wait. I ended up walking to the Walgreen's across the street to get cash.Bottom line, between making my feet bleed in two places and the absence of a functional credit card reader, I will not be back again.

0.description: I moved to Albany Park a year ago and have been visiting Sam for over 8 months now. I like the new location, it's nice and inviting. Sam welcomes you with a great attitude, and offers me some tea, or coffee. He very well knows how I like my hair cut now so I don't have to spend some much time with details. I'm in and out in no time which is great since I don't normaly have much time.He has invited me to try the nail services a few times, so next time I visit I'll do my best to try it!

4.description: Awesome place! Very clean very friendly and great service.

12.description: Secret Gem in Albany Park!Must try the Mangollada its amazing. Affordable, and great snacks would def recommend it to anyone craving late night sweets

3.description: I am one for unique and different places and this is fersure one of them! I love the vast variety of homemade ice creams and desserts. When id first gone, I had a homemade waffle with a scoop of Carmel chocolate chip ice cream, Nutella, chocolate sauce and pecans and it was AWESOME!I can't wait to go back and try the hotchips with cheese. I haven't gone to a place that sold that as an item since I was a freshman in high school! I love that they sell the Mexican and American version of Cheetos and other brands of chipsOverall the ice cream (from the bucket) was alright and nothing too great, but the prices were great. If you had a choice between any old fast food or 31 flavors joint, driving over here is way more worth it.

1.description: Perhaps I'm just a little bit too excited for the spring time in Chicago.  I get to walk around to explore my neighborhood instead of trying to stay warm by rushing home after work.  For now my "foodie hours" are officially extended.  Hubby and I walked to the east side of Albany Park to search for some mangollada.  I've been noticing the presence of Fruityland Ice Cream, which is located in close proximity to the CTA Kedzie Brown Line station.  You can't possibly miss the bright-colored store-front and interior when you're passing by.  However, is this place worth of stopping by?  My answer is affirmative.  We did wait for about five (5) minutes until it was our turn to order.  Well, it was within my expectation since Chicagoans are quite sensitive to the Mother Nature; many outdoor activities are performed when weather permits.  With that being said, tonight was just perfect for some cold sweet treats.As long as the wait wasn't ridiculous (which it wasn't), I'm still a happy gal when I'm holding a large cup of mangollada in my hand!  Their mangollada appeared to be very popular, about six (6) out of ten (10) people ordering it.  The other 40% of the customers went with other treats, such as paletas, Aguas frescas, smoothies, elote, ice cream, yogurts, and other miscellaneous because there is a ton of options.  Our mangollada was great.  The chili sauce wasn't extremely-drenched throughout the entire cup, so I could still taste the mango and mango ice cream without having the chili sauce over-powering their flavors.  Getting this was worth the twenty (20)-minute walk from our apartment.  We can't wait to go back to try some other items on the menu.

2.description: The name Fruityland makes it seem like a produce market. LIES! Kinda how a Viking named a huge ice glacier Greenland and a more hospitable place Iceland. Since Fruityland is vegetable poor, but full of frosty treats it should be called ICETOWN.And what a grand place it is! Dozens of ice cream bars and decadents. Which is great if one wants something normally found on an ice cream truck but it's out of season or they aren't around. Or they hate that damn music. Ice cream sandwiches, rocket pops, screwballs, fudgesicle, pushups, dreamsicles, klondikes, drumsticks, and my personal favorite. Chocotacos! But wait. there's more. They also have waffles with ice cream, soft serve, and gas station nachos made even more gas station-y since they use cheetos, and elotes. And a few tables and chair to enjoy all this stuff on and open year round with reasonable hours. Magic. See ya there. I'll be the one with the Chocotaco. BTW despite the name it doesn't pair well with their nachos or elotes.

9.description: I'm a froyo snob. Went with my friends to this place and loved it. They don't just have ice cream. They have flamin hots with nacho cheese. Waffles with ice cream. All kinds of frozen desserts. And it is inexpensive. Support this local business! And great customer service!

10.description: This place is awesome! Great prices and delicious ice cream. I got a waffle cone with 2 scoops of ice cream for $1.50 plus tax. The flavors I tried were coconut and rum with raisins. There were coconut flakes in the ice cream which were delicious but the rum with raisins was my favorite! I would definitely come back.

4.description: I do not understand why the reviews are so good about this place. the taste of the ice cream was same as any ice cream that you could get from a grocery store. the only reason i give an extra star was because of the prices. they mostly attract latin crowd in the area, so i guess do not know any better. maybe after knowing what scooters or black dog tastes like; this place did not feel that good.

6.description: Really don't know what all the hype was about. Had a chance to try, and let's just say it's average (blah) of any other ice cream shop, maybe a little cheaper. Overall, not impressed, not impressed at all, and definitely not worth waiting inline for 15 minutes.

15.description: Albany Park's best ice cream shoppe, is no longer the best secret in town. And for good reason! Very affordable prices, hand scooped ice cream sundaes, cones and shakes. There's always a line, but it moves quickly. The mangollada is a very popular item, combining fresh mango sorbet, mango chunks, and a savory chile syrup. It's not too sweet, but very refreshing on a hot day. This place used to more focused on its push cart business, but has rapidly expanded offerings in the past year and a half. Definitely worthy of your business!

0.description: Hi this is Sara again! I had just  had dinner at Thai Valley and I was walking with my Daddy and we went past the bright color front of Fruityland and we just couldnt stop ourselves from going in.  This place is the best!  It's like an ice cream, candy, snack shop with a mexican twist.  We loved it.  I got the bubble gum flavor ice cream.  They call it chicle here.  That's ok though because they let you try as many flavors as you like before you have to decide.  I even got it dipped in sprinkles.  Daddy got strawberry (fresa) dipped in chocolate sprinkles.  He said it reminded him of being a kid.  Super friendly service.  Great prices and pay parking in front.  We'll definitely be back.  And cash only.

5.description: Being that I am a Canadian who lived in south, south bordertown Texas for about 5 years, I think I know a thing or two about Elotes and Mangolladas and Mexican food in general. I have come to realize the Chigaco has a very large Mexican population - which usually means some authentic Mexican food - yummo!!! I never dreamt of the day that I would get an authentic Elote en el vaso anywhere north of Houston. I have to admit, it wasn't as good as south Texas, you know its all about the water LOL!!! But fit the bill just right. Super inexpensive and a bevy of Mexican street food treats!

13.description: An ice cream place is an ice cream place.  Not so with Fruityland.  It has opened recently and there's always a line.  I decided to break my sweets fast and stop by, and I was welcomed with a line outside the door.  They have a cornucopia of hispanic-centric foods.  Takis with cheese, elotes, chiccharones... all types of stuff, in addition to lots of frozen treats.  I was confused and overwhelmed.  I wish they would've just had a simple menu with a list of all of the stuff they have with prices.  Seems simple enough to me.Anyway, I knew what I was there for.  I had chili spiced mango before.  It is an interesting taste, so why not try it in ice cream form?  I got a small mangollada... and it was interesting.  It could've had a little less of the chili syrup, as it was way too salty, but it was pretty good overall.It's a great place to go in the summer, and the prices are ridiculously cheap.

11.description: They serve Abuelita Mexican hot chocolate!

8.description: It's official, a place that has Cheetos con Queso (Crunchy Cheetos smothered in hot nacho cheese) and yes, Ice Cream can be ordered too... This has become the #1 dining destination of choice for my Boyfriend. God help me. Food that comes in neon colors not generally found in nature scares me, as does squeezey nacho cheese- so no, I haven't tasted it or the many options of candy, chips, elotes, fruit with hot sauce or ice cream but the service is smiley when we did buy for some hungry ultra-runners (like bringing a full keg to a frat house- they go nuts!) The prices are ridiculously cheap too- I can't believe how cheap these candy, treats and snacks are! Granted, if you came in asking what is low-calorie, certified organic you may be punted out to laughter, but of you are looking to snack on your cheat day- the cost plus speedy service can't be beat. And if you see me here rolling my eyes as Boyfriend eats his weight in nacho cheese, say hello!

14.description: Friendly, inexpensive, and great ice cream and frozen treat selection!

7.description: ELOTES ELOTES ELOTES, it's a chant I say loudly in my head before I enter this place.  I grew up in the area and have fond memories of eating paletas and elotes.This has place has everything!  Sandwiches, waffles with ice cream, strawberries with yogurt OR cream, elotes, hot cheetos with nacho cheese.... DROOLUgh SO GOOD.I probably could snack here everyday.  The staff here are so friendly =)But beware this place is poppin' there is always a line... but it's WORTH IT

3.description: You can't beat $5 for a haircut.  They always take their time and are very detailed.  I have been coming here since 2008 and have never been dissatisfied.

1.description: Waiting over an hr and wanted to leave; but every minute I've invested would be at a lost if I leave. I'm pot committed.So I'm writing this review from my iPhone..When I walk in, multiple staff members made eye contact and ignored me. I stood at the front door lost and seeking for help... They didn't want to deal with me.First red flag I've ignored... After 20 minutes I finally see someone walk to the front desk, which happens to be midway inside... I ask for a waiting list... This lady just looked at me and said I would need to walk to each barber and find out what's their wait...So I did... Everyone said they are book for the night... And this one person said he has 6 people lined up for him... There happens to be only 6 customers in the store... Wtf!? I guess he wanted me to leave... But I waited it out.While "waiting it out", I notice everyone took one or two more customers and leave. The person I was waiting for only had 3 people in front of me... Not six...In all I waited 2 hrs and was ignored...Service was the worst ever!!!Stick to what you know! Go to Betty n nicks!

2.description: It seems getting a "Flat Top" is very difficult to do. I have tried with different places and none of them were willing to do "Flat Top" except for those salons owned by Mexicans.Well we are very lucky in Chicago as there are plenty of salons owned by Mexicans.Tonight I went to Vanessa's and Wendy's for a hair cut.As soon as I walked in, the cashier tells me to go to station #8Station # 8 was stationed by an older lady with very few words. I told her that I wanted a "Flat Top" with #1 on the sides with shampoo.She immediately got to work. After about 30 minutes she was done.My damage:$10.00 + $3.00 tipRegular hair cut is only $5.00Now I am going to go to Tatami Sushi in Glenview for dinner.

5.description: Great way to practice your Spanish.  Sit down and explain how you want your haircut.   This place can get crowded, so try to get there in the early afternoon during the week.   There are less loitering homeys at this place than say, Betty and Nick's.  There's an older Mexican man there who (I forgot his name) uses real aloe vera fresh from the plant to shave the back of your neck using a straight razor.  Clipper cuts are just $5.00.   They have model photos of hair styles on the wall that are numbered.  I hardly see very many women getting their haircut but mostly color and eyebrow shaping.

6.description: After waiting half an hour and watching the staff let people get in front of me in line at We Care Hair down the street, I stormed out on Lawrence Avenue muttering profanity. I usually don't let my feathers get ruffled if I have to wait, but letting people cut me in line is wholly unacceptable and I've been a loyal customer for over fifteen years.Today a new barber shop owns my allegiance which just goes to show how nuances can turn a loyal devotee into a turncoat in the span of thirty minutes. While storming down Lawrence, I knew of a $5 barber shop and shuttered to think of what I would encounter when I walked in, I decided to bite the bullet and get a haircut at Vanessa's & Wendy's Family Hair Care (Yes, it's Vanessa's & Wendy's).Upon walking in, I was greeted by three stylists, and saw a waiting area of probably ten chairs which were all empty. Loud merengue was blaring with the distinct sound of La Banda Gorda cranking in the background and I had no wait to get a haircut! A young guy asked me in broken English what kind of haircut I wanted and I told him a number one.The clippers felt fine and he worked from the bottom up. After finishing off the bottom part of my fade, I was amazed to see him pull out the big razor blade to do my hairline. To say the least, it was a hair raising experience as I hadn't expected it and I was holding my breath as the razor went across my skin and neatening my hairline. After a quick fifteen minute haircut I paid my $5 and tipped the guy $15 since I enjoyed the place so much.As compared to We Care Hair down the street, Vanessa's and Wendy's is more geared towards the entire family. This place screams Albany Park since the posters on the wall depicting all of the fades have white people, black people, and hispanics. Pretty cool place in my opinion and the best $5 haircut I've ever gotten. Well worth my money and I will not go anywhere else again!!!

7.description: I fell in love with this place when years of havin my hair be cursed and not turn out how i want finally turned out  great! Thanks to "Julia" she made my blonde highlights turn amazing! And she was very nice. They were evenly spaced, not to mention not too yellow or orange. I come all the way from the nw suburbs to get my hair done now bc i love how julia does it. In fact alot of customers at my work compliment me on it. I recommended my.sis  to go and she loves hers too. The receptionist is very nice also, i had time running on the meter and she did  me a favor and went to put more money on it..well my money that is! Anyways i really recommend this place, it does get busy so go earlier.

8.description: Its hard to rate a place like this. Its a $5 haircut and they run the place like an assembly line. If you just need a basic cut, you might try it out. Anything complicated I would stay away, also, the staff does not speak very good English.

0.description: Easy walk-in.  Excellent price.  A dive with bountiful of outlets.  Guys openly get their eyebrows done.  LOL. $10 min charge on credit cards.  Cash only tip.$5 HAIRCUT -- good cleanup.  She complied to scissors for thinning instead of blade (my hair gets super frizzy on blades and unmanageable).  Defaults to round shape on the back that I think is more for guys than girls.HIGHLIGHTS -- cap style and hair is threaded out.  Painful.BRIGHT HAIR COLOR -- beware of the automatic bleach procedure.  The expected color was supposed to be Fuchsia, and I end up with Magenta to Fuchsia as it was over bleached (too bright for talent work, 1-star less).  I would have enjoyed the accidental color more, IF I was on vacation, or during the holidays.  About a 3+ hour process.  She meticulously applied 2 color tubes to every strand of my short hair.  Worth it!THE HAIR BLEACH -- tingled a bit.  So far, my scalp feels good.  The last time Vidal Sassoon bleached my hair, my scalp molted and shed for a week.THREADING -- eyebrows and chin were painless.  Every single upper lip hair was threaded out and it hurt, but looks great.  No pain no gain.I am glad to have found a place that can put crazy colors on my hair that would stay for a while.  Paul Mitchell Beauty School plainly refused my violet/purple color request.

4.description: Do not get your hair cut here.  I went here once, the guy cutting my hair was rushing so much that he ripped out one of my earrings with the clippers!  And he still made me pay for the bad haircut!

29.description: After spending 8+ hours shopping downtown for a graduation dress, I didn't find anything under $150 that I would even consider. So I decided to check out the shops in my neighborhood, thinking that if I was going to pay THAT much for a stupid dress, I was going to really be in love with it. But then, after spending another 4 hours looking in Wicker Park, I still didn't find anything. Plus, I was ignored and given some dirty looks at most of these places. Needless to say, I was pretty much heartbroken. On my way home, I walked past Futurgarb and didn't really think about going in. I think I thought it was some sort of eco-friendly shop with a bunch of hemp T-shirts. But I decided to pop in and check it out. What the hell, eh? Thank God I went in there. The two ladies working were more than accommodating, but not pushy or annoying. Granted I was the only one in the store, but they still made me feel comfortable and even helped me pick out a few things (with some accessory tips, too). I landed the perfect graduation dress, and I thought I was going to cry. Next time I won't waste endless hours downtown or at the snobbish other shops in WP. This place is so great, with a fantastic variety of dresses, tops, pants, and soooo many accessories (hello huge wallet table up front!). And the cats ARE awesome.

42.description: I am going to write an Ode to FuturgarbOh Futurgarb, I'm glad to sayI'd shop at you most any dayYour belt buckles are really neat (The Boring Store's right down the street!)There's lots of eco-friendly stuffAnd you will not leave in the buffCause they've got clothes! Shirts by the dozen,Asymmetrical zippers? Love 'em!Cats roam in between the racksIf you need hats, well they've got stacks!The staff is always very kindThey're helpful when you need to finda sweet new purse, an eco-bagwith less $$ on the price tag.So though it's hidden, hard to seeFuturgarb's the store for me.

23.description: ***The review below was NOT written by me!!!****I've actually only been in here once, but i certainly don't recall any unpleasent older. Cool store.

8.description: Awesome shop, my #1 go-to spot in Wicker Park for jackets, casual wear and unique swag designed locally.  Owner and staff are beyond friendly and very helpful.  As an added bonus they always have a killer indie rock playlist ;)

31.description: I go in this store every once in awhile.  I am totally a fan.  I don't always leave with something though.  I don't always find clothes there, but more accessories.  I love how they have the kitties roaming around.  I'm a big cat fan, and they are all so friendly.  Also, the girls that work there are always super sweet!

34.description: The store is like trendy vintage casual.  I was certainly attracted to the accessories here, and the displays on the mannequin in the windows got me in.  I think it's great that they have men's and women's clothes here.  I found a gift for my sister here for Christmas.  In addition, I did find this shirt I really liked but they were out of my size.  The lady was so sweet in offering to order another for me and left a message to tell me so.  The prices are a bit higher for me than I'd want to spend, but the staff here is great.  I'm sure I'll be back to check in for that shirt.

16.description: Came here to shop for my guy, was able to find great tees, jeans, and button down shirts. Pant selection was not that good(men's). Overall great place, not pricey.

13.description: My favorite clothing store for the last 5-6 years.  Great friendly service, fantastic selection of clothing and accessories. I usually go here when i feel like splurging for myself and always leave with a bag full of merchandise.

11.description: What a pleasant little accident!!!! I was in the window shopping mood and took a trip to the city. I have no idea where I was going but I needed some retail therapy. I just so happened to procure rock star parking in front of this place and strolled on in. You may ask "Dana G., why are 90% of your reviews clothing stores?" and I may answer "Yo fellow Yelp-er, because I will eat Ramen Noodles for a year if it meant a vast wardrobe and full shoe closet!" I LOVE THIS STORE! The clothes and accessories are exactly my style. Funky , unique, and hip clothing, EXCELLENT customer service, and a few furry friends (chilled out feline variety), and a relaxed vibe are what to expect here. Just so happens when you are drunk and shopping the booths at North Coast Music festival and spend all your money at one booth, when you go home and soberly read your receipt it will say Futurgarb. True Story. Match made in heaven I suppose. Wednesdays they have % off deals and if you're a reg you get a punch card for additional savings!Some stuff is on the pricey side... that's why I had to give it 1 less star.

39.description: i feel bad dissing on futurgarb at all, because as everyone has already said, the customer service is really good. they are very friendly and super sweet. however, it seemed a little bit like a cross between hot topic and american eagle or something to me... the trendy stuff wasn't that trendy (billabong? seriously?) and while the men's accessories did seem well stocked, it was all a little bit... generic seeming to me. kind of like the best stuff from the mall in a store not in the mall. the sale section was pretty hot, so props for that too. i'd definitely try it again, but minus the staff, was not very impressed.

37.description: I went in shopping for a  few people and really loved their selection. It was very reasonable priced. Had some sugar skull catholic icon accessories. A lot of wallets and pursues.

0.description: I frequent Futurgarb as my go-to spot for gift-giving.  Always solid pricing...every Wed is 20% off!  I have stuck with them for years, through their move down the street.  Linda & I are friends for sure...she is always there when I show up & is sweet as pie!  Couldn't recommend a small business more...

38.description: The store really stands out (unlike they're clothes) ...... I hate how they have cats roaming around (not very customer service oriented if you ask me). I can't go in this place without sneezing! Keep your cats at home. If I wanted to see cats in a place of business I would go to a pet store.

27.description: Somehow, I've hung out in Wicker Park for a million years, yet I've just stumbled upon this cool place! They have a great selection of hats (fedoras are my thing). The owner and staff were very courteous and helpful when I needed to try on several medium sizes of a particular hat I found until I found the one with the right cut and fit. They also have a cool selection of clothing and accessories. Definitely a place worth checking out. By the way, 4 and a half stars would be more appropriate of a rating. Oh ,and I like the two cats in there that chill out to the cool music playing while on the counter..

32.description: I needed a new wallet. You know, one of those things to carry money and your driver's license, and credit cards and all that stuff. Not a difficult request to comply with, right? Oh, and I didn't want to pay a zillion dollars. I wanted something functional, and not bad looking. And, while wanting to be stylish, I am of a certain age, so I don't want something with a picture of, say, Hello Kitty, or something made of duct tape. That is no country for old men. Anyway, I walked the stretch of Milwaukee Ave from Damen to Ashland. I went into pretty much every little tsotchke selling business I saw. (Though I didn't go to Kmart, thank you very much.)  And there were wallets, sure, but they were either of the five zillion dollar variety, or of the Hello Kitty or made of duct tape (isn't that clever?) variety. Sigh. But finally towards the end of my journey, I came to Futurgarb. And there were wallets. Lots and lots and lots of wallets. Cute wallets, different colors, different sizes. And they were reasonably priced--the one I finally chose was on sale, I think I got it for 10 bucks. And I've gotten a lot of compliments on it!There were also lots of hats. I thus proclaim that Futurgarb is, among other things,  "your wallet and hat superstore."  Very cute cat, too!

44.description: I dig this boutique...the clothes, the owners, their cats... The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because lately the clothing is a little too alterna-teen. I used to buy some Hazel pieces here, because it was the only place in the city I could find Hazel (but I haven't liked the line lately). And they usually carry some great pieces from Groggy, Bench, Drifter and Industry...among others.Generally feel very comfortable here, great atmosphere.

24.description: Grace hats.Nuff said

7.description: I went last night (on a Thursday) and it was supposed to be open until 8:00 pm, but when I arrived at 7:30 pm it was closed.  I have a Spring Rewards deal I bought that expires in 2 days and I'm not sure I'll be  able to make it back there now.  It wasn't an expensive deal, but still.

40.description: I love their hat selection!

30.description: I've been in here twice so far. Once I snagged a neat military-style hat that was exactly what I was looking for, and was even in their big 50% off section. The second time was this past Sunday, where I got a BC Ethic racing jacket.Unfortunately the jacket ripped horribly within 36 hours (through no fault of my own, for clarification). I called them and she knew exactly what type of jacket I was talking about, which begs the question as to why they sell it if it's so defective, but she also promised she'd try to recompense me as well as possible. So my advice is definitely stop in and have a look around, because it's definitely one of the cooler boutiques on the Milwaukee drag, but don't buy the damn racing jacket.Oh, and the shop cats are awesome.

46.description: Have I ever mentioned how much I hate clothes shopping? With a vengeance. I don't mind stopping by this place though. The uber-cool artsy design of the signs and storefront could signal high pretension, but the place has a real down to earth feel. It even has a couple cats hanging out. The buyer seems to take special care in getting new cool, unique pieces every month that you can't find anywhere else in Chicago. With shirts averaging around $60, it's cheaper than most hip/designer boutiques. The styles lean towards rock 'n' roll hipster for both men and women, though there's plenty of things you could wear in a casual workplace. The most similar shop I can think of is Untitled, which leans more towards a younger look, and is more expensive.

1.description: Great Place.I went there on a recommendation from a friend. Bought the same top she did and got 20% off. it was a weds. and the manager said every Weds you get 20%. Awesome.She was really nice & helpful.Will take my daughter there.

9.description: We found this place on New Year's Eve when we were early for our show at Davenport's Piano Bar.  We've been going to Davenport's since it opened and generally try to get there right on time because historically there's been nothing to do in the neighborhood.  Somehow we overlooked Futurgarb.  Interesting items you won't see anywhere else at extremely reasonable prices.  We now make it a destination before every Davenport's show.  Indicative of its diverse stock is the list of things we've bought so far: hoodies, sweaters, scarves, wallets, and a leather cuff.  Everything is beautifully displayed and the staff are low key and gracious.  Even let me use my $5 coupon before I'd written this review!

26.description: This is my favorite apparel store in the whole city hands down.  The brands of clothing are carefully selected.  It is not overpriced, and provides great value merchandise.  Unlike other places where you must be an anorexic hipster to wear anything in the store, here, there is also clothing that can fit the non-anorexics as well, whether they are hipster, quasi-hipster, or non-hipster.One of the better sources for accessories also, like its great hat selection, along with belts, wallets, rings, shades, etc.  Good selection of hoodies and neckties, and arty t-shirts.The clearance section in the back has good finds.  There are bargain clearance hats, shirts, jeans, hoodies, coats.  Always stocked.Additionally, the people working at Futurgarb have a good eye to help pick out great looking-fitting clothes.  Use their assistance...this has probably kept me from buying things I thought would work but didn't...on more than one occasion.The cats also like to participate in customer service.  The orange one will often stop by the counter to see what you decided to purchase, while the mixed color one will greet you again by the door, before you leave.

25.description: As soon as I stepped into the store I was not only in awe by what they had to offer, but I was greeted as soon as I walked in. The girl that was working helped me and my friends in every way, shape, and form. She even said we could come back and get a discount on a vest that we are in desperate need of when we get more money. I plan to keep coming back for all of my future needs in clothing because, needless to say, they're awesome.

12.description: The selection of items were great! They're goods are high quality so it's a little on the expensive side, but they have many deals (including yelp deals!) and i even had someone pass out a 20% off flyer on the street. I'll be back.

21.description: We were scanning for vintage stores on Milwaukee, but found this cute store with friendly owners, some interesting men's/women's clothing, and two cute store kitties.  The staff was helpful, will to bargain with you and seems to far enough away from what Wicker Park has devolved into to still be what I consider cool.

17.description: Nice, helpful staff and a solid selection

10.description: I appreciate your taking the time to respond to my comments. You do have a lovely store. Hope the team improves and wish you all the best.

5.description: Super cute boutique amongst many great shops on Milwaukee! The ladies in this store are all super helpful, even undressed the manikin so I could try on their last Small! :)

3.description: Okay lets first start off I am a super hat fanatic, and great Stylist. When I go in my closet I don't go for what just looks good but is comfortable. Not what is trending but what brings out certian features in my overral physical appearance. They first off had my hooked by the mouth after I heard they had a Fadora hat sale at $10 I was totallly like,Then one day I went in shopping for my Father's birthday/ Anniversary/ my mom's retirement party...Yea! Ikr somthing you definitely need to put your best threads on to attend. When I was assisted by a young lady by the name of Linda Who showed me a hat she just got in ,I instantly fell in love with!Immediately she pointed me in the direction of a button up shirt which perfectly complimented the hat To a' T'And fit me quite well too, If i must say so myself. Gave my a additional %10 off and A beautiful smile to complete it. I would greatly refer anyone looking for good threads to come here.

35.description: Yes! My good friend recently purchased a sexy fedora here for half off. So we rolled up the other day and we both walked out of there with a new hat, mine at $5 and his $10- and these are not cheap thin felt hats- these are quality heavyweight wool hats with liners. I was a little suspicious of the storefront- the facade design seemed too forced with the faux rusting paintjob- it looked too trendy- but soon as i stepped in i was taken back- Great selection of mens and womens clothing- Great alternative to urban up the road. Prices can be high, but this is designer clothing people. Just shop the sale rack in back- surely you'll find a steal. Owner is extremely friendly- they really take care of you. Hard to say that about most boutiques. Help me get the word out, Futurgarb is an excellent neighborhood boutique. Check it out.

19.description: ***The review below was NOT written by me!!!****I've actually only been in here once, but i certainly don't recall any unpleasent older. Cool store.

28.description: Note: This review is from a guy's perspective. I gave up wearing women's clothes long ago so I won't focus on that side of the store.Cats chilling on shelves/counters: CheckFunky scooter/bike randomly placed in store: CheckGood selection of guys clothes: CheckGreat selection of hats, wallets & belts: CheckDistinct sale section: CheckFriendly staff that isn't too cool to say hello: CheckClothing: I've been shopping at Futurgarb for a few years now, since I live down the street. I start there then hit other stores up Milwaukee until the prices get so high I can't afford to a shoe lace. I don't always find something because some of the clothes can be trendy, but when I do I'm happy. They do keep their stock fresh, which is nice. I personally steer clear of the douchey hipster shirts with 98 weathered looking, randomly layered images. (Judge much?) But that's just how I roll. I like simple but unique clothes and FG has them too. Overally, they have a lot of different styles to help you maintain your swagger.  Also, since I love hats, so FG is the first place I go when I want a new lid. I the fall/winter, they gave a great selection to keep your melon pimped out all winter long. Service: The owner is really nice and always seems happy to see ya when you walk in without following you while you shop. I sometimes wear a ski mask while shopping and she STILL doesn't follow me. Now that's trust.  When you finally realize you have no clue what to wear, she'll find you something that covers up your beer belly and helps you look taller at the same time. Yes, I've got issues. Some of the stores up Milwaukee/Damen could learn from this.  Bottom line: If you buy something here, your partner/lover/friends will finally be OK being seen with you in public.

45.description: I am always finding cool pieces here, and ASV is right about the hipster rockstar vibe. They also carry Dickies skirts and jackets for women, and I think this might be the only place in the area that carries them, but Ragstock might, as well. They have great t-shirts for guys and my boy stocked up on quite a few things while we were out shopping together. The staff is friendly but let you wander around exploring on your own. It's not nearly as pricey as you'd expect but the clothes are super cool.

33.description: I thought this place had great clothes - greatly exceeded expectation.  I looked at their website and realized they have a huge selection of hats, but the shop is so crowded with things - lovely.

43.description: Great place to shop for trendy-isg clothing.  They offer a good selection of fitted t-shirts such as affliction and Drifter.  Shop is sort of hidden on Milwaukke ave.  I sometimes walk right past it even though I know where it is located.  The offer a good assortment of pants and hats as well.

2.description: Love this place. Great selection on sunglasses, reasonably priced. Awesome accessories, earrings, scarves, bracelets.

18.description: Cool Find, they have interesting selections of cool things to wear, both clothes and accessories.Pricing is very reasonable, even 20% off on Wed.The owners are nice, helpful, and sincere.

41.description: Futurgarb is my favorite store in Wicker Park.  They have the friendliest staff in Chicago.  I have shopped at Belmont Army, Akira, Urban Outfitters, and Una Maes, and have been completely ignored, not even a hello.  I always feel welcome and at home in Futurgarb.I love the selection of current trends they offer, and the hat and sunglass selection is amazing. This is always my first stop when looking to add to my wardrobe!!

4.description: Nestled on the 1300 block of Milwaukee is a hipster clothing haven called Futurgarb. I found out this place actually had been on this block for over ten years. So the interior decor had bold orange and red contrast walls with a slick light hardwood floor. Trendy. Chic. Yet unpretentious. The sales lady was super chill and extremely helpful. I looked at hundreds of fedoras & sunglasses selection to choose from. Some shirts had a cool European vibe. Their belt collection were unique. There was even artwork for sale which was pretty cool. I ended up only window shopping on that occasion. Overall the clothing and accessories were very fair in price and fashionable. The regional and national chains are jockeying for position in this area. Local establishments deserves our recognition and will continue to be the sheer embodiment of the Wicker Park image.So check it out and remember to support our locals.

6.description: Awesome selection of clothes and awesome that they have sales all the time. Staff really helpful and friendly. Love this place.

22.description: Almost everything in this clothing store is pretty cool. Garments are available at several different price points. There's plenty of cool items that are affordable. Many of the pieces in the store look quite distinct and unique. They have a lot of vegan, leather alternative handbags, purses, and wallets. Many of the brands focus on sustainable production, reusable materials, and fair labor practices. They also have a good selection of $10 sunglasses. The owner is very nice and helpful, and she makes the experience great. I love this store, and I recommend you visit, too.

15.description: I purchase most of my clothing from Linda's shop.  This is a Chicago family owned boutique with friendly and helpful service, great prices and most importantly a great selection of fashionable clothing.

20.description: I love this place!! I went absolutely mad over the fedora's and the cute wallets and clutches. The dresses were cute and the tops -- I thought they were amazing! Especially the really unique ones with the interesting graphics. Plus, the place is reasonably priced.

36.description: Agreed.. Great store and really friendly people.  Whats up that melissa's butt anyway?   Really?  Really?   Geeesh just go to the gap already..

14.description: It's taken me over a year to realize that this little store is here on Milwaukee, next to Harold's Chicken. There aren't too many stores this east on Milwaukee, close to Division. But the hip urban aesthetics blend right in with the more industrial looking storefronts in the area.I was aimlessly browsing, amused at this latest discovery. But then I discovered what had been there all along, right in front of me. Through the middle aisles of the store ran rows of knit caps. A bigger selection than I've noticed anywhere. Color, type of knit: fine or coarse, rim and rimless, flecked with pink, ear-covering vs ear-exposing, etc. Once I noticed them all, I started my quest for the beige knit cap. I found 2 to ponder upon. Then the store manager helped me find 4 more...and then she went the extra mile. She helped me navigate through charts unknown.I never knew there could be so much in the selection of the winter cap. Maybe that's why all my life I've avoided trying to shop for one. She helped me steer away from a plain knit with a masculine and functional look to one that was more delicate and feminine. Who knew?! Since I bought it, I love wearing my cap. And it sure solves the cold head problem as well.Secretly, I go around gloating the joys of being a girl who can wear a femme cap. Yesterday, I was at a bar with a draft, and surveyed the room and saw 1/2 a dozen boys wearing their masculine functional caps. What a bore. Their heads know not the delights and the wonders of a lovely femme cap.

1.description: So, everyone at this salon seemed nice which is why it's hard to say this, but it is the worst manicure I've ever had.Boyfriend needed a hair cut and I thought hey, my fingernails can use a tune-up.  We walked in.  He had to wait about 10 minutes for a stylist, but I sat with the manicurist right away.  It should tell you something that he was done 20 minutes before I was.She showed me a bunch of differently-shaped fake nails on sticks and asked which one I wanted.  I picked the second-most square, square without sharp edges, as my fingernails were then (and always are.)  "Squoval," she told me, which cracked me up.  Her English wasn't great, but apparently the language of Cosmo is universal.  Squoval indeed.Except when she started shaping my nails, It was taking absolutely FOREVER.  I noticed she was making them VERY oval - almost sharp.  It was painstaking, and I wondered why she was being so careful to make them so oval when only seconds ago I had indicated "squoval" with an actual visual guide.  I asked her to make them more square, and had to fine tune it.  "More square than that.  More square.  Flatter.  A little flatter."  After we got that taken care of, the shaping went quicker, since my nails are already squoval.  Ten minutes into the manicure and I had two slightly misshapen too-oval nails and not much more.  The trimming, clipping, cleaning, and painting that followed was the most agonizing, tedious thing ever.  I wanted to just take the nail file from her and do it myself because she was going soooooo sloooooow.  With every swipe of the file, she would then set it down and clean under the nail with an orange stick.  Every. Single.  Time.I sat down at 3:45.  We had to be someplace at 5:30, so at 5:00, when I had a single coat on my nails (the polish was thick and not great since the selection was both lacking and made up of drugstore brand and off-brand lacquers), I asked her to just top-coat me and be done with it.  The thought of waiting for a second coat was too much to bear and I was getting antsy from sitting for so long.  After that, there was no dryer or drying spray, which is just as well because I didn't have the time.I left with an hour-and-fifteen-minute manicure that looked like something I did myself in 10 minutes before running out the door.  Good thing it was only $10, but I still had buyer's remorse.  Not remotely relaxing.  Extra star is for Boyfriend's haircut, which looked just fine.  I guess stick to the stylists and take your nails elsewhere.

0.description: this place is cute. The head hair stylist is the owner and she is so adorable! thank you Yolanda for coloring my hair and cutting it. She did a  great job, let me take you on my adventure. I was looking for a place to style my hair but since I'm a student I couldn't afford a high-end place. Then, I bumped into this salon and it as a walk-in service which is really convenient. I did have to wait a little since Yolanda was busy (which you could tell she's good if people wait for her). They had latin music playing and it made the vibe, fun. It's so nice to be in a place that you can tell is family orientated. So it was my turn, Yolanda was so polite and started conversation right away (usually the hair stylist i've encountered  don't). I told her I didn't know my hair color and she said that's ok, she knows what color I had (I was amazed! ) and surely enough, the color came out exactly as my hair color (I as retouching my roots). Basically, great service, affordable, and def recommend!

1.description: Rice is hard, ergo, half cooked, delivery was fairly quick.Tons of meat on tacos. Barbacoa taco-- too much sauce and meat is not tender - skip.Asada taco - pretty goodBistec taco - not too flavorfulLengua taco - nice texture but terribly bland - skip

9.description: So a buddy of mine and I were in the mood for Mexican delivery for the Bulls season opener and we found this place on Grub Hub. We are usually skeptical of Mexican delivery but you can't beat this place! It is cheap, the food is very tasty and the delivery was super fast! I will definitely be visiting this place again!

23.description: Let me premise this with - I am PICKY especially when it comes to Mexican food. I'm always hesitant to try a taqueria that is new to me because I only eat very lean cuts of meat, chicken breast and can't stand any skin, fat or gristle! My finicky eating habits make it extremely challenging to find a yummy, taco shop. I was pleasantly surprised with La Case De Roy Moy. This place is fabulous and within 2 blocks of the house - even better! I had the trio of tacos: shredded chicken, carne asada and barbacoa. The chicken was AMAZING! Pretty sure it was shredded chicken breast but if it wasn't, they did a really awesome job at fooling me. I have the innate ability of detecting the teeniest piece of dark meat even if it's mixed with white meat chicken. The carne asada was nothing less than outstanding. I wouldn't opt for the barbacoa again only because the taste of it pales in comparison to the chicken and carne asada.  The tacos were STUFFED with meat; in fact, I could only finish two of them.  The best part of this meal was that I didn't have to dissect not even the tiniest piece of fat or gristle! My meal was surgery free and pretty darn exceptional! The rice and beans were excellent but I couldn't finish all of my meal and wound up sacrificing these items to the BF for his lunch leftovers.Bring CASH! No credit cards taken here.

5.description: Best tacos around. Sometimes the phone person is hard to understand but the food makes up for it. Super authentic and full of meat and cilantro. The tortas are amazing and the bread is never soggy. Highly recommend this place

25.description: The chicken nachos I ordered here were phenomenal. I would actually label them the best chicken nachos I've ever had, and I tend to order this dish almost every time I go out for Mexican, so I've had it at quite a few different restaurants.  I didn't order the standard chicken nachos. I asked for the chicken nachos -cheese and sour cream +guacamole. It was incredibly flavorful. My favorite thing about this place was the aromatic, and just assertive enough flavor of lime in each bite. gahhh. delicious. Our server did not speak english, luckily the friend I was out to eat with spoke spanish fluently and covered any misunderstandings between the two of us. The server was very sweet, polite, and shy, but the whole not speaking english thing was kind of a problem, and she kind of disappeared after awhile.  Overall, however I really enjoyed myself.

12.description: It was a searing hot Saturday afternoon and my sister and I were wrangling my grumpy kids.And we wanted Mexican food.  REALLY GOOD Mexican food.  But we couldn't take the kids out to eat and it's too hot to cook (and who are we kidding?  We can't make really good Mexican food.)In desperation, we turned to Grub Hub and found this restaurant listed.  Having never tried it before, we ordered delivery.  Chicken burrito, Steak burrito, Barbacoa tacos, chips and salsa verde, enough to share.It came 10 minutes early and it was SO SO SO SO SO SO good.It is now Tuesday and I am still thinking about Saturday's lunch.  That kind of good.Yum...

21.description: what a surprise!!!! i usuallu dont like barbacoa but HOLY COW !!!! IT WA SO YUMMY!! have been back every pay day since jan 2010 to get my barbacoa fix and the carne asa tacos and camarones ala diabla... TO DIE FOR!!! PLEASE GIVE THIS PLACE A CHANCE DONT LET THE DECORE FULL YOU!!! AMAZING FOOD!!!

16.description: This place is our go to spot for Mexican delivery.  Good food, inexpensive, and quick delivery!

17.description: Was excited for lunch today after reading the reviews.  Sadly, I'm not entirely sure I should even give it the two stars.  Chicken enchiladas rinks turned into bland chopped chicken then cooked with a few peppers and onions.  With MOLE.  And about 20 strands of "cheese".    Which lookedikebthey may or may not have met a few seconds in a microwave to melt.  Bland frijoles, which were a strange grayish color.  Chips were clearly from Saturday, maybe Friday. Salsas were decent, but unfortunately for my friend BOTH very spicy.  I myself thought they were hot, but I love spicy hot so I was ok.  I don't feel the need to return.  A shame as its quite close to the house.

10.description: Not good.  Not good at all.If you are looking for a boat load of cheap, greasy, bland, topping free Mexican food this is the spot for you.For the money they pile you up with food, but I would rather spend an extra buck per taco and get stuff like flavor - oh, and sour cream.

11.description: Whenever we're in the mood for Mexican, we go here.  And by go...I mean delivery.    We really love their food.  It's perfect for filling up and not so greasy that you feel disgusting when you're done.  I usually go nachos with chicken and extra avocado and he goes with a steak burrito.  We're also a fan of their pastor tacos and often grab a couple just because we can.  Did I mention how cheap they are?  They're cheap.  We often find ourself ordering extra food just to meet the minimun deliver fee (on grubhub).  Plus, delivery is usually 20-25 minutes early...Perfect!

26.description: Food is good, and the take out was quick.  I had a chicken burrito with everything on it, had two interesting salsas on the side, and I asked for chips, don't know if they come with it normally.  The inside of the restaurant is bare bones, but clean.  The menu is decent sized.  Don't know if I'd go back and sit down, but would definitely get take out again.

22.description: I lived in San Diego, and I have yet to find Mexican food as good as when I was in SD. This place is AMAZING. The inside is so so, but the food more then made up for it. I had the carne asada dinner plate and everything was good. I can't rave enough, but its amazing!

0.description: 3.5Chicken tacos were really good.  Like another review, I'm pretty picky about white meat/grizzle and this was really tasty!!!  The steak taco wasn't as good but still solid!Guac was fresh and pretty good as well.  Place isn't very inviting but food quality for the price was solid.  I'll be back

20.description: I am hopelessly devoted to Taqueria San Juanito on Kedzie but, as I've discovered on a few late night taco-seeking missions, their hours aren't always ideal for the hungry and intoxicated. Or just one of those so-hungry-and-indecisive-oh-my-god-when-did-it-get-to-be-11-PM?! moments.La Casa de Roy y Moy to save the day! My dining companion, Abbie H., and I ordered from them via Grub Hub on a whim and were thrilled with what we got.While I can't speak for the decor of the place, delivery was zippy and the deliveryman was friendly. Everything arrived well-packaged with ample sides of salsa, table settings, napkins, etc.My dining buddy got the nachos with meat. A steal at $6.50, these were very lightly salted crispy chips topped with marvelously spicy, oily, crumbly chorizo, a heavy-handed topping of mild white cheese, lettuce, tomato, and several dollops of sour cream. My tacos? Fantastic. As other reviewers have noted, the quality of the meat at Roy y Moy's is out of the world. And to hit that $15 order miminum? I tried pretty much every one on the menu. Chorizo, as mentioned prior, was deliciously spicy, greasy, and exactly what it should be. Carne asada had beautiful grill marks and wasn't dried out from too much time on the griddle. Picadillo was lean but still retained its moisture and was perfectly spiced. And the al pastor? I think Roy y Moy's just stole my heart for best pastor in Albany Park. Sweet, tender, and without a piece of gristle in sight, I even talked my pork-wary dining companion into nibbling a piece. ...And gushing over it.Oh. And the beans. Order a side. Or two. Roy y Moy's beans are hit with a heavy dose of chicken stock, rendering them rich, filling, and far more flavorful than any other Mexican restaurant's I've been to. I was so happy I ordered an extra couple of side orders because these beefed up my leftovers for days to follow and are really SO. DARN. GOOD.I'm so happy to have found a great taqueria that delivers for those nights I don't feel like cooking or hiking out for a meal. This place will definitely be in my regular rotation.

19.description: The chicken nachos I ordered here were phenomenal. I would actually label them the best chicken nachos I've ever had, and I tend to order this dish almost every time I go out for Mexican, so I've had it at quite a few different restaurants.  I didn't order the standard chicken nachos. I asked for the chicken nachos -cheese and sour cream +guacamole. It was incredibly flavorful. My favorite thing about this place was the aromatic, and just assertive enough flavor of lime in each bite. gahhh. delicious. Our server did not speak english, luckily the friend I was out to eat with spoke spanish fluently and covered any misunderstandings between the two of us. The server was very sweet, polite, and shy, but the whole not speaking english thing was kind of a problem, and she kind of disappeared after awhile.  Overall, however I really enjoyed myself.

2.description: I've ordered from here probably 10 times...the food is a solid 4/5; a little greasy and cilantro-heavy (it's Mexican delivery, whaddya expect?) for my tastes but generally pretty tasty.  However, my past order contained so much hair in it, I can't overlook it as an accidental stray falling in.  Pick out one, okay it happens, pick out two, someone wasn't being careful, pick out three four five plus and someone just doesn't care.  Wear hairnets people!  At the end of the day, my appetite is gone, my half-eaten lunch is in the trash, and I'll be taking my business elsewhere.

18.description: For the price, this place is pretty awesome. All the food is cheap and well made for the price. Recently tried the chilaquiles, and they weren't so great, but all the other food I have tried has been pretty good. I like that it tastes like more authentic Mexican food, and the tacos have all been really delicious! The delivery is usually pretty fast also which is a plus.

13.description: I am hopelessly devoted to Taqueria San Juanito on Kedzie but, as I've discovered on a few late night taco-seeking missions, their hours aren't always ideal for the hungry and intoxicated. Or just one of those so-hungry-and-indecisive-oh-my-god-when-did-it-get-to-be-11-PM?! moments.La Casa de Roy y Moy to save the day! My dining companion, Abbie H., and I ordered from them via Grub Hub on a whim and were thrilled with what we got.While I can't speak for the decor of the place, delivery was zippy and the deliveryman was friendly. Everything arrived well-packaged with ample sides of salsa, table settings, napkins, etc.My dining buddy got the nachos with meat. A steal at $6.50, these were very lightly salted crispy chips topped with marvelously spicy, oily, crumbly chorizo, a heavy-handed topping of mild white cheese, lettuce, tomato, and several dollops of sour cream. My tacos? Fantastic. As other reviewers have noted, the quality of the meat at Roy y Moy's is out of the world. And to hit that $15 order miminum? I tried pretty much every one on the menu. Chorizo, as mentioned prior, was deliciously spicy, greasy, and exactly what it should be. Carne asada had beautiful grill marks and wasn't dried out from too much time on the griddle. Picadillo was lean but still retained its moisture and was perfectly spiced. And the al pastor? I think Roy y Moy's just stole my heart for best pastor in Albany Park. Sweet, tender, and without a piece of gristle in sight, I even talked my pork-wary dining companion into nibbling a piece. ...And gushing over it.Oh. And the beans. Order a side. Or two. Roy y Moy's beans are hit with a heavy dose of chicken stock, rendering them rich, filling, and far more flavorful than any other Mexican restaurant's I've been to. I was so happy I ordered an extra couple of side orders because these beefed up my leftovers for days to follow and are really SO. DARN. GOOD.I'm so happy to have found a great taqueria that delivers for those nights I don't feel like cooking or hiking out for a meal. This place will definitely be in my regular rotation.

4.description: Very good food. Good price and the food is so freshly cooked. Loved it. Downside lady dont speak good english but who cares every one knows  resturant spanish.

24.description: Amazing food. Been here 5 times and every time its been amazing!

6.description: 3.5Grubhubbing on a Saturday night I wanted to try some neighborhood food without having to go out since I enjoy supporting local businesses.  I ordered some quesadillas and a burrito which all arrived on time.Steak quesadillas were a bit bland and I was not a big fan of the tortilla which did not bode well.  Surprisingly, the burrito was outstanding and the onions in the burrito added a nice sweetness to my al pasto burrito.  They did mess up my drink order but I'm not going to get too worked up about it.  All in all it is good and even better if you live real close.

15.description: Let me premise this with - I am PICKY especially when it comes to Mexican food. I'm always hesitant to try a taqueria that is new to me because I only eat very lean cuts of meat, chicken breast and can't stand any skin, fat or gristle! My finicky eating habits make it extremely challenging to find a yummy, taco shop. I was pleasantly surprised with La Case De Roy Moy. This place is fabulous and within 2 blocks of the house - even better! I had the trio of tacos: shredded chicken, carne asada and barbacoa. The chicken was AMAZING! Pretty sure it was shredded chicken breast but if it wasn't, they did a really awesome job at fooling me. I have the innate ability of detecting the teeniest piece of dark meat even if it's mixed with white meat chicken. The carne asada was nothing less than outstanding. I wouldn't opt for the barbacoa again only because the taste of it pales in comparison to the chicken and carne asada.  The tacos were STUFFED with meat; in fact, I could only finish two of them.  The best part of this meal was that I didn't have to dissect not even the tiniest piece of fat or gristle! My meal was surgery free and pretty darn exceptional! The rice and beans were excellent but I couldn't finish all of my meal and wound up sacrificing these items to the BF for his lunch leftovers.Bring CASH! No credit cards taken here.

7.description: This was my second time ordering from this place on delivery.com, for a late night hankering for some Mexican food and dessert. The delivery time from order was reasonable at about 30 minutes, and I live on the west side of Albany Park. I was having a sweet tooth this evening so I ordered a couple tacos and the tres leches cake and the flan from their small dessert menu.  First, I will say that their entree items, including the tacos, tortas, and quesadilla that I've tried are really good and are a much better deal than Big Star or other places in flashier neighborhoods. They tasted really fresh and authentic. The desserts are a different story.....The tres leches cake was moldy (and there is nothing like the taste of mold to ruin a meal!) and the flan was pretty tasteless and seemed old. I'm not sure if they bake these in-house or buy from a bakery somewhere else, but I probably won't go there with a sweet tooth ever again (or have delivery from them, rather). Now, if Kristoffer's Cafe would open a location on the north side...you know where my tres leches would come from then, but that's a whole different story....

8.description: My newsfeed from Everyblock started chatting about this place so we ordered carry out for dinner.  Really good food, really, really cheap.  I loved my al pastor burrito and the husband liked his chorizo burrito.  The basic quesadilla was thick with cheese-nothing fancy, but the kids liked it.  The tacos were also a steal for the price.  Ordered two sides of beans to round it out and we still have left overs.  We will be picking up burritos there again!  Thanks Everyblock!oh-heads up.  Yelp said they accept credit cards but it is cash only :)

3.description: So I ordered from GrubHub got my order a little disappointed the super nacho order for dollars... I could count the nachos. . Very disappointing.  Also, tacos almost no cheese good thing I paid for it. And the burritos 70% lettuce for a $40 bill order left to be desired

14.description: Now, I know that people have mentioned that this place rules and you wouldn't expect it by the appearance. But, La Casa de Roy Moy absolutely rules and you wouldn't expect it at all. I really wasn't sure what to think when I stepped in. I did travel a little out of my way from a friends place to come here. So, when all I saw was what is exactly in the main picture, but with no real counter top, I wasn't so sure about here. But, it's all about the food and I was about to find out how much it delivers. It's all so unassuming, just some tacos, nothing more. But, these were some completely glorious tacos that are right up there with anything that I've had. The beef that they use is some of the best tasting beef that I've had from a mexican place. I don't know what spices are used with it, but it was insta-smile on my face. That doesn't even begin on how awesome the chicken was. I didn't realize that it was barbacoa, and oh boy was I a happy boy. My only slight gripe was that the chicken was on the drier side, but whatever. This was some killer shit. I also got myself one of their appetizer quesadillas. I was in a gorging mood, but it was also nice to have as something small. It was simple, but yet it didn't seem to last all that long in front of me. La Casa de Roy Moy is completely worth going out of your way for. This is a small gem that is begging for me to return.

58.description: I typically have good experiences here.  I like the food and the prices.  The service in the restaurant for eat-in is always mediocre but here is what happened:I was in the restaurant last night to eat and was very unhappy with the service. The service in the restaurant has always been mediocre, but last night it was terrible. The girl behind the counter/waitress was more interested in her iPhone than the customers. It took forever for her to come take our order, my food came out at least 5 min before my friends did. My rice had a hair in it. Add in that the girl was also talking a lot on the phone so loud that it made it hard to have a conversation while eating. Finally there was an older man who I believe was related to the business who has some sort of respiratory issues and was making unusual sounds behind us our entire meal. The experience was terrible. I guess I have to stick to just take out.

56.description: My husband and I have ordered take out from here a few times. The food is very good and the price is even better. They give you huge portions and when we've ordered for delivery, we've never had to wait more than 30 minutes. On average it's a 20-30 minute wait, and we live about 10 minutes away with no traffic.And the smoothies are DEELISH! Highly recommend!

29.description: In search of a good Chinese spot so decided to try this spot out based on the hit or miss reviews . I ordered orange chicken crab Rangoon and chicken fried rice . Orange chicken was more of a lemon chicken so 3 out of 5 stars. The crab Rangoon was ok it was too sweet for my taste but it tastes freshly made and not like it had been sitting and just got reheated. Lastly the chicken fried rice was ok the rice alone was good but the chicken inside was not good at ALL! It smelled weird as if it was no longer good so that immediately killed my appetite. This place is a lot better than where I usually go but I don't think I'd ever come back.

42.description: I ordered the sesame chicken dinner. It came with chicken fried rice and an egg roll. All of it was pretty good. Their service is very quick.

23.description: I've only ever been for lunch. There are great lunch specials. I love the general tso's. It's crunchy and spiced really well. The service is really good and the price is totally fair.

47.description: When it comes to standard Americanized Chinese take-out, this place is right up there with the best in town. My wife is very picky about her pepper steak, I'm picky about my orange chicken, and we've both been quite pleased each time we order from here. So let's be clear that the 5-star rating is for: not that it's high-end haute cuisine or anything close to "authentic" Chinese... but for what it is, it's the best compared to others peddling basically the same stuff.EDITED TO ADD: Extremely quick delivery too. I typically prefer pickup when I order out because it usually takes a lot less time. But I've ordered delivery twice from this place and both times it has arrived in less than 25 minutes. That's less time than it would take for me to get there and back.

8.description: FIRST & LAST!After reading few bad reviews I still gave this place a chance after Carolynn M. and Ebony J. review's thinking I might get the same experience.... WRONG!This is what I ordered. Beef Broccoli less meat more broccoli, Shrimp Fried Rice & Won Ton Soup.1) Beef Broccoli or rather say Beef w/ TWO Broccoli stalks.    The beef is nothing special but extremely greasy that I wouldn't need chap-stick for a week.2) Shrimp Fried Rice- Frozen shrimp with awful stale rice with no flavor. ( BTW it is rice you know add some type of seasoning).3) Won Ton Soup- Fried dumplings in a container half water, half Vegetable oil. All this for the hefty price of $30 that just went into the trash. Good Lawrd!

31.description: The lunch special is so good and so inexpensive I feel too guilty not tipping the cashier! Its like $7.50 for a soup, fried rice, and main dish. The orange chicken is amazing. the sign on the door says no msg but I wonder with how good the orange chicken is. The most amazing part of it, they let you order it for pick up!AND they are open on mondays!i highly recommend

34.description: Best Chinese takeout I've had in Chicago.  Had delicious sesame chicken, crab rangoon, mongolian beef, chicken with vegetables.  Place is tiny to eat, but takeout was the best I've had, again.  Can't wait to drive out of my way to pick some up.

16.description: Pretty standard Chinese food. Nothing special other then great prices. They also have good tapioka drinks. I ordered from here a few times. I have a few bones to pick with this place. Mangolian beef has mursrooms and aspargus? I wasn't aware that aspargus was even on the menu in most Chinese restaurants however to use portabella mushrooms in Asian food is borderline idiotic. Please change the menu so it does not have Mongolian beef because people expect beef onions ONLY it should read beef aspargus and mushrooms. Orange chicken was amazing. Great consistency you can always count on them not to mess this dish up. Anything else now your asking for to much. Some of the recipes remind me a lot of panda express. This place only gets 3 stars for that reason.

13.description: I highly recommend this place. Pros:1. It is not always crowded2. The food is delicious (and cheap). $7.95 for a plate and i have the half as take overs3. Service is super fast4. People who are working there are very niceCons:Sometimes it is hard to find a table

11.description: I found this place on grubhub and decided to give it a try.  Unfortunately, I'm not impressed.Chop Suey: lacked any flavor and the meat was fatty.Spicy Szechuan pork soup: not spicy at all! Again, no flavor. The broth actually was thickened up by all the fat!Spare ribs: over cooked and chewy.Four season house special: not spicy at ALL!
