No flavor!The ONLY saving grace for this place is the portions. They're more than ample, although after your first plate you may not feel up for seconds.

39.description: First time here, girlfriend and I were craving for Chinese food and unsure of where to go. We decided that 3 and a half stars on yelp out of a hundred some odd reviews was good enough.We weren't wrong. Rating this as a place where we simply wanted cheap chinese food, we were taking care of. The price is super cheap at the lunch special, we paid thirteen bucks for a huge portion of two lunch specials, one being orange chicken, vegetable fried rice, an egg roll, and a chicken low mein with the same sides. It's basically doubling as lunch and dinner for both of us. The egg rolls were good, the food was pretty good, though I preferred her low mein to my orange chicken which is my usual go to at chinese food places.The lady at the register was super nice, friendly, and helpful. The place was tiny, but we were ordering for pickup. We will order here again the next time we crave Chinese. Really glad we decided to check it out.

37.description: I always find reading the first two to three sentences of other reviews--sets the tone for the rest of the review.  A lot of time people feel "disrespected" which doesn't exactly reflect on the quality of the food. (Some guy said something to someone then screwed up the order--things like that happen, if they happen all the time the place will close)  I consider language and cultural differences before I make any such claim.  So here is the deal---this place actually is pretty good and I really don't like Chinese food that much.  Sure, the good people at Michelin won't be handing out a window sticker to these guys but I've never been disappointed.  (Okay I have been because they are too cheap to turn on the AC.  I sweat more than a WWII Japanese POW so I don't care much for sweating while I eat.)   Mind you this is great for what it is, a neighborhood place that can found in Everywhere USA...but do those other places have the cheap lunch specials?  Probably not...damn my sweat stains...this is cheap fun.

0.description: This is what almost everyone in the neighborhood is looking for: a decent Chinese-American takeout and delivery place. They're easy to find, there's some free parking (not much), it's in a well-lit area, the place is clean, the service is brisk and friendly, the prices and portions are great. What's not to like?You will find that this is among the top restaurants of its kind in Chicago. There are MANY others that serve lousy, low quality versions at the same price point, and I am guessing it's only because their clientele doesn't know any better, so these other places can continue to exist. Of all the cities I've lived in, Chicago has the highest percentage of lousy takeout Chinese. You will thank your lucky stars (and Yelp, and me) that this is NOT one of the lousy ones. It's the opposite. They make great meals. The only time I was ever disappointed was with the General Tzo chicken which was mostly inedible cracklins (maybe I could order it with white meat instead). Their similar sesame chicken has never disappointed. The soups are all great. They make smoothies in a variety of fruit flavors.The tastiness and quality of food is comparable to what you'd get at a casual dining Chinese restaurant. Yet you're getting better prices here because there's less money wasted since they're not trying to make a fancier dining experience. I enjoy eating in, but it's not a date-worthy place. I wouldn't bring my parents and grandparents for a big family dinner there. But I would definitely order take-out or delivery and have all my relatives over to my house and serve this food. It's very, very good. Food comes out quickly, sometimes a little too quickly (soup, appetizer and entree may arrive within 1-2 minutes of each other or in mixed-up order). They're eager!If you're in the area and looking for quick, hot, delicious Chinese-American food, this is a good choice. If your kids are crying for a hamburger instead, have them walk next door for McDonalds. If your spouse gripes only for a latte, good news, there's a Starbucks in the same small plaza.

38.description: For thorough info see my first review.  But since I wrote my original review I've carried out food on many the occasion since 2013 and noticed a decline in their ability to serve quality.  This is especially so when ordering in the evening towards the end of the night.  Trust me you should never EVER order the last hour before close.  They skimp on quantity, the quality is below decent and if you had special instructions you can just forget about those!It sickens me that on more than one occasion I've contacted them about poor quality which they've had crap to say about & never owning responsibility for.  Pointing the finger at something or someone else.  On one such occasion I'd requested the food be made spicy.  I sat and waited in their reserved area because I was told it would be made fresh.  I picked up my food and headed home.  The food was as is, not spicy and probably as made for any walk-in business.  I called back and the phone guy says " Maybe your spicy is different from the cook's kind of spicy"  "Next time ask for extra spicy".  When I ordered my meal I told the same phone dude to make it extra spicy.  I wouldn't know it at the time, but that wouldn't be the last time this would happen.  On another occasion the amount of sauce given with an entree was nil, not enough to give flavor to the beef or vegetables it was served with.  And beyond that on another takeout order the shrimp (as shown in Yelp photos) included in the shrimp fried rice was mushy.  Mushy shrimp occurs when the shrimp has been frozen for far too long, frozen - thawed - then frozen again and or when overcooked.  On my last and final trip the quality was poor, not made to order, shrimp mushy and to top it all off the potstickers were burnt.  Burnt so bad in fact that the smell of burnt permeated the plastic and foil container.  Who the F puts burnt product in a bag expecting a customer to enjoy it ??????I think I've wasted enough time, money and effort here.  Previously when seeing their menu I thought about how creative it was, the colors and marketing of it.  Now when I look at it, I think of the guy with penis on the brain that decided to use the longest paper he could find.  The stupid thing wouldn't fit in my drawer unless folded, oh well, to the recycle bin it will go.

51.description: Small (18-seat), bright storefront in a neighborhood strip mall.  Pretty standard Chinese fare; best deal is the $5.45 daily-except-Sunday lunch special (with soup or egg roll, entrée, pork or chicken fried rice, and fortune cookie).  Takeaway and delivery available.  No liquor, but they do have a lineup of rather inventive fruit smoothies with tapioca "bubbles"--we tried coconut and avocado versions.  I ordered the Mongolian beef; a merely OK rendition of one of my favorite dishes.  Even though the waiter asked if I wanted it spicy, and I said yes, the dish as served was on the mild side, with no detectable hot peppers; I wonder if they've had problems with Western customers objecting to the least trace of heat?  No bed of noodles under the beef, but a generous portion of a good pork fried rice on the side.  The memsahib reports that her garlic shrimp was quite satisfactory.No real public restrooms, though a staff restroom/storeroom at the back of the kitchen is available for emergencies.  Not an altogether ideal arrangement.One block from the Kedzie station on the Brown Line.  Small shared parking lot, which was full on our Sunday afternoon visit.

27.description: The good: From online order to door in exactly 20 minutes, wow. The bad: The food. I spent an embarrassingly long time the other night researching Chinese restaurants that deliver to me and ultimately I picked Wok Cuisine. The reviews were hit or miss, but it seemed better than some other restaurants so I figured it's worth a shot. It did its job, it fed me, it didn't poison me and it satisfied my craving for Chinese food. What it didn't do was make me a fan to order from them the next time I want Chinese food. We ordered:Chicken Fried Rice - Not much flavor, not much chicken, but almost any fried rice is decent. Crab Rangoon - Probably one of the worst crab rangoons I've had. It didn't exactly taste bad, it just didn't really have a taste. Kung Pao Beef - Lots of veggies, not a lot of meat. Nothing to call home about. Sweet & Sour Chicken - Also probably some of the most sub-par sweet & sour chicken I've had. Now the sauce, you can't screw up. I think that stuff just comes in 50 gallon drums and you just have to make the chicken. The problem with the chicken was, it was tiny, tiny chunks of chicken. Lots of breading, not much chicken. Mongolian Beef - Same as Kung Pao, lots of veggies, little meat. Still on the hunt for a good Chinese restaurant that delivers in the Albany/Irving Park neighborhood.

32.description: I lived on the same block as Wok Cuisine for 5 years and ate there 2-3 times a week for most of those years. I was rarely if ever disappointed. They have consistently good quality food, and fast and friendly service. Now that I've moved, I appreciate it even more because I haven't found anything to replace it. I loved the General Tso's Tofu, Orange Tofu, and Broccoli with Garlic Sauce. I miss Wok!

54.description: You know, every restaurant needs to be approached with reasonable expectations. There are literally hundreds of these strip mall/counter service restaurants in the city and you basically know what to expect -- chunks of meat in sauce, fried rice, egg rolls etc. Some do it better, some do it worse, but most of them hover around the "Edible and even good if I'm really hungry".  Wok Cuisine definitely is on the better side, and it's pretty consistent too. Most of the stuff you get what you expect, but it's pretty good - standouts are the Sesame Chicken (or most of the dishes in the chunks of fried meat in sweet/spicy sauce category) - the sauces are generally sweeter with flecks of red peppers.  The delivery is really fast and the people working are pretty friendly.It doesn't make sense to mince every single dishes at a place like this - you just need to try it and find the ones that are better for you. Like I said, mostly counter-Chinese hovers around your expectations. If you live in the area, though, or find yourself passing by and wondering what this place is like, well, it's probably what you're imagining but a bit better.

48.description: My wife and I order from here often and were always very pleased with the food and the service is great. Very nice staff. If you want delivery service it's really quick. Try the orange chicken, steamed mixed veggies and the thick noodle dish with beef and chicken.

44.description: Blech. Fried rice.... bland, no taste.Mongolian beef....5 percent beef, 70 percent onions and yuk and 25 percent grease.Eggrolls .. Inedible.44.50 wasted.Never again.

24.description: I highly recommend this place. Pros:1. It is not always crowded2. The food is delicious (and cheap). $7.95 for a plate and i have the half as take overs3. Service is super fast4. People who are working there are very niceCons:Sometimes it is hard to find a table

7.description: I love this place.  I've been ordering for years and for delivery to different addresses.  When I was out of their delivery range, I would pick it up.  It is always delivered quickly, and hot.  They have the best sesame chicken that I can find in this city.  Literally.  Everything that I order is tasty.  Their watermelon smoothie is my FAVE in the summer.

49.description: I ordered take-out of veggie fried rice, chicken with string beans and hot & sour soup. The rice tasted like it had been sitting around for a few hours. The peas tasted like styrofoam and the rice was dry. The soup tasted about like nothing. Mostly like water and cornstarch. The chicken was the best of the three, but nothing special about it. Menu said spicy, but it was only a tad less bland than the rest.

40.description: Always order carry-out or delivery.  Best Chinese food so far. Fresh vegetables in their dishes.  My go to is General and orange chicken.  I am never disappointed.

53.description: If you are looking for Chinese takeout, try this place.  I haven't been disappointed yet.

30.description: Love this place!

46.description: I just ordered a c11 special... beef egg foo young, chicken fried rice and egg roll for $8.75. First off, it was the nastiest Chinese food I've ever tasted. Second of all, it was too high. And third, I'll never eat from there again. My fried rice was bland, and needed some color and serious flavor. My egg foo young, was bland, needed some flavor, and the container of weird tasting gravy they gave me on the side was thick like pudding. I couldn't think of the words to describe it. The egg roll they gave me was really small and was old and hard as a stone. These people are crazy for giving this place a solid 4 stars. This shit was pain old gross...northsiders don't know shit about good Chinese food. That's what I get for not sticking to my regular hood Chinese joints...sorry #1 Chop Suey, I won't stray again.

1.description: Haven't had a chance to try the food so I can't give a full review.  Have only been here a handful of times because of the bubble tea.  I would recommend and make sure to keep your punch card to make your way to a free one.

55.description: I've Been coming here for years.  So much that they know me by name.  Love the Sesame Chicken here.  The combo lunch specials are a bargain and they always use quality ingrediants.  Great egg rolls too.  Give them a try.

9.description: I stopped in at Wok Cuisine to order some food to go after finding myself in the area for a meeting. I had the orange chicken with fried rice off of the lunch menu. The reason I am rating this place so highly is because the food was actually non-greasy, not salty, and well seasoned- a rarity for an americanized Chinese place. I actually didn't feel gross after finishing my food! So, a good place to try for cheap, not AS super unhealthy Chinese food. Sweet!

26.description: Tried various lunch dishes from here- sweet sour pork (off menu) orange chicken, soup, spring rolls- with brown rice- it just... wasn't good. The sweet sour pork was disgusting if I may add. I am Chinese so I will admit that I am picky. Will not order from here again.

25.description: Pretty standard Chinese food. Nothing special other then great prices. They also have good tapioka drinks. I ordered from here a few times. I have a few bones to pick with this place. Mangolian beef has mursrooms and aspargus? I wasn't aware that aspargus was even on the menu in most Chinese restaurants however to use portabella mushrooms in Asian food is borderline idiotic. Please change the menu so it does not have Mongolian beef because people expect beef onions ONLY it should read beef aspargus and mushrooms. Orange chicken was amazing. Great consistency you can always count on them not to mess this dish up. Anything else now your asking for to much. Some of the recipes remind me a lot of panda express. This place only gets 3 stars for that reason.

12.description: Since moving to Chicago last year, I have been on a search for good Chinese and have found that it is very hard to find!  Last night at work a client suggested Wok Cuisine, said she was going for years.  I tried it out, figured I'd be ok with losing $9.  IT WAS THE BEST CHINESE I HAVE FOUND YET!!  I ordered sesame chicken, and they used real meat!  The meat was not stringy at all, the sauce was not thick, it was so good :)  I am very, very pleased and this will be my new go-to.  The egg roll was ok, nothing spectacular, but definitely not bad!  And the broccoli was cooked to crisp perfection, not overdone at all.

59.description: Don't bother. Very greasy. None of the meat seems to be of very high quality. Huge unpalatable chunks of cheap veggies (broccoli, canned water chestnuts). They used to have really, really good crab rangoon. And I remember loving the cold sesame noodles. The portions are large. The delivery is quick. There are better choices; maybe not in Albany Park, but still.

21.description: Never had good food from here. Every once in a while my husband andvi go here because we are starving and need food fast. There is always the same gentleman at the register...this review doesn't reflect anything he did....he's great! But the food is terrible. The meat texture is always off to the point my husband and I had to spit out half of our meals. Honestly every other bite I had to spit something out and im not a picky person. The vegetables in my dish taste as if the cook did not wash them....it had a dirt taste. The crab ragoon taste like just cream cheese no crab....Never again will I go here....even when desperate paying $40 for s bunch of crap I had to throw away because no one will eat it.

17.description: I ordered the general chicken dinner with Brocoli and a egg roll. The food was good overall, the chicken was a little hard but I still enjoyed it! I had enough for 2 people which is great, next time me and a friend are hungry we can grab a bite to eat from here without breaking the bank.I would definitely recommend this place and the cashier was also very friendly!

10.description: I just ordered-delivery. Shrimp fried rice and sesame chicken meal which came with an egg roll and I bought wonton soup.... Wayyy to much food. I could only eat a little of the chicken and rice which was AMAZING! Best I've had in Chicago so far and delivery was fast (under 30minutes).  I'd definitely order both again - especially the shrimp fried rice with extra shrimp (they're the big-medium sized shrimp!). Very happy with the food and delivery this could be trouble because I normally don't order delivery!  :)

5.description: Hands down the best Chinese delivery in the city. Their sweet and spicy chicken wings are amazing they very crispy and saucy. everything always arrives streaming hot and fresh. The orange chicken is also my go to for take out. The delivery is also very quick and affordable.  We love this place and everything it has to offer

3.description: Easy ordering online through Yelp, quick delivery. To meet the minimum requirement, I knew I'd be ordering two meals which I was ok with because who doesn't love leftover Chinese food? I ordered the sweet and sour chicken combination which came with a choice of rice (I chose chicken fried rice) and an egg roll. My second meal, Mongolian beef. Sweet and sour chicken was delicious though I was surprised the sauce came on the side for the chicken. Fried rice was decent. The Mongolian beef was super disappointing. Weird flavor and what kind of Mongolian beef comes with carrots, peas and mushrooms? Typically it's onions and scallions. Conclusion: I will order from here again but will have to find a second entree to meet the minimum requirements. Won't choose the Mongolian beef again.

35.description: Your standard fast food Chinese restaurant. A little on the greasy side but that's pretty much normal for a fast food Chinese restaurant. Did not expect anything unique about this place! If you're passing by with huge hunger then this place might be a deal.

19.description: I stopped eating Chinese food for years and randomly got a craving so I tried their sesame chicken, pork fried rice, spring roll combo and crab rangoon appetizer. The dinner combo was amazing..I've never had better chinese food- the whole experience was great - friendly front of house, and parking for take-out - definitely recommend! :)

28.description: I thought I'd try this place out, the food is edible. I ordered szechuan Beef & Mongolian beef.I tried them side by side. They are the same exact dishes. No creativity or trying to authenticate these dishes with any flavor that discerns one from the other.Many of these hole in the wall chinese fast food places will create any dish you throw at them, but this place doesnt really stand out from other locations that put a little heart into their recipes.Its the McDonalds of Chinese food. A bit disappointed, as I would like to have patronized this business more. But just too bland, no creativity, low quality. I could have got the same meal from a $5 Chun King can at a Jewel grocery store.

45.description: Googled best Chinese delivery in Chicago and this place popped up in top 10. I have to say it was by far the WORST Chinese food I have eaten! Egg rolls were rubbery, couldn't figure out where all the grease at the bottom of bag was coming from. Could have been the Kung Pau Chicken or the Mongolian Beef that had a spoiled rancid smell! The only dish that we were able to eat more than 3 bits was the pineapple chicken fried rice and that was all we could stomach !! For the icing on the cake the delivery man made me come down 3 floors cause he couldn't find parking in front of building. Can you say "no tip"!!

33.description: After a nice stressful day at school a good smoothie would be something I looked for and this place doesn't offer it they used sugar instead of the honey other places use for a better flavor and the fruit smoothie it self at times tastes like the fruit was going bad I would try their food and at times it would taste 5/5 but the soon after I guess they had kitchen staff change that the flavor just went away 1/7

43.description: This was the best Chinese food I've had in a long time! The egg foo young was delicious! Will come back again and again!

2.description: After not eating all day and craving some mangolian beef, we decided to try this place out since a friend recommended us to do so. Unfortunately, it wasn't what I expected. Very few places know how to cook GOOD mangolian beef. This wasn't one of them. By other reviews, I deeply believe they need to focus on this specific item.

18.description: Inexpensive and tasty!!I decided to try this place out yesterday and ordered combination Lo-Mein to go. The order came out very fast! OMG the lo mein was sooo tasty! I am getting hungry right now just writing about it. Lots of meat and not at all greasy!Will def order from this place again! :)

41.description: The food is above average Americanized Chinese...however, they have the rudest delivery man in the restaurant delivery business! I would pass on the place simply because I find his attitude revolting.

52.description: I used to love this place. I have spent probably upwards of $2000 here over the past 5 years. Never, never never again. This evening I drove 30 minutes out of my way and then spent another 15 minutes driving around their block trying to find parking, only to discover that half of the tables in the place were taken up by the employees and their 6 screaming toddlers.The kids were allowed to run havoc all over the restaurant, both into and out of the kitchen. The rest of us were all jammed up on top of each other in the 3 tables that remained for patrons. One child was watching a movie on a cell phone with the volume turned up so loud that I couldn't hear the conversation of anyone in the room. The sound included very loud running water, which is a rage trigger for me. Volume of that movie clocked in at 90 dB based on my cell phone noise meter and it was right in my ear. On top of the screaming kids.I opted to pay for my order and get it to go. I explained to them that the children and movie were far too loud to stay. No apology, no nothing. I drove the 30 minutes back home and am now sitting here with my cold food. My next step will be to report them to the health board for letting the kids run in and out of the kitchen and put their grubby little hands all over the tables, fixtures and patrons' food.I don't care if the food is good or not. These guys do not deserve to have a business anymore.

50.description: Sometimes, life gets stressful. I'm tough and can take it all on. But to take all this on and make dinner too? Too much. And please, let us not talk of dishes or kitchen cleanup right now. I am getting over a truly nasty bronchitis, a close family member was diagnosed with cancer, a big business balance due to the IRS, my assistant had a horrible death in her family and the dog got injured too. Moments like this, my Grandmother would advise to order takeout, take a hot bath and get a good night's sleep before taking on anything more. Takeout? Yes please! Open until 10? Perfect as I didn't get out of work until nearly 8!I mosied about yelp to find nearby Chinese options and found this... excited to find appetizer options that are not deep-fried such as the sauteed green beans (excellent!), steamed broccoli and even brown rice options. Entering to find smiley service and some truly adorable kids? Awesome. I teased the kids about trying on their shoes or trading shoes while the food was prepared- it was a pleasant wait rewarded by a hefty bag of delicious takeout.Boyfriend wanted Orange Chicken and was delighted with the taste and portion size (enough to share or save for next day leftovers) The chicken was moist, tender and delicious. The rice sticky and plump, generous in portion size. The veggies crisp, fresh and flavorful. The packaging was the solid plastic, reusable sort perfect for next day leftovers for lunch. I'd say something nice about the fortune cookies- but the Beagle ate mine- the fortune said "You are practical, analytical and will always get what you want" Yes, yes indeed I did. And here, it is delicious! I put the menu on my fridge, can't wait to come back and order more.Call them or walk in and place your order- they make everything better right away with good food and polite, charming service.P.S. I apologize for not posting pictures of the food- but as I said, there has been considerable stress which this meal helped to relieve. We made it a romantic evening eating outside on our deck, in the moonlight with our beagle. Super-cute, but not camera-friendly. Next time, promise!

4.description: I love this place because the owners are super nice and the food is cook at lightning speed. II's also super cheap- If you're lucky enough to be available for their weekday lunchtime special here, you can get so much food for $5.95. Must try the Sesame Chicken here. Delicious! The place is a tad small though, so big parties might be an issue.

6.description: Decent spot. Very small, dined in. Fast service! Wonton soup was good, chicken & broccoli lunch special included soup or egg roll and fried rice. Good portion and tasted pretty good.

22.description: Inexpensive and tasty!!I decided to try this place out yesterday and ordered combination Lo-Mein to go. The order came out very fast! OMG the lo mein was sooo tasty! I am getting hungry right now just writing about it. Lots of meat and not at all greasy!Will def order from this place again! :)

15.description: The good: From online order to door in exactly 20 minutes, wow. The bad: The food. I spent an embarrassingly long time the other night researching Chinese restaurants that deliver to me and ultimately I picked Wok Cuisine. The reviews were hit or miss, but it seemed better than some other restaurants so I figured it's worth a shot. It did its job, it fed me, it didn't poison me and it satisfied my craving for Chinese food. What it didn't do was make me a fan to order from them the next time I want Chinese food. We ordered:Chicken Fried Rice - Not much flavor, not much chicken, but almost any fried rice is decent. Crab Rangoon - Probably one of the worst crab rangoons I've had. It didn't exactly taste bad, it just didn't really have a taste. Kung Pao Beef - Lots of veggies, not a lot of meat. Nothing to call home about. Sweet & Sour Chicken - Also probably some of the most sub-par sweet & sour chicken I've had. Now the sauce, you can't screw up. I think that stuff just comes in 50 gallon drums and you just have to make the chicken. The problem with the chicken was, it was tiny, tiny chunks of chicken. Lots of breading, not much chicken. Mongolian Beef - Same as Kung Pao, lots of veggies, little meat. Still on the hunt for a good Chinese restaurant that delivers in the Albany/Irving Park neighborhood.

57.description: Way better than Panda Express, the food is good and at reasonable prices! I would not recommend you to dine in since the establishment is small and a bit crowded, but carry out service is phenomenal. The dishes are generously portioned and delicious, or as I say "Deeelishousssss!"

20.description: Hey look-it... If you're looking for General Tso Chicken, there is no better place in the neighborhood.  There is usually seating for everyone, and the lunch special is cheap and spot on.  Hot and Sour soup is worth writing about.  Its a to-go eat in American Chinese place.  Pretty good.  nuff said

36.description: I stopped in for lunch while on an errand in this part of town. What a pleasant surprise to find a real restaurant in this tiny space. Clearly the do a lot of take-out and I saw someone making deliveries. But I ate in, enjoying really tasty, freshly cooked General Tso's chicken, with very good fried rice and an ok egg roll. $7 or so including my soft drink, really friendly service, and a comfortable spot.

14.description: The take-out here was pretty good- I'll definitely give them a 2nd try. Pepper beef, shrimp & scallops were delish. Shrimp in lobster sauce had no black beans (?) and pork chow mein was just OK. No Cantonese pan-fried noodle option is a bit confusing. Classic chinese restaurant pricing - it's a deal!

58.description: I think they put crack in their chicken. I don't understand how it's so good. That sauce... wow. Addicting! I'm only giving 4 stars because I've had their fried rice as well and it was just so-so. I have yet to try anything else though. That chicken is just so good! Maybe one of these days I'll venture away from it and try something new.

56.description: As amazing as ever. Brought three friends who had never been here and declared the wings the best chicken they have ever had. One tip though: I think the spicy version is better, so if you're bringing someone who wants them mild, get two orders. Also had a very nice broccoli with oyster mushroom. The jajangmyun is amazing, but the gun cha jang is similar and a little lighter in flavor, worth trying.

29.description: Wings were good if you like double or triple fried wings. Service, like others mentioned, was pretty bad for both dining in and take-out. Overall, not worth the headache of getting there and putting up with the cramped space.

42.description: This place always has me torn. The food (lollipop wings) is always good, but the service is horrendous! I always try to call in my order and when I did this last two times, someone took my order the first day and on the second day, it took 15 minutes to get through. This place could be so much bigger and better, but the ownership is the same and they unfortunately lack vision.

23.description: Great Sea is one of my favorite restaurants.  I have been going there on many occasions.  Every dish I've ordered have been simply delicious and authentic.   To those who gave low reviews, apparently, you don't know what to order.  If you're not sure what to order in a restaurant, ask the wait staff for their recommendations!

47.description: The service is not the greatest, but the food is fucking amazing.  Big portions and great taste.

8.description: Worst place ever! Just finished having dinner with my friend and the service was absolutely HORRIBLE!!! Server was completely rude., had no cordination on serving food., and OVERPRICED. To top it off we couldn't split the check with 2 cards and after paying they said they didn't charge my card for the tip. Server would not let up on us not tipping her and when my friend did not tip for the horrible service she gave us attitude and turned around. Never coming back here in my life!!

31.description: Great Sea is located at the end of the Kimball brown line. I have a friend that rides the brown line from the Loop to Kimball just to eat these wings. I have had the wings courtesy of fellow Yelper Eva S, and I was excited to share this with two visitors from Seattle. We ordered the wings ($15.95) for takeout, and there was only a ten-minute wait time. One can choose from three spice levels. I opted for medium spice, which is a balance of sweet and heat. The wings come with a takeout container of white rice. I reheated the wings and rice for dinner that evening (350 degrees for 15 minutes), and the girls and I finished the wings in minutes. My visitors had never had Korean chicken wings before, and these wings hit the spot. Sweet with just a little kick, the medium spice wings are recommended for those with a lower spice tolerance. Like B-Dubs, Great Sea also sells bottles of its wing sauce.

34.description: Clearly, I should've gotten the wings, but they were kinda pricey and we just wanted to have some greasy, Friday night Chinese. We ordered orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken, and some fried rice.  The food was so bad, I threw it all away and went hungry.  To their credit, the staff we encountered was very nice, but I may honestly never be back.

16.description: Chicken wings.This is a Chinese-Korean restaurant. Maybe it should pick one cuisine and make it better. But the way it is, I'd say go with chicken wings & Chinese food. Also, when the check came out it said, "Please Tip in Cash." Well, we didn't, and the server made sure to remind us before we left to tip in cash, because well, servers in Asian restaurants can do that.

13.description: The food here is good and greasy. Staff is very nice but just bad english point blank. Main issue ive seen here is keeping clean and never remodeled. P.S changed your dirty carpet and add ventalation to that muggy smelly restaurant. You can afford it obviously because your so busy.

11.description: Come for the wings. Spicy, tangy and sweet. The cost seems pricey, till you see the portion size, then it is actually very reasonable! Seriously, get the wings as carryout, and skip the dine-in experience.Waitstaff was so-so. The waitress tended to interact with my husband, rather than both of us, which I found a little annoying. The menu was fairly small and the quality was mediocre at best.     Also, this place had the worst tea I've ever had at a Chinese restaurant! Tasted like there was only one teabag used in the whole pot. I'd come in hoping for some pan-fried noodles and pressed duck, but didn't see it on the menu. I had the shrimp & scallops which was extremely bland. (However, mix a bit of the left over wing sauce in, and it is MUCH better!)

39.description: The best fried chicken that I ever had...So delicious and black noodles is great too. Tip has to pay by cash!!! Definitely will returning again.

37.description: (Based solely on wings and rice)...Finally.  Finally.  I can't believe it took me so long.  Let's blame laziness and/or ignorance as I lived only a few short blocks away.  So here it is...the wings are as advertised if not better.  For $15 you get a healthy platter of wings and rice.  I'd say go here at least once if not twice if not weekly or daily.  Remember we are talking about wings here and not actually the chinese portion of the menu but this place does deliver.

0.description: Okay let's start this off by saying the atmosphere is meh. The walls are white and mirrored. The chairs are barely staying together and the floor is spotty. BUT those chicken wings!!! That's why everyone goes there. They're phenomenal! Literally finger lickin' good. Was here over the weekend bc of the rave reviews. So glad I go to experience this deliciousness. We ordered a plate of non-spicy wings. I would have preferred spicy but it's ok. The non spicy was really good. They were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. They were well seasoned with a sweet sauce. I was not disappointed in the least. Also ordered a plate of beef fried rice. That was not my favorite to be honest. It had too many peas and not enough flavor. The sauce from the wings was tasty on the rice though.I would highly recommend stopping to get wings to go if you're craving wings.

38.description: Come for the wings. Spicy, tangy and sweet. The cost seems pricey, till you see the portion size, then it is actually very reasonable! Seriously, get the wings as carryout, and skip the dine-in experience.Waitstaff was so-so. The waitress tended to interact with my husband, rather than both of us, which I found a little annoying. The menu was fairly small and the quality was mediocre at best.     Also, this place had the worst tea I've ever had at a Chinese restaurant! Tasted like there was only one teabag used in the whole pot. I'd come in hoping for some pan-fried noodles and pressed duck, but didn't see it on the menu. I had the shrimp & scallops which was extremely bland. (However, mix a bit of the left over wing sauce in, and it is MUCH better!)

51.description: Pretty good Jjam bbong and jja jja myun.  The kampongee was delicious although different from NYC.  The place is pretty run down and dirty, but I kind of expected that.  Service was okay, kind of annoying to ask us to order when we only have 2 menus for a party of 6.  This place was pretty solid.

27.description: I've heard about this Korean Chinese Restaurant in Chicago and I decided to check out for lunch when I had quick trip up to Chicago with my mom lol. I parked on the street and we had a quick lunch. The chicken wings (Kang Poong Gi-korean way of saying it) here have had a of buzz for awhile and we started off with that. They were good and I like the way they cut the wings-really unique, but I wish they were spicier. We also got the Jjampong (spicy noodle seafood soup) it was good but could of used possibly a little more variety in seafood (other than shrimp). I would go here again for the wings and it's definitely a hole in the wall place.

32.description: Get the chicken, and Jajangmyeon.  oh my, you will find the best korean chinese food if you order these two.

54.description: Don't eat here for the ambiance. No circus. Just chicken wings. They are just the right balance of sweet, spicy, and crispy. The shrimp version is just as tasty if you want to go the surf route as well. They've apparently caught on to the popularity of the sauce and bottled (it's actually a small jar) it up for purchase at the counter. We like to bring a jar home and use it on any unwarranted protein for that taste of chicken wing heaven.They are generous with their white rice. Stick with the white. The fried rice is just so-so and actually on the wetter side for my taste. The black bean sauce noodles used to be tastier, but because I can't get them anywhere within a 30-minute drive from me I still order them because...well, black bean sauce noodles, duh.They accept credit cards but CASH ONLY FOR TIPS. If you have ever waited tables, you know this is the preferred tip anyway so don't get your undies in a bunch.

48.description: First time that I tried their food. Hot and Spicy Chicken Wings and they were delicious. A friend brought some by so I haven't yet had the opportunity to try other menu items but I know I would like to have the wings again..

44.description: I went to get wings to-go..Stayed for wonton soup and egg rolls. Waitress messed up order, brought us food that we didn't order.. And only one order of wings to-go instead of two.. I'll go back.. Because the wings were good. That good. Similar to the "Tokyo Drunettes" at the old Japonais.. And the wings at Joong Boo. Yum

24.description: Had the sweet and spicy wings and they did not disappoint! The only thing I would recommend is to avoid showing up 30-60 minutes before they close, as they made me feel rushed the entire time I ate. Outside of that, will probably be going back for seconds soon!

7.description: I've heard about this Korean Chinese Restaurant in Chicago and I decided to check out for lunch when I had quick trip up to Chicago with my mom lol. I parked on the street and we had a quick lunch. The chicken wings (Kang Poong Gi-korean way of saying it) here have had a of buzz for awhile and we started off with that. They were good and I like the way they cut the wings-really unique, but I wish they were spicier. We also got the Jjampong (spicy noodle seafood soup) it was good but could of used possibly a little more variety in seafood (other than shrimp). I would go here again for the wings and it's definitely a hole in the wall place.

49.description: Wings. only wings. nothing but wings. Others have said good things about other things. But wings.  Cool story though last time we went some large table behind us had a magician show up for some lady's birthday, then 5 minutes into the magic show her bf pops the question. We were all like "wtf who proposes at a chinese restaurant" but w/e it was dinner and a show lol. Did I mention wings?

40.description: Food and service was great.  Wings are definitely a must try!  We went to a different restaurant, but due to the awful weather the original restaurant was not operational.  Found this place and they accommodated a large party well :-)  Will definitely go again.

53.description: I'm so in love with this place...Chachangmyun so good. To be completely honest my husband isn't crazy about it, however, this isn't his review. =] My son and I can't get enough.Chambong also ridiculously good. Spicy hot deliciousness in my tummy.The spicy tofu... I love tofu. Like, for real. But this? I lurve it so hard.And now... the gangpongghi... spicy Korean chicken wings. TO DIE FOR.The restrooms are clean. The service is good. Totally worth my gas coming from Indiana. Totally.

30.description: four on the chicken wings! they are so good. I was not thrilled with the rest if the menu. the food was average to below average. my family and I eat the wings at least once a month!

46.description: Delicious wings and black noodles. Service kind of sucks but just order those two things, eat and pay and you'll be fine

1.description: I've been here countless times with the family. It's a great family chinese food place. Mom and Dad have been going here since they started dating back in 1995, so it's great to see the owners recognize us every time we come. Our traditional order: kam-pung-gi (spicy chicken wings), egg drop soup, mongolian beef, jja-jang noodle, jam-pong noodle, sweet and sour pork, and sometimes fried rice. But all orders include rice and kimchi and pickled onion side dish so it's not necessary to order fried rice.This has to be the best chinese place in all of Illinois.

55.description: Chicken wings.This is a Chinese-Korean restaurant. Maybe it should pick one cuisine and make it better. But the way it is, I'd say go with chicken wings & Chinese food. Also, when the check came out it said, "Please Tip in Cash." Well, we didn't, and the server made sure to remind us before we left to tip in cash, because well, servers in Asian restaurants can do that.

9.description: Very good spicy fried wings.  They give you a healthy portion and push up the meat on the wings so that the bone is exposed.  This allows for easy consumption.  The flavor is a spicy/sweet sensation, amazing!  The jajangmyun is above average.  However, service is not so great, staff is not the friendliest.  I'd opt for take out.  The wings warrant a 4 star rating.

26.description: Lollipop chicken!!! It's the best thing on the menu and. It's about $14 for a platter which can comfortably feed 2/3 ppl. The hot and sour soup is good here also!

25.description: please please please get the chicken and jajangmien(?), the sauce on the chicken is tangy but not generic, amazing and makes you crave for more, the noodles are a great plus to your meal and offers a different flavor to the chicken

12.description: I came to this restaurant to have dinner and it was the worst experience ever! Food was overpriced and the service was terrible. The employees that work there have no sort of manners and didn't want to let me and my friend leave because we didn't leave a tip. No one is entitled to ask for a tip if they don't deserve it after being rude. Am I right?

59.description: This place was recommended to me years ago so I was delighted when a friend and I happened to stumble upon it in her hood last weekend.  It's dine in, quick moving, mostly Asian clientele.  We were seated quick despite the lack of two person tables avail, she seated us at a table for 8.  When larger parties walked in and had to wait, I felt bad for like one second until I had a sweet and spicy chicken wing in my grip and that feeling left me quick!  These wings!!  These wings are the best wings everrrrrrrrrrrr!!  They sell the sauce bottled at the cashier.  They are juicy and crispy and huge.  There were tables of dudes bellied up to a couple plates of wings, it was like the Chinese-Korean version of Superbowl Sunday, with less cussing.  We also ordered the Mongolian Beef -- this was the dish that was recommended to me way back when and it was delicious.  The quality of food here is refreshing when you're used to eating typical Chinese take out, very fresh and authentic.  We also ordered King Pao Chicken which is actually my go to order of all time, and that was awesome as well.  Nice and spicy, fresh veggies, lots of peanuts and no heavy brown sauces.  Food came quick, then the waitress pretty much leaves you alone until you flag her down.  I probably could of used a gallon of water by the end of that meal, but my glass was empty after like the first couple bites and no one refilled us.  Forgiven.  I'll be back with a gallon of my own water.

21.description: I don't usually eat boned wings but this place makes it very easy to eat and the wings are very meaty. Amazing taste you kinda get addicted and can't stop eating. Put the extra sauce you have left from the wings onto the rice it's awesome

17.description: Don't eat here for the ambiance. No circus. Just chicken wings. They are just the right balance of sweet, spicy, and crispy. The shrimp version is just as tasty if you want to go the surf route as well. They've apparently caught on to the popularity of the sauce and bottled (it's actually a small jar) it up for purchase at the counter. We like to bring a jar home and use it on any unwarranted protein for that taste of chicken wing heaven.They are generous with their white rice. Stick with the white. The fried rice is just so-so and actually on the wetter side for my taste. The black bean sauce noodles used to be tastier, but because I can't get them anywhere within a 30-minute drive from me I still order them because...well, black bean sauce noodles, duh.They accept credit cards but CASH ONLY FOR TIPS. If you have ever waited tables, you know this is the preferred tip anyway so don't get your undies in a bunch.

10.description: I know of a few Chinese places that probably have all-around food better than here, but the only one thing none of them can top are the black bean noodles. I don't know how the chef does it, but he really makes the noodles and sauce right. Every other Chinese place I've been to [and I have been around] especially has a tendency to make the sauce too thick with pork fat and starch, but it's not that way here. I don't even care that it's located on slightly grungy Lawrence; I would go and forgive everything just for the noodles.

5.description: Literally the best. Great Seas is my go to place for Chinese-Korean food. Most people know great seas for being the originator of Lollipop Chicken Wings in Chicago, but to me, Great Seas is way more than that.  They have traditional Chinese dishes, but what my family and friends go for are the Chinese-Korean dishes. These dishes bring fond memories of visiting South Korea and in Korea they deliver these meals in proper plates, bowls and dishes and when you are done you just leave it outside you house and they pick it up.  (Crazy I Know!)  At Great Seas, We order family style and share. Some of our must order foods are the Tangsuyuk (sweet and sour crisy pork, this is not your usually sweet and sour dish as its a bit brighter and lighter), JJampong (spicy seafood noodle sou), Lollipop Chicken Wings (we only get it Korean Spicy style)And to finish we get jjajangmyeon (black noodles).  The only other places that I know that serve this style food is Yu's in Schaumburg and a wack version at H-Mart.  A few tips are that they take credit card, but only do cash tips, which means it is always a good idea to bring a few bucks to tip the servers.  Also, they sell the sauce in bottles for the Chicken Wings, so you can use it at home.

3.description: My friend took me here since I was craving fried chicken for the longest time. We got here pretty early around 5 pm, so plenty of parking / seated right away. This restaurant is located in a ghetto er area, and you would never have guessed that a restaurant located here would have such delicious food. Definitely hole in the walll with the most minimal decoration, but super clean restrooms ! We ordered the chicken lollipops extra spicy, and the spicy seafoood soup.  We could have done without the seafoood soup and just ordered the chicken. The chicken & noodle soup came out in less than 10 min.  The chicken was so fresh and steaming.  The sauce was thick and vinegarry sweet and also deliciously spicy.  The bones were fried to a crisp!! Just the way I like them.  They also serve rice with the wings as welll. The noodle soup was passable but it was nice to order something that wasn't just wings. They also give a side of radish kimchi. $15 for wings $10 for noodle soup. Portion size is huge !!! Next time I'm coming I will order the plain wings as welll.

35.description: I've been coming here for over 20 years but today I wasn't happy with this place. They need to keep this this place clean. I will never eat in this place again.. Plus I found bone in the water. Good luck with your junky restaurant.

19.description: The BEST wings in Chicago, hands down! All the food is good here, but the wings are awesome! Highly recommended.

28.description: My family and I have discovered Great Sea wings few years back and we always come back for birthdays and whatnot. I also have ordered wings to go for my job and everybody loved it! The wait time wasn't that long, and the food was hot after I picked it up and got to work. You can get the wings mild or spicy. Either way, they're pretty sweet and they serve them looking like drum sticks.The location is convenient- you can take the cta and it takes you right by the restaurant, or you can park in the street but pay to park. The ambience is casual and relaxing, and the servers are pretty nice.While the wings are on top of my recommendation list, they also have pretty good Chinese food. Second on my recommendations is their crab rangoon.

45.description: Love this inexpensive Korean-Chinese fusion restaurant. Love their jajamyun, and their jampong is good there too. But what I love most about the place is the Chicken Wings!! If you don't get anything there, get the Chicken Wings!! Yummm. :)

33.description: Went their for their wings...and needless to say they were delicious!!! I also had their family soup and it was great.. my sister tried their shrimp fried rice and it was great! I also loved that they have the special wing sauce that you can take home!!  I bought a couple of sauces to make at home and looking forward to it..

43.description: We had ordered take out here one night based on the great reviews. We did not get the raved about wings. We had gotten the Mongolian beef and the black noodles. The beef was very delicious. I didn't try the noodles but the boyfriend enjoyed them. We decided to go here for lunch and try the wings that everyone is raving about. We ordered egg rolls, chicken wings, and beef in oyster sauce. The beef was horrible. It has a weird texture and was very bland. The wings were ok. Not hot and spicy at all. Egg rolls had a weird filling. Also they had alcohol on the menu but they didn't know how to make cocktails. Overall we were very disappointed.

2.description: Lollipop chicken wings is really the only thing you want to come here for.  And I recommend you get them as take out to enjoy in your own home.I brought the whole family one snowy miserable night and had to pay the meter to park down the block.  There is no private parking.  Place was packed and a little claustrophobic.  No windows.  Not that one would like the view of Lawrence Ave anyway.The neighborhood is not a bad area but on the night we were here some of the patrons, and most notably the take out patrons, looked like they were here after a visit to a methadone clinic.Friendly service with limited English.  We ordered a selection of entrees and also had to try the wings as an appetizer.  We clearly ordered soup, then wings, then entree.  I was actually very clear about this.  They forgot the soup, then wings and entrees came all at once.  Wife said the wings were good but everything else was the worst Chinese food she ever had.  I'd probably agree.We tried this place because of the great Yelp reviews.  I try not to nail places with one star but  Great Sea failed us terribly.

18.description: Great Sea's hot and spicy chicken wings make a running for the best asian chicken wings in the United States of America (Not an exaggeration). I have friends in different states that aren't even from Chicago that know about this place and rave about it. The chicken wings never disappoint. The chicken wing sauce is soo good that I bring any leftover sauce home, put it in my toothpaste and brush my teeth with it.  The Jajangmyun is very delicious as well, and serves as the perfect complimenting dish with the chicken wings. *Note: You can pay your meal with card, but you HAVE to tip in cash. They don't give you the option to tip on your card. They have an ATM in the restaurant if you need to use it. *Note 2: Hot tea and Korean Radish Kimchee is free, but you might have to ask for it.

41.description: Very disappointing experience for me. The food was subpar at best. The neighborhood area is unsettling, run-down, and dirty.  I got the wrong server on my visit. Was rude from the time I sat down and acted like she was mad. Maybe she had a bad day with someone else that looked like me, I donno. Maybe other guys before me didn't leave her any tip. Ordered spicy chicken wings and black bean noodles. The server lady didn't bring out the standard sides that comes with this item. Since she never came back to check on the table, I went up to the counter to ask for it. I was kind and courteous like I always am.Afterwards they brought me the check. It didn't have a tip section, so I drew my own line and added the tip. Another lady who brought the check to me looked at the receipt, then asked me if I had cash instead (in Korean).  I said no, sorry I don't have cash (I already checked my pockets). She then restated that they only take cash for tip.  So I said, well, I have cash in my car... At this time the first server (who acted like she was mad at me) joined the table, so figuring they can work it out themselves, I just walked out.  Based on the service I got, it would have been justified to not leave a tip and never come back. I am a very easy customer. I rarely ask for anything. If I can get it myself, I do it myself (whether it's napkins or to-go boxes). But I decided to do my part by giving a decent tip--in hope that maybe the server will feel better.So you heard it here. They don't want tips unless it's in cash.As a side note, this is my first time here at "Korea Town". But in reality, objectively speaking, it should be Mexico Town. 6 of 10 businesses are Mexican, and the people walking on the sidewalk are mostly of Latin decent.  Customers were mostly Mexican/Hispanic as well during my 40-min lunch. So this area definitely has more of the latin flair.Also, their wings are definitely nothing to talk about in my opinion. That's just me. The way they make it is kinda over fried. I generally don't like anything that's too fried and greasy. BWW has better wings that this place any day of the week.

52.description: Chicken wings are delicious! Went to a BBQ and someone brought them to the party. Love these chicken wings! We plan on going to the restaurant soon to try other food.

50.description: All I can say is this is the best Chinese restaurant place have ever been to. I drive 1 hour away with my boyfriend about once a month just to eat dinner their. Other than the wings rice and everything is a 5 star! :-)

4.description: Food was ok, ate the chicken wings they were really good, pretty expensive also ate chicken fried rice that was also okay but I will definitely go back when I'm in the mood for the wings.

6.description: Great Sea is located at the end of the Kimball brown line. I have a friend that rides the brown line from the Loop to Kimball just to eat these wings. I have had the wings courtesy of fellow Yelper Eva S, and I was excited to share this with two visitors from Seattle. We ordered the wings ($15.95) for takeout, and there was only a ten-minute wait time. One can choose from three spice levels. I opted for medium spice, which is a balance of sweet and heat. The wings come with a takeout container of white rice. I reheated the wings and rice for dinner that evening (350 degrees for 15 minutes), and the girls and I finished the wings in minutes. My visitors had never had Korean chicken wings before, and these wings hit the spot. Sweet with just a little kick, the medium spice wings are recommended for those with a lower spice tolerance. Like B-Dubs, Great Sea also sells bottles of its wing sauce.

22.description: Wings. Wings! They are so good.  This is my Sunday Funday go-to lunch spot.  It's so chill inside compared to the hectic Lawrence Ave traffic outside. Of course, I got the wings and fried rice.  The bubble teas are ok not the best I have to admit. I had to get crab rangoon too tho... It have a problem, love those things.  This is definitely a neighborhood favorite. So many loyal partons come by just for the wings.  I wanna know what's their secret.  These wings remind me of my childhood best friends mom's cooking.  This is the closest I've ever come to her wings here in the States.

15.description: Great Sea is one of my favorite restaurants.  I have been going there on many occasions.  Every dish I've ordered have been simply delicious and authentic.   To those who gave low reviews, apparently, you don't know what to order.  If you're not sure what to order in a restaurant, ask the wait staff for their recommendations!

57.description: Wings and fried rice were amazing. You can tell that the chicken was fresh. The wings was all that I saw people ordering. I would definitely come here again, despite the service. It took a few minutes to get noticed when we entered and the waitresses gum accidentally dropped in the bowl of white rice when she spoke. Thank God we don't like that rice. Pretty gross, but you could tell how embarrassed she was. She also apologized several times. So Id recommend it for the food, not the service.

20.description: Their wings are divine! In my opinion they are just completely crave-able and memorable.  They are unlike any other wings I've tasted before and I'm not even a wing person.  They're fully coated with the reddest sweet and savory sauce and they're crispy on the outside yet perfectly cooked inside.  Portion of wings for the price was good.  Had the fried rice and rangoons and they were ordinarily good but you won't forget those chicken wings!

36.description: This review is based purely on the wings that someone picked up from here for a BBQ that I attended. They were delicious and that sauce is amazing. Can't comment beyond that other than to say this was hubby's favorite meal growing up in Chi-town.

14.description: Horrible! The food was good, but nothing special and we felt very rushed by our waiter. He convinced us that we should order everything at once and he would pace it, but the dishes came out one right after the other. The drinks were very good though!

36.description: 24-hours?  that means I can sleep here, right?  Got about ten baked goods hot off the racks for under five bucks.  Tamales are only available on the weekends.  I would imagine the breads would make good dinner rolls, but I went with eating it while shuffling through the bag and simultaneously walking down the street. This is especially delicious while also falling on icy sidewalks.  Great desserts, friendly staff, and everything is completely fresh.  I'm bringing my sleeping bag next time.  I will sleep with tongs clutched to my chest for quick pastry-snatching in the middle of the night.

29.description: This place may prove to be my healthy eating downfall.  How can I resist so many tasty sweets for under $1.  At that price, I would go everyday except I don't want to gain 10lbs.  While I am not a huge fan of their cookies (they are too crispy - I prefer chewy), Markellos seems to specialize in pastries anyway.  Their selection is huge, and always fresh since they are open 24/7.  I steer toward the flakey ones with fruit fillings.  These taste as good if not better than many of the pastries available at high-end bakeries in Wicker Park, but for a quarter of the price.

42.description: this is one of the only bakeries in the city where you can get traditional Guatemalen baked goods (like the toasty thin lightly sweetned champurradas - think of a big ass cookie that isn't too sweet, but they do not add the little toasted sesame seeds like they do in Guatemala) - these are baked goodies - to be enjoyed with a big cup of joe. Stuff is relatively authentic - they even have Guatemalen tamales and stuffed peppers - Brings me back to my childhood when I spent summers in Guatemala - And YES - you can get a ton of baked goodies for super cheap - super super cheap Last night I got literally 24 of their big champurradas, plus six rolls (just out of the oven) and two other pastries for $6.65... is that legal???I like it - a lot!!!

23.description: Dear Carbaholic, When you come visit, please know that there will always be this 24 hour bakery at our disposal.  I can treat you, as the bill will probably be a total of $10, and BOTH of us will leave with a bag full of Mexican bread items.  Unlike most Chicago places, and all New York spots, parking is plenty.  What would you like? Churros, French bread, banana filled baked empanadas or an assortment of cookies?  Pick them all, no problem!  I'll fit the bill! Please remember me when I visit you in NYC.  I know there are plenty of 24 hour joints there, so places, including bakeries here in Chicago, should get the same kind of respect.Love, The Bullmoose Queen akaYour Chicago Yelp Buddy

31.description: Holy cow! The walls of this place are lined with cases of baked goods. It is self-serve so grab a basket from the counter and help yourself. They have a huge variety of stuff. Sheet pans of hot rolls are continually brought out from the kitchen.  They aren't the best rolls in the world but they are cheap, hot, and tasty. Open 24 hours and they have FREE PARKING!

34.description: I was so pleased when I walked in and grabbed a pair of tongs and a basket! What fun! Everything looked so good and the bakers were in the back whipping up more tasty treats as I selected mine. The staff was really nice and I stocked up for super cheap. I will totally trek out here again soon.

16.description: Best coffee cake ever

11.description: So I decided to go early and check out the place in a different time in the day......GLAD I DID !I got couple cookies, odds and ends and yummy flan.I even got tamales.. wrapped in banana leaf.it was heavy on the account of most of it was masa and little meat but delicious never the less!Definitely advise newbies,to check it out!

39.description: A panaderia open 24 hours???? Crazy but true! Markellos is open 24 hours,so next time you get a sweet tooth at 3am,you know where to head to. They have a nice selection of sweets, ranging from churros to the famous conchas and orejas.The prices are light, and I managed to walk out of there with a hefty bag of pan dulce to last me a couple of days for under 7 bucks.(I have a big appetite so a couple of days is alot) I've been meaning to go back on a day when they have tamales,which i heard are tasty as well.

37.description: Still going there and still pretty gosh darn awesome.

0.description: Grab your personal basket and tongs to make your selections from the cashier. The croissant and the pineapple pastries were the standouts on the sweet side. For savories you have to wait until the weekend when they have Guatemalan tamales and chili relleno - those were immense. No labels on most of the pastries so if you like surprises this place is for you!

38.description: This 24-hour bakery offers traditional Guatemalan and Mexican pastries, cookies, muffins, and bread.  I've been going here for years, usually getting their warm, fresh-baked rolls. When you first walk in, you notice the huge sheet pans of rolls in the middle of the store.  Grab a basket & tongs and go for it!  They are delicious and ridiculously cheap.  The bakers in the back are constantly working, so there's always a new batch of warm pastries or bread out.I stopped by here recently and bought some rolls, tamales, and stuffed peppers.  The tamales were filled with pork in a mild sauce, wrapped in banana leaves and foil.  The masa was very moist, probably due to the fact that they were wrapped in banana leaves.  The stuffed poblano peppers were filled with chicken, potatoes, and minced carrots, dipped in an egg batter, and lightly fried.  They were both delicious.For under $9, you can buy 4 fresh-baked rolls, 2 tamales, and 2 stuffed peppers, which turned out to be a great lunch for my bf and I.  They also offer churros, slices of cake, and flan.  This small bakery is very popular in Albany Park, and you'll see people here at all hours of the day getting fresh-baked bread.

27.description: Nice place....small storefront...and odd I originally thought this was a Greek Bakery (I swear it is/was) but the buzz is now it is a spanish bakery.  And 24 hours.2 staff in front that were helpful (alittle language barrier) abd it was a quick in and out.  Reminded me of a small bakery from the 70s. LOLNow I know these guys used to be up by Lawrence and Rockford in old greektown back in the day, and I know they moved to their current location.  I seen greek bread (for church) in there, but they dont have baugettes and whatnot (I kinda think this is odd as they had rolls though)   I bought a spanish brownie (very rich and powdery) it was ok.  Bought some other stuff that I may bring with me to Joe's moon rising event tomorrow.Oh yeah....they dont take credit cards.  Be warned.Updated....it is a Greek owner who grew up in South America, he still makes Greek breads and such but specializes in Hispanic treats.

32.description: We went to a picnic / reunion today in one of the forest preserves out near The Little Red School House. We stopped here and picked up a bunch of the jumbo cookies, some with m&m's, some with chocolate chips and some with sprinkles and a bag full of churros. We knew there would be lots of kids at the picnic and to say the bakery goods went over well would be an understatement!!! Was so cute to see little kids running around with those big old cookies and having a great time. They were the first thing to go. Hmmmm, saw the big kid I am married to having one too now that I think about it!!!

13.description: The cream filled pastries are good, but don't buy the cookies, they have a really strange taste to them.

24.description: Open 24 hours, and packed as if it was 6am at all of those hours. Tiny place, but ever so popular. I always thought it was like, the best kept secret in the chicago hispanic world, but I guess word is getting out.To specify, they specialize in guatemalan and mexican bread. The guy is greek so they have ocassional greek goodies too. Credit cards not accepted, but you shouldnt need it bc its super cheap.Go for the pirujo bread! AKA, the small roll-looking bread in racks smack in the middle of the bakery floor. and you want to go when they are fresh out! You can tell when you see hoards packing in the middle to fight for bread. No less than a purchase of 10 accepted(JK, but seriously, youll eat like 3 of them on your walk/drive home alone). Just follow the smell and you will find it. Eat it with frijoles and queso. YummmMinus star only because sometimes its super packed that its hard to find parking and sometimes you have to wait for baskets/tongs. But seriously, $10 will get you enough bread for the week.

7.description: Giant cookies for, I think, 65cents! The flan and tres leches were also super yummy. I get the urge to stop there all the time since everything is so cheap... Highly recommended!

40.description: This bakery is as cosmopolitan as it gets. It serves Guatemalan baked goods, is owned by a Greek guy, possesses no concept of a time zone,  and has an ambiance and lines reminiscent of Communist Russia. You must check your American-bred snootiness and love of sterility at the door, cause this place doesn't waste time on extraneous activities such as "sweeping" or "cleaning the tongs between customers". Don't expect it to rival a Parisan bakery in terms of quality, but there's something comforting about this place...something akin to hearing an Amy Grant song on the radio.

30.description: 24 hour bakery? SIGN.ME.UP. The real reason I go to Markello's is because of their Guatemalan tamales (only available on weekends). I mean, I can't wait until Christmas to get my tamale fix from my mom, so I go there.  The tamales are pretty good, they could use more meat, though. But they also have my favorite Guatemalan bread (and I use the term loosely, it's more like a cookie), champurradas. MMMMM, dip them in milk--that is, if you can make it home without eating them all first.  They also have empanadas (no, not the savory kind, they are stuffed with this amazing coconutty filling), another favorite. Other than the fact that they're 24 hours, the best part is the smells of the fresh bread and peeking into the back and seeing the bakers baking! Why are you still reading this? Go get some bread!!!

1.description: My last visit here was a bust. I was super excited to take my friends to what had been my favorite local bakery, but everything i got this time tasted stale. Unsure if I got there at a bad time this time- but inconsistency is definitely a downer. The Danish pastries are usually great as is Everything else I tried the first several times I came here. Oh but The donuts are awful-- they taste like someone frosted a dense crouton.

9.description: Fresh and affordable, prices are unbelievable!  I walked out with a shopping bag full of fresly baked goods for under $15 & the croissants are sooooo good!

26.description: I hate to be a wet blanket but this place was lacking. It had some merits and faults which balanced out to mediocre.The Good: A big selection and a friendly staff. Very cheap and open 24 hours. The Bad: The pastries are quite mediocre; they're just saturated with butter and sugar and lack any real complexity in flavor. The savory items are just oily and gross, to be avoided for sure. And they have no descriptions on any of the items. Although you can ask easily enough, it's mildly annoying.

25.description: I am a great lover of Mexican bread (its not a pastry, its just bread with sugar and spices). I was raised there and there was always Mexican bread in our table. The selection is small but fresh and very good. Avoid the cake-looking stuff, stick to the staples and you'll be  happy. Very good bread.

12.description: How have you not ever heard of this bakery? Get in the car. Yes, right now. I know it is 11:00pm- now! lets go! I am a textbook insomniac... Don't sleep much and may be incapable of sleeping an entire night. Thus, it is not unusual to find me awake at 1, 2, 3:00am. It is however, unusual for me to find a place that welcomes anyone at those odd time intervals and serves delicious carbs!!Weekends can be interesting. It is even more unusual to find a place open at 5:00am before Boyfriend's Saturday 6:00am competitive swim group (yup) or has something he enjoys eating- tamales? Not my choice for breakfast but he is all over it. Turnovers are delicious. Banana Bread? Yum! Try it. Cash only. Worth going to an ATM at two am to obtain cash, promise.

21.description: This is a 24 hour bakery.  That automatically makes it amazing.Cash only.I miss having this place within walking distance.  It is a gem.  Once in the while, the churros are kind of soggy/not the freshest,  but they're so delicious either way.  The other treats and breads are amazing as well.   I try to stop in whenever I'm in the area and I love knowing I can literally do this whenever I want.

17.description: 24 hour bakery? SIGN.ME.UP. The real reason I go to Markello's is because of their Guatemalan tamales (only available on weekends). I mean, I can't wait until Christmas to get my tamale fix from my mom, so I go there.  The tamales are pretty good, they could use more meat, though. But they also have my favorite Guatemalan bread (and I use the term loosely, it's more like a cookie), champurradas. MMMMM, dip them in milk--that is, if you can make it home without eating them all first.  They also have empanadas (no, not the savory kind, they are stuffed with this amazing coconutty filling), another favorite. Other than the fact that they're 24 hours, the best part is the smells of the fresh bread and peeking into the back and seeing the bakers baking! Why are you still reading this? Go get some bread!!!

10.description: Thank god for this place! Recommended by a friend with delicious pictures I had to check this place out.  They bake fresh 24/7. What more could you ask for? The cheese Danish,  Conchas and bolillos are on point.  I'm so happy to find such an awesome bakery close to my house.  Will definitely be back,  all the time.

5.description: Who could have guessed the best latin bakery of the city would be hidden in this modest spot?Who could have guessed the best latin bakery is owned by a Greek guy?Who could have guessed they would be open 24/7 and work a like sweat-shop for your urgent late night carb needs?Who could have guessed the best churros in the city is actually made here?Who could have guessed you can buy a huge Flan cake-high quality here for the price of two cheesecakes in Starbucks?Now let's come to the facts. Yes this is a good bakery and they have good products. There are some cons of course. If you want to get a churros, you have to be early. they never last.Of course for their price range you can not expect gourmet french patisserie products. I read some reviews here written by true ignint duchebgs. Yes not ignorant but ignint!For the price and quality no other bakery can beat Markellos, for those stupid critics here please stay in Lakeview and Andersonville and keep paying 5-6$ each for your penny size pastries then be happy then come here and say they were yummy.

35.description: The greatest neighborhood bakery in town.As stated in my previous review, I have gone to Markello's bakery ever since it opened in the 1990's.  Some things never change and I can always count that walking past the bakery I am enticed by the aroma of freshly baked goods.  These days I walk in and am always surprised by the things that I find in there.  They sell bread crumbs, Italian bread, rolls good for making sandwiches and for dipping into soups.  If you've got a sweet tooth they have all sorts of pastries to whet your appetite from chocolate chip cookies to goat cheese filled pastries and banana bread.  Markello's always smells great and they are open any day any time you can count your life on it.  They are a foundation of the community and my friends are always jealous that I have such a badass bakery at my disposal.Customer for life.

19.description: 24 Hours of Happiness!I visited Markello's for the first time as I promised some colleagues I would pick up some great Guatemalan/Mexican goodies.  The selection is great and the pastries and breads looked so delicious!  I left with two paper bags full of goodies for under $15.  What a deal!Markello's is cash only, so come prepared!  They are open 24/7, so you have no excuse to not pay a visit!

28.description: This is a great bakery.  I can't believe it is open 24 hours a day.  The pastries are always fresh and amazing.  Very authentic Mexican bakery.  It is all very inexpensive.  It's becoming dangerous with how close I live to this place.

3.description: I go here for my torta bread, which is fresh and fluffy and amazing.Then sometimes I'll get a churro, which is also fresh and fluffy and amazing.Rating: Fresh and fluffy and amazing.

33.description: Excuse me?  Did that storefront actually say 'Open 24 Hours'?  Holy ish.  My friends and I walked in at 9pm to the comforting aroma of freshly baked goodies.  There were sheets and sheets of piping hot, freshly baked bread.  And it smelled soooo good.  For those with a sweet tooth, there's a billion cookies, muffins, churros, elephant ears, cakes, etc. to choose from.  If my friend didn't stop me, I probably would've bought everything in there.  You grab a basket and some metal tongs...and off you go!  It was BUSY at 9pm, too.  No surprise, I guess.  On weekends, they sell tamales.  Believe me - I'll be back for that.So, 2 churros, 1 chocolate covered elephant ear and 1 muffin cost a grand total of $3.40.  Albany Park, you are amazing!

43.description: Damn.. someone else reviewed this place already.  Well just read hers, Patricia's.  Its a fcukin' awesome bakery.  You can get a butt load of baked goods for CHEAP. Grab a basket, a pair of tongs and walk around "going to town" on everything.  Its HOT as hell inside, obviously because its a bakery.  Its 24/7 which is self explanatory.  AND!! they've got CHURROS! for FIFTY CENTS! Anytime of the day!.Its friggin' marvelous!

2.description: Dear Markellos,You're the pillar of my beloved neighborhood, Albany Park, which I'm proud to call home.  Your dedication to produce amazing pastries, 24/7, is my elixir for my ongoing insomnia.  Why are you so awesome?  Tell me why, Markellos!   You fed me and hubby's cousin for $6.80.  What a pastry heaven that we've just experienced!  While I'm not proficient with some of the names of Mexican bread, I'm confident that no matter what I've picked, it will be delicious without a doubt.  I will be back like a terminator, Markellos.  See ya soon...P.S.  We had six (6) items for $6.80 after tax.  I'm good now for the morning.  Bring cash as it's a cash-only establishment.
