18.description: Excuse me?  Did that storefront actually say 'Open 24 Hours'?  Holy ish.  My friends and I walked in at 9pm to the comforting aroma of freshly baked goodies.  There were sheets and sheets of piping hot, freshly baked bread.  And it smelled soooo good.  For those with a sweet tooth, there's a billion cookies, muffins, churros, elephant ears, cakes, etc. to choose from.  If my friend didn't stop me, I probably would've bought everything in there.  You grab a basket and some metal tongs...and off you go!  It was BUSY at 9pm, too.  No surprise, I guess.  On weekends, they sell tamales.  Believe me - I'll be back for that.So, 2 churros, 1 chocolate covered elephant ear and 1 muffin cost a grand total of $3.40.  Albany Park, you are amazing!

41.description: only in chicago...a greek guy gets a job on a ocean freighter, somehow winds up in guatemala, learns to bake like a champ, and comes to albany park to open up shop.

4.description: Open 24 hours and fresh for longer. I walked out with a week's worth of baked goods for less than $5, and it proved to be the best impulse trip for my roommate and I in the middle of the night. There's surprise filling in half of the items I bought, but they were all pleasant surprises. Grab a brownie for the road, stock up on croissants for breakfast, and fill your basket to the top with other treats you don't need to justify to yourself.

6.description: Just great...in my hood,fabulous! 24hr..what! Loving it. Small space with lots of breads, sweets and treats. Nice ladies behind the counter and the best part was the price. 6 items 3.50...come on, tell me how not to love this place.

22.description: 24 Hours of Happiness!I visited Markello's for the first time as I promised some colleagues I would pick up some great Guatemalan/Mexican goodies.  The selection is great and the pastries and breads looked so delicious!  I left with two paper bags full of goodies for under $15.  What a deal!Markello's is cash only, so come prepared!  They are open 24/7, so you have no excuse to not pay a visit!

15.description: If you grab the baked goods fresh from the rack, this place is absolutely spot on and delicious.  Otherwise the breads can stale out.It's so cheap though and they've been here forever.  I can always count on this place for a quick breakfast pastry.  Bless them for being open 24 hours.

20.description: A 24 hour bakery?!  You've got to be kidding me!  The first time I came in here I was amazed to learn that they are open at all hours of the day.  And after they rung up my order I was even more amazed at how affordable everything was.  Whenever I come here I always try whatever came fresh out of the oven because nothing beats fresh out of the oven baked goodness.

8.description: Open 24/7 and their pastries and bread  are fresh because it smells like baked goods heaven. I tried their conchas before and they were delicious and fresh. Not from  around here, but definitely would enjoy this place for my sweet tooth fix.

14.description: Very friendly service. I contacted this business by phone to inquire about their baked pastries and the service and friendliness I received was highly commendable. Highly recommended for all of your bakery needs!

58.description: Awesome repair experience. The power button on my iPod Nano 6 stopped working after about a year and a half of use. Since it was a gift and specially engraved, it was worth it to me to get it fixed rather than go to Apple and have them either a) give me a new one or b) shrug. Was referred to Ali and Ashraf at Chicago Gadgets by Hassan at Andersonville Tech. They fixed it within 24 hours and charged $50, which I thought was fair. Opening up those Nanos and dealing with the tiny parts is no joke!

56.description: Fantastic service.. they fixed my iPad 2 screen (big honkin' crack right up the middle) within hours.. Best price around I could find, too. Applied a free screen protector as well. A little bit out there, but well worth it to save ~$35-$40 over the other places in Lincoln Park. I'd definitely recommend these guys for any iPhone / iPad work.

29.description: I had a problem with a phone that I was returning, The problem was not with Chicago Gadgets but with USPS. Mohammed was a very friendly men. He always listened to my numerous calls and issued a full refund for the phone that we were returning. His Kindness saved me $$ and it was greatly appreciated

42.description: I promise you Yelp'ers that you will not get better customer service any where else! Moe (the owner/operator) of the Gadget store went way above and beyond to get my iPhone unlocked! He went through a detailed procedure and told me exactly what he was doing, all the while explaining what each step actually meant for me. I've learned a lot from this shop just by getting the phone serviced. I highly recommend this place for all their listed services, and if I ever need any work done in the future, I'll definitely  be going back to this place!

23.description: Chicago Gadgets is the place to go if you need any electronics fixed. Make sure you follow up periodically.

47.description: Our Ipad glass cracked.  After waiting on hold for with Apple for 10 minutes and then being told there is no repair option, but only a replacement option for $300, I called Chicago Gadgets Store.  The staff was knowledgeable and fair.  They looked over the Ipad inspecting the camera, wireless and screen functionality.  The price was extremely reasonable and they didn't try to sell "extra" services.  The Ipad was repaired in less than two hours and looks as good as new.  They even threw in a free screen protector.  I highly recommend Chicago Gadgets and would gladly use them again.

8.description: My older iPod's battery was dying. I had gone to Chicago Gadgets several years ago for something else and remembered they were very good at fixing electronics. I was not disappointed this trip either. The staff was very friendly and my iPod battery was replaced within 20 minutes or so. The cost was really minimal and exactly what they advertised it would be. I only wish I had brought my iPhone to them this past summer when I had an "accident" with it! I would highly recommend Chicago Gadgets.

31.description: Awesome. Awsome. Fast. Friendly. Cheap!!! Got my s4  screen done for $95 in an hr. Did some research before finding this place and everyone else was quoting closer to $200!

34.description: I really appreciate the honest dealings and good service I've had at this place. I needed a replacement phone more or less on the fly, and they had a solid selection of good used  androids at fair prices. These guys are the real deal. No weird stuff going on and no sketchy or questionable phones.

16.description: Chicago Gadgets is the place to go if you need any electronics fixed. Make sure you follow up periodically.

13.description: My iphone was stolen. A friend gave me his unused Samsung Epic phone but it needed a battery. I called three electronic places that are well reviewed here on Yelp. They each had the battery I needed for $39.99. I checked out Craigslist and found a few postings about phones for sale by this store. I decided to call and see if they sold batteries. They sure did! At the price of $15.99! It was way out of my route home, but I jumped on the CTA, switched to the brown line, and walked the short distance from the Kedzie stop to their store front. This place is full of accessories and gadgets! No clutter. Everything neatly lined up, in easy view, and fairly priced. The young woman was polite and helpful. Bought what I needed and was happy to find that the battery had charge. I was able to call Sprint from the phone to activate the services on it.I left out feeling happy that I saved some money and that I found a well stocked reputable "gadget" store. Before you go anywhere else, give them a call first. Never hurts to get a price quote. You may save big going here instead. That's if you don't mind making the trek this side of Chicago. PS- very diverse neighborhood...didn't seem dangerous at all...on the walk down to the store are many restaurants, store fronts, businesses, and a huge local ice cream shop...I enjoyed discovering this side of Chicago...

11.description: I was disappointed with my experience at Chicago Gadgets Store. I gave them my ipad mini retina to repair since it had a hairline tear in the screen. Their main store is currently experiencing some kind of electrical problems, and are operating out of the space next door. I handed my ipad off to an associate who told me it would be ready in 24 hours or less, and that she would call me when it was ready. Well, 3 days went by and I heard nothing. I tried calling (about 10 times), but the signal was either busy, nobody picked up, or their mailbox was "full." Finally I went to retrieve my ipad yesterday, and while they corrected the screen tear that I got the repairs for, there is now a new tear that wasn't there before. I asked the associate if they generally call customers to let them know their orders are ready, and she said yes, but she did not apologize to me. She also did not think anything was wrong that people could not call into the store. Very poor customer service, here. They staff the place with teenagers who don't have customer service skills. Nobody was rude, exactly, just not helpful.

39.description: Not a bad place at all, on the contrary really thrilled I found this location that I can trust.  I bought 3 phones (for my family & I) from this place.  I've also recommended several people to this place!  The first phone I bought worked perfect.  The second phone had some charging issues so we went back and they exchanged it without any issues.  Unfortunately the 3rd phone had data connectivity issues ( I had to sit and wait up to an hr and still get a blank page and that was on full wifi bars & full 4G). So  I went to in to see what was going on because I didn't want to exchange the phone unless it was the same one.   Upon entering the store the girls in front are quite helpful and considerate; they evaluated my situation and had one of the tech guys check out my phone. After some time the tech guy came out told me to go ahead and get another phone and the only comparable phone I saw on display (price wise) was a My Touch 4G so I decided to give it a try - which ended up unsatisfactory because it was just not "my type" of phone so i came back within 2 hrs, than the guy gave me the same phone I left there as an exchange with the same MEID#.  I was upset because I didn't want the same phone I had problems with. He said they reset it and maybe I could give it another try so reluctantly I did. So less than a wk later I realized there was no way this phone was working correctly so I had to go back again. Wasn't too happy about that but the manager (Moe) did come out and very kindly assist me.  He made sure I got the same phone model but a different phone this time.  He politely offered his apologies for my time coming back and forth and made sure I was 100% completely satisfied before he let me leave. He has even followed up with me since I got the new phone to be sure it is functioning correctly. I appreciated that and glad they resolved the issue.  I must admit they have won my business and I WILL most definitely be checking their website as well as stopping in their store to fix any tech issues I may have as well as to buy new & or used devices they may have to offer!

37.description: Exceptional customer service. And probably the only place in Chicago that has what they have. I got a Virgin Mobile iPhone 4S, like new, clean ESN, for $230 instead of $300-$350 new. I bought it and the external speaker wasn't working for some reason, they fixed it at no charge in 5 minutes. I think it's important that places like this exist both for local economy and for the sake if reusing instead of trashing and buying new. And these guys are doing it right.

0.description: I'd cracked my iPad screen and watched as it got worse over several days and eventually shattered in one corner to the point where I knew I needed to replace it.  I was leaving town in a couple days and needed to take it with me, so I knew I needed to get it fixed quickly.  I also knew I didn't have an arm and a leg to spend on the repair.I surfed the web and found a couple options, and Chicago Gadgets was the closer of the two, and instantly quoted me a price on their web site which I felt was very reasonable, so I shot them an email that evening via their web site.  I hadn't gotten a response yet an hour or so after the opened the next morning, so I decided to go ahead and show up at the shop and take my chances that they could fix it in time.Within the time I drove to the shop they'd answered my email, and in it they verified the price that had been quoted online (I love that feature on their web site!), and told me they could do it in about four hours.  Excellent!So I dropped it off and went home, expecting to return late that afternoon.  Instead, they called in about two hours -- It was ready!  I drove back over and picked it up, and carefully checked their workmanship before leaving.  I've have an iPhone screen and an iPad screen on an earlier model replaced in the past, and while both were functionally fine, neither glass was quite as perfectly set in as the original.  This one looked perfect!That was eight days ago, and it's worked like new ever since.  One lesson learned from all of this -- If a corner breaks on your case, replace it immediately.  I didn't, the iPad slipped out, the screen cracked, and you know the rest.  I also stopped on the way home and bought a new case so I'd be all ready for my trip.  They carry a limited selection of cases at Computer Gadgets, but didn't have one for my model.

38.description: Took my PS3 in to have the blu ray reader replaced. They had it fixed in less than an hour!!!  Very cool shop! Easy to get to, just off the Brown line. Would definitely recommend!

51.description: I am an avid yelper, and this is my first time ever review.What can I say other than "Alex is awesome".  I brought in my iPad with a shatterd screen and a bent corner.  The thing looked like it had been run over by a car.  I went to the Apple store...$250 to replace it.  Brought it to Alex...$100 and it look like nothing ever happened.I would trust Chicago Gadgets with my gadgets anytime.

27.description: I was disappointed with my experience at Chicago Gadgets Store. I gave them my ipad mini retina to repair since it had a hairline tear in the screen. Their main store is currently experiencing some kind of electrical problems, and are operating out of the space next door. I handed my ipad off to an associate who told me it would be ready in 24 hours or less, and that she would call me when it was ready. Well, 3 days went by and I heard nothing. I tried calling (about 10 times), but the signal was either busy, nobody picked up, or their mailbox was "full." Finally I went to retrieve my ipad yesterday, and while they corrected the screen tear that I got the repairs for, there is now a new tear that wasn't there before. I asked the associate if they generally call customers to let them know their orders are ready, and she said yes, but she did not apologize to me. She also did not think anything was wrong that people could not call into the store. Very poor customer service, here. They staff the place with teenagers who don't have customer service skills. Nobody was rude, exactly, just not helpful.

32.description: In an out in under an hour for a new iPhone 5 screen, and it was only $80. Couldn't have asked for nicer service or a better experience.

54.description: I stopped in here today with a frozen iPhone 3G, and at first I was told they were very busy and it would take them about 2 days, but then a very friendly employee (I didn't get his name) stopped to take a look at it. A few minutes later he had it working again! He also took the extra time to discuss it with me and give me advice. I will definitely be going back here for any tech problems. Thanks again!

48.description: I took my iPad in and they fixed it the same day.  The corners were bent out of shape just a bit, but the job looked good otherwise.  Unfortunately, the screen cracked again within two weeks.I brought the iPad back within the 30 day time frame and Mohammed agreed to fix it free of charge.   Excellent customer service!  I'll use them again in the future.

44.description: I have been to Chicago Gadgets on three separate occasions, all for repairs to video game systems.My first trip was because my Wii lens was not reading discs.  I dropped off my console in the morning, they called me within a couple hours with an estimate ($50 to repair/replace the lens) and the work was done before they closed that same day.Based on my first trip, I recommended Chicago Gadgets to my brother, whose Wii was not displaying on his TV.  I took it in and they replaced some video component.  $50 again.Finally, I took my PS3 and Wii there because they were damaged by a power surge in my home after a thunderstorm.  Both consoles would not display the video when hooked up to my TV.  When I took them in, the guy did a couple different system resets on my PS3 while I watched in the store.  He got it to work and did not charge me anything.  For the Wii, it needed a new motherboard, which they replaced for $65.I cannot say enough great things about this place.  If my consoles have issues, or if I need something repaired on my iphone, I will be sure to head back to Chicago Gadgets. They really care about their customers and are pretty damn fair with their repair prices.

24.description: I can't say enough good things about this place. My first experience with them was taking my sons PS3 because he thought it was broke. I dropped it off and they told me it just needed to be reset and didn't charge me anything for the diagnostic testing. Last week I dropped my Galaxy Note 2 and after countless drops, the screen finally shattered. I went to another place closer to me and was told 149.00 to leave the phone for some ridiculous amount of days and 200.00 for a 2 day repair. Who can be without a phone for that length of time nowadays!? Another highly recommended place with great reviews couldn't repair it until next week. I Googled searched screen repairs and Chicago Gadget came up. I didn't know they repaired screens and called. Mohamad Z. is the manager and answered my call and told me to bring it right over. It was almost 11am and informed him I had a previous appt at 3:45 and asked if I could have my phone repaired by 2:30pm. He told me to bring it in and he would see what he could do for me. I get there and a tech said it could be repaired by that time so I left it and was given a loaner phone while I waited...SWEET! I killed some time and got a phone call at 1:45 saying my phone was ready for pick-up. The phone looked great and thanked Mohamad and told him I had been there before. Because I was a repeat customer he knocked my bill down to 85.00! I love great customer service and I definitely got it here. Thumbs up all around... Thank you Mohamad and Chicago Gadgets!!!!

7.description: Decent place

49.description: I broke the glass on my iPad 2.  After doing a bit of research, I found Chicago Gadgets online.  They claimed they would fix the digitizer for $99.99.  That's about $150 less than Apple charges.  I dropped it off two nights ago and they promised it would be done the next day.  Sure enough, the next day they called to say it's ready.  They did a great job.  I would highly recommend them.  They were friendly, courteous and professional.

40.description: I'm lucky a cracked screen is all that happened. We had some friends over to experience the fun of a summer BBQ, which happened to include 8 bottles of vino.Luckily much time had past since we ate, as it was somehow decided the best place to put the speaker and my iphone was directly on the BBQ. After some dancing and crashing into the grill, my iphone fell on the concrete below and the screen shattered.I lived with my phone like this for months, when one day I passed by CGS on my way to lunch at Semiramis (only one of the best Lebanese joints around). I decided to pop in to inquire, and I found out a fix would only cost me $60 - and they'd be able to do it while I ate. I kid you not, 15 minutes later they called saying it was done. I hadn't even bit into my first falafel yet.And, you would never know the difference. It's worked perfectly since then, and the glass sure looks the same as the original. This reminds me, I still need to invest in a side table which should probably sit in the grass, not on the concrete...

53.description: Replaced the cracked screen on my iPad within a day for 60% less than Apple wanted to charge. Couldn't be happier. Nice staff; easy walk from 'L'.

30.description: On my flight into Chicago, my ailing 5th gen iPod gave strong signals that it was about to finally croak. It couldn't hold a charge for more than 20 minutes, tops, and the select button had become stuck in place and ceased to function. The only way the unit worked at all was with an external battery strapped to it with a rubber band! So, research on Google revealed that the batteries on these units are notorious for failing after a lot of use and as the batteries swell with age, they impede the select buttons. DIY repairs are tricky, but not impossible. But, quite honestly, I didn't feel up to the task, and didn't want to take a chance on screwing up the countless hours spent curating my music exactly as I like it. So, through Yelp, I found out about Chicago Gadgets. After a long but pleasant ride on the Red/Brown lines from downtown, I was at the store and after a brief diagnostic they took my unit and fixed it over night. Now, it works like a charm. Cost = $65. Well worth it, if you ask me. Mohamad and his team definitely know what they are doing and they run a tight operation. The young woman working the front register is obviously bored to tears and would much rather be somewhere else, but don't let that throw you. She's actually pretty cordial and who cares about bedside manner in situations like these, anyway?! Bottom line is this place is legit. Reasonably priced and able to get the job done. Not the most convenient location depending on where you are coming from but easily accessible by train. In fact the Kedzie station is at ground level only a block away.

46.description: No matter what problem your tech may be having they have a solution.  I went to fix the earphone jacks of my Iphone and Ipod on separate occasions, they were done in HOURS.  Although the duration will vary depending on your problem.  Awesome place! Definitely worth it.

1.description: I had to replace the screen on my iPhone, 2nd time, so I DIY'd it cause I'm not about to payThe last ppl I did...I went here for the part, decent pricesThey sell screens, buttons, whatever it is you need for water damageI didn't see much in tools, but who knows they might sell those call themThey have an array of used phones too, all kinds & carriersBut I asked, warranty on used phones are only a week, livin on the edgeI parked right in front, metersThere were a few ppl in there, but I got in & out in 10minI replaced my own iPhone screen and it works great,  and I can't tell it's not Apple, like the last place I had it replaced there was some weird window/node in it, anywayIf you need phone parts, I'd check them out

55.description: I love Chicago Gadgets! Alex saved my laptop from going to hell and I will be forever grateful! I have a 2008 Sony Vaio that looks like it's on it's last life, but I refuse to let it die... because it's pink... Anyway, my laptop won't turn on so I bring it to the guys down the street. They tell me there's an issue with the motherboard and they can't fix it. Womp, womp. I'm thinking it's a goner. I didn't give up hope so I brought it to Chicago Gadgets. I handed it over, praying for the best, hoping for the worst, and got a phone call about 30 minutes after I dropped it off saying it could be saved! At this point, I was jumping for joy! He managed to save all my music, documents and photos, so double plus! 2 days later I walked out of Chicago Gadgets, busted Sony Vaio in hand, $140 poorer. For the price, it doesn't get any better!

9.description: Mohamad and his team do excellent work and offer very reasonable prices.

26.description: My HTC One S had a cracked screen, which I thought I would have to live with since hearing that fixing screens on HTC phones is very difficult. Then my power button starting working sporadically and that was impossible to live with. My boyfriend had his iPhone repaired at Chicago Gadget and recommended them. They did an amazing job. My phone is as good as new. They even fixed an internal board and didn't charge me over the amount originally estimated ($120, very reasonable).I would recommend them to anyone. I'm happy that l was able to have it repaired rather than replaced!

25.description: Old school business ethics plus cutting edge knowledge of electronics.  They charged me HALF of what another local business charged for replacing my iPad glass.  I asked the owner why and he said its wrong to charge more just because you can.  I am a customer for life.

12.description: Called and confirmed the estimate and found the store easily. Free street parking was available just around the corner. My screen was replaced within 2 hours and beautifully done. Price was exactly as quoted. I'm a happy customer and would recommend this store to everyone plus I couldn't find a better deal anywhere.

59.description: I went to Chicago Gadgets because the Apple Store doesn't fix audio jacks for my iPod 5th generation.  I went inside thinking I'd have to return a few hours later to give them time to repair it but the guy was able to repair it in 20 minutes! I am able to enjoy listening to my iPod again and it only cost me $45 instead of having to purchase a brand new iPod with a 10% discount for recycling my iPod if I had opted to do so at the Apple Store.

21.description: I recently cracked the glass on my iPad2 and wanted to get it repaired before the glass shattered.I called the store to see if the charge I saw online was accurate and approximately how long the repair would take.I was told repair would be about two hours and online price was accurate.I left my iPad and was pleasantly surprised to be called less than an hour later.Repair was completed and I could come in to pick up. Hats off to Chicago Gadgets and their employees.They could not have been any nicer or more helpful! The repair was made at a fraction of the cost and was even able to pick up a case to prevent future accidents at an unbelievable price.I truly can't say enough good things about this business.Plenty of street parking. Why pay more when you can get repairs done in a timely manner at a fraction of the cost? I will be a lifelong customer. Thanks a million.

17.description: Old school business ethics plus cutting edge knowledge of electronics.  They charged me HALF of what another local business charged for replacing my iPad glass.  I asked the owner why and he said its wrong to charge more just because you can.  I am a customer for life.

10.description: I brought in my iPhone 4 that I purchased online, it was stuck in headphone mode.  They took a look at it, called me up to let me know they couldn't find anything wrong with it, and I could come pick it up!  I don't know what they did but the problem was gone!  No charge!  Also bought an iPod and a Nintendo ds, no problems, fair prices!!  Love this place!!

5.description: Fast, polite, efficient. Do the work they promise with no hidden extras once you get there. You pay what they say from the get go. No fuss no muss.

3.description: great customer service,great prices,Moe went out of his way to make everything great! i will tell all my friends about this great little shop,and most of all,the superb service! thank you!

35.description: I came in here with a Galaxy S III that had water damage and seemed beyond repair. They were able to fix it, which amazes me. (It would just turn off after a few minutes)They will take your item and examine it within a day for free, and call you with the estimate. This is the best  method.It did take them two attempts to fix, but as I said, they got it done. And trust me, this phone was messed up. Even more important to me is that they gladly took it back to re-examine and didn't try to charge me for second visit.I recommend, if anyone can fix it, they can. Also have the best selection and prices on used phones I have seen anywhere.

19.description: This place is TERRIBLE. If I could figure out how to give them -5 stars, I would. I took my iPad in to have a new battery installed. First, I was told they could do it the same day. When I got there they said they had to charge the battery overnight and that I could pick up the iPad the next day. I got there the next day and they had put some sort of horrible screen protector on that pixilated everything into green and blue. They said it prevented finger prints, but I could see mine on it as soon as I swiped the screen to see if the iPad was working properly. I told them I was a photographer and that I didn't want that stuff on my iPad. The technician said my photos were poor quality. What photographer uses an iPad to do professional photos? Right then I knew he had been prowling around looking at stuff he shouldn't have been and I could see by the expression on his face that he knew he had made a mistake. I got the iPad home and the battery they had put in it couldn't hold a charge for as long as the one that had been in it when I took it in. The crap on the screen developed bubbles in it before I even got it home. Luckily, I was able to remove it and throw it in the trash. I called the technician and reamed him out for poking around looking at stuff on my iPad. I also told the manager that I wanted them to remove the battery and refund my money. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!!!! They violate your privacy, have no ethics and sell you crap.

28.description: A few months ago, my hubby's laptop fan was failing, and we called around the neighborhood for some repair estimates. Chicago Gadgets' estimate was the lowest, so we went to them. They did a great job, so when I managed to bust the hinge & case of my Sony Vaio, I knew I could trust them. I know Sony parts are expensive, but they were able to track down some used parts at a reasonable price. They fixed everything while I was away on vacation, and everything is great! Chicago Gadgets are now my go-to guys for computer hardware issues.

45.description: Broke my laptop screen (argh) and took it here because it's so close to me. They seem to be pretty busy there both times I stepped in, but they managed to fix it in less than 24 hours. The part was expensive but the labor was very reasonable. No frills, straightforward, good prices - what's not to like?

33.description: I needed two phones pronto .. I was referred to this place but I was quite skeptical about going to a place that wasn't a brand name. On the contrary, they were professional and oh so helpful.  Great phones at great prices.  they got my phones up and running for less than  half of what it would have cost me at the "phone store" .No more "phone store" for me.. this is my got to spot for electronics!Thanks Chicago Gadgets!

43.description: Chicago Gadgets is a life-saver.  My son destroyed our iPad by tossing it off our second story balcony.  I bought another one and he shattered the screen.  I brought it to Chicago Gadgets and was quoted $100 to replace the screen.  This is about $30 less than other places in the city.  A few hours after I dropped it off I received a call telling me the volume wasn't working and some other problems were found.  The person I spoke to said he was not going to charge me for the additional repairs.  Who does this???  He told me the iPad would be ready the next day and I would receive a call.  Sure enough, 10:00 the next morning they called and it was ready.  Bravo Chicago Gadgets!!!  I will recommend you to everyone.

2.description: Their quote to replace my Galaxy S5 LCD was $5 less than the second lowest quote and $25 lower than anyone who had the part in stock.The tech did the repair in the time I needed before I had to catch a Metra train out to the burbs. Phone looks great. I am very happy with the service.

18.description: I came in here with a Galaxy S III that had water damage and seemed beyond repair. They were able to fix it, which amazes me. (It would just turn off after a few minutes)They will take your item and examine it within a day for free, and call you with the estimate. This is the best  method.It did take them two attempts to fix, but as I said, they got it done. And trust me, this phone was messed up. Even more important to me is that they gladly took it back to re-examine and didn't try to charge me for second visit.I recommend, if anyone can fix it, they can. Also have the best selection and prices on used phones I have seen anywhere.

41.description: My iphone was stolen. A friend gave me his unused Samsung Epic phone but it needed a battery. I called three electronic places that are well reviewed here on Yelp. They each had the battery I needed for $39.99. I checked out Craigslist and found a few postings about phones for sale by this store. I decided to call and see if they sold batteries. They sure did! At the price of $15.99! It was way out of my route home, but I jumped on the CTA, switched to the brown line, and walked the short distance from the Kedzie stop to their store front. This place is full of accessories and gadgets! No clutter. Everything neatly lined up, in easy view, and fairly priced. The young woman was polite and helpful. Bought what I needed and was happy to find that the battery had charge. I was able to call Sprint from the phone to activate the services on it.I left out feeling happy that I saved some money and that I found a well stocked reputable "gadget" store. Before you go anywhere else, give them a call first. Never hurts to get a price quote. You may save big going here instead. That's if you don't mind making the trek this side of Chicago. PS- very diverse neighborhood...didn't seem dangerous at all...on the walk down to the store are many restaurants, store fronts, businesses, and a huge local ice cream shop...I enjoyed discovering this side of Chicago...

52.description: This is a computer and computer accessory repair shop.  I would have to assume that their website is up to date.  I was wrong.  My companies wifi network is malfunctioning and we have exhausted our IT knowledge.  We called Chicago Gadgets hoping that they could come resolve the problem.  Their website claims they handle internet connectivity issues, including dealing with the ISP.  However, I was told on the phone that they can't send someone out to our location to do this work.  It is not a question of the amount of work or the distance from their business to ours, they just do not do it.I have to question the validity of their work if they can not keep their website current.

50.description: I had to take my IPad to get screen fixed. OMG they fixed it perfectly and you can't tell it was even broken. Thanks a million, the work was done in the time they told me and all of their workers were friendly and professional. I will always take my computer problems to them!!!!!!

4.description: I have taken numerous devices to these guys - iPhones with broken screens, iPads with crushed buttons, laptops in need of assistance - and always had a great experience.  Their prices are good.  And they are very accommodating.

6.description: I took my iPhone 5s here when my lock button broke. They quoted me at $55, which was significantly less than the other repair shop I contacted. I brought the phone in at 6 p.m. and it was fixed within an hour. I was really impressed by that - I didn't even have an appointment.The next day, I noticed my phone's screen wasn't rotating when I'd rotate the device. I took my phone back to Chicago Gadgets because I thought maybe they had broken something else when fixing the lock button. As it turned out, I was wrong - it was a software issue that was fixed by rebooting iOS. The tech who explained this to me was really helpful and went out of his way to explain some other iOS quirks and how to fix them (damn you, Apple).I can't recommend these guys enough. They're fast, polite and right off the Brown Line.

22.description: Fixed both a cracked screen and broken volume button on an iPhone 5. Fast service, reasonable prices!

15.description: Fixed both a cracked screen and broken volume button on an iPhone 5. Fast service, reasonable prices!

57.description: This place is awesome.  It is neat and clean, and they are very courteous - unlike a lot of these small electronic stores/repair spots.  My son got a game for his birthday that wouldn't play in our old Wii system.  He was heartbroken.  We took it here, they diagnosed the problem, and called letting us know what needed to be done.  They repaired it in an hour, we had the Wii back on the same day - working perfectly (with a 30 day guarantee on the repair).We will be back - thank you!

20.description: Fixed my iPad 2 screen in less than 3 hours on a saturday.  Great service, quality job. would definitely recommend.

36.description: I had a problem with my PS3. The blue rays lens was not working an it could not read  the disks. I brought it to this store and they fixed it in two days. They are really fast with their work and the prices are affordable. The prices are based on the product and the type of problem it has.

14.description: I had to get my iPod headphone jack fixed. I emailed them 1st to get an estimate. The emailed me back within 5 hours! That's great! I brought my iPod in at about 530pm and I got it back the next day. Great customer service, great prices and great work done. I will definitely go back if I need  something!

1.description: Great haircut, great ladies, will definitely be back.

2.description: Good Price....Mens Hair Cut $5.00!!!!! I usually give a $2.00 tip especially if the hot tall latina woman cuts my hair!...lol....Anyways there friendly there, there ususally not that much of a wait.....and they cut hair just like u want it. Good neighborhood place.....i'm very loyal to this place,,,i hope it sticks around for a long time!!!

0.description: I've been going here for years, and I just love it!  They do a great job cutting my hair! I bring an elderly friend, she and her family just love her hair cut! We travel over 10 miles to go there, when I have other errands in the neighborhood. $5.00 for a haircut, I use to pay $15 to $25! I give them a $3 tip! I rarely have to wait, maybe one person is ahead of me.  I can't recommend this place highly enough!

1.description: Some of THE WORST Middle Easter food in the country. The portion size was about half that of a Lean Cuisine. Chicken was undercooked, beef was microwaved and old, and shawarma was made out of slices of fake chicken for salads marinated in some sort of salty concoction. The rice tasted like someone sprinkled Kraft mac n'cheese powder on it. You can get better food in prison.

2.description: New resturant open in Albany Park great food very cheap and tasy swear this is the resturant to go. This resturant should be super busy soon with their prices. Friendly and quick service with the nicest owners and people your ever meet hope they are around for a long time because this is the spot to eat at.

0.description: I like the food mediterrean veggie seafood and salad and american fast food and Chinese noodle soup and Japan Udo noodle soup korean spicy noodle soup fried rice egg rolls I order fried rice it was the best I will go back to K&L

3.description: Great haircuts, they take the time and get it right every visit. The price for the amount of service is amazing. Mike and his team are awesome, and make you feel at home. The shop is small and can get crowded during busy times, but it always thins out pretty quickly, which baffles me, bc they are meticulous about haircuts and this is not a quick cut with clippers kind of place. If you are in the area and need to look sharp for an affordable price, look no further.

1.description: I get my haircut here by mike he is amazing great guy. Very friendly and always makes you feel at home. He is very knowledgeable with hair and will advice you with his expertise . I have curly hair and I had no idea what to do with it anymore. I recommend this place not only do they it amazing hair but they use the blades like no other to line up your beard etc. the eyebrows they do here are also amazing . There is not one bad thing I have to say about this place . Glad it's in the neighborhood .

2.description: My 12 year old started caring about his hair and asked to get his hair cut here.  She made him feel so important and spent 45 minutes on his hair, making sure it was perfect.  He walked out beaming!  He wouldn't let me touch his hair... Best hair cut ever!!

5.description: I got my haircut done by Mike here. I moved into the area from California, I always get my sides faded high up, but I try to keep it a bit longer up top. It is very easy to screw up, the one time I went off my usual barber all the progress I had on it was destroyed. So when I left California and tried to search for one here, I was worried. I ended up coming to this place off of reviews, said I needed a faded, and Mike worked on me. I never had a razor finish before, my hair was great, and it was only ten bucks which is the cheapest I've gotten my hair cut before. It was a quick trip, a nice conversation, and I'll be going there regularly for sure.

6.description: Been going here for 10 years. Really nice people and amazing care for the price (they still use an actual straight edge razor for edging neck and beard). $10 for a men's haircut and $3 for a cleanup of neck.

7.description: Love....love...LOVE this place!!  Went with my niece and daughter and each of us got a haircut and our eyebrows done.  Valentina is wonderful!!  She was attentive, patient and she's just plain GOOD at what she does!!  We had been searching for a salon that would be "our place" to go....and we found it!!

8.description: I've gone here twice now and have been pleased with my haircut both times. It's a pretty simple setup, and a haircut is only $10! They do a good job and don't rush through you to get to the next customer. And my absolute favorite part is that they use an actual razor for the sideburns, neck hair, and  temple (?? is this what it's called!?) hair. It keeps that nasty hair away longer than a plain old shave with an electric razor, which is nice in between haircuts!

0.description: At the recommendation of a friend I got my hair cut about 4 pm. Mike cut my hair extremely well and was also very friendly. He listened to what I wanted and was knowledgeable about his craft. I highly recommend  this business to anyone looking for a great haircut at a good price. It is convenient to the CTA Kedzie brown line stop and also has easy street parking. I had no problem finding a parking spot. The wait was reasonable and walkins are welcome.

4.description: My eyebrows came out perfect! Mark cut my hair and did an excellent job. Cut it just the way I wanted and I look like a brand new me! All this for only $25!

1.description: Dr Hunn I believe that's how you spell it, was very nice. He explains everything very thoroughly. As uncomfortable as it was to get the colon therapy, he was there to make it as comfortable as possible. The only thing is the clinic is called chiropractor it's right in front of the Walgreens. Despite me being late he still took me in.

9.description: Came here on groupon to try their colon hydro therapy. I'd never tried it and their staff made me feel extremely comfortable. I left feeling refreshed and happy with the service. Would go back again.

12.description: I can't speak for any other massage therapists here but I have gone here twice now to get a massage from Mun Han.  I first started going to him a few years ago when he was working out in Villa Park.  I tracked him down after he left and found out that he now is at the Good Morning Clinic.  I will pretty much follow him anywhere! I have a lot of neck, back, and foot pain due to my job and body alignment that is really helped by a deep tissue massage.  He is great at diagnosing asymmetry in your body and working on tight muscles.  He will get on top of the table to work your muscles correctly and stretch you in all the right places. The pressure is perfect.  I think the best word to describe his massage is "therapeutic".  I feel great afterwards-relaxed, recharged, and loose.  If you are interested in a spa experience, this place may not be for you.  However, if you want a exceptionally therapeutic massage, Mun Han is excellent.

21.description: Well, I have to say that the treatment was OK, as it did what it was supposed to do, but it is aggravating that Gloria leaves the room for most of the time.  Also, her English is hard to understand.  There was one session where the tube came out TWICE, and I had to bang on the wall to get the girl to come back in the room and take care of things.  Also, I was offended that she kept trying to sell me all these bacteria supplements.  A simple enema does the same thing, and you just buy it at Walgreen's and do it yourself, so you don't get the awkward moments with Gloria.

16.description: It's been years since I've been here, but Paola's review is spot on.  The therapist (if you can call her that) leaves the room and doesn't come back for 15-20 minutes at a time.  No massaging or assistance is provided.  She comes back in to make sure you're not dead, then bolts out like Costanza from a fire.  Otherwise, you're on your own.The only reason I would return is because afaik, they are the only ones in the north side that use the LIBBE system, which is the best imo.

17.description: Just a heads up the location changed in November and they are under new ownership. New address is 4007 W. Lawrence AVEChicago, IL60630

10.description: Won't go into the details, but I will say that the experience and service were excellent! I'll be going back!

5.description: I received my first colonic here. This place is very clean and the man performing the procedure didn't speak english that well but he was very gentle and and patient with me. The only issue I had was he left me alone in the room for more than 20 mins. It was busy that day and he was the only person working. I would have preferred he stay in the room for the first 20 minutes of the procedure just so I could have a little extra support. I wasn't bad. My stomach cramped a lot during the procedure, but other than that everything else was fine. I highly recommend this place.

11.description: Came here to use a youswoop coupon that I purchased for a 1 hour swedish massage. I arrived about 20 minutes late and they were still accommodating and gave me a massage for about 50 mins. The massage itself was ok. It was a little weird that the massage room was outside (when you walk out of the room, you're in the waiting area). I know that this place is known for their colonic... but I was greeted by the unpleasant smell when I walked into the office. The lady is very nice and friendly. I wish the massage worked my muscles more. The nice thing was that when my massage was over, it was raining. The lady gave me an umbrella, walked with me (with her own umbrella) to my car, and then made sure I got into my car before taking the umbrella back and then walking back to the office. Talk about customer service! :)

22.description: I really do NOT recommend coming here. The style of colonic is not professional at all. The therapist LEAVES the room while you are having the colonic, and does not massage or assist you. This was a very scary experience, and I have to question the hygiene. Try a reputed colonic hydrotherapist (there are several in the directory, or ask around). The therapist should stay in the room with you and massage your abdomen during the procedure.

0.description: i have never been constipated for more than a day in my life. but a combination of age, bad diet over the holidays, overeating (critical!)  lack of hydration led to two weeks on basically not going and worrying about that. what goes in must come out! so...i tried prunes, laxatives, throwaway enema bottles and real enemas (very pleasant) and nothing!.i had heard of hydrotherapy and colonics for years. never paid a drop of attention, assuming they were charades of the new age variety. but i have no health insurance and after finding a 35$ groupon, i found myself at doctor hans office, a tube up my ass, and hoping for the best.well, it was an amazing experience. you can see what is coming out of you through the tubes at the floor. dr han was unintrusive and calming.  i know some people were upset he wasnot in the room massaging bellies and holding hands but i appreciated the privacy to focus of what i needed to do to help the procedure.two days later, i am going again. i am completely relieved at this point. the pharmaceutical industry spreads bad info about colonics, since their MULTI-MILLION dollar profits from laxatives etc are at stake. this procedure (enemas) is thousand of years old and it works. a colonic is just an enema times 100.take your digestive health into your own hands. i did. do it today. you wont regret it one bit

20.description: I really like it here. I don't want them to stay in the room the entire time. It's nice because she checks in periodically and then leaves you to yourself.

19.description: I really like it here. I don't want them to stay in the room the entire time. It's nice because she checks in periodically and then leaves you to yourself.

2.description: Dr.  Incredible. I have to say this by far was the most relaxed,Anxiety free visit I've had with my colon hydrotherapy.I was so impressed, even brought my elderly aunt with me and he makes it so calming especially with the warm water pad- makes a huge difference. Definitely will go back for sure!Thank you!!

18.description: This place was TERRIBLE, unprofessional, I would not recommend anyone to go here. I seriously wish I had checked the Yelp reviews before making an appointment but was desperate (clearly) and trusting on blind faith that because they are located in Lakeview they would be up to par. Definitely not! Go to any other place but this.

13.description: I came here to use a YouSwoop for a massage but instead got a very thorough application of lotion.  It was suppose to be a 60 minute Swedish massage, but the women didn't come in until 15 minutes after it was suppose to start.  (I'm hesitant to call her a masseuse, as given the lack of actual massaging, I doubt she is licensed.) For the remaining 45 Vaseline Intensive Care Lotion was rubbed all over my body.  Prior to the massage I had said I'd like to focus on my upper and lower back. At one point she came across the two small knots in my shoulders. Each time she rubbed them for all of ten seconds before continuing to apply the lotion. At one point she asked if the pressure was too strong (?!?!?!). I told her it wasn't strong enough, but that only yielded her pressing really hard on my fingers during the hand portion of the "massage". Like another yelper said, there is a framed note reminding people to tip. The implication was that "coupon" and "YouSwoop" users don't tip. The sign worked because I did tip but my guess is that if an actual massage had been performed, her tips would be better.  Go here if you have dry skin, don't go if you need muscle relaxation.

4.description: I purchased a Groupon for colon-hydrotherapy sessions.  Easy to get an appointment, many available time slots and online booking makes this very easy.  Only street parking is available, so give yourself a little extra time.  As awkward as this treatment is - the Doctor made me feel very comfortable.  Highly recommended!

6.description: I only gave four stars because of location. I couldn't find one thing wrong with this place. I was a half an hour late and still he was very pleasant and welcoming...the customer service is excellent. I came for a colonic and it was my first time I was very shy and nervous and he was extremely warm and made me feel very comfortable. I definitely will be back. EXCELLENT SERVICE GUYS!

15.description: I received a gift card for the Good Morning Clinic from my husband for a massage...three years ago. I had been reluctant for three whole years to go to the Good Morning Clinic because I was frightened by the thought of getting an accidental colonic. And, on a side note, I'm the worst person ever to give a gift card to. I never use them.I finally decided to make an appointment because I've really been in need of a massage. I figured I would brave it out and give Good Morning Clinic a try. When I called to make my appointment, I clearly stated to the receptionist that I wanted to make an appointment for a massage. Three times she replied, "So, that's a colonic at 11? Or, "so a colonic and a massage at 11?" Or, "I'll see you at 11 for the colonic." And, after reiterating three separate times that I'd like ONLY a massage, this receptionist called the day before my appointment to remind me that my 11:00 appointment for my colonic was tomorrow. YIKES!!! I arrived at the Good Morning Clinic, still a bit nervous that I might be receiving a colonic, at 11:00 sharp. The office was empty, aside from the small space heater and me. And, it was FREEZING. I began to dread what might come next. I waited, next to the small space heater, just the two of us, for about 15 minutes until I was called back to my "massage" room. It was FREEZING. A couple of minutes later, after I was instructed to undress, the receptionist back in with the same mall space heater from the waiting room. Ok, I'm not going to give you a play by play from here but this is the basic just of it...the masseuse was 45 minutes late. The music was Frank Sinatra soft rock-style, no words, just piano. It was so cold in the room, the masseuse had to get another space heater and some warm packs to put on my back so I wasn't shivering. The electricity went out three times, I assume from the excessive use of space heaters. Hence, I listed to the same Frank Sinatra soft rock-style song three times before I actually heard another song. The masseuse used only Johnson's Baby oil and Jergen's Facial Lotion, as the massage oil. She massaged my hands and feet for most of the 40 minutes, leaving only about 10 minutes for my neck and back, which were the problematic areas I was hoping to have worked on. She left the massage room at least 8 times, for several minutes at a time, throughout my massage. She referred to my face, arms, and feet as "legs." Her cell phone buzzed several times during the massage. When she was done "massaging", mostly leaving the room alot, she said "all done. Sorry for the power. Drink water." She did not offer me water at the clinic. I feel more tense after my massage than I did before I went. I DO NOT RECOMMEND Good Morning Clinic. Sorry, honey.

7.description: I was super nervous and the Dr. was very relaxing and said you will be fine just relax and considering I had a stick up my a** so to say it was a delight of an experience, when I asked him at the end what should I do and not do he said well dont go to a steak house, he was very nice and had a sense of humor. I will be going back and adding the coffee to the therapy, I heard it cleans the liver, I will ask him just to confirm..

8.description: I've continued to see the Dr at the clinic once a week and am still very, very happy with the services!

3.description: I had the colon hydrotherapy ! Dr.Hang was very attentive and funy guy:))Very relaxed and you feel like a newborn:)One thing, location- clinic it is across the Walgreens

14.description: I had a great experience here..I went with my friends to get a colonics..and we all were satisfied with it.I dont want them to stay in the room the whole time..and they came back to check on me..very nice!!i dont know why anyone would want them to stay with you while poop is coming out of you, but ok..I would rather massage my own tummy...and it worked!!!my friend also got ear wax out of her ear too in another session!i brought my 3 year old with me, and was acting terrible n the lady was very nice about it, and patient, and even gave my son a blanket and let him lay on the couch to go to sleep!!!Very nice people there...Not to mention the price is just right!!!!!!I will be going back next week, and continue to be a customer there.

3.description: I can't believe the good reviews on this place.I admit, I used to be a regular here because It's byob, they never check your ID, and I was underage. It used to be a great place to dance and hookah with your friends... and then...EVERYBODY DOWN! Are those gun shots right outside? How many times has this happened.. two that I know of (another occurred while my friend was there).. and that's two too much for me. I knew the neighborhood was shady, being right by the admiral theater and all, but having fun is not worth it if people are outside playing with guns. Other than that, why would you go somewhere that plops water bottles on the tables (that you don't ask for) and charges you for them without telling you ($2 each). Then, there's a min for each person. I had friends stop in to say 'hey' for 5 mins.. and we end up getting charged extra. They didn't eat, drink, or smoke anything. What a friggin' rip off.

1.description: If I could give this place a negative review I would. First, all of these reviewers are lying. Its not even called Nefertiti, its called Arabesk Palace. On a Friday night there was 2 groups of people in the whole place. It smelled really funky and made me feel uncomfortable. Its also in a shady ass neighborhood not safe for walking around at night. Never ever will I attend ArabesK palace again, They didn't get my money once and they never will.

2.description: The Nefertiti I once knew has gone up in smoke! I remember back in my undergraduate days this joint  was a little run down. The seating certainly had caught on fire one too many times from projectile coals. There was dim lighting despite the projectile coals. And there was an abundance of old men unable to projectile, smoking hookah outside. Not that I minded because I love seediness. It's so much more interesting!After visiting recently, I realized that the new renovations certainly helped the place transform into a family oriented destination. The child friendly playground area is great and the puppet show is so much fun. After all, smoking hookah with your 5-year-old son is now all the rage. I'm kidding, of course.Though I miss the seediness of old, the last time I was there I had such a wonderful time with friends, some of which do not smoke at all and some that probably smoke too much. The place is open and spacious so the hookah does not completely overwhelm the immediate area, much to a nonsmoker's delight. Also, while we were there, the scheduled belly dancer got into a row with the owner/manager, and then left unexpectedly. My group did not mind though because we had a great deal of fun dancing traditional dances and listening to awesome music.

5.description: I love the environment and the live music on weekends, definitely worth revisiting, I love their food and everyone is very friendly and courteous. You must go.Oooops, they do have hooka's there, if smoke bothers you...stay out!

6.description: I've been here once, and haven't gone back just because I haven't really thought about it, and my friends don't really hookah anymore.  When I went there, it was pretty good.  I liked that it is open late, and it wasn't very busy.  There were kids in there, but they didn't bother us.  My friend and I also ordered falafel and hummus. It was really good.  I see everyone talks about the minimums they have.  They usually have that at most hookah places...or atleast ones I have been to.  Neighborhood is a little shady, but not too bad.

7.description: This is maybe the best hookah cafe I have found in the city. Open late, it is definatley a great place to stop by for some food and shisha, as both are flavorful and morerately priced. They have several great flavors of shisha and a very attentive staff that can answer all your questions. The hummus and falafel sandwiches are great and the atmosphere is lively. On the weekends they have live belly dancers. The first night I dropped by for the belly dancing the table next to mine had a rather portly gentleman standing on his chair literally showering money on the dancers. I had the second best seat in the house. The whole place is very clean and tons of fun. They also allow you to byob for something like $5 a table. Excellent.

0.description: From my old profile I love the environment and the live music on weekends, definitely worth revisiting, I love their food and everyone is very friendly and courteous. You must go.Oooops, they do have hooka's there, if smoke bothers you...stay out!

4.description: Fun place.  Even more so if you're into jailbait.  So my friend and I rolled into the parking lot at about 10:30pm on a Saturday.  Parking wasn't bad, though the lot was completely packed.  We walk in to the place and are pleasantly surprised.  Now it's not like I was expecting some really run-down, third-rate pita-stand, but I wasn't expecting a really spacious and inviting restaurant/cafe, either.  Lots of couches, lots of nooks and crannies, big screen TV, and even a little dance floor--no, really.  Kind of like Central Perk on Friends....except that it was Egyptian. Friday and Saturday nights they have a belly dancer come in at midnight (it was more like 1am tonight) and they also have a DJ.  Oh yeah, and with the DJ there is an incredible amount of bumping and grinding.  Teeny-bopper bump and grinding.  But are they ever amusing.  I hadn't realized it prior to going in, but apparently one of the main attractions of this place is the fact that it's both 24-hours and BYOB.  And they have all kinds of hookah-stuff--if you're into that sort of thing.  And speaking of smoke, they kicked out some kids for smoking some non-hookah-stuff--so that just goes to show that it's a fairly legitimate place of business--though a bit odd in certain resepects.  As soon as you sit down the waitress brings you two (there were two of us) bottles of water--which are $2 a piece.  And the bottom of the menu states that there is a $10 minimum per person--don't usually run into those kind of rules.  Another thing that they do which is a bit different is include a mandatory 15%-tip on the bill, and like I said, there was only two of us.  There is a pretty young clientele there--lots of high schoolers--so I can understand them helping out their customers with a little math.  And about the food...we had nothing but apps, which all kicked ass.  Especially the falafals (sp?).  And there was this vinegar-fava bean concoction which I thought was really interesting...not to mention the dessert--some kind of sweet, gooey cheese-like substance which was quite the delectable and tasty treat.  So all in all, a good time--especially if you are are easily amused by belly dancers, high schoolers, and dirty old men staring with the jaws on the floor.

12.description: Nothing great or horrible about this place.  The waitress was friendly and quick.  I don't think the food was special where I would want to go again.  It was a good place to catch a quick meal.

7.description: An authentic Mexican restaurant, with surprisingly large, tasty portions.The red (cheese) enchiladas were good, though the green (chicken) enchiladas were spicier.  Neither had a fatty, oily aftertaste.The Pechuga de Pollo (Chicken Breast) was moist and tasty, too.  The refried beans which come with most of the plates was some of the best I've tasted anywhere -- again, no fatty aftertaste.TIP:  they bring you chips, 2 types of salsas, and a pickled carrot-onion-jalapeno mixture quickly after you sit down.  The carrot mixture, though a bit spicy, can be mixed in to your food for an extra kick, or can be eaten straight from the bowl.  A great neighborhood place.

20.description: This little Mexican restaurant has tasty and filling enchilada dinners with your choice of fillings and toppings. You can have fillings like chorizo and beef tongue. Your usual assortment of tacos, burritos and tortas can be ordered here. I usually go for the enchiladas suiza, but last time I tried the tacos al pastor, which were delicious. The refreshing horchata is not bad here.

19.description: A decent taqueria option in the neighborhood, and convenient if you're on your way to the nearby market or bank. I stuck to a simple order of carne asada tacos and a lengua taco. Tacos are the best way to gauge if a place is worth going back to. The carne asada tacos hit the spot. Just chopped steak, onion, and cilantro with green salsa on the side. My only complaint was that the steak was chopped too fine. The lengua tacos, on the other hand, were disappointing. They had the boiled and diced version. I prefer braised lengua, soft and shredded. Looks like I have to look elsewhere for that type of lengua. But they do have plenty more on the menu (check out their dinner specials), so it's definitely worth trying if you're in the area and need cheap eats.

1.description: Let me start off by saying the food is great! The quality of the meat is better then the "average" taqueria.My issue is not with the food but it is with the service.I placed an order for 15 tacos to pickup and asked the waitress to make sure I have 15 thing of hot sauce(10 green 5 red). One for each taco right? After I paid and received my order I asked if she put the 15 sauce I asked for and she assured me they were in the bag so I didn't think twice and didn't bother checking. When I got home I discovered only 5 sauce in the bag.I was starving but I refuse to that pysa make an ass out of me so I took all the food back demanded my money back. She lost a 50 sale cause she was trying to save herself 10 sauce.

2.description: Love this place! Super fresh. Delicious perfectly cooked food. Great tacos and guacamole.

9.description: I went here yesterday and as I was waiting for my food (I was only waiting ten minutes) I saw two cockroaches crawl across the floor!!! I was so disgusted.

6.description: Very decent Mexican food when you have a taste for it. Have ordered tacos, burritos, tortas, and guacamole and all have been good. Will continue to explore the other items on the menu and hopefully those will be good as well.

18.description: This little Mexican restaurant has tasty and filling enchilada dinners with your choice of fillings and toppings. You can have fillings like chorizo and beef tongue. Your usual assortment of tacos, burritos and tortas can be ordered here. I usually go for the enchiladas suiza, but last time I tried the tacos al pastor, which were delicious. The refreshing horchata is not bad here.

10.description: So we ordered from this place because they delivered and they had good ratings. First off I googled them to find a menu and I thought they were pretty cheap so I called to place the order. We ordered the taco dinner chicken only sour cream and cheese  (3 tacos rice and beans) $6 +.50 for sour cream and cheese 6 steak tacos everything +sour cream and cheese $1.35 per taco +.50 each taco for sour cream and cheese Steak nachos $3 +$1.60 for the steak which I thought wasn't bad 3 flautas no rice or beans $1.50 each So I call to place the order and she tells me it will be $42 I'm thinking the prices online are wrong and I checked 2 different menus. My fiancé says whatever I place the order she says 30 min perfect were starving 50 min later she calls and says what did you want on the 6 steak tacos?..... Everything +sour cream and cheese. I say yes but we we're suppose to of gotten the food 20 min ago she hangs up on me ....I'm not happy.Ok well now this is 20min over the time we we're suppose to have gotten the order. 20 min later we get our food.We pull everything out and we are missing steak tacos that she called to confirm and all our tacos have sour cream but no cheese which I was charged .25 for each and i got 8 tacos... So I call back to say the order is not completely correct and she knew exactly who I was and said no I sent them... We no I can assure you, you didn't. and she says they must be in the drivers car. AND SHE HANGS UP ON ME AGAIN ... So needless to say we didn't get the food we were missing and I'm out money. We will not be ordering from here again we will just drive to our favorite place on Harlem and  Diversey

13.description: Delicious Chorizo torta (yet it was kinda small) and steak burrito dinner. Their red salsa is spicy and delicious. Horchata is awesome, too.

16.description: i think this place is decentwife had carned asada suiza burrito and it was full of flavor but the meat was a little toughi had 3 tacos that were all goodwe'd go back, maybe try the breakfast and chimichanga

17.description: Decent mexican food for cheap. When ordering in, they bring you a load of salsas, pickled carrots and chips. The service is never grand, in fact, I've had to chase down the waitress for water when we've been the only table in the joint but overall, they are friendly. Bonus points for having Mexican Coke.

15.description: Nice place to indulge in some Mexican food. The place itself seems to have had a recent make-over from a few years back. It's not a complete overhaul, just a few additions of reproduced artwork and their menu posted over their walls which is a nice upgrade from their barren picnic checkered pattern table cloths they had back then. Another nice little treat, as a result of their change, is the addition of an appetizer. Along with your expected chips and salsa, they now serve you Frijoles Rancheros right before your dish comes out.As you sit, you are welcomed by a very friendly lady who brings you your menu and chips with salsa before asking you what you would like to drink. The chips are nicely sliced and appropriately seasoned with salt, which makes me think they may be store-bought. Their taste and texture allows me to overlook this speculation. On the table, a small bowl of green avocado based salsa, a small bowl of slices of jalapenos and carrots, and the small bowl with red salsa which goes very well with the aforementioned chips. It seems to have a hint of ketchup, but with the right amount of flavor and spiciness, it is a great match out of the three bowls for the chips that lay before you. The horchata is delicious and appears to be natural and not made from store bough instant powder as other restaurants tend to serve. As you indulge in your beverage and chips, a steaming hot bowl of frijoles rancheros is brought for you to enjoy. Although they are not the best they can potentially be when it comes to their seasoning, the frijoles are a nice touch that separates this place from other local restaurants. The taco dinner plate, although it may seem a generic plate, is a great menu item to choose as it allows you to sample up to three of their meats. Their carne asada is diced a bit too small, but its taste makes up for it as it doesn't require salt or seasoning when eaten on its own. The carne pastor is not as great as in other places, but considering only a few places are known for their carne pastor, they do an adequate job. It may be busy, but the lady that served you your food comes back and checks up on you a few times during your meal, ensuring you enjoy your food.

0.description: Wanna eat good Mexican food?  Go to a local "hole in the wall"...like this place.  Nothing fancy,  just good food.  If I see mariachi's singing around the tables and people drinking gigantic margaritas, it's a sure sign they're using gimmicks to get people in the door cuz the food is mediocre at best.  I'll stick to the basics,  good tasting food,  end of story.   **Not a 5 star due to one of the waitresses that's there once in a while...must be a fill in when the regular waitress is off.  But, she's not very good at her job.

5.description: This is becoming one of my favorite spots. The food is flavorful, is always cooked perfectly, and though it is simple, it is surprisingly good! Simply delicious. I usually order Combination 1 and add one or two more items and I have never been disappointed.  I plan to keep coming back until I've tasted everything on their menu.

11.description: Walking distance. Not the fanciest place but the food is great! Big menu to choose from and food is very authentic! My niece is pickiest eater anywhere but loved the food! My only complaint is no alcohol but I know it's a pain to get a license but how much space do margaritas and a blender take? The one thing I like is; they put up a glass "hallway" to keep the freezing temps out! Before it was the outside door straight into the Restaurant!  Now I want tacos!!!!

8.description: Good food.  Always hits the spot when I am in the mood for Mexican.

3.description: Appearance-wise, Restaurant Jerez is your typical Mexican restaurant. The food, though, is above par. This hole in the wall is worth a try if you're ever in the neighborhood.

14.description: Still one of my most favorite places to eat great tasting Mexican food. It is simple, well favored, clean, well prepared, and appropriately priced food. When given a choice of a great Burrito, this IS the place.

4.description: (3.50 stars)  This small "hole-in-the-wall" was Wednesday's lunchtime stop with my client, and was a nice surprise.  While I generally enjoy Mexican food, the bastardized Tex-Mex pretenders are something that I try to avoid.  This certainly wasn't a problem at Jerez.Brought a cup of complimentary Mexican chicken soup to start the meal, a hearty platter of beef burittos, yellow rice and refried beans soon followed.  While I wouldn't swear to the fact that everything was made in-house, there wasn't anything which would lead me to believe otherwise.  The mole sauce was mild, but flavorful; with a generous shake or two of hot sauce, it hit the spot.  The burritos were very nicely proportioned between filling, casing, cheese and sauce, and were among the best I've had in recent years.  I was particularly appreciative of the fact that the refried beans lacked the heavy and greasy characteristics of a packaged product.Service was friendly, if a bit hurried; excusable because the waitress/owner seemed to be working all of the tables.  All told, inexpensive and definitely worthy of a try (or a return visit).

58.description: Best fish monger in Chicago.  Go... befriend them.....  and you'll practically have a sous chef before you leave.

56.description: Don't come here expecting some upscale market.  This is a stripped down to the essentials kind of place.  My father used to walk up here for the boiled shrimp, and for good reason.  These guys know their fish, they know how  to cook it, too, and  the shrimp he brought home was never chewy and dry or flaccid and undercooked.  It was always spot-on.Yeah, their prices are high, but you're also paying for impeccable freshness and an almost encyclopedic amount of fishy expertise from the staff.  The  fish on display is gorgeous, and if you're a true fish lover you'll be tempted to buy everything you see.  Try some of the prepared dishes.  I'm partial to their tuna salad, though I didn't care much for their fried shrimp.I understand they're now carrying Kobe beef and a few other types of meat.  I'm not a big meat-eater so that doesn't do much for me, but I'm betting it'll be the same high quality as the fish.  The Fish Guy also hosts "Wellfleet" an "occasional" restaurant.  I couldn't begin to do this concept justice, so check their website for an explanation.  Oh, and their ten buck Tuesdays?  Great deal!

29.description: I've never been a big connoisseur of fish, but recently my horizons have been expanded and I've been adding fish to my cooking repertoire more and more. Buying fish just "anywhere" won't do; whenever possible, I like to buy the best quality I can find. The Fish Guy Market is on a stretch of Elston Avenue and it's pretty easy to miss if you're not looking for it (as evidenced by me driving right past it). Street parking is quite easy. Their selection isn't abundant, but rather thoughtful and well-chosen. You'll definitely find something to work with here. In addition to fish, they sell duck breast, Kobe beef burgers, albacore tuna salad, crab cakes, clam juice, and giant pieces of cooked lobster for only $3.50. I think I may just take a stab at making my own lobster rolls with it in the very near future. The store is immaculate and pleasantly fishy smelling. The staff is friendly and eager to please. When I made my purchase, I was asked how far I was traveling and they offered ice packs so my fish would stay cold. That's good customer service. All of the fish I bought was delicious: salmon, tilapia, trout and mahi mahi. To be honest, I really don't know how their prices compare with other fish markets as I'm a novice, but I just know the quality is there and I assume you get what you pay for.ps - they also sell their own ready-to-eat lobster rolls and fish tacos.

42.description: The best fish monger for the casual fish enthusiast.  Lots of clean and fresh fish, the guy behind the counter knew where they all came from and had other good info besides.  Not nearly as cheap as Isaacson or any other retail/wholesale place but if you don't like buying fish with their delicious heads on its your place.

23.description: We had the lobster roll (just right for one person) and the shrimp salad sandwich.Both were very good, but not very heart healthy.  I'd love to be able to try a grilled fish option.We'll be back perhaps to purchase the fish, but not to eat the sandwiches offered.I can recommend for those who are able to eat mayo, everything was tasty.

47.description: Based on one visit: The staff (of one young dude) was very helpful. We perused the selection, which was not vast, but it was varied, and all very fresh. Not fresh: the frozen section, but that's only b/c it's done frozed and we weren't shopping for that kind of thing. On the fresh side, ample supplies of shellfish: mussels and littleneck clams. There were also shrimpies in at least two sizes. On the fish side were sushi grade tuna, yellowtail, the non-evil kind of sea bass, and something called kingfish, plus a few more. The one not-in-stock empty spot was salmon, we went late in the day on a busy saturday. But that's ok, salmon's delicisous, but I've been around and around that fishy block. We asked for a description of the kingtip, which we'd never heard of, and the guy behind the counter helped us understand the texture, flavor, and best cooking methods. We ended up with 1.5lbs of Kingfish, which was prepared thusly:  Salt, pepper, lemon juiceDredged the filets in flourSauteed till golden on each side, about 5mins per side depending on thickness of the cut. Served with a brown rice medley, asparagus, and hollandaise sauce. If you like fish like grouper, or halibut, or even lighter flatfish, you may want to try kingfish, it's very tasty - not too "fishy". It is not wimpy in the pan at all, either.
