I am excited to see what the change in menu brings! I'll see you soon Ixcateco!

2.description: Went there for valentine's day.  This was our third visit since it opened. The food was great as usual and at the end of the dinner,  they gave the girls a rose. How sweet of them :) We tried the grilled white fish, it was delicious but fair warning,  the sauce is on the spicier side. I had the shrimp dish and it was good but not the biggest fan of the sauce. To me, it was weird to eat rice with a sweet sauce. It worked with the shrimp but not the rice.   Overall,  we will definitely come back again to try when they change their menus again.

18.description: Good variety on the menu. I had the carne asada and my wife has the shrimp. The steak was good and tender, shrimp had good flavor it was just a little too spicy for my wife's taste.  But, I thought it was really good. Garlic mashed potatoes were also really good. Overall the food was definitely worth a try but it's just lacking in ambiance for a place with a better than average menu. It's BYOB and no corking fee, which was nice.

41.description: Food was excellent and staff was super friendly and accomadating.

52.description: So excited for the hood! This place is fabulous! The food was delicious! We started out with the ceviche: so fresh and flavorful! We had the chicken mole with garlic mashed potatoes...perfection! Chicken is super tender and the potatoes are a perfect mix of mash/ little potato pieces with just the right amount of garlic. And the mole...incredible!! The carne asada was suburb as well. We topped off the night with the mango ice cream. It was an unexpected mix of savory and sweet. Another plus is it's a BYOB! The only reason I gave it 4 stars is the service was a bit slow, but there were a few big parties. Hopefully this is just a kink that will get worked out in the near future! Can't wait to go back!!

50.description: This place was really good food was amazing. And  I mean amazing. For a new restaurant service wasGood and I'm sure will get better. Definitely recommend and it is still byob right now so as prices are good it's a great night out

4.description: Welcome the new mole inspired restaurant to the hood. This little place takes mole to a new level. Mole is good, really good, and they serve it and several different ways. Best is the salmon with a red mole that you can lick to the last drop. Next is the dark mole chicken- the mole hear is deep, smokey, sweet, and spicy. Then the pumpkin mole was good too with hints of thanksgiving and smokeless. In terms of food to call out that's where it ends. Overall the meat was way undercooked. The chicken for example was just underdone and made the skin especially rubbery. The Pork was especially fatty - in didn't mind the fact that it was pink but had way too much fat. It was chewy and a bit gross which took away from the mole it was on.  Apps were also just ok. Tried the fried corn dough with meat and veggies on top but was a bit dry and didn't really make sense. Guacamole was good but nothing special.  Also, prices are in the high side for what u get - so be prepared to spend around $25 per person. I have to say that service and atmosphere was really attentive and nice. Bonus that right now it's a BYOB too. Would give it another try but would def ask for the meat to be cooked more.

6.description: Amazing. I had the enchiladas. I highly recommend them. The chips, guac, and salsa were also perfect. Service was attentive, quick, and just as good as the food.

22.description: Four stars because I've only been here once. Pretty sure the fifth star will come.This place has gotten a lot of good press -- richly deserved -- but it's not impossible to get into. Yet. Which is saying a lot, because it's tiny. That works for it, because it has the feel of a small family business, with the food of, well, Frontera Grill. Which is not a surprise, since the chef/owner made his bones working at Frontera and Topolobampo.The menu is as tiny as the space. Rather than trying to a little bit of everything, Ixcateco has a menu of about a dozen items. The flavors are all bright and fresh. The chef was Bayless's "Master of Mole," and the restaurant opened with a lot of mole dishes. When I went, there were only one. My companion ordered the traditional black mole, which had the complexity that comes of a three-day process. I had the adobo-marinated carne asada, wood grilled and served with a fresh tomato sauce and black beans. Simple, but delicious.Service was delightful. Our server was a young man who was NOT related to owner, contrary to my prediction, but who was visibly proud of the food he was serving. There's an older gentleman, who apparently was a maitre d' at Topolobampo, who works the front of the house, greeting guests and making sure each table is set "just so." He's a delight.The restaurant is BYOB, and there's a liquor store across the street who's waiting for you!

15.description: Ixcateco Grill, I dig you.Albany Park's newest restaurant, I put a bet in that they would handle a dinner party of 9 and the bet paid off!  Coming in at 8 o'clock it took a little bit of time for them to get the tables together, but the wait was not too bad.  It was refreshing to see the place bustling with lots of people enjoying food and drink and it was loud.Once seated we cracked open our bottles of beers and wine, and got our menus and water.  The menu is simple - ten dishes and that's it!  The simplicity of the menu should make for consistent eats and we got our chips and salsa right away.  The chips were fresh and had a nice citrus note to them and the green salsa was tasty.We went with about two over every appetizer and three of the guacamole.  Here is a breakdown of the eats:Guacamole - On point, could spend all day eating this there is a great texture to this guacamole that gives a pleasant mouth feel.  Grab some more chips because this guac is awesome.Ceviche - Tilapia cerviche hit the spot and we probably should have ordered some more.  The composition of the dish made it pleasant in your mouth with fresh flavor that leaves you yearning for more.  The portion size could be bigger but it makes up with lots of taste.Ensalada - This dish wholly surprised me because I actually thought it was going to be the worst of the appetizers we ordered.  In retrospect, this salad was actually the best of it because of the goat cheese and nuts.  The agave ginger dressing just took this salad to the next level and I surprisingly took more than I was planning to!Picadita - The roasted chicken here really stands out as you take a bite of it.  This dish comes in two picaditas so you'll get your fill.  The Masa canoe had a good snap to it when cut, but again the roasted chicken really stands out in this dish.I was really tempted to get the chicken in black mole but decided to go with the Carne Asada instead.  I ordered a side of chunky garlic mashed potato as a side dish and this comfort food was exactly what I needed  The steak was tender, moist with the wood grilled flavor that carried the dish.Overall I would say the food was terrific at a good value.  The only thing that could have been improved would be the service but I understand given the size of the group I was with.  Some friends wanted more drinks, and some friends could not handle waiting but they weren't drinking.Oh yes, BYOB - so make sure you bring some of your favorite wine or beer to pass the time, dinner will be fantastic.

57.description: This place is hands down amazing.  It's 5 star affordable dining... Wait Staff friendly and attentive.  Food is easily the top Mexican in Chicago!  Ceviche is super fresh, camarones are delicatable, and you  won't find a better carne asada dish cooked medium rare!!!!! If you don't come here, you are not eating great Mexican!!!!

20.description: Good variety on the menu. I had the carne asada and my wife has the shrimp. The steak was good and tender, shrimp had good flavor it was just a little too spicy for my wife's taste.  But, I thought it was really good. Garlic mashed potatoes were also really good. Overall the food was definitely worth a try but it's just lacking in ambiance for a place with a better than average menu. It's BYOB and no corking fee, which was nice.

36.description: Went here for a girls' night out.  Didn't realize how small the restaurant was so we had to wait for a bit, but the staff was lovely and kept us updated on the wait.  And then we sat down and ... YUM!  We tried the chicken mole, the steak and a shrimp dish, and everything was so well prepared.  Mole has never been my favorite but the mixture of spices was so complex and the chicken was just perfectly cooked .. I couldn't stop eating.  Would be five star except that the prices are a tiny bit higher than I thought they should be, but the warm service and family-like atmosphere really almost makes up for it.  4 1/2 stars.

14.description: Everything I had was very good. Not your run of the mill Mexican place. The service was mostly young kids who were probably doing their first service jobs so you have to have a bit of patience but I was ok with it.

1.description: I was looking for a place that was close to where I live (nothing worse than getting a relaxing massage then fighting traffic home or dealing with public transpo) to get a massage and wind down from a hectic week.There was a bit of a language barrier, but that didn't bother me. The masseuse was 5-7 minutes late and wrapped up 10 minutes early, so I only really got a 45 minute massage though I paid for an hour ($60 + 20% tip).The place was clean and the women were friendly, but it was a bit odd that I had to pay for, and tip, my masseuse before I even received the massage. I probably won't be back, but I'm glad I gave it a shot.

2.description: Clean and friendly. Commutation is a little bit iffy were English is their second language. They are open until ten pm. I would return.

0.description: 30 min Tui Na Massage for $45 was relaxing and effective.  The therapist had a good massage rhythm where the treatment begins and ends as a complete cycle.  I do feel balanced.Price could be better and competitive.Easy to get appointment.Clean simple organized establishment.Beware of towel on headrest as you can get wrinkles and dents on your face for hours.  :-)

28.description: Great little spot. We had the passion fruit water and horchata, esquites, and a variety of tacos to get a good sample of their offering. The steak and pork were seasoned to perfection and very tender, but the tilapia was a little too...fishy. To be fair, the sauce and toppings on the tilapia taco were great, but the fish was a little past its prime.This place has found its way into our regular rotation. Very tasty!

1.description: Just had enchiladas with green mole, a chicken burrito and 3 different tacos--all outstanding, and incredibly reasonable prices.  The owner runs the place and his mom cooks, and it is so much better than the standard Mexican storefront fare that you get so often in Chicago.  Love it!

9.description: I've been going to El Mogote for years and I can still say that they've really good tacos. My family typically gets the steak tacos and it's great every time we order. It's a bit pricey compared to other taco places, but it's well worth it. They also have good burritos. Every time I go there, I get great service and the food does not take long at all. I recommend everyone to go to this place. Really great food and it's BYOB.

29.description: Good food. Decent prices. I ordered on Grub Hub in a Friday night and got my food in 30min! I had a quesadilla and tacos and they both had a good amount of meat in them.

23.description: Incredible food and service! We came in for a late dinner on a Wednesday and tried each of the tacos on the menu. They were all SO delicious, with different spices and salsas, and we could taste some  amazing marinades happening on several of the meats. Can't wait to come back and try more of the menu! Atmosphere: a lovely modern, minimalist space; clean and simple decor makes the little shop feel spacious. The lady serving the entire place during our visit was gracious, attentive, and friendly. Don't miss this delicious little neighborhood treasure! And don't forget to bring your own tequila if you'd like them to mix you a margarita :)

5.description: Really good food - some nice options here. A nice break from typical Mexican restaurants in the area.

31.description: I have lived literally around the corner from this place for a year now. Seeing its previous kind of run down look I had always put off going here, but after walking by and checking out the clean and pretty tasteful new decor my fiancé and I thought we would give it a try. Boy am I glad we did! I had two cochinita pibil tacos and some steak nachos. My fiancé had a fish taco, a mushroom taco and hongo huaraches. The tortillas appear to be homemade, which was unexpected and welcome, and all of the food we had was excellent. As we were both eating we were thinking of our favorite taco place in the city, Antique Taco in Wicker Park, and this was just as good, if not better, without the line going out of the door. With the price as inexpensive as it was and the quality as high as it was I will for sure to be back again for some excellent tacos.

25.description: Great food! The ingredients in everything we ordered were fresh and not greasy. The arrachera and al pastor tacos were delicious! The accompanying sauces were tasty too. Our server was very friendly and attentive, we didn't even have to ask for refills. Overall, it was a pleasant dining experience for our party of four. I look forward to more tasty tacos.

12.description: This place has been remodeled and the menu has been revamped, and the food here is suddenly delicious. The carne asada here is fantastic, and, I promise, you will not finding a better tasting chicken quesidilla anywhere. In fact, the quesidilla was so good I went back the next day, just to tell them just how phenomenal I thought it was.  The tortilla used, is made in house,  and has a bit of a sweeter flavor to it.  Instead of slices or chunks of chicken, the quesidilla is filled with shredded and marinated chicken, and it's taste just can't be topped.

21.description: This is a small restaurant with great food and great service! It was my first time going here and I was overall satisfied. The chips and salsa were great and our waitress was very nice and constantly asked us if we were okay. The food was delicious and so were the drinks! Not too pricey either. I will definitely be coming back.

16.description: Ok...felt a little guilty passing up Clark St. for this visit. A relatively wide variety of tacos available here of which we ordered six: arrachera, cochinita pibil, barbacoa, al pastor, cecina, and pescado. Each taco was dressed to match it's primary ingredient. Two salsas were brought out with the tacos (different from the one that came with the complimentary chips). Great flavors in each, and priced still to match your everyday taqueria. (we had made a decision between Mogote and another popular new suburban $3-$4/taco joint).They offer a variety of aqua frescas but we went with the cucumber lemonade. And just to get us started we had their two tamale appetizer. A funny thing with the tamale - not sure if it was intentional - I got a part that was crisped up. One might think that it was a mistake since tamales should be soft, but it was a crunchy tasty mistake.Browsing the photos here - do note that they have weekend brunch menu too. Will need to try that and their plate entrées. TVs at both ends of the restaurant provide captioned entertainment.

17.description: This is our go-to Mexican delivery place. We get the burritos usually (steak and barbacoa are both great). And the tacos al pastor are phenomenal. I tried them once after reading a fellow Yelper's review and now I make sure to get a couple every time we order! Satisfying, hearty food at a great price!Minus a star only because once they delivered the tacos without the usual toppings of cilantro and onion.

10.description: Was looking for good Mexican in Albany Park. Really glad I found this place. Very high quality food at very good prices. Brought some tequila with us. The server mixed some truly outstanding margaritas. The service was great as well. Very highly recommended. Try:Cochinita pibilAnything barbacoaThe house-made tortillasEnchiladas in mole (get a mix of the Poblano and the green)

11.description: Never had a Torta on rock hard French bread and quesadillas with super think tortillas. The meat was so chewy and stringy. We spend $75 on our delivery and not one of us finished our food. We are so disappointed.  Never again.

26.description: Really love this place. Recently revamped and the food is even better. They definitely gave some special attention to the tacos which are AMAZING but you really can't go wrong on the entire menu. They make their tortillas to order, so don't go in expecting fast food! Expect great food.Drinks are a little pricey, but for the quality I think they're worth it. No I'm not talking alcoholic drinks, just incredible jamaica and horchata :) They CAN make you a margarita if you BYOTStaff is friendly and helpful which is actually a little rare in this area and much needed. If you have questions and don't know what anything is you can just ask and they're more than happy to explain everything to you.I recommend the Queso Fundido to start. Trust me.

27.description: Are you tired of waiting in line at other nearby brunch spots (thinking Tre Kronor or Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club)?  I have the answer for you.   Restaurante El Mogote has been an Albany Park staple for years, but they have recently remodeled and are now offer an absolutely amazing brunch.  We took my Mother-in-Law in for brunch today (Mother's Day) and had Passion Fruit & Strawberry Bellinis (BYOB), delicious coffee, Huevos Caprienos, and Domingo Por La Manana (x2).It's a small spot and is expertly run by Rigo and his mom and a small staff.  If it's busy you may have to wait longer for your food, but it's definitely worth checking out for brunch or dinner.

0.description: I was here for dinner, and not only was the server attentive, the food was great too!We ordered three different tacos and the guacamole. Definitely the best guac I've had since I've moved from the wear coast. Tacos were great too. Succulent and spiced perfectly with their custom sauces.Highly recommended!

20.description: I've lived in Albany Park for almost two years and just discovered this place. This place is great. It's the best cochinita pibil taco I've had in a restaurant in Chicago. The whole menu is like the Rick Bayless cookbook. Their guacamole is exceptional. Their tortilla chips are made in-house and are crisp and fresh. The decor is unassuming, so all of this came as a surprise. It's a big step above most Mexican restaurants in the city. It's BYOB and if you bring your own tequila they will mix up some of the best margaritas you've ever had. This place is a gem. I'm going to be coming back, and coming back...because this isn't the kind of food I make at home, and it is delicious. We brought our friend who was visiting from out of state, and he was blown away. This isn't re-fried pinto beans with Chihauhau cheese, sour cream, lettuce, and tomato. Their flavors are totally on the mark. Real, delicious Mexican food.

19.description: Easily best tacos in Albany Park, maybe this part of the North Side, that I know of.

33.description: I went with a large group. Everyone raved about their food!  It is a BYOB, but if you bring your own tequila, they will mix you a margarita.  I tried the hibiscus margarita and it was great; it will be even better in the summer.The tamale (appetizer) was perfect. Just the right amount of spice balanced by the corn meal and meat.Now I have to rave about their Albany Park burger.  I know, ordering a burger at a Mexican place seems odd, but I just had to try it.  I now when I want a great burger, I don't have to leave the hood!  It was spicy (but not excessively so), juicy and thick--I had to cut it in quarters to eat it.  Oh, and the fries were good too (I'm not a fry person, so for me that is a glowing endorsement).I may have misunderstood, but I thought I heard someone mention outdoor seating come summer?  If so, that would be perfect!

2.description: Full disclosure: when hubby suggests Mexican carryout for dinner my stomach feels sad. This is because a.) I'm picky about which Mexican dishes I really *love* to eat and b.) Mexican food doesn't always travel well. My defenses were lowered tonight though, so when he suggested El Mogote I actually entertained the idea and hopped on Yelp to take a gander at some food porn pics. Fellow Yelpers had me at "cochinita pibil"...My oh my, it was what dreams are made of. Perfect in every way, comparable to what I've eaten in Mexico. My only regret is that I didn't order more. Hubby got a torta and taco, both of which he really enjoyed, and we shared a side of rice and corn. The rice was unfortunately bland, but greatly helped with some of their delicious green salsa. The corn was also very tasty, but pretty hot, even for my iron stomach. Glutton for punishment I am I'd probably order again, but add some crema or cheese to cool it down. All in all this was an excellent meal and I can't wait to try again. Mexican takeout? Yes, please!

32.description: This place has been remodeled and the menu has been revamped, and the food here is suddenly delicious. The carne asada here is fantastic, and, I promise, you will not finding a better tasting chicken quesidilla anywhere. In fact, the quesidilla was so good I went back the next day, just to tell them just how phenomenal I thought it was.  The tortilla used, is made in house,  and has a bit of a sweeter flavor to it.  Instead of slices or chunks of chicken, the quesidilla is filled with shredded and marinated chicken, and it's taste just can't be topped.

18.description: Really love this place. Recently revamped and the food is even better. They definitely gave some special attention to the tacos which are AMAZING but you really can't go wrong on the entire menu. They make their tortillas to order, so don't go in expecting fast food! Expect great food.Drinks are a little pricey, but for the quality I think they're worth it. No I'm not talking alcoholic drinks, just incredible jamaica and horchata :) They CAN make you a margarita if you BYOTStaff is friendly and helpful which is actually a little rare in this area and much needed. If you have questions and don't know what anything is you can just ask and they're more than happy to explain everything to you.I recommend the Queso Fundido to start. Trust me.

13.description: Incredible food and service! We came in for a late dinner on a Wednesday and tried each of the tacos on the menu. They were all SO delicious, with different spices and salsas, and we could taste some  amazing marinades happening on several of the meats. Can't wait to come back and try more of the menu! Atmosphere: a lovely modern, minimalist space; clean and simple decor makes the little shop feel spacious. The lady serving the entire place during our visit was gracious, attentive, and friendly. Don't miss this delicious little neighborhood treasure! And don't forget to bring your own tequila if you'd like them to mix you a margarita :)

4.description: Very good.  The tilapia tacos were great.  Guacamole made just right. The horchata comes in a huge glass. Definitely recommend this place.

24.description: Was looking for good Mexican in Albany Park. Really glad I found this place. Very high quality food at very good prices. Brought some tequila with us. The server mixed some truly outstanding margaritas. The service was great as well. Very highly recommended. Try:Cochinita pibilAnything barbacoaThe house-made tortillasEnchiladas in mole (get a mix of the Poblano and the green)

6.description: Came here because of Yelp reviewsThe food was excellent and Rego made excellent Margaritas with the Tequila and Triple Sec we brought.  EXCELLENT experience and will DEFINITELY be back.

22.description: This place is excellent. My boyfriend and I came here for lunch. The ambience is very nice. Different for a Mexican restaurant. One reason we came here is that they are a BYOB. We bought our own tequila and had strawberry & passion fruit margaritas. The complimentary chips and salsa were very good. The chips were very fresh and crispy. The menu is kinda different from a typical Mexican menu. They have the usual tacos, tortas, burritos, etc. but they have sandwiches also. I had the Albany Park burger which was a burger with chorizo, poblano peppers, cheese, it was very yummy. My boyfriend had 3 tacos. He ate every bit. We will definitely go back here.

15.description: AMAZING service. Our waiter was patient and gave excellent service. The tacos here are one of the best tacos we've had. The horchata wasn't too sweet, it was just right. The quesadilla was great. Everything came out nice and fresh. Even the fries were crispy and fresh! Have nothing to complain about this place. Cute little restaurant & I will be coming here more often.

7.description: I can not rave about this place enough! I came across it on Yelp looking for a spot to get dinner in my area. The inside is super cute, very clean, and open kitchen. Everything tasted so fresh and well thought out. You can tell the owners care and have a passion for their restaurant. I got the carne asada tacos, rice and beans. Mouthwatering. The horchata is amazing too and comes in a huge goblet/glass. While yes it might be more expensive than other Mexican restaurants in the area, it is completely worth it. I want to try everything on the menu and wish I could eat here every day! Definitely give this place a try if you want to be blown away.

8.description: Yum! Great tacos and guacamole, reasonably priced, fast service and delicious! The restaurant has seating for about 50. A nice place to have lunch or dinner. Street parking.

30.description: So good. Tamales d.f., mole enchiladas, and all the tacos are delicious. Best Mexico City style food I've had in the area.

3.description: Are you tired of waiting in line at other nearby brunch spots (thinking Tre Kronor or Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club)?  I have the answer for you.   Restaurante El Mogote has been an Albany Park staple for years, but they have recently remodeled and are now offer an absolutely amazing brunch.  We took my Mother-in-Law in for brunch today (Mother's Day) and had Passion Fruit & Strawberry Bellinis (BYOB), delicious coffee, Huevos Caprienos, and Domingo Por La Manana (x2).It's a small spot and is expertly run by Rigo and his mom and a small staff.  If it's busy you may have to wait longer for your food, but it's definitely worth checking out for brunch or dinner.

14.description: So good. Tamales d.f., mole enchiladas, and all the tacos are delicious. Best Mexico City style food I've had in the area.

3.description: I went one day to try it out since I always go to Rockys tacos. First off I waited wayyy too long for my tacos. The waitress put my order in wrong and they gave me a salad I didn't ask for. Once I finally got my food and I went home The food tasted good, but later that night I was soooo sick. I will never eat here again! I have never been that sick with food before. NEVER AGAIN!

1.description: **New Management. NOT GOOD ANYMORE**All of the reviews prior to this are correct.But Taqueria El Aguila Real changed owners, since then the steak is not as flavorful and the salsa is not as good nor the beans. The beans taste like they're from a can.Today I ordered tacos. I order them the same every single time. Only cilantro, onions and tomatoes. The woman that is always at the register knows what I want and recites it back to me exactly right. Today I received all tacos with lettuce, sour cream, and cheese!I called to complain and the woman handed me off to a man who then hung up on me. Since I live relatively close I walked in there and asked why they hung up on me and told them that's not how they are supposed to treat customers. The woman said if I gave her the tacos back she'd give me my money. I told her that I scraped off all that I didn't want and had my own cilantro at home.I also told them how it wasn't as good since they took over and that they messed up my order one too many times. Anytime we have visitors we bring them to this taqueria, and we order all the time. No longer will we be ordering from here and I urge anyone else to not give this place any business. Try Rocky's Tacos, the place on montrose and whipple, or even the million others on Irving Park.

2.description: Orale! I walked out with 4 tacos and a Jarritos tamarindo for like $7.18. No quiero Taco Bell, bitch. The steak tacos were weak, but fortunately, I had two al pastors on hand. Epic victory there. Actually, I think I just got fooled by the cilantro they applied, and the lime the put in the bag with it, but so what, I won. In your face, YUM Brands.

0.description: After a long day of moving and unpacking, we were starving at  11 p.m.  Certainly it makes sense to take a walk and see what the new 'hood has to offer, right?Tacos were required.  Jackpot with El Aguila Real.We walked past and the place was empty but well lit.  We tried the door and it was locked.  Sad.  Next, the little man inside came running to open the door and invite us in!  Bonus!The man (not sure if he's the owner or what) was so very nice!!  He brought our chips and salsa while we read the menu and was very proud to announce that they were "on the house".  The salsa was great, nice and spicy the way I like it.  Two tacos and a steamy bowl of menudo later, we were very happy.  The carne asada tacos were very good, not greasy and the menudo was gigantic, spicy and chewy delicious, served with piping hot tortillas, cilantro, limes and onion.  All of our food was about seven bucks!I know that this will be a regular go-to place for me in the future.  Honestly, I probably would have given it 4 stars, but the fact that he opened the place for us gave him the coveted fifth star.

4.description: Mmmm-MMM!    Went here with my mom.   The awesome burrito I got stuffed with tasty pork was about 5.50.  Not bad, when you consider I had to get part of it boxed up, cause I was full!   'Course, it could have been because I'd been snarfing some of the salad my mom got before I got my own food!   I don't even like salad normally,  but I kept at this one, and poor mom was like "hey, it's mine, get your own!"  Guess she liked it too.  I'm not even exaggerating.   It's also a plus that they have a small beer selection that includes Blue Moon (woo-hoo!).  There's wine too, but I don't know the kind or if it's good.   But it's a small diner-ish place, so people aren't gonna go there for wine tasting anyway.  They're gonna go for the yummy avocado salads!

58.description: The BEST Shrimp Fried Rice in the City!  All the food here is very good.  Nothing outstanding, other than the SFR.  BYOBAlways slow service.  As long as you expect this you'll have a good time.

56.description: I'm a fan of cripst pad see ew, and this place doesn't disappoint.I order here once in a while when I do get the urge to eat.I have only eaten here once and I carry out mostly, the carry out times are mostly on point.  I've never showed up and my food isn't ready.  The family that owns this place is super nice, and whenever I order they throw in free cokes!  The basil chicken is made to order to be mild or super spicy and you can get it made from ground chicken or just chicken pieces.  The crispy pad see ew is made to perfection!  One of the best that I have had.  I would get it everytime, and probably will from now on.The pad thai is very good as well.I would also suggest the shrimp friend rice!  I actually don't like friend rice but this I would make an exception for.It's an authentic, family owned, thai restaurant.  Can't get better than that.

29.description: Bland food. Slow service. Delayed ordered with no complimentary appetizer. I must say there are much better options for good Thai food in the area

42.description: Oh my god this place is horrible. I had the thai spring rolls which tasted like it had burnt tofu in it. I had thai ice tea and it tasted as though it had some weird spice in it. I had pad see ew and it had no sauce at all with it and the noodles tasted nasty. The only thing in my order I could eat was the pot stickers. Everything else was so bad I couldn't even try to eat it. There goes $18 down the drain and an empty stomach to take to bed.

23.description: I'm sure they can care less about reviews so I won't go there with how they need to hire more staff. No I think I'll go there! Owner lets one man bus/wait the entire restaurant making you wait ridiculously long for your order, your food, and your check. I love their food but their service needs a lot of work. I despise going there during lunch because my entire stay takes an hour and a half just to eat pad Thai and an egg roll. Insane. I don't have that much time during lunch!Back to food. Soup is awesome. Never had anything like it. Hot sauce is unique with a Spanish (sofrito) flavor. Try their crispy padsee eww. Very nice and crispy.

47.description: i love thai valley! i lived two blocks away for over twenty years, and i love thai food, but somehow managed to never even think of going. a friend swore by it for years and finally i tried it.i couldn't be happier, the price and quality give 5 stars. the lunch special is the best deal you will get at a legit restaurant. i have tried every thai dish there, pad thai, pad see ew, panang, etc. i always expected it to suck, and was proven wrong every single time.i now order the beef fried rice every time, a dish that i wouldn't even think of ordering anywhere else because it is just so simple yet often f###ed up by other restaurants

8.description: JESUS JOSEPH AND MARY THIS PLACE IS GOOD!! Theyre BYOB! (foremost is right next door) and the food is just sooo fresh!. I HATE chinese food but DEF hit up the occasional thai spot,ever since river kwai closed (R.I.P) I cant seem to find an OKAY place. Thats sad when im willing to settle for OKAY. Had the noodle kee mow which is my FAV and like all appetizers. I keep telling myself Im going to try differernt things when I go but keep going for what I know. I will try other food and update review!

31.description: Below average tasting Thai Food.  Orange Chicken was burnt.   Not one or two pieces of chicken....I'm talking every piece of chicken.   Would never go back.

34.description: Overall if you are craving Thai food this place is not bad to go to. We went there last night and for appetizer we ordered spring rolls and cream cheese crab wonton. I enjoyed the spring rolls but the cream cheese crab wonton was more greasy dough than the actual stuffing (I love a good crab wonton). For the main dish I ordered Shrimp pad thai and my boyfriend ordered the chicken pad thai. Chicken pad thai was good (probably the best choice on the menu) and there was a lot of chicken. My shrimp pad thai on the other hand had only 5 small pieces of shrimp...

16.description: I'm sure they can care less about reviews so I won't go there with how they need to hire more staff. No I think I'll go there! Owner lets one man bus/wait the entire restaurant making you wait ridiculously long for your order, your food, and your check. I love their food but their service needs a lot of work. I despise going there during lunch because my entire stay takes an hour and a half just to eat pad Thai and an egg roll. Insane. I don't have that much time during lunch!Back to food. Soup is awesome. Never had anything like it. Hot sauce is unique with a Spanish (sofrito) flavor. Try their crispy padsee eww. Very nice and crispy.

13.description: Lunch special is fantastic especially since it's only six bucks for a soup, appetizer, and entree. I come here with my dad every so often for lunch and the food here is really good and I can definitely say that it's authentic. I do agree that they need to hire more staff but the main waiter is very nice and does a really good job of holding his own. It also absolutely DOES NOT smell like cat pee in the restaurant and that other reviewer seems to be very rude. I think it's worth it to try and I'm a big fan of their Lad Nar which tastes like Thai food I used to eat back when I was a kid. No complaints here.

11.description: Very good... Never disappoints you get your money's worth soup, appetizer, and entree for lunch special only $6.95/sit down only...love the pad see eiw, spring rolls and crab Rangoon

39.description: Excellent Authentic Thai food at very affordable pricing.  Street Parking can be a bit hard.The menu does not have as many items as a typical Thai restaurant in the area. However the food is carefully and properly made here. I always get their panang with spinach and the minced chicken with basil. The Thai fried rice with basil is very good also. The pad Thai is up to par, a bit wet though.   When you get the panang it will take some time to prepare, but it's done correctly. Simmer using low heat. If you eat enough Thai curry you will know what I mean when the curry is prepared correctly. Many times I have tasted curry prepared quickly using high heat causing the panang sauce to have a slight burn taste.BTW, I gave up on their delivery.... took too long and the seasoning seems lacking  and not as flavorful.

37.description: This tastes like Thai food made by some guy who learned to make Thai food from a guy who learned to make Thai food from a guy that learned to make Thai food from a guy that visited Thailand once in 1972,Tried it out twice because I'm a glutton for punishment.  The first time got some curry and the FRIED PAD SEE EWW!!!  FRIED!I have been to a lot of Thai restaurants.  Lots.  It's a favorite ethnic go-to... Chicago has made me sad in this regard.  Most places just don't cut it and all of these 'fusion' asian restaurants just spread the mediocrity around the various style so that they all just suck.  But I digress:I have been to a lof of Thai restaurants and have never heard of this FRIED Pad See Ew.  I mean, the dish is actually named "Fried with Soy Sauce", so FRIED Pad See Ew sounds redundant, but there it was next to regular Pad see Ew for a dollar up charge.Oh my, what a novelty.  I could see myself buying this from a stand at some local festival while I watch toddlers scream for funnel cakes.Yet a novelty does not save a restaurant from its myriad other failures.First order was take-out.  Ready in 30 minutes the fellow on the phone said.  I headed over there and announced myself at about 25 minutes.    It wasn't ready, but no worries, I'm 5 minutes early or so.  Not sure why it takes THIRTY MINUTES to make Coconut Milk Soup and Curry that you already made hours ago and just have simmering on the pot waiting to throw in whatever meat I choose, but whatever.The inside of this place was odd.  In the front near the windows facing the street was the dine in area, which seemed fine.  But in the back sitting area which doubled as the waiting for pick-up area was a large TV.  So if you were in the dine-in area, you got to hear it but not see it.  Cozy.So when I got there, the TV was on number 15 of the countdown of the TOP TWENTY STUPID DAREDEVILS!  Quality television for the discerning intellectual.Before my food was ready, I got to watch the rest of the show in its entirety.  I was even prepared to get mad when I got to see the number 2 STUPIDEST DAREDEVIL but then get my food and leave, never knowing who had the dubious distinction of being number one.  Because that's how it always works.Except this time.  I got to finish the show.  For anyone that's counting, this puts me in the restaurant for FORTY FIVE MINUTES.  So what the guy on the phone really meant when he said 'ready in 30 minutes' was 'ready in an hour and ten minutes'.Anyway, took that home and had some bland Thai food, not at all inspiring.  Sad sad sad.  Except for the Fried Fried with Soy Sauce.  That was fun.So why did I go a second time?  Because the first time may have been a fluke.  Head Chef might have been out sick that night or who knows?!?Yeah, lightning strikes TWICE!  Bland, boring, not properly cooked, poor presentation.  'Fried rice' that was just white rice with sauteed vegetables thrown over it.  The Tom Kha was OK, but how do you mess up Tom Kha?Anyway, sorry for you guys that think its great.  I pray for your palette.

0.description: I've been going to Thai Valley for almost 2 decades now. It's good Thai for decent prices.The only thing is there one server and he's been there for much longer. As of lately it seems the place has been getting slammed with large parties.It's usually empty and quiet.Otherwise I've never been disappointed with any of their dishes.I recommend their Pepper Steak - very delicious.

38.description: Seriously? I don't know whether you guys who gave this place better than 2 stars have had Thai food outside of Chicago (because so far Chicago thai restaurants are FAIL) but this half-assed garbage does not even rate.Ordered the tom ka, papaya salad, basil fried rice, and pad see ew.Tom ka we ordered with tofu but got it with chicken. Nothing special about it, tasted like they heated up a can of coconut milk and threw in some chicken. Papaya salad was actually decent, though nothing special.Basil fried rice...well I don't know how they can call this fried rice because there is nothing fried about it. I got some sad wilted basil leaves, mushy steak and a mess of  bell peppers and onions (supposed to be hot peppers) over plain old steamed rice. Absolutely not fried rice by any  stretch of the imagination. Even for what it was it sucked.Pad see ew- Yuck. A meager smattering of overcooked broccoli  and dry chicken accompanied overcooked noodles that were baaaaaarely sauced and certainly not sauteed to a nice caramelized glaze like they're supposed to be. Tasted like they dunked old noodles back into tepid dirty water, chucked in old chicken and broccoli cooked yesterday and called it a day.We ordered take out and I guess if I had ever set foot in the place beforehand I would never have ordered from there in the first place...place smells of stale cigarettes and they have a TV blaring in the back while people in the front get to eat to it as background music. Yuck, just yuck.

51.description: The food is not as delicious as I hoped it to be.  When my friend and I went, the place was pretty empty.  I may give this place another chance on another day, but I'm not going to expect much.

27.description: thai valley = oh yeah!! everything we have had from here has been delicious.Curry, good. Pad Thai, awesome. Tom Yum soup, spicy and wonderful!

32.description: Came here with my husband for the lunch special. We arrived at 11, but it was 11:20 before they even turned the lights on (after 3 more tables had arrived). The service was good, but the food was too sweet for my taste. I had the Tom Yum chicken soup. I normally love the spicy lemongrass flavor of tom yum, but this soup was waaaaaay to sweet for me. The crab rangood was just ok, nothing mindblowing. The basil chicken, a dish I love and eat all the time, was also way too sweet! The cook must have a sweet tooth.  My husband's fried rice was good, but that's not enough to lure me back to Thai Valley.

54.description: Thai Valley is the bomb. I mean, my goodness it's good. I've been eating here for almost ten years and it hasn't changed, which is a wonderful wonderful thing. The things that I recommend are: Vegetable tempura, potstickers, chicken satay, and as far as main dishes go, order the basil over rice, the gang garee, chicken cashew, or the pad see ewe. Those have all been my go-tos for all these years. The owner is always there and always friendly. The place is always clean and bright. The food is just so good and even though I named what I like, I'm sure that no matter what you choose, you will not be disappointed. The lunch special is $6.95 and you get a lot of food. You get soup, an appetizer, and an entree. The soup that comes with it, Tom Yum, is another thing that I frequently get as a meal (if I'm in the mood and late for the lunch special). It's chock full of straw mushrooms and ground chicken and the broth has a unique flavor that not everyone enjoys based on my experience, but I love it. One thing I want to try is their desert of mango and sticky rice. There will be an update!Everything is great. Everything is fresh. Thai Valley, you're the best!

48.description: this is our go-to place for thai take out!  their prices are decent and the food's delish.  i'm glad they finally took down the photo of blago and the fam that was signed and framed.  :-)  try their tom yum soup and won ton soup are both wonderful.  there's this spicy beef salad that my husband orders all the time and is full of delicious flavor.  their portions are very generous for the price.  our other regular order is pad thai and spring rolls.

44.description: I love this place! We've discovered this resto almost 15 years ago! They have great and very cheap lunch special , it comes with soup , appetizer and a large entree! We've moved to the burbs but each time we visit the cirty and craves for Thai this place is where we go!

24.description: This place used to be the best that good on the north side. Now it's just edible... It's too bad as I really did enjoy this place once upon a time.

7.description: The guy who answered the phone was very nice and very friendly! I think he's the guy that delivers too! The seafood fried rice was the bomb!! Tom yum soup was also great!!! We'll order here often!! I was supposed to order pad see ew but I ordered pad Thai instead, but I wasn't sorry, it was great!! Thanks Thai valley! And for $2 delivery 2 thumbs up!!! Over all I was pleased!!

49.description: Pretty basic Thai - nothing special, but nothing really wrong with it.  Sometimes the beef is a little tough, and I don't think I would risk ordering anything out of the ordinary.  But if you need  a quick Thai fix, try this place out.

40.description: Ok, ...a lot of people seem to like this place, but we weren't so excited by it, so I'll share our experience.I tried the "crispy" Pad See-Ew based on some yelper's opinions of it.  Not knocking their love of it.  But I personally found it horrible.  So bad I didn't eat it.Let me preface this with the fact that I love deep fried things.  I don't dab the grease of my pizza with a napkin, I'll eat an entire funnel cake by myself, I think deep fried twinkies are amazing.But this crispy Pad See-Ew was yucky.  Each of the noodles are deep fried, in theory this sounds wonderful.  In practice, I think their oil was about 100 degrees too cold.  Those noodles soaked up so much oil.... when you bit into the noodle you got a mouth full of oil.  Also, the "rest" of the dish tasted like it had no sauce.  So it was deep fried noodles with tofu and egg...and it tasted like deep fried noodles, with plain tofu and plain egg.My husband got the pepper and garlic tofu.  He also was unimpressed, he added a bunch of crap from around the house and made it tolerable for himself, but we both looked at each other and decided we never needed to try this place again.We tried to get the pot stickers, but they either don't make or were out of veggie ones.  So we got the spring rolls.  I didn't have any major complaints about them but my husband thought they weren't good, so I guess it worked out well.  I ate the spring rolls for dinner because mine was awful, and he ate his doctored pepper and garlic tofu.If you're thinking about trying this place for the first time, maybe don't try these items... I bet the WHOLE menu isn't awful, but our opinion of these were so poor, we don't feel the need to (potentially) waste more money trying.

53.description: I have been going to Thai Valley ever since I was young, which was about 10 years ago. I grew up blocks away from that but live in the suburbs now. Every time I visit my grandparents I always make sure to get takeout from Thai Valley. The only things I have ever got was beef and broccoli, eggs rolls, and chicken fried rice. Yes, it doesn't sound like anything crazy but no one has ever beaten those meals. It's simple but amazing. I finally got a chance to take my boy friend and he is hooked as well. It hasn't changed in years and thats why I like it so much.

30.description: I read reviews on this place before i walked in thinking everyone has their own taste buds and i would try this place out for myself since i dont live that far away. I walk into this place and there is not a single person to take my take out order. The i think owner finally gets up to take my order from watching iron man on tv off in the corner. I order chicken pad thai and spring rolls. I get home and the pad thai tastes like it sat underneath a heat lamp for an hour  coming from a box at the grocery store. It was not true pad thai by any means. and if a thai food place cant get pad thai correct there is something really wrong.I open up my spring rolls thinking they can redeem themselves. and my spring roll looks like its sushi. It looked and tasted like it was wrapped in Styrofoam. It was awful. Please I want to let you know, if you like thai food you will want to go somewhere else. I wish i would have gone to mcdonalds right next door instead. I am not the one to really write extremely bad reviews because i understand small business's are trying to make it in corporate america, but do yourself a favor and go to a different small business in the area.

46.description: not bad for the priceservice kinda slowwill be back

1.description: The food here is super-tasty. I particularly like their Thom Ka Gai and their curries. Their Tod Mun and -of course- Pad Thai are excellent.  Owner is a wonderful man!And the prices are VERY reasonable! If you are on a budget and want some tasty Thai food, don't miss Thai Valley!Have some excellent lunch deals, too.Pleasant interior and generally good service, although since it is a small place there is some waiting at peak times.

55.description: I have been here a lot of times and finally decided to do a review on it. I liked the fried rice and the Chili on rice everything else was just ok. The soup of the day is always the same and the smell and taste of it reminds me of cleaning products. That is why i hardly ever eat the soup of the day. I have definitely been to better Thai places. The waiter is always the same guy since he takes care of every table even if it is busy. I don't remember him coming to our table at all asking if everything was ok. There was also what looked like a piece of hair in my sister's food!! EWW!  So in the end I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless they are looking for a cheap dinner.

9.description: Always seemed empty inside and now I know why. 1) Smells like cat pee inside2) Bad staff3) Even worse food - the tom ka kai was actually inedible, weird thick consistency and intensely lemony (so much so that no other flavors came through). I will NEVER go back. Way too many other good Thai restaurants in the neighborhood to waste your money on this place.

26.description: Great service. Great prices, including lunch specials. Delicious soup! Tom Yum is my favorite!

25.description: Great lunch special- 2 appetizers and entree for 6 bucks! Tasty, casual and good service!

12.description: I would give it 5 starts, but the service is slow... Otherwise I think it's perfect. I have tried several menu options and none disappointed me

59.description: Decided to stop in since there was a 2 hour wait at Semiramis (failed attempted groupon use). We walked by the place and I looked in and thought to myself that it might actually be good. I had no idea I would be walking back over to eat in the same night. We started out with Crab Ragoon as an appetizer. They were huge and came with 7 pieces...pretty good. For my meal I went with the Roasted Duck over rice. The portion was just right...not too big, not too small.The duck was very tender and packed with lots of flavorNice little spot to stop in  randomnly. This place is BYOB and delivers

21.description: My family has visited this family's restaurant for over 30 years. The original Thai Valley was located on Lawrence. There is an entire menu worth checking out, and others have mentioned trying different foods. That is all well and good, but I have consistently ordered only one dish from here over the many years: the fried rice. Their fried rice is hands down the best friend rice I have eaten anywhere in the US. I've lived in LA, in New Orleans, and a few other smaller cities, and Thai Valley's fried rice is the one I compare all fried rice to. And, none ever come close. It could be a combination of my taste buds and their unique recipe, but whatever it is, it works. If you try this place out, start with the fried rice and then work your way out. The fried rice with the wonton soup: my family's classic combo. I guarantee that you will be satisfied with this combo. It is perfect, and there are few restaurants that can meet perfection with such simplicity. There is a reason this place has been open for over 30 years, and I think the reason is the fried rice.

17.description: The food was not worth the wait, it had a burnt smell to it. Will not be ordering again.

10.description: This place is a hidden gem. I would go there literally every weekend when I lived in Chicago.Fairly affordable price, especially their lunch special, and the portion is HUGE. Satay was my favorite from this place--tender marinated chicken, skewered and charcoal-broiled, served with peanut sauce & cucumber salad. You get to pick your own choice of fried rice as well. I would always go with beef fried rice. Sooooo good. Now I miss this place. I discovered I had a huge appetite Thai food when I first checked out this place about 5 years ago. Just try it, you won't regret it.P.S. : The only thing was I could never get used to their appetizer soup though. I don't know what it's called but I was never a big fan of it.

5.description: I've been coming here for more than a decade. The food is always wonderful. You can't really beat their lunch special price of $6.95 for soup, app and entree, but what really makes me give this place 5 stars is the service. There's always this one man there who always waits on us and he is always on top of everything. The food comes out fast, my water is always filled right away and he's just so friendly. Even when this place is packed for lunch this man is just all sorts of amazing and I needed to write this review because I've been coming here and this service has always been wonderful. I'll continue to come here for a long time.

3.description: I waited for over 5 minutes to greeted and seated.. Ordered probably some of the worst crab Rangoon I've ever tasted with a good amount grease coming off them and the fish I ordered almost took 30 minutes in an almost empty restaurant that I had to switch it to go.. Not a good first experience at all..

35.description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant... I've been to a lot...this place has the best best egg rolls...I crave these..I could make a whole meal out of this...I've tried a lot of things on the menu and I've loved all of it...sometimes the food is better than other times...but definitely better most times...Lunch specials are the best...includes soup, appetizer and main dish..and a lot of it so I always have left overs.I admit even if we order ahead we always have to wait a long time after you get there..but let me tell you..the egg rolls are worth it..I also like their  pad Thai  and their soups...Street parking...

19.description: This is the only place that does pad si we with the very crispy noodles. (You have to request then xtra crispy)  Mmmm. Reasonably priced and very friendly. Street parking. Just off the Brown Line kedzie stop.  We come with the whole family. Everything is made to order. The pad Thai and fried rice are the way to go also.

28.description: I've been here a few times and their food here is very greasy. I had ordered the pad thai on one occasion and on another occasion it was the pad see ew. Everything was oversauced and there were no fresh vegetables on the pad thai. So sad...

45.description: The prices were very reasonable, the range for entrees were about 6-7$, with the highest item on the menu being a 18.99 red snapper dish. I ordered the Pad Woon Sen, it was my first time having it but it was very flavorful. I also saw a group of cops eat here so you know the food is good. I would definitely come here again to try different dishes and judging by the other reviews here, I won't be disappointed.

33.description: this is our neighborhood Thai place and we like it a lot! The food is pretty good and consistent. The only reason for 4 starts vs 5 stars is because their interior definitely needs a refresh. It seems like nothing has changed since the 70s

43.description: We ordered from this place a couple weeks ago. I really wanted to like it because they deliver to my place and we don't have many Thai delivery options in the area. We ordered basil chicken, the bass and pad thai. The basil chicken was really good. No complaints there. Now the pad thai....actually I don't think I can even call it pad thai. It was a different type of noodle from what I've ever experienced and there was no taste at all. I thought maybe they forgot to add seasonings to it and just gave us the cooked noodles. There is no way that was pad thai. It was so bad we didn't even eat it.The bass was pretty gross. They serve it whole, which doesn't scare me. My family eats whole fish all the time, with head, tail and all. The problem here is that they did not scale it well. All the scales were left on the tail, head and sides of the fish. I know it's deep fried, so maybe that doesn't matter, but who wants to eat fish with scales on it? The taste was ok, I've had much better. It did come with a nice garlic sauce. I don't think I'll give this place another try. My boyfriend and I are really particular with Thai food since it's one of our favs and this place just didn't do it for us. Lately it's been Dharma Garden or pick up at Sticky Rice.

2.description: Daughter had Pad Thai. Had no taste. None.Almost no chicken. I had Pad Kee Mao(sic).Awful, burnt, licorice taste. Greasy and just yuck.Same problem with the chicken.Almost none. Spring Rolls were awful, too.How do you mess up Spring Rolls?I don't give out bad reviews easily and only when warranted.I love Thai Food and this was just bad.

18.description: In agreement with a lot of the other reviewers, this place is decent but not amazing.I do have to say that the staff is incredibly nice and friendly.

41.description: Thai Valley is my solid choice for Thai take-out in my neighborhood, Albany Park.  Carry-out service is quick and friendly.  Prices are reasonable.  Most dishes are very good - - even family and friends have been impressed.  My favorites are the lemon grass chicken (yum), pad thai (with a side of peanut sauce), shrimp rolls, and chicken cashew.

52.description: thai valley to me is yet another case for wanting half stars, but I'm in a good mood and enjoyed it enough to give them three. I stopped in for lunch with a friend and we just sat ourselves. There were a decent amount of people in around 12:30ish, but it didn't take us long to get our food. The lunch specials are a bit thin in selection, but I got myself some pad prik, soup, and shrimp rolls lunch deal.The shrimp rolls were pretty good. The tails were still on them, which caught me a bit off guard, but no big deal. The tom yum soup that was the special was very good. More savory with some nice sized chunks of mushrooms in there. The pad prik was pretty solid, nothing too spectacular. They didn't dumb down the spicyness thankfully (which happens too often for me).The service was friendly and there was a very old school vibe to thai valley. Its nothing I would go out of my way for in the end though

50.description: I love this place. Good prices and the lunch specials are amazing. $5.95 for soup, appetizer, and entree? Its a good deal. Service might not be all that great, but who cares? the food is great. I love the clear sweet and sour sauce they have. i pour it over the fried rice and it makes it taste even better!

4.description: Great Thai food for the prices. I loved the fact they offered mild and spicy green curry. The place is generally empty, and there is only one server. Everyone there is very friendly. The pad Thai was ok, can definitely be more flavorful. The cardboard cut out of the woman would always freak me out. I'd think it was an actual person.

6.description: We love Thai Valley! We've been consistently ordering their food take out for 3+ years. Their Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, Crab Rangoon, Shrimp Rolls, Tom Yum Seafood Soup and Panang Curry are amazing! We've never eaten inside and the interior is not much to look at. But it's wonderful for take out and delivery!

22.description: Best lunch special ever...after Pilipino Isla of course.  But this place can't be beat for their brand of Asian cuisine.  The food is good enough, nothing Bourdainish about but it's also six bucks so nobody is going to spend time transforming pad thai into something that resembles a piece of bamboo for an audience who doesn't care.  So yes this is a review of the lunch deal which comes with soup, appetizer and main dish. I'm not going to be too critical because only an ass would critique a six dollar meal...only a bigger ass would be critical of a real live old thai lady doing the cooking especially when I grew up on a fake version of Thai food.  Long story short it's a destination lunch place...4 stars****

15.description: Very pleasant service, every dish is done well, and you can't beat the lunch specials. The candy they have by the register is an added favorite of mine. Some people have knocked this place for slow service, but considering it seems to only ever be one guy running the front l, and probably one in the kitchen, they do an excellent job managing rush periods.

57.description: This is my new go-to-spot for thai food in my neighborhood.The food is great and the people are nice.The service is definitely slow. But the owner is the man, he's super-friendly.My suggestion: Order it, take your time picking it up, bring it back home, eat happy.

20.description: This is the only place that does pad si we with the very crispy noodles. (You have to request then xtra crispy)  Mmmm. Reasonably priced and very friendly. Street parking. Just off the Brown Line kedzie stop.  We come with the whole family. Everything is made to order. The pad Thai and fried rice are the way to go also.

36.description: Every Sunday my death metal band and I go to Thai Valley to get sweaty with hot peppers. Some weeks the food comes out fresh and fast, other weeks, we have to wait 25 minutes just to get our orders in. The speed of the service doesn't seem at all correlated with the number of customers though. Sometimes it's jam packed and we get great service. Other times, we're the only ones there and end up having stomach growling contests before we even get to speak to the waiter.When I say 'the waiter' I really mean, the one and only waiter. Again, regardless of how busy the place is, it's always just this one guy! I don't get it!The food itself is also hit or miss, but for $6, the lunch special (soup, appetizer and entre) never fails to satisfy. They've always been good with special requests and made me suffer (in a good way) once when I mentioned that their 'hot' wasn't hot enough the previous time. All in all, I like the tradition of coming to this place but in the grand scheme of Thai restaurants, it's Thai Valley only shines with three stars.

14.description: Best lunch special ever...after Pilipino Isla of course.  But this place can't be beat for their brand of Asian cuisine.  The food is good enough, nothing Bourdainish about but it's also six bucks so nobody is going to spend time transforming pad thai into something that resembles a piece of bamboo for an audience who doesn't care.  So yes this is a review of the lunch deal which comes with soup, appetizer and main dish. I'm not going to be too critical because only an ass would critique a six dollar meal...only a bigger ass would be critical of a real live old thai lady doing the cooking especially when I grew up on a fake version of Thai food.  Long story short it's a destination lunch place...4 stars****

12.description: Big fan of the place. They have an eatery inside that has the best chicken kabob sandwich in town. Make sure you ask them to put it on their special bread they make there fresh everyday. The grocery store itself has all the middle eastern items you need.

3.description: This supermarket is awesome! It has everything you need to make the perfect Middle Eastern meal. Nice sized parking lot so you don't have to pay for parking like the markets on Devon. It is a pretty big store and is well kept - very organized with directory signs in each aisle. The meat section is very clean and the prices are very reasonable. The workers didn't give me a weird look because I'm Asian. I certainly respect that. Also, all of the breads are freshly made! You can see them make it too. I'm a fan of this place - highly recommend!

1.description: Love coming here. They have huge variety of different products from Turkey and other Mediterranean countries. My favorite is the Turkish tea. Very friendly people and prices are not that bad.

2.description: Although the place has almost everything..the chicken legs i bought from them were rotten and had to throw it in garbage by the time i reached home! In future, maybe i will buy other items from them but meat or chicken NO WAY!

9.description: Sahar is apparently a fairly new grocery store on Kedzie. I wandered in and was pleasantly surprised by the wide selection of Turkish and Middle Eastern goods. I bought some cherry juice from Turkey, a candy bar from Palestine, and a box of couscous from France. I felt like buying more stuff! There is a meat counter, a small fruit / vegetable section, and also a variety of nonalcoholic drinks for the true Muslim at heart.

10.description: I had the absolute best chicken kabob and falafel sandwich there! It had lots of veggies: tomato, pickle, red cabbage, onion and seasonings. It reminded me of the Turkish kebab stands all over the place in Rome, Italy. A very small market in general but it has floor to ceiling shelves packed. They must have an inventory of many thousands of items. I also needed self burning charcoal for incense; they had it. A wide selection of tea. Delicious spinach pies, you get the idea. One minor complaint - when I first noticed it there was a grand opening special of buy 3 sandwiches get 1 free, the following week it was gone. They should have left the promotion going several months to attract new customers and to ensure I would keep going back every few days. One other minor complaint and it would help the business save credit card fees - you have to pay at the takeout counter separately from the grocery counter.

4.description: More expensive than any other international markets. Also the cashier who works on Sunday needs to learn customer service.

6.description: Reasonably priced Zabiha meat. I got chicken drumsticks and beef stew meat.I also purchased a whole lamb shoulder (2.99/lb, came out to less than $30). What I did not like is that they did not clean the meat properly and did not separate it how I asked. My husband was not pleased with it when I got home. I will try them again and update if they get the lamb situation together. The other meat otherwise was just fine.

0.description: I go there every time I need a middle eastern food product. They should reconsider their vegetable prices through.Nice treatment and well-organized store.

5.description: I went here because of the very good lamb leg reviews. No.. That meat is black and blue looks like the lamb was beaten to death before it died. Gross

13.description: I have been shopping here for a couple years now! Even better since they moved to larger location.Meat products are halal. The staff are very helpfull and pleasant. They also have a pital kitchen and food is great!

11.description: Highly recommended. These guys have moved on up from a small store to a super market that has become huge. Here's why: their staff are quick in taking your orders when ordering meat, cheese, fish, or other cooking meats available when needed. They have large selection of items when needed that are from other countries that none other have available. What I find a rarity in purchasing cooking foods is their Egyptian Spinach (AKA Emlookhia). Most importantly, they recently opened a small corner counter that serves delicious foods that includes home made homus, koofta, chicken kabob, and chicken koofta. They also server rostaire chicken for only a spanking price of 5.99.

8.description: I have simply never had falafel this good ever in my falafel-loving life. Monkeys from Mars, I tell ya, this stuff is like the falafel of your dreams, if the people in your dreams dreamed only of falafel and decided to make falafel better than the people in your dreams' dreams of falafel. Five falafel balls for this one, folks. Oh yeah - fresh pitas! Pa-dow.

14.description: I just had a really good shopping experience here.  There is an enormous selection of Turkish and  Middle Eastern food products.  The stock is logically arranged and the aisles are well-labeled.  There were plenty of grocery carts and the staff was helpful.  The prices seemed very reasonable.  We will certainly come back.

7.description: Vimto on Ice, check. Half Lamb Shoulder, check. Halal Chicken Thighs, check. Royal Rice, check. "Mejnoon" Dates, check. Tang, check. Watermelon Balls, check. Organic Eggs, check. Steamed Kale, check. Bulgarian Feta, check. Marmarabarlik Olives, check. Polish chocolates, check. Leblebli, check. Pistacio Lokum, check.  This kitchen is looking ready for Ramadan. Cannot wait to Sohoor with ya!  Shukran Sahar!  Ramadan Kareem.

28.description: We ate here for the first time last night and all loved it. Fresh tasting food at decent prices. The Bubba beef is awesome!!!

1.description: This place has been satisfying my cravings for the longest-ever since I was pregnant. I love their thin crust sausage/pepperoni pizza, mozzarella cheese sticks and especially their cheese fries. I've ordered pasta here once and it was delicious. The only complaint I have is this new delivery driver. I've never seen this guy before nor has he delivered to my house before. Trying to say I short changed him, I said the rest was his as his tip. This incident only stopped me from getting delivery, I'll just be picking up my food from now on.

9.description: We were celebrating Mom's special day with Chinese food from her favorite restaurant and Dad made some other home made favorites like ribs and fish.  I wanted to add to the equation but I was working late that day so I decided to stop at Vini's which was on the way home from work.  Vini's has been on my radar since I started my new route to and from work along Lawrence Avenue specifically to avoid the speed cameras on Foster Avenue where I could easily be caught going over the uncommon city speed of 30 mph as required over there.I think the plus about this new route is that I've found a new pizza place to go to.  I noticed the "$19.95:  20" one-topping pizza and 10- buffalo wings" special on the window.  I  looked up their menu online and found a vast menu of your typical fast food pizza shop fare. I ordered  one pepperoni, and one spinach pizza and was surprised at how much of a difference a couple of inches made.  Compared to most pizza places I go to, it's rare to find 20" pizzas, at most places 16"-18" is usually the norm for a large.When I finally made it to the party everyone had already got their fill of all the food there, saying how they began to doubt that I was coming with the promised pizza.  Although full, they were still tempted to eat the pizza and they loved it.  You know it had to be good if they still loved the pizza on full stomachs.  These two large pizza's were practically gone by the end of the party!  Everyone wanted to know where the mysterious pizzas that came in plain huge brown boxes were from.  I was pleased with the simple thin crust pizza, which had a pleasant texture where you weren't fighting a chewy tough crust for a change.  The containers of tender chicken wings that came with each order was nice too.  I chose one hot and one bbq, I didn't know which I preferred more--each was uniquely tasty.This place offered such a deal, quality food, and I should mention friendly quality service as well.  I called the pizza order ahead of time and told them what time I'd be there.  When I arrived to pleasant smiling faces, I was told to wait a few minutes, as I observed they were just sliding the pizzas out of the oven.  I was happy to present piping hot pizza at the party!I know I'll be back for their $19.95 deal, maybe one day I'll even splurge on one of their specialty pizzas.  I also know Vini's is going to have a few new customers from the guests at the party too.

29.description: Bacon.When you order a meat lover's pizza, usually you'll get a pie stacked with pepperoni, sausage, maybe some bacon or ham. Here at Vini's Pizza, they will load this pie up with bacon the way you'd do it if you were making your own pizza. Every bite of pie is crisp and topped off with a bodacious layer of bacon.  I ordered delivery via GrubHub so I wouldn't have to make any phone calls and the delivery came 10 minutes earlier than the projected time. I got coupons all day and bacon pizza because seriously this wipes out the taste of anything else on this pizza and I am fine with it!

23.description: Vini's is my go-to GrubHub pizza joint.While I have sampled their pizza and found it enjoyable, the true treat on their menu is the Pizzarito. It's somewhere in between a calzone and a pizzafied version of a burrito, and the value is phenomenal. I consistently find myself getting two meals out of the thing (and it reheats surprisingly well), although I did tackle one in its entirety on one occasion. Delivery has always been fast, affordable, and the food is always hot. I've had several bad experiences with other Italian eateries on GH, but I must say I've never been disappointed by Vini's.Carryout is also recommended - one time they goofed my order and greatly discounted my meal with no argument. A really great establishment that probably doesn't get the credit it deserves. Check it out.

5.description: Best Italian American eatery! I really love the chicken alfredo and you will too! Chicken tenders + pizza slices are the highlights of the restaurant!

31.description: In fairness to the restaurant, I never got to actually taste my pizza. I attempted to order delivery and was met with incomprehensible employees. They didn't not know where North Clark street was (a major street in Chicago) and repeatedly extended the amount of time it would take for me to get my food. It started out as 20 minutes and eventually was over an hour before I finally cancelled the order. No thanks, I'll call Dominos.

25.description: Perfectly good neighborhood pizza joint. I ordered delivery via Grub Hub a half hour before they closed, and my food arrived 10 minutes earlier than the promised time! Nothing fancy, just thin crust pepperoni pizza, onion rings, and jalapeno poppers. It all came up to scratch. The poppers are stuffed with cheddar cheese instead of the more common cream cheese, so I was excited since this is my preference. The only oddity is that the poppers were served with marinara instead of the usual ranch, but I won't hold that against them because I could have very easily requested a substitution. The pizza was hot with generous and evenly-distributed toppings with an excellent cheese-to-sauce ratio. This will be our new go-to place.

12.description: This is the kind of thin (not medium) crust pizza that makes Chicago iconic. Nice salty cheese, perfectly cooked. The crust had that great grainy consistency with some little black dots on the bottom. On Mondays a 14" pizza is $12 including tax. Proper pizza!

21.description: I'm born in raised in Albany Park, and I have to say, this is by far the BEST tasting Italian food in the neighborhood. Price is great, everything is made fresh to order, and they are pretty quick with their turnaround.  I always order take out or delivery.  Try ANY of their pizza's, you can't go wrong.  Now if you go there to get other food, know what you are ordering. Most of their sandwiches are decent, but why on earth would anyone get a burgers, dogs, or gyros here, is beyond me. It's a pizza joint. Stick with that, you can't go wrong. Their Italian beefs are epic, I recommend their BUBBA BEEF sandwich, simply UNFUCKWITABLE, yes, that is how I feel, and I support that statement.  Another good value they have if you have to feed a group of 3 - 5 is their 20" pizza special with wings, for $20/tax. Comes with one topping and the wings aren't bad.  They also cater, I had a last minute get together and they were able to help me out with a one day notice.  And I fed a group of 20 for a great price.  Oh yeah, and if you are a fan of DEEP DISH, search no more, way better than yer typical Chicago joints, you'll see.  If you live in the area, do take out or delivery. Enjoy!

16.description: Very reliable and tasty 'za.  My wife and I go crazy for the cheese and crust utilized by this little neighborhood place. It's nice to have the option of a quick slice - which always seems fresh,btw, in addition to a whole pie. Friendly staff and they're pretty quick in cooking your meal. Check em out if you're over by Albany Park.

17.description: Vini's is a cozy little neighborhood place offering an inclusive umbrella of fast food staples beyond pizza. I've enjoyed everything I've gotten from there, but by far, my favorite is the deep-fried Panzerotti. It's pretty much their version of a calzone, but holy balls, is it delicious! Your clogged arteries will ask you to enjoy these treats sparingly, but regardless, I'd recommend starting there and branching out to other options.

10.description: We order the grub hub delivery the other night. The driver was the nicest guy very friendly & helpful ensuring  I had all the food secure in the arms so I didn't drop it. The pizza was cheese it was fine the sauce was kind of to sweet for us but crust was good & they didn't skip on the cheese. We also order the lasagna which was on special it came with fresh bread the portion was huge & again plenty cheese. The sauce was very sweet. I guess it preference  some might like sweet sauce or possibly they put to much sugar when making the sauce this night. Overall decent food with good specials. I would probably give 3 but since the driver was so amazing bump it to 4 stars.

11.description: Delivery was incredibly fast, driver was friendly.  We ordered wings and cheese fries.  Had this been a normal Sunday of beer and football I might have thought the food was decent.  The wings looked like nothing that has come off any chicken I've seen and we're dry and over cooked.
