The cheese for the fries had no flavor at all.  Definitely will not order again.

26.description: Its hard to find a fast food pizza joint with good slices. This place does it well.I believe there slices are called slicer crust. kinda of a hybrid slice between  thin crust and pan. So if your in a rush and have a craving for a good slice of pizza this is the go to place.

27.description: What a terrible waste of money. We ordered a bacon double cheese burger, gyro and large cheese fries with two cans of pop. The gyro was the worst gyro I have ever had in my life. I've never seen a gyro with char marks on it before but I guess it's not that uncommon from what i've heard. What really grossed me out though was the flavor. It was so charred that's all I could taste was burnt meat. Not yummy. I was told the burger was good enough, although it seemed like a frozen patty. The veggies were fresh but the meat was pretty flavorless. The bacon was undercooked and way too chewy. The fries were hardly warm and ten minutes into us eating, they were cold. I'm so pissed we wasted our money on this crap. The only real good thing about them was the cheese for the fries and the veggies. This is Chicago, where the hell can I find a good gyro?!

0.description: Best pizza place in the Mayfield/Albany park area... Order from here regularly and am never disappointed. I tend to keep it simple and stick with pepperoni and garlic. Prices are also extremely reasonable and delivery is always early or on time!

20.description: decent joint for a quick slice

19.description: Vini's is my go-to GrubHub pizza joint.While I have sampled their pizza and found it enjoyable, the true treat on their menu is the Pizzarito. It's somewhere in between a calzone and a pizzafied version of a burrito, and the value is phenomenal. I consistently find myself getting two meals out of the thing (and it reheats surprisingly well), although I did tackle one in its entirety on one occasion. Delivery has always been fast, affordable, and the food is always hot. I've had several bad experiences with other Italian eateries on GH, but I must say I've never been disappointed by Vini's.Carryout is also recommended - one time they goofed my order and greatly discounted my meal with no argument. A really great establishment that probably doesn't get the credit it deserves. Check it out.

33.description: 3.5 Stars.After being shut out (ignored) at Maries Pizza down the street, hubby and I walked in here last Friday night. Just like their location in LP, you can opt for a slice instead of the whole pizza. I think it was approximately $6 for 2 slices, which also comes with 2 cans of soda. Decent stuff, generous slices, and a friendly staff.When in the mood for some quick slices to go, I'd definitely consider returning to Vinis.

2.description: It's an okay resturant. Prices are very affordable. I will say that you should only order certain things from this resturant, mainly the pizza and burgers. I made the mistake of ordering a gyro. The meat was fried like it was bacon. It was crispy around the sides. I will not fault them too much, as they are not known for the gyros; but still fried lamb meat that was cut so thin it actually looked like bacon.  I went in one time and I guess they let their children man the register, sometimes. The cashier had to be younger than twelve. After having to repeat my order several times. I still received the wrong order. They gave me an Italian combo, instead of an Italian beef. While they have their faults, I still patron the resturant for their delicious pizza.

32.description: Really good food. Ordered a baked Pizzarotti with green pepper, onion and bacon and an order of hot wings. The Pizzarotti is a monstrous calzone, at half the price of a large pizza. Ours was cooked perfectly with a brown, crispy crust. The inside was oozing with finely chopped bacon, diced onions, thinly sliced green pepper strips, house marinara and cheese. If I knew how big this thing was going to be, I would have invited a few friends over. Ginormous! The guy at the counter said he likes the Pizzaritto better. I can't wait to try that next time!

18.description: Not a good first impression at all. I ordered the fried chicken meal and the skin on it was hard as a rock. I'm not sure if they put too much flour on it or I'd they just cooked it too long. The garlic bread had some over toasted parts and others drenched in butter. I'll adjust my review if the pizza is decent in the future.

13.description: Delivery took 1hour and 20 minutes - after they said 45 minutes. Also, we live 10 minutes away. Wings were some of the nastiest looking wings I've ever seen. And although I didn't even want to try them, I did and they were as bad as they looked. Pizza is fine, and Pizzarito is good. Cheese fries were fine. Overall, we probably won't order from here again.

4.description: Solid for delivery. 3.5 stars. Had a deep dish with pineapple and pepperoni, which to my surprise, the pineapple were cooked beneath the sauce, making it gooier than normal. Crust not on par with Lou Malnati's butter crust but the ingredients used in the tomato and base were excellent.Thin crust with spinach and green peppers ordered. To me this was the more successful of the two pies.Both arrived well packaged and hot, which I appreciated but did take about 30 minutes longer than grubhub anticipated, even only being a mile from the destination. This is not a huge problem per se, but perhaps grubhub should work out a time bump feature with the restaurant for deep dish if they haven't already. I wouldn't hesitate to use them for a party again. But the pizza connoisseur might want to stick to a Pequod's or Lou's or within the deep Chicago field.

24.description: This is our new go to pizza place. The food is excellent. We always get an order of wings- they're a good size and the BBQ sauce is great (Note: I'm a Buffalo native, so it's hard to get a good wing review out of me). We've tried several different pizzas and they've all been top notch. Our most recent order included a pan pizza with spinach, ricotta, garlic, and sausage. I'm drooling as I type this When I think about moving to a different neighborhood, I think about how much I'll miss Vini's. We love you!

6.description: I try to give smaller restaurants business, but this dive is the reason I DON'T!! I ordered  a gyro meal, and my sister ordered a cheeseburger meal. Not only was my gyro meat overcooked, but they butchered my sisters order! To top it off, there were roaches congregating in the ceiling!!! This restaurant has slow traffic, now I know why.

22.description: So far, this is my new favorite thin crust delivery pizza place in my new hood. for me, it's all about how good the sauce is. it's not too herby, not too sweet.  it's perfect!  delivery has been quick the last 2 times i ordered too.

15.description: Normally they are awesome, but I just ordered a gyro and it had not a drop of cucumber sauce, and the meat is burned, I'm really sad :(

7.description: Screw it..I ordered a pineapple and bacon pizza that was pure uncut crack..I'll be back!(no terminator)

8.description: I was craving garlic bread so badly for the past 48 hours that I couldn't help but search for a place that delivered to get my fix.  I was a block away so I opted for carry out.  I logged onto GrubHub, placed my order for garlic bread and mozzarella sticks (I know I'm a fatty), and made my short trip over to pick up my food.  The restaurant is right across the street from Walgreens on the intersection of Lawrance Ave and Pulaski Ave.  The people working inside were super friendly and quick.  I picked up my food and rushed home to induldge.  That's where the story takes a twist.First off, I was disappointed with the garlic bread.  It was literally french bread cut in half with butter and what seemed like garlic powder slapped on.  It wasn't even covering the whole piece of bread, most of it was left uncovered.  Let me tell you, I wasn't a happy camper because I didn't get my fix.  The mozzarella sticks were ok, very heavy though.  I know foods like this tend to be on the heavier side, but this was heavy from the oil they fry it in.  I felt sick afterwards.  I won't go back for the garlic bread for sure, but maybe i'll the the pizza if I get a random craving.

30.description: i like the fact the slices are big and you can have fries and a pop for 5 bucks

3.description: I came in because it was convenient. I will come back because they are so nice and well priced. I had a hamburger and fries and it was quite tasty especially for only $7.00.

14.description: Came in here on NYE.I was craving fries, and jumbo shrimp when I was at the Walgreens across the street. I am not going to say the food was superb, but it hits the spot for those heavy craving days. It is family owned, so you can tell that everyone works together.My boyfriend got the mostaccioli, with sausage. The sauce tasted very plain, I assume it was canned, warmed, and tossed. We shrugged and kept eating.

3.description: I usually don't write reviews but  joseph walawski (salesman) was very kind to me and my brother was very patient and helpful  and  made it easy  for me to sign up for a sleepys card. Would recommend to go see him also works at another location(six corners) The manager was polite also

1.description: I am extremely aggravated right now.  I purchased over $1000 of mattress from Sleepys in Albany park which included removal of the old mattress on the invoice!! They took the old mattress out and left them piled up next to the condo door!!!! I am so pissed I have been calling all day to try to get these picked up and moved to a dumpster and have been getting the run around that they will complete the rest of the houses and then come move these mattresses.  Well guess what?! My association is not so forgiving and is going to charge me hundreds to haul them away!!! It's 9 pm and I am calling customer service for the 5th time about this and no one has come to pick anything up.  I am totally fed up and regretting buying anything from them.

2.description: Going to this Sleepy's location was amazing! After a flood, I needed a new mattress, box, etc. Ray (one of the managers) was extremely helpful at helping me find great quality within my pricepoint. Delivery was seamless and even more important, the bed is AMAZING!!! I've never slept so good in my life! I will definitely be returning for any future bedding needs. If you're in the market soon, definitely ask for Ray--I cannot understate how courteous and forthwright he was in dealing with me (which is something hardly seen these days in customer service).

0.description: We just received our new mattress today and it..is...AMAZING! We got a great deal on the mattress of our dreams. It was a long time coming.. .Trust me:-/ Ray, the sales person at Sleepy's Albany Park was great to work with. He gave my husband an incredible deal and was very professional yet personable throughout the whole process. I honestly think he was almost just as excited as we were when we finally were getting our mattress delivered. (We paid in moderate "doses".. What can I say, I have commitment issues..:-/) It was well worth the wait! The delivery guys were quick and ahead of schedule (We chose a Sunday delivery which in itself was great to have that option , again thanks to Ray:). Delivery window was 2-6, they were here at 1pm. In and out in 10 minutes tops) We honestly couldn't be happier! Make sure to ask for Ray for a great customer service experience :)

4.description: free delivery is about $60. Free haul away is only to the alley otherwise $20 per piece. Add it together and they charge tax on delivery and haul away. I made a mistake shopping at their store. I am warning you to stay away.

1.description: I was to this place several times for legs and bikini waxing. Once did haircut - not bad. Two women working there are very friendly. The prices are not high and not low. Full leg - 50$, bikini - 35$, brasilian - 50$. But waxing was made not professional enough.  When bikini waxing is being done, you lie in the direction of the window and is hidden only by transparent curtain. So probably someone from the street can see  what is happening. This is not how it should be! After last time when I wanted to get brasilian bikini - my first time (!) and Rosa was using improper wax, it was painful as it expected to be, but the wax didnt' delete hair at all! Can you imagine this? I suffered for nothing! But nevertheless they took money from me,though like for ordinary bikini, not brazilian. After this I decided that never come back! Better to pay 5-10$ more and to get normal service. And a week later I got perfect brazilian in Trim for 55$!

0.description: I love the haircuts here! Rosa is so nice and she cuts my hair better than any fancy salon I've been to. I will keep going back to her!

3.description: I think it's really sad that my review is only the third.  With the amount of traffic this place gets, there ought to be more reviews.  But maybe the clientele isn't all yelpy savvy... maybe I am an idealist... maybe the people who need this place when it's time only use it as a last resort, maybe a lot of things.  First thing when you walk in, nice incense smell.  Cool guys behind the counter, every single time.  2 buck forties.  Decent big bottles of wine.  OK prices on snack food, though I've never resorted to that, as I know the rhythm of the neighborhood and how going to Cermak Produce before 10pm yields the best possible food purchases, always.  Foremost liquors is fine and dandy, but these guys are the real deal.  You want to see people streaming from the mexican karaoke bar just next door with their eyes slewn around their necks?  Go to David's.  This is the place where the six packs of Corona that you find on your front curb come from, or the big bottles of Bacardi, or the Mojitos.  This is where it all comes from, brother or sister.  We're all united in that need to relax that only certain types of high class can afford, no?

1.description: I'm not very familiar with this area but I was going to an event that allowed you to BYOB.When we walked in it was not really any different than any other Liquor Store, but I was surprised by the variety of Liquor in this small store.  I truly liked that they had some good prices for a corner Liquor Store.We get our stuff and then realize we need to add value to our Ventra Card and found out that the store can add value boy did that help us from having to hike all the way back to the train.When we go back the employee that was there was all laughs and he was talking to us as well as the other customers that was there.  You would have thought you walked into your favorite bar the way the delivery guys, the employees and customers interacted.I wasn't expecting to buy anything else but I saw a drink(doh I didn't take a picture) that I had never seen in my neighborhood before so I wanted to try it but I didn't know what beer to mix with it...it became a great and fun debate about which beer would be best in this prepackaged tomato flavored salt cover cup.  I ended up picking Tecate it wasn't my favorite drink but I'm glad I tried it out.If I was in the area I would go back again they were very friendly and had us laughing all the way out the door!Enjoy!

2.description: This place is pretty great. The owner is open to suggestions when it comes to adding new items which is pretty cool. It doesn't look that big but the selection is pretty vast and it is done in a really efficient and organized way.

5.description: I refer to this place solely as "The Corner Store". It is! *points* It's on a corner!Ahem. They're open late, have a great selection of beer and wine for a stop and go, and I know all the dudes that work there. They're cool!Decent pricing, usually always have the two pack special on camel lights (our smoke of choice) -if they're not sold out- and there's usually a dance beat thumping through the speakers. My kind of place.Corner store, thank you. I can make the trek down the block to fulfill my caffeine, pop, and snack needs no matter the weather or my attire (read: pj pants). Rock on!

0.description: If I could give David's Food & Liquor 100 stars I would.That's a review cliche but I'm dead serious.First things last; I love Mom & Pop places and local small businesses, also, I adore C-Stores. So that drew me in for my chips, pop, beer, candy, paper fix. I have credentials from many years of going to hundreds of them. However, even if you don't care about that, read further.David's is cool as hell and if you're in the area and need any random snacks, booze, milk, paper towels, cigs, ect ...you have dum dum syndrome if you don't give it your business. It's owned by Adel, a young cool guy who moved to Chicago from Yemen with his SO and 5 kids to give them a better life. Did I mention he was cool? Since he is. Nice as the day is long with always a kind word and smile for each customer. As a regular he let me bring in my tiny dog G daily. Also, one day when I had to go to the store across the street and was nervous to leave my dog tied outside he actually watched George for me a few minutes. Who does that?!?  For a relative stranger...while hes working?? And when I needed a few boxes for moving he put some aside for me. Not only that- he remembered my birthday!  Besides the amazing customer service and care he has for customers he has fair prices and great hours. It's clean, well run, good selection. This little C-Store is awesome. 100 stars!

4.description: These guys are just a minutes walk for me, across from the Walgreens on Kedzie and Montrose.The guys there are extremely friendly, and act accordingly the more you go there. Goes with any establishment you become a regular at.They provide a limited but basic variety of liquor and munches needs come the late nights when you're 1) near the store, and 2) find everything nearby to be closed.Given Montrose's CTA bus stops running at a certain point, it's a quick alternative to Foremost Liquor which is about 10 minutes from here on Kedzie, with a significantly larger selection of products. As well of course, any bar you might want to go to east of here at around Lincoln Square.But at David's, you at the very least are provided with a decent variety of well, call, and premium drinks - all at an affordable price. Surprisingly, they also offer a constantly updated aisle of fridges that have your microbrews.I come here often for those late nights when I'd like to pick up a six pack of beer, some smokes, and perhaps some snacked goods to go with em.All around very cool guys who work there, very good prices, and the convenience for your late night needs.

3.description: So having tried a few other Filipino restaurants in the area, this one is my favorite.  I actually ordered takeout after a disappointing trip to another restaurant.  The sinigang is authentically sour.  The pork bbq is a touch sour so don't expect the more prevalent sweet pork bbq marinade.  The garlic fried rice (sinangag) is a little more elaborate than I'd make at home since it has scrambled egg in it too, but it's still good.  The pancit bihon is good although palabok is my favorite pancit.  Their version of lumpia shanghai is smaller than my family's (we make cigar-sized lumpia), but it is still meaty and tasty.  I even like the leche flan.  The only thing I haven't liked here is the turon.  I don't order the Japanese stuff because there are better and more authentic Japanese restaurants in the city.  It's a little kitschy in ambience, but you'll have fun singing along with the karaoke and eating Filipino food.  Btw, this place is BYOB.

1.description: I'm currently sitting in Hiromi's waiting for my order and I'm already wanting to leave. First of all, I totally get the need to have karaoke. It's the only logical conclusion when you have a combined Filipino and Japanese restaurant. But it's a total turn-off to other customers when you have a tone-deaf, FOB Filipino bellowing at the top of his lungs, singing song after painful, ear-splitting song, at a volume that is way too loud and obnoxious. Helpful tip: just limit the karaoke to one night a week......Now on to the food itself. Being a ramen fiend myself, I'm always trying to find good ramen joints. The beef ramen itself was actually pretty decent. The broth had a good flavor, the noodles had a snap to it, and it was overall a pretty good dish. I don't think they had a pork belly option, but it wouldn't be a bad idea to add that into the menu. I also had the tekka maki, which was small, but fresh and tasty. Will maybe give it another try and test out something from their Filipino menu. I just gotta remember to bring the earplugs...Oh, and the waitress was pretty hot...just sayin...

2.description: If you want flipino food. This is not the place. The food is not very tasty. Most of the dishes is made with vinegar. Very sour!!! Prices are high. Service is good. The beef smelled, like it was not cooked properly. If you are going for asian food. I recommend thai or vietnamese....

5.description: Awesome restaurant! The people were friendly and the Filipino lady assisted me and my friend great. After touring downtown Chicago, we were starving and wanted some "food for the soul," or home food. I don't even know if I'm applying it right, haha. Anyway, the food was great! I had the Garlic Fried Rice and was thinking of siding it with Beef Mechado, but the lady recommended Chicken Adobo for "Ulam" or side dish and enlightened me that it very well complemented the Garlic Fried Rice. Once I took that first bite, it made me hungrier since it was so good! My friend ordered the Lechon Kawali, and they served it with a side of Sarsa Ni Mang Thomas sauce which was really good also. They should include more fatty pieces instead of meet in the Lechon Kawali in my opinion, those are my favorite ;). Anyway it was about 12 A.M. when we were there so I don't really have a say in the environment during the day. Overall, it was a great experience. Definitely will be coming back sometime later. Thanks Hiromi's Oriental Restaurant!

6.description: This place is fun.  It is BYOB and there is karaoke.  Believe me, this combination has its own sort of charm.  Its a Filipino/Japanese mom and pop-type restaurant.  They bring the karaoke mic to your table, and you sing off of tv screens on the walls from your table (most people singe while sitting).  Selection is decent, but it the video karaoke versions of songs are not the best nor most up to date.  This place is smaller and filled with regulars, but don't be intimidated, Filipinos are some of the most fearless, accepting, and worst karaoke singers on the planet.  Avoid this place if you ever feel embarassed for others, because you will be, this place is devoid of ringers.   A good place to go and laugh with your tone-deaf friends.  I brought a bunch of non-filipino friends to this place with a 30 pack of beer, and though they were intimidated at first we eventually felt comfortable (the beer helped).  The owners were very nice and gave us some free dessert.  The other patrons are very nice too.  The Japanese food is decent and passable.  The Filipino food can be strange for those not used to it, but their versions are pretty spot on.  Try the lumpia, eat Japanese if you don't want to take chances.  Look at their website it kind of gives you a sense of the place and menu.

0.description: Agreed. Food isn't that great. When you do two different cusines, you are the master of none. But if you go in there and just expect ok but not GREAT food you will enjoy yourself. What you come there for is the BYOB karaoke at your table!!! I LOVE THIS PLACE.  I have come here many times. I have hurt many a diners ears...and for that I am sorry! But sometimes you hear some people that should have recording contracts. I am not one of those people.Once me and a friend came here and a Whitney Houston song flashed on the screen. Me and my friend shared a laugh wondering which girl was going to murder that song at the table next to us. Well the table was crowded and we couldn't see who was singing...but SHE was the second coming of Whitney.We ate humble pie. Even more so when we realized the person singing was not female.LOVE THIS PLACE.

4.description: This place is great, a family owned business who are great people. I've only tried the filipino food on two seperate occassions and it tasted terrific. I know the family that owns the place and they are the nicest people so the service should be spot on. Definitely a great place to check out if you live in chicago or just visiting like I was but definitely a must. Oh, they have karaoke so you should already be there singing Journey like Arnel Pineda for all you filipinos!

1.description: Tip for a piece of mind,  special occasions are stressful enough.  I bought items for my daughters sweet 16 at house of wedding.  Her bouquet had crystal flowers which were broken. I brought it to there attention,  two weeks later I return to find they glued the flowers.  I also purchased a doll which had broken lace and they stitched it so ugly.  The refused to give me a refund or discount.  Very poor customer service.  The alterations on my dress were also terrible.  Save your self lots of headaches.  Do not shop here.After waiting two hours they offered me 20.00 for the defective items,  can u believe that.  That isn't even 10% off.

0.description: they have rental dresses! i love them and yes i would highly recommend to others.

58.description: Judging by the looks of this place, both on the inside and outside, there is much left to be desired.  However, don't let looks fool you here.  This place is fantastic.  The staff is very attentive and friendly.  And the food is very good.  I usually get the sweet and sour pork.  It's reasonably priced, I think about $10 should do it per entree.  The pork noodles soup is very good too.As there are many Chinese restaurants in Chicago, and most are probably not worth venturing out of your neighborhood to go to, I will gladly make the commute from Lakeview over to this place on Lawrence because it's just that good.

56.description: Chinese food lovers, assemble!  You're in for a treat if you love Korean-Chinese food.  This place has the staples: jjajangmyun (noodles in a black bean sauce), jjamppong (noodles in a spicy broth with vegetables and assorted sea food), mongolian beef, and delicious beef fried rice.The place itself seems a little run down, but their food makes up for it.  The jjampong is pretty damn good--the soup isn't too spicy, the noodles are soft (but not too soft), and they're always nice enough to give an extra side bowl of soup if one person orders the jjampong.  The beef fried rice is really good compared to other Korean-Chinese food places.  The beef is tender and the portion is more than enough for 2 people.The servers are very friendly and though they don't necessarily stop by and ask how your meal is going, they're always walking around for you to be able to flag them down.  Four stars for you, Peking Mandarin!

29.description: A yelp fail after a long timeDishes were stale .. Hard to believe all the positive reviews for the place.. Maybe it was one off experience Do yourself a favor & walk few blocks east to Cafe Orient 33 whether it is fried rice or wings

42.description: When my parents were in town over Thanksgiving weekend we ventured to Peking Mandarin for a typical Korean-Chinese lunch of jajangmyeon (black bean noodles), jjambbong (spicy seafood noodle soup) and tang su yook (sweet and sour pork/beef/chicken- we went with beef). We enjoyed all three dishes- big portions, good taste, cooked well. The noodles had the right bite and came with plenty of "stuff," i.e. a good amount of seafood with the jjambbong and meat with the jajangmyeon. I especially enjoyed the tang su yook! The only thing I did not like was a side order of veggie eggrolls that we ordered. They were lukewarm and had been overfried so that they were super dark brown, not very appetizing at all. Otherwise the food was on point!The interior is outdated but comfortable with plenty of seating. The service was friendly and quick, and there is plenty of metered street parking on the block.

23.description: The first time I tried this place was this past new year. My sister recommend it to me. It had great food and good service. The place was a mess one customer was being a real pain. The lady was doing her best order after order. My Mangolian beef was also kinda burnt and the rice was soggy. I decided to give them another chance..... Wow was I surprised !  This is my second favorite Mongolian beef in this city. The sefood soup was perfect. And bravo on the combination seafood platter. Unlike my first experience I really enjoyed the food here.  They are quick when u call in an order. Also they are a skimpy when u oder 40 worth of Chinese food and you don't get a fortune cookie... -1 star for consistency and skimping me on fortune cookies. Other then that great place to take care or that Chinese food addiction you have been ignoring....

47.description: We had a mean craving for jajangmyun and since our go-to place was closed for the day, we hit up Peking Mandarin. We ordered the jajangmyun, champong and mongolian beef. All delicious and really hit the spot! I was tempted to order the beef fried rice as well but since it was just the two of us, I reluctantly refrained from ordering a fourth dish. Service was as good as the food. It was around 9pm (they close at 9:30) so it was getting close to their closing time but the owner was still super friendly and just had an all around great attitude.Will definitely be back! Hopefully with more people so I get to try even more dishes (beef fried rice, chicken wings and sweet & sour pork - I'm looking at you).

8.description: BEST MONGOLIAN BEEF EVER! Nice spot in Albany Park very traditional inside and staff is always nice. They accept credit now which is great

31.description: Literally the best chinese food in Chicago. Don't believe me? Come here and get the Mongolian Beef, the potstickers, the eggrolls. You will see. The interior is shabby going on shockingly bad, but I can live with it for food this good.  The people working there are all gems and so super nice.  I'm almost glad they don't deliver, because I would be 460 pounds right now.

34.description: That spicy seafood noodle soup... Words cannot express just how delicious that was. The broth is thick, the ingredients are fresh, the noodles are made in house. Get the spicy seafood noodle soup. And don't get confused when a side of scissors comes with your soup... you should use them to cut the homemade noodles.And the soup isn't he only thing that's awesome here. The kimchi is the best I've ever had. They also make that in house (no big deal) and it's perfect. Not too fermented, nice and crunchy so you can still taste the cabbage.I also had the black mushrooms with greens vegetables ... And now I have tasty vegetables for days! But really... for days cause they don't skimp on those portions.I just moved into an apartment 2 blocks away from this place, and it's going to take some serious self control to not eat here everyday. And one last thing: get the spicy seafood noodle soup.

16.description: Came here because its close to home and had good yelp reviews. Were not disappointed. Had the crab Rangoon which had a generous amount of filling but breading was dark moat likely from old oil. We did go only one hour before close so if they had a busy day we had the end of the oil used for the day probably. They still tasted good. Same with the egg rolls, but they too tasted good. We had the hot wings #32 on the menu & it was tasty! Free rice & nice hot green tea, I think it tasted like Jasmine green tea which was also good. We will come again for sure to try more things.

13.description: Sea food noodle soup is always on point! its spicy goodness! I go there just for this soup.I think the chicken wings are good but sometimes they come out kinda tough and dry underneath that delicious sauce. The combination fried rice is what i usually get but I request they add more soy sauce.

11.description: First time trying this place. We didn't call ahead and ordered it to go. I ordered a combination fried rice and egg rolls. It looks somewhat pleasing to the eye but everything was super bland, mostly colorless and I'm pretty sure they use frozen peas & carrots in the rice. I had to use a lot of soy sauce in the rice and load my egg rolls in sweet/sour sauce & chili sauce to liven it up. I bit into some chicken tendons. That was not helpful either. I can't speak to their entrees but their fried rice and egg rolls were a no go for me.

39.description: Got the inside tip from an insider tipper that this is THE Chinese Korean (Korean Chinese?) joint in all of this section of town. If you're cool and into that elusive cuisine, you go here.True? Who knows, but I AM pretty cool (my mom says so at least), and with noodles so long you have to cut them with scissors (because knives are no match for them!), this is grubby good. Get the black bean foodstuffs and then go adventurous for another dish.

37.description: I love this Chinese restaurant.  Food is good and they are always friendly.  I will continue to come here.

0.description: Hidden little gem....loved my experience. I walk in and was told to just take a seat very friendly and fast service. Super nice I got soup right away (didn't order it) and a nice tea pot full of green tea! Yum soup very rich and full of flavor lots of body (specially for a wonton soup). I ordered the cashew chicken to be safe and it was far from safe. Lots of flavor and just enough amount. After having it ready very quickly I was helped my multiple people which was great and what they all had in common was a very pleasant way they treated customers. I would definitely come back for seconds

38.description: I came here on a snowy day to have my first Korean-Chinese meal. I liked the interior of the restaurant a lot; it seemed like little had changed from when it first opened. On the tip of my friend, I ordered jajangmyeon and we split a bean curd soup. Don't forget to add the bean curd from the small dish to your broth! The jajangmyeon was a very rich, yet delicious dish. The portion was very large, and could easily feed two people. Service is not exactly attentive, but they get the job done. I hope to go back to try other dishes like jjambbong (spicy seafood soup) or mongolian beef.

51.description: The restaurant itself isn't the greatest in the inside, but the food is really good and really inexpensive for the amount and quality you get. Their Mongolian beef is very good, so is their egg drop soup. They don't have a menu you can take with you, so that bugged me.

27.description: MMM! as good as it gets. Great servings and great service

32.description: Not so great location and parking is terrible but this is definitely my favorite Chinese restaurant in this area.This place have run down old interior but their black bean noodle and sea food noodle soup are top notch. I like to have sweet and sour pork with those two noodles. Mongolian beef and spiced fried chicken are among my favorite.Give this place a go if you are looking for good Chinese treat.

54.description: Best "hole in the wall" Chinese food in the area.

48.description: My favorite Korean restaurant ever. This place has been around forever, my parents got married in 1984 and they went on their first date here. The spicy noodle soup, chow ma mein, is hands down the best thing on the menu. There are other places that make it, but nothing compares to this soup. It definitely is spicy and clears out stuffed sinuses, phenomenal! I usually take the black bean noodle dish to go, cha chiang mein, also really great. We can go here as a family of 5 and leave with the bill being under $100, very reasonable prices. If you're looking for a fancy place to eat, this isn't your destination. The interior has been unchanged since I can remember, and I will be 27 years old this year. So that's not the greatest, but the food makes up for it.

44.description: Can I just say I've been going to this place forever.  I love it.  I recommend the spicy seafood and noodle soup.  It's great on cold days like today, it really hits the spot.  I love their kimchee to its sooooo good. I really recommend this place if you want great food at great prices.

24.description: One of the best egg rolls and there famous chicken wings in town , you won't be disappointed + BYOB

7.description: A hidden gem. My family has been coming to this restaurant since I can remember. Now that I have a family of my own, I want to continue that tradition. My fiancé was hooked on our first date here. The quality of the food and the service are always excellent. My favorite has always been the Mongolian beef and chicken wings. We live quite far from the restaurant now which makes it such a treat (and adventure) when we do get to have it.

49.description: The start of Summer 2013 family restaurant outings.    Mom wasn't with us, so I gave the kids a choice in he car.   Pizza or chinese.   Obviously they chose.....I want to put this first, the Mongolian Beef is fantastic.I am glad mom wasn't with us.  The restaurant has seen better days.  Tired, older, and in need of a re-model.   We were not shown to our table, but just pointed to the side room.   I picked out of the 3 set tables.   The waitress promptly came and took our drink order.   Overall service was like the decor....tired, older, and in need of a re-model.   Almost forgot...they were out of coke.  Sprite ok???   Really. On to the food.    These dishes were bland and forgettable:  won-ton soup, cashew chicken, noodle lo mien, pot stickers.The egg roll was decent.  Pretty tasty.Finally... The Mongolian Beef was out of this world.  Really. Really GOOD.    I might stop by just to get the Mongolian Beef.I did tell the kids, sometimes we hit a good one, and sometimes not.   We did find a keeper for one dish.

40.description: I just left this restaurant and I think it's necessary for everyone to know where to find the best spicy seafood noodle in Chicago. It's spicy, plenty of seafood and the noodles tasted great. The portion was big enough to feed 4 people! 2 if you're super hungry. We ordered the black bean noodles (I didn't like it much but only because I'm not a big fan of black bean noodles), sweet and spicy fried shrimp (tasty) and crab Rangoon (filled with cream cheese). Service was helpful. Lots of people coming in to pick up their orders. The inside is quite antiquated but you know it's because they prefer to focus on the food than the decor. I know I'm going to be back here many times because this is the boy's favorite place for black bean noodles. But I will happily oblige as long as I can get the delicious spicy seafood noodle!

53.description: Really great fresh Chinese food and such a bonus that they use brown rice for their fried rice. It is a bummer though that they do not deliver, nor do they even have carryout menus. I know they are more of a dine in place but seriously, it is not that difficult to print up some carryout menus!We tried the Mongolian beef, Crab rangoon, shrimp fried rice and mushroom chicken and all were very good! We will definitely be revisiting this neighborhood gem!

30.description: Sweet and Sour Chicken, Mongolian Beef. That's all you need to know..

46.description: Okay, it's really time to let the secret out of the bag and let the white people in on the secret...the mongolian beef is their fourth (if that, best dish here)... 1) jja jang myun is why you go here 2) Jjam pong is why you keep going back 3) Tang Su yuk is what you get each time to share.   Order it and stop wondering what all the asian people are eating...once you get it in front of you, eat it,  enjoy it and thank me later for expanding your horizons.  All the dishes are spelled out phonetically, so just practice reading them aloud before you go and everything will be alright.   Now that you know the secrets of my asian peepz...look past the decor, look pass the slow service and begin to appreciate these Korean-Chinese women who have been doing this for over 30 years (I remember it from when I was young) and still slangin' the best noodle dishes in old k-town. Just went there this past weekend and my girlfriend was reminded of how good this place really was because she hadn't been there in over 10 years.

1.description: This is more like 3.5.This is the first Korean Chinese restaurant we have been to so I feel like I can't give a very well thought out review until I try Great Sea Restaurant. However, we had the jjamppong, spicy chicken wings, and sweet and sour pork. We loved the jjampong and the sweet and sour pork. The wings were kind of dry and we probably wouldn't order them again. Portions were huge. For 32 bucks we even had leftovers to bring home. We loved the old school feel of the place too. We will be back on a cold winter evening when we need some spicy seafood soup to warm us up.

55.description: Solid Chinese and I'm not much of a Chinese food lover. As others have said the Mongolian Beef is that good- beef is very tender and the favors are spot in. Decor is a mix btw a 70s chinese diner, and an outdated basement- but the food and service is solid.

9.description: This restaurant serves Koreanized Chinese food. It's interesting and worth trying, but not sure I'd come back since this is kind of a hike. The place is clean and the people who work here are friendly and very nice. The portion sizes are large and the prices are cheap. I took my sister and mom here today on the recommendation of a Korean friend since my sister is obsessed with Korean culture and food.  We ordered the jjajangmyeon (black bean noodles), tangsooyook (sweet and sour pork), and jjampong (spicy seafood noodle soup). These are the Korean names rather than the English/Chinese because my sister ordered for us. Everything was good but the jjampong was the winner, hands down. The flavor was good and not so spicy that you couldn't enjoy it. Definitely a must order. The jjajangmyeon was good but it's a heavy dish and too much will send you into a food coma. The tangsooyook was probably my least favorite, but still solid. If you're close by, this isn't a bad place, but I don't think I'll make the hike again.

26.description: It's true...the spicy seafood noodle and Mongolian Beef are really good. Spicy seafood noodle tastes just like the Filipino version of "Lomi".Disappointed with the sweet and sour chicken and chicken wings, both were tough.

25.description: Mongolian Beef - AWESOMESAUCE, Chicken Wings - OMG, Chicken Lo Mein - shut the front door - CANNOT STRAY FROM THOSE THREE.Christina who works there is great, she always remembers our order even if I don't. This is the only place I'll go to now when I get that cravin'

12.description: have been coming here for 20 years .Never fails. recommend sizzling soup, spicy chicken wings , crab Ragoon and seafood spicy noodle platter. I would travel miles just for their food.

59.description: I love this place! It is my favorite Chinese restaurant hands down. Reading these reviews makes me want to venture out and try new things, but now that I no longer live in the city and can only get this when I feel like making a trip out of it I don't know that I could part with what I already crave. I love the beef and broccoli. Perfect sauce and nice lean meat. Egg rolls are insanely good. Crab ragoon is super good. Plus I recently saw these delicious looking/smelling wings on someone else's table and had to have them. They are cooked perfectly with crispy skin and this awesome sweet/ and spicy red sauce. Like I said I have to travel to come here so if you don't take advantage.

21.description: My fave place for Mongolian Beef!

17.description: As per recommendations by fellow yelp reviewers, I tried sweet and sour pork, the chicken wings and the black bean noodles. I didn't like the black bean noodles. However, the people were right..the portion sizes are way too large and I couldn't finish the black bean noodles even though I was sharing with my sister. The sweet and sour pork & the chicken wings are really delicious. However, I only tried a few pieces because I was full..So beware of the large food portions. I am going back again and again. Friendly staff :) Nothing to complain (although I wish they would not give me ice water)

10.description: Tasty food.  Kitchy decor.  Friendly staff but I'm not sure I'd want to be here when it was really busy.  They aren't the most efficient and that could really impact your meal if they were busy.Their Chicken Wings are what everyone waits for and they are definitely good.  Hot and Sour Soup and other items we had were also very good.  Probably the best Chinese food outside of Chinatown.Prices are very reasonable.

5.description: Hands down 5 stars. Fantastic spicy chicken wings; the chicken and sauce. Great rice quality cooked perfectly, awesome seafood soup, and Mongolian beef out of this world. Frequent buyer when I can afford $40 for a wonder of 2 sets of wings and the beef :)

3.description: I have ordered a bunch of times from here since the wings and Mongolian beef are amazing. I decided to dine in a few days ago and experienced the worst service ever. Yelling and being disrespectful is a no no. I was embarrassed because I had told my girlfriend it was a good place to go out and have lunch there...bad choice

35.description: This place was pretty nasty.  None of our dishes had much flavor.  The lo mein had a "different" type of texture.  The egg rolls were flavorless and over-cooked.  S&S chicken was pretty blah.  Done.

19.description: It's true...the spicy seafood noodle and Mongolian Beef are really good. Spicy seafood noodle tastes just like the Filipino version of "Lomi".Disappointed with the sweet and sour chicken and chicken wings, both were tough.

28.description: This is definitely not the place to go on a first date.  Waitresses are fast and the food is seasoned to perfection.  Also,  not expensive.  I recommend the sizzling soup, beef with vegetables,  and combination rice.  Everything here tastes amazing and their menu is not over  loaded with options.  They are very busy here so don't expect waitresses who are going to ago you about your day.  Service is fast, but it's a great place for those who are  in the neighborhood and starving. ...nothing fancy

45.description: Let me set the scene. My Wife were set to see two different properties with our (now former) Real Estate agent. She stood us up. Not only did she leave us standing outside a building for an hour, she stood us up on a 100 degree day. Those of you who know my Wife, know how much she hates the heat. We left, tired hot and hungry. This is where Peking Mandarin saves the day. Finding this place was dumb luck. We turned the corner, and there it was. From the outside, it looks kind of run down and dumpy, but the inside is wonderfully decorated. The old style booths and decor were quaint and cozy.  My Wife must have had a look of Murder on her face, because our server seemed sensitive to her plight. She set us up with cold drinks as soon as we sat down. The menu looked like what you would typically find in a Chinese restaurant in Chicago, but brother....the food was anything buy typical. It was amazing.  We started out with the Egg rolls and pot stickers. The Egg rolls were good, but the Pot stickers stole the show. They were a pork-filled, deep fried gift from the Gods. This may have been the best Chinese appetizer I ever tasted. My entree was just as fabulous. I opted for the deep fried pork. Not only was it mouth watering, the portion size was ridiculously-huge. It was enough food for three people. Not bad for nine bucks.  Here's the delicious bottom line on Peking Mandarin. If you're sick of the typical, bland Chinese food in Chicago, you must try this place. And I mean...now! Its by far, the best Chinese food I've eaten. Not just in Chicago, but anywhere. I can't wait to go back.

33.description: Oh my lord the food is good here: The mongolian beef, the crab rangoon, the wonton soup, the chicken wings. Oh lordy lordy it is so damn good. The wait staff has no interest in your feelings, they don't care how your "day is going," they are not "glad to see you," they are not "impressed with your choices." And they will probably not bring your check. Get over it. Go here, eat well, and drink plenty of water. Love it. Mmmmm. Eat it. Good so good.

43.description: This rating is based only on the jja jang myun and jjam pong.  Very good compared to most other korean restaurants in Chicago , but pales in comparison to the "real stuff" that you can easily find for $7-8 in other cities like Toronto, NYC, LA. I guess beggars can't be choosers, right?  Noodles were pretty good, but not chewy as they should be. Too much jja jang myun sauce, and too many filler vegetables in the jjam pong -- it's supposed to be brimming with seafood, not cabbage.  However, it does earn 3 stars for Chicago. And the eggrolls were pretty delicious too.

2.description: Great service and good food. Their egg drop soup was super good and the spicy fried pork with vegetables was awesome. Not a big fan of their crab rangoons, nice and crispy but the cream cheese was laid in too thick without much flavor. Also tried the hot and sour soup which was a bit too mushroomy but otherwise good. Our first visit but we will be back to try some more dishes.***update-GET THE CHICKEN WINGS!

18.description: The first time I tried this place was this past new year. My sister recommend it to me. It had great food and good service. The place was a mess one customer was being a real pain. The lady was doing her best order after order. My Mangolian beef was also kinda burnt and the rice was soggy. I decided to give them another chance..... Wow was I surprised !  This is my second favorite Mongolian beef in this city. The sefood soup was perfect. And bravo on the combination seafood platter. Unlike my first experience I really enjoyed the food here.  They are quick when u call in an order. Also they are a skimpy when u oder 40 worth of Chinese food and you don't get a fortune cookie... -1 star for consistency and skimping me on fortune cookies. Other then that great place to take care or that Chinese food addiction you have been ignoring....

41.description: Decided to check this place out due to the many positive Yelp reviews and it was semi close to my place.  Ordered the crab Rangoon, sweet and sour chicken and Mongolian beef.  Prices were very reasonable And everything was tasty but the winner for me was the Mongolian beef.  Will definitely order here again just for that Mongolian beef...yum!

52.description: Jajangmyun (noodles with black bean sauce) and ggampongi (hot and spicy chicken wing lollipops). This is what to get here. I've been coming here since I was probably 5 years old, and it really hasn't changed much at all. Definitely one of my favorite places to go to for Chinese-Korean food. Fast, simple, delicious. What more do you need?

50.description: Lunch special prices are great. I got a soup, tea and veggie entree for $6

4.description: I like Peking Mandarin very much. I have been going there for years. We get Mongolian Beef, Seafood noodles. Pot stickers and the special fried rice regularly but have tried and liked many of the other items. Tip, order spicy and that is what you get.Oh and don't forget the hot and sour soup at Peking Mandarin and order it spicy. I'd put that up against matzo ball soup any day.

6.description: When I first moved to Albany Park I tried this restaurant out of pure necessity (it was open late and I wanted Chinese) now I bring anyone I can here. The spicy shrimp and the chicken wings are stand outs. The black bean noodles and spicy sea food soup is phenomenal!

22.description: Sure the interior might be considered outdated but I personally appreciate the vintagey-ness of it.....I usually get take out anyways.+ The crab rangoon is amazing, especially if you ask for it with the peanut-mustard sauce. Who would think peanuts and mustard go together, but they do. Excellent!+Hot and sour soup - after having this from Peking Mandarin, all other hot and sour soups pale in comparison. And an order of this is a meal in itself, for not very many dollars!!!!+Spicy fried chicken wings - I am pretty sure I tried these for the first time years ago at the recommendation of another yelper. Amazing! (And I don't even usually like chicken wings).+Chicken wing sauce. I went through this phase where I would get the Spicy Fried Chicken Wings just for the sauce (not that they weren't excellent but like I mentioned, I am not a big chicken wing sauce). THEN, I found out you can actually order just the "chicken wing sauce" as a side with anything. Yup, that's the way to go.~other dishes....I can't say I've tried too many others because ~ when I have, I haven't been disappointed (but also not wowed so I pretty much just stick to what I've mentioned)

15.description: These mfs are expensive and have mediocre food. I can go to Chinatown & get authentic food,  large portions, & the food is awesome for the highway robbery prices they're charging.  No thanks

57.description: I've been told the best Mongolian Beef in Chicago! Read my review for the verdict!Well its great! Simple! Crispy! The location is convenient for me, right down the street but it is not in a high traffic area! Very old school Chinese restaurant. They do compete with the place across the street that is famous for fried chicken drumettes slathered in sauce, so we ordered it just to compare!The place across the street wins!

20.description: This restaurant serves Koreanized Chinese food. It's interesting and worth trying, but not sure I'd come back since this is kind of a hike. The place is clean and the people who work here are friendly and very nice. The portion sizes are large and the prices are cheap. I took my sister and mom here today on the recommendation of a Korean friend since my sister is obsessed with Korean culture and food.  We ordered the jjajangmyeon (black bean noodles), tangsooyook (sweet and sour pork), and jjampong (spicy seafood noodle soup). These are the Korean names rather than the English/Chinese because my sister ordered for us. Everything was good but the jjampong was the winner, hands down. The flavor was good and not so spicy that you couldn't enjoy it. Definitely a must order. The jjajangmyeon was good but it's a heavy dish and too much will send you into a food coma. The tangsooyook was probably my least favorite, but still solid. If you're close by, this isn't a bad place, but I don't think I'll make the hike again.

36.description: Amazing food! And BYOB but there is not a bottle opener in the house. They will look at your bottle of wine as if it's a novelty item.

14.description: I just left this restaurant and I think it's necessary for everyone to know where to find the best spicy seafood noodle in Chicago. It's spicy, plenty of seafood and the noodles tasted great. The portion was big enough to feed 4 people! 2 if you're super hungry. We ordered the black bean noodles (I didn't like it much but only because I'm not a big fan of black bean noodles), sweet and spicy fried shrimp (tasty) and crab Rangoon (filled with cream cheese). Service was helpful. Lots of people coming in to pick up their orders. The inside is quite antiquated but you know it's because they prefer to focus on the food than the decor. I know I'm going to be back here many times because this is the boy's favorite place for black bean noodles. But I will happily oblige as long as I can get the delicious spicy seafood noodle!

3.description: I have gone back a few times,  however, the last 3 times, I have not been happy with the end result,  I no longer go here.

1.description: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. First of all..this place needs to hire people with professionalism. The guy with a Mohawk who cut my nephew's hair was constantly texting. He would then continue cutting his hair, then text. I was getting irritated by this. Once he finished, my nephew had cuts on his forehead. He was bleeding and the staff did nothing about it.  The guy at the counter was full of hickies. So unprofessional. No tip was given.

2.description: I went here when my regular salon was too busy down the street and was very happy with the results but wish I didn't have to wait as I like to get in and out but was happy that I did. Have been there twice and 2 different guys have cut my hair and was happy with both. Wish they had their hours posted here as I need a hair cut before going to work today.

5.description: I've been here for the first time, I asked for Lidia after reading some reviews about her. As it turns out, it wasn't the best cut i'd expected...but wouldn't complain for just a $ 5 haircut. I rated the salon 3 star because I like the spacious and clean salon, and she kind of took her time enough for $ 5 haircut. One advice, if you wanted a complete, perfect haircut for some special events, never go to these cheap salons because most likely you will not be satisfied. I wanted a more style to my cut, but of course not I should have known. I wanted a style, cute asian or Korean haircut, but decided to give this salon a try. I wasn't satisfied at all and I don't think I will ever come back to a place like this again.

0.description: This is the best place I've gotten my hair cut. I don't speak Spanish, and I don't think they speak much English, but they must understand English very well. I've been going there for years now, and never had a problem at all. They take their time, and do a very good job.  The best part it only cost $5.00 for a regular haircut. Parking is not too hard to find. It's hard to find parking on the side streets, but you can always find a meter on Montrose, and it's only like .25/hour.This place is half the cost of places like cost-cutters, and does a MUCH better job. I highly recommend this place.

4.description: This place is great.  For 5 bucks, I have gotten some of the best hair cuts in my life.  They take their time and do a very detailed job.  On top of that, they even give you a straight blade treatment on the back of your neck, ears and the side burn area.  They also do a great job with women's hair because both my mom and sister get their hair done at this place.  If you're there, ask for Consuelo; she has done a great job.

3.description: Great place to enjoy your time smoking hookah. They have dance floor and stage for party's, also there's a middle eastern restaurant next door. They have over 5 or 8 tv's beautiful place.

1.description: Nahhhh... Too dirty and too crowded from neighborhood... Wolfs sit there and look for victims. I'm talking about if you are a girl damn you better be there with your bf. I didn't like it. And I don't think I would ever come back.Hookah is okay. Charcoal on time. Price wise they are okay.

2.description: I can and can't understand why this place would receive less stars than deserved. Hookah bars are usually very chill and relaxed. This one is for the most part yet I'm sure with a place like that they have indeed hosted events. The interior is a lot more than one would expect while comparing it to the looks of the outside and location. Colorful lights and comfortable leather seats not your average tattered laid back hookah bar. Hours are very flexible and the wait staff are attentive and friendly. I never once had to ask for a new coal or a new flavor. Prices are average. I think the only not so nice thing I could say and my friends as well, I wish they would play some American music every now and then ;) aside from that this place is stellar. This bar over Alibaba ANYDAY.

9.description: dont dont dont dont go there

10.description: This is a great low key place to come have some hookah with friends. I've been coming here regularly for a couple months now. The prices are fair and the hookah is pretty solid. They carry most of the major flavors and mix some house specials. Voltage is our favorite. Service here is pretty nice and relaxed. Virginia is the usual waitress and she's a real sweetheart. We drank here once and they didn't charge us any fees, unlike Ali-Baba's and some other hookah places. My only gripe is that it can be a little hard to hear each other sometimes around the couch area. I don't think this is mostly because the venue is a room with a high ceiling and the acoustics must mess with the sound. It would be really cool if there were a couple more couch areas to sit by, especially by the windows, that are a bit further from the speakers.We usually don't come during the nights with life performances and dancing and all that, so I can't really relate to the other reviewers. Overall, a pretty nice place to bring some fiends and enjoy good smokes and conversation.

4.description: Have been smoking hookah on lawerence street for years. This is a place i have always seen but never been to. One of my buddies used to swear by this place and came here all the time. So I gave it a shot. The parking lot was jammed pack, this made me think wow there must be a lot of people in here, nope. We were greeted by a man who looked like a CIA officer with a head piece and microphone, later I realized everyone had one.The inside was dark with lots of strobe lights and lots of seating. My initial thoughts were is this a strip club? On the many monitors was a slideshow of someone's wedding on repeat! Music was loud and there seemed to be vip booths on both ends of the room like a nightclub. Also I saw signs posted that everything was being videotaped. All of this was too much for me on a Tuesday evening. I understand this place is prb fun and packed on the weekends but for casual smokers like me I enjoy a laid back lounge. The lights cameras and feel was very awkwardish! But I must say the hookahs here are good and clean, and they have a very extensive drink menu. Overall not my kinda hookah spot :(

6.description: Do not go. We waited on our hookah while the staff is eating. If you like wasting money and shitty customer service this is the spot. Otherwise do yourself a favor and don't go here.

11.description: it seems that this hookah lounge went  under new management!! the atmosphere is ok, but they need to do something about the furniture.  but will be back

5.description: What a miserable experience. For one the staff were cold an inattentive. It seemed nearly impossible to get our hookah checked on when it started to taste even more stale than it did initially -- I'm inclined to agree with a previous reviewer that it tasted like they mixed in burnt tobacco or something. I've smoked plenty of hookahs but something just tasted "off" about this one. Also, the atmosphere at this place kind of sucks. When I go to a hookah lounge, I'm looking for a place to relax, sit back and have great conversations with friends. The music was so damn loud that I felt like I was at an EDM festival. My friends seated across from me simply couldn't hear me unless I yelled at the top of my lungs.I haven't been there since it was called 5 star hookah years ago. Sure, they've fixed up the place since then, but at least before they were friendly and I could go there and relax.

7.description: Bad music that is too loud, bad atmosphere- uncomfortable seating, not for lounging or relaxing, unclean sticky floors and full of glaring old men, got the pervert vibe. The staff didn't seem friendly or like they cared that we were there. Trying to hard to be a club and not a hookah bar.

8.description: Place is a complete joke! Bunch of fugees dancing with each other. Felt like I was at a kids Bday party!

0.description: Strawberry banana smoothie was fresh and delicious and the Blue Mist hookah was a hit. Very casual and calm atmosphere for small hangouts and friendly

58.description: Amazing comfort food! Recommendations: to start get yourself at least a couple empanadas, as a main dish I'd recommend either the rotisserie chicken that's thrown directly on the coals right before it's served to you and is nothing short of succulent or the national dish called the bandeja paisa which is heart cloggingly delicious. As you eat be sure to wash it all down with a guanabana con leche "milkshake". Finally, for desert try the brevas con arequipe. You will feel the cavities forming immediately, but they are worth every filling. Provecho.

56.description: Everything here is amazing. It is a great place for family, dates, friends...anyone! Being BYOB never hurts either. Empanadas are to die for with the salsa verde and lime.

29.description: Chicken breast with garlic is delicious here! Big portions too and it's Byob if you're looking for a low key, hassle free dinner.

42.description: The chicken is delicious! It's BYOB which is great the plantains are sometimes under cooked,  but the staff are great.  Side note ladies,  the first bathroom stall needs to be repaired, it doesn't lock.  Overall,  good food at a good price.

23.description: Dear Potential La Brasa Roja Carry-Out Patron,Would you like some delicious and quick rotisserie chicken to carry across the street to the bar? How about some decent, and massive, empanadas with green salsa? Yes? Well, then walk to the back of the restaurant, put in your order, then walk to the front and pick-up your chicken. Done and done.

47.description: This is a great place you never will get wrong from one of their specials and is absolute delicious their food. Rest maybe will need some improve decoration wise soon but for the rest great food, good prices and nice staff. I recommend bandeja paisa and both of the 5 dollars special are awesome (steak or rotisserie chicken).

8.description: I don't know what is lately going on with this restaurant but it keeps going downhill for me. :( The broiled chicken is extremely dried, over cooked and sometimes I get chunks of dried extra hard meat. Why? The plantain is never soft, always hard and dried. Maybe that's the way they eat it in in Colombia and I'm not aware of this? :/ I have tried plantains or maduros from other places like Fina Estampa or D'Candela and boy are they good! Then again Fina estampa and D'Candela are Peruvian restaurants. The only thing I do enjoy is the 2 small boiled potatoes that comes when you order a whole broiled chicken.

31.description: Whole chicken + empanada + corn pancake with cheese = date night, solved. I was really impressed not just with the tenderness of the fall-off-the-bone chicken, but with its seasoning. Wonderfully balanced and complemented perfectly by the boiled potato and salsa. Comfort food at its simple, elegant best.

34.description: I've been here a million times.  The very best value in Chicago!  $9.99 for a whole chicken that you can't possibly finish unless you have 2 very hungry people.  Makes great leftovers as well and the salsa verde is unreal.  I've tried to make it myself 15 times and still have yet to come close!

16.description: Great rotisserie chicken I also loved the yuca and plantainsI did a take out lots of people

13.description: Easily the best chicken In chicago. Everything is on point and the steady soundtrack of Cumbia really adds to the atmosphere

11.description: TIP:    DON'T get the $6 lunch special, order the 1/2 rotisserie chicken for only .95 cents more!! What a dope I am, I shoulda, woulda, coulda, but didn't doa, when it came to ordering the 1/2 rotisserie chicken with potato, corn pancake and plantain for $6.95, at this location today.  Instead, I ordered the measly lunch special for $6, which was 1/4 of a drumstick and a 1/4 of a thigh (I swear it was smaller), that came with chewy and delicious rice, a whole boatload of beans and a small nondescript salad, I ordered a corn pancake separately, for an extra $2.   Although most of the meal was tasty, I would've been better off if I got more of the chicken, because it was the stuff dreams are made of, succulent, crispy and mouth-watering.  It was that great.  Corn pancake though was a little leaden, but maybe it's suppose to be like that, I don't know??  If somebody could let me know on that one, I'd appreciate it.But if only I ordered the 1/2 chicken, but because I was in such a hurry and so hungry, at that point I could've eaten the wooden tables, and for some reason didn't even bother reading the menu, just went by what I remembered from the Yelp reviews.  Okay here's the reason, it was hot and muggy,plus I couldn't find the Citibank I was looking for and the parking around there is atrocious!Next time I'll definitely get the 1/2 rotisserie chicken and be a little more patient.Honorable mention:  get the flavorful Columbian soda, orange.  Waitress was helpful though, considering there was a little bit of a language barrier.

39.description: Cheap eats,  grab a whole chicken and two boiled potatoes for about $10. Golden brown skin and flavorful when their hot.

37.description: This place has some great food. Their meals are always made as you order and their meats come out on a sizzling platter. Delish. They don't give you much spicy sauce, you have to keep asking...hence the 4 stars.

0.description: Great food! You will receive a traditionally Colombian cooked meal. Since most things are charcoal grilled..the taste is amazing, not to mention you receive oodles of food for your $$ For those that mentioned the meat being dry..it's not! You combine the "chimichurri" sauce with the juicy chicken or steak and it's divine  Service is great and instead of this place looking high end, the money is clearly invested in the food. Although, I can really appreciate the hand painted walls which takes you away to the scenery in Colombia My recommendation for first timers that have never experienced Colombian food, you're in for a treat: try the Empanadas for your appetizer (1-2 per person, depending on hunger), Matrimonio or the Bandeja Paisa for your entree, and the Colombiana soda to drink.The rotisserie chicken is also excellent! even to go, it's awesome to slam at home like a King or Queen

38.description: This little restaurant is on the corner, The parking was hard to find but once we parked and went inside it was nice and cozy. They have specials for $5.00 pretty cheap and great food! We ordered a whole chicken, everywhere else we tried chicken was dry and bland. But La Brasa Roja's chicken was so moist and juicy and the seasoning was fantastic. Even the skin was crispy and delicious! The fried bananas were okay as well. I defintitley will go back and have some! another happy customer~

51.description: Great tasty chicken.  Love the coating on the chicken skin.  Everything else was just ok.  would go back for the chicken.

27.description: Ordered for pickup for 8:00, arrived early at 7:55, waited until 8:20 for entire order.  Half of the order was ready, sat and waited for the rest, so half the order was cold when I got home.  Maybe done in only, avoid take out.  Doubt I'll be back

32.description: They're good.  The food is good.  Lots of flavor.  not 5 because the inside is not the best looking restaurant.  I try not to look at the glasses too closely.  The hot/green sauce is so good.  I love it.  It is also cheap so we gather often.  They have the special for $5 for chicken or steak w/rice and beans which is a great price and you get full every time.  The maduros are good also.  I didn't like the empanadas.  I thought they were dry.

54.description: This  is a great and affordable place to eat.  For 4.95 you can have grilled rotisserie chicken or steak with beans and rice.  Not a bad deal and the portion size is great! The staff is always friendly and willing to help. It's a very nice neighborhood restaurant!

48.description: Great food love the chix special eat here daily

44.description: Starting to wonder about the reviewers in this neighborhood. Went to this restaurant based on the rave reviews.  The food was ok. The service was inattentive.  The fruit flies we had to keep swatting away, we're obnoxious. I witnessed a server dumping used salsa from other customers into a clean bowl and putting it back in fridge for re-use. We asked if they had tortillas and were presented with a pack that was microwaved and ripped to shreds when we tried to separate.

24.description: Love the chicken!!! And the spicy Aji (green salsa) and it's fast! I haven't tried the empanadas because I always get chicken but I'm definitely trying them next time!

7.description: I usually order for pick up, chicken special with an empanada and an arepa. Taste is great and the price is very affordable. The few times I have dined there the service is really good, fast and efficient. I recommend getting a "Colombiana" a Colombian soda, ask for a cup with some ice to enhance the flavor. "Buen provecho"

49.description: Excellent food and service. The food is reasonably priced, consistently good and I don't think I have had better chicken anywhere. And they have freshly squeezed juices, which is rare. I like the blackberry juice.

40.description: Great place for quick eats. Simple menu. However, the Chicken can be a bit dry. Although, it's my third or fourth try there.

53.description: I've never eaten in here, but I've gotten food to go several times. I've ordered their rotisserie chicken dinners, and that chicken is truly outstanding. I haven't tried any of their other entrees, but I definitely will soon. Their plantains are also cooked perfectly.It's mesmerizing to watch the chicken guy keep up with the 2 dozen or so birds he has going at one time, and manage all of the orders. It's really very impressive!Their flan is also homemade and very delicious.

30.description: Food just like you were in South America.  The roast chicken is the best.  And so cheap!

46.description: All I can say is that I wish I had found this place years ago. It is simply the best spit roasted chicken I've ever had.

1.description: This place rocks my world!!! Yummy chicken at an incredibly low price is so hard to find nowadays...enter La Brasa...my kids get their mango licuados from this place (although we ask with little sugar otherwise its a tad on the sweet side and then they wont sleep) So..I know this place is not fancy by any means but personally as long as its clean and the service is good, I could care less if the menus are old..the ceiling needs work etc..sometimes you pay more because of the location or the chef that went to Le Cordon Bleu..here its a no frills good old family owned restaurant. Their empanadas are very good and I especially cant resist their stew (sancocho) made only on Sundays.Minus one star because sometimes their chicken is a bit on the salty side...But I can always count on La Brasa to feed my family and I at an affordable price which again Im finding it harder to do in Chi-town.

55.description: The first thing you'll notice is that you can smell this place before you can even see it. The heavenly scent stretches down the street, tickles my nose and lifts me off of my feet like in an old Looney Tunes cartoon. Once you're inside, note their crazy setup. They have an actual charcoal grill inside spinning an impressive number of Chickens. I've never counted, but I'd guess 50-75 at a time. As other reviewers have noted, this place is all about the chicken. Their 1/4 Chicken Lunch Special is absolutely perfect in every way. DELICIOUS chicken, tasty beans and rice and a small salad for under $5.00! Also, their meat pies (empanadas) are great. I recommend adding a couple to your order. The only thing I don't love about this place are the sides you get with the Chicken Dinner Specials. The plantains are okay, the whole potatoes are underwhelming and the corn cake is a tasteless rubber puck, gross. When my family gets dinner there, we simply order a la carte. We get a whole chicken, a side of rice and a side of beans. My wife and son and I always have more than enough to eat this way.

9.description: The rotisserie chicken is super tasty. Get the whole chicken meal with potatoes, corn pancake and plantain. It's cheap and easily feeds two. Do it like a local - walk to the back to order and pay, then wait in line and take it to go.

26.description: BEST broiled chicken in town....you can take a whole chicken for 10 $ dine in experience sucks...usually this place is packed on weekends and the staff insufficient. ...if you dont care for service and want a good tasty meal this place is for you...you Get what you pay....a cheap tasty meal....

25.description: I give this place 5 stars! Food, service, and prices were great! Wait time for your is amazingly fast!

12.description: I've eaten from La Brasa hundreds of times.  The food is thebomb.com

59.description: So,  we used to love this place, last 2 times been shorted a breast and given a back piece.uhm....no thanks, looking for a new spot, am reduced to roasting a chicken myself!

21.description: Love, love, LOVE the Empanadas! Gave only 4 stars because they've messed up my order more than once.  Try the steak and chicken combo! Its AMAZING!

17.description: I went there last night with my wife and another couple. I must say the food and the service was great. Not busy at all on a Friday night. I would definitely recommend this for their chicken. Very affordable also

10.description: Dear Potential La Brasa Roja Carry-Out Patron,Would you like some delicious and quick rotisserie chicken to carry across the street to the bar? How about some decent, and massive, empanadas with green salsa? Yes? Well, then walk to the back of the restaurant, put in your order, then walk to the front and pick-up your chicken. Done and done.

5.description: Ms Philippines really won but all that aside I keep the chicken, steak, and empanadas from here in rotation like a Michellin tire.

3.description: I got a recommendation from a Colombian girl, to try this restaurant for their national cuisine.6.15 p.m. Saturday.I come in, have myself seated and wait to be served. The first impression was very good, staff is VERY friendly. Cozy atmosphere, cheerful Latin music is playing, people keep coming in, some for take out, some to dine in. It's not too loud.I'm looking at that awesome Rotisserie grill and can't wait to get my teeth into their chicken.I get the menu and realize, it's only two pages, all items printed in big font with big white space between, so yes.. my choices are quite limited. That's fine with me. I ask my waitress about the specials, and, to my surprise, she only mentions the beef ribs.. "Okay", I think to myself,  go ahead and order the ribs and the Rotisserie chicken.As I'm heading towards the bathroom, I notice signs of "run-downess".. It's not too bad, but it's bad enough for you to make a note of it.I'm coming back, just had my order served and ready to enjoy it!The ribs were.. okay. Overly charred and kinda dry. So was the chicken.. dry.. I've taken time to read other people's reviews, some claim it was the best rotisserie chicken they had tried. To me, it was a very mediocre rotisserie chicken.In the end, I received a check for $27 just for the two dishes and bottle of Malta, a Colombian pop. I think more fair price would've been $20-$22. That was the last nail in the coffin.Again, my kudos to a VERY friendly staff there and I loved the atmosphere, but...On my way out, I got a couple of bunuelos, $1 e.a.
