6.description: Yelp loner, Mrs. Rosa J., with her nerdy hubby went on to a search for food in the neighborhood of Albany Park.  Her original target was Susie's on Montrose, but they took a hide on the Christmas Day.  Rosa J. and hubby then diverted themselves to Elston walking toward the north direction.  Lo and behold, Ay Ay Picante opens.  Evidence?  There was a lady walking out of the restaurant with her take-out.  Ready, set, and let's get inside.  They have a pretty extensive menu, ranging from meat, poultry, vegetarian, and seafood.  Hubby and I both love seafood, so he picked out a salmon dish, and I took the young man server's suggestion: cau cau de mariscos.  This is a seafood casserole dish, with octopus, shrimps, garlic sauce, and steamed rice on the side.  Although the seafood dishes appeared to be pricy, they were generous with the portions of seafood.  Hubby's dish had an entire filet of salmon, with the mandarin sauce and mashed potatoes.  By the way, the green sauce that was offered with the starter bread was amazing!  It wasn't too spicy, but the flavor was just in the right balance of garlic and other blend of spices. We both enjoyed the food, a lot.  The portions were quite large, so I took some home.  Guess Rosa J.'s Christmas was just as awesome, when food keeps her company.  We found a yelp check-in offer (30% off on one entree) and inquired the young man if this was valid.  This wasn't today, but he manually applied the discount to us.  Well, you didn't need to do that, but thanks a lot, sweetie.  The total came to a little more than $40, with two (2) seafood entrees and two (2) cans of Inca Kola.  I will complete the mission to track down the Inca Kola at my local Hispanic supermarket because that stuff is quite delicious!  It's located on Elston in the Albany Park neighborhood, so there should be a plenty of street parking.  The bus isn't accessible on Elston, but the nearest stop is Montrose (CTA bus 78), coming from the south, or Lawrence (CTA bus 81), coming from the north.

22.description: I love this place, my boyfriend is Peruvian and the food tastes just like his family makes! Its a little pricey some dishes but it's really worth paying for! I. Wish they delivered

15.description: Ay Ay Picante is my all time favorite Peruvian restaurant. First and foremost, you must try the green spread on your French bread. This is a creamy spread and just has a hint of spice that's perfect. My friends also like to add butter onto their bread, but I don't personally think it's needed. My go to dish is the Lomo Saltado. This delectable dish consist of onions, tomatoes, strips of steak with French fries and served with white rice. I must have a side order of Platano maduros (sweet plantain) as well. I'm Puerto Rican and that's one of my favorites!! A plus about the restaurant is that its BYOB. I like to come here with a group of girls. I've celebrated my birthday here a couple times and it's certainly a memorable event. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. Recently, the owner provided me with a business card to another restaurant they've opened up called, Ceviche on Diversey near California that's also BYOB. I've been meaning to try them out with some friends, possibly a double date and switch up this time.

57.description: Absolutely Love this place, great food , great service. The only two negatives are, hard to find parking and wish the place was a bit more roomy. It's charming as is, but more elbow room would be fantastic!!!!

20.description: Food is plentiful for sure. I usually eat Lomo saltada as I don't get here often and love that dish. This time I got the beef with peas dish and was so glad I tried something different. Yummy! Kids had arroz con pollo and it's different than what I am used to. The rice was awesome. Service was better than usual. In the past, I would have called the service indifferent. Today, it was quite pleasant. Thanking God I don't have to travel closer to downtown to get good food.

36.description: loved my filet mignon, with an incredibly flavorful sauce, and mashed potatoes and broccoli.  The empanada was good, but I always feel so guilty eating fried food.  Nevertheless, the empanada was very fresh tasting and I do recommend it.

14.description: Seated right away. First time dining. Four other parties arrived after us. Told a staff member, politely, we are ready to order. We were told, "I'll get your server." Bread and water arrived fifteen minutes later. Asked again. Same answer by same staff. Waited another fifteen minutes. Asked again. Same answer from same staff. Then the same staff person started taking orders from the parties that arrived after us! No one took our order.  Left and dined at Smoque. Dessert at Mindy's Hot Chocolate.

1.description: Everytime i go here, they always make the skin around my nail bleed. Theyre nice and they dont talk much but thats fine. I tipped them anyway but im never coming back here again.

9.description: I went there for a pedicure.  The staff was very nice and my pedicure came out great.  Everything appeared sanitized and properly wrapped.  If you are uncomfortable with people near you in a language other than English as some have suggested in these reviews and those I've seen for other nail salons, then you may wish to pass.  If your primary interest is a standard and inexpensive pedicure then this is a place to try.  I know they offer other services too.  I saw them applying artificial nails on a client and another client went for a more extravagant design/bejeweled look.  A couple words of warning.  Anyone and everyone who came in was told either that they were ready now or in 20 minutes.  I didn't really see anyone's service start immediately.  Even if they took a seat at a station they may have to wait a bit for the tech to get to them.  They were really busy at the time.  I was told 20 minutes and I came back in 15.  They seated me at a pedicure station and I ended up soaking my feet for almost 30 minutes before they got to me.  On the bright side, I didn't feel like they rushed through my service.  Also, I am not familiar with polishes in general, but I would say that barely a quarter of their selection was Essie or OPI, the two in which I am familiar.  They did have a lot of colors available, just in brands that were unfamiliar to me.  In short, try this place.  I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.  Just be sure you don't pick a day when you have strict time limitations.

12.description: The girls are very nice and good at what they do. Not a great location for the type of business though..it's right on Lawrence and Pulaski..two very busy streets with horrible parking and lots of traffic..

21.description: I decided to try out this place after a neighbor and a friend highly recommended it.  I was extremely impressed.  What an experience!  I went in for a pedicure.  My nail girl Susan took her time and also massaged my legs and feet.  Then while my nails dried she gave me a neck massage.  They also give you a card and after 4 manicures or pedicures, the 5th one is free!  And if you go before 3 pm Tues - Thurs the pedicure is only $15.  What a deal!  I will definitely be back.

16.description: This is a good deal. I am not a regular anywhere... but this was a nice treat- a good price and a nice job! Pedicure included cutting and filing of nails, foot filing, and oil with a leg rub, then the painting of my nails. I was there for about 25mins. and was helped right away. $15- nowhere else.

17.description: After my latest visit, I don't think I'll be returning to Andrew Nails.  This place is super close to me and super cheap, I've never had a problem with their pedi's....but this is the second time I've gone in for a fill only to find that when they remove my nail polish a couple of my nails have a greenish spot on them which looks like mold.  Now, most people might freak out over this, but all it was was a superficial spot that came off with a little filing when I got home, basically water got in between my nail and the acrylic and voila, mold.  I don't know if they just don't do the acrylic right or what but it has never happened anywhere else.  What's worse is that while I'm fine with it and ready to just file it off, the nail lady gets all worked up and all the employees start talking in Chinese to each other and she tells me I left the set on too long (the latest incident was brand new set put on 2 weeks ago) and she tells me my nails are too thin and I have to let them rest 2 weeks-no crap my nails are thin, you just ripped off the acrylics!  I'm guessing they're just afraid I'm going to get worked up like its fungus or something (I've seen nail fungus from a nail salon and it ain't pretty but this isn't it).  After going there for awhile I've seen that their stuff doesn't seem very clean and I won't be back.

10.description: I got a typical manicure.  They were courteous, but not friendly.  They talk to each other in Chinese, which is typical or expected, but they never acknowledged me other than what do you want and here's how much it is, then a cold thank you and goodbye. The place smells of chemicals.  The price is really cheap!  $10 for a manicure, which is a deal! But I can't say it was the best experience.  I'd rather pay more for a not so awkward nail salon and one that smells and looks better.  I won't be coming back. P.S.They only accept credit cards for services over $20.  If your line of work will reimburse you for a manicure and you need a receipt, you'll have to fight for one as they don't typically give receipts except for credit card payments.

5.description: If you don't get done what they want they pretend to take your appointment but they don't really do it. So you have to wait a long time anyways. And they always speak in their language and laugh. Who knows, they are probably talking about the customers since I asked what was so funny one time and they said it wouldn't be funny in English. I cough them more than once where one of them says something and the rest laugh and stare at the same customer. I was one of those customers. Coincidence? I think not!Not a big fan of this place at all. I kept coming here because I'm always short on time and it's close to my house, but not anymore.

11.description: Prices are so cheap, which is always a plus! The girls who work there are also very nice and friendly and do a great job! I will definitely be back! :)

3.description: The pedicures are usually adequate. The workers are average at best...not very friendly and looking for big tips. Its not the greatest but could be worse.

0.description: This is my spot! Andy is my favorite! He is so good at what he does and he's very nice. If you're looking for a high-end spa mani and pedi then pass. Go to Wicker Park or any of those neighborhoods and pay $40 for a no-chip manicure. If you just want to get your nails done and leave with beautiful toes, then come here. They have decent massage chairs, and the massages are okay when they work on you. I love coming here, I have been a loyal customer since I moved to this neighborhood in 2006. Beware! They are always super busy! I usually call ahead and ask if I should stop by or if I can make an appointment. Even with an appointment there is a little wait time. I don't mind waiting because I love getting my nails done there, but just something to think about.

20.description: I am very happy with this place. I have been a faithful customer for about a year now. The pedis are $15 bucks all day everyday and the fills are $15 too. Lucy is friendly and always greats you the moment you walk in the door. The pedis are great and so relaxing and they really take thier time between 30 - 45 MIN. in the winter they offer $15 facials those are great too.

19.description: I just got an excellent manicure and pedicure at Andrew Nails. I received a friendly greeting and prompt attention. The guy who did my nails spent quite a bit of time, but it was worth it. I got perfect nails at a very reasonable price. Highly recommended.

2.description: Forgot who did my pedicure but i hate to say you get what you pay for,  she did my nails great but butchered the bottoms of my feet i dont mind the razor but not when you don't know how to use one,  i came home with dents and skin still half way off on both the bottom of my feet,i would try again with someone else.

18.description: I am very happy with this place. I have been a faithful customer for about a year now. The pedis are $15 bucks all day everyday and the fills are $15 too. Lucy is friendly and always greats you the moment you walk in the door. The pedis are great and so relaxing and they really take thier time between 30 - 45 MIN. in the winter they offer $15 facials those are great too.

13.description: My only complaint is that they should treat every customer equally! Its 2011 and they seem to be a Little discriminative. They talk amongst each other in their own language.. like any place does, but they do it a little too much, and make it obvious that they are talking about you. They also seem to know if you have money and try and charge extra for something, they need to get it together. Also to get a great job, you have to know who to go to, this isn't cool or cute for new comers.

4.description: Andrew Nails is my #1 salon in the city. They always do a great job and the staff is very friendly! And most importantly, this place fits everyone's budget!

6.description: I used to really enjoy this place- until the last time my friend and I went here. I bragged about this place to my girlfriend just to feel ashamed about bringing her here. We both sat down for pedi's and we wanted a sea salt with a hot stone massage. Apparently putting sea salt in the water and THEN rubbing down our feet with hot stones ( like I had before) was the FUNNIEST THING EVER!! what was even funnier was when my gf and I asked " What is so funny, bcuz we wanna laugh too," the guy decided to tell his co-workers ( in THEIR language) what was funny. We still til this day do not know what was said or what was so funny. I feel like that was beyond RUDE! We both work in the service industry and over tipping is Never a problem.. 10% was all we left... To be looked at and talked about in another language in front of your face!!!!! Not flipping cool. I will never show my face or EVER recommend this place ever again!

15.description: I do there artificial nail usually. It's a good place, if to consider prices and the service you get for your money.  I prefer when my nails are done by Lucy. There is one man there, the job he does is not bad, but once he hurt my finger, trying to file the tip, besides he's not too friendly.. Pedicure is normal, the same as in any place of such price range.

7.description: I really like this place! It's super inexpensive AND if you have a student ID you get 5$ off anything your getting done! They have OPI and Essie nail polish along with some other less known brands.  There's like 5 workers and the place is always PACKED. Sanitation and setting is eh,ok. If you're looking for a super nice and clean establishment this isn't the place for you. I come here to get the job done for super cheap and leave! I guess the inexpensive-ness is what makes up for the setting. The workers are friendly and they work hard. The place is kind of small too but you can never go wrong with a QUALITY mani and pedi for 15$!

8.description: I work at a nail salon and I can't say this was the best experience At all. I understood everything they said and they were even bad mouthing me because the person who did my nail had done it wrong from what I ask them he had the courage to say that my finger is crooked... Just to redo the whole nail again and then he has it was straight. Just not a great experience for me at all. And he burned my nail and kept doing it over and over again when I told him it hurts,.. At the end I did give me a tip for redoing it but they gave me and my boyfriend a rude thank you and good bye. Smh I will never come back here again to so my nails

14.description: Good deal for the money.  They are great at trimming ingrown toenails.  Other places my toenails bother me a week later.  I can go about 3-4 weeks before I need them trimmed again.  They are great with gel manicures.  Other places the gel manicures didn't even make it 2 weeks.  I probably could have went 3 weeks before I needed a fill in.

12.description: The food is the best. Lamb is so tender it melts in your mouth. Five star. Correction the address is 4807 n Elston ave  not Kenneth

3.description: Thank you AboHanni Best Yemen  food in Illinois,  Chicago  kebdda was amazing with Amazing bread,  Foul, was tasty,  Marsha, Massoob, massoob was nice with banana and honey,  Don't forget the adani tea,

1.description: I love mandi and when I want mandi this is the place to be. Their lamb mandi is exceptional. Best I've ever had. The lamb is soo tender, literally falls off the bone. Each portion is so big that you can easily share between two to three people. Their chicken mandi is also very delicious, however lamb is the way to go. Their lamb kabsa is also very delicious however the mandi is their specialty. The mandi comes with a delicious spicy sauce that the dish doesn't really need because its already so amazing but with the sauce it takes everything to whole other level of delicious goodness.

2.description: They are few times when an image and thoughts of a special dish you like comes to your mind and make you crave for it. Last night, I obeyed those images of a generous plates of original Yemeni Food and visited this place, and it was just great !A dish of Mandi (lamb spiced and cooked in a special way, with rice) made perfectly with a fresh and tender meat and spiced rice.Fahsa (kind of pulled lamb cooked in a special Yemeni pot) was absolutely the best!Very well-cooked meat in a flavorful stew, the pot continues boiling and sizzling on your table ! served with Yemeni bread.Masoob (sweet dish with Yemeni wheat bread mixed banana) amazingly topped with honey, cream, cheese and black seeds ..and a cup of Adani Chai (tea with milk and a touch of cinnamon and cardamon) made my day !People there are really nice and friendly, having there brand new restaurant, which will definitely make me a new regular customer after this visit ..

9.description: The food is Amazing and taste really good. The service was good. The atmosphere in General is really good. Love the place and for sure will come here again and again :)

10.description: Great food

13.description: This is the best place in Chicago for Yemeni Food. Meat and Chicken are Zabihah Halal. They have short and sweet menu but everything they serve is delicious. I have tried lamb Mandi and believe me you won't get anything better that this anywhere. The quality and quantity of rice and lamb they serve is outstanding. Highly recommend this place. !!!!

16.description: I Love that food. I Orderd fasah and mandi it was amazing! The servers are very nice and friendly. I love that restaurant!

6.description: We ordered the Mandi "Plate" - Serves about 5-6 easily!  The rice had phenomenal flavoring and the quality of the lamb was perfect! It had no game-y smell to it and it was fall-off-the bone, melt in your mouth texture. I give it a four, as the ambiance was nice, but not great. Will be going back for seconds and thirds!

15.description: I love the service food is great mashallah very generous and great prices allhamdulila I love the chicken and rice.

0.description: The food were great clean and fresh. Lamb were so tender, rich in flavour and perfectly seasoned. The waitress there was awesome, she knew the menu and specials by heart, recommended a delicious grilled fish for us of which me and my friend loved!

5.description: I went there yesterday and i'm on my way back again now for the next day... As simple as that :)Awesome flavored food, reasonably priced, I recommend it, no regrets for sure :)

11.description: I payed 22$ for some dried rice and very litte  lamb meat . I went there for lunch the place smells more like mold , it took them 5 minute to find a menu , it looked more like flyer , I ordered lamb and rice , and I got a very dry rice with a bone that had just little meat , I asked for extra mean and I got more bone , witch I payed 22$ for that . I call that theft . Shame on you

8.description: I've tried this restaurant a few times. The quality of food is great. Service is great too. Highly recommended for Yemeni food lovers!!!

4.description: Great yemenia food

14.description: I have not had the food yet, but I hear it is very good and very reasonably priced. I had the pleasure of visiting a few evenings ago with some brothers I had just met. I don't really care for milk in my tea, so they treated me to a very delicious red tea, and an excellent mint tea. Everyone was welcoming and friendly. I look forward to going back for more tea, and perhaps some lamb and bread, depending the options on the menu.

7.description: This is a Yemeni RestaurantWent there for carry out dinner.menu was very limited, only few options. i was thinking of getting the Yemeni chicken sandwich but they were out of chicken.another dish (lamb stew) that i was thinking of they said comes out boiling and should be eaten there because it wouldn't taste good carried out.i opted for a lamb and rice dish which was indeed very tasty. though for $13 it was a small lettuce and tomato salad, about 3-4 cups of rice and about 3-4 oz of lamb meat. would have liked a more lamb and less rice for the price

3.description: Great service. Reasonable prices. And two wonderful ladies to avail you to a quality hair styling

1.description: Like Jean C., I too am too old for the hipster thing, but I have been since before I was born.  For a lot of years I have been going to Ulta on Clybourn but about six months ago I decided I was over being overscheduled and rushed.  Too bad, there is some real talent there.  But that is another review.  Note to self, write that review!Anyway, I went to Hair Circle yesterday on Jean and Lisa's reviews.  Rose was welcoming, she said "what do you want to do today?'  She picked up a book and sat down next to me to look at photos of hair styles.  I told her that I wanted to let my gray be gray, she said it was up to me, but "those grays are trouble, not the color the texture."  It made me laugh, but didn't convince me.We picked something that looked like my current cut but a little shorter.  It seems like it is "in style" now to use a razor and make hair go every which way (I do not like this, can you tell?) and Rose did not do this.  She made it very neat and even.  I actually liked the way she styled it.  Great price, but not such a great cut...kinda started to look like a mullet (gasp) after a week or so.If you are looking for pretentious, loud trendy music, and all of that hoopla you will not find it here.

2.description: Hair Circle is not only great VALUE but always leave feeling fantastic!  My hair never looked better!  Sandy and Rose are some of the best stylists I have ever gone to!  My hair looks healthy and I always get compliments!!!  Try them out!!!

5.description: I just moved to the neighborhood and thought I'd get to know this salon, since it's within walking distance of my house. I called to see if they could work me in for a bang trim, and the person on the other end of the phone snorted and rudely told me that they don't do bang trims. They do "the whole thing or nothing at all."  Not the kind of neighborly treatment I was hoping for.

6.description: Have been going to Mario Tricoci for years but recently moved into the neighborhood and, on a whim, gave this place a try.  I'll never go back to overpaying again!  Rose did a fantastic job--better than I got at my former salon, and for a fraction of the price.  Don't expect a stylish atmosphere or trendy finishes.    There's a no frills feel to the place.  But who cares with results that get so many compliments?

0.description: I'm too old for the hipster thing.  When I want a cut or some color, I want a good, solid stylist who listens to me when I tell her what I'm looking for instead of pushing the trendy looks at me.  Sandy has never disappointed me.  I always know I'll be happy with the way I look when she finishes.  And she's good with solutions to problems like: how do you let the gray grow out without that brown/orange/white gradient?It's a small, laid back salon with decent prices and a friendly atmosphere.  There are a lot of regulars, men as well as women.

4.description: Rose does a fantastic job cutting hair for a very reasonable price.  She also gives my husband some of the best haircuts he's ever had...even when he brings in very trendy photos.  Just be prepared for her to talk your  ear off for at least an hour! :)

1.description: Ok, nothing really separates this place from the countless other pool halls on Lawrence, they don't serve beer, have tons of pool tables and cater to a mainly foreign speaking clientele -  except for one thing.  They have a 20 ft sign that is misspelled!  I live right across from this place and every time I go outside I get to see the lovely Uno Billiad (Billiad not BillaRds) sign swinging in the breeze.  That's right, they spent money on a 20 ft electric sign that is misspelled.  The best part about it though is that the painted sign on the front of the building is spelled correctly.  So not only did they pay for a sign with incorrect spelling, but they knew it was wrong when they were installing it."So that sign looks great, yeah how much is the bill, oh that's no problem and to tell you the truth I really don't care that it is misspelled, no one will notice."I would give them one star for this but I don't know the owners so they may have issues and I would give them three stars since they are just your average pool hall like I said, but seeing this symbol of ignorance everyday just drives me bonkers.  Especially when they have the painted sign and three neon signs in the windows that are all spelled correctly.Oh Uno Billiads, and I don't mean Billiards!  :P

0.description: We love this place & love supporting neighborhood joints. It's a no-frills BYOB local billiard place with regulation size pool tables as well as snooker tables. Not fancy, don't expect a bar or pop 40 music. Sometimes the TVs are on, sometimes they're off. Sometimes music is playing (usually some type of latin music), sometimes it's just the noise of the poolhall. But the owner is always nice - he's Korean, quiet & very kind. His wife may come in with their little poodle too! Tables are clean, cues are decent - not that well taken care of, so bring your own if you have one. Balls are always shiny and clean! Clientele is usually men, sometimes younger guys but nobody really bothers you. We've gone here many times, no fights, no rude people, everyone is pretty cool - mind their business & have a good time. It's Albany Park, so our neighborhood is full of different ethnic backgrounds, we love it. And there's an ice cream parlor right next door! You can also go to any taco place and bring food in. Sometimes a guy comes in selling pizzas. If you enjoy playing pool and don't care about a fancy joint, don't be afraid to hit up this place!

12.description: . Thumbs up for the stuffle,a sweet or savory filling between two sheets of shatteringly crisp and delicious pastry pressed in a waffle iron. Ditto for the biscuit sandwiches with bacon, cheese and apple butter.  Dough-nots are not doughnuts and if you are expecting a tender, fried ball of dough you will be disappointed.There is room in this neighborhood for a take-out coffee shop that opens early and serves delicious, unusual pastries,  Fact is this storefront immediately south of the Francisco L station has been a coffee shop on and off for more than 15 years

7.description: Despite all the hype, their offerings, while slim, are better than your usual Dunkin' Donuts but I'm not wowed by them.  Stuffles land flat (literally) and the dough-nots are quite dense.  They finally offered cinnamon rolls and were disappointingly doughy (not in good Cinnabon way, for lack of comparison).  Good for a quick bite while waiting for a train but I would not go out of my way for any of this.  Honestly, I'm more likely to patronize their friends across the tracks at First Slice for a better selection of baked goods.

3.description: This is the second time my husband and I have gone to Hot Bar for breakfast. Unless you're there first thing in the morning, prepare to have limited choices. However what you do end up ordering will be delicious. The feta, egg sandwich on focaccia is amazing and the dough-nots are super flavorful. The inside leaves a lot to be desired but I get their idea of wanting people to pop in and out before getting on the L. The service is so-so and could be better but considering you're in and out in a couple minutes it's not that big of a deal. Im hoping they'll have iced coffee in the summer!

1.description: Had biscuits with ham which were very delicious. Cookies are to die for although they look ordinary. People in the store were very nice.Their website has the menu of Baker Miller only, that's their branch at Western. I suppose what they have on display in the cafe are the only pastries available.

2.description: Been to their shop on Western a lot and absolutely love it, so I was very excited when they opened up Hot Bar two blocks from my home. Been there numerous times since they opened and their food is really good. Love the stuffles and the sandwiches (I'm a savory kind of guy). Went in this morning (12/05/15 around 7:45a) and was met with two rude workers. I was a bit taken aback as a huge part of the service industry is customer service and there is a competitor a mere 20 yards away. The two ladies had not put up signs signifying the contents of the stuffles. When asked what was in the stuffles I was met with a cold "I don't know." I stood their waiting to see if they were going to find out or help in any way, but they didn't. I asked if one had meat or cheese in it and you would have thought I asked how many spots were on the cow from which they got the milk for their coffee bar. I was finally able to work out which stuffle had meat and cheese in it and, thankfully, my experience with those two ladies was over. A decent stuffle and a decent sandwich does not make up for poor customer service. I don't wake up on a cold morning and frequent local small businesses in order to be treated rudely. Unfortunately that is what happened this morning.

9.description: Have been to Hot Bar now a couple times.  Loved it the first couple as the owner was there, super friendly and clearly in charge.  This morning, however, both ladies who were working there were very short, didn't have the Stuffle tags listed and couldn't tell us what we're in each of them.  We were trying to be friendly and inquire about other pastries and all we got were blank rude stares.  Very unusual.  Also, if your making cinnamon rolls 2 feet away from the counter, I ask if you have them and you say no these are going somewhere else... I'm going to be disappointed.  Sell me a damn cinnamon roll. Otherwise, delicious!

10.description: The sugar coated pear jam stuffed " doughnot " was amazing.  It's hard to find good pastries with good coffee and this place has both.  I also tried a cherry stuffle and that was pretty good too.  I will definitely be back!

13.description: I found the service to be first rate, and the food was great too! They have some original food types for us foodies out there. They make something called a "stuffle" which is a stuffed waffle. Very tasty! Also they make the stuffle several different ways to suit different tastes. I also got a donut from there it was cinnamon dusted and was very fresh! Give this place a try if you want to support a budding new business with some great and original ideas. A must for foodies, not for nerds!

16.description: High quality sandwiches and pastries  , quick in and out. They also have a sit down area inside. Love it ! :).

17.description: This place is great! It opens earlier than First Slice, which is just up the street, so it's a really convenient option for us early commuters who want to grab a cup of coffee. The people are super friendly and the food is good (I can vouch for the bacon and cheese biscuit--sweet and savory, and easy to eat on the train).

15.description: The prosciutto stuffle last Saturday was unreal. And the cinnamon toast dough-not was equally amazing - beyond sugar and cinnamon, there was a nice custard flavor to the dough. Looking forward to dropping in again soon!

0.description: I'm so happy to have Baker Miller here in Ravenswood Manor. I love the tasty treats and delicious coffee with oat milk. I'm nuts about the Oreo muffins and the breakfast sandwiches are delish too!!The staff and owners are always friendly and sweet. Thanks for opening up in the neighborhood, you guys are awesome keep up the good work!

5.description: I want to support this place--staff is really nice and food is decadent, if that's your bag...but a vegan healthy option is sorely needed. Pretty please? Also, the egg sandwiches need to be hot. Pretty please. Both times, I bought a cold sandwich sitting out under heat lamps...

11.description: Well, my first review got removed because it was apparently not a first hand customer experience. Even though I went in today. So that's annoying. This spot was advertised for months to be a general store & then it randomly opened up as a cafe. Next to another cafe. When I WENT INTO THE CAFE TODAY, hey hello I went in!!! As a customer!! I realized it's not a general store, so that's annoying. Then I realized they had not one vegan option. Then later my friend went in and said his breakfast sandwich was hard from sitting under a heating lamp. Gross. Soooooo yep. I stand by my original review-- a general store of sorts would have been way better & the neighbors in my building seem to agree. Pretty lame.

8.description: General store or not this place is a great addition to the neighborhood.  Not sure what compels people to slam places open only for a week with a one star review.  The cinnamon donut hole thing was my favorite but the savory stuffles were also pretty awesome.

4.description: Stopped by for a coffee and something sweet! I was not disappointed, had the toast and jam dough-not. Would love to try the stuffle next. The staff was super friendly which is always a plus!!

14.description: I so wanted to like this place.  Was excited to go.  First time they were closed, so went back and found it to be more like a kitchen I had walked into.  No seating but a few window bar seats.  The name made me think our food would be hot.  Not even lukewarm.  The cheese in my ham and cheese croissant was so cold it was hard.  The stuffle with nutella was also a big let down.  I expected that fresh out of the oven taste and instead these felt like they had been sitting out for hours.  Thought I would try their cinnamon rolls that I love from their other location, but seems they cook them here (there were a ton) but do not sell them?!    Not sure if this all was a fluke as it wasn't the owners working, but I will not be back to find out.  Bummer.

6.description: Still thinking about the stuffles we got this morning, we tried both the bacon cheddar and the Nutella.

1.description: Nice place to get a hair cut and also an asian style loose perm.

0.description: If you are looking for a affordable price for good quality cut/color/hair service, this is the place to go.  I have been coming here for more than 10 years.  The owner is very sweet and attentive to my needs.  You should call ahead and make appointment before going if you want to avoid waiting.  Her customers always come back and leave very happy.

58.description: Mann these doggs are soo great!! All the goods. Great price.  And really fast service. And it's got the essential 3Cs classic, cozy & clean!! Perfect fries. The owner is a supper nice guy too. I almost wish I didn't like the doggs so much because it's gonna be hard to try anything else on the menue. I guess I could always get a cheese burger with a side of Hotdogg..... Chubbyboy style I can't wait till I have the need to take it to dogg town because I know how to get there. Next stop Hotdogg Station!!

56.description: Great place for a quick snack.  Last weekend I had a 1/3-lb hamburger.  1/4-lb is too small, 1/2-lb is too big, so 1/3-lb is a perfect size.  Today I had a Polish Sausage, and it was just as good. If I had a complaint:  too many french fries.  I couldn't finish them.

29.description: Doing the basics well is harder than we think. Hot Dog Station is a great little oasis that does justice to the Chicago classics! My beef was flavorful and I like that the giardiniera is a good mix of veggies instead of being mostly peppers like Portillos or all celery like Al's. Keeping a place clean should a basic step but not every place spends enough time maintaining cleanliness. Hot Dog Station was spotless!  I don't think they'll be suffering from any of the same issues as Sun Wah (I love them but why do they keep getting shut down?!?)While I was enjoying my food, I realized I couldn't hear all the rif raf outside. I couldn't hear the cars, couldn't hear the Brown line, couldn't hear the school kids walking by.  Maybe I temporarily lost my hearing but if I did, I highly doubt I would be listening to La Bamba in my head though it is a catchy tune. Whatever soundproofing they did, if any, was well worth it. This was such a nice surprise! My best friends parents own Albany Office Supply around the corner on Lawrence (check them out!) so it's good to know there's a place like this if we're ever in the area visiting them.

42.description: Man, after 15 years vegan I've been craving a simple Chicago-style hot dog and never found one that appeased me until now. One day I was running about and my craving was fierce. A quick Yelp search and a bounce and a hop found me at Hot Dog Station.Yup, veggiedog on the menu, didn't even bother with the rest. Do I want a meal? What's that? Fries and a drink, fuck yeah, hook me up. Came out with the quickness and I wolfed that shit down barely managing to take a picture.Small, clean, fast, super polite staff. Yup. Thanks for the "veggie" option!

23.description: Everything we've eaten here has been yummy! Burger, hot dog, chicken sandwich and italian beef were all freshly prepared when ordered.  The restaurant is cute, clean and service is great. It's become our neighborhood go to for weekend lunch. A little pricier then I'd like or I would give it 5

47.description: Okay, this place is an Albany Park gem. It's so unassuming and I am so glad my boyfriend and I stopped here last night because we were hella starving and got a double cheeseburger, chicken sandwich, fries, chi got dog and two waters for $20. I can't tell you how hard it is for me to find a decent Chicago hot dog but this place delivers. The owner and his employees obviously care a lot about their food and their customers because he came over and asked us how how good was, even struck up a friendly conversation. I felt like I was so taken care of. He also gave us some cool old photos of trains. Sometimes the CTA guys come over to the restaurant and drop off old pictures of trains and the owner was kind enough to give some to us for free. I can tell he really really cares about his business. I will definitely come again.

8.description: I really have to stop drinking! I mean seriously!!!So after a wild night with my favorite people, I felt like death when I woke up. So food and water should cure this nasty hangover that I was experiencing. I stopped at a nasty buffet at first to stuff my face (that review will follow shortly) but that did not do the trick. I decided to run errands after eating at that nasty buffet and when my hunger striked again i remembered this place.I ordred a hotdog with only relish, ketchup, tomatoes, fries and a SIDE OF MAYO! You guys should really try eating mayo with your fries it's better than having sex. My order took less than 5 minutes to come up. Everything was fresh and tasted great.This place is really clean, friendly and fast. They close pretty early and its a shame that not more people visit this little gem.

31.description: Absolutely love this place. My guy and I stopped in on a whim one day, since it's right down the block from our (semi-)new apartment and we have returned twice since. First thing I noticed was how immaculately clean it is - I'm actually shocked to see it's been open years, not mere months. The owner and the staff are the friendliest guys ever, always professional and accommodating. And then the food. I've had their gyro, chicken sandwich and blt hot dog, and all were great. My fiancé is stuck now on their deep fried hot dog, just smothered in cheese, it's so good. Will be back soon to try more on this creative menu.

34.description: After almost 3 years in Chicago I decided to finally try a chicago style hot dogs and since this place was so close and had good reviews I gave it a try. I really have to say it was actually very good I didn't have expectations since I'm not a big fan of hot dogs but this place was absolutely good. One thing that also impressed me the must was their really nice service, manager or supervisor was very helpful and so nice with everyone will show up. On top of the great service  u can't bit a place that it look very clean and this place was very organize and clean. Overall great choice to be first time visiting hot dog stand in Chicago.

16.description: Hot Dog Station was a great restaurant for my girlfriend and I. This is her third time in Chicago, and wanted a Chicago Style Hot Dog, so I brought her here.The server was extremely friendly and helpful, offering to let my girlfriend try their cheese sauce as she decided what to order. She ended up getting a Chicago style hot dog with Cheese Fries, and she really enjoyed it. I got the Italian Beef with Mozzarella, Sweet Peppers, and dipped, and it had great flavor.The only slight negative was the cheese fries were a bit too cheesy at points for my girlfriend, but overall she really enjoyed them.If I could give a 4.5 I would!

13.description: Great food.  Like the hot dogs and chicken sandwiches!!! Right next to the kimball station!!

11.description: Great hot dog place. Like classic hot dog place. Clean, friendly. Had the Long Island. Onion rings were perfect. Not too crunchy and the ring didn't come out when you bit into it. Right across from the El. Convenient and close-by. Will visit again.

39.description: Really enjoyed my food at this place. I got chicken tenders and cheese fries. The chicken tenders were fresh and crunchy, the BBQ sauce and honey mustard were both good if not phenomenal (I was sad that they were out of ranch). The cheese fries were awesome - I love me some cheese fries,  I get them everywhere I go if they're available. Too often from smaller shops the cheese is that light yellow, sort of plastic - looking and not very flavorful. This place has great cheese sauce that has a lot of flavor and they are very generous with it, which is lovely. it may not be gourmet food but it's simple and tastes good and it's not expensive.

37.description: one of my favorite places in Chicago for a Chicago style hot dog. Prices are reasonable, place is clean, and the owner is friendly

0.description: Chicago dogs. Let's have a quick chit chat about them. A beef frank, a poppy seed bun, onions, green relish, tomatoes,pickle, sports peppers, celery salt and the ever important mustard. Perfection. The staff was welcoming the greeted me immediately and took my order within 30 seconds of walking in it was great.Place is great and the fries are hot and fresh and great prices too. All in all super clean, bangin' food, friendly staff, welcoming bright location, what more could you ask for?P.s. they were playing some bangin' tunes too!

38.description: My wife and I love this place! The staff is very friendly and the food is excellent! Near North Park University and the Kimball brown line station. Would highly recommend to anyone.

51.description: Very nice atmosphere! Had a Chicago style dog and "Diablo" dog. Both were delicious ! Our server/cashier was nice. Checked up on is twice. great place

27.description: Once again this place blew me away with the friendly service and most importantly the high quality of the FOOD!! Every time I come to the city this will be my first stop. Best gyro sandwich in town!! :)

32.description: They have one of the best Italian beef sandwiches I've ever had.  In addition, I recommend to add sweet peppers and mozzarella (extra $0.59 on each add-on).  The service is consistently friendly.  The dude (assuming he's the owner because he's always there) resembles Aiden from Sex and the City (which is not a bad thing)!

54.description: Good hot dogs and very good fries.  This place is clean and bright with a retro design.  It's a welcome addition to Albany Park!  We will be back to try other menu items - they offer Italian beef, chicken sandwiches, burgers, etc.

48.description: awesome hotdogs, good prices, and fantastic service.  every time I've gone in, I've been in and out in less than 5 minutes.  I will be back here 8,356 more times.

44.description: I really have to stop drinking! I mean seriously!!!So after a wild night with my favorite people, I felt like death when I woke up. So food and water should cure this nasty hangover that I was experiencing. I stopped at a nasty buffet at first to stuff my face (that review will follow shortly) but that did not do the trick. I decided to run errands after eating at that nasty buffet and when my hunger striked again i remembered this place.I ordred a hotdog with only relish, ketchup, tomatoes, fries and a SIDE OF MAYO! You guys should really try eating mayo with your fries it's better than having sex. My order took less than 5 minutes to come up. Everything was fresh and tasted great.This place is really clean, friendly and fast. They close pretty early and its a shame that not more people visit this little gem.

24.description: Live next door and rely heavily on this place when I don't feel like cooking.  The atmosphere is great.  Decorated with transit memorabilia and usually fun lesser known music.  The guy behind the register is always friendly.  He waves if I walk by the place without stopping.  The food is always delicious.  I am not a native Chicagoan and I am 100% comfortable taking natives here for a hot dog.  Prices are very reasonable.  The only problem is that sometimes they run out of random food items.

7.description: I ran in here on my way to the train and asked if I could use the bathroom if I bought a drink, and the owner/manager said I could just use it... I didn't have to buy anything.  He was super friendly.So friendly that my boyfriend came back the same night to try the place out.  It's a cute little place, clean, with a nice diner feel.  The food is good diner food... reminds me of Portillo's... If you are looking for taste comparison.  But, seriously, the owner is so nice!  I like giving my business to places that treat you nice from the minute you walk through the door.I don't live near here, so I'm not sure when I'll be back... but if you do live here, or are taking the Brown Line to Kimball, then definitely give them a go.

49.description: I have to add a review because the owner of this place is awesome.  One day while we were at the laundromat, my fiance went over there to get a few hot dogs. My Fiance got into a conversation with the owner about the "kraut dog" that they had on special. My Fiance is used to those since he's from New Jersey(please forgive him). Long story short, the owner gave my fiance a free hot dog to taste so that the owner could "make it better". My fiance suggested that he use a different brand of mustard(other than the yellow we use, apparently they use spicy brown in NJ/NY), and he actually took the suggestion, and last time we went in, he had the "right" mustard on it - according to my finance.I'm not sure when the last time a place actually asked for an opinion, and actually took it, and applied it. I hope this place stays around.

40.description: The food is very tasty; had the hamburger and my partner had chicken tenders and we split cheese fries. The burger was on the better end of the spectrum of "diner burgers", the chicken tenders were nice and crispy and the cheese fries were regular fries with regular cheese sauce but they do NOT skimp on the cheese and that's the secret to good cheese fries.The decor is fun, old-timey rock and great old posters. Fun, cheap place for a tasty,  simple meal.

53.description: GREAT chicago hot dogs and the fountain drinks r so kool and refreshing.Have alot of brownline signs and pics with a little history.Me and wifey always stop for something between kimball bus and brownline

30.description: Best Maxwell street style polish on the north side. Simple. No slashin the sausage so it cooks faster. Just pure unadulterated dog poppin in your mouth.  With the trinity: yellow mustard, grilled onions and sport peppers. It's like the Voltron of Chicago food. L to the git. Get it. Got it. Good.

46.description: After over a year of eating at Hot Dog Station several times a month, I have to upgrade my rating to 5 stars.  The food is always delicous, the is always friendly, and Demitri is an awesome advocate of our neighborhood.  Thanks!

1.description: Let me start this review by clarifying...I am life long Chicagoan who knows a thang or 2,3,4 and for good measure 5 about an Italian beef....I'm talking west side, north side, south side and franchise! I remember when all beefs seemed like foot longs (but maybe I was just younger) and never disappointed.... long gone are those days thus, thought I was destined to only remember the way we were....In steps this spot....for real, for real the beef was good. I'm talking heavy in my hand, melt in my mouth, full of flavor good. Not as long as the old days but heavy enough that I forced hubby to grab a hold of it as proof!Dipped, cheesed, hot peppered and placed in a plastic bag for cleanliness as we traveled home, was a small clue that they care about me and the food. Will be back to try the dogs (i mean that has to happen first) and hopefully 5 star this fine Chicago establishment :)

55.description: Super cute place! Nice little throw back to the 50s! The owner is extremely nice and the food is amazing.  The customer service is outstanding; the owner serves you your meal himself and away makes sure you are enjoying it. This place is oozing with nostalgia from the decor, to the music. If your want a great burger, fun music, and a great dining experience, come here! You'll love it!

9.description: I've lived in the area for 3 years and haven't had a chance to eat at Hot Dog Station...until today. First, the food is outstanding!!!! Flame-grilled burgers, super yummy cheese fries. Totally the best hangover food ever! The quality was outstanding, crisp lettuce perfect tomatoes on the burger. The food seriously is incredible!!Next....the owner was so nice! I got there about 20 minutes before closing, and he chatted with me while my food was being cooked (everything was done fresh, fyi). I can't wait to go back!

26.description: The fine line of quality control and good food here is what the industry standard is made of. The burgers are fresh not greasy, the ingredients are fresh cut all the way down to the jalapenos on the burgers. Their burgers rival any big chain burger joint. The beef combo sandwiches are out standing. This is the hole in the wall that should have crowds lined down the block and around the corner.

25.description: Kudos!  As a daughter of Chicagoans and Albany Park long time resident, I am happy to announce that a quality and flavorful Italian Beef has been found.  If you knew Carms in Hillside and have been grieving with me, then cry no more.  The owner took my order and, though I was a carry out, he offered me a seat and some water while I waited.  Families, a group of guys, and random people like myself sat enjoying their meals in the cozy and clean space.  Once I got home I realized that because I had asked for 'dipped', they placed my sandwich in a small plastic baggie before wrapping it up in foil.  This kept da' juice from going everywhere and my sandwich stayed warm.  The flavor, good lord the flavor.  It's everything you want.  I like sweet peppers, my husband likes it with giardiniera.  Both sandwiches were perfect in every way.  Please keep this place in business.  Beef sandwiches are a special treat for me, but if you're stepping off the brown line or live the area and want a great sandwich then stop in.  Super friendly and doing a great job of keeping Albany Park delicious.

12.description: The food is very tasty; had the hamburger and my partner had chicken tenders and we split cheese fries. The burger was on the better end of the spectrum of "diner burgers", the chicken tenders were nice and crispy and the cheese fries were regular fries with regular cheese sauce but they do NOT skimp on the cheese and that's the secret to good cheese fries.The decor is fun, old-timey rock and great old posters. Fun, cheap place for a tasty,  simple meal.

59.description: One of my pet peeves when when it comes to hot dogs, specifically in Chicago, is that a Chicago-style dog should be constructed neatly. And no skimping on the ingredients, like too thin of tomato slices. God forbid leaving a key ingredient out! Well the Hot Dog Station puts together the perfectly put together dog!! And their fries are delicious! I came all the way up from Bucktown for one of their Chicago Dogs. Well worth the trip!

21.description: Went there Saturday at 11am and waited for 20 mins.....no one there!!, and the sign on the door says open at 10:30amSMH

17.description: After almost 3 years in Chicago I decided to finally try a chicago style hot dogs and since this place was so close and had good reviews I gave it a try. I really have to say it was actually very good I didn't have expectations since I'm not a big fan of hot dogs but this place was absolutely good. One thing that also impressed me the must was their really nice service, manager or supervisor was very helpful and so nice with everyone will show up. On top of the great service  u can't bit a place that it look very clean and this place was very organize and clean. Overall great choice to be first time visiting hot dog stand in Chicago.

10.description: They have one of the best Italian beef sandwiches I've ever had.  In addition, I recommend to add sweet peppers and mozzarella (extra $0.59 on each add-on).  The service is consistently friendly.  The dude (assuming he's the owner because he's always there) resembles Aiden from Sex and the City (which is not a bad thing)!

5.description: I love this resturant. The guy, who I intially thought was the owner, gives great customer service. I just L-O-V-E the resturant's decor. The old paintings, posters and signs of the L' lines. I went in one time with my father, who works for CTA, he was taken back as well. He's a big history buff and he knew the year in which every photograph was taken. It's definitely a true Chicago Style Vienna Hot Dog stand. No ketchup on anything, they do have a ketchup dispenser in front, though. You just will need to get a couple of small cups of ketchup.One thing that I will say about the Hot Dog Station it is a little pricey. So, I may visited just once a month, ususlly over the weekends. The food is worth the price, though. Plus, you won't find another place like this in Albany Park. Just a heads up, they are not open on Sundays. I always forget that.

3.description: One of the best Hot Dogs I have had in my life. The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. Try the Chicago Dog, you won't be disappointed.

35.description: Albany Park is severely lacking in dog and burger joints until now..Go here and spend money, keep this place going because it's worth it..Not to make comparisons to chains like Portillo's but the Burger here is very similar, but just as good imo. The dogs are awesome, they use Red Hot Chicago, which I prefer over Vienna, yeah I said it.  They have specialty dogs too, like the BLT dog and hot dogs w/ spins on them from other cities. The owner is super cool, welcoming and you can tell he really cares about his business. You can tell he cares about the quality of his products because, well, the products are quality when you receive them. Hot Dog Station is extremely consistent, I've never been disappointed.

19.description: Their fast food is great! I usually do not eat hot dogs or fast foods but I make the exception when it comes to this place; their foods are always well cooked, non greasy and their fries are fabulous, crispy and with some potato skins, yummy! I love eating here when I pick up my son from Von Steuben, good mommy and son bonding time over a pizza puff and fries.

28.description: I have been here a few times and am working my way through the menu.  The Italian beef is legit.  The hot dogs are good and the burger was excellent.  Very nice restaurant, clean and convenient location in the heart of Albany Park.  And they deliver!  Quickly too, my order was at my door 15 minutes after ordering.  Great food, great service (really nice people).  This is the place to go for hot dogs, burgers, and beef in Albany Park.

45.description: I truly enjoyed this restaurant!! It was inexpensive,a good atmosphere and the customer service was superb.  The restaurant was spotless and decorated great!  I also enjoyed the music and it was at good level, not to loud or too low! The manager was very attentive to his customer needs!  I loved it... I would definitely return and would recommend it to everyone I know

33.description: Yessss. My never-approve-of-anything father approved of their Italian beef!! Very tasty and good quality. Coulda been a bit more stuffed with meat, but nicely soaked in au jus with the soft and chewy bread. Was really really tasty. Added 59 cents for peppers-- do it! Have had better dawgs in Chi but this place has still got it going on. Tried a small amount of the chicken tortilla soup has a very nice kick to it but also freshly made. They pride themselves on high quality and amazing service. And you can tell! Nice job HDS!!

43.description: Great service, The interior is so cute, phenomenal italian beef and hot đogs. The food is brought to your table. Definitely worth going to!

2.description: What a delicious hot dog and fries they have!! We had the char grilled maxwell street polish hot dog and it was the bomb!! The ambience is nice and relaxing!! The music and the decorations are amazing because they make me feel like I live in the 1950s!!  Will definitely be coming back!!

18.description: Doing the basics well is harder than we think. Hot Dog Station is a great little oasis that does justice to the Chicago classics! My beef was flavorful and I like that the giardiniera is a good mix of veggies instead of being mostly peppers like Portillos or all celery like Al's. Keeping a place clean should a basic step but not every place spends enough time maintaining cleanliness. Hot Dog Station was spotless!  I don't think they'll be suffering from any of the same issues as Sun Wah (I love them but why do they keep getting shut down?!?)While I was enjoying my food, I realized I couldn't hear all the rif raf outside. I couldn't hear the cars, couldn't hear the Brown line, couldn't hear the school kids walking by.  Maybe I temporarily lost my hearing but if I did, I highly doubt I would be listening to La Bamba in my head though it is a catchy tune. Whatever soundproofing they did, if any, was well worth it. This was such a nice surprise! My best friends parents own Albany Office Supply around the corner on Lawrence (check them out!) so it's good to know there's a place like this if we're ever in the area visiting them.

41.description: I ran in here on my way to the train and asked if I could use the bathroom if I bought a drink, and the owner/manager said I could just use it... I didn't have to buy anything.  He was super friendly.So friendly that my boyfriend came back the same night to try the place out.  It's a cute little place, clean, with a nice diner feel.  The food is good diner food... reminds me of Portillo's... If you are looking for taste comparison.  But, seriously, the owner is so nice!  I like giving my business to places that treat you nice from the minute you walk through the door.I don't live near here, so I'm not sure when I'll be back... but if you do live here, or are taking the Brown Line to Kimball, then definitely give them a go.

52.description: This place is absolutely perfect for Italian Beef sandwiches, sausages, hot dogs and fries. The food is incredible and service with a smile. Please do yourself a favor if you're wavering on going here and just do it. You'll never stop coming back!

50.description: Awesome spot. My son and I have been here many times and have never had a bad experience. The hot dogs are all great, especially the chile/cheese. The fries are always hot and not over seasoned. However what keeps me coming back is the service. Always very attentive and polite. I dig polite.

4.description: This place is amazing. Seriously the cleanest, friendliest and freshest food ever. Wish they had extended hours for a late night craving! I'm so picky about hot dog places but this place is seriously worth a try. You definitely won't be disappointed!

6.description: Man, after 15 years vegan I've been craving a simple Chicago-style hot dog and never found one that appeased me until now. One day I was running about and my craving was fierce. A quick Yelp search and a bounce and a hop found me at Hot Dog Station.Yup, veggiedog on the menu, didn't even bother with the rest. Do I want a meal? What's that? Fries and a drink, fuck yeah, hook me up. Came out with the quickness and I wolfed that shit down barely managing to take a picture.Small, clean, fast, super polite staff. Yup. Thanks for the "veggie" option!

22.description: Love this hidden gem! They have great veggie dogs, cute atmosphere and a friendly owner.

15.description: Wow, I grew up on the south side where there is a great hot dog stand on every corner and some of the best food ever. This place BLEW ME AWAY! From the second I opened the door the cashier greeted me, and the place was flawless, super clean.THE FOOD WAS EASILY TOP 5 in Chicago.1 cheese dog only cheese- wow. I'm all for the fake liquid it's amazing, but this was the thicker version, unbelievable. I almost ate all the cheese off my dog with my fries which were made fresh to order, still hot 5 minutes after I started eatingClassic Chicago dog, everything no tomatoes- everything you want in a hot dog.Everything about this place blew other places out of the water, must have for any hot dog fan in Chicago.

57.description: Decent Beef, a little small. Good fries. May have been hoping for more based on Thrillist top 10. Rating may have been higher but my giardiniera was left off the sandwich. It was on the receipt so I know I ordered it correctly.

20.description: my first visit.......I have to say AWSOME. .. I asked, who I assume to be the owner, how long they have been there. He said 3 years..boy have I been missing out. the burger AWSOME. . the polish AWSOME. ..the fries AWSOME.   definitely will be back..Super clean, well put together establishment.  and the owner, what a nice guy. Albany Park has one of the best burger in Chicago. From the bun to the fresh cut onions.I would love to be at a BBQ at this guy's house!!!! Ps.  I would have posted a picture but my family ate it all !!!

36.description: Normally I wonder why people make a big deal about Italian beef sandwiches.  But I totally get why everyone raves about the Italian beef at Hot Dog Station--it is fabulous!  Good fast food at a reasonable price.  The people are friendly.

14.description: Not only is the food delicious, but the owners are very nice people. I haven't tried the hot dogs (I'm not a big hot dog fan); I usually get a burger and fries. The only downside I can think of is that the restaurant doesn't have free refills. I also wish they had milkshakes, but since it is a smaller place, I understand why it may be cost prohibitive. What I feel really makes the place though is the owners; they are great at making people feel welcome, and they remember you when you come back.

3.description: Went there today and it was very nice . Decent girls and they are professional. Definitely a happy ending involved

1.description: This place got some nasty ass girls working here-- this lady gave my husband a fucking condom covered BLOW JOB that he paid $100 dollars for! Extremely unprofessional! Good job Ruby Spa on being a homewrecker, we have 2 kids ! Smh.

2.description: I just went to Ruby 's and the lady's are sexy and very helpful to their customer's a very clean place I will be going back and thanks to all the other reviews of this place and I think Xindy's went out of business they haven't been open since last September or October so Ruby 's will be my new massage parlor.

5.description: I was rather surprised to see that this placed was reviewed by women. Quite shocked really, because once inside it has the air of "house of ill repute," so to speak. I chose it because the lights were still on early one evening after doing some instense running. I was sore, stressed out, and wanted to just relax.The entrance was rather inviting; several Asian women were sitting around watching TV and the one at the counter related their price information. Pretty standard dollar a minute sort of deal. I agreed, and was led back to one of the rooms to undress. The table shower thing was pretty awesome. I didn't know how to feel being treated like a piece of dirty meat to be hosed down and disinfected for her petite Asian hands. For some reason she concentrated on my posterior assets and the divide. Did I offend? Did not know and by now wasn't caring, I was being showered by another human being. Felt weird feelings of regressing to infancy in the strong, confident hands loofa-ing me up.The massage itself was rather lackluster. It was quite "sensual" as one of the other women reviewers mentioned. Again, I was treated to backdoor antics and showered with compliments. Really know how to flatter a guy, these masseuses. My thighs and back were really worked on after requesting such work. I left feeling better, just not as relieved as when a 60 y.o. Asian lady did deep tissue and beat the hell out of me. I was reborn then, not at this joint. I left sticky, but not the good kind of sticky.I am of the same opinion that it is tacky to request to be tipped. It IS rude to demand a fixed amount. I experienced the same thing and was quite put off by their pushy demeanor. Even breaking into Cantonese and giggling to another masseuse between hasseling me for a tip. Blatant sycophancy and mediocre massage do not a good client relationship make. So, I tipped half of what she requested. Smarmy chocolate starfish loving diva that she was she had a problem with it. Yeah, even worse is when you purse your face into a vaggy resembleance of a smooshed ET figurine to give me the "stink" finger for lousy salesmanship. I've had better massages at more reputable places. Move on down the strip.

6.description: Effy or Mi-Mi. Effy is more methodical and reserved but Mi-Mi is definitely more outside the box. Either one is a go. 60 / 10 / 60 / 20 / 40

7.description: Ok, so I was dying for a massage - so many friggin workouts and no massage in a very long time, and my muscles are tight.  I cruised down Archer avenue, looking at signs, and saw Ruby Spa with a sign lit up that said 'open'.  I park my car, go up to the door - windows are tinted and door is locked.  I ring bell and some Chinese woman answers the door.  Two other Chinese women are lounging on the leather couch in their pajamas.  So the woman is showing me the prices for massage.  In the meanwhile, two creepy men came in separately.  I should have gotten a clue, but hey, I'm dying for a good, deep tissue massage.  We go into the room, and i strip down.  The woman comes back in, continuously rubs oil softly all over my back and butt.  No deep tissue massage here, just gentle, sensual (eeewww!!!) strokes up and down my back and butt.  And I'm telling you, she's about 1/2 inch from my privates at least 3 times.  Then she says 'you have such nice body'.  UGGGHH.  Ok, I will never visit again.  Obviously, she was attempting a happy ending on me.  YUCK!!!  I give them 2 stars though - she did tell me I have a nice body and she gave me a little bottle of cold water after.

0.description: Listen I had gone to this wonderful massage place not far from Xindy's down the block.THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC!!!!!!I was left breathless leaving the establishment. There is street parking and its not far from the Stevenson expressway.People were friendly and accomodated me fairly well.The chinese masseuse had rubbed away my back and leg pain. She was very courteous and friendly . I can walk much better after this relaxing experience.Thankyou RUBY SPA

4.description: There should be a statute of limitations on  yelp reviews: the only ones of this place I found were on 2010. Massage is a flowing business: peaking today, bancrupt (or jailed) tomorrow. So, forget what you read, and there are no MIMIs or EFFIs there.But YoYo is, and she is delighful, and she knows what to massage and how to please. It's a totally legit nice massage, masterfully performed by the womaqn who could be a movie star.The only true part is the lobby: it's still unpleasant and unwelcoming, with a table full of unfinished food and garbage bags on the floor. But hey, for a lobby experience, go to Hilton or Drake. For a massage, go to YoYo.

1.description: I had the best seafood soup  ever.  My children ate a great Churrasco  with black beans soup. We love it.

9.description: This place place opened about a year ago and I've been here a couple of times a month.Every time I come here I taste diferent choices from their extense menu, since appetizers to main dishes... since national or imported beer to the most extraordinary mix drinks.It's an ideal place to meet with friends after work, for a business meeting and also suitable to come with family with kids.Prices are pretty good. I have tried almost everyhing of the Latino restaurants in the North side, I just found Tortuga's as the best choice.Don't miss the Chorizo (Guatemalan style), churrasco  (my favorite one).Staff is very friendly, private parking in rear.

12.description: Terrible ceviche it was serve in a plate hard yo see the fish and the shrimp, just tomate, the tortuga's sandwich the meat was hard like a rock , they don't see me there never more . Nunca he visto un lugar con tan mala calidad en los platos y tan caro . Que disgusto

21.description: Stopped in last night to check out Tortuga's and I left really impressed, satiated and eager to return!For as empty and cavernous as the restaurant may appear from the outside, it's literally night and day when you eat as a guest there. The staff and patrons I spoke with filled the room with generosity and warmth. Everyone was helpful toward making menu and drink suggestions. And, even though I was alone, I quickly felt included in every one's conversations and celebrations.Many diners were eating seafood, but I opted for the Churrasco Guatemalteco. It was a fantastic steak. The best I've had in our neighborhood. The cut was of really good quality, expertly seasoned, and cooked to a perfect medium rare. I regret not starting with Ceviche. Everyone was eating it. It looked amazing and fresh. Next time it will be mine!In a way, I felt a little like I was on vacation. Sipping on Famosa beer, the official Lager of Guatemala, I would at times get lost in the thumping latin beats provided by their in house DJ. For some, it might be a little loud. But, I kind of liked the vibe they were trying to create. They mentioned that Thursdays is Karaoke and they have a full catalog of Latin and English songs. The weekends are centered around latin dancing with music provided by a DJ. In May they're hosting a famous Guatemalan rock band called Viento en Contra for two shows. This piqued my interest a bit, and I politely asked if the DJ had any of their music. They quickly changed the song for me. And again, I was turned onto something new and enjoyable. The songs were a lot slower than I expected. But you could hear the emotion in the melody and singing. Even though I didn't understand any of the words, I could sense the heartbreak and longing, or proclamations of love being sung.Thank you Tortuga's for such a welcoming experience. I hope other gringos, like myself, take a chance. You are a great addition to the neighborhood, and I can't wait to return many more times.

16.description: I have to admit I went in here with really low expectations and left really surprised. The decor here is middle eastern whcih threw me off at first. Thinking it is from the place that was here before... Our waitress though was very nice. We started with the Guacamole. The Guacamole here was very fresh and some of the best I have had. For dinner I had the Carne Asada and it was also cooked to perfection. I would say my only complaint was the loud music while we tried to eat. Over all though the food and service was great. Turn down the music a bit though.

17.description: was a little nervous about the banquet hall style interior. But the food was AMAZING!!! Will definitely go back.

10.description: Es un ambiente familiar excelente servicio y las margaritas son una delicia. I love this place I feel so good with my friend Alex the best of the best bartenders in chicago. Great food good prices .

5.description: Waited over 40 minutes for food only to get the completely wrong order. Ordered Jibaritos and got steak burritos instead. Considering this place is fricking empty right now, I dont understand how this is acceptable. The waiter seemed too distracted by the soccer game on the TV. Highly recommend avoiding this place.

11.description: We were at Tortuga's Saturday night and it was delicious. The food was amazing and the staff were so kind and accommodating. We will definitely be eating here again, so pleased with the service and food.

3.description: The best Latin restaurant in the area! Many tvs, great food and friendly staff. I ordered the longanizas and Yuca con Chicharron those two plates are delicious. Everything in the menu is absolutely delicious. Oh they also have a great music!

0.description: We came here with my 2 year old on Saturday around 2:00. No one greeted us so we finally sat down on our own and had to go through 3 high chairs before we found one that was suitable. Chips and salsa were great. Our server who is also co owner was very nice and helped us with the menu. Margaritas were great and food was great. Especially ceviche. They also brought out some oranges for our little one. We will be back and also try their delivery.

20.description: Tortuga's is a welcome addition to the area.  The food is great and represents pan-Latin cuisine and the margaritas are excellent and large.  You can sense great pride in ownership with their food and drink offerings.  An added bonus is the incredibly warm and friendly staff and owners.  They really want to get to know their patrons and their inviting personalities show in their enthusiasm to get to know you (but not in a creepy or overbearing way).    I've docked them a point for ambience.  On a recent visit, the owners mentioned wanting to expand their food offerings (which are already plentiful), but I would recommend they focus on sectioning the restaurant, losing some TVs, and turning off the strobe lights and outside sidewalk music.  It's on the verge of tacky territory, but with a few tweaks could be a really central meeting location in the neighborhood.If you concentrate solely on the food and incredibly warm owners and staff, you will be pleased.

19.description: Tortuga's is a welcome addition to the area.  The food is great and represents pan-Latin cuisine and the margaritas are excellent and large.  You can sense great pride in ownership with their food and drink offerings.  An added bonus is the incredibly warm and friendly staff and owners.  They really want to get to know their patrons and their inviting personalities show in their enthusiasm to get to know you (but not in a creepy or overbearing way).    I've docked them a point for ambience.  On a recent visit, the owners mentioned wanting to expand their food offerings (which are already plentiful), but I would recommend they focus on sectioning the restaurant, losing some TVs, and turning off the strobe lights and outside sidewalk music.  It's on the verge of tacky territory, but with a few tweaks could be a really central meeting location in the neighborhood.If you concentrate solely on the food and incredibly warm owners and staff, you will be pleased.

2.description: Everything I had was delicious. The steak was excellent. Their maduros we cooked perfectly and not too sweet. Ceviche was also great, we just had the appetizer portion of the shrimp on the tostada. Definitely need to come back to order more and see how the rest of the food is.The hospitality is so nice, our waiter was actually the owner and he was super helpful!

18.description: Pricey but delicious. Be aware, they might have crazy loud Spanish language karaoke that will start with no warning. The food was amazing. The ambiance was ... Unique. They set it up like banquet style even on days when they haven't rented it out.

13.description: We stopped in tonight because the place we had planned to have dinner was closed. We've driven by so many times and thought we should try.  And we were not disappointed! Huge space! Casual decor. Good Food. And friendly owner. My husband ordered a margarita and for $9 it was quite large and flavorful.  I had sangria  also good.  Food was authentic to Latin America; I've been to Puerto Rico, Costa Rica,  Belize,  Peru and Ecuador, so I can confirm the authenticity. I had jabiritos and my husband had the Churrasco Steak. Both good. We had a very nice time chatting with the owner about his business,  background and Central America in general.  Made for a nice evening.  We'll be back!

4.description: We showed up to meet the owner and make final arrangements for a date we had arranged with him for an event. He was late so, while we waited, we ordered to eat. First, they brought me a glass of red wine instead  a Pinot Grigio, even though it is on their menu. Then they messed  up our order and brought us the wrong dish. Then the owner finally showed up, and he was pretentious and told us he had given our event date away to someone else. And, last but not least, I was made to wait 30 min for my receipt because no one knew how to print a client copy. I don't blame our server because she was probably not trained well. The owner should pay more attention to detail and get off his high horse.

6.description: I was very impressed with this place.  I went when it was fairly empty, so can't speak to what it's like when/if it gets loud and crazy.  I ordered some big meaty combo plate (Churrasco Guatamalteco) and it was excellent.
