I'm not usually into margaritas (usually too sweet and not alcoholic enough), but the margaritas here  are great.  I definitely look forward to coming back to try more things on the menu.

15.description: Absolutely TERRIBLE service! Ordered a drink two times with waitress and finally had to go to bar and get it myself. Appetizer brought out with half of the dinner orders, and food was extremely greasy.

7.description: Long story short, the food is great, but the place is half the time always closed to the public. What's the point if people can't come in and enjoy the place. So annoying and I don't know if I will keep driving here for no reason.

8.description: I came here for lunch on a Friday, and it was dead. Jacob Marley dead. There was only one other occupied table in the whole place. Are you looking for a lunch spot that's not fast food and won't leave you waiting instead of eating? Then I highly recommend Tortuga's.In a neighborhood with Mexican restaurants left and right, this place sets itself apart by being pan-Latin. You can get a jibarrito. You can get Guatemalan specialties. You can get a regular old quesadilla. It also distinguishes itself by offering smoothies, live music in the evenings, and making everything to order. This includes the complimentary tortilla chips brought to each table as well as the amazing guacamole. While this is a cantina, it's not anything like a typical bar. They do have a full bar, but the food is the real star here, and at lunch my daughter was not only welcomed but fawned over by the gentlemen working that day. They gave her a little cocktail umbrella to play with and repeatedly offered to bring more chips when they saw how much she liked them. The portions are also pretty generous, not at all bad for the price. This place is also conveniently near both the brown line and a bus stop. Parking isn't too difficult to find most of the time. Getting there isn't a problem. Making yourself put down the chips and go home, though? That could be tricky.

14.description: Hours are all wrong! They are open when they feel like it. Went there on two different occasions the first time was closed even though the hours said it was open. The second  time I decided to call ahead and the man who answered the phone said they were open until 1130pm. I had called around 9pm when I arrived there was some lights and people inside but the doors were locked. I decided to call and this time can hear someone in the background saying "tell them we're closed" and that's what the guy said. I told him I called earlier and HE said they were open til 1130 he replied with a" sorry, come tomorrow" Extremely UNPROFESSIONAL. NEVER GOING BACK. HUGE Waste of time.

3.description: Dokil Bakery sends it's baked goods everywhere!  I'm in Dayton Ohio now and eating Bean Bread right now and loving it!  Picked this nice little pastry up at the Dong Yang Oriental Food and Gift Shop.  Fantastic.

1.description: Cute place. All of their pastries are individually wrapped in plastic. so it's really easy to get something to bring back home for a friend.Their custard bun is very good.

2.description: On whim, we checked out this bakery.  They have a vast selection of bean bread.  They even have bean donut.  I was not too fond of that, it was too oily and sweet.  The bean manju was pretty good.  We also tried the red bean and custard bread.  They were a little too sweet for me and the bread was lacking something, maybe texture.  Overall, this place is A-OK.  I will probably check out other korean bakeries just for the sake of comparison.  The lady that runs the shop is really nice.  They have been there for a long time now.

9.description: Delicious butter cream buns.  Its nice that they individually wrap them for you so you can get one on the way to wherever it is you are going and can just throw it in your purse or bag.  And so conveniently located right near my house.  My friend who was visiting from Boston was so impressed that you could get so many different cuisines in Albany Park. I will be stopping in again.

10.description: Big fan of their green & white bean buns and potato croquette donuts. This is a popular bakery that sells stuff you'll typically find at Mitsuwa or chinatown, but done in a korean style. They also sell loaves of bread, cake rolls, and rice cakes.  If the drive is too far, find their pastries at most korean groceries.

4.description: If I had lived closer, I would be frequenting Dokil Bakery on a daily basis. Most of the baked goods offered could easily satisfy even the sweetest of sweet tooths without the accompanying sugar rush. Buns and rolls I have tried were good, but what really stood our were the mini trio of buns. Each one had a different bean filling -- from red bean to white bean to green bean. Clearly, this concept was designed for indecisive customers like myself, who never know what to get when faced with so many options.Another favorite treat of mine are the mini baked Korean white bean cakes, which are typically sold by the dozen, if not more. (See picture.) It takes quite a bit of self-restraint to not want to finish the entire package in one sitting. Price-wise, I don't find the bakery to be more expensive than the other ones I've been to. Quality, however, I find DB to deliver better than most.And if you feel like you're missing out on DB (and I'll admit that you are!), check out your local Asian groceries as they may carry some of the aforementioned baked goods as well.

6.description: As good as it gets in Chicago! Best Korean bakery shop in town!!!

11.description: They have a lot of the bakery items that I usually find at home (in Hawaii).  They have these really good things they call "nut ball"..its a soft dough with a custardy cream and walnuts in it.  soooo good!!  they give like 20 pieces for about 4 dollars or so...i think.

5.description: So delicious and inexpensive.  It's also very clean, pleasant and relaxing in there with large wooden tables by the window for good people-watching and lots of sunlight.  The girl at the counter was very nice and asked if I would like her to bring me a glass of water.  I had the 4 miniature bean cakes which came with one red, one white and 2 green cakes.  It was under $2.

7.description: This Korean bakery offers a variety of pastries, buns, and cakes.  But I was on the lookout for one item in particular - the Cream Bun.  I've had them at New York Bakery and wanted to try their version of it.I was happy to find it here, and I purchased a couple of them, plus an Almond Bun.  The cream bun is an individually-wrapped sweet roll filled with buttercream.  The bread was soft, sweet and perfect with the buttercream.  The almond bun consisted of an almond sponge cake that was also filled with buttercream.  This particular buttercream was sweet and a bit salty, which was a nice surprise.  Dokil also has sponge cake rolls filled with buttercream (another favorite of mine), bread, cookies, and buns filled with sweet bean paste.  I'll definitely be back to try their other items.

8.description: I always come to to Dokil when I'm craving Korean pastries.  Love the green and white bean buns, peanut crumb buns, custard buns, jelly roll cakes and korean cookies.   Korean pastries are not too sweet and have a soft and spongy texture.

0.description: This is my favorite Korean bakery in Chicago for Korean Breads (for rice cakes-go to Nak Won)! I have a sweet tooth and I'm Korean. I tried New York Bakery, too, but this place is better. Their bread is fluffier and the taste is better and the texture is crunchier. I love the Peanut Crumb Bread (the round one with yummy crumbs), gumbo bbang, i think it's called.  Everything is fresh and made the day of! The prices here are cheaper, too, than NY Bakery. Go! You won't be disappointed! I have good taste :). The baker is nice, too.

1.description: I did not have high expectations for the dinning experience going in, but I was really counting on the great reviews of the food. The place is modest, at times painfully so. As a Puerto Rican born and raised in the island I noticed right from the appetizer that the food had a different flare, as if it was influenced or mixed with another cuisine. Catch my drift?I started with the stuffed potato, and a café con leche. The stuffed potato was orange, which I found odd. The taste was ok, but the ground beef was skimped on and bland. The coffee tasted more like milk than actual coffee. For my main dish I had the shrimp in garlic sauce with the fried plantains, boy had the fried pork with mofongo. The shrimp had a good flavor, but it was swimming in oil and garlic, tons and tons of garlic. Like an entire can of minced garlic. A big one. The fried plaintains were great! Crispy, bright yellow, and fresh!Boy's "carne frita" was extra chewy, perhaps double fried. The mofongo was ok. Not bad, not great.

9.description: Had the arroz with pulled pork and the jobarito with garlic shrimp. Both were absolutely excellent and giant portions for the price ($10 & $9). The pulled pork was definitely some of the best I ever had. Absolutely lovely little hole in the wall

23.description: Great Food, loved the Jibarito and yellow rice. Rice was soft, oily,salty and flavorful. Had the Jibarito with steak and all the fixings. Wife had the vegetarian Jibarito but she wasn't wowed. I guess it would help if they used the same adobo seasoning on the veggies as they do with the meat. That picosito sauce was spicy but I definitely can appreciate it cause I like vinegary hot sauces. Being Puerto Rican I'm  glad to see them in the neighborhood and appreciate their style of cooking. Next I'll try their style of Mofongo, another popular PR staple on the island. To Be Continued.

25.description: Tried the steak Jibarrito last night and it was delicious!  We placed a large order and everything was made fresh on the spot.  Meat was tender, juicy and full of flavor.  Garlic Mayo was DELISH!  I've tried other location in past that have been very greasy-& this is not! It came with a side of arroz con gandules that was very good as well.  This is a new restaurant and I hope the word gets out so he can stick around!!

12.description: Great Food, loved the Jibarito and yellow rice. Rice was soft, oily,salty and flavorful. Had the Jibarito with steak and all the fixings. Wife had the vegetarian Jibarito but she wasn't wowed. I guess it would help if they used the same adobo seasoning on the veggies as they do with the meat. That picosito sauce was spicy but I definitely can appreciate it cause I like vinegary hot sauces. Being Puerto Rican I'm  glad to see them in the neighborhood and appreciate their style of cooking. Next I'll try their style of Mofongo, another popular PR staple on the island. To Be Continued.

21.description: Finally, a place  nearby to satisfy my jibarito fix! I knew as soon as I opened my bag and a burst of garlicy goodness wafted through the air that I was in for a treat. This place has officially de-throned Borinquen as my favorite jibarito spot in the city. I highly recommend the steak jibarito, habichuela, and arroz con gandules. They do not skimp on the meat, but if you like you can add extra meat for a buck. Super cheap! My jibarito was deliciously garlicky and had the perfect ratio of mayo, tomato and lettuce so that your sandwich is full, but doesn't crumble when you take a bite. The plantains (which function as the 'bread' in this sandwich) are perfectly fried and were not too greasy. The habichuela, dear God, the habichuela. I don't know what they put in those beans, but I'm pretty sure they sprinkle a little bit of magic in them. So. Flipping. Good. You can't beat the price. We ordered two jibaritos, a side of platanos maduros, arroz con gandules, y habichuela and our bill was under $20. The restaurant is not fancy by any means, but who cares?! The food is divine and that's all that matters. I will definitely be ordering again and frequently.

16.description: Dude. The jibarito is amAAAAzing!!! They serve my jibarito with the garlic margarita atop the plaintain which makes it more delicious. I also recommend the monfongo with fried pork...we dipped that fried pork on that puerto rican salsa (which my boyfriend so loves!) My boyfriend has tried several jibaritos in Chicago and said that it was one of the best jibaritos in Chicago. Our waiter was friendly and prices are very reasonable. When I get sick of eating healthy I'll come back for sure.

17.description: Finally, a place  nearby to satisfy my jibarito fix! I knew as soon as I opened my bag and a burst of garlicy goodness wafted through the air that I was in for a treat. This place has officially de-throned Borinquen as my favorite jibarito spot in the city. I highly recommend the steak jibarito, habichuela, and arroz con gandules. They do not skimp on the meat, but if you like you can add extra meat for a buck. Super cheap! My jibarito was deliciously garlicky and had the perfect ratio of mayo, tomato and lettuce so that your sandwich is full, but doesn't crumble when you take a bite. The plantains (which function as the 'bread' in this sandwich) are perfectly fried and were not too greasy. The habichuela, dear God, the habichuela. I don't know what they put in those beans, but I'm pretty sure they sprinkle a little bit of magic in them. So. Flipping. Good. You can't beat the price. We ordered two jibaritos, a side of platanos maduros, arroz con gandules, y habichuela and our bill was under $20. The restaurant is not fancy by any means, but who cares?! The food is divine and that's all that matters. I will definitely be ordering again and frequently.

10.description: Got take out arroz con gandules and bistro and the camarón a la plancha.  So delicious!  Ask for tostones!  Can't wait to go back.

5.description: I was pumped to try some of the Puerto Rican food selections from El Picosito Jibaro, located on Lawrence near Kedzie in what apparently was a Middle Eastern food outlet.  For my take away order I chose the jibarito with lechon, which came with a side of arroz con gandules, and also an alcapuria.  The jibarito was fine, and actually held together as a "sandwich" to eat.  However maybe I was missing some grease and flavor, as I have had some absolutely messy jibaritos elsewhere that were impossible to eat by hand but tasted better.  The flat plantain pieces of this jibarito were a bit dry, though they held up through every bite. The ingredients included a respectable amount of pork, plus lettuce, tomato, cheese and mayo.  The container of Puerto Rican style rice was good but not great, with a sprinkling of gandules.  The alcapuria was just disappointing, with a dry oval-shaped mass of plantain dough surrounding some bland meat pieces.  I want to like this place more, and I must say the service was pleasant and quick at the counter.  I will have to try it again, but perhaps next time I will dine in.

11.description: Best Puerto Rican food I have had beside my moms came here because it was close to the house tried the mofongo with fried pork rice and gandules acapurias relleno de papa and pastel steak jibarito everything was  delicious delicious  delicious.

22.description: Best jibaritos around! Their tostones are crispy and on point I haven't been disappointed yet! Oh and they deliver too!!!! So happy this place is here!

0.description: Hidden gem amongst many other great restaurants in the neighborhood.This place is down to earth and non-pretentious. we order one entree to share between two of us, and we were full. More importantly, the carnitas and rice dish tasted great. The pork was moist and the rice was tasty.Highly recommended.

20.description: So excited to finally have a Puerto Rican restaurant in Albany Park. I tried it last week and it was excellent, even my friend was amazed, will definitely come back!

19.description: My husband and I were going for a walk and saw this place. Stopped in to get a menu. Ordered one of each type of plantain to give it a try. While we were waiting they gave us a pastelillo to share! Like here, try it. And we did and it was awesome. So we ordered dinner! Now I'm stuffed and oh so happy to have Puerto Rican food within walking distance! Go check it out :)

2.description: I'd give it 4.5 stars if I could..   Really great PR food and nice people too. The lechon is wonderful

18.description: I have tried a lot of steak Jibarito's and this one was FANTASTIC. Everything from the crispy platino, to the lettuce that was fresh and meat which was seasoned to perfection, the fresh tomatoes, cheese and mayo. Need I say more. The rice was DELISH. First time I ate here and I definitely will be making the trip every time  I want a steak Jibarito.

13.description: Great jibaritos. I look forward to trying more of the menu.

4.description: Stopped by today for the first time..... Love love love the food. The place itself is not bad but it was really cold that it was kinda difficult to enjoy the food.... The Arroz con gandules was delicious!!! We loved the jibaritos and the sandwiches but my faves were definitely the relleno de papa. DEFINITELY WILL BE GOING BACK SOON!!!!

24.description: Don't be confused by the "Kabob" sign and middle eastern decor. The food here is what you would expect at a Puerto Rican restaurant and it's all delicious. Portions are generous but some things (like the roast pork) aren't always available. Service is friendly but it helps if you speak a little Spanish.

6.description: Great food! Love the pechuga (chicken breast) sandwiches, arroz con gandules and pastelilos.I will definitely be back for more food in the future!

15.description: There seriously aren't enough stars I can give this place this is the first Puerto Rican place that even competes with my abuelas food and she is straight off the island so you know it's the bomb. All the other Puerto Rican places I've tried had bland rice or boring beans or dry meat with underseasoned and floppy plátanos but this place . This place is amazing the rice had actual amazing flavor and a beautiful color and the jibarito was bomb the meat was moist plátanos crispy and garlicky and it was just amazing

7.description: Love how cheap and good it is. Under $8 gets you full. La jibarita is the best. So instead of regular plantain, this is sweet plantain. Never had a la jibarita until this place but I've had jibaritos before.

8.description: We are from out of town and wanted to take my parents for an Anniversary dinner, so we stopped by on our way through Chicago. We are Puerto Rican and there are no Puerto Rican restaurants in our area so we thought we would give that a try. Unfortunately the food was subpar. The bistec empalizado was downright horrible, the steak in the middle of the thick batter was paper thin. When we said something they apologized and told us basically that the steak is not made there, basically they buy it frozen and fry it up! The rice was ok. My bacalaito was not cooked through and the middle was uncooked batter. All and all it was very poor Puerto Rican food, my mom cooks way better than this. The server was nice though! I would never go back!

3.description: A secret place, well hidden from an unexperienced eye, occupying a modest facility of what seems to have been a Middle Eastern restaurant, offers a hearty jibarito fix for all ya tired and hungry soles.Great delicious food, *definitely not for dieters.

14.description: OK... tried this place out today and the food was in fact very good.  The meat in the jibarito was tender and the sandwich as a whole  was very tasty. The habichuelas guizada on the white rice was the best I've had in a restaurant. That was the upside.  Now the downside.  The ambience in this place is all wrong!! Middle Eastern murals in a Puerto Rican restaurant just don't not work  for me. Come on! A couple cans of paint would really go a long way. Seriously!

3.description: This is a traditional Korean bath house.  20 bucks for tub dunking, steam room, sauna- stay all day and try not to faint. You can always opt for extra services for extra money- salt scrubs, shiatsu massage...ect.  I was a little nervous being nude but forgot about it quickly. The old women seemed to be cool with it so I joined in too.

1.description: first time there , a very clean place . it was a Sunday morning and it was pack. most of the guys that they were there were gay . i walked straight to the steam room it was a guy masturbating , later on in the sauna it was another guy doing the same thing ......

2.description: A more convenient alternative for Northsiders than the Division Street Russian Bath House, Paradise Sauna provides many of the same services, including a really hot sauna, really cold dunk, massages, etc.  My wife has been there many times to get massages and body scrubs and likes it, so I checked out the men's side for the first time this weekend.It's larger than Division Street also, and gets more crowded.  It also seems a bit cleaner and well-lit, while losing a lot of the sense of history that goes along with Division Street.One thing about it that I didn't like, though, was the weird vibe I was getting from some of the guys.  I'm not gay, and this is DEFINITELY not a gay bath house.  But some of the fellows were obviously checking out the other guys.  It made it kind of awkward.  There is absolutely NONE of that going on at the Old World, Eastern European Division Street Bath House.I'll probably be back because it's a 5 minute drive from my house, but Paradise Sauna could really use some of the Russian Mafia vibe that you get at Division.$20 for all-day admission to the sauna$100 for a 30 minute body scrub, 60 minute massage, and all-day sauna admission.

0.description: Old fashioned bath house akin to the Russian variety.    My Russian partner likes to visit here for his skin.  Steam room is very, repeat very, hot.  I went but could not take it -- would not recommend to folks with heart problems.   They also have massage, hot and cold spas, and a sauna.  Regulars are social with one another.  One of the regulars has been a Korean man who is 104!  One negative experience he had here was spotting a rat grinning at him from on top of a locker.  Probably from the restaurant in front.  He notificed the management and has never seen another.

12.description: This is your standard nail salon, maybe even a notch above. It's in a kind of crappy strip mall so the first time I went there I was with a couple of friends and I said guys, I don't know what to expect from here so don't hold it against me....I am happy to report we were pleasantly surprised. The decor is lovely, they have a flat screen tv, lots of magazines, and a good selection of nail colors to choose from. The staff is really nice and I have never had to wait more than 5 or so minutes, although I almost always go on a weekday.I am giving an extra star for massage chairs that are beyond anything I have ever experienced, none of this having to push your back into it to feel anything, these chairs are seriously spot-on.Quality of the mani/pedi is standard, and with the $18 special I would recommend them to anyone.

7.description: As you can tell from my multiple check-ins, this has now become my new nail spot.  $15 fills, friendly nail techs, clean and modern space, normally a short wait, and most importantly-perfect nails every time.  They do such a great job, they know exactly how I like my nails and I don't even have to tell them anymore.  So happy I found them!

3.description: Oh,  LJ Nails. How sad I am to leave this review and ultimately part ways.  However,  the time has come for me to do so.  I'll give some background: I've been going to LJ Nails on and off for years.  In the past year or so,  I've been going almost every other week,  with an occasional  week off. So,  what's that, 20+ visits this year alone?  Usually,  I'm satisfied.  The place isn't the nicest,  but it seems clean.  They're never the most professional or timely,  but I'm never in a hurry;  I go there to de-stress.  Their prices are super competitive,  and Lena does a great job,  so all the "not-so-great" items are usually offset by a great mani & pedi for a low price. I'm ok with that compromise. Today,  though,  was the second time in as many months that the door was locked when I got there.  They close at 8 on Tuesdays,  and I got there at 6:20. Additionally,  I called in advance,  telling them when I was coming,  and confirming they had time for me.  They let me stand outside for ten minutes,  looking at me occasionally,  and never opened the door.  It's amazing to me that they would not even take the time to unlock the door and tell me they changed their minds.  To see that someone went out of their way to patronize their salon and not have the courtesy to even open the door and explain that they're full just boggles my mind.  Needless to say,  I doubt I'll ever set for in there again.  I'll take my money and my loyalty somewhere that values it.

1.description: Horrible customer service. I called to make an appt and they told me it's walk in. When I got here no one greeted me. Than another customer came in and she went straight back for a pedi. I told the guy that I was waiting for a pedi he said that was his customer and she had an appt and that I had to wait 10 minutes.More than 10mins pass by and the guy is like another 5 minutes. Than they took back this other lady and he was like they have an appt and that I will be next. After 25 mins they took someone else so I walked up to him and asked him how much longer he said idk like an hour. After he told me I was next. So that was it I told him that it was horrible customer service and I was not going to waste my money there. And left.

2.description: After making an appointment one week in andvanced , my friend I had to wait an hour and still didn't not get any services. I have had many issues with his salon and last night was the last straw. Here are many salon in this city with the same prices. Avoid yourself a headache and wasting your time

9.description: I love it here. They are reasonably priced - ESP Mon - Wed when they offer $18 pedicures.  woot.  It's a little - well way - out of the way for me, but hey, if I have the time then it's worth the trip (only if there's no traffic).They clean my footsies oh so nicely and massage them 'til I melty.  Me likey. alot.  They have good color selection and the salon is typical - nothing fancy, but it's def clean.  The owners are super sweet and always accommodate late comers - which I always tell them not too (so hardworking already!) even tho I have been guilty of it myself....oopsie.So, yea, I'm def a regular and try to get my stuff done on Wed - decent enough time to still be fresh for da wkend.  And getting my eyebrows done at Mario's next door makes the trip more worth it.  Splendid.

18.description: The place LOOKS really nice. Can't complain about that.  Went here for mani/pedi the other day and came out with the sloppiest manicure I've ever had.  I believe the lady doing my nails was too distracted by her child running around the entire salon.  He was into everything and even managed to run over my purse while riding his tricycle around the salon.  Very unprofessional.  After she finished my nails she returned to the back room with the child and after getting the chance to actually look at my nails I was horrified.  Paint was literally everywhere...on my cuticles, on the side of my nail and even UNDER my nail (disregarding the fact that not even all of my nails ended up painted...there were areas on the sides that were somehow missed).  I had to ask the gentleman TWICE to come back and try and clean them up (which proved unsuccessful).  He seemed really annoyed that he had to put down his sandwich to get a paper towel soaked in remover and try and clean them up.  Isn't there some sort of brush for that?  I was really disappointed that I had spent the money at all because it looked worse then if I had painted them myself.  I will NEVER be back here...regret going at all.

10.description: eww ewww ewww. OK, maybe I'm spoiled but the guy who did my Mani pedi was awful. he did not make my feet soft, the massage was severely lacking. The chair sucked. when he got to my nails he cut my cuticles way to short, i bled. i believe he over charged me cause it was forty bucks!!! Needless to say I didn't leave a tip, and I wont be back. I'll stick to lee nails by six corners, soo much better...

13.description: So been coming here for a couple years before it was LJ nails just bc I think it's convenient.  I must say I was here this pass weekend for the usual mani and pedi and was quite dissapointed.  I should take the ladies name because I never like when she gives me a mani and pedi ESPECIALLY a french I would have to stop her there.  The lady who was good just had a baby so isn't there anymore and lee the guy who owns da place never does pedi's unless it's extremely busy and he doesn't have a choice lol. Over time there massage chairs seem to not work as good as before or just not work properly at all.  I'm a pretty loyal customer so always go back anyway but now that sara doesn't work next door at hair by marios I think I will have to find a new local nail spot. I use to knock out the eyebrows threading and nails in one stop =/Yes they're $18 pedicures sun-mon are nice but I don't usually go until friday or sat. anyway

16.description: Sunday through Wednesday: $18 pedicure. Not bad!The massage chairs are nice and the ladies are nice. There are a couple guys there, too. I prefer the older lady who looks about middle aged. The younger girl is ok.The first time I went there, she (older chick) was massaging my legs, and I was all relaxed. Then she started smacking the sides of my legs! LOL. I was startled, but then it was nice because it loosened my muscles. Just watch out for that. Haven't had a manicure there... but seems about average. I like this place because it's next to Hair by Mario, which is also a good, inexpensive place to get beautified.

17.description: strange i haven't written a review for l j yet.i frequent this salon a lot because it is right next to my apt. the people who work here are really friendly and only talk to you if you open to them first... which is how i like it. sometimes i just want to relax.normally about 2 to 4 people working at a time. it is vietnamese owned and is open long hours. i really like when the younger guy gives me pedicures and tina for manicures. nice array of colors. 3 of the 4 shelves are opi and essie colors and the last one is a mix of china glaze and some others. and just this christmas they got new pimping massage chairs :)

15.description: Sufficient job on the pedi, but not what I'd call thorough. Heels felt pretty rough & dry when I left. However, massage chair here is probably best I've ever sat in during a pedicure, and they do $18 spa pedi special Sun-Wed.I wouldn't go back and wouldn't recommend, unless all you want is a polish change.

0.description: I've been coming to this place for 5 years and I am a regular. They have decent prices and are the only techs I let touch my nails. If you're looking for a place for you to be worked on once you walk in, this place isn't for you (unless they're not busy) usually one tech is working on 2 different hands or they switch off when it gets busy. I've only had a pedi once from them (don't like people touching my feet) but they left it nice and smooth for prom night.

5.description: The only reason I came here is because the place i usually go to is closed on Mondays. I walked in and was told to pick a color, once i was done picking a color the girl was just texting on her phone for a few minutes and when she was done she told me to sit down. I go to sit and she asks me if i want no chip nail polish, I have acrylic nails so i thought she was just talking about the actual nail polish so i asked how much it was and she said $30, I said no thanks and after I said no I could see her attitude change. She also told me my nails were old and asked if i wanted to remove my nails and i said no and she was annoyed by my declining of her trying to upsell me. This lady did my nails so quick! Not in a good way either, she did a half ass job just to take the next customer who did come in for a no chip manicure. She also charged me $1 to cut my nails down when the other place i go to does it for free. I could just feel her vibes and she wasnt happy to have me there for some reason and since she was pissing me off and being rough and doing a  job I did not leave her a tip and this b*tch was mad! Ha! The salon looks old and dirty, the staff is rude and talk about you in their language and they have a crappy selection of polish colors plus you can tell the nail polish' are old and have been sitting there for a long time! I will NOT be coming back here! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!

11.description: I came here on a whim because traffic was bad on Thursday, and when I looked at my hands on the steering wheel, I realized I needed a manicure. I pulled in without checking a single review.  Boy, do I regret it. Maybe they are not used to men here, but they gave me a weird look and initially asked if it was for me. I said yes. They did things in an odd order that threw me off a bit. I told them they could be aggressive with my cuticles, and they barely touched them. Even the push back was minimal, and barely got past the centers of my nails. The filing was also minimal. The massage had a terribly greasy lotion, that took forever to wash off, and left a white residue. I came back from washing and was sitting down. She gave me this odd look and asked if I wanted clear coat. I said, no but I would like a buff.  She then asked if I wanted to pay. I said yes and she said $17 please. I said the sign says $12. She said the buff was an extra $5.  So, they would have taken the time to put on clear for free, but a quick buff is extra?  I've never had that before.  I said no thanks (since even the edges of my nails looked like crap still), paid the $12.  I gave her a $1 tip so she at least knew that I am aware that tipping is customary.

8.description: I had the WORST experience at this nail salon yesterday....let me preface by saying that I am a busy woman/mother and I had to skip my lunch at work to be able to get this service done before I had to pick up my daughter at daycare and for those who have kids can relate to how difficult it can be to find the time to be able to indulge in these type of things...so I rushed from work to come here and arrived at around 3 pm.. when I went in..there were four workers..3 female 1 male...and 4 ppl getting stuff done...then I walked in..uh-oh...4 workers. and with me..5 ppl..getting a service done..looks like we were one short..regardless, they proceeded to ask what I wanted done..(mani/pedi) so they usher me to the chairs and start the water pressure going.the notion of having me sat down, to me, impled thatthey would get to me fairly quickly...well there I am waiting and waiting..no.."we will get to you in X amount of minutes" no.."sorry for the wait" nothing..no type of apology..no acknowledgement of my presence by ANYONE  that there I am just sitting there..not even the bath salts they use are thrown in.... so I finally speak up if they can at least start that process of putting the salts into the water...a lady begrudgingly puts one little ball in..ok I can be patient..I know these places usually get busy etc...but when 20 minutes have passed and all that is happening is my feet are getting wrinkly...I do begin to get impatientI look around for any indication that  SOMEONE will be almost done...I see one is going to start doing acrylic nails...the other a manicure and the two people doing pedicures are barely getting their cuticles cut. and Im sure also getting a manicure done..all these processes take a MINIMUM of 30min to complete...So now I DO get agitated for their lack of regard for people's time and obviously very unconcerned for their client's satisfaction..not to mention they ignored me the whole time after they sat me down..I had to be out of there by 4:20o pick up my daughter. I do not have their sweet time to just lie around and waste 2 hrs of my time at a nail spa...I finally had to ask them how long it'd be and they turn to one another-speak in their language-then come back and say 20 minutes....it was already 3:45...I had to leave no later than 4:20...I understand they get busy but I would've preferred ten times more the honest truth of being told in the BEGINNING"You know...it'll be about a 30 min wait" then I can determine if I want to wait or not...why usher me to get my feet soaked for half and hour and just proceed to ignore me for such a long period of time if they are not going to have a person to work on me within a REASONABLE amount of time? I am disgusted at their purely UNPROFFESIONAL..and indifference for  their clients time and satisfaction..if anything they acted like it is  the client who owes them gratitude for getting a service done by them instead of them being appreciative of the client that is bringing business to them..well needless to say..I stormed out of there..feet soaking wet....and although this place was convenient because of its close proximity to my house and ample free parking.....their outright disinterest and   lack of professionalism will make me never to want to visit this establishment again....the city is inundated with nail shops anyway.so I will have plenty to choose from and do not need to invest my money to a business that outright has no care or interest to making the client feel valued

4.description: Update: The male nail tech was much more nicer!! Handle me why better and he carried a nice conversation with me. Place is doing a bit better as I come here.

14.description: The staff is very curteous and welcoming. The surroundings are very nice considering other nearby business. However they do a bad job on nails. I asked for a pink and white. I almost felt like it was the first time she was doing it. The pedi was marginal at best. They are best for a quick polish change or .....thats about it.

6.description: I recently went here with someone to get her nails done. We were not sure how late they would be open, so we looked them up on the internet. They have almost no web presence besides these reviews. When we were finally able to call, we were told that they would be open till 8:00 P.M. They would not accept customers after 7:30 P.M. It was a Monday night.We get there at 5:30 P.M. The neon sign in the window is blinking OPEN. The employees are working on each others' nails. When we try to go in, the door is locked. We get a dirty look from this younger employee who walks over, cracks the door open and says "We're not open." So, we both say, "Hey. We were told you would accept customers till 7:30 P.M. We're 2 hours before that."The employee curtly asked what we wanted. My friend said she wanted a full set. We were hoping this would let us get in since it would be worth it for the place, financially speaking. Nope. Even after that, the employee said no. My friend asked for the manager, but was told there is no manager. As we were walking away, my friend told the employee that she would call the better business bureau on the nail shop. The employee laughed at us and then turned off that neon sign.So, don't go here if you want your nails done by polite professionals. They don't have any. I hope they enjoy working on their own nails. Their not going to have much business if they're like this all the time.

28.description: It was a hectic day, and we were doing laundry over at the coin laundromat in the same plaza.  I decided to walk over, and get a bite to eat.  I got a grilled chicken sandwich and gyro burger combo meals, both were pretty darn good. Both meals come with fires and a can of  pop. What I really appreciated about this place was that they cooked my food to order, when I ordered it.  No stuff sitting around on a warmer!  With that being said, there will be a bit of a wait time for your food (which i don't mid because it's cooked fresh), unless you call in in ahead of time.I will be returning to try the other menu items!

1.description: The food was awesome sauce and everyone was super nice. And the gyros were amazing and the place is cool beans

9.description: Great food for a great price. I recommend the gym shoe or the gyro burger. Can't go wrong with either. always great for a quick bite! Highly recommended

29.description: i cant speak for all the food items, cuz ive only been eating the 1/2lb chop steak sandwich which i absolutely love!! i know they have new owners so maybe thats played a role in them ebcoming better, only down side is it takes a LONG time for the food, definitely not a "fast food" place....

23.description: This place is the most awesome place when I had been to kimball before but now I'm at Devon so no need to go their every week they have some good stuff to eat like burgers with some French fries. The most awesome thing about them is that they have such a neat and clean restroom :)

5.description: Just anothet awesome update about how aweslme this place is...Food as always is spectacular. And they are so so nice :)) My family comes here and they always offer my 15 month old son a small plate of fries or a lollipop free of charge... small things like this really make a place stand out :) Please please go here...we should support businesses like these! Great great job to the owners.

31.description: I agree with An P. This. is. drunk. food.With it being across from the train, it's EXCELLENT for a stumble home. I've only had their chicken philly which is really good. Quite comparable to the chicken phillies in Greektown at Mr. Gyro. The fries are seasoned with what might be seasoning salt [?] but taste really good with barbecue sauce. The employees there are really nice and everything is made to order so you have to wait a little bit. Give 'em a chance! It's nice to have something in a plaza that was completely empty :)

25.description: The gyros cheeseburger is amazing..the guy at the register has good customer service.

12.description: Tried the famous Jim Shoe sandwich and I absolutely loved it. Will surely be back to try out other things on their menu. This place had a feel of a typical neighborhood fastfood joint. Fairly well maintained and clean along with good food definitely earns them a 5 star.

21.description: I've had the chicken sandwich, the pizza (yum!), the chicken nuggets, and the gyros, and they are all good, greasy goodness.  Go for it!

16.description: Greasy. Coming home from the train I woke up from my slumber to espy Makki Fast Food and Grill outside my train window. What was it? Well the sign said fast food but in Albany Park you can never really tell what anything is from the outside. Sliding across ice and snow, I made my investigation.Makki Fast Food & Grill serves up super cheap eats from 8am-1am and is open 7 days a week. Located next to Roosevelt High School, I shudder to think what kind of zoo this place becomes once the high schoolers roll in. Fortunately for me, the high schoolers were long gone and the tables were all clean and the only thing on was TV tuned to the news.I looked at the menu and they served up high school prices! 14" pizza for $6.49 a cheeseburger combo for $4.49 and pop for a mere 51¢. I wonder what this place will become since it's open until one in the morning. They were still cleaning the place up and setting up a backroom so the place is very brand new. I ordered my food and waited over ten minutes, so this place will never win any awards for speedy service, but such is the way things are done in Albany Park. Patience is a virtue and I virtuously accepted my food and paid with card and was on my way. On the way back sliding through the ice fields the food maintained integrity, texture and temperature despite the below-freezing temperatures.My burger was from some deep frozen meat so I can't say it had much flavor. The fries were much better and were very delicious and suitable for drunk food. I will investigate further this Makki Fast Food and Grill as I strive to add another mayorship and try their Chicken Masala. Chicken Chinese does not sound very good but then again the place down the street serves up Bulgogi Taco.

17.description: Tried it on a whim while doing laundry in the same plaza. Ordered the gyro and WOW! The best gyro sauce and very meaty. Very nice and polite people working over there. The fries are also deliciously crispy.

10.description: This place is amazing great management and great food, I would highly recommend this place.

11.description: Horrible food, and customer service. I've just recently started reviewing on yelp and this one is long overdue. Last time I went there must have been over a month ago probably longer and the sting is still there. Guy at the front desk, think his name is sadik, has an anger problem. They've messed up my order every time I went there, and sadik has argued with me when I told him that's not what I ordered. To the point where the owner had to tell him to go in the back. The food is so so, except they use patties with filler in it, you might feel some pieces of tendon or maybe plastic in the patties. DO NOT go here, only reason they are in business is because the kids from the highschool next door probably come in to eat since its cheap. Horrible horrible horrible.....HORRIBLE

26.description: Stopped by Makki Grill on a night that I didn't feel like cooking and ordered my meal to go.  Had a pleasant time chatting with the very friendly guy behind the counter while my food was prepared.  Walked out with a gyro, fries and a can of pop for a decent price.  The food was very tasty and in an absolutely huge portion.  Would definitely do the same again on another lazy night.

27.description: I really like this place.  They have some super good prices.  I get the felafel sandwich lunch special everytime I go there.  I like the fact I can get a nice descent meal for under $5!  Today I had the veggie Biryani and a pop.  It was around $6.50 I think.  They have good hours and friendly person to serve you.  Go there and eat well.

0.description: Great cheap tasty food- only complaint is that they can be a little slow. I love the butter chicken and the chicken biryani- but have yet to try the fusion food options myself. My roommate thinks they're great too. Lovely friendly and sincere owners.

20.description: We placed an order for delivery. It took over 1 hour for the food to arrive, we paid much more than we should have, the order was messed up and we received very rude customer service. Def not going to this place again.We ordered 2 philly sandwiches, we asked for everything on the side. The meat for 2 sandwiches was packed in one piece of wax paper, the cheese was completely stuck to the wax paper. The main problem was that we had 3 meals ordered, we ordered fries with each one. They did not give us fries with our order. We called them back to tell them the situation. They refused to give us a refund or drop off any fries. They claimed the fries "were free with each order" and "it was too cold and expensive to send fries again". Mind you this happened in May and we live maybe 10 minutes from them. I told them to their face my family and I will not be returning and giving them business again after the way they treated us. They still refused to do anything for us. Clearly they do not care about their customers and they do not care if their business fails. They only care about the few dollars they stole from us.

19.description: Great food , good prices , if you are into spicy food , check the chicken butter masala .... yummy

33.description: Greasy. Coming home from the train I woke up from my slumber to espy Makki Fast Food and Grill outside my train window. What was it? Well the sign said fast food but in Albany Park you can never really tell what anything is from the outside. Sliding across ice and snow, I made my investigation.Makki Fast Food & Grill serves up super cheap eats from 8am-1am and is open 7 days a week. Located next to Roosevelt High School, I shudder to think what kind of zoo this place becomes once the high schoolers roll in. Fortunately for me, the high schoolers were long gone and the tables were all clean and the only thing on was TV tuned to the news.I looked at the menu and they served up high school prices! 14" pizza for $6.49 a cheeseburger combo for $4.49 and pop for a mere 51¢. I wonder what this place will become since it's open until one in the morning. They were still cleaning the place up and setting up a backroom so the place is very brand new. I ordered my food and waited over ten minutes, so this place will never win any awards for speedy service, but such is the way things are done in Albany Park. Patience is a virtue and I virtuously accepted my food and paid with card and was on my way. On the way back sliding through the ice fields the food maintained integrity, texture and temperature despite the below-freezing temperatures.My burger was from some deep frozen meat so I can't say it had much flavor. The fries were much better and were very delicious and suitable for drunk food. I will investigate further this Makki Fast Food and Grill as I strive to add another mayorship and try their Chicken Masala. Chicken Chinese does not sound very good but then again the place down the street serves up Bulgogi Taco.

2.description: I just moved to the area and I'm  cursed with not having laundry in my unit/building. Luckily the nearest laundromat is literally 2 minutes away (yes I timed it). So I drop my laundry off and my stomach is telling me that it needs to get fed. I didn't feel like driving anywhere so I started walking and spotted this place.First of it smelled delicious in there. They serve Indian food which is my favorite dish and as I was scanning the menu I saw that they also serve Philly cheesesteaks. I was really indecisive because it's a hit or a miss when it comes to Philly cheesesteaks. Since I live life in the fast lane I ordered it!  I'm a big whiney baby and I complain about every thing but this philly was absolutely amazing. I mean so good I had it for dinner for a week straight. It was freshly prepared and the owner is absolutely great. You can absolutely taste that he cares about his food and customers. I have also tried his Chicken Beriyani and its yum yum yummy!You can't go wrong with this place, food is amazing, prices are unbeatable and the customer service is great!

32.description: This place just opened up a block away, so my husband and I decided to try it out. These guys were very NICE and the PRICES ARE GREAT! The menu is very eclectic as well (middle eastern, Pakistani/Indian, burgers, shrimp).We ordered a beef pizza and the service was kind of slow and there were 4 guys in the restaurant but only 1 cooking? Oh well, they are new and probably working out the kinks. I was so hungry when I got home with the pizza and we found that it was completely uncooked, except for the toppings. The dough was only cooked on the crust.  We couldn't even peel the pizza off to put it on a pan to bake it more. So, we called the place and they were very apologetic and offered to make another one. The second one was a little more cooked and my husband thought it looked okay at the restaurant, but the center was completely uncooked. It's like they are using dough that is still frozen?? At least this time we could get it off of the cardboard and we ended up baking it another 15 minutes. There are lots of toppings which is nice, but there is hardly any sauce or flavor, I'm sad to say.  Maybe we'll give them some time to work things out and try again. :/

18.description: Great Food! gyro sandwich to die for!

13.description: Been here a few times and the food in never consistent. The owners are rude, cheap on the ingredients. The last 4 times i went they didn't have what i wanted. Sometimes they don't have chicken and the other times they don't have tortillas for the burrito. Its best to call them and find out if they have what you wanna eat.

4.description: There food is great have to try the Makki burger.. Definitely a great burger that's a load and will definitely fill you up

24.description: Yummy. This fast food is made to order and absolutely delicious.  I have been going here for the last 8 months or so and am happy each time I try something new.  Recently, I got the pizza and it is AMAZING.  The crust is crispy and thin (made from scratch) and the toppings are flavorful and kinda spicy.  And to make this place even better, the pizza costs about the same as getting a frozen pizza at the grocery!  The new owner is really friendly and welcoming and they cook everything when you order.The philly cheese steak sandwich is really good, just the way I like it with small chopped pieces of meat instead of long gyro like slices.  It comes with fries and a drink and again, the prices are amazing.

6.description: Great chicken and rice combos, the spicier the better. The service is great, these are all around great Muslim brothers trying to serve great food cheap.

22.description: The Gym Shoe sandwich was delicious!   Very friendly service and a very clean place...

15.description: The chicken nuggets are good. I really like the spicy gyro pizza. Just tell the waiter no bell peppers it changes the taste. The pizza crust reminds me of D'agostino's pizza.....

7.description: I have been going to makki grill for a long time now, i love their food and my taste buds are always satisfied. Tonite, they were closing but they still took our order, and again the food was just awesome!

8.description: The worst!  Not just once but THREE times, they have been out of tortillas!  And one other time, they were out of CHICKEN!! Seriously?!! It wasn't even busy, my friends and I were pretty much the only ones there. Also, the partially bald desi guy that works there shows attitude for some reason The only thing I used to go there for was their chicken Philly burrito which I actually love if they don't go cheap on the chicken! Nothing else is worth mentioning except the bad fries which a couple times were horrible and I think it as because they probably didn't change the oil in the fryer for like a week (nasty, all the gunk that builds up)Anyway because of their repeated let downs, my friends and I don't plan to go back there.

30.description: Excellent food, its zabiah and better then the food they serve on Devon. Quality and fresh and the servers are real nice. The philly cheese steak is amazing and cant be beat in chicago land. Great prices and food that hits the spot.

3.description: Back when I lived in the area I would frequent this place often. Stuff my face with samosas. Took my best friend here today turns out he's a regular here too ! Difficult because he can only eat halal meet and I'm not very picky so five stars for this place definitely ! Excellent customer service and delicious food and a public parking lot ! Must visit.  If you have a tasteful palate.

14.description: Yummy. This fast food is made to order and absolutely delicious.  I have been going here for the last 8 months or so and am happy each time I try something new.  Recently, I got the pizza and it is AMAZING.  The crust is crispy and thin (made from scratch) and the toppings are flavorful and kinda spicy.  And to make this place even better, the pizza costs about the same as getting a frozen pizza at the grocery!  The new owner is really friendly and welcoming and they cook everything when you order.The philly cheese steak sandwich is really good, just the way I like it with small chopped pieces of meat instead of long gyro like slices.  It comes with fries and a drink and again, the prices are amazing.

1.description: liking this one more and more!  They have really stepped up their game and I enjoy shopping here.  the music is good, the store is organized and the staff is friendlier than at other locations.  Their prices have raised a tiny bit on the nicer brands but you can still find unique items at a good price.

9.description: I know it's a resale shop but jesus... It is SO nasty and SO horrible in there.  My friends and I love hitting these types of stores, but we were shocked when we saw this place.  The worst thing I've ever seen... shit stained underpants on a hanger for sale.  Really?  We actually bought 2 pairs of underpants for a joke gift to a couple that was getting married.  Hers were pink and the size of a car cover.  His was a purple paisley man thong.  That was fun!

23.description: Love all the village thrifts I have been to and this one is no exception. Lots of stuff to choose from and more organised than the Roscoe location. Having at least two hours is essential when thrifting and if you don't want to pick through stuff then go to a walmart.

25.description: Part of the trio of horrible Village Discount Outlets (the others being the Roscoe Village and Clark St. locations) this place is picked over, the housewares that are worth getting have all been marked up because they are "collectable" (yeah right!), and their furniture sucks.  I love the Village Discount chain but try to avoid this one as much as possible.

12.description: Not the cleanest, but the prices can't be beat and it is the closest to home.  Sort of like reaching into a magicians magic hat I always seem to be able to pull just what I needed out of it.Recently as the Rhubarb in our back garden was nearing the end of its "best" I went into a pie baking frenzy.  With only the three pie plates I had in the house I rushed out and "hit the thrift" to see if they had any glass pie plates that I could use.  Abracadabara ~ They did!  I walked out of the Village with 5 "new"/slightly used glass pie plates and all for a total of $3.40!  It would have cost me more than that for just one if I had run to Target and I would have had to drive farther than the 1/2 mile up Elston.Yes the whole concept of buying someone else's used stuff is a bit tacky and it makes my mother-in-law cringe (another benefit!) but I find the coolest things.  For just .50 to .90 I regularly buy vases so that when I take a friend cut flowers from my garden I can say  "just keep the vase, I have others".  I love making Pies to give to friends, relatives or neighbors and I never worry about if they will remember to return the pie plate!  I have found cute little skirts that I wear once to a bar-b-que and if they get spilt on, no biggie, because they only cost $2 to begin with.  I find "autocross clothes", nice comfortable outfits that I can get oil or brake dust on with no worries.  I have found art work and old board games to furnish our weekend place in Indiana.  I even found a set of fancy dishes that I used to serve a special romantic meal for just me and hubby.I can't say I have never bought a gift there but as long as it looked to be perfect and made the recipient happy was there any harm?I grew up in a family that was fighting to stay above the poverty line as my father had heart problems and was often hospitalized and out of work.  I learned from a favorite Aunt when I was in College that I could have fancy clothes like all the other girls if I just knew where to shop.  When she first brought up thrift stores I turned up my nose.  My friends would die if they knew I was wearing cast offs, USED clothing. She asked me "have you ever borrowed clothes from a friend?"  Well Of course I had.  I had probably borrowed something from nearly every girl on my floor at some point that first term.  "How is this any different?" I could only respond with a blank look.  "Can you tell the difference after a few washings if it was bought new or used?  Everything that is ever bought new will eventually end up in a thrift store at some point in its life.  You just need to find it before it is totally used up!"  At a thrift store you find everything from the bottom rung like Walmart to the highest in high fashion like Chanel and Escada.  I am no longer that wanting poor kid with a desire to be like my friends.    I no longer care what other people think and I enjoy the hunt immensely.  Village Thrift is the closest thrift store to my house and I am there at least once a month.  It is good pickings and the people there are friendly.  I never know what treasure I am going to find but I do know that if God wants me to have it I will find it in a thrift shop!

21.description: You know those people that hoard things? Newspapers piled up to the ceiling, random boxes of crap shoved in every corner, back issues of Better Homes & Gardens lining the floor, and piles of clothes requiring a sherpa to navigate? Well, I think they take notes on how to be "good hoarders" at this Village Discount. The racks are shoved so full that things are poking out. Generally that doesn't bother me, but when the aisle is barely one person wide, this can pose a serious personal space dilemma. To touch the mothbally clothes, or to encroach upon the space of another Village Discount shopper? I generally opt to just leave the aisle, but it would help if they could organize a bit better....I found one prom dress and it was hanging from the ceiling "on display." I figured it would likely take me the rest of the evening to get someone to get it for me, plus it was $28. Seriously...I don't spend $28 at thrift stores on anything but vintage posters of Chicago, and even then I get a little antsy out of principle. I mean, these funds ain't goin' to charity...are they? If not, then no...I cannot fork over $28 for a 3 year old prom dress someone already got talked out of...nope. So, in conclusion...it's messy, musty and a bit chaotic, just like most of the other locations (some are better than others, however. See: Andersonville). The housewares/furniture is total crap, but if you dig I am sure there are good finds to be had in clothing...

16.description: MMMThe wonderful odor immediately greeted me upon entering this Irving Park establishment. I browsed through just about every section, finding almost nothing save a couple of ties. The best part was when an overly large, thoroughly creepy man behind us started sharpening a large knife he was about to purchase about 2 inches from my back...nevertheless I can't see myself coming back here - especially after a wonderful near-death experience. 2 stars for not being worthless like the location in Roscoe Village

17.description: I'm sure there are some finds here but I don't have the patience.  I'll be the first to admit I'm a lousy thrifter.The biggest parking lot I've ever seen at second hand store though!

10.description: My first Village Discount experience, and I am thinking there will be plenty more!! Go, prepare to spend a few hours there, get a cart, and dig, dig, dig!! 1 recycling bin blue pencil skirt 1 bright red pencil skirt 4 polyester blend fantastic patterned shirts (perfect with a black pencil skirt) 1 fabulous patterned neckerchief 2 pairs of earrings (best jewlery selection ever!)1 sweatshirt and 1 cute band t-shirt for summer sports league Total $6.12 (50% off that day, just because?)Prepare to be overwhelmed, dig through masses of clothing, chat with the crazy cart lady and don't forget to check out the bags and jewlery!

5.description: take a xanax before you go and plan on being patient,it can get pretty frustrating,but where else can you find like new levis for $2-3 that are $30-35 new.it's not often but I occasionally have made a fantastic find here....once got a railroad steamer type trunk for 8 bux and i once got a vintage  1973 schwinn 10 speed for 8 bux that I later sold for $100.i myself don't get bothered by the smell,but it does smell a lot like an industrial laundry in there,it's pretty weird.

11.description: I LOVE thrift stores but this one is seriously a dump.  The place is a mess, it smells, and the workers are rude.  They are also so smart that they right on the few good things they DO have in store with permanent marker.  Joy.

22.description: I like it.As someone said above me the ladies that work there are kinda mean and pushy and they dont understand you.They could also use a shower it seems.I mainly go there for clothes to wear to my  job.You could also find decent dress and casual clothes.

0.description: 2.5 stars so far?  Come on, guys.  As far as the merchandize goes, they deserve more than that.  Please give them some TLC!  I didn't smell anything disguising other than the typical thrift-store aroma tonight, so it has to be at least three (3) stars in my book.  Well, when it comes to thrift shopping, you better know the current market prices on merchandize.  My thrift-shopping expertise is on women's ready-to-wear.  Before I commence the thrift-shopping 101, if you're a novice, you should check out stores like Kohl's, Nordstrom Rack, Forever 21, Express, Ann Taylor, and even Chico's so you get a fundamental understanding of "price points." On the other hand, thrift stores may appear to have some "designer stuff," but do you really want to spend $45 on a Jessica Simpson bag when you can get one brand new, and perhaps in the current season, for the same price or less at a department store when it goes on sale?  In this case, you may want to purchase one at a department store, obviously.  The same principle applies.  Would you want to a "Candie's" brand coat for $40 at a thrift store when you can get one at Kohl's (where the brand can be found) for even less?  Thrift-shopping pupils: I think you've gotten the picture.  Hubby purchased a nice-condition PS 1 for $16 and a couple of vinyl records for $3.  Tonight's selections on clothing and other merchandize were pretty decent.  Thus, give this store a chance and pay a visit.  They do have a private parking lot for your shopping convenience.

20.description: 2 star enogh for this placeThe bad ever smill you well smill it in a closed place.Not helpfull with any one.Prices cheapSome good stuffSome items are the same prices as new one.

19.description: 2 star enogh for this placeThe bad ever smill you well smill it in a closed place.Not helpfull with any one.Prices cheapSome good stuffSome items are the same prices as new one.

2.description: I like this one.  Clean.  Again, hit or miss.Nice parking.  3 colors half off.  Colors change on Thursday.  Reasonably priced.Oh c'mon!  All the years I have gone,  it has not smelled.  Well okay it has.  When you are shopping near a smoker.  WHEW!

18.description: I have been going here on and off for years.  Every time it seems to get worse.  How could there be so much stuff on the floor?  Don't even try to use a cart because it just gets stuck in the piles of clothing.  The last three times I have been followed through the store by men who have apparently thought the Village Discount is a pick up place.  One of the times I was groped by someone and decided to leave before he would need to call an ambulance.  I have scored some good clothes for my kids and some good shoes for myself.  At this point I don't think it is worth going though.

13.description: Cleaner and less cluttered with detritus than the location on Roscoe, with pants facing outward, the selection, like most thrift shops, is hit or miss.  I think what helped with this location was that the non-clothing stuff was limited to small area in the corner, which meant less floor pollution.  They charge a little more than the Roscoe St. location, but you are definitely getting a higher quality of apparel to choose from.

4.description: I go to thrift stores several times a week, including this store, since I resell on eBay and also am looking for art materials. I think I might stop going to this one altogether because of the poor customer service. There is an older Indian lady, cashier there, who one day decided she doesn't want to ring me up...This has been 5 times in a row. I did nothing to her and was never rude. She closes down her register every time when I get to place in line, then laughs and tries to get the attention of the other lady cashier, and I can't tell the manager since he has a personality like Lurch from the Adams family. It sucks that the customer service is like this since I have made some good finds on occasion.

24.description: I am sorry but I really have to disagreee with the previous reviewer.  I previously would never have been caught dead in a place like this except that my partner started going on the advice of a friend.  This is probably not the best place to look for used furniture but the clothing selection is terrific.  On my visit today, I picked up, among other things, a Claiborne silk shirt for $3, a camel hair sport jacket for $2.50 and a good quality wool tweed sportcoat for $5.   A woman friend with two children also did very well.    I may try some of the other ones but I think this place rocks.  Staff is pushy (expecially when trying to get through the narrow aisles) but not unfriendly.

6.description: A thrift store is clean in my books if I don't see poop. Thankfully I've not so I don't know what the hell all the low ratings are about this place. It's not Neiman Marcus, it's a thrift store.Now I've heard enough poo stories in other thrift stores to feel that as long as I don't see it that's your first star...well the other two, they come from selection.Clothes and shoes/purses are a hot mess. If you're willing to dig you will find things.Linens look like a bomb went off, but again if you dig you will find fabrics.I've had 5/5 with behind the counter finds, I mean good way under priced collectible glassware to random figurines. I have a problem with owls, don't judge.Lastly, it is probably the messiest of any of the Village stores, but I don't think it's all that either- but I actually like digging.Stay away if you want something more organized, I'd recommend Unique to you they even do by size.

15.description: A totally hit-or-miss thrift store with a sparse furniture section (read: one office chair), bric-a-brackish housewares and more clothing than anything else.  I found a signed copy of Devil in the White City here once 4 years ago (I sold it on eBay for $40), but ever since then I haven't found much to glow about.  You're better off hitting up the Unique on the same stretch of Elston, although that branch has been going south for a while now, too.

7.description: Like many thrift shops - a hit or miss place. That being said, this is my favorite. I always find something interesting to buy - I have found perfect lamps and stain-glass ceiling fixtures, semi-vintage glasswear and dishes, clothing of all qualities, perfect bedspreads and curtains, and books of all types. Most stuff is clean, or is clean-able. And very, very cheap. Today, I spent $15.00 - 3 perfect tops, 3 books, a wooden bowl, two sets of working retro indoor-outdoor party lights, a small decorative box, and an open bag of 8 size-A unused vacuum cleaner bags. Nothing individually cost more than $2.90.Yes, it is cluttered and the aisles are too narrow, and sometimes I am annoyed by the other folks there (unruly children, body odor, etc,) but that is thrift shop life. If you want better sorting and wider aisles, go to Unique, though you will pay more. Weekends tend to be the messy-est. I like to go on Mondays or Tuesdays - less people shopping, less stuff dropped on the floor, and the staff a bit more mellow. Avoid holidays - they have special pricing, but the crowds are killers!

8.description: You know those people that hoard things? Newspapers piled up to the ceiling, random boxes of crap shoved in every corner, back issues of Better Homes & Gardens lining the floor, and piles of clothes requiring a sherpa to navigate? Well, I think they take notes on how to be "good hoarders" at this Village Discount. The racks are shoved so full that things are poking out. Generally that doesn't bother me, but when the aisle is barely one person wide, this can pose a serious personal space dilemma. To touch the mothbally clothes, or to encroach upon the space of another Village Discount shopper? I generally opt to just leave the aisle, but it would help if they could organize a bit better....I found one prom dress and it was hanging from the ceiling "on display." I figured it would likely take me the rest of the evening to get someone to get it for me, plus it was $28. Seriously...I don't spend $28 at thrift stores on anything but vintage posters of Chicago, and even then I get a little antsy out of principle. I mean, these funds ain't goin' to charity...are they? If not, then no...I cannot fork over $28 for a 3 year old prom dress someone already got talked out of...nope. So, in conclusion...it's messy, musty and a bit chaotic, just like most of the other locations (some are better than others, however. See: Andersonville). The housewares/furniture is total crap, but if you dig I am sure there are good finds to be had in clothing...

3.description: I like to call this place, DENIM HEAVEN... I come here for specific costumes. This week, I had to head over to VD (haha) for a Canadian Tuxedo for an upcoming party... If you don't know what a Canadian Tuxedo is, I recommend you google it. But seriously, this place is a mess so you have to be patient. You can find some really random things here (again, I come here for costume stuff and crappy white elephant gifts) and I've never been disappointed. p.s. as I recommend with ANY thrift store, have hand sanitizer ready when you leave

14.description: I'm a digger, a browser a siftera grabber, a hauler, a stitchera shopper, a shouterdon't put it past me to accost youif i find you ogling my cartbut no other village discountgive me the heebie jeebies like this placealthough if you have a quarteryou probably can find at least something to buy here!

3.description: My Boyfriends niece is autistic. She has trouble socializing. Thing is, she LOVES Hello Kitty and becomes excited, even outgoing at the sight of the familiar characters- she can identify them all and talk to you about them at length about their names and identifying features. So I pick up a little something here for her, from time to time. Though the space is small, the counter is friendly and the Hello Kitty stock substantial. The prices are super unbeatably cheap and it makes her day.To date, her favorite was a Hello Kitty sewing kit (Make your own Hello Kitty doll!) and that made her really proud, showing the doll she made to everyone in an enthusiastic, sweet fashion. So proud of her... and this cute shop for making a little girl so happy!

1.description: Very expensive most of the sanrio products look knock off and cheap not much to choose from. When I say everything literally everything is over priced and old. None of the sanrio stuff are worth it looks very poorly made. Honestly better in China town where you even have more to choose from and is cheaper plus better quality.

2.description: I needed staples for two staplers that don't use standard size staples and didn't want to drive all the way to Staples. I discovered this place on Yelp and thought, what the heck, might as well try them first since they are in the neighborhood. Not much to look at from outside in fact I'd driven past it a hundred times but the service  was top notch.The nice lady behind the counter took a look at my staplers and immediately knew which staples would work and the price was reasonable! She said they have been there for 30 years and I could tell she knew her stuff. From now on I'm checking here first for all my office supply needs.Oh yeah, and if you have a Hello Kitty fetish this is the place for you in a BIG way!

5.description: Mom and pop shop to the nth degreeDo you wish you had a Staples that was located right by the train station so you could get a few office supplies? Albany Office Supply has been around for the better part of 20 years stocked to the brim just in time for the back to school season.When I was a kid, I would come in here to get all manner of pens, paper, envelopes, and stamps to write letters in the most fanciful manner. I've always been impressed by how much stuff they can fit into their store considering half of the shop is dedicated to printer ink and cartridges for fax machine toner, etc.Albany Office Supply falls short of Staples / Office Max / Office Depot as you won't find any fancy office furniture or laptops to buy. On my last visit to Albany Office Supply, I was able to get name tag stickers, a clipboard, 2 Sharpees, and a box of pens for under $15. Support your local businesses!

6.description: Small neighborhood office supply shop with a basic selection of paper, envelopes, printer cartridges, etc.  But what makes it worth the trip is the wide selection of Hello Kitty (and other Sanrio) items from bento boxes to school supplies.  They also have a good selection of backpacks and briefcases and are a FedEx drop off point.

7.description: Hello Kitty fans unite!  Actually, I'm too old for Hello Kitty, but this place was my go-to spot for all things kitty 20 years ago.  And they're still here!  It's mostly an office supply store, with paper, pens, notebooks, and other supplies you need for home and school.  But most kids gravitate towards the front of the store, where there's a variety of Hello Kitty and Sanrio products.  They have coin banks, water bottles, stuffed animals, hair clips, stationary, wallets, pencils, key rings, pencil cases, and more.  There used to be another store nearby that just sold Sanrio products, but they're gone.  Fortunately you can still find some of your old favorites in this store.  It's a small store, Korean owned and run.  Good to see them still around.

0.description: Looks like Albany Office Supply may be closing.This store was THE place to score Sanrio swag when I was a kid in the early 90s and the best place for fancy pens and pencils for sketching. It was like a wonderland of girly awesomeness. Now, the store is in disarray, the shelves cluttered with a weird collection of odds and ends like military lamination pockets mixed in with typewriter tape. Single items lay neglected side by side. Everything seems to have a fine layer of dust. The Sanrio section is sparse, and everything is 30% off.Go while you still can.It's a sad fact that many of the businesses in Albany park are in decline.

4.description: Albany office supply just took down Staples on Lawrence and Pulaski!  Albany Office Supply - 30 years in the business and still kicking

1.description: This is an old school barber shop. While the facilities are dated, the barber has maintained an old-school quality and professionalism. He mainly uses scissors to cut hair, unlike most of modern barbers/stylist that rely on clippers. His skills are great, and his price of $13 for a haircut is a steal. This place is a hidden gem.

2.description: very good traditional haircut/styling!  No standard shampoo, no barber small talk, no mustache trim, no scalp massage.  But for $11 - good cut!

0.description: Warning... If you're not a Korean speaker then this barbershop isn't for you.  I've been going here the better part of 2 years now and I can probably count on two hands how many words i've said to him.  He's not much of a conversationalist but despite that fact, he does a great job.  The prices are really cheap and it includes a shampooing.  I've shaved my head for the summer months but as soon as I grow it back i'm headed over to his barbershop.

1.description: His number has changed to (773) 283-4377
