0.description: This is my neighborhood barber shop. I've been coming here since 1995. Bill is always pleasant. He gives great cuts and shaves as well as using the old school straight razor with the cream on your neck. All that for $7? What a bargain! An old school barbershop with an old school feel. Bottom line, if you're a guy that lives in the area you owe yourself a great cut. Let Bill do it!

12.description: The spring that helps lower the door to our dishwasher broke so it needed to be replaced. I called on a Monday and was given a 2 hour window that he would arrive that Wednesday. The 2 gentlemen were on time, gave us an estimate and worked very quickly and efficiently. I would use them again if we needed appliance repairs.

7.description: I can't say enough good things about AA Best Appliance or Ivan--but prompt, courteous and thorough is where I will start.I was in a situation where I had already been through another service company who misdiagnosed the problem and the part for my dishwasher.  $200 later I still had a broken machine.  Ivan arrived on time, did a very thorough inspection and was able to remove the debris from the pump and save me the cost of ordering a new part.  Best part for me (beyond no longer having to wash my dishes by hand)? No need to shop around for appliance repair next time something goes wrong :)

3.description: We've used AA Best Appliance for a washer & dryer repair at our rental unit. Ivan is great! He provides honest, professional service with quality repairs.At the beginning of November the motor went out on the dryer so we had to purchase a new motor. A couple weeks later one of the tenants contacted me saying that the dryer was taking 2 cycles to dry and was rattling. Ivan was able to come out the following day to assess the situation. He determined that the rattling was from the new motor having to settle and that the dryer wasn't drying because there was too much lint build up in the duct. Not only does he tell you what's going on but he shows you why something is or is not working. I feel very confident in the quality of service I received. He kindly cleaned out the lint for me and checked the motor. The rattling has stopped and the clothes are drying.

1.description: I have been using AA Best since approx 2008, when I had a washer/dryer break on me. They are upfront on price, get the job done quickly, and get it done right. They have repaired 2 washers for me, a fridge, and a couple other appliances. If they can't or don't do that service, they are honest about it too. They won't waste your time.

2.description: Did they fix my problem - Yes. I will only be honest with the work done though. My washer was leaking water into the drum. I needed a new water valve and I told them that on the phone. They said there's a $69 a service charge -- and I assumed that would be part of the repair costs, and that they use that to deter people from just getting free estimates. Well they had the water valve with them, and this is a $30 part, but he said it would cost me $170 to repair. I then asked, and that's including the $69 charge? He said, "no the $69 charge is in addition to that, but I'll lower the repair cost to $140." I then had to help him take the washer off the dryer. He replaced the part, but then when he was going to test it, he forgot to connect the water valve to the internal tubes, and he asked me to turn on the water. I said, "don't you need to connect those tubes?" He said, "oh yeah, right, that would have been bad."It was fixed in less than 30 minutes, and I was charged in total $140 + $69 = $209. If I subtract $30 for the part, that's $358 an hour!After the work is done --two things have happened. 1) Our housekeeper left a note "is the dryer not working? I had it on for four hours and clothes are still not dry." He forgot to turn on the gas valve when we reconnected the dryer. 2) Today, while running the dryer, the room is stifling hot and humid. The metallic dryer vent fell off. I just doubt that he put it on securely as he was trying to get done as quick as possible. So those are the facts. The job was done. I paid $358 an hour for the work done. There were some "brain fart" moments -- we've all had them, but when it's a professional you're paying, and that's what they do, you do want it to be done right without the "oops" moments.

9.description: We just moved into a new place when our washing machine began smoking (literally) halfway through a cycle. A day later the dishwasher door fell off one of its hinges and would no longer close.I was referred to Ivan from our home inspector. He came out the next day, was on time, and not only fixed both issues for a totally reasonable (read: below what we assumed we would have to pay) price.  He also pointed out how to maintain both machines and some best practices for preserving their life.Next time something smokes or falls off, Ivan's our man.

18.description: I have been using this service for 8 years and have always been very pleased. Ivan is honest and will tell you if your appliance is worth repairing. Recently, my dishwasher wasn't draining and I was scheduled to host a party in my home. I left a message and Ivan was able to squeeze me in and fixed the dishwasher. Yay! The service fees are very reasonable as well.

10.description: The phone number no longer works

13.description: Great.  Really really great.  Ivan was right on time for the initial service call, ordered the part we needed, and came back 2 days later to fix the machine.  Very polite, quick, and what I assume was a reasonable cost (service fee and then the cost of the part).  If any of our appliances break again, we'll definitely call Ivan.  He even liked my cat.

16.description: My GE dishwasher was not draining properly and was running endlessly.  I called AA Best on a weekend, and even though no one answered, AA Best followed up immediately the following Monday to see if I still needed assistance.  I had an appointment within a few days and was given a 2 hour window.  Ivan called before arriving and came close to the beginning of the window.  He was prompt, courteous, friendly and fixed my problem.  He even gave me tips on some issues I was having with my furnace, free of charge.  I thought the price was reasonable.  I would definitely call them again.

17.description: Something's fishy.  I had an appointment that was to be confirmed by the lady answering the phone the day before or before they showed up to my house.  No call came.  In the meantime I had errands so I missed the serviceman.  Not sure who Ivan is on these other posts - but this man that called was a heavy latino accent and sounded threatening on the phone.  he said. 'Why didn't you call DUDE - you're wasting our TIME and out GAS. !!!"  And then waited on the phone.  I've been worried ever since.  The lady on the phone was nice though.

15.description: I called Monday to see if anyone could repair my washer and by Tuesday afternoon the wonderful service guy was there . He even gave me tips on how to use the washer more efficently.  He had a great attatude , humorous and polite. I would recommend this company to anyone. The price was very affordable as well.

0.description: These guys are the best. I've been using AA Best for several years, and they've a) saved me a lot of money and b) always come out immediately, which, when you have a baby and a broken washing machine, is really really important. They are friendly and knowledgable, and if they think that a service or repair isn't worth the money they'll tell you honestly. They've extended the shelf life on my washer by a solid two years and just recently resurrected my dishwasher. Can't go wrong with these guys.

5.description: Interesting.  I called this company as it was recommended on Yelp and Angie's list.  The person called me back and told me he could not help me as they don't service my area.  Fine, so I asked if he could recommend someone who did.  He said he couldn't recommend competition?  but he doesn't service my area?  I think that's very unhelpful.  anyway, he hung up on me.  I can't help but write this as someone who is rude may not always be good to use.

11.description: Our Kitchen Aid washing machine was not spinning properly and we called AA Best and had an appointment 2 days later.   They gave us a 2 hour window of when they would arrive and said they would call when they were on their way.   The delivered as promised.Ivan took a look at the problem and said he did not have the part with him but would return 2 days later or the next day if he had a cancellation.   He gave us a firm estimate of the cost to repair.The next day he came and repaired the washing machine and its good as new.  The initial service call was $60 less than Sears.  The final cost was exactly as promised.   I would highly recommend AA Best and will call them again if another appliance breaks down.

8.description: AA Best Appliance is great.  They were able to fit me in on the same day I called.  Ivan quickly diagnosed the issue with my washing machine.  He had all of the necessary parts and repaired it within 30 minutes. He was friendly, respectful and knowledgeable.  I would definitely recommend AA Best Appliance.  They provide excellent customer service and high quality work.

4.description: 1. Were on-site for repairs within an hour of my call even though it was a non-emergency2. Cost was reasonable for the visit and repair ($179 to repair washer spin mechanism).3. Re-oiled the same mechanism4. Raised the washing machine an inch to help prevent future damage5. 90 day labor warranty, 1 year product warranty

14.description: Ivan was very knowledgeable and an extremely nice guy.  Price was good and work was great.  Call these guys.

6.description: For the second time in about two years, my refrigerator was dying -- loud noises, rising temperatures, etc.  Some web research uncovered my problems were pretty common in the model, so I started to look into replacements.  To get one that would fit the abnormally small space, it was going to be about $1400, so I decided to call AA Best.  Ivan came out and immediately knew what the problem was.  Two hours later, it was not only running again, but he installed some extra "stuff" to prevent the problem from recurring.  He even hooked up the icemaker, which had been disconnected since I'd moved in three years earlier.  Yes, I'm lazy.Anyway, highest recommendation from me.  The price was fair and Ivan really knows what he's doing.  I will definitely call them again when the next appliance breaks.

1.description: I live in the neighborhood and this is one of the stores I go to for lottery tickets.  This is a newer store.  Most of the clerks are not that friendly.After my experience today, I will never go there, again.I went to buy lottery tickets.  I was given my change.  I realized the clerk had shortchanged me out of a dollar.  The male clerk had an attitude.  He began to add up the value, and the manner he did it was as if I was wrong.  He continued to be rude.  I stated, "You need to know how to speak to people."  Then, he states," I have to be careful. "  I have no problem with this, however, there is no need to be rude to a customer.  The man couldn't let up and states,  "Obviously, you never make mistakes."  His attitude was totally uncalled for.  At this point, I went off and swore.Yes, everyone makes mistake.  When it was mentioned, he did not have to be rude and not let the matter drop.There are other stores I can spend my money at.

0.description: Cup ramen - 5 starsBottled Water - 5 starsCigarette selection - 4 starsVitamin water and Gatorade variety - 5 starsScratch off lottery tickets?  YesMini-advil packs for a ridiculous price? CheckYou've got to try the 7-Eleven coffee paired with a banana for fifty cents.  To die for!All sarcasm aside, it's just a 7-Eleven and it's a block away from where I live which makes for extra convenience for me.And a bonus, had to make a last minute champagne run on new years eve, and they  had bubbly moscato instead champagne.  Saved the night!

3.description: Free food for....EVERYONE? Very Nice. God Bless you, Gamblers. Being in a pool league, I get to travel to different bars. I have been to my fare share of holes. This is a neighborhood bar fitted with a dart room, yes DART ROOM! The bar is pretty stardard but the service is outstanding. It gives me a homely feel to it. The man and woman behind the counter were friendly and inviting and constantly checking on the free food making sure everything gets rotated. The pool table was very well maintained and gave us players ample room to shoot. The have a giant dart room with maybe 6-7 dart boards for league also (i am guessing). This is an awesome neighborhood bar and great service and quality. Nothing too fancy but nice enough to not be a dive bar.

1.description: The neighborhood is not the best in the city but this is perhaps the best dart bar perhaps in the area. A local joint for the non immigrant community of Albany Park the place was decent enough although with its name perhaps four or more poker machines would of been appropriate

2.description: Ahhh... Good ole gamblers...

9.description: I started playing darts there early 2001 and have been a true regular ever since.  Jackie has to be the most conscientious bar owner in the city!  She has the most dart teams coming out of her bar than any other dart bar in the city, too.  Ray, Greg, Donna, and Dorothy are also the great bartenders.  She has her annual BitchFest in February that gathers all her ladies for a Sunday afternoon of fun/frolic/bitchiness (in the best way).

10.description: Gambler's is a PERFECT neighborhood bar.  Same faces for years which makes it so special.  Formerly, MONGO's and prior to that Blue Adriatic.  Wonderful bar staff (especially Ray). I only go a few times a year to reunion with old friends and family and I am treated as if I were there on a daily basis.  Tip well, they deserve it.

4.description: Cheap drinks, good juke box, friendly staff.  Thanks for the good times!

6.description: Staff is GRRRRRRRRRRRRRRReat!  Hey DJ...play that funky music white boy!  Cheap drinks and a pool table...can't go wrong

12.description: This is a very down to earth pub where the owner will personally serve you and make you feel welcome. They have a seperate room where they have live music once a month or so. The last time I went they didn't have many different things to eat, so you can go to one of the restaurants that are nearby if you like.

5.description: Gamblers is an Albany Park institution, long established as one of the finest dart bars in the city, the tradition continues on as flocks of darters will come far and wide to fling sharp pointy darts at their impressive row of darts again and again. One of the greatest things of being a Yelper and being in a dart league is that every other week I get to try out a usually new dart bar and get the opportunity to get into the nitty gritty and experience the best of what dives have to offer. Playing here on Tuesday night, Gamblers furnished us with a soup and salad buffet with plenty of chips and dessert. Who knew!? Random dive bars hook it up with the eats, joe!Having such a good time with their congenial and well-mannered team, me and my fellow teammates returned to Gamblers on a Saturday night to sharpen our teeth on the boards and to hang out. My friend ran into his co-worker who is in one of the higher level leagues and I saw plenty of Windy City Darters board members hanging out and shooting out.The Windy City Darters were having an official Nickel level qualifier and people were playing for some big money. Afterwards, they opened up a blind draw tournament and plenty of people played. I am always impressed with bars that still got the muscle to have Saturday night dart tournaments because it shows the robustness of the sport. At Gamblers there is no shortage of friendly northwestsiders and the Juke rarely stops playing.Over 40 dart trophies line their walls and people were playing all night. As we kept shooting until closing time, we were given free shots for keeping up the shooting. Seeing as how Gamblers is six blocks from my house , I can get myself used to playing marathon dart sessions with some of the best players in the city.

13.description: A place that caters to darts and is a great place for beginners and experts alike.  Plenty of dart boards (non-electronic) to choose from, and even during league nights, there are places to play.  While the place might seem creepy upon first entering, it isn't what it seems.   One might see a pathetic regular or two, sitting at the bar, watching the tv, but that isn't frequent.  Despite its relatively stark edifice, it's a great place with fun people - everyone laughs and hangs with their groups.  Pool costs a buck I think, and they have (I think) 6 steel-tip dart boards in the fantastic back room.  There's Golden Tee, an ATM, and a Millenium touch machine.  The bartenders are great, and Jackie, the owner, is the sweetest.

11.description: It's a hole in the wall, dive, neighborhood bar.  Once you've been there a few times, it's like you're family.  The bartenders are a trip and the owner is the sweetest... but don't you dare cross her!  If you're looking for a little bar that offers good music on the juke box, darts and regulars to chat with... I'd recommend gamblers!

8.description: This was a good find.  A friend and I stumbled upon Gamblers when we were an hour early for a dinner party.  The sign says "thirsty" under the name.  We were greeted with a warm welcome and the regulars were quite nice.  The prices were great too...$6.75 for a Makers rocks and Schitz...not too shabby.  If you ever find yourself in Albany park or looking to get drink before the strip club, Gamblers is the place to be.

0.description: Gamblers is the perfect place to grab a beer, watch the Blackhawks, Bears, Cubs, play pool or darts with friends and enjoy the evening. They have plenty or TVs, a couple pool tables and a whole room dedicated to darts. On Sundays they usually have free food. The bartenders are wonderful and the owner is awesome and the clientele is friendly.

7.description: Oh, dive bars, how I love thee!  Gamblers, you are about to become part of my regular haunts despite that I live nowhere near you.  I have not played darts in 10+ years, and I was never good at it.  I had so much fun here.  Even though my friends are really good at darts and so are the regulars, I felt oh so comfortable here.  Local bar, cheap, crappy beer by the pitcher, Kettle One, friendly staff and regulars who embrace newbies...perfect night.

12.description: One of the best steak burritos out there, and I have tried them all. The steak with onion and cilantro is delicious. Not a bunch of glop in the burrito so you taste the quality of the meat. Burrito is a bit pricey but worth it for the quality. The chicken burrito is quite good too. Food is always consistent.

3.description: This restaurant has had major improvements in their food quality yes the price is a bit high but now it's worth it came in yesterday for a burrito and a drink and it was perfectly made now I'm going back today to get a taco dinner. The horchata is one of the best I have tasted!!

1.description: You could easily split a platter but its hard to say no to chopped onions and cilantro on the tacos. Good rice. Will be a regular. Stuffed and happy.

2.description: Most people rave about the steak tacos, but I love the veggie burrito, myself. I only wish it had sliced avocado instead of guacamole, but that's just me, and they'll do it if I ask nicely :) The menu isn't big, but it's authentic and inexpensive and delicious.

9.description: This is our go-to for take out on busy weeknights when my fiance and I are scrambling to get home and eat.  I LOVE their carne asada tacos, i literally could eat them every day.  Freshly made tortilla chips with guacamole and their house made salsas are killer.  I'm making myself hungry for tacos just writing this review.

10.description: Great food but cooks are unable to cook more than one order at a time so if you're NOT in a hurry or have 15-20 minutes to wait for your order, then give it a try.

4.description: The steak burrito with onions and cilantro is one of the tastiest burritos I've had. Juicy beefy flavor, nice crunch of the onion with the cilantro for extra flavor. The green sauce and the red sauce are both great additions to the flavor scale. Nice staff in the house take good care of you. Note to the house, pull back a tad on the salt and you might have a perfect burrito.  Buenocito mammacito!!!

6.description: This is hands down the best taco place ever.  I was really sad when the palapita on Milwaukee closed.  This is my new go to place!  Carne asada Tacos are to die for and the al pastor are some of the best I've ever had -next to atotonilco.

0.description: Holy guacamole! I think I'm in love. I have driven past Mini Palapita several times, wondering how the food was. The building is misleading and you question if anyone leaves here without getting food poisoning. They always say never judge a book by its cover! After eating a carne asada burrito with everything on it, I don't know if I will eat again at my usual Taqueria. I swear they're hiding a charcoal grill in the back because I don't know where all that flavor is coming from in the steak. Whatever it is that the cooks are doing, keep it up! I call that talent. The burritos are pricey at $10 for one with everything on it. Or should I say in it? Worth every penny.The gentleman who took my order asked if I needed anything else with the burrito I ordered, and I usually settle on the salsa verde as a dipping sauce. The man eyed me for a moment, and suggested I try the "black sauce." I had never heard of black sauce before so I was down to try something different. Again they nailed it with flavor and the right amount of heat. I tore through the entire serving and never once touched the salsa verde. You know, I am REALLY fighting the use of a popular cliché here, but let's just leave it at "I'm never going back." Thanks guys!

5.description: Tacos control my life!!!So my boyfriend did not want to cook, which kind of pissed me off!!! I was really looking forward to eating a great steak. I really need to stop being so damn selfish all the time and let him relax once in a while. So he texted me to stop at this place to get Tacos. He lives a few blocks away and i guess this place has always been one of his favorite places.I get here and the place is dead! It was about 4:50 PM. I placed my order for 6 steak tacos and honestly i think the prices were a bit outrageous. For $16 bucks i could have eaten an entire meal plus alcohol at Chilis. My order was prepared right away and the two guys that were there were very nice! When i got to my boyfriends house we went right for it. The Tacos were pretty damn good! I do not have any complaints. The steak was nicely seasoned and everything was fresh!I honestly wish that they would stay open longer on the weekends! If they would stay open past 1 AM i can guarantee that this place will have many people stopping by for a late night taco!

13.description: I got a burrito and some chips here. Pricey, but tasty. Carne asada meat was moist and gently seasoned; it and the other ingredients were well-balanced together. Tortilla chips were perfect -- still moist from being fried without being greasy, and coming apart in crisp flaky layers. The guy behind the counter says nothing has changed here since this was a Pasadita outpost except the name. Maybe I just came on a good day then, because IMO the food was better than anything I got during its Pasadita days. Better than the Palapita on Milwaukee too, IMO.ADDENDUM JANUARY 2016: Been back a couple times since. The food has become even pricier, and it's still worth it. This place is the real deal with al pastor cooked on a spit with pineapple drippings cascading down and broiled carne asada rather than griddle-fried chunks of flavorless meat. These things make a difference worth paying for.

11.description: Has gotten a little too expensive and smaller portions. I dont like the extra charge for cheese.

8.description: Great steak tacos, better than anywhere else in Chicago!  Pricy but well worth it!! Finally the perfect tortilla meets the perfect grilled steak

14.description: This restaurant recently changed owners but the food is still great! I personally like the steak tacos! It is a small hole in the wall mexican joint. The food is a B +. The reason I am giving them 5 stars is because I was there on 4/15/15 I came in with a jacket and it had my wallet in my jacket along with $300 + in cash. By the time I traced my foot steps I called them on 4/17/15 and they had my jacket and my wallet (the money was gone)! I was still excited to have my wallet back and have my jacket back. I think losing a wallet you expect the cash to be gone. Thank you guys for at least returning my belongings even though the cash wasn't there. Back to the food. They have a green and red salsa which is decent, the fresh chips you get if you eat in is nice and crispy. Small joint. Good for lunch. The parking lot has a lot of pot holes so be careful pulling in. Otherwise, if you're in the area and want to grab a quick lunch it's worth the stop.

7.description: Wow..wow.wow. The restaurant before this was ok. So trying this "new" Mexican restaurant was kind of skeptical. However I was surprised with the quality of food AND service. The meat was delicious and not to mention the chicken tortas! The food has been consistently good and fresh. Only drawback is that it doesn't have too much indoor seating.

3.description: I just bought a DS Lite and really really wanted to take advantage of its wi-fi capabilities. I was happy to find out that there was a GameStop right in my neighborhood.Of course, I took my sweet time walking there, and arrived right as they were closing. The employees were very sweet and let me in anyways. Annnnd then I was an idiot and grabbed the wrong item. I'll be back tomorrow to exchange it? Good thing GameStop has a decent return policy.

1.description: The service is great. Just went today to sell a couple of wii games an got cash on the spot. The woman who helped me was really nice and took the time to explain how store credit and cash differ when selling games. Will come again to buy an sell.

2.description: The sales associates were very friendly and helpful, but it can get pretty packed in there. They must've have been understaffed that day I went because there were only three workers and there was a long line, but all of them were busy with customers. My kids were behaving like they were in a candy store and wanted to buy everything. The associate helping hubby was very super helpful and offered a variety of promotions and tips. I really like this store and now see us going in the future.Yes there is a big parking lot that was pretty empty in the evening.

0.description: When I wrote my last review, the people that worked there weren't so awesome. They have changed employees, and they are mostly girls now that work there. They're all so nice and knowledgable and sweet and funny. I love these guys. Girls. lol I'm here at least like, once a week 'cause my boyfriend is always buying games, and he buys me apparel lol. he bought me a zelda wallet and a green 1-up mushroom beanie hat. This place is great, now. YOU GO GIRLS!!!

4.description: I never would have thought I'd be writing a review for a video game store.  LOL.  But I've been converted thanks to Nintendo Wii.  I've finally found a system that allows me to play in a way that makes sense.  Gamestop had a good selection of Wii games and the cool thing about this place is that the used games have a cool return policy.  You can buy a used game and try it out for up to 7 days.  If you don't like it (or get bored with it) you can return it for a full refund.  This is a great way to find out if you like a game or not before you drop $50 on it.  Like today we picked up Metroid thinking it looked really cool, but when we got it home it was insanely slow and difficult to get anywhere.  It's going back tomorrow.  Oh, and they have a club card for $15 bucks you get a one year membership.  With the membership you get a 10% discount on your games and a monthly gamers magazine.  They let us apply the discount to the purchase we made today so it starts working for you right away.  They guy behind the counter had a lot of useful info to share but I got the sense he was sick of dealing with obnoxious kids all day.  Although I would be too if I had to deal with them.

3.description: This place is a hidden gem in the Chicago sewing/designing community. If you need quality supplies, then you must check it out. It is the best place in the city to buy interfacing (all at 60" and super inexpensive), shirting material (you order from a sample catalog), zippers, pins and needles and I think it is the only place left that still sells furrier supplies. Yes, there are no prices on anything, but just politely ask Steve, he'll be happy to tell you the price and answer all of questions. From every trip there, I always walk satisfied and usually slightly more educated. I highly recommend Leonard Adler & Co.!

1.description: Wow, this place is great to have around if you need a zipper, and maybe other clothing related supplies.  It's an old school warehouse and in this internet Amazon age, is a definite one of a kind.   I think Steve said they inventory 25000 zippers.  Steve is what makes it a one-of-a-kind.  He is a funny, helpful guy who has been there 52 years, and it was delight chatting with him about the company history and my coat zipper needs.  My futile internet search, but ultimate word-of-mouth referral, for a good heavy gauge two-way YKK zipper (the best and Steve confirmed this) lead me to this gem of a business.  They have a lot of fashion designer and fashion school clients, but will take in (but don't really need) walk-in business like myself.  Hope they stay around forever and it's already been 108 years.

2.description: That I get to shop here sometimes is one of the joys of living in a city like Chicago.  This is where you go when the sewing notions at Joann won't cut it for you anymore.   Shelves of zippers in lengths that are unavailable elsewhere.  Zipper parts, too.  Thimbles in every size, including large sizes to fit men.  Parts for your Jiffy steamer or your gravity fed steam iron.  Ribbing for the cuffs and waist of bomber jackets and parkas.  Lining, oh, such linings.  Interfacing.  High quality muslin for less than you will pay at the chain fabric stores.  Racks of thread on cones.  Rolls of twill tape in various widths.  Buttons.  Snaps.  Patternmaking tools (all the college fashion programs send their student here for that stuff).  Waxed Silamide thread.  Scissors.  Specialty furrier items.... and they've recently added a line of lovely dyed garment leather.  They have a lot more than is on the website.And Steve, the owner, is a wealth of knowledge.

0.description: Fantastic service!  They know their inventory and are able to answer telephone inquiries quickly and accurately!  Street parking.We needed to find buttons to replace a few on the husband's dress overcoat.After much searching of the internet and various fabric stores we found Leo Adler.When I called to inquire, they were able to immediately tell me that they had the size, color, construction of the required button in stock.It was a drive, but we were able to go by and pick up the needed buttons (2 medium, 1 large) for his coat!We are very pleased.Give them a call or drop by and see if they can help you.They are very helpful.The front door is a bit difficult to find, due to lack of signage.  Persist and you will win!

28.description: Best burritos in town. Hands down. Salsa is just the right amount of hot and the chips are always made fresh to go.

1.description: I was introduced to Lindos (what the college kids call it) in the beginning of the school year by a few friends and I fell in love! You can either dine in or take out. If you dine in, they give you chips and salsa. I am in love with their verde salsa. I order here at least twice a week. Their food is so fresh and so good! I usually get their steak burrito but I have tried their other dishes and it's just as good! I'm not sure why some people are complaining about their pricing. They have daily specials and their portions are huge! It's also byob which is always a plus! I'm giving it 4 stars because their service is really slow if you dine in.  If you want to get take out, I would call in advance so it's ready when you come pick it up.

9.description: Lindo Michoacan has THE best burritos in Chicago. I've been going here for burritos since I moved to the city in 2008. I've tried many other burritos in that time and still none compare to Lindo Michoacan. Their meat tastes fresher and like it's better quality than most taquerias. I'm not sure I'm explaining this well but the meat is just better. They also use fresh cheese. Their pico de gallo is really good and also always fresh. I guess it is the overall freshness and quality of the ingredients that makes the burrito so good. I always get the pollo, carne asada or veggie burrito. They have a seriously good veggie burrito with some atypical ingredients. The pollo is my favorite, though. The chicken is just perfectly cooked and expertly seasoned. The best part might be the price. Two people each have a burrito and chips with salsa and the bill is under ten bucks! This place is perfect for the frugal foodie.Honeslty, I can't speak to the quality of the other menu items. I'm never able to order anything but burritos. However, when the servers walk by holding trays of enchiladas and pots of soup they always look delicious. Maybe I'll try them one day...

29.description: Not so good this time. Beef Tostada was very bland, the rice and beans were way off flavor. The star of the show was the beef soup excellent. Service was not so good, of course everyone was glued to the TV for the World Cup so I understand.

23.description: Lindo's burritos are always excellent and are decently priced. A genuine, good tasting Mexican restaurant - recommend trying it if you have not in the past.

5.description: So a co-worker had suggested this restaurant and I met up with a friend here for lunch. We started with the chips,guacamole and salsa, which were very good. She ordered the tongue burrito and I went with the tongue simmered in red sauce with jalepenos, which was delightfully spicy. The meat was tender and delicious, and we finished off with coffee and I drank far too much of it.The food was amazing, the portions were huge (I got three meals ouf of my entree) and the price was phenomenal. We agreed it was the best Mexican food we'd had in Chicago in quite a while. Also, the waitstaff didn't try to rush us out the door, even though we lingered for quite a while sipping coffee and munching on the chips. I'll be back and bring some friends so we can some burritos!

31.description: Lindo Michoacan has THE best burritos in Chicago. I've been going here for burritos since I moved to the city in 2008. I've tried many other burritos in that time and still none compare to Lindo Michoacan. Their meat tastes fresher and like it's better quality than most taquerias. I'm not sure I'm explaining this well but the meat is just better. They also use fresh cheese. Their pico de gallo is really good and also always fresh. I guess it is the overall freshness and quality of the ingredients that makes the burrito so good. I always get the pollo, carne asada or veggie burrito. They have a seriously good veggie burrito with some atypical ingredients. The pollo is my favorite, though. The chicken is just perfectly cooked and expertly seasoned. The best part might be the price. Two people each have a burrito and chips with salsa and the bill is under ten bucks! This place is perfect for the frugal foodie.Honeslty, I can't speak to the quality of the other menu items. I'm never able to order anything but burritos. However, when the servers walk by holding trays of enchiladas and pots of soup they always look delicious. Maybe I'll try them one day...

25.description: Fight your temptation to walk through the wrong door and head in through the parking lot.Being relatively new to the 'hood, I think this is the best burrito in the immediate area.  For about $5-6 (depending on tax and extras) you get a good sized quality burrito.  Everything is tasty, well put together and relatively prompt.Dining here was also a good experience.  I was feeling like butt and it was cold so I got myself a bowl of seafood soup and it hit the spot.  I virtually drank all the broth and the seafood was great (although it is authentic so does require some work).  The staff was on top of extra limes and offering me extra chips and such.Probably the only gripe, and it may not even really be one, is that getting guacamole on a burrito seems to be a bit foreign.  I called in such an order and instead got a burrito and a side of guacamole.  The whole thing was still only about $10 and I had guacamole for days so I really can't complain.  But I definitely will be back.

12.description: This place is amazing! I love the tortas, burritos, & tacos. It has the right Mexican flavors in each bite! Really recommend after a night of drinking and partying!

21.description: This place is the bomb for Mexican. It's open all the time and the food is really fresh. With two huge TVs on Wrestling or Soccer... What else do you need? Try the Al Pastor Tacos and Chicken Caldo to die for or get resuscitated by!

16.description: Fresh delicious food and ingredients, sweet and attentive staff that gives you space, and most importantly affordable for a student on a budget who enjoys good authentic Mexican food.

17.description: I've been going to Lindo's for two years. The last few times I have sat in the waitresses have been rude and take 15 minutes or longer to come and even take your drink order. Food is good but I will not be returning.

10.description: Authentic food, nice clean place for a quick cheap bite to eat. The staff was very friendly and attentive! The food came quickly and tasted amazing!

11.description: First time customer. The food was good yes, but I was not expecting my car to be booted immediately after leaving it, without warrant. The owner was good about handling the situation, but I still don't understand why a business would want to potentially drive away customers by hiring an outside company to patrol it's lots. Anyone know the name of this lot company so I can send complaints where they're due?

26.description: My familu has been going here for a really long time. Their food is good and worth the money. The past time we went here the service is usuallt friendly. But for some reason today are waitress was plain out rude to us. When we ask for little things like a cup of ice she gave us the dirtiest look. When she was takkng our order she just has mean smug face on her. We ask for straws she told us to wait with an attitude. Really? Wait for straw when they are in your pocket. I understand it is kinda unusual for an asian family going to this authentic mexican restaurant, but I believe they should friendly and give nice service for everybody. I think we won't be coming for awhile. But I think this time the service is just fluke.

27.description: Just had breakfast here...eggs with smoky poblano sauce.  I have to say this is some of the best Mexican food I've had north of Mexico.  Even the refried beans were superb...and I seldom eat refried beans!  The dishes are made to order and the restaurant is connected to the adjoining Mexican grocery. Definitely have to check this place out for lunch or dinner.

0.description: What an excellent restaurant! You can't beat the burritos and how much meat is inside! They were huge! My fajitas came out sizzling and tasted great.Now, the guacamole was impeccable! Creamy and chunkyThis is my new go to Mexican restaurant, and loved stopping in the supermarket after dinner.

20.description: Steak burrito is spot on. I will definitely be back here about 15-20 times this year.

19.description: Best burritos in town. Hands down. Salsa is just the right amount of hot and the chips are always made fresh to go.

33.description: Im not mexican but this restaurant is one of the authentic places to be when it comes to mexican cuisine. They serve fresh meat and veggies, thanks to their own supermarket adjacent to the place. I think they have the best horchata and caldo de res in town! Though their tacos are not above the rest, their burito is a must try. They also serve breakfast at a reasonable price.

2.description: I used to come here a lot, and tip very well.  These days if you come as a party of 1, even during the day, they will only seat you at the counter.  Don't want the counter seat L.M.  You used to be my favorite place to recommend, now, not so much.   Thanks, but no thanks.  (Food is good but that's not everything..)

32.description: Food: Amaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaazing!!!! Note: If you see mexicans actually eating at a Mexican restaurant, then it's good! Everything on the menu is delicious! I have been here about 45 times. Price: You can't beat the prices. Everything is completely affordable! This place is not recommended for a first date. This is a completely casual place. It is not fancy, but be sure that if you are starving and in the area you will eat great food.I recommend the "Caldo de camarones," which is my favorite shrimp soup.You will definitely get the authentic Mexican experience. Trust me, I know Mexican food, and this is it!

18.description: Think you can't mess up rice and beans?  Yes you can!  Want aluminum tasting rice and beans?  Then go here.

13.description: Fight your temptation to walk through the wrong door and head in through the parking lot.Being relatively new to the 'hood, I think this is the best burrito in the immediate area.  For about $5-6 (depending on tax and extras) you get a good sized quality burrito.  Everything is tasty, well put together and relatively prompt.Dining here was also a good experience.  I was feeling like butt and it was cold so I got myself a bowl of seafood soup and it hit the spot.  I virtually drank all the broth and the seafood was great (although it is authentic so does require some work).  The staff was on top of extra limes and offering me extra chips and such.Probably the only gripe, and it may not even really be one, is that getting guacamole on a burrito seems to be a bit foreign.  I called in such an order and instead got a burrito and a side of guacamole.  The whole thing was still only about $10 and I had guacamole for days so I really can't complain.  But I definitely will be back.

4.description: Not unlike any number of services , restaurants must closely review their food costs and profit margins to keep the doors open.  Unfortunately, Lindo Mich has taken this process to another level.  Since my review in Feb 2015, they  have both increased their prices and reduced the size of their portions!  Yesterday, Fall was in the air.   Nothing like a nice bowl of chicken soup (Caldo de Pollo)  to take the chill off.  For years, the bowl was full to the rim with delicious broth, and included a breast, leg & thigh and lots of veggies. Yesterday, the bowl was short at least 1 1/2 Cups of broth short, and floating around lonely inside, was a drumstick, and the bottom half of a chix breast.  The serving used to have a few potatoes in it along with carrots & chayote.  Now its full of potatoes ( instead of protein) ,  Thats about 50% less food than usual, and the price is up almost $2.  While the quality was there, I was still hungry when I left.  I'm hoping that other regular customers  have expressed their concern.  I will check it out again very soon to see if some of my other favorite dishes have gone thru major portion control reduction.   Bummer.  BEWARE !!!!!  Park only where you see signs "PARKING FOR LINDO MICHOACAN".  The towing company will boot you in a hot minute  if you park at the lot for the strip mall just North of the restaurant. Cost of $150 to get your car out of bondage!

24.description: So a co-worker had suggested this restaurant and I met up with a friend here for lunch. We started with the chips,guacamole and salsa, which were very good. She ordered the tongue burrito and I went with the tongue simmered in red sauce with jalepenos, which was delightfully spicy. The meat was tender and delicious, and we finished off with coffee and I drank far too much of it.The food was amazing, the portions were huge (I got three meals ouf of my entree) and the price was phenomenal. We agreed it was the best Mexican food we'd had in Chicago in quite a while. Also, the waitstaff didn't try to rush us out the door, even though we lingered for quite a while sipping coffee and munching on the chips. I'll be back and bring some friends so we can some burritos!

6.description: Best burrito in the city. Great nachos. El Pastor tacos a tad on the dry side but thats a pretty minor beef

22.description: Greasy chips, solid salsa, great ceviche (and the portion was huge), Guacamole you could eat for day.  Fajitas combination was perfect, the service was good and the food came out really fast.  I need to go back and try the burritos other reviewers raved about.

15.description: Of all the Mexican restaurants in the area I like this the best. Good quality ingredients and delicious everything.

7.description: The food here was actually very good. The stuffed chicken breast with mushrooms and spinach were amazing..definetly will be back. Great service also

8.description: Great steak burrito. You can sit in or take away. Great authentic Mexican food. The setting is not glamours, but it is still pleasant.

30.description: Been frequenting this pkace 2-3 times a week for a year. Food is consistent and good. May take a while but worth it. Love how their steak torta, it is seasoned well. Their Texan looking salsa is good too. Chicken tacos are a no go, lack seasoning. Service is there but could be better. You won't get the same waitress throughout your meal so speak up if you need something one of the many will tend to you. Table ownership would be nice so at least you are checked up on by the same waitress as you're dining. You'll also have to walk up to pay your bill they typically don't come back after they give it to you.

3.description: While the sister grocery store next door doesn't impress me much, Lindo Michoacan Restaurant wins my repeated businesses.  Well, it definitely has won many CPD men and women.  I often see cops dining inside and doing their community outreach (maybe)?  Anyhow, you can't legally follow the police vehicles, but you can certainly track down where officers go for food, at least it's what I do.  It's one of a few restaurants that has a pretty extensive seafood menu items, especially the soup.  Hubby and I ordered the caldo de pescado (fish soup) and siete mares (seafood combination soup) for to-go.  They also have the pineapple drink, under the jugos naturales category.  Hubby had one, and I sampled.  It was delicious, yet if you've had the pineapple lemonade from Dos Ricco's (on S. Cicero by the Midway Airport), nothing else could measure up to that heavenly, refreshing, and soothing pineapple lemonade from the god of fusion (Dos Ricco's emphasizes on Asian and Mexican fusion dishes...an amazing place)!  Sorry for digressing, but I thought it was necessary to share this piece of information on the previous paragraph for just being a foodie.  The soup we had was well-made, even though it entailed a longer wait at the restaurant.  My caldo de pescado was filling, and the amount of fish was considerably generous.  I know it's a minute detail, but the tortilla that came with the soup was fluffy and thin enough to create a nice absorption when soaking up the soup.  Hubby and I both agreed that we will go back for their soup, and perhaps other items on the menu.  Lindo Michoacan restaurant is located one (1) block north from the CTA Kedzie Brown Line station, so it's readily accessible without driving your own vehicle.  Nevertheless, there's limited parking available within the strip mall.

14.description: Worse mexican food .. The fajitas are just terrible, posole even worse .. I will not go there anymore..service is good

58.description: This family owned restaurant definitely gives you a bang for your buck!!  The lamb was incredibly succulent and the basmati rice was delicious.  The place reminds me of my grandpa's house and is a smaller, modest feel.  Definitely a casual eatery.  Will return!

56.description: I went there with my friend for dinner. I had a combination plate and his was lamb shank. Lamb shank was super tender, just fell off the bone. And mine, the meat was very flavored. We also had tea with milk and spices, looked pinky but tasted very good and special.

29.description: I have no idea what Afghan food is supposed to taste like but this place is good. Lunch is cheap. It is a mom and pop place with a homey feel. Don't expect to get in and out, service is pretty slow, at least for lunch, and it isn't fast food so just chill out. Get the lunch special, it is a legit dinner plate for $6.

42.description: After so much disappointment on devon over the last month, I have found my food heaven. We got the combination kabob platter and it was divine. Also very enjoyable was the afghani sheer chai, it was so good I needed a 2nd cup. The cost is also very reasonable. I will go out of my way to eat here again.

23.description: I had Kabuli kebab it was something out-of-earth! It was amazing totally recommend it

47.description: This place is a hidden gem! Food was so delicious! We ordered kabob plates with yogurt sauce on the side.

8.description: I have always wanted to try afghan cuisine and there cud'nt have been a better place to try it. I had the aushak and Afghani sheer chai. It was delicious. The people serving the food were kind and courteous !!! Wud definitely come back !!!

31.description: Excellent food and service. I got this recommendation from an Afghan friend so we decided to check it out.  The owners are super friendly and attentive.  We had the green tea which is not like the green tea I make or have had before. I inquired and found out it is from Afghanistan. Oh, that stinks cuz I'd like to buy some! We ordered hummus (okay) and he got a small cup of lentil soup and I got a small colorful salad. Being vegan I decided to order the Vegetarian Sampler appetizer as my meal. (No yogurt sauce was put on to accommodate me) It was excellent. I especially loved the butternut squash and the eggplant. My husband got the chicken kabob spicy and the 'brown rice' meaning it has a lot of seasonings in it.  He said the food was tasty meaning perfectly seasoned not just salt added in.  Best of all free parking on the side street on Sunday! Definitely will be back!

34.description: Incredible food. Great ingredients, everything fresh and perfectly cooked! Dev Dev said, verbatim "someone found his new favorite restaurant" and Dev Dev knows what he is talking about, I trust his word. Apart from the food being so unarguably great, the staff was super friendly without being too invasive, attentive but not too overbearing. Prices were good for the quality of food. ($10-13 for an entree). If you're looking for a great new place to try don't give it a second thought, this is place to go!

16.description: Family run and it shows! The food is outstanding, always fresh and flavorful. Been going here since they opened and love that they do delivery in the neighborhood. The chicken shammi kabob is one of my favorites along with the chia tea.

13.description: Very traditional and typical Afghan spot. Great customer service from the point we walked in till the end. Definitely 5 stars for that! Now don't get me wrong, the food here is quiet authentic and flavorful, however I have been spoiled by some amazing afghani food from NY, so to me it was good, but I've had better. We ordered chicken and beef kebab, chicken and lamb, and Mantu for appetizer. They give you complimentary soup as a starter, which I believe is made of lentils, corn and shredded chicken. But we wished they gave us some bread on the side too. At the end we had some leftovers, and the owner offered to give us tahini and red sauce on the side to go, which I thought was a considered gesture. We also got their famous pink chai. Very refreshingI say if you're in the neighborhood, definitely give this place a try!

11.description: Loved this place. The owner is friendly and cares about service. The food was fantastic, the portions generous and they had a good selection of vegetarian dishes for the wife (and those were tasty though despite the lack of meat).

39.description: Stopped by here when I happened to be in the area. Would definitely go back if it wasn't so far from my house. I got the chef's sampler appetizer plate, which was really good. My only complaint was that pretty much everything had the same garlic yogurt sauce, which was an excellent sauce, but made everything taste a bit the same. But the Mantu, the meat dumplings, were particularly good. I definitely want to come back here to try their kabobs or some of the other entrees.

37.description: This is the kind of place that foodies say they love, but don't patronize. It is a small storefront family-owned business. The chairs and tables are the type you see in a school cafeteria. The pictures on the wall are standard tourist shots. There is a small tv high on a wall that shows the equivalent of a test pattern. The food is honest, delicious, and representative of one country. There is no alcohol; in fact, I didn't even see soft drinks, although they probably are available.In short, Afghan Kabob is everything you want in an ethnic restaurant. You should go. Now.I am vegetarian/vegan, and my friend is an omnivore. There is a decent vegetarian selection which can be easily made vegan, typically by omitting a yogurt sauce. Much of the menu does consist of meat kabobs and other Afghan dishes. Meat lovers should find plenty to satisfy them.We started with the vegetarian sampler. Really, really good. The hummus and squash were outstanding. I loved loved loved the eggplant. The leek rolls were good, but for me at least, the mint taste was overpowering. My friend liked the rolls a little better than I did.Friend had a chicken salad, and I ordered a vegan main course of lentils with rice. We both were very happy.The service was friendly and efficient. Definitely no alcohol served here. I did not inquire if it was okay to bring in wine, but I assume it is. Maybe oenophiles should call first.Highly recommended. Good for vegetarians, vegans and carnivores. You should go!

0.description: Starting the new year off right. Found this place on a cold Wednesday night, it was empty inside but open for business. Usually not a good sign but given the weather I thought not much of it. The guy behind the counter provided adequate service. The star of the show was the food. The rice is cooked to a slick perfection. The lamb and chicken were prepared with a wide array of bold flavors and not a single bite was dry or brittlePriced right for great food.

38.description: Service was excellent and so friendly. We started with the sampler platter consisting if four appetizers. Two types of dumplings, an eggplant dish and a squash dish. Very, very good. Then we had the lamb shank with rice and raisins and the combination beef and lamb kebab. It was a lot of food and so tasty. We loved it and felt that it was all cooked fresh from good quality ingredients. We will return!

51.description: The best Afghani food place you can find in Chicago. So delicious.esp, the chicken chapli kabob and the kashmiri chai is to die for. Ambience isn't too great but a good casual place for lunch with friends. Food is made fresh so takes about 15 to 20 minutes to serve.

27.description: Popped into Afgan Kabob one night...I really wish I'd done this sooner. Overall, the service was the best part of the experience. I feel like they want you to feel at home here. The workers/owners (possibly) were some of the most attentive and nice people that I've stumbled across in a long time. However, the food is delicious, so that's a bonus too. Loved the hummus. The Chicken kabob, Shami Kabob, Lamb kabob and Beef Kabobs were all really good. I'm excited to order from Afgan Kabob again.

32.description: My fiance and I were walking around in one of the many Chicago snowstorms we tend to get, and a hunger struck us! Luckily, Afghan Kabob was in sight, and as we are both fans of middle eastern cuisine, we decided to duck in.Amazing. No other words for it. While the ambiance is a little meh, get over that. Focus on the quality of the staff and the food. The owner served us, and he was an incredibly kind and pleasant gentleman. He was attentive, but not overbearing, and his friendliness added to the quality of the meal.Onto the meal. WE were served chicken soup with vegetables immediately, and it was hearty and fantastic. I added hot sauce to mine, and their hot sauce is amazing and clearly a home made recipe. Delicious.Then, we split the mushroom turnover appetizer. INCREDIBLE. Perfectly seasoned, and with an absolutely tasty garlic yogurt dip.My fiance ordered the lamb and beef kebobs, and I ordered spicy chicken kebobs. Both were perfectly seasoned and delicious. Just a perfect, satiating meal. He also had the chai, and I had the hot tea. Both were just excellent.On an additional note, we are both on the Dukan diet which strongly limits what we can eat; this place is VERY friendly for those of us on such diets.On a secondary note: I took my fiance to the more upscale  ay Ay picante down the road for his birthday ( different cuisine, Peruvian), and it bears note: I would and SHOULD have taken him to Afghan Kabob, and given the opportunity would do so again in a heartbeat.Bottom line: We will be back again and again. What a quality and unsuspectingly so establishment! Seriously, I cannot say enough good about it.

54.description: I've 0.2M from this place for 10year, but for some reason never thought to go?  My Mistake! The food was exceptional and the prices are set just right for the quality and amount of food provide.  I did an on-line order which was confusing so next time I'll just call direct or walk over.  I ordered Mantu which are like dumplings with meat and herbs and covered in flavorful sauce.  Also, hummus with pita bread!  This was an amazing appetizer so full of flavor and 100x's better than best store bought.  The entree was spicy chicken kabob with 2 cups of brown basmati rice that was very light and fluffy.  The chicken was grilled just right, moist and juicy, but spice as in flavor not heat which was awesome!!  In addition, the owner and staff were very friendly and understanding when I showed a 20min after the time the told me to come.  They even called me.  Long story but was tired up finishing a chore.  Anyway, I will be going back to try the rest of the menu!!

48.description: Such friendly people and great food.

44.description: I really wanted to love this place. It is certainly not bad, but it is not all that great either. This place wavers between 3 and 3.5 stars for me. I ordered the Chefs Combination plate from the appetizer section as my entree. It consisted of beef dumplings, spinach, leek and onion dumplings, butternut squash, eggplant. I also had a side of pureed spinach. I loved my food, although the eggplant and butternut squash was lukewarm. My companion had the Beef Kabob. It was dry and a little overcooked. We both thought it would be skewered cubes of beef. Sadly, it was not. Instead the beef was tiny slices resembling shreds. This dish was most disappointing. There is no ambiance whatsoever, so it has the charm of a hole in the wall type of place. The owner/server was pleasant and kind but a little overwhelmed during our visit. I would go back, if I were in the neighborhood and give it another try, but I would not make a special trip as I live some distance away.

24.description: Excellent bulani. Best I have had in the Chicago area. The service is friendly. The space is too small for a large group but the owner made the best of what he had. I overall liked the food a lot.

7.description: Great place to go for Afghani food. The owners are very friendly and speak Dari/Farsi. I would recommend trying the Kabouli palow, which is like Persian shirin polo (sweet rice) with lamb. The rice is sweet with carrots, raisins, and orange peel shreds. My fave!Their mast (yogurt) is my absolute favorite and is a great accompaniment to the basmati rice. It's loaded with fresh mint. My friends and I fight over this stuff. It's that good.Just a heads up if you order the brown rice - it's actually white basmati rice that's soaked in lamb juice. Tastes amazing, but I think most people order brown rice thinking its a healthier option over white rice. Here, the two are one in the same. The mantu here is also awesome. Filled with lamb, onions, and spices. Pretty much everything here is good, in my opinion, except the kabob (too spicy. I can't handle it!).

49.description: The food here is amazing. If you are a vegetarian, I highly recommend the sampler platter. You'll be stuffed, but satisfied.

40.description: Amazing authentic Afghan food! Great prices and tasty food. Appetizers are delicious too!

53.description: I am so glad to find a good Afghan restaurant again. I hadn't had this cuisine since I was about 7, and the soup they offered as an appetizer took me back about two decades. There are enough options here to satisfy somewhat xenophobic eaters, adventurous types, vegans and meat lovers alike. I ordered the sabzi appetizer and a mantu plate, which was absolutely delicious, and filling without weighing you down. The owners were gracious and the service was excellent - the place is a small family restaurant in the best way.

30.description: Still just as amazing as the first time!  Also I can say that for delivery and in house now that I have now also eaten in the restaurant.  Can't compliment this place enough.  The food is always consistently amazing and I have never gotten such good service.  I felt guilty about ordering delivery during the snow storm 2 weeks ago but since they knew me I was told no problem.

46.description: We enjoy Afghan cuisine, and were happy to finally get to sample Afghan Kabob's offerngs recently. It was alright, but not the best Afghani cooking I've had. (To be fair, we were spoiled by our intro to Afghan food at a delightful restaurant in New Jersey, the likes of which we have not seen since.)We were especially eager to try the Kabuli Pulao, having loved a dish called Norange Palaw (rice with orange, carrots and pistachios over succulent braised lamb pieces) in the past. The Kabuli Pulao (brown rice with carrots & raisins over a lamb shank) was OK -- the lamb was falling off the bone, the rice was pleasant -- but the lamb was a bit dry and the dish lacked the bright flavors we'd hoped for. A chef's sampler of appetizers was more successful; it featured dumplings (mantu & aushak), eggplant (superb flavor) and squash -- all were very good, though the accompanying pita was among the worst I've had, dry and tasteless. We also liked their green tea chai -- very flavorful.There are factors that detract from Kabob as a dining destination for me. It is a plain storefront, not very inviting, and alcohol is not permitted. The one server seemed to be doing it all on a moderately busy night (however he was very courteous & helpful).I'm glad I tried Afghan Kabob, and I wish them well, but I don't think I'll be back. The food & ambiance not what I'd hoped they would be.

1.description: Casual storefront restaurant with delicious food. We ordered the vegetarian sampler and an order of sabzi (spinach). The sampler had hummus, aushak (leek dumplings), bourani badmejan (eggplant), and bourani kadu (butternut squash). Everything tasted great, the standout was the aushak, which was well spiced and flavorful. There were quite a few other vegetarian options on the menu, next time I go back I'll try the bulanee (dumplings).  Loved that the food was well spiced and had an authentic central Asian flavor.One tip - driving by the restaurant was hard to find at night. It's right on the northeast corner of Montrose and Elston, but the sign is hard to see. And the map on the restaurant's website is wrong, and will send you a mile west.

55.description: Small place Very good food and the owner/server is a very nice guy and gracious host. I had the ground chicken entree which was huge and very tasty. Came with a delicious soup and a bread basket. The yougurt sauce and rice were delicious as well. Only lost a star because of the environment is and look of the restaurant. They could at least play some music to lift the vibe. It's kind of quiet and akward in there.

9.description: Popped into Afgan Kabob one night...I really wish I'd done this sooner. Overall, the service was the best part of the experience. I feel like they want you to feel at home here. The workers/owners (possibly) were some of the most attentive and nice people that I've stumbled across in a long time. However, the food is delicious, so that's a bonus too. Loved the hummus. The Chicken kabob, Shami Kabob, Lamb kabob and Beef Kabobs were all really good. I'm excited to order from Afgan Kabob again.

26.description: We are been there many times, kabob is jucy and tender, love the dumplings with spinach, okra is so yummy , come back again for sure

25.description: One of the best meals I've had in Chicago, after a decade of calling this city home. The waitress and owner were so nice, and the food was incredible. We did the Chef's Sampler of appetizers and I loved everything on the plate. My lamb and chicken combo platter was perfect, and I had enough to take home for another meal. HIghly recommended.

12.description: Ordered a lot of food for take out.  Man was it all so so good. Will be back many times! As usual with the sampler, the dumplings, you can never get enough.. Awesome place.

59.description: Ate here for first time. Amazing ashak dumplings and chicken kabob wasn't bad although the palao could've been better. Also waitress was nice :)

21.description: Great little spot on Montrose, definitely underrated, kabobs are all great, the gem is the soup and rice they serve. Service is amazing with a nice family owned atmosphere.

17.description: Afghan Kabob is still awesome! I still always order the Kabuli Palaw. I now go for the bulanee with mushroom or squash fillings.

10.description: Authentic delicious food. Lots of food ate and brought home half of it.Try it out. Right by MCC.

5.description: Find this place from Yelp..,Went with my hubby and son.. It was welcoming family oriented atmosphere. Seems like family own business... I ordered qabuli palav, chefs special mixed mushed pumpkin,dumpling filled with different herbs and meat. My son ordered ground lamb Kabab ... Food was fresh and delicious,, my boy and son loved it. Anyone has a taste for Afgani food this is the right place..

3.description: Good portion size. The meat is always very well tenderized. The service can be a little slow but the feel is very home like.

35.description: I love little neighborhood places like this, with authentic decor simple decor and absolutely delicious almost like home cooked meals. The owner of the restaurant was very nice and friendly too. My husband and I both had lamb dishes, and they were perfect!

19.description: Small place Very good food and the owner/server is a very nice guy and gracious host. I had the ground chicken entree which was huge and very tasty. Came with a delicious soup and a bread basket. The yougurt sauce and rice were delicious as well. Only lost a star because of the environment is and look of the restaurant. They could at least play some music to lift the vibe. It's kind of quiet and akward in there.

28.description: Checked this place out as I was looking for Mediterranean cuisine in the neighborhood. Ordered the hummus as an appetizer and the combination plate for an entree and both were tasty. The place was small but clean and service was friendly. Will go back again.

45.description: The flavor of the food was delicious. I was disappointed when my I ran out of the actual dish and all I had left was an entire plate of rice.  I know Lamb is not cheap, however, I'm not paying for a big plate of rice either.  I'll give them another stab at it.

33.description: Awesome tasty food. Attentive staff. It's more for casual dining than a romantic date. We had chefs sampler, combination plate and hummus. Chefs sampler has leek dumplings, ground beef dumplings, butternut squash paste, and eggplants. I didn't think I liked the leek dumplings and butternut squash but I did! Egg plants is divine. The combination plate has 1 long piece of each shami (ground) chicken and beef kabobs, a couple smaller pieces of lamb and chicken. I got disappointed that there were not many non ground meats at first but after I tasted the shami ones, I took it back. They were so delicious thanks to the marinade done perfectly. Everything from kabobs, appetizers and down to the rice was great. I would go back to this place.

43.description: Love this place! Absolutely amazing food for less than 12 dollars! Freshly made and nice scenery! I take many dates there and they have enjoyed it very much!

2.description: This place is amazing! It looks very authentic. It's a small family own restaurant. Great service. The people here are very friendly and nice. The food is super exquisite! We ordered the chicken in red sauce, a combination plate with beef, chicken and lamb kabob with rice. All the food had unique and delicious flavor.  At the end we had their tea wich we fell in love with it.Prices are not bad speciallyfor the quality of food you get. Portions are kind of big. I shared with another person and we both where full at the end.I will be coming here again for sure. It's so much worth it. Definitely recommend it.

18.description: Excellent bulani. Best I have had in the Chicago area. The service is friendly. The space is too small for a large group but the owner made the best of what he had. I overall liked the food a lot.

41.description: I thought that Kabul House in Skokie was the only Afghani restaurant in the Chicago metropolitan area. I'm glad to have passed by Afghan Kabob and see that it is a part of the Chicago landscape. I was completely wowed.Chicken vegetable soup. Boranee baunjan. Butternut squash. Mantoo. Chicken korma chalaw.The soup was homemade, evident from the lack of salt that you get on the tongue when you eat Campbell's and Progresso soup. The eggplant in the boranee baunjan was addictive. I'm hooked on the butternut squash, for sure. The beef mantoo and the vegetarian mantoo were a hit. And the chicken korma chalaw was spicy without leaving my tongue numb. I was converted to a fan instantly.The service is outstanding, but bear in mind that the restaurant is not like an American restaurant where you're rushed through your meal and hinted at to leave so that tables can become available. Take your time. Enjoy the meal. Make plans to return. It's all good and I don't mean that as a cliche.

52.description: Yummy food and excellent service. Our server was attentive without being intrusive. The food was excellent and the portions ample.  We had the bulanee kachaloo (my favorite part of the meal) and sabzi appetizers and both were tasty. For my main dish, the vegetarians had the aushak plate, a generous, delectable portion. The meat eaters at the table had the combination plate (huge) and the chicken and beef kabob, both served with brown rice. We all went home full and happy. Oh, yes, the soup is made from chicken, so the vegetarians were served a green salad--nothing to write home about, but a nice gesture. I would have rather had something more interesting with those delectable Afghan spices though.

50.description: Afghan Kabob is still awesome! I still always order the Kabuli Palaw. I now go for the bulanee with mushroom or squash fillings.

4.description: This is the kind of place that foodies say they love, but don't patronize. It is a small storefront family-owned business. The chairs and tables are the type you see in a school cafeteria. The pictures on the wall are standard tourist shots. There is a small tv high on a wall that shows the equivalent of a test pattern. The food is honest, delicious, and representative of one country. There is no alcohol; in fact, I didn't even see soft drinks, although they probably are available.In short, Afghan Kabob is everything you want in an ethnic restaurant. You should go. Now.I am vegetarian/vegan, and my friend is an omnivore. There is a decent vegetarian selection which can be easily made vegan, typically by omitting a yogurt sauce. Much of the menu does consist of meat kabobs and other Afghan dishes. Meat lovers should find plenty to satisfy them.We started with the vegetarian sampler. Really, really good. The hummus and squash were outstanding. I loved loved loved the eggplant. The leek rolls were good, but for me at least, the mint taste was overpowering. My friend liked the rolls a little better than I did.Friend had a chicken salad, and I ordered a vegan main course of lentils with rice. We both were very happy.The service was friendly and efficient. Definitely no alcohol served here. I did not inquire if it was okay to bring in wine, but I assume it is. Maybe oenophiles should call first.Highly recommended. Good for vegetarians, vegans and carnivores. You should go!

6.description: I thought that Kabul House in Skokie was the only Afghani restaurant in the Chicago metropolitan area. I'm glad to have passed by Afghan Kabob and see that it is a part of the Chicago landscape. I was completely wowed.Chicken vegetable soup. Boranee baunjan. Butternut squash. Mantoo. Chicken korma chalaw.The soup was homemade, evident from the lack of salt that you get on the tongue when you eat Campbell's and Progresso soup. The eggplant in the boranee baunjan was addictive. I'm hooked on the butternut squash, for sure. The beef mantoo and the vegetarian mantoo were a hit. And the chicken korma chalaw was spicy without leaving my tongue numb. I was converted to a fan instantly.The service is outstanding, but bear in mind that the restaurant is not like an American restaurant where you're rushed through your meal and hinted at to leave so that tables can become available. Take your time. Enjoy the meal. Make plans to return. It's all good and I don't mean that as a cliche.

22.description: Only reason it's four stars is that the waitress messed up some of the orders, but very small.  I was with family and we ordered bulanee kadu and gashnee and aushak as appetizers, and a combination and one chicken kabob. The food was amazing and the price was decent. I highly recommend this place, nice layout, food and staff!! Go here if you're nearby

15.description: Great service and very flavorful food.  My go to is the Kabuli Pulao and Sheer Chai to finish the meal at the end.  If I am not looking to get very full, the Mantu and other appetizers are also very good.  Everyone here is always very nice and attentive.  If you eat in, they usually give you a soup in the beginning as well which completely opens up your appitite.

57.description: Delicious ethnic food served by an extremely nice and helpful owner. The dumplings and the lamb shank were extremely good, and sizable portions too. Not the cheapest ethnic food around, but the quality is worth it.

20.description: Awesome place of  authentic Afghan cosine!! Tried Boulani Kachalu, Ch.Shish Kabob, Chapli Kabob & Lamb chops. Great food with homemade spices.

36.description: I've gotta begin by saying I am from Iran so I can appreciate any authentic Middle Eastern foods but will always prefer Iranian dishes. I ordered the Mantu  because of all the attention previous reviewers were giving it. Now I LOVE Chinese dumplings and Italian ravioli and with no disrespect I found the Mantu to be a cross between those with some middle eastern spices. I didn't care for it BUT make no mistake it was prepared with care and I'm certain as close as you can get to homemade... just not my cup of tea.I also ordered the combination plate which gives you a lot of food especially for the price. The 2 large Kabobs are good and become much better when mixed with the yogurt sauce... but the STAR of the dish for me was the 2 pieces of lamb they tucked on the side of my bed of long grain brown basmati rice!! Those lamb chunks were scrumptious and if I return would absolutely forget exploring the menu and go after just that. It's worth mentioning that I'm not a huge lamb lover but this was just fantastic.The service was very pleasant as the owner was serving me... he took great pride in his craft and was an absolute  gentleman!! The only reason this place doesn't score higher is because the ambiance is OK with cheap utensils and that I'm not a Afghanistan Food Lover. But if your curious I couldn't think of a more authentic place or friendlier people to serve you.

14.description: Small joint + family owned = authentic. If you like eggplant, start off with the  bourani bandemjan . If you are in the mood for chicken, I recommend getting the  chicken  korma  chalaw. You get rice and chicken in some type of sauce (ask to make it spicy) and has the right amount of kick. Throw some mast (yogurt) on that and you got yourself a meal. I also tried the beef shish kabob and it was pretty good. Definitely would come back .

58.description: I grew up on Filipino food (with beef in place of pork due to dietary restrictions - I know that's blasphemy for Filipinos!) since my nanny was from Cebu. The tapsilog (fried beef, garlic fried rice, fried egg, and vinegar sauce) tasted pretty much like hers, however, absolutely every other entree on the menu is pork. I'd have loved to try more dishes, but alas, it was all pork and I'm Muslim.

56.description: Small, always busy, hardly follow business hours posted, and you'd be lucky if they pick up your call. With that said; best Filipino food in town. Their palabok tops all other Filipino restaurants in town. Come in for their weekend buffet. Choices are limited, like their seating, but the food is worth it at that price ($8 I think). Also, their main source of business is their catering. So feel free to call ahead for an order of their Eggrolls or even a party platter of their palabok. Your platter will sure to be the talk of the party.

29.description: I came here after seeing this place on Bizzare Foods.  Everything here is pretty homey and definitely pretty popular.  On the weekends, there is the buffet as well!We ordered the Tapsilog, a variety of other dishes, Coconut Corn Cake, and the Halo-Halo.  Overall, I thought everything was not too bad.  I can see why it is pretty popular here and everything is affordable.  The coconut corn cake was sweet but not too sweet.  It was pretty good for a mini dessert.  I think I may have been a bit crazy ordering the halo-halo on such a cold day, but I couldn't resist.  Loved the dessert and definitely would order it again if I am ever back in Chicago.
