42.description: I want to eat their garlic rice foreeeeeverrrr, and their lumpia is the best I've had since I was in high school in California. SO NUMMY. SO INEXPENSIVE. A+ WOULD NOM AGAIN. Here's a measure of value/quality: they have no air conditioner, and I DID NOT CARE because the food is just. that. good.

23.description: Authentic home cooked food will have me coming back for more. Super fresh daily lunch buffet with a side of Lumpia Shanghai rolls nailed it for us. Will be back for crispy Pata next time and lonsilog. Thanks Nicki for your newbie's welcome. Great place with lots of family and friends.

47.description: I came across this place on a search for good Filipino food and was pleasantly surprise at the quality of food. They usually have some hot trays of chicken, pork and tripe adobo rocking at the front and if you are in a hurry to get some food in you this stuff is ready to go. If you are in the mood for some tocino or longaniza you can order off the menu and this stuff is well worth the 5 minute wait to get it out to you. They also have all the other traditional filipino food on the menu so the selection is everything you'd really want. The only downside of this place is that the inside is very very sparse. It has a few rows of tables along either wall and the inside is very compact. You could probably only fit about 25 people in here total at one time. That being said the food is still awesome. I wouldn't really recommend this place for a fine dinning experience but if you are just popping in for some quick (and delicious) food, or takeout, it's the spot to go.

8.description: The weekend ayce buffet ($8.45 as of 01/10/2015) is totally worth it!  I am SO sorry that I forgot about taking the pictures after my initial plate.  I sincerely apologize for that.  My tip is to come in within 30 minutes after opening so that they will all the dishes ready and hot!

31.description: Called to complain about the food being salty and got an answer that i should not buy food from them then. Rude!

34.description: Update everyone if you guys close or open I try calling no answer what kind of store gonna put big call number but don't know how to answer stupid

16.description: Just eat here. Simple as that. Home cooking, fast! Everything is good. Small joint, but busy and the staff is unbelievably nice!  Only being an out of town visitor, I now crave their food! Lol I miss you longcilog!

13.description: This place have the best Filipino food! I finally found a palabok that taste like real palabok. It reminds me of home. The serving was huge for the price. The guy was so nice he gave me free kare-kare to try which was so delicious as well. The mais con yelo was delicious too. Everything was great. This place is now my favorite Filipino restaurant in Chicago. I just hope I will always get lucky to find a spot to park. :)

11.description: This is the best Filipino restaurant that I've been to! The interior space is small but with food so good it doesn't matter! The food portions are large for the amount that you pay- everything is fresh and delicious. Their Halo halo is the best I've had! I love everything about Ruby's! I recommend it to everyone.

39.description: I think I have found my new Filipino joint by a long shot. This place offers cheap food packed with a punch. We have been wanting to come here for a long time, but something always comes up. I finally got to try it and I will definitely be back. We got the Lumpia Shanghai, Tapsilog and Longsilog which comes with garlic rice and 2 fried eggs cooked to perfection. The Lumpia Shanghai was probably one of the best I have tried. It doesn't taste like you are just eating the breading like most places. Everything tasted amazing. I wish they had a combo platter where we can get the Tapsilog with the Longsilog. The guy who works at the front was also very very friendly and helpful!

37.description: FIRE!! I love this place. It is a small hole in the wall near Montrose and Pulaski but it is super yummy. I love the egg rolls and the noodles. It is very cheaply priced and you get nice huge portions. Never a bad experience, If you are craving Filipino food this is the place to go!

0.description: Per usual, Nic is awesome and food is fresh. I urge you to try buffet on weekends - can't lose with $9.One thing my parents mentioned was that the food was kind of cold. I personally didn't notice this, but I just downed everything without chewing, so I wasn't as observant.

38.description: Just eat here. Simple as that. Home cooking, fast! Everything is good. Small joint, but busy and the staff is unbelievably nice!  Only being an out of town visitor, I now crave their food! Lol I miss you longcilog!

51.description: Insanely underpriced for the quality and variety of dishes this place churns out every day of the week. That is why it's very difficult to find a seat to enjoy the $8.45 all you want weekends only buffet (try early when they won't be running out of food yet or early-late like 2:30, but that's not even a safe bet for seating at the communal tables.) From 3-5 you can find a seat, but they might be out of the beef and tripe stew with peanut sauce and that would be a shame, or running short of my very favorite: the fatty pork spareribs balanced perfectly with sour tamarind broth, green beans and potatoes. They won't be out of crispy pork belly, though, and you can always comfort yourself with that thought. Crispy chiccharon-like skin; tender fatty meat, served with a vinegar based sauce or a weirdly generically named "all purpose sauce," that really gets the job done.If you want to simply choose "ulams" or single dishes from the buffet -- and the two I named are solid winners but so is everything else I've tried here -- with rice to go, that will set you back just 5.45 to try two. The counter service here is amazing considering how completely insane the line, the takeout, the constant phonecall orders and the one guy working the register and counter. Everyone knows Ricky's name -- he's one of the owner's two sons and he has a zen like calm you would need in such an environment. Upon noticing visitors, Ricky was kind both times I was there to explain every dish on offer at the buffet with no sense that he was exasperated or hurried. People come here knowing they're going to wait, and they do so good naturedly. Please, if you come here, do the same.

27.description: Fantastic food worth driving from Indianapolis to eat. Best bihon and shanghai lumpia made by the best people around. Nickie is awesome and will never steer you wrong on what to try. A must try restaurant!

32.description: A friend of mine lives a block away and he had mentioned that the food here is great.  He mentioned that they offer a buffet but it turned out that the buffet is only on the weekend.  We ended up ordering two combo plates (only $5.75) and the portions were very generous. We both got to select two items so i asked for the crab cake and the adobo chicken.  That chicken was fall-off-the-bone tender and very flavorful.  The crab cake was essentially egg foo young and it was a pretty big patty.  My two items were served with a bunch of white rice.  So much that I was not able to finish it.My only suggestion would be to upgrade the decor a bit.  Some wall art would be nice and possibly nicer furniture.  I think this would make this place perfect!  I will definitely be back when I'm in the area again.

54.description: Great food with great prices but a tiny hole in the wall, so I wouldn't come with a big group. Coming here in the summer is just like being in the Philippines since they don't have any air conditioning and everyone in there is Filipino, but it's worth it for the food. They have a lunch buffet that's dirt cheap and has a lot of choices. This is very authentic and is like my parents' cooking.

48.description: Tocilog !!!!! Soooooo gooooooooood! It comes with yummy garlic rice! This place is a hole in the wall but it really does have great Filipino food. There's a buffet of traditional Filipino dishes that are ready to serve. If you want tocilog or tapsilog call in ahead of time to avoid waiting. The egg rolls are good too!Btw, bring cash they don't take credit cards.

44.description: Went here last night with my boyfriend because we were looking for a great new Filipino option.I can't believe how inexpensive it is! The garlic rice is delicious, and the tapsilog was definitely our favorite item. The tocilog was not my favorite- it was kinda dry and tough, but I guess I'm just not that into fried meat. Lumpia shanghai were good also.The dessert looked awesome but it was VERY much corn flavored, and I'm sure it's an acquired taste, but it's not my taste yet :)In the meantime, everything was at least good, and the tapsilog was great. It was clean, fast, and affordable. I'll definitely be back.

24.description: Beef jerky for dinner, that's what tapsilog reminds me of. When it comes to finding the great hole in the wall places, definitely come check out Ruby's.I'm not very familiar with Filipino food, but some of the items reminds me of Chinese "fast food" like fried rice and roast pork, just "flipped". Ruby's has an interesting format. There's a board on the wall that I ordered the Topsilog ( I suppose the rice box) and then there's the pre-cooked trays of food. I got in half an hour before closed and I thought, shoot, they ran out of food, but they cook the topsilog in the kitchen.I got half beef and half pork - the pork is way better, beef is cut thick and tough. Both are meat candy that can be offset with the vinegar onion sauce. The rice is fantastic and TWO eggs that looks partially poached and fried. It's two meals in ONE.I'm ok with the lumpia. They are like cigarette sized egg rolls, a bit salty, just dip it in sweet chili sauce. It's super greasy, so be prepared to be stuffed. It's cheap, it's good, it's alot and it's perfect for take out.

7.description: Today I tried the tocilog, BBQ chicken and sansrival. Wow, it was all delicious. Ruby's has become a family favorite. I took my picky son (burgers & pizza only, thanks!) today to give it a try. He loved it. Thank you Jesus! We now have more food options. =)As always the counter service is perfect. Nick is always so patient and gets me to try new things each time. Everything he's recommended has been on point. The prices are unbelievably great. Well worth every cent.

49.description: My dad has been coming to Ruby's for years. It's comfort and delicious. I recently have been making trips here for take out and have been met with not only great food but kindness by the staff. Family owned and quality food is what this place is about. My favorites include, tapasilog/tocilog, palabok, crispy pata, any other turo-turo specials they have daily. Garlic rice here is also very good! Friendliness of staff and great food will always keep me and my family coming back!

40.description: Pretty much everything at Rubys is flame. Tapsilog, tocilog, longsilog - these basic filipino breakfasts are on the dot, the tapa, tocino, and longanisa all cooked to perfection along with two eggs and awesome sinangag. The lumpia is flame as well, along with other filipino staples, Kare Kare, Dinuguan, they got it all, and it's all worth the money.There's an all you can eat special on the weekends. Gets pretty crowded, so get their early or in the mid afternoon, after the lunch rush. The service here is really good, Nicky, one of the owners has become like a brother to me, and everyone who works here is really nice.The only downside is it can get kinda hot, and the place is it a little small but there are way too many upsides for those things to weigh Ruby's down.

53.description: I'm still dreaming about the tocilog I had last weekend at Ruby's Fast Food. It was a huge portion and I had to stop myself from eating the entire meal so I wouldn't bust at the seams.Upon arrival at this hole in the wall Filipino food spot, we were met with a super long line. We waited in line about 30 minutes before making it up to the counter to finally order. You place your order with a super nice guy, pay the man your money [Pro-Tip: Ca$h only], then wait for your goods. It then took another 15 minutes for our food to be ready. It's well worth the wait but I highly recommend going in non-peak times (ie opening & closing) to avoid the insane waits. Once we got our food, we decided to take it to go as there were no seats in the small restaurant. I tried the:Tocilog $5.75 - This meal was mine, mine, mine! And I'm so glad. Absolutely my favorite thing I had. Came with a huge heaping portion of garlic rice, two eggs and a good portion of tocino (sweetened cured pork). Usually this dish is served with sunnyside up eggs but at Ruby's they do fried eggs. I'm down with it. Seriously so good, I could eat this meal everyday. Tapsilog $5.75 - Same as above except substitute the tocino with tapa (dried meat). Honestly I preferred the tocino but still a very solid meal. My friend liked his tapsilog better than my tocilog so to each their own!Lumpia $4.45 for 12 pieces - Every Asian culture seems to have their own take on what we think of as an eggroll and lumpia is just that for Filipinos. At Ruby's they serve Lumpia Shanghai which are thin, long rolls filled with meat, some random veggies & spices, deep fried to make one strip of goodness. They come with sauce for dipping. Yum!Prices are insanely reasonable and considering how big the portions are, super cheap! Amazing value and even better food. I hate to do comparisons but Ruby's is WAY better than Uncle Mike's. It's replacing UM's on my list of go-to Flip breakfast joints. I want it right now...AHHHH!

30.description: My coworkers and I have ordered takeout combos from here several times. They don't disappoint. I've tried the longsilog and tapsilog and both were very filling and tasted great. They have generous portions.I've been in the restaurant only once and from what I could tell it was a bit dim. It's got a down-home greasy spoon kind of vibe. My 5 stars are for the food quality, however and not the ambiance.

46.description: The food at Ruby's is the real deal, and explains why there's usually a line to order every time I go, which is always worth the wait. After eating here about a half dozen times, the best dishes to try are definitely the Dinuguan and Crispy Pata (call ahead) if you're an adventurous eater. Portions are generous and the prices are very affordable. The hours seem to vary, I don't think they open at 9am on weekends, but can't seem to find their posted hours. Don't forget to bring cash either. Highly recommend Ruby's.

1.description: If I could give Ruby's more than 5 starts, I would in a  heartbeat.I don't think I have ever walked into this shop and had it not be crowded. The food here is incredible and the portion sizes are huge for the price. On top of that, the owners are genuine individuals who care about their food and the patrons they serve. This past weekend, my boyfriend had a death in his family and needed a significantly large order on short notice. Rubys was very accommodating and had a catering size platter of lumpia and pancit ready within an hour. I can not explain how much it meant, not only to my boyfriend and I, but his family as well. Most places would not be willing to fill such a large order on such short notice. However, at Ruby's, not only were we told that it would be no problem at all, but they didn't even charge extra for the last minute order. I would HIGHLY, HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommend trying it out. Thank you Rubys for everything. You are an Albany Park gem.

55.description: I popped into Ruby's for some early takeout dinner on a chilly Sunday afternoon.  Ruby's closes early on the weekend (5PM ??) so I was not really sure what would be left when I wandered in.  There were actually a few people in line ahead of me (all of the customers seemed to be Filipino - that's a good sign).  The first thing everyone seems to notice is the small buffet area, and I think I will have to pop in earlier on some weekend day to try out all of these selections.  I just had to order the lumpia a la carte (I always order lumpia at a Filipino restaurant).  There are 12 pieces in the order of lumpia shanghai, and these long and slender lumpia stayed remarkably crunchy even after taking them home.  They tasted great especially when dipped in a marmalade-like sweet and spicy sauce.  The big box of tocilog is indeed a considerable portion (and under six bucks), and I am pleased to say that I have leftovers for the next day.  The long stringy pieces of glazed pork "tocino", intermingled with a few pieces of glossy fat, are almost jerky-like in chewiness (some call this stuff Filipino bacon) but the flavoring is deliciously sweet and hearty.  The tocilog comes with a heap of garlic rice and two fried eggs.  I barely used my tub of vinegary dipping sauce dip, as the pork is quite tasty as is.  I also ordered a couple of dessert items, including a tapioca pudding that was more interesting than tasty.  It was a very starchy mix of mochi balls, banana, and some sort of potato-like pieces.  I don't think I will have that again, but I will be back to Ruby's for crunchy lumpia and more delicious Filipino food.

9.description: I came here after seeing this place on Bizzare Foods.  Everything here is pretty homey and definitely pretty popular.  On the weekends, there is the buffet as well!We ordered the Tapsilog, a variety of other dishes, Coconut Corn Cake, and the Halo-Halo.  Overall, I thought everything was not too bad.  I can see why it is pretty popular here and everything is affordable.  The coconut corn cake was sweet but not too sweet.  It was pretty good for a mini dessert.  I think I may have been a bit crazy ordering the halo-halo on such a cold day, but I couldn't resist.  Loved the dessert and definitely would order it again if I am ever back in Chicago.

26.description: Today I tried the tocilog, BBQ chicken and sansrival. Wow, it was all delicious. Ruby's has become a family favorite. I took my picky son (burgers & pizza only, thanks!) today to give it a try. He loved it. Thank you Jesus! We now have more food options. =)As always the counter service is perfect. Nick is always so patient and gets me to try new things each time. Everything he's recommended has been on point. The prices are unbelievably great. Well worth every cent.

25.description: Small place but great Filipino food.  Always great food.  This is one of my favorite Filipino restaurants.

12.description: The best Filipino food in town. If you are ever near Albany park try going to Ruby's to have some authentic Filipino food at a very affordable price. Their food is the best, specially the lechon kawali and dinuguan (blood soup). If you decide to stop by make sure to bring cash since they only take cash no credit cards, and it's only street parking. All in all this the place to go if your craving for Filipino food.

59.description: A no-frills, hole-in-the-wall restaurant serving delicious and authentic Filipino food. Also, the prices are surprisingly low for the generous servings. I took my non-Filipino friend who has never had Filipino food before. She was a bit unsure about the items from the turo-turo, so the guy working there gladly offered a sampling. It was a pretty big sample too....not a spoonful, but a styrofoam bowl filled with several spoonfuls of the dish. My friend ordered the 2 ulam with rice for $5.75. The styofoam container was heavy! It consisted of a generous amount of garlic rice with 2 bowls practically overflowing with the ulam. I order the bangsilog, which was fish with garlic rice and eggs. The silogs are $5.75 as well. We both enjoyed our meals and left with happy, full stomachs. Overall, a great, authentic bang for your buck!

21.description: Filipino food done deliciously, authentically and super-affordably, & all with great friendly host!

17.description: if only theres a negative stars i eould give it! it says here and up at the store they ipen at 11 we came last time and it says close now open tomorrow. the next day we came they open at 12noon it would be helpful if they will post it there including the time they will open the next day. now im calling to see if they open here in yelp. still its close.. wtf is happening?! so lazy now cuZ u know people want your food? then its not like that if u wanna keep ur business open on time dont be a lazy owner!

10.description: I found this place on yelp after getting a nail removed at Elmo's Tire, just down the block. I am not flipino, nor have much experience eating flipino food. Ruby's son (I forgot to ask his name), took the time to explain the canteen style food for me. He even volunteered to let me sample every menu item. We are talking about 1 inch cuts of meat here of salmon, pork, and beef, all in different sauces.  I was almost full from trying all the samples!  I'm bad with names but I got the pork cooked in shrimp paste, salmon with onions, and fried beef w garlic fried rice and two eggs. He knew I was a first timer, so threw in a container of spagetti and leftover beef sauce to eat with rice. Try the purple desert made of purple yam called ube. Homemade and delicious!! I've been in a rut lately with food, not really craving or enjoying anything, just going through the motions for sustenance. I think it was because the food is different from what I'm use to eating that I really enjoyed the food. Very refreshing to enjoy food this way again.This place is really great. I grew up in albany park and amazed that today is the first time I've heard of this place (the restaurant has been open for 19 years). I will definitely go back to try their weekend buffet, lumpia, and lechon. This place also caters, so I'll be getting a tray of lumpias from here, rather than my usual place.  The prices are very reasonable! I had a ton of food with all the freebies that feed 3 people with plenty of leftovers. Total was $16 and change. The prices are very reasonable (5.75 for a 2 combo plate) Please support this family, this place is a true hidden gem!

5.description: They need to put their correct business hours because everytime we go, they are always close and its in the afternoon.

3.description: Me and hubby loves this place! Love their comfort food. and Nick and his brother are awesome! Everything they cook here are authentic and very very tasty!

35.description: Seriously tasty Filipino food, very legit. Too often Pinoy restaurants in the U.S. disappoint, but not this place. Don't expect much ambiance or even much seating, but do order the longsilog and enjoy two perfectly charred, plump longganisa sausages with super fresh, deliciously garlicky rice and two eggs fried over hard. The lumpia shanghai were properly skinny, crispy and tasty. The only thing I wasn't in love with was the pancit palabok, which was a bit too saucy and with too large of chicharron chunks for my taste. But I admit, that may just be a "my lola used to make it different" type of gripe. I'll be back!

19.description: I'm still dreaming about the tocilog I had last weekend at Ruby's Fast Food. It was a huge portion and I had to stop myself from eating the entire meal so I wouldn't bust at the seams.Upon arrival at this hole in the wall Filipino food spot, we were met with a super long line. We waited in line about 30 minutes before making it up to the counter to finally order. You place your order with a super nice guy, pay the man your money [Pro-Tip: Ca$h only], then wait for your goods. It then took another 15 minutes for our food to be ready. It's well worth the wait but I highly recommend going in non-peak times (ie opening & closing) to avoid the insane waits. Once we got our food, we decided to take it to go as there were no seats in the small restaurant. I tried the:Tocilog $5.75 - This meal was mine, mine, mine! And I'm so glad. Absolutely my favorite thing I had. Came with a huge heaping portion of garlic rice, two eggs and a good portion of tocino (sweetened cured pork). Usually this dish is served with sunnyside up eggs but at Ruby's they do fried eggs. I'm down with it. Seriously so good, I could eat this meal everyday. Tapsilog $5.75 - Same as above except substitute the tocino with tapa (dried meat). Honestly I preferred the tocino but still a very solid meal. My friend liked his tapsilog better than my tocilog so to each their own!Lumpia $4.45 for 12 pieces - Every Asian culture seems to have their own take on what we think of as an eggroll and lumpia is just that for Filipinos. At Ruby's they serve Lumpia Shanghai which are thin, long rolls filled with meat, some random veggies & spices, deep fried to make one strip of goodness. They come with sauce for dipping. Yum!Prices are insanely reasonable and considering how big the portions are, super cheap! Amazing value and even better food. I hate to do comparisons but Ruby's is WAY better than Uncle Mike's. It's replacing UM's on my list of go-to Flip breakfast joints. I want it right now...AHHHH!

28.description: Pretty decent authentic Filipino food. For an amazing price. Not cleanest of places. Sometimes their hours are a little wack.

45.description: 5 stars = Food +3, Value +1, Atmosphere +1Would I recommend? Not even a question.  Ruby's was my favorite restaurant in Chicago - over hot doug's, way too much chicago pizza, and othersWhat to expect? A small space with a community atmosphere and some amazing food (I've never had Filipino before so I can't speak on authenticity) --Food - 3 / 3 We got the Sunday Lunch buffet.  $8.45 for some of the most amazing food I've ever had.  So good, that I forgot to take pictures, sorry guys! (Some) of the Food I loved: -Seafood with mussels stew - really good and something you wouldn't expect from such a cheaply priced buffet -Crispy pork (similar to the pata) - I was really bummed I didn't have time to order the crispy pata (you have to call a few days ahead), but this was a very good substitute-Fried chicken - Perhaps the best fried Chicken I ever had -think the adobo spices just worked-Desserts - Ernie and Arnie just threw this in for us for free because we were from out of town.  There was one cinnamon soup + dumpling dish that was like nothing I've ever had (a good thing)One negative: The tapsilog ($5.75) - maybe it's because I never had it before, but the meat was too dry for me. --Value - 1/1 Umm $8.45 for all-you-can-eat, filipino food that I can get nowhere else.  Enough said--Atmosphere - 1/1 Ernie and Arnie were so nice and really contributed to the family /community atmosphere--The other stuff: This is the reason I wanted to start Yelping! Ruby's is a small, totally unassuming,  but amazing culinary experience.  This is my definition of a 5 star restaurant. Thanks for the recommendation Andrew Zimmerman!

33.description: The weekend ayce buffet ($8.45 as of 01/10/2015) is totally worth it!  I am SO sorry that I forgot about taking the pictures after my initial plate.  I sincerely apologize for that.  My tip is to come in within 30 minutes after opening so that they will all the dishes ready and hot!

43.description: Had lunch there for the first time today. This place definitely has a following. I waited in line for about 5-10 minutes but it was worth it. The food was great and very reasonably priced. If you're hungry and on a budget, this is the place to go.

2.description: Been here twice and both times didn't disappoint. Food is great for a really good price. Will definitely come back again :)

18.description: I love this place! Nikki is very nice! I wish this place was big enough to seat more people during lunch. During the summer days it would be nice to have the AC or have 2 fans circulating the air. I love their palabok! Really can't beat the price for a Filipino meal. My husband who is not Filipino loves this place a lot. Don't forget to bring cash when you go!

41.description: A few years ago I used to attend parties hosted by a Filipino friend of mine, at which, instead of dancing and socializing, I preferred to shovel homemade seafood rice, pork in black rice and pieces of whole-roasted pig into my face until I fell asleep comfortably atop a warm and cozy VCR. Needless to say, I am no longer invited to those parties, but luckily for me there is Ruby's.At less than $9 for AYCE, there were definitely to be no regrets, especially with dessert included, but with just the first bite of pork skin in a purple stew my eyes rolled back into my skull and I silently unleashed a scream of, "YES!!"True, there is no A/C here and I did come a hot summer day. True also that it bothered me a lot more when I was outside. It would feel wrong to eat this food in these amounts on a summer afternoon in any other way. (If it really bothers you, I hear it gets pretty cold in Chicago in the winter.)Menu changes often, you say? Well, I'm definitely coming back...right after I digest.

52.description: Best Filipino food and Best food overall! I go here almost every Sunday and even have to make a trip here for lunch during the week just to get my cilog fix!Their prices here are very very reasonable and the closest to Lola's cooking as you can get. Or at least the closest it can get for me=) I recommend this place to Everyone that loves Filipino food and food in general. Ruby's is definitely one of the Best restaurants in Chicago! Lines can get long and seats are scarce but SO worth it!

50.description: As far as phillipino food this place hits the spot. Nothing fancy, it's just really solid food executed well and priced ridiculously affordable. My favorite will continue to be the tapsilog which is served with garlic fried rice and two eggs over medium. Hearty and flavorful food.

4.description: 3 stars from me because I lean more towards quality over quantity. The food is great for the price ($5.75 for tocino special, which includes a large amount of garlic fried rice and two over-hard eggs), but it is indeed "fast food". We ordered the tocilog and tapsilog, both of which were very oily and over-fried. I walked out feeling like my arteries were clogged, but it was a good quick meal.

6.description: Beef jerky for dinner, that's what tapsilog reminds me of. When it comes to finding the great hole in the wall places, definitely come check out Ruby's.I'm not very familiar with Filipino food, but some of the items reminds me of Chinese "fast food" like fried rice and roast pork, just "flipped". Ruby's has an interesting format. There's a board on the wall that I ordered the Topsilog ( I suppose the rice box) and then there's the pre-cooked trays of food. I got in half an hour before closed and I thought, shoot, they ran out of food, but they cook the topsilog in the kitchen.I got half beef and half pork - the pork is way better, beef is cut thick and tough. Both are meat candy that can be offset with the vinegar onion sauce. The rice is fantastic and TWO eggs that looks partially poached and fried. It's two meals in ONE.I'm ok with the lumpia. They are like cigarette sized egg rolls, a bit salty, just dip it in sweet chili sauce. It's super greasy, so be prepared to be stuffed. It's cheap, it's good, it's alot and it's perfect for take out.

22.description: Fabulous! Whenever I have a party to attend, and don't have time to make something homemade, I call up Ruby's and order 50 lumpia to go. Everyone LOVES them. Great tasting food at an unbelievable price.

15.description: i love filipino food a lot and this place is great! everytime i come here, it is busy and packed.. the service is good here too.. but let me warn you.. if you come in a very hot day.. prepare to sweat inside cause i dont think they got a/c there lol..ive tried longsilog, tocilog, tapsilog, adobo, lumpia shanghai and lechon.. they were all good.. it comes with garlic rice and egg too which is delicious but very oily..the longsilog and tocilog is flavorful and tender.. love it! the tapsilog was a little too tough for my liking but it was good non the less.. the adobo is great and well seasoned.. the lechon was decent.. a bit too salty for me... and cant forget the lumpia.. its a very great appetizer and its just amazing.. cant wait to come back!

57.description: I just picked up a huge plate of pancit bihon for a Filipino fundraiser for my work. I just wanted to let you guys know that it was a great hit! Everyone in the office loved it and came for seconds and thirds! Maraming Salamat!

20.description: I love the food and the guy in the front is helpful and polite... BUTT this place is extremely unorganized! They make their own hours, never pick up the phone, and there's no bathroom! I will always come back for the tocilog breakfast because it has crack inside of it, but I dread everything else that comes with the experience of dining at Ruby's. This is the soup nazi Seinfeld episode only its the filipino version. "NO SOUP FOR YOU!"

36.description: I'm a nurse.  Which inevitably means I work with lots of Filipinos who love to eat.  Word of mouth recommendations are the way to go...and my experience at Ruby's confirms this. The food is excellent and the menu constantly changes so you'll always find variety here.  There are staples like noodle and breakfast dishes that are made to order but they have a range of curries, proteins, etc that's ready to eat.  The guy behind the counter Nicky is so welcoming and helped to explain the menu that was in Tagalog for a non Tagalog speaking person.  It's a no frills restaurant but the service and food are on point.  This neighborhood joint has been filling bellies for 18 years strong.  I'm definitely coming back!

14.description: Excellent service and fresh, delicious food.   Go there on the weekends for the buffett.

3.description: I walk by this store every day and noticed that they do make the kimchi in the store.  I've seen boxes upon boxes of Napa cabbage piled high inside.  The woman who works there is usually busy picking through the cabbage, preparing it for kimchi.  The kimchi I've purchased here is very fresh, which also means it's mild in flavor.  Personally, I like the more assertive flavor of "older" kimchi, which has a nice spicy and sour kick to it.  I had to go to Joong Boo Market for the latter.  But for those that prefer fresh, mild kimchi, check this place out.  It's $3 for a small jar and $5 for a large jar (think family-size).

1.description: Where else in Chicago is there a store specializing in kimchi? This place is perfect, with a wide variety of kimchi and all sorts of other Korean goodies. As far as the comment about them not having older kimchi, I've been going here for several years, and they've always had it--you just have to ask for it.

2.description: Thanks to Mike Sula I sought out NCK one day and squelched my concerns over the place's appearance and purchased some really good kimchee. It's much better than store-bought products with the different additives. I also purchased a giant jar of doen jang (fermented bean paste) and it should last the rest of my lifetime. It is much more flavorful than the packaged doen jang from Hmart. Don't be afraid to go in -- the woman inside is very helpful.

0.description: They have black garlic. So good, and so good for you! The store is closed on Sunday,

4.description: I am by no means an expert on Korean cuisine, so I just pointed at the items and the cheerful little woman happily packed them up for me.  I ended up with some chopped kimchee, some whole cabbage kimchee, some sort of pickled soy beans, some small anchovies, some sort of fish paste concoction, etc, etc.  If you like the fermented flavors, this place is for you!  Not as big of a selection as some places (no pickled garlic stems or pickled crabs, etc), but a good supply of lovingly created, spicy cabbages.

1.description: The tacos were just okay. The tortillas were dry and hard when we ate at the restaurant. The enchiladas were good but just a bit spicier than I can handle. Overall, just average. Not bad for the price and portion. BYOB.

9.description: Come for the Spanish Soap Operas, stay for the food!Let me start by saying this place is authentic. I found myself trying to tap into my college Spanish courses to remember what some of the basic food words were. In addition to that they have true Spanish candy at the register and Univision Spanish Soaps on the television.But I suppose I should review the food. I stepped out of my comfort zone to try the Mexico City style Torta Cubana. For those of you who have had the Gargantuan at Jimmy Johns... this is the Mexican equivalent. It comes fully loaded with every meat known to man as well as an egg and who knows what else. It had good flavored but their was just too much of everything which made it tough to handle.My girlfriend had more traditional food and I would consider it good but nothing to write home (or I suppose in detail on Yelp) about.Overall it's a nice little place with a friendly staff. The atmosphere feels as legitimate as any other and the food/menu seem to match.

23.description: One word...YUM! This place is the real deal, great authentic food. They have a sandwich called the Pambazo and it is excellent! The staff are very friendly.

12.description: Love this place, the food is amazing and they have a great variety of food that can be somewhat difficult to find outside the south side of Chicago, like Pambazos, chalupas, authentic huaraches, and suadero. I recommend all of these, specially the pambazos they are delicious.

21.description: We just moved to Albany Park and decided we wanted to check out a local place but didn't know where. We checked Yelp for places within walking distance (parking is at a premium on my block) and we decided on this one... and it was an excellent choice.There were only a few people eating there and we walked in and placed our order right away and it was done quickly. I had a steak torta and my bf had a 1/2 chicken and 1/2 steak burrito, they were both AWESOME! I also had a lime Jarritos--- the total bill was around $13. Both the torta and the burrito were big enough that we each only ate half and saved the rest for later. :)I'll definitely be visiting here again.

16.description: This place used to be a Korean restaurant, and you can still see remnants from the past here.  The built in table grills that were used for Korean BBQ are now covered and replaced with round Mexican artwork.  If it were up to me, I would have created some kind of Korean-Mexican taqueria BBQ place.  Kinda like that food truck in LA... kalbi tacos and horchata soju anyone?  *sigh*  A girl can dream.Anyway, back to reality!  This is your basic taqueria, with an extra room next door for parties.  I ordered a carnitas taco, a suadero taco, and chips & guac.  Both tacos were topped with cilantro and onion, with salsa verde on the side.  The carnitas taco was just "ok".  The meat was very moist and tender, but it tasted like they had cooked it with a bit of lime juice, which I didn't care for.  I preferred the suadero taco, which is chopped beef brisket.  The brisket was crispy on the outside, but tender within.  Suadero isn't something I see too often on taqueria menus here, so it's worth trying.  And the guac was fine (a little too chunky with tomatoes, though).I noticed that they serve pata tostadas, which I'd like to try during my next visit.  As far as the rest of the menu goes, it's regular taqueria fare that many of you already know by heart.

17.description: We just moved to Albany Park and decided we wanted to check out a local place but didn't know where. We checked Yelp for places within walking distance (parking is at a premium on my block) and we decided on this one... and it was an excellent choice.There were only a few people eating there and we walked in and placed our order right away and it was done quickly. I had a steak torta and my bf had a 1/2 chicken and 1/2 steak burrito, they were both AWESOME! I also had a lime Jarritos--- the total bill was around $13. Both the torta and the burrito were big enough that we each only ate half and saved the rest for later. :)I'll definitely be visiting here again.

10.description: I gave this place another try. Unfortunately, I will not be returning. I got steak tacos again, still small, but the bigger issue was that the meat was very poor quality. I kept biting into crunchy cartilage. I couldn't finish my food and ended up throwing it away.

5.description: The huaraches are the best ov had in Chicago, and iv had plenty. Byob!

11.description: As the other reviews said, not much from the outside, and do not expect much from the décor (maybe used to be a Korean bbq, because of the tables have the insert and the lower table has panels that move for insert of the equipment?)  But the food is great, fabulous guacamole and love, love, love the nachos!  They do not add guacamole, but chunks of fresh avocado.  Either no meat or chicken.  All cooked to order.  BYOB, so price is cheap!  We love it. They are sweet to us, we don't speak much Spanish, nor they English, but we make it work and the one waitress recognizes us and is sweet.  Must be a family restaurant.  Only negative is one night we had ordered the guacamole, and it was so limy , it wasn't good - but the rest of the dinner was fine and we probably could have returned it, just didn't.  We have eaten there 7 times. We eat usually about 7 or 8, and by the time we leave it is much busier.

22.description: This place used to be a Korean restaurant, and you can still see remnants from the past here.  The built in table grills that were used for Korean BBQ are now covered and replaced with round Mexican artwork.  If it were up to me, I would have created some kind of Korean-Mexican taqueria BBQ place.  Kinda like that food truck in LA... kalbi tacos and horchata soju anyone?  *sigh*  A girl can dream.Anyway, back to reality!  This is your basic taqueria, with an extra room next door for parties.  I ordered a carnitas taco, a suadero taco, and chips & guac.  Both tacos were topped with cilantro and onion, with salsa verde on the side.  The carnitas taco was just "ok".  The meat was very moist and tender, but it tasted like they had cooked it with a bit of lime juice, which I didn't care for.  I preferred the suadero taco, which is chopped beef brisket.  The brisket was crispy on the outside, but tender within.  Suadero isn't something I see too often on taqueria menus here, so it's worth trying.  And the guac was fine (a little too chunky with tomatoes, though).I noticed that they serve pata tostadas, which I'd like to try during my next visit.  As far as the rest of the menu goes, it's regular taqueria fare that many of you already know by heart.

0.description: The food is always good. The staff is always pleasant the place is always clean. I recommend the guacamole and the tacos pastor! I even did chorizo and eggs one day here for breakfast!

20.description: love this family bussines restaurant , is always packed ,is a real mexican food whitch i love, yeaaa  ....... you whait for your meal some times we whait 20  minutes  but is delicious   we try the guaraches,chalupas poblanas,or the tortas they are huge i love the coffee they  put cinnamon stik  awesome   we definaly come back soon.

19.description: Erika V, I totally agree with you that this place would be spectacular with the grilling table. Hands down, Cardona's is my favorite place for Mexican grub. The ingredients are a lot more sophisticated here: You get lettuce, tomatoes, grated cheese, and sometimes avocado on your tacos without any extra cost. The meats are very flavorful although they can be a tad salty at times. I also love the fact that they sell American food here (hot dogs , hamburgers) because I developed a strange affliction in my childhood to enjoy french fries with salsa.  Although I haven't tried a lot of dishes here, the ones that I have (enchiladas, chile relleno, burritos) were all superior to those served at other restaurants. Did I also mention that their portions are huge?

2.description: I've been there before and can't believe I haven't written a yelp review yet.  Sorry about that, but Happy 2015, yelpers.  However, good luck on finding a restaurant that is open today.  Cardona's is certainly open for business.  This is a place they you can find all things Mexican on the menu, such as tortas, huaraches, tacos, soups, and refreshing drinks.  You name it, they've got it all!  Although they're tricky on providing water, unless you ask for it, their drinks are quite good.  I've had the piña colada and the limon Aguas frescas.  You will definitely need one of those to go with the complimentary starter salsa.  That salsa...let me tell you, is super on point.  Nevertheless, it's spicy and please be aware.  I constantly order different items every time I visit there.  Today I had the pechuga empanizada; they are like Mexican-style chicken patties with beans, rice, and lettuce on the side.  Hubby, on the other hand, had two (2) servings of huaraches.  One (1) serving is already quite large and big enough to fill up a commercial plastic oval plate, if you know what I'm talking about.  Well, he consumed two (2) of them...I swear to God that I'm not starving him at home...I'm a good wife.  With two (2) drinks and two (2) entrees, the total came to $25 before tax and tips.  The service is not as speedy as a McDonald's drive-through or other fast-food type of Mexican joints, but the three (3) ladies who work there are "Working." Yes, it's with the capital "W."  Thus, be patient and watch some Mexican soap opera in the meantime.

18.description: We are somewhat new to the Albany Park area and always looking for new restaurants to try - especially now that it is nice out! We decided to try Cardona's tonight and it was fantastic - I'm already planning on bring my friends here. We both had the tacos - he carne asada and I had fish (special order - it's Friday during lent!!) and both were delicious. My fish was pretty amazing - super tender and very nicely flavored. And the BEST re-fried beans I've had in the entire city...and I've been to a few very good Mexican Restaurants. And, their horchata was OUT of this WORLD. Just perfect flavor and thickness...I don't like it when it's too thin. But honestly, the waitress was friendly, the set up is pretty cool, super cheap, equal amounts of families (very well behaved children) and couples and some drama-filled Novelas on T.V. If you want some delicious Mexican food, this is the place to go.

13.description: I like this place i really do. Their tacos are Bomb! But it seems you have to wait a AWFUL long time just to get your food. I ordered like 7 tacos all steak took way to long in my opinion. They weren't all that busy either, I don't know but ill come back and see if they will speed it up next time.

4.description: They make their own tortillas! I'm usually a fan of flour, but I do love fresh made corn tortillas. I just stopped by for a carry out snack - 1 Rajas taco. Very good, green salsa is pretty spicy. Looking forward to going back.

6.description: Yummy.  This place is a gem with wonderful,  authentic,  freshest-around Mexican food.   The service is great,  and the Mexican  soap operas on the TV  are almost as great.   The only bad thing I could say is that there was too much good food to finish.

15.description: The meals here are very filling! It's a great price for what you pay for. I ordered a veggie burrito, it was a bit bland/dry. My friend ordered a chicken dish and really enjoyed it! Nice place to go, friendly people.

7.description: very unprofessional. ordered tacos and was told that they were going to be ready within 10 minutes or less. I decide to go a bit early and the door was closed and the front lights were turned off. I knock and knock as I watch them chat away, never opened the door.  Stood there for more than 5 minutes. Got home call them and I told the lady that I had went and that the door was closed and that I was knocking she then hangs up. How rude! Calls me back within 10 minutes or less and says, "the door is open you can come and pick up your order now." Uhm, no thank u! Never ordering again.

8.description: Doesn't look like anything special from the outside, but definitely worth it. Super cheap ( i think the most expensive thing I saw was $11.95), no limit on tortilla chips, and takes credit cards- if those aren't persuasive enough reasons I am sure the food will win you over. Since it was my first time at this place I decided to play it safe and order the carne asada tacos. The boyfriend was far more adventurous and ordered the Cubana. The whole menu has pictures for the most part, so for beginners I would guess this could be helpful- the only bad thing is there are no descriptions :( Anyways- My tacos were pretty freaking good for $6.95. My boyfriends torta was a MONSTER. The thing easily took up the whole plate. It looked like a sub on crack- and it had like 30 different kinds of meats. Not for me, but if you're into that sorta thing I promise you will not go hungry!!  There was only one waitress there and the place was pretty hoping. She did a good job keeping up. All in all, pretty good experience and only 19.94! Excellent. Oh and a few other things- salsa is deliciously spicy, don't wait for the waitress to come grab your credit card- just go up and pay at the register, plenty of street parking (pay to park or residential) and right by Kimball brown line stop.

3.description: Might be my favorite Albany Park taqueria. The hand made tortillas are off the chain and the decor is homey and charming. Expect a bit of a wait though, home made tortillas take time!

14.description: I ordered take out and got the Chilanga torta.  Chilanga is a pejorative term for people from Mexico City.  At Cardona's, it is also a really tasty sandwich with sliced milanesa, oaxaca cheese and poblano peppers.   The green salsa is pretty good, nothing unusual there.  The red salsa had a nice roasted pepper flavor and was neither too spicy nor too mild to be enjoyable for the average spice-loving palate.Next time I think I will try the pambazo, which I haven't seen on many other menus and looks interesting.There was a small mixup with the price.  The prices listed on allmenus.com were different than what I was charged, but not by much.  I'll be sure to confirm the price before my next order since I don't have an official menu handy.

58.description: My girlfriend and I were in search of Korean food so we headed up north to Lawrence Ave. We didn't really have a destination in mind; we werejust in search of Korean food. We ended up stumbling upon Noodles Party and figured we'd give it a go. With the exception of one family, this place was deserted which is usually the first clue that it's no good. How wrong we were as this place really does have excellent Asian food. We ordered Philipino Lumpina (small egg rolls) to start which were really good. We got an order of Thai Rice soup which was excellent - reminded me of my Chinese grandmother's Juk (sp.). You can't go wrong with any of the noodle dishes here. Everything is fresh and the waiter/owner was very friendly. Total bill for two with tip was $28 and it's BYOB to boot. This place is worth the trip even if it's not Korean.

56.description: Noodles party and I are in a bad relationship.  I trust them and they let me down.  I go back and they delightme w/ their flavors.Because they deliver to me we have eaten their take out quite a few times since my poo-poo review.  Everything since has been yummy.  I still don't like their tofu prep BUT I had shrimp in my pad siew and it was melt in your mouth perfection!!!Keep working out the kinks Noodles party!BTW- have taken a large group there...never been busy.Went for lunch & the special are CHEAP!!!  you can get whatever you want off the menu (I assume the portion is smaller)Took my baby & put a blanket on the floor in the corner & let her roll around...no problem:)

29.description: This place is great. It doesn't have the fancy ambiance that usually makes dining and eating an experience, but the food is great and the service good. The prices are super reasonable and every time I come with friends, we have a fantastic time. Peter, the owner, is very kind and accommodating. Favorite dishes include the pad see ew with extra veggies and crispy noodles - yes, they'll stir fry the noodles to give them a little crisp - oh so good!  Curries are fantastic unless you want something super spicy, then you'll want to add your own bam! to it.

42.description: Noodles Party has almost never let me down.It's a Pan-Asian party with dishes from China, Japan, Indonesia, the Phillipines, Thailand and probably more! It has everything you could imagine wanting from any number of Asian restaurants, all within one modest establishment!The pros:1. Delicious to a nearly unbearable degree. I crave Noodle Party like a fat girl craves cake. And I'm fat so I know about cake cravings baby.2. Cheap and tasty dinners with portions that are neither tiny nor mountainous like some places, that try to disguise their food's crappiness by giving you so much that you feel bad about complaining.3. Cheap(er) and filling lunch specials.4. Appetizers that actually tease the appetite with flavor instead of drowning it in a sea of oil and salty sadness.5. Consistent quality of food, flavors, and spicy level variable by request. When I have a cold, I beg the owner to spice my Panang curry to the max so I can burn my sinuses into functionality.6. Friendly and humorous owner.7. Ample seating.8. Colorful fish tank and its army of ever-bickering, always-breeding guppies.9. Near my house!The cons:1. Delivery takes forever and a day. (1-2 hours at times!)2. Ordering lunch specials to be delivered leaves room for substitution on the part of the order-taker. We've gotten some interesting interpretations of what we ordered. Deliciousness still trumps goofy food combos.3. The delivery driver must launch my food from the restaurant via catapult to save on space in his car, because my delivery orders are usually busted up / leaking / squished.So basically, as long as I am not a lazy bum and go get my food or dine in, the experience is sublime. But even with the crazy delivery, the food is still good enough for many many repeat visits.Go EAT!

23.description: Fast delivery! Good sauces and a healthy amount of spice. Large portions. My entree "Chow Fun" had generous tofu slices, but skimpy vegetable assortment. My husband's pancit entree was good, but needed more spice and was a little skimpy on the protein assortment--two shrimp, a couple chunks of chicken, two slices of pork.Appetizers were disappointing, especially for the price! Skip the crab rangoon, chicken pot stickers (saltiest soy sauce ever!), and even the edamame. Instead go for a second entree to share! I think they do noodles well, so I'd order something noodle-y again. I've had the Pho Bo before and for a quick fix it's pretty good, but nothing like what you can get near Argyle. Also, their Pad Khee Mao is pretty decent, but still not worth giving the place a four star review.

47.description: $4.50 lunch specials, free street parking, and an interesting mix of Thai and Indonesian cuisine.  The food is pretty good, the prices are pretty reasonable, and it's in a neighborhood where this type of cuisine isn't an easy find.It's not the greatest Thai place in the world, but I'll definitely be going back.

8.description: This was the worst food I have ever ordered.. The food also took more than an hour to arrive. It looked and tasted like it was left over from lunch. I tried calling them but no one could speak English well enough to communicate with. I wish I could rate with negative star.

31.description: I have ordered from this place several times, and never had a bad experience. I cannot speak for the dine in. But every dish i have had was amazing. When you order online you get complete customization of the dish, which i was very fond of *the extra spicy is serious*. The employees were incredibly nice as well. All in all i would say this is a place to not pass up.

34.description: This is one of my go-to delivery spots. In fact, if it weren't for the photos on Yelp, I'd have no idea what the restaurant looks like. The delivery service has always been quick, and the orders accurate. The variety of Pan-Asian options is large, and surprisingly consistent across all the cuisines. I usually get noodles or soups, and they always hit the comfort zone.

16.description: Have ordered takeout various times and finally came In for dine in. Pleasantly surprised to find great service (they were empty but also friendly enough) but I wonder if they have better deals for takeout/delivery. Either way, their food is always delicious. Order the filipino lumpia its a fav! No complaints here, I definitely recommend!

13.description: If you come here and don't like it, there is something wrong with your taste buds!! Very clean, cozy, friendly staff, and super delicious food!!

11.description: Tofu Satay, yay!!! So good! Wish they would include the cucumber salad with the satay like most places do, but the tofu is so good...I can get past it!Lots of different noodle dishes to choose from for a noodle nut like me. Not your typical menu- they have Thai, Japanese, & Indonesian noodles. I believe the man who takes the orders during the week also makes the food. He is fast & friendly.However, the noodle portions have gotten noticeably smaller. Still worth it for the satay. There aren't many non-vegetarian Asian restaurants that offer tofu option, so I am grateful to have found one that does!

39.description: I like this place. I've never gotten anything that I didn't like. Their online ordering is a plus especially since you get a lot of options to customize your order. The portions are a little small but it keeps me from overeating so perhaps that's a good thing!

37.description: So I love my Pad Thai. It was my turn to pick a place to order and with luck we had a $10 off coupon from Grub Hub. Obviously I picked Noodles Party and LOVED it! Ordered my Pad Thai without sprouts (its a texture thing) and they listened! Very rare for me. Also ordered their Crab Rangoon and Shu Mai another of my faves! Both were amazing! I was a little worried about the Rangoon description because it claimed to have celery in it(texture again). When I took a bite...one of the BEST Rangoon I've ever had! I like mine awfully cream cheesy like and this was perfect! Its been a long time since I've had that. I also ordered the Chicken pot-stickers. The BF didn't care for them as much as I did but oh well his loss. More yummy appetizers for me! The appetizers even came with the sauces that I love! Sometimes I find that the Rangoon sauce is different at different places. Always throws me off!Now, I forgot what dish he ordered and liked it for the most part. Only complaint...not enough meat and too much veggies for him. When I find out what he ordered I will update. This is the only reason the "Party" is only getting 4 stars. Wasn't a party for all. I got my fave combinations of flavors and they all came out perfect....very very rare for me! I will definitely be ordering from these guys again in the future. Despite other reviews that I read, I didn't find that the delivery took longer then a delivery should. 30 minute wait was not that bad. (we ordered 30 min before close) Boxes were intact (after transport) and packed nice and neatly! I think I found my new fave spot. Next time I will have to have the dine in experience.

0.description: I have ordered food through Grubhub and it is always delicious. Delivery takes about an hour which means the soups aren't usually as hot as I would like but I don't mind.

38.description: Excellent addition to the neighborhood!  Ordering online for pickup is a snap!  Wonderful menu, super food, great service!

51.description: Got three orders to go that we would share so we could have our own "noodles party" at home while watching something on the TiVo.  We shared some pancit, Malay charred noodles, and pad siew.  The pancit was probably the best item out of the 3, it had lots of flavor and was just the right amount of spiciness.  The Malay charred noodles didn't have the smokey flavor that was promised in the description, and the pad siew was too sweet and not spicy at all despite the request for medium spiciness.  On the upside, the items themselves are reasonably priced, and it is nice that you can place your order online using their website.

27.description: *sigh*Alright, so they have a vegan curry on their menu. It was pretty tasteless and I'm not sure why they don't have the option for coconut milk in it because that would be excellent. Soy milk? No thanks.So tonight I tried their Masaman Curry and Veggie Potstickers.Here's what happened.I'm giving this place 2 stars because of their REALLY FRIENDLY, super fast delivery guy. I see a lot of reviews have had slow delivery, but tonight they were half hour earlier than grubhub told me they'd be. That was great.Cut to me shoving a potsticker in my mouth and chewing and being like "huh... this seasoning is good, but... is that tofu crumbles? That's strange. " and then deciding to look inside the next one only to realize that is not crumbled tofu... it's chicken. Dead scrambly chicken for people who eat dead scrambly chicken, not vegans. For a restaurant that is vegan friendly, they don't pay much attention to keeping the meat out of it. If you are going to eat chicken potstickers, I'm sure you will like them. Grubhub gave me $5 free grub for that part. Yay Grubhub!So, as for the curry... Ridiculous. I understand it's a mixing of Indian and Thai, but if you put something on your menu, you should try to make it work. The only thing good about it was the potatoes. They were cooked like potatoes are supposed to be cooked.  The sauce was alright, but the tofu was probably seitan or just really overcooked while the onions weren't cooked at all. And the peanuts were likely just tossed into the batch at the very end, so they were really crunchy and did not mesh with the other not-so-good tastes. The peanuts were a not-so-good taste of their own.I always feel bad giving poor reviews, but I just felt like they weren't even trying to care. And that's stupid.

32.description: I have never eaten inside, but I always order delivery from here. They are only a couple blocks from me but they still are so quick! I love their pad woon sen, cucumber salad and egg rolls. They also have pretty good sushi that tasted fresh last time I got it. I havent been very adventurous with my ordering from them, because when I find something I like I usually stick with it. No complaints at all from Noodles Party, they definitely are one of my go-to places to order delivery from!

54.description: Good Asian food with a kickass name on a stretch of Lawrence that doesn't charge for parking (Yay!)Decor was ok, but the chairs are very uncomfortable - wouldn't want to stay for an extended period of time.Food was good.  We ordered the Spicy Japanese Udon (Not spicy, request they spice it up) and the Thai Cashew, both ordered with tofu.I like the way they prepare the tofu, but they could give you more (maybe 5-6 pieces per dish).  The sauces on both were very good, pretty light but yet very tasty.It's a BYOB, the staff is very friendly, and it certainly won't break the bank, our meal was under $15.Will be a new friend for both dine-in and delivery.

48.description: I had three different types of noodles here, the malay charred and indian noodles. All of which, were not even close to south east asian cooking. It was disappointing .

44.description: Online ordering??  I'm in!!  I admit, though, the menu was a little overwhelming for me.  Noodles Party stays true to its name - they offer noodles from a billion different countries!  Filipino, Thai, Viet, Cambodian, Indonesian, Chinese, Japanse - if you're in the mood for one particular noodle, I'm SURE you can find it on this menu.  My fam and I ordered a good variety of noodles.  The Singapore noodles were "too wet" for my dad.  I think they use a thicker type of rice noodle, too, than what we're used to from Chinese restaurants.  The pad see ewe was solid, though.  Just enough sweetness to the noodles and lotsa broccoli.  The ginger/beef stir fry was also very good - loved the the oyster sauce.  Downside: The delivery took over and hour.  Upside: When I called into the restaurant, the employee was super nice and apologetic about the extra wait time.  Nice!  I'll definitely give them another try when I'm in my parents 'hood.  Lotsa variety = win in my book!

24.description: I had really been craving some Pho, but since I'm in the Portage Park area there aren't many good options in this area. I actually yelped pho in my area & this place came up. When I went with my husband the pho dish was actually just a side dish of soup, not the huge bowl I had been imagining with all the fixings.... so, I ended up ordering Yum Woon Sen (with sliced chicken instead of ground chicken) and my husband ordered basil fried rice. My husbands fried rice was good, not the best, but good. My yum woon sen was a little on the sweet side, and I'm used to having it served on lettuce, but this just came with large wedges of tomato (I am not a fan of large pieces of raw tomato..... at all) and huge chunks of chopped onion. The shrimp and the chicken were really good though. I will try Noodles Party again, but I won't be ordering the yum woon sen again. Maybe pad thai?

7.description: This place used to be my go to Thai for all and any Thai food however it is hard to stand by that these days. When tasting food do you ever feel like you can taste the love and effort put into cooking it? I can now say the opposite about that. All good things must come to an end. No party in my tummy these days after having eaten at Noodles Party.

49.description: I've ordered 3 times now.  An extra star for super-delicious pineapple fried rice and fast delivery!

40.description: Terrible. Portion sizes are tiny which I guess is a plus once you taste the food. The food is BLAND!!!! I ordered the tiger shrimp which sounded amazing and flavorful -- turns out, not so much so. It was watery and had absolutely no flavor, I had to add a couple of teaspoons of hot sauce just to make it taste like something other than cardboard.The spring rolls are the worst ones I've ever had and I eat a ton of Thai food. They were literally the equivalent to eating paper with carrots on top. You have to absolutely soak them in the sauce for any hope of flavor.The veggie pot-stickers were the only items we purchased that tasted like anything and the taste basically came from them being fried. The boyfriend's Indonesian noodles came with only four shrimp and a crap-ton of flavorless noodles. The shrimp, by the way, were small -- not the awesome butterfly style shrimp.This was seriously the most disappointing waste of $30 I have ever spent. I really wish I would've just bought a bunch of veggie buffalo wings from the grocery store.

53.description: My girlfriend and I have been trying new restaurants we have found on yelp, and we tried this one tonight, as we have been driving by it for months.  Unfortunately, we have to report that the overall experience was less than desirable.  We consider ourselves pretty experienced as far as Thai cuisine, and this left quite a bit to be desired.  We ordered spring rolls that were adequate, albeit they were missing avocado as listed on the menu.  We went on to order the Seafood Tom Yum soup, which was extremely bland. As this is a soup we make often for ourselves, we were disappointed to find that it seemed to lack key ingredients and seemed to have been rushed.  Granted, we did go to restaurant 45min before closing, but that has never been an issue before anywhere else.     Our entree was the red curry, which was ok in flavor (after I added liberal amounts of chili paste), but the texture of the curry was very thin, and the temperature was lukewarm.       The service was decent, but when we informed our waiter of the blandness of our soup, he seemed annoyed and impatient with us that we had issues with the food.  He the tried to hit us with a bunch of 'cooking issues' that were insulting because he assumed that we didn't know what went into the dish.  No apologies were offered, no attempts to fix it or accommodate us were made, other than bringing us out a ramekin of cilantro, and one of lime.      Prices were reasonable, decor was nice, but if you are looking for decent Thai food in the vicinity, go to Siam Taste Noodle on Milwaukee and Addison.  You'll find equivalent prices and better service and quality by far.

30.description: Lots of selections. Wifi. Easy in and out for Togo orders.

46.description: this place would be good if the owner could actually get the order correct.  We have been ordering for years and have had the food messed up many times but keep going back.  I have no clue why, but I will NEVER call them again.

1.description: I love this place. I live somewhat close so my orders get here in under 40 min super hot and yummy. Any of the fried rice is great with tofu (I'm a meat eater but it's just so good I order it every time). Anything I've ever gotten from here has been great. Now I'm hungry.

55.description: Yummy.  I'd give it five stars but, the drunken noodles were not really all that spicy.  But that's okay.  We went tonight - braved the snow and walked the half a mile to get there.. We thought that it was closed because no one was in there, but it was open and we had the place to ourselves.  It was nice.  I'll go again.. when its warmer.  I'm inclined to order delivery.  :)

9.description: Lived in Chicago for many years, ordered from many restaurants. This is by far the worst service I've ever experienced and nearly the worst food! After waiting for well over an hour and a half for a delivery of a couple simple noodle dishes and a soup order and crab Rangoon. I called to complain and ask for a discount. The woman in the other end of the phone said no and when I protested she and I quote said "I don't care"! A verbal confrontation the tool place. Finally I gave up and said I would post on YELP. Keeping my promise here I am. Food not worth ordering. Service beyond pathetic!

26.description: Got delivery last night with a $7 off promo code from Seamless.  We had mussaman curry, Vietnamese noodle grill, and roast duck noodle soup.  Portions were large and prices were cheap, but the food was meh.  Not terrible, but not amazing, and not as good as many Thai places in the area.  Selected mild spicy for the curry, but it was REALLY spicy; the other dishes were bland and almost flavorless.  Plus dishes were mostly noodle, with very few pieces of meat or vegetable.  Also the roast duck soup that you can order on Seamless is not in the take out menu (the restaurant actually called me to ask if they could use chicken instead because they don't have duck), so some consistency between online/offline would be good.Not disgusting, but not great.  I'm glad I had the coupon or I would've been more upset.  With so many better options nearby (like Dharma Garden and Sticky Rice), no reason for me to order from Noodles Party again.

25.description: This place is super average - not great, not awful, pretty empty inside, and ok service and prices.Their menu is super varied, so you can satisfy a lot of choosy people here. Otherwise, not really worth a visit.

12.description: I've eaten here more times than I count, not to mention the numerous time I've had carry out or delivery.  It's my "go to place" to take friends or have a delicious meal at home.Friendly staff.  Fast delivery.  Very inexpensive.  My meal is always at my door super fast, well under the predicted delivery time per the website - same for when I eat in or carry out.I was disappointed when they stopped having maki on the menu (the sweet potato maki was to DIE for, and so cheap!).  However, there are so many other choices I can't complain.  There have been times I would have like to eat Saturday lunch there, but they don't open until 3 pm Saturday.  Again, can't complain.My favorites?Cucumber salad Carrot salad Panang curry (with rice or noodles) Masaman curry Thai iced coffee I've never ordered something I didn't like.

59.description: It was a Sunday night around 8:30 pm.  I was hungry and decided to give the neighborhood Pan-Asian restaurant a try.  I ordered Pick-Up (delivery is $2) since I was down the street.  They serve all Asian cuisine, and I was in a SUSHI mood, and decided to try some from here.BIG MISTAKE.I ordered their California Roll, Spicy Salmon Maki, and Sweet Potato Maki.  All were gross; the rice was hard and cold (not the correct sushi rice) and seemed old and dried out.  I was really upset, as other reviewers said their sushi was okay.  This definitely was sub-par.  I ended up picking the rice off and just eating the filling, it was that bad.The only reason they get one star was for the decent crab rangoons I ordered along with the yucky sushi.  Otherwise they would have received zero stars. Rangoons and the maki 3 rolls totaled about $18.I would try their Thai dishes next time since the owners are Thai and would prob do a better job than imitating their sad Japanese sushi.Sushi NOT recommended.  Can't speak for their other dishes.

21.description: We ordered cuz the sign looked nice. Them the food was bland and we thought maybe it was what we ordered. Then we ordered again and I went inside the restaurant to pick it up only to be scared of what I was going to eat. We have not ordered again in 4 yrs

17.description: Ordered take out: Friendly on the phn & in person.  Ready in 20 mins, they called me in 15 mins to let me know my order was almost ready (which I thought was nice).  Clean inside.  Good Food.  I had Chkn Pad Thai very tasty & my hubby liked his dish, Beef Lard Nar.  Portions could be a little bigger.  I'll order again.  I like the menu, nxt time I will venture off & try something else.

10.description: I was not really impressed with their food today. It's my first time here and I have to say it didn't meet my expectations. I ordered Basil Chicken and the chicken was grinded! The rice was also very poor and with hardly any taste. Sorry but I'm taking my money somewhere else next time.

5.description: Food was good and Crab Ragoon are very large and you get 6. :)

3.description: Horrendous. Frozen, deep fried appetizers. Delivery took over an hour, and the driver was super rude. He practically tossed my food at me and did not give me a receipt; even to sign. Will not order from here again.

35.description: the food has good flavor but they refuse to make anything spicy.  I understand it's a liability issue and they're used to people who don't understand what spicy means but they will still refuse to do what I ask.I'd give them a higher score but i'm really irritated that "XXX spicy" and "please make this thai spicy" produces noting but mild food.So the flavor is good and we'll add my our heat.

19.description: This place is super average - not great, not awful, pretty empty inside, and ok service and prices.Their menu is super varied, so you can satisfy a lot of choosy people here. Otherwise, not really worth a visit.

28.description: I have ordered here several times throughout the past few months. I have had most of their dishes and I have not been disappointed with anything thus far.  Although I would not recommend getting the sushi here as it is just okay. But then again they're not really a sushi place. I've dined in a few times as well and service was fairly good each time as I was attended to just the right amount of times without it being a nuisance. Will continue to frequent this place!

45.description: In order to hit the $15.00 minimum for delivery, I ordered the vegan curry and the spring rolls. The portions are so small! The curry was also a little bit watery, and the tofu tasted greasy when I bit into it. The spring rolls were dry, I didn't eat them. one star for fish-sauceless options, one for having the word 'vegan' on the menu, another for delivering to me.

33.description: Love the Pho Bo. Closest I can get to actual Pho without leaving my home in the freezing cold!  and the Thai iced tea is good. I don't like the fact that they charge me $2 extra for basil sprouts hossin sauce and a lime. which is fine, but put it on my card don't make me go dig for change

43.description: Sooo totally randomly in the area but thanks to Yelp I was able to find a more than decent place for lunch, instead of Burger King or other nonsense. My drunken noodles were fabulous and any time that I can get Sriracha at lunch makes me cry with happiness. My hubby's pad see ew, his favorite Thai noodle dish, was proper. I think the owner was the server and he bustled between 5 tables with ease. Thumbs up.

2.description: This place is good, but maybe not a go-to.The broth in the Wonton soup is great. The contents inside the broth are so-so, pretty flavorless.Pineapple fried rice (chicken, no raisins) was pretty good. Not great. I did throw a egg on top which made it great but that's just personal preference and from my own kitchen.Lumpia rolls killed it for me. I spent some time in the Philippines and while I did not expect perfectly authentic.... these taste like they took Italian sausage from the grocery store and wrapped wonton papers around it. They are just bad. I was quite shocked at the many fans of them. Their food is totally edible, contrary to what a lot of people said in their reviews, and I will probably be back late night.

18.description: Fast delivery! Good sauces and a healthy amount of spice. Large portions. My entree "Chow Fun" had generous tofu slices, but skimpy vegetable assortment. My husband's pancit entree was good, but needed more spice and was a little skimpy on the protein assortment--two shrimp, a couple chunks of chicken, two slices of pork.Appetizers were disappointing, especially for the price! Skip the crab rangoon, chicken pot stickers (saltiest soy sauce ever!), and even the edamame. Instead go for a second entree to share! I think they do noodles well, so I'd order something noodle-y again. I've had the Pho Bo before and for a quick fix it's pretty good, but nothing like what you can get near Argyle. Also, their Pad Khee Mao is pretty decent, but still not worth giving the place a four star review.

41.description: I thought this is the place for good noodle dishes. I was disappointed. The food is just okay.

52.description: Delicious, cheap food served to you by (what I think is) the owner, who is very, very nice and accommodating-plus BYOB!!! I hate that it is almost always empty when we go because I'm afraid they might close-I strongly urge all who love Asian food to go here!!!
