50.description: I'm not rating this place on the entrees because we both ordered dishes we were unfamiliar with and I don't think it's fair to judge the quality of a place by an unfamiliar dish which I might not like even if James Beard came down from heaven to fix it for me.  But honestly?  I really hated my Indonesian Bakmi Goreng.  Dawn similarly hated her Maylay Charred Noodles.  I ate some of hers, and found it okay, but nothing I'd order again.  She pretty much hated the Bakmi Goreng, too.  If I rated on those, this place would lose another star.I was very disappointed in the spring rolls, and found the satay to be just so-so.  I did try the satay combo because I thought it would be fun to sample the different kinds rather than just ordering the chicken as usual.  The chicken was okay, nothing special, the shrimp was pretty tasteless and the tofu nothing to write home about (Though be fair, tofu isn't an easy ingredient to work with.)  The pork was tasty enough though nothing that knocked my socks off, and the beef was tough, with the same lack of flavor I found in the chicken and pork.The spring rolls were about as dry and tasteless as I've ever eaten, served with a light, mostly flavorless sauce.  How do you make spring rolls boring?  And in spite of the stated ingredients -- tofu, eggs, sprouts and cucumber -- what I got was a few sprouts, a little avocado and a load of carrots.  Now I love carrots, but in this context... not so much.I ordered through GrubHub so I can't speak to the way they deal with customers.  The delivery guy seemed nice enough and the food arrived in a timely manner, well packed and still hot.  The Thai iced coffee was packed with the hot food, though, which did nothing to improve either.I'm not going to say that the quality was bad, I'm saying that I didn't like the taste of anything I got, and that's about as far as I'm willing to go to be fair.

4.description: We eat here at least 2/3 a month. Good food. The portion was average. And the price is reasonable also. We usually just get the pad Thai and pad see ewe..

6.description: I love this place so much. Its family owned and small! Defiantly a great hole in the wall restaurant. The owners are so nice and the food is great! My husband and I love this place and would defiantly recommend it.  The Bakmi Goreng is bomb!

22.description: I took my kids for dinner after a baseball game this summer.  We were excited about trying a new place, so the kids ordered won ton soup and Pho Bo and I ordered Thai basil chicken.  The kids got their soup and my son tried the wonton soup and had this look on his face like he was disgusted.  He said "this soup tastes salty and had no flavor".  I tasted it and he was right!  My daughter had the pho soup (she loves pho), but this pho was awful, the meat in the soup was dry and tough, the broth was flavorless.  I had the Thai basil chicken and it wasn't any better.  It had a strong flavor of old water chestnuts, their version was definitely not what I expected!!! The place was empty when we walked in, I did find it odd, since it was a weekend and dinner time.  I should have known that it was going to be a bad dining experience.  Definitely do not recommend this place!! I forgot to mention how dark and dirty this place was.

15.description: Asian places always seem to have fish tanks. Im always leery of a place who cant keep their fish tank clean. Dirty tank here.i had the garlic egg noodle thingy in the tips. I t was good not fantastic. Not bad. Coulda uses a little more tofu. Small portion. I was still hungry so when i finished he came with the check asking if I wanted anything else. Weird, just assumed I didnt but he was nice enough. Crab Rangoon was good. nice and greasy!Friday night no one in there. I like that. Kinda felt a little rushed out.

57.description: When I need my quick fix of Thai food, I go here.  They deliver but I usually drive out there and pick my food up.  It's quick, cheap and tastes fairly good.  They have very cheap lunch specials.  If you are on a budget, go here!

20.description: Asian places always seem to have fish tanks. Im always leery of a place who cant keep their fish tank clean. Dirty tank here.i had the garlic egg noodle thingy in the tips. I t was good not fantastic. Not bad. Coulda uses a little more tofu. Small portion. I was still hungry so when i finished he came with the check asking if I wanted anything else. Weird, just assumed I didnt but he was nice enough. Crab Rangoon was good. nice and greasy!Friday night no one in there. I like that. Kinda felt a little rushed out.

36.description: We've been ordering from Noodles Party for over a year now, and they never let me down.  Nice selection (not just Chinese & Thai, but Malaysian, Indonesian, and even a limited sushi menu), consistently fast delivery, great-tasting food (the hot & sour soup is the f***ing BOMB), reasonable prices, and they offer brown rice.  Good enough for me to keep coming back.

14.description: Loved it!!! Indonesian shrimp noodle to die for, smells bad but tastes great! Filipino Lumpia so good, crab ragoon mmmmm

28.description: After a long day of moving we were looking for some take out near our new place. We decided La Fogata looked promising from the outside.We ordered a burrito and carne asada. After paying for my order I asked if chips and salsa were included....and of course they weren't. It would be an extra $1.50. Since I charged the bill to my credit card and didn't have any cash I thought the lady would just add them for free....but no.We got home to eat and were horribly dissatisfied with the quality of food. The burrito was a big pile of mush and I wouldn't even feed the carne asada to the dogs.I would rather eat at taco bell and we know call this place "La Forget It"

1.description: This place is 5 stars if you're not picky, 2 stars if you are (or simply have any special request).First of all, the food is excellent. I've had amazing tacos, chorizo egg breakfasts, quesadillas, and most of all TORTAS. They're huge and generously stuffed. Only problem is, I can't eat beans or mayonaise, and despite using GrubHub and ALWAYS trying to write "No beans and no mayo please" under the special instructions section, they have ignored it every single time, as well as ignored little side orders that were paid for, like extra sour cream. It's not worth even trying to customize your order.So, good for ordering directly from the menu, just as long as you don't want to change anything.

9.description: The fajitas are fantastic! This is a great neighborhood Mexican restaurant.

29.description: Looks kind of cool from outside, but it's not Old School as much as just past its prime or something. Salty, boring food sticky tables.

23.description: Picture this!! coming from and Born and Raised in KC,MO.. ok It's not the Town of Mexican Restaurante's However!! the BEST!!! fried Ice Cream is there.. with this Crust made out of who knows what but it's ohh so good with this  cinnamon with this Vanilla Bean Ice Cream.. umm umm umm umm UMMM!!!... so.. I needed this fix.. I google this place on Metromix and Literally DROVE 15 Miles To find this place on my Navigation.. FOR WHAT ?? Ugh! it was like blowing up a balloon and right after you pay for it.. it burst right before you get the car .. GOOD LAWD!! the lady was nice but ... I tipped 20% for the Servers Efforts but .. a can of Soda.. $1.. no refills.. just  you know. it's not even worth me discussing anyomore.. If you're walking down the street.. and need to desperately eat and you want to contribute to the neighborhood dining experience.. just go.. be nice.. digest the food and get what you pay for.. well not really but.. .... you get what i'm saying ? You won't die over it... and so it goes.... ohh and do NOT Try the Fried Ice Cream.. it's made with a Corn Flake Crust ...HUH ?? Yuk!

5.description: First time  ordering from here on grub hub and I will say this by far the best place I ever ordered from.. from the taste to the presentation simply amazing.

25.description: I work really close to La Fogata, that's why I frequent it, It's an alright restaurant. I love the nachos from here and the $2 margaritas on mon,tues, and wednesda nights other than that..not much to say about it.

12.description: The bistec en chile de arbol was really good, as was the rice on the side.  Refried beans were so-so (I am generally not a fan of most refried beans). The Mexican hot chocolate was okay, but there are better places for that in the 'hood.

21.description: I know this place hasn't gotten good reviews, so maybe it's some of the other food options. I have only been in once when a guy was singing karoake...yes, he was good, but it was LOUD.My husband and I usually get the chicken burrito and steak tacos and we love it!...they are cheap as well. The chips and guac are spendier and have always been delicious until a month or 2 ago. I don't know if they got a new cook, maybe? The chips are homemade and delicious but the guac has no flavor anymore! :(  We normally order out so I add my own salt and lime juice at home to the guacamole. Anyways...if you want some good tacos and a margarita, this is the place to go. The server is always SOOOo friendly. I always end up tipping big here b/c I just can't help it.

16.description: Try their shrimp dishes. Those are something special!

17.description: Its a little hole in the wall but surprisingly, its really good! But then again, it's really hard to mess up Mexican food! So the reason I give it 3 stars is mainly due to the location. Its a great place to get some grub at a great price and at any time (their breakfast tortas are great!)

10.description: Customer service was okay but the food was completely and utterly disgusting I hated it and trust me I  hate leaving negative feedback in any restaurant but I must share this with everyone that restaurants food is horrible.... If you do decide to eat there make sure the prices on the menu are what they charge you. I order 3 tacos and because I ordered carne asada they charge me an extra dollar it doesn't state that in the menu... i wish i could give them no stars!!!!!

11.description: I ordered food via grub hub bc I was craving Mexican food. I ordered tacos pastor, guacamole and queso fundido. Over all food quality: CRAP.....no bueno.Queso fundido was NOT tasty at all and WAY TOO SALTY. Tacos pastor....didn't taste NOTHING like genuine tacos pastor, it wasn't fresh and it had an odd sweet taste I did not like. Not only that but was way too greasy. Who screws up Guacamole!?! Well they did, nothing about the guac tasted fresh, lacked flavor, salt and lime. Too much tomato. Then left me with a nasty after taste makes my stomach cringe. Don't waste your money, there are MANY WAY BETTER Mexican food joints, my in-laws are Mexican so I know good Mexican food, this place lacks quality & flavor. I felt bad but I had to throw away 80% of the food bc I just felt nauseous after trying a little of everything.

26.description: The cuisine is not my cup of tea, though the quality and service are good.  I'm writing simply to praise their fanDICulous homemade corn tortillas.  Hot, doughy, delicious.  Keep 'em coming!

27.description: You have to go when Freddy the Mexican lounge lizard plays his Casio keyboard. (I think he may have upgraded to a Yamaha by now) Anyway, call ahead and find out when he's playing next. Then request the Brazilian standard, Girl From Ipanema, and watch him get excited because nobody ever requests him to play anything that's not Ranchero Top 100. I haven't had the food lately, but they can't mess up a steak taco and a beer. The place is very small, and mostly has booths and a couple of tables for 4. You cannot go to La Fogata and take it too seriously, meaning, set high expectations. This place is great if you want to tell a story of a Third World adventure.

0.description: It's very rare to find good CALDOS (SOUPS) for DELIVERY.I ordered a POZOLE and CALDO DE POLLO, Both VERY GOOD. Only thing i can say is they added a pretty big piece of corn in my caldo de pollo and this lessened the sapce for the actual broth which is what we look for when ordering soup.Great red salsaand chips! One of my favs so far from a Mexican Delivery.Ps. I am an actual Mexican and a chef. This place is pretty authentic

20.description: If someone asked me, "hey, would you like to go to a fun little Mexican restaurant with above average food, very friendly staff and the chance to sing the two Javier Solis songs you happen to know at Karaoke there in the later hours (on Friday or Saturday nights) would I go? " Most definitely yes, and I have done so several times. La Fogata immediately sets a positive tone for me as my table is equipped with homemade salsa de arbors and salsa verde, not the standard mushy tomato, onion, cilantro and salt version that is made in 20 gallon bulk cans served at other places. I find the prices extremely reasonable and enjoy the tacos, enchiladas con mole and the seafood tostadas. Another bonus for beer drinkers is that they serve Bohemia here; by far the tastiest Mexican beer available. To sum up the crowd, on my last visit I had an early dinner and played about 10 Vicente Fernandez songs on the juke box, a little Mexican girl who was dining with her father came over to our table and spontaneously started dancing and twirling in her polka-dot summer dress to the music. She was having the time of her life and so were we.

19.description: Having passed this place a million times growing up in Albany Park, I never set foot into La Fogata except recently. La Fogata has neon beer signs but has the pastel colors of many Mexican restaurants in the city. On my inaugural visit to La Fogata I was coming home from class and wanted a change of pace from the usual late night spots and stopped in for what I thought would be quick Mexican. I looked through the tacos and burritos and settled on flautas because some Mexican restaurants just don't have flautas. After taking my order, I sat down and waited. While waiting, a man came up to the karaoke machine and started crooning old Mexican songs. The speakers must have been on max because I couldn't stand the volume anymore!!! No idea what was going on but after what seemed like an eternity the food came out and I took it home.At home the chicken and chorizo flautas were good and the rice and beans hit the spot. While the food was decent, I didn't find it overly stimulating and have yet to make a return visit to La Fogata. Perhaps I will come back one day when the value proposition has improved as the menu was a bit pricey for what I got, but I just found La Fogata's menu on GrubHub, so it may merit a return visit!

2.description: This was my 1st time here, and I am also surprised to read a few bad revues. Maybe it's from neighboring competition since there so many tacorias in the area? Who knows. I gave it 5 stars, because for a small casual mex place, it's about as good as it gets. The salsas are good enough to come here for alone. Both the verde and the red arbol chili salsa are amazing. I feel like I could write a paragraph on them alone, but I'll spare us. I nerd out to salsas as I like to make them as home, but there's is something. It's really good!I took the advice of another poster, saying they had bought the chicken verde enchiladas more than any one person to date, so I gave it a go, and they are indeed top notch! Very filling, as they are stuffed with shredded chicken. I ordered a side el pastor taco, since it was my 1st time here, but couldn't eat it, as the dinner plate was pretty filling. Ambiance was nice. Nothing fancy, but def a step up from your typical, almost hot dog style shop. Very clean. You could take a date here for a simple date night. Service was great. No issues here.After one visit, I think this would be one of the best mom & pop style Mex restaurants in the area. I recommend the place!

18.description: I know this place hasn't gotten good reviews, so maybe it's some of the other food options. I have only been in once when a guy was singing karoake...yes, he was good, but it was LOUD.My husband and I usually get the chicken burrito and steak tacos and we love it!...they are cheap as well. The chips and guac are spendier and have always been delicious until a month or 2 ago. I don't know if they got a new cook, maybe? The chips are homemade and delicious but the guac has no flavor anymore! :(  We normally order out so I add my own salt and lime juice at home to the guacamole. Anyways...if you want some good tacos and a margarita, this is the place to go. The server is always SOOOo friendly. I always end up tipping big here b/c I just can't help it.

13.description: The food sucked and the dekivery took an ho ur and a half. Dont waste ur miney, there are better places

4.description: I have to write a review for this place, because I'm sure at this point I've ordered their verde chicken enchiladas more than any other customer known to man.I order the meal, and get a huge side of the salsa verde, and smother everything in the sauce. The salsa verde is ridiculously good, i could drink it with a straw. The meal comes with some delicious refried beans (sometimes comes out a bit salty, but i still love them) and rice.I am a woman of habit, and I also ALWAYS get their horchata and some guacamole - but the enchiladas are the stars of the show.OH..... and before i forget - the reason i initially fell in love with this place was the POZOLE. My god. It really is amazing. The best part is it never disappoints and is delicious every time.. If you like red pozole, you will adore this soup, I guarantee it.I definitely recommend La Fogata - I have to; I am eating the enchilladas right now, watching Seinfeld, for the second time this week.

24.description: I've mostly stuck with the basics here, and they're done nicely.  Tasty margaritas, delicious guacamole, and completely acceptable tacos (chicken is moist, chorizo is mild but flavorful, and neither is too greasy).  Service isn't lightning fast, but it is friendly, and food came out quickly once we'd ordered.  There are two TVs, which is kind of a lot for such a small restaurant, but they aren't too disruptive.  Prices aren't dirt cheap, but they're reasonable.

6.description: We ordered from them via Grub Hub for the first time. The delivery was prompt.The Torta Cubana was outstanding! It had breaded steak, re-fried beans, cheese, ham, egg, avocado and a hot dog. Delicious and enough for left overs. The pastor torta was good.Will definitely order from them again.

22.description: Having passed this place a million times growing up in Albany Park, I never set foot into La Fogata except recently. La Fogata has neon beer signs but has the pastel colors of many Mexican restaurants in the city. On my inaugural visit to La Fogata I was coming home from class and wanted a change of pace from the usual late night spots and stopped in for what I thought would be quick Mexican. I looked through the tacos and burritos and settled on flautas because some Mexican restaurants just don't have flautas. After taking my order, I sat down and waited. While waiting, a man came up to the karaoke machine and started crooning old Mexican songs. The speakers must have been on max because I couldn't stand the volume anymore!!! No idea what was going on but after what seemed like an eternity the food came out and I took it home.At home the chicken and chorizo flautas were good and the rice and beans hit the spot. While the food was decent, I didn't find it overly stimulating and have yet to make a return visit to La Fogata. Perhaps I will come back one day when the value proposition has improved as the menu was a bit pricey for what I got, but I just found La Fogata's menu on GrubHub, so it may merit a return visit!

15.description: Got delivery from here and I was not at all impressed. The gorditas we're not good at all! The steak taco was okay. Nachos were pretty good. I wouldn't order it again though.

7.description: The food is slightly above average but the peripherals bring it down.Walked in one Saturday and got two burritos to go.  Despite the prices quoted in the menu, I got charged about a dollar more and an extra charge for the guacamole I ordered on each.  Was somewhat annoyed but just wanted my food with no hassle.  Also, I think there's a $10 limit on credit cards so make sure you order enough to hit that limit.About 20 minutes later, despite a restaurant with exactly two other customers in it, I received my burritos.  I'm all for fresh and made to order food but a little warning would have been nice.The burritos were good but not amazing or even great.  They were poorly constructed so that by the time you got to the last third, it was already falling apart.  They weren't wrapped in foil either which could have mitigated this problem.So I guess I'll say that if I ended up here again for some reason, it wouldn't be the worst thing, however I wouldn't actively endeavor to return.

8.description: I actually disliked this place before because they always put mayo on my torta de carne asada and I always forgot to tell them not to. However, when I asked for the mayo to be substituted for sour cream they were accommodating. I opted out for the tomatoes as well and just like that my dislike for this place turned around! I usually get a torta and an horchata from them when I'm in the neighborhood. Drinks are pretty good too, especially their margaritas. Nachos are average. I'd like to try more of their dishes though so I guess this review is mostly for their mayo-less carne asada torta.

3.description: Love their food. They have the best steak quesadillas I've had. Same as the nachos. Good flavor and good portions.

14.description: I like this place.  We wanted to try it despite the negative reviews because we live right down the street.  We went there for lunch.  It's cute and small.  I love the blue stucco walls and the pictures of Pancho Villa.  The food was really good (surprise!).  The ingredients were fresh and I was pleased to see my steak tacos served with lime.  I would call the fare more traditional Mexican.  I definitely disagree with the reviewer that prefers taco bell's imitation meat...  I give La Fogata only 4 stars because there was a slightly unpleasant odor when we walked in (I stopped noticing it after 5 minutes).  I suggest getting rid of the carpet in the dining room.  Tile is more authentic anyway!  Maybe we'll just try the takeout next.

1.description: Now here's a story of how Chicago Harwdood saved the day!I'm currently renting an apartment, and in the process of buying it directly from the landlord.  We were less than 24 hours from closing on the sale and signing all the paperwork when all of a sudden, with just hours to go, my fiance walked into the kitchen to find the wooden floors throughout our kitchen had buckled for no apparent reason!So we called Chicago Hardwood for an immediate inspection.  They were there in less than 2 hours, immediately found and stopped the leak from the fridge, and gave us a number of options of how we might fix the floors.  The service from Chicago Hardwood was absolutely fantastic.  We had just enough time to call our lawyer and postpone the sale.  If we hadn't found the buckling or had it inspected by a qualified inspector like Darek and had gone ahead and bought the place, it could have cost us thousands of dollars in repairs.  I can't recommend Darek enough for hardwood inspections. It's been an absolute pleasure to work with the team at Chicago Hardwood.

2.description: Keith and Voitek are super knowledgeable and extremely helpful.  They provided me with great advice.  If you need help from the pros, they are a great resource!

0.description: I wanted to refinish my hardwood floors in the bedrooms over my vacation. After extensive research I decided to use Pallmann Magic Oil. Naturally no one sells this product anywhere in New England (the closer retailer was in Baltimore). A quick Google search found Chicago Hardwood Floor. I ordered 2 liters... More than enough to finish both rooms. The order shipped same day and actually arrived early. Yeah! I'll save you the laughable DIY disaster details, but I found myself in need of another 2 liters to finish the second room. I placed the order over the weekend but Monday came and went and nothing was shipped. I called today morning. They were very apologetic and upgraded the shipping to next day air at their expense. My project was back on track!  These guys were far and away the best!  Thanks so much! :)

28.description: Simply outstanding! A full bakery, halal butcher shop, grocery store, and spice house. Today's grocery list: pickled gherkins ($3.99), pickled mangoes ($1.99), pickled turnips ($1.59), tahina ($3.99 for 16oz), amazing spinach pies ($1.75 each), the freshest pita I've ever had ($1 for a stack of 12!), and a huge container of allspice ($2.99). There's a sizable frozen/refrigerated selection and tons of dried goods. I didn't try any of the desserts but they are gorgeous and plentiful.

1.description: This grocery store and bakery used to be my go-to place for delicious Middle Eastern baked goods, tea and olive oil.However, the decline in both sanitation and food quality has me rethinking this place. Employees chain-smoking directly in the store, filthy floors, damaged food product packages and dented cans, blaring loud mariachi music, a meat case that looks like a road kill morgue, and almost empty bakery cases with less-than-fresh offerings. That was my most recent and probably last experience in Al Khyam.Sad times.

9.description: This is a nice place for falafels.  I have to agree with the reviews on the falafels being one of the best around.  But the final sandwich does not quite match up to my favorite places.Moreover, the service at this place has been horrid, the 3 times I've been there.  We put up with it, just because the falafel are just that good.  Last time we went, the waitress was sitting there in the corner eating her own dinner.  I don't even think that's allowed per regulations.  But she didn't care to check in with us.  We had to sort of wave her down for anything.  Really careless...Also, I have to say, the hot sauce doesn't quite match up to Pita Inn, which is still king in my opinion.I guess I rate it as 3-star (OK) because it's not too far and the softness of the falafel do make up for the shortcomings with everything else.Update 8/16 - OK, downgrade down to one star because the service issues have just gone too far now.  I tried going there again (it was a few months ago and that was the last time) and they closed like 15 minutes before their posted closing time.  The person inside was just shrugged as if to say, sorry buddy, ur SOL.  Mr. Khayyam, don't be sorry... just know that you lost a customer that was willing to put up with your BS service.

29.description: I needed a sweet fix after eating next door at Al-Khaymeih, so what better place to go to than a Middle Eastern bakery!  It was like a party in here...there was Mexican music blasting and some of the workers were dancing as they were mopping up.  I ordered from their big selection of baklava...it goes for $6.99 a pound.  The baklava was good!  Not as syrup-y as what I would have wanted, but it was still delicious!

23.description: The baklawah was very, very tasty. My uncle found some molasses that he couldn't find anywhere else. Their filo dough was half the cost of Jewel.Overall a great store, it just took a while to get service at he bakery.

5.description: Baklava is good, they have typical manakheesh (cheese bread) with zaatar, etc. It was OK. Lots of middle eastern options in terms of the grocery store. Fresh meat section.

31.description: Looking for lamb tongue? $4.99/lb.  Veal breast? $1.99/lb. Fresh Pita bread? they make it on site. Spices: $2/jar twice the size of the stingy $7 bottles you buy at Jewel or Dominicks.Want to see an annoyed Middle Eastern woman complain to the butcher that he should de-bone her meat before weighing it? Want to gaze at the beautiful glaze of homemade pastries in one of the longest bakery cabinets ever?It's all here.

25.description: Ya, habibi! Go here for the Pita bread, it's the best in the city. Verily, all the Middle Eastern groceries and restaurants in town serve THIS bread (albeit at a markup!). It's that good. Go on a Sunday when it's right out of the oven, buy a dozen bags - you can freeze them for quite a long time. I prefer the larger, round bread, but they also make the popular "pocket" pita bread. Honestly, I think the bread they make here is better than anything I've had "over there", and I ate a LOT of that stuff "over there!" Giant selection of sweets, cookies, baklava - all made here.Awhile back, they got a new bread oven that is out in the middle of the bakery. It's so cute to see all the kids gathered around, mesmerized, watching the guy take fresh Zatar bread out of the oven. Zatar bread - it's the stuff in the plastic bags that has spices, meat (lamb) or cheese on it. Especially good the day it's baked, but you can also do the ol' "third world" method of warming it up by throwing it on an open gas burner (ditto for the pita bread). Drizzle a little olive oil on it, and wallah - lazeez!! (delicious!)The guys who own the store are Lebanese, I believe - and they are the greatest. The Lebanese, along with the Syrians *really* know good food, in my experience. Syrians are like Italians who speak Arabic. Lebanese would be like Frenchmen who speak Arabic (and French). So, if you're unsure about what something is, just ask one of the guys, you'll have your own personal shopper in a minute!The olives and feta cheese in the deli cases here is WAY cheaper (like dollars per pound cheaper) than Dominick's and the large corporate chains. Plus, it's way more FUN to shop here. Delicious bakery smells, free sample tastes, charming owners - YALLAH!

12.description: Decent prices and wide selection, but  I was incredibly disappointed with their baklava, the pride and joy of an Arab bakery.  The man said that the pieces he sold me were baked that morning.  Either he was lying (a poor decision) or their baklava is always hard and dry.  At eight dollars a pound, I will go elsewhere.

37.description: Its not only a bakery. They also have restaurant right next to it. Awesome Awesome food. I'm a big fan of middle eastern food and had tried lots of places. This is the best in all. Their Kefta Kabob and steaks are the best. They melt in your mouth. They own a meat shop right next to them so I'm sure they are getting best meat. Service and environment is good as well. Waiter we had was well behaved and well informed. Food cost isn't much expensive but its not cheap either. It also worth its price. Compare to Reza's this is better, specially price wise. Best thing about them is they are Zabhia Halal. ( Zabiha Hala is something that matters to Muslims. One good thing about Zabhia Halal meat is its Organic. )

21.description: As Erika said, best pitas in the city. They're magical. They're so robust, I make thin-crust pizzas out of them with better results than when I use raw dough. I'm especially fond of the large, flat kind, which are closer to what we greenhorns think of as a tortilla (and they make wonderful tortillas too, for the record) than what we greenhorns used to think of as a pita (thick, spongy flatbread that you can make a pocket out of).

16.description: When I first walked in I was greeted by one of (what I think was) the managers. As soon as I mentioned I was looking for maamoul molds he became much more friendly, took me to the back of the store, diligently searched through a bunch of boxes and presented me with them (they were just $3) with a big smile.Whenever I'm next door at the restaurant, I pop in here for bits and pieces: Vimto blackcurrant soda (though I wish they stocked the still cordial variety), olives, fig preserves (way cheaper in here than Whole Foods!), orange blossom and rose water, pistachios, spices, and pita bread.I love wandering the aisles littered with drums of olive oil, five gallon jars of pickled labneh, pickled turnips (though I make my own), halwa, and other Lebanese delicacies.You'll also find a great selection of baklawa, maamoul, and other delicious baked goods (for reasonable prices) in their bakery case, as well as fresh baked pitas.Everything is reasonably priced, and you can walk out of here with several grocery bags of goodies for less than twenty dollars.

17.description: Stopped by this place on the way home from So Gong Dong Tofu House because I was craving something sweet and there happened to be a parking spot right out front.  Al Khayam has a decent selection of middle eastern canned goods, groceries, and cheeses, and a halal meat counter.  They also have an awesome assortment of bulk spices, both whole and ground.  I bought about 4 ounces of whole fenugreek seeds for just over $2.  I will definitely be back for some of the spice blends and for more whole, inexpensive spices.  After perusing the selection of cheeses, meats and assorted grocery items my dining companion and I remembered our original intention:  baklava.  Al Khayam offers a bunch of different little baklava bites, so we decided on a few and took them to go.  We stuck to the small bite baklavas, so we could try a few, but they have larger pieces cut as well.  My favorite one that we tried was a square cut baklava filled with walnuts.  It was crispy on top with just the right amount of syrup on the bottom.  It was somewhat spicy, with just a hint of rosewater.  Lovely.  I'll definitely be back.

10.description: This is one of the shortest reviews I think I've ever written but it's getting straight to the point: PITA!For $2+tax you can get 2 HUMONGOUS circular pita breads that were hand-made that same morning.  Don't even think to get pita from the same restaurant you pick up your tabbouleh, baba ghannouj, or hummus, just do yourself a favor and make a quick stop at Al Khayyam's grocer.If you don't believe, take a peek at Al Khayyam's business profile pictures or just make a visit.

11.description: In Albany Park you can damn well find anything if you look hard enough. After a devastating awesome dinner at Al-Khaymeih, we saw a sign for super megacheap hummus over at the grocery store next door and couldn't resist. Stepping inside into Al-Khyam, we walked into another universe.Stepping in, you will be greeted by the biggest wall of shisha that you have ever encountered. The amount of shelf space dedicated solely for shisha made me wish I had a hookah as all flavors under the sun were represented with plenty of charcoal to keep your hookah locked and loaded. Shisha is stacked on two shelves five feet high and three feet wide, if you can't find something you like there - you don't like shisha.Plenty of olive oils to choose from of all different sizes as well as honey with honeycombs still inside, nuts, pineapple jam, more fruit preserves. I am not jam or honey expert, but I can imagine getting lost in their tidal wave of preserves! Across from this shelf, you'll find dried apricots, dried oranges, and dried all manner of fruit you didn't think could be dried. If dried fruit and honey are your thing - stop on by immediately!If you are a fan of baklawa, make sure you check out their bakery! For $6.99 a pound, you can rock baklawa of all kinds with plenty of nuts and sweet crispy honeyed goodness. The baklawa I had was super sweet, super crunchy and packed with nuts. YUM!You'll find hookahs from $40 and up on the top of the shelves along with more aisles of candy, spices, and more neat little gifts for people. There are pots and pans if you need some and some interesting teapots. Stop by Al-Khyam next time you are in Albany Park, you'll soon find yourself becoming a regular.

26.description: Being a huge fan of spinach pies, I was excited to have found an authentic place to try. The spinach pies were absolutely delicious, so fresh! The best i've had thus far...and you cant beat the price...$1.75!!Alongside the delicious spinach pies were also delectable bakery treats...oh, and lets not forget pita haven! The pita bread is obviously baked there so its super fresh and delicious..they even have mini pita's!My mom was in awe of all the spices and other groceries they had there...oh and its nice and clean! :)

27.description: Stopped by this place on the way home from So Gong Dong Tofu House because I was craving something sweet and there happened to be a parking spot right out front.  Al Khayam has a decent selection of middle eastern canned goods, groceries, and cheeses, and a halal meat counter.  They also have an awesome assortment of bulk spices, both whole and ground.  I bought about 4 ounces of whole fenugreek seeds for just over $2.  I will definitely be back for some of the spice blends and for more whole, inexpensive spices.  After perusing the selection of cheeses, meats and assorted grocery items my dining companion and I remembered our original intention:  baklava.  Al Khayam offers a bunch of different little baklava bites, so we decided on a few and took them to go.  We stuck to the small bite baklavas, so we could try a few, but they have larger pieces cut as well.  My favorite one that we tried was a square cut baklava filled with walnuts.  It was crispy on top with just the right amount of syrup on the bottom.  It was somewhat spicy, with just a hint of rosewater.  Lovely.  I'll definitely be back.

35.description: Consistent good Lebanese bakery offering fresh bread & baklava.   That's really all they have to offer, unless of course you plan on cooking some middle-eastern fare, in which case they've got most of the ingredients you'll likely need.Prices are fair.  But what really interesting is their selection of hookah tobaccos (which is hidden at the one end of the store).  They have an entire aisle devoted to the ritual, and have everything you'll need to get started, including hookahs, tongs,  charcoals & tobaccos.  The guy there is really friendly & will answer any of your questions if you wanna get into preparing and enjoying hookahs (a nice after dinner thing for when company comes over or at the end of a long day.)If you're there, head driectly across the street to Andy's Fruit Ranch, as it has excellent selection of, well, everything it seems.

8.description: Nice people, great products.  Found everything I needed and got cheery service. It's a bit of a hike from downtown but convenient enough from the brown line.  Will definitely be back and I will have to try out the bakery next time.

0.description: I Yelp-searched for Sumac in desperation and the amazing Yelpers advised Al Khayam Bakery--thanks guys!  Spices at a bakery??  I've been going to the restaurant next to it for years, which I never reviewed it for selfish reasons :o  I knew this "bakery" was known for its pitas (not into pitas that much), but little did I know it was actually a little mid-east grocery store disguised as a bakery.  I never saw such a humongous can of chick peas in my life!  After almost loosing hope not finding the Sumac in their big selection of mideast spices in plastic bottles, I was relieved to finally find the Sumac Spice $3.59/lb in a bag with help from a friendly store clerk in another section of the store.I no longer have to smooch for extra dressing from Pita Inn that comes with their Chicken Fattoush salads.  I treated those little containers as gold.  Now I feel I struck a gold mine--I can make as much as I want :)I loved going through the cookware.  Found some kind of mold--package was all in Syrian so I didn't know what it was but it looked interesting so I got it anyway.  I googled it when I got home and found out it was a Momoul cookie mold and found videos of how to use it.  Can't wait to try making some!  I bought some spicy dired mangos and spicy toasted pita chips to try as well.  'Tho the food items weren't to my liking and the store isn't very astheticly appealing, the 5 stars are for the Sumac, nice employees, and the enlightening cultural food discoveries.  I'll have to go back and try some actual Momoul cookie varieties-dates, pistachios, walnuts--before I decide which one to make, and pick up that giant can of chickpeas when I get on my occasional hummus kick.

38.description: Great Lebanese (Mediterranean) food for sure.  Extensive, authentic bakery/ethnic grocer next door.  Make it a mission to try entire menu offerings.  Forgot to mention that Al Khayameih (correct spelling-bakery next door is Al Khayam) has hearty vegetarian selections.Food:  Fresh tasting food, very large portions.  Consistently good.  Quality lean tender cuts of beef.  Super flavorings & spices.  Great food always.  Ambiance:  Medium sized restaurant, clean, and tables comfortably arranged.  Lebanese, locals & the young eat here regularly.  A gem, and they know it.Service:  Professional attentive wait staff.Wish:  Newer wait staff is hit or miss.  No worries with long-time staff.

20.description: Baklava for $6.99 a pound! I love a deal and this is a great deal but that isn't even the best part. This is the freshest baklava I've ever tasted. I wasn't aware of the many different varieties having only had what I assume is the standard filo and honey version. Al Khayyam has at least a half dozen different types. I've had cashew, walnut and pistachio. I like the rolled style cashew personally but always select a delicious menagerie. A pound of their baklava fills what appears to be about a 5" by 8" aluminum carry out/ leftover container... and that's a lot of baklava. But since it's so fresh it keeps well for over a week. They also will generously cover your pound of goodness with a crushed pistachio. DAMN IT"S GOOD! While there I grabbed a can of hummus for $0.88 and a block of feta for $3.49. Both were great. Now I expected the feta to be good but canned hummus? It was really good. Also there was a young guy who I imagine is the owner/ owner's son and he was super accommodating and outgoing which has not always been my experiences at neighborhood, ethnic specific joints. He was helpful and friendly. Sanabel Bakery is still my spot for fresh pita and delicious, savory, middle eastern baked goods. But for spices (great deals!) and the rest Al Khayyam is my spot. Oh ya.  The picture is misleading.  This is a grocery and not a sit down place.

19.description: Wonderfully exotic Arabic grocery store, butcher and bakery.....I love the vast assortment of baklava in various shapes, sizes and varieties.  Interesting aisles of Middle Eastern food, cookware and specialty items.  I love places like this.One of a kind and unusual.

33.description: one of my favorite places to eat around chicago. they use zabiha meatvery affordabledelicious foodnext to the restaurant is the actual bakery. this is also where i buy my meat. consistently fresh, and good cuts.

2.description: Check your bread. it may still be warm. Things you're sure you'll never find outside of the Middle East, you can find here...and they are happy to help you locate whatever  item you need. It's gotta be in there somewhere......Prices? Amazing. Nobody is charging you airfare on that box of exotic whatever-it-is. Lots of fresh items too, like Lebne, and olives (are olives technically fresh?).Stand around and sniff the air, just for the pleasure of it.

34.description: Wonderful grocery store to find anything you can't find at a chain.  They bake their pita bread fresh everyday, Make their own pickles, olives, and pickled turnips.  Al Khayyam has a huuugggee variety of spices, which can be bought from the oz. to the lb.  I highly recommend this place for spices, pita bread, olives, middle eastern cheeses, and rice.

32.description: We stopped in here after eating dinner at Semiramis down the street to pick up some baklava to take home.  The store itself is a typical ethnic grocery store filled with everything that you would need to make an authentic Middle Eastern meal at home!  My friend from Turkey would love it here! =]  We were only here to get sweets so we went into the bakery area and asked about the million different shapes of baklava.  He said that one side was pistachio and the other side was walnut.  We decided to try one of each to try it out cause that's how I roll!  When we got home I tried the pistachio and all I could think of when I bit into it was about the smell of the store because that's what hit my nose first, even before I bit down.  (BTW...the store smelled like a lemony cleaning product which is good because it means it's clean but it's not good when it gets attached to food!)  So I almost didn't bite into it because it smelled so strongly of the store!  But, of course, I did anyways and the taste didn't get much better for me.  The texture was nice but I could not get past the flavor!  So I will definitely not be going back for the baklava which deserves a 2 star rating in my opinion.  But I would probably go back to the 3 star store to get some Middle Eastern items you really can't find many places!

18.description: They have a very large space for a 'corner-store' type of grocer, 2 or 3 storefronts. The selection encompasses many, many brands and products most of which I am not terribly familiar or use frequently. They do have a few staples I can use such as olive oil, giardinera, etc. The spinach pies from the oddly-organized bakery area were very bread-y - not nearly enough spinach. The restaurant is delicious and I have ordered take-out several times.

13.description: Happy Valentines Day to me! I have just completely inhaled a serving of their fresh, delicious, completely additive baklava. I did not even like baklava before trying Al Khayyam's version. OMG! It's amazing!Warning--if you purchase the 1lb tray you must not (I repeat *must not*) be alone with it. You will (oh you will) eat more than you ought.(As I reach for another serving...)

4.description: Ya, habibi! Go here for the Pita bread, it's the best in the city. Verily, all the Middle Eastern groceries and restaurants in town serve THIS bread (albeit at a markup!). It's that good. Go on a Sunday when it's right out of the oven, buy a dozen bags - you can freeze them for quite a long time. I prefer the larger, round bread, but they also make the popular "pocket" pita bread. Honestly, I think the bread they make here is better than anything I've had "over there", and I ate a LOT of that stuff "over there!" Giant selection of sweets, cookies, baklava - all made here.Awhile back, they got a new bread oven that is out in the middle of the bakery. It's so cute to see all the kids gathered around, mesmerized, watching the guy take fresh Zatar bread out of the oven. Zatar bread - it's the stuff in the plastic bags that has spices, meat (lamb) or cheese on it. Especially good the day it's baked, but you can also do the ol' "third world" method of warming it up by throwing it on an open gas burner (ditto for the pita bread). Drizzle a little olive oil on it, and wallah - lazeez!! (delicious!)The guys who own the store are Lebanese, I believe - and they are the greatest. The Lebanese, along with the Syrians *really* know good food, in my experience. Syrians are like Italians who speak Arabic. Lebanese would be like Frenchmen who speak Arabic (and French). So, if you're unsure about what something is, just ask one of the guys, you'll have your own personal shopper in a minute!The olives and feta cheese in the deli cases here is WAY cheaper (like dollars per pound cheaper) than Dominick's and the large corporate chains. Plus, it's way more FUN to shop here. Delicious bakery smells, free sample tastes, charming owners - YALLAH!

24.description: When I first walked in I was greeted by one of (what I think was) the managers. As soon as I mentioned I was looking for maamoul molds he became much more friendly, took me to the back of the store, diligently searched through a bunch of boxes and presented me with them (they were just $3) with a big smile.Whenever I'm next door at the restaurant, I pop in here for bits and pieces: Vimto blackcurrant soda (though I wish they stocked the still cordial variety), olives, fig preserves (way cheaper in here than Whole Foods!), orange blossom and rose water, pistachios, spices, and pita bread.I love wandering the aisles littered with drums of olive oil, five gallon jars of pickled labneh, pickled turnips (though I make my own), halwa, and other Lebanese delicacies.You'll also find a great selection of baklawa, maamoul, and other delicious baked goods (for reasonable prices) in their bakery case, as well as fresh baked pitas.Everything is reasonably priced, and you can walk out of here with several grocery bags of goodies for less than twenty dollars.

6.description: This place has .99 freshly baked pita in packs of 12. You can't beat that price man. They sell zabiha meat at affordable prices.. They have various items in the grocery section, but most of it is middle easternesque. Great for my husband!There is also a restaurant next to it but I've never gone.

22.description: This is one of the shortest reviews I think I've ever written but it's getting straight to the point: PITA!For $2+tax you can get 2 HUMONGOUS circular pita breads that were hand-made that same morning.  Don't even think to get pita from the same restaurant you pick up your tabbouleh, baba ghannouj, or hummus, just do yourself a favor and make a quick stop at Al Khayyam's grocer.If you don't believe, take a peek at Al Khayyam's business profile pictures or just make a visit.

15.description: Baklava for $6.99 a pound! I love a deal and this is a great deal but that isn't even the best part. This is the freshest baklava I've ever tasted. I wasn't aware of the many different varieties having only had what I assume is the standard filo and honey version. Al Khayyam has at least a half dozen different types. I've had cashew, walnut and pistachio. I like the rolled style cashew personally but always select a delicious menagerie. A pound of their baklava fills what appears to be about a 5" by 8" aluminum carry out/ leftover container... and that's a lot of baklava. But since it's so fresh it keeps well for over a week. They also will generously cover your pound of goodness with a crushed pistachio. DAMN IT"S GOOD! While there I grabbed a can of hummus for $0.88 and a block of feta for $3.49. Both were great. Now I expected the feta to be good but canned hummus? It was really good. Also there was a young guy who I imagine is the owner/ owner's son and he was super accommodating and outgoing which has not always been my experiences at neighborhood, ethnic specific joints. He was helpful and friendly. Sanabel Bakery is still my spot for fresh pita and delicious, savory, middle eastern baked goods. But for spices (great deals!) and the rest Al Khayyam is my spot. Oh ya.  The picture is misleading.  This is a grocery and not a sit down place.

7.description: I've been getting their pita from Middle eastern bakery but decided to visit their location.  It was fun to look at my beloved pita coming our from oven in the store.  Sweet section has many kinds of "baklava" - including hard to find Osh El Bulbul ( "bird's nest") !!  I did not look around much on Grocery section, but when I decide to stock up my Middle eastern stuff I will come back here.  Their large pita is great for wraps - i usually roll any kind of salad vegetable with dressing or spread (hummus etc),  avocado, then cut in half.  Healthy and filling quick fix.  Yum, Yum!

36.description: The best pita in the city is right here.  Here's a tip:  They make the white pita in the morning and the whole wheat in the early afternoon.  Show up at the right time of day, and it's still warm.  The pita bread is also certified kosher.  The bakery staff speaks mostly Spanish (though the owners are Lebanese), so a rudimentary knowledge of Spanish helps.There are all sorts of other Middle Eastern goodies in this store.  Looking for halvah?  They've got like 20 different kinds.  Ditto with yogurt.  Browse the aisles, pick something exotic, and take it home and sample it.

30.description: After an arduous afternoon bike ride through the city (my ass will not forgive me), my roommate and I decided to skip going to Lincoln Square for a bite to eat, and decided on making some falafel at home. We went into Al Khayyam in pursuit of pita ($1! So cheap!). We made our way through the doors and zipped straight to the bakery section. There was an older man, working at the stove, heating up the pita. He greeted us with a polite "Hello!", and a huge smile.My roommate stopped dead in her tracks. Her eyes were glossed over and she looked as if she had just discovered the meaning of life, the universe, and everything. "I want that!" she pointed at the pita in the oven. He gladly obliged, pulling it out and stuffing that and a few other pieces of just heated pita into our bag.We walked to the registers, my roommate touching the bag of pita to my face and couldn't help but snack on it while in line.Less than $4. I love this place. I loooove Albany Park!

3.description: We drove 45 minutes to get to get baklava for a party. It was average at best, and not  fresh. Disappointing.

14.description: This place is amazing! All of the workers are so nice and so helpful. The quality, taste, and selection of the food is the best I have ever seen at any arabic grocery. I really have had only wonderful experiences in Albany Park in general, but this place is my favorite part of the neighborhood. Their pitas, cheeses, and baba ganoush are must tries.

1.description: I have been seeing Raechel for years, and I am obsessed with her. She makes you look and feel absolutely beautiful. She has not only done my makeup for me, she has also taught me how to wear makeup, taught me simple getting ready routines, and was completely honest with me about what I needed and what I did not need. She is also a genuine and good person who listens and gives great advice. I would follow her to the ends of the earth, but I'm glad she's close by!

0.description: Rae does my lash extensions and they are gorgeous! Shes very precise and they last a long time.  I have referred her to several people and they have all loved the experience

1.description: Our tenant called us to let us know her fridge broke. We looked at a couple places to purchase a fridge in good working condition, none of which met our expectations. Found L&L on yelp, walked in this morning, friendly staff. Answered all our questions for us. Bought a slightly used fridge that comes with a 3 month parts warranty and delivery. They will be delivering the fridge on Monday and hauling away the old fridge. Thanks for being honest and we love helping small businesses grow!!

9.description: Not exactly the best customer service, but price is good and Moishe is a nice guy. Got next-day delivery.

23.description: This place is very rough around the edges, though they do get the job done (even though it can take them awhile).My apartment had the hookups for a washer and dryer, but I was a sad panda. There was no washer and no dryer to go into the little alcove. My landlord wouldn't buy us one outright, but he agreed to pay half.Washers and dryers and kind of pricey, so i decided to look into second-hand merchandise. Like most second-hand retailers, customer service is not their strong point. Be prepared to wait, and wait and have to make lots of calls to get what you want.In the end, it's nice to be able to wash clothes at home, and I'd say that it was worth a week's worth of hassle. Hopefully I'll never have to go here again.

12.description: This is my kind of store!  Wanted a fridge. Didn't want to pay a lot and wanted it delivered quick and for free. Walked in, told Moshe what I wanted, he Gabe me the options in my price-point, and I didn't need to haggle in price. Everything prices appropriately.  Fridge delivered next day. No nonsense and no drama. Bada boom Bada Bing.

21.description: Wow. Scam artists, you could learn something from these guys. If I could give them less than one star, I would. We need our oven repaired. In reality, we knew that what was wrong with it was the little digital computer board was broken. I told them this over the phone. They charged me $65 to basically repeat this information back to me. First, they said someone would call me to set up an appointment. No one called after 4 or 5 days. Then I called and finally got in touch with someone to set the appointment. They arrived 2.5 hours after they said they would be there. The guy finally tells me, like I said, what I already knew. Hey said someone would call me to tell me how much the replacement part would cost. Of course, days pass. I call them. The guy who I talked to (Jeff) was a sleazy douche-bag. He was completely disrespectful and creepy to me. But that's neither here nor there. The long and short of it is that I called Jeff, and he told me, "Oh, you need a new stove," and I said, well, can I get my money back, because you guys didn't do anything, and after patronizing me and being very condescending, he said, "Have your landlord call me."Avoid these people like the plague

16.description: Wow. Scam artists, you could learn something from these guys. If I could give them less than one star, I would. We need our oven repaired. In reality, we knew that what was wrong with it was the little digital computer board was broken. I told them this over the phone. They charged me $65 to basically repeat this information back to me. First, they said someone would call me to set up an appointment. No one called after 4 or 5 days. Then I called and finally got in touch with someone to set the appointment. They arrived 2.5 hours after they said they would be there. The guy finally tells me, like I said, what I already knew. Hey said someone would call me to tell me how much the replacement part would cost. Of course, days pass. I call them. The guy who I talked to (Jeff) was a sleazy douche-bag. He was completely disrespectful and creepy to me. But that's neither here nor there. The long and short of it is that I called Jeff, and he told me, "Oh, you need a new stove," and I said, well, can I get my money back, because you guys didn't do anything, and after patronizing me and being very condescending, he said, "Have your landlord call me."Avoid these people like the plague

17.description: Great second hand /  rebuilt appliances.Store looks like crap and its crampt, but they have many styles to look at.  Get to know Moshe, he's the main man.  Give him a price range and he'll find you something decent.  Sometimes they get high end appliances(slightly used) and you can get a price much better than at a typical appliance store.If you need parts, they can help.  I've found drawers for older model refrigerators, racks, knobs and handles for ovens.  Delivery guys do a good job and will take the junk for a fee.  If you are new to owning rental property, this is a cost effective option.

10.description: My fiance and I have been shopping for a stainless steel refrigerator for weeks and do not have the budget to pay a fortune for it, and luckily we were recommended to come check out this place. The sales associate Adam was extremely friendly and amazing. The first time we showed up to the store it was right before they close and Adam stayed 30 mins with us showing us of our possible options. He went above and beyond to help my fiance and I to find an affordable stainless steel refrigerator that fits our budget and also fits perfectly in our new home. Thanks Adam! Will definitely recommend others to check out the place.

5.description: Recent purchase of a Whirlpool Duet Sport HT Washer was quite satisfactory. Decent price, Decent shape for a scratch and dent and a pleasant install. I have to confess... I am an L&L Moonie if you are old enough to get that.Years ago Art, God bless him, was the best and gave me a sweet deal on a Jenn Air Dual Fuel Dual oven range and Profile GE Microwave. Still working fine after over 10 years.Naturally, I go back when the washer died and met Moeshe, who turned me over to Chuck on Montrose, who had the right washer for me and another good deal.I can't help myself... They are the only place I know to go...

11.description: I heard from a friend about this place. I called and told them what I was looking for. I talked to a really nice and sweet Girl on the phone. She told me she would check on what we have and  why dont I just come in. So the next day I went in and to my surprise Lori remembered me and she and I talked to Moishe. They are very nice and honest. They helped me out greatly and got my stove and Fridge with a price that I can afford, I would tell you if you need something QUICK and AFFORDABLE THIS IS YOUR SPOT.  Also the other guys that work there asked can I help you did you need anything I kepts saying yes and Thank you.  I will send my friends and family. See ya soon,

22.description: Terrible customer service.  I waited around for two days for a person to repair my stove.  4 hours after the repair person was supposed to show up he calls and gets my voicemail (I'm on a work call),  I call him back 10 minutes later and he was already on his way to another job.  Two days wasted and my stove is still not fixed.

0.description: This is an update to my update.  I bought my washing machine used over 3 years ago and it's still going strong. No problems.   It's now hard to recall the crappy delivery men or the rough employees. All I can see is a very good washing machine.  So, if you can put up with some front-end negativity I think this place is worth a look.

20.description: Today I am shopping for the right hoses to convert the portable washing machine I bought from L & L a year and a half ago to a permanent-fixed washer (new apartment, new setup). The used machine has worked perfectly.  About two months after I bought it, I thought it wasn't working, and called (it was guaranteed). The repair man came on time, the machine wasn't broken, my son had just changed a setting that made it not fill, and the guy refused to charge us and was nice as he could be, although he'd climbed three flights for nothing. I'd give them five stars, but the owner made a complementary comment about the nice fit of the slacks I was wearing, even though there was a picture of his wife and daughters on the wall! I chided him, and he laughed and said, What could he do, a good looking woman will always be a good looking woman and he just couldn't help it! So just be aware of that little feature and wear a skirt, which I will if and when I need another appliance--and which I told him at the time.  I thought the service was excellent and the product has really lasted.

19.description: If I could give less than one star I would.Fridge died in my apt. and landlord gave me a credit line to pick something out here.They delivered a different fridge than what we picked out, though swear its what we wanted.  This fridge looks like a bomb was detonated inside of it.  They lost the brackets to switch the door open direction, so mine currently opens into a wall.  Going to bestbuy today, they can come pickup their crap on their own time.

2.description: THE WORST SPOT TO PURCHASE APPLIANCES! I walked in to acquire a piece for my dishwasher. The salesman on the floor proceeds to direct me to a gentlemen around the corner. The new guy I'm directed to asks what I need. I explain. He then says one minute and picks up his phone starts a conversation and walks away leaving me in the middle of the store. I then walk back to the original guy again to ask for help. He then ask me to show him the piece. This time he says we don't have it. Proceeds to sell me a new dishwasher. The outside looks fine pretty clean. I open it and roaches  ran out of the dishwasher. Freaking disgusting. I immediately walked out. Felt as if I should've burned my clothes. Be careful what you buy from these people. You might just be purchasing a new room mate señor roach

18.description: ABSOLUTE worst repair service I have ever received in Chicago.I was charged for a job that wasn't done properly.  Upon requesting that someone come back out to assess my dishwasher, still broken...I was told that the repair was out of their capacity, that L&L 'doesn't do that kind of repair'.  Would have been nice to know this immediately, before writing a check and being lead to believe that their job was one well done.  To top it off, many many of the folks working here are rude, disinterested and argumentative.  Multiple service men, and a handful of other office workers were outrageously discourteous while I tried to explain my situation and one hung up the phone.  The manager tried earnestly to get me partial money back.   And one receptionist was quite kind, and listened as one might be expected to in customer service when customer is dissatisfied.  Otherwise this experience was such a massive disappointment, I'd be hard pressed to lend half a star.  DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!

13.description: EDIT: So our coin dryer finally needed repair, in fact the tech came out 4 separate times. It was a pain to get him out each time, we had to call to follow up on the appt to remind them and were rescheduled several times. HOWEVER, we were only charged one $85 service call, one $50 part, and even though three of the calls were unrelated to the original failure, we were never charged again. Scott was very patient and came out each time, took 3 minutes to fix whatever was the problem (broken switch, blown fuse, etc) and never was rude or grumbled. These guys stand behind their repair warranty and even go above and beyond what is required!Original review: If you want friendly customer service, a clean store, and quick attention, go to Lowes and pay 4 times as much.If you want cheap prices and an honest transaction, L&L is for you. There is no BS here, you come in, pick what you want, pay and get out. If you order repair service, you get a gruff voice and a "yeah, we'll get out there."BUT...1. They have the best prices for appliances and repair2. They are honest and stand behind their warranties3. Their appliances last long beyond the warranty (our coin washer and dryer are more than 7 years old and have never needed repair, we've bought fridges and stoves and they've lasted years too)4. There is no BS, they will not charge you for a bogus repair5. It's a mom-and-pop place. Support local businesses!

4.description: Had the part for my stove I needed for dirt cheap.

24.description: Great second hand /  rebuilt appliances.Store looks like crap and its crampt, but they have many styles to look at.  Get to know Moshe, he's the main man.  Give him a price range and he'll find you something decent.  Sometimes they get high end appliances(slightly used) and you can get a price much better than at a typical appliance store.If you need parts, they can help.  I've found drawers for older model refrigerators, racks, knobs and handles for ovens.  Delivery guys do a good job and will take the junk for a fee.  If you are new to owning rental property, this is a cost effective option.

6.description: Terrible customer service! Price is not that attractive if you do your research. I came here because several people recommended me here for rock bottom prices. This was an appliance purchase for a rental property so I wasn't too picky about the product.I bought an over the range white GE microwave from them at $125. That was as far as they could come down from $150, which they tried to justify because "its new, the plastic is still on it." This pricing was not inclusive of shipping or tax. I later found a brand new, unused one was at a major appliance store for $175.  A used, newer model of the same brand and color was on craigslist for $75. Moral of the story: do your research before entering the store and shop around to avoid buyer's remorse. An easy thing to say now in hindsight, but then I was just trying to save some time and money, which did not happen.They were shrewd in placing the microwave way up top on the shelf so I could could not inspect the condition of the item. Upon delivery, the side of the appliance that was facing the wall had a huge dent, and the top of the unit was all scratched up with evidence of rust. "New" my ass, I'm pretty sure they just put a film on it. I would be less upset had the microwave been cheaper.No consistency in communication and complete lack or organization. When I inquired about shipping the lady at the store quoted me one price and the salesman quoted me a different higher price. On the day of the scheduled delivery, they called and asked if they could deliver the next day instead. When I asked them what time, they did not know, "just call in the morning." So I call the next morning and asked them what time I could expect delivery. The guy did not know and told me he would call me back just to get me off the phone. Fine, they are busy and need to consolidate their deliveries to optimize delivery route, understood. They did not call back for a few hours, so I call back asking the same question with the same response. Frustrated, I just kept calling back until they got it on the truck on on its way. I hate to be one of those annoying customers but I doubt they would have actually gotten it delivered on that day had I just waited around for their return call. Also, they did not offer installation service for the microwave when I asked, simply stating "just use a screwdriver." If it only were that simple.  Except they did not include any mounting hardware! The thing is they had said they would provide the hardware before and now it was missing. I called them about this and they didn't remember, and that I should stop by the store to see if they have anything available. Ain't nobody got time for that! This could have been avoided had they got it right the first time.If you want to buy appliances I would go elsewhere. The hassle is not worth it, and the pricing is not the greatest.

15.description: i called 3 times in 3 days  and she told me will call you back to schedule  service in 5 m but never called back ,bad service made me wait for nothing

7.description: Avoid this store like the plague!!! This has got to be one of the worst operations I have ever dealt with. In a span of one month, I purchased a refrigerator, stove, and coin operated washer and dryer. Over the last six months, I have called them nearly a dozen times to get each of the appliances serviced. The appliances are garbage. I would have been much better off (and saved myself a ton of time, money and patience) if I would have just purchesed new appliances from Abt, Home Depot or Best Buy. You've been warned!

8.description: I was looking for a stacked washer and dryer, one unit, not too easy to find. I called Adam,at the Lawrence Ave. location and explained to him what I was looking for and although it was not for me,  I needed a good solid working machine.  He directed me to look at a couple he had at another store.  I chose one and delivery was prompt and hook up was arranged where the parts needed would be include as promised.  I received a call later that day from Adam asking me if I found what I was looking for and he promised me that the warranty would be honored if any problems were to arise.  I just needed to call.  Yesterday,I received a follow-up call from Adam asking if the party that I purchased the unit for was satisfied with the performance of the machine.  I told him they were and he assured me that  if any issues were to arise, please call and it would be addressed.  I was impressed with the follow up call and the assurance Aadam offered.

3.description: We got a great deal on a slightly banged up new oven. It lasted about a year and half. We cannot repair the oven due to the oven not having a model or serial number on it. Let me repeat: Our slightly banged up, but brand new oven which we purchased for a third of the retail price, does not have a serial number. We now need to purchase a new oven, which will be from a legit retailer.

14.description: moishe always takes care of me and the prices are right.  if you know a little bit about what you're looking for, and can haggle a bit, you're going to make out great.  l&l is a landlords dream!

1.description: This was a nice place.  A buddy and I stumbled upon it wine in hand.  This was during Ramadan so we didnt think they would let us bring wine but they were cool with it.  I had the dried beef and mozzarella appetizer.  The cheese was really domestic swiss.  The holes were a dead give away.  For the main dish I got the grilled combo platter of ground chicken, beef and ground beef with a rice pilaf.  Very nice.  We had a cool French speaking Maroccan waitress.  However I must admit that the hookah smoke was an unfortunate distraction.  Fortunately there were not too many people smoking.  I wonder how they get around the city smoking ban......  Marc

2.description: This place was very cool.  My friend and I were the only ones in there, but it was an odd time (5pm Sunday afternoon).  I have to agree with Norbie about the owners/staff -- sooooo super-friendly!  =)   I can't remember what flavors of tobacco we got, but they were tasty.  I think the bill was $25 for two hookahs and two waters.  I'd definitely go back!

0.description: I have to say that I honestly really love this place. We attended a 30th bday party there this Sunday evening. The atmosphere was great- very relaxing as well as some interesting décor. I loved the owner's passion for belly dancing (as she performs herself)-- you can tell she's incredibly dedicated to the business. Food was very good as well as reasonably priced... PLUS its BYOB. Overall, I'll be back again w. my wine... ready to get my belly dancing on :)

1.description: I don't recommend this location at all Service VERY BAD with BAD attitude  Don't waste your time here

2.description: Small but not bad at all.

0.description: I really like this Sally's. Average sized, have everything you need. If it's not on the shelf, just ask and they'll check in the back or when it will be delivered. They may not seem very helpful when you first walk in, but just ask for help (they tend to leave you alone); everyone here is pretty knowledgable. Also what I like is that they know what's on sale, so they'll always save you a few dollars or hook you up with a freebie/promo

3.description: Not bad for a 5 dollar haircut.  Make it 10, because I figure a good cut is worth at least 10 bucks.  So I walked in 5 minutes before posted closing time, but they were happy to oblige.  15 minutes later I walked out with a decent cut, and it only cost me 10 dollars.  Lots of very nice looking Hispanic girls in here!  I'm not sure how much they understood of what I asked for, but the end result was good.  If you live in the neighborhood, it's worth stopping by.  AND....since it's ONLY 5 BUCKS A CUT...  TIP WELL!!!!!

1.description: Not a great place for a woman's haircut. Most of the stylists do not have skill enough for a diverse catalog of styles. I had a pixie cut and wanted just a little trim to keep the mullet effect at bay. Decided I didn't want to pay too much to cut so little hair so I went here. Explained what I wanted very clearly. I came out looking like an 18 year old boy headed for the Navy, buzzed around the sides with hair piled on top. That was my most humiliating haircut ever and my last trip to Quizhpe's.

2.description: In my neighborhood there are no less than 5 $5 haircut joints within six blocks walking distance. My usual Wendy's and Vanessa's was packed almost out the door today, so I decided to dice roll Quizhpe's to get my hair did before my friend's wedding party tonight. I dropped in and saw about three people waiting in line, but apparently they were waiting for people getting haircuts so I was seated immediately on a Friday at 5:30pm.Sat down, the lady popped some stuffing on my collar so hair would not drop in then put a towel on my shoulders. #1 fade with scissor cut on top, please! The hair stylist gave me a fade all the way to the top of the dome which was higher than other places generally do and took great care near the top. The scissor cut began and I was getting worried because I was pretty sure I was starting to look like someone who escaped planet of the apes with a chimpanzee haircut. I was actually getting mad about it, but then combed my hair forward and it looks great. Of course with a $5 haircut you get an obligatory razor shave on your hairline and they do a good job getting all of the hair out of your head so you don't need to shower again right after. Good job, Quizhpe's!

0.description: This is the first $5 haircut shop when I enter W.Lawrence Ave. from Broadway St.All I need is a simple haircut, no fancy, no perm or any kind. They speak Spanish all the time with each other, but most of them understand and speak English pretty well.I expect these affordable community / neighborhood  haircut Salon will be more and more since you go west through W. Lawrence Ave. there are bunches of them.Tip them well after the cut is done.

58.description: Pros:Great weight room: hands down the best one in comparison to other Xsport facilities.Large space upstairs to do your own thing (as long as there isn't a Zumba class going on, it's like a circus then)Great gym first thing in the morning and late at nightCons:Ladies locker room is awful.  Not only is it not clean most of the time, they really need to remodel that thing, it's not functional if its crowded, barely any room to walk around inMusic during a cardio class is ridiculous, seriously can you turn it down...just a little?Parking lot, parking lot, parking lot, seriously the worst I have ever seen.  If you don't live near by, it's really not worth traveling to this location since there is no where to park. Perverts: if your a woman, a good looking woman, the men are like predators- my favorite, catching groups of them hang outside of the Zumba class watching all the ladies " bounce" around.  The staff says nothing.Cardio area is completely worthless, I think there is something like 25-30 total machines. Doosh bags who pretend to be boxers for a whole week, who stand there and beat the punching bag as fast as they can, then rest, then repeat, then rest, then repeat, then go home.  GREAT WORKOUT, JACK ASS. I'm sure I'll be watching you live on HBO in the near future.  - make better use of your time, and stop annoying the rest of us with the unnecessary noise.

56.description: I was a member a while back.prosgroup classessaunanever a problem getting an ellipticalconstook my money then never followed up like some gyms do.weight area intimidating-uncomfortable for some reason-i never had a problem parkinggood hours

29.description: 1 star only because I had to.I have had nothing but problems with 2 locations (Logan & Elston-this review will be on both yelp pages) since starting my membership in December 2013.The incompetent employees at BOTH locations truly get more shocking with every visit.I opened a tanning account originally with the Lakeview location, unaware that I was not able to use this membership at any of their other locations (BECAUSE.. and you'll see this trend start now: No one told me! Their customer service is horrific). At the time, I lived near the Logan Square location and had my membership transferred.
