With no problems.I moved in April and am now closer to their Elston location, so naturally I would have my membership transferred and that would be that. No no noooooo. Every time I have gone to the Elston location in the last 4 months it's been a gamble on whether or not I will actually tan during this visit.Every time I have been there, I've been told that I do not have a membership; and am either refused service, told to go back to the Logan Square location to sort it out for myself (which I did. they had me sign some papers and that was it. it was "all taken care of" -said the manager in the spa at Logan), or on a good day whoever was working the desk wouldn't feel like dealing with whatever is actually wrong with my account and would "just let me" tan.Now, I have physically shown multiple employees my online banking showing them that I have recently paid my bill, so what's the problem? I was actually in there TODAY to update my credit card, to pay you with!!Let me ask you this, XSport, champion of all that is bullshit; why would one frequent a gym under the ruse that they have a membership?? To willingly deal with your poor choice of employees, horrible lack of customer service and just straight idiocy? That's not really my idea of fun.And don't even bother trying corporate because they are truly no better.Will not spend one more penny in this cesspool (either one...they're equally disgusting -- seriously, are these places ever inspected?)

42.description: I would rather be writing this review after a few months of being a member, however this didn't happen because of1. They were too aggressive in selling me their products and services. 2. I was not informed the supplements cannot be returned.3. They wouldn't provide myself with thorough answers.4. Personal training sessions are overpriced.First off, I requested a trainer of my body type so I can see their program is working. I was told there is a guy, but when I came in next time they said they cannot find him and assigned myself a different guy. I was asking for that guy but they told me the new guy will be my personal trainer from now on.I liked my training sessions, however I didn't get answers for some of my questions.I was recommended to buy 4 kinds of supplements with very shallow explanation of why I need this. Trying to return the supplements, which I didn't open, I was told they don't do returns and the only thing they can do is to get me a gift card which for the amount spent, which can be used across all their locations.We scheduled to meet with a manager at the gym and when I came asking to call her I was told she's on a tour and they cannot call her.To cancel a membership you have to mail a letter to the corporate and they claim this is Illinois law and all the gyms are no different in this.I found it challenging to find a parking lot by the gym at 5-6 p.m. however this is not an issue as the street parking around the place is easy.What I loved is they work 24/7, gym looks nice and clean with lots of space and tools, not crowded at all.

23.description: I just joined the Elston Xsport and I like it so far. I haven't tried the classes yet but I signed up for personal training for 6 months. I'm very happy with my trainer so far, he's very positive and keeps in touch with me despite my fluctuating work schedule. The gym is pretty warm inside and I wish they would filter the air or open a window. It gets a little humid and smells like sweat sometimes. But other than that, it's a pretty basic gym with more than enough to get in a good workout. The parking lot fills up around their peak hours and I had to park on the street which is not too bad.

47.description: If I could give this place zero stars, I would. One of the workers there was giving my friends and I an attitude. We were inquiring about membership and she was getting irritated at all the questions. Isn't it your job to try and sell membership?

8.description: Join this gym if you don't mind getting charged for a bunch of shady extra shit and having to sit on hold with customer service multiple times per year.

31.description: I received a yelp message from corporate about my experience. I'm happy to say that Alex also called to patch things up and apologize for the confusion, which I greatly appreciated. Also, everyone at the desk has been nothing but helpful and friendly since my first day. On top of all of that, my personal trainer Lauren is AMAZING! She's fun, cares genuinely about her clients and is very in tune with what I want and can accomplish. Thank you for paying attention to your customers!

34.description: Honestly, I don't understand why all the bad reviews. What, because they don't provide towels?The thing about the Elston location that I don't think some people can appreciate is that it's not a health club culture; it's a gym culture. I'd say about 90% of the people who train there are there to train hard, push heavy weight, and make friends with others training just as hard (the women train just as hard, if not harder).It's a great gym for seasoned lifters, professional lifters, beginners, and those in between.(Also, the first 12 pictures are not of the Elston location).Pros:+ gym culture (no glam health club sparkles, no purple and pink). Also, if you ask to work in, they understand what you mean and will usually welcome you to work in.+ Iron plates (plates are not covered with rubber, so no wondering if their weight includes the rubber or not)+ Staff is friendly and helpful: girls at the front will always say hello, most often goodbye, and sometimes small talk in between); + staff is helpful: I'd mentioned that I'm having trouble finding a whey protein powder without artificial sweeteners. So a couple of the guys are keeping their eyes open for one (they thought they'd found one for a moment, but research showed otherwise. So they're still looking).+ Chalk is welcome, just don't make a mess.+ Trainers are certified and actually know what they're doing/talking about.+ Wear what you want. (My friends and I just wear jeans and gym shoes-we don't even use the locker room).+ There's a sort of family/fellowship culture there. You meet people, they remember you later, gain friends, notice when you haven't shown up in a while, give/get tips for better form/ lifting / results, etc.+ good variety and selection of machines, both upstairs and downstairs.+ 5 or 6 benches+ 2 sets of dumbbells (or 4 of each weight)+ treadmills, elliptical machines, bikes, stairs, etc.+ smoothie bar and sitting area+ small store area (staff also have good knowledge of products sold)+ protein drinks, protein bars, etc. kept cold+ classes upstairs+ heavy bags and speed bags upstairs+ since Elston is not a "full-service" gym, you can get good deals to only go there (versus paying an arm and a leg for them all, like when you sign up at Niles).+ once you sign up, you're locked into that contract for life, as long as you continue to renew each year. So if you get a great deal, no worries about price hikes. (By buddy's been a member since they opened up around 2001.    Because he renews every year, he's still paying the great price he got back then).+ they just started up something that none of the other locations are doing: members can bring in friends or relatives anytime (no limit of times) for free (previous price = $10). The hope is that they'll sign up, but no pressure.+ open 24/7Cons:- small parking lot. You can park for free on the surrounding streets, but you could also drive around for 20+ minutes searching for a spot during peak times. And they're land-locked, so buying more space for parking is next to impossible (and the neighborhood won't let them build a multi-level parking garage).-

16.description: Is it the most amazing gym in the world?  No, but it's $20/month and a mile from my house.  I've been a member at the more expensive Xsports as well, so at first it was a tad disappointing (i.e. no towels, no pool, not as many classes, etc.), but it's really not too bad.  There are some work out classes, there are sufficient machines and weights, and there's even a sauna room.  The staff are also pretty nice, so can't complain.

13.description: I've been a member here for six years...I've seen good cleaning ladies and Bad cleaning lady and then you Have MARIA... This lady goes above and beyond friendly and hard working.... The women's locker room has.NEVER been cleaner and neither has the machines.... They better know what they have and keep her!!!

11.description: Great spacious place to get a full workout. Plenty of benches for flat, incline and decline. Plenty of smith machines, too. Friendly staff that keep it clean.I'm an Xpress member and although this gym is further from me than the others, I still come here. Highly recommend.

39.description: I like this gym. I was a bit scared because of the negative reviews but was pleasantly surprised. Good membership price, cheap tanning and every treadmill has their own tv. Plus my trainer Rachael was amazing! She knew her stuff and was super cool. The bathroom did kind of smell but it is a gym. Gyms in Ca are so much more expensive and crowded plus you don't always have a tv @ your machine.

37.description: I have been stalked for weeks to join this location by Thomas Cubas. I was mislead to believe that by joining for $19.99 per month it would give me access to all locations. I have detailed emails and phone calls between him and I and he was basically lying to get me in the door and stick me with more misleading confusion. I was a fan of Xsport without all the lying. I specifically asked him would the $19.99 give me access to the Logan square location because it's near my home and he emphatically said yes. He lied for weeks. Not Appreciated At All & Not needed. I may look into joining Planet fitness because of this and i know it has less amenities but they are the lesser liars.

0.description: Alright gym at best. This is my preferred gym since it's walking distance from home. Two of the cleaners (A young man and woman) who are there morning to mid afternoon are two of the hardest workers in this facility and clean up the mess a few irresponsible folk might leave behind. Pros-Hammer Strength, Cybex and Free Motion machines-Lot's of cardio machines-Can get a quick workout upstairs on some machines-Good customer serviceCons-Can be packed almost everyday-Almost impossible to find a dumbbell that is 5lbs-25bs-There are some not so nice members in the weight room who hog stuff and may give other members a rough time. -A few safety hazards in the weight room like walking areas being crowded, plates, some dumbbells, benches scattered everywhere

38.description: I know this is one of the more poorly rated Xsports but I actually really like this location.I'll get the cons out of the way first.Towels, organization, other people.First towels, there are none. All other non-express Xsports that I've been to provide towels, I do not know why they don't have them.Second organization, and by this I mean of the weights. Things are often a mess and just spread out everywhere. Getting your hands on a DB under 30 lbs can sometimes be impossible. People here often simple just don't give a fuck and don't put things back and this really frustrates me.Third people. Some of the people here are straight up awesome, lots of serious people who don't necessarily take themselves too seriously. Its got a good and motivating vibe in that regard. Now beyond that there are other folks who simply have no basic respect for others in many regards. This usually just is limited to folks taking up tons of equipment and having no regard for others that may need to use it. The number of times I've had to wait on a bro using the incline bench as a texting chair is angering.With all that said it might seem like I hate this place, but its quite the opposite. This location is special to me. All the machines and benches are black and all the weights are metal which gives it a much more serious vibe. Something about those aspects just make it more visceral and motivating. They've got 3 nice power racks all stationed in front of mirrors how they belong. Its clear lifting is the main focus of this location and I like that.They've literally got every piece of equipment I want which is really nice.If you're looking for cardio or classes this location might not be as good as some others for that.I've been going here for probably 6 months now and have no plans to stop.

51.description: The price is decent here and it's walking distance from my house. However, there is a serious lack of cleaning supplies. You ask people to clean the machines after they use them but don't have an adequate amount of supplies to do so. I'm glad that they upgraded some of the equipment but the cardio machines still suck and there simply aren't enough of them. Other than that, what sucks most about this gym is the crowd. The rest of the gym is ehhh on cleanliness, it's a gym, there's obviously going to be sweat somewhere here and it's not going to smell great. Oh and I think a lot of people would appreciate it if they covered the windows in the group exercise room. Either that or have a staff member ask all the pigs who stand there to move elsewhere.

27.description: I also would like to share the SAME COMPLAINT as Jay H below on this highly incompetent and RUDE LEE supposed manager. I was told they were fined 10k (right.....) for gym bags being used in wait for it......A GYM. Thats right folks now we are being told gym bags are not allowed in a gym and that I needed to go back to the parking lot to get my stuff. LEE admitted to the THEFTS that occur in the locker room as well. Well lets see I am not allowed to bring my gym bag in with the items i need for my workout now? XSPORT and Kelly Cartwright you really need to pick up the ball here and listen to the members. All with complaints please email Kelly and let her know about the big issues with this location and LEE in general. Her email address is kelly.cartwright@xsportm… and Dan Morrissey (both with capital fitness) is also another employee that this should be brought to his attention as well!LEE how about worry about keeping the gym clean and the equipment put back instead of your employees sitting behind the desk doing nothing and playing with their cell phones???A very dissatisfied member!!!!Stay away for those who aren't members yet!

32.description: I have been a member at this Elston location since 2003...so I think I am pretty qualified to make the assertions I will be making. Back in the earlier years, it was a great gym....machines would always be working...you could go at 7-9 pm and guaranteed that there'd be a treadmill, elliptical to use. Weight room was kept clean and in order...fast track to NOW and the staff is pushy, there is definitely a high turnover rate because no "manager" lasts longer than 6 mos...each time I have had to speak with a manager, I have gotten someone different. This beside the point that they are aggressive..unorganized (lost paperwork I had given them to freeze my membership due to having a baby) and unprofessional. I have seen the front staff numerous of times on their cell phones. On to my next point, in the warmer weather months, it's like they purposely only have the ceiling fans on. This along with a bad circulation system inside the gym, creates a STUFFY, suffocating feeling to the gym. There is no way one can work out comfortably when you can't even breathe. But my BIGGEST annoyance with this gym or I should say with the whole XSPORT chain is the corporate greed...they are so hung up on enrolling as many people as they can that they care SQUAT about making the workout experience a pleasant one. I cannot even go anytime between 5pm-8pm because they are jam-packed anywhere you go to the gyy, cardio, weights, 2nd Fl. Even though clearly they are filled to capacity, they are still giving "tours" to prospective members.What would usually be an hour to complete my workout becomes more like an hour and a half because I have to wait to use a machine because there are 5 people ahead of me waiting to use the machine. I was a member for a long long time because they were so close to home and affordable but now I'd rather go a bit out of my way and pay a bit more...but at least know that the gym is not going to be overflowing with people. XSPort only cares about getting you IN..but it's obvious that their highest priority is NOT catering to the wellness and lifestyle of its members

54.description: This location is by far the worst. I feel that it is dirty as the wash stations never seemed to be stocked with cleaning solution. There are also many people who do not clean up after themselves or put weights away-it is a mess. I tried attending a yoga class in the evening but the noise from the boxing area right outside the door made the whole experience less than relaxing. There also have been guys walking around without shoes or socks as well as a guy washing his hair in the drinking fountain. This is disgusting. I only go to this location since it's the closest to my house.

48.description: Totally misleading advertisement ..... No free 7 days pass   .... They are wasting your time and want to get you to sign up for 18 months!!!!False advertisement. !!!!!!There  is no 9.95 per month!!!! They want to sell you membership ,,,All bs ...I am very very disappointed  ...  I wanted to pay as advertised month by month $9.95But I been told at gym NOPE ... It's  $40-$50 monthly and I need to get 18 months membership .... WOW... PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME,

44.description: Z  E  E  E  E  R  O  O  O  O    STARSI went here to utilize the 7-day free pass as advertised ALL OVER the internet. I went with a time constraint needing to be at work by 12 PM. I arrived at 9:55AM and was expecting to work out for an hour. Instead of being offered a workout I was pressed into a tour, shown the weight room, taken upstairs, etc. I declined to view the locker room. I was practically dragged by the hand into the tanning salon booth to tour it even though I emphatically stated I won't be using the tanning rooms at all. Then after the tour I was shown a chair and they started with the numbers games where they talk really, really fast and write down lots of numbers and figures then cross out numbers and present multiple options all at once in a deliberate effort to purposely confuse the (future) (would-be) client. In te end I should have just stood up and walked away but I had the sense if I did stand up and walk away they would follow me to my home in their car - that's how pushy those 2 guys were. They kept telling me I don't know how to lift weights and I must have a trainer that will take me to new levels, etc. I explained that I had worked with trainers int he past and simply wanted to sing up for a month-to-month membership and they kept pushing and pushing and going over multiple options, on and on. In the end I signed up for some membership and called the corporate headquarters to cancel the next day. It was the only way to make those 2 guys stop. After the tour and the extended time trying to sell me training sessions I didn't want I had to leave and go home and change for work. I never even had the opportunity to use the workout facilities that day - the very reason I went there in the first place! I will never set foot in the MAYFAIR Elston Ave location as long as I live!UPDATE:In the interest of honesty and full disclosure, about a week after writing my review I was personally sought out by a rep from their Customer Service Dep't. This lady took the time to specifically listen to my complaint and profusely apologized for the complete and utter terrible way the guys at the Mayfair Elston Ave location mis-behaved towards me. She offered me a couple promos as a courteous outreach, in gesture of an apology. I do thank Kelly for taking the time and responsibility to correct and rectify a very negative experience! Only due to Kelly I am changing from 1 star to 2 stars. I wish there was a way to rate the corporate division separately....

24.description: Gum still has not been cleaned out of cup holder since my last update...Seriously? Is it at a corporate level too? You just apologize for a filthy gym yet choose to do nothing about it?

7.description: Seriously the biggest crooks, lied to my face about how i cancel. Now i have to send in a letter to corporate, that could take months for them to get around to opening and canceling. I know because i had to cancel my tanning that way, that i when i ashes about how to cancel my gym membership and the Manager(laugh) said "no you can cancel that here with us." Bottom line it is cheap because you will pay for it in many other ways.EDIT after posting this review I got a call from Mike at xsport saying he would help me close my account, just fax directly to him my letter and he will do it same day. Well I did on July 14th and still on 8/1 I am getting charged. Due not ever come here, they will steal from you over an over and tell you it's your fault but as the good guys they will not refund you but stop stealing from you,then guess what the steal from you again.

49.description: This place really as awful as the other Yelpers have stated. I called here twice-both times I received totally different information on registration, policies, prices, etc. We go in here and we are not greeted, the people at the counter speaking to one of the 3 employees standing around were being really rude and kept staring at us like how dare we walk into their gym? Ew, who are you? That's not the gym's fault, but it seems to be a common theme that other yelpers have said the people who frequent this gym are really intimating/rude/gross. So, we're standing around and then finally someone decides to give us the time of day and we ask for a tour. We're told to fill out paperwork for liability reasons, ok...but the form was asking us if we exercised and what our goals were, it wasn't about not suing them if we trip and break our face. So, we're told just fill it out and someone will be with you in a few minutes. We fill it out and notice there's at least 7 trainers/employees standing around all talking and laughing with one another, while we're still being unattended. So after 10 minutes of waiting we reapproach the front desk and say "you know what, we have to go we have to be somewhere and we just really wanted a 5 minute tour of the gym" and instead of saying sure, she ran off found some random employee and completely ignored what we said about needing to go. The employee was trying to get us to sit down and talk about training or something, instead of just giving us the tour we kept asking for. The reviews on here on terrible, why would I want anyone training me or anything? I wanted to see it for myself. We tell her "we have to go, we've been waiting in here for quite some time to be shown the gym and we're leaving" and her response isn't "I'm sorry" it's "well when can you come back in?" and when we said we didn't know since we both work and really we weren't in any rush to come back to this location she gave us an attitude and said she'd call us. Sorry, I gave you a fake number because the customer service is just as crappy as everyone says it is. It's unfortunate too because it's just simply not that hard. We intended to sign up w/ this gym, but we really wanted to see if it was dirty and as rude as the last reviews claim before doing so. No one is going to meet their sales quota with that attitude.

40.description: I have been a member here for years but I may be done now.  I went in at 2 PM on a Sunday.  It was not that busy.  The girl at the front desk rolled her eyes when I asked to tan. After asking me my info multiple times because she clearly was not listening she had to get a manager because she couldn't get the system to work.  She finally gets it going with his assistance and it was the one type of bed I specifically told her I did not want.  She went back to try to set things up with the right bed and the system would not let her because none of the beds were clean. That is a little ridiculous at 2 PM on Sunday when it was very quite but I said nothing.She then said she would clean beds and walked away extremely slowly.  It's not the first time I've been in there and all of their 10+ beds are dirty.  Usually at that point they say go up to bed #__ in 5 min.  No one said a word so I am left standing at the front desk wondering what I am supposed to do next.  I then ask the manager if the transaction is all set up because I will just come back another time.  His response was "she has to clean the beds." I then said forget it, I will come back later as he clearly was not going to provide any insight on how long I needed to wait, whether I could come back later, etc.  His response was a rather lippy "well, do you want a dirty bed?"At that point I had had enough.  I don't even need to patronize the gym.  I walked out of the gym.  The manager followed me out and got in an SUV and chatted with some gal....no wonder the beds are dirty.  The kid was a disrespectful lazy punk.Stay away.  Not worth it.

53.description: It's really dirty, dark, and gross. Women's bathroom always smells like someone took piles and piles of huge shits all over the place. There are always barefooted dudes walking all over the second floor and I reported them to the front desk, but no one really seems to care. This is just disgusting. One guy told me "oh well if he's barefooted by the boxing section that's a different story". Really now????There is never any cleaning spray around so no one ever wipes down the equipment. seriously, this place needs a complete gut rehab and start again. They need more spin bikes to accomodate renee's classes. I've seen so many fights it's ridiculous. They only have 19 spin bikes and often they are broken. I don't think anyone really checks them out for service. During one class, one girl's pedal broke off the bike, how dangerous!

30.description: Service sucks, they stole 75 $ out of my account fought two months to get it back, x sport corporate offices suck to, barely can get a hold of them.

46.description: It's close to home so the DH and I thought we would give it a try. We spoke to the pm manager when we there who must also be a used car salesman because his pitch to entice us to join was akin to "what can I do to get you into this car?" He repeatedly told us we NEEDED personal training and the more sessions we might buy would result in paying less money "in the long run." We are middle aged adults, not 20-somethings who will believe this line. We assured him this was not a money thing, but he persisted. This guy knew next to nothing about fitness, only sales-and was not really effective at that. We signed up for free fitness assessments. I was hoping the clientele would be less shady during daytime hours when I went for my assessment.  It was better, but I also got to see how dirty the place is with sunlight streaming in.  The pt assigned to do my assessment was not there when I arrived for my appointment so I did 25 minutes of cardio and he still had not shown up. The day manager tried to call him but no answer. Apparently there is no accountability for tardiness or AWOL by employees. I said I would go do some weight machines. 35 minutes later still no personal trainer.  I spoke to the day manager again (who never once apologized) and professed my displeasure with the unprofessional ism and lack of structure in  this Xsport and left. An HOUR later the pt called me and apologized and offered me a free pedicure. WHAT?????? How about a few free training sessions since you can afford to show up at your own leisure?Bottom line: the membership is reasonable but there is a hard sell for everything else; run by unprofessional idiots and utilized largely by thugs and and smelly, dirty people. Don't bother with this one. If I could give it zero stars I would.

1.description: Smell like ass! Management sucks!Equipment is old! Too crowded!Parking is an issue!Would not recommend!

55.description: One of the main deterrents of this place is the parking lot - it's way too small relative the gyms capacity. Once you can get past that, its actually a really good place to work out. There's a great comradery between a lot of the people who lift there and it even seems like a mini community. Most everyone is really nice and respectful here. A big plus is the main weightlifting room - it's a mans zone. I can see how it could be intimidating, but if you want to get your swoll on this is the place. I try and avoid this xsport from 6-8 because its just too crammed with people, but aside from that its solid.

9.description: I was excited when we first got our memberships. About a month after joining my doctor put me on bed rest and my husband took in all the paperwork since that's what they asked us to do. They claimed to have lost it and continued billing us. He took it in a second time and claimed to have lost it again and of course billed us that month too. He takes it a third time and the person at the desk says I was supposed to take it in and not him. While on bed rest I went to take the paperwork in and it didn't seem to matter because they continued to bill us. He took full responsibility of me while on bed rest, as I couldn't be left alone and they didn't want to freeze either one of our accounts. The person at the desk just completely interrupted my talking, said he couldn't do anything, and walked away. Fast forward 1 year later, I'm finally cleared from bed rest and am looking forward to going back to the gym. Xsport would've been on the top of my list but as much as I like the gym I don't have time to be dealing with another billing problem. The only reason for the 1 star is because they offer childcare and therefore my husband and I could workout together or I can simply go on my time and take the kids with me when he's not home. I'll most likely be going to a local gym even if they don't offer child care and at a fraction of the price that xsport charges. I'm really bummed I'm not considering this gym but the service was horrible. I wouldn't recommend.

26.description: Annoying sales rep  this gym feels like a car lot where they have annoying sales cars men

25.description: I had moved to the Elston location from a different Xsport for convenience, even though the Elston location is dark and dingy and a little smelly. I was approached by one of the trainers, named Lee, and purchased a twelve-session training package, although he was pushing me to purchase a 24-package. He drew up the contract, which I signed without looking at (this later came back to haunt me). After 2 sessions with Lee, during which he was always distracted, constantly walking away to do other things, and would end our sessions in 45 minutes (instead of an hour, which is what I paid for), he finally texted me AN HOUR before our third session to tell me that he was unable to continue with our training and that I would have to find another trainer. He was also supposed to changed my membership from the Pipers Alley location to Elston (which was half the price), which he never followed through with. I decided to continue on at a nicer location. Lee was unable to accommodate me in helping me find a new trainer, and I had to spend 2hrs on the phone with corporate to do this.After I'd had one session with my new trainer, I realized that Lee had actually signed me for a 24-session contract, although I had expressly told him I wanted to go with the 12. While this was my fault for not reading the contract, when I called corporate to clarify the error, I was told there was nothing they could do for me. Frankly, Lee, behaved extremely strangely throughout this entire episode, and I am fairly certain he knowingly mislead me into signing a longer contract then  I had verbally agreed to. In addition to this, XSport policies and procedures are insanely inefficient and not customer-oriented. I was on hold for close to 30-60 minutes every time I called corporate. I had to send all documentation to them by certified mail (as opposed to email, which is just as easily trackable). I cancelled not only my personal training sessions (which was a HUGE hassle, and which I plan on pursuing elsewhere), but also my membership to XSport, along with my husband's membership, and the memberships of the three friends my husband regularly trains with. We're taking our business elsewhere, even if it costs us more to do so.

12.description: A lot of equipment here for you to select from /also classes,although it's considered an express gym

59.description: Best time to go is late night. Avoid all the congestion and parking issues.Actually enjoy the construction that is going on around there right now because has kept the gym not as busy. Easy to get in the zone during workouts. I haven't attended any of the classes here but machines are good, with the exception to the one or 2 broken elliptical machines from time to time.

21.description: Small, stuffy, busy and they have very pushy sales people in your face, aka trainers, which are super nice until you say no. Hard time finding a parking spot.

17.description: Ladies, the women's bathroom is covered in inches of sewage water as of this moment. The women's locker room floor is wet from that water being tracked in because Xsport did not close the conjoined bathroom/locker room while roto-rooting their sewage system. They didn't even put up signs about the work or the potential biohazard. Just a generic sign about there being men in the women's locker room today.They let the plumbers drag their disgusting sewage encrusted wet hoses and sewage water equipment across the main first floor carpeted area where people exercise instead of using the side service door.When I told the front desk staff member about the potential for human waste and e-coli to be spreading around the gym, the desk staff acted like I was completely stupid. He dismissed me, saying they had signs up about men working in the locker room. I repeated that my concern was about the raw sewage on the bathroom floor and Xsport not closing the conjoined locker room and allowing female clients to WALK THROUGH SEWAGE WATER, and allowing the contaminated water to be tracked through the main gym area. I repeated this FOUR TIMES and each time he just said that signs are posted about men working in the women's locker room, totally ignoring my concerns.This is horrific and I am never setting foot in this gym again.

10.description: This place is just the worst. The "manager" Lee is just horrible. Just from my facebook friends alone I've heard a lot of very negative feedback about him specifically.This is the closest gym to my house and my favorite place to lift in terms of the gyms actual set up.At any rate I go to the gym every day. They stopped me at the beginning of the week saying I wasn't allowed to enter without talking to the head of customer service because there was a note under my account saying so. I called their hot line and wait 10 min up front with no answer. I ask if there is a direct line to her, they give it to me (why not give me this number in the first place?) I've left several voicemails and no one has attempted to get back to me. There was no reason left as to why I'm being stopped, but I've already paid off my year at the gym and they aren't allowing me in. The gym is a daily thing for me, it's bs for them to stop me with absolutely no reason and have me being allowed back in contingent on someone speaking to me but making no effort to contact me after a week. The staff here is just horrible, rude and unprofessional.

5.description: Gum still has not been cleaned out of cup holder since my last update...Seriously? Is it at a corporate level too? You just apologize for a filthy gym yet choose to do nothing about it?

3.description: Completely rude and not really into trying to get paying customers. I went for a 7 day trial. I wanted to experience the gym. I brought my daughter. I was dressed in gym clothes and ready to workout.  They didn't tell me until after I filled out all the paperwork that I wasn't allowed to use childcare. My husband was also with me. So he took her home. I found it rude they didn't tell us straight away that we couldn't use the childcare-when that was clearly our intent. I then went to a class. One of the managers kicked me out and said it was for members only. It's like they were really trying to get me not to join. I mean seriously people. Mission accomplished!! I will not be joining. I don't recommend this location to anyone.

35.description: Didn't expect much from this place from all the reviews, but honestly my experience here has been pretty good so far being my first gym membership.I usually go post rush hours so it's not as busy. Bathrooms are decent and equipment is maintained Well Enough, but why make yourself at home, ya know? Unless you're a professional body builder or a personal trainer, be in and out with your workout.Some complaints; "XsportCafé" is pretty slow making your drink. My girlfriend took a nap while we waited 40 minutes; needless to say, that is too long to make a shake. The employees often socialize in between making the shakes, and it gets awkward while you're waiting, and hear inside jokes irrelevant to you. Members need better gym etiquette putting things away. Gets messy.

19.description: Worst xsport ever , very dirty and most of the machines are broke , old . In addition, they're not friendly as other xsport's .

28.description: the worst customer service ever!! management is the worst , lee specially been a member since 2005 and never felt the need to look for another gym till now after the way i was harassed on two occasions this being the last about a gym bag in the gym?! what lee feeling the need to call the police because someone would not acknowledge you and your unannounced title , come on im there to workout not talk ,and the whole made up policy about a gym bag in the gym!!? and lack of customer  appreciation

45.description: While it is one of the more economical choices in terms of what's available for fitness clubs in Chicagoland, the overall experience I've had with the XSport chain has left a great deal to be desired. I used to go to the one out in Arlington Heights because it was convenient for work. The staff seemed to have an air of elitism, and were determined to up-sell as much as they could, whether on personal training sessions (to the tune of thousands of dollars, potentially), tanning beds (which is totally cheesy IMO) and the vast array of mid-grade supplements offered in the little "store" they have. I realize this is par for the course for most gyms, but I personally don't appreciate the assumption that I know nothing about health & fitness, and that the only way to stay in shape was to spend all kinds of money on a trainer, along with hundreds of dollars on a heart rate monitor, and a significant monthly expenditure  on various ingestibles (powders, bars, gels, etc.) designed to enhance my workout results. I did actually purchase a large container of an expensive protein mix that I was supposed to take 3 times daily, which was impossible because all it did was make me feel incredibly full, bloated, and constipated. The clientele consisted primarily of people looking to hook up (even at 8 in the morning!), giving the place the feeling of a nightclub or some other social setting instead of a place to work out. This vibe is greatly enhanced by the terrible House music pumped loudly over the speakers 24-7.I now go to the one on N. Elston in Chicago since it's literally a mile from where I live. When I went in to switch my membership so as to make that my primary location, they couldn't do it unless I paid the next higher tier fee each month. It was only about 7 dollars more than I'd already been paying, but I got the feeling the guy was just being lazy, and that it was easier just to charge me more than to actually switch my membership over. Same deal with the clientele & the terribly cheesy club music, but somehow the members seem to be even less considerate of the fact that other people besides themselves use the facility. Apparently, no one can be bothered to put the weights back where they belong after using them, nor can they do so with medicine balls, workout mats, or anything that can be picked up & moved.  Seriously, it's like a joke. I'm not sure if it's some sort of self-entitlement thing (like "I pay to come here, so I shouldn't have to clean up after myself, ergo someone should do it for me"), or perhaps just plain ignorance, but it's aggravating nonetheless. There are a few individuals who find it necessary to completely monopolize entire stations for the duration of their visit. This wouldn't be quite so annoying if they were actually USING the equipment for its intended purpose as opposed to using it as their own personal clothing rack/magazine display, and spending half their time walking around talking to other people instead of working out. There are 15 large flatscreen TVs in the weight room, 10 of which are programmed with pretty much the same content (5 on the XSport advertising "channel", 5 on some awful music video network that is also roughly half commercials for the club itself), and the remaining 5 are divided among various brands of intelligence-insulting crap. Granted, I typically go during the late morning/early afternoon when most of the programming is aimed at the Lowest Common Denominator, but surely there are other more interesting selections to offer. Nickelodeon should NEVER be one of those options!One other thing that left a bad taste in my mouth was the complete unwillingness of the staff to help me figure out a way to temporarily modify my membership status over this past Summer.  The kind of work I'm doing these days requires very long hours after which I am simply too exhausted to go workout.  During a labor-intensive project of this nature, I usually only end up making it to the gym one day a week. So I inquired as to whether or not it would be possible to adjust the parameters of my membership so as not to continue paying the full amount each month for a facility I would not be using as often. They looked at me like I had 3 heads. Not only did the first couple people I tried to speak with appear as though they couldn't comprehend what I was asking, the person "in charge" that day didn't even offer any suggestions. He recommended I "call the corporate office" but warned me not to get my expectations up. Wow, such tremendous customer service!  This is the kind of loyalty & appreciation one can expect after 5 years of monthly dues.Recently, my wife got a job working for Midtown Athletic Clubs. I am DEFINITELY going to look into procuring a membership with them instead. Beyond that, there's a YMCA about a mile in the opposite direction from our condo. At this point, anything seems like a better option than continuing to pay XSport.

33.description: When you have 2 1/2 stars out of 81 reviews it makes me feel like my review is somewhat unnecessary at this point,  but it has to be said. This place is not clean nor a enjoyable environment to be in.  It seems more of a fashion show than a gym. I'll stick to lifting weights in my home.

43.description: Ladies, the women's bathroom is covered in inches of sewage water as of this moment. The women's locker room floor is wet from that water being tracked in because Xsport did not close the conjoined bathroom/locker room while roto-rooting their sewage system. They didn't even put up signs about the work or the potential biohazard. Just a generic sign about there being men in the women's locker room today.They let the plumbers drag their disgusting sewage encrusted wet hoses and sewage water equipment across the main first floor carpeted area where people exercise instead of using the side service door.When I told the front desk staff member about the potential for human waste and e-coli to be spreading around the gym, the desk staff acted like I was completely stupid. He dismissed me, saying they had signs up about men working in the locker room. I repeated that my concern was about the raw sewage on the bathroom floor and Xsport not closing the conjoined locker room and allowing female clients to WALK THROUGH SEWAGE WATER, and allowing the contaminated water to be tracked through the main gym area. I repeated this FOUR TIMES and each time he just said that signs are posted about men working in the women's locker room, totally ignoring my concerns.This is horrific and I am never setting foot in this gym again.

2.description: I have been coming here for a year and a half with a trainer. I really recommend getting a trainer at this location but they constantly have issues with the necessary tools to help you fully. The electric scale broke over two months ago and was replaced with an old, manual scale. The scale is broken most of the time and can't be calibrated. I made a formal complaint through the company at the end of August and got an email two weeks later saying they couldn't reach me. I called and emailed back several times and finally got her on the phone. She said she would take care of it.The scale is still in place. I pay $50 per session for a personal trainer and a lot of other people do. I don't feel like the money I spend is going to where it needs to be. I don't feel confident I'm getting my correct weight each week.Also, there is only one computer at the check in station. This constantly holds up the process. I was informed that the staff would get another one if they met a goal... Why is my time waiting based on the staff meeting a goal to get a necessary tool for their job? There are so many trainers and people just line up waiting to be checked it. This goes into my hour I'm paying to get trained. I was told the team met the goal and was going to that computer three weeks ago! I can't really complain about the customer's needs being met when it doesn't seem like they listen to their own staffs concerns.

18.description: The GM MANAGER he's not professional person he's disrespectful he doesn't have knowledge about what he's doing or saying

41.description: Workout towels not provided.  Need to bring your own.Parking lot is across the street, but small, so fills up fast. You can park on the streets nearby.Compared to the other regular Xsport locations I have visited, this one comes off as very simple and straight forward.  I get no attitude from the staff.  The locker room is small, but clean, especially the showers which is a nice change.It is a little annoying that workout towels are not available, but still, this gym has all of the essentials to get a good workout in.

52.description: Globo-gyms. There's really not much I can say about this particular one other than the fact it smells like rancid broccoli. Its not so much the gym, but its the people that congregate around the machines and talk. They just.............talk. No working out.......just talking.I've also seen people (not just one, but multiple) exercise in leather jackets.Leather. Jackets. Wilson's leather jackets.This review makes me sad.

50.description: Dirty.  Nobody re-racks weights which just creates a cycle of clutter.  You can't tell what people are using since everything is strung out (Weight Area). Trash all over the floor as well- the staff needs to take some ownership of this place and take a lap every hour to make the place look half way presentable. No towel service- locker rooms are not clean so I dont use them.Weight equipment is out dated and worn out (Ie. pins fall out, parts are loose, seats are crooked, collars totally missing)They have 15 televisions, yet 10 of them just try to sell you over priced services or products that they offer and they are all in one 12 X 12 area.  Horrible design. If there was a better option in this area I would take it- but unfortunatly there are no good gyms so I lower my standards since its so convienent. I wont comment on the clientel since it's not the gyms fault who becomes a member. Overall- this could become a 4 star gym if they just cleaned the place up and fixed the broken/worn out equipment.

4.description: I love the spinning, cycling bootcamp and regular bootcamp classes here. Renee S. is The Best instructor! She really pushes you. Danny is good also.I also really like the shower facilities. The fact that people wear their workout clothes (and sometimes outdoor clothes even) and shoes, bring smart phones etc to the sauna kills me though! I come from Finland, the land of saunas and the way sauna bathing is abused here I cannot even bear to witness, so have to skip it altogether.

6.description: I'm a gym junkie and I don't leave reviews anymore because all the gyms are pretty much the same. Today I want to recognize Josh from the morning shift. For the past 6 months I have seen this kid bust his ass to keep this gym clean. He gets thoes spots that most people wouldn't think about. His attention to detail makes this gym a joy to work out at. Thanks for all your hard work buddy I don't think anyone else as far as staff goes deserves any recognition in fact the Manger and assistant Manger jobs seem like a revolving door kinda turns me off. Hopefully this gym can get its shit together and have more people like Josh.   Josh is the real MVP,  keep up that incredible work ethic you are going to be successful in whatever you do its up to Xsport to recognize and give you a promotion eventually or lose there hardest working employee. Once again thanks for keeping the gym in such god shape. You rock !

22.description: Giving 2 stars because the young lady at the front who checked me in was nice and persoanble. However, the guy (not naming names) who signed me up for a membership was not. He was so dry. No enthusiasm or passion about his job. We were interrupted by another worker that was trying to help someone with supplements. I appreciate it was quick however, I don't appreciate the lack of attention/poor customer service that was shown to me. When I find a gym that has great customer service I don't care about the membership fee, I'm signing up!!!!! Customer Service goes a long way!

15.description: I have been working out here for almost 10 years now. I would definitely recommend this gym over any other in the area, but that is actually pretty sad because I would prefer and pay for something more upscale. The free weight room has all of the equipment necessary to get a good workout. In fact, this is one of the only Xsport 's in the Chicago area that has a comprehensive selection of equipment. However, the equipment is broken half the time, the free weights tend to be scattered all over the place, and this place is usually dirty and smelly. Clearly their only objective is to get as many members as possible and spend as little money as possible keeping up the place. There are very few cardio machines, so sometimes you have to fight to get one. And there are limited machines on the second level, could be better. I'm always looking for a better gym though. Can we get a Lifetime in Chicago please???

57.description: I don't expect a lot from this place.  I figure I am getting what I pay for and would give it 3 stars if it was just clean.  Yes - clean.  There is always random hair in the lockers in the locker room, the matts have footprints all over them - so I question if they are ever washed and their is actual litter on the ground inside.  It's weird.  Once during a yoga class I had to leave because I was trying to push another clump of hair away from my matt with my block and so much dirt and filth came with it - I started to gag a little.  I did mention it to the manager downstairs and he was receptive to my feedback.  But the random dirt - still all over the floor the following week.   There are at least 10 employees there at all times - have a little pride in the place.  So three stars for the price if they could keep up with the cleanliness needed for a gym that hosts the number of members they do and another star for four if the staff was friendlier.  They are super friendly at Belmont and Kimball, and always make you feel welcome.  On the positive - There is a lot of equipment (sure its old - but the membership is $39/month - im okay with that as long as it works), and it isn't ridiculously crowded like the Logan Square XSport or the one of Belmont and Kimball.  I have never had to wait for anything.

20.description: The GM MANAGER he's not professional person he's disrespectful he doesn't have knowledge about what he's doing or saying

36.description: I have belonged to this location for over 10 years. I think they do a great job keeping the place clean though, from other reviews I've read, the women's locker room needs to be remodeled. The men's locker room is fine except when some weirdo hocks a loogie in the shower. :( I love that it's open 24 hours and the rate is only $19.95 per month. I never have to wait to get on an elliptical and they keep the machines in good working order. The weight room is the best of any gym to which I've ever belonged. I don't really like to swim, so a pool is unnecessary for me. It can be hard to find a space in the parking lot, but I can always find a spot on one of the nearby streets. As has been mentioned in other reviews, they should provide towels.

14.description: So.. I like the elston express. Believe it or not, I like that it is "small" (compared to the Harlem location-have you seen it? It's huge!) .. I visited the Harlem/Irving location trying to decide if I liked it.. On our tour, I literally got dizzy from all the people, machines, etc. so I like my good ol' elston xsport. It isn't the greatest gym, but it's by my place, there's always free parking nearby, and the people there don't bother me. Also, staff is nice!

3.description: they have rice and hemp rolling papers.........nuff said.......

1.description: I'm not someone that knows tons about smoke accessories, but my roommate just got a hookah so we headed over here since people had good ratings.  The place is clean, well organized, and the staff was very nice and helpful.  She didn't try to sell you on certain brands, and the prices were less than what we were expecting!

2.description: Just moved into the neighborhood and my boyfriend and I needed a place to get some smoke accessories. This place has it all and the owners are very accommodating. One of the ash catchers that we bought didn't fit our glassware so we went back to the store and got it exchanged with no fuss. Prices are super affordable. They only take cash.

0.description: Since I moved back to Chicago this has been the store i go to. They are very nice and helpful and you can not beat the prices. I've bought all my glass from them since I moved back. You gotta check this store out.

4.description: I'm an old school head, and I hate how everything is so dang expensive nowadays. I bought a Roor here like a year and a half ago when I moved to Albany Park, and it just broke... looked around my new area, Logan Square, to find a replacement, and everything was at least 3x what I paid at SfL. I drove all the way down, owner was nice as hell, and gave me a replacement for the same price I paid before... flawless victory. I don't go anywhere else for glass. And this is coming from a hardcore hippie.

0.description: Poor sampling of Filipino food. Highlight was the lechon kawali (pan-roasted pork)--but how can you go wrong w/crispy pig fat? It was, however, so greasy that it left a thick puddle of oil in the bottom of the takeout box. The lumpia shanghai (a type of Filipino egg roll), though crisp, were bland. Even worse was the pancit canton (noodle dish), which mostly tasted like noodles doused in soy sauce with a few julienne carrots thrown in.No need to stop here.

58.description: I ate at the store on Narragansett when it first opened and my opinion hasn't changed with this store. Even though it is immensely popular I am not a fan. The chicken is supposedly marinated. I find it dry and greasy. Other than the novelty of the side dishes, they are average. As someone else mentioned the desserts seem mass produced and substandard. Normally I am relatively easy to please but I don't know what I'm missing about this place.Note: this chain is from Guatemala and not Mexico as some of the other reviewers have noted.

56.description: This is where we're getting our fried chicken from now on!  Forget KFC and Popeye's...Pollo Campero's chicken is more tasty (but more expensive).  They have a nice selection of sides, which includes plantains (yum!!!), rice, yucca, and I forget the others.  Also, I love their salsa bar.  They even serve chicken wraps and chicken bowls, which come with grilled chicken, rice, beans, diced tomatoes, and cilantro.  The chicken bowl was ok and the bf really enjoyed the chicken wrap.  But from now on, I'll just get chicken.  I took my mom here last week and she loved it because it reminded her of how they cook chicken in the Philippines.  So tasty!!  I will definitely come back over and over again!

29.description: I love me some fried chicken. I had some PC chicken straight from Guatemala and El Salvador before they had all those laws against bringing food into airplanes and EVERY TIME someone I knew was going there I told them to bring some of that chicken back. When I heard that they were opening one in Chicago I was ecstatic! This was before I knew about Yelp and all that good stuff. I waited in line. I waited some more. They had a big chicken dancing in the front and they had bars to guide you through the lines. Then I got there and was so in love. I'm a sucker for their fried chicken and their plantains and I go there whenever I can to pick me up some good fried chicken and plantains. I had to give it four stars though. I don't know what it is but the ones from Guatemala tasted better. But I may be just saying that because it originated there and my mind doesn't want to believe that they can even replicate it anywhere else away from Central America. HAHA!

42.description: I came here back in 2007 on a trip to Chicago.  This was arguably the best fried chicken I've had (fast-food wise).   You could smell the fried chicken from a block away and the chicken seasoning that they use is very different yet tasty from what I'm used to.  I can't remember what I had for sides but remember that it was very different from your typical fried chicken fast food restaurant.   We have a couple of Pollo Campero's in L.A, and hope to check these out soon.

23.description: Not a fan of the food here in general, but we end up here once in awhile due to lack of choice in the area, and due to the fact it's next to Starbucks. Usually I'll get the Caribbean Bowl it's the only thing I've found I like there.They have gotten my order wrong and gave me fried versus grilled chicken more then once. There isn't anything wrong with the food per-say, but it's definately nothing special. Last time we were there the guy at the counter was making the same joke to everyone who came in the door.

47.description: This place is like Baja Fresh if Baja Fresh were good. Think fresh ingredients, free refills and a salsa bar. Yes, please. It is a diamond in the rough of Albany ParkThe best part; sweet plantains. That's right as a side you keep 4 giant platanos maduros and a little sour cream to boot. Bienvenidos la comida de Guatemala. Te necesito.

8.description: Not more than three stars. The chicken was not fresh but it had nice tropical flavor. Their portions are small. This place needs to be more busy to serve fresher food and still think they are expensive.

31.description: This is the best fast food fried (and grilled) chicken in Chicago.  I don't say this lightly, as I do still have Popeye's cravings now and then.  This is a fast food joint, so you walk up to the counter, order your food and they bring it out.  Drinks are pretty good - I've had the horchata on a couple of occasions, and that can vary in taste - it was excellent today tho'....The fried chicken skin is crispy and super flavorful.  You'll pick the bones clean, like the barbarians you secretly wish you were.The grilled is also excellent, and puts me in serious doubt when I get the fried stuff.  Just go there.  they have a parking lot if you drive (we do, from the office, and it is worth it).  And it is near all sorts of public transit. Oh, and on a side note, to all my friends here in gringolandia, if you mispronounce "Pollo Campero", it humorously translates to "Chicken With Dog" - but this doesn't mean there are dogs anywhere near this most delicious lunch spot.

34.description: Honest to say, I've had Pollo Campero chicken several times and it's just nothing special, just okay.  I do like one thing, the take home salsa / sauce bar.  Other than that, I'll stick to Popeyes, KFC, or even Brown's when in the mood for convenient fried chicken.Overall, okay food, okay service, okay prices.

16.description: 2.5 rounded up.it's a fast food joint and the chicken was ok but i thought the options for sides were really limited.

13.description: If you go into this Pollo Campero right now, you'll know why the franchise is struggling in Chicago. The chicken is delicious, don't get me wrong, but the staff has little or know idea what they're doing. They forgot to put items in the bag that I paid for, they took forever and the cashier didn't even know the menu. Me: what sauces come with the strips?Cashier: what sauces?Me: it says strips come with sauceCashier: we don't have sauces. Me: OK.Cashier: oh wait lemme check.... We got three.Me: OK. What are they?Cashier: I think chipolte mayo and something else. I also order a dessert that she didn't know they didn't actually have, at least I got a refund for that item. I got all the way home and found out half my girlfriend's meal was missing. Again, the chicken is delicious but it's not inexpensive and if you have to deal with horrible service and  missing items what is the point? The store on Narragansett closed. I wonder if they had the same problems. It's interesting to me that for a place the had lines out the for and around the corner when it opened, it only ever has four or less customers in it at any given time and everyone waits and waits and waits.....The last two I was there it was a lame experience. I hope their management can turn it around cause the chicken is really good. Shame they can't keep it together.

11.description: Okay dare I say it? I came back to Pollo Campero after a long hiatus since the partner was in the mood for it. Mind you, we live on Chicago's South Side near Midway. But this time I am glad I did come down. I had a 3 piece white meat (I never knew the difference), and it was really good. He had me try this drink that according to him was made from the flower of the chestnut. Wow, it was so good and the chicken this time around was really good so I am glad I came back. Service also was impeccable and I have to admit, it was awesome this time around. I totally like this location vs the Narraganset location due to it being overcrowded and not looking so sanitary. Although it was cold outside and slushy the day we went, the floor was clean and the whole place was fresh. Give them a try and please make sure you try the Yucca fries because they are not the typical fries and the way they make them is really nice.

39.description: Watch out, Popeyes!You've got some SERIOUS competition from Pollo Campero!  The skin is amazingly seasoned and crispy.  The meat is delicious and juicy.  If you get a family style dinner, you get your choice of tortillas, rolls or biscuits.  We opted for the Hawaiian-esque style rolls.  As for sides, the plantains and rice were just sooo good.  Yum.  My starving friend and I basically devoured the food..and were seriously satisfed afterwards.Don't forget to stock up on salsa at the yummy salsa bar.  My personal favorite was the tomatilla and the jalapenos. Awesome!For 8 pieces of chicken, 2 sides and 4 rolls, the total came out to about  20 bucks!  A little steeper than Popeyes or KFC, but the flavorful goodness is worth it!

37.description: There is this odd quailty recently when I come to this location. I can't tell if it's me or the atmosphere. Thankfully, nothing is wrong or odd or different about the food. IT'S STILL DELICIOUS. During my last visit it took awhile for the food to arrive and that was after I was stared at sideways for trying to order chicken ala carte rather than within some predetermined meal deal. Sometimes you don't want any damn sides. Just gimme the chicken chica. I don't know, it just feels like things are moving in slow motion here. Where is that Fast Forward button?

0.description: I just moved to the area not long ago... I've driven by this place  few times. Decided to try it last week... The guy at the register was so nice and helpful. He explained their menu and even gave me samples. The food was ready quickly and was delicious. Looking forward to stopping by again soon

38.description: For me, the only improvement this place could make would be to install a drive-thru ;)  We've never eaten in, we always order to-go.  The food is consistently delicious, service is always pleasant and fairly quick.Delicious chicken - fried or grilled, and we love the black beans and rice and mashers.  There is a parking lot (though it can sometimes be frustrating).

51.description: When I first saw the crazy chicken billboard above the restaurant, I thought it was funny.  When I ordered my first meal there (in the Brickyard Court), they only had the fried chicken version.  Later on, the menu offered two versions, broiled or fried.  I love the broiled one, with its spices.  It's better than KFC, in my opinion, and more juicy.  The Campero bean is its signature food.  It's the best baked beans I've tasted.  I order a large portion always.  Of course, it also offers your typical Hispanic food choices, like side orders of tortillas, yellow rice, etc.  I always go there for the CHICKEN and beans.  The best in Chicago.

27.description: This place is just ok. For some reason it takes forever once you order your food.  Be prepared to spend at least a half hour to 45 minutes eating or waiting on your food there.

32.description: Beats the Colonel and Popeyes hands down. For sides, get the Campero Beans (Lotsa bacon), tortillas and sweet Plantains for your sides. Avoid the Salad. The bowls are pretty good alternatives, but the chicken is what makes this place shine. The Yucca fries are now off the menu so that itself deserves a one star deduction.  Make sure to get 2 or 3 different salsas from the salsa bar to dip the tortillas in. The desserts are nothing to write home about.

54.description: I love the chicken from Pollo Campero!  I also really like the Campero beans, the tostones, yucca, and the sweet plantains.  The rice is okay (my boyfriend likes the rice but not so much the beans so it just depends on what you like) and I don't really like the tortillas (I forgot why - I think because they are flour and seem microwaved) but I do like the dinner rolls.  I tried the maranon drink here for the first time ever and I like it!  I would go here over Popeye's, KFC, or Brown's.  I want to try breakfast here.

48.description: Mmm... crispy chicken skin!I've been back to this location a few times and I love their fried chicken thighs and wings.  The chicken is moist, flavorful, and the crispy skin is the best part.  No heavy breading or weird batter here - just lightly seasoned and fried.  Pair that with sweet plantains and a biscuit and you have a fast food meal that actually tastes like real food.  I've tried my bf's chicken tenders, which were pretty good (I prefer chicken on the bone, though).  I haven't tried the other side dishes, other than their tostones and french fries, but someone told me that the rice & black beans were kind of bland.  They have a salsa table with three different kinds of salsas (red, green tomatillo, and chipotle), as well as limes, chopped onion, and cilantro.  I'm sure the rice & beans would taste better with a little salsa and cilantro.  I wasn't crazy about their prepackaged flan, either.  But I go here mainly for their fried chicken and sweet plantains and have never been disappointed.

44.description: Pollo Campero has quite possibly the tastiest chicken strips that I've ever had! There must be a magic spice in there. The sauces with them are ok, and the other food is ok, but nothing special. The place has cool decor and gives the feeling of being somewhere else... definitely a place to check out if you're in the neighborhood. It's not worth a trip across town for though.

24.description: Apparently, you can't get served here if you don't speak Spanish.  I waited and waited and waited while the Spanish-speaking couple in front of me had the entire freakin' menu explained to them.  It isn't that difficult.  Also, why does it take the entire front crew to do the explaining?This isn't the first time I've been rebuffed here.  The last time I went in, I waited several minutes for someone to take my order, and no one did.  I was the only one in line!  The manager was standing ten feet away.  I was too pissed to say anything to him because I thought I would lose my temper and really let him have it.  That was several months ago, and I finally decided to give them another chance, and this happens!As far as the food goes, I can only go on memory from just after the place opened years ago.  The chicken was heavily brined, which kept the meat moist, but otherwise I felt it was good, but unexceptional.  I hated the Campero rice; better stuff can be found at any halfway decent taqueria.I love fried chicken, and I wanted to try this place again, but I guarantee I will never walk into a Pollo Campero ever again.  The best fried chicken in the world isn't worth this crappy service.

7.description: This review is for the customer service. I did not appreciate the fact that I was ignored and passed over while waiting in line simply because I do not speak Spanish. And when I asked the cashier if I could order he motioned to the other cash register, but the employee working that station was helping bag food. I was unable to order because instead of taking the next person in line the cashier took the whole group behind me. If you make a mistake like that the least you could do is apologize.

49.description: How To Eat Like A Real Mutha(- Shut yo-I'm Just Talking About Chicken):1.  Grab screaming, crabby baby, bring him to the car and wrestle him into his strappy seat.  Pretend it doesn't hurt too bad when he kicks you in the eye with his baby-shoed foot.2.  Drive.  What is far enough to lull him to sleep with this drive... Mars Cheese Castle? No, maybe not that far.  Pollo Campero? Yes! Yes. Okay, drive the almost 25 miles from your house to Pollo Campero.  Yes, later, when your child is a angst-ridden pre-teen, he will charge that you love Pollo Campero more than him.  Based on that eye-kicking a few minutes ago, you might not know how you feel about that...  You will hear every other word on NPR interspersed with baby shrieks.  It's like real world Mad Libs.3.  The baby is blissfully asleep.  Alas, no drive-thru.  Okay, dad will go in first and place his order, come back to the car, then mom will go in and place hers and come back to the car.  Mom will still have to order for dad because he will like what her food looks like more than his.  Whatever...4.  Rip the hot, oily skin directly from three pieces at once  and cram all the way into mouth.  Repeat. Stare at stuff in front of you as eyes glaze over.  Dip chicken into mashed potatoes and gravy.  Repeat.  Repeat.  Repeat. Repeat.5.  Give baby the rest of your food, because he woke up starving from all of the earlier crying and flailing.6.  Take the rest of the chicken and continue on to Mars Cheese Castle after all, because you clearly didn't drive far enough.

40.description: As far as I'm concerned this chicken and the Burritos are out of this world!  You must try it.

53.description: I had the fried chicken and thought it was OK. The chicken was tasty and moist. I also had the mashed potatoes, they were alright. It was very busy inside, but the employees were very quick and friendly.I prefer Popeye's for fried chicken and think Popeye's has some of the best mashed potatoes.I may go back to Pollo Campero to try some of the other things offered.

30.description: Meh.  Chicken joint (grilled and fried), Latin style.  Meaning, complimentary tortillas (or biscuits), rice, beans w/bacon, yucca fries, and plantains on the menu.  Also, there's a free salsa bar with diced onions and jalapenos.The grilled chicken skin is surprisingly crispy with a hint of lime flavor.  The fried chicken skin isn't heavily battered, and in fact, reminds me of shake & bake but better.  Fried chicken only comes in dark meat.  I'd much rather prefer Popeye's with some hot sauce.  The grilled chicken was better than the fried, while the rest of the sides (rice, beans w/bacon, plantains) were just ok.  Eating the chicken inside the tortilla kind of masked its flavor, so I wouldn't recommend that.  The best thing there were the yucca fries - thick cut, moist, and absolutely delicious with the dipping sauce!This place has a touch of class serving you on real plates and silverware and actually delivering your food to your table.

46.description: 5-Stars?  Really?  Reading these reviews had me so filled with optimism.  I was stuck in the standard Lawrence Avenue traffic cluster$#%& and knew this was nearby.  It was the height of lunch-time so I wasn't sure how long of a wait it would be, but any excuse to get off of Lawrence Ave was a good one.  I was prepared for battle.Only 1 table with people.  No need for armor.It was OK.  I certainly didn't achieve anywhere near the crunchy chicken skin fat nirvana I was hoping for, but it was alright.  It did, however, make me lust for Hourglass's chicken...and watermelon soju.  ...well.  It was the traffic, actually, that made me lust for the soju.

1.description: This place doesn't have much to write home about.  However, when you are traveling from work and want something to eat...super-sonic quickly...then you can count on this place.  They have weekday daily special, which comes with an entree and a fountain soda.  For under $5, it's a deal.Food is fine.  Of course it's not gourmet-quality.  They do have pretty decent empanadas, which I recommend.It's quick, clean, friendly place to be.  I believe they do have wifi available, but SB is next door and occasionally you get the wifi signal from there.  This place isn't really competitive to other restaurants in Albany Park, but kudos to awesome Sunday hours (opening until 2200 hour).  With that being said, I'm grateful because there are very limited choices left when you get home at 2030 hour on a Sunday.

55.description: I am a huge fan of El Pollo loco (yes, I know it's a chain but I barely eat fast food and you can do much worse). El Pollo Campero is like the Carribean equivalent with fried chicken (the also offer grilled, but fried is the especialidad) which is crispy, juicy, and crazy delicious, and an adventurous list of sides including buttery biscuits, sweet plantains or tostones (salty plantain chips), yuca fries, cole slaw, black beans and so forth. You can't do better than this when it comes to fast food!Edit: I've knocked off a star because it was less awesome on the second visit. The chicken strips meal had only 3 strips, and the mashed potatoes sucked. Oh well. Get the real fried chicken.

9.description: Fried chicken AND empanadas? Yes, and yes.Can I just eat here and pretend that I'm in Breaking Bad? I bet Los Pollos Hermanos was like this. Unfortunately, no Gus Fring look-a-like spotted here when I visited, but the staff were welcoming and friendly. The Latin twist is a nice change from the KFC/Popeye's chains - there are plantains, rice, beans on the menu, and a salsa bar at the restaurant. I tried the chicken bowl and all the empanadas as a snack and loved it all. Next time, I've got my eye on a big bucket of fried chicken.

26.description: When it's good, it's some of the better fried chicken you can get.  It's a great change of pace from familiar American fried chicken.  They've also got a great set of sides to go along with your chicken.  The only real downside is that there is a lack of consistency with the product.  Sometimes the chicken is as juicy as you can imagine.  Other times the chicken is really dry.  It's a gamble each time you go, but I keep going back because it's just that good when things are right.

25.description: So many different kinds of fried chicken are there?  Well, a heck of a lot!  Lately, we have been huge Crisp favorites, but sometimes ya gotta change it up a bit.  So we head to Priscilla's for some the soul food version, or to Popeye's for a fast food staple.  So here's a new one: Latin fried chicken.  It's crispy on the outside without having an inch of batter/breading, but at the same time, keeping the inside it's juicy. The pieces are fairly large in size.  They have a great "salad bar" option of salsa verde, rojo and pico de gallo salsa to top the great chicken.  A box 20 piece special for $20.

12.description: Good service.Clean location.GREAT tasting food.Love Pollo Campero, how this chain has not expanded all over the city I do not know, but this place would totally kick KFC's and Popeyes' butt.Great chicken with great side options (beans, rice, plantains) and a good selection of salsas to choose from at the salsa bar.This specific location has plenty of sit down (dine-in) tables and a parking lot outside. The parking lot is shared by local businesses, so it can get full at times, especially weekends or during rush hour weekdays.  This location also does NOT have a drive-thru, so plan to get out of the car to get to this tasty chicken.

59.description: Easily the best Chicken that I have had in my life. It tastes exactly as advertised, Crunchy & Juicy, and so flavorful. I now understand why so many people have been talking about it. Wow! Try the sweet plantains and Campero Beans (which Chicago Magazine voted best in Chicago).Worth the drive, but I can't wait until there is one closer to my home. Open more please.

21.description: Okay dare I say it? I came back to Pollo Campero after a long hiatus since the partner was in the mood for it. Mind you, we live on Chicago's South Side near Midway. But this time I am glad I did come down. I had a 3 piece white meat (I never knew the difference), and it was really good. He had me try this drink that according to him was made from the flower of the chestnut. Wow, it was so good and the chicken this time around was really good so I am glad I came back. Service also was impeccable and I have to admit, it was awesome this time around. I totally like this location vs the Narraganset location due to it being overcrowded and not looking so sanitary. Although it was cold outside and slushy the day we went, the floor was clean and the whole place was fresh. Give them a try and please make sure you try the Yucca fries because they are not the typical fries and the way they make them is really nice.

17.description: I've been in the parking lot of this place & have seen long lines here at any given time of the day.  Finally, I decided to try it.Am I missing something?
