Why would people wait in long lines to consume average food?The fried chicken was tasty, but just okay.  Same goes for pretty much everything else I consumed, including the salsas. Prices were decent & the space was clean. It felt like......McDonalds! Then it hit me: I'm in the Hispanic equivalent of McDonalds. It all became clear as a shot of fine agave tequila.I'd go back, but only if I pass up a mom & pop taqueria.

10.description: Whoa that fried chicken though! The chicken is perfectly breaded and is so freaking tasty!!!! The sides are so-so, except for their plantains that shiz is yummmmy!

5.description: This place was incredibly busy and chaotic when we went (speaking to its popularity) but I was not impressed. I had the chicken bowl and we got chicken tenders for the kids. I wish I'd tried the yucca fries. I thought the chicken bowl was pretty unimpressive, and the tenders were anything but. The place seemed really grimy to me. They need to clean behind the booths. Desperately. I won't be back to find out if they have.

3.description: If Pollo Campero was good at one time, then it has gone down in quality. What I really wanted was a bucket of fried chicken. What I ended up with was 16 pieces of dry chicken where somehow the batter was not fully cooked and oozed out when biting into some of the pieces. My guess would be that the chicken had been sitting under a heat lamp, long enough to dry out the meat, but not hot enough to cook the rest of the batter. The sides here were memorable. The beans and rice are high in sodium and very tasty. The coleslaw is fantastic. Hence two stars instead of one. It's not enough to bring me back. The location was convenient and I was hoping I wouldn't have to travel far for good fried food. Eat here if you must. I believe the restaurant is generally clean and well maintained. Just don't expect a unique experience.

35.description: This place had a huge hype when it first opened in the Brickyard area. In fact, people waited ours in line to eat. I'm not understanding why? Both times I went,  the food was bland including the chicken! Isn't this their specialty? Even after adding salsa to my meal it still didn't taste any better. Apparently, this place is a big chicken franchise in Guatemala. Perhaps someday I will give this place a third chance...in Guatemala!

19.description: Meh.  Chicken joint (grilled and fried), Latin style.  Meaning, complimentary tortillas (or biscuits), rice, beans w/bacon, yucca fries, and plantains on the menu.  Also, there's a free salsa bar with diced onions and jalapenos.The grilled chicken skin is surprisingly crispy with a hint of lime flavor.  The fried chicken skin isn't heavily battered, and in fact, reminds me of shake & bake but better.  Fried chicken only comes in dark meat.  I'd much rather prefer Popeye's with some hot sauce.  The grilled chicken was better than the fried, while the rest of the sides (rice, beans w/bacon, plantains) were just ok.  Eating the chicken inside the tortilla kind of masked its flavor, so I wouldn't recommend that.  The best thing there were the yucca fries - thick cut, moist, and absolutely delicious with the dipping sauce!This place has a touch of class serving you on real plates and silverware and actually delivering your food to your table.

28.description: Having had this from the original locations in Guatemala, I have to say that they  have done a pretty good job of keeping it real.  As Marlo L. mentioned before, we also would bring a box of chicken with us on the plane back to Chicago.  Never failed.  However they do sell you a six pack of Guatemalan beer at the restaurant, makes it that much better. The chicken is delicious and juicy. They have a unique way of flash frying the chicken.  They say they dont fry it, not sure how it's done then.  I dont like how they have had to "Americanize" everything else around the chicken.  The bowls and the grilled chicken and the salads... thats not what I remember PC for.  The sides are great, only place i can get some killer beans and tortillas with my chicken.   It is a bit pricey, the chicken cannot be that expensive.  But you do pay a little more for the classic table side service.  All in all great place.  Always reminds me of Guatemala and my family.

45.description: I'm dropping 2 stars on this place. I was over in the mall on Pulaski & Lawrence where the Staples store is located. I haven't had yucca fries for some time, so I thought I'd come here again to fulfill my craving.To my disappointment, yucca fries are off their menu now! My favorite Pollo Campero item, no less... So I settled on fried plantains, which were decent, and Campero beans, which are more like a bean soup than the usual Mexican beans.The other change is that their serving size has shrunk for the "personal meals". Used to be 2 side dishes included, now it's only 1. And I thought I got more than 2 small tortillas last time. Only thing not to shrink was the price. With drink and 3 pieces of dark meat plus an extra side, I was over $9.No wonder I was only one of 5 customers sitting there though it was almost noon on a Friday. The lines sure have gone down since the busy grand opening craze the place experienced. For a fast food chicken place, service is above average since they bring you the food to the table. The staff asks if you need anything else, but I figure they are so bored given the slow volume of customers that it at least keeps them occupied.Smaller meals and no yucca fries are a deal-breaker for me. Sorry, Pollo Campero, but I won't be returning anytime soon.

33.description: Christopher and I stopped at Pollo Campero today on our way to visit Jean C.  Walking through the door, there was a rather strong odor of chicken grease. We should have gone elsewhere, but ... oh well. I ordered the personal meal,  basically chicken, a biscuit and I picked out a side of plantains. I didn't see that you could choose fried or grilled chicken. They gave me grilled which is fine, but would have been nice if they asked what i wanted. Chris ordered the Campero bowl, which is grilled or fried chicken (they didn't ask him either for his choice), rice, beans, chopped onions, cilantro and fresh salsa. Sounds good? Was pretty much tasteless.  My chicken was ok, but with all the really good chicken options around, we won't be back.

43.description: Well, I think this is the most underrated fast food chicken in Chicago.  I had the fried chicken and it was incredible.  It wasn't seriously greasy, like the Popeye's that I've always loved.  Instead, it's just a nice understated fried chicken, and juicy without the grease.  And the sweet plantains, damn that's good stuff.  The service was very good, also.  The lady behind the counter was very helpful, and told me I couldn't lose with the fried chicken.  And she was right.  Also, she brought out some grilled chicken for me to try, free of charge.  I only wish they had a location that was closer to me, and that didn't require fighting heavy traffic to get there.

2.description: I was actually pretty impressed with this place. For a fast food joint, it offers a unique alternative to the same-old, same-old. Is it super authentic Latino food? No, not really. But if you are in a hurry and don't want a hamburger, it's a pretty good option, without having to go and wait at a regular restaurant. I got the grilled chicken -extra interesting that it was grilled with lime -never thought of that on chicken -so that was pretty cool. The sweet plantains were the real deal -though a little greasy. The yucca fries were a very "white people" version of yucca, but still interesting.The cashier was really friendly and I only waited maybe 5-6 minutes for my order. Again, it's fast food. But an interesting option if you want to try something different in a hurry!

18.description: I was so looking forward to Pollo Campero moving into my 'hood. Sure, some may have been excited about the Starbucks opening next door in this still-under-construction strip mall, but for me I was getting pumped up about the Guatemalan-style fried chicken. I actually waited about 30 minutes in line during its opening day in July for a take-out order (the wait for a table was longer - the interior is not that large). The crowds have died down a bit since then, but they do a brisk business luring the Latino population (and this particular Asian guy) to this spot. This is the second Pollo Campero to open in Chicago. What makes the chicken special? It is crunchy, spicy, and juicy without going overboard on any of these attributes. They have a great selection of side orders like yucca fries, tostones, and sweet plantains along with more "common" ones like beans, Spanish rice, and mashed potatoes. They also have a salsa bar where you can scoop up different salsas, cilantro, and lime wedges to add a bit of kick to your flavorful chicken. While the main reason to come here is the fried chicken and the latin-style sides, they also have a serviceable burrito, and some salad and bowl-style dishes that I've not tried. The mango juice is pretty tasty, and they also have horchata, tamarindo, and some cashew-fruit drink called maranon that I will have to try. The flan is not bad, but they are ready-made containers and not "fresh". If you are lucky, the life-size yellow Pollo Campero character will greet you at your table and perhaps give you a high-five, though its appearance frightened a young tyke during my last visit. The one time I dined here, I sat next to the mural of one of the great pyramids in Tikal, Guatemala, and I think that made my dining experience complete.

41.description: This place is a healthier alternative to fast food. You can get tasty grilled chicken, beans and rice. They have a small sauce buffet to add to your dish.  All for under 10 bucks.   I usually alternate between the Campero bowl or the Caribbean bowl which both have the rice bean chicken combo with your preference of beans. You basically order, pay, and they bring you the food to your table. They have a soda fountain for free refills. They play salsa music overhead which makes it more interesting. The grilled chicken is very tender.  I order extra chicken for more protein and because it tastes good.

52.description: Where did this place come from?  I used to have to drive to Brickyard to get this very unique South American style fried chicken.  This place gets points for originality, because the chicken tastes like no one elses.  It is quite delicious and heavily seasoned, it is similar to the colonel's orginal recipe in form and texture although the spices are different, very flavorful.  It loses some ground in that the chicken is on the small side, and does not go cold very well, surprisingly.  My advice is to eat in and not box it.  The eat in location is very nice, always clean, and service is good, they bring you the food and they use real silverware.  The tortillas are a different touch, but I haven't had any sides that stand out.  Portions are on the small side and it can be pricey.  Definitely glad to see another take on Fried Chicken though.Update on Sides:  Mashed potatoes good.  Biscuit good and buttery only when warm, as soon as they cool the get kind of hard and unappetizing, they are really kind of greasy.

50.description: Don't cry for me Guatemala!The truth is I puked this food up.All through my wild days, I drank mojitos ,shoulda had chicken fingers -And not nasty burritos.I bet even Evita would have hated this food. Though she was from Argentina, not Guatemala.  This was nothing to write home about.I went here for a fundraiser to send a school group to Guatemala to have a 'cross cultural experience'.  Excellent.  I showed up ready to eat.  The food was bland - and there was corn mixed with the rice I ordered, as well as little pieces of pork (which was not noted on the menu).  I was super jazzed that they had flan.  It was served in a little plastic cup, with a pullback tinfoil lid.  GROSS!I didn't really puke the food up.  I kind of wanted to.But then I started to think about how much trouble making myself throw up is.  You have to wait until your home, and then get your glass of water ready - and then make sure the toilet is clean.  Then you can just stick that toothbrush down your throat and have at.Works like a charm, but my eyes always water.  This time, I didn't have the energy.  Plus then I thought about Karen Carpenter, and got all "Oooh! I don't wanna be skinny like that" - needless to say, I digested this stuff, and let nature take its course.And fortunately, I'm very regular...I ended up just throwing it away...but I stayed and chatted with my friend.  I think learning about Guatemalans is very important.Skip Pollo Compero.  You won't be missing much. At all.  It's fast food style, served on plastic trays. Then you put a number on your table, and wait for someone to find you and they bring out your food. There is a soda machine for you to get your own drinks... I didn't care for this at all.I want to say "hurray" for this place, but I can only muster an "eh" and a shrug.

4.description: Usually I've come here and the food is pretty good but today waiting for my order watching them power wash the floors behind the counter where they prepare the food at 8:00 pm while all the food is out and there's people still eating that's discuss thing watching the mist fly up into the air, got my food but lost my apatite.

6.description: about as authentic as you can get. Great rice and chicken meals and the service is good.

22.description: Expectations people.  This is fast food fried chicken.  Super yummy and crispy, not a lot of batter like KFC etc.  Loved the fried plaintains as a side.  Mine were a little dry, but some of my husband's were not.  Note to Pollo Campero, if you are reading, keep the plaintains moist please.  Anyway the 2 piece meal of chicken comes with roll or tortillas.  I'd recommend the tortillas, as the roll is basically generic white bread.  It comes with a little tub of sour cream, which was yummy with the warm tortilla.The horchata was not great.  It had a funny taste to it, compared to other burrito places we have gotten horchata.  We may try one again at some pt, but otherwise we'll skip it.  We will definitely be back for the yummy salty crispy fried chicken+sweet plaintain fast food experience.

15.description: Food is good perfectly crispy chicken. The place always has a lot if people which is good for business. Smart marketing in opening this place in a very Latino populated community.

57.description: Convenient, yes.  Reasonable, yes.  Overly hyped, definitely.  Okay fast food chicken with nice Mex/Guat side dishes but nothing to wait in line for.

20.description: Pollo Campero has the best fried chicken around!  Campero bowl is pretty dang good too.  The only place other than White Castle to be smart enough to have grape soda on tap!  It's also happens to be close to Admiral... so I hear...

36.description: I first tried this chain in Guatemala and fell in love,  and was excited to hear that they were opening one her in Chicago. I made the mistake of trying to go opening week and the line was around the block for days.  I was finally able to try the stateside version about a month after it opened.  Not too shabby.  The Latino sides and rice are a nice change of pace. The salsa bar has been revamped for the American palate-so not as good as I remember.  Have been back several times and was never really disappointed.  I don't crave it with mouth watering intensity, but still very good

14.description: I gave 4 stars because, I like el pollo loco more than this chicken place. This food chain offers hispanic style chicken, grilled or fried. They have combo meals with different sides. I recommend yuca fries and campero rice. There is a salsa bar to compliment your chicken. For dessert, I suggest sweet stix! They are fried tortilla with cinnamon and sugar alongside of dulce de leche dip

0.description: This was my first time going to a pawn shop to buy a present and pawn some items.  After driving around and checking out some of the other pawn shops in the area and comparing prices, I continued on to Reliable Jewelry and Loan.Upon entering the store, I was greeted politely and courteously.  One of the staff had noticed that I had parked on the street and mentioned that there was free parking in the back, so I moved my car and parked in the lot. The staff was helpful and took their time in explaining the process and procedures of pawning items as I explained this was my first time.  After having visited other shops in the area, I already knew the approximate value of my items and was happy with what they offered, so I decided to pawn my items here.  With the additional funds, I was able to get a present for my girlfriend for our anniversary.  I was pleased with the selection and cost. Another bonus is that it is less than a block from the CTA Brown Line Kedzie stop.  The next time that I come here to pick up my item, I will be able to just hop off the train on my way home from work, get my items and hop back on.  I would recommend Reliable Jewelry and Loan to anyone.

3.description: Don't even waste your time. The shop is smelly and super disorganized. My son had to pick up a tux that he was measured for over a month prior, the suits were not in on the day that they were promised and they measured him wrong. When he tried on the suit, he had to get it altered several times before they got it right. We were there for 2 hours. The drop off was a breeze/

1.description: My experience was very similar to the other reviewers. I was looking for a wedding dress this summer, and since I live in the neighborhood, I thought I'd give this place a try. Stephanie was the name of the young lady who helped me, and although she was very sweet and kind, I was very disappointed with the level of service. Although they claim to be a bridal shop, they don't actually keep any bridal dresses in stock. Stephanie showed me several catalogs, and I found a few that I liked. But I was shocked to learn that I would have to order a dress before I could try it on. That's not terribly convenient. I ended up going to a larger full-service bridal shop instead.

2.description: On the same trip with my dear friend from out of town, we came across Kathy's "VIP" Bridal in Albany Park...apparently they are a retailer of this extra special designer (that I frankly, can't recall)...and apparently that designer is...popular. So off we went...Despite being a retailer of this specific designer, they had no dresses by them. Also, the remaining selection was extremely small and sparse. The ladies at the counter were helpful, but couldn't really assist us on the Mira Couture journey...as, well...they didn't have any to speak of. The bridesmaid dresses were all decidedly...flamboyant. Thank the Lord I was not asked to try any of them on. So, off we went...back to the white, poofy, sequined drawing board. Street parking is pretty easy during business hours...

0.description: This is more of a quinceanera place.. not, as the name would have one think, a bridal place.I walked in to inquire about wedding and bridesmaids dresses. I was told that they do not sell wedding dresses. "But it says wedding dresses on your sign..."Apparently you can order wedding dresses from their catalogs, but I wasn't even offered to look at one. I was basically told that there was nothing there for me... which is fine... I just think they need to change their sign and name.

If you want your phone repaired never ever take it to any Metro PC ever. I went to get it repaired and needed a new digitizer I spent 180 dollars. It looked fine at first within 2 days I notice the touch screen is not working so well. Didn't think much of it. Two more days later a corner of the screen comes out. Apparently, it was not glued in together right. I would not have noticed if a piece of string wasn't caught in it. So now half my screen is not working. I touch the corner and see it is coming out. The screen cracks and now I am back at the problem for why I paid to have it fixed. I take it back and they send me to where the technician is. Which is a shady place on Irving park and Kedzie which is a food mart that sells phones. They say they do not want to cover the warranty because they will not make money off it. He says I should not have touched where it was coming off. I told him it should not be coming off in the first place. I tell him how the digitizer was not working the moment it became unglued from the corner. He says it does not work that way. He has fixed a lot of phones and that never happens. Apparently he is so experienced he can not even properly glue a screen back together. So now they refuse to fix the problem or give me my money back for not properly repairing the item which is what I paid for.

12.description: So it's been about 2 months now and I originally went to purchase some equipment at Gear Club Direct and long story short, they told me it was in stock and I went in on the day of my event to find out that they lied and it was not in stock. I know I should of purchased it in advance but for some stupid reason, i felt they had me covered. So I was upset because I was not able to use that lighting fixture at my event that evening, which i promised the client i would have. Does Gear Clubdirect care? Absolutely not. I put a true honest review on Yelp! and FB and low and behold, I got a call form their manager giving me his personal number and blah blah blah that he will discount me the price and will have it in within a week AS LONG AS I REMOVED my bad review! Stupid me, i removed the review and two months now and nothing from them. They still don't even have it in stock. So why am i still holding a grudge? Well, for starters the client emailed me this morning to see if I can compensate him for not having that fixture. Of course, im going to take care of my clients. But the store.....hell no. I will be putting that review back up and having all 8 of my djs and our friends put a review on their bad customer services and lies. Seems they didn't give a shit once I removed my review. LMAO. No need to call me now and beg me to remove this post or any other review or give me a discount. I just spent $5,483 online with another store to upgrade few things. I know they dont care and it's sad. Anyone starting out to dj or have kids looking to getting into djng...please beware Gear Club Direct. In my opinion check out Midwest Pro Sound & Lighting or even AvMaxx on Montrose Ave. Business is business - I have enough friends. Support your small business, they offer the same product and most likely cheaper. Big companies care about the large clients with large installations at clubs, bars, etc.

3.description: When it comes to top gear in lighting and sound, I look to gear club direct!  Local, affordable and accessible this place has it all. Top tier service and gear makes choosing this place for your lighting and audio needs a no brainer. I have been a customer of Gear Club for years. I know that whether looking for new gear, used gear, or trading in my old gear, I know I will always get a great price. Guitar who, never that. Thanks Gear Club!

1.description: Horrible experience... BUYER BEWARE!!!I'm left out in the cold after spending well over $10,000 in gear. I purchased speakers which I had problems with from the beginning they sold me used gear and passed off as new and they even got Chicago police officer involved in the scam! I was sold his used speakers and I have not used them except for one gig and one of the speakers has issues can't get an exchange or refund LUIS GARCIA SCAMMED ME!!! I tried several times to reach out to him but he ignores my text and emails!!! I once considered him a friend but all of it was a scam to get my money!!!

2.description: I placed an order and paid for for a Keytar. After several weeks, I began contacting the company for a status update, since it had not yet shipped. I made many attempts to contact them and never got the courtesy of a response. On November 2nd I filed a Paypal claim against Gear Club Direct, and FINALLY received some communication from them in the form of a refund with no explanation or apology. Bad business, bad communication. I will be ordering all future electronic instruments & components from a more reliable source.

9.description: This review is based on my experience with Luis Garcia. To base off my experience with him in one word, it would be "scum". Advertises items on craigslist that his company sells on there website for MORE money. I know people like to make some extra coin on the side but this was a pathetic way to hurt reputation for a business that has been around. If the owner would like to contact me, I would be more then glad to assist him with information. Thanks

10.description: I am very disgusted with GEAR CLUB DIRECT!!!!I NEVER received (2 x ADJ Vizi Spot PRO Led) that I purchased on 11/29/2013. Then, I couldn't believe that the manager Luis Garcia wasn't going to honor the on-line order purchase I made to begin with and tried to switch the product on me without my knowledge for a different lower end model (ADJ Vizi Led Spot) that I did NOT purchase to begin with!Mr Garcia's excuse was that the webmaster had incorrectly priced the product I purchased on-line on Black Friday and would therefore not honor it. The worst part about it is that he tried to switch product on me that didn't have the features I needed (such as interchangeable gobos and 50W led bulb). Had I not carefully noticed the different model on the boxes to begin with, I would have accidentally walked out with the wrong product on 01/16/2014. I am even more upset that Mr Garcia had never mentioned previously that I would not be receiving the ACTUAL lights that I ordered, considering I called at least 3 times to check the status on my order and had spoken directly with him. I requested a FULL REFUND IMMEDIATELY on 01/18/14 considering that Mr Garcia canceled my order promptly on 01/16/2014 because he was not going to honor my invoice that I had paid 6 weeks ago prior!! It's now FEBRUARY 10th 2014 and I still HAVEN'T received my REFUND!!Going forward, I will never do business with your company again and will make sure that none of my peers nor business partners in the industry will make any purchases as well!!

4.description: No joke. These guys are serious. They got the goods. They got tons of space. They got credit. They ship. They rent.Check them out.The most competitive no-haggle prices ANYWHERE. Friendly service. Hot damn!This is a golden nugget on the NW side. Easy from 90 or 94. Right off Elston.No reason to go anywhere else.Lights? Bam!Cables? Miles, yo!Cases? Bah BOOM!PA systems? Unntz unntz unntzMics? Checka 1 checka 2Come on, now! What more can I say? Check out the website if you need more info cuz I'm done.

6.description: Bummed to see some people had a bad experience, but it sounds like some small print policy or technical difficulty factors might have been at play....I've just finished using over an hour of Luis's time with a personal online consultation that ended in me buying a powered mixer that I feel much more confident about, at a cheaper price than competitors, and not that much more than independent used listings (which wouldn't have Peavey support, I assume).I feel pretty grateful to have had that service, since places like guitar center always seem to be trying to swindle you somehow....personalized recommendations and good prices and non-robotic communication.I will be checking with them again.

0.description: I bought some American DJ LED lights since my old Vertigo light just gets too hot with its 2 x 300 watt halogen bulbs. I knew what I wanted but couldn't find it on their site so Luis and I chatted and he had them. They were about 15% cheaper than a local retailer with no tax and free shipping. The lights were shipped direct from American DJ in LA and arrived in less than a week, by Fed-x. They were new units, in factory boxes, and well packaged. I hooked them up this morning and they work as expected, look great and are as bright as the Vertigo was, possibly brighter, without the heat. I almost didn't give them a 5 star rating because they were late sending an order confirmation. I had to call twice. In fact, the lights arrived before the email confirmation from Manny. (I needed the order confirmation to register the warranty with American DJ.) Later that day, I got snail mail and there was a copy of the order and a credit card receipt, in a hand-addressed envelope. I may need 1 or possibly 2 more lights and I will use them again. I'm sorry others have had so much trouble.

5.description: We were searching for a Moog Sub 37 Tribute Edition for our son as a Holiday and Birthday gift. To my surprise this is a hot and hard to find item. After calling the Manufacturer, the recommended Gear Club as one of their Authorized Dealers. We spoke with Luis who answered all our questions and packaged the synthesizer with a Moog ATA Case for a very fair price. Customer service was excellent both before and after the purchase and my son is thrilled with his new music gear. We will definitely purchase from Gear Club again and recommend them to everyone.

13.description: This is a fantastic place for all musical needs - purchasing or renting.  Very nice, knowledgeable people, great pricing, all with the feel of a secret club.  Better than Guitar Center and without the attitude you sometimes find elsewhere.  It's worth going out of your way to get to know this place.

11.description: My son ordered a DDJ-SB DDJ-SB Two-Channel DJ Controller on Jan 9. That same day, Adiran called him back to say the item was out of stock and wouldn't be in for a week or two. My son called back that day and cancelled the order - deciding to order it elsewhere where it was in stock. On JAN 13 the charge went through.A week+ went by, and no refund. My son called back to check on the status of his refund, and was told he should be receiving it soon. The next week - no refund. I (mum) called, spoke with Adrian, who let me know they had no record of my son initially canceling the order on the order date - that when my son called the week before they THEN cancelled the order, and that the item JUST returned to their warehouse after being re-routed back.I was dumbfounded as to why they shipped an item which was cancelled to begin with. They claimed they had no note of my son's phone call - even though I was sitting beside him during both calls. On Monday, Jan 27, Adrian informed me that his refund will go through, and he should have it in a day or two. LESS a $25 restocking fee. I was not pleased.On Friday, Jan 31, still no refund posted. I called on Saturday, but the one person managing the shop couldn't assist me.I rang Feb 3, and found that they posted his refund on FRIDAY - not Monday. A 5-day difference. Less the $25 restocking fee. Did not receive refund until Wednesday, Feb. 5.I do not recommend doing business with GCD. There are plenty of other sites to purchase equipment from where this situation would never occur, and the customer service level is infinitely higher. I am a completely unsatisfied customer.

8.description: I won some American Audio HP-550 Snow headphones from Club Direct on April 23rd and it's been 4 months and still have not received them. I even posted on their page on Facebook and seconds after they message me saying "looks like we overlooked your headphones. We'll get them out first thing in the morning. Our apologies" on June 8th. I would not recommend to anyone to do service with them. They do scam contest for likes on Facebook and from what I hear from other reviewers they have scammed other people.

14.description: GCD has been very good to me and my friends who shop there. Luis and the rest of the crew are very knowledgeable of there stock and always know What's Hot and what's not. Hands down they will always have my business. They always turn me on to new gear and always recommend the best gear to meet my needs. Thanks Guys!Keep up the good work!Jimmy

7.description: This is definitely a company you have to be on top of. I placed an order back on August 28, 2015 for a pair of replacement ear pads for my Pioneer HDJ-2000 headphones. The price was good but the shipping surprisingly was pretty high, but I needed the ear pads so I placed the order. I was sent an email confirmation for the order and it stated my ear pads would arrive in 5-7 business days. Well that didn't happen nor did I receive a call or email stating a delay or any update on my order. So I called and they assured me it was shipping out that same day and I'd receive it mid week. Now it's been 2 full weeks since my original order date. They even sent me a "shipped" email. Fast forward to today September 28, 2015 and I still never received the ear pads! I called and they said they were having issues with their shipping PC and they'd call me back. I was so irritated I cancelled the order and demanded an immediate refund (which they took care of within minutes) so that's the only positive I have for their company! My advice, either have them assure your item is truly in stock and follow up with them on the promised shipping estimate or shop elsewhere. The headache of waiting is not worth the low pricing.

58.description: Ordered a pizza. While waiting noticed an ant infestation around garbage can in the customer area, that was chock full; pointed it out to counter man. He thanked me, did nothing. Got the attention of one of the kitchen staff, she said it was someone else's job. Upon looking into the kitchen area I saw another overflowing garbage can, and stuff on the floor. While waiting for the pizza (about ten minutes), no one came to change the bag in the ant garbage, the top of the bin was pushed open by the content. Got a refund, called 311 and made a sanitation complaint.

56.description: Nice email once my delivery was "out"The BLT on French bread was good. I chose to add garlic butter sauce. The Baked Lasagna 4 stars by my cousin's descriptive sound and gesture.Chicken tenders were no match for my goddaughter

29.description: This place....sucks. At 1 am, when the place closes at 3, me and my brother ordered a couple things on grub hub. It said we would get our food by 2:20. It was now 3:00 am and my brother called Sarpinos...no answer...big surprise. My brother then called grub hub customer service, we got a refund and free food for our next order (at another place because we definitely won't order from here again). Apparently they couldn't even get ahold of this shitty restaurant OR the driver. Don't order from here, most likely your food will be extremely late or you won't even GET your food. I hope you close down, Sarpinos.

42.description: Great on line ordering, we have order quite few times now even in snow storm pizza always delivery in less than hour most time within 30mins and hot. Great value for pizza night!

23.description: I abs-so-freaking-lutely LOVE sarpino's. They are open til 3AM, so working the night shift at the ER is a little bit better when ordering from them. Online order is pretty easy to use. They are fast, and the deals are amazing. You can order so much food for $20. The bacon alfredo pizza is the bomb, so is the margherita. The other food is okay, like the calzone and the salads. I always ask for extra marinara because it's just too delicious.

47.description: Sarpino's is a great pizza delivery option, especially if you live near this one or any of the several in the city because you will get it piping hot.  I love how easy it is to order online, and the variety of online coupons you can pick from insures you always get a great deal.  The toppings are great, the crust is good for a thicker one (I usually prefer thin crust), but the sauce is a little sweater than I like.  My fav order is two small pizzas (2nd one is half-price) so that both my husband can have exactly the toppings we prefer.  Of course, Sarpino's also makes it easy to order half/half toppings on a larger pizza too.  We sometimes add an order of cheesie bread with the small pizzas, which is really more than we should eat, but we proceed to stuff ourselves to the brim.

8.description: This pizza joint isn't terrible, but it's also not great.  I would say if you are not too picky, then it's perfect.  IF you are picky, go somewhere else.  The cheese and sauce are low quality.

31.description: This pizza was terrible! The green peppers tasted like they came right out of a can. The sauce was too sweet for my liking and it was over $20 for a 12 inch pizza. I won't be ordering from here again!

34.description: Got a baked lasagna today with garlic bread. It was pretty good but I'd rather make a homemade one that has spinach and other kinds of toppings. This lasagna was filled with a lot of meat sauce. Had a lot of cheese and a fair amount of noodles. The garlic bread it came with was a bit rough.

16.description: Landed in Chicago about 11 pm and we excited to experience our first pizza in the city! It was too late to go out (for us)  and so delivery was the next best thing! We found sarpino's on Yelp and reviews looked pretty good for the places that were open late. We ordered 3 of the deep dish pizza's.  The special chicken,  the special cheese,  and sausage pizza.  I didn't have the sausage but friends loved it! The other two were great! Great place to order when you want a quick and easy pizza fix!

13.description: I will never again be giving my business to this shady establishment. My pizza had hair in it and what looked like saliva on the top. There was a nasty polish woman working after midnight who refused to refund my money even though I hadn't touched the pizza because there was hair CLEARLY on it. She was rude and unapologetic and I will never come here and will tell all of my friends that come here from school to go to the dominos down the street instead. I'm also going to call the city and ask them to inspect this establishment since they're clearly unsanitary.

11.description: As far as quick service pizza places go, sarpino's is by far my favorite. Lots of toppings, quick, and just plain. Lots of interesting specialties and gourmet pizza options too. I wouldn't go so far as to say it's "the best" pizza, but for what it is, it's really good.

39.description: Ordered carryout from their website - which was super easy and included a 15% off coupon!When I went in to pick up (in 15 minutes) the lady informed me that if you call in your order, you get a free pop as a carryout special. However, if you get 15% off online you don't get the pop, but then she gave me one anyway!Easy, fast, and my calzone is delicious. Lots of veggie options too...

37.description: I love pizza as if it were a first born child of mine. However, I can afford a pizza...not a child. Ok, that was a terrible analogy that made zero sense. But my point was that I love pizza and Sarpino's has never failed me. This particular joint has some pretty good carry out deals. A large 3-topping pizza with a free two-liter of soda for $11.99??? C'mon son?!? This would've costed an arm and a leg had it been delivered to my place.Their service is quick and the pizza stays nice and warm on the ride home. They're open late so they can definitely contain one's late night hunger pains.

0.description: I usually eat Domino's but recently switched to Sarpino's. One of the best choices I've made. This store in specific is great. Fast service and fresh pizzas, always. Thanks Sarpino's!

38.description: Sarpinos charged me $9.99 for what I thought was supposed to be the free pizza.  I called my order in for two extra large gourmet/specialty pizzas.  They have a deal:  buy one get one at half off.  I didn't think they would honor the #2 coupon for a free medium one topping with every extra large specialty/gourmet pizza purchase but I asked "for the heck of it," and they said yes.  When I picked up the order they told me I get a free liter of pop.  That threw me off--I thought they were being incredibly generous.  No wonder he wasn't takaing my coupon for the free pizza when I tried to hand it him, he said he didn't need it--little did I know it was because I was charged for it.  If had known they weren't going to honor the coupon for the free pizza, I wouldn't have ordered it, because we really didn't need more pizza.  Oh well, my fault for not checking the receipt before I left.I have a pet peeve when I get charged wrong for anything anywhere  I would have given them a better rating for their food and nice personnel, but being charged wrong leaves a bad taste in my mouth where I couldn't even enjoy the sweetness of the pineapples in the Hawaiian pizza :(It was a special occasion so I thought of Sarpinos unique pizzas to celebrate and treat my friends.  It took away from what would have otherwise been a pleasant experience for me.

51.description: I didn't realize this was on par with Domino's/Pizza hut, I should have read the reviews closer. So, with that being said, I don't think I can fault them for the taste or quality.I ordered the Spinach Special, which sounded good in theory. It had spinach, garlic, leeks, green onions, multiple cheeses... as I said, in theory, it sounded delicious. I don't like a doughy pizza, and this is very doughy. Oh - and there's no sauce (?!). They send you a tiny little cup of marinara to dip the pizza in, which was gone after 1 1/2 pieces.All in all, the other half ended up in the garbage, as I didn't feel like blowing the calories on bad pizza.It's cheap, that's for sure, and if you order online, you get a 15% discount. Delivery was fast too.

27.description: Foods great never had an issue with the delivery very fast while ordering delivery drivers are polite.

32.description: Guess what? It's not fancy pizza. It's not even really good.  But it is cheap and quick, and the 15% off for ordering online is pretty great! Yusssssss

54.description: Oh my, my... this pizza is fabulous!  A) They always have delivery.  So convenient.B) They always have coupons.  So awesome.C) They have an amazing selection of specialty pizzas.  So yummy!!I love the taco pizza (trust me, it's good) and their cheesy bread.  I could eat that every day and still love it.  They have a ton of pizza options and specials if you order two of the same size (second one is cheaper).  Delivery is always quick and this is a great option for parties or a night at home when you don't feel like cooking.  Never too expensive and always open.  What more could you ask for?  This is - hands down - my favorite delivery pizza in the city (sorry, Pizza Metro).

48.description: I've lived here 5 years, and tasted pizza from almost everywhere, but I just tried Sarpinos for the first time this past week (due to late night delivery) and loved it! Just ordered it again.  It's good!

44.description: I found Sarpino's to be like bad booze on a rough night: It's not what you would have wanted had you the choice, but it scratches the itch.Delivery:  Standard.  Took about an hour, and everything was hot when it got here.  And they deliver until 3 am.  And delivery is free, so, hey, bonus.Pizza:  Meh.  Fine, I guess.  Very doughy.  If we do this again I might go for thin crust.  I'm sort of into doughy pizza, but it was doughy even for me.  Each slice was just heavy under the weight of the doughiness.Toppings:  Superior.  Pepperoni covered damn near our whole pie.  One-up on PIzza Hut, whose shitty pizza I actually like, but they are SUPER stingy with toppings.  Dipping Sauce:  Hard to say, because we ordered the creamy garlic but got saddled with marinara instead.  Why would I want marinara?  There is already tomato sauce ON the pizza.Wings:  Do not want.  They're baked, not fried, which some people may be into.  But unfortunately this left the skin very chewy/gooey even though I ordered them well done hoping to combat "wing sogginess," which plagues all delivery wings.  They were also fattier than a lot of other wings I've had and I ended up on a weird, gooey hunt for actual chicken meat.  Also, the menu calls them "Buffalo" which is a misnomer.  These wings are certainly spicy, but they are dry.  There is no Buffalo sauce and there is no Buffalo flavor.  Big, big disappointment on the wings.  I would avoid, especially because at about $1 per wing, they ain't cheap.Price:  Menu pricing is high for what you get, but if you order on the website you can see "Store Specials" which should save you some dough (GET IT).  You also get 15% off for ordering online.

24.description: Fast. Yummy. And they drew me a unicorn on my box because I told them I had a shitty day at work. Very friendly in my book!

7.description: Pizza is delicious yet customer service is lacking. If you want the 15% discount, you order online. Easy enough. You'd think.I have NEVER been able to order online... by smart phone or computer. A few times, the person on the phone seemed to know the website was bad and gave me the discount. Tonight, the guy was an imbecile saying if I wanted the discount, I'd have to order online. Three times I told him that the website didn't work and 3 time, this MORON said, if I want the discount I should order online. 3 times. So very frustrating!!

49.description: I recently ordered pizza delivery from Sarpino's, thanks mainly to a menu stuck on my front door (wow, the menu on the door works!). I was ordering pizza for my friend who was trying to feed a bunch of hungry movers. The delivery came at the exact time that I had asked for, and the pizzas were a hit with the group as well. We went with a sausage and pepperoni (sausage slices rather than the more typical sausage chunks) and a spinach and mushroom combo. Both varieties were good, with what I would call a medium crust. There are some interesting-looking specialty pizzas for the more adventurous palate. The menu lists a bunch of special coupon offers, so mention the one that fits your dining needs for a slightly better deal. Considering I live only blocks from Marie's I never thought I would ever order from Sarpino's, but this was a unique situation and by all accounts the Sarpino's pizza was a good choice.

40.description: Sarpinos is our favorite pizza place by FAR. They use the freshest ingredients, have wonderful and interesting topping combos and really aren't much more expensive than anyone else. We have always had fast delivery and every single pizza we have ordered has been delicious!

53.description: By far the best Damn Pizza I have EVERRRRR Tasted, visited Chicago for the first time, and late one night after coming home, my friend asked if I wanted pizza, I said sure. He ordered from Sarpino's,, and I was in love. I used to say NY had the best Pizza. HELL no !!!! I will not eat pizza again until I go back to Chicago in a couple of weeks. PERIOD

30.description: so it finally happened. it was 230am and i was drunk and hungry. i couldnt do mexican food yet again. so i did what i swore id never do and ordered from sarpinos. seeing as i work in a pizza place, i know my way around a pie. and seeing their menus with disgustingly low prices on every door i ever delivered to convinced me that i should never step foot inside. but i was drunk. sue me.customer service was amazing. i have no idea who their manager/whatever is at 230am on a weekday, but he was extremely friendly and helpful. pizza was a little slow to cook (compared to what they told me over the phone, i understand how ovens work). pizza was iffy. reminded me of little caesars, but not $5 and not already cooked. for 230 in the morning, it did the job. if its anytime before midnight and youre not on a super tight budget, i'd encourage you to try any other place in the world. but it wasnt terrible either. one interesting thing i found, and maybe they switched it up, but they say that they provide one free dipping sauce with any pizza. i saw this and asked for ranch. i also had ordered mozz sticks. when i got the food, the mozz sticks had ranch with them, and the pizza had one ranch and one marinara sauce. id like to assume that they meant to put the red sauce with the mozz, but its entirely possible that (a) they give you ranch with your mozzarella sticks, and (b) they give you red sauce to dip your pizza in. over all, im only giving them a 3/5 for their amazing customer service. if you like politeness, go here. if you want good pizza, dont be drunk at 230am.

46.description: The pizza wasn't bad.  Most pizza isn't bad.  It wasn't that good though and the price seemed a bit high.  The sauce was too sweet for  my taste and the crust was too doughy.  Chewing it made my jaw muscles tired.  I much prefer dominoes if you're going the route of cheap pizza.

1.description: I always order from this particular Sarpinos.  The pizza is delivered within the promised time frame and sometimes sooner.  Their pizzas are fresh, the cheese is loaded on as I like it.  I do ask for extra cheese.  The sauce is perfectly sweet. The crust is well, heavenly good.  It's soft and buttery.  It's a really good pan pizza.   The ingredients are satisfyingly good.  On this order, I had asked for sausage and mushroom on half the pizza.  It was very good and filling!  I have ordered numerous times here for myself and for others in my home.  There was never a single complaint, in fact there's never anything left. Quality is great and so is consistency!  Delivery guy(s) are great too.

55.description: Best deals ever! With coupons you can save a lot of money when you order pizza. I love the vegetarian pizza!

9.description: It's been awhile since I've been to Sarpino's but my last experience was down right awful! My bro loves Sarpinos because of their wide range of toppings and it's a damn shame we won't be ordering from here anymore. My brother and I had a coupon where If you buy 2 pizza's you get a third one free. Unfortunately, they don't seem to honor their coupons! What do you know? No third pizza.... thanks Sarpino's. My brother called back to complain, he was very polite. The manager insisted that he gave us the pizza... what a rip off. By the way, the pizza is overly salted and skimpy on the toppings that are given. I should have just went to little Caesars. Note: I'm no way affiliated with the little caesars staff or their company.

26.description: order from here if you dont want to receive your pizza, the quality of this slop is not worth the wait

25.description: Awesome pizza, I've been ordering all sorts of food from this location for years and never tried the pizza. Tonight we ordered a Greek Pizza and the Bacon Cheeseburger Pizza(extra cheese) and they were both the best pizza we've ever had. Thank you to the staff for making such an awesome pizza.

12.description: I always order from this Sarpinos and my pizza gets delivered in 30 minutes! Always! And the best part is that the pizza is always like fresh out of the oven! I recommend their pizza and delivery service 100%

59.description: I was pleasantly surprised by how good the pizza was (had the garlic and the pepperoni). Definitely better than P. H. or L.C.'s! My son picked it up after we ordered over the phone, so I don't know anything about the ambience. Our 2-for-1 coupon made it reasonably affordable--prices are a bit high.

21.description: Great consistent service and food.

17.description: Fast. Yummy. And they drew me a unicorn on my box because I told them I had a shitty day at work. Very friendly in my book!

10.description: Love this place, I always order late night and delivery is very fast!!! The pizzas and wings are great, the salads and pastas are okay.

5.description: wow. I gotta say, I've had pizza from some of the "best" Chicago pizza places but this one is my new all time favorite for thin crust. It's not super thin or crunchy so if that's your thing 1.) don't even and 2.) you're probably not going to be a huge fan.I however, am a huge fan of Sarpino's Pizzeria.It was a cold and blustery day. It was snowing and blowing and I couldn't bring myself to leave the office for lunch, nor could I bear the thought of a poor Jimmy John's delivery person pedaling in the snow to bring me my lunch. "Pizza?" I asked myself. Yes. It had been less than 24 hours since my last pie but I couldn't get the idea out of my head... Lou Malnoti's had failed me the night before. My boyfriend and I agree that their thin crust is much too thin and crusty. I order online through Yelp. They arrive about 40 mins later...The pizza is hot and perfectly sized -adorably nestled in it's miniature pizza box. It comes with extra marinara on the side and a packet each of red pepper flakes and Parmesan cheese. For good measure they also include a pepperoncini, which I appreciate.  The pizza is perfection: fluffy crust, savory sauce, and tons of stringy cheese. It perhaps had a bit more sauce than I like however when sauce is this good, who could complain?I ordered a caesar salad which I gobble up. Plenty of croutons and dressing on the side (2 little cups worth). It was great. Together, the salad and pizza live happily forever in my tummy. On a more practical note:This place has zero hype compared to the typical Chicago pizza chains. And it's clear to me that  the quality is SOooooooo much better at small pizza joints like this. I think I am making a vow to avoid Chicago pizza chains, at least for a while. Sorry Nancy's, Lou Malnoti's, Home Run Inn, Palermo's, and who ever else is left (excluding Giordano's of course.)

3.description: I used to order from Sarpino's often with no complaints. The food i've ordered from there was always good and hot. But this location is the pits and i'll never order from there again. I ordered a medium sized pizza with capicola and spinach with the regular crust. That's what I usually always order. That night when I got the pizza it a regular sized pizza with thin crust. I called them back immediately ant told the rude person on the phone that my order was wrong. He kept saying no, no you got the medium than hung up. I even measured the round cardboard it came on which measured 10 inches. I know it was smaller even before I did that since the box had way to much extra space in there. I then emailed the company and called the company twice. No one ever got back to me via email or phone call. That's just not right or fair. Your company lost a good customer. Not that you care obviously.

35.description: Please never stop being the most affordable decent pizza in town. Please never stop being open until 3am.I've had a few disappointments, but overall I have come to love "Sarps" as it is known around our lazy apartment.Easy online ordering, super cheap deals, reliable, hot, and FREE delivery. If it WASN'T so cheap, I would have higher expectations for quality, but you can seriously get a large pizza for $10. Boyfriend absolutely loves it (he is not as picky as I am) but seriously loves it.

19.description: If I could give negative reviews, I would do so. I ordered here last night around 12:40am. Around 1:20, my order arrived. Everything correct. No complaints for 1am food. I fell asleep on the couch around 2, and my cell phone rings. I answer it, and it's a Sarpino's driver telling me my food has arrived. I said no, I'd already received the food, thanks & good night. Ten minutes later, same number calls again. "Are you Caryn? Buzz me in. I have food." Excuse me? It's 2am, I'm home alone, and I'm CERTAINLY not buzzing you in when I JUST told you i got it already and thank you. I told him not to call again. Fast forward to 3:00am, my boyfriend is home and now we are sleeping. MY DOOR BUZZER IS RINGING. Are you kidding me? I look at my phone and now a DIFFERENT number has called THREE TIMES. My boyfriend goes downstairs to tell him please leave, and that we have already received the food and to stop calling me.Mistakes happen. I told the first guy no big deal, but that seems like a serious lack of communication on their part. And don't ring my buzzer at 3am.

28.description: If I could give negative reviews, I would do so. I ordered here last night around 12:40am. Around 1:20, my order arrived. Everything correct. No complaints for 1am food. I fell asleep on the couch around 2, and my cell phone rings. I answer it, and it's a Sarpino's driver telling me my food has arrived. I said no, I'd already received the food, thanks & good night. Ten minutes later, same number calls again. "Are you Caryn? Buzz me in. I have food." Excuse me? It's 2am, I'm home alone, and I'm CERTAINLY not buzzing you in when I JUST told you i got it already and thank you. I told him not to call again. Fast forward to 3:00am, my boyfriend is home and now we are sleeping. MY DOOR BUZZER IS RINGING. Are you kidding me? I look at my phone and now a DIFFERENT number has called THREE TIMES. My boyfriend goes downstairs to tell him please leave, and that we have already received the food and to stop calling me.Mistakes happen. I told the first guy no big deal, but that seems like a serious lack of communication on their part. And don't ring my buzzer at 3am.

45.description: Pizza, calzone, salads, etc!  I've ordered multiple times from this location and I get it fast and hot and always good!  No delivery fees either!

33.description: This is my go-to neighborhood pizza joint for delivery. Their menu is cheap, good, and lots of items to choose from. Pizza always come on time and never cold. Plus you can't beat the free 15% online coupon on any order.

43.description: Ok pizza.....ok prices......good when you just want something fast

2.description: Too pricey and the pizza isn't even all that. They should have stayed in the suburbs. This chain does not deserve to be in a city with a hella of a lot more great pizza options around. And for this I'll pass on them.

18.description: Always yummy and reliable to order from here any night of the week!  They're always open until 3am.  Order from their website instead of third party apps, they offer way better deals and coupons.

41.description: I enjoy the Greek pizza here :) pretty expensive though

52.description: It is what it is.They delivery late and for free.  That might be enough af a reason to give them so many stars but the sandwichs are pretty good too.  I wasn't a big fan of the cheese bread but it was ok.Cheap and fast.  Makes sense to me.

50.description: I've ordered from Sarpino's before and it was fine. This time around I ordered a pepperoni with bacon bites pizza (mmm), BBQ wings, and cheese sticks, which was all finger-licious good. I got three types of dipping sauce: garlic, jalapeno, and chipotle. All this cost $23 which was more than enough for 2 people.I would order from them again.

4.description: Horrible. Everything was horrible. I ordered the sarpinos chicken sandwiches, Buffalo wings, sarpino's shrimp pizza. Everything was truly horrible. Delivery was fast. Food was the worst I've had this year.

6.description: So after a long day spent in the ER after slipping on a patch of black ice, I was hungry. I ordered online an XL pizza, double pepperoni, double mushrooms, and yes I was charged for it. I tipped the driver a good 30% and waited for my pizza. The pizza arrived in a reasonable time, but my pizza only came with single pepperoni and mushrooms. Calling the location got me about a five minute wait on hold and no sh*ts given over the missing items on my pizza, The manager's answer was that fresh pizza is their priority, never mind paying for or getting extra items. Not getting anywhere with a discount on my tab on the missing items I paid for, I tried the nuclear option, OK, enjoy your review on Yelp. Five minutes later the manager calls back sounding apologetic, but another phone rings on his end and he promptly puts me on hold. Sorry, if I'm not your priority, don't bother calling me up.To sum this up, I paid for a substandard pizza at Downtown prices and got half the order I paid for, customer service is just what could be expected for the neighborhood. Anyone giving this location and its pizza five stars on Yelp probably considers Olive Garden haute cuisine.

22.description: When it comes to hunger, Sarpino's is the key. I think that everyone knows how it feels to be hungry at night, and you don't have a car or sometimes you feel lazy to go somewhere to eat. I have been ordering from them a while a go. delivers aren't delayed, I always get my Pizza earlier. It's a great place to have a night pizza from.

15.description: Have eaten at Sarpino's before but not at this location. Called to order a No Cheese pizza and was given a very hard time about it from the person I spoke with. Really?? How hard is it to NOT put cheese on your pizza and just put extra sauce?? The person was very rude and condescending to the point where I hung up the phone and gave my business elsewhere. Would rather go hungry or eat Spam rather than get anything from this place.

57.description: Update 9/10/11: These assholes lost a customer. I'm never ordering from them again.

20.description: Forget about Papa John's or Domino's.  Please come and embrace your local business.  When everything else closed and you're hungry to death, log onto their website and place an order.  You can't go wrong with a regular-size calzone for under $7 and a medium pizza for two for under $20.  Don't forget to order "online" so that you can start earning loyalty points and get 15 percent off.  After you place an order for pick-up, start walking toward the location because it will ready WHEN YOU ARE THERE.  Seriously, can't go wrong with that.  I sometimes order it off my phone while I'm traveling back home from work.  Don't get me wrong.  I'm not a pizza-type of person and have every intention to eat healthier, but Sarpino's will be your best companion when you're just lazy.  I've ordered the gourmet pizza (margarita specially), calzones, and baked ziti.  I won't expect the high-end restaurant quality, but you can't complain.  They do delivery as well.  We live very close to this location, so we often do pick-ups.  Everyone who works there is very courteous.  So far I've never encountered any problem whatsoever.

36.description: Their quality has been declining the last few months.  This location has been our go to just because it's the closest, but I guess we can start going to a different location. The were advertising their gourmet and specialty pizzas for a different price on the website yet they wouldn't honor it....seriously!? Not a good way to treat their customers....

14.description: Great pizza!  We love the fact that this is one of the only pizzerias that have sun-dried tomatoes as an ingredient! Love em! And thanks for the speedy delivery!

58.description: Maybe I'm spoiled coming from Rogers Park, with JB's and Gullivers but this pizza was not very good. Greasy and bland. I've only ordered delivery two times, but experience was the same. There won't be a third time. Delivery was prompt and drivers were friendly. ** Warning, if you're using a credit card for delivery they are actually using the now illegal credit card imprints that capture all of your information.  Merchants are only supposed to use last four digits of credit card on receipts to avoid card information theft. I hope their drivers are licensed and bonded, but this is doubtful.  I got a replacement card afterwards, just in case.

56.description: WHAT?I've been going to Marie's forever and their Pizza is always incredible..I personally would say its the best on the Northwest side..It's greasy, thin, classic Chicago pizza..The "Marie's Special" is your best bet, sausage, green peppers, onions and mushrooms..The perfect marriage..This is the best pizza to partner w/ a beer..

29.description: Delicious pizza, and very cozy atmosphere. We enjoyed Maries's Pizza on Lawrence. Very good service too :)

42.description: Tried again with Friends who moved to Florida. They had not been here for three years. Their granddaughter had the best comment regarding the holiday decor she said"it looks like santa's throw up". Sad and tragic all at once.  It's one thing to be nostalgic but another to serve crappy food.

23.description: This place is run by idiots the only people in this place worth anything are the cooks. The lady that takes the orders and delivery driver are pretty much useless. They have messed up my order and had me waiting almost 2 hours every time. Then the lady that takes the orders try's to tell me that I didn't order something when I did. I knew they were gonna do this so I recorded me making the order when I told her that she told me it was illegal I told her it was to show her how stupid she is. Anyways if you want to eat there go there and eat do not get anything delivered. They must be drinking at the liquor store or sumthing. Anyways don't order from this place unless you want to be over charged have your order messed up and wait forever and then told you are a liar. I did call the lady on the phone some choice names and she called me back 3 times to argue about it. Screw this place never again.

47.description: This Place is TOPS!!! I am from Rogers Park as well and Love JBs and Gullivers but I must disagree with Marie's review from 10-27-14 since Marie's Pizza is FAB!!! The thin crust is beyond Great!! The sauce is Yum!! The decor is out of style but fun! We went there with a Groupon to try the place out and we are so happy we did!!! Our waiter was Mark and he was GREAT he made us laugh with his funny jokes and  he had such a great personality he made us feel like regulars which we will be now!!!!!  The one thing I noticed is that the bartender had a puss on her face the WHOLE time, which was kind of a downer, I wanted to buy her a shot to see if she has it in her to smile!?!?!!? I cant wait to trey the other items on the menu as Marie's is a GREAT Neighborhood Restaurant!!!

8.description: I live across the street from Marie's and it is a decent little place. It's a very well known pizza joint and when we first moved into time neighborhood I was excited to try it out. It's a very old place and they haven't changed t since it opened in sure...it's kinda cool actually. Our server was an older lady super nice and she had been working their for years which I can appreciate, service was great. Giving three stars because he food was just okay. Pizza was traditional thin crust it was good but I was not wowed like what I had read. We also got wings which were very small. It's very basic. Not bad but not great. But I can appreciate the tradition they seem to keep.

31.description: Great live music.  The food is average, but the staff and ambience make up for it.  The place is attached to a liquor store and has been open for a million years.  The minestrone soup is a fav.

34.description: Horrible service was told sit anywhere sat in a booth waited 10 minutes just to be told that I couldn't sit at the booth because we were a party of 2, we were asked to sit at a table so we moved 15 minutes later no waitress no menus. Pretty crappy service, I don't recommend. There no negative if not that what this place would get

16.description: Stopped by yesterday for the first time in years since I was in the old neighborhood.  Pizza is even better than I remember, crispy cracker crust.  Got a large Maries special and a large greek salad for 3 people.  No pizza leftovers was the only downside because it was that good!

13.description: The greatest thing on Sunday, is Judy Roberts is playing! The other talent was  delightful and personable! We were having a great time ! The food is Okay , and the staff was doing the best they could do under their circumstance.Management team is challenged .We were not the happiest of customers.   It was my first time there and wanted to have a great time.The entertainment was great!!!!!! Unfortunately I don't think we will be back.     Judy , we will follow anywhere but not ther    l

11.description: The pizza here is delicious, thin crispy crust cut the Midwestern way, in squares.  I love it.  The reason I'm giving three stars is the service.  Everything feels chaotic: getting seated, getting a menu, getting the attention of a server, ordering food.  There are vast swaths of time where no one pays the slightest bit of attention to you.  They tell you they're busy.  It's okay, I'm not in a rush.  Just act like you care whether I ever come back.  But I probably will.

39.description: Go here, eat here, enjoy it here! Great Pizza & Great Service. Support an outstanding local business! My mom has been eating here for at least 35 years... I'd love to see u around for another 35! Love you Marie's! Keep up the great work!

37.description: Our favorite thin crust pizza place. we drive all the way from the west suburbs  for this pizza. You can get your pizza however you like it, they will accommodate your ingredients wish on their pizza without any problem. Tastes really good with a beer.I like their cannolis which have  a hint of lemon.Decor of the place is old but they keep it clean. On weekends they have live music. Usually a trio playing Sinatra and old classics per your request.Great place.

0.description: This is one of my favorite places in Chicago. The pizza is consistently good, if you like thin, delicious, greasy pizza (and if you DON'T like that, I probably don't want to know you), but where Marie's really shines s the ludicrous decor. Awful red booths, nearly-hideous bronze-ish walls, a bathroom that hasn't been updated in 30 years...And the Christmas decorations! If you haven't been here around the holidays, you really should make the trip. Truly, truly awesome. By awesome, in this case, I mean terrifically cheesy and over the top. It seriously has to be seen to be believed.

38.description: I'd never tried Marie's before, and it showed up in my GrubHub, with high yelp marks, so I figured, "What the hell. I'll try this place." I mean, even when pizza is bad, it's not *bad*. Or so I thought.Delivery was fast. I'll give Marie's that. But then the delivery guy couldn't figure out how my callbox worked. I feel like a delivery driver should be acquainted with a wide array of different callboxes, and mine isn't exactly rocket science. It's your standard "scroll through the names and press the button to call" kind. So when he called me, I explained to him how it works---that he had to scroll through the names---and still he kept trying to type my name into the keypad. I'm pretty sure tying shoes is significantly more difficult than using a callbox, and I'm quite confident this gentleman was wearing shoes, so I don't know what the deal was.So I walked downstairs and through the courtyard to the gate to get my pizza, came back upstairs and got ready to dig in. Any confidence I had in the intrinsic not-that-badness of pizza is shattered. I'm  convinced that Marie's must have a massive underground marketing ring that pays people to post positive Yelp reviews, because that's the only possible explanation for even one five-star review, much less the plethora I've found here. I can't believe that people either enjoy food this disgusting or are malicious enough to lead others astray with such positive reviews. Nobody is *that* terrible a person.I like to get bacon on my pizza. So that's what I got. Imagine you had a slab of bacon, 4-5 slices thick. Then you chop through the slab, but didn't separate the slices, and throw the chunks on the pizza. That's what I think they did, so instead of crispy-tender salty goodness, I got chewy soft cubes of half-cooked fat that left my mouth coated in slime and a greasy pork chop aftertaste. It was hands down not only the worst pizza I've ever had, but probably the worst delivery meal I've ever had.It was so terrible, I wish I had a gag reflex so I could throw it up. Maybe I'll go drink some Strawberry Essence Suave shampoo and hope that does the trick. Or if anyone knows where I can pick up a good stomach flu, let me know. I'm all ears. Whatever helps me get this out of my body as soon as possible.

51.description: This is a place for nostalgia and fun.  Thin crust pizza is good, atmosphere is old school fun.

27.description: The greatest thing on Sunday, is Judy Roberts is playing! The other talent was  delightful and personable! We were having a great time ! The food is Okay , and the staff was doing the best they could do under their circumstance.Management team is challenged .We were not the happiest of customers.   It was my first time there and wanted to have a great time.The entertainment was great!!!!!! Unfortunately I don't think we will be back.     Judy , we will follow anywhere but not ther    l

32.description: Went to this restaurant because we had a Groupon for pizza and a pitcher of beer or a wine flight.  The pizza was fine, but we were not informed that there was an additional charge of $10 for the type of beer we selected.  If we were notified of the amount for the up-charge prior to the selection, we would not have chosen it.  This was very misleading and it put a damper on our evening since we felt we were being taken advantage of.  If it wasn't for this situation, I would go back.  Because of the way we were treated, we won't return.

54.description: We couldn't decide where to eat on Saturday night. Pizza sounded good, and I looked at Chicago Eater's list of "Chicago's 25 Iconic Pizzerias" and chose Marie's Pizza & Liquors, a place I've heard of but never tried. The "iconic" designation didn't spook me since I saw some familar names like Lou Malnati's, Piece, Pequod's and Spacca Napoli (though the omission of Uno's/Due's is criminal). Marie's has a weird throw-back vibe that was sort of interesting--like time-traveling back to, I don't know, 1967 (or earlier?)--but the pizza just wasn't good. I think Domino's is better. Honestly, I think just about any pizza other than (bad) pizza from a grocery freezer is better. I'll never go back to Marie's.

48.description: I went with a friend of mine to this restaurant and was immediately welcomed with Christmas decorations. I will say, I love Christmas decorations so that automatically won my heart. This was a very clean and festive restaurant. They even had a small band that would play at people's tables that night. I'm not sure if that is a regular thing. Food was very delicious. I had the chicken parmesan and it was pretty darn tasty. Next time, I may be a little more adventurous.Only one complaint, we had a very long wait time for a table, but once we sat down, service was pretty decent.

44.description: What. The. Heck. This is probably one of the more unfortunate dining experiences I have had so far. Our waitress was not very kind or helpful, which put me off at the start. The jalapeno poppers we ordered as an appetizer were okay, but nothing to write home about. The pizza was ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE. It honestly tasted like it had been MICROWAVED and that they used ragu for their sauce or something.  When you are paying for a restaurant meal you should be getting fresh food. Apparently they feel differently at Marie's. I would have rather had a frozen pizza than the crap they served here. The "performers" who could barely play their instruments were very intrusive and unwanted, though they insisted on playing several songs at my table. I felt very uncomfortable by the way they stared at my breasts and winked at me-in front of my boyfriend. You couldn't get me to come back if you paid me.

24.description: Classic eccentric Chicago pizza parlor! Love the live music!!!! Order extra pizza they don't have family size here.....yummmmmm

7.description: My family has been going here for over 50 years.. I am 3rd generation as are the owners... I have never been so disappointed. First my dad came home with 2 pizzas not 3 he paid, the nonEnglish speaking pizza maker told him yeah 2 getting the impression there were 2 in one box. Not very bright on our end, but we called immediately and were told we would receive a refund for 1pizza. 4 days later we call and are told the same thing. Well, today the Manager yelled on the phone saying we were liners and had received 3 pizzas, then hung up on us... Really? The customer is always right and I am not going to lie..

49.description: Our party of three just spent an hour and a half at Marie's Pizza on Lawrence waiting for a pizza that never came. Our waitress checked in with us once to tell us that we had not been forgotten and freshened our drinks. When I informed her and then the manager that we were leaving we were told that the pizza was coming. We paid the bill for our drinks and left. The only apology was offered was by the waitress after she overheard our guest saying "I can't believe they didn't even apologize". I will never ever go back to Marie's.

40.description: I have tried many places in Chicago, and hands down this is the best thin crust pizza I have ever had. Also, I have to shamelessly plug the red velvet cupcake, very moist and just the right amount of frosting. The fact that it is connected to a liquor store, even better. It was a win win situation. I will definitely visit this place again.

53.description: Really fun place.  Went on a Wednesday night.  They had a little jazz band playing. Got the thin crust pepperoni and onion.  Lots of sauce. Tasted fresh.  Loved the red booths. A real blast from the past. Service was good.  Didn't have to wait for a table.  It's worth a trip to check out the Christmas decorations.

30.description: If you like ultra thin crust pizza, this is YOUR place. Its ultra hot, paper thin, with a great sauce flavor and excellent cheese coverage. It's also one of the few exquisitely kitsch Chicago Italian style restaurants left in the city. The decor during the holidays is a must see.

46.description: quite the place to go for decent food, great atmosphere and the strolling musicians.  you cannot beat the prices, and the decorations are out of this world.  Fun place to check out a few times per year, an old chicago favorite

1.description: I ordered delivery late on a Sunday. Delivery was on time.-Grilled chicken ceaser salad was blah... only had romaine, cherry tomatos and pieces of grilled chicken that needed more seasoning. -Toasted ravioli was good, but they only sent one small 2oz container of marinara for like 8 pieces.-4 bottles of water were ordered and I was called from restaurant saying they were out of water! WHAT KIND OF RESTAURANT RUNS OUT OF WATER!!? And they didn't even try to make up for it by sending me a soda or something. I will order from here again when it's really late and I am really hungry.It's only fair to add that I have ordered their pizza before and It's good.
