55.description: Good, solid thin crust.  We had the special which is sausage, mushroom, onion, green pepper.  We got two versions actually.  Apparently, there was some mix up and the first pizza left off the mushrooms.  We had it half gone and the server stopped by to check and asked 'Are there mushrooms on there?'  We hadn't even noticed honestly but confirmed that indeed there were no mushrooms.  She cheerfully announced that something got messed up and brought over another pizza (no charge) with the mushrooms.  Soooooo, AWESOME service there!  We didn't even know we had a problem!  LOLSo, the two pizzas in comparison were a bit inconsistent in the crust.  The first one - probably cooked a little less than the second - had a softer crust.  The second one had a superior crispiness.The sausage is homemade w/fennel - I LOVE fennel!  Also, they use fresh mushrooms which I'm also a fan of on pizza vs. the canned ones.In comparison to my fav thin crust, Rosati's, Marie's holds its own.  I wasn't really a big fan of the wandering musician thing - too loud I think.  It was hard to carry on a conversation.

9.description: So many people that visit Chicago go to The Bean at Millennium, Sear's Tower, State Street, Michigan Avenue, etc.. Where tourists SHOULD be is in the neighborhoods, at places like Marie's. Mid-century is in vogue right now--Marie's is stuck in a wonderful time warp. So many places, such as Biasetti's on Irving Park remodeled...and soon after went out of business. We are so fortunate to have Marie's, a place where we go and feel as though we are time-traveling. They service is sincere and attentive and friendly. The owner is so proud(and rightfully so) of her establishment. The pizza is great, the atmosphere is amazing, the holiday decorations can't be beat. Sit at the bar, grab a booth, and listen to the jukebox or traveling musicians.  And if you are looking for a great spot on New Year's Eve for a group, I highly recommend Marie's. THIS is Chicago.

26.description: So last night, I ordered a half-pound hamburger and a 12pk of special export beer, simple enough or so i thought.... took almost an hour to arrive which isn't the worst thing to happen. My burger only had one patty, making it a quarter pounder and the twelve pack they gave me, EXPIRED OCT 2014!!!!I ordered late, so i called back this morning, and apparently a manager won't be in until 5pm! HOW IS THIS PLACE STILL OPEN THEY SHOULD BE CLOSED for  incompetence

25.description: I LOVE this place!! red booths make me think I'm 'in the movies' and REAL music so many nights!! And the best pizza ever with amazing desserts.  I love sitting at the bar first and then moving to a booth. Thoughtful servers...and how can they remember what I drink and like to eat???This is a true Chicago tradition and should be appreciated and enjoyed!Yea Nadine!!!!!!!!

12.description: Good, solid thin crust.  We had the special which is sausage, mushroom, onion, green pepper.  We got two versions actually.  Apparently, there was some mix up and the first pizza left off the mushrooms.  We had it half gone and the server stopped by to check and asked 'Are there mushrooms on there?'  We hadn't even noticed honestly but confirmed that indeed there were no mushrooms.  She cheerfully announced that something got messed up and brought over another pizza (no charge) with the mushrooms.  Soooooo, AWESOME service there!  We didn't even know we had a problem!  LOLSo, the two pizzas in comparison were a bit inconsistent in the crust.  The first one - probably cooked a little less than the second - had a softer crust.  The second one had a superior crispiness.The sausage is homemade w/fennel - I LOVE fennel!  Also, they use fresh mushrooms which I'm also a fan of on pizza vs. the canned ones.In comparison to my fav thin crust, Rosati's, Marie's holds its own.  I wasn't really a big fan of the wandering musician thing - too loud I think.  It was hard to carry on a conversation.

59.description: Decided to order pizza for pick up on a Friday afternoon and was greeted by a friendly bartender. The pizza was smelling great in the car, I ordered 2 pizza's, one was just Sausage and the other was the Maries Special (sausage,onion, green pepper and mushroom) Very tasty...But I think my mistake was I should of ate it there cause by the time I got it home it was cold...Next time I am grabbing a booth and enjoying it there.

21.description: This is one of my favorite places in Chicago. The pizza is consistently good, if you like thin, delicious, greasy pizza (and if you DON'T like that, I probably don't want to know you), but where Marie's really shines s the ludicrous decor. Awful red booths, nearly-hideous bronze-ish walls, a bathroom that hasn't been updated in 30 years...And the Christmas decorations! If you haven't been here around the holidays, you really should make the trip. Truly, truly awesome. By awesome, in this case, I mean terrifically cheesy and over the top. It seriously has to be seen to be believed.

17.description: If you like ultra thin crust pizza, this is YOUR place. Its ultra hot, paper thin, with a great sauce flavor and excellent cheese coverage. It's also one of the few exquisitely kitsch Chicago Italian style restaurants left in the city. The decor during the holidays is a must see.

10.description: Awesome place! excellent pizza and the atmosphere is completely old school.  I love the entrance which is shared with the liquor store and the bar itself is a throw back.

5.description: - Old school look & vibe which was cool- Hope you're not in a hurry because you're going to be there awhile- Server screeched at us for whatever reason when she first came to the table and provided us with two wine glasses, one of which had significant amount of lipstick on it- Pizzas aren't big, but prices are pretty standard for what you get- Thin crust is nice and crispy along the edges, but soggy by the time you get to the center- Cheese was nicely caramelized and the sauce was nicely pureed and even throughout- Nothing really stands out except the combo of the crust, sauce and cheese works well- Sausage is extremely bland and there isn't much of it- Print out your coupons because they don't honor anything on your phone- Overall decent value & I'd go back for another try

3.description: I love this place when I am on the north side of Chicago. Been going here 30 years. Classic old style pizza joint and bar. Can't miss unless you like chain pizza! Give them a try.

35.description: This is a great restaurant!  It has a welcoming atmosphere and delicious food!  The pizza is the best!  Another plus is the traveling band on the weekends!  The gentlemen are so talented and do not play too loudly as to disturb any conversations. They also take requests and they sing and play beautifully!!!We are now visiting Marie's every weekend!  The service is out of this world and everyone on staff is helpful and they all work together.  If you want a delicious thin crust pizza with a wonderful Italian ambiance, this is the best place in Chicago!  Some restaurants are only eager to raise prices and do a lot of unnecessary remodeling jobs that cost the customers.  Marie's is perfect the way it is!!!  A++++

19.description: Pizza is good but service is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo slow!!!!! The food is good but they need quicker servers...couldn't enjoy or food cause we didn't anything to wash it down with! They also have really good specials... But again they need to step up their service.

28.description: Best pizza I've had since I used to live in Logan Square. I won't mention the other pizza place because that would just be wrong haha. I tried a few different types of pizza (pepperoni, sausage, veggie) and they all passed my test of deliciousness. One thing I love about this place is that it ALSO has a well stocked liquor store connected next door with all of my favorites. I have yet to go on a Friday night, which is said to be quite entertaining, but now that I am a member of Mayfair, I feel like this place will definitely become one of my regular spots to eat.

45.description: I love this place. It's living history with great pizza, great service and a lot of charm that takes you back about 50 years.I discovered this joint with a friend after a golf game and we were both jonesing for pizza and happened upon Marie's. We loved it and I was happy to see they deliver as well.Marie's rules!

33.description: I had never felt more invisible in my life. I sat around for 20 minutes attempting to get a waitress' attention. Instead, every table around me was serviced. I visited this spot due to a positive recommendation. I ended up leaving without even being served a glass of water. I see positive reviews about the pizza. Unfortunately, I don't even think this place is worth a try unless they get new staff who understands the meaning of *customer service*.

43.description: Marie's has the best thin crust pizza in Chicago, hands down.  My favorite is the Marie's special followed by just bacon. The crust is crisp, thin and has the right ration of cheese to meat to sauce.  The best way to experience Marie's is to dine in.  That super thin crust does not travel well.  If you get it home and it is not as crisp as you'd like, pop in in a frying pan on low hear to crisp it up and you are in business.

2.description: Erm... well, we had a taste for a really good chicken caesar salad. This place had good reviews, so we gave them a shot. What a mistake. I thought, "Wow, for $12.25, this must be one hell of a salad!" But... nope. It's a tiny little box with bits of iceberg lettuce, a few cherry tomatoes and some chintzy slices of chicken. To add insult to injury, they don't even OFFER caesar dressing in their choices of dressings on GrubHub. For a caesar salad!!! We had to just choose "no dressing" and add our own caesar dressing from our fridge. This would be a fine salad for $6, MAYBE $7. Maybe we shouldn't have ordered salads from a pizza place but... they just lost us as customers for sure.

18.description: Classic eccentric Chicago pizza parlor! Love the live music!!!! Order extra pizza they don't have family size here.....yummmmmm

41.description: I just found out about this place recently. They have a great jazz group on Wednesday nights so we went for the music. The thin crust pizza is good and affordable. Also, they have spumoni! Hey, I would stop there just for the spumoni, it is really good. Try the spumoni!!!!!!We've been there a couple of times and the service has been friendly and efficient. Oh, and as others have mentioned the over the top decorations are fun.

52.description: Marie's during the holidays is full of cheer.  I can honestly say that it continues to surprise as a wonderful part of a great neighborhood.  They aim to please with a double dough pizza that tastes amazing!

50.description: Awesome throw back decor. The wait staff was very attentive and pleasant. Crust is nice and crunchy and the sauce flavorful. Added garlic for a little extra kick and it was super yummy.  Anyone who thinks Dominoes is better than this place must like overly sweet sauce and doughy crust. Marie's is the exact opposite. The sauce had a strong tomato taste and the crust was clearly hand thrown. Generous salami and cheese in the antipasti salad was great. We will definitely be back!

4.description: Incredibly rude delivery driver! He gave us a lecture when our doorbell did not work! We rent, this is not our responsibility. Moreover it was working last week. I'm sorry, it's winter, batteries die. I wish I could take back my tip since this driver was SO incredibly rude!! I will never order from here again!!

6.description: The retro atmosphere and strolling trio is why we come here. The pizza is good but quite greasy. The last time I was in the owner loudly chastised a waitress in the bar/dining area during the dinner hour. Very rude and unprofessional on her part. I guess this comes from never having actually worked in the business, just inheriting it. But, the waitress good, said nothing and continued serving after having been yelled at. The owner's boyfriend (who is just along for the ride methinks) is also someone who belittles the employees in front of the customers. This is a good way to lose business and I have noticed it has been waning. The father was not this way at all!  Fun if the owner doesn't come in!

22.description: Pizza is good but service is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo slow!!!!! The food is good but they need quicker servers...couldn't enjoy or food cause we didn't anything to wash it down with! They also have really good specials... But again they need to step up their service.

15.description: Best pizza I've had since I used to live in Logan Square. I won't mention the other pizza place because that would just be wrong haha. I tried a few different types of pizza (pepperoni, sausage, veggie) and they all passed my test of deliciousness. One thing I love about this place is that it ALSO has a well stocked liquor store connected next door with all of my favorites. I have yet to go on a Friday night, which is said to be quite entertaining, but now that I am a member of Mayfair, I feel like this place will definitely become one of my regular spots to eat.

57.description: I have a love-hate relationship with Marie's for many years. Their pizza is excellent if you know how to order it - the thin is way too thin so gets soggy and greasy in the middle, but if you order it "double dough" it comes out like a normal thin pizza which can actually hold ingredients. Ask for fresh tomato and for it to be well done, and the sausage is very good. Unfortunately there is little consistency- in the the dough thickness, in the amount of sauce or ingredients put on, etc. so it's a crapshoot but the flavor and the crust are so good.      The hate part is the management or lack thereof. Even when I was a THREE TIMES A WEEK REGULAR CUSTOMER, if I had a problem with my order, then they had a problem with ME. I can't tell you how many times I heard from them "there is no manager" so they wouldn't fix the problem or give me a credit. They often forgot to double dough the pizza so what would come all greasy and sloppy and mushy and their answer was "ok next time you order we won't charge you for double dough" SERIOUSLY? You sent me the wrong pizza and you're not going to fix it? Oh and yes, that credit card imprint situation needs fixing too.      The liquor store has gone downhill so bad and they have such a poor selection now I don't ever bother to order beer anymore.     It's too bad the owner of this place is the way she is (everyone in the neighborhood knows

20.description: This is the best pizza in Chicago.  The greek salad is fantastic with fresh anchovies and fetta cheese.  The pizza is wonderful, fresh sauce and thin crusts.

36.description: We went in a large group, close to 20 people. Yes, we called ahead. I was good 40 minutes late, but there were quite a few people arriving after me, as this was a weekday and not everybody could've made it on time...Half an hour since my arrival, I was already surprised not to get the menu. My friend that arrived shortly after me, halted our waitress and we ordered drinks: water, and wine for me, diet coke or him. Pop arrived 10 minutes later.Water took 10 minutes more than the coke.It took total of 45 minutes and 3 different people inquiring at the bar, to get my wine. The tiniest glass I've ever seen. I never got the menu. Never had a chance to order food. I caught the waitress, ordered the 2nd glass of wine.After spending 2 hours at this place, I never got my second glass of wine. When the bill arrived (no, they didn't split it), I asked if the 2nd glass is on it. The waitress said: no, as I never brought it. And shuddered her shoulders. No apology whatsoever.She added 20% tip to our bill. She had not earned a penny of it, that's for sure.NEVER AGAIN, not even the really great bands will ever get me back to this dingy place!

14.description: This is the best pizza in Chicago.  The greek salad is fantastic with fresh anchovies and fetta cheese.  The pizza is wonderful, fresh sauce and thin crusts.

29.description: This is my 1st time having ramen in Albany park. The ambience here is nice and relaxing and the employees here were very pleasant and attentive. When i came in at 1p there were a few people there so it wasn't busy. I came for the lunch special 11am-3pmI ordered 2 rolls for about $8   Spicy tuna    Salmon avocado roll Both were fresh and deliciousI also ordered the Tonkotsu ramen $9 which was really good and filling. It definitely hit the spot! I will be back to try more items on their menu.

42.description: I was hungry when getting off the brown line tonight and wabi sabi looked inviting so I thought I'd give it a try. It was great! They brought me green tea while I waited for my to go order and the spicy miso ramen was so good. I devoured it. So happy to have a quality ramen joint in the hood.

23.description: Wabi Sabi Roll, Sashimi appetizer, and Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen are my favorites! Best ramen I've had in Chicago. Definitely worth the extra drive! Highly recommend!

47.description: Sushi was very fresh and good!! Price is not expensive at all, very reasonable. Will definitely return.

8.description: Wow, I can't believe the rave reviews this place received.  Maybe the dine in is better than the delivery, but the broth we received with our ramen was full of grease and oil.  Sushi seemed fresh and gyoza was good, but I was incredibly disappointed with the ramen.  My husband couldn't even eat his it was so greasy.  It was also very bland.  Just for frame of reference, I lived in Japan for a year so I have a pretty good idea of what ramen should be like and this was not a good representation.  Maybe it was just an off night.

31.description: I live right down the street from this restaurant, so I was really excited to have a new Asian restaurant open in the neighborhood. However, the food was far from stellar, and I say this with the utmost respect in hopes they will improve.My boyfriend and I visited last night for the ramen. We asked the noodles to be cooked more al dente since other friends who visited said the noodles were over done (ramen should be chewy). The noodles came out right but the broth was just warm and the pork slices and egg were actually cold. I understand they cook the pork in advance and slice to go, but they need to make sure the ramen is hot, as the temperature of the stock is very essential to the ramen eating experience (the stock should be just hot enough to require a little blowing and slurping... part of the ramen enjoyment). The sushi was terrible. I can't mince words here, as my boyfriend is a trained sushi chef who has been making sushi for 10 years at local sushi restaurant with a Japanese executive chef. The rice is the most important aspect of sushi. Each grain should be separated from the next and be chewy and lightly sticky. The rice in the sushi we had was compressed together, glue like, with no separation of the grains of rice. I'd compare this experience to the difference between Parisian French bread and sliced white bread. The former has texture and is delicious by itself. The second is not comparable as a stand alone ingredient (though I'm partial to PB&J sandwiches made with sliced white bread). For people who don't know good sushi, it's a shame they are served substandard sushi rice, most likely reused from the day before (you never ever reuse sushi rice. It should be made fresh each day). Aside from the rice, the fish was not fresh.However, the waitress who worked there was very friendly, and filled our green tea automatically. They also have decent tako yaki (caramelized octopus dough balls). I think they need to hire a new sushi chef. The ramen is ok as long as you ask for the noodle to be more undercooked and the broth to be piping hot. *And get the garlic broth - it is better than the regular tonkatsu broth.Info on proper sushi rice: web-japan.org/nipponia/n…

34.description: Good food but nothing extra ordinary. Place is a bit pricey for the amount of food served.

16.description: Really amazing service, great location, adorable little spot.  If you're the type to get fancy rolls with lots of flavors and sauces and toppings, you might like this spot, because those things all disguise the quality of fish and they are reasonably priced.I however am interested in just the fish.  Really good sashimi doesn't need all those extras.  And I'm afraid it's below average.  I'm not saying it's old/unsafe - I'm just saying it's not good.  Reminds me of a roll I'd get at a college cafeteria.Lawrence Fish Market over on Lawrence has spoiled me, perhaps.  But that's a much better bet if you like your sushi simple and care about quality.

13.description: I don't write a lot of reviews because not a lot of places surprises my taste buds in a positive way. Well Wabi Sabi did just that. I moved in the neighborhood a couple months ago and today was my first time visiting this small Japanese restaurant. The ambiance was great which made me skeptical of how the food was going to taste because some restaurants create a nice ambiance only to mask how terrible their food is. Wabi Sabi did not disappoint with the taste of the dishes we ordered. We had the Tonkotsu Ramen which was amazingly delicious. Also had the Beef Negi Maki and Salmon roll which were equally as delicious. Will definitely have to come back again especially between 11 and 3 for their lunch specials.

11.description: I'm going to make this short and sweet. The sushi is borderline awful. I eat a lot of sushi and been all over the city and this was grocery store quality. As someone mentioned below it's on par with Jewel sushi. I thought that was harsh based on other reviews until I ate the sushi. I did carry out, and walked the 5 minutes home. We ordered a lot, and could barely finish half. I hate to be a downer and I know business owners put a lot of heart and soul in the food, but good sushi really has two main things to focus on: taste and quality of the rice and the quality and taste of the fish. Both were severely lacking. The rice was mushy and flavorless. The fish was poor quality and tasted as such. The ingredients used in the rolls besides the fish tasted stale and offered nothing but to make the rolls more off-putting. I might give this place one more shot and am curious about the Ramen, but disappointed that a place so close to home was not a hit in my house.Also, on another note, and applicable to Wabi Sabi, I'm so tired of seeing 90% of rolls on a menu cater to the taste of American eaters (being an American myself): everything contains something tempura, or cream cheese, drenched in sauce, etc. Some rolls I get, but there's got to be some creativity without all the crazy flavors...I've seen other places do it. Sometimes, simple is better.

39.description: So, to clarify why five stars before the review:I take price and quality into consideration heavily. Typically, the lower the price and the higher the quality, the more the stars. If I'm at an expensive place, I expect to be blown away, and if I'm at a decently priced place, I expect to be able to not only come frequently, but be able to afford it frequently. WITH THAT SAID:I'm so excited that I randomly stopped by this place. My girlfriend and I were on our way to LD Pho, since we felt sick and were craving some pho. Upon arriving, we sadly learned they're closed on Wednesdays apparently, but I had just caught glance of a good looking sushi place next door. We walked back, checked out the menu, and it didn't initially seem like they had a lot of vegetarian options (hint hint, we're vegetarians), but it seemed legit, I figured let's try it out.So, we went in, the actual menu inside had a good sized vegetarian menu, and we LOADED UP.Sesame salad, ginger salad, vegetable tempura, avocado roll, sweet potato roll, the crunchy vegetable roll, and the tempura ice cream desert.Oh my god. The servings for the sushi were just right, for the tempura as well, and the largest salad serving I've gotten at a sushi place. We were stuffed before we even got desert. Our favorite was the sweet potato roll hands out, it came out looking like a speciality roll even though that was our crunchy vegetable, which was also delicious (avocado was good, but the other two were beyond comparison for it). We were in surprise heaven knowing its in walking distance for the price. Considering we gorged ourselves and ordered more food than we usually did, we only came out to little more than forty bucks. We could've easily subtracted desert and another roll to bring it down to little more than thirty bucks. It was great.This is the first place in awhile that I walked into without looking at yelp, I don't know how long they've been around, but they deserve the neighborhood's business. It is nice to know we have a great priced sushi restaurant in walking distance, with quick service and a nice atmosphere. The only aside was the music, which was entertainingly out of place, and made us love it more. I'm excited to come back here and my gf has told me the same thing.

37.description: Me and my friend like trying out new places especially Ramen places. It just came up during my search in Yelp so we decided to try it. We ordered the tonkotsu ramen, spicy garlic ramen and the pork buns. Everything was really good! We started with the pork buns and it was really  tasty with a perfect bun. Both ramens were really good and tasty too. We initially thought that it wasn't much cause of a smaller bowl comapred to other places but the amount was just right to fill us. This place is a must try! Will definitely come back!

0.description: After a few months of passing by this place, we decided to try it when I had a ramen craving. It was the best dining decision we've made in a long time! The service, ambiance and meals we chose were spot on. The maki rolls were fresh, the right-sized bite and some of the best sushi we've had in Chicago. The ramen could not have been better. The flavors melded together so perfectly and the pork belly was juicy and tender. I probably shouldn't tell you this, because i don't want to wait for hours to get a table due to its popularity, but it's definitely on par with Wasabi and other restaurants known for their ramen.The service was wonderful and attentive. The chef told us the ramen broth is prepped for 20 hours -- no wonder it's so good! He also told us that next time we're in he'll make us a special roll.We've found our new favorite neighborhood restaurant and look forward to our next visit.

38.description: Vegetarian here! Rolls were stellar, I obviously can't comment on the fish but my veggies were fresh. Salads were to die for, I'm a sucker for a great ginger dressing. Also got a tempura ice cream for dessert, I've never had anything like it but it rocked! I would absolutely eat all of it again, and soon.Decor was nice, and staff was attentive and great at answering any questions.So happy to have a great little sushi place so close to home!

51.description: Great local spot and addition to the area.They have some unique options on the menu and a wide variety from sushi to ramen.Prices are reasonable.  The interior is inviting and well designed.  Staff is very friendly as well.Definitely will be back, again and again.

27.description: I've been here twice now. Ramen is pretty good and the price point is perfect for the neighborhood. I've been sending my neighbors and friends here and I plan on going back many more times this winter.The dance dance party music is pretty terrible but that seems to be common with Japanese joints run by younger people.

32.description: It was an amazing experience. Everything was perfectly made & perfectly seasoned. I had the spicy garlic Miso ramen and it's the best I've ever had. I will be back just for that. California roll is great too. Perfect ambience for a date night. Don't forget to try they're peach green tea. So good! Give them a try.

48.description: Such a nice sushi place in Albany Park. It's very nice and clean inside. We were just want to try everything as we look at the menu. Lastly we end up ordered pork buns, crabragoons, red fire pork chop, spicy garlic ramen and two maki. They were fresh and delicious. The prices are reasonable not like some other sushi place. Also the staff was super nice and attentive. Overall 5 stars. We definitely will come back and try other stuffs.

44.description: Finally ramen in Albany park ILove the location since it's near my place. The sushi is very reasonable and its good quality sushi! The ramen is good too I got the spicy and the tonkotsu ramen. Def. ask for the spicy oil! It makes. Difference and makes then ramen so much better.

24.description: Went today for the first time with my family. Everything was very good, from the appetizers to the sushi to the entrees. The service was excellent. We all loved it. They even brought out this really cool sushi cake for my mom's birthday.  Will definitely come again

7.description: Wabi Sabi offers a variety of Japanese cuisines, such as sushi, ramen, donburi, and other kitchen foods. I think the variety is great. When looking at the menu, there's a lot of things I want to try. The starters all look delicious as well. However, I do think that without specialization, Wabi Sabi becomes a jack of all trades and nothing stands out. In fact, there are some items that just aren't that good.Ramen -- Pretty average. Definitely not one of the best in the city. Portions are small, broth is less flavorful, and meat is skimped on.Don -- As the word "don" implies, it's a rice bowl with toppings. Well, Wabi Sabi decided to put these on plates. Portions are small, and the don experience is killed.Tako balls -- One of the starters we chose. Very little, if any, octopus inside. I didn't have to opportunity to try any of the sushi, so I can't say anything about that. But overall, Wabi Sabi did not impress. I do, however, want to give them credit for their variety and excellent service.

49.description: Good sushi place in the neighborhood. We ordered the lava stone tako ball and creamy shrimp maki. They are awesome and delicious. The spicy tuna on lava stone is very fresh. Next time probably we will try to have some Ramen.

40.description: Ordered delivery and overall pretty good with a quick delivery speed.- Salmon don - very fresh fish, generous portion and a good price.  One note - didn't come with soy sauce, which I found odd, though I had my own on hand.  Also could have used more radish, but that's just my personal preference- Crab rangoon - 4 very large rangoon, with a good amount of crab in them, very well balanced crab-cream cheese ration.  Some of the better crab rangoon I've had in Chicago- Pork buns - all the parts tasted good, but were way off in proportion.  Lots of bun to VERY little meat filling and could really have used some kind of vegetable or pickle to brighten the flavor

53.description: 5 Star for delivery service. I'm absolutely thrilled to have Wabi Sabi in Albany Park and that they serve lunch starting at 11 AM. I ordered:Pork Buns: Wife loved them!Tonkotsu Ramen: Excellent ramen. The pork was so tender. Broth was super tasty. Egg was on point. I'm so excited to have good ramen in Albany Park!Roll Lunch Special:Salmon Avocado Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, Philadelphia Roll. All were super tasty and fresh. Nice quick lunch special5 Piece Shumai did not taste like they were recently thawed. Great fresh taste. We are definetly planning on coming in for dinner and check out the rest of the place. Great job.

30.description: Ordered from here twice since becoming aware of its existence 2 weeks ago.1st Order: Squid salad, Negihamachi roll, Tonkatsu Ramen (w/ side of chili oil)2nd Order: Wabi Sabi roll, Tonkatsu Ramen (w/ side of chili oil)The squid salad is meh, standard Japanese/Korean pre-cooked squid. Not a big deal, low price should've given it away. Negihamachi was not good, I tried ordering hand-roll, but they didn't see the note. Tonkatsu and 'excellent' spicy oil saved the order. Their chili oil had this smokiness to it that I had yet to encounter in a ramen (or Chinese/Korean/Thai) sauce. I used a bunch of it, and w/ all the other parts of the soup it was enough to pique my interest in a second order.Wabi Sabi roll on order 2 was awesome. Plenty of fresh raw fish on the interior w/ spicy crab on top. Bonito flakes are more appearance than anything, but they did not detract from the dish as a whole. Tonkatsu Take II was as solid as the first.Very pleased that this place opened and I jumped on-board early on. The staff was very sweet on both occasions. I hope they manage the business aspect and flourish. - Note to other restaurants: NEVER, EVER, CLOSE BEFORE 10PM. Wabi Sabi got the memo pre-open, didn't fall for some weak sauce 9pm weeknite bullshit. Unless you open at 7am for breakfast, keep your ass open til 10pm!

46.description: I was intrigued when I saw a review for this place on everyblock.  I convinced my husband to go one weeknight just to check it out.  I hadn't been by it (other than driving in the car when I noticed the location) so I didn't know what to expect.I was really glad/surprised to see a restaurant that put some effort into the general decor and ambiance.  (Not to say that NONE do, but its not the rule in this neighborhood).  Sometimes we're looking for a place to take friends or guests, and as much as we can love the dives or casual places you're sometimes just looking for something different.  We're vegetarians so we can't really rate the fish.  But everything we did have was really good.  Edamame was normal (this ALWAYS tastes the same), and then a few of the vegetarian rolls.  The presentation was nice, the waitstaff was attentive (without hovering) and friendly.   Overall I was really pleasantly surprised.They don't have a whole ton of vegetarian options so we won't be able to go too often without getting burnt out, but its a really nice option to have.  (HEY Wabi Sabi, so do you see me?? Don't forget us vegetarians!  Maybe an entree, or a few more "interesting" vegetarian rolls that aren't just veggies rolled up.  Think fun sauces or additions.)

1.description: This is my new go to place for ramen. I always go to Schaumburg to satisfy my cravings for authentic Japanese ramen but now I found this place that's near my home. I learned about Wabi Sabi while browsing through Yelp for a good ramen shop. I was skeptical to try them at first but after reading all their reviews I was sold. We ordered online since it was a bit too cold to go out. We ordered tonkatsu and sho-yu ramen, takoyaki and dragon maki. The tonkatsu ramen was just like the tonkatsu ramen from Japan, it makes you think the winter cold nights in Tokyo and eating ramen at one of the many ramen shops there. The sho-yu ramen was to die for, the taste was exquisite. The takoyaki was just a little smaller from the ones I've seen in and eaten before but it's still really good. The dragon maki was my favorite, the rice was perfect not too soft not to hard. The sauce has the perfect heat in them. It was so amazing that my parents devoured them in 2minutes.All in all I would definitely visit their store to experience the vibe, but their food is totally on par with the other Japanese restaurants I've gone to.

9.description: Went today for the first time with my family. Everything was very good, from the appetizers to the sushi to the entrees. The service was excellent. We all loved it. They even brought out this really cool sushi cake for my mom's birthday.  Will definitely come again

26.description: Love this place. Please don't ever have your food quality decline due to your success on making the freshest sushi. The salmon was melt in the mouth and unagi nigiri was so warm. That's so hard today find at many sushi places in Chicago. My new favourite. Keep it up guys!

25.description: Went tonight for the first time and what a fantastic sushi spot for the neighborhood.Everything I had was great- goyza, Wabi Sabi Maki, Godzilla Maki and Chicago Maki.  Great interior and excellent service.Thank you!

12.description: As it is getting chillier here in Chicago, sometimes I crave ramen.  I saw this place was opening near me and decided to check it out.  I liked the ambience for it had nice decor and top40 hip hop in the background.  The staff were very nice and accommodating.  The reputable Food Network judges always say how you know how good a chef is by how they cook eggs, and the soft boiled egg in the ramen was absolutely perfect!!  My roommate and I both ordered our ramens to be spicy and they willingly accommodated us.  The broth was a perfect balance of salt and surprisingly light.  Especially since they have only been open for a week, I was very impressed.

21.description: I'm going to make this short and sweet. The sushi is borderline awful. I eat a lot of sushi and been all over the city and this was grocery store quality. As someone mentioned below it's on par with Jewel sushi. I thought that was harsh based on other reviews until I ate the sushi. I did carry out, and walked the 5 minutes home. We ordered a lot, and could barely finish half. I hate to be a downer and I know business owners put a lot of heart and soul in the food, but good sushi really has two main things to focus on: taste and quality of the rice and the quality and taste of the fish. Both were severely lacking. The rice was mushy and flavorless. The fish was poor quality and tasted as such. The ingredients used in the rolls besides the fish tasted stale and offered nothing but to make the rolls more off-putting. I might give this place one more shot and am curious about the Ramen, but disappointed that a place so close to home was not a hit in my house.Also, on another note, and applicable to Wabi Sabi, I'm so tired of seeing 90% of rolls on a menu cater to the taste of American eaters (being an American myself): everything contains something tempura, or cream cheese, drenched in sauce, etc. Some rolls I get, but there's got to be some creativity without all the crazy flavors...I've seen other places do it. Sometimes, simple is better.

17.description: I have been ordering from wabi sabi I feel like since they opened but I didn't want to write a review until I'd dined in. I finally did and it still gets 5 stars. I'm SO HAPPY this place is in Albany park!  It's truly a hidden gem.  The ramen is so reasonably priced and is on par with Wasabi and other posh ramen restaurants in the city. The Spicy Garlic ramen is something I swear by on a cold winter evening. The sushi is amazing, so fresh, the portions are filling and and the presentation of everything is beautiful! Even for pick up orders.I'm proud to say that Wabi Sabi is my new neighborhood hotspot!!!

10.description: Wait staff attentive.  Seaweed salad sweet and crunchy.  Sunomono salad had nice big pieces of yellowtail. Negihamachi hand roll had lots of fish thru and through.

5.description: I came in on a Sunday evening and we were the only couple in the restaurant. It had me a little concerned and I don't know how long they have been open, but trusted the Yelp reviews and ordered the lava stone appetizer and the Tonkatsu ramen with added spiciness and I'm glad I did. The lava stone is an appetizer with deep fried rice balls with spicy tuna on top. The tuna was fresh and delicious, but I thought the rice balls were a little tough to chew so wasn't as thrilled about this appetizer. The ramen was perfectly spiced and perfectly done with a soy sauced-soft boiled egg and just the right amount of noodles. The crunchy veggies were nice too but I wish they added more of it, I thought that was sparse. I thought the price point of the ramen was as expected for the Chicago area. Most ramen bowls go for about $15 and this bowl was smaller but goes for $11. I will definitely be back to try some more ramen and rolls.

3.description: Wabi Sabi had their grand opening as hubby and I were leaving Albany Park for a new neighborhood where we purchased our house.  Many chic ramen bars in the city are located in those popularly-known north-side places, such as Wicker Park and Lincoln Park.  However, Wabi Sabi was founded in east Albany Park on Kedzie, one (1) block north from the CTA Kedzie Brown Line station.As someone who LOVES Albany Park as being one of the most diverse neighborhoods in the U.S., I sincerely wanted Wabi Sabi to do well because AP really needed a quality coffee shop and a restaurant that serves ramen.  Nevertheless, Wabi Sabi failed to deliver in my opinion.  We didn't order anything from their sushi/sashimi menu because my affection for "LFM" on the opposite side of Albany Park is way too strong!  That was alright, though.  I saw ramen on the other menu and went with the "black garlic ramen" instead.  I wouldn't say that bowl of black garlic ramen was awful, yet I found it uninteresting and bland.  In other words, there was no depth in term of the flavor of the broth, the ingredients, and the choice of noodle.  Don't get me wrong.  It tasted soothing and comforting, but it was a solid three (3) star-quality.  I said this in a very fair manner because you will be able to find a better-crafted, more delectable, and more unique bowl of ramen elsewhere in the city.  It was surprisingly to me that hubby had a craving for yaki udon this evening.  I saw a lack of reflection and comment from him on this dish.  I, therefore, assumed that it was just average.  Wabi Sabi had a massive potential to be a cool hang-out joint with your pals, significant other, or someone whom you want to share a meal with.  The food I had tonight didn't cut it.  I honestly don't know if I would be back because choices of restaurants on Kedzie, between Lawrence and Irving Park, are beyond plenty.

35.description: I happened across this place while randomly flipping through yelp reviews. My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on Friday night and we snagged one of the last tables available. Patrons continued to stroll in and were required to wait for table during the entire time we were present. There was also only one waitress serving the entire restaurant. She was diligently running back-and-forth in order to accommodate all of the customers. The menu is fairly extensive but we were only interested in ordering ramen. I quickly decided on my usual--the tonkotsu ramen, while the boyfriend was feeling adventurous and ordered the spicy miso garlic ramen. After trying so many different ramen places throughout Chicago, the ramen at Wabi Sabi was pretty standard at best. The broth did not have very much depth...to my disappointment. The pork slices were small and also lacked flavor. However, The soft boiled egg was well cooked. Overall, I would probably only come back if I was in the area and wanted something to warm up my tummy. If I could, I would rate this place 3.5 stars.

19.description: This is my 1st time having ramen in Albany park. The ambience here is nice and relaxing and the employees here were very pleasant and attentive. When i came in at 1p there were a few people there so it wasn't busy. I came for the lunch special 11am-3pmI ordered 2 rolls for about $8   Spicy tuna    Salmon avocado roll Both were fresh and deliciousI also ordered the Tonkotsu ramen $9 which was really good and filling. It definitely hit the spot! I will be back to try more items on their menu.

28.description: Decent sushi spot. Ordered the miso soup, shrimp shumai and soft shell crab for starters and all were just ok. Then tried the rainbow roll and the tiffany roll. The rainbow was ok and tiffany roll was good. Overall a decent spot, byob is a plus, service was good, but this would not be my first choice. But since the location is close to my house, I will give it another try.

45.description: Udon noodles and sushi were top notch. Fantastic to have high quality sushi in Albany Park.

33.description: I came in on a Sunday evening and we were the only couple in the restaurant. It had me a little concerned and I don't know how long they have been open, but trusted the Yelp reviews and ordered the lava stone appetizer and the Tonkatsu ramen with added spiciness and I'm glad I did. The lava stone is an appetizer with deep fried rice balls with spicy tuna on top. The tuna was fresh and delicious, but I thought the rice balls were a little tough to chew so wasn't as thrilled about this appetizer. The ramen was perfectly spiced and perfectly done with a soy sauced-soft boiled egg and just the right amount of noodles. The crunchy veggies were nice too but I wish they added more of it, I thought that was sparse. I thought the price point of the ramen was as expected for the Chicago area. Most ramen bowls go for about $15 and this bowl was smaller but goes for $11. I will definitely be back to try some more ramen and rolls.

43.description: Sushi is jewels' grade quality, ramen is sub par in comparison to wasabi or yusho. Cute decor though.

2.description: Cute space, fair prices, and impressive cuts of sushi! I came here during the lunch hour and was pleasantly filled up on my small budget.  The crab rangoon was so good and so stuffed, there was no attractive way to eat it. Luckily my boyfriend and dining partner has seen me at my grossest. Get your napkins ready! I enjoyed one of the best White Dragon rolls I've ever tried - although I can do without the cream cheese.  I'll definitely be back.

18.description: Had a nice dinner here. Nice to see more variety in the hood!I had udon and my wife had a nice fish dish. Highly recommend!

41.description: Excellent service and amazing food,  their ramen is very tasty. Must try and will definitely return!!!!!

52.description: As it is getting chillier here in Chicago, sometimes I crave ramen.  I saw this place was opening near me and decided to check it out.  I liked the ambience for it had nice decor and top40 hip hop in the background.  The staff were very nice and accommodating.  The reputable Food Network judges always say how you know how good a chef is by how they cook eggs, and the soft boiled egg in the ramen was absolutely perfect!!  My roommate and I both ordered our ramens to be spicy and they willingly accommodated us.  The broth was a perfect balance of salt and surprisingly light.  Especially since they have only been open for a week, I was very impressed.

50.description: It's refreshing to have fresh new businesses that really put thought into it only food presentation, but also space layout and decor. The clean cut, modern look gives off an expensive appearance. But when you delve into the menu, you're pleasantly surprised by the reasonable prices on sushi and ramen. I had the chicken teriyaki which was simple yet delicious. The lava stone was also good, something unique to this restaurant as it was my first time having fried rice balls with spicy tuna on top. I will easily become a regular as I live only 2 blocks away.

4.description: Great little place! My husband and I split the Creamy Shrimp Maki under the signature maki on their very cute/modern looking menu. I am new to sushi, so I wasn't really sure what to expect, and I was really delighted at how delicious it was. The plate was decorated using various sauces with beautiful flowers, and everything was fresh and tasty. I also had the spicy garlic ramen which was just about as spicy as I can handle (with a broth anyway), but seasoned very very well. My husband had the curry ramen, and he said it was maybe the best he's had in a while. Overall, the freshness was obvious, the seasoning was on point, everything was delicious, and the restaurant was cute and very clean. I will definitely be back very soon, and I will be adventurous and try new things.

6.description: Ordered pick up via yelp. Had the tonkotsu ramen & pork buns. Glad that there is a good ramen place closer by. The ramen is good, but the broth not as rich as other places (oiistar & strings). The buns were tasty but a bit salty. I didn't have the sushi, but looked like a good variety. Will be back to try other items. On another not Yelp's Eat24 is so convenient.

22.description: I've past thru Wabi Sabi many times and finally decided to dine-in to try their food last night. The pretty waitress ( Yes she is so beautiful) recommended some top sale items. We ordered the Salmon Rush , Sunomono Yellowtail , Godzilla Maki , Sashimi Dinner , Tempura Udon and Tonkotsu Ramen . WOW...all were delicious and the prices are reasonable. We definitely will come back and try other stuffs. Highly recommend on their Ramen and Salmon Rush. Great sushi place in Albany Park.

15.description: Finally ramen in Albany park ILove the location since it's near my place. The sushi is very reasonable and its good quality sushi! The ramen is good too I got the spicy and the tonkotsu ramen. Def. ask for the spicy oil! It makes. Difference and makes then ramen so much better.

20.description: We have been to pretty much every single ramen hot spot there is in the city and this newly opened spot is pretty amazing in comparison and in some ways even better! Perfectly flavored broth, just the right amount of everything. It is certainly very authentic. Great customer service, clean, prompt, courteous and just wonderful!! Also a great value!

36.description: We live very close and want to try this place since it just opened . Very disappointed about the ramen. Salted and the meat is not good as well

14.description: I've had three very solid meals at this neighborhood ramen spot (and my husband has been a couple of times additionally--it's finally winter, and soup sounds really, really good right now).  I've tried the Tonkotsu ramen, the black garlic ramen, and the curry ramen.  All were very consistently tasty.  The size of the portion is right in the middle.  It's not a massive bathtub like you get in some places, but it's not skimpy, either.  I'm actually happy that you can get an appetizer and a bowl of ramen and leave feeling full but not dead of soup.  I've had some of their simple sushi rolls and while they're not life changing, they're competently executed and the fish is fresh.Prices are reasonable and it's BYOB, which helps keep the bill to a very manageable total.  The atmosphere is pleasant, although they do go for the untz untz techno that seems so popular in many sushi places.  Service is friendly and generally attentive, although we've usually had to indicate that we're ready for the bill.  All in  all, a nice addition to the neighborhood, and I hope it continues to do well.

58.description: I love St. Alfred. Every single time I visit Wicker Park I go in. Most of the real fly kicks are in men's sizes but I love to go look. If I was a guy I'd be broke.

56.description: as a sneaker fiend, i really want to like this place, but every time i go in there all i can do is sigh.  i'm always disappointed, as i rarely see a shoe on the shelf begging me to buy it; when i do see something worth trying on, they never have my size.  st. alfred, must you be so... banal?  as such, i still have to travel (on the internet superhighway, or via good ol' train, plane, and automobile) for alarmingly dope shoes.

44.description: everybody knows that this is the spot.

29.description: Chicago is complete with STAs location in the best part of town (Wicker). From streetwear heavy hitter brands the hundreds, dqm, huf (&more) and crooks to upper echelon threads like original fake, NSW, and their in-house label, that is just the tip of the iceberg. Its walls are adorned with limited edt sneaks from classics Nike, adidas, clarks, and vans to up and comers like generic surplus and the connoisseur gentleman brand visvim. It doesn't stop there. There are fresh new eras that can't stay on the shelf, limited kaws/of fake vinyls and collectibles, TH accessorie and phoenix eyewear, shwood sunglasses, and classic kicks to oogle. To top it all off, the staff is anti-NYC etiquette. Not bashing on NYC but the sta staff is few and far between the most knowledgable and welcoming people ever! Please believe!

42.description: What it is:  A well run boutique.  Being more than just a shop, St Alfred is a staple in the Wicker Park neighborhood.  You wanna find out what's going on tonight?  Go to St Alfred.  You want the newest sneakers to drop or some real fly threads for the weekend?  Go to St Alfred.  You wanna take your girl out somewhere nice because you're trying to get with her?  DON'T go to St Alfred.  She'll like the cloths you pick up there, but its not a cutesy little shopping store.  I swear, you meet someone here, and they don't forget you.  That's because they sell cool shit to cool people, and it is understood when you walk in the door that you don't have to deal with some geeks bullshit or squeeze past some louis vutton purse carrying skeezer to find what you need.  When I need something new, this is my first stop.  Nice work St Alfred.

23.description: Wicker Park, I love you! Your shopping selection is so much better than Michigan Ave. We arrived to Saint Alfred and were greeted right away. They have great sneakers and carry a wide selection of various brands for shirts. The BF picked up some shoes and the guy checking us out was sweet enough to throw in a postcard when he found out we were from out of town!

47.description: I visited St. Alfreds on Sunday 2/22. I am definitely a shoe person and they have a wide variety of kicks.  They specialize in tennis shoes and casual shoes.  Its a hip trendy store, I like the selection of novelty T shirts as well.  I was able to find a shirt that summed up my whole 2008 "You are now rockin with the BEST!"  Also you can order online and they will ship to you, I will be losing my mind in their online store.lol

31.description: Good crew of folks.  Good selection of the usual White Label style urban apparel, DQM, Huf, Hundreds, etc.  Nice selection of kicks.  Low attitude compared to its New York and LA counterparts.

34.description: Look who's done it again. There is a reason St. Alfreds is my favorite store when it comes to buying sneakers.  I was looking to buy the gray/neon yellow Nike Air Max 95's, which is my favorite Air Max of all time!  I was feeling lazy, so I called a couple of places around Schaumburg to see if they still had them in my size.  I won't put these stores on blast, but lets just say they need to train/educate their employees.  If you work at a place that sells shoes, it should be a given that you know what products you carry.  I didn't want to bother, so I just called St. Als and asked if they had them. The person I spoke to said they did, and he even put the shoes on hold for me.  Drove down to Wicker Park, parked the car and paid the meter (Thanks City of Chicago for making me pay a meter on a Sunday).  Strolled into St. Als and asked for my shoe, and they had it behind the counter.  The guy who I talked to on the phone was Frank, and he was very knowledgeable and friendly.  He told me that they are going to re-launch their website soon, so we can order from the website. I came, I saw, I got my shoes.  Excellent customer service is what sets St. Alfreds apart from all the other sneaker joints, and that is why they will continue to have me as a loyal customer.

16.description: Yea this place is a gem.. Sick kicks, have u lookn good from top to bottom

8.description: this place could be a little hard to spot from the street, their sign is an "A" if you pass icream, you've gone too far! its just two doors down from iCream.This place is cool, we stopped in to buy a gift, they have some cool shoes that you wouldn't normally see in dept stores. Keep in mind that they don't accept Discover and they also don't have gift receipts, the guy was nice enough to print out an extra receipt with the price crossed out. Thanks!Also, they don't have boxes.

11.description: I must say, St. Alfred didn't disappoint this travelling sneakerhead.  It was my first time in Chicago, but I knew St. Alfred was the 'marquee' kicks store in Chicago.  None of that snooty NYC boutique attitude you'll get at some joints (if you've been to Supreme, you'll know what I mean).  Just a bunch of cool and professional guys that know their craft.  The store was busy and they wanted to help as many people as possible or we could have spent hours discussing the decline in leather quality and stitching from Jordan brand or how New Era QC needs serious overhaul.And luckily for me, I swung by their store during a big sale.  There's no better feeling that going through the store, picking up your purchases, walk up to the cashier ready to pay full price and they tell you there's a steep discount on everything.Impressive range of kicks.  And great selection of clothing - I think it was the first time I've see legit Bathing Ape outside of Busyworks.  I think the most impressive part of St. Alfred's is their store brands.  Sick prints and incredibly slick fitteds.  YES!  A store that loves contrasting underbrims as much as I do.One of the finest sneaker and streetwear stores anywhere.

26.description: This place has done a great job at curating their sneaker collection.  The kids who work here are super friendly which is always a plus when shopping in a small boutique.

39.description: stars across the board,,, as soon as you walk in your greeted and you get the feeling they really wanna help. the prices are reasonable, the workers are much more friendlier then the asses down the street @ leaders... the whole vibe of the store is great...

37.description: dope spot and the fellas here always take care of me and my fitted addiction...are they just adding to the addiction? perhaps, but im not hating them for it.  good choice of gear as well.

0.description: The store offers a wide variety of shoes and usually the general releases as well as the more exclusive shoes. Their prices are are sometimes a little higher than what you would pay at Footlocker, Champs, etc., but one expects that from an independent retailer. When ordering through their online shoes shipping is very fast and they even throw in a complementary Saint Alfred postcard.

38.description: really enjoyed the service and selection at St Alfred.  I have needed cute/ hot/ rad sneakers for months and my usual shops just didn't have what I was looking for.great tees, mainly for guys.  zero attitude, all the gents working in the shop talked with me, even though I was clearly not a neighborhood gal and probably a little older than the usual clientele.  the person who greeted me kept trying different shoes, including taking my foot-shape into consideration, until we found a pair that worked!  cute mid-top vans.  there was no rush to get me to purchase or leave the store as I needed to just stick around and let the dogs settle.  no point in getting cute shoes if your feet hurt or your toes are smushed.took 1 star away because they didn't have water-resist spray on hand to prep the shoes before going out the door;  and they didn't have my size in my 'prize' selections, but I'll sign up for their twitter and will absolutely come back ;)  love the lo-chill demeanor and lack of 'too cool for you' attitude.cc's:  mastercard + visa only, no discover

51.description: I like to come in here with my daughter when were walking around and it gets too hot, they got A/C on and dont seem to mind if i come in and take a load off for a while. I only bought 1 pair of shoes here, some of them are a little too wild for me, but they got a cool selection, its like a gallery more than a store. the dudes who work there are nice and i hate to get bothered every 2 seconds by a sales person. they ask you if you can be helped, i say no and they dont bother me again, sweet. will def drop half my paycheck here when the MF DOOM 2 dunks come out.

22.description: Small shop, but packs a punch for the serious street wear head.Staff is friendly & easy to talk to.They carry 'The Joneses' line, which is a plus!They have exclusive items & from time to time do in stores with musical guests. This is a plus in my book!

32.description: So good, I stopped by here twice.Checked this out the first time before a Slum Village concert at the Double Door across the street. Chopped it up with one of the workers and talked about life, kicks, and Hawaii. They promptly invited us back the next day to watch the World Cup final at the Six Points pop up shop next door.  We agreed and found our way back the next afternoon.The fact that they have this pop up, in addition to the shop next door is amazing to me. I'm a fan and a frequent shopper of the Kicks/HI shop in Hawaii (of which STA is a sister store), and the vibe is very much the same. Cool people, dope product, and a vibe that is consistent with the Kicks/HI Aloha Spirit.Chicago, you're hella lucky to have this spot in your city. STA All Day.

54.description: After searching through LA including Santa Monica for some awesome kicks, I came across St. Alfred's here at home in Chi-town.Wow!  This place has it together.  They had a lot of really cool sneakers I'd never even seen before and walked out with a couple bags of shoes.I feel like I should give them 5 stars but I think if they expanded their selection just a little they would definitely hit 5.Keep it up St. Alfred's!!!

48.description: The thing that stands out the most is customer service here. Other boutique stores I've been to aren't as nice as these guys are. They always great everyone and make the effort give you service. It's so easy to say "Hello" so I don't know why everyone doesn't do it. At times they look like a deer in headlights because it's out of the particular associate's element but like I said its the effort that counts here.These guys have a good network so they get the most exposure out of any stores like it. Another thing that puts these guys at the top is their sales, usually it's rare to find a sale in these kind of stores but so far all 3 times I've been here they have something going on. Maybe it's just the economy though. Either way it's still nice.Also, if you like exclusive Jordan's you'd be happy here.

13.description: This is a dope store. They always have the hottest releases and caps/clothing is on point. However, I feel the staff can be a little more inviting. There were a few that were super friendly, but it seems like the guys that are there full time lack customer service. Step that up and your shop will be one of the premier sneaker spots in Chicago. Just my 2 cents, until then, FL it is.

24.description: Ok let me start by saying that st.alfred has the best service of all stores in chicago of its kind. The workers are all super cool and ready to help. They are also really funny. They talk to you like a normal person not a customer. Sneakers here are top notch they get all the limited shit. I'm talking jordans to nikes to converses. Clothing is good. Carry kaws which is something new but a good addition to the store. The inhouse brand does well but doesn't really appeal to me. The manager Brian or krabby is really layed back and chill. One thing i did like about the store is that they carry visvim. yes visvim thats my shit

7.description: This store was the shit, it has all the stuff we Europeans can only dream about! And when we get it in Europe prices are double in comparison with this store. This store was still expensive if you put it next to footlocker or something but what do you expect, most of the shoes in here were special editions or really rare ones and in that case i don't mind to spend 160$ for a pair of nikes. Good job guys, keep it up!

27.description: They care more about customer service than any shoe store in the city. Sure, they've got a pimp shoe collection, but Saint Alfred puts as much on experience as they do on style. I purchased a pair of boots in early October. Put them away for a couple of months, and whipped them out for the first snow fall. When water started seeping in through the soles, I got pretty ticked and decided to bring them back to the store. They were more than happy to refund the defective purchase,  even months after the fact. Shotty service isn't their game,  if something's awry their going to make it right. Thanks to people like Joseph, this place is a step above the rest.

49.description: Yay! They now carry New Balance and  Head Porter, Original Fake and Futura Labs from Japan. And of course Stussy.

53.description: Eh.  That's the feeling i have every time i leave St. Alfred's.  I've probably walked through at least a dozen times, and their selection is not bad by any means, but there is no shoe that is calling me to take them home.  Still have yet to make a purchase there.  And when I'm in there i sometimes feel that the guy behind the counter feels the same way as i do.  Just doesn't really seem to care to much about anything, or maybe he knows that he's got the same stuff as a half dozen other places within a short walk. It's a shame. I really do want to like this place, but it appears to be a one sided relationship.  i give it 3 stars b/c the collection is pretty solid and I'm sure someone can find something that wets their pallet.

30.description: If you ever need street wear. Dope kicks. And Great accessories this is your one stop shop. They carry everything from original fake to Nike to converse. Their shoe selection is above par and their clothes are on point. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable in the fashion industry. Always a good time to chop it up with their staff. Friendly outgoing and never rude.

46.description: st. alfred's is great. coming from nyc, the people who run this shop are super friendly. none of the snobbery that is usually involved in rare-kicks shops seems to apply here. they remembered that they are actually trying to sell things and that being nice to everyone who walks in the door might be a good idea. i also love how the shop is laid out too. most of it dedicated to things you can actually buy instead of 'trophy' items that are nfs. love the logo as well. all in all its a pretty tight execution on a singular theme with really good people working there. oh yeah, and they threw in a bunch of freebies when i bought a pair of blazers.. which was a nice touch.

1.description: Was visiting from out of town and checked Yelp for shoe stores in Chicago. I was impressed with there selection and prices!!

9.description: Great store for people into Japanese and American streetwear. They've carried brands like Visvim, Original Fake, Mastermind Japan and Soph over the years (Their own brand and collabs are pretty boss too). If you're lucky you can even occasionally catch some nice Nike Tier 0, Vans Vault, and other rare releases as well. The employees have great personalities as, well as personal style, and give great service. I always stop buy to shop here when I'm in Chicago. I appreciate stores like these in my hometown.

40.description: Shout out to my boys who work hard and hold down the STA fort.  This IS the place to go.  The girl's selection for sneakers is ON point and you won't find the dudes working there talking about how many of this or that they own or what LV or Bape keychain they are going to cop next.  Krabby, Michael, Joe, Frank, Johnny, Deal, 2nd, you guys are the best.

25.description: I must say, St. Alfred didn't disappoint this travelling sneakerhead.  It was my first time in Chicago, but I knew St. Alfred was the 'marquee' kicks store in Chicago.  None of that snooty NYC boutique attitude you'll get at some joints (if you've been to Supreme, you'll know what I mean).  Just a bunch of cool and professional guys that know their craft.  The store was busy and they wanted to help as many people as possible or we could have spent hours discussing the decline in leather quality and stitching from Jordan brand or how New Era QC needs serious overhaul.And luckily for me, I swung by their store during a big sale.  There's no better feeling that going through the store, picking up your purchases, walk up to the cashier ready to pay full price and they tell you there's a steep discount on everything.Impressive range of kicks.  And great selection of clothing - I think it was the first time I've see legit Bathing Ape outside of Busyworks.  I think the most impressive part of St. Alfred's is their store brands.  Sick prints and incredibly slick fitteds.  YES!  A store that loves contrasting underbrims as much as I do.One of the finest sneaker and streetwear stores anywhere.

12.description: Been going here since 2005 great staff and very helpful.great selection in sneakers and tee's.

59.description: Kicks, tees, and urban style. I had to pry my good friend away from his St. Alfred addiction after dropping almost some serious coin when they released a special line of Nike Dunks and Air Force1's. Chicago now has a spot that is comparable to both coasts in LA and NYC who have dominated the street fashion culture. The hometown spin on the apparel is a nice change of pace (gotta love da Bears couture) for folks looking for something fresh and unique while supporting our home team. Prices are what you would expect out of a boutique store such as St. Alfred, but you will also find a lot of limited production pieces that will keep your fashion senses percolating.

21.description: There's not enough time in the day to say all the great things St. Alfred has to offer. They have such a huge selection of sneakers, hats, and tees and accessories that can satisfy any shopper. Their urban-wear is sick. They have some of the most creative and original designs ever. The quality of their clothing is great and I always get compliments on the shirt designs. They also carry some very unique and hard to find brands, styles and makes. I have seen all kinds of people wearing their clothes from celebrities to skateboarders to hipsters to businessmen. Take a stroll in and check it out. You will not be disappointed.

17.description: Great sneaker shop. They always have the need and hottest release. The staff is super friendly and always very helpful.

10.description: probably one of my favorite shops in Chicago along with Jugrnaut. Very clean, professional, stylish & friendly. There are many shops popping up in & around Chicago & STA should be the model for those stores. Every saint that works there is very down to earth, feels like shopping from a friend. STA Has come through clutch so many times on sneaker release dates, not to mention the dope streetwear they sell as well as make. Awesome shop, can never go wrong stopping by here.

5.description: Went here for the first time like 4 years ago now every time I come to Chicago I make sure I stop here. Always has some exclusive fire. It's not just ideal for Sneakerheads that don't want to deal with the madness of Nike town during the day of a hit release but they've got mean threads. Even their own line is nice. Most boutiques have egh lines but theirs is kind of perfect. I live in Cincinnati and we don't have a store that carries Head Porter! I like this spot. Check em out

35.description: All the Yelpers are right. They greet you with their sales they have going on for the day when you walk in. The customer service is better than any boutique I have been to. Usually they are snobby and not willing to help (ahem, MAJOR!). But they even had stickers and a decent amount of Js for sale. Great selection all around. I had to cop their newest New Era fitted release when I went in there a couple weeks back. They are the king when it comes to premier street boutiques.

19.description: Good urban shoe store. Prices are higher but fair. If you're looking for shoes that you don't see every day this is the best place in the city to find them.

28.description: Probably the best sneaker store in Chicago...maybe not for the average consumer but for the pure "sneakerhead. I'm no Sneakerhead but I know quality and this store has it in spades. The employees are hard-working, cool, and free of pretension. They know their product. The fact that they are actually busy helping people puts them head over heels over all the other stores.They also have a bunch of edgy t-shirts. Like shirts with random words on them that don't make sense. Too cool for school. They don't have my leather vans though! UGH!

3.description: I should say I am still love this place, and the store manager refund me finally. Thanks all.

33.description: Hands down best sneaker boutique in the chi. never pompous, always helpful and great collection of gear. places like this make our city shine.

43.description: I've been going to Saint Alfred since they opened up, and they've yet to disappoint.The staff is extremely personable and friendly, a nice change from other Chicago sneaker shops.They also don't mark up their shoes to ridiculous prices, which is always a plus, haha.Lastly, St. Alf's always comes through with great designs for their shirts and fitteds, I own a bunch.A real great contribution to Chicago.

2.description: Great shoes, horrible service. My boyfriend and I visited the store last week and he asked one of the employees what his favorite shoes in the store were, the employee, who was sitting on the window ledge, continued to sit and didn't get up to help us and replied, the ones on my feet, referencing his beat up Vans. The other employees seemed to care more about the people hanging out in the store, not customers interested in their shoes. We did end up buying shoes and we love them. But, I hope the employees learn how the treat customers and potential customers.

45.description: so i have what you would call a nike addiction and i am going to have to stick st. alfred with partial blame for this.its true, if i avoid this place for weeks i start to walk with a slight twitch. one that can only be stopped by popping in and drooling all over the nicely stocked womens section....yes you read that correctly... womens section! how exciting.everytime ive been in they've had some form of deal going on, everyone who works there seems genuinly happy to be there, and everyones been more than eager to try and help me find something i might be happy with.so there it is boys and girls. i feel i speak for all of wicker park when i say , thank you st. alfred  you do chicago proud.

18.description: Fly. No other word for it but fly. Saint Alfred is one of those very rare streetwear shops--like Concept in Boston--that carries the most exceptional, limited, and rare designers and editions. Years back Vogue magazine did a story on Supreme--the NYC skateboard shop--and compared it to Chanel in how it has won the hearts and minds of its core customers and that same paradigm would apply to Saint Alfred, too. You'll find your expected stuff from adidas, Stüssy, Nike, Diamond Supply, and the like here but also things like the ultra-lux Japanese streetwear brand Visvim. Their staff is friendly and know their products, too. The house Saint Alfred line is also really awesome: seriously understated but slick caps and tees. Fly.

41.description: Top notch Urban Streetwear and Sneaker store.My favorite shop in all of chicago due to its amazing staff and amazing selection.One word to describe this place... AMAZING

52.description: Some of these reviews are hilarious!"Hip-hop Shopper" and "nice to see Chicago catch on to what LA is doing"???  I'm sorry you had to step out of the TMZ, and I apologize for a store like St. Alfred.  Sincerely.This place is consistently on point.  It is true, you have to be on your game to catch the "hot chit" before it's gone, but you should already know that.

50.description: Now, why can't every boutique be as unpretentious? I didn't buy anything but not for lack of want. Staff was nice even though it was pretty obvious we weren't going to purchase. They get new stuff frequently so visit often. I'm glad I don't live close otherwise I would own too many sneaks and still be sorely lacking in dancing skills.

4.description: I stopped  in today too grab some gear. I was greeted by Emily. She was absolutely amazing! Her customer service  was above and beyond. Emily even went out of her way too their office next door (mind you its Chicago so it was freezing) too grab my size. Thank you so much Emily! Also the gentleman at the register was so sweet.

6.description: Cool spot I checked out while in Chicago back in Sept '14.  Nice selection of different sneakers, streetwear, and accessories.  Staff was extremely cool.  Only con I have was trying to find it...there isn't a huge sign outside for it.  But once your able to track this place down, I would recommend stopping in...

55.description: When I got the dough to buy kicks of my choice, St. Alfred is my prime spot. I drop in maybe twice a month, and I usually leave carrying a bag or two. The St. Alfred brand, itself, is definitely killing it right now. The only way i could describe it is NY hip-hop meets Chi sensibility.

15.description: Small shop, but packs a punch for the serious street wear head.Staff is friendly & easy to talk to.They carry 'The Joneses' line, which is a plus!They have exclusive items & from time to time do in stores with musical guests. This is a plus in my book!

57.description: At home in L.A. we have lots of little shoe boutiques like St. Alfred... They cater to an urban style with every colorful pair of Nike, Puma, Converse and more that you can think of. It's nice to see Chicago catch on to the hip-hop shop craze. Maybe we're not two years behind the trend spectrum after all?? Way to go St. Alfred. The latest dunks... they are there. The Jordan AF12's... they are there. The list goes on and on...  I've been on a desperate hunt for a pair of the safari Nike dunks and I figured if St. Alfred doesn't have them, than no place will. I was correct, they did have them... but not in my size. And on and on it went with the rest of the pairs I picked out. It seemed like they had all display shoes and no stock!!! Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrr.The guys that worked there seemed more interested in talking fashion shop with the other dudes that hang in the store than helping me find a fit so I could leave a happy hip-hop little shopper. I know I don't fit the bill for their typical clientele, but that shouldn't make a difference when it comes to service. Maybe next time I'll rock out a St. Alfred shirt (they carry nifty apparel too) and I'll garner more attention. But until that happens... or until they up the stock quantity... 3 stizzars it is.

20.description: I went in looking for baby Jordan's and also because a buddy of mine has a few of their hats. No Jordan's for babies but, the hat stash is epic. I walked out of there with a Kick Ass lid. The service is top notch. Cool peeps, friendly as hell. This is a never miss when you're in Wicker Park.

36.description: Store was dope. Wanted to cop there sig series tees but they were out of alot of them. Def will b bak

14.description: This is the spot! Been coming here for a number of yrs and they always have great service and a great selection of kicks and clothes. There always super cool and chill not rushing you or anything.They also have there independent brand and have events every so often.

3.description: I have been going to Kathy for over 10 years (even before she had her own place). Every time I leave, I am very happy with my haircut. In one sitting, I get a haircut, eyebrowns, shave, and line up with the blade all for a very fair price. Kathy is also a really nice and fun person. Sam is fantastick with a blade and lining people up and also does a really good job with his haircuts.
