It is so good I drive from University Village all the way to Pulaski and montrose and then back down to work in Oak Lawn. I reccommend this place to anyone looking for a very good haircut, line up, and eyebrow threading for a very good price.

1.description: I've been following Kathy around Chicago for well over 10 years she's fantastic at what she does. I don't drive so I take two busses and two trains round trip just to get to her.  I've seen here stay open well after her closing time just to accommodate her customers and her prices are exceptionally affordable.  If your debating don't you will be pleasantly surprised.

2.description: Clean, quick, and cheap. All the essential elements in staying Fresh To Death!

0.description: Wonderful and friendly service!Kathy does the BEST eyebrow threading I've ever seen. I love the fact that I'm always taken care of and treated like family when I'm there. This place is a hidden treasure , believe me.

4.description: I have been coming here for almost 8 years. I used to live walking distance from here and though I moved further away I still come here. I have tried other places when pressed for time but I have never found a better value than Kathy's.

3.description: $10 for regular manicure. I haven't heard of prices like this ever. It was as good as any manicure done at any other salon.

1.description: Ok, first let me say...this is THE WORST NAIL EXPERIENCE I have ever had!1. The place is clean but very run down. Did not give me that relax and enjoy feeling.2. While it is cheap (I paid 10$), it is AWFUL. The guy who works there did my nails, and it should have been the first red flag. His hands were shaking throughout the whole thing, and of course eventually the painting looked horrific. I mean you can see lines of nail polish, bubles and a while bunch of crap.When I paid, i told them that the guy should not touch anybody, because he is terrible. The woman who took my money did not respond a single word. Non-existent customer service.NEVER AGAIN!I hope other people read it and not waste their time going to this place. Very disappointed. :(((

2.description: Love this place, i come here once a month to get a pedicure, service is great it's a family business, they always treat me like if im part of the family, I highly recommend it!!!

5.description: Never going back again. Walked in today for a mani pedi and nothing was said. Put me in a chair. FORTYFIVE MINUTES later, no one had come over to me and said anything. I got up, dried my feet and finally got a look from someone, telling me that she was almost done with the person she was working on. I told her that I didn't care, I'd been there for almost an hour and didn't have time to spend another two there. What the hell? They couldn't have told me when I walked in that it would be at least a half hour? I had a babysitter at my house that I was paying for! I just shat $12 out and wasted an hour of time I don't have. NEVER AGAIN.

6.description: Actually, the name of this place is A 1 Nails. There is another nail place a few doors east, but this review is for A1, located just west of the alley at Montrose and Kedzie. This place is great. They're super nice, reasonably quick, and the price is right. They would get 5 stars anyway, but they really rock  because they fixed 4 of my daughter's nails when she messed them up not an hour after we left there. And, a 14 y.o. can't possibly attend her Confirmation without her zebra manicure in perfect shape, lol. Go here, you won't be disappointed.

7.description: I just moved to the area and I am sooo happy to find a place to get my nails and eyebrows done for a good price within walking distance! Mani-pedi $30 eyebrows $7. Now this isn't some posh spa, but its clean and the lady is really nice. Eyebrows are done in a back room, but it didn't bother me she did a great job! My only reason for the lack of one star is because it is just a plain and simple nail salon, and my manicure didn't dry completely so my nails were messed up which I am sure is my fault.

0.description: Best deal in town. Really cheap and they do such a great job every time. Very detail oriented and friendly. If you don't mind going to a "dive" type of place I highly recommend going here.

4.description: Even though this isn't a fancy nail salon the place is so warm and welcoming making it my favorite place to relax and feel pampered. I've gotten everything from a simple manicure/pedicure to acrylic nails, no chip manis being my favorite. All very well done. Service here is amazing, everyone is so nice and friendly. Prices are not ridiculous either and they do a perfect job everytime. I will be loyal to this nail salon for as long as I live in the city!

58.description: I had the signature soup, Sam-gye-tang, Chicken Soup With Ginseng. I loved it. Commonly, a whole chicken is boiled in a broth with Korean ginseng, dried jujube fruits, garlic, ginger and glutinous rice. It is traditionally served during the summer for its nutrients which can easily be lost through excessive sweating and physical exertion during the hot summer. It's in my neighborhood, I love to go back and try different dishes.

56.description: While the ginseng chicken soup is also excellent, there are some other interesting dishes to try at this establishment. Love their teas.

29.description: This place wasn't as great as I thought it would be. The waitress lady was kind of rude and i felt like she was nicer to Korean and mean or rude to non-korean customers. Unless we call for her, she wouldn't come and check on us for water or side dishes. But cute little place. Food wasn't bad but not as good as other korean places i've been to.

42.description: I had excellent service and food! I will come back again when I am in this part of town.My first time eating Korean and I loved it.

23.description: Wonderful service and outstanding food.  Very clean restaurant.  Just all around good experience

47.description: I live just a couple blocks away and stopped in for some take out. The decor was very nice. I'm new to Korean food and was not disappointed! I got a strawberry smoothie which was easily the best I've ever had to accompany my Bi-bam bop. The service was excellent and very friendly. When I opened my bag at home I was astonished at the amount of food I received and everything was delicious(even though I had no clue to what I was doing with all of it). I ate good for two days! Reasonably priced impeccable quality and friendly staff. Can't wait to bring friends to dine in!

8.description: I went here for dinner last night - by first time to have traditional Korean Food.  IT WAS AWESOME!We started off the dinner with dumplings . . wow - they were a little different than I am used to - not greasy  - but just lovely pillows.  It's almost as if they were air baked at the end.  So good!  I am not a big red meat eater, but I loved theirs!  We ordered 2 combo's with  - I am going to mess up big time on the spelling . . bibimbob and bulgogi (I think).  My dinner date is a regular here and I let him take the reigns with ordering.  May it as good.   And it reminds me of traditional farmhouse eating ...  like tapas or dim sum. .  all the little plates of bites around the table.   I will NOT be hesitant to go there again!

31.description: I love this place.   The inside is clean and neat.   The food is good.   I love especially ginseng chicken soup.

34.description: This place is known for their Korean ginseng chicken soup.  The soup is served with a whole cornish hen that is stuffed with rice, ginseng, and dates.  It's an amazing soup that fills you with vitality and feel-goodness.  This last time I also tried th 'dak dori tang' which is a spicy chicken stew (portion size for two).  It's spicy and very flavorful.  Since this is a dish I cook often at home, this probably isn't something I would order again personally.  But it's wonderful and if you are in the mood for something spicy and hearty, this should hit the spot.The restaurant is quiet and serene.  This is NOT a Korean bbq joint, so you don't have to worry about the smokiness that so many people equate with Korean dining these days.  There's a cute grandmother, possibly the owner, who if you're lucky, will be your server as well.  So kind and charming.FYI: they have a frequent diner stamp card.  Free bowl of chicken soup for every ten visits.

16.description: If you come here, you have to get the samgaetang. That is their speciality. The broth has a nice clean taste and the chicken is so tender that you can easily pull pieces off with your chopsticks.My friend eats a lot of rice, and they gave us extra rice for free :)A lot of times at korean restaurants you expect to receive bad service. But the service here was really good, the waitress was really nice and attentive, and she spoke both english and korean. I will be back*You get a free drink for checking in on Yelp

13.description: This review is for their Sam gye tang (ginseng chicken soup), which they are known for. I dragged my flu stricken body, in attempt to get the taste of that chicken soup my mom used to make when I was sick. Granted, I never liked this thing that much--c'mon it's like a clear chicken broth soup with lots of garlic, dates, ginseng... And something that I always ate when I had no appetite. I honestly can't imagine someone who isn't Korean that never had it being blown away the first time he/ she tries it, since it's pretty mild in flavor, but it'll grow on you. Anyhow, this soup pops in my head when I'm sick. And I'm pretty sure this is the only Korean restaurant that serves this. It came out boiling hot in the ddook bae gi (the stone pot), with the small whole chicken. The broth was rich, and the meat fell off the bone effortlessly. I think it was possibly better than my mothers (sorry mom). Also this is how our family ate the soup; eat the 2/3 of the chicken meat as you dip it lightly on salt and pepper mix, take the rest of the meat apart from the bones, mix well with the sweet rice, and eat it like jook (porridge). But my mom put more sweet rice than they did here, but no worries, she didn't prepare a separate bowl of rice. In other words, it's plenty of food. And yes, be careful of the little bones. It's annoying but I take my time to take off all the bones so the rest of my eating experience is uninterrupted.The banchans included leek cucumber kimchi (o-ee so-bak-ee), regular kimchi, radish kimchi (kkak doo gi), picked garlic, anchovies with pepper, and tossed bellflower (do-rah-ji moo-cheem). They all tasted flavorful, clean, and fresh. Some were a little sweet for me but still, everything tasted so fresh, and usually banchans are a good preview of how the food will be. I'm excited to try more things from this restaurant!P.S. The grandma serving here is so cute and sweet--I kinda love and hate elderly serving me food because I think it's ridiculous and I should be serving them food (yes I'm strange) but she's awesome.

11.description: Loved the Bi-bim Bap. Based on other reviews, I better try the soups also.

39.description: I was a fan of things Korean before gangnam style, especially the staples (kalbi & bulgogi). Korean food, to me, always good so definitely stop by and try some at this place when you get the opportunity. But what I want to do in yelp is review bathrooms, restrooms, comfortrooms. Lol. Strange, I know, but the motivation is if you cant keep your dirty parts clean, its just very hard to wholeheartedly trust your ability to keep other things clean, like the food I'm eating or the place you're cooking it in.This place killed it. Bathroom is clean and well renovated. Not sure what it looked before but its pretty nice now. Some technical things can be upgraded but otherwise it almost have a lounge or loft feel to it. My first bathroom review so 5*

37.description: If you want to try Korean authentic food other than Bibimbob, GO HERE.If you like chicken but the Korean fried chicken thing sounds too heavy for you, GO HERE.If you want a hot night with your partner after dinner, GO HERE and get some Mother Father Ginseng Chicken!

0.description: the best chicken ginseng soup we had in Chicago. this is a family style restaurant with a small menuthe chicken ginseng soup is light and tasty, just the right portion, feels very nutritious toothe seafood pancake is quite good with a generous portion of seafood

38.description: my secret spot for korean deliciousness.  They make a quality soon-do-bu (sic).It's a very low key, unassuming on the outside (as are most good korean places in Chicago that' I've noticed).Prices are good.This place doesn't have your traditional korean bbq menu or table side fire pits, which I like because it gives it a different variety.A must for those looking for authentic korean.

51.description: Been here hundred times over and decided that I owe this place a well deserve review. By far my favorite authetic korean restaurant in town. Although it is a bit far from the city, it is so worth of the drive just come here to eat. The owner just recently renovated the place which makes the dining experience even better than before. My usual at this place is the Ginseng Chicken Soup which you get a whole chicken stuffed with the korean sticky rice flavor with herb and garlic boil in soup with ginseng. You also get rice with beans and delicious side dishes with it. The side dishes are to die for on their own. You can tell the owner really put thoughts into preparing food for the customer. I am also a big fan of the Dol Sot, a korean rice dish slow cook in a claypot with a crispy layer of rice at the bottom of the bowl. The meal usually ends with a cup of chilled ginseng tea flavored with honey, like the side dishes, it is also the complimentary item at the restaurant. A private parking lot is behind the restaurant so parking is not an issue. Earned a solid A++ on my list.

27.description: Wow. Stopped by for lunch. Tried their chicken soup. I was not sure if their chicken soup is good. But guess what,  it was amazing!!!banchan(side dishes) was great as well. They have check in special which is free drink. My new favorite place.

32.description: We went to buy a motor cycle helmet for my husband, but the place was not open yet so we yelped to find a nearby Korean restaurant. Ssyal was less than a mile away.We ordered fried dumpling, Gunmandu, for an appetizer, which did not have much flavor.   It was definitely not housemade and the same thing we had in some other Korean restaurants in Chicago.  My husband tried Kong Kuk Su for the first time and liked it.   It was something different; however,  I do not think he would order it again.   I had the combination of Galbi and Soon Do Bu Jigae.   The Galbi tasted good but too much fat.   Do Bu Jigae was excellent.  The seasoning was perfect without being salty.   Ssyal's specialty is the ginseng chicken soup so I would definitely come back to try it, along with few other dishes that I have not had for a long time.

54.description: Myself and a friend visited Ssyal Ginseng House for dinner. The service was friendly and the food was excellent. We had several dishes and the clay pot chicken. It was very tasty and satisfying. The restaurant and bathrooms were clean. Will be back for more clay pot chicken. Gives you a lot of energy!

48.description: Ssyal Ginseng House - the name itself should give you a clue that this isn't your run-of-the-mill Asian fare. When was the last time you've had a dish with real ginseng in it?One thing to notice is that even though the place is family-owned, the decor is pleasantly modern and bright. Service is impeccable and prompt, and the food speaks for itself. I ordered the Sam-Gye-Tang like all the other 5-star reviewers. Hey, they first kept the place open by serving nothing but this chicken soup. And why not? It was the most tender and flavorful chicken soup I've tasted this side of the ocean. The ginseng tea was delicious as well but I would hold off on that if you are unitiated. Like all other Korean restaurants, free side dishes were included with you meal, and the ones here have delightfully clean tastes. You can tell they make their own pickles and kim-chi.If an authentic Korean fare in an upscale urban atmosphere is on your to-do list, give Ssyal Ginseng House a try.

44.description: Oh man, I love samgyetang! I'm so happy to have found a place in chi-town! This place is really cute! Simple, elegant, modern design. And the food tastes very clean and healthy. The samgyetang broth was yummy, but it could use more ginseng and dates, but it still hit the spot.:)My mom got the daegutang which also had a clean, tasty flavor, perfectly spiced. I wish there was more ban-chan variety, but the banchans available were fresh and yummy as well.

24.description: I was looking for some Korean food while travelling on Lawrence. I found this place and saw some good reviews. They are known for their Ginseng Chicken but I was in the mood for more spicy. We had the bibimbap which was good as were the side dishes (bamchan) but the real standout was sundubu jjigae. I never had it before but the picture looked irresistable. It was succulent, spicy and melted in my mouth. It may become my new favorite dish.  According to wiki it is a hot and spicy jjigae dish made with uncurdled dubu, seafood, meat,...vegetables, mushrooms, onion, and gochujang or gochu garu.....sounds about right. It looks as good as it sounds and tastes even better.

7.description: I had the ginseng chicken soup to follow all the yelp reviews, but it was so bland!  I had to even ask for extra salt, and I'm someone that likes things slightly under seasoned!My fellow patron had the dolsot bibimbap, and that was also EXTREMELY bland.  We had to put spicy sauce on every bite (after dousing the whole dish with it), and it still wasn't very flavorful.On the other hand, the service was great, which is why I am giving two stars.  There was one little old lady there that was absolutely adorable and sweet.

49.description: Hands down get the samgyetang. Just get the damn soup because that's what they specialize in. The word "ginseng" is in the name of the restaurant, for crying out loud! I've tried their other dishes and always come back to the soup.Whenever my family and I feel like we need to be nurtured from the inside out, we come here and get the soup. It's a whole Cornish game hen stuffed with rice, stewed in a ginseng broth with jujubes and the natural juices of the Cornish game hen. They give you a dish of green onions and a dish of coarse sea salt. (FYI: This is not your typical sodium-laden, MSG-filled soup so if you're used to that, GET OVER IT and taste how food is supposed to taste, damn it.)  I usually dump half the green onions in and then dip the chicken pieces lightly in the salt before eating it. It also comes with a side of mixed grain rice. I like to just mix everything together in my bowl and then eat it because it reminds me of the Chinese chicken jook (or congee) that my family makes at home. It's comfort food for me. Service is very friendly but refills on the tea are a little slow and sometimes overlooked altogether. They also recently remodeled and it's a lot more inviting and comfortable inside now. I remember when it was lit with fluorescent lights, carpeted, and looked more like a ginseng store with tables instead of a restaurant. It was good before but even better now.

40.description: I have been in love with Korean food since I was three years old. I am always looking for an authentic Korean restaurant with great food and service. The service is lacking within many Korean restaurants. It is rare to receive really good service and/or without an attitude. Most of you non-Asian people know exactly what I mean.Ssyal Ginseng House is at the top of my list due to one important fact...excellent service without any of the above! Our server was so nice and attentive. The older lady near the counter was also such a sweet and attentive women. I just wanted to hug her. Bulgogi is my absolute favorite and their Bulgogi wasn't lacking in any way. It arrived to the table hot, delicious and plentiful. I love the fact that I wasn't given the stink eye when I asked for the chef to make my Bulgogi spicy. A definite plus. I loved the decor and feel of this restaurant. The ginseng submerged in water in huge glass containers were pretty unique and cool. I will definitely come back.Ssyal Ginseng House you have done Korean and customer service the way it should be done in every Korean restaurant! Thank you for a great experience. I will be back.

53.description: We went there last Saturday night, nice n clean interior, great service! The gram there is sooooooo nice and she reminds me of my gram. We had Sam-gye-tang and rice cake, yum! I love Korean food and this place reminds me of my days in Korea!

30.description: They are known for their ginseng chicken soup (it's good). However, since I'm not a huge fan of ginseng, I always order soon du bu.  Their soup is great and I love their brown rice with it. This restaurant has great service too. The staff are super nice and friendly unlike other restantants.  The service and quality of food makes this place my favorite Korean restaunt by far.

46.description: One of the best chicken soup in town

1.description: Usually I go to Joong Boo Market to get my Korean fix but the menu is quite small and I was feeling something different. It was a cold day out, snow still on the ground. We were craving something soupy to warm us up. I had this place bookmarked for quite a while but never found myself in the neighborhood. Luckily that day, we were! I think this place is a hidden gym! We were the only two people in the restaurant when we arrived at around 4:30, go figure. Immediately we were waited on with two cups of nice hot barley tea and menus. If you know Korean food, you know that Sam Gye Tang is a classic dish. It is basically a whole chicken that is stuffed with sweet rice and boiled with ginseng into a delicious and flavorful broth that will cure any winter chill. In addition to the soup, we ordered the spicy pork, and the stone beef bibimbap. All equally delicious and authentic tasting. They also provide you with an array of banchan aka Korean side dishes. Anyone who goes to Joong boo for Korean food should come here for a nice change for some new but familiar Korean dishes!

55.description: Homey ma & pa restaurant that I'm really surprised isn't more busy. Slow-cooked samgyetang (ginseng cornish hen soup) made by a sweet Korean grandma. This is as authentic as it gets. The broth is delicate and has the perfect hint of ginseng. It is nice being able to add my own sea salt to taste, and the traditional bean rice is delicious.  Ssyal offers honest-to-goodness food you can't find nowadays. Really friendly service and great food. A must, especially on those cold days or when you're craving some comfort food! You leave feeling all warm and good inside.

9.description: This is a local fave for me, just a few blocks down from my house I've never actually had the ginseng soup but every thing I've tried there is amazing! Love thr dbbokki (spicy rice cakes), their bibimbap and kimchi stew are also a must try!

26.description: I'm in pain dealing with a flu, and that hit me the night before and I still dragged myself to work this morning.  However, I left work early because my whole body ached, and unexpectedly, there was an image coming across my brain: ginseng chicken soup.  I don't live far at all from this place, and I passed here a million times via CTA 81 Lawrence bus.  I always wanted to try their ginseng chicken soup because my mom would fix this for me when I was sick back home.  I no longer have Mom with me, but I have a husband!  He volunteered to travel there to do a take-out order.  How sweet!  The ginseng chicken soup was great.  The broth was mild, flavorful, and excellent for a sick patient like myself.  The chicken was tender and came straight of the bones.  I had to be careful with those little bones because I accidentally swallowed a couple of pieces.  They include the sea salt with pepper if you want to adjust the salinity of the broth.  That was a nice touch.  My hubby ordered the stir-fry squids.  This also came with the bean sprout soup and white rice.  The entire ordered came with five (5) different banchans (kimchi, horseradish, pickled cucumbers, tofu skins, and black beans).  The squids were good but not anything out of the world.  We couldn't finish all the banchans.  Thus off the refrigerator they went.The total came to about $34.  Yeah, this is an once-in-awhile splurge.  I don't do that often to ensure my wallet is "healthy" as well.

25.description: This review is for their Sam gye tang (ginseng chicken soup), which they are known for. I dragged my flu stricken body, in attempt to get the taste of that chicken soup my mom used to make when I was sick. Granted, I never liked this thing that much--c'mon it's like a clear chicken broth soup with lots of garlic, dates, ginseng... And something that I always ate when I had no appetite. I honestly can't imagine someone who isn't Korean that never had it being blown away the first time he/ she tries it, since it's pretty mild in flavor, but it'll grow on you. Anyhow, this soup pops in my head when I'm sick. And I'm pretty sure this is the only Korean restaurant that serves this. It came out boiling hot in the ddook bae gi (the stone pot), with the small whole chicken. The broth was rich, and the meat fell off the bone effortlessly. I think it was possibly better than my mothers (sorry mom). Also this is how our family ate the soup; eat the 2/3 of the chicken meat as you dip it lightly on salt and pepper mix, take the rest of the meat apart from the bones, mix well with the sweet rice, and eat it like jook (porridge). But my mom put more sweet rice than they did here, but no worries, she didn't prepare a separate bowl of rice. In other words, it's plenty of food. And yes, be careful of the little bones. It's annoying but I take my time to take off all the bones so the rest of my eating experience is uninterrupted.The banchans included leek cucumber kimchi (o-ee so-bak-ee), regular kimchi, radish kimchi (kkak doo gi), picked garlic, anchovies with pepper, and tossed bellflower (do-rah-ji moo-cheem). They all tasted flavorful, clean, and fresh. Some were a little sweet for me but still, everything tasted so fresh, and usually banchans are a good preview of how the food will be. I'm excited to try more things from this restaurant!P.S. The grandma serving here is so cute and sweet--I kinda love and hate elderly serving me food because I think it's ridiculous and I should be serving them food (yes I'm strange) but she's awesome.

12.description: Had a big dinner for 16 people last night, and everything was just great! The service was absolutely courteous and very accommodating.  The food was delicious and the chicken ginseng soup was perfect for a rainy cold night. Thank you!

59.description: Some friends and I stopped in here for a lunch and we had a nice meal.  The restaurant is nice and clean.  The decor is largely white and was minimal but tasteful.  The meal started off with some delicious tea.  We ordered a seafood pancake that I was surprised I liked.  For our main entree, I ordered a basic bibimbop ($9).  It was good and they were kind enough to cook the egg all the way through as requested.  The banchan had plenty of kimchi varieties but little else (bean sprouts and seaweed).  The veggies in the bibimbop tasted good and seemed fresh.  The rice was cooked well and I got my fill.  Not particularly outstanding but a good meal.  The meal ended with a nice cup of honey lemon citron tea.  I was a bit too intimidated to try the ginseng chicken soup but my friends also agreed their food was very good.  The service was quite good too.  I think it is ideal for korean mom and pop shops to supplement their service food service pro's which often results in better overall service.

21.description: The other times I been here it was just to carry out today was my first time sitting down to eat. Welcomed with hot tea upon arrival.

17.description: PLUS: Sam Kye Tang (Korean chicken soup)MINUS: The parking lot at the back is small and sometimes full.THE place to go to in Chicagoland for sam kye tang.  Really hits the spot on a cold Chicago winter day, though ironically Koreans traditionally eat this in the summer (to replenish vital energy lost from the heat and sweating.)  The recipes come directly from a genuine Korean granny laboring in the kitchen (the mother of the owner).  She sometimes comes out and greets the customers and asks how the food is.  The side dishes are fresh and flavorful and the service is above average for a Korean restaurant.  If you run out of side dishes or rice, just ask for more.I usually only order the sam kye tang here, but the bulgogi is also good.  The recipe for the sam kye tang was changed a year or two ago and now there's less ginseng and it's floating free in the soup, whereas before it was stuffed in the chicken, with chestnuts and jujubes, but its still excellent, with rich thick broth and fall off the bone tender chicken.

10.description: We went around 12:30 and parking was a little difficult to find since theres alot of other cars in the area.We did not have to wait to be seated. We got the squid and the kong gooksu. They were both pretty good. The squid was very spicy so if you like spicy food you should get that. The gooksu was very refreshing and cold with ice.We also had mandoo as our appetizer and they were fully stuffed and hot as we were served.

5.description: This place is great. It's small yet very cozy. Very relaxed mood. But you want to know how the food is... DELICIOUS! I went with my family so we ordered a bunch of food (so I don't really remember what exactly was ordered) but I promise you that EVERYTHING I we ordered was DELICIOUS! Everything tasted fresh and definitely made with TONS of love. And a plus was that our waitress was very nice ^^. With the little Korean I know she encouraged my attempts to speak in Korean and added to the fun. All in all, great time with the family and great time over all!

3.description: After living in the city for a year, I've been searching for my go-to Korean restaurant. I finally found it with Ssyal. Everything is delicious, especially the spicy pork rib dish. I couldn't stop eating it. It's actually even more tasty than some pork dishes I had in Korea. We've gone through most of the dishes and hands down, the bi bim naeng yum and dwaeji galbi are the best! My husband I come here at least once a month because it feels like we're back in Korea!

35.description: Best get well food ever!!  Their sam gye tang is always good. And side dishes are always fresh. I recomend trying every food there.  I love the grandma who serves there. She is always so nice.  And i highly recomend their ginseng milf shake for dessert!!

19.description: The other times I been here it was just to carry out today was my first time sitting down to eat. Welcomed with hot tea upon arrival.

28.description: I went here for dinner last night - by first time to have traditional Korean Food.  IT WAS AWESOME!We started off the dinner with dumplings . . wow - they were a little different than I am used to - not greasy  - but just lovely pillows.  It's almost as if they were air baked at the end.  So good!  I am not a big red meat eater, but I loved theirs!  We ordered 2 combo's with  - I am going to mess up big time on the spelling . . bibimbob and bulgogi (I think).  My dinner date is a regular here and I let him take the reigns with ordering.  May it as good.   And it reminds me of traditional farmhouse eating ...  like tapas or dim sum. .  all the little plates of bites around the table.   I will NOT be hesitant to go there again!

45.description: Parking was on the street and plentiful when my friend and I were here.  We came late around 8:30pm but there were a lot still here eating.  The surrounding area of this place was dark so just be aware but you should be fine.  The waitress was very nice but didn't understand what we asked her so she brought over the man working there to explain. Their menu was simple and easy to read in my opinion.  I didn't know what I wanted at first but eventually decided.I ordered the Dol-sot Bi-bim Bap ($11.99) and my friend ordered the Gun Man-du ($6.99) because she wasn't hungry.  It took awhile before our food came out to the table.  The Gun Man-du was good and the Dol-Sot Bi-bim Bap was alright.  It did remain hot for a very long time so that was good. lol  I think it didn't have enough meat in my opinion but plenty of vegetables.  I also had the bean sprout soup that came with the Dol-Sot Bi-bim Bap or at least I thought that was the name of it. lol The other appetizers that were brought to our table were good to me.  I was full when I finished everything so I thought it was worth the money I paid.Good place for some Korean food and I would come back if I come back to Chicago.

33.description: Everything was very good. The bibimbap was made just right flavorful and with the rice perfectly crisped. Portions were generous and all side dishes were replenishable.

43.description: This place specializes in Sam Gye Tang, which is a special kind of Korean Ginseng Chicken Soup.  However, it's not the only thing that is good here.  They have a variety of other korean entrees including bibimbap and yukaejang (spicy beef soup) that is solid.Having been here before, upon our last visit we've noticed updated menus as well as new tables and chairs.  This place is definitely putting in the effort.

2.description: Absolutely Love.Ssyal is one of the rare restaurants that just gets better and better.  I have been going to Ssyal for about 8 years now, fairly regularly -- few times a year, and lately once a week as i have been trying all their different dishes.(by the way, i know i had reviewed Ssyal before but can not find my old review - same with a few of my other reviews ...i wonder if that happens to other yelpies too).Chicken Ginseng -- as good or better than what you get in Seoul. And i have had my share of great food in Seoul.Lately I'm trying a new dish each week -- and each time i'm like WOW....Great service. Family oriented.New updated interior and clean, spacious toilets.Delicious food. High value.Thanks Y'all.

18.description: First time here ...been wait for 20mins still didn't get my food :( and is not like they busy

41.description: This marks my second Korean adventure since I've been in Chicago. Once again I ordered my favorite, galbi ribs. This came with a warming well seasoned consommé with bean spouts n scallions. Of course like many sit down Korean restaurants it came with ban chan which were just okay. Most Korean restaurants I like to go to I look forward to the ban chan because I consider them to be part of the meal. The ban chan here seemed a little bland. The ribs however were tender and well marinated. Very well done. I have a lot of love for this place because the owner is this sweet old Korean lady who looks like she loves life! She greets and runs food and takes orders, omg she is the cutest old Korean lady I've witnessed to this day. You gotta love an owner that takes pride in their work. And for being such a small restaurant, it's pretty elegant for the this part of town. Newly remodeled it looks flawless and it's very cozy and warming. Not the best Korean restaurant I've been to but it's up there in the rankings. They offer a lot of reasonably priced items, and my dish was one of the more expensive at $17. But it was well worth the price. Please give this place support because a local business like this deserves it. I would love to post pictures I took of the food but yelp is having technical issues with accessing my photos on my phone. #yelpfail

52.description: I really like this place. The food tastes like home cooking, Korean style, and you get so much I can never finish it all in one meal. I love the touches of all the Korean side dishes you get with meals -- the homemade kimchi is wonderful. You have to try their homemade Red ginseng tea. The owners/staff are really nice and always very accomodating. I live nearby so stop in to pick up carry out more often than eating in and get wonderful service never the less. Eating in is warm and enticing though as the sizzling platters coming your way make receiving your food seem extra delicious.

50.description: When my body is not feeling 100%, I like to go to Ssyal. I typically get the sam gye tang like many other reviewers have talked about and I don't know if the medicinal properties of ginseng are just that powerful but I always leave feeling so much better. I also love that even though I leave really full (I have a hard time finishing the whole thing), my body doesn't feel sluggish at all but instead, rejuvenated. The sweet ginseng tea that they give you at the end of the meal is also a nice touch.

4.description: I'm in pain dealing with a flu, and that hit me the night before and I still dragged myself to work this morning.  However, I left work early because my whole body ached, and unexpectedly, there was an image coming across my brain: ginseng chicken soup.  I don't live far at all from this place, and I passed here a million times via CTA 81 Lawrence bus.  I always wanted to try their ginseng chicken soup because my mom would fix this for me when I was sick back home.  I no longer have Mom with me, but I have a husband!  He volunteered to travel there to do a take-out order.  How sweet!  The ginseng chicken soup was great.  The broth was mild, flavorful, and excellent for a sick patient like myself.  The chicken was tender and came straight of the bones.  I had to be careful with those little bones because I accidentally swallowed a couple of pieces.  They include the sea salt with pepper if you want to adjust the salinity of the broth.  That was a nice touch.  My hubby ordered the stir-fry squids.  This also came with the bean sprout soup and white rice.  The entire ordered came with five (5) different banchans (kimchi, horseradish, pickled cucumbers, tofu skins, and black beans).  The squids were good but not anything out of the world.  We couldn't finish all the banchans.  Thus off the refrigerator they went.The total came to about $34.  Yeah, this is an once-in-awhile splurge.  I don't do that often to ensure my wallet is "healthy" as well.

6.description: I have heard that Korean soup is really good for you when you're sick and that samgyetang is best. So I dragged my sniffling carcass by bus to Albany Park.I received a cup of hot tea once I was seated and did not bother looking at the menu. My chicken ginseng elixir was wheeled out on a cart and accompanied by six banchan and purple rice! As others have stated, you are given green onions and sea salt on the side to season the soup to taste.I felt a lot better afterwards and even received a slice of watermelon at the end of my meal! The young girl who waited on me and the ajumma who owns the restaurant were very nice. Both asked how I liked the food. The owner seemed to know the regulars and engaged in friendly chit chat. Very different than San Soo Gab San!I would definitely go back to try other items or maybe just get the samgyetang again. Looking forward to trying to make rice porridge with the leftovers as another Yelper helpfully suggested. Limp in, leap out!

22.description: I absolutely love this restaurant! Came here on a Tuesday night with a group of 4 and everything we ordered was on point. Pancake, ddeokboki, syal gae tang, soondubu, yu-kae tang are were all very hearty and not over powering or artificially marinated with msg like other places. Although it's located in a sketchy neighborhood, the restaurant is very clean, simply decorated.Service met expectations, but I don't expect much since the food completed it all.

15.description: This place makes THE BEST Dolsot Bibimbap ever!!  No joke, everything's fresh to order, super delicious and piping hot.  This is my go-to Korean restaurant and I recommend you burning the crap out of your mouth eating from a nuclear hot stone bowl sooner than later!

57.description: I'm not a big fan on the ginseng chicken soup, but there are other items that can be had to fulfill an appetite. Service was OK, but prices were good as well as the dishes. I don't particularly care for kim chee, so you can be assured that there are alternatives available.

20.description: If you come here, you have to get the samgaetang. That is their speciality. The broth has a nice clean taste and the chicken is so tender that you can easily pull pieces off with your chopsticks.My friend eats a lot of rice, and they gave us extra rice for free :)A lot of times at korean restaurants you expect to receive bad service. But the service here was really good, the waitress was really nice and attentive, and she spoke both english and korean. I will be back*You get a free drink for checking in on Yelp

36.description: The ginseng chicken soup is so good. I went there in a group of 4 when we were in Chicago for spring break. We drove 30 mins just to eat at this restaurant, definitely worth it! The chicken is tender and the soup tastes just great. The price is good for the food. The place looks clean.

14.description: The samgaetang really, really hit the spot after a ridiculous night out. The broth is extremely savory but clean. The part where it tastes so clean is the real shocker for me, because once chilled the soup turns into a big gelatinous blob which speaks to how long the bones must have sat in the broth to give up all their flavor. Also love how soft the chicken bones are, this means they have fulfilled their marrow-giving destinies to the fullest.Just a heads up, if you've never had samgaetang before I would imagine the first time is going to be just slightly disappointing. It's my hunch that samgaetang is an acquired taste that you grow up with, although I would love to be proven wrong. The chicken soup is meant to be seasoned to taste, which is why they give you that tiny little dish full of salt. Another preferred method for Koreans is to shred your chicken and dip pieces into the salt before they head towards your mouth. Then scoop up a spoonful of brothy rice, place a big blob of kimchi (my fave is the radish kimchi) on top  and voila - a perfectly seasoned bite. The more green onions the better. I also like a healthy dash of pepper. Honorable mention dishes: Dakbokkumtang (or is it Dak-doritang here? They're the same thing). Spicy, sweet, and extremely generous portions. I packed it to go and seriously fed myself for a week. Also have to mention the adorable little old lady who served us. She is extremely hospitable, which is sort of an atypical thing for authentic Korean restaurants.P.S. Take the broth home for some excellent congee (or what the Koreans call juk) the next morning. Remove all chicken bones, and add rice at home and boil till rice is done. I could eat 10 bowls in one sitting. Whatever you do, don't waste that broth.

3.description: I go here kind of a lot - not weekly but probably more than most of friends get massages....anyway yesterday I go and had a very odd experience.  It was a little painful!  She spent a lot of time on my butt! I felt like she was trying to rub the cellulite right out - which I would SO appreciate - but I don't think that is possible.  I guess I was too confused to say anything.  I'll go back for sure - just an odd experience and not at all relaxing. I still love that you can virutally go anytime without a whole lot of notice.

1.description: Wow. A real massage.  Have a very sore shoulder and a huge improvement over yesterday.  This is therapeutic massage, Thai style.  They mount you to get the best angle...Not always comfortable but you will be loosened up.  Ask for Bella.

2.description: People, people, people...how can you give this 4 or 5 stars??? Yes, it's clean I guess but they have no idea what they are doing and the place is 100% a rub and tug! It's so shady.I went in out of desperation b/c I had several painful knots in between my shoulder blades from traveling. I specifically told the girl that checked me in AND the 'massage therapist' (I put that in quotes because I am sure you don't have to be certified in anything to work here) what I wanted them to do and she just went ahead and did the whole massage like she would have done any other person without paying attention to the knots until, after 3 times, I guided her there. They use this Ben Gay like spray that is sticky and smelly and doesn't make it easier to massage. I made her stop early and asked her to leave. I didn't tip and I have never ever done that. She had absolutely no idea what she was doing though and didn't help me at all.and, the table had paper down on top of it...totally for the rub and tugs. ugh. sketchy, shady and no good whatsoever.

9.description: I am also impressed by this location.  There's plenty of (metered) on-street parking and a few nice restaurants et cetera that can be added to the overall experience once you've had your massage.The facilities are very clean and the staff quite attentive.  I'm also a fan of deeper massage and am very pleased with the technique (Tui Na) employed by the masseuses. If you bring your wife (or girlfriend), you can wait in front and have a cup of tea while she takes her time to get dressed.I've recommended this place to a few friends and they've also found it to be a great value in a pleasant, convenient neighborhood.  Communication is never a problem, especially if you speak to the front desk about any issues on the way in.

10.description: Very friendly staff. They speak reasonably good english. I had a 1 hr massage. As i was sore all over from a lot of sports.,i opted for the hard deep tissue massage.The masseuse did a very good job. Asking questions about where it pained and explaining what she was doing.Their showering facilities are very clean as well.

4.description: I had a very enjoyable experience. I called and was able to set-up an appointment an hour from when I called, they were very polite and professional when they greeted me, and the massage was excellent and very affordable. The facility is also very neat and clean with perfect lighting and relaxing music. If you're feeling very tight and need an affordable full body massage (including hands and feet) check this place out.

6.description: Best massage in the city and surrounding suburbs. Very nice and professional staff. Have been here many times for single one hour massage and couples massage. Very happy and extremely relaxed each time!

12.description: awesome place, really cozy, clean. the tables and linens are soft and they give you hot towels. have had massages from lena, christina and emily and all are amazing. i like my massages light and they are really good about toning it down for me. great prices, easy parking on ashland.

5.description: Not bad for a one-hour, $70 massage. They work your body very well, but fair warning: the ladies mount you. They use their whole bodies to get all the kinks out. They also use hot towels at the end, which I think is a nice touch.

13.description: wow, not sure about those other reviews, love this place!!!!

11.description: The massage was really good, and hard, even a little harder than I wanted. The girl was very sweet, and very comfortable with me...getting on the table and working me from the top. At first it was weird, but it only made the massage better. There was a slight language barrier, but all in all they did a good job and were very nice and clean.

8.description: This place was the frickin' bomb! That is if you want a little extra relaxation at the end of you massage. I didn't opt for said ending since my wife got the massage for me even though my buddy said it wasn't cheating since she got it for me.The only awkward part was the table shower. If you've never heard of it, Google it. I don't wanna get into details... Ok, I will.So, I change outta my cloyed in one room, leaving my underwear on under my towel and they take me back to the showers. Now I'm thinking, I'll just rinse off because they're gonna use some oils during my massage that need to stay on my skin or whatever. I walk in and there's a table with a shower head laying on it. Uuhh... I spent a few months in South Korea when I was in the Air Force, this looks badly familiar, I'm thinking. The masseuse then tells me to undress and get on the table... This is how that conversation went;Her: Take off your towel and climb on the table.Me: ...what?Her: take off you towel and climb on.Me: uh..everything,Her: yes. Take of you towel and underwear.Me: all of it?Her: yes, all of it. It's a shower.Me: uuhh..Oookkaayy.She then hands me a tiny towel to cover myself.Thing barely covered my hand let alone my business.So I climb on face down and she starts soaping up my whole backside! She just cut straight to business! I layer there petrified I was cheating but I wasn't really sure if I was. She didn't touch my mommy/daddy bits. Not yet so I wasn't sure. I said to myself, self, if she touches you business, you've still got your new watch on, just run naked down Chicago Ave. I didn't want my lady at home to kick my ass. She keeps a shovel in her trunk so I know she ain't messing around...So, the nice awkward shower gets over and I stand up to dry myself off. I reach for my towel on the other side of the room and she says no, she'll dry me off...Oh God. Imma have to run naked down the street in a minute.I stand there as she dries me off... I stood there waiting for the... whatever...So that's over and she takes me back to my room and the regular massage starts. I was naked with a towel on me so it was a little uncomfortable but it was a nice massage. At one point she did tell me that it would work better if I would just relax. I told her I was trying.So, overall, it was a good massage. Just awkward. I'd totally recommend this place if you're looking for a regular massage or one with a little extra, something. If ya know what I mean.

0.description: On a whim and in desperate need of s deep tissue massage, I decided to try this place did to its convenient location to my house. I was able to get pretty much a walk-in appt calling 15 minutes before coming in which was lovely. I had Katie who was absolutely great, she gave one of the best massages I've had and the place is incredibly clean and aesthetically pleasing as well as very well kept. Couldn't be happier also pretty reasonably priced!

7.description: It always surprises me how clueless some reviews are. It's impossible to go to Sunkiss and not be enamored by Connie, their beautiful receptionist, and the whole relaxing and yet professional atmosphere. And then, if you are lucky to get Christine or Annie, you will be in heaven as your pain, and stress will miraculously go away. Best massage ever!

3.description: Good haircuts, great people and awesome process! Enough said!

1.description: Looked great for men and kids.But was marginal for a women's haircut ($15 for me)p.s. Fabi (as per the old reviews) does not work here anymore.

2.description: Steve cut my hair. Awesome haircut. I think the best I have ever had! I'll be back every two weeks for sure!

5.description: I love this salon. Faby works magic with my eyebrows. Always cuts my hair the way I ask and can blow dry the curls out of my hair very quickly. Prices are good and staff is friendly. What more do you need.

6.description: The owners/stylists were previously from Mario's.   Fabi has been cutting my boyfriend's hair since she was at Mario's and always does a great job.     She is awesome threading eyebrows and I will only see her.    When Fabi is busy and you don't have time to wait, Tito also does a great job cutting hair.   The shop is nothing fancy but there are only 4 stylists in the shop and they can get busy so expect to wait..but it's worth it!

7.description: After wearing out the usual $5 haircut places in K-Town, I ventured further west on Lawrence in the Mayfair neighborhood. The Hair Lounge Salon offers a little more than just clipper cuts. For a few dollars more you get someone that can actually understands what "just a trim" means. You also have a choice of an all scissor cut or just electric clippers. For me, a scissor cut gives you a different look than a clipper cut. So if you're used being sheared like sheep at places like Betty & Nicks, and want a change, check this place out.

0.description: Faby is a talented lady who understands different hair types and what kind of cut will suit you best.  I've been trying to grow out a bad cut from a fancy, expensive salon in New York for about 1.5 years now and needed a trim to even things out.  Faby went into detail right away telling me about my hair and how it was a big no-no for my last stylist to chop up my wavy hair with a razor and to cut the ends into a point instead of a more gradual slope.  She gave me a great cut for $10 and threaded my eyebrows for $5.  She did exactly what I wanted, taking just a little bit off and cleaning up the lines for a more natural look.  She understood when I told her I go to the gym every day and wash my hair often and do not blow-dry it and need to keep it long and simple so it does not curl up in weird ways.  She also cut my hair while it was dry which I prefer because with my type of hair, you can see exactly where the curls fall as opposed to when it's wet.  Not a lot of stylists know how to cut hair dry.  I don't know how much it costs if you get the whole shampoo/blow-dry/style thing, but I know they do that too.  Please just understand, the Hair Salon Lounge is NO FRILLS.  It's really like a big unisex barber shop.  I prefer the casual atmosphere compared to the snooty fashiony places who just follow fads whether they .  And these days with the recession, I'm so grateful to them for their reasonable prices.  I'll be coming here from now on.

4.description: Best hair salon place! Quality haircuts, friendly staff! As other reviewers have mentioned, you would do good by calling ahead and making an appointment (especially with Fabi) because it does tend to get busy. $10 haircuts and $5 eyebrows, priceless quality. Fabi really takes her time with her work, and it's obvious she enjoys it. My husband also loves his hair cuts there by one of the guys (I dont know his name.) Great place!

58.description: Psst, there are nicer cashiers now. It really does make a difference.

56.description: my favorite local grocery store...andy's boasts an amazing selection of produce, lots of interesting ethnic groceries, and some good veggie staples (nice tofu, tofurkey brand products etc), great prices, decent selection of craft beers in their fridge.  my only complaint is that the produce sometimes suffers from freshness issues.

29.description: Decent produce (for non-organic), great prices and in my hood! They make amazing pico de gallo and hot wings and I can always count on their array of ethnic foods. Plus the folks who work there are nice.

42.description: Wow!!! Buh-bye Jewel.  I am a fan.  The produce and meat must be 40% cheaper than Jewel, and is better, too.   The deli is great, meat department is above average, the overall selection in the store is awesome.  Lots of ethnic foods.  Lots of fun. If they sold great steaks, I'd give 'em a 5.

23.description: This grocery store is my one and only.I love this place.  The produce is awesome- never lets me down.  The meat is GREAT.  It's so reasonably  priced and much higher quality than anything sold at Jewel.  The dairy is good and reasonably priced.  Dry stuff- like canned things and frozen stuff can be kinda pricey and a limited selection.  But as far as fresh stuff, this place can't be beat.Also- check out the awesome bulk stuff, like twizzlers and snack mixes and chocolate covered raisins, up by the front near the registers.  And the wine- a nice and reasonably priced selection.

47.description: Typical grocery store.IT caters to the many cultures in Albany Park.Been going there since I was a toddler before it was renovated.I used to buy candy from all these different countries.

8.description: "I thought you said they had a good selection of Eastern European wines. Why do you lie to me? I demand satisfaction!" That's exactly what I said to Maria F. right before I spotted the hidden bottles of bliss. I had managed to locate a bottle of Banatski Rizling among the jumbled clusterf*ck of a display and was having a bit of trouble finding this supposed "sh*t ton of booze" from the Balkan region. It seemed the two bottles of Romanian wine and my Riesling might be it. I clutched my meager find and headed for the register. I glanced to the side and saw the word "Vranac" on a bottle at the other end of the aisle. I stopped dead in my tracks.Not only did they have about three different kinds of Vranac, (I bought a 2007 Hercegovacki) but they also had a Serbian version of my beloved Bear's Blood (Medvedja Krv - I prefer the Bulgarian Medvezh'ya Krov') that everyone at dinner enjoyed, Zdrepceva Krv (Foal's Blood) and a Plavac (Zinfandel). Add the Banatski Rizling and that's 7 wines from the Balkans, which is already considerably more than your average liquor store carries. If that wasn't enough, I know for a fact there were at least two more that I'm forgetting. So Maria F. wasn't kidding; they have "a good selection of Eastern European wines."I ended up with a huge bottle of the Banatski, my 2007 Hercegovacki Vranac and the Serbian Medvedja Krv. It set me back about $30. The Banatski was larger than the other bottles and it was still under $12. I'm a fan of these cheap E. Euro wines because they can actually stand up to the scrutiny of my wine connoisseur friends without breaking the bank. Plus wines in a different language are guaranteed to impress and look more expensive than they really are.

31.description: I live equidistant between HarvesTime and Andy's Fruit Ranch, but I've always been partial to the former. I decided it was time to share some more neighborhood love and go to Andy's.In addition to a huge selection of ethnic produce (think: Chinese long beans, sour oranges and bitter melon), Andy's also sells wine and beer, something that HT does not. The wine selection was surprisingly vast, and prices were quite reasonable.Their meat department wasn't as good as HT, but they still stocked the basics. They have a good variety of dry and canned goods, many of which I've never come across before.Andy's is a great ethnic market that serves a very diverse neighborhood. I'll definitely be adding them into my grocery shopping rotation, especially because their parking lot is a lot less headache inducing than their counterpart to the east.

34.description: Andy's Fruit Ranch is my "go-to" for salad greens (the carry at least six varieties!) other vegetables, citrus,apples (again, at least six varieties), potatoes, onions, spices, coffee, eggs and dairy.  The variety of 10 pound bags of rice from India, Pakistan and elsewhere is astounding.   You'll also find meat, imported cheese,  prepared food for take-out, a variety of European-style breads from small local bakeries, pre-packaged containers of nuts, seeds, dried fruit (particularly dates and figs) and candy, two dozen varieties of honey, imported cookies & candy from all over Eastern Europe, large bars of chocolate of all kinds, wine, beer and some very interesting frozen foods.  There is an interesting mix of Hispanic and Middle Eastern and Eastern European offerings for the diverse population of Albany Park.  The prices on produce, rice, dried beans, coffee, and the dairy case are less than you'll pay in the big chains but the prices on name-brand packaged goods tend to be on the high side.The store is clean, smells fresh, and is well organized and uncluttered.  The check out is quick and efficient.  Andy's is within walking distance for me but for those larger purchases (the aforementioned rice) I am grateful for the large parking lot.

16.description: I made a quick stop here today because I was in the neighborhood and needed a few items. The store seems clean and has a nice selection of ethnic foods, produce and meats. The deli is not as widely stocked as some others I go to on a regular basis (like Lincolnwood Produce), but I got what I needed. They even carry Diet Inca Kola. Go figure!!! I am sure I will be back. It is not far from home and centrally located among many interesting restaurants, shops and bakeries.

13.description: We live in the neighborhood and this has become our go to for produce.  It's just as good as big box stores for about 1/3 the price.  They also have a wide variety of ethnic food and spices, which we love.Andy's also has a wide variety of brand names for a smaller store.  And they recently started selling Boar's Head luchmeat which is great. Only complaint I have is that the butchers have no clue what it means by "shaved" luchmeat.  No matter how thick or thin you ask them to cut it, it all comes out the same.  Once they can get that figured out, I'll give 'em 5 stars.

11.description: Very reasonable prices on both produce, bakery items, and canned goods. They have a huge selection of dried fruit for cheap!

39.description: Loved it here! They have my two favorite things here:1. Kinder Bueno2. Fanta Shokata3. And these cracker cheese sticks from somewhere in Europe!It may be small and a pain to get there from Bucktown but it's worth it to get my sweet Fanta Shokata and some other Eastern European goods!

37.description: I made a quick stop here today because I was in the neighborhood and needed a few items. The store seems clean and has a nice selection of ethnic foods, produce and meats. The deli is not as widely stocked as some others I go to on a regular basis (like Lincolnwood Produce), but I got what I needed. They even carry Diet Inca Kola. Go figure!!! I am sure I will be back. It is not far from home and centrally located among many interesting restaurants, shops and bakeries.

0.description: Let's get this straight here off the bat.  If you're not necessarily in a mood where you need to know how the products you're buying got here or if stuff needs to be organic, then you're in for some serious savings.And don't get me wrong, I love Whole Foods type places, it's just so hard to not come here when things are so. damn. cheap.  For your beans, lentils, dry goods, canned stuff, and produce (not berries), give this place a shot.  I got enough food for two different huge crock pot meals for $28.  The eggs are all reputable brands and priced competitively.  Again, as long as we're not asking questions  (I can already feel my animal hormone levels rising) the meat is pretty cheap here.  Most of your needed carbs and condiments can be found here as well.Two gripes:  1)  The cheese section is crap.  If you're looking for anything outside of your standard hash house selection or cotija, you're screwed.  2)  There is a section containing loaves of locally-produced looking bread.  These are also crap.  The slices don't have the density to make a proper sandwich, much less one that doesn't fall apart in your hands.Otherwise, this is an excellent playground of canned seafood and European condiments.  There are a few things that their either won't have or will be unreasonably priced ($2 for a box of Kraft mac-n-cheese) but they do have decently priced beer (nothing too special) so you could theoretically get everything in one trip.Again, as long as your expectations are tempered appropriately, this is a gold mine of savings.

38.description: I lived down the street from Andy's for 3 years, and just recently moved. I miss it already.    I prefer supporting local business to large chains and Andy's is a perfect example why. It is an amazing local market, with great produce, wonderful deli counter, and lots of international foods you will pay thrice as much for at any chain grocery store.  The staff is mostly local college students who remember you, engage in conversations with you, and make you feel great about shopping there. They also have a discount for local college students.     Overall, the selection is great, the prices are great, the staff is great. I miss this grocery store, and hope I will be able to find one half as good in Evanston.

51.description: Okay... so maybe they don't have everything Whole Foods does, but they have what I want. I'm  a big fan of the fruit and produce section. They have all the staples (lettuce, celery, peppers, etc.) and at very reasonable prices. The produce does take looking over when you're picking it out, but you should be inspecting your produce before you take it to the check out anyway. That said, I have never been disappointed with any of the produce I've bought there, nor any of the other grocery items. They have a great selection of the dried, canned and frozen staples I use all the time too.

27.description: I'm torn.  The selection is wonderful, especially for a cook like me who needs Japanese eggplant, tortillas, and raki all in one week.  But...so far, the fruit I picked up last week has been just terrible!  The oranges were beautiful on the outside and sour on the inside, the peaches were mealy and the apricots brought back a family of fruit flies into my kitchen.  I'm hoping this is just a fluke!  I want to shop here all the time!

32.description: The northside's answer to Stanley's, Andy's is the solution to your inexpensive produce needs.  Great beer selection and meats taboot.

54.description: Looking for dried prawns (think shrimp jerky)? Look no further. Want a butter lamb? Come to Andy'sNeed some Russian beer? Beer here!Gotta have Gelatinous Mutant Coconut? Score!We strolled in here as one of our neighborhood tour stops. After stuffing my face across the street it was a little hard to imagine buying, let alone eating any sort of food.I could stroll the aisles of this store for hours gazing at all of the different ethnic food items. There were so many food products I'd never seen or heard of. If you're making a dish and are having a hard time finding unique ethnic items Andy's probably has it and for a reasonable price.

48.description: Good times abound at Andy's.  I stopped by on a whim bought a super cheap giant can of kalamata olive oil, some decently priced produce (nothing super cheap or super great looking but way ahead of jewel and dommies) and some weird beers from Eastern Europe.  Didn't need any meat but they had some cool goat and lamb cuts.

44.description: It's ok if you only need a few things, the meats are not the best, deli is pretty anemic and they do not carry much past the basics.  My main gripe is the lack of 1% Milk.  Harvest Time down the street on Lawrence destroys this place.

24.description: Dear Andy's,I want to give you five stars.  I really do.  Your produce looks so pretty.  And your baby asparagus is delicious.  I can wander up and down the aisles and marvel at all the ethnic food you have.  I could stare at your wall of wine for hours before I make a selection.  You have my favorite Ritter Sport chocolate bar that I was never able to find in the US before. You're there for me for those last-minute ingredients that I forgot when I went on my weekly shopping trip.  And I dig how you get around the alcohol sales law by making me physically ring up my beverages.But sometimes your produce is bad.  I cut into tomatoes to find the seeds bright green.  The core of an onion was moldy.  And there was a third time more fruit was bad but I can't remember right now.

7.description: This grocery store is my one and only.I love this place.  The produce is awesome- never lets me down.  The meat is GREAT.  It's so reasonably  priced and much higher quality than anything sold at Jewel.  The dairy is good and reasonably priced.  Dry stuff- like canned things and frozen stuff can be kinda pricey and a limited selection.  But as far as fresh stuff, this place can't be beat.Also- check out the awesome bulk stuff, like twizzlers and snack mixes and chocolate covered raisins, up by the front near the registers.  And the wine- a nice and reasonably priced selection.

49.description: its a shame really. their produce seemed nice. they had a nice selection of ethnic items. but, they sold me rotten sausage, and i probably won't be coming back. i'm not talkin' about sausage a day past the expiration date. what i'm talkin' about is sausage that smelled like fish rotting in a dumpster. the expiration date said otherwise, but that stuff was RANK.

40.description: Selection was good for deli, produce and meat selection. Parking lot was clean isles were clear as well. Two cashiers were available with minimal wait to get through. Also wide variety of ethnic foods.

53.description: As a recent transplant to Albany Park I'm looking forward to shopping at Andy's Fruit Ranch rather frequently. I've gone a few times now, and I've been able to find all the produce we get on a regular basis. It seems to generally be nicer than what I'd find at, say, a Jewel or Dominick's and cheaper too. I actually prefer that the fruits and vegetables are actually ripe when I get them rather than almost ripe like most larger grocery stores. All too often I've picked up avocados or bananas in anticipation of eating them rather than being able to eat them right away.A good selection of beers, Mexican Coca-Cola, and a shelf full of exciting new candy bars I've never seen before is just icing on the cake. The, uh, ranch cake I guess.

30.description: Tofurkey slices?!  Hot damn, what a find!  I would never expect to find that here, but there it was, in multiple flavors too.Not a one stop shop, but certain things are worth a visit for their excellent prices.Fuji apples at $.99, decent wine selection at cheaper prices than a neighborhood liquor store, and most veggies looked fresh.

46.description: Andy's is great- I'm here almost daily to pick up all the basics, meat, produce, and the best pico de gallo I've ever tasted.  Overall, the produce is usually fresh except the garlic and strawberries.  Don't look for organic produce here :( but they have added a selection of organic milk, eggs, butter, etc.  Also, the wine and beer selection is impressive especially since it's affordable. My only complaint would be the unfriendliness of the regular cashiers.  I'm not exaggerating when I say I'm here almost everyday for over 3 years so you would think by now I could maybe get a smile or reply when I say "hello" or "thank you"??!!  Also, maybe if they just took a second to look up and say hi I could avoid getting asked for my ID EVERYday for 3 years...I realize people need to be carded but part of the reason I shop at a local small grocery is to support  my neighborhood, small businesses, AND better service...the better service on behalf of the full-time cashiers is SERIOUSLY lacking.  Everyone else is great though and the prices and selection can't be beat- please go just don't expect a friendly ending to your experience.Andy, if you're listening....could you throw the Prosecco in the cooler and ask the cashiers to be friendly?Thank you,Very loyal customer on Sunnyside

1.description: Rosa J. has been trying to stock her refrigerator with a plethora of veggies and fruit in case that hubby needs to make something vegetarian at home.  I normally eat very light during my lunch break, so having great nutritious items at home is just essential. I went in during Andy's off-peak times, so their hot food selections were pretty depleted.  Otherwise, they seemed to have some delicious food, such as catfish, spinach pies, and other items that I wasn't sure what they were.  They also have pretty decent seafood department.  The presentations and freshness of the fish I saw appeared to be more superior than what I usually see at Mayfair Market (on the opposite end of Albany Park on Pulaski).  However, I will stick with Mayfair Market (MM) for fresh produce.  Andy's selections are adequate, but I prefer the prices I see at MM and it's a much shorter commute for me.  What Andy's has but MM lacks is the variety of ethnic items.  I saw many Middle Eastern, Asian, Polish, and Mexican canned food, dairies, and pastries.  They looked enticing, but I shouldn't steer my focus to consume fresh veggies and fruit instead adding more calorie intakes that most likely would be storing in my body until the spring comes.  I love polar bears, but I refuse to become one myself!  My conclusion is that unless I'm passing through Andy's Fruit Ranch when I'm out and about, I won't make a point going there because MM is just sufficient enough for my grocery needs.

55.description: I would really love to find a close place that has fresh produce. I am a salad junkie and we eat alot of fruit in our house. I like the fact that Andy's is close and they have essentials along with some ethnic specialty items and organic things but I am really not impressed with the produce which is why I went there in the first place, after all it is called Andy's FRUIT Ranch!I had to throw out half of what I bought within 3 days, I hate that.  It looked fresh when I bought it but it obviously wasn't. I would go back for some quick essentials but as far as produce goes, no thanks.

9.description: Andy's isn't my first choice in ethnic markets - it's not too close to home, and Harvestime is. However, it was fun to browse while waiting to have dinner in the area. They have an insanely large amount of canned sardines - be warned, these are the large and not delicious kind (BRISLINGS ALL THE WAY!). Also, they sell Schweppes Bitter Lemon soda in 1 liter bottles, and that shit is just straight up delicious. The next time I'm drying for some bitter lemon, I'll be back!

26.description: Andy's has been my go to grocery store in the hood for almost 4 years. I am moving soon and I'm sad to say good-bye to Andy's. They have the best guacamole (they raised the price recently because it is damn delicious and in high demand). I recently picked up a pint ORGANIC cherry tomatoes for $2.99 where Jewel sells them for $6, you get less and they are already on the verge of rotting. Great selection of dried fruits, nuts and candies along the wall behind the service desk. The super nice cashiers that have to put up with annoying and grumpy customers all day. Thank you for being so friendly, I will miss you dearly!

25.description: I shop here once in a while, depending on what I need to buy.  Today I need yufka, Bulgarian feta, Jacob's Coffee, European style bread, organic milk, Turkish Raki, and Serbian chocolates.  It seems like they increase the prices every month, and their fruits and vegetables are poor quality compared to Cermak, but they have the biggest selection of ajvar I've ever seen, so I will be back, but I don't like it at all.  Too expensive.

12.description: I really like this place a lot.   I can always find some great treat that I've never tried before.  Sometimes it's fun to take a little "trip" and buy an item where I can't read the ingredients or the directions because they are in another language.  It rarely turns out well but it's fun just the same.I had to take off a star because their coffee selection is really really bad.  Otherwise I'd do most of my shopping there.

59.description: I love this place. The produce is beautiful and fresh. The produce quality here is well above jewel or Dominick's. Also, they have this amazing shelving system full of healthy treats (yogurt raisins, chili limon peanuts, trail mix, etc.) This place is very price sensitive, as in pretty inexpensive. My only issue is that sometimes there is a "non fresh" odor coming from the meat/seafood area. When that happens I wander away from that area. I try to be polite and find something else to buy, but the odor is pretty strong throughout the store. That doesn't happen very often. I do the majority of my grocery shopping here. Great quality and great value.

21.description: Great produce, nice clean store and friendly staff.  Good price on meats!

17.description: Andy's, you are so fantastic, I can't even begin to do you justice! I just recently moved down the street and am so thrilled that you are my neighborhood grocer! You always have fantastic produce at super reasonable prices! I've wandered your aisles seeking inspiration and have always walked away with everything I needed! You have everything, and I mean EVERYTHING, I want/need/use to cook, from Polish goulash seasonings to Mexican beans to German Haribo! WOW!!And the things you have that I've never even considered using! Like Bulgarian wine! Or Mexican spices! Or pickled anything! Or canned herring! Who has such an amazing selection of canned herring?!In short. Andy's, you are awesome. I hope you stay just the way you are, forever and ever. I'm now just waiting for a ring to formalize our love.

10.description: I live equidistant between HarvesTime and Andy's Fruit Ranch, but I've always been partial to the former. I decided it was time to share some more neighborhood love and go to Andy's.In addition to a huge selection of ethnic produce (think: Chinese long beans, sour oranges and bitter melon), Andy's also sells wine and beer, something that HT does not. The wine selection was surprisingly vast, and prices were quite reasonable.Their meat department wasn't as good as HT, but they still stocked the basics. They have a good variety of dry and canned goods, many of which I've never come across before.Andy's is a great ethnic market that serves a very diverse neighborhood. I'll definitely be adding them into my grocery shopping rotation, especially because their parking lot is a lot less headache inducing than their counterpart to the east.

5.description: Really great deli with some of the best prices I've seen in my neighborhood! Produce is good, although a few items can be hit or miss ($2.49 a pound for lemons?! Cheaper at Mariano's!). All the Eastern European snack foods and chocolatey delights your heart could desire. Friendly staff. I'm a regular!

3.description: Get Ready... My Boyfriend's mother is coming to town. From Manhattan. I get to cook to impress! I plan menus backwards, forwards and in case I am stuck at work late and cannot escape. If this happens to you, go to Andy's: Have you gone to the frozen section? They carry gnocchi. And not just any gnocchi, but a smoked mozzarella cheese gnocchi that is light, airy, flavorful and sublime. I'd post a big, elaborate recipe, but with gnocchi like these, you won't need it. A little olive oil or butter and parsley (maybe a bit of dill, some fresh cracked pepper, a light dusting of fresh Parmesan?) one more thing, very important, If you buy this wondrous pasta and pour a jar of Prego or Ragu over it...  I won't threaten violence but I may unleash my perpetually-hungry Beagle on your monstrous desecration of dinner.

35.description: Andy's is my go-to place in the neighborhood for most of my grocery needs. The produce is varied and usually in good shape, the shelves are well-stocked and organized, the cashiers are friendly, and my husband appreciates their selection of micro-brews. I can't give Andy's 5 stars because their selection for things like breakfast or cheese (unless you're looking for Mexican or Greek cheeses) is pretty limited. That just means we have to supplement our grocery trips with stops at Pastoral or Whole Foods. Otherwise, I couldn't ask for a better neighborhood grocery store.
