19.description: Very affordable produce, but what I loved was the wide variety of ethnic foods.  I bought some taramosalata (a Greek fish roe spread), some dates, and some figs, but there were so many other items of numerous national origins that I would love to go back and buy and try.  p.s. they have Mexican coke.

28.description: "I thought you said they had a good selection of Eastern European wines. Why do you lie to me? I demand satisfaction!" That's exactly what I said to Maria F. right before I spotted the hidden bottles of bliss. I had managed to locate a bottle of Banatski Rizling among the jumbled clusterf*ck of a display and was having a bit of trouble finding this supposed "sh*t ton of booze" from the Balkan region. It seemed the two bottles of Romanian wine and my Riesling might be it. I clutched my meager find and headed for the register. I glanced to the side and saw the word "Vranac" on a bottle at the other end of the aisle. I stopped dead in my tracks.Not only did they have about three different kinds of Vranac, (I bought a 2007 Hercegovacki) but they also had a Serbian version of my beloved Bear's Blood (Medvedja Krv - I prefer the Bulgarian Medvezh'ya Krov') that everyone at dinner enjoyed, Zdrepceva Krv (Foal's Blood) and a Plavac (Zinfandel). Add the Banatski Rizling and that's 7 wines from the Balkans, which is already considerably more than your average liquor store carries. If that wasn't enough, I know for a fact there were at least two more that I'm forgetting. So Maria F. wasn't kidding; they have "a good selection of Eastern European wines."I ended up with a huge bottle of the Banatski, my 2007 Hercegovacki Vranac and the Serbian Medvedja Krv. It set me back about $30. The Banatski was larger than the other bottles and it was still under $12. I'm a fan of these cheap E. Euro wines because they can actually stand up to the scrutiny of my wine connoisseur friends without breaking the bank. Plus wines in a different language are guaranteed to impress and look more expensive than they really are.

45.description: Andy's is full of fresh items with great service.  I typically shop here when trying to figure out dinner for that evening.  They have a variety of ethic foods and I always seem to find something interesting to try.  If I am in the area, I make a point to stop at Andy's.

33.description: If you need imported goods from Bulgaria, this is your place.

43.description: Andy's is a gem of a place! They have the most amazing deli in terms of feta cheese and olives! The meat is always fresh and very competitively priced! They have great produce, and are a treasure trove of eastern european food products and euro candy/chocolates! They have yet to not have a LOT of Toblerone in stock, which is just enough to make me hug each person there, every time I walk in the door!They have liquor, wine, and beer as well - including some interesting liquors I had not seen before. They also host fairly regular wine tasting events, so you can get a taste of what they're selling!They are right on Kedzie, a short block north of the Kedzie Brown Line stop, which makes it VERY convenient! Everyone is very friendly, and happy to help you find something.

2.description: -The guacamole from the deli is really good and I haven't seen it around for a better price anywhere besides Cermak Produce maybe-Great selection of teas, learned about a bunch of kinds I had previously never heard of or come in contact with-Also a wide selection of mineral waters which I've been drinking more and more of lately-The produce section is solid and you can always find seasonal produce for really low prices.

18.description: Looking for dried prawns (think shrimp jerky)? Look no further. Want a butter lamb? Come to Andy'sNeed some Russian beer? Beer here!Gotta have Gelatinous Mutant Coconut? Score!We strolled in here as one of our neighborhood tour stops. After stuffing my face across the street it was a little hard to imagine buying, let alone eating any sort of food.I could stroll the aisles of this store for hours gazing at all of the different ethnic food items. There were so many food products I'd never seen or heard of. If you're making a dish and are having a hard time finding unique ethnic items Andy's probably has it and for a reasonable price.

41.description: I like Andy's and would give them more stars if they had friendly cashiers. Only 1 woman has been friendly to me while I've been there. I have to admit, when I walk through the door I always make sure to look at the cashiers to see who is going to be checking me out and then I mope through the store depending on who it is. There is one woman that works there that doesn't say ANYTHING to me, not even the total due. She just looks at me and back at the screen where it has the amount due is lit up. I cannot stand that. They always roll their eyes, too, when I bring my own bags. I think I've collected enough bags from stores to kill off Lake Michigan, pardon me for putting forth a little effort to do my part. I'm not Ms. Green USA, but I do what I can. Usually. Their produce and meat is WAY cheaper then Jewel and that is what I always buy here. Their meat is fresh and their produce is 'good' 90% of the time - by good I mean not wilting, moldy, etc. For other things - mayo, cheese, etc. I go to Jewel just because it's cheaper. I'm not going to lie, I may have to try some other neighborhood grocery stores just because I don't appreciate the rudeness of the cashiers.

52.description: Pretty cheap prices on produce and meat.  Unfortunately, the produce is inconsistent in its freshness and quality.  There is a lot of rare ethnic foods, but not a great selection of cheese.  Their dry goods section is a strange mix of foods and often lacking basic staples.  When it comes to groceries, I usually go somewhere else.What gives Andy's an edge and one of the few reasons I still ever stop in is that they have a great selection of wine and beer.  I love that I can grab a cold sixer of craft-beer (Three Floyds, Great Lakes, Half Acre) from the cooler at prices as good as any liqour store in town.Employees are generally friendly and Andy's has a decent parking lot.

50.description: Produce is decent--can be pretty hit or miss.  But, like most of the other reviewers, it's all about the ethnic selections here at Andy's.  Very good bulgarian feta, too.They have raw, unsalted sunflower and pumpkin seeds amidst lots of other house-packed nuts and dried fruits.  Excellent prices on these. Additionally, there's a few fake meat products, which makes me happy.I go here once a week or so to stock up on fresh veggies & fruit, and for things like canned beans, the aforementioned seeds, and sometimes frozen bureks and pasta.  The bread from various bakeries is also yummy.If they had even more vegan items (like Soy Garden butter, or Tofutti cream cheese) then I'd shop here even more and give it 5 stars without hesitation.

4.description: I know being a cashier at a grocery store isn't an ideal job, and I know that dealing with annoying customers all day can make a person insane. However, if that's not your idea of a great job, then quit! But then again,  if rudely telling the customer to get out because your closed (why are your doors wide open and why did 3 of your workers I passed by not tell me anything?) and throwing a tantrum when bagging up groceries is your solution, or your way of telling me off, then maybe you do deserve a job as a grocery store clerk, because any other job that looks for customer service, would never work out for you. Which is pretty much most jobs out there. Why do you hate your life so much? I'm so sorry I made you take the groceries out of the basket. I can't believe I made you do that extra step after a long day of standing around. I'm sure everyone working there at the time just doesn't care about your rude actions, and I'm sure they would do the same thing as you did. But as a manager in the restaurant industry myself, I would hate to have people like them working for me. As the owner of this store, I would at least have someone on every shift who would think like the owner, and take care of situations like this the right way, as if it were their store. Instead, when I asked the cashier for his name (who wouldn't give it to me), and told him because I wanted to complain, everyone was standing around not giving a crap about how disrespected I felt. I'm not some privileged daddy's girl, nor do I feel like I'm above everyone else. one thing I am, is stubborn. I'm someone who has worked hard to move my way up through a business, and I hold customer service as my highest value. If this is a business who expects to succeed, or even cares, I would expect a response to this. It may seem like I'm blowing this way out of proportion, but with this experience I went through, and the people I dealt with, I'm sure this will happen again to other customers. And that leaves you at risk of losing more customers, just because you choose to ignore it. To the cashier, I hope bagging groceries for the rest of your life is fulfilling.

6.description: This is the most wonderful small grocery you can imagine.  The staff are polite and awesome. The meat is the best. Produce selection is beautiful and quite diverse. They have things you'll never find at Jewel like bitter melon, fresh olives that you can cure yourself or fresh dates that you can let dry in your own windowsill.Plus all the multinational goodies from far east Asian to near west European. Of course, if you need anything you see, you have only to ask the manager and he'll see about getting it for you.Their selection of cooked foods and cold deli salads is really good, tasty and prepared fresh daily.  They have a corn salad that makes a fine meal. (I like to toss a bit of feta cheese in it.)And speaking of feta cheese, what a great selection -- cow, sheep and goat fetas -- take your pick. And cured olives of many varieties. very good!Wonderful selection of wines of unexpected quality.  They're not your usual. They're also not all multi-national versions of two-buck chuck at inflated prices. They often have fruit wines grown and fermented locally (like Michigan) as well as plenty of local and imported wonderful ales, lagers and stouts.A must stop if you're in Albany Park.

22.description: A good place to find certain kinds of imports, but the selection of "standards" is limited. Prices are reasonable, but not spectacular. Overall, Andy's gets a resounding "okay" from me.

15.description: Odd selection.  You may not be able to find everything you need, but if you know they have it then it is good quality.  I went in for dinner rolls once - the kind in the tube you make.  They didn't have them but had 15 kinds of filo dough.  So we can't use them for our weekly trips - but they are great for getting a few items.  The produce is great, as well as the guac from the deli (cheap!) made fresh daily.

57.description: Very affordable produce, but what I loved was the wide variety of ethnic foods.  I bought some taramosalata (a Greek fish roe spread), some dates, and some figs, but there were so many other items of numerous national origins that I would love to go back and buy and try.  p.s. they have Mexican coke.

20.description: Odd selection.  You may not be able to find everything you need, but if you know they have it then it is good quality.  I went in for dinner rolls once - the kind in the tube you make.  They didn't have them but had 15 kinds of filo dough.  So we can't use them for our weekly trips - but they are great for getting a few items.  The produce is great, as well as the guac from the deli (cheap!) made fresh daily.

36.description: This place is still "the bomb".

14.description: I went for a bike ride on Sunday and was going to go to my regular produce store on my way back, but I came across Andy's so I figured I'd check it out!  Great little grocery store.  Good selection of produce at a good price, it was pretty easy to find everything.  They had coconut milk, which I also needed, but I didn't really get t anything else.  But, it appeared as though it's a typical produce store - with great prices and selection on the produce and the other items are pricier.  They did have a deli counter, I didn't even look over there though, so I can't say how that was.  If I'm in the neighborhood again and in need of produce, I'll be sure to stop by again!

58.description: Props to Taco Chino.Good flavor here, and the Mexican elements are just as on point and as proper as the Korean elements.Nachos. Dope.Korean bbq flavors. Dope.This is my stomping grounds, and perhaps the street/ethnic food capitol of the Midwest. I am not sure if the Kogi truck was out first before Taco Chino, but I will tell you that Korea Town and Albany Park has been blending Latins and Asians since forever...be it food, biz, or family. This place is CLEAN, and nicely decorated. This is odd because usually food in Albany Park is always good, but most often it is served in weird, dank, and sometimes scary places...(Lawrence Fish Market, George's Kabob??).I am not a million percent sure if the fusion here is perfect...but it is certainly honest, and these guys should be commended for their execution and creativity.

56.description: Good Food, Good Prices, and fast service. I always get the Steak Nachos Supreme - AWESOME! The burrito is a little small, but if you ask them to add rice it's actually pretty good. Not too much of a fan of the Korean flavors, but I might it out one of these days as it looks good in the pics.

29.description: I went back hoping for a better experience and yes, I am much more satisfied. First off, it was a Saturday and I didn't know that they did hand made tortillas on Saturday.  *Hand made* tortillas. They were perfection.The bulgoki was delicious again, I also tried a couple new ones and they were pretty good. Nothing super special, but decent. Service was better the 2nd time around as well.  I'll go back again, but only on a Saturday.

42.description: After seeing this place, I finally decided to try it.I tried the chicken quesadillas and chips and salsa. I don't know how the front desk person can take your order and make your food without using gloves.Maybe this was just because of being short staffed ,but i wish he would use his gloves next time.

23.description: I used to frequent this place quite a bit when it opened. I was in the area and was in the mood for Korean Tacos. It was good but not as good as as the old days.I had:-Bulgogi Taco-Pork/Kimchi Taco-Steak TacosAdd the habanero salsa for extra flavor!

47.description: Holy kimchi taco.  I think I'm in love!  Best taco I have had in Albany Park...and let me say I have frequented many of the taquerias around here.  I did notice while I was there that it was a bit slower that others--but then I peeked into the kitchen and they were slicing and chopping the onions--everything to order.  And you can tell.  Totally fresh, delicious and not greasy.  Had the bulgogi taco, kimchi taco and the carnita taco--all awesome.  Can't wait to go back--and those in the AP: they deliver until 11 pm.  Done!

8.description: I used to frequent this place quite a bit when it opened. I was in the area and was in the mood for Korean Tacos. It was good but not as good as as the old days.I had:-Bulgogi Taco-Pork/Kimchi Taco-Steak TacosAdd the habanero salsa for extra flavor!

31.description: Not good at all. Ordered a steak burrito and the meat actually stinks. I couldnt finish even a small piece of it.

34.description: This is an okay place to eat for tacos but the owners are jerks! I dont come back because of that.

16.description: It's nothing to brag about. Quick, fast tacos. Sometimes you get chips with your order, but I'm not sure what qualifies that.The ambiance needs a little improvement but what do you expect?

13.description: A consistent disappointment.  Unfortunately there are not very many places is this hood that I can say anything good about, but I have learned my lesson and will not waste my money or time here again, except maybe out of desperation.  The breaking point was after waiting for over 15 minutes for a carne asada quesadilla (there was only an order for 2 tacos ahead of mine) I got home to the driest disaster that I have pictured here.  I kid you not there was not even a tablespoon of a cheese scattered mostly in the middle.  There was a decent amount of meat (though dry and tasteless and as with the cheese mostly in the middle) but the two ingredients put together on a rubbery flaky tortilla was worse then cafeteria slop.  Note that I saved the best to eat for last and that's what's pictured, it turned into dog dinner.  To say something nice the bulgoki is very tastey, the supreme nachos are indeed loaded but every topping is in a scoop on top of the chips and not layered so you can enjoy them together, not my thing. Orchata is not bad.

11.description: I am updating my review back to 4 stars based on the food. Even with poor listening skills and messed up orders, I keep coming back. That kind of says it all.

39.description: This is one of my favorite places to eat out. My all time favorite is the Kimchi Tacos because I'm Mexican and I was a teacher in S. Korea at one time. Their dinner platters are great. My husband, son and I love to eat the Carne Asada plate. They make everything fresh and according to your liking. The guys in the kitchen are great and friendly. Their service may feel a little slow because they make things pretty fresh. I'd rather have fresh than reheated. We eat here at least once a month and I even brought my Korean friends. They loved it!

37.description: Entering my third year in the condo, I've been back to Taco Chino sporadically several times. I've also tried a couple other taco joints nearby and TacoChino does better than the others. Rocky Tacos and Lindo Michoacan both Pale in comparison! My aunt was in from New York and really liked the food here when we got home from a long day at the hospital. The (regular) tacos, guac & quesadillas are about all I've tried and I liked it all! Guy behind counter is polite and prices are pretty good.

0.description: This isn't what I was expecting at all,  but I'm very glad I bought that groupon!   Korean burritos!   I had the kimchi and it was great. Also,  it's BYOB

38.description: I always pass this place on my way home from work and the name alone would tease me and beg me to stop in to try their "Mexi-chino" creations.  (Side note:  "Chino" is Chinese in Spanish, Mexican Spanish).   I finally got a chance to go in with my Dad and brother this past Saturday (another side note: the weather was a chilly 67 degrees) and the first thing that assaulted us as we entered was how HOT and HUMID this place was.  It was uncomfortable, but I decided to muscle through it because I had been looking forward to going into this place for a very long time. To order you have to go up to the counter, this was a little confusing to me because there was no one at the counter, but there was a man (the only employee in site) bringing out food to patrons, cleaning tables, etc. The same man bussing and waiting on tables stepped behind the counter to take my order.  I explained to him that I had never been there and that I was excited to try one of their Mexican entrées with their "chino" twist.  The cashier/waiter/busboy/and possibly cook snapped at me and told me it was not "Chino", and quickly said it was Korean.  I was just referring back to their name, Taco CHINO, because going in there I knew to expect Korean touches to their food...they should change their name to Taco Koreano if it offends them when people say Chino.   He also quickly told me that the Korean portion of the menu would take too long to prepare and gave me all kinds of dumb excuses to discourage me from ordering anything other than your regular Mexican entrees.  So for Dad I order the chicken enchiladas dinner, for my brother I order the taco dinner and for me I ordered a huarache and we all had horchata for our beverage.  Total came out to $30.00.I joined my Dad and brother at the table and 4 minutes later our food was delivered by the cashier/waiter busboy/cook/microwave operator (yes, I think he was trying to discourage me from ordering off the Korean menu because it would require him to actually do more than reheating food in the microwave!)!  That is very alarming because that tells me one thing:  They have food just sitting around waiting to be reheated in the microwave when an order is placed.  Dad said his enchiladas tasted old and bland.  The steak in my brother's tacos was drier than the Sahara.  The fried masa base to my huarache was as hard as a rock...I have an appointment with my dentist tomorrow and will be sending the bill to Taco Chino.  NEVER, EVER, EVER will I set foot into this place again and pay good money for old, bland, stale, hard, and reheated food...and dental problems!!  If I could give this place a zero, I would.

51.description: Other reviewers complained that the service is slow, but I did not find that to be the case. For a dive, I found the service to be excellent. The man behind the counter (likely the owner) was friendly, helpful with suggestions, and clearly proud of his work. There are pictures of Andrew Zimmern on the walls, and the man looked ever so pleased when he told us that Andrew came back for the kimchi tacos twice. We can't argue with Andrew Zimmern, can we? Ok, yes we can, but I still ordered a kimchi taco. I ordered a bolgogi taco, too, and both were excellent. My husband had the chorizo burrito which was excellent, but a little too heavy. We split a giant plate of steak nachos which was huge, excellent, and super cheap. I liked the Korean-inspired items better than the straight up Mexican offerings, but it was all very good. We'll be going back soon and often.

27.description: Visit this location often as its close to the train and my apartment. They have good steak taco and my husband loves the Bulgoki Nachos. The prices are very reasonable and service is super fast.

32.description: I wanted to like this place, I really did. The concept is great, especially after the whole koji taco food craze. But the execution fell short. First the bolgogi burrito. This is one of their Mexican Korean fusion items that sounded better than the actual product. The bulbogi was more like terryaki beef. It was salty and over marinated, and drenched in the sauce that tasted like it was bought from a store in a bottle. Along with this salty beef was what appeared to be fried rice, kim chi, and mayonnaise. The kim chi and the mayo were the only parts of the burrito that made it palletable. Next the lengua (tongue) taco, and the taco al pastor (barbecue pork). These are usually my favorites when getting Mexican food, but both tacos lacked flavor. It's almost as if they forgot to add salt to these dishes. I tried to doctor them up with the red and green sauces, but those were both flavorless too. I feel as if they had Koreans cooking the Mexican food, and Mexicans cooking the Korean food. Because neither side was on point. Albany park is the perfect location for a concept like this, but the execution of this idea needs some help. I'll think long n hard about eating here again.

54.description: A really decent place to get your mexican/ korean fix-We had the korean beef burrito, bulgogi torta, nachos supreme with beef,and a large horchata. Everything was very flavorful and their sauces were also really good. They use habanero for their spicy sauce; if you can't take the heat salsa verde is a wonderful medium spice sauce.  It seems to be more of a take out joint but there are a few tables inside if you don't feel like trekking back home.

48.description: had the korean quesadilla. was served with bell peppers inside as well as cilantro. also served with really good guacamole on the side. my only complaint would be they skimped on the guac while giving a huge dollop of sour cream.

44.description: This place is my local go-to place. All the Korean fusion stuff is amazing, the standard Mexican stuff is so-so(get the fusion stuff). My fave is their tortas, any kind. I think they use bread from the Bakery located directly next door to them which is also wonderful and that bread is good I tell you! They deliver for cheap and their service is minimal,(not a check-on-your-table place) very helpful and friendly. Go here for terrific, affordable Korean-Mexican fusion, right next to Kimball Brownline stop.

24.description: Their tacos are fantastic.  Definitely try the kimchi tacos and the korean beef tacos.  I'm not typically a fan of kimchi, but those tacos are wowoweewowoo.Heads up:  the parking lot is the worst place in the world.

7.description: I was starving one night and decided to try Taco Chino for a second time. I don't too much care for the fact that they charge 75 cent for each additional topping on your taco (cheese, tomatoes and sour cream). A $8 taco dinner easily becames a $11 dinner. That night, I got their overpriced dinner with NO cilantro or onions. I find myself repeating myself every time I go to a Mexican resturant in Albany Park (high Latino pop). Taco Chino is within walking distance of my apartment. So, I get my taco dinner to-go. I get home and low and behold, I have both cilantro AND onions on my tacos. I was starving so I scarf down one of the tacos after having pick almost the entire taco apart. I then decided I paid way too much money to be unstastifed with my food. So I marched back up there. Tell them that my order was messed up and I needed them to re-make it. As I was waiting for them to re-make my order. The cashier walks over to me, asking why I ate one of the tacos. I explained my intentions of just eating the wrong order. Not sure why that should even had been asked. YOU messed up my order! If I decided to eat the entire dinner, what difference does it make. You're going to throw it away anyways. I check my order before I leave and head back home. I open the box up and the meat was cold, as if it had been sitting awhile. Instead of going back, I have vowed just never to go back to the expensive, bad customer service restaurant.

49.description: i been there last week Great food! nice price and good serviceTry there Supreme nacho absolutely outstanding!!! and is B Y O B!!!

40.description: Awesome local place to go for comfort food. The food is made super fast. I got the American burrito with beef and it was great! I like the green sauce for the side. If you want cheap and quickly prepared fast food this is the place to go:)

53.description: Super cheap, super good, suuuuper slow.Came here for the first time on a Wednesday around 5.  There was no one in front of me in line, and it took over 15 minutes for me to get my chorizo torta.  I probably could have made it myself faster.  That being said- it was DELICIOUS and the cheapest I've had of anywhere in Chicago.  Under 5 dollars AND it came with avocado!  A great surprise.  I'll probably come back, especially since it's near school.  Curious to try the Korean food too.

30.description: What's with all the bad and mediocre reviews for this place? I went here last night with Kenny O., and I actually liked it. We ordered the lengua taco, kimchi taco, bulgogi taco, and a half order of the nacho supreme. The bulgogi taco was my least favorite, but it wasn't bad. It was actually quite good. I usually hate bell peppers in Mexican food and on pizzas, but the bell peppers in the bulgogi taco actually tasted good. The favor of the bulgogi was good, it wasn't too overpowering, and the bell peppers actually complimented the beef. The only thing I didn't like in this taco was the shredded lettuce. I don't know, it just didn't work for me. I'm split between the other two tacos for my favorite. The lengua taco was fatty and juicy, just how I like it. The kimchi taco, on the other hand, was more complex, and I liked the slight tangy acidity of the kimchi on the pork. Both tacos were garnished with chopped raw onions and cilantro. I'd even order the nacho supreme again, too. It was nothing spectacular, but it was tasty too. I think I'd try one of the Korean nacho supreme next. I do kind of think that the restaurant should be called Taco Koreano though, as there was nothing Chinese on the menu.

46.description: Really cheap food, but lots of taste. I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in Friday evening with a few siblings. The place was a little on the small side, just an fyi. It's definitely leans more towards a fast food place rather than a restaurant but the food tasted better than fast food. The portions were huge and the service was very friendly. Everyone enjoyed their meals and we all agreed that we would come back again.UPDATEThe first visit I gave 5 stars, the most recent deserves 0 but I am forced to give 1.  The visit was so bad that I refuse to step foot into this place again.  I walked in with my cousins on a Friday night for dinner around 8.  The first thing that seemed off was the fact that I had to order my food at the counter.  Last visit, the lady at the counter said to sit down and they would take my order as in a regular restaurant.I ordered my food and that's when problem number 2 started.  I wanted the quesadilla dinner (comes with rice and beans on the side) and I clearly said that when I was ordering.  I told the girl at the counter that I was a vegetarian and wanted green peppers and onions instead of meat.  The girl looked confused so I explained my request again.  She said she didn't know if that was possible, so she went to the back and someone that prepares food came out.  I explained what I wanted to him and he understood and rang out my order.  I paid and sat down.Problem number 3 was when the food came without the side of rice and beans.  I called the counter lady over and she said the quesadilla doesn't come with rice and beans.  I told her that I've eaten here before and I've ordered the same thing I ordered last time which came with rice and beans.  I wanted the dinner and she said she will ask a guy in the back.  What she had to ask I don't understand, but whatever.  She came back and said I had to tell her ahead of time when I was placing my order and I told her then.  She looked at me like I was speaking a foreign language and out of frustration I said it's fine and she walked away.The fact that she didn't bother to fix the problem ruined my meal.  That and the fact that she was trying to blame it on me really ticked me off.  I will NEVER set foot into this place again.

1.description: Mediocre Food. Worst. Waitress. Ever.In my other reviews, the wait was long. In this one the waitress simply didn't give a crap about her job nor about customer service. There were two ladies working the front counter during my visit. If you see one with cheek piercings and colored hair and she's on her phone, RUN! She is terrible!! This is the first place I've been to where sometimes you get chips and salsa, sometimes you don't. Sometimes you get the water you asked for, sometimes you don't. Sometimes you ask for something and the girl in question hears you while she texts or plays who knows what on her phone, or sometimes she doesn't hear you.I hope no one I know wants to come here again !

55.description: Just try some fusion taco chino

9.description: If I could I'd give them less stars. Terrible service for terrible food. My kimchee tacos were mostly onions, with each taco having less and less meat. DO NOT order delivery from this place. The hostess is unprofessional and has zero customer service skill. She actually had called me back a half hour after I placed my order to ask for directions. I waited for over an hour for my food, that came with the wrong drink. The worst experience ever DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS PLACE,  unless you're looking to have a bad time with bad food

26.description: Went there last night after buying the recent Groupon and my wife and I both enjoyed our meals.  I had the Taco dinner and she had the Bulgoki quesadilla.  I think we'll try to go back on a saturday for the hand-made tortillas, but we'll definitely be going back.

25.description: More things in life should be kim chi tacos.

12.description: This place was my go to spot back in high school, despite the fact that I no longer find myself in the area I try to visit every now and then and I am never disappointed Korean style tacos or Mexican style love it. The owners who run it are just as great as their food. Can do and accommodating attitudes

59.description: Good place to go for guacamole and nachos.  Their korean tacos are delicious but I think better in burrito form.  The wait for the food can be a while some times.They do also have really good chicken soup.  It's basically huge pieces of bone in chicken and veggies thrown together - not the prettiest - but very good when you need it for a cold!

21.description: This sounded like a cool place that combined Korean and Mexican food. Prices were decent. The cashier was distracted by her phone. I ordered NO lettuce as always. Got sope with lettuce. When I pointed it out, she said I didn't tell her. When I told her I did, she asked if I wanted her to pick it off. No offer of a replacement. I didn't want to risk sending it back. Taco de carne asada was dry. Chorizo was too pungent for my taste. When I left, cashier didnt even look up from her phone.  I wont be back. My quest for a great taco in my new neighborhood  continues.

17.description: This taco joint gives  you ONE teaspoon of hot sauce for your meal! And don't get the tamales, it has very little meat in it and I mean very little ! Over all the food was ok, maybe because I was hungry idk. I would not recommend this place at all to anybody ! Thumbs down!

10.description: Been coming here for years. Amazing food. Bulgogi torta hands down makes this the best Korean Mexican fusion in Chicago.Christian really made my last experience here one to remember. And is also the reason I felt the need to write this review. He was an amazing waiter, very attentive, polite and hard working. Thanks again Christian!

5.description: Clean neighborhood Mexican joint, but with a Korean twist. Salsa. Red or green salsa. Or if you dare, ask for the spicy one and your mouth will be on fire.

3.description: Had the korean chicken taco and bulgogi burrito and kimchi fries. This place is decent for the amount of money you pay. It's a nice korean fusion place but the food was pretty plain. Nothing too special here.

35.description: Tried three different versions of the Korean tortas, not a lover at all. Very sad to have brought my family here only to see disappointment on their face's. I don't even want to give their Mexican food a chance if they are going to make a subpar attempt on this ethnic mix.

19.description: Recently ordered from there for the first time (delivered) and I was slightly disappointed. This place was hyped up to me through a co-worker and I had high expectations. I ordered the bulgogi taco and regular taco de asada.  The asada was ok as far as that goes, but the bulgogi taco?? No thanks!!! It's a bad replica of a bulgogi...infact it's an insult to bulgogi lovers. Although the food was filling, it did not make my taste buds happy. I will not order from here again.

28.description: Bulgoki Quesadilla was the winner from our dinner last night, we'd like to try the taco version nextkorean chicken taco was ok, but some bites lacked flavorkimchi taco was a bit overbearing in the kimchi sidewe'd like to also try the korean beef taco or quesadilla

45.description: The tortas are alright. The bread is soft and warm and the ingredients are pretty basic, nothing special or exciting. The cheese quesadilla is a little more mediocre, a good amount of cheese but lacking in flavor. The only reason I gave this place 2 stars is because of their salsa verde. Best ever. Not too vinegary and just a little bit of spice. I ate the mediocre chips just to have the salsa. I agree with what some of the other reviewers said about the corn shells on the tacos. I think they're made with creamed corn instead of corn flour. Soggy and chewy and not good. I ate the meat with a fork and left the shell.Overall, if you're not a picky eater, you get a good amount of food for the price. I may stop by to get chips and salsa verde again one day.

33.description: KOREAN TACOS! Best kimchi and bugolgi tacos ever..super clean. Super cheap. Great place.

43.description: Came in for the fish tacos and found them to be bland and soggy. Yelpers mislead me here. Bean dip was good but that is hard to mess up. I don't plan on coming back.

2.description: Went in around 6 pm and order the taco dinner of al pastor. There was plastic in my taco. Worst ever.

18.description: I love the Korean beef tacos and burritos here.  However you won't find a parking space in the lot on the weekend because of the close proximity to a laundry mat.

41.description: Called to place a carry out order... Ordered pork kimchi taco, chicken taco, Korean beef taco, bulgugi taco, and bulgugi nachos. I would definitely go back for the bulgugi menu items- the meat was sweet and succulent.  Service was extremely fast and polite.

52.description: Slow service. Mediocre food.People that came in 30 min after I ordered came in, ordered and still got their food before me. That's how slow they are with take out... I didn't even order a lot but I did see the chefs in the back making the other people's food before mine. It wasn't even busy. There was only one family inside when I walked in and they were already eating..I got Korean chicken quesadilla, Korean beef tacos, and pork kimchi tacos. The first 2 were a disappointment. The best thing was the pork kimchi tacos. I don't know if I'd ever go back again. Parking sucks, service is sloooooow, food is eh. I don't think it's worth it just to go to get pork kimchi tacos.

50.description: We order from here at least once a month! So yummy! The Korean taco is fabulous!

4.description: Thank you, Groupon!  You're the best ambassador to support local businesses.  Because of you, Groupon, I was able to meet Taco Chino tonight.  Taco Chino is known for making Mexican food with Korean ingredients.  To be honest, I thought the food might have an "identity-crisis" issue, but the food stayed true to what Mexican cuisine should taste like, but the Korean fusion made the dishes interesting and bolder on flavors.  Obviously, as you yelpers might have figured out, I purchased the groupon deal some time ago to give a try since this is located in my beloved neighborhood, Albany Park.  As an experimental trip, we ordered the tilapia taco dinner and caldo de pollo (chicken soup).  I felt a bit under the weather and believed that soup would help me with my sickness.  I didn't feel for a kimchi taco or bulgugi burrito tonight.  I would say perhaps next time since I have two (2) more groupons.We paid the difference, which about $8 bucks.  The young man behind the counter was working like a mad man because that was that busy!  There were many dine-in patrons, some phone orders, many to-go orders, and perhaps some delivery orders.  He did it all!  I knew the kitchen dude didn't have much easier time, either.  He was flying like a superman preparing the orders.  We waited for about fifteen (15)-minutes on site.  We didn't mind; we placed the orders at the dinner prime time.  The chicken soup had some Korean twist to it.  The chicken was cooked in a Korean style.  It was pretty tasty.  They included the diced jalapeños and onions, along with a quarter-sized lime in case you wanted to boost the spice.  My suggestion would be to add some of these and let them mingle with the broth for a minute or two.  I liked it how it turned out.  My only complaint was that I wish there was another piece of chicken in my soup.  Hubby's fish taco was quite delicious.  I took a bite and liked it.  I know some establishments in Albany Park don't offer fish tacos, but Taco Chino apparently does.  So seafood lovers: check this place out.  I took a couple of pictures of the menu (as of 12/02/2014) instead of the food like I usually do.  That way you yelpers can get a better idea for what they offer.  Purchase the groupon deal to give it a try.  It's not sacrilegious to have some "fusion" in your life, and we are not talking about religions in here.

6.description: Kimchi taco was the best. I asked for onion cooked, and I think you should ask for it when you have kimchi taco.

22.description: Kimchi tacos FTW! Clean, cheap, fast, delicious, friendly.

15.description: What's with all the bad and mediocre reviews for this place? I went here last night with Kenny O., and I actually liked it. We ordered the lengua taco, kimchi taco, bulgogi taco, and a half order of the nacho supreme. The bulgogi taco was my least favorite, but it wasn't bad. It was actually quite good. I usually hate bell peppers in Mexican food and on pizzas, but the bell peppers in the bulgogi taco actually tasted good. The favor of the bulgogi was good, it wasn't too overpowering, and the bell peppers actually complimented the beef. The only thing I didn't like in this taco was the shredded lettuce. I don't know, it just didn't work for me. I'm split between the other two tacos for my favorite. The lengua taco was fatty and juicy, just how I like it. The kimchi taco, on the other hand, was more complex, and I liked the slight tangy acidity of the kimchi on the pork. Both tacos were garnished with chopped raw onions and cilantro. I'd even order the nacho supreme again, too. It was nothing spectacular, but it was tasty too. I think I'd try one of the Korean nacho supreme next. I do kind of think that the restaurant should be called Taco Koreano though, as there was nothing Chinese on the menu.

57.description: Seriously, where else in the city can you get a HUGE serving of steak nachos, with everything on them for $6??? They even include guac on there for no extra charge! Not to mention the guy who has always rung me up is friendly, professional, & quick. Great taste, great prices, great portions. What's not to love?

20.description: Korean Nacho supreme (bulgogi) is still my favorite goto food. I took my friend to eat. She ordered the Korean spicy noodle but alas she's not impressed. However she likes the nacho supreme. I love the bulgogi taco.

36.description: As the brown line train pulls into its slot at the kimball stop, I look out the window and see TacoChino. I wonder what it is. After more than a year of gazing out the train window at the store and wondering what kind of place it is, I finally walked in. What I saw, I liked. This is a true gem that had been staring at my face and I have been ignoring it. Is TacoChino Mexican or Chinese or what the heck is it? TacoChino is a fusion of Mexican and Korean cuisine. It's nice because people who are up for new food adventures as well as those who like authentic Mexican food will enjoy it. Food-- They have authentic Mexican food. I have been searching for tasty authentic cheap Mexican food in the north side. I am glad I have finally found it. They are also known for their Korean Mexican fusion. Basically everything they have can be ordered Korean style- Bulgogi tacos, Korean tacos, kimchi taco... Korean nachos, Bulgogi burrito, Bulgogi tortas ......Taste: Really delicious! We got what we normally get at Mexican places- tacos. We got Picadillo (ground beef), chicken, chorizo, steak, Korean beef and Bulgogi tacos as well as rice and beans. Everything was phenomenal. I was surprised at how good tacos with Korean style meat tasted. Every one must try. Even the authentic Mexican tacos were good. The meats were spiced to perfection. At some places, the meats are just grilled with no additional spices. Here, I could taste some smoky and fragrant spices in the meat. The spices were subtle and not the kind that made the food "spicy hot". We also got two bottles of sauce- green and red sauce . They were tasty and we used it to make our tacos as spicy as we wanted it. I know they also get fresh bread. There is a Mexican bakery next door and I saw the bakery delivering the bread. Cost: Cheap and very Affordable . Regular Mexican tacos are $1.90. The Korean Tacos are around $2. They have tons of other options that cost similar to or cheaper than hole in the wall taco places in Pilsen or other Mexican neighborhoods. Travel- Brown line Kimball stop is on the opposite side of the street. The 82 kimball bus also runs here. There is a free parking lot as well.Bottom line- must try

14.description: This place is a spin on your usual taqueria. Portions are generous.Kimchi taco was ok but I wouldn't order it again, same goes for the kimchi nachos. However, I did fancy the bulgoki taco. It's worth a try if your looking different.

3.description: Came in here for some simple supplies for an art project. The place is clean and well organized. Not to mention the cashier was friendly!

1.description: It's a dollar store. Don't get all hoity-toity on me, the Dollar Tree can make for a lot of fun... we were throwing a rather large family shindig and I had visions of a s'mores buffet. A s'mores buffet? Yes! I bought minis of every candy they had: Brach's Caramels, Snickers, Reese's, Milky Way, Kit Kats, Butterfinger...  even retractable marshmallow roasting sticks. We used multiple marshmallows with homemade cookies instead of graham crackers. It was indulgent and the kids (and adults) LOVED it. While here I also purchased toys like big boxes of sidewalk chalk, cute individual bottles of bubbles- perfect to entertain the youngest kids. What surprised me was the name brand cosmetics. Yes. Maybelline and l'oreal nail decals to amuse the older tween girls! No clean up, no chemicals, and no whining. This is rare for a tween so if you are faced with one, buy these for a dollar each instead of paying more elsewhere. And for me, Physician's Formula brow wax- which sells for about $5.00 at the drugstore but here is a sweet deal at $1.00. Good stuff. They have tea lights and candles, which were placed in tall clear glass vases and lit the yard romantically when it got dark. So get here to pick up some cheap treats and bargains when you are already loading up on dollar store cleaning products (Comet, magic eraser, bleach, glass cleaner and that like...) as one does.

2.description: A very well organized and fully stocked dollar store! I came to get some wrapping supplies and was very impressed by their selection. They also have aisles dedicated to uocoming holidays- for instance, they had 2 full aisles of valentine's day stuff that would be perfect for hosting parties, and another aisle for st. Patricks day! This would be the place to go to get cheap things for decorating. Lots of disposable utensils and plates and stuff. The fake flowers look pretty nice too. Plus, they have a parking lot so it's super convenient.

0.description: One of the better dollar trees. They always have everything in stock and things you can't find at the smaller stores.

4.description: Yeah, it's the Dollar store -- big deal -- we stopped in here to pick up a bunch of little plastic toys, tons of candy, faux tattoos, among other things -- for 25 to 30 kids on our block. It was our 15th Annual Block Paaaaarrrrttaaaay. There were 25 houses (couples or singles) on our block who participated this year (25 out of 30 houses). We had several meetings to organize our block party. We always have a theme too. We were "in charge" of the goodie bags for the little crumb snatchers (a/k/a "kids") on our block and had a $100 budget. This store is well organized, well stocked and clean. This surprised me because some times these stores can be triple "D" (and I am not referring to "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives" here). I have found some Dollar Tree stores to be "disorderly, dreggy and disgusting," but not this store. We purchased tons of mini candies, sour patch candies, little plastic toys and colorful glow sticks (bracelets and necklaces). We also picked up faux stick-on tattoos, and even found some finger-stache (mustache) for the little boys. Even the girls wanted the finger-stache (which surprised me). The little girls got some mini-stickers for their tiny nails. They seemed excited to get these -- we even found some stuff for face painting. I was really surprised to find a face painting kit, but maybe it was meant to be used for Halloween, but hell, I used it for the little crumb snatcher's tiny faces. We had a fantastic Magician for the kids, face painting by yours truly and live music (the DJ was incredible and got everyone involved from dancing to musical chairs). The kids were on a sugar high from noon until 10 pm (I'm sure the parents were not happy about this), oh well. The kids were like super balls -- bouncing all over the place on a major sugar high! This year our theme was "patriotic" because we wanted to pay tribute to our troops. We managed to find small flags and other patriotic stuff. Several of our neighbors have sons and daughters serving in the U.S. Army and/or Marines. We used the mini flags for our community tables, which were loaded with a myriad of salads and desserts. We even purchased red, white and blue balloons and had them filled with helium. I had no idea that the Dollar Tree store even sells balloons for all occasions, like the "Party Store" and, WOW, these were a lot cheaper here! I also had no idea that they sell name-brand stuff (like cleaning supplies for the washroom or kitchen and even some name-brand cosmetics). So, I was like "WTF!" On the other hand, my friend/neighbor was like "Holy Mother Mary of God -- thank you for all the good stuff that we found here" and with that we shouted "Amen and Amen" and got the hell outta there.

29.description: Ordered delivery even though I live four blocks away, food still took an hour to deliver so I was better off just walking over.Pad Thai - Noodles were bland and could have used more green onion.  1/3 of the container was filled with cabbage as filler.  Pad Thai included shrimp for $2 extra and had 5 pieces total that were overcooked.  I would not order this dish again.Potstickers - The six potstickers were stuck to each other but were still relatively crisp served with a dipping sauce.  I would order this dish again.Crab Rangoon - Six pieces folded and crispy.  Came with a sweet and sour sauce that was too sweet and was not very thick.  Pass on the sauce.Sushi - Orderd a crispy shrimp tempura roll, it was in a small plastic container and looked beat to all hell when it got to me.  Surprisingly it still tasted good despite how beat up it was.Overall assessment - I would probably pick my food up next time, but I am neutral on that.

42.description: This place recently opened less then 2 blocks from my apartment, so I was very excited at the possibility of having sushi and Thai food so close by. My fiancé ordered steamed pot stickers and 2 orders of chicken pad Thai on Grubhub for pick up. There was a small issue with the restaurant not getting our order from Grubhub, but it wasn't a big deal and once they got it straightened out, our food was made very quickly. The gentleman (owner or manager possibly?) was very apologetic about the whole thing.As for the food...my fiancé and I loved it! The pot stickers were really delicious and I honestly could have eaten an entire order by myself. The pad Thai was also excellent. Good sized portion with plenty of chicken and sauce. The price for our order was really great too - under $22 total.I've only tried one other Thai place in the area (Hot Woks) and I think Ruk is leaps and bounds better. I will definitely end up becoming a regular since it's close, inexpensive, and delicious.

23.description: Had a very positive experience ordering from this restaurant. So happy they are in my neighborhood. I had a few questions regarding sushi when I called. The sushi chef actually got on the phone to make certain he was making what I'd like, and answered any questions I had. I ordered a snow dragon roll. Delicious. Miso soup delicious....spicy tuna...just ok. But I think they do a lot of things well. Great neighborhood spot. Looking forward to my next meal arriving tonight!

47.description: I ordered some tofu pad thai and tofu tom kha soup for pick up. My order was ready quickly in about 10 minutes. The soup was rich and flavorful. The pad thai was just the right amount of spicy and flavorful as well! I am definitely looking forward to coming back to eat in next time for sushi too!

8.description: Ordered delivery from here last night.  My husband and I might be moving into the neighborhood soon so we ordered a variety of food to try out.  The crab rangoon was maybe the best I've ever had. Perfectly crisp, but soft in the middle. The plum sauce was great. We also had the pad see ew with chicken (huge portion). I love that they offer options to add extras to this for a very reasonable fee. (I ordered extra broccoli for maybe 1.00.) Lastly, we had an Alaska roll. It was packed with tuna and avocado.  We will definitely be back! Oh--and they offer a number of coupons on grubhub:)

31.description: Well what can I say.. First time here ordered something simple.. Crab rangoons and something called spider maki, well I'm giving this place a one star because not because of there food but there sanitary habits, I happen to look in the back where there prepare the food and happen to see the older lady holding her phone and talking and then proceed to hang it up and continue mixing raw materials with her hands not even washing her hands..

34.description: Wife and I had take out from there tonight. My wife and I enjoyed every morsel. Will definitely order from there again.

16.description: Had a very positive experience ordering from this restaurant. So happy they are in my neighborhood. I had a few questions regarding sushi when I called. The sushi chef actually got on the phone to make certain he was making what I'd like, and answered any questions I had. I ordered a snow dragon roll. Delicious. Miso soup delicious....spicy tuna...just ok. But I think they do a lot of things well. Great neighborhood spot. Looking forward to my next meal arriving tonight!

13.description: I've eaten here (well I've eaten their food, at my house) close to a billion times since they've opened.  I feel confident enough now to say that I love them. Their veggie sushi options are great. (My husband still pines for the sushi we used to get in Wicker Park.)  I think I finally found a place he won't complain about!  My husband was pining for the Hot Pepper Noodles that we used to get a Penny's in Wicker Park (Anyone seeing a trend here?) But neither of us were interested in driving all that way to get it.  So I browsed the menu and saw the Spicy Basil Noodles.  He decided to give that a try, and it was pretty damn close to Penny's Hot Pepper Noodles.  And 30 minutes closer.  They were really good.Here's what I can remember trying so far:Veggie Sushi: Everything we've had has been very good.Pad See Eiw:  Honorable mention.  My favorite still goes to Dao Thai.  But this is respectable.  I wish they used chinese broccoli. Pad Thai: Some of my favorite Pad Thai I can remember having in a while.Vegetable Fried Rice: I think this might be my favorite fried rice I have ever tried.  Its possible it tasted so good because it was free (grub hub coupon). I might have to try it again and pay for it just to make sure it is as good as I remember.Red Curry: Usually I'm not a red curry person but I tasted my husbands.  I think I might be becoming a believer.This place is WAY WAY better than Thai Valley. And Dharma Garden.  And I actually liked it better than Opart Thai House. Its only competition in this area that I have tasted is Spoon Thai.I really like their spice levels.  They have more options than "spicy" or "not spicy" if you order on grub hub.Every time I have been in every employee was very friendly.  I've also never had an order messed up.  I've yet to use the delivery since they are within walking distance.  (Although, ask me next winter if that's changed).I seriously have not had one bad thing from this place.

11.description: I don't post these often. Great food. Friendly ownership. Awesome addition to the neighborhood!!Let an authentic Thai family cook dinner for you!This is a new weekly staple for me.

39.description: Ordered carry out, really enjoyed my Basil Curry fried rice. Pad Thai was ok, needed a little something to put it over the top. I'm really hoping they do well we need more places like this to take off in Albany Park.

37.description: A bit small - but delicious and well priced.  Extremely excited to get such a good restaurant within the neighborhood! Will be eating here again - hopefully soon!! Just a note, the Tom Yum soup was amazing - but the medium was incredibly spicy - so I'm sure the hot is crazy!

0.description: This review is for the food only.  Sure they suck answering the phone,  but their food is damn good! Plus they offer vegetarian options including delicious veggie sushi!  I am in absolute love with their veggie futo maki roll and mock duck! Mock, mock, duck, goose!!!

38.description: Ate here last Saturday, food was good I was surprised. Happy to have a sushi spot blacks from my house. Will return. The only thing that bothered me was that I came home smelling like fried food :( not too happy about that, maybe carry out is best.Has any else had that problem or was it just that night?

27.description: I've eaten here (well I've eaten their food, at my house) close to a billion times since they've opened.  I feel confident enough now to say that I love them. Their veggie sushi options are great. (My husband still pines for the sushi we used to get in Wicker Park.)  I think I finally found a place he won't complain about!  My husband was pining for the Hot Pepper Noodles that we used to get a Penny's in Wicker Park (Anyone seeing a trend here?) Pad Thai: Some of my favorite Pad Thai I can remember having in a while.Vegetable Fried Rice: I think this might be my favorite fried rice I have ever tried.  Its possible it tasted so good because it was free (grub hub coupon). I might have to try it again and pay for it just to make sure it is as good as I remember.Red Curry: Usually I'm not a red curry person but I tasted my husbands.  I think I might be becoming a believer.This place is WAY WAY better than Thai Valley. And Dharma Garden.  And I actually liked it better than Opart Thai House. 32.description: I love ordering delivery from here.  The food is delicious and always on time if not early. I usually order the pad thai, medium spicy.  The spice level is perfect and the peanut sauce is great.  I love the crab rangoon as well, made deliciously with peanut sauce on the side.  I've had a couple of other noodle dishes, too and they were also good. You get a great amount of food but not way too much.  The sushi is also good and tastes fresh!

48.description: I don't post these often. Great food. Friendly ownership. Awesome addition to the neighborhood!!Let an authentic Thai family cook dinner for you!This is a new weekly staple for me.

44.description: Thank you so much for opening in this area. I ordered rainbow roll and tom yum soup for delivery. Cleared my sinuses right out. Great spice. Fish fresh. Will be ordering here now cuz it's closer than other sushi places

24.description: I always get takeout from their location on Milwaukee because I work right there, so I'm glad to see that the food is consistent from this location as well. I ordered some sushi and chicken pad thai for delivery, and it came really fast! Everything was very fresh and tasted exactly like the food I get from their other location. Great addition to the neighborhood!

7.description: Awesome Tom Kha soup. Great fried rice - I got the Mango Tango with chicken. Am looking forward to coming back.

49.description: BYOB, no corkage fee.  Excellent value for $$.  A great addition to the neighborhood and a good option for commuters.  Standardize menu with a little twist on classic maki.LUNCH SPECIALS (M-Sat, 11:30 am - 3:00 pm) -- ROBATA $9-11 served with rice, miso soup, 2 gyoza and mixed green salad; WEEKDAY LUNCH $5.95, 9 choices with soup and appetizer of the day; BENTO BOX $9.95 with miso soup, house salad & California roll.SAKURA ($9.95) -- a roll for less than $10 in my favorite super white tuna that hardly shows up in a maki selection.  Decent fish portion.PAD SEE EIW ($7.50) -- serves 2.  Well done.  $1 beef upcharge.FRIED BANANA ($3.95) -- 5 petit perfect rolls.  Banana with small strips of coconut.  Caramel dip with sesame dip.  Addictive.VENUE -- clean, orderly, clutter-free.SERVICE -- pleasant.  Brown bag leftover for you.  Yay!

40.description: First time trying and we were blown away! Great, delicious quality for great, low prices. We tried spicy shrimp maki, spicy scallop maki, spicy Cali crunch, and spider maki. All were fantastic. The free fried rice coupon we received was a generous portion. Our new go to, fave sushi place!

30.description: I stopped by the restaurant on my own this evening.  I enjoyed the food, and the restaurant feels cozy and clean.  My one issue was that there was a Glade plug-in type thing in the dining room that had an overpowering smell and gave me headache during the time I was there.

46.description: I love "Tom Kha" so much and Robata Gill is very good. All of everthing the sever and chef are very nice.

1.description: We went there for the half price appetizers and rolls happy hour advertised on their website but when we got there the waitress told us they did not have happy hour specials.  We pulled up their website and showed her the ad but she still would not honor the advertisement.  The place was empty yet the service was incredibly slow.  I'm only giving it two stars because the sushi is actually pretty good, but the lack of service was really disappointing.  A complete bait & switch.

9.description: I was very happy with my first experience here. The restaurant was clean, the food was fast, and the service was friendly. My group ordered a mix of sushi and Thai dishes. The red curry was really outstanding and definitely my favorite! The pad thai was great, just a little bit dry to me. All of the rolls I tried were fresh and delicious. For Thai food in particular, this is my favorite spot in the hood now. Definitely cleaner and better food than Thai Valley. Very affordable prices and a diverse menu are also a win!

26.description: This is truly a great place for some freshly made sushi. I dined there recently, there was only 2 other tables and service was really slow, but I noticed a lot of people ordering take-out, which is what we should've done also. However, the food was great, we will definitely be a regular at this place!

25.description: Mango fried rice is how someone today would say "on point." Sushi is always fresh and delicious. Pad Khee Mao is just as good can't wait to try the Pad Siew. Banana Rolls were also delicious, but not as I would have expected.. Banana anything from an Asian restaurant you think fried bananas and powdered sugar no ? This is basically an banana egg roll dipped in maple syrup. Different. None the less still amazingly appetizing.

12.description: My husband and I love Ruk! Their lunch special is such a good deal and it's so delicious- for like $5.95 you get a soup, and app & a main. It's fresh and tasty

21.description: We were a party of 10 adults and two kids. The sushi were pretty good but not the steak teriyaki under the entree list. The veggies were undercooked and comes with regular rice, not the Japanese version. I think Renga-Tai restaurant taste better. However, customer service was great. She gets the extra star.

17.description: This is truly a great place for some freshly made sushi. I dined there recently, there was only 2 other tables and service was really slow, but I noticed a lot of people ordering take-out, which is what we should've done also. However, the food was great, we will definitely be a regular at this place!

10.description: It's a bird, it's a plane, it's the Godzilla Maki !!!! I've only been here twice but the food and the service was phenomenal both times. The presentation of some of these rolls is unbelievable ! No matter what you order, you can't go wrong...

5.description: Mango fried rice is how someone today would say "on point." Sushi is always fresh and delicious. Pad Khee Mao is just as good can't wait to try the Pad Siew. Banana Rolls were also delicious, but not as I would have expected.. Banana anything from an Asian restaurant you think fried bananas and powdered sugar no ? This is basically an banana egg roll dipped in maple syrup. Different. None the less still amazingly appetizing.

3.description: Ordered the pad see eiw and veggie egg rolls for delivery. The order arrived on time and hot. The sauce on the noodles was great, but the chicken tasted a little odd. (To be fair, I had a nasty cold at the time, so I'm not sure if it was me or the chicken.) I recommend the egg rolls, which are teeny, fried crispy, and come four to an order.

35.description: Really happy to have Ruk in the neighborhood. Food is good, place is clean and the staff are welcoming. I'll be back often.

19.description: Pretty solid food - fresh and delicious and not too pricey. The Tom Kha was delightful.

28.description: Sushi is so delisios it just melting in your mouth,  salmon plate and noodle s is awesome too) definitely come back again, atmosphere is beatyful

45.description: I was very happy with my first experience here. The restaurant was clean, the food was fast, and the service was friendly. My group ordered a mix of sushi and Thai dishes. The red curry was really outstanding and definitely my favorite! The pad thai was great, just a little bit dry to me. All of the rolls I tried were fresh and delicious. For Thai food in particular, this is my favorite spot in the hood now. Definitely cleaner and better food than Thai Valley. Very affordable prices and a diverse menu are also a win!

33.description: Awesome Tom Kha soup. Great fried rice - I got the Mango Tango with chicken. Am looking forward to coming back.

43.description: This is a really good lunch spot. The prices are perfect. I have to be careful what I order though. Everything I've ordered (except the chicken fried rice and the free spring roll included in lunch specials) always comes barely warm. It was also the worst rama chicken I've ever had, so I won't be ordering that again. The wait staff is very nice. I like the look of the place and I love that xylophone.

2.description: BYOB, no corkage fee.  Excellent value for $$.  A great addition to the neighborhood and a good option for commuters.  Standardize menu with a little twist on classic maki.LUNCH SPECIALS (M-Sat, 11:30 am - 3:00 pm) -- ROBATA $9-11 served with rice, miso soup, 2 gyoza and mixed green salad; WEEKDAY LUNCH $5.95, 9 choices with soup and appetizer of the day; BENTO BOX $9.95 with miso soup, house salad & California roll.SAKURA ($9.95) -- a roll for less than $10 in my favorite super white tuna that hardly shows up in a maki selection.  Decent fish portion.PAD SEE EIW ($7.50) -- serves 2.  Well done.  $1 beef upcharge.FRIED BANANA ($3.95) -- 5 petit perfect rolls.  Banana with small strips of coconut.  Caramel dip with sesame dip.  Addictive.VENUE -- clean, orderly, clutter-free.SERVICE -- pleasant.  Brown bag leftover for you.  Yay!

18.description: Their Sushi is GREAT! I have recommended this place to many of my friends that always ask for a good sushi joint.But the service here was pretty horrible the last I brought my friend over. When we entered one of the waitress just sorta pointed for us to sit any where. It was pretty hot in there so we asked to be moved to an area where the fan would hit us and instead they moved the fan to face us (which was) the other waitress how brought our food always had a little attitude which was pretty annoying. We were done and my friend and I split the check she paid cash and the rest I asked her to put on my card. We had left them the tip on the table. She asked for me to signed and I crossed out the tip because we had left it on the table. She gave me my receipt and as we were walking off she screamed something And both my friend and I looked back and said "excuse me?" And she screamed "no tip today?!" And we looked at each other like is she seriously asking for a tip when we left it on the table. We told her and pointed at the table that there it was. I have worked in the food Industry for 3 years and I tip very well because I know how it feels getting tip very little or nothing at all. This experience really pissed me off and I don't think I'll come back here to dine again.Overall great food bad costumer service

41.description: Ordered delivery sushi, was fresh and staff is friendly. Also added in 4 eggrolls for no extra charge..so that's always cool. :)

50.description: So happy to have a new sushi & thai restaurant in the area.  The food was delicious.  I really enjoyed the panang curry.  All of the vegetable were so fresh.  The best part are the "robata grill" options - tasty morsels similar to appetizers like bacon wrapped scallops and cauliflower with ponzu sauce.  Great variety in terms of thai and sushi options.  Look forward to coming back.

4.description: Delicious! I order delivery from here very often, we decided to bring the family here last night and they were very impressed with the quality of fish.  The sashimi is so fresh, salmon & super white are some of my favorites! I have enjoyed everything I have eaten here & it's byob! Nice to have great sushi in the neighborhood!

6.description: This place is great for a quick snack- I say this because I think it is a bit over priced for the sizes of the roll..But you should definitely come and dine-in on Happy Hour which is from 3-5pm from Mon-Th.. All rolls and appetizers are half off... The waitstaff is great and very friendly. If you would like a recommendation- try the Bangkok roll, you won't be sorry!!

22.description: Very good, especially for delivery. We ordered sushi---it was all attractively packaged and expertly cut. The rolls were consistent and the delivery was even earlier than they promised. Very good tamago, unagi, and crunchy shrimp roll---the spicy tuna roll is chili and not mayonnaise (yay!) and the sweet potato roll is awesome.

15.description: Great food. Wonderful presentation. Loved the Mason jars for the drinks. Sushi was awesome and the chocolate lava cake was delicious. Wife got the chicken pad basil and it was also delicious.Definitely coming back again.

20.description: We had the veg potstickers, curry fried rice and spicy basil noodle. It was okay but a tad expensive and it took over an hour to deliver. There are plenty of places around with better food, better prices and quick delivery. Wouldn't order from here again.

36.description: Really good food!  And a cute atmosphere.  My date and I shared the pad see ew with chicken, the rainbow roll, and two orders of the bacon wrapped pineapple.  The pad see ew is probably one of  the best I've had in awhile.  And the bacon wrapped pineapple was so delish that we got two orders.  And the place is BYOB!!  Very affordable date :).

14.description: Ordered delivery even though I live four blocks away, food still took an hour to deliver so I was better off just walking over.Pad Thai - Noodles were bland and could have used more green onion.  1/3 of the container was filled with cabbage as filler.  Pad Thai included shrimp for $2 extra and had 5 pieces total that were overcooked.  I would not order this dish again.Potstickers - The six potstickers were stuck to each other but were still relatively crisp served with a dipping sauce.  I would order this dish again.Crab Rangoon - Six pieces folded and crispy.  Came with a sweet and sour sauce that was too sweet and was not very thick.  Pass on the sauce.Sushi - Orderd a crispy shrimp tempura roll, it was in a small plastic container and looked beat to all hell when it got to me.  Surprisingly it still tasted good despite how beat up it was.Overall assessment - I would probably pick my food up next time, but I am neutral on that.

58.description: This is a typical neighborhood taqueria - you go here because it's close to home and the food is good and easy on the wallet.  I stopped in for lunch and ordered two chile relleno tacos, chips & guac, and a pop.  I asked for the tacos to be topped with onions and cilantro only.  The chile relleno tacos were good, but greasy.  They definitely needed a squeeze of lime to cut the fat.  The highlight of the meal was the guacamole.  It wasn't overmashed, and had lovely bits of creamy avocado throughout.  And I liked the three salsas given - fresh tomato, smoky red chili, and creamy green.  Top your chips with a drizzle of all three salsas with sour cream on the side... mmm, good stuff.  The menu is basic, but there are a couple items that I want to try next time (crispy potato tacos, chicharron sopes, al pastor tacos).  They also serve breakfast and dinner.  It's a little hole-in-the-wall type of place that's overshadowed by McD's across the street.  Resist the big arches and go here instead.Update 2/17: I also recommend their lomo tacos, which is thinly sliced beef sauteed with onions and peppers.  The carne asada tacos are pretty good, as well.  The potato tacos are a decent veggie option.  It's just sauteed potatoes with sour cream, cheese, tomatoes, and lettuce in a crispy taco shell.

56.description: As far as neighborhood taquerias go, this one is top notch.  The market around this stretch of Lawrence is terribly over-saturated, but I do think San Juanito is the best.  The chilaquiles (green) are fantastic, as are the steak fajitas and the classic tacos al pastor.  Staff is friendly and service generally fast, which is more than I can say for some of the taquerias nearby.

29.description: This place is awesome!  Delicious food, and a great price.  I particularly love the chilaquiles, which even though is listed under breakfast you can order any time.  They are usually pretty busy on weekends, but I've never had to wait long for a table.  The service is great, all of the waitresses are very nice.  And I love the green sauce they bring with the chips.

42.description: I'm in love with this place.  If it were a person, I'd probably marry it.  It was a determining factor in whether I resigned my lease for my crappy apartment so I could stay nearby (I resigned my lease).It really is one of the best Mexican restaurants I've ever been to--which I don't say lightly considering Mexican food is my lifeline.  (My vision of heaven includes mounds of Mexican food.)  I've tried a lot of things there, but my soulmate is their torta (I'm not sure if it's a good or bad thing, but the servers know my order).  The bread is soft and their fillings are plentiful and fresh.  Their chorizo is divine.  Plus, they handmake their own tortillas--how can you say no to that?

23.description: the food is good but the service suck they charged me 15 percent of tips just because i had my daughter wich she is 6 months it was 4 of us these really sucks

47.description: I can't complain about this place; the prices were great, the food was tasty with fresh veggies, and the service was great and fast. I know I got more for my buck than I would have at a chipotle or other restaurant. Under $6 for a huge burrito and I could have got fires and a drink for the amount I would spend at another place. I would totally give them another try.

8.description: So delicious. The carne asada tacos were perfect. Just order them with onions and cilantro, add a squeeze of lime and that's all you need. The nachos with chicken were pretty good as well, although I stuffed myself with tacos, I only had a few bites of the nachos.

31.description: This is the best Mexican food I've had yet! The service was fast, the portions are generous and the chips and three types of salsa were all very delicious.

34.description: Holy hell, So damn good. We went because we has a restaurant.com coupon so why not try out mexican right? My wife got the garlic shrimp with rice and a horchata and I being a giant pig went with the Torta Cubana. HOLY HELL IT WAS BIGGER THAN MY HEAD! Not only were the portions great but it was delicious. Staff was friendly and the whole thing was like just over 20 bucks! hell yes. Definitely going back.... as soon as I can!!!!

16.description: This is one of the best places for authentic tacos in the neighborhood!! Their green salsa is very good and unlike other so called Mexican restaurants, their salsas are not watered down to accommodate those that can't handle spice. Sometimes service may be slow but that is only because the place gets packed but the waitresses always try to accommodate you and are quick and efficient. I have been here a few time with my family and have always had a pleasant experience...both in food quality and service.

13.description: There are certain cuisines in Chicago that you just have to go to the South Side for if you want the best:  Soul food, Caribbean food, Chinese food, barbecue, and of course, Mexican.  Of course, the rest of the city has some good contenders for each of these.  But you'll have to take your standards down a notch.  There's no North Side equivalent of Ruby's or Nuevo Leon or Birreria Zargoza, Amelia's, or even El Milagro.    Which is why, dear yelper, you need to be aware of a new category: North Side Mexican.As far as North Side Mexican is concerned, Taqueria San Juanito is very, very solid.  I've been coming here regularly for months - the meat is juicy, the ingredients are fresh, and the salsas hit the spot.  Everyone here is crazy friendly and helpful and very welcoming.There was one night, out of nowhere back in May, when everything was a complete disaster - the tortillas were mealy and microwaved and all the meat was burned.  But it was just one night - maybe they fired the chef.  The next time I ordered it was right back to normal.  Oh, also - do not order delivery from San Juanito.  There are like ten reasons it's a bad idea, and I'm not sure if it's San Juanito's fault or the delivery service's fault.

11.description: I was excited to eat here, because I see this place everyday on my way home from work and the yelp reviews were pretty good so I figured why not!? So I ordered a burrito for my bf and torta for me...I had the huge one with asada, al pastor and chorizo, it was too big do not attempt to eat on ur own unless you have a bottomless pit for a stomach.  Anyway, I tasted my bf's burrito and it was mediocre and the torta was not great...a little to porky tasting :( I was sad because I wanted to like it. The chorizo was super greasy and made me cringe, oh I forgot! we tried the tacos al pastor and they too disappointed :(((( maybe it's just not for me, I'll stick to the places by my house....this is what I get for venturing out of the hood -_-

39.description: My favorite Mexican restaurant this side of town.  It is my go to place whenever I am craving tacos al pastor.    They serve 3 salsas.  The red one is extra spicy and the green one is just as good but less spicy.  Serving of guacamole is good and delicious.

37.description: Al pastor tacos were good, a bit greasy but overall tasty. It's $7.99 for 3 tacos and a side of beans and rice with some salsas. The service was good and prompt. Will come back here, met my expectations.
