0.description: I consider myself a taqueria connoisseur having visited establishments all across the United States. This place has easily entered my top three best establishments with only one visit. Before I even sat down I was greeted with an array for premium salsas.-A pico de gallo that was not only extremely fresh but had kick. -A roasted tomato with a bold flavor without all the heat-A cool green cream that tasted like some sort of avacado lime mixture that was delicious and refreshing I ordered a taco dinner, one al pastor and two steak. The food was in front of my face within five minutes. The steak was tremendous and well seasoned but the real star is the al pastor. You can see these guys creating the spit in the back so you know this is the real deal. Tender, juicy, and flavorful. One of the best in the city. The rice was also great with little pieces of peppers sauteed in. This is now my go to taco spot. A must try for taco aficionados.

38.description: I live in the neighborhood and I have been to almost all of the Mexican places around Albany Park.  I make it a point to order Nacho's in an attempt to identify which Mexican place has the best.  Taqueria San Juanito so far is the winner - I can never eat the whole plate of nachos carne asada.  They also have the best Chips and Salsa of all of the places in the area.  Yes, it is kind of "diveish" but every time I go there the Chicago PD is also there enjoying their lunch or dinner break and the food outweights the environment.  The staff are nice and responsive too!   I highly recommend this place and their Nachos!

51.description: I think I've been to most of the Mexican restaurants in Albany Park, and this is my favorite. A huge burrito for $4-7, and every meal is served with unlimited chips with three different salsas. The cheese/ham/pineapple quesadilla is really great too. Service and atmosphere is very predictable and comparable to other little places in the neighborhood, but the food is much better than average.Note that they have a $10 minimum for using cards.

27.description: Al pastor tacos are AMAZING!

32.description: That place is busy on a Sunday night!!  Hubby's cousin just got off the bus and appeared to be hungry, so we went there based on the stellar yelp reviews they've received.  The service was friendly.  I ordered caldo de cameron like my usual route at a Mexican joint.  It was portioned adequately, which I like it because I hate to experience Mexican food coma but food is always tasty.  Not to mention that the shrimps are gigantic!!  The hubby said the pastor gordita was good even though he still favors the gorditas at a different Mexican neighborhood restaurant.  The starter salsa and chips were on point.  They did forget our orders of horchata and Jamaica but we were able to grabbed one of the servers and there was enough remedy for this minor glitch.  In the end, they didn't charge us the drinks we ordered and continue to apologize for the mistake.  Honestly, it didn't bother us at all because the entire experience was enjoyable.  The restroom offered a baby-changing station.  It was very thoughtful of them to provide this for the convenience of moms with infants. P.S. The definition of Mexican food coma:  due to the generosity of my fellow Mexican friends and families, overly large portions of food can cause a temporary incapacity to do anything because a petite, 95 lb Asian girl can't handle it all at once.

54.description: The best spit roasted Pastor going in AP right now! I love this place. I really do.If you're coming to AP for Korean tacos, there are other places that make that great. At this place it's all about the traditional and authentic. Recipes passed down from generation to generation. I especially like their green salsa. It has an avocado base but still brings some nice, balanced heat.This place is flying a little under the radar right now. But, hopefully people will take notice. With this place and the new creperie, Kedzie is becoming quite the strip.Very close to the brownline and the gym(???) opening up.I'm pretty sure it's BYOB too. But maybe don't quote me on that. :)

48.description: Best al pastor tacos in Chicago if not the world. The green sauce, God bless the green sauce. One of a kind. El Ranchito in Maywood holds the crown for steak while San Juanito are the kkings of pork. Must try. I dare you not to love this place.

44.description: This place is amazing. I am writing this review about eight months after moving to the neighborhood. It was the first Mexican place I went to after moving here. I haven't even bothered to try any of the others. They have an enormous variety of dishes, killer chilaquiles, a version of the torta I'd never heard of called Pambazos, and a soup that I saw last time I was in FULL of fresh seafood. If you don't live in the neighborhood, I recommend taking a field trip. It's special. And, it's BYOB. Just pop on over to Andy's across the street, and pick up a sixer. If you're somewhat adventurous, try the cabeza. It's amazing.

24.description: Perfectly good al pastor and asada tacos. Service was friendly. Would not hesitate coming back.

7.description: I love this authentic Mexican restaurant! The food is just great as well as the service. I love how they make their tortillas handmade in front of you. I would recommend coming here if you'r craving Mexican food.

49.description: Living a hop, skip, and a jump away from here is dangerous. For my waistline, my rapidly deteriorating cooking skills... among other things. Taqueria San Juanito is awesome. Spacious, plenty of parking, friendly service, affordable-- yes, it is cheaper than buying groceries and making dinner-- definitely BYOB, close to the brown line, and, oh, the food.That green salsa. Oh man. I cannot say enough amazing things about that green salsa. I've never encountered it anywhere else and beg the staff for extra containers every time I carry out... or dine in and, inevitably, am laden with piles of leftovers. Creamy, bright green, mild, and a little tangy, this salsa is the condiment of my dreams. From what I can tell (or wheedle out of the proprietors), it's an avocado-based salsa verde. The buttery avocado smooths out the vinegary spiciness of the peppers but still retains a pleasant kick. As far as meat, San Juanito's al pastor is the way to go. Slightly sweet, fatty enough to stay moist, and flecked with bits of caramelized onion, order it topped with cilantro and raw onion. Their chorizo, my Mexican food staple, is also great and a little unusual compared to other renditions I've tasted. Crumbly and spicy, it has a slightly sweet, cinnamony undertone to all the usual savoriness.For vegetarians, San Juanito's offers a chile relleno taco. I don't think the textures jive perfectly but it's definitely something I haven't seen many other places. A warm tortilla is filled with a lightly egg-battered poblano, filled with melted cheese, and topped with the usual cilantro ribbons and onion.Excellent for carry-out and definitely a pleasant experience for dine-in, I'm happy to add San Juanito to my list of usual neighborhood haunts.

40.description: I have only tried the tacos and every time they are amazing from the fresh made hand made corn tortillas I love the tres leches cake they give u free when u have a child they are friendly and have great tacos can't wait to try more from here

53.description: i think i've officially tried every mexican joint in AP - and this is by far my favorite.  fast, cheap, delicious - always what the doctor ordered.love taking my food to go, but dine-in is always a great choice because the chips and salsa they serve are awesome...burritos are 2 meals, easily, and the taco dinner is my favorite - 3 tacos + rice and beans w/cheese.  try something new every time you go, you'll never be disappointed.

30.description: Fantastic and especially for the price.  The steak burrito dinner is so good and such a deal for 8 bucks.  The very large burrito, beans, and rice make the main dish.  Prior to that are plenty of chips and salsa.  Bring cash if you plan to spend 10 bucks and under for a meal.  Anything over is okay for credit cards.  In short, for Mexican food, this place rocks.  Check it out.

46.description: I'm really looking forward to mowing down some of the delicious looking al pastor tacos they have roasting on a spit in this place (20 tacos for 30 bucks!), but for now I have a hard time getting over just how unbelievable their chilaquiles are. They soak piles of handmade tortillas in this gorgeous creamy, spicy green sauce until it's more like an insanely delicious Mexican breakfast lasagna than the lifeless corny egg dish most taquerias offer up. Topped with fluffy scrambled eggs, sour cream and onions alongside fluffy rice and refried beans, the chilaquiles here are pretty much a revelation. My lady friend tried the version with the red sauce and it was good, but the ones with the green sauce are better than anything I have had for breakfast on any of 3 trips to Mexico. If they sold this in a bottle, I very well might bathe in it. With an uncommonly friendly staff and great prices, there's a good reason this place is swarmed with local Mexican families on the weekend. An authentic gem in the Lawrence and Montrose UN Corridor.

1.description: I love B.Y.O.B.... I wish they had this in Los Angeles. Being in town for a wedding, we were super starved one night and went out on a rainy summer night adventure to find TACOS. Walked by this place and saw the BYOB sign... smelled the food and it was packed! Ran to the nearest liquor store (yes we ran!) and got back in time for the last opening hour. Good taco plates... I was super stuffed. Super Happy. And Super Buzzed.

55.description: MMMHHH!Delicious, my friends take me to this place and since then I attend up to 3 times in a week . I love the Chips great salsas for chips and about the food  wow the burrito de carne asada so good. The price: Excelente. I hope they keep the prices but if they need to go higher they deserve more because the Chef is so clean, fast, and I guess they know me already because as many times I been there lately but am feels so comfortable eating food that they prepare.Custumer service very nice and the personal take care of everyone who get inside this bussiness.

9.description: First of all the service was slow it took them 15 mins to just give us the menu and then 40 mins to give the food to us they are really slow and need more staffs or something to make it go faster and the food was just simple like when I make it myself at home but it was kind of good but not the best

26.description: Food was hands down absolutely delicious. The El Pastor tacos are phenomenal and cheap!! Service left much to be desired. Even though the food came out quickly, the waitress got our order wrong and then got upset with us when we asked not to pay for the extra side of rice she brought instead of the fries we ordered. Will go back. Hopefully she was just having a bad day. Get the pork. Seriously so good.

25.description: On my ever lasting hunt for good Tacos I ended up at this place. I've been on yelp for about a year but have been actively yelping for about 7 months. The main reason I stopped here was because of the good yelp reviews but oh my lord was I deceived. It was about 1 pm on a Friday and this place was pretty much dead. The server saw me walk in but just looked at me. There were no directions to either seat myself or wait to be seated; so I seated myself. My server came within a few minutes and took my order. 3 steak tacos with lettuce, tomato, cilantro and cheese and also a large horchata. My horchata came first and I was ready to gulp that sucker down but it was spicy. WHY WAS IT SPICY??? I asked many of my friends and they told me that Horchata is not spicy! My tacos were disgusting. Not seasoned and just sort of thrown together. i see all these great Yelp review but i do not know where and how! I was very disappointed and i will not return. If the service was more active and up to standard then maybe this review would have  been a bit different but service was as terrible as their food.No Thank You

12.description: I have eaten about 300 times already. No joke. Since the place opened, it has been great tasting and always great service. Their steak meat is the best. Most of the Mexican restaurants that i visited have a mushy pot roast tasting steak meat. They have the best tortas and burritos.

21.description: Revisited at night with a group, it was fairly late without much of a crowd. The carne asada and lengua tacos were good, al pastor was dried out again, and seemed to be simply reheated. Salsas were pretty good. Definitely a good value. Overall, it was a pretty typical taqueria experience. I'll continue the quest for amazing tacos in the neighborhood.

17.description: That green sauce! Goes well on the pastor tacos, and very well on the steak tacos. Their carne asada was very good also. The enchiladas verde, it was good, but I prefer the order that I had at Garcia's in the Square.

10.description: My favorite taco joint ever! They have great Tortas and gorditas there! If you want to taste Mexico without going to Mexico then come here!!! I promise you won't be disappointed- plus the prices are cheap for the quality of the food! The servers are great and very speedy, haha but they take your order in a jiffy...

5.description: I only got food to take out because my girlfriend and I were craving Mexican food. We just looked up this place and we got very lucky! I chose a burrito al pastor and it was just great!! It was very rich and the favors were perfectly balanced. My girlfriend got two tacos and she was able to make almost five tacos out of them because the amount of meet was great! Don't forget to order an horchata:)

3.description: the wife and I absolutely love this place.  We try and go here every Saturday night.  Best Al pastor tacos I've had on the northside and even that might not be doing them justice.  Wife loves the shrimp soup and shrimp fajitas.  Price is very cheap, service is always fast, excellent and very friendly.  The homemade tortillas on the weekends are great.  This place is truly a hidden gem.

35.description: oh my god, also get the green chilaquiles combination.  that's eggs AND steak resting atop a mountain of tortilla chips soaked in that glorious avocado salsa.  i stopped in the middle of eating it just to write this update.

19.description: Best Taco place in town....you get a ton of tasty food for your buck....always pack on weekends .....the most expensive plate cost 15 bucks ...plenty of food.....u like beer BYOB rule...not fancy...just a good place to stuff yourself......

28.description: This no-frills place serves up excellent tacos and traditional Mexican plates. For adventurous eaters I recommend the tongue taco with lime, onion & cilantro. I give it five stars. I also had the chile rellanó taco, which was okay but next time I'll try a different one. The horchata was a delicious with which to wash down the tacos.

45.description: A wide variety of delicious and cheap tacos close to the train? Count me in! 20 tacos for $30, seriously?!? $5 for a giant burrito? Yes sir!The chorizo was EXCELLENT!!! So much flavor packed into the meat. Definitely the best chorizo taco I have had in Chicago. The chicharon taco is smothered in awesome green sauce.If you dine in you also get chips with three sauces!

33.description: I came here with a friend last night because I was looking for affordable Mexican food while out on a Chicago visit. This place had gotten lots of positive yelps so we decided to give it a try. The food was very good (I had chicken tacos, my friend had a beef burrito and drink) and inexpensive (total bill came to $12). Just FYI, this place does not serve alcohol of any kind, that was a surprise to me - wish I had checked that!BUT, I can't give a 4- or 5-star review because of the disgusting moldy smell that permeated the restaurant. It kind of smelled like several old sponges were still being used to clean. It made it hard to enjoy the food. Also, when I walked to the bathroom there were stacks of red meat just sitting on top of a counter. Is that some kind of health code violation?Overall good but I doubt I would go back.

43.description: I went here for National Taco Day! It's walking distance from my casa and it's always somewhat busy in comparison to the other taco joints on that stretch of Kedzie. With my Aunts in tow, we hustled our booties on over to TSJ for some sweet taco action. I think it is always a good sign when you see the boys in blue at an establishment, they usually know where the good eats are. I went for the al pastor tacos. I thought they were tasty, not the best in the city but still pretty solid. Skip the beans & rice...they are nothing special. As with most taquerias, you are greeted with a basket of chips & salsa but at TSJ they provide you with a trio of salsa! You get your basic mild salsa, a smokey red salsa and a creamy green salsa which is quite delicious. It's an avocado based "salsa" and I will be asking for extra upon my next visit. TSJ is totally affordable. They have various specials including 20 tacos for $30...something to keep in mind for my next fiesta! Ole!

2.description: Hola!I saw this restaurant featured on Chicago's Best show last week and decided to take a ride from the far south side to the far north side to check it out. Luckily, it was Sunday,  so I had no trouble parking on the street (for free, yay!!!), but for what it cost in gas I could have gotten a great meal from any number of South side Mexican restaurants.  That being said, it was average. I had guacomole to start. It was pretty much just mashed avocado.  No onion, lime, garlic...kinda bland except for the salt I put on. Chicago's Best featured a "Super Torta" called a Cubano. It sounded interesting, but I didn't want hot dogs on my torta. I settled on a Michoacana, which is Carne asada, ham, chorizo, beans, lettuce, tomato and sour cream on a toasted super size torta bun. Large size for sure. The asada was chopped into tiny pieces, as the chorizo is, and the tomatoes too. That caused alot to fall out as I picked it up. The chorizo was borderline burnt, but had flavor. The couple of pieces of ham were very thin and looked more like bologna..couldn't even taste it. The beans I noticed only on one side of the bun. I guess overall it was just "ok". Larger slices of Carne asada would make it easier to eat, but I wouldn't make the drive that far to go here again.The staff was buzzing around, very helpful and friendly. Parking on a regular day on Kedzie would probably be a challenge, I even drove around the block to check it out.Restaurant was clean, bathroom too. Decor was typical. Drove back via Lake Shore Drive, on a beautiful day.

18.description: This place is great! Food is delicious, tortillas a mano every weekend and phone orders are always on point (phone order are always ready in 15 mins) I came across this place because I noticed CPD was always eating here, so you know the food is good whenever you see police continually frequent a restaurant. Anyhow, one of the better Mexican food spots in Albany Park / North Park.

41.description: I absolutely love this place!  The quality of food is great. Their three salsas are to die for. Love their pozole on the weekends and freshly made tortillas while you are eating. They are also super nice. They always remember me and my daughter.

52.description: San Juanito didn't have the greatest tacos or burriotos, but their chilaquiles were really good!

50.description: I went here merely after reading what seemed to be great reviews. Complete opposite of what I expected. The place is a hole in the wall. The food was terrible and the prices were outrageous. I ordered to-go and the lady forgot my queso for my chips. My beef for my enchiladas looked like it was chewed up and spitted out onto my to go box. I did asked the lady if it was ground beef or shredded. She said shredded. That's why i ordered it. The enchiladas had to cheese sauce, just melted cheese. I also ordered the cheese enchiladas and it was just shredded cheese blend. Softened, not melted. Terrible. I also ordered 2 beef tongue tortas and it was just mayonnaised filled with wilted iceberg lettuce. The pico was brown instead of fresh vibrant colors.  Also very bland. I would never, ever go to that place again.

4.description: I love their al pastor tacos! So good! The tortillas are hand made too!

6.description: On my ever lasting hunt for good Tacos I ended up at this place. I've been on yelp for about a year but have been actively yelping for about 7 months. The main reason I stopped here was because of the good yelp reviews but oh my lord was I deceived. It was about 1 pm on a Friday and this place was pretty much dead. The server saw me walk in but just looked at me. There were no directions to either seat myself or wait to be seated; so I seated myself. My server came within a few minutes and took my order. 3 steak tacos with lettuce, tomato, cilantro and cheese and also a large horchata. My horchata came first and I was ready to gulp that sucker down but it was spicy. WHY WAS IT SPICY??? I asked many of my friends and they told me that Horchata is not spicy! My tacos were disgusting. Not seasoned and just sort of thrown together. i see all these great Yelp review but i do not know where and how! I was very disappointed and i will not return. If the service was more active and up to standard then maybe this review would have  been a bit different but service was as terrible as their food.No Thank You

22.description: The food was good.  Likely to eat at this one more often now that I have tried it.  Only down side is no Mexican hot chocolate.

15.description: Very very delicious and authentic mexican food. Tortillas made by hand and BYOB! Highly recommended

57.description: Yummy greasy cheap Mexican food.  I got chips and salsa, a Chorizo Burrito and a Steak Quesadilla for me and my fiance for under $15.  And it was hot and full of deliciousness.  :)This place is really kind of a dive and the tv always has one soccer or Mexican soaps, but the staff is really pleasant and the food is always quick.  Its a nice place to stop after a long day at work when you don't want to cook but don't want to sell your first born on a restaurant in one of the pricier hoods.

20.description: This is one of the best places for authentic tacos in the neighborhood!! Their green salsa is very good and unlike other so called Mexican restaurants, their salsas are not watered down to accommodate those that can't handle spice. Sometimes service may be slow but that is only because the place gets packed but the waitresses always try to accommodate you and are quick and efficient. I have been here a few time with my family and have always had a pleasant experience...both in food quality and service.

36.description: Great Cuban tortas!  Only reason It's not 5 stars is Because the chips were bad. Not fresh at all!

14.description: That place is busy on a Sunday night!!  Hubby's cousin just got off the bus and appeared to be hungry, so we went there based on the stellar yelp reviews they've received.  The service was friendly.  I ordered caldo de cameron like my usual route at a Mexican joint.  It was portioned adequately, which I like it because I hate to experience Mexican food coma but food is always tasty.  Not to mention that the shrimps are gigantic!!  The hubby said the pastor gordita was good even though he still favors the gorditas at a different Mexican neighborhood restaurant.  The starter salsa and chips were on point.  They did forget our orders of horchata and Jamaica but we were able to grabbed one of the servers and there was enough remedy for this minor glitch.  In the end, they didn't charge us the drinks we ordered and continue to apologize for the mistake.  Honestly, it didn't bother us at all because the entire experience was enjoyable.  The restroom offered a baby-changing station.  It was very thoughtful of them to provide this for the convenience of moms with infants. P.S. The definition of Mexican food coma:  due to the generosity of my fellow Mexican friends and families, overly large portions of food can cause a temporary incapacity to do anything because a petite, 95 lb Asian girl can't handle it all at once.

3.description: For value alone, this place gets 4 stars. I've gotten fairly flavorful giant tacos from this place, and is very reasonably priced. It's a great go-to Mex neighborhood spot. It's a typical hole in the wall, no frills Mex place, so there's no real reason to dine in. Perfect for take out. There's plenty of competition in the neighborhood for grease pit Mex shops, but this is my fav.BTW - The pastor here is sometimes hit or miss, but often is the best pastor I've ever had. It slow roasts on a spit like gyro meat would, with a giant pineapple on top. When it's good, it's unreal! Don't pass it up!

1.description: This place is pretty tasty, though it always takes forever.  The tacos al pastor here are excellent.  Al pastor is something that not a lot of places do a great job at.   I really want to try the green chorizo, but I have yet to come when it's been in stock.

2.description: My wife and I stopped into Gallo Bravo around nine or ten pm after a long day and we were really hungry which usually makes food taste better. The chips were decent and the three sauces to dip them in were really good. I've never seen wasabi served with mexican food but it was worth trying. The staff members were friendly (especially the waitress). I ordered a chicken burrito and my wife ordered a cheese enchilada. The food was ready quickly and we decided to get horchata to wash it down. I'm really glad we did. Best horchata I've ever had, hands down. Actually...hands up in praise because the horchata was heavenly.However my "chicken burrito" was not. It was steak. I spent the first few bites really confused as to whether I was eating shitty steak or really shitty chicken. I tried really hard to eat half of it but couldn't make it. Got it boxed up and had it the next day at lunch in hopes that maybe I wad tired, delerious & judgemental. I have to admit, it was slightly better but I still wanted to stick it in a paper bag, put it on someone's front porch and light it on fire so they'd have to stomp it out and get shit on their boots.My wife's enchilada was pretty good and honestly I'd love to come back and try this place again. The horchata was amazing. It's open 24 hours. And the staff was friendly. I feel bad that my first time eating there was unpleasant but we'll give it another shot. Even though I still have nightmares about their steak burritos, come December it definitely won't stop us from turning on Vampire Weekend and drinking ten dollars worth of Gallo Bravo horchata.Take away: don't order anything with chicken because it might be steak ;)Second take away: I was too bashful to speak up about the mistake so the bad review is more about myself than Gallo Bravo. I deserve two stars for not being true to myself.

5.description: Late night they microwaved my order and tried to sell it to me.

6.description: this review also applies to the one on belmont and milwaukee as im pretty sure theyre owned by the same people and ive visited both numerous times. used to be pretty decent but has definitely gone down hill in the past year or two. shitty quality meat, red chorizo reminded me of sloppy joe last time i was here. cheap prices so if youre too drunk to care go for it. sometimes the counter-people dont grasp english which makes it harder to order, i imagine phoning orders in is tough. the most interesting thing about this place/chain is that they have green chorizo. like neon green. last time i went they were out of it, hence the sloppy joe meat, but its definitely a little bit interesting and slightly redeeming.

7.description: El Gallo Bravo sets you up! Relatively inexpensive & great! Open 24 hours no less!

8.description: Food is great, service is great, but what's up with the super loud, ear hurting music from the DJ with the laptop in the room next door with the pool table? Are they trying to keep people out on purpose? It's pretty weird. Not sure I can go back just because of that. That's how loud it is.

0.description: A tasty dive it is.On some random weeknight I decided to try "some taco joint."  Which one didn't matter, I had a few in mind and all of them were within a short walk of this place.  I think I passed El Gallo Bravo on Lawrence and despite the knowledge that it's (supposed) to be open late, I didn't see anyone behind the counter.  So, I jetted over here.That random night, there was a small party going on in the bar area.  This location is a small taqueria (taco shop) with an attached area serving as a "bar" room.  Sometimes, patrons can drink, sing and more in the attached area.  That night, it was wacky in that motherfucker.  Some drunk dude kept trying to hit me up for spare change for I don't know what.  His speech was slurred and I couldn't understand anything beyond his bad breaf'.  But, I pressed on.  Intent on trying some tacos.  I decided on a burrito suizo with chicken, got a steak taco and a lengua one as well.  On a spit (grill) I saw what looked like, shaved and marinated white meat.  The cook told me it was marinated pork.  !! Another time, fo'sho!The burritos are enormous, there's enough there for two people.  (In case it wasn't spicy, I asked for sliced jalapenos to be added. If you too would like it, ask for a specific kind ie slices, diced, etc At some taquerias; when jalapenos are requested they might put the whole damn thing inside, whole!)  The steak was alright and the lengua was outstanding for a hole-in-the-wall taco joint.  I wasn't drunk and honestly, kind of impressed.  For a dive kind of joint, everything was tasty and I didn't spend much coin for it.  Now it should be understood this is by no means a five star venue.  Common household appliances are in often use.I think the bravissimo of this location, for me, is the late night cook.  Since that first visit, I've been back more times than I'd like to admit and only late night.  The expansion of my "Winnie the pooh" is clearly, evident.  So long as this one "late night cook" (whomever he is) is on deck, my food will be consistently decent.  But there have been not-so-great times as well.  Those times I can remember that due to clientele pulling his attention from cooking, the preparation suffered.Last but not least.  Peep the photos, I've posted a few.  By no means should you ever get a dessert from the clear glass case when it's on special.  It can be utterly disgusting.

4.description: I can't speak for the food, but boy they ticked me off today! I got a flyer in my apartment that said WE DELIVER, and listed their menu, and them  being 24 hours. Cool. Sounded good, we looked at their menu, made a list and called. First time, they hung up on us after we said we were calling for delivery. Second time, we got a explanation that their delivery guy is here only 1 hour a day ( what???). At this point, I don't care if their food is good. There are plenty of other decent places around, they've lost my interest and business.

58.description: The restaurant is nicely done and food is good. I'm giving it three stars because the wines by the glass are overpriced--some ridiculously so. That was really disappointing. You can go to the nicer places in Lincoln Square--same general area, serving the same people who have a choice to go there instead--and get a better wine selection that's more reasonable. Still wondering why a glass of pinot noir is $19 for a 6 oz pour (they do have 3.5 oz for less.) Honestly, I hope they read this and make some changes! Otherwise a nice experience.

56.description: I loved this place! The new look is great and the food is perfect! This fulfilled our expectations and I will defiantly be a statute in this place! Look for me by the wine dispensary system !! Yes, wine dispensary system!!!!!!!!!

29.description: Eeek! I'm so excited to have this place in my hood!! It was on the top of my Yelp list Friday night for nearby places so me and my husband decided to try it out...and wow. We were so impressed!! First of all a place like this was so needed in the neighborhood...we walked to a cute and cozy bar area where everyone seemed to be having a great time and greeted by the manager I believe...so nice! There was a 15 min wait for a table so we wanted to get a drink he asked us right away what we wanted and explained the wine list to us thoroughly...he took our drink orders himself and brought us back our wines...I had a Pinot my husband had a cab. I do think the prices were a bit high for the pour we got but the atmosphere and service was so great and worth it!We got our table had a great server! We ordered the burratta, meatballs and shrimp pizza. We could not believe how great the food was!! Absolutely amazing!! We are just so excited to have a place like this close by...rather it's just for a glass of wine or dinner. We were so impressed! We had the apple tart for dessert which came in sizzling skillet with salted caramel apple gelato...it was insanely good! Give this place a go!!! From the service to the food and the drinks you will not be dissatisfied!!

42.description: This place is great! One of my favorites for this neighborhood. The food is amazing, the atmosphere is perfect and they have wine. Done and done. Just know that the restaurant menu when you eat in is completely different than their pizza delivery menu. Definitely a wine bar, not a pizza place, although the pizza is still excellent :)

23.description: We live in the neighborhood and have been waiting for something like this! We took our friends who were visiting from San Francisco  and met other friends from the neighborhood. The interior is super cute and has a trendy downtown feel. Good atmosphere! You can totally dress up or be casual. Wood walls and leather seating. Food was really awesome! We just picked a bunch of items and shared... AMAZING! Everything we got was amazing. My favorite was the fig and prosciutto pizza. I can't wait to try others! We also had the roasted veggies which were perfect, bruschetta, and the sausage and peppers which were both delicious!! I'm not a huge dessert person... But when I see bread pudding on a menu... I can't say no. We were also told the apple tart was a favorite... So the owner/manager gave us both and comped them! So nice!These desserts were both amazing! Such a nice gesture and good business move. Extensive wine and beer list. I tried 3 different whites. I like to read descriptions of the wine, which was not on the wine menu. Our server led me in the right direction. All were great! This place is perfect for a girls night, date night, group of friends... Anything! I had never heard of this place, didn't know it was there... And was slightly hesitant to go... Now I can't wait to go back!!

47.description: Absolutely, the best Albany Park location. Everyone in this establishment knows everything about it. Hector the bartender very attentive and knowledgeable about the bar and food. The owner super nice and friendly, willing to speak to you and tell its story. absolutely love this place and coming, super excited for making it my first review.

8.description: My Angelo's experience started rough but management corrected the misstep and created a positive.  I look forward to going back and trying the thin crust pizza again.  This really is a nice addition to the neighborhood with the coolest interior west of Lincoln Ave.Made it back to Angelo's with 2 other couples and enjoyed cocktails and prosciutto, fig pizza.  Moved on to meatballs and stuffed mushrooms.Great atmosphere and awesome vibe!

31.description: Good was pretty good, the one cocktail I had was good. However service was so slow that I can't say more since I couldn't get anyone to come over to order dessert or another cocktail. Sorry, but slow and bad service is not worth my time.

34.description: Service was lackluster and the pizza was just ok. Televisions covering the walls in the dining room. Rock and roll music playing. I wouldn't call this a wine bar. It felt more like a sports bar. They offer $5 glasses of wine on Sunday; however, it's not wine from the list - just some generic shit they wouldn't sell otherwise.

16.description: Wow. Very hip remake of a neighborhood pizza joint. Really perfect interior to my taste. There are wood paneled walls and black tiles, a glass enclosed wine cooler, warm leather banquettes, and soft lighting. The bar is spacious and there are comfortable high backed chairs--no bar stools to fall off of. And classic Italian movies playing on overhead monitors. With a club-like sound track, it could be overkill--but it's not. This place is more Williamsburg than Albany Park, but here it is. With the large front windows open in summer and CTA buses zooming by, the location reasserts itself from time to time. It was great to hang at the bar for an extended happy hour. There is a great designer cocktail list with much to choose from, and I opted for their take on the Old Fashioned, which they call Vecchio. Clever. The drink was terrific, smooth, alcoholic, served with an orange peel and a single large ice cube that melts slowly and mellows the drink as you sip. Quite perfect. Then on to the wine selection, a sauvignon blanc from somewhere, I forget, but it was credible. You can order most wines by the glass in 3 oz. or 6 oz. servings, with prices to match. For a snack I had melted goat cheese in sugo with crostini. The cheese was nice and gooey, the tomato sauce tangy and the crostini were perfectly charred and tasty. But I know this place will rise or fall on its pizza (and to a lesser extent its pasta) and I didn't go near either. So I will leave it to others to pen the final verdict. I was fine with my happy hour experience at Angelo's. I think you will be too.

13.description: Went here for the first time on a Sunday evening with a friend and decided to sit at the bar. It was empty except for a few people at the bar and 2 dining room tables. We were excited to try them out since we read the great reviews on here. The place is super modern and inviting.We had a few beers, ordered an appetizer, margherita pizza and orange bread pudding.  I remember the octopus app being good. However, portion was too small for the price. The pizza was mediocre. Nothing special at all!!  I didn't care for the thicker crust and there were no ingredients that truly stood out. Bread pudding was delicious.ProsGood beer and wine selection Modern downtime restaurant feel without the crowdAmple seatingConsToo pricey for mediocre foodPizza was a bustService was lacking (the bartender was not friendly)Overall, it was a big let down.I would ONLY go back for drinks IF I was in the neighborhood.

11.description: I love this restaurant.  It's just a few blocks from my apartment and I've had nothing but great experiences here.  The food is great and reasonably priced.  On Valentine's Day we went early around 6:30 and weren't greeted at our table for 15 minutes.  I wasn't too concerned about it.  My husband and I were just chatting about our day and didn't really even notice.  It was clear there was a mixup with the servers, honest mistake.  But without even mentioning it, the manager come over and told us our dinner would be take care of.  It was so nice of them to recognize the mistake and cover our dinner!  We had no intention of complaining or anything and it was refreshing to see a restaurant value customer service so highly.  Great spot!

39.description: We came here with a group of 8 girlfriends to catch up last week and then I ended up bringing my fiance back the very next night because I couldn't shut up about how good my meal was. Both times, the food exceeded expectations. 1) Order the bruschetta - the mix of tomatoes combined with just the right amount of balsamic and goat cheese - a huge winner. 2) Order the fig and prosciutto pizza - we sampled 3 pies and this was the favorite (all were quite good, but this one had people fighting over the last piece.) 3) the roasted veggies were another huge win - big flavor and I didn't want to order them in the first place but they won me over. The cocktails are wonderful - I sampled the aviation and the old fashioned and that cookie dessert skillet thing is fantastic. The first visit we had a table the second visit we sat at the bar. On both occasions the service was great and the food was exceptionally good. Loved it.

37.description: Did a birthday dinner last week at Angelo's, and would definitely come back. The good news is, the menu is versatile enough to allow for diverse preferences and tastes among a big group - but I will say that not all the dishes really delivered (I attribute this to poor choice among some of the people ordering, ha)... But overall, I enjoyed the meal. Would recommend the meatballs, gameretto (shrimp) pizza, and sausage & peppers. Also, solid drink menu - beer, wine, and cocktails were all plentiful in choices available.

0.description: Here's my sign for you:+//////////////////////////+|                            ||     THIS IS IT.     ||                            |+//////////////////////////+Yep, that's right Yelpers. You've come to Yelp searching for somewhere to eat and/or drink and this is the place. You might as well just stop reading now and head straight to Angelo's.You're looking for excellent pizza? Here ya go.Well-made cocktails? Got 'em.Nice, laid-back atmosphere? Done.Good service? Johnny "Yepp." (#dadjoke; #notadad; #okay)Check this place out.

38.description: Really nice atmosphere and the hospitality was good.  Can't complain about the food ;it was excellent.   Our server offered a unique bottle of wine that cost about $50 bucks.   Looked it up later and it was an $8 bottle.  That sucks ; never nice to be taken advantage of.   I think I'll be back,  but more cautious about the type of wine I order.

51.description: 5 stars this place is amazing! Everything  from the atmosphere to the food to the service  was excellent! We had the butternut squash salad which tasted so refreshing! The sweet corn Alfredo paste which was excellent flavor with the mushrooms and bacon! The shrimp scampi was so had so much flavor! The sausage and peppers were also so tasty  with a hint of spice!!!! To end the night with an hot apple strudel dessert  topped with ice cream!!!There bartenders  make an perfectly tasy Manhattan and Old Fashion!!!!I definitely plan on returning  soon to try the resy of their menu.....especially  the pizza and wine selection!

27.description: Came for the first time based on a recommendation from a friend.   The octopus was to die for,  awesome spice.  Great wine and bet selection.   Will always come back!!!!!!

32.description: Wonderful place with fantastic wine suggestions...and I'm not even that in to wine.  The burrata magherita is superb and Instagram worthy.

54.description: Angelo's is amazing! I've been here for dinner and for brunch and both times have been great. The food and drinks are delicious! My favorite dish is the gnocchi

48.description: When I moved to Albany Park, the flyer from Angelo's was one of the first I received. At the time it was both an Italian and Mexican restaurant, and while I can't complain about the food I ordered for delivery, it was a bit confusing how encompassed both cuisines. Fast forward a few years and I'd noticed when driving by it seemed it was being re-vamped. It's now open as Angelo's Wine Bar with a new decor, food focus and menu. I went here last month when my dad was in town visiting and it was a nice night with the large window/doors open on Montrose. Not being big eaters, we ordered the shared plates of shrimp scampi and meatballs and both were delicious. They also had a great drink menu, and again the ambiance was really nice. My neighbors and I have made plans to come here for after work drinks in the future. It also seems like a potentially good place to watch games--not a sports bar vibe, but plentiful TVs.

44.description: Exceptional small plates and great ambience.  I'm always on the lookout for quiet(ish) bars where I might be able to talk to the person sitting next to me without competing with a loud TV or soundtrack (which can be frustrating to find in this 'hood)... visited Angelo's on Thursday night and it hit all the marks.  Ordered a couple of plates (sausage and peppers and roasted vegetables- 2 for 1 special on Thursdays) that completely exceeded my expectations... fresh and tasty!  Sat at the bar and the service was attentive and transparent.  They have an extensive draft beer selection (Moretti on tap!) and a great wine list.  My only wish is that they could expand their wine offerings in the sub-$10/glass category... as it stands, they all look great, but are a bit pricey.  Just a couple more options would be welcome and make cheapskates like me more likely to indulge.A great addition to the neighborhood... I'll be back.

24.description: Came here with my boyfriend last night. the service was good. but they put bacon bits inside my salad, I didn't like it, not to mention that the bacon bits smells really bad, it gives bad breath. I didn't eat the salad after that, then we ordered a pizza, okay just took over 40 minutes and they had given it to somebody else. but they let us have a free pizza, because they felt bad that we had waited over 40 minutes and we didn't get our pizza. however the pizza was very spicy they put a lot of spicy stuff on the pizza. it was so spicy that it made my lips burn my boyfriend's lips were burning to. Not the most fun experience the second time around, they really did try I just didn't care for their food, or the waiting over 40 minutes to get a pizza.

7.description: Eeek! I'm so excited to have this place in my hood!! It was on the top of my Yelp list Friday night for nearby places so me and my husband decided to try it out...and wow. We were so impressed!! First of all a place like this was so needed in the neighborhood...we walked to a cute and cozy bar area where everyone seemed to be having a great time and greeted by the manager I believe...so nice! There was a 15 min wait for a table so we wanted to get a drink he asked us right away what we wanted and explained the wine list to us thoroughly...he took our drink orders himself and brought us back our wines...I had a Pinot my husband had a cab. I do think the prices were a bit high for the pour we got but the atmosphere and service was so great and worth it!We got our table had a great server! We ordered the burratta, meatballs and shrimp pizza. We could not believe how great the food was!! Absolutely amazing!! We are just so excited to have a place like this close by...rather it's just for a glass of wine or dinner. We were so impressed! We had the apple tart for dessert which came in sizzling skillet with salted caramel apple gelato...it was insanely good! Give this place a go!!! From the service to the food and the drinks you will not be dissatisfied!!

49.description: Such a amazing job on the inside design and the ambiance is perfect for a date, friends or bringing family together.

40.description: Such a great edition to the neighborhood. Our server knew his wine so well, helped us pair it with food and was kind + patient. The vibe in there is awesome. We will absolutely be visiting more.

53.description: we wish we could rate this higher but they never even lets us sit and try their food... so this is purely on how we were treated at the door...we walked in around 5:30, party of 3 ( 2 adults + 1 well behaved 4 yr. old child ) ... the hostess asked if we had a reservation... we said "no" and she proceeded to check with whom I'm guessing is her manager to see if they could accommodate us... let me also say again it was 5:30 and there was maybe 2 tables already seated... it was pretty much empty. the man whom I'm guessing was the manager was oddly making a face like it would be impossible to seat us... and then proceeded to say that it would be an hour wait... I looked at him, then at the empty dining room and couldn't believe he said that... the restaurant was empty and they were turning away a walk-in... sadly, they have a lot to learn about how to get a positive word out in the neighborhood. it was shocking. so we walked right out and won't be back. we were really excited to try this place since it is a new spot in our neighborhood... we like to support local establishments. i hope they think twice of turning walk-ins away after reading this review.

30.description: A foodie haven with friendly staff who will create the drink or dish to fit your mood

46.description: Awesome service!  Laid back atmosphere!  Excellent food! The shrimp scampi was absolutely delicious!  Definitely going back!  They have a Sunday Brunch that I will be partaking in very soon!

1.description: I've been to Angelo's more than a few times and this review is looong overdue. The vibe here is definitely to my liking. Rustic and cozy for dinner with friends or family, but also ideal ambience for a date night. The space is beautifully lit. The service consistently friendly and attentive. Big plus.For starters, there is a veritable buffet of bitters and spirits for your cocktail or elixir of choice. Have to say that the classic Aviation and Manhattan are my favorites off the menu. Both boozy and smooth. Kudos to the large square ice cubes btw! The wines by the glass are well curated and I've pretty much loved every single one we've tried.Food highlights: the white fish, beat salad, charcuterie plate and risotto. Actually I could spend most of my days eating their take on bolognese. Super flavorful and the noodles are done perfectly!  And....the desserts. Large enough to share and always the best part of any meal in my opinion! Go for the bread pudding with a side of gelato. 5 stars. There is no other place I'd rather eat at in the area. Love at first bite!

55.description: In love with the new place , the food and drinks are amazing. Albany Park needed this!

9.description: This is my favorite place in the city. This place truly gets it. Everything is absolutely fantastic.

26.description: This place is excellent!   The service was superb!  The food was decadent and drinks were delicious

25.description: My Angelo's experience started rough but management corrected the misstep and created a positive.  I look forward to going back and trying the thin crust pizza again.  This really is a nice addition to the neighborhood with the coolest interior west of Lincoln Ave.Made it back to Angelo's with 2 other couples and enjoyed cocktails and prosciutto, fig pizza.  Moved on to meatballs and stuffed mushrooms.Great atmosphere and awesome vibe!

12.description: We been customers for years since even before they have the place remodel. My husband Johnny Garcia order BBQ wings and a large pizza for tonight's Super Bowl. When he got home they gave us hot wings (No BBQ). My husband called talked to the owner he told him we didn't want that, he told the owner my wife is going to bring it back. The owner told him we will work something with you. We expecting to have our BBQ wings hot and ready to go but not the case. The owner got the wings from me asked me for the receipt came back with the money in hand. This is not the first time they have mistaken our order but been regular customers we gave them another chance. The quicker I was to give this place a 5 star before, the quicker I will say the way I was treated today is not the way you treat customers doesn't matter if they been customers for years or if they are first time customers. #AngelosWineBar #HorribleService #DontValueLongTimeCustomers

59.description: I've been here for lunch and dinner a few times already and I am IN LOVE with this place!The staff was super welcoming and friendly when we walked in, our server was very attentive and the food and drinks were delicious!The atmosphere is perfect. It's a great place to go with your family, for a date night or even just a night out with friends for dinner & drinks. I HIGHLY recommend this place!

21.description: Food is pretty decent, but today my lobster Mac and cheese came delivered with a plastic top covering it. The heat or mishandling must have made it crack into pieces and I pulled these shards out of the Mac and cheese. I didn't find it all either so I just ate the middle. I know things happen so hopefully they'll change the way they package this for delivery in the future! We've enjoyed most of the other food we've had here.

17.description: Food is pretty decent, but today my lobster Mac and cheese came delivered with a plastic top covering it. The heat or mishandling must have made it crack into pieces and I pulled these shards out of the Mac and cheese. I didn't find it all either so I just ate the middle. I know things happen so hopefully they'll change the way they package this for delivery in the future! We've enjoyed most of the other food we've had here.

10.description: You guys, I did not see this one coming. My girlfriends and i picked a centrally located place to meet and eat (and drink). I figured "wine bar" would mean a good juicy wine list. Not the most extensive wine list I've seen, but the wines we had were great, so no complaints. We ordered some plates to share and they were all so delicious! Beet salad...omg. May have been the best salad I've ever had. That was unexpected for a random Tuesday night. Flat iron steak....melt in your mouth good. Roasted veg....crispy, flavorful deliciousness. My friends ate sausage and peppers and thought they were awesome, although I can't personally speak to them. I hope this place gets some traffic in the next few weeks/months. The menu is incredibly tasty. We didn't do the pasta or pizza, but I'm willing to go back and try that, and I'm optimistic about the flavors of all that. Thanks for a really tasty meal!

5.description: I am so happy to find another gem in the neighborhood. The decor in this gastropub is rustic and gorgeous! I felt like I was somewhere else than my neighborhood. Such a treat.We ordered the stuffed mushrooms ,roasted beet salad, sausage and peppers, and the flat iron steak.All these dishes were delicious. My favorite was the steak followed by the beet salad. My husband loved the sausage and peppers.For drinks , I ordered a red lambrusco and husband ordered scotch with a splash of coke. He was in heaven!!The service was friendly, everyone in that establishment had a welcoming non pretentious demeanor. We will be coming here more often. They have a great variety of dishes and it's perfect for a date night or a night out with friends. Whatever shakes your Christmas tree! The cherry on top , hubs left his credit card at the restaurant. He noticed an hour later so he went straight back to Angelo's to see if it was still there.  As soon as he returned, our server saw him and without him saying anything, she said "I have it".Truly a great place!! It deserves every star I entered!!!

3.description: Entering Angelo's, you'll see a gorgeous granite bar, wood flooring with wood paneled walls.  It's an exquisite and upscale restaurant with fine furniture and a cozy interior, along with TVs playing old classic movies while the bar played sports games.   They even had a live band play Jazz.  A welcoming owner who greeted us, it was definitely warm and inviting!The perfect atmosphere to sip a glass of wine while catching up with my girls.  We wanted to try everything but we weren't that hungry so we didn't order too much.  We ordered the Burrata Caprese salad, Gnocchi pasta, and Stuffed Mushrooms.  We shared our meals and ordered a Bottled of red wine to go along with it.  The friendly owner and our server were very well educated about the wines they carry and suggested some of their favorites.  Throughout the night, the owner checked in on us to make sure everything was going smoothly.The food had a lovely presentation; it was delicious and not so heavy like your typical Italian restaurants with big plates.  After the heavy holiday meals, eating light was needed!It's an ideal spot to enjoy a bottle of one of their excellent wines.  All in all, they have good food, good ambiance and a lovely presentation!  Will definitely come back to try more of their food!

35.description: Found Angelo's on yelp. Been trying to go there for a while now but have not had a chance. So glad we made time for it because i think its going to be a favorite spot for us. The place is gorgeous even though I dont think it matches the neighborhood.The staff is very helpful and friendly. I had the old fashioned and the hubs had the chianti. The drinks were amazing. For food we tried the marinated olives which came free from a yelp check in. They were delicious but the portion was very big. The best part was the baked goat cheese. Holly cow was it amazing. The sauce had a roasted red pepper taste to it and the bread was grilled and drizzled with balsamic vinaigrette. So so good. Looking forward to my next visit.

19.description: Ate there for the first since the renovation and the restaurant is better than ever! Its amazing! Chicken piccata is to die for! The service is great! Everyone is super nice, the place looks fantastic! Its officially my new favorite place

28.description: Awesome place!  Fantastic food and outstanding service.  What's not to like.  Will be back soon.

45.description: This was a pleasant surprise in the Albany Park neighborhood! My brother and sister-in-law were in town and wanted to go somewhere close by for dinner. Angelo's was great! From the shared plates to the pizza and extensive wine & beer list, everyone left very full and very happy! Can't wait to come back!

33.description: I am so happy to find another gem in the neighborhood. The decor in this gastropub is rustic and gorgeous! I felt like I was somewhere else than my neighborhood. Such a treat.We ordered the stuffed mushrooms ,roasted beet salad, sausage and peppers, and the flat iron steak.All these dishes were delicious. My favorite was the steak followed by the beet salad. My husband loved the sausage and peppers.For drinks , I ordered a red lambrusco and husband ordered scotch with a splash of coke. He was in heaven!!The service was friendly, everyone in that establishment had a welcoming non pretentious demeanor. We will be coming here more often. They have a great variety of dishes and it's perfect for a date night or a night out with friends. Whatever shakes your Christmas tree! The cherry on top , hubs left his credit card at the restaurant. He noticed an hour later so he went straight back to Angelo's to see if it was still there.  As soon as he returned, our server saw him and without him saying anything, she said "I have it".Truly a great place!! It deserves every star I entered!!!

43.description: Love this place! I've been here for dinner and brunch and loved everything. The breakfast pizza has been my favorite thus far though. So tasty. It is also HUGE and enough to serve 2-3 people easily. I ordered it thinking it was a single serving and happily brought the rest home...it reheated decently too. Additionally the waitress told us that they do fundraisers for the neighborhood schools and a fun sounding wine wasting w/ apps on Mondays.  I'm thinking of making Angelo's my new neighborhood go to place.

2.description: A neighborhood place, no trek necessary.  Excellent price, good portion, balanced fine dining food preparation and ingredients.  Versatile venue.  You can eat here everyday and stay within budget.  Forgetabout grocery list.SHARED PLATES -- a hearty selection of appetizers priced between $9-$15 that is a balanced dish.WHITEFISH ($13) -- perfectly balanced dish in taste and ingredients with a just right portion.  I love fingerling potato.PIZZA -- serves 1.5.BREAD PUDDING ($8) -- a nice surprise as pudding pieces are crunchy on the outside.  Nice touch on orange zest.  A bit too sweet.  Serves 2.FLORENTINA COCKTAIL ($9) -- my first sweet wine (Medici Ermete Lambrusco) in a cocktail.  Multi-palate experience.  Sweet, Sour, and Bitter.  Perfectly created that none of the flavors is dominant.COFFEE -- Umbria Medium Roast.  The fresh ordinarily brewed house coffee produced plenty of crema, a joyous moment.SERVICE -- Bartender Hector didn't fail my Q&A.  LOL. Good taste Hector as I wasn't disappointed with your suggestions.  Automatic brown bag for you.  Yay!POWDER ROOM -- spacious.  Purse table.  Soap and lotion.  VENUE -- impressively clean and organized.  The only romantic venue in the area and you can still see and hear your date (sit by the wall or corner).  Comfortable welcoming place for dates, friends, and family.ONLINE MENU -- it's the other menu for pickup and delivery.  Restaurant Menu are attached here as photos.FREE PARKING -- plentiful especially on the North South residential streets.

18.description: Nice decor warm and cozy nice beer selection and wine good cocktail good service but food nothing to write about. ..WE will come back try something else

41.description: Great food and atmosphere. Huge wine selection and creative drinks. Family owned and operated. Thanks again Ramiz for the hospitality.

52.description: They did a fantastic job of the re-design of this place.  I'm really glad to have a place like this within walking distance.My husband and I stopped in very shortly after they reopened.  We had a salad (I can't remember which, I thought it was the beet salad, but not sure.)  The gnocchi, and the pesto asparagus pizza.  The salad was very good, I remember we polished it off.  Unfortunately I wasn't as pleased with the gnocchi, and they suggested it as a "favorite." I love gnocchi, I eat a lot of gnocchi.  There was something just odd about it.  Its almost too soft I guess. It feels like mashed potatoes.  Just sort of soft and gooey.  It wasn't bad, just not great.  No flavors really stand out either.   We also had the asparagus pizza.  We thought this was good. Our only minor complaint was that the asparagus pieces were too big so you would get a whole spear in one bite!  (But we're splitting hairs here.)I went in a second time and our waiter suggested the gnocchi.  I was with a group, so I went up and asked (who appeared) to be the manager if it had changed at all.  He said it didn't but thought maybe we went on a bad day.  His reaction was also the "why didn't you tell us last time, we will do anything to make it right."  Which was refreshing.  He actually offered to bring me one to taste again.  I declined.  I knew someone at our table would order it and I would just have a bite :)  They did, and I did.  It was the same.  This must just be their style.  It sounds like other people like it, but its not for me.  I ended up ordering the sweet corn alfredo (Minus bacon, I'm a vegetarian).  It was good, different, not holy moly to die for good.  But good. I ate it all.So I haven't been blown away impressed with the food, but everything has been respectable and there are more things to try.  It helps that they seem really interested in the customer having a good experience, so I wouldn't be afraid to try something new.  I'll be back, sooner rather than later.

50.description: I ordered takeout this past Friday night after work.  I ordered the thin crust Angelo's Special pizza, size small (10 inches).  The pizza was good, nothing special, and a decent value.  Normally, I would give a place like this three maybe four stars, but the hostess needs to understand that her job description is basically not to act like she has a stick up her butt.  I walked in to a fairly empty restaurant and was greeted with "can I help you?" There was no "welcome to Angelo's" or "hello, dining in?" I'd probably only go back with a good coupon.

4.description: Found Angelo's on yelp. Been trying to go there for a while now but have not had a chance. So glad we made time for it because i think its going to be a favorite spot for us. The place is gorgeous even though I dont think it matches the neighborhood.The staff is very helpful and friendly. I had the old fashioned and the hubs had the chianti. The drinks were amazing. For food we tried the marinated olives which came free from a yelp check in. They were delicious but the portion was very big. The best part was the baked goat cheese. Holly cow was it amazing. The sauce had a roasted red pepper taste to it and the bread was grilled and drizzled with balsamic vinaigrette. So so good. Looking forward to my next visit.

6.description: Hey, we really like this place! The atmosphere is great, the staff attentive and the food delicious. We've just found our go-to neighborhood place! Thanks!

22.description: Went here on Christmas Eve with a large group, so I got to try several different things on the menu.  Everything was excellent!Their fig/prosciutto pizza was one of the best things I've had in a while, and their baked goat cheese was another highlight.Very cool atmosphere inside - would be perfect for a date night or any group outing.One weird thing though: as fantastic as their dine-in menu is, their take-out/delivery menu is just standard Chicago nonsense (wings, beef, etc).  Don't be fooled!

15.description: My new favorite dish is the scallops. Can't say enough wonderful things about this dish.

57.description: Wow. Very hip remake of a neighborhood pizza joint. Really perfect interior to my taste. There are wood paneled walls and black tiles, a glass enclosed wine cooler, warm leather banquettes, and soft lighting. The bar is spacious and there are comfortable high backed chairs--no bar stools to fall off of. And classic Italian movies playing on overhead monitors. With a club-like sound track, it could be overkill--but it's not. This place is more Williamsburg than Albany Park, but here it is. With the large front windows open in summer and CTA buses zooming by, the location reasserts itself from time to time. It was great to hang at the bar for an extended happy hour. There is a great designer cocktail list with much to choose from, and I opted for their take on the Old Fashioned, which they call Vecchio. Clever. The drink was terrific, smooth, alcoholic, served with an orange peel and a single large ice cube that melts slowly and mellows the drink as you sip. Quite perfect. Then on to the wine selection, a sauvignon blanc from somewhere, I forget, but it was credible. You can order most wines by the glass in 3 oz. or 6 oz. servings, with prices to match. For a snack I had melted goat cheese in sugo with crostini. The cheese was nice and gooey, the tomato sauce tangy and the crostini were perfectly charred and tasty. But I know this place will rise or fall on its pizza (and to a lesser extent its pasta) and I didn't go near either. So I will leave it to others to pen the final verdict. I was fine with my happy hour experience at Angelo's. I think you will be too.

20.description: One of my favorite thin crusts in the city...highly recommended. Beyond that (ie, entrées, appetizers, deserts) are really not the greatest (especially for the price). Also, when we ordered enrteees and apps for delivery our food  got steamed and mushy...several occasions...again, stick with the pizza. You'll enjoy.

36.description: My boyfriend and I came here for a Friday night date and loved it! The fig and prosciutto pizza we agreed is one of the best and most unique I have ever had in my life!!!We also ordered the calamari. It was very delicious and came with pickled vegetables on top. I only wish it came in a bigger portion because I felt it was kind of expensive for a small dish. I also didn't like how they didn't have any cheaper wine deals. They were all rather expensive and was hoping for $7-9/glass range and that wasn't the case. I believe they have a wine tasting special during the week so maybe I'll try out that day instead.

14.description: After many stops under the heading of "wine bar"  in Chicago, I am so relieved to finally find a place that has the consistency of a Lettuce restaurant, the warmth of a neighborhood place that makes you feel like a local celebrity. This spin on small plates/. Wine bar is worth the travel if you are not from the neighborhood and as comfortable as you need it to be to drop by. 100% on my books.

3.description: Ok so I was scared trying a new stylist, I always am. But I think it was time after 3 years of going to Salon Blonde I needed a change and it was getting too expensive.  So I read Stella's review and thought why not.  So far so good, I am yet to actually wash my hair and style it myself. That is my ultimate test cause with 2 kids I have no time to stand in front of a mirror with a whole bunch of hair tools.  The salon itself is ok , nothing fab. But Goca is very nice, and she seems to know hair. She is helpful when it comes to your cut.   After about 2 minutes I felt like she was one of my friends as we talked about everything, it was a comfortable experience. So kudos to Goca, and thanks Stella!   I might have to change this to 5stars in the future.

1.description: I also went to Goca based on Yelp reviews and also because she is in my neighborhood. I needed and emergency bang trim as my normal hair girl was not available and she took me even though I didn't have an appointment. I just have to say that it took her maybe 5-10 minutes to trim my bangs and she did an amazing job since I am so picky about my bangs and she even understood how my bangs work..so as I was leaving I went to pay and she didn't even charge me but I still gave her money for her trouble and taking me on such a short notice. I thought that was really nice of her! Now that she is in my neighborhood and she did a great job I may be tempted to switch stylists....

2.description: Goca is amazing!she is the best hair stylist in Chicago.She does amazing work with hair!

5.description: I went to Goca's after seeing Stella's review. Her salon is right in my neighborhood, and I am so happy to have found a hip hair stylist like Goca in Jefferson Park!  She was very attentive as to what I wanted in a haircut, but also made helpful suggestions.  I felt like a million bucks when I walked out... After first going to Goca for a haircut, I am definetely going to her with cut and color next.  She also got me in for a haircut within the week of calling which was a plus for me. I found a new hair stylist!!!

6.description: I went to Goca based on Yelp reviews and am very happy with her.  She did a very nice job on my hair, but after I played with it a bit, I wanted the back a bit different.  I called her and she took care of it immediately - and gratis!  She is very personable and I felt comfortable immediately.  It's so nice she is in my neighborhood and I intend to help keep her there!

7.description: I went to "the goca" after seeing a girls hair that comes into the bar I work at. OMG! Her hair was so cute so I went to see "the goca" as a friend of mine fondly referred to her. First of all, can I just say that "the goca" is too cute?!! She is. This is important to me when finding a new stylist, they have to be cute and have good style which she definately does. The salon is cute, has hip decor, and it's yellow! She uses Matrix and Rusk products so my hair smells purty now, I need to get this shampoo for real. She brightened up my color and took the bulk out of my hair - and gave me some cute bangs as well. Also, she's far more reasonable pricewise then the salons I've been frequenting lately. At least I won't have to sell my first born to get a highlight and cut anymore...and the price I was quoted was the price I was charged - which is refreshing. For real. Love "the goca".  You will too.

0.description: My mom and I get our hair cuts and color here!  Goca is fabulous ! She is friendly and fun and most important great stylist !!! Also few of my friends come to her salon and they are very happy with her !

4.description: I'd been going to Mario Tricoci for years and I had lost faith on stylists in chicago area since I thought if at Marios are stuck in the same old ways even though they try to catch up with areas like Cali or New York. But no matter what they did my hair was either too brassy or too green when they'd try to steer away from gold. On top of it my hair was always damaged. Someone introduced me to goca and she did on my hair whatever I'd been asking for years and never got in other places. My hair is not damaged and is the perfect natural shade with highlights that have no brass whatsoever. The reason why i went to her is cuz my friend gets highlights done by her and she goes really light and her base is dark which i was told it causes for your hair to pull a lot of gold, but my friend has amazing creamy color and she has long hair which is  something i couldnt have at that shade since my hair would break as a result of other places using cheap products. I am glad i found her. I cant wait to try her haircuts
